original: ye triṣaptāḥ pariyanti viśvā rūpāṇi bibhrataḥ / vācaḥ patiḥ balā teṣām tanvaḥ adya dadhātu me /
analyzed: ye triṣaptāḥ pariyanti viśvā rūpāṇi bibhrataḥ   vācaḥ patiḥ balā teṣām tanvaḥ adya dadhātu me  /
translated: The seven who go about in three, bearing all forms, the Lord of Speech, the strong, may they this day bestow upon me all their powers.

original: punar ehi vacaḥ pate devena manasā saha / vasoḥ pate ni ramaya mayi eva astu mayi śrutam /
analyzed: punar ehi vacaḥ pate devena manasā saha    vasoḥ pate ni ramaya mayi eva astu mayi śrutam  /
translated: Come back again, O Lord of Speech, with the God's mind. O Lord of treasure, delight thee in me. In me be fame.

original: iha eva abhi vi tanūbhe ārtnī iva jyayā / vācaḥ patiḥ ni yacchatu mayi eva astu mayi śrutam //
analyzed: iha eva abhi vi tanū ubhe ārtnī iva jyayā    vācaḥ patiḥ ni yacchatu mayi eva astu mayi śrutam  /
translated: Here let the Lord of Speech extend both arms as 'twere with cords. Let him, the Lord of Speech, restrain them. In me be fame.

original: upahūtaḥ vācaḥ patiḥ upa asmān vācaspatiḥ hvayatām / sam śrutena gamemahi mā śrutena vi rādhiṣi //
analyzed: upahūtaḥ vācaḥ patiḥ upa asmān vācaspatiḥ hvayatām    sam śrutena gamemahi mā śrutena vi rādhiṣi  /
translated: The Lord of Speech is invoked. Let the Lord of Speech invite us. With the heard let us go together. Do not part us from the heard.

original: vidma śarasya pitaram parjanyam bhūri dhāyasam / vidma u su asya mātaram pṛthivīm bhūri varpasam /🔽jyāke pari naḥ nama aśmānam tanvam kṛdhi / vīḍuḥ varīyaḥ arātīḥ apa dveṣāṃsi ā kṛdhi //
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram parjanyam bhūri dhāyasam   vidma u su asya mātaram pṛthivīm bhūri varpasam  / jyāke pari naḥ nama aśmānam tanvam kṛdhi   vīḍuḥ varīyaḥ arātīḥ apa dveṣāṃsi ā kṛdhi  /
translated: We know the father of the arrow, the rain-cloud, the giver of much. We know his mother also, the earth, of wondrous works.🔽O arrow, make thy body like a bow, and draw it to the ear. Make the arrows of our foes weak and powerless, and drive away their hatred.

original: vṛkṣam yat gāvaḥ pariṣasvajānāḥ anusphuram śaram arcanti ṛbhum / śarum asmat yāvaya didyum indra /
analyzed: vṛkṣam yat gāvaḥ pariṣasvajānāḥ anusphuram śaram arcanti ṛbhum   śarum asmat yāvaya didyum indra  /
translated: When the cows, lowing round the tree, praise the arrow, the swift one, the strong one, drive the arrow away from us, O Indra, drive away the lightning.

original: yathā dyām ca pṛthivīm ca antar tiṣṭhati tejanam / eva rogam ca āsrāvam ca antar tiṣṭhatu muñjaḥ id /🔽vidma śarasya pitaram parjanyam śata vṛṣṇyam / tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti /
analyzed: yathā dyām ca pṛthivīm ca antar tiṣṭhati tejanam   eva rogam ca āsrāvam ca antar tiṣṭhatu muñjaḥ id  vidma śarasya pitaram parjanyam śata vṛṣṇyam    tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti  /
translated: As heat is in the heaven and earth, so let the reed enter into the disease and the discharge.🔽We know the father of the dart, the rain-god of a hundred powers. With him we make thy body whole. Thy seed is in the earth. Without thee be the dart.

original: vidma śarasya pitaram mitram śata vṛṣṇyam / tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti /
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram mitram śata vṛṣṇyam   tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti  /
translated: We know the father of the dart, Mitra of a hundred powers. With him we make thy body whole. Thy seed is in the earth. Without thee be the dart.

original: vidma śarasya pitaram varuṇam śata vṛṣṇyam / tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti /🔽vidma śarasya pitaram candram śata vṛṣṇyam / tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti /
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram varuṇam śata vṛṣṇyam   tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti  / vidma śarasya pitaram candram śata vṛṣṇyam   tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti  /
translated: We know the father of the dart, Varuna of a hundred powers. With him we make thy body whole. Thy seed is in the earth. Without thee be the dart.🔽We know the father of the dart, the moon of a hundred powers. With him we make thy body whole. Thy seed is in the earth. Without thee be the dart.

original: vidma śarasya pitaram sūryam śata vṛṣṇyam / tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti /
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram sūryam śata vṛṣṇyam    tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti  /
translated: We know the father of the dart, the sun of a hundred powers. With him we make thy body whole. Thy seed is in the earth. Without thee be the dart.

original: yat āntreṣu gavīnyoḥ yat vastau adhi saṃśritam / eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam /
analyzed: yat āntreṣu gavīnyoḥ yat vastau adhi saṃśritam   eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam  /
translated: Even that let loose for thee, outside the body, all of it.🔽I burst thy bladder, as 'twere Vritra, the foe of the rain-cloud.

original: pra te bhinadmi mehanam vartram veśantyāḥ iva / eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam //
analyzed: pra te bhinadmi mehanam vartram veśantyāḥ iva    eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam  /
translated: Even that let loose for thee, outside the body, all of it.🔽Thy bladder is extended like the ocean, the receptacle of the sea.

original: viṣitam te vasti bilam samudrasya udadheḥ iva / eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam /
analyzed: viṣitam te vasti bilam samudrasya udadheḥ iva   eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam  /
translated: Even that let loose for thee, outside the body, all of it.🔽As an arrow shot from the bow falls down upon the ground,

original: yathā iṣukā parāpatat avasṛṣṭā adhi dhanvanaḥ / eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam /
analyzed: yathā iṣukā parāpatat avasṛṣṭā adhi dhanvanaḥ    eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam  /
translated: Even so let loose for thee, outside the body, all of it.🔽The Mothers go on their way, the Sisters are the Adhvaryus,

original: ambayaḥ yanti adhvabhiḥ jāmayaḥ adhvarīyatām / pṛñcatīḥ madhunā payaḥ /
analyzed: ambayaḥ yanti adhvabhiḥ jāmayaḥ adhvarīyatām   pṛñcatīḥ madhunā payaḥ  /
translated: Pouring out milk with honey.🔽Those that are yonder in the sun, or with the sun together,

original: amūḥ yāḥ upa sūrye yābhiḥ vā sūryaḥ saha / tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram //
analyzed: amūḥ yāḥ upa sūrye yābhiḥ vā sūryaḥ saha   tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram  /
translated: May they impel our sacrifice.🔽I call the heavenly waters, where our cows drink,

original: apaḥ devīḥ upa hvaye yatra gāvaḥ pibanti naḥ / sindhubhyaḥ kartvam haviḥ /
analyzed: apaḥ devīḥ upa hvaye yatra gāvaḥ pibanti naḥ    sindhubhyaḥ kartvam haviḥ  /
translated: The waters, the oblation to be offered to the rivers.🔽In the waters is immortality, in the waters is medicine.

original: apsu antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam / apām uta praśastibhiḥ aśvāḥ bhavatha vājinaḥ gāvaḥ bhavatha vājinīḥ /
analyzed: apsu antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam   apām uta praśastibhiḥ aśvāḥ bhavatha vājinaḥ gāvaḥ bhavatha vājinīḥ  /
translated: By the praises of the waters, O horses, become strong, become strong, O cows.

original: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana / mahe raṇāya cakṣase /
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana   mahe raṇāya cakṣase  /
translated: For ye are waters, full of blessings: give ye us strength for manly deeds, For the great joy of looking on.

original: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ / uśatīḥ iva mātaraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ    uśatīḥ iva mātaraḥ
translated: Of all your waters that are most propitious, give us a share thereof, As to fond mothers their child.

original: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha / āpaḥ janayatha ca naḥ /
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha   āpaḥ janayatha ca naḥ  /
translated: To him we come unto you all, for whose enjoyment ye quicken us, And, O ye Waters, beget us too.

original: īśānāḥ vāryāṇām kṣayantīḥ carṣaṇīnām / apaḥ yācāmi bheṣajam /
analyzed: īśānāḥ vāryāṇām kṣayantīḥ carṣaṇīnām    apaḥ yācāmi bheṣajam  /
translated: Ye who are mistresses of treasures, and dwell among the people, I ask the Waters for a balm.

original: śam naḥ devīḥ abhiṣṭaye āpaḥ bhavantu pītaye / śam yos abhi sravantu naḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ devīḥ abhiṣṭaye āpaḥ bhavantu pītaye   śam yos abhi sravantu naḥ  /
translated: Be gracious unto us, O ye Goddesses, for our protection, and for drinking: Be gracious, and flow unto us for our welfare.

original: apsu me somaḥ abravīt antar viśvāni bheṣajā / agnim ca viśva śaṃbhuvam /
analyzed: apsu me somaḥ abravīt antar viśvāni bheṣajā   agnim ca viśva śaṃbhuvam
translated: In the waters, in my inmost soul, Soma hath told me all the balms, And Agni who is gracious to all men.

original: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajam varūtham tanve mama / jyok ca sūryam dṛśe //
analyzed: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajam varūtham tanve mama  jyok ca sūryam dṛśe
translated: O Waters, give the medicine, a refuge for my body, and That I may long behold the sun.

original: śam naḥ āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ śam u santu anūpyāḥ / śam naḥ khanitrimāḥ āpaḥ śam u yāḥ kumbhe ābhṛtāḥ / śivāḥ naḥ santu vārṣikīḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ śam u santu anūpyāḥ   śam naḥ khanitrimāḥ āpaḥ śam u yāḥ kumbhe ābhṛtāḥ   śivāḥ naḥ santu vārṣikīḥ  /
translated: Be the far-stretching waters gracious to us, and the marsh waters: Be the dug-out waters gracious to us, and the waters brought in jars: Be the rain-water gracious to us.

original: stuvānam agne ā vaha yātudhānam kimīdinam / tvam hi deva vanditaḥ hantā dasyoḥ babhūvitha /
analyzed: stuvānam agne ā vaha yātudhānam kimīdinam   tvam hi deva vanditaḥ hantā dasyoḥ babhūvitha  /
translated: Bring hither, Agni, him who praises thee, the demon who injures men, For thou, O God, hast been appointed the slayer of the Dasyus.

original: ājyasya parameṣṭhin jātavedaḥ tanū vaśin / agne taulasya prāśāna yātudhānān vi lāpaya //
analyzed: ājyasya parameṣṭhin jātavedaḥ tanū vaśin   agne taulasya prāśāna yātudhānān vi lāpaya  /
translated: O Agni, O Parameshthin, O Jâtavedas, O Tanûvân, O thou who hast a share in the sacrifice, O Agni, eat up the Yâtudhânas, and drive them away.

original: vi lapantu yātudhānāḥ attriṇaḥ ye kimīdinaḥ / atha idam agne naḥ haviḥ indraḥ ca prati haryatam /
analyzed: vi lapantu yātudhānāḥ attriṇaḥ ye kimīdinaḥ    atha idam agne naḥ haviḥ indraḥ ca prati haryatam  /
translated: Let the Yâtudhânas, the sorcerers, the Kimîdins, be driven away. Then do thou and Indra, O Agni, accept this our oblation.

original: agniḥ pūrvaḥ ā rabhatām pra indraḥ nudatu bāhumān / bravītu sarvaḥ yātumān ayam asmi iti etya /
analyzed: agniḥ pūrvaḥ ā rabhatām pra indraḥ nudatu bāhumān   bravītu sarvaḥ yātumān ayam asmi iti etya  /
translated: Let Agni seize them first, and let Indra drive them away with his arms. Let every Yâtudhân declare, 'Here am I,' when he comes hither.

original: paśyāma te vīryam jātavedaḥ pra naḥ brūhi yātudhānāt nṛ cakṣaḥ / tvayā sarve paritaptāḥ purastāt te ā yantu prabruvāṇāḥ upa idam /
analyzed: paśyāma te vīryam jātavedaḥ pra naḥ brūhi yātudhānāt nṛ cakṣaḥ   tvayā sarve paritaptāḥ purastāt te ā yantu prabruvāṇāḥ upa idam  /
translated: We will behold thy power, O Jâtavedas. Tell us, thou who seest men, of the Yâtudhânas. By thee have all been scorched in days of old. Let them come hither, proclaiming this.

original: ā rabhasva jātavedaḥ asmāka arthāya jajñiṣe / dūtaḥ naḥ agne bhūtvā yātudhānān vi lāpaya //
analyzed: ā rabhasva jātavedaḥ asmāka arthāya jajñiṣe   dūtaḥ naḥ agne bhūtvā yātudhānān vi lāpaya  /
translated: Seize them, O Jâtavedas: for our sake thou hast been born. Be thou, O Agni, our messenger: drive thou the Yâtudhânas away.

original: tvam agne yātudhānān upabaddhām iha ā vaha / atha eṣām indraḥ vajreṇa api śīrṣāṇi vṛścatu /
analyzed: tvam agne yātudhānān upabaddhām iha ā vaha   atha eṣām indraḥ vajreṇa api śīrṣāṇi vṛścatu  /
translated: Bring hither, O Agni, the Yâtudhânas bound in fetters. Then let Indra with his bolt cleave the heads of these in pieces.

original: idam haviḥ yātudhānāt nādī phenam iva ā vahat / yaḥ idam strī pumān akaḥ iha saḥ stuvatām janaḥ /
analyzed: idam haviḥ yātudhānāt nādī phenam iva ā vahat    yaḥ idam strī pumān akaḥ iha saḥ stuvatām janaḥ  /
translated: This oblation let the Yâtudhânas bring hither, as foam is brought. The man or woman who hath done this, let him come hither to the people who sing praise.

original: ayam stuvānaḥ āgamat imam sma prati haryata / bṛhaspate vaśe labdhvā agnīṣomā vi vidhyatam /
analyzed: ayam stuvānaḥ āgamat imam sma prati haryata    bṛhaspate vaśe labdhvā agnīṣomā vi vidhyatam  /
translated: This man hath come to praise you: welcome him. O Br̥ihaspati, having gained the mastery, O Agni and Soma, pierce ye through.

original: yātudhānasya soma pa jahi prajām nayasva ca / ni stuvānasya pātaya param akṣi uta avaram //
analyzed: yātudhānasya soma pa jahi prajām nayasva ca   ni stuvānasya pātaya param akṣi uta avaram  /
translated: O Soma, slay the demon's offspring: lead thou his people captive. Cast down the upper and the lower eye of him who praises thee.🔽Where, O Agni, thou knowest the generations of these, of the Atri race, O all-knower,

original: yatra eṣām agne janimāni vettha guhā satām attriṇām jātavedaḥ / tān tvam brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānaḥ jahi eṣām śatatarham agne /
analyzed: yatra eṣām agne janimāni vettha guhā satām attriṇām jātavedaḥ    tān tvam brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānaḥ jahi eṣām śatatarham agne  /
translated: with prayer increased, slay thou their hundredfold army, O Agni.

original: asmin vasu vasavaḥ dhārayantu indraḥ pūṣā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ / imam ādityāḥ uta viśve ca devāḥ uttarasmin jyotiṣi dhārayantu //
analyzed: asmin vasu vasavaḥ dhārayantu indraḥ pūṣā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ   imam ādityāḥ uta viśve ca devāḥ uttarasmin jyotiṣi dhārayantu  /
translated: In this (world) let the Vasus place this (man), Indra, Pûshan, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni. Let the Âdityas and all Gods place him in the highest light.

original: asya devāḥ pradiśi jyotiḥ astu sūryaḥ agniḥ uta vā hiraṇyam / sapatnāḥ asmat adhare bhavantu uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam /
analyzed: asya devāḥ pradiśi jyotiḥ astu sūryaḥ agniḥ uta vā hiraṇyam    sapatnāḥ asmat adhare bhavantu uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam  /
translated: Let there be light for him in the region of the Gods, the Sun, Agni, and also gold. Let our rivals be beneath us. Raise him to the highest vault of heaven.🔽By which, O Jâtavedas, thou hast brought to Indra all the waters with the highest prayer,

original: yena indrāya samabharaḥ payāṃsi uttamena brahmaṇā jātavedaḥ / tena tvam agne iha vardhaya imam sajātānām śraiṣṭhye ā dhehi enam /
analyzed: yena indrāya samabharaḥ payāṃsi uttamena brahmaṇā jātavedaḥ    tena tvam agne iha vardhaya imam sajātānām śraiṣṭhye ā dhehi enam  /
translated: therewith, O Agni, increase thou this (man) here. Place him in the highest rank among his kinsmen.

original: ā eṣām yajñam uta varcaḥ dade aham rāyaḥ poṣam uta cittāni agne / sapatnāḥ asmat adhare bhavantu uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam /
analyzed: ā eṣām yajñam uta varcaḥ dade aham rāyaḥ poṣam uta cittāni agne    sapatnāḥ asmat adhare bhavantu uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam  /
translated: I give to these their sacrifice and glory, and wealth and nourishment, and thoughts, O Agni. Let our rivals be beneath us. Raise thou this man to the highest vault of heaven.

original: ayam devānām asuraḥ vi rājati vaśā hi satyā varuṇasya rājñaḥ / tatas pari brahmaṇā śāśadānaḥ ugrasya manyoḥ ud imam nayāmi //
analyzed: ayam devānām asuraḥ vi rājati vaśā hi satyā varuṇasya rājñaḥ    tatas pari brahmaṇā śāśadānaḥ ugrasya manyoḥ ud imam nayāmi  /
translated: This Asura of the Gods shines forth, for the true command of Varuna the King is powerful. From that I lead this man forth by the Brahmans grace, from the fierce wrath of Manyu.

original: namaḥ te rajan varuṇa astu manyave viśvam hi ugra nicikeṣi drugdham / sahasram anyān pra suvāmi sākam śatam jīvāti śaradaḥ tava ayam /
analyzed: namaḥ te rajan varuṇa astu manyave viśvam hi ugra nicikeṣi drugdham    sahasram anyān pra suvāmi sākam śatam jīvāti śaradaḥ tava ayam  /
translated: To thee, O Varuna, King, be homage and mercy, for thou, O mighty one, desirest all the guile of the wicked. I send a thousand others away with thee, and let this man live a hundred winters.

original: yat uvaktha anṛtam jihvayā vṛjinam bahu / rājñaḥ tvā satya dharmaṇaḥ muñcāmi varuṇāt aham /
analyzed: yat uvaktha anṛtam jihvayā vṛjinam bahu   rājñaḥ tvā satya dharmaṇaḥ muñcāmi varuṇāt aham  /
translated: The falsehood which thou hast spoken with thy tongue, the much iniquity, from the King whose law is truth, from Varuna I deliver thee.

original: muñcāmi tvā vaiśvānarāt arṇavāt mahataḥ pari / sajātān ugra iha ā vada brahma ca apa cikīhi naḥ /
analyzed: muñcāmi tvā vaiśvānarāt arṇavāt mahataḥ pari   / sajātān ugra iha ā vada brahma ca apa cikīhi naḥ  /
translated: I deliver thee from the great ocean of Vaisvânara. Speak here to thy kinsmen, O mighty one, and give us counsel.

original: vaṣaṭ te pūṣan asmin sūtau aryamā hotā kṛṇotu vedhāḥ / sisratām nārī ṛta prajātā vi parvāṇi jihatām sūtavai u //
analyzed: vaṣaṭ te pūṣan asmin sūtau aryamā hotā kṛṇotu vedhāḥ   sisratām nārī ṛta prajātā vi parvāṇi jihatām sūtavai u
translated: O Pûshan, let the Hotar Aryaman, the wise, make thee prosper in this race. Let the woman, rich in offspring, be delivered. Let the joints of the child to be born be loosened.

original: catasraḥ divaḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ bhūmyāḥ uta / devāḥ garbham sam airayan tam vi ūrṇuvantu sūtave /
analyzed: catasraḥ divaḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ bhūmyāḥ uta     garbham sam airayan tam vi ūrṇuvantu sūtave  /
translated: The four regions of the sky, and the four regions of the earth, The Gods have sent forth the germ: let them spread it out for the birth.

original: sūṣā vi ūrṇotu vi yonim hāpayāmasi / śrathaya sūṣaṇe tvam ava tvam biṣkale sṛja //
analyzed: sūṣā vi ūrṇotu vi yonim hāpayāmasi   śrathaya sūṣaṇe tvam ava tvam biṣkale sṛja  /
translated: Let the she-wolf spread it out: we cast away the womb. Break it, O thou that art to be broken: let the broken womb be cast away.

original: na iva māṃse na pīvasi nā iva majjasu āhatam / avaitu pṛśni śevalam śune jarāyu attave ava jarāyu padyatām /
analyzed: na iva māṃse na pīvasi nā iva majjasu āhatam    avaitu pṛśni śevalam śune jarāyu attave ava jarāyu padyatām  /
translated: It is not in the flesh, it is not in the fat, it is not in the marrow that it is struck. Let the spotted and the mossy know it. Let the womb be cast away.

original: vi te bhinadmi mehanam vi yonim vi gavīnike / vi mātaram ca putram ca vi kumāram jarāyuṇā ava jarāyu padyatām /
analyzed: vi te bhinadmi mehanam vi yonim vi gavīnike   vi mātaram ca putram ca vi kumāram jarāyuṇā ava jarāyu padyatām  /
translated: I break thy bladder, I break the womb, I break the two flanks. I break the mother and the son, I break the youngling with the after-birth. Let the womb be cast away.

original: yathā vātaḥ yathā manaḥ yathā patanti pakṣiṇaḥ / eva tvam daśamāsya sākam jarāyuṇā pata ava jarāyu padyatām /
analyzed: yathā vātaḥ yathā manaḥ yathā patanti pakṣiṇaḥ   / eva tvam daśamāsya sākam jarāyuṇā pata ava jarāyu padyatām  /
translated: As the wind blows, as the mind moves, as birds fly through the air, so, O thou of ten months, with the after-birth, fall down. Let the womb be cast away.

original: jarāyu jaḥ prathamaḥ usriyaḥ vṛṣā vāta abhra jā stanayan eti vṛṣṭyā / sa naḥ mṛḍāti tanvaḥ ṛju gaḥ rujan yaḥ ekam ojaḥ tredhā vicakrame /
analyzed: jarāyu jaḥ prathamaḥ usriyaḥ vṛṣā vāta abhra jā stanayan eti vṛṣṭyā    sa naḥ mṛḍāti tanvaḥ ṛju gaḥ rujan yaḥ ekam ojaḥ tredhā vicakrame  /
translated: The first-born son of the after-birth, the bull, the cloud-born, thundering with rain, comes to us. He, the straight-going, breaks our bodies. He who hath divided his single strength into three parts.

original: aṅge aṅge śociṣā śiśriyāṇam namasyantaḥ tvā haviṣā vidhema / aṅkān samaṅkān haviṣā vidhema yaḥ agrabhīt parvā asyāḥ grabhītā /
analyzed: aṅge aṅge śociṣā śiśriyāṇam namasyantaḥ tvā haviṣā vidhema   aṅkān samaṅkān haviṣā vidhema yaḥ agrabhīt parvā asyāḥ grabhītā  /
translated: In every limb, penetrating with thy flame, we will adore thee, honouring thee with our oblation. We will honour with our oblation the joints and the members. He who hath seized this one's joints is seized himself.

original: muñca śīrṣaktyai uta kāsaḥ enam paruḥ paruḥ āviveśa yaḥ asya / yaḥ abhra jāḥ vāta jāḥ yaḥ ca śuṣmaḥ vanaspatīn sacatām parvatān ca /
analyzed: muñca śīrṣaktyai uta kāsaḥ enam paruḥ paruḥ āviveśa yaḥ asya   yaḥ abhra jāḥ vāta jāḥ yaḥ ca śuṣmaḥ vanaspatīn sacatām parvatān ca  /
translated: Let the cough leave his head and his throat. The disease that hath entered his limbs, joint by joint,

original: śam me parasmai gātrāya śam astu avarāya me / śam me caturbhyaḥ aṅgebhyaḥ śam astu tanve mama /
analyzed: śam me parasmai gātrāya śam astu avarāya me   śam me caturbhyaḥ aṅgebhyaḥ śam astu tanve mama  /
translated: Be peace to the upper part of my body, be peace to the lower part of me. Be peace to my four limbs, be peace to my body.

original: namaḥ te astu vidyute namaḥ te stanayitnave / namaḥ te astu aśmane yena dūḍāśe asyasi //🔽namaḥ te pravataḥ napāt yatas tapaḥ samūhasi / mṛḍaya naḥ tanūbhyaḥ mayaḥ tokebhyaḥ kṛdhi //
analyzed: namaḥ te astu vidyute namaḥ te stanayitnave   namaḥ te astu aśmane yena dūḍāśe asyasi  / namaḥ te pravataḥ napāt yatas tapaḥ samūhasi   mṛḍaya naḥ tanūbhyaḥ mayaḥ tokebhyaḥ kṛdhi  /
translated: Homage to thee, O lightning! Homage to thee, O thunder! Homage to thee, O stone, wherewith thou smitest Dūdāśu!🔽Homage to thee, O son of the mountain, from whom thou gatherest heat. Be gracious to our bodies, and make us happy in our children.

original: pravataḥ napāt namaḥ eva astu tubhyam namaḥ te hetaye tapuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ / vidma te dhāma paramam guhā yat samudre antar nihitā asi nābhiḥ //
analyzed: pravataḥ napāt namaḥ eva astu tubhyam namaḥ te hetaye tapuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ   vidma te dhāma paramam guhā yat samudre antar nihitā asi nābhiḥ  /
translated: To thee, O son of the mountain, let homage be paid. To thy heat and thy impulse we offer homage. We know thy highest abode, which is in the ocean, hidden as thy navel.

original: yām tvā devāḥ asṛjanta viśve iṣum kṛṇvānāḥ asanāya dhṛṣṇum / sā naḥ mṛḍa vidathe gṛṇānā tasyai te namaḥ astu devi //
analyzed: yām tvā devāḥ asṛjanta viśve iṣum kṛṇvānāḥ asanāya dhṛṣṇum    sā naḥ mṛḍa vidathe gṛṇānā tasyai te namaḥ astu devi  /
translated: The shaft which all the Gods have fashioned for the strong man to wield, be gracious to us, Goddess, when we sing thy praise. To thee, O Goddess, be homage.

original: bhagam asyāḥ varcaḥ ādiṣi adhi vṛkṣāt iva srajam / mahā budhnaḥ iva parvataḥ jyok pitṛṣu āstām /
analyzed: bhagam asyāḥ varcaḥ ādiṣi adhi vṛkṣāt iva srajam   mahā budhnaḥ iva parvataḥ jyok pitṛṣu āstām  /
translated: I have taken from this maiden her beauty and her splendour, as a garland from a tree. Like a great rock, let her remain firm among her fathers.

original: eṣā te rājan kanyā vadhūḥ ni dhūyatām yama / sā mātuḥ badhyatām gṛhe atha u bhrātuḥ atha u pituḥ /
analyzed: eṣā te rājan kanyā vadhūḥ ni dhūyatām yama    sā mātuḥ badhyatām gṛhe atha u bhrātuḥ atha u pituḥ  /
translated: This maiden, O King Yama, is thy wife. Let her be taken away. Let her be bound in her mother's house, and then in her brother's, and then in her father's.

original: eṣā te kulapā rājan tām u te pari dadmasi / jyok pitṛṣu āsātai ā śīrṣṇaḥ śamopyāt /
analyzed: eṣā te kulapā rājan tām u te pari dadmasi    jyok pitṛṣu āsātai ā śīrṣṇaḥ śamopyāt  /
translated: This is thy share, O King, which we give thee back. Let her remain firm among her fathers. Let her be bound to the head.

original: asitasya te brahmaṇā kaśyapasya gayasya ca / antaḥkośam iva jāmayaḥ api nahyāmi te bhagam // //
analyzed: asitasya te brahmaṇā kaśyapasya gayasya ca    antaḥkośam iva jāmayaḥ api nahyāmi te bhagam
translated: With the Brahman of the dark one, with the Brahman of Kasyapa and Gaya, I bind thy beauty, as kinswomen bind the inner sheath.

original: sam sam sravantu sindhavaḥ sam vātāḥ sam patatriṇaḥ / imam yajñam pradivaḥ me juṣantām saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi //
analyzed: sam sam sravantu sindhavaḥ sam vātāḥ sam patatriṇaḥ   imam yajñam pradivaḥ me juṣantām saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi  /
translated: Let the rivers flow together, let the winds blow together, let the birds fly together. Let the sky rejoice in this sacrifice of mine. I offer with the oblation of the Samasrava.

original: iha eva havam ā yāta me iha saṃsrāvaṇāḥ uta imam vardhayata giraḥ / iha etu sarvaḥ yaḥ paśuḥ asmin tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ /
analyzed: iha eva havam ā yāta me iha saṃsrāvaṇāḥ uta imam vardhayata giraḥ   iha etu sarvaḥ yaḥ paśuḥ asmin tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ  /
translated: Come hither to this very place, come hither to the libations here. Exalt these songs of mine.🔽The streams of water that flow down from the mountains, never failing,

original: ye nadīnām saṃsravanti utsāsaḥ sadam akṣitāḥ / tebhiḥ me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvaiḥ dhanam sam srāvayāmasi //
analyzed: ye nadīnām saṃsravanti utsāsaḥ sadam akṣitāḥ   tebhiḥ me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvaiḥ dhanam sam srāvayāmasi  /
translated: With all those streams of water we pour forth wealth for ourselves.

original: ye sarpiṣaḥ saṃsravanti kṣīrasya ca udakasya ca
analyzed: ye sarpiṣaḥ saṃsravanti kṣīrasya ca udakasya ca
translated: Those that flow down from clarified butter, from milk and water,

original: tebhiḥ me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvaiḥ dhanam sam srāvayāmasi //
analyzed: tebhiḥ me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvaiḥ dhanam sam srāvayāmasi
translated: With all those streams of water we pour forth wealth for ourselves.🔽Those who rise at night on the new moon day, the wanderers who eat,

original: ye amāvāsyām rātrim udasthuḥ vrājam attriṇaḥ / agniḥ turīyaḥ yātu hā saḥ asmabhyam adhi bravat /
analyzed: ye amāvāsyām rātrim udasthuḥ vrājam attriṇaḥ   / agniḥ turīyaḥ yātu hā saḥ asmabhyam adhi bravat  /
translated: May Agni, the fourth, the slayer of the demons, speak for us.🔽Varuna has spoken for lead, lead is protected by Agni.

original: sīsāya adhi āha varuṇaḥ sīsāya agniḥ upāvati / sīsam me indraḥ prāyacchat tat aṅga yātu cātanam /
analyzed: sīsāya adhi āha varuṇaḥ sīsāya agniḥ upāvati   sīsam me indraḥ prāyacchat tat aṅga yātu cātanam  /
translated: Indra gave me lead, that is the charm for driving away the demons.🔽This lead conquers the Viskandha demons, this drives away the wanderers.

original: idam viṣkandham sahate idam bādhate attriṇaḥ / anena viśvā sasahe yā jātāni piśācyāḥ /
analyzed: idam viṣkandham sahate idam bādhate attriṇaḥ   anena viśvā sasahe yā jātāni piśācyāḥ  /
translated: By this I conquer all the Pishachas that have been born.🔽If thou slayest our cow, or our horse, or our man,

original: yadi naḥ gām haṃsi yadi aśvam yadi pūruṣam / tam tvā sīsena vidhyāmaḥ yathā naḥ asaḥ avīra hā /
analyzed: yadi naḥ gām haṃsi yadi aśvam yadi pūruṣam   tam tvā sīsena vidhyāmaḥ yathā naḥ asaḥ avīra hā  /
translated: We will pierce thee with lead, that thou mayest not slay our hero.

original: amūḥ yāḥ yanti yoṣitaḥ hirāḥ lohita vāsasaḥ / abhrātaraḥ iva jāmayaḥ tiṣṭhantu hata varcasaḥ /
analyzed: amūḥ yāḥ yanti yoṣitaḥ hirāḥ lohita vāsasaḥ   abhrātaraḥ iva jāmayaḥ tiṣṭhantu hata varcasaḥ  /
translated: Like sisters without brothers, stand ye, shorn of splendour, as ye are.🔽Stand thou below, stand thou above, stand thou in the middle place.

original: tiṣṭha avare tiṣṭha paras uta tvam tiṣṭha madhyame / kaniṣṭhikā ca tiṣṭhati tiṣṭhāt id dhamaniḥ mahī /
analyzed: tiṣṭha avare tiṣṭha paras uta tvam tiṣṭha madhyame   kaniṣṭhikā ca tiṣṭhati tiṣṭhāt id dhamaniḥ mahī  /
translated: The little finger also stands, and the great sinew stands erect.🔽Of the hundred sinews and the thousand nerves,

original: śatasya dhamanīnām sahasrasya hirāṇām / asthuḥ id madhyamāḥ imāḥ sākam antāḥ araṃsata /
analyzed: śatasya dhamanīnām sahasrasya hirāṇām   asthuḥ id madhyamāḥ imāḥ sākam antāḥ araṃsata  /
translated: These are the middlemost, they have stood firm, and have all moved together.🔽The mighty bow of yours, with sand for its string, hath passed around.

original: pari vaḥ sikatāvatī dhanūḥ bṛhatī akramīt / tiṣṭhatā ilayatā su kam //
analyzed: pari vaḥ sikatāvatī dhanūḥ bṛhatī akramīt tiṣṭhatā ilayatā su kam
translated: Stand ye, O ye two, in easy place.🔽We heal away the markless, the shapeless, and the spiteful.

original: niḥ lakṣmyam lalāmyam niḥ arātim suvāmasi / atha yā bhadrā tāni naḥ prajāyāḥ arātim nayāmasi //
analyzed: niḥ lakṣmyam lalāmyam niḥ arātim suvāmasi    atha yā bhadrā tāni naḥ prajāyāḥ arātim nayāmasi  /
translated: But those which are auspicious, we bring to our offspring for their welfare.🔽Savitar hath loosened from thy feet the splint, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, from thy hands.

original: niḥ araṇim savitā sāviṣak padoḥ niḥ hastayoḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā / niḥ asmabhyam anumatiḥ rarāṇā pra imām devāḥ asāviṣuḥ saubhagāya /
analyzed: niḥ araṇim savitā sāviṣat padoḥ niḥ hastayoḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā    niḥ asmabhyam anumatiḥ rarāṇā pra imām devāḥ asāviṣuḥ saubhagāya  /
translated: Anumati hath loosened for us the bone, and the Gods have loosened this for our welfare.

original: yat te ātmani tanvām ghoram asti yat vā keśeṣu praticakṣaṇe vā / sarvam tat vācā apa hanmaḥ vayam devaḥ tvā savitā sūdayatu //
analyzed: yat te ātmani tanvām ghoram asti yat vā keśeṣu praticakṣaṇe vā    sarvam tat vācā apa hanmaḥ vayam devaḥ tvā savitā sūdayatu  /
translated: All that we drive away with speech. May the God Savitar make thee ready.🔽The Rishya-padî, the Vrishâdâtî, the Go-shedhâ, the Vidhâman,

original: riśyapadīm vṛṣadatīm goṣedhām vidhamām uta / vilīḍhyam lalāmyam tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi //
analyzed: riśyapadīm vṛṣadatīm goṣedhām vidhamām uta  / vilīḍhyam lalāmyam tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi  /
translated: The Vilîdhyâ, the Lalâmî, these we banish from ourselves.🔽Let them not find us who would pierce us, let them not find us who would over-pierce us.

original: mā naḥ vidan vivyādhinaḥ mā u abhivyādhinaḥ vidan / ārāt śaravyāḥ asmat viṣūcīḥ indra pātaya /
analyzed: mā naḥ vidan vivyādhinaḥ mā u abhivyādhinaḥ vidan    ārāt śaravyāḥ asmat viṣūcīḥ indra pātaya  /
translated: From afar drive thou away from us the arrow, O Indra, drive it from us from every side.🔽Let the arrows fly from us to our enemies, those that are here and those that are afar.

original: viṣvañcaḥ asmat śaravaḥ patantu ye astāḥ ye ca asyāḥ / daivīḥ manuṣyesavaḥ mama amitrān vi vidhyata //
analyzed: viṣvañcaḥ asmat śaravaḥ patantu ye astāḥ ye ca asyāḥ   daivīḥ manuṣyesavaḥ mama amitrān vi vidhyata  /
translated: The heavenly and the human powers of mine, O Rudra, pierce my enemies.🔽The foe who is within our house, the foe who is without, the foe who is a stranger, and he who is a neighbour, and he who threatens us,

original: yaḥ naḥ svaḥ yaḥ araṇaḥ sajātaḥ uta niṣṭyaḥ yaḥ asmān abhidāsati / rudraḥ śaravyayā etān mama amitrān vi vidhyatu //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ svaḥ yaḥ araṇaḥ sajātaḥ uta niṣṭyaḥ yaḥ asmān abhidāsati    rudraḥ śaravyayā etān mama amitrān vi vidhyatu  /
translated: Let Rudra with his arrow pierce these my enemies.

original: yaḥ sapatnaḥ yaḥ asapatnaḥ yaḥ ca dviṣan śapāti naḥ / devāḥ tam sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mama antaram /
analyzed: yaḥ sapatnaḥ yaḥ asapatnaḥ yaḥ ca dviṣan śapāti naḥ   / devāḥ tam sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mama antaram  /
translated: Let all the Gods afflict the foe, whether he be a friend or stranger, or he who, hating us, reviles us. Let the Brahman's armour be between me and them.

original: adāra sṛt bhavatu deva soma asmin yajñe marutaḥ mṛḍata naḥ / mā naḥ vidat abhibhā mā u aśastiḥ mā naḥ vidat vṛjinā dveṣyā yā /
analyzed: adāra sṛt bhavatu deva soma asmin yajñe marutaḥ mṛḍata naḥ    mā naḥ vidat abhibhā mā u aśastiḥ mā naḥ vidat vṛjinā dveṣyā yā  /
translated: Be thou, O God Soma, a path that leads not to destruction. Be ye propitious to us, O Maruts, in this sacrifice. Let not the curse find us, let not the slander find us. Let not the treacherous, hateful sin find us.🔽The weapon which today is raised against us, O ye who slay the wicked,

original: yaḥ adya senyaḥ vadhaḥ aghāyūnām udīrate / yuvam tam mitrāvaruṇau asmat yāvayatam pari /
analyzed: yaḥ adya senyaḥ vadhaḥ aghāyūnām udīrate    yuvam tam mitrāvaruṇau asmat yāvayatam pari  /
translated: Turn that away from us, O Mitra and Varuna.

original: itas ca yat amutas ca yat vadham varuṇa yāvaya / vi mahat śarma yaccha varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham /
analyzed: itas ca yat amutas ca yat vadham varuṇa yāvaya   vi mahat śarma yaccha varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham
translated: From this place and from that place, O Varuna, turn away the weapon. Give us wide protection, give us a great protection, turn away the weapon.🔽Thou art the great chastiser here, unconquered, O Indra, in the slaying of foes,

original: śāsaḥ itthā mahān asi amitra sāhaḥ a stṛtaḥ / na yasya hanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana /
analyzed: śāsaḥ itthā mahān asi amitra sāhaḥ a stṛtaḥ   na yasya hanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana  /
translated: Whose friend is never slain, who is never overcome at any time.🔽The giver of welfare, the lord of the people, the slayer of Vrtra, the victorious, the powerful,

original: svasti dāḥ viśām patiḥ vṛtra hā vimṛdhaḥ vaśī / vṛṣā indraḥ puras etu naḥ soma pāḥ abhayaṃkaraḥ /
analyzed: svasti dāḥ viśām patiḥ vṛtra hā vimṛdhaḥ vaśī   vṛṣā indraḥ puras etu naḥ soma pāḥ abhayaṃkaraḥ  /
translated: May the bull Indra go before us, the drinker of Soma, the giver of safety.🔽Drive thou our enemies away, O Indra, cast down those who fight against us.

original: vi naḥ indra mṛdhaḥ jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ / adhamam gamaya tamaḥ yaḥ asmām abhidāsati //
analyzed: vi naḥ indra mṛdhaḥ jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ    adhamam gamaya tamaḥ yaḥ asmām abhidāsati  /
translated: Crush thou the lowest darkness of him who riseth up against us.🔽Destroy the Rakshas, destroy the foes, break thou the jaws of Vrtra.

original: vi rakṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja / vi manyum indra vṛtrahan amitrasya abhidāsataḥ /
analyzed: vi rakṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja   vi manyum indra vṛtrahan amitrasya abhidāsataḥ  /
translated: Destroy the wrath, O Indra, Vrtra-killer, of the foe who riseth up against us.

original: apa indra dviṣataḥ manaḥ apa jijyāsataḥ vadham / vi mahat śarma yaccha varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham /
analyzed: apa indra dviṣataḥ manaḥ apa jijyāsataḥ vadham    vi mahat śarma yaccha varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham
translated: Drive thou away, O Indra, the thought of those who hate us, drive thou away the weapon of the spiteful. Give thou wide shelter, give us ample freedom from the blow.

original: anu sūryam ud ayatām hṛd dyotaḥ harimā ca te / goḥ rohitasya varṇena tena tvā pari dadhmasi //
analyzed: anu sūryam ud ayatām hṛd dyotaḥ harimā ca te    goḥ rohitasya varṇena tena tvā pari dadhmasi  /
translated: Let thy heart's light and thy tawny radiance rise up with the Sun. With the red cow's hue we invest thee with it.

original: pari tvā rohitaiḥ varṇaiḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya dadhmasi / yathā ayam arapāḥ asat atha u a haritaḥ bhuvat /
analyzed: pari tvā rohitaiḥ varṇaiḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya dadhmasi   yathā ayam arapāḥ asat atha u a haritaḥ bhuvat  /
translated: We invest thee with the red-hued rays of light for the sake of lengthened life, that thou mayst be without disease, and then become a tawny-coloured cow.

original: yāḥ rohiṇīḥ devatyāḥ gāvaḥ yāḥ uta rohiṇīḥ / rūpam rūpam vayaḥ vayaḥ tābhiḥ tvā pari dadhmasi //
analyzed: yāḥ rohiṇīḥ devatyāḥ gāvaḥ yāḥ uta rohiṇīḥ   rūpam rūpam vayaḥ vayaḥ tābhiḥ tvā pari dadhmasi  /
translated: The cows that are red-hued, and those that are red-spotted, every form, every age, with these we invest thee.

original: śukeṣu te harimāṇam ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi / atha u hāridraveṣu te harimāṇam ni dadhmasi //
analyzed: śukeṣu te harimāṇam ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi    atha u hāridraveṣu te harimāṇam ni dadhmasi  /
translated: In the parrots we lay thy tawny hue, and in the partridges. And in the yellow orpiment we lay thy tawny colour.

original: naktaṃjātā asi oṣadhe rāme kṛṣṇe asikni ca / idam rajani rajaya kilāsam palitam ca yat /
analyzed: naktaṃjātā asi oṣadhe rāme kṛṣṇe asikni ca   idam rajani rajaya kilāsam palitam ca yat
translated: Thou art the herb that sprang to life at night, O Ramê, Krishna, and Asîknya. Here, O Night, dye the leprosy and grey hairs that are on him.

original: kilāsam ca palitam ca niḥ itas nāśaya pṛṣat / ā tvā svaḥ viśatām varṇaḥ parā śuklāni pātaya /
analyzed: kilāsam ca palitam ca niḥ itas nāśaya pṛṣat    ā tvā svaḥ viśatām varṇaḥ parā śuklāni pātaya  /
translated: Leprosy and grey hairs, drive them away from hence, O speckled one. Let thy own hue enter into thee: let the white ones fall away.

original: asitam te pralayanam āsthānam asitam tava / asiknī asi oṣadhe niḥ itas nāśaya pṛṣat /
analyzed: asitam te pralayanam āsthānam asitam tava    asiknī asi oṣadhe niḥ itas nāśaya pṛṣat  /
translated: Thy dwelling is in the black, thy station is in the black. Thou art the black plant, O Plant: drive away from hence the pimple.

original: asthi jasya kilāsasya tanū jasya ca yat tvaci / dūṣyā kṛtasya brahmaṇā lakṣma śvetam anīnaśam //
analyzed: asthi jasya kilāsasya tanū jasya ca yat tvaci   dūṣyā kṛtasya brahmaṇā lakṣma śvetam anīnaśam  /
translated: The white spot which is in the flesh of the pimple, and which is in the skin of the body,

original: suparṇaḥ jātaḥ prathamaḥ tasya tvam pittam āsitha / tat āsurī yudhā jitā rūpam cakre vanaspatīn /
analyzed: suparṇaḥ jātaḥ prathamaḥ tasya tvam pittam āsitha   tat āsurī yudhā jitā rūpam cakre vanaspatīn  /
translated: The eagle was born first of all: thou wast his bile. The Asura won thee by fight, and made thee the trees.

original: āsurī cakre prathamā idam kilāsa bheṣajam idam kilāsa nāśanam / anīnaśat kilāsam sarūpām akarat tvacam /
analyzed: āsurī cakre prathamā idam kilāsa bheṣajam idam kilāsa nāśanam   anīnaśat kilāsam sarūpām akarat tvacam
translated: The Asura first made this remedy for the pimple, this destroyer of the pimple. He destroyed the pimple, and made the skin whole.

original: sarūpā nāma te mātā sarūpaḥ nāma te pitā / sarūpa kṛt tvam oṣadhe sā sarūpam idam kṛdhi //
analyzed: sarūpā nāma te mātā sarūpaḥ nāma te pitā   sarūpa kṛt tvam oṣadhe sā sarūpam idam kṛdhi  /
translated: Thy mother is called Sarupa, thy father is called Sarupa. Thou art the plant that makes Sarupa: make thou this Sarupa.

original: śyāmā sarūpaṃkaraṇī pṛthivyāḥ adhi udbhṛtā / idam u su pra sādhaya punā rūpāṇi kalpaya /
analyzed: śyāmā sarūpaṃkaraṇī pṛthivyāḥ adhi udbhṛtā   idam u su pra sādhaya punā rūpāṇi kalpaya  /
translated: The dark-hued Sarupamkarani is raised up above the earth. Do thou, O pimple, make this well: restore the skin to its former condition.🔽Where Agni, entering the waters, hath burnt them up, where they have made the limbs that hold the Law,

original: yat agniḥ āpaḥ adahat praviśya yatra akṛṇvan dharma dhṛtaḥ namāṃsi / tatra te āhuḥ paramam janitram sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman /
analyzed: yat agniḥ āpaḥ adahat praviśya yatra akṛṇvan dharma dhṛtaḥ namāṃsi   tatra te āhuḥ paramam janitram sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman  /
translated: There they call thee the highest source of life. Thou, O lightning, knowing our agreement, pass by us.

original: yadi arciḥ yadi vā asi śociḥ śakalyeṣi yadi vā te janitram / hrūḍuḥ nāma asi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman /
analyzed: yadi arciḥ yadi vā asi śociḥ śakalyeṣi yadi vā te janitram   hrūḍuḥ nāma asi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman  /
translated: Thou art called Hrudu, god of the green one. Knowing our agreement, O lightning, pass us by.🔽If thou art grief, or if thou art great grief, or if thou art the son of king Varuna,

original: yadi śokaḥ yadi vā abhiśokaḥ yadi vā rājñaḥ varuṇasya asi putraḥ / hrūḍuḥ nāma asi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman /
analyzed: yadi śokaḥ yadi vā abhiśokaḥ yadi vā rājñaḥ varuṇasya asi putraḥ   hrūḍuḥ nāma asi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman  /
translated: Thou art called Hrudu, god of the green one. Knowing our agreement, O lightning, pass us by.

original: namaḥ śītāya takmane namaḥ rūrāya śociṣe kṛṇomi / yaḥ anyedyus ubhayadyus abhyeti tṛtīyakāya namaḥ astu takmane /
analyzed: namaḥ śītāya takmane namaḥ rūrāya śociṣe kṛṇomi   yaḥ anyedyus ubhayadyus abhyeti tṛtīyakāya namaḥ astu takmane  /
translated: I pay homage to the cold lightning, to the red lightning I pay homage.

original: āre asau asmat astu hetiḥ devāsaḥ asat / āre aśmā yam asyatha / āre aśmā yam asyatha /
analyzed: āre asau asmat astu hetiḥ devāsaḥ asat    āre aśmā yam asyatha
translated: Let that weapon be far from us, O gods, let the stone be far from us which ye have hurled, let the stone be far from us which ye have hurled.

original: sakhā asau asmabhyam astu rātiḥ sakhā indraḥ bhagaḥ / savitā citra rādhāḥ /
analyzed: sakhā asau asmabhyam astu rātiḥ sakhā indraḥ bhagaḥ savitā citra rādhāḥ
translated: Let that bounty be a friend to us, let Indra be a friend, let Savitar be a friend, the bountiful.🔽Ye, sons of the mountain, O Maruts, having the sun for your garment,

original: yūyam naḥ pravataḥ napāt marutaḥ sūrya tvacasaḥ / śarma yacchatha saprathāḥ //
analyzed: yūyam naḥ pravataḥ napāt marutaḥ sūrya tvacasaḥ   śarma yacchatha saprathāḥ  /
translated: Grant us protection, ye who are renowned.

original: suṣūdata mṛḍata mṛḍayā naḥ tanūbhyaḥ / mayaḥ tokebhyaḥ kṛdhi //
analyzed: suṣūdata mṛḍata mṛḍayā naḥ tanūbhyaḥ   mayaḥ tokebhyaḥ kṛdhi  /
translated: Purify yourselves, be gracious, be gracious to our bodies,🔽And bestow favour on our children.

original: amūḥ pāre pṛdākvaḥ triṣaptāḥ nirjarāyavaḥ / tāsām jarāyubhiḥ vayam akṣyau api vyayāmasi aghāyoḥ paripanthinaḥ /
analyzed: amūḥ pāre pṛdākvaḥ triṣaptāḥ nirjarāyavaḥ   tāsām jarāyubhiḥ vayam akṣyau api vyayāmasi aghāyoḥ paripanthinaḥ  /
translated: With their caul we cover our eyes, of the wicked, who lie in wait for us.🔽Let it go forth, cutting in twain, bearing the bow of Indra,

original: viṣūcī etu kṛntatī pinākam iva bibhratī / viṣvak punarbhuvā manaḥ asamṛddhāḥ aghāyavaḥ /
analyzed: viṣūcī etu kṛntatī pinākam iva bibhratī   viṣvak punarbhuvā manaḥ asamṛddhāḥ aghāyavaḥ  /
translated: The mind of the woman who bears again. The wicked have not prospered.🔽Many have not been able, nor have the young been bold enough to attack.

original: na bahavaḥ sam aśakat na arbhakāḥ abhi dādhṛṣuḥ / veṇoḥ adgāḥ iva abhitas asamṛddhāḥ aghāyavaḥ /
analyzed: na bahavaḥ sam aśakat na arbhakāḥ abhi dādhṛṣuḥ   veṇoḥ adgāḥ iva abhitas asamṛddhāḥ aghāyavaḥ  /
translated: Like the horns of a bamboo, the wicked have not prospered on every side.🔽Go forth, O feet, and move, and carry the full to their homes.

original: pretam pādau pra sphuratam vahatam pṛṇataḥ gṛhān / indrāni etu prathamā ajīta a muṣitā puras /
analyzed: pretam pādau pra sphuratam vahatam pṛṇataḥ gṛhān   indrāni etu prathamā ajīta a muṣitā puras  /
translated: Let the first prize-winning wife come forth, O Indra, uninjured, in front.🔽The god Agni hath come forward, the slayer of Raksases, the repeller of disease,

original: upa prāgāt devaḥ agniḥ rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ / dahan apa dvayāvinaḥ yātudhānān kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: upa prāgāt devaḥ agniḥ rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ   dahan apa dvayāvinaḥ yātudhānān kimīdinaḥ  /
translated: Burning the double-dealing Yatudhanas and Kimīdins.🔽Burn thou the Yatudhanas, O god, burn thou the Kimīdins.

original: prati daha yātudhānān prati deva kimīdinaḥ / pratīcīḥ kṛṣṇavartane sam daha yātudhānyaḥ /
analyzed: prati daha yātudhānān prati deva kimīdinaḥ   pratīcīḥ kṛṣṇa vartane sam daha yātudhānyaḥ
translated: Burn thou the black-spotted Yatudhanis, as they come against us.🔽She who hath cursed with a curse, she who hath laid evil and folly,

original: yā śaśāpa śapanena yā agham mūram ādadhe / yā rasasya haraṇāya jātam ārebhe tokam attu sā /
analyzed: yā śaśāpa śapanena yā agham mūram ādadhe   yā rasasya haraṇāya jātam ārebhe tokam attu sā  /
translated: She who hath thirsted for the carrying off of the sap, let her eat her own offspring.

original: putram attu yātudhānīḥ svasāram uta naptyam / adhā mithas vikeśyaḥ vi ghnatām yātudhānyaḥ vi tṛhyantām arāyyaḥ //
analyzed: putram attu yātudhānīḥ svasāram uta naptyam   adhā mithas vikeśyaḥ vi ghnatām yātudhānyaḥ vi tṛhyantām arāyyaḥ  /
translated: Let the she-fiends devour their son, and sister, and their grandchild. So let the women with dishevelled hair destroy each other, and let the she-fiends and the wicked perish.

original: abhīvartena maṇinā yena indraḥ abhivavṛdhe / tena asmān brahmaṇas pate abhi rāṣṭrāya vardhaya //
analyzed: abhīvartena maṇinā yena indraḥ abhivavṛdhe   tena asmān brahmaṇas pate abhi rāṣṭrāya vardhaya  /
translated: With the Amulet Abhivarta, wherewith Indra waxed in strength, Do thou, O Brahmanaspati, with that make me to wax in strength for the kingdom.

original: abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yāḥ naḥ arātayaḥ / abhi pṛtanyantam tiṣṭha abhi yaḥ naḥ durasyati //
analyzed: abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yāḥ naḥ arātayaḥ   abhi pṛtanyantam tiṣṭha abhi yaḥ naḥ durasyati  /
translated: Surpassing our foes, surpassing those who hate us, Stand thou surpassing him who fights against us, surpassing him who injures us.

original: abhi tvā devaḥ savitā abhi ṣomaḥ avīvṛdhat / abhi tvā viśvā bhūtāni abhīvartaḥ yathā asasi /
analyzed: abhi tvā devaḥ savitā abhi ṣomaḥ avīvṛdhat    abhi tvā viśvā bhūtāni abhīvartaḥ yathā asasi  /
translated: Thee hath Savitar the God surpassed, thee hath Soma surpassed. Thee have all beings surpassed, that thou mayst be the Abhivarta.

original: abhīvartaḥ abhibhavaḥ sapatna kṣayaṇaḥ maṇiḥ / rāṣṭrāya mahyam badhyatām sapatnebhyaḥ parābhuve /
analyzed: abhīvartaḥ abhibhavaḥ sapatna kṣayaṇaḥ maṇiḥ   rāṣṭrāya mahyam badhyatām sapatnebhyaḥ parābhuve  /
translated: The Amulet Abhivarta, the conqueror, the destroyer of foes, Be bound for my kingdom, to overcome my spiteful rivals.

original: ud asau sūryaḥ agāt ud idam māmakam vacaḥ / yathā aham śatru haḥ asāni a sapatnaḥ sapatna hā /
analyzed: ud asau sūryaḥ agāt ud idam māmakam vacaḥ   yathā aham śatru haḥ asāni a sapatnaḥ sapatna hā  /
translated: Up hath that Sun ascended, up hath this word of mine ascended, That I may be a slayer of foes, a victor, a foe-destroyer.

original: sapatna kṣayaṇaḥ vṛṣā abhiraṣṭraḥ viṣāsahiḥ / yathā aham eṣām vīrāṇām virājāni janasya ca /
analyzed: sapatna kṣayaṇaḥ vṛṣā abhiraṣṭraḥ viṣāsahiḥ    yathā aham eṣām vīrāṇām virājāni janasya ca  /
translated: The foe-destroyer, the bull, the conqueror, the foe-subduer, That I may be the lord of these heroes and of the people.

original: viśve devāḥ vasavaḥ rakṣata imam uta ādityāḥ jāgṛta yūyam asmin / mā imam sanābhiḥ uta vā anyanābhiḥ mā imam prāpat pauruṣeyaḥ vadhaḥ yaḥ /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ vasavaḥ rakṣata imam uta ādityāḥ jāgṛta yūyam asmin    mā imam sanābhiḥ uta vā anyanābhiḥ mā imam prāpat pauruṣeyaḥ vadhaḥ yaḥ  /
translated: All ye Gods, ye Vasus, guard this man: ye Âdityas, watch ye over him. Let not this man be struck by the weapon of a fellow-man, whether he be a kinsman or a stranger.

original: ye vaḥ devāḥ pitaraḥ ye ca putrāḥ sacetasaḥ me śṛṇuta idam uktam / sarvebhyaḥ vaḥ pari dadāmi etam svasti enam jarase vahātha /
analyzed: ye vaḥ devāḥ pitaraḥ ye ca putrāḥ sacetasaḥ me śṛṇuta idam uktam    sarvebhyaḥ vaḥ pari dadāmi etam svasti enam jarase vahātha  /
translated: Ye Gods, who are the Fathers of this man, and ye his sons, ye who are of one mind with him, hear this my speech. Him I deliver over to you all: bear him in safety to old age.

original: ye devāḥ divi ṣṭha ye pṛthivyām ye antarikṣe oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar / te kṛṇuta jarasam āyuḥ asmai śatam anyān pari vṛṇaktu mṛtyūn //
analyzed: ye devāḥ divi ṣṭha ye pṛthivyām ye antarikṣe oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar   te kṛṇuta jarasam āyuḥ asmai śatam anyān pari vṛṇaktu mṛtyūn  /
translated: Ye Gods who dwell in heaven, on earth, in air's wide region, in plants, in cattle, in the waters, grant him a hundred winters yet of life. Let him escape a hundred deaths.

original: yeṣām prayājāḥ uta vā anuyājāḥ huta bhāgāḥ a huta adaḥ ca devāḥ / yeṣām vaḥ pañca pradiśaḥ vibhaktāḥ tān vaḥ asmai satra sadaḥ kṛṇomi //
analyzed: yeṣām prayājāḥ uta vā anuyājāḥ huta bhāgāḥ a huta adaḥ ca devāḥ    yeṣām vaḥ pañca pradiśaḥ vibhaktāḥ tān vaḥ asmai satra sadaḥ kṛṇomi  /
translated: Ye Gods, whose fore-offerings and whose after-offerings are presented, ye who have a share of what is offered and of what is left, whose are the five divided regions, to you, ye who sit in the assembly, I deliver this man over.

original: āśānām āśā pālebhyaḥ caturbhyaḥ amṛtebhyaḥ / idam bhūtasya adhyakṣebhyaḥ vidhema haviṣā vayam /
analyzed: āśānām āśā pālebhyaḥ caturbhyaḥ amṛtebhyaḥ   idam bhūtasya adhyakṣebhyaḥ vidhema haviṣā vayam  /
translated: To the four quarters of the world, to the four immortal guardians, to the overseers of all that is, let us offer worship with oblation.

original: yaḥ āśānām āśā pālāḥ catvāraḥ sthana devāḥ / te naḥ nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyaḥ muñcata aṃhasaḥ aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ āśānām āśā pālāḥ catvāraḥ sthana devāḥ   te naḥ nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyaḥ muñcata aṃhasaḥ aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye four, O ye who guard the regions, who are stationed in the regions, ye Gods, Deliver us from Nirrti's bonds, from sorrow after sorrow.

original: a srāmaḥ tvā haviṣā yajāmi a śloṇaḥ tvā ghṛtena juhomi / yaḥ āśānām āśā pālaḥ turīyaḥ devaḥ sa naḥ su bhūtam ā iha vakṣat /
analyzed: a srāmaḥ tvā haviṣā yajāmi a śloṇaḥ tvā ghṛtena juhomi   yaḥ āśānām āśā pālaḥ turīyaḥ devaḥ sa naḥ su bhūtam ā iha vakṣat  /
translated: Uninjured thee, with sacrificial food we worship. Thee, unmaimed, with ghee I offer. The God who is the fourth, the guardian of the regions, may he bring us good fortune here.

original: svasti mātre uta pitre naḥ astu svasti gobhyaḥ jagate puruṣebhyaḥ / viśvam su bhūtam suvidatram naḥ astu jyok eva dṛśema sūryam //
analyzed: svasti mātre uta pitre naḥ astu svasti gobhyaḥ jagate puruṣebhyaḥ   viśvam su bhūtam suvidatram naḥ astu jyok eva dṛśema sūryam  /
translated: Hail to our mother and our father be, hail to our cattle and to all mankind. To us be all things good and kindly given. Long may we look upon the sun's bright face.

original: idam janāsaḥ vidatha mahat brahma vadiṣyati / na tat pṛthivyām naḥ divi yena prāṇanti vīrudhaḥ /
analyzed: idam janāsaḥ vidatha mahat brahma vadiṣyati   na tat pṛthivyām naḥ divi yena prāṇanti vīrudhaḥ  /
translated: This great hymn, O ye people, will I sing, the hymn that speaks of Brahma. Not on the earth, not in the sky, is that by which the plants are made to breathe.

original: antarikṣe āsām sthāma śrānta sadām iva / āsthānam asya bhūtasya viduḥ tat vedhasaḥ na vā /
analyzed: antarikṣe āsām sthāma śrānta sadām iva    āsthānam asya bhūtasya viduḥ tat vedhasaḥ na vā  /
translated: In the wide air their resting-place is spread, as of the weary ones who travel ever. They know the resting-place of this existing world, or know it not, the wise.

original: yat rodasī rejamāne bhūmiḥ ca niratakṣatam / ārdram tat adya sarvadā samudrasya iva śrotyāḥ //
analyzed: yat rodasī rejamāne bhūmiḥ ca niratakṣatam    ārdram tat adya sarvadā samudrasya iva śrotyāḥ  /
translated: When ye, O Heaven and Earth, were moving on, and the earth was fixed, then was that made moist, even now, for ever, as the ocean's shore.

original: viśvam anyām abhīvāra tat anyasyām adhi śritam / dive ca viśva vedase pṛthivyai ca akaram namaḥ /
analyzed: viśvam anyām abhīvāra tat anyasyām adhi śritam   dive ca viśva vedase pṛthivyai ca akaram namaḥ  /
translated: I have paid homage to the All-knowing Heaven, and to the Earth, to the one that holds the universe within her, and to the other that is above it.🔽Golden-hued, pure, purifying, in whom Savitar was born, in whom Agni,

original: hiraṇya varṇāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ yāsu jātaḥ savitā yāsu agniḥ / yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire suvarṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu //
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ yāsu jātaḥ savitā yāsu agniḥ   yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire suvarṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu  /
translated: in whom the golden ones received Agni as an embryo, may those waters be gracious and kind to us.🔽In whom Varuna, the king, goes in the midst, beholding the truth and untruth of men,

original: yāsām rājā varuṇaḥ yāti madhye satya anṛte avapaśyan janānām / yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire suvarṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu /
analyzed: yāsām rājā varuṇaḥ yāti madhye satya anṛte avapaśyan janānām    yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire suvarṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu  /
translated: in whom the golden ones received Agni as an embryo, may those waters be gracious and kind to us.🔽In whom the gods make their food in the sky, in whom they become manifold in the atmosphere,

original: yāsām devāḥ divi kṛṇvanti bhakṣam yāḥ antarikṣe bahudhā bhavanti / yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire suvarṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu //
analyzed: yāsām devāḥ divi kṛṇvanti bhakṣam yāḥ antarikṣe bahudhā bhavanti   yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire suvarṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu  /
translated: in whom the golden ones received Agni as an embryo, may those waters be gracious and kind to us.🔽Look upon me with your auspicious eye, O waters, touch my skin with your auspicious body,

original: śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyata apaḥ śivayā tanvā upa spṛśata tvacam me / ghṛtaścutaḥ śucayaḥ yāḥ pāvakāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu /
analyzed: śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyata apaḥ śivayā tanvā upa spṛśata tvacam me    ghṛtaścutaḥ śucayaḥ yāḥ pāvakāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu  /
translated: you who drip with ghee, who are pure and purifying, may those waters be gracious and kind to us.

original: iyam vīrudh madhu jātā madhunā tvā khanāmasi / madhoḥ adhi prajātā asi sā naḥ madhumataḥ kṛdhi //🔽jihvāyāḥ agre madhu me jihvā mūle madhūlakam / mama id aha kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi //🔽madhumat me nikramaṇam madhumat me parāyaṇam / vācā vadāmi madhumat bhūyāsam madhu saṃdṛśaḥ //
analyzed: iyam vīrudh madhu jātā madhunā tvā khanāmasi   madhoḥ adhi prajātā asi sā naḥ madhumataḥ kṛdhi  / jihvāyāḥ agre madhu me jihvā mūle madhūlakam   mama id aha kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi  / madhumat me nikramaṇam madhumat me parāyaṇam   vācā vadāmi madhumat bhūyāsam madhu saṃdṛśaḥ
translated: This plant is born of honey: with honey we dig thee up. Thou art produced from out the honey: make thou us full of honey.🔽The honey is before my tongue, the honey is upon my tongue. In my resolve is all my wish: to me alone thou comest.🔽My going forth is full of honey, my coming back is full of honey. With speech I utter what is full of honey: may I be full of honey, sweet to look on.

original: madhoḥ asmi madhutaraḥ madughāt madhumattaraḥ / mām id kila tvam vanāḥ śākhām madhumatīm iva /
analyzed: madhoḥ asmi madhutaraḥ madughāt madhumattaraḥ   mām id kila tvam vanāḥ śākhām madhumatīm iva  /
translated: I am sweeter than the honey, sweeter than the honey-yielding plant. Thou hast chosen me, indeed, as a branch full of honey.

original: pari tvā paritatnunā ikṣuṇā āgām a vidviṣe / yathā mām kaminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ /
analyzed: pari tvā paritatnunā ikṣuṇā āgām a vidviṣe   yathā mām kaminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ  /
translated: I have come to thee with the all-embracing cane, to thee the unoffending, that I may win thy love, that I may win thy love as one who never turns away.

original: yat ābadhnan dākṣāyaṇāḥ hiraṇyam śatānīkāya sumanasyamānāḥ / tat te badnāmi āyuṣe varcase balāya dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya //
analyzed: yat ābadhnan dākṣāyaṇāḥ hiraṇyam śatānīkāya sumanasyamānāḥ   tat te badnāmi āyuṣe varcase balāya dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  /
translated: The golden amulet which the sons of Daksha bound on Satani, full of good will, that I now bind on thee for life, for splendour, for strength, for a hundred autumns, for a long life.

original: na enam rakṣāṃsi na piśācāḥ sahante devānām ojaḥ prathama jam hi etat / yaḥ bibharti dākṣāyaṇam hiraṇyam sa jīveṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ //
analyzed: na enam rakṣāṃsi na piśācāḥ sahante devānām ojaḥ prathama jam hi etat   yaḥ bibharti dākṣāyaṇam hiraṇyam sa jīveṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ  /
translated: Neither Rakshasas nor Pisāchas can endure him, for this is the first-born strength of the Gods. He who wears the gold of Daksha's son, he makes his life long among the living.🔽The splendour, light, strength, and power of the waters, and the virility of the trees,

original: apām tejaḥ jyotiḥ ojaḥ balam ca vanaspatīnām uta vīryāṇi / indraḥ iva indriyāṇi adhi dhārayāmaḥ asmin tat dakṣamāṇaḥ bibharat hiraṇyam /
analyzed: apām tejaḥ jyotiḥ ojaḥ balam ca vanaspatīnām uta vīryāṇi   indraḥ iva indriyāṇi adhi dhārayāmaḥ asmin tat dakṣamāṇaḥ bibharat hiraṇyam  /
translated: the powers of Indra, we place in him. May he, when he is strong, wear the gold.

original: samānām māsām ṛtubhiḥ tvā vayam saṃvatsarasya payasā piparmi / indra agnī viśve devāḥ te anu manyantām a hṛṇīyamānāḥ /
analyzed: samānām māsām ṛtubhiḥ tvā vayam saṃvatsarasya payasā piparmi   indra agnī viśve devāḥ te anu manyantām a hṛṇīyamānāḥ  /
translated: With the seasons of the year we strengthen thee, with the milk of the year we fill thee. May Indra, Agni, and all the Gods approve of thee, and be not angry.🔽Vena saw that highest mystery, where all becomes one form.

original: venaḥ tat paśyat paramam guhā yat yatra viśvam bhavati eka rūpam / idam pṛśniḥ aduhat jāyamānāḥ svarvidaḥ abhi anūṣata vrāḥ /
analyzed: venaḥ tat paśyat paramam guhā yat yatra viśvam bhavati eka rūpam    idam pṛśniḥ aduhat jāyamānāḥ svarvidaḥ abhi anūṣata vrāḥ  /
translated: The dappled one, finding the heaven, milked it when born. The hosts have sung to her.

original: pra tat vocet amṛtasya vidvān gandharvaḥ dhāma paramam guhā yat / trīṇi padāni nihitā guhā asya yaḥ tāni veda sa pituḥ pitā asat /
analyzed: pra tat vocet amṛtasya vidvān gandharvaḥ dhāma paramam guhā yat    trīṇi padāni nihitā guhā asya yaḥ tāni veda sa pituḥ pitā asat  /
translated: The Gandharva, knowing the highest abode of immortality, should proclaim that mystery. Three steps are hidden in him. He who knows them becomes the father of the father.

original: sa naḥ pitā janitā saḥ uta bandhuḥ dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā / yaḥ devānām nāmadhe ekaḥ eva tam saṃpraśnam bhuvanā yanti sarvā /
analyzed: sa naḥ pitā janitā saḥ uta bandhuḥ dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā   yaḥ devānām nāmadhe ekaḥ eva tam saṃpraśnam bhuvanā yanti sarvā  /
translated: He is our Father, our begetter, and our kinsman, who knoweth all the worlds and all the regions. He only hath the name of all the deities: all things approach him to consult with him.

original: pari dyāvāpṛthivī sadyas āyam upātiṣṭhe prathama jām ṛtasya / vācam iva vaktari bhuvaneṣṭhāḥ dhāsyuḥ eṣa nanu eṣaḥ agniḥ /
analyzed: pari dyāvāpṛthivī sadyas āyam upātiṣṭhe prathama jām ṛtasya    vācam iva vaktari bhuvaneṣṭhāḥ dhāsyuḥ eṣa nanu eṣaḥ agniḥ  /
translated: In a moment he hath encompassed heaven and earth: I have approached the first-born of eternal Law. He, the supporter of the world, is like a voice in him that speaks: he is the bearer, he is this Agni.

original: pari viśvā bhuvanāni āyam ṛtasya tantum vitatam dṛśe kam / yatra devāḥ amṛtam ānaśānāḥ samāne yonau adhi airayanta /🔽divyaḥ gandharvaḥ bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ eva namasyaḥ vikṣu īḍyaḥ / tam tvā yaumi brahmaṇā divya deva namaḥ te astu divi te sadhastham /
analyzed: pari viśvā bhuvanāni āyam ṛtasya tantum vitatam dṛśe kam    yatra devāḥ amṛtam ānaśānāḥ samāne yonau adhi airayanta  / divyaḥ gandharvaḥ bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ eva namasyaḥ vikṣu īḍyaḥ   tam tvā yaumi brahmaṇā divya deva namaḥ te astu divi te sadhastham  /
translated: He hath encompassed all existing things, to see the thread of Law that is extended out, Where the Gods, winning immortality, have settled in the common place of all.🔽The heavenly Gandharva, who is the Lord of all the world, who is to be worshipped alone, who is to be praised among the people,🔽Thee, O celestial God, I worship with prayer: to thee be adoration. Thy home is in the heavens.

original: divi spṛṣṭaḥ yajataḥ sūrya tvac avayātā harasaḥ daivyasya / mṛḍāt gandharvaḥ bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ eva namasyaḥ su śevāḥ /
analyzed: divi spṛṣṭaḥ yajataḥ sūrya tvac avayātā harasaḥ daivyasya   mṛḍāt gandharvaḥ bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ eva namasyaḥ su śevāḥ  /
translated: The priest hath touched the sun-bright robe of thee, the heavenly, the divine. Be gracious, O Gandharva, who art the Lord of all the world, to be worshipped alone, auspicious.

original: anavadyābhiḥ sam u jagme ābhiḥ apsarāsu api gandharvaḥ āsīt / samudraḥ āsām sadanam me āhuḥ yatas sadyas ā ca parā ca yanti //
analyzed: anavadyābhiḥ sam u jagme ābhiḥ apsarāsu api gandharvaḥ āsīt    samudraḥ āsām sadanam me āhuḥ yatas sadyas ā ca parā ca yanti  /
translated: With these, unblamable, he went to meet them. The Gandharva was among the Apsarases. The ocean, they say, is the abode of these, whence they go forth and come again.

original: abhriye didyut nakṣatriye yā viśvāvasum gandharvam sacadhve / tābhyaḥ vaḥ devīḥ namaḥ id kṛṇomi //
analyzed: abhriye didyut nakṣatriye yā viśvāvasum gandharvam sacadhve   tābhyaḥ vaḥ devīḥ namaḥ id kṛṇomi  /
translated: To the Apsarases, to the Gandharva, to the lightning of the cloud, to the star-like, who attend on the Gandharva Visvâvasu, to you, O Goddesses, I pay this homage.

original: yāḥ klandāḥ tamiṣīcayaḥ akṣa kāmāḥ manomuhaḥ / tābhyaḥ gandharvabhyaḥ apsarābhyaḥ akaram namaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ klandāḥ tamiṣīcayaḥ akṣa kāmāḥ manomuhaḥ    tābhyaḥ gandharvabhyaḥ apsarābhyaḥ akaram namaḥ  /
translated: To those that are moist, that are full of moisture, that are fond of the eye, that are bewilderers of the mind, to the Gandharvas and the Apsarases I have paid homage.

original: adaḥ yat avadhāvati avatkam adhi parvatāt / tat te kṛṇomi bheṣajam su bheṣajam yathā asasi //
analyzed: adaḥ yat avadhāvati avatkam adhi parvatāt   tat te kṛṇomi bheṣajam su bheṣajam yathā asasi  /
translated: That which runs down from here, that which runs down from the mountain-top, that I make for thee a medicine, that thou mayst be quite well.

original: āt aṅgā kuvid aṅga śatam yā bheṣajāni te / teṣām asi tvam uttamam anāsrāvam arogaṇam //
analyzed: āt aṅgā kuvid aṅga śatam yā bheṣajāni te    teṣām asi tvam uttamam anāsrāvam arogaṇam  /
translated: O thou that art a limb, O thou that art a limb, a hundred are thy remedies. Of these thou art the best, that runnest not to pus, that art free from disease.

original: nīcais khananti asurāḥ arusrāṇam idam mahat / tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam anīnaśat //
analyzed: nīcais khananti asurāḥ arusrāṇam idam mahat   tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam anīnaśat  /
translated: The Asuras dig it from below, this great remedy that runneth not to pus. That is a medicine for running sores, that hath destroyed the disease.

original: upajīkāḥ ud bharanti samudrāt adhi bheṣajam / tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam aśīśamat //
analyzed: upajīkāḥ ud bharanti samudrāt adhi bheṣajam   tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam aśīśamat  /
translated: From the sea's bosom they bring up the remedy. That is a medicine for running sores, that hath healed the disease.

original: arusrāṇam idam mahat pṛthivyāḥ adhi udbhṛtam / tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam anīnaśat //
analyzed: arusrāṇam idam mahat pṛthivyāḥ adhi udbhṛtam   tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam anīnaśat  /
translated: This is the great remedy of the earth for the pain of the limbs. It is the remedy for the flow of blood, it has destroyed the disease.

original: śam naḥ bhavantu apaḥ oṣadhayaḥ śivāḥ / indrasya vajraḥ apa hantu rakṣasaḥ ārāt visṛṣṭāḥ iṣavaḥ patantu rakṣasām /
analyzed: śam naḥ bhavantu apaḥ oṣadhayaḥ śivāḥ   indrasya vajraḥ apa hantu rakṣasaḥ ārāt visṛṣṭāḥ iṣavaḥ patantu rakṣasām  /
translated: Be auspicious to us, O waters, and the plants. Let Indra's thunderbolt drive away the Rakshasas. Let the arrows shot from afar fall upon the Rakshasas.

original: dīrgha āyu tvāya bṛhate raṇāya ariṣyantaḥ dakṣamāṇāḥ sadā eva / maṇim viṣkandha dūṣaṇam jaṅgiḍam bibhṛmaḥ vayam /
analyzed: dīrgha āyu tvāya bṛhate raṇāya ariṣyantaḥ dakṣamāṇāḥ sadā eva   maṇim viṣkandha dūṣaṇam jaṅgiḍam bibhṛmaḥ vayam  /
translated: For long life, for great joy, ever free from sickness and full of strength, we wear the Jangida amulet that destroys the Visva-khandha.

original: jaṅgiḍaḥ jambhāt viśarāt viṣkandhāt abhiśocanāt / maṇiḥ sahasra vīryaḥ pari naḥ pātu viśvatas /
analyzed: jaṅgiḍaḥ jambhāt viśarāt viṣkandhāt abhiśocanāt    maṇiḥ sahasra vīryaḥ pari naḥ pātu viśvatas  /
translated: The Jangida amulet, from the jaw, from the Visara, from the Visva-khandha, from the burning fever, the amulet of a thousand powers, protect us on every side.

original: ayam viṣkandham sahate ayam bādhate attriṇaḥ / ayam naḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: ayam viṣkandham sahate ayam bādhate attriṇaḥ   ayam naḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: This one conquers the Visva-khandha, this one drives away the devourers. This one, the all-healing Jangida, protect us from distress.

original: devaiḥ dattena maṇinā jaṅgiḍena mayobhuvā / viṣkandham sarvāḥ rakṣāṃsi vyāyāme sahāmahe /
analyzed: devaiḥ dattena maṇinā jaṅgiḍena mayobhuvā    viṣkandham sarvāḥ rakṣāṃsi vyāyāme sahāmahe  /
translated: With the amulet given by the gods, the Jangida amulet that brings bliss, we conquer in the contest the Visva-khandha and all the Rakshasas.

original: śaṇaḥ ca mā jaṅgiḍaḥ ca viṣkandhāt abhi rakṣatām / araṇyāt anyaḥ ābhṛtaḥ kṛṣyāḥ anyaḥ rasebhyaḥ /
analyzed: śaṇaḥ ca mā jaṅgiḍaḥ ca viṣkandhāt abhi rakṣatām    araṇyāt anyaḥ ābhṛtaḥ kṛṣyāḥ anyaḥ rasebhyaḥ  /
translated: Let the hemp and the Jangida protect me from the Visva-khandha. One is brought from the forest, another from the field, from the juices.

original: kṛtyā dūṣiḥ ayam maṇiḥ atha u arāti dūṣiḥ / atha u sahasvān jaṅgiḍaḥ pra naḥ āyuṃṣi tāriṣat /🔽indra juṣasva pra vaha yāhi śūra haribhyām / pibā sutasya mateḥ iha madhoḥ cakānaḥ cāruḥ madāya /
analyzed: kṛtyā dūṣiḥ ayam maṇiḥ atha u arāti dūṣiḥ   atha u sahasvān jaṅgiḍaḥ pra naḥ āyuṃṣi tāriṣat  / indra juṣasva pra vaha yāhi śūra haribhyām    pibā sutasya mateḥ iha madhoḥ cakānaḥ cāruḥ madāya  /
translated: This is the Amulet that wards off the spell, and this the Amulet that wards off hostility. And this is Jangida the Conqueror: may he prolong the days we have to live.🔽O Indra, rejoice, drive on, come, Hero, with thy two Bay Steeds. Drink of the juice that gladdens thee, O thou who lovest it, O thou who lovest it, for joy.

original: indra jaṭharam navyaḥ na pṛṇasva madhoḥ divaḥ na / asya sutasya svar na upa tvā madāḥ su vācaḥ aguḥ /
analyzed: indra jaṭharam navyaḥ na pṛṇasva madhoḥ divaḥ na    asya sutasya svar na upa tvā madāḥ su vācaḥ aguḥ  /
translated: O Indra, fill thee full of the new store of meath, as of the heaven's. Let the sweet juices of this juice, of this juice, come unto thee for joy.

original: indraḥ turāṣāh mitraḥ vṛtram yaḥ jaghāna yatīḥ na / bibheda valam bhṛguḥ na sasahe śatrūn made somasya /
analyzed: indraḥ turāṣāh mitraḥ vṛtram yaḥ jaghāna yatīḥ na   bibheda valam bhṛguḥ na sasahe śatrūn made somasya  /
translated: Indra, the Victor, Mitra, he who slew Vr̥itra, as Bhrigu, cleft the forts of the Yatis. He conquered foes in the wild joy of Soma.

original: ā tvā viśantu sutāsaḥ indra pṛṇasva kukṣī viḍḍhi śakra dhiyā ihi ā naḥ / śrudhi havam giraḥ me juṣasva indra sva yugbhiḥ matsva iha mahe raṇāya /
analyzed: ā tvā viśantu sutāsaḥ indra pṛṇasva kukṣī viḍḍhi śakra dhiyā ihi ā naḥ    śrudhi havam giraḥ me juṣasva indra sva yugbhiḥ matsva iha mahe raṇāya  /
translated: Let the pressed juices enter thee, O Indra: fill full thy belly, O thou Strong One, with them. Come hither, listen to our call, and to my songs, O Indra, with thy fellows. Here rejoice thee for the great enjoyment.

original: indrasya nu pra vocam vīryāṇi yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī / ahan ahim anu apaḥ tatarda pra vakṣaṇāḥ abhinat parvatānām /
analyzed: indrasya nu pra vocam vīryāṇi yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī   ahan ahim anu apaḥ tatarda pra vakṣaṇāḥ abhinat parvatānām  /
translated: I will declare the mighty deeds which Indra wrought in the beginning, deeds which the wielder of the thunderbolt performed. He slew the Dragon, cleft the streams, and with his fist rent open the caverns of the mountains.

original: ahan ahim parvate śiśriyāṇam tvaṣṭā asmai vajram svaryam tatakṣa / vāśrāḥ iva dhenavaḥ syandamānāḥ añjaḥ samudram ava jagmuḥ āpaḥ /
analyzed: ahan ahim parvate śiśriyāṇam tvaṣṭā asmai vajram svaryam tatakṣa   vāśrāḥ iva dhenavaḥ syandamānāḥ añjas samudram ava jagmuḥ āpaḥ  /
translated: He slew the Dragon lying on the mountain: Tvashtar fashioned for him the light-winning bolt. The waters flowed like milch-kine with their milk effused, and straight to the ocean went the running streams.

original: vṛṣāyamāṇaḥ avṛṇīta somam trikadrukeṣu apibat sutasya / ā sāyakam maghavā adatta vajram ahan enam prathama jām ahīnām /
analyzed: vṛṣāyamāṇaḥ avṛṇīta somam trikadrukeṣu apibat sutasya    ā sāyakam maghavā adatta vajram ahan enam prathama jām ahīnām  /
translated: The Bull, assuming power, chose Soma for himself: on Trikadrukas he drank the juice expressed. Maghavan took his arrow, took his thunder-bolt, and slew the Dragon, first-born of all the snakes.

original: samāḥ tvā agne ṛtavaḥ vardhayantu saṃvatsarāḥ ṛṣayaḥ yāni satyā / sam divyena dīdihi rocanena viśvāḥ ā māhi pradiśaḥ catasraḥ /🔽sam ca idhyasva agne pra ca vardhaya imam ud ca tiṣṭha mahate saubhagāya / mā te riṣan upasattāraḥ agne brahmāṇaḥ te yaśasaḥ santu mānye /
analyzed: samāḥ tvā agne ṛtavaḥ vardhayantu saṃvatsarāḥ ṛṣayaḥ yāni satyā    sam divyena dīdihi rocanena viśvāḥ ā māhi pradiśaḥ catasraḥ  / sam ca idhyasva agne pra ca vardhaya imam ud ca tiṣṭha mahate saubhagāya    mā te riṣan upasattāraḥ agne brahmāṇaḥ te yaśasaḥ santu mā anye  /
translated: May the same seasons, O Agni, and the years, and the Rishis, strengthen and prosper thee, O thou who art true to thine own nature. Shine forth with the heavenly light: illumine all the four regions of the world.🔽Be thou enkindled, O Agni, and increase this (sacrificer): rise up for great bliss. Let not thy attendants, O Agni, be harmed: let thy priests be glorious and honoured by all.

original: tvām agne vṛṇate brāhmaṇāḥ ime śivaḥ agne saṃvaraṇe bhava naḥ / sapatna hā agne abhimāti jit bhava sve gaye jāgṛhi aprayuchan /
analyzed: tvām agne vṛṇate brāhmaṇāḥ ime śivaḥ agne saṃvaraṇe bhava naḥ    sapatna hā agne abhimāti jit bhava sve gaye jāgṛhi aprayuchan  /
translated: These Brahmans here, O Agni, choose thee: be thou gracious, O Agni, in our abode. Be thou, O Agni, the slayer of our foes, the conqueror of our enemies: watch thou over thy own house, O thou that art never careless.

original: kṣatreṇa agne svena sam rabhasva mitreṇa agne mitradhā yatasva / sajātānām madhyameṣṭhāḥ rājñām agne vihavyaḥ dīdihi iha /
analyzed: kṣatreṇa agne svena sam rabhasva mitreṇa agne mitradhā yatasva   sajātānām madhyameṣṭhāḥ rājñām agne vihavyaḥ dīdihi iha  /
translated: With thy own Kshatra, O Agni, be victorious; with thy friend, O Agni, be friendly. Be thou the chief in the midst of the people, O Agni, the guest of kings, shine here.🔽Over the haters, over the spiteful, over the envious, over the foes,

original: ati nihaḥ ati sṛdhaḥ ati acittīḥ ati dviṣaḥ / viśvā hi agne duritā tara tvam atha asmabhyam saha vīram rayim dāḥ /
analyzed: ati nihaḥ ati sṛdhaḥ ati acittīḥ ati dviṣaḥ   viśvā hi agne duritā tara tvam atha asmabhyam saha vīram rayim dāḥ  /
translated: Over all evils, O Agni, do thou pass, and then give us wealth with heroes.🔽The plant, born of the gods, hated by evil, which is to be used against an oath,

original: agha dviṣṭā deva jātā vīrudh śapatha yopanī / āpaḥ malam iva prāṇaikṣīt sarvān mat śapathām adhi //
analyzed: agha dviṣṭā deva jātā vīrudh śapatha yopanī   āpaḥ malam iva prāṇaikṣīt sarvān mat śapathām adhi  /
translated: The waters have looked on all my oaths as on a stain.🔽The oath of one who has a rival wife, the oath of a sister-in-law,

original: yaḥ ca sāpatnaḥ śapathaḥ jāmyāḥ śapathaḥ ca yaḥ / brahmā yat manyutaḥ śapāt sarvam tat naḥ adhaspadam /
analyzed: yaḥ ca sāpatnaḥ śapathaḥ jāmyāḥ śapathaḥ ca yaḥ    brahmā yat manyutaḥ śapāt sarvam tat naḥ adhaspadam  /
translated: And the oath which the Brahman utters in anger, all that is under our feet.🔽Rooted in the sky, stretched over the earth,

original: divaḥ mūlam avatatam pṛthivyāḥ adhi uttatam / tena sahasra kāṇḍena pari naḥ pāhi viśvatas //
analyzed: divaḥ mūlam avatatam pṛthivyāḥ adhi uttatam   tena sahasra kāṇḍena pari naḥ pāhi viśvatas  /
translated: With that one of a thousand branches, protect us on every side.

original: pari mām pari me prajām pari naḥ pāhi yat dhanam / arātiḥ naḥ mā tārīt mā naḥ tāriśuḥ abhimātayaḥ /
analyzed: pari mām pari me prajām pari naḥ pāhi yat dhanam   arātiḥ naḥ mā tārīt mā naḥ tāriśuḥ abhimātayaḥ  /
translated: Protect me, protect my offspring, protect our wealth on every side. Let not misfortune overcome us, let not our enemies' curses prevail.

original: śaptāram etu śapathaḥ yaḥ su hārd tena naḥ saha / cakṣuḥ mantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇīmasi //
analyzed: śaptāram etu śapathaḥ yaḥ su hārd tena naḥ saha   cakṣuḥ mantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇīmasi  /
translated: Let the curse fall on him who curses us, and let him go with him who hates us. We crush the back-bone of the hater of our spell, the hater of our prayer.

original: ud agātām bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake / vi kṣetriyasya muñcatām adhamam pāśam uttamam /
analyzed: ud agātām bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake   vi kṣetriyasya muñcatām adhamam pāśam uttamam  /
translated: The two bright stars, the two that watch and guard us well, have risen on high. Unbind the lowest and the highest bond of him who rules the field.

original: apa iyam rātriḥ uchatu apochantu abhikṛtvarīḥ / vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu //🔽babhroḥ arjuna kāṇḍasya yavasya te palālyā tilasya tila piñjyā / vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu /🔽namaḥ te lāṅgalebhyaḥ namaḥ īṣā yugebhyaḥ / vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu //
analyzed: apa iyam rātriḥ uchatu apochantu abhikṛtvarīḥ   vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu  / babhroḥ arjuna kāṇḍasya yavasya te palālyā tilasya tila piñjyā   vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu  / namaḥ te lāṅgalebhyaḥ namaḥ īṣā yugebhyaḥ   vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu  /
translated: Let this Night vanish hence away, and all the days that follow it. Let the Plant that destroys the field destroy the field's dominion.🔽Of the red stalk, of the yellow stalk, of the barley, of thy chaff, of the sesame, of the sesame cake,🔽Homage to thy ploughs, homage to thy yokes and to thy plough-lines. Let the Plant that destroys the field destroy the field's dominion.

original: namaḥ sanisrasa akṣebhyaḥ namaḥ saṃdeśyebhyaḥ / namaḥ kṣetrasya pataye vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu //
analyzed: namaḥ sanisrasa akṣebhyaḥ namaḥ saṃdeśyebhyaḥ   namaḥ kṣetrasya pataye vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu  /
translated: Homage to thy wheels that roll with noise, homage to thy shafts and axles. Homage to thee, O Lord of the field. Let the Plant that destroys the field destroy the field's dominion.

original: daśa vṛkṣa muñca imam rakṣasaḥ grāhyāḥ adhi yā enam jagrāha parvasu / atha u enam vanaspate jīvānām lokam ud naya /
analyzed: daśa vṛkṣa muñca imam rakṣasaḥ grāhyāḥ adhi yā enam jagrāha parvasu    atha u enam vanaspate jīvānām lokam ud naya  /
translated: Let go this man, O Tree, ten times let him go, whom the Rakshas seized upon the days of old. Now, O Tree, lead him up to the world of living men.

original: āgāt ud agāt ayam jīvānām vrātam api agāt / abhūt u putrāṇām pitā nṛṇām ca bhagavattamaḥ /
analyzed: āgāt ud agāt ayam jīvānām vrātam api agāt    abhūt u putrāṇām pitā nṛṇām ca bhagavattamaḥ  /
translated: He has come, he has come up, he has come to the host of living men. He has become the father of his sons and the most blessed of men.

original: adhītīḥ adhi agāt ayam adhi jīva purāḥ agān / śatam hi asya bhiṣajaḥ sahasram uta vīrudhaḥ /
analyzed: adhītīḥ adhi agāt ayam adhi jīva purāḥ agān   / śatam hi asya bhiṣajaḥ sahasram uta vīrudhaḥ  /
translated: He has come to the living, he has come to the houses of the living. For he hath a hundred remedies, yea, and a thousand healing herbs.

original: devāḥ te cītim avidan brahmāṇaḥ uta vīrudhaḥ / cītim te viśve devāḥ avidan bhūmyām adhi //
analyzed: devāḥ te cītim avidan brahmāṇaḥ uta vīrudhaḥ   cītim te viśve devāḥ avidan bhūmyām adhi  /
translated: The Gods have found thy healing, the Brahmans and the herbs. The All-Gods have found thy healing on the earth.

original: yaḥ cakāra sa niḥ karat saḥ eva subhiṣaktamaḥ / saḥ eva tubhyam bheṣajāni kṛṇavat bhiṣajā śuciḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ cakāra sa niḥ karat saḥ eva subhiṣaktamaḥ   saḥ eva tubhyam bheṣajāni kṛṇavat bhiṣajā śuciḥ  /
translated: He who hath made, let him unmake: he is the best of all physicians. Let him make medicines for thee, the pure physician.

original: kṣetriyāt tvā nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: kṣetriyāt tvā nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  /
translated: From the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from hate, from Varuna's noose, I deliver thee. I make thee sinless by the Brahman. Auspicious to thee be both the Heaven and Earth.

original: śam te agniḥ saha adbhiḥ astu śam somaḥ saha oṣadhībhiḥ / eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: śam te agniḥ saha adbhiḥ astu śam somaḥ saha oṣadhībhiḥ   eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  /
translated: May Agni with the waters be propitious to thee, may Soma with the plants be propitious to thee. From the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from guile, from Varuna's noose, I deliver thee. I make thee sinless by holy power. Auspicious to thee be both the heaven and the earth.

original: śam te vātaḥ antarikṣe vayaḥ dhāt śam te bhavantu pradiśaḥ catasraḥ / eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: śam te vātaḥ antarikṣe vayaḥ dhāt śam te bhavantu pradiśaḥ catasraḥ   eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  /
translated: May the wind in the atmosphere give thee life. Auspicious to thee be the four quarters. From the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from guile, from Varuna's noose, I deliver thee. I make thee sinless by holy power. Auspicious to thee be both the heaven and the earth.🔽These four quarters, which the Goddesses, the wives of the wind, whom the sun looks upon,

original: imāḥ yāḥ devīḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ vāta patnīḥ abhi sūryaḥ vicaṣṭe / eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛnomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ devīḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ vāta patnīḥ abhi sūryaḥ vicaṣṭe    eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛnomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  /
