translated: From the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from guile, from Varuna's noose, I deliver thee. I make thee sinless by holy power. Auspicious to thee be both the heaven and the earth.

original: tāsu tvā antar jarasi ā dadhāmi pra yakṣmaḥ etu nirṛtiḥ parācais / eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /🔽amukthāḥ yakṣmāt duritāt avadyāt druhaḥ pāśāt grāhyāḥ ca ud amukthāḥ / eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: tāsu tvā antar jarasi ā dadhāmi pra yakṣmaḥ etu nirṛtiḥ parācais    eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  / amukthāḥ yakṣmāt duritāt avadyāt druhaḥ pāśāt grāhyāḥ ca ud amukthāḥ    eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  /
translated: In these I place thee, O man, that thou mayst grow strong. Let consumption go away, let Nirrti go away to a distance. Thus do I deliver thee from the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from hatred, from Varuna's noose. I make thee free from guilt by prayer. Auspicious to thee be both the heaven and the earth.🔽Freed from consumption, from misfortune, from blame, from the noose of hatred, from the grasp of the Raksases, are ye freed. Thus do I deliver thee from the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from hatred, from Varuna's noose. I make thee free from guilt by prayer. Auspicious to thee be both the heaven and the earth.

original: ahar arātim avidaḥ syonam api abhūḥ bhadre su kṛtasya loke / eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: ahar arātim avidaḥ syonam api abhūḥ bhadre su kṛtasya loke    eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  /
translated: Thou hast found the day, the harmless, the kindly, and hast become in the world of the well-done deed. Thus do I deliver thee from the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from hatred, from Varuna's noose. I make thee free from guilt by prayer. Auspicious to thee be both the heaven and the earth.

original: sūryam ṛtam tamasaḥ grāhyāḥ adhi devāḥ muñcantaḥ asṛjan niḥ enasaḥ / eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt / anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: sūryam ṛtam tamasaḥ grāhyāḥ adhi devāḥ muñcantaḥ asṛjan niḥ enasaḥ    eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt    anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  /
translated: The Gods, delivering thee from the grasp of darkness, from the snare of sin, have set thee free. Even so do I deliver thee from the snare of the field, from the snare of kindred, from the snare of the curse, from the snare of Varuna. I make thee sinless by the Brahman. Auspicious to thee be both the Heaven and Earth.

original: dūṣyāḥ dūṣiḥ asi hetyāḥ hetiḥ asi menyāḥ meniḥ asi / āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma //
analyzed: dūṣyāḥ dūṣiḥ asi hetyāḥ hetiḥ asi menyāḥ meniḥ asi    āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma  /
translated: Thou art the curse of the curser, the dart of the darter, the missile of the missilee. Win the better, step over the equal.

original: sraktyaḥ asi pratisaraḥ asi pratyabhicaraṇaḥ asi / āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma //
analyzed: sraktyaḥ asi pratisaraḥ asi pratyabhicaraṇaḥ asi    āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma  /
translated: Thou art the noose, thou art the fetter, thou art the counter-enchanter. Win the better, step over the equal.

original: prati tam abhi cara yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma //🔽sūriḥ asi varcaḥ dhāḥ asi tanū pānaḥ asi / āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma /
analyzed: prati tam abhi cara yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma  / sūriḥ asi varcaḥ dhāḥ asi tanū pānaḥ asi    āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma  /
translated: Go thou against him who hates us, or whom we hate. Win the better, step over the equal.🔽Thou art the sage, thou art the giver of splendour, thou art the protector of the body. Win the better, step over the equal.

original: śukraḥ asi bhrājaḥ asi svar asi jyotiḥ asi / āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma /
analyzed: śukraḥ asi bhrājaḥ asi svar asi jyotiḥ asi    āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma  /
translated: Thou art the bright, thou art the shining, thou art the heaven, thou art the light. Win the better, step over the equal.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī uru antarikṣam kṣetrasya patnī uru gāyaḥ adbhutaḥ / uta antarikṣam uru vāta gopam te iha tapyantām mayi tapyamāne /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī uru antarikṣam kṣetrasya patnī uru gāyaḥ adbhutaḥ   uta antarikṣam uru vāta gopam te iha tapyantām mayi tapyamāne  /
translated: Heaven and Earth, and the wide air between them, the wondrously wide-roaming spouse of the field, And the wide air, guarded by the wind, may they be heated here when I am heated.

original: idam devāḥ śṛṇuta ye yajñiyāḥ stha bharadvājaḥ mahyam ukthāni śaṃsati / pāśe sa baddhaḥ durite ni yujyatām yaḥ asmākam manaḥ idam hinasti //
analyzed: idam devāḥ śṛṇuta ye yajñiyāḥ stha bharadvājaḥ mahyam ukthāni śaṃsati   pāśe sa baddhaḥ durite ni yujyatām yaḥ asmākam manaḥ idam hinasti  /
translated: Hear this, O ye gods who are worthy of sacrifice: Bharadvaja praises hymns for me. Let him be bound in a noose, let him be yoked to misfortune, he who injures this our mind.

original: idam indra śṛṇuhi somapa yat tvā hṛdā śocatā johavīmi / vṛścāmi tam kuliśena iva vṛkṣam yaḥ asmākam manaḥ idam hinasti //🔽aśītibhiḥ tisṛbhiḥ sāmagebhiḥ ādityebhiḥ vasubhiḥ aṅgirobhiḥ / iṣṭāpūrtam avatu naḥ pitṝṇām ā amum dade harasā daivyena /
analyzed: idam indra śṛṇuhi somapa yat tvā hṛdā śocatā johavīmi    vṛścāmi tam kuliśena iva vṛkṣam yaḥ asmākam manaḥ idam hinasti  / aśītibhiḥ tisṛbhiḥ sāmagebhiḥ ādityebhiḥ vasubhiḥ aṅgirobhiḥ    iṣṭāpūrtam avatu naḥ pitṝṇām ā amum dade harasā daivyena  /
translated: Hear this, O Indra, O Soma-drinker, what I, being sorrowful, call upon thee with my heart. I cut him off with my thunderbolt, as it were, a tree, who injures this our mind.🔽With the eighty-three, with the singers of the Saman, with the Adityas, the Vasus, and the Angiras, may the fulfilment of our sacrifices protect us. I have given him up to the divine wrath.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī anu mā dīdhīthām viśve devāsaḥ anu mā rabhadhvam / aṅgirasaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ pāpam ā ṛchatu apakāmasya kartā /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī anu mā dīdhīthām viśve devāsaḥ anu mā rabhadhvam   aṅgirasaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ pāpam ā ṛchatu apakāmasya kartā  /
translated: O Heaven and Earth, do ye consider me. O All-gods, do ye take hold of me. O Angirases, the fathers who are dear to Soma, let the doer of evil meet with misfortune, he who acts against our will.

original: atīva yaḥ marutaḥ manyate naḥ brahma vā yaḥ nindiṣat kriyamāṇam / tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahma dviṣam dyauḥ abhisaṃtapāti //
analyzed: atīva yaḥ marutaḥ manyate naḥ brahma vā yaḥ nindiṣat kriyamāṇam   tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahma dviṣam dyauḥ abhisaṃtapāti  /
translated: Let him have burning coals and tangled weeds. Let the sky scorch the man who hates the prayer.🔽Seven are thy breaths, eight are thy thoughts. I cut them off for thee with prayer.

original: sapta prāṇān aṣṭau manyaḥ tān te vṛścāmi brahmaṇā / ayāḥ yamasya sādanam agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sapta prāṇān aṣṭau manyaḥ tān te vṛścāmi brahmaṇā   ayāḥ yamasya sādanam agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ  /
translated: To Yama's house thou goest, O Agni, with a messenger, with a guide.

original: ā dadhāmi te padam samiddhe jātavedasi / agniḥ śarīram veveṣṭu asum vāc api gacchatu //
analyzed: ā dadhāmi te padam samiddhe jātavedasi    agniḥ śarīram veveṣṭu asum vāc api gacchatu  /
translated: I place thy foot in the well-kindled fire. Let thy body be wrapped in Agni. Let thy breath go to the wind. Let thy speech go to the waters. Let thy eye go to the sun. Let thy ear go to the quarters. Let thy mind go to the moon. Let thy self go to the king.🔽O Agni, giver of life, I choose longevity. With face of ghee, with back of ghee, O Agni,

original: āyuḥ dāḥ agne jarasam vṛṇānaḥ ghṛta pratīkaḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ agne / ghṛtam pītvā madhu cāru gavyam pitā iva putrān abhi rakṣatāt imam /
analyzed: āyuḥ dāḥ agne jarasam vṛṇānaḥ ghṛta pratīkaḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ agne    ghṛtam pītvā madhu cāru gavyam pitā iva putrān abhi rakṣatāt imam  /
translated: having drunk the sweet ghee of the cow, protect this man as a father his son.🔽Put it on, give us splendour. Make this man old in age, long-lived.

original: pari dhatta dhatta naḥ varcasā imam jarā mṛtyum kṛṇuta dīrgham āyuḥ / bṛhaspatiḥ prāyacchat vāsaḥ etat somāya rājñe paridhātavai u //
analyzed: pari dhatta dhatta naḥ varcasā imam jarā mṛtyum kṛṇuta dīrgham āyuḥ   bṛhaspatiḥ prāyacchat vāsaḥ etat somāya rājñe paridhātavai u
translated: Brihaspati gave this garment to be put on by Soma, the king.

original: pari idam vāsaḥ adhithāḥ svastaye abhūḥ gṛṣṭīnām abhiśasti pāḥ u / śatam ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcī rāyaḥ ca poṣam upasaṃvyayasva //
analyzed: pari idam vāsaḥ adhithāḥ svastaye abhūḥ gṛṣṭīnām abhiśasti pāḥ u  śatam ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcī rāyaḥ ca poṣam upasaṃvyayasva  /
translated: Thou hast put on this robe for happiness: thou hast become the saviour from the curse of milch-kine. Live a hundred winters yet, and, in thy riches, grow thou strong.

original: ehi aśmānam ā tiṣṭha aśmā bhavatu te tanūḥ / kṛṇvantu viśve devāḥ āyuḥ te śaradaḥ śatam /
analyzed: ehi aśmānam ā tiṣṭha aśmā bhavatu te tanūḥ   kṛṇvantu viśve devāḥ āyuḥ te śaradaḥ śatam
translated: Come hither, stand upon the stone: let the stone be thy body. May all the Gods prolong thy life a hundred autumns.

original: yasya te vāsaḥ prathama vāsyam harāmaḥ tam tvā viśve avantu devāḥ / tam tvā bhrātaraḥ suvṛdhāḥ vardhamānam anu jāyantām bahavaḥ su jātam /
analyzed: yasya te vāsaḥ prathama vāsyam harāmaḥ tam tvā viśve avantu devāḥ   tam tvā bhrātaraḥ suvṛdhāḥ vardhamānam anu jāyantām bahavaḥ su jātam  /
translated: The garment which we take away, the first that thou hast worn, may all the Gods accept it for thee. May many brothers, prospering, follow thee, well-born, as thou growest strong.

original: niḥsālām dhṛṣṇum dhiṣaṇam ekavādyām jighatsvam / sarvāḥ caṇḍasya naptyaḥ nāśayāmaḥ sadānvāḥ /
analyzed: niḥsālām dhṛṣṇum dhiṣaṇam ekavādyām jighatsvam      sarvāḥ caṇḍasya naptyaḥ nāśayāmaḥ sadānvāḥ  /
translated: The barren, the unfruitful, the one-born, the gluttonous, the hungry, all the daughters of the greedy one, the ever-wandering, we destroy.

original: niḥ vaḥ goṣṭhāt ajāmasi niḥ akṣāt niḥ upānaśāt / niḥ vaḥ magundyāḥ duhitaraḥ gṛhebhyaḥ cātayāmahe /

translated: We drive you forth from the cow-pen, from the stall, from the trough for drinking. We drive you forth from the house, the daughters of the Maguṇḍi.

original: asau yaḥ adharāt gṛhaḥ tatra santu arāyyaḥ / tatra sediḥ ni ucyatu sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ /
analyzed: asau yaḥ adharāt gṛhaḥ tatra santu arāyyaḥ    tatra sediḥ ni ucyatu sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ  /
translated: The house that is below, there let the wicked ones be. There let languor be laid low, and all the Yātudhānas.

original: bhūta patiḥ niḥ ajatu indraḥ ca itas sadānvāḥ / gṛhasya budhne āsīnāḥ tāḥ indraḥ vajreṇa adhi tiṣṭhatu /
analyzed: bhūta patiḥ niḥ ajatu indraḥ ca itas sadānvāḥ   gṛhasya budhne āsīnāḥ tāḥ indraḥ vajreṇa adhi tiṣṭhatu  /
translated: Let Indra and the Lord of Beings drive the Sadāns from hence. Seated at the threshold of the house, let Indra with his thunderbolt keep them afar.🔽If ye be born of the Kṣetriyas, or if ye be sent by men,

original: yadi stha kṣetriyāṇām yadi vā puruṣa iṣitāḥ / yadi stha dasyubhyaḥ jātāḥ naśyata itas sadānvāḥ /
analyzed: yadi stha kṣetriyāṇām yadi vā puruṣa iṣitāḥ   yadi stha dasyubhyaḥ jātāḥ naśyata itas sadānvāḥ  /

original: pari dhāmāni āsām āśuḥ gāṣṭhām iva asaram / ajaiṣam sarvān ājīn vaḥ naśyata itas sadānvāḥ /
analyzed: pari dhāmāni āsām āśuḥ gāṣṭhām iva asaram    ajaiṣam sarvān ājīn vaḥ naśyata itas sadānvāḥ  /

original: yathā dyauḥ ca pṛthivī ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ / eva me prāṇa mā bibheḥ //
analyzed: yathā dyauḥ ca pṛthivī ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ   / eva me prāṇa mā bibheḥ

translated: This Prithniparni was born first, the conqueror. With her I cut off the head of the evil-named, as of a bird.

original: arāyam asṛk pāvānam yaḥ ca sphātim jihīrṣati / garbha adam kaṇvam nāśaya pṛśniparṇi sahasva ca /
analyzed: arāyam asṛk pāvānam yaḥ ca sphātim jihīrṣati   / garbha adam kaṇvam nāśaya pṛśniparṇi sahasva ca  /
translated: The wicked man who drinks the blood, and he who fain would rob us of our store,🔽The child-killer Kanva, crush and overcome, O Prithipardhi!🔽Drive her to the mountain, drive the Kanvas who would rob us of our life.

original: girim enām ā veśaya kaṇvān jīvita yopanān / tān tvam devi pṛśniparṇī agniḥ iva anudahan ihi //🔽parācaḥ enān pra nuda kaṇvān jīvita yopanān / tamāṃsi yatra gacchanti tat kravya adaḥ ajīgamam /
analyzed: girim enām ā veśaya kaṇvān jīvita yopanān   tān tvam devi pṛśniparṇī agniḥ iva anudahan ihi  / parācaḥ enān pra nuda kaṇvān jīvita yopanān   tamāṃsi yatra gacchanti tat kravya adaḥ ajīgamam  /
translated: Go, O thou Prithipardhi, and consume them as a fire consumes the wood.🔽Drive thou away the Kanvas who would rob us of our life.🔽To the dark place where they are gone, thither have I brought the flesh-devouring fiend.🔽Let the cattle come hitherward that have gone far away: let the wind be their companion.

original: ā iha yantu paśavaḥ ye pareyuḥ vāyuḥ yeṣām sahacāram jujoṣa / tvaṣṭā yeṣām rūpadheyāni veda asmin tān goṣṭhe savitā ni yacchatu //
analyzed: ā iha yantu paśavaḥ ye pareyuḥ vāyuḥ yeṣām sahacāram jujoṣa   tvaṣṭā yeṣām rūpadheyāni veda asmin tān goṣṭhe savitā ni yacchatu  /
translated: Let Tvashtar know their forms, let Savitar lead them to this fold.🔽Let the cattle come together to this fold: let Brihaspati bring them hither, knowing them.

original: imam goṣṭham paśavaḥ sam sravantu bṛhaspatiḥ ā nayatu prajānan / sinīvālī nayatu ā agram eṣām ājagmuṣaḥ anumate ni yaccha /
analyzed: imam goṣṭham paśavaḥ sam sravantu bṛhaspatiḥ ā nayatu prajānan   sinīvālī nayatu ā agram eṣām ājagmuṣaḥ anumate ni yaccha  /
translated: Let Sinivāli lead their vanguard: let Anumati give them up to us when they have come.🔽Let the cattle come together, let the horses come together, let the men come together.

original: sam sam sravantu paśavaḥ sam aśvāḥ sam u pūruṣāḥ / sam dhānyasya yā sphātiḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi //
analyzed: sam sam sravantu paśavaḥ sam aśvāḥ sam u pūruṣāḥ   sam dhānyasya yā sphātiḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi  /
translated: Let the increase of our corn come hither. I offer with the oblation of the Srasava.

original: sam siñcāmi gavām kṣīram sam ājyena balam rasam / saṃsiktāḥ asmākam vīrāḥ dhruvāḥ gāvaḥ mayi gopatau /
analyzed: sam siñcāmi gavām kṣīram sam ājyena balam rasam   saṃsiktāḥ asmākam vīrāḥ dhruvāḥ gāvaḥ mayi gopatau  /
translated: I mix the milk of cows, I mix the strength and sap with butter. Our heroes are well-bathed, the cows are firm in me, the cowherd.

original: ā harāmi gavām kṣīram āhārṣam dhānyam rasam / āhṛtāḥ asmākam vīrāḥ ā patnīḥ idam astakam /🔽na id śatruḥ prāśam jayāti sahamānā abhibhūḥ asi / prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe /
analyzed: ā harāmi gavām kṣīram āhārṣam dhānyam rasam   āhṛtāḥ asmākam vīrāḥ ā patnīḥ idam astakam  / na id śatruḥ prāśam jayāti sahamānā abhibhūḥ asi   prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe  /
translated: I bring the milk of cows, I have brought the sap of grain. Our heroes are brought, the wives are brought, this top-knot.🔽Let not the enemy prevail. Thou art the conqueror, the overcomer. Slay the eater and the counter-eater. Make the sapless sapless, O plant.

original: suparṇaḥ tvā anu avindat sūkaraḥ tvā akhanat nasā / prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe /🔽indraḥ ha cakre tvā bāhau asurebhyaḥ starītave / prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe /
analyzed: suparṇaḥ tvā anu avindat sūkaraḥ tvā akhanat nasā   prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe  / indraḥ ha cakre tvā bāhau asurebhyaḥ starītave   prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe  /
translated: The eagle found thee, the boar dug thee up with his nose. Slay the eater and the counter-eater. Make the sapless sapless, O plant.🔽Indra made thee for the Asuras to carry away. Slay the eater and the counter-eater. Make the sapless sapless, O plant.

original: pāṭām indraḥ vi āśnāt asurebhyaḥ starītave / prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe /
analyzed: pāṭām indraḥ vi āśnāt asurebhyaḥ starītave   prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe  /
translated: Indra broke the pot for the Asuras to carry away. Slay the eater and the counter-eater. Make the sapless sapless, O plant.

original: tayā aham śatrūn sa akṣaḥ indraḥ sa alāvṛkān iva / prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe /
analyzed: tayā aham śatrūn sa akṣaḥ indraḥ sa alāvṛkān iva   prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe  /
translated: With that I crush the enemies, as Indra the Salavrkas. Slay the eater and the counter-eater. Make the sapless sapless, O plant.

original: rudra jalāṣa bheṣaja nīlaśikhaṇḍa karma kṛt / prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe /
analyzed: rudra jalāṣa bheṣaja nīlaśikhaṇḍa karma kṛt   prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe  /
translated: Rudra, the medicine of water, the fulfiller of deeds with the blue crest, the eater and the counter-eater, destroy the tasteless ones, O plant.

original: tasya prāśam tvam jahi yaḥ naḥ indra abhidāsati / adhi naḥ brūhi śaktibhiḥ prāśi mām uttaram kṛdhi //
analyzed: tasya prāśam tvam jahi yaḥ naḥ indra abhidāsati    adhi naḥ brūhi śaktibhiḥ prāśi mām uttaram kṛdhi  /
translated: Destroy the eater of him who hates us, O Indra. Speak to us with the powers. Make me the upper eater.

original: tubhyam eva jariman vardhatām ayam mā imam anye mṛtyavaḥ hiṃsiṣuḥ śatam ye / mātā iva putram pramanāḥ upasthe mitraḥ enam mitriyāt pātu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: tubhyam eva jariman vardhatām ayam mā imam anye mṛtyavaḥ hiṃsiṣuḥ śatam ye    mātā iva putram pramanāḥ upasthe mitraḥ enam mitriyāt pātu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Let this one increase for you alone, O old age. Let not the other deaths harm him for a hundred years. Like a mother with love in her lap, let Mitra protect him from misfortune.

original: mitraḥ enam varuṇaḥ vā riśādāḥ jarā mṛtyum kṛṇutām saṃvidānau / tat agniḥ hotā vayunāni vidvān viśvā devānām janimā vivakti //
analyzed: mitraḥ enam varuṇaḥ vā riśādāḥ jarā mṛtyum kṛṇutām saṃvidānau   tat agniḥ hotā vayunāni vidvān viśvā devānām janimā vivakti  /
translated: Let Mitra and Varuna, the destroyers of enemies, make him subject to old age and death, in agreement. That Agni, the priest, knowing the ordinances, proclaims all the generations of the gods.

original: tvam īśiṣe paśūnām pārthivānām ye jātāḥ uta vā ye janitrāḥ / mā imam prāṇaḥ ha āsīt mā u apānaḥ mā imam mitrāḥ vadhiṣuḥ mā u amitrāḥ /
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe paśūnām pārthivānām ye jātāḥ uta vā ye janitrāḥ   mā imam prāṇaḥ ha āsīt mā u apānaḥ mā imam mitrāḥ vadhiṣuḥ mā u amitrāḥ  /
translated: You are the lord of the earthly animals, those born and those yet to be born. Let not his breath depart, let not his out-breath. Let not the friends nor the enemies slay him.

original: dyauḥ tvā pitā pṛthivī mātā jarā mṛtyum kṛṇutām saṃvidāne / yathā jīvāḥ aditeḥ upasthe prāṇa apānābhyām gupitaḥ śatam himāḥ //
analyzed: dyauḥ tvā pitā pṛthivī mātā jarā mṛtyum kṛṇutām saṃvidāne    yathā jīvāḥ aditeḥ upasthe prāṇa apānābhyām gupitaḥ śatam himāḥ  /
translated: Let Dyaus thy Father, and let Prithivī thy Mother, and let old Age and Death, in mutual agreement, Make thee secure in Aditi's lap, O Living One, guarded by expiration and inspiration, a hundred winters.

original: imam agne āyuṣe varcase naya priyam retaḥ varuṇa mitra rājan / mātā iva asmai adite śarma yaccha viśve devāḥ jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asat /
analyzed: imam agne āyuṣe varcase naya priyam retaḥ varuṇa mitra rājan    mātā iva asmai adite śarma yaccha viśve devāḥ jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asat  /
translated: Lead him, O Agni, to long life and splendour: make him dear seed, O Varuṇa, O Mitra, O King. O Aditi, give him shelter as a mother, that he may live a hundred winters, O ye All-Gods.

original: pārthivasya rase devāḥ bhagasya tanvaḥ bale / āyuṣyam asmai agniḥ sūryaḥ varcaḥ ā dhāt bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: pārthivasya rase devāḥ bhagasya tanvaḥ bale   āyuṣyam asmai agniḥ sūryaḥ varcaḥ ā dhāt bṛhaspatiḥ  /
translated: In the earth's essence, in the strength of Bhaga's body, let Agni give him life, let Sûrya give him splendour. Let Brihaspati give him.

original: āyuḥ asmai dhehi jātavedaḥ prajām tvaṣṭar adhinidhehi asmai / rāyaḥ poṣam savitar ā suva asmai śatam jīvāti śaradaḥ tava ayam /
analyzed: āyuḥ asmai dhehi jātavedaḥ prajām tvaṣṭar adhinidhehi asmai    rāyaḥ poṣam savitar ā suva asmai śatam jīvāti śaradaḥ tava ayam  /
translated: Give him life, O thou all-knowing one. O Tvashtar, give him offspring. O Savitar, give him increase of wealth. A hundred autumns let him live through thee.

original: āśīḥ naḥ ūrjam uta sauprajāstvam dakṣam dhattam draviṇam sacetasau / jayam kṣetrāṇi sahasā ayam indra kṛṇvānaḥ anyān adharān sapatnān /
analyzed: āśīḥ naḥ ūrjam uta sauprajāstvam dakṣam dhattam draviṇam sacetasau   jayam kṣetrāṇi sahasā ayam indra kṛṇvānaḥ anyān adharān sapatnān  /
translated: Give us blessing, and food, and easy childbirth, and skill, and riches, ye who are of one accord. Let him, O Indra, with his might, win fields and lands, and make his foemen lower than his footstool.

original: indreṇa dattaḥ varuṇena śiṣṭaḥ marudbhiḥ ugraḥ prahitaḥ naḥ āgan / eṣa vām dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe mā kṣudhat mā tṛṣat /
analyzed: indreṇa dattaḥ varuṇena śiṣṭaḥ marudbhiḥ ugraḥ prahitaḥ naḥ āgan   eṣa vām dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe mā kṣudhat mā tṛṣat  /
translated: By Indra given, by Varuna appointed, by the Maruts sent forth, fierce, he hath come to us. On you, O Heaven and Earth, he rests. Let him not hunger, let him not thirst.

original: ūrjam asmai ūrjasvatī dhattam payaḥ asmai payasvatī dhattam / ūrjam asmai dyāvapṛthivī adhātām viśve devāḥ marutaḥ ūrjam āpaḥ //
analyzed: ūrjam asmai ūrjasvatī dhattam payaḥ asmai payasvatī dhattam   ūrjam asmai dyāvapṛthivī adhātām viśve devāḥ marutaḥ ūrjam āpaḥ  /
translated: Give him strength, O ye rich in strength, give him milk, O ye rich in milk. Give him strength, O ye Heaven and Earth. The All-Gods, the Maruts, the Waters have given strength.

original: śivābhiḥ te hṛdayam tarpayāmi anamīvaḥ modiṣṭhāḥ su varcāḥ / sa vāsinau pibatām mantham etam aśvinaḥ rūpam paridhāya māyām //
analyzed: śivābhiḥ te hṛdayam tarpayāmi anamīvaḥ modiṣṭhāḥ su varcāḥ   sa vāsinau pibatām mantham etam aśvinaḥ rūpam paridhāya māyām  /
translated: I gratify thy heart with pleasant juices, free from disease, most gladdening, of fair colour. Wearing the Asvins' form and magic power, drink ye this drink, ye that have garments.

original: indraḥ etām sasṛje viddhaḥ agre ūrjām svadhām ajarām sā te eṣā / tayā tvam jīva śaradaḥ su varcāḥ mā te ā susrot bhiṣajaḥ te akran /
analyzed: indraḥ etām sasṛje viddhaḥ agre ūrjām svadhām ajarām sā te eṣā    tayā tvam jīva śaradaḥ su varcāḥ mā te ā susrot bhiṣajaḥ te akran  /
translated: This strength, this food, O Indra, which thou madest first, immortal, to be thine own, therewith do thou live a hundred years, well-coloured. Let not thy physicians take away thy life.

original: yathā idam bhūmyāḥ adhi tṛṇam vātaḥ mathāyati / eva ā mathnāmi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ /
analyzed: yathā idam bhūmyāḥ adhi tṛṇam vātaḥ mathāyati   eva ā mathnāmi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ  /
translated: As the wind smites the grass that grows upon the ground, so do I smite thy heart, that thou mayst love me only, that thou mayst never leave me.

original: sam ced nayāthaḥ aśvinā kāminā sam ca vakṣathaḥ / sam vām bhagāsaḥ agmata sam cittāni sam u vratā /
analyzed: sam ced nayāthaḥ aśvinā kāminā sam ca vakṣathaḥ   sam vām bhagāsaḥ agmata sam cittāni sam u vratā  /
translated: If ye, O Aṣvins, lead him to the place of love, and bring him back again, Your blessings have come nigh to him, his heart and will and purpose too.

original: yat suparṇāḥ vivakṣavaḥ anamīvāḥ vivakṣavaḥ / tatra me gacchatāt dhavam śalyaḥ iva kulmalam yathā /
analyzed: yat suparṇāḥ vivakṣavaḥ anamīvāḥ vivakṣavaḥ   tatra me gacchatāt dhavam śalyaḥ iva kulmalam yathā
translated: When birds of prey, when birds that fly with broken wings, when birds that fly with soundless wings,

original: yat antaram tat bāhyam yat bāhyam tat antaram / kanyānām viśva rūpāṇām manaḥ gṛbhāya auṣadhe //
analyzed: yat antaram tat bāhyam yat bāhyam tat antaram   kanyānām viśva rūpāṇām manaḥ gṛbhāya auṣadhe
translated: What is within is without; what is without is within. O Plant, seize in thy heart the mind of all the maidens of all forms.

original: ā iyam agan pati kāmā jani kāmaḥ aham āgamam / aśvaḥ kanikradat yathā bhagena aham saha agamam //
analyzed: ā iyam agan pati kāmā jani kāmaḥ aham āgamam    aśvaḥ kanikradat yathā bhagena aham saha agamam  /
translated: She has come hither longing for a husband; I have come longing for a son. I have come with Bhaga, as a neighing horse.

original: indrasya yā mahī dṛṣat krimeḥ viśvasya tarhaṇī / tayā pinaṣmi sam krimīn dṛṣadā khalvān iva /
analyzed: indrasya yā mahī dṛṣad krimeḥ viśvasya tarhaṇī    tayā pinaṣmi sam krimīn dṛṣadā khalvān iva  /
translated: The mighty stone of Indra, the slayer of all worms, wherewith I crush the worms together, as with a stone a pot of clay.

original: dṛṣṭam adṛṣṭam atṛham atho kurūrum atṛham / algaṇḍūn sarvān śalunān krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi //
analyzed: dṛṣṭam a dṛṣṭam atṛham atho kurūrum atṛham    algaṇḍūn sarvān śalunān krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi  /
translated: I have destroyed the seen and unseen worm, and the Kurūra worm as well. All the worms that have no teeth, all the worms that have no jaws, we crush with this our spell.

original: algaṇḍūn hanmi mahatā vadhena dūnāḥ adūnāḥ arasāḥ abhūvan / śiṣṭān aśiṣṭān ni tirāmi vācā yathā krimīṇām nakir ucchiṣātai /
analyzed: algaṇḍūn hanmi mahatā vadhena dūnāḥ adūnāḥ arasāḥ abhūvan    śiṣṭān aśiṣṭān ni tirāmi vācā yathā krimīṇām nakir ucchiṣātai  /
translated: I slay the worms that have no teeth with mighty slaughter. The discontented have become discontented and joyless. I drive away with this my speech the disobedient and the obedient, that not one worm may escape me.

original: anvāntryam śīrṣaṇyam atho pārṣṭeyam krimīn / avaskavam vyadhvaram krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi //
analyzed: anvāntryam śīrṣaṇyam atho pārṣṭeyam krimīn   avaskavam vyadhvaram krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi  /
translated: The worms that dwell within the entrails, in the head, and in the sides, The worms that dwell in the intestines, in the joints, and in the stomach, we crush with our spell.

original: ye krimayaḥ parvata īśu vaneṣu oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar / ye asmākam tanvam āviviśuḥ sarvam tat dhanmi janima krimīṇām /
analyzed: ye krimayaḥ parvata īśu vaneṣu oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar   ye asmākam tanvam āviviśuḥ sarvam tat dhanmi janima krimīṇām  /
translated: The worms that dwell in the mountains, in the trees, in the woods, in the plants, in the cattle, in the waters, All that have entered our body, all that, I destroy, the whole race of worms.

original: udyan ādityaḥ krimīn hantu nimrocan hantu raśmibhiḥ / ye antar krimayaḥ gavi //
analyzed: udyan ādityaḥ krimīn hantu nimrocan hantu raśmibhiḥ   ye antar krimayaḥ gavi  /
translated: Let the rising sun kill the worms, let him kill them when he shines forth with his rays. The worms that are within the cow.

original: viśva rūpam catur akṣam krimim sāraṅgam arjunam / śṛṇāmi asya pṛṣṭīḥ api vṛścāmi yat śiraḥ /
analyzed: viśva rūpam catur akṣam krimim sāraṅgam arjunam    śṛṇāmi asya pṛṣṭīḥ api vṛścāmi yat śiraḥ  /
translated: The worm of many forms, four-eyed, variegated, and red, I crush its back, I break its head.

original: atri vat vaḥ krimayaḥ hanmi kaṇva vat jamadagni vat / agastyasya brahmaṇā sam pinaṣmi aham krimīn /
analyzed: atri vat vaḥ krimayaḥ hanmi kaṇva vat jamadagni vat    agastyasya brahmaṇā sam pinaṣmi aham krimīn  /
translated: Like Atri, I kill your worms, like Kanva, like Jamadagni. With the holy power of Agastya, I crush the worms.

original: hataḥ rājā krimīṇām uta eṣām sthapatiḥ hataḥ / hataḥ hata mātā krimiḥ hata bhrātā hata svasā /
analyzed: hataḥ rājā krimīṇām uta eṣām sthapatiḥ hataḥ   hataḥ hata mātā krimiḥ hata bhrātā hata svasā  /
translated: The king of the worms is slain, and their lord is slain. The mother of the worm is slain, the brother is slain, the sister is slain.

original: hatāsaḥ asya veśasaḥ hatāsaḥ pariveśasaḥ / atho ye kṣullakāḥ iva sarve te krimayaḥ hatāḥ /
analyzed: hatāsaḥ asya veśasaḥ hatāsaḥ pariveśasaḥ   atho ye kṣullakāḥ iva sarve te krimayaḥ hatāḥ  /
translated: The near kinsmen are slain, the distant kinsmen are slain. And those that are like small children, all those worms are slain.

original: pra te śṛṇāmi śṛṅge yābhyām vitudāyasi / bhinādmi te kuṣumbham yaḥ te viṣa dhānaḥ /🔽akṣībhyām te nāsikābhyām karṇābhyām chubukāt adhi / yakṣmam śīrṣaṇyam mastiṣkāt jihvāyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te /
analyzed: pra te śṛṇāmi śṛṅge yābhyām vitudāyasi   bhinādmi te kuṣumbham yaḥ te viṣa dhānaḥ  / akṣībhyām te nāsikābhyām karṇābhyām chubukāt adhi  / yakṣmam śīrṣaṇyam mastiṣkāt jihvāyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te  /
translated: I loosen thy horns wherewith thou strikest, I rend thy womb, thy poison-carrying womb.🔽From thine eyes, from thy nostrils, from thine ears, from thy throat,🔽From thy head, from thy brain, from thy tongue I drive away thy malady.🔽From thy neck, from thy jaws, from thy shoulders, from thy nape,

original: grīvābhyaḥ te uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyaḥ anūkyāt / yakṣmam doṣaṇyam aṃsābhyām bāhubhyām vi vṛhāmi te /
analyzed: grīvābhyaḥ te uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyaḥ anūkyāt    yakṣmam doṣaṇyam aṃsābhyām bāhubhyām vi vṛhāmi te  /
translated: From thy shoulders, from thy arms I drive away thy malady, thy malady of the neck.🔽From thy heart, from thy lungs, from thy spleen, from thy sides,

original: hṛdayāt te pari klomnaḥ halīkṣṇāt pārśvābhyām / yakṣmam matasnābhyām plīhnaḥ yaknaḥ te vi vṛhāmasi //
analyzed: hṛdayāt te pari klomnaḥ halīkṣṇāt pārśvābhyām    yakṣmam matasnābhyām plīhnaḥ yaknaḥ te vi vṛhāmasi  /
translated: From thy kidneys, from thy liver we drive away thy malady.🔽From thy bowels, from thy entrails, from thy rectum, from thy belly,

original: āntrebhyaḥ te gudābhyaḥ vaniṣṭhoḥ udarāt adhi / yakṣmam kukṣibhyām plāśeḥ nābhyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te /
analyzed: āntrebhyaḥ te gudābhyaḥ vaniṣṭhoḥ udarāt adhi   yakṣmam kukṣibhyām plāśeḥ nābhyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te  /
translated: From thy flanks, from thy chest, from thy navel I drive away thy malady.🔽From thy thighs, from thy knee-bones, from thy legs, from thy hoofs,

original: ūrubhyām te aṣṭhīvadbhyām pārṣṇibhyām prapadābhyām / yakṣmam bhasadyam śroṇibhyām bhāsadam bhaṃsasaḥ vi vṛhāmi te /
analyzed: ūrubhyām te aṣṭhīvadbhyām pārṣṇibhyām prapadābhyām   yakṣmam bhasadyam śroṇibhyām bhāsadam bhaṃsasaḥ vi vṛhāmi te  /
translated: From thy hips, from thy buttocks, from thy womb I drive away thy malady.🔽From thy bones, from thy marrow, from thy sinews, from thy veins,

original: asthibhyaḥ te majjabhyaḥ snāvabhyaḥ dhamanibhyaḥ / yakṣmam pāṇibhyām aṅgulibhyaḥ nakhebhyaḥ vi vṛhāmi te /
analyzed: asthibhyaḥ te majjabhyaḥ snāvabhyaḥ dhamanibhyaḥ   yakṣmam pāṇibhyām aṅgulibhyaḥ nakhebhyaḥ vi vṛhāmi te  /
translated: From thy hands, from thy fingers, from thy nails I drive away thy malady.

original: aṅge aṅge lomni lomni yaḥ te parvaṇi parvaṇi / yakṣmam tvacasyam te vayam kaśyapasya vībarheṇa viṣvañcam vi vṛhāmasi //
analyzed: aṅge aṅge lomni lomni yaḥ te parvaṇi parvaṇi    yakṣmam tvacasyam te vayam kaśyapasya vībarheṇa viṣvañcam vi vṛhāmasi  /
translated: The malady that dwells in every limb, in every hair, in every joint of thine, The malady that dwells within thy skin, that do we banish with the aid of Kasyapa's spell, and drive it far away.

original: yaḥ īśe paśupatiḥ paśūnām catuṣpadām uta yaḥ dvipadām / niṣkrītaḥ sa yajñiyam bhāgam etu rāyaḥ poṣāḥ yajamānam sacantām /
analyzed: yaḥ īśe paśupatiḥ paśūnām catuṣpadām uta yaḥ dvipadām   niṣkrītaḥ sa yajñiyam bhāgam etu rāyaḥ poṣāḥ yajamānam sacantām  /
translated: He who is Lord of cattle, of the four-footed and of those that have but two, Let him, redeemed, come to his share in sacrifice. Let the increase of wealth follow the sacrificer.

original: pramuñcantaḥ bhuvanasya retaḥ gātum dhatta yajamānāya devāḥ / upākṛtam śaśamānam yat asthāt priyam devānām api etu pāthaḥ //
analyzed: pramuñcantaḥ bhuvanasya retaḥ gātum dhatta yajamānāya devāḥ   upākṛtam śaśamānam yat asthāt priyam devānām api etu pāthaḥ  /
translated: Sending forth the seed of life, give passage to the sacrificer, O ye Gods. The victim that hath been prepared, that hath been active, let it go to the dear place of the Gods.

original: ye badhyamānam anu dīdhyānāḥ anvaikṣanta manasā cakṣuṣā ca / agniḥ tān agre pra mumoktu devaḥ viśvakarmā prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye badhyamānam anu dīdhyānāḥ anvaikṣanta manasā cakṣuṣā ca   agniḥ tān agre pra mumoktu devaḥ viśvakarmā prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ  /
translated: Those who have looked upon it with the eye of the mind, as it was being bound, let Agni, the God, the first of all, set free, Vishvakarman, rejoicing in offspring.

original: ye grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ viśva rūpāḥ virūpāḥ santaḥ bahudhā eka rūpāḥ / vāyuḥ tān agre pra mumoktu devaḥ prajāpatiḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ viśva rūpāḥ virūpāḥ santaḥ bahudhā eka rūpāḥ    vāyuḥ tān agre pra mumoktu devaḥ prajāpatiḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ  /
translated: Those domestic animals of every form, of many forms, though different, yet of one form, let the God Vayu, the first of all, set free, Prajapati, rejoicing in offspring.

original: prajānantaḥ prati gṛhṇantu pūrve prāṇam aṅgebhyaḥ pari ācarantam / divam gaccha prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ svargam yāhi pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ /
analyzed: prajānantaḥ prati gṛhṇantu pūrve prāṇam aṅgebhyaḥ pari ācarantam    divam gaccha prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ svargam yāhi pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ  /
translated: Let the wise ones receive him, as he goes round the limbs, the breath before all others. Go to the sky, stand firm with thy members. Go to heaven by the paths which Gods have travelled.

original: ye bhakṣayantaḥ na vasūni ānṛdhuḥ yān agnayaḥ anvatapyanta dhiṣṇyāḥ / yā teṣām avayā duriṣṭiḥ su iṣṭim naḥ tām kṛṇavat viśvakarmā /
analyzed: ye bhakṣayantaḥ na vasūni ānṛdhuḥ yān agnayaḥ anvatapyanta dhiṣṇyāḥ   yā teṣām avayā duriṣṭiḥ su iṣṭim naḥ tām kṛṇavat viśvakarmā  /
translated: Those who, while eating, have not gained possessions, whom the fires, the domestic shrines, have followed, May Visvakarman make for us good offering of that ill-offering of theirs which is left over.

original: yajñapatim ṛṣayaḥ enasā āhuḥ nirbhaktam prajāḥ anutapyamānam / mathavyān stokān apa yān rarādha sam naḥ tebhiḥ sṛjatu viśvakarmā /
analyzed: yajñapatim ṛṣayaḥ enasā āhuḥ nirbhaktam prajāḥ anutapyamānam   mathavyān stokān apa yān rarādha sam naḥ tebhiḥ sṛjatu viśvakarmā  /
translated: The Rishis call the sacrificer guilty, abandoned, repenting of his gifts to creatures. The little ones whom he has cherished, the feeble, may Visvakarman unite us with them.

original: adānyān soma pād manyamānaḥ yajñasya vidvān samaye na dhīraḥ / yat enaḥ cakṛvān baddhaḥ eṣa tam viśvakarman pra muñca svastaye /
analyzed: adānyān soma pād manyamānaḥ yajñasya vidvān samaye na dhīraḥ   yat enaḥ cakṛvān baddhaḥ eṣa tam viśvakarman pra muñca svastaye  /
translated: The fool who, knowing the sacrifice, is not generous, who thinks himself not to be a debtor, Whatever sin he has committed, bound by that, O Visvakarman, set him free for bliss.

original: ghorāḥ ṛṣayaḥ namaḥ astu ebhyaḥ cakṣuḥ yat eṣām manasaḥ ca satyam / bṛhaspataye mahiṣa dyuman namaḥ viśvakarman namaḥ te pāhi asmān /
analyzed: ghorāḥ ṛṣayaḥ namaḥ astu ebhyaḥ cakṣuḥ yat eṣām manasaḥ ca satyam   bṛhaspataye mahiṣa dyumat namaḥ viśvakarman namaḥ te pāhi asmān  /
translated: The Rishis are terrible: to them be homage, the truth of their mind and the truth of their eye. To Brihaspati, O mighty and glorious one, be homage. To Visvakarman be homage: protect us.

original: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtiḥ mukham ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi / imam yajñam vitatam viśvakarmaṇā devāḥ yantu sumanasyamānāḥ /🔽ā naḥ agne sumatim saṃbhalaḥ gamet imām kumārīm saha naḥ bhagena / juṣṭā vareṣu samaneṣu valguḥ oṣam patyā saubhagam astu asyai /🔽soma juṣṭam brahma juṣṭam aryamnā saṃbhṛtam bhagam / dhātuḥ devasya satyena kṛṇomi pati vedanam /
analyzed: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtiḥ mukham ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi    imam yajñam vitatam viśvakarmaṇā devāḥ yantu sumanasyamānāḥ  / ā naḥ agne sumatim saṃbhalaḥ gamet imām kumārīm saha naḥ bhagena   juṣṭā vareṣu samaneṣu valguḥ oṣam patyā saubhagam astu asyai  / soma juṣṭam brahma juṣṭam aryamnā saṃbhṛtam bhagam    dhātuḥ devasya satyena kṛṇomi pati vedanam  /
translated: The eye of sacrifice, the beginning, and the mouth, with speech, with hearing, with mind I offer. Let the Gods, with all their works well-ordered, come to this sacrifice of ours.

original: iyam agne nārī patim videṣṭa somaḥ hi rājā subhagām kṛṇoti / suvānā putrān mahiṣī bhavāti gatvā patim subhagā vi rājatu //🔽yathā ākharaḥ maghavan cāruḥ eṣa priyaḥ mṛgāṇām suṣadā babhūva / eva bhagasya juṣṭā iyam astu nārī saṃpriyā patyā avirādhayantī /🔽bhagasya nāvam ā roha pūrṇām anupadasvatīm / tayā upapratāraya yaḥ varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ /
analyzed: iyam agne nārī patim videṣṭa somaḥ hi rājā subhagām kṛṇoti   suvānā putrān mahiṣī bhavāti gatvā patim subhagā vi rājatu  /🔽yathā ākharaḥ maghavan cāruḥ eṣa priyaḥ mṛgāṇām suṣadā babhūva   eva bhagasya juṣṭā iyam astu nārī saṃpriyā patyā avirādhayantī  /🔽bhagasya nāvam ā roha pūrṇām anupadasvatīm    tayā upapratāraya yaḥ varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ  /
translated: May the God Savitar, the God Brihaspati, the God Soma, the God Pusan, the God Vishnu, the God Varuna, the God Indra, the God Agni, the God Brahman, the God Prajapati, the God of gods, the Lord of lords, the God of all, the Lord of all, the God of men, the Lord of men, the God of cattle, the Lord of cattle, the God of the world, the Lord of the world, the God of the waters, the Lord of the waters, the God of the plants, the Lord of the plants, the God of the trees, the Lord of the trees, the God of the forest, the Lord of the forest, the God of the mountains, the Lord of the mountains, the God of the rivers, the Lord of the rivers, the God of the oceans, the Lord of the oceans, the God of the earth, the Lord of the earth, the God of the sky, the Lord of the sky, the God of the atmosphere, the Lord of the atmosphere, the God of the quarters, the Lord of the quarters, the God of the regions, the Lord of the regions, the God of the worlds, the Lord of the worlds, the God of the past, the Lord of the past, the God of the future, the Lord of the future, the God of the present, the Lord of the present, the God of the gods, the Lord of the gods, the God of the Rishis, the Lord of the Rishis, the God of the Gandharvas, the Lord of the Gandharvas, the God of the Apsarases, the Lord of the Apsarases, the God of the Yakshas, the Lord of the Yakshas, the God of the Rakshasas, the Lord of the Rakshasas, the God of the serpents, the Lord of the serpents, the God of the birds, the Lord of the birds, the God of the beasts, the Lord of the beasts, the God of the trees, the Lord of the trees, the God of the herbs, the Lord of the herbs, the God of the waters, the Lord of the waters, the God of the plants, the Lord of the plants, the

original: ā krandaya dhanapate varam āmanasam kṛṇu / sarvam pradakṣiṇam kṛṇu yaḥ varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ /
analyzed: ā krandaya dhanapate varam āmanasam kṛṇu   sarvam pradakṣiṇam kṛṇu yaḥ varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ  /
translated: O Lord of Wealth, make him cry out, make him repent, make him turn to us. Make all things favourable to him who is to be won over.

original: idam hiraṇyam gulgulu ayam aukṣaḥ atho bhagaḥ / ete patibhyaḥ tvām aduḥ pratikāmāya vettave /
analyzed: idam hiraṇyam gulgulu ayam aukṣaḥ atho bhagaḥ    ete patibhyaḥ tvām aduḥ pratikāmāya vettave
translated: This gold, this bdellium, this ox, and this Bhaga, these have given thee to the husbands, to the one who is to be won over, to the one who is to be gained.

original: ā te nayatu savitā nayatu patiḥ yaḥ pratikāmyaḥ / agniḥ naḥ śatrūn prati etu vidvān pratidahan abhiśastim arātim / sa senām mohayatu pareṣām nirhastān ca kṛṇavat jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: ā te nayatu savitā nayatu patiḥ yaḥ pratikāmyaḥ   agniḥ naḥ śatrūn prati etu vidvān pratidahan abhiśastim arātim   sa senām mohayatu pareṣām nirhastān ca kṛṇavat jātavedāḥ  /
translated: May Savitar lead thee hither, may thy husband lead thee hither, he who is to be won over. May Agni, the wise, come to our enemies, burning, consuming the curse and hostility. May he confound the armies of the foe, and make them powerless, O all-knowing one.

original: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ īdṛśe stha abhi preta mṛṇata sahadhvam / amīmṛṇan vasavaḥ nāthitāḥ ime agniḥ hi eṣām dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān /
analyzed: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ īdṛśe stha abhi preta mṛṇata sahadhvam   amīmṛṇan vasavaḥ nāthitāḥ ime agniḥ hi eṣām dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān  /
translated: Ye are terrible, O Maruts, in such a case as this. Go forward, crush, be united. The Vasus have crushed these who were to be crushed. Let Agni, their wise messenger, come hither.🔽O bountiful one, the hostile army of our enemies, which is to be overcome,

original: amitra senām maghavan asmān śatrūyatīm abhi / yuvam tām indra vṛtrahan agniḥ ca dahatam prati /
analyzed: amitra senām maghavan asmān śatrūyatīm abhi    yuvam tām indra vṛtrahan agniḥ ca dahatam prati  /
translated: Do thou and Agni, O Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, burn it up.

original: prasūtaḥ indra pravata haribhyām pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇan etu śatrūn / jahi pratīcaḥ anūcaḥ parācaḥ viṣvak satyam kṛṇuhi cittam eṣām /
analyzed: prasūtaḥ indra pravata haribhyām pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇan etu śatrūn    jahi pratīcaḥ anūcaḥ parācaḥ viṣvak satyam kṛṇuhi cittam eṣām  /
translated: O Indra, urged by the two bay steeds, let thy bolt go forth and crush the foes. Destroy the words of those who come against us and those who come from behind. Make their hearts true on every side.

original: indra senām mohaya amitrāṇām / agneḥ vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūcaḥ vi nāśaya //
analyzed: indra senām mohaya amitrāṇām    agneḥ vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūcaḥ vi nāśaya  /
translated: O Indra, confound the hosts of the foe. With the speed of Agni and Vayu, scatter them in all directions and destroy them.

original: indraḥ senām mohayatu marutaḥ ghnantu ojasā / cakṣūṃsi agniḥ ā dattām punar etu parājitā /
analyzed: indraḥ senām mohayatu marutaḥ ghnantu ojasā   cakṣūṃsi agniḥ ā dattām punar etu parājitā  /
translated: May Indra confound the army, may the Maruts slay it with their might. May Agni give them sight. Let them return defeated.

original: agniḥ naḥ dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān pratidahan abhiśastim arātim / sa cittāni mohayatu pareṣām nirhastān ca kṛṇavat jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān pratidahan abhiśastim arātim    sa cittāni mohayatu pareṣām nirhastān ca kṛṇavat jātavedāḥ  /
translated: May Agni, the wise, return to us as our messenger, burning up the curse and hostility. May he confound the thoughts of the others and make them handless, O all-knowing one.

original: ayam agniḥ amūmuhat yāni cittāni vaḥ hṛdi / vi vaḥ dhamatu okasaḥ pra vaḥ dhamatu sarvatas /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ amūmuhat yāni cittāni vaḥ hṛdi   vi vaḥ dhamatu okasaḥ pra vaḥ dhamatu sarvatas  /
translated: This Agni has bewildered whatever thoughts are in your heart. May he stir up your dwellings. May he stir them up from every side.

original: indra cittāni mohayan arvāṅ ākūtyā cara / agneḥ vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūcaḥ vi nāśaya //
analyzed: indra cittāni mohayan arvāṅ ākūtyā cara    agneḥ vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūcaḥ vi nāśaya  /
translated: O Indra, confounding their thoughts, move hither with the intention (of destroying them). With the speed of Agni and Vata, scatter them in all directions and destroy them.

original: vi ākūtayaḥ eṣām ita atho cittāni muhyata / atha u yat adya eṣām hṛdi tat eṣām pari niḥ jahi //
analyzed: vi ākūtayaḥ eṣām ita atho cittāni muhyata    atha u yat adya eṣām hṛdi tat eṣām pari niḥ jahi  /
translated: Let their intentions go away from here, and let their thoughts be confused. And whatever is in their heart today, drive that away from them on every side.

original: amīṣām cittāni pratimohayantī gṛhāṇa aṅgāni apve parehi / abhi prehi niḥ daha hṛtsu śokaiḥ grāhya amitrān tamasā vidhya śatrūn /
analyzed: amīṣām cittāni pratimohayantī gṛhāṇa aṅgāni apve parehi   abhi prehi niḥ daha hṛtsu śokaiḥ grāhya amitrān tamasā vidhya śatrūn  /
translated: Confusing the hearts of these, O Apva, take their limbs and go away. Go forward, burn them in their hearts with grief. O Grahi, pierce the foes with darkness.

original: asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣām asmān aiti abhi ojasā spardhamānā / tām vidhyata tamasā apavratena yathā eṣām anyaḥ anyam na jānāt /
analyzed: asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣām asmān aiti abhi ojasā spardhamānā    tām vidhyata tamasā apavratena yathā eṣām anyaḥ anyam na jānāt  /
translated: That army of the foe, O Maruts, which, striving with us in might, cometh against us, pierce it with darkness and with Apvrs, that they may not know one another.

original: acikradat su apāḥ iha bhuvat agne vi acasva rodasī urūcī / yuñjantu tvā marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ ā amum naya namasā rāta havyam /
analyzed: acikradat su apāḥ iha bhuvat agne vi acasva rodasī urūcī   yuñjantu tvā marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ ā amum naya namasā rāta havyam  /
translated: Here hath he roared, here hath he bubbled forth. O Agni, part asunder the two wide worlds. Let the Maruts, all-knowing, yoke thee. Lead him with reverence to the oblation-bearer.

original: dūre cit santam aruṣāsaḥ indram ā cyāvayantu sakhyāya vipram / yat gāyatrīm bṛhatīm arkam asmai sautrāmaṇyā dadhṛṣanta devāḥ /
analyzed: dūre cit santam aruṣāsaḥ indram ā cyāvayantu sakhyāya vipram    yat gāyatrīm bṛhatīm arkam asmai sautrāmaṇyā dadhṛṣanta devāḥ  /
translated: Even though he be afar, let the red-steeds bring hither Indra, the sage, to be our friend, When they have brought to him the lofty hymn in the Gâyatrî metre, the gods have dared to offer the Sautrâmanî.

original: adbhyaḥ tvā rāja varuṇaḥ hvayatu somaḥ tvā hvayatu parvatebhyaḥ / indraḥ tvā hvayatu viḍbhyaḥ ābhyaḥ śyenaḥ bhūtvā viśaḥ ā pata imāḥ //
analyzed: adbhyaḥ tvā rāja varuṇaḥ hvayatu somaḥ tvā hvayatu parvatebhyaḥ   indraḥ tvā hvayatu viḍbhyaḥ ābhyaḥ śyenaḥ bhūtvā viśaḥ ā pata imāḥ  /
translated: Let King Varuna summon thee from the waters, let Soma summon thee from the mountains. Let Indra summon thee from the people. Becoming a hawk, fly to these people.

original: śyenaḥ havyam nayatu ā parasmāt anya kṣetre aparuddham carantam / aśvinā panthām kṛṇutām sugam te imam sajātāḥ abhisaṃviśadhvam //
analyzed: śyenaḥ havyam nayatu ā parasmāt anya kṣetre aparuddham carantam    aśvinā panthām kṛṇutām sugam te imam sajātāḥ abhisaṃviśadhvam  /
translated: Let the hawk lead the offering away from here, him who is held captive in another's house. O Asvins, make the path easy for thee. Let thy kinsmen here assemble round thee.

original: hvayantu tvā pratijanāḥ prati mitrāḥ avṛṣata / indra agnī viśve devāḥ te viśi kṣemam adīdharan // //
analyzed: hvayantu tvā pratijanāḥ prati mitrāḥ avṛṣata   indra agnī viśve devāḥ te viśi kṣemam adīdharan
translated: Let the people and thy friends call thee hither, and let thy comrades come to thee. Indra, Agni, and all the Gods have established thee in this house in peace and safety.

analyzed: yaḥ te havam vivadat sajātaḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ   apāñcam indra tam kṛtvā atha imam iha ava gamaya
translated: The kinsman who disputes with thee for thy call, and the Nischya, O Indra, having made him turn away, then bring hither this (man).

original: ā tvā gan rāṣtram saha varcasā ud ihi prāṅ viśām patiḥ ekarāj tvam vi rāja / sarvāḥ tvā rājan pradiśaḥ hvayantu upasadyaḥ namasyaḥ bhava iha /
analyzed: ā tvā gan rāṣtram saha varcasā ud ihi prāṅ viśām patiḥ ekarāj tvam vi rāja    sarvāḥ tvā rājan pradiśaḥ hvayantu upasadyaḥ namasyaḥ bhava iha  /
translated: Let the kingdom come to thee with glory. Rise up, the lord of the people, the sole king, rule thou. Let all the regions call thee hither, O king, be thou to be approached and worshipped here.

original: tvām viśaḥ vṛṇatām rājyāya tvām imāḥ pradiśaḥ pañca devīḥ / varṣman rāṣṭrasya kakudi śrayasva tatas naḥ ugraḥ vi bhaja vasūni //
analyzed: tvām viśaḥ vṛṇatām rājyāya tvām imāḥ pradiśaḥ pañca devīḥ   varṣman rāṣṭrasya kakudi śrayasva tatas naḥ ugraḥ vi bhaja vasūni  /
translated: Thee for the people's choice to be their King, thee these five Goddesses, the regions of the sky. Rest on the summit of the kingdom's central point. From thence, O Mighty One, distribute thou wealth.

original: acha tvā yantu havinaḥ sajātāḥ agniḥ dūtaḥ ajiraḥ sam carātai / jāyāḥ putrāḥ sumanasaḥ bhavantu bahum balim prati paśyāsai ugraḥ /🔽aśvinā tvā agre mitrāvaruṇā ubhā viśve devāḥ marutaḥ tvā hvayantu / adhā manaḥ vasu deyāya kṛṇuṣva tatas naḥ ugraḥ vi bhaja vasūni /
analyzed: acha tvā yantu havinaḥ sajātāḥ agniḥ dūtaḥ ajiraḥ sam carātai   jāyāḥ putrāḥ sumanasaḥ bhavantu bahum balim prati paśyāsai ugraḥ  / aśvinā tvā agre mitrāvaruṇā ubhā viśve devāḥ marutaḥ tvā hvayantu   adhā manaḥ vasu deyāya kṛṇuṣva tatas naḥ ugraḥ vi bhaja vasūni  /
translated: Let thy kinsmen come to thee, O thou who lovest guests: let Agni, swift, be messenger to meet them. Let wife and sons be gracious unto thee. Look on the ample tribute which they bring.🔽Let the two Asvins, Mitra, Varuna, and all the Maruts call thee hitherward. Now make thy spirit ready to bestow good gifts. From thence, O Mighty One, distribute thou wealth.

original: ā pra drava paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām / tat ayam rājā varuṇaḥ tathā āha sa tvā ayam ahvat saḥ upa idam ehi //
analyzed: ā pra drava paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām   tat ayam rājā varuṇaḥ tathā āha sa tvā ayam ahvat saḥ upa idam ehi  /
translated: Come hither from the farthest distance, from the most distant place. Be both the heavens and earth propitious unto thee. So saith this King Varuna. He hath invoked thee. Come hither to this place.

original: indra indra manuṣyāḥ parehi sam hi ajñāsthāḥ varuṇaiḥ saṃvidānaḥ / sa tvā ayam ahvat sve sadhasthe sa devān yakṣat saḥ u kalpayat viśaḥ /
analyzed: indra indra manuṣyāḥ parehi sam hi ajñāsthāḥ varuṇaiḥ saṃvidānaḥ    sa tvā ayam ahvat sve sadhasthe sa devān yakṣat saḥ u kalpayat viśaḥ  /
translated: Come hither, Indra, to the men. For they have knowledge of the Gods, and with the Varunas are they in close alliance. He hath invoked thee. In thine own abode be seated. Worship the Gods. Allot the people to their several tasks.

original: pathyāḥ revatīḥ bahudhā virūpāḥ sarvāḥ saṃgatya varīyaḥ te akran / tāḥ tvā sarvāḥ saṃvidānāḥ hvayantu daśamīm ugraḥ sumanāḥ vaśā iha /
analyzed: pathyāḥ revatīḥ bahudhā virūpāḥ sarvāḥ saṃgatya varīyaḥ te akran   tāḥ tvā sarvāḥ saṃvidānāḥ hvayantu daśamīm ugraḥ sumanāḥ vaśā iha  /
translated: The Pathyas, the Revatls, in many a form, various, have all come hither, and have made thee better. Let all these, agreeing, call thee hither, the tenth, the fierce, the well-disposed, the female.

original: ā ayam agan parṇa maṇiḥ balī balena pramṛṇan sapatnān / ojaḥ devānām payaḥ oṣadhīnām varcasā mā jinvantu a prayāvan //
analyzed: ā ayam agan parṇa maṇiḥ balī balena pramṛṇan sapatnān    ojaḥ devānām payaḥ oṣadhīnām varcasā mā jinvantu a prayāvan  /
translated: This mighty Parna gem hath come, crushing the foemen with its might, The strength of Gods, the milk of plants. May it, immortal, animate me with splendour.

original: mayi kṣatram parṇamaṇe mayi dhārayatāt rayim / aham rāṣṭrasya abhīvarge nijaḥ bhūyāsam uttamaḥ /
analyzed: mayi kṣatram parṇamaṇe mayi dhārayatāt rayim    aham rāṣṭrasya abhīvarge nijaḥ bhūyāsam uttamaḥ  /
translated: In me, O Parna gem, let the Kshatriya place his power, and in me his wealth. May I be the nearest and the best of the kingdom's guardians.

original: yam nidadhuḥ vanaspatau guhyam devāḥ priyam maṇim / tam asmabhyam saha āyuṣā devāḥ dadatu bhartave /
analyzed: yam nidadhuḥ vanaspatau guhyam devāḥ priyam maṇim   tam asmabhyam saha āyuṣā devāḥ dadatu bhartave  /
translated: The gem which the Gods have hidden in the tree, the dear and secret one, May the Gods give it to us to keep, with life that it may be ours long.

original: somasya parṇaḥ sahaḥ ugram āgan indreṇa dattaḥ varuṇena śiṣṭaḥ / tam priyāsam bahu rocamānaḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya /
analyzed: somasya parṇaḥ sahaḥ ugram āgan indreṇa dattaḥ varuṇena śiṣṭaḥ   tam priyāsam bahu rocamānaḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  /
translated: The Parna gem of Soma, mighty and strong, given by Indra, appointed by Varuna, That have I gained, much-lauded, for long life, for a hundred winters.

original: ā mā arukṣat parṇa maṇiḥ mahyāḥ ariṣṭatātaye / yathā aham uttaraḥ asāni aryamṇaḥ uta saṃvidaḥ /
analyzed: ā mā arukṣat parṇa maṇiḥ mahyāḥ ariṣṭatātaye   yathā aham uttaraḥ asāni aryamṇaḥ uta saṃvidaḥ  /
translated: The Parna gem hath mounted up on me for my protection and my safety, That I may be the foremost of the kingdom's guardians, and of Aryaman's most intimate associates.

original: ye dhīvānaḥ rathakārāḥ karmārāḥ ye manīṣiṇaḥ / upastīn parṇa mahyam tvam sarvān kṛṇu abhitas janān /🔽ye rājānaḥ rāja kṛtaḥ sūtāḥ grāmaṇyaḥ ca ye / upastīn parṇa mahyam tvam sarvān kṛṇu abhitas janān //
analyzed: ye dhīvānaḥ rathakārāḥ karmārāḥ ye manīṣiṇaḥ    upastīn parṇa mahyam tvam sarvān kṛṇu abhitas janān  / ye rājānaḥ rāja kṛtaḥ sūtāḥ grāmaṇyaḥ ca ye    upastīn parṇa mahyam tvam sarvān kṛṇu abhitas janān
translated: Thou, O Parna, who art wise, who art a carver, a smith, a thinker,🔽Thou, O Parna, who art wise, who art a carver, a smith, a thinker,

original: parṇaḥ asi tanū pānaḥ sayoniḥ vīraḥ vīreṇa mayā / saṃvatsarasya tejasā tena badhnāmi tvā maṇe /🔽pumān puṃsaḥ parijātaḥ aśvatthaḥ khadirāt adhi / sa hantu śatrūn māmakān yān aham dveṣmi ye ca mām /🔽tān aśvattha niḥ śṛṇīhi śatrūn vaibādha dodhataḥ / indreṇa vṛtra ghnā medī mitreṇa varuṇena ca /
analyzed: parṇaḥ asi tanū pānaḥ sayoniḥ vīraḥ vīreṇa mayā   / saṃvatsarasya tejasā tena badhnāmi tvā maṇe  / pumān puṃsaḥ parijātaḥ aśvatthaḥ khadirāt adhi    sa hantu śatrūn māmakān yān aham dveṣmi ye ca mām  / tān aśvattha niḥ śṛṇīhi śatrūn vaibādha dodhataḥ   indreṇa vṛtra ghnā medī mitreṇa varuṇena ca  /
translated: Thou art the leaf, the covering of the body, of the same womb as the hero, with me the hero.

original: yathā aśvattha nirabhanaḥ antar mahati arṇave / eva tān sarvān niḥ bhaṅgdhi yān aham dveṣmi ye ca mām /🔽yaḥ sahamānaḥ carasi sāsahānaḥ iva ṛṣabhaḥ / tena aśvattha tvayā vayam sapatnān sahiṣīmahi //
analyzed: yathā aśvattha nirabhanaḥ antar mahati arṇave    eva tān sarvān niḥ bhaṅgdhi yān aham dveṣmi ye ca mām  /🔽yaḥ sahamānaḥ carasi sāsahānaḥ iva ṛṣabhaḥ   tena aśvattha tvayā vayam sapatnān sahiṣīmahi  /
