original: śatena mā pari pāhi sahasreṇa abhi rakṣa mā / indraḥ te vīrudhām pate ugraḥ ojmānam ā dadhat //
analyzed: śatena mā pari pāhi sahasreṇa abhi rakṣa mā   / indraḥ te vīrudhām pate ugraḥ ojmānam ā dadhat  /
translated: Guard me with a hundred, guard me with a thousand, protect me well. May Indra, Lord of Plants, the Mighty, bestow on thee the power of sight.

original: ā paśyati prati paśyati parā paśyati paśyati / divam antarikṣam āt bhūmim sarvam tat devi paśyati //
analyzed: ā paśyati prati paśyati parā paśyati paśyati    divam antarikṣam āt bhūmim sarvam tat devi paśyati  /
translated: He looks abroad, he looks around, he looks away, he looks at home. Thou, Goddess Plant, beholdest all, the heavens, the air, and earth, and all.

original: tisraḥ divaḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ ṣaṭ ca imāḥ pradiśāḥ pṛthak / tvayā aham sarvāḥ bhūtāni paśyāni devī oṣadhe /
analyzed: tisraḥ divaḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ ṣaṭ ca imāḥ pradiśāḥ pṛthak   tvayā aham sarvāḥ bhūtāni paśyāni devī oṣadhe  /
translated: Three times the heavens, three times the earth, and these six regions separate ways. Through thee, O Goddess Plant, may I behold all creatures, every one, the noble and the base.

original: divyasya suparṇasya tasya hā asi kanīnikā / sā bhūmim ā rurohitha vahyam śrāntā vadhūḥ iva /
analyzed: divyasya suparṇasya tasya hā asi kanīnikā    sā bhūmim ā rurohitha vahyam śrāntā vadhūḥ iva  /
translated: Thou art the pupil of the eye of him the heavenly bird. Thou hast come down to earth, as a tired bride comes down from heaven.

original: tām me sahasra akṣaḥ devaḥ dakṣiṇe haste ā dadhat / tayā aham sarvam paśyāmi yaḥ ca śūdraḥ uta āryaḥ /
analyzed: tām me sahasra akṣaḥ devaḥ dakṣiṇe haste ā dadhat tayā aham sarvam paśyāmi yaḥ ca śūdraḥ uta āryaḥ  /
translated: The God of thousand eyes hath placed thee in my right hand. Therewith I see all creatures, noble and ignoble.

original: āvis kṛṇuṣva rūpāni mā ātmānam apa gūhathāḥ / atho sahasra cakṣo tvam prati paśyāḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: āvis kṛṇuṣva rūpāni mā ātmānam apa gūhathāḥ   atho sahasra cakṣo tvam prati paśyāḥ kimīdinaḥ  /
translated: Reveal thy forms, conceal not thyself. Thou, with a thousand eyes, behold the Kimīdins.

original: darśaya mā yātudhānān darśaya yātudhānyaḥ / piśācān sarvān darśaya iti tvā rabha oṣadhe /
analyzed: darśaya mā yātudhānān darśaya yātudhānyaḥ   piśācān sarvān darśaya iti tvā rabhe oṣadhe  /
translated: Show me the Yātudhānas, show me the Yātudhānīs. Show me all the Piśācas. Thus have I seized thee, O Plant.

original: kaśyapasya cakṣuḥ asi śunyāḥ ca catur akṣyāḥ / vīdhre sūryam iva sarpantam mā piśācam tiras karaḥ /
analyzed: kaśyapasya cakṣuḥ asi śunyāḥ ca catur akṣyāḥ   vīdhre sūryam iva sarpantam mā piśācam tiras karaḥ  /
translated: Thou art the eye of Kasyapa, thou art the four-eyed void. Like the sun in the mist, creeping, do not hide the Pisacha away.

original: ud agrabham paripāṇāt yātudhānam kimīdinam / tena aham sarvam paśyāmi uta śūdram uta āryam //
analyzed: ud agrabham paripāṇāt yātudhānam kimīdinam    tena aham sarvam paśyāmi uta śūdram uta āryam  /
translated: I have raised up the Yatudhana, the Kimidins, from the guard. By him I see all, the Sudra and the Arya.

original: yaḥ antarikṣeṇa patati divam yaḥ ca atisarpati / bhūmim yaḥ manyate nātham tam piśācam pra darśaya //
analyzed: yaḥ antarikṣeṇa patati divam yaḥ ca atisarpati   bhūmim yaḥ manyate nātham tam piśācam pra darśaya  /
translated: He who flies with the atmosphere, and he who creeps over the sky, and he who thinks the earth his lord, show me that Pisacha.

original: ā gāvaḥ agman uta bhadram akran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantu asme / prajāvatīḥ puru rūpāḥ iha syuḥ indrāya pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ duhānāḥ /
analyzed: ā gāvaḥ agman uta bhadram akran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantu asme   prajāvatīḥ puru rūpāḥ iha syuḥ indrāya pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ duhānāḥ  /
translated: The cows have come and brought us luck. Let them rest in the cow-pen and be glad among us. Here let them be, rich in offspring, of many forms, yielding abundant milk to Indra at early morn.

original: indraḥ yajvane gṛṇate ca śikṣate upa id dadāti na svam muṣāyati / bhūyas bhūyas rayim id asya vardhayan abhinne khilye ni dadhāti devayum /
analyzed: indraḥ yajvane gṛṇate ca śikṣate upa id dadāti na svam muṣāyati    bhūyas bhūyas rayim id asya vardhayan abhinne khilye ni dadhāti devayum  /
translated: Indra helps the sacrificer and the singer. He gives, he does not take away his own. Increasing his wealth again and again, he places the pious man in an unbroken stall.

original: na tāḥ naśanti na dabhāti taskaraḥ nāsām āmitraḥ vyathiḥ ā dadharṣati / devān ca yābhiḥ yajate dadāti ca jyok id tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha /
analyzed: na tāḥ naśanti na dabhāti taskaraḥ nāsām āmitraḥ vyathiḥ ā dadharṣati    devān ca yābhiḥ yajate dadāti ca jyok id tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha  /
translated: They are not lost, the thief does not injure them. The foe's distress does not oppress them. With them he lives long, the herdsman, with which he worships the gods and gives gifts.

original: na tāḥ arvā reṇu kakāṭaḥ aśnute na saṃskṛtatram upa yanti tāḥ abhi / uru gāyam abhayam tasya tāḥ anu gāvaḥ martasya vi caranti yajvanaḥ /
analyzed: na tāḥ arvā reṇu kakāṭaḥ aśnute na saṃskṛtatram upa yanti tāḥ abhi   uru gāyam abhayam tasya tāḥ anu gāvaḥ martasya vi caranti yajvanaḥ  /
translated: The dust of the chariot-wheels does not reach them, they do not go to the place of anointing. Their wide pasture is free from danger. The cows of the sacrificer wander freely in that place.

original: gāvaḥ bhagaḥ gāvaḥ indraḥ me ichāt gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ / imāḥ yāḥ gāvaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ ichāmi hṛdā manasā cit indram /
analyzed: gāvaḥ bhagaḥ gāvaḥ indraḥ me ichāt gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ   imāḥ yāḥ gāvaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ ichāmi hṛdā manasā cit indram  /
translated: The cows are Bhaga, the cows are Indra, the cows are my desire. The cows are the first food of Soma. These cows are the people. I desire Indra with my heart and mind.

original: yūyam gāvaḥ medayatha kṛśam cit aśrīram cit kṛṇutha supratīkam / bhadram gṛham kṛṇutha bhadra vācaḥ bṛhat vaḥ vayaḥ ucyate sabhāsu //
analyzed: yūyam gāvaḥ medayatha kṛśam cit aśrīram cit kṛṇutha supratīkam    bhadram gṛham kṛṇutha bhadra vācaḥ bṛhat vaḥ vayaḥ ucyate sabhāsu  /
translated: O cows, you make even the lean one fat, and the ugly one beautiful. You make a good home and good speech. Your great life is proclaimed in the assemblies.

original: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ / mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ rudrasya hetiḥ vṛṇaktu //
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ   mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ rudrasya hetiḥ vṛṇaktu  /
translated: The cows, rich in milk, shining, full of offspring, drinking pure water at a good drinking place, may no thief rule over you, may no slanderer. May the dart of Rudra pass you by.

original: imam indra vardhaya kṣatriyam me imam viśām eka vṛṣam kṛṇu tvam / niḥ amitrān akṣṇuhi asya sarvān tān randhaya asmai aham uttareṣu /
analyzed: imam indra vardhaya kṣatriyam me imam viśām eka vṛṣam kṛṇu tvam   niḥ amitrān akṣṇuhi asya sarvān tān randhaya asmai aham uttareṣu  /
translated: O Indra, increase this Kshatriya of mine, make him the sole lord of the people. Crush all his enemies. Make them subject to him in the battles to come.

original: ā imam bhaja grāme aśveṣu goṣu niḥ tam bhaja yaḥ amitraḥ asya / varṣma kṣatrāṇām ayam astu rāja indra śatrum randhaya sarvam asmai /
analyzed: ā imam bhaja grāme aśveṣu goṣu niḥ tam bhaja yaḥ amitraḥ asya    varṣma kṣatrāṇām ayam astu rāja indra śatrum randhaya sarvam asmai  /
translated: Allot to him the village, the horses, the cattle; allot to him who is his enemy. Let him be the strongest of the chiefs, the king. O Indra, make all his enemies his prey.

original: ayam astu dhana patiḥ dhanānām ayam viśām viśpatiḥ astu rājā / asmin indra mahi varcāṃsi dhehi a varcasam kṛṇuhi śatrum asya /
analyzed: ayam astu dhana patiḥ dhanānām ayam viśām viśpatiḥ astu rājā    asmin indra mahi varcāṃsi dhehi a varcasam kṛṇuhi śatrum asya  /
translated: Let him be the lord of riches among the rich, let him be the king, the lord of the people among the people. O Indra, bestow upon him great glory. Make his enemy gloryless.

original: asmai dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri vāmam duhāthām gharma dughe iva dhenū / ayam rājā priyaḥ indrasya bhūyāt priyaḥ gavām oṣadhīnām paśūnām /
analyzed: asmai dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri vāmam duhāthām gharma dughe iva dhenū     ayam rājā priyaḥ indrasya bhūyāt priyaḥ gavām oṣadhīnām paśūnām  /
translated: Let Heaven and Earth yield him abundant treasure, as two milch-kine yield milk for the caldron. Let him be dear to Indra, dear to cattle, dear to plants and dear to all the people.

original: yunajmi te uttarāvantam indram yena jayanti na parājayante / yaḥ tvā karat eka vṛṣam janānām uta rājñām uttamam mānavānām /
analyzed: yunajmi te uttarāvantam indram yena jayanti na parājayante   yaḥ tvā karat eka vṛṣam janānām uta rājñām uttamam mānavānām  /
translated: I yoke thee with the ever-victorious Indra, by whom they conquer and are never vanquished. He who hath made thee the sole ruler of men, and the best of kings among mankind.

original: uttaraḥ tvam adhare te sapatnāḥ ye ke ca rājan pratiśatravaḥ te / eka vṛṣaḥ indra sakhā jigīvām śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni //
analyzed: uttaraḥ tvam adhare te sapatnāḥ ye ke ca rājan pratiśatravaḥ te    eka vṛṣaḥ indra sakhā jigīvām śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni  /
translated: Thou art above, thy foes are under thy feet, O King, whosoever they may be that hate thee. Sole ruler, victorious, Indra's friend, bring to him the food of those who hate him.

original: siṃha pratīkaḥ viśaḥ addhi sarvā vyāghra pratīkaḥ ava bādhasva śatrūn / eka vṛṣaḥ indra sakhā jigīvām śatrūyatām ā khida bhojanāni /
analyzed: siṃha pratīkaḥ viśaḥ addhi sarvā vyāghra pratīkaḥ ava bādhasva śatrūn   eka vṛṣaḥ indra sakhā jigīvām śatrūyatām ā khida bhojanāni  /
translated: Devour all the people, O thou who hast the form of a lion; trample down the foes, O thou who hast the form of a tiger. Alone, O Indra, the hero, the victor, bring hither the food of those who are hostile to us.

original: agneḥ manve prathamasya pracetasaḥ pāñcajanyasya bahudhā yam indhate / viśoviśaḥ praviśivāṃsam īmahe sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ manve prathamasya pracetasaḥ pāñcajanyasya bahudhā yam indhate   viśoviśaḥ praviśivāṃsam īmahe sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I think of Agni, the first, the wise, of him of the five peoples, whom they enkindle in many ways. We implore him who enters into every people. May he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yathā havyam vahasi jātavedaḥ yathā yajñam kalpayasi prajānan / eva devebhyaḥ sumatim naḥ ā vaha sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yathā havyam vahasi jātavedaḥ yathā yajñam kalpayasi prajānan    eva devebhyaḥ sumatim naḥ ā vaha sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: As thou carriest the oblation, O all-knower, as thou orderest the sacrifice, knowing (all things), thus bring thou to the gods our good-will. May he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yāman yāman upayuktam vahiṣṭham karmaṅkarman ābhagam agnim īḍe / rakṣaḥ haṇam yajña vṛdham ghṛta āhutam sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yāman yāman upayuktam vahiṣṭham karmaṅkarman ābhagam agnim īḍe   rakṣaḥ haṇam yajña vṛdham ghṛta āhutam sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: In every rite I praise Agni, the most serviceable, the most bountiful in every work, the slayer of fiends, the increaser of sacrifice, offered with ghee. May he deliver us from tribulation.

original: su jātam jātavedasam agnim vaiśvānaram vibhum / havyavāham havāmahe sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: su jātam jātavedasam agnim vaiśvānaram vibhum   havyavāham havāmahe sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Well-born, all-knowing, Agni, the all-encompassing Vaiśvānara, the bearer of oblations, we invoke. May he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yena ṛṣayaḥ balam adyotayan yujā yena asurāṇām ayuvanta māyāḥ / yena agninā paṇīn indraḥ jigāya sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yena ṛṣayaḥ balam adyotayan yujā yena asurāṇām ayuvanta māyāḥ   yena agninā paṇīn indraḥ jigāya sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: By whom Indra conquered the Pāṇis, may that Agni deliver us from tribulation.🔽By whom the gods found out the immortal, by whom they made the plants full of sweetness,

original: yena devāḥ amṛtam anvavindan yena oṣadhīḥ madhumatīḥ akṛṇvan / yena devāḥ svar ābharan sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yena devāḥ amṛtam anvavindan yena oṣadhīḥ madhumatīḥ akṛṇvan   yena devāḥ svar ābharan sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: By whom the gods brought heaven, may that (Agni) deliver us from tribulation.🔽Of him whose is this that shines in the regions, and all that is born and is to be born,

original: yasya idam pradiśi yat virocate yat jātam janitavyam ca kevalam / staumi agnim nāthitaḥ johavīmi sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yasya idam pradiśi yat virocate yat jātam janitavyam ca kevalam   staumi agnim nāthitaḥ johavīmi sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I praise Agni, I call on him in need. May he deliver us from tribulation.🔽We ever think upon Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, we ever think upon him. To me have come these lauds.

original: indrasya manmahe śaśvat id asya manmahe vṛtra ghnaḥ stomāḥ upa mā ime āguḥ / yaḥ dāśuṣaḥ su kṛtaḥ havam eti sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: indrasya manmahe śaśvat id asya manmahe vṛtra ghnaḥ stomāḥ upa mā ime āguḥ   yaḥ dāśuṣaḥ su kṛtaḥ havam eti sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: He who comes to the worshipper's good work, may he deliver us from tribulation.🔽He who is strong among the strong, whose arms are strong, who hath mounted the strength of the Dânavas,

original: yaḥ ugrīṇām ugra bāhuḥ yayuḥ yaḥ dānavānām balam āruroja / yena jitāḥ sindhavaḥ yena gāvaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ugrīṇām ugra bāhuḥ yayuḥ yaḥ dānavānām balam āruroja   yena jitāḥ sindhavaḥ yena gāvaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: By whom the rivers were subdued, by whom the cattle, may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yaḥ carṣaṇipraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ svar vid yasmai grāvāṇaḥ pravadanti nṛmṇam / yasya adhvaraḥ saptahotā madiṣṭhaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ carṣaṇipraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ svar vid yasmai grāvāṇaḥ pravadanti nṛmṇam   yasya adhvaraḥ saptahotā madiṣṭhaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Whose sacrifice, most gladdening, hath seven priests, may he deliver us from woe.🔽For whom the bulls and steers and oxen are prepared, for whom the ladles are made ready by the man who finds the light,

original: yasya vaśāsaḥ ṛṣabhāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ yasmai mīyante svaravaḥ svarvide / yasmai śukraḥ pavate brahma śumbhitaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yasya vaśāsaḥ ṛṣabhāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ yasmai mīyante svaravaḥ svarvide   yasmai śukraḥ pavate brahma śumbhitaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: For whom the pure Soma flows, purified by prayer, may he deliver us from woe.🔽The Soma-pressers long for his approval who, armed with arrows, they invoke in fight for kine,

original: yasya juṣṭim sominaḥ kāmayante yam havante iṣumantam gaviṣṭau / yasmin arkaḥ śiśriye yasmin ojaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yasya juṣṭim sominaḥ kāmayante yam havante iṣumantam gaviṣṭau   yasmin arkaḥ śiśriye yasmin ojaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: In whom the hymn hath found a resting-place, in whom is power, may he deliver us from woe.🔽He who was born first for the performance of the rite, whose is the power which the first hath discovered,

original: yaḥ prathamaḥ karma kṛtyāya jajñe yasya vīryam prathamasya anubuddham / yena udyataḥ vajraḥ abhyāyata ahim sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ prathamaḥ karma kṛtyāya jajñe yasya vīryam prathamasya anubuddham   yena udyataḥ vajraḥ abhyāyata ahim sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: By whom the uplifted thunderbolt was hurled at Ahi, may he deliver us from woe.🔽He who leads forth to battle and to war, the Lord, who mingles the two kinds of nourishment,

original: yaḥ saṃgrāmāt nayati sam yudhe vaśī yaḥ puṣṭāni saṃsṛjati dvayāni / staumi indram nāthitaḥ johavīmi sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃgrāmāt nayati sam yudhe vaśī yaḥ puṣṭāni saṃsṛjati dvayāni   staumi indram nāthitaḥ johavīmi sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I praise Indra, I call on him for aid. May he deliver us from woe.

original: vāyoḥ savituḥ vidathāni manmahe yau ātmanvat viśathaḥ yau ca rakṣathaḥ / yau viśvasya paribhū babhūvathuḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: vāyoḥ savituḥ vidathāni manmahe yau ātmanvat viśathaḥ yau ca rakṣathaḥ   yau viśvasya paribhū babhūvathuḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Who have become the overlords of the universe, may they both deliver us from sin.🔽By whom the vast expanses of the earth are measured, by whom the atmosphere is held in place,

original: yayoḥ saṃkhyātā varimā pārhivāni yābhyām rajaḥ yupitam antarikṣe / yayoḥ prāyam na anu ānaśe kaḥ cana tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: yayoḥ saṃkhyātā varimā pārhivāni yābhyām rajaḥ yupitam antarikṣe   yayoḥ prāyam na anu ānaśe kaḥ cana tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: By whom no one has ever transgressed the rule, may they both deliver us from sin.🔽Under your rule the people dwell, O Vayu, when you rise they move on, O you of wondrous light.

original: tava vrate ni viśante janāsaḥ tvayi udite prerate citra bhāno / yuvam vāyo savitā ca bhuvanāni rakṣathaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: tava vrate ni viśante janāsaḥ tvayi udite prerate citra bhāno    yuvam vāyo savitā ca bhuvanāni rakṣathaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: You two, O Vayu and Savitar, protect the worlds. May you both deliver us from sin.🔽Drive away from us, O Vayu and Savitar, evil, drive away the Raksases and the Simidās.

original: apa itas vāyo savitā ca duṣkṛtam apa rakṣāṃsi śimidām ca sedhatam / sam hi ūrjayā sṛjathaḥ sam balena tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: apa itas vāyo savitā ca duṣkṛtam apa rakṣāṃsi śimidām ca sedhatam    sam hi ūrjayā sṛjathaḥ sam balena tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: For you unite with strength and with power. May you both deliver us from sin.🔽May Savitar and Vayu bestow upon me wealth, nourishment, and bodily strength, most auspicious.

original: rayim me poṣam savitā uta vāyuḥ tanū dakṣam ā suvatām su śevam / a yakṣmatātim mahaḥ iha dhattam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: rayim me poṣam savitā uta vāyuḥ tanū dakṣam ā suvatām su śevam    a yakṣmatātim mahaḥ iha dhattam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Grant me here freedom from disease and greatness. May you both deliver us from sin.

original: pra sumatim savitar vāyo ūtaye mahasvantam matsaram mādayāthaḥ / arvāk vāmasya pravataḥ ni yacchatam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: pra sumatim savitar vāyo ūtaye mahasvantam matsaram mādayāthaḥ    arvāk vāmasya pravataḥ ni yacchatam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: O Savitar, and Vâyu, make ye glad the mighty juice for help, for favouring us. Turn hitherward the stream of your most liberal grace. Do ye deliver us from woe.

original: upa śreṣṭhāḥ naḥ āśiṣaḥ devayoḥ dhāman asthiran / staumi devam savitāram ca vāyum tau naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: upa śreṣṭhāḥ naḥ āśiṣaḥ devayoḥ dhāman asthiran   staumi devam savitāram ca vāyum tau naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Our best desires have settled in the place of you two Gods. I praise the God Savitar and Vâyu. Do ye deliver us from woe.

original: manve vām dyāvāpṛthivī subhojasau sacetasau ye aprathethām amitā yojanāni / pratiṣṭhe hi abhavatam vasūnām te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /🔽pratiṣṭhe hi abhavatam vasūnām pravṛddhe devī subhage urūcī / dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: manve vām dyāvāpṛthivī subhojasau sacetasau ye aprathethām amitā yojanāni   pratiṣṭhe hi abhavatam vasūnām te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  / pratiṣṭhe hi abhavatam vasūnām pravṛddhe devī subhage urūcī    dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I think upon you, Heaven and Earth, bountiful, of one accord, who have extended your immeasurable regions. For ye are the two supports of treasures. Do ye deliver us from woe.🔽For ye are the two supports of treasures. Ye mighty, blessed, wide-extending Goddesses, Heaven and Earth, be ye propitious unto me. Do ye deliver us from woe.

original: a santāpe su tapasau huve aham urvī gambhīre kavibhiḥ namasye / dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: a santāpe su tapasau huve aham urvī gambhīre kavibhiḥ namasye   dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I call on you, O ye who burn not, very hot, deep, wide, whom sages worship. Heaven and Earth, be ye propitious unto me. Do ye deliver us from woe.

original: ye amṛtam bibhṛthaḥ ye havīṃṣi ye srotyāḥ bibhṛthaḥ ye manuṣyān / dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /🔽ye usriyāḥ bibhṛthaḥ ye vanaspatīn yayoḥ vām viśvā bhuvanāni antar / dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: ye amṛtam bibhṛthaḥ ye havīṃṣi ye srotyāḥ bibhṛthaḥ ye manuṣyān    dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  / ye usriyāḥ bibhṛthaḥ ye vanaspatīn yayoḥ vām viśvā bhuvanāni antar   dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye who support the immortal food, ye who support the oblations, ye who support the streams, ye who support mankind, O Heaven and Earth, be gracious unto me. Deliver us from tribulation.🔽Ye who support the kine, ye who support the trees, in whom are all existing things, O Heaven and Earth, be gracious unto me. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: ye kīlālena tarpayathaḥ ye ghṛtena yābhyām ṛte na kim cana śaknuvanti / dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: ye kīlālena tarpayathaḥ ye ghṛtena yābhyām ṛte na kim cana śaknuvanti    dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye who delight in sweet refreshment, ye who delight in ghee, without whom nothing can be done, O Heaven and Earth, be gracious unto me. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: yat mā idam abhiśocati yena yena vā kṛtam pauruṣeyāt na daivāt / staumi dyāvāpṛthivī nāthitaḥ johavīmi te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yat mā idam abhiśocati yena yena vā kṛtam pauruṣeyāt na daivāt    staumi dyāvāpṛthivī nāthitaḥ johavīmi te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Whatever this my soul is grieved with, whatever I have done, whether through man's act or fate, I praise Heaven and Earth. I call on them for help. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: marutām manve adhi me bruvantu pra imam vājam vājasāte avantu / āśūn iva su yamān ahve ūtaye te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: marutām manve adhi me bruvantu pra imam vājam vājasāte avantu   āśūn iva su yamān ahve ūtaye te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I think upon the Maruts. Let them speak forth to me. Let them aid this my strength in the winning of strength. I call the swift ones, easy to invoke, to succour us. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: utsam akṣitam vyacanti ye sadā ye āsiñcanti rasam oṣadhīṣu / puras dadhe marutaḥ pṛśni mātṝn te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: utsam akṣitam vyacanti ye sadā ye āsiñcanti rasam oṣadhīṣu   puras dadhe marutaḥ pṛśni mātṝn te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: They who always open the unfailing spring, they who pour out the juice among the plants, I place the Maruts in the fore-front, with their Mothers of various forms. May they deliver us from tribulation.

original: payaḥ dhenūnām rasam oṣadhīnām javam arvatām kavayaḥ ye invatha / śagmāḥ bhavantu marutaḥ naḥ syonāḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: payaḥ dhenūnām rasam oṣadhīnām javam arvatām kavayaḥ ye invatha    śagmāḥ bhavantu marutaḥ naḥ syonāḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: The sages who have produced the milk of the milch-cows, the juice of the plants, and the speed of the horses, may the Maruts be kind and gracious to us. May they deliver us from tribulation.

original: apaḥ samudrāt divam ud vahanti divaḥ pṛthivīm abhi ye sṛjanti / ye adbhiḥ īśānāḥ marutaḥ caranti te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: apaḥ samudrāt divam ud vahanti divaḥ pṛthivīm abhi ye sṛjanti   ye adbhiḥ īśānāḥ marutaḥ caranti te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: They carry the waters from the ocean to the sky, and those which produce the sky on the earth, the Maruts who rule with the waters, may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: ye kīlālena tarpayanti ye ghṛtena ye vā vayaḥ medasā saṃsṛjanti / ye adbhiḥ īśānāḥ marutaḥ varṣayanti te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: ye kīlālena tarpayanti ye ghṛtena ye vā vayaḥ medasā saṃsṛjanti   ye adbhiḥ īśānāḥ marutaḥ varṣayanti te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: They who satisfy with sweet juice, they who with ghee, they who unite me with strength and fat, the Maruts who rule with the waters and cause to rain, may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: yadi id idam marutaḥ mārutena yadi devāḥ daivyena īdṛś āra / yūyam īśidhve vasavaḥ tasya niṣkṛteḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yadi id idam marutaḥ mārutena yadi devāḥ daivyena īdṛś āra   yūyam īśidhve vasavaḥ tasya niṣkṛteḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: If this is done by the Maruts through the Maruts, if by the gods through the divine, O Vasus, you are the lords of that atonement. May they deliver us from tribulation.

original: tigmam anīkam viditam sahasvat mārutam śardhaḥ pṛtanāsu ugram / staumi marutaḥ nāthitaḥ johavīmi te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: tigmam anīkam viditam sahasvat mārutam śardhaḥ pṛtanāsu ugram   staumi marutaḥ nāthitaḥ johavīmi te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: The keen-arrayed, the well-known, the mighty host of the Maruts, terrible in battle, I praise. I call on the Maruts for help, being in distress. May they deliver us from tribulation.

original: bhava śarvau manve vām tasya vittam yayoḥ vām idam pradiśi yat virocate / yau asya īśāthe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /🔽yayoḥ abhyabhve uta yat dūre cit yau viditau iṣubhṛtām asiṣṭhau / yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: bhava śarvau manve vām tasya vittam yayoḥ vām idam pradiśi yat virocate   yau asya īśāthe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  / yayoḥ abhyabhve uta yat dūre cit yau viditau iṣubhṛtām asiṣṭhau   yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I meditate on you, Bhava and Sarva. Know that power of yours by which this shines forth in the directions. You who are the lords of its bipeds and quadrupeds, deliver us from tribulation.🔽By whom there is abundance even when far away, you who are the most renowned of those who bear arrows, you who are the lords of its bipeds and quadrupeds, deliver us from tribulation.

original: sahasra akṣau vṛtra hanā huveham dūregavyūtī stuvan emi ugrau / yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: sahasra akṣau vṛtra hanā huve iham dūregavyūtī stuvan emi ugrau   yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: I invoke the thousand-eyed, the Vritra-slayers, the mighty ones, praising them as they range far and wide. You who are the lords of its bipeds and quadrupeds, deliver us from tribulation.

original: yau ārebhāthe bahu sākam agre pra ced asrāṣṭram abhibhām janeṣu / yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yau ārebhāthe bahu sākam agre pra ced asrāṣṭram abhibhām janeṣu   yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: You who have long ago begun to do much together, who have power over the kingdom among the people, you who are the lords of its bipeds and quadrupeds, deliver us from tribulation.

original: yayoḥ vadhāt na apapadyate kaḥ cana antar deveṣu uta mānuṣeṣu / yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yayoḥ vadhāt na apapadyate kaḥ cana antar deveṣu uta mānuṣeṣu   yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: By whose destruction no one is lost, either among the gods or among men. Ye who have power over his two-footed and four-footed creatures, deliver us from tribulation.

original: yaḥ kṛtyā kṛt mūla kṛt yātudhānaḥ ni tasmin dhattam vajram ugrau / yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /🔽adhi naḥ brūtam pṛtanāsu ugrau sam vajreṇa sṛjatam yaḥ kimīdī / staumi bhava aśarvau nāthitaḥ johavīmi tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /🔽manve vām mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāvṛdhau sacetasau druhvaṇaḥ yau nudethe / pra satyāvānam avathaḥ bhareṣu tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kṛtyā kṛt mūla kṛt yātudhānaḥ ni tasmin dhattam vajram ugrau   yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  / adhi naḥ brūtam pṛtanāsu ugrau sam vajreṇa sṛjatam yaḥ kimīdī   staumi bhava aśarvau nāthitaḥ johavīmi tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  / manve vām mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāvṛdhau sacetasau druhvaṇaḥ yau nudethe   pra satyāvānam avathaḥ bhareṣu tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: In him who practises witchcraft, who digs up the roots, who is a fiend, lay ye the thunderbolt, O ye two mighty ones. Ye who have power over his two-footed and four-footed creatures, deliver us from tribulation.🔽Speak ye to us, O ye two mighty ones, in our battles. Cast with your thunderbolt the Kimīdin. I praise you, Bhava and Aśva, I call you, being in need. Deliver us from tribulation.🔽I seek you, O Mitra and Varuṇa, who strengthen the pious, who are of one mind, and drive away the wicked. Ye who help the truthful in his battles, deliver us from tribulation.

original: sacetasau druhvaṇaḥ yau nudethe pra satyāvānam avathaḥ bhareṣu / yau gacchathaḥ nṛ cakṣasau babhruṇā sutam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: sacetasau druhvaṇaḥ yau nudethe pra satyāvānam avathaḥ bhareṣu   yau gacchathaḥ nṛ cakṣasau babhruṇā sutam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye who are of one mind, and drive away the wicked, who help the truthful in his battles, who go about with the brown one, looking on men, to the pressed (juice), deliver us from tribulation.

original: yau aṅgirasam avathaḥ yau agastim mitrāvaruṇā jamadagnim attrim / yau kaśyapam avathaḥ yau vasiṣṭham tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yau aṅgirasam avathaḥ yau agastim mitrāvaruṇā jamadagnim attrim   yau kaśyapam avathaḥ yau vasiṣṭham tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye who support Kaśyapa, ye who support Vasiṣṭha, deliver us from sin, ye twain.🔽Ye who support Śyāvāśva, Vādhryaśva, Mitra-Varuṇa, Purumīḍha, Atri,

original: yau śyāvāśvam avathaḥ vādhryaśvam mitrāvaruṇā purumīḍham attrim / yau vimadam avathaḥ saptavadhrim tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yau śyāvāśvam avathaḥ vādhryaśvam mitrāvaruṇā purumīḍham attrim   yau vimadam avathaḥ saptavadhrim tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye who support Vimada, Saptavadhri, deliver us from sin, ye twain.🔽Ye who support Bharadvāja, ye who support Gaviṣṭhira, Viśvāmitra, Varuṇa, Mitra, Kutsa,

original: yau bharadvājam avathaḥ yau gaviṣṭhiram viśvāmitram varuṇa mitra kutsam / yau kakṣīvantam avathaḥ prota kaṇvam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yau bharadvājam avathaḥ yau gaviṣṭhiram viśvāmitram varuṇa mitra kutsam   yau kakṣīvantam avathaḥ prota kaṇvam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye who support Kakṣīvān, ye who support Prota-Kaṇva, deliver us from sin, ye twain.🔽Ye who support Medhātithi, ye who support Trisaṅkū, Mitra-Varuṇa, Uśanā Kāvya,

original: yau medhātithim avathaḥ yau triśokam mitrāvaruṇau uśanām kāvyam yau / yau gotamam avathaḥ prota mugdalam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yau medhātithim avathaḥ yau triśokam mitrāvaruṇau uśanām kāvyam yau   yau gotamam avathaḥ prota mugdalam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Ye who support Gautama, ye who support Prota-Mugdha, deliver us from sin, ye twain.

original: yayoḥ rathaḥ satya vartma rju raśmiḥ mithuyā carantam abhiyāti dūṣayan / staumi mitrāvaruṇau nāthitaḥ johavīmi tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yayoḥ rathaḥ satya vartma rju raśmiḥ mithuyā carantam abhiyāti dūṣayan   staumi mitrāvaruṇau nāthitaḥ johavīmi tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Whose chariot, with true course and straight reins, ever goes together, reproaching him who is to be reproved. I praise Mitra-Varuṇa, in distress I invoke them. Deliver us from sin, ye twain.

original: aham rudrebhiḥ vasubhiḥ carāmi aham ādityaiḥ uta viśvadevaiḥ / aham mitrāvarunā ubhā bibharmi aham indra agnī aham aśvinā ubhā /
analyzed: aham rudrebhiḥ vasubhiḥ carāmi aham ādityaiḥ uta viśvadevaiḥ    aham mitrāvarunā ubhā bibharmi aham indra agnī aham aśvinā ubhā  /
translated: I wander with the Rudras and the Vasus, I with the Âdityas and the All-Gods. I bear both Varuṇa and Mitra, I bear Indra and Agni and the Aṣvins both.

original: aham rāṣṭrī saṃgamanī vasūnām cikituṣī prathamā yajñiyānām / tām mā devāḥ vi adadhuḥ purutrā bhūri sthātrām bhūri āveśayantaḥ /
analyzed: aham rāṣṭrī saṃgamanī vasūnām cikituṣī prathamā yajñiyānām    tām mā devāḥ vi adadhuḥ purutrā bhūri sthātrām bhūri āveśayantaḥ  /
translated: I am the Queen, the gatherer of treasures, the first of all who know and are adorable. The Gods have set me in many a place and station, bestowing on me much that claims our wonder.

original: aham eva svayam idam vadāmi juṣṭam devānām uta mānuṣāṇām / yam kāmaye tantam ugram kṛṇomi tam brahmāṇam tam ṛṣim tam sumedhām //
analyzed: aham eva svayam idam vadāmi juṣṭam devānām uta mānuṣāṇām   yam kāmaye tantam ugram kṛṇomi tam brahmāṇam tam ṛṣim tam sumedhām  /
translated: I myself declare this thing that pleaseth Gods and men. I make him mighty whom I love. I make him Brahman, Sage, and R̥ishi, and endued with ample understanding.

original: mayā saḥ annam atti yaḥ vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇati yaḥ īm śṛṇoti uktam / amantavaḥ mām te upa kṣiyanti śrudhi śruta śruddhā iyam te vadāmi //
analyzed: mayā saḥ annam atti yaḥ vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇati yaḥ īm śṛṇoti uktam    amantavaḥ mām te upa kṣiyanti śrudhi śruta śruddhā iyam te vadāmi  /
translated: He who beholds, he who breathes, he who hears the word I speak, all these enjoy the food I give them. They who have no protector come to me for shelter. Hear, O thou Hearer! Hearken, I speak to thee.

original: aham rudrāya dhanuḥ ā tanomi brahma dviṣe śarave hantavai u / aham janāya samadam kṛṇomi aham dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa /
analyzed: aham rudrāya dhanuḥ ā tanomi brahma dviṣe śarave hantavai u aham janāya samadam kṛṇomi aham dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa
translated: I stretch the bow for Rudra, the shaft that slays the Brahman-hater. I make the people's quarrel. I have entered Heaven and Earth.

original: aham somam āhanasam bibharmi aham tvaṣṭāram uta pūṣaṇam bhagam / aham dadhāmi draviṇā haviṣmate suprāvyā yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: aham somam āhanasam bibharmi aham tvaṣṭāram uta pūṣaṇam bhagam    aham dadhāmi draviṇā haviṣmate suprāvyā yajamānāya sunvate  /
translated: I bear Soma, the slayer of the foe, I bear Tvashtar, and Pusan, Bhaga, and the God. I give wealth to the worshipper who offers gifts, to the good-natured sacrificer who presses out the juice.

original: aham suve pitaram asya mūrdhan mama yoniḥ apsu antar samudre / tatas vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanāni viśvā uta amūm dyām varṣmaṇā upa spṛśāmi //
analyzed: aham suve pitaram asya mūrdhan mama yoniḥ apsu antar samudre   tatas vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanāni viśvā uta amūm dyām varṣmaṇā upa spṛśāmi  /
translated: I am the father of this (child), I am the head of him; my womb is in the waters, in the ocean. Thence I extend over all the worlds, and I touch with my height even this sky.

original: aham eva vātaḥ eva pra vāmi ārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā / paras divā paras enā pṛthivyāḥ etāvatī mahimnā sam babhūva /🔽tvayā manyo sa ratham ārujantaḥ harṣamāṇāḥ hṛṣitāsaḥ marutvan / tigmeṣavaḥ āyudhā saṃśiśānāḥ upa pra yantu naraḥ agni rūpāḥ /
analyzed: aham eva vātaḥ eva pra vāmi ārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā   paras divā paras enā pṛthivyāḥ etāvatī mahimnā sam babhūva  / tvayā manyo sa ratham ārujantaḥ harṣamāṇāḥ hṛṣitāsaḥ marutvan    tigmeṣavaḥ āyudhā saṃśiśānāḥ upa pra yantu naraḥ agni rūpāḥ  /
translated: I am the wind, I blow, setting all things in motion. I am beyond this heaven, beyond this earth. So great is my majesty.🔽With thee, O Manyu, mounting our car, exulting, O thou of the Maruts, with our hearts elated, sharpening our sharp arrows, our weapons, let the men go forth, assuming the form of fire.

original: agniḥ iva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīḥ naḥ sahure hūtaḥ edhi / hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva vedaḥ ojaḥ mimānaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva /
analyzed: agniḥ iva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīḥ naḥ sahure hūtaḥ edhi   hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva vedaḥ ojaḥ mimānaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva  /
translated: Be thou, O Manyu, like fire in thy glow; be thou, invoked, our general in the battle. Divide the forts for slaughter of our enemies. Measuring out strength, drive away the foes.

original: sahasva manyo abhimātim asmai rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehi śatrūn / ugram te pājaḥ nanu ā rurudhre vaśī vaśam nayāsai ekaja tvam /
analyzed: sahasva manyo abhimātim asmai rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehi śatrūn    ugram te pājaḥ nanu ā rurudhre vaśī vaśam nayāsai ekaja tvam  /
translated: Bear thou, O Manyu, this man's hostility: go forward, slaying, crushing, breaking up his foes. Thy terrible flame hath been stayed, O thou who art to be invoked by many, and thou hast made one thy subject.

original: ekaḥ bahūnām asi manye īḍitā viśaṃviśam yuddhāya sam śiśādhi / a kṛtta ruc tvayā yujā vayam dyumantam ghoṣam vijayāya kṛṇmasi //
analyzed: ekaḥ bahūnām asi manye īḍitā viśaṃviśam yuddhāya sam śiśādhi    a kṛtta ruc tvayā yujā vayam dyumantam ghoṣam vijayāya kṛṇmasi  /
translated: Alone thou art of many, O Manyu, when invoked. Sharpen thyself for every fight. With thee for our ally, whose splendour is not blunted, we will make a glorious shout for victory.

original: vijeṣa kṛt indraḥ iva anavabravaḥ asmākam manyo adhipāḥ bhava iha / priyam te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidma tam utsam yatas ābabhūtha /
analyzed: vijeṣa kṛt indraḥ iva anavabravaḥ asmākam manyo adhipāḥ bhava iha   priyam te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidma tam utsam yatas ābabhūtha  /
translated: Like Indra, thou art unconquerable in fight. Be thou, O Manyu, our overlord here. We praise thy dear name, O Hero. We know that spring from which thou hast come.

original: ābhūtyā sahajā vajra sāyaka sahaḥ bibharṣi sahabhūta uttaram / kratvā naḥ manyo saha medi edhi mahādhanasya puruhūta saṃsṛji //
analyzed: ābhūtyā sahajā vajra sāyaka sahaḥ bibharṣi sahabhūta uttaram   kratvā naḥ manyo saha medi edhi mahādhanasya puruhūta saṃsṛji  /
translated: With conquest born together, O Manyu, thou bearest the thunderbolt, the weapon, the higher power. Be thou, O Manyu, with our spirit, in the great battle, O thou who art invoked by many.

original: saṃsṛṣṭam dhanam ubhayam samākṛtam asmabhyam dhattām varuṇaḥ ca manyuḥ / bhiyaḥ dadhānāḥ hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥ parājitāsaḥ apa ni layantām /
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭam dhanam ubhayam samākṛtam asmabhyam dhattām varuṇaḥ ca manyuḥ   bhiyaḥ dadhānāḥ hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥ parājitāsaḥ apa ni layantām  /
translated: Let both the conquered and the conquering wealth be made equal for us. Let Varuna and Manyu give it to us. Let the foes, laying their terrors in their hearts, go down defeated.

original: yaḥ te manyaḥ avidhat vajra sāyaka sahaḥ ojaḥ puṣyati viśvam ānuṣak / sāhyāma dāsam āryam tvayā yujā vayam sahaskṛtena sahasā sahasvatā /
analyzed: yaḥ te manyaḥ avidhat vajra sāyaka sahaḥ ojaḥ puṣyati viśvam ānuṣak   sāhyāma dāsam āryam tvayā yujā vayam sahaskṛtena sahasā sahasvatā  /
translated: He who hath set thy wrath, O Thunder-armed, thy might, O Victor, in continual operation, With thee to aid, O thou of many helpers, may we subdue the Dâsa and the Ârya.

original: manyuḥ indraḥ manyuḥ eva āsa devaḥ manyuḥ hotā varuṇaḥ jātavedāḥ / manyum viśaḥ īḍate mānuṣīḥ yāḥ pahi naḥ manyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: manyuḥ indraḥ manyuḥ eva āsa devaḥ manyuḥ hotā varuṇaḥ jātavedāḥ    manyum viśaḥ īḍate mānuṣīḥ yāḥ pahi naḥ manyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ  /
translated: Indra is wrath, and wrath was first the God, wrath was the Hotar priest, and Varuṇa was wrath. The human tribes who dwell on earth adore wrath. Be gracious, O thou Manyu, with thy fervour.

original: abhīhi manyo tavasaḥ tavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn / amitra hā vṛtra hā dasyu hā ca viśvā vasūni ā bhara tvam naḥ /🔽tvam hi manyo abhibhūti ojāḥ svayaṃbhūḥ bhāmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ / viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahīyān asmāsu ojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi //
analyzed: abhīhi manyo tavasaḥ tavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn    amitra hā vṛtra hā dasyu hā ca viśvā vasūni ā bhara tvam naḥ  / tvam hi manyo abhibhūti ojāḥ svayaṃbhūḥ bhāmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ   viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahīyān asmāsu ojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi  /
translated: Come hither, Manyu, mightier than the mighty, with fervour as thy friend destroy our foemen. Slayer of foes, of Dasyus, Vr̥itras, bring all things precious unto us, O thou of many helps.🔽For thou, O Manyu, art the Lord of power, self-existent, terrible, subduing scorners. Most mighty, worshipped of all men, give us strength in battles, O Most Strong.

original: a bhāgaḥ san apa paretaḥ asmi tava kratvā taviṣasya pracetaḥ / tam tvā manyo a kratuḥ jihīḍa aham svā tanūḥ bala dāvā naḥ ehi /
analyzed: a bhāgaḥ san apa paretaḥ asmi tava kratvā taviṣasya pracetaḥ   tam tvā manyo a kratuḥ jihīḍa aham svā tanūḥ bala dāvā naḥ ehi  /
translated: Though I have been thy servant, O thou Wise One, I have come hither as one who hath no portion. I, Manyu, have despised thee in my spirit. Come to us, O thou Giver of strength, with thy own body.

original: ayam te asmi upa naḥ ehi arvāṅ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśvadāvan / manyo vajrin abhi naḥ ā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūn uta bodhi āpeḥ /
analyzed: ayam te asmi upa naḥ ehi arvāṅ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśva dāvan    manyo vajrin abhi naḥ ā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūn uta bodhi āpeḥ  /
translated: Come hither to us, come thou to us, O Manota, come thou to us, O thou who hast all things. Turn thou unto us, O thou who hast the thunder, and slay the Dasyus, and be gracious unto us.

original: abhi prehi dakṣiṇatas bhava naḥ adhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri / juhomi te dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram ubhau upāṃśu prathamā pibāva /
analyzed: abhi prehi dakṣiṇatas bhava naḥ adhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri   juhomi te dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram ubhau upāṃśu prathamā pibāva  /
translated: Go forward, and be thou on our right hand: so trample down the many forts. I offer thee the first sweet draught to hold: first drink ye both the draught that is without a straw.

original: apa naḥ śośucat agham agne śuśugdhi ā rayim / apa naḥ śośucat agham /
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham agne śuśugdhi ā rayim    apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Drive thou away our sin, O Agni, shine upon us with wealth. Drive thou away our sin.

original: su kṣetriyā sugātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe / apa naḥ śośucat agham //🔽pra yat bhandiṣṭhaḥ eṣām pra asmākāsaḥ ca sūrayaḥ / apa naḥ śośucat agham //🔽pra yat te agne sūrayaḥ jāyemahi pra te vayam / apa naḥ śośucat agham //🔽pra yat agneḥ sahasvataḥ viśvatas yanti bhānavaḥ / apa naḥ śośucat agham //
analyzed: su kṣetriyā sugātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe apa naḥ śośucat agham  pra yat bhandiṣṭhaḥ eṣām pra asmākāsaḥ ca sūrayaḥ    apa naḥ śośucat agham  / pra yat te agne sūrayaḥ jāyemahi pra te vayam   / apa naḥ śośucat agham  pra yat agneḥ sahasvataḥ viśvatas yanti bhānavaḥ   apa naḥ śośucat agham  /
translated: For good fields, for good going, for wealth we worship thee. Drive thou away our sin.🔽When thou, O Agni, art most praised of these, and our princes, Drive thou away our sin.🔽When we may be born to thee, O Agni, and to thy princes, Drive thou away our sin.🔽When the rays of thee, O mighty Agni, go forth on every side, Drive thou away our sin.

original: tvam hi viśvatomukha viśvatas paribhūḥ asi / apa naḥ śośucat agham /
analyzed: tvam hi viśvatomukha viśvatas paribhūḥ asi    apa naḥ śośucat agham  /
translated: For thou, O Agni, hast a face on every side, and art on every side a guardian. Drive thou away our sin.

original: dviṣaḥ naḥ viśvatomukhā ati nāvā iva pāraya / apa naḥ śośucat agham /
analyzed: dviṣaḥ naḥ viśvatomukhā ati nāvā iva pāraya   apa naḥ śośucat agham  /
translated: As in a ship, O thou who lookest every way, carry us over our foes. Shine thou upon our sin and drive it far away.

original: sa naḥ sindhum iva nāvāti parṣa svastaye / apa naḥ śośucat agham //
analyzed: sa naḥ sindhum iva nāvāti parṣa svastaye    apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Carry us over, as in a ship, to bliss. Shine thou upon our sin and drive it far away.

original: brahma asya śīrṣam bṛhat asya pṛṣṭham vāmadevyam udaram odanasya / chandāṃsi pakṣau mukham asya satyam viṣṭārī jātaḥ tapasaḥ adhi yajñaḥ /
analyzed: brahma asya śīrṣam bṛhat asya pṛṣṭham vāmadevyam udaram odanasya    chandāṃsi pakṣau mukham asya satyam viṣṭārī jātaḥ tapasaḥ adhi yajñaḥ  /
translated: The Brahman is his head, the Brihat his back, the Vamadevya is the belly of the rice. The metres are his wings, his mouth is truth. The sacrifice, the spread-out, is born from penance.

original: anasthāḥ pūtāḥ pavanena śuddhāḥ śucayaḥ śucim api yanti lokam / na eṣām śiśnam pra dahati jātavedāḥ svarge loke bahu straiṇam eṣām /
analyzed: anasthāḥ pūtāḥ pavanena śuddhāḥ śucayaḥ śucim api yanti lokam    na eṣām śiśnam pra dahati jātavedāḥ svarge loke bahu straiṇam eṣām  /
translated: Unharmed, purified, cleansed by the wind, the pure ones go to the pure world. The fire does not burn their penis. In the heavenly world they have many women.

original: viṣṭāriṇam odanam ye pacanti na enān avartiḥ sacate kadā cana / āste yamaḥ upa yāti devān sam gandharvaiḥ madate somyebhiḥ /
analyzed: viṣṭāriṇam odanam ye pacanti na enān avartiḥ sacate kadā cana    āste yamaḥ upa yāti devān sam gandharvaiḥ madate somyebhiḥ  /
translated: Those who cook the spread-out rice, misfortune never befalls them at any time. Yama sits there, he goes to the gods, he rejoices with the Gandharvas who are full of Soma.

original: viṣṭāriṇam odanam ye pacanti na enān yamaḥ pari muṣṇāti retaḥ / rathī ha bhūtvā rathayānaḥ īyate pakṣī ha bhūtvā ati divaḥ sam eti /
analyzed: viṣṭāriṇam odanam ye pacanti na enān yamaḥ pari muṣṇāti retaḥ   rathī ha bhūtvā rathayānaḥ īyate pakṣī ha bhūtvā ati divaḥ sam eti  /
translated: Those who cook the spread-out rice, Yama does not destroy their seed. He goes as a charioteer, riding in a chariot, he goes beyond the sky as a bird.

original: eṣa yajñānām vitataḥ vahiṣṭhaḥ viṣṭāriṇam paktvā divam ā viveśa / āṇḍīkam kumudam sam tanoti bisam śālūkam śaphakaḥ mulālī / etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ /🔽ghṛtahradāḥ madhu kūlāḥ surā udakāḥ kṣīreṇa pūrṇāḥ udakena dadhnā / etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ /
analyzed: eṣa yajñānām vitataḥ vahiṣṭhaḥ viṣṭāriṇam paktvā divam ā viveśa   āṇḍīkam kumudam sam tanoti bisam śālūkam śaphakaḥ mulālī   etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ  / ghṛtahradāḥ madhu kūlāḥ surā udakāḥ kṣīreṇa pūrṇāḥ udakena dadhnā    etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ  /
translated: This is the most excellent of sacrifices, spread out, reaching to heaven, having the sky for its covering. The lotus, the water-lily, the lotus-fibre, the lotus-stalk, the lotus-root, the lotus-bulb, all these streams flow to thee, swelling with sweetness in the world of heaven. Let the lotus-pools stand round about thee.🔽With lakes of butter, banks of honey, streams of wine, full of milk, water, and curds, let all these streams flow to thee, swelling with sweetness in the world of heaven. Let the lotus-pools stand round about thee.

original: caturaḥ kumbhān caturdhā dadāmi kṣīreṇa pūrnām udakena dadhnā / etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ /
analyzed: caturaḥ kumbhān caturdhā dadāmi kṣīreṇa pūrnām udakena dadhnā          upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ  /
translated: I give thee four jars divided into four parts, full of milk, water, curds. Let all these streams flow to thee, swelling with sweetness in the world of heaven. Let the lotus-pools stand round about thee.

original: imam odanam ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu viṣṭāriṇam loka jitam svargam / sa me mā kṣeṣṭa svadhayā pinvamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā me astu /
analyzed: imam odanam ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu viṣṭāriṇam loka jitam svargam    sa me mā kṣeṣṭa svadhayā pinvamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā me astu  /
translated: I have set down this all-diffusive food, the conqueror of worlds, the heavenly food, among the Brahmans. May it not fail me, but swell with its own sap. May the cow of every form be for me the milker of all desires.🔽The food which the first-born of truth, Prajapati, cooked for Brahman by his penance,

original: yam odanam prathama jāḥ ṛtasya prajāpatiḥ tapasā brahmaṇe apacat / yaḥ lokānām vidhṛtiḥ nābhireṣāt tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum /
analyzed: yam odanam prathama jāḥ ṛtasya prajāpatiḥ tapasā brahmaṇe apacat   yaḥ lokānām vidhṛtiḥ nā abhireṣāt tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum  /
translated: Which is the support of the worlds, the centre, may I by that food pass over death.🔽By which the creators of the world passed over death, which they found by penance and toil,

original: yena ataran bhūta kṛtaḥ ati mṛtyum yam anvavindan tapasā śrameṇa / yam papāca brahmaṇe brahma pūrvam tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum //
analyzed: yena ataran bhūta kṛtaḥ ati mṛtyum yam anvavindan tapasā śrameṇa   yam papāca brahmaṇe brahma pūrvam tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum  /
translated: Which Brahman cooked for Brahman in the beginning, by that food may I pass over death.🔽By whom the earth was upheld, the supporter of all life, who filled the atmosphere with sap,

original: yaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm viśva bhojasam yaḥ antarikṣam āpṛṇāt rasena / yaḥ astabhnāt divam ūrdhvaḥ mahimnā tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum //
analyzed: yaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm viśva bhojasam yaḥ antarikṣam āpṛṇāt rasena   yaḥ astabhnāt divam ūrdhvaḥ mahimnā tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum  /
translated: Who established the sky above with his greatness, by that food may I pass over death.🔽From whom the thirty-day months were created, the year with its twelve months,

original: yasmāt māsāḥ nirmitāḥ triṃśat arāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ yasmāt nirmitaḥ dvādaśa araḥ / ahar rātrāḥ yam pariyantaḥ na āpuḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum //
analyzed: yasmāt māsāḥ nirmitāḥ triṃśat arāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ yasmāt nirmitaḥ dvādaśa araḥ   ahar rātrāḥ yam pariyantaḥ na āpuḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum  /
translated: The days and nights which never reach their end, by that food may I pass over death.

original: yaḥ prāṇa daḥ prāṇa davān babhūva yasmai lokāḥ ghṛtavantaḥ kṣaranti / jyotiṣmatīḥ pradiśaḥ yasya sarvāḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum /
analyzed: yaḥ prāṇa daḥ prāṇa davān babhūva yasmai lokāḥ ghṛtavantaḥ kṣaranti   jyotiṣmatīḥ pradiśaḥ yasya sarvāḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum  /
translated: Whose quarters are all full of light, with that mess of cooked food pass over death.🔽From whom the nectar was produced, who is the overlord of the Gayatri,

original: yasmāt pakvāt amṛtam saṃbabhūva yaḥ gāyatryāḥ adhipatiḥ babhūva / yasmin vedāḥ nihitāḥ viśva rūpāḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum /
analyzed: yasmāt pakvāt amṛtam saṃbabhūva yaḥ gāyatryāḥ adhipatiḥ babhūva   yasmin vedāḥ nihitāḥ viśva rūpāḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum  /
translated: In whom the Vedas are laid up, of all forms, with that mess of cooked food pass over death.🔽Drive away the hater of the gods, let my enemies be subject to me.

original: ava bādhe dviṣantam deva pīyum sapatnāḥ ye me apa te bhavantu / brahmaudanam viśvajitam pacāmi śṛṇvantu me śraddadhānasya devāḥ /
analyzed: ava bādhe dviṣantam deva pīyum sapatnāḥ ye me apa te bhavantu  / brahmaudanam viśvajitam pacāmi śṛṇvantu me śraddadhānasya devāḥ  /
translated: I cook the Brahman's mess which conquers all. Let the gods listen to me, who have faith.🔽Let Agni Vaiṣvânara, strong, of true strength, burn them up,

original: tān satya ojāḥ pra dahatu agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ vṛṣā / yaḥ naḥ durasyāt dipsāt ca atho yaḥ naḥ arātiyāt /
analyzed: tān satya ojāḥ pra dahatu agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ vṛṣā   yaḥ naḥ durasyāt dipsāt ca atho yaḥ naḥ arātiyāt  /
translated: Him who would injure us, and him who injures us, and him who hates us.🔽Him who injures us who do not injure, and him who injures him who does not injure,

original: yaḥ naḥ dipsāt a dipsataḥ dipsataḥ yaḥ ca dipsati / vaiśvānarasya daṃṣṭrayoḥ agneḥ api dadhāmi tam /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dipsāt a dipsataḥ dipsataḥ yaḥ ca dipsati    vaiśvānarasya daṃṣṭrayoḥ agneḥ api dadhāmi tam  /
translated: I place in the jaws of Agni Vaiṣvânara.🔽Those who seek him in the house, in the opposite direction, on the new moon day,

original: yaḥ āgare mṛgayante pratikrośe amāvāsye / kravya adaḥ anyān dipsataḥ sarvān tān sahasā sahe /
analyzed: yaḥ āgare mṛgayante pratikrośe amāvāsye   kravya adaḥ anyān dipsataḥ sarvān tān sahasā sahe  /
translated: The flesh-eaters, the injurers, all of them, I overcome with force.

original: sahe piśācān sahasā eṣām draviṇam dade / sarvān durasyataḥ hanmi sam me ākūtiḥ ṛdhyatām /
analyzed: sahe piśācān sahasā eṣām draviṇam dade   sarvān durasyataḥ hanmi sam me ākūtiḥ ṛdhyatām  /
translated: I give them wealth, I drive away the Piśācas. I slay all those who are hard to overcome. May my purpose be accomplished.🔽The gods who rejoice in that sun, who vie with it in speed,

original: ye devāḥ tena hāsante sūryeṇa mimate javam / nadīṣu parvateṣu ye sam taiḥ paśubhiḥ vide /
analyzed: ye devāḥ tena hāsante sūryeṇa mimate javam   nadīṣu parvateṣu ye sam taiḥ paśubhiḥ vide  /
translated: Who are in the rivers and mountains, with those cattle I will find.🔽I am the scorcher of the Piśācas, like a tiger of those who have cattle.

original: tapanaḥ asmi piśācānām vyāghraḥ gomatām iva / śvānaḥ siṃham iva dṛṣṭvā te na vindante nyañcanam /
analyzed: tapanaḥ asmi piśācānām vyāghraḥ gomatām iva    śvānaḥ siṃham iva dṛṣṭvā te na vindante nyañcanam  /
translated: Like dogs seeing a lion, they do not find a place to lie down.🔽I cannot be harmed by Piśācas, thieves, or forest-robbers.

original: na piśācaiḥ sam śaknomi na stenaiḥ na vanargubhiḥ / piśācāḥ tasmāt naśyanti yam aham grāmam āviśe /
analyzed: na piśācaiḥ sam śaknomi na stenaiḥ na vanargubhiḥ   piśācāḥ tasmāt naśyanti yam aham grāmam āviśe  /
translated: From that village which I enter, the Piśācas perish.🔽From that village which I enter, this fierce power of mine.

original: yam grāmam āviśataḥ idam ugram sahaḥ mama / piśācāḥ tasmāt naśyanti na pāpam upa jānate /
analyzed: yam grāmam āviśataḥ idam ugram sahaḥ mama   piśācāḥ tasmāt naśyanti na pāpam upa jānate  /
translated: From that the Piśācas perish, they do not know any evil.🔽Those who anger me, the prattlers, like mosquitoes a mighty elephant,

original: ye mā krodhayanti lapitāḥ hastinam maśakāḥ iva / tān aham manye durhitān jane alpa śayūn iva /
analyzed: ye mā krodhayanti lapitāḥ hastinam maśakāḥ iva   tān aham manye durhitān jane alpa śayūn iva  /
translated: I consider them ill-behaved, like people with little to say.🔽May Nirṛti give him up, like a horse with a horse-whip,

original: abhi tam nirṛtiḥ dhattām aśvam iva aśva abhidhānyā / malvaḥ yaḥ mahyam krudhyati saḥ u pāśāt na mucyate /
analyzed: abhi tam nirṛtiḥ dhattām aśvam iva aśva abhidhānyā   malvaḥ yaḥ mahyam krudhyati saḥ u pāśāt na mucyate  /
translated: The one who is angry with me, he is not released from the noose.

original: tvayā pūrvam atharvāṇaḥ jaghnuḥ rakṣāṃsi oṣadhe / tvayā jaghāna kaśyapaḥ tvayā kaṇvaḥ agastyaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā pūrvam atharvāṇaḥ jaghnuḥ rakṣāṃsi oṣadhe   tvayā jaghāna kaśyapaḥ tvayā kaṇvaḥ agastyaḥ  /
translated: Thou, O Plant, didst aid the Atharvans of old to slay the Rakshas. With thee Kaçyapa slew (them), with thee Kanva and Agastya.

original: tvayā vayam apsarasaḥ gandharvān cātayāmahe / ajaśṛṅgī aja rakṣaḥ sarvān gandhena nāśaya //
analyzed: tvayā vayam apsarasaḥ gandharvān cātayāmahe   ajaśṛṅgī aja rakṣaḥ sarvān gandhena nāśaya  /
translated: With thee we drive away the Apsarases and the Gandharvas. O Plant with horns like those of the he-goat, destroy all the Rakshas with thy smell.

original: nadīm yantu apsarasaḥ apām tāram avaśvasam / gulgulūḥ pīlā naladī aukṣa gandhiḥ pramandanī / tat pareta apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana /🔽yatra aśvatthāḥ nyagrodhāḥ mahā vṛkṣāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ / tat pareta apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana /
analyzed: nadīm yantu apsarasaḥ apām tāram avaśvasam   gulgulūḥ pīlā naladī aukṣa gandhiḥ pramandanī   tat pareta apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana  / yatra aśvatthāḥ nyagrodhāḥ mahā vṛkṣāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ   tat pareta apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana  /
translated: Let the Apsarases go to the river, to the foam of the waters, to the foam that floats on the stream. The plant Gulgulû, Pîlû, Naladî, smelling like the ox, the gladdener, with that, O ye Apsarases, go hence, awake, and be not heedless.🔽Go hence, O ye Apsarases, to the place where the holy fig trees, the Nyagrodhas, the great trees, the trees with crests are.

original: yatra vaḥ preṅkhāḥ haritāḥ arjunāḥ uta yatra āghātāḥ karkaryaḥ saṃvadanti / tat pareta apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana /
analyzed: yatra vaḥ preṅkhāḥ haritāḥ arjunāḥ uta yatra āghātāḥ karkaryaḥ saṃvadanti   tat pareta apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana  /
translated: Go hence, O ye Apsarases, to the place where the green, the verdant, the dark-green trees are, and where the trees that are cut down and those that are not cut down are talking together.

original: iyam agan oṣadhīnām vīrudhām vīryāvatī / aja śṛṅgī arāṭakī tīkṣṇa śṛṅgī vyṛṣatu //
analyzed: iyam agan oṣadhīnām vīrudhām vīryāvatī   aja śṛṅgī arāṭakī tīkṣṇa śṛṅgī vyṛṣatu  /
translated: This plant of all the plants, the most vigorous, with horns like those of the he-goat, with sharp horns, hath gone forth. Let it drive away the Rakshas.

original: ānṛtyataḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ gandharvasya apsarāpateḥ / bhinadmi muṣkau api yāmi śepaḥ //🔽bhīmāḥ indrasya hetayaḥ śatam ṛṣṭīḥ ayasmayīḥ / tābhiḥ haviḥ adān gandharvān avakādān vyṛṣatu //
analyzed: ānṛtyataḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ gandharvasya apsarāpateḥ   bhinadmi muṣkau api yāmi śepaḥ  / bhīmāḥ indrasya hetayaḥ śatam ṛṣṭīḥ ayasmayīḥ   tābhiḥ haviḥ adān gandharvān avakādān vyṛṣatu  /
translated: I break the testicles of the Gandharva, the lord of the Apsarases, who dances with Sikhandin, and I crush his penis.🔽Fierce are Indra's weapons, a hundred iron spears. With these he has slain the Gandharvas who gave the oblation, the Avakads, and scattered them.

original: bhīmāḥ indrasya hetayaḥ śatam ṛṣṭīḥ hiraṇyayīḥ / tābhiḥ haviḥ adān gandharvān avakādān vyṛṣatu //
analyzed: bhīmāḥ indrasya hetayaḥ śatam ṛṣṭīḥ hiraṇyayīḥ   tābhiḥ haviḥ adān gandharvān avakādān vyṛṣatu  /
translated: Fierce are Indra's weapons, a hundred golden spears. With these he has slain the Gandharvas who gave the oblation, the Avakads, and scattered them.

original: avakādān abhiśocān apsu jyotaya māmakān / piśācān sarvān oṣadhe pra mṛṇīhi sahasva ca /
analyzed: avaka ādān abhiśocān apsu jyotaya māmakān    piśācān sarvān oṣadhe pra mṛṇīhi sahasva ca  /
translated: The Avakads, the tormentors, the pisâchas in the waters, all these, O Plant, crush thou and overcome.

original: śvā iva ekaḥ kapiḥ iva ekaḥ kumāraḥ sarva keśakaḥ / priyaḥ dṛśaḥ iva bhūtvā gandharvaḥ sacate striyaḥ / tam itas nāśayāmasi brahmaṇā vīryāvatā /
analyzed: śvā iva ekaḥ kapiḥ iva ekaḥ kumāraḥ sarva keśakaḥ   priyaḥ dṛśaḥ iva bhūtvā gandharvaḥ sacate striyaḥ   tam itas nāśayāmasi brahmaṇā vīryāvatā  /
translated: Like a dog is one, like a monkey is one, a boy with hair all over his body. Becoming dear to the sight, a Gandharva associates with women. Him we banish hence by holy power that is strong.

original: jāyāḥ id vaḥ apsarasaḥ gandharvāḥ patayaḥ yuyam / apa dhāvata amartyāḥ martyān mā sacadhvam /
analyzed: jāyāḥ id vaḥ apsarasaḥ gandharvāḥ patayaḥ yuyam    apa dhāvata amartyāḥ martyān mā sacadhvam  /
translated: Your wives are the Apsarases, O Gandharvas, your husbands are ye. Fly away, ye immortal ones; associate not with mortals.

original: udbhindatīm saṃjayantīm apsarām sādhu devinīm / glahe kṛtāni kṛṇvānām apsarām tām iha huve //
analyzed: udbhindatīm saṃjayantīm apsarām sādhu devinīm    glahe kṛtāni kṛṇvānām apsarām tām iha huve  /
translated: The Apsaras who swells and rejoices, the Apsaras who is a good prophetess, who accomplishes the things done in the gambling match, her I invoke here.

original: vicinvatīm ākirantīm apsarām sādhu devinīm / glahe kṛtāni gṛhṇānām apsarām tām iha huve /
analyzed: vicinvatīm ākirantīm apsarām sādhu devinīm   glahe kṛtāni gṛhṇānām apsarām tām iha huve  /
translated: The Apsaras who searches, who scatters, the Apsaras who is a good diviner, Who takes the stakes in gambling, to her the Apsaras I call hither.

original: yāyaiḥ parinṛtyati ādadānā kṛtam glahāt / sā naḥ kṛtāni sīṣatī prahām āpnotu māyayā / sā naḥ payasvatī aitu mā naḥ jaiṣuḥ idam dhanam /
analyzed: yāyaiḥ parinṛtyati ādadānā kṛtam glahāt   sā naḥ kṛtāni sīṣatī prahām āpnotu māyayā   sā naḥ payasvatī aitu mā naḥ jaiṣuḥ idam dhanam  /
translated: With whom she dances round, taking the stakes from the gambling, May she bring us the stakes, may she win the prize by her magic power. May she come to us rich in milk: let her not carry off our wealth.

original: yāḥ akṣeṣu pramodante śucam krodham ca bibhratī / ānandinīm pramodinīm apsarām tām iha huve //
analyzed: yāḥ akṣeṣu pramodante śucam krodham ca bibhratī   ānandinīm pramodinīm apsarām tām iha huve  /
translated: Those who rejoice in the dice, bearing sorrow and wrath, The gladdener, the delighter, to her the Apsaras I call hither.

original: sūryasya raśmīn anu yāḥ sañcaranti marīcīḥ vā yāḥ anusañcaranti / yāsām ṛṣabhaḥ dūratas vājinīvān sadyas sarvān lokān paryeti rakṣan / sa naḥ aitu homam imam jusāṇaḥ antarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvān /
analyzed: sūryasya raśmīn anu yāḥ sañcaranti marīcīḥ vā yāḥ anusañcaranti    yāsām ṛṣabhaḥ dūratas vājinīvān sadyas sarvān lokān paryeti rakṣan   sa naḥ aitu homam imam jusāṇaḥ antarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvān  /
translated: Those who move along the rays of the sun, or the lightnings, Whose leader, the strong one, moves quickly round all the worlds, protecting them, May he come to enjoy this oblation of ours, the strong one, together with the atmosphere.

original: antarikṣena saha vājinīvan karkīm vatsām iha rakṣa vājin / ime te stokāḥ bahulāḥ ehi arvāṅ iyam te karkī iha te manaḥ astu /
analyzed: antarikṣena saha vājinīvan karkīm vatsām iha rakṣa vājin   ime te stokāḥ bahulāḥ ehi arvāṅ iyam te karkī iha te manaḥ astu  /
translated: Together with the atmosphere, O strong one, protect here the cow with the calf, the dappled one. Here are many drops for thee: come hitherward. Here is thy dappled cow: here let thy heart be.

original: antarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvan karkīm vatsām iha rakṣa vājin / ayam ghāsaḥ ayam vraje iha vatsām ni badhnīmaḥ / yathānāma vaḥ īśmahe svāhā /
analyzed: antarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvan karkīm vatsām iha rakṣa vājin   ayam ghāsaḥ ayam vraje iha vatsām ni badhnīmaḥ   yathānāma vaḥ īśmahe svāhā
translated: With the atmosphere, O strong one, protect here the calf Karki. Here is the fodder, here is the stall. Here we will tie the calf. We will have power over you by name. Svâhâ.

original: pṛthivyām agnaye sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot / yathā pṛthivyām agnaye samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu //
analyzed: pṛthivyām agnaye sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot   yathā pṛthivyām agnaye samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu  /
translated: To Agni in the earth they bowed; he prospered. As they bowed to Agni in the earth, so to me let them bow, let them bow together.

original: pṛthivī dhenuḥ tasyāḥ agniḥ vatsaḥ / sā me agninā vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām / āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhenuḥ tasyāḥ agniḥ vatsaḥ   sā me agninā vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām   āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā
translated: The earth is the cow; her calf is Agni. May she, with Agni for her calf, yield me milk, food, strength, and the fulfilment of my desire. Svâhâ! To life first, then to offspring, to growth of wealth.

original: antarikṣe vāyave sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot / yathā antarikṣe vāyave samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu /
analyzed: antarikṣe vāyave sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot   yathā antarikṣe vāyave samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu  /
translated: To Vâyu in the atmosphere they bowed; he prospered. As they bowed to Vâyu in the atmosphere, so to me let them bow, let them bow together.

original: antarikṣam dhenuḥ tasyāḥ vatsaḥ / sā me vāyunā vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām / āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā /
analyzed: antarikṣam dhenuḥ tasyāḥ vatsaḥ   sā me vāyunā vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām   āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā  /
translated: The atmosphere is the cow; her calf is Vâyu. May she, with Vâyu for her calf, yield me milk, food, strength, and the fulfilment of my desire. Svâhâ! To life first, then to offspring, to growth of wealth.

original: divya ādityāya sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot / yathā divya ādityāya samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu //
analyzed: divya ādityāya sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot    yathā divya ādityāya samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu  /
translated: To Âditya in the sky they bowed; he prospered. As they bowed to Âditya in the sky, so to me let them bow, let them bow together.

original: dyauḥ dhenuḥ tasyāḥ ādityaḥ vatsaḥ / sā me ādityena vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām / āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā /
analyzed: dyauḥ dhenuḥ tasyāḥ ādityaḥ vatsaḥ   sā me ādityena vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām    āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā  /
translated: The sky is the cow, the sun is her calf. May she, with the sun for her calf, yield me milk, food, strength, and all that I desire. Long life, first of all, offspring, prosperity, and wealth. All hail!

original: dikṣu candrāya sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot / yathā dikṣu candrāya samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu //
analyzed: dikṣu candrāya sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot   yathā dikṣu candrāya samanaman eva mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu  /
translated: The quarters bowed to Chandra, and he prospered. As the quarters bowed to Chandra, so may they bow to me. May they bow down to me.

original: diśaḥ dhenavaḥ tāsām candraḥ vatsaḥ / tāḥ me candreṇa vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām āyuḥ prathamam prajām posam rayim svāhā /
analyzed: diśaḥ dhenavaḥ tāsām candraḥ vatsaḥ   tāḥ me candreṇa vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām āyuḥ prathamam prajām posam rayim svāhā  /
translated: The quarters are the cows, Chandra is their calf. May they, with Chandra for their calf, yield me milk, food, strength, and all that I desire. Long life, first of all, offspring, prosperity, and wealth. All hail!

original: agnau agniḥ carati praviṣṭaḥ ṛṣīṇām putraḥ abhiśasti pāḥ u / namaskāreṇa namasā te juhomi mā devānām mithuyā karma bhāgam //
analyzed: agnau agniḥ carati praviṣṭaḥ ṛṣīṇām putraḥ abhiśasti pāḥ u namaskāreṇa namasā te juhomi mā devānām mithuyā karma bhāgam  /
translated: The fire moves, entered into the fire, the son of the seers, the protector from imprecations. With adoration, with homage, I offer to thee. Let me not share in the sin of the gods.🔽Purified by the heart, O all-knower, knowing all the ways of the gods, O god,

original: hṛdā pūtam manasā jātavedaḥ viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān / sapta āsyāni tava jātavedaḥ tebhyaḥ juhomi sa juṣasva havyam //
analyzed: hṛdā pūtam manasā jātavedaḥ viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān   sapta āsyāni tava jātavedaḥ tebhyaḥ juhomi sa juṣasva havyam  /
translated: The seven mouths of thine, O all-knower, to them I offer. Accept the offering.

original: ye purastāt juhvati jātavedaḥ prācyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / agnim ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: ye purastāt juhvati jātavedaḥ prācyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    agnim ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: O Jâtavedas, those who sacrifice before us, who from the eastern region threaten us with danger, — Let them, approaching Agni, be destroyed and perish. I slay them with the counter-charm that turns them back.

original: ye dakṣiṇatas juhvati jātavedaḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / yamam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enā pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: ye dakṣiṇatas juhvati jātavedaḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    yamam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enā pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: O Jâtavedas, those who sacrifice on our right, who from the southern region threaten us with danger, — Let them, approaching Yama, be destroyed and perish. I slay them with the counter-charm that turns them back.

original: ye paścāt juhvati jātavedaḥ pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / varuṇam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: ye paścāt juhvati jātavedaḥ pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    varuṇam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: O Jâtavedas, those who sacrifice behind us, who from the western region threaten us with danger, — Let them, approaching Varuṇa, be destroyed and perish. I slay them with the counter-charm that turns them back.

original: yaḥ uttaratas juhvati jātavedaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / somam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: yaḥ uttaratas juhvati jātavedaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    somam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: O Jâtavedas, those who sacrifice on our left, who from the northern region threaten us with danger, — Let them, approaching Soma, be destroyed and perish. I slay them with the counter-charm that turns them back.

original: ye adhastāt juhvati jātavedaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / bhūmim ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: ye adhastāt juhvati jātavedaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    bhūmim ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: O Jâtavedas, those who sacrifice beneath us, who from the lower region threaten us with danger, — Let them, approaching Earth, be destroyed and perish. I slay them with the counter-charm that turns them back.

original: ye antarikṣāt juhvati jātavedaḥ vyadhvāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / vāyum ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: ye antarikṣāt juhvati jātavedaḥ vyadhvāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    vāyum ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: Let them, turning away, be destroyed, having gone to Vâyu. I slay them with the counter-spell, turning them back.🔽Those who, O Jâtavedas, offer sacrifice from out the region of the zenith, and threaten us,

original: yaḥ upariṣṭāt juhvati jātavedaḥ ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / sūryam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: yaḥ upariṣṭāt juhvati jātavedaḥ ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    sūryam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: Let them, turning away, be destroyed, having gone to Sûrya. I slay them with the counter-spell, turning them back.🔽Those who, O Jâtavedas, offer sacrifice from out the intermediate regions of the sky, and threaten us,

original: ye diśām antardeśebhyaḥ juhvati jātavedaḥ sarvābhyaḥ digbhyaḥ abhidāsanti asmān / brahma rtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi //
analyzed: ye diśām antardeśebhyaḥ juhvati jātavedaḥ sarvābhyaḥ digbhyaḥ abhidāsanti asmān    brahma rtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  /
translated: Let them, turning away, be destroyed, having gone to Brahman. I slay them with the counter-spell, turning them back.🔽The spell that hath assumed a womb, immortal, growing, well-born,

original: ṛdhak mantraḥ yonim yaḥ ābabhūva amṛta asuḥ vardhamānaḥ su janmā / adabdha asuḥ bhrājamānaḥ ahā iva tritaḥ dhartā dādhāra trīṇi /
analyzed: ṛdhak mantraḥ yonim yaḥ ābabhūva amṛta asuḥ vardhamānaḥ su janmā   adabdha asuḥ bhrājamānaḥ ahā iva tritaḥ dhartā dādhāra trīṇi  /
translated: Uninjured, shining, like the days, Trita, the supporter, supports the three.🔽He who first sat in the ordinances, from whom thou makest many varied forms,

original: ā yaḥ dharmāṇi prathamaḥ sasāda tatas vapūṃṣi kṛṇuṣe purūṇi / dhāsyuḥ yonim prathamaḥ ā viveśa yaḥ vācam an uditām ciketa /
analyzed: ā yaḥ dharmāṇi prathamaḥ sasāda tatas vapūṃṣi kṛṇuṣe purūṇi    dhāsyuḥ yonim prathamaḥ ā viveśa yaḥ vācam an uditām ciketa  /
translated: The supporter who first entered the womb, or he who hath observed the voice that is not uttered.

original: yaḥ te śokāya tanvam rireca kṣarat hiraṇyam śucayaḥ anu svāḥ / atra ā dadhete amṛtāni nāma asme vastrāṇi viśaḥ erayantām /
analyzed: yaḥ te śokāya tanvam rireca kṣarat hiraṇyam śucayaḥ anu svāḥ   atra ā dadhete amṛtāni nāma asme vastrāṇi viśaḥ erayantām  /
translated: Here have ye both established your immortal names: let the clans send forth their garments unto us.🔽When these two have gone forth to the ancient ford, to the seat that never grows old, standing,

original: pra yat ete prataram pūrvyam guḥ sadaḥsadaḥ ātiṣṭhantaḥ ajuryam / kaviḥ śuṣasya mātarā rihāṇe jāmyai dhuryam patim erayethām /
analyzed: pra yat ete prataram pūrvyam guḥ sadaḥsadaḥ ātiṣṭhantaḥ ajuryam    kaviḥ śuṣasya mātarā rihāṇe jāmyai dhuryam patim erayethām  /
translated: The sage, the two mothers of Susha, have brought the husband of Jama to the yoke.🔽This, O thou of the great wide path, is the homage which I, the sage, offer with my hymn,

original: tat u su te mahat pṛthujman namaḥ kaviḥ kāvyena kṛṇomi / yat samyañcau abhiyantau abhi kṣām atrā mahī rodha cakre vāvṛdhete /
analyzed: tat u su te mahat pṛthujman namaḥ kaviḥ kāvyena kṛṇomi   yat samyañcau abhiyantau abhi kṣām atrā mahī rodha cakre vāvṛdhete  /
translated: When, turning to the earth, ye two approach it, here the great wheel hath grown in its stations.🔽The sages have fashioned seven boundaries: one of these hath the sinner passed beyond.

original: sapta maryādāḥ kavayaḥ tatakṣuḥ tāsām id ekām abhi aṃhuraḥ gāt / āyoḥ ha skambhaḥ upamasya nīḍe pathām visarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau /
analyzed: sapta maryādāḥ kavayaḥ tatakṣuḥ tāsām id ekām abhi aṃhuraḥ gāt    āyoḥ ha skambhaḥ upamasya nīḍe pathām visarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau  /
translated: The prop of life hath stood in the nest of the high one, in the sending forth of the paths, in the supports.🔽And I, the immortal, go in the vow, making the life of the body good, the life of the soul.

original: uta amṛtāsuḥ vrate emi kṛnvan asuḥ ātmā tanvaḥ tat sumadguḥ / uta vā śakraḥ ratnam dadhāti ūrjayā vā yat sacate haviḥ dāḥ /
analyzed: uta amṛtāsuḥ vrate emi kṛnvan asuḥ ātmā tanvaḥ tat sumadguḥ    uta vā śakraḥ ratnam dadhāti ūrjayā vā yat sacate haviḥ dāḥ  /
translated: Or, verily, Shakra bestows the treasure, or he who is united with strength the oblation.

original: uta putraḥ pitaram kṣatram īḍe jyeṣṭham maryādam ahvayan svastaye / darśan nu tāḥ varuṇa yāḥ te viṣṭhāḥ āvarvratataḥ kṛṇavaḥ vapūṃṣi /
analyzed: uta putraḥ pitaram kṣatram īḍe jyeṣṭham maryādam ahvayan svastaye    darśan nu tāḥ varuṇa yāḥ te viṣṭhāḥ āvarvratataḥ kṛṇavaḥ vapūṃṣi  /
translated: And I praise the son, the lordly power, the father, the eldest, the boundary, to call him for welfare. Now do thou, O Varuṇa, make manifest those forms of thine which thou hast hidden away.

original: ardham ardhena payasā pṛṇakṣi ardhena śuṣma vardhase amura / avim vṛdhāma śagmiyam sakhāyam varuṇam putram adityāḥ iṣiram / kavi śastāni asmai vapūṃṣi avocāma rodasī satya vācā /
analyzed: ardham ardhena payasā pṛṇakṣi ardhena śuṣma vardhase amura    avim vṛdhāma śagmiyam sakhāyam varuṇam putram adityāḥ iṣiram   kavi śastāni asmai vapūṃṣi avocāma rodasī satya vācā  /
translated: Thou fillest half with half of the milk; with half thou increasest thy strength, O irresistible one. We have magnified the auspicious friend, the son of Aditi, Varuṇa, the active one. With true speech we have declared to him the forms which the wise one has ordained for the two world-halves.🔽This is indeed the most excellent one among the worlds, from which the sacrifice, the terrible one, with its violent manliness,

original: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas yajñaḥ ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ / sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yat enam madanti viśve ūmāḥ /
analyzed: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas yajñaḥ ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ    sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yat enam madanti viśve ūmāḥ  /
translated: immediately after birth, overcomes the enemies, when all the auspicious ones rejoice in it.

original: vavṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ śatruḥ dāsāya bhiyasam dadhāti / avyanat ca vyanat ca sasni sam te navanta prabhṛtāḥ madeṣu /
analyzed: vavṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ śatruḥ dāsāya bhiyasam dadhāti   avyanat ca vyanat ca sasni sam te navanta prabhṛtāḥ madeṣu  /
translated: Growing in strength, with abundant power, the enemy of the Dāsa causes fear. He has covered the uncovered and the covered. They praise thee, O swift one, in thy festivals.

original: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvis yat ete tris bhavanti ūmāḥ / svadoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛja sam adaḥ su madhu madhunā abhi yodhīḥ //
analyzed: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvis yat ete tris bhavanti ūmāḥ   svadoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛja sam adaḥ su madhu madhunā abhi yodhīḥ  /
translated: In thee they mix the abundant thought, when these two become three, the auspicious ones. Make the sweet sweeter, O sweet one, with the sweet, and fight with the sweet against the sweet.

original: yadi cit nu tvā dhanā jayantam raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ / ojīyaḥ śuṣmin sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ /🔽tvayā vayam śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyantaḥ yudhenyāni bhūri / codayāmi te āyudhā vacobhiḥ sam te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi /🔽ni tat dadhiṣe avare pare ca yasmin āvitha avasā duroṇe / ā sthāpayata mātaram jigatnum atas invata karvarāṇi bhūri //🔽stuṣva varṣman puru vartmānam sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām / ā darśati śavasā bhūri ojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: yadi cit nu tvā dhanā jayantam raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ    ojīyaḥ śuṣmin sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ  / tvayā vayam śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyantaḥ yudhenyāni bhūri   codayāmi te āyudhā vacobhiḥ sam te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi  / ni tat dadhiṣe avare pare ca yasmin āvitha avasā duroṇe   ā sthāpayata mātaram jigatnum atas invata karvarāṇi bhūri  / stuṣva varṣman puru vartmānam sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām   ā darśati śavasā bhūri ojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ  /
translated: If, O thou who art victorious in battle, the sages rejoice in thee, O thou who winnest wealth, in every fight,🔽Make thyself stronger, O thou who art mighty, make thyself firm: let not the evil-living, the cheerless, overcome thee.🔽Through thee we will be victorious in battles, beholding the many advantages of war. I urge thy weapons with my words: I sharpen thy limbs with prayer.🔽Thou hast established that in the lower and the higher abode, in which thou hast helped with aid. Set thou the mother in her place, the active one: from this place send forth many a wondrous thing.🔽Praise him, O thou of the lofty abode, the most widely spread, the most impetuous, the most victorious of the victorious. He shows himself with might, with abundant strength: he overthrows the measure of the earth.

translated: So hath the great, the lofty-minded Atharvan spoken to Indra, to his own body. The two sisters, the two mighty Mothers, the two who are to be worshipped, impel him, and make him grow in strength.

original: mama agne varcaḥ vihaveṣu astu vayam tvā indhānāḥ tanvam puṣema / mahyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ tvayā adhyakṣeṇa pṛtanāḥ jayema /
