analyzed: mama agne varcaḥ vihaveṣu astu vayam tvā indhānāḥ tanvam puṣema   mahyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ tvayā adhyakṣeṇa pṛtanāḥ jayema  /
translated: Let my glory be among the people, O Agni. May we, kindling thee, increase our bodies. To me let the four quarters of the world bow down. Under thy leadership may we conquer in battle.

original: agne manyum pratinudan pareṣām tvam naḥ gopāḥ pari pāhi viśvatas / apāñcaḥ yantu nivatāḥ durasyavaḥ amā eṣām cittam prabudhām vi neśat /
analyzed: agne manyum pratinudan pareṣām tvam naḥ gopāḥ pari pāhi viśvatas    apāñcaḥ yantu nivatāḥ durasyavaḥ amā eṣām cittam prabudhām vi neśat  /
translated: Drive thou away, O Agni, the wrath of others. Be thou our guardian, O thou that art on every side. Let the evil-minded go away to the distance. Let the thought of these be confused and bewildered.

original: mama devāḥ vihave santu sarve indravantaḥ marutaḥ viṣṇuḥ agniḥ / mama antarikṣam uru lokam astu mahyam vātaḥ pavatām kāmāya asmai /
analyzed: mama devāḥ vihave santu sarve indravantaḥ marutaḥ viṣṇuḥ agniḥ    mama antarikṣam uru lokam astu mahyam vātaḥ pavatām kāmāya asmai  /
translated: Let all the Gods be on my side in the conflict, the Maruts with Indra, Vishnu, and Agni. Let the wide world of the atmosphere be mine. Let the wind blow for this my wish.

original: mahyam yajantām mama yāni iṣṭā ākūtiḥ satyā manasaḥ me astu / enaḥ mā ni gām katamat cana aham viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu mā iha /
analyzed: mahyam yajantām mama yāni iṣṭā ākūtiḥ satyā manasaḥ me astu    enaḥ mā ni gām katamat cana aham viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu mā iha  /
translated: Let them sacrifice to me, let them worship me whom I love. Let my thought be true, let my mind be true. Let me not commit any sin. Let all the Gods here protect me.

original: mayi devāḥ draviṇam ā yajantām mayi āśīḥ astu mayi deva hūtiḥ / daivāḥ hotāraḥ saniṣan naḥ etat ariṣṭāḥ syāma tanvā su vīrāḥ /
analyzed: mayi devāḥ draviṇam ā yajantām mayi āśīḥ astu mayi deva hūtiḥ    daivāḥ hotāraḥ saniṣan naḥ etat ariṣṭāḥ syāma tanvā su vīrāḥ  /
translated: On me be the Gods' bounty bestowed: on me be blessing, on me the Gods' worship. O ye divine Hotars, accept this (offering) of ours: may we be safe in body, with brave sons.

original: daivīḥ ṣaṭ urvīḥ uru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsaḥ iha mādayadhvam / mā naḥ vidat abhibhā mā u aśastiḥ mā naḥ vidat vṛjinā dveṣyā yā /
analyzed: daivīḥ ṣaṭ urvīḥ uru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsaḥ iha mādayadhvam   mā naḥ vidat abhibhā mā u aśastiḥ mā naḥ vidat vṛjinā dveṣyā yā  /
translated: Ye six divine regions, give us wide room: here, O ye all Gods, be joyful. Let not misfortune, let not slander find us, let not the sin of guile find us, O Soma, King.

original: tisraḥ devīḥ mahi naḥ śarma yacchata prajāyai naḥ tanve yat ca puṣṭam / mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhiḥ mā radhāma dviṣate soma rājan /
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ mahi naḥ śarma yacchata prajāyai naḥ tanve yat ca puṣṭam    mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhiḥ mā radhāma dviṣate soma rājan  /
translated: Ye three goddesses, grant us great protection, for our offspring, for our bodies, and for our increase. Let us not be deprived of our children, nor of our bodies: let us not fall into the power of the foe, O Soma, King.

original: uru vyacāḥ naḥ mahiṣaḥ śarma yacchatu asmin have puruhūtaḥ purukṣu / sa naḥ prajāyai haryaśva mṛḍa indra mā naḥ rīriṣaḥ mā parā dāḥ /
analyzed: uru vyacāḥ naḥ mahiṣaḥ śarma yacchatu asmin have puruhūtaḥ purukṣu    sa naḥ prajāyai haryaśva mṛḍa indra mā naḥ rīriṣaḥ mā parā dāḥ  /
translated: May the Bull, of wide dominion, grant us protection: may he, much-invoked, much-desired, at this invocation. Be gracious, O thou of the bay steeds, to our offspring, O Indra: afflict us not, forsake us not.

original: dhātā vidhātā bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ devaḥ savitā abhimātiṣāhaḥ / ādityāḥ rudrāḥ aśvinā ubhā devāḥ pāntu yajamānam nirṛthāt //
analyzed: dhātā vidhātā bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ devaḥ savitā abhimātiṣāhaḥ    ādityāḥ rudrāḥ aśvinā ubhā devāḥ pāntu yajamānam nirṛthāt  /
translated: The Ordainer, the Disposer, he who is the lord of the world, the god Savitar, the conqueror of hostility, the Âdityas, the Rudras, the two Asvins, may the two divine (deities) protect the sacrificer from misfortune.

original: ye naḥ sapatnāḥ apa te bhavantu indra agnibhyām ava bādhāmahe enān / ādityāḥ rudrāḥ uparispṛśaḥ naḥ ugram cettāram adhirājam akrata /
analyzed: ye naḥ sapatnāḥ apa te bhavantu indra agnibhyām ava bādhāmahe enān   ādityāḥ rudrāḥ uparispṛśaḥ naḥ ugram cettāram adhirājam akrata  /
translated: Let those who are our enemies be turned away: with Indra and with Agni we repel them. The Âdityas, Rudras, those who touch the highest, have made us a dread ruler, a sovran monarch.

original: arvāñcam indram amutas havāmahe yaḥ go jit dhana jit aśva jit yaḥ / imam naḥ yajñam vihave śṛṇotu asmākam abhūḥ haryaśva medī /
analyzed: arvāñcam indram amutas havāmahe yaḥ go jit dhana jit aśva jit yaḥ    imam naḥ yajñam vihave śṛṇotu asmākam abhūḥ haryaśva medī  /
translated: From yonder world we call hitherward Indra, who wins him kine, wins riches, wins the horses. May he, in fight, accept our sacrifice: be thou, O Lord of Bays, our friend.

original: yaḥ giriṣu ajāyathāḥ vīrudhām balavattamaḥ / kuṣṭhehi takma nāśana takmānam nāśayan itas /
analyzed: yaḥ giriṣu ajāyathāḥ vīrudhām balavattamaḥ   kuṣṭhehi takma nāśana takmānam nāśayan itas
translated: Thou who wast born among the mountains, strongest of plants, drive thou the malady away. Drive thou the malady away from us, O Kuṣṭha.

original: suparṇa suvane girau jātam himavataḥ pari / dhanaiḥ abhi śrutvā yanti viduḥ hi takmanā aśanam //🔽aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi / tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata /
analyzed: suparṇa suvane girau jātam himavataḥ pari   / dhanaiḥ abhi śrutvā yanti viduḥ hi takmanā aśanam  / aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi   tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata  /
translated: On the Suparṇa mountain, on the skirts of Himavat, the plant was born. With wealth they come, renowned, for they know the remedy for malady.🔽The Aśvattha, the Gods' abode, is in the third heaven above us. There the Gods found the healing balm, the plant, the Kuṣṭha, of immortal life.

original: hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi / tatra amṛtasya puṣpam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata /
analyzed: hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi   tatra amṛtasya puṣpam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata  /
translated: The golden ship, bound with gold, sailed in the sky. There the Gods found the healing balm, the plant, the Kuṣṭha, of immortal life.

original: hiraṇyayāḥ panthānaḥ āsan aritrāṇi hiraṇyayā / nāvaḥ hiraṇyayīḥ āsan yābhiḥ kuṣṭham nirāvahan //
analyzed: hiraṇyayāḥ panthānaḥ āsan aritrāṇi hiraṇyayā   nāvaḥ hiraṇyayīḥ āsan yābhiḥ kuṣṭham nirāvahan  /
translated: The ships were made of gold wherewith they brought Kuṣṭha hither.🔽This man of mine, O Kuṣṭha, bring him hither, set him free again.

original: imam me kuṣṭha pūruṣam tam ā vaha tam niḥ kuru / tam u me agadam kṛdhi //
analyzed: imam me kuṣṭha pūruṣam tam ā vaha tam niḥ kuru   tam u me agadam kṛdhi  /
translated: Make him well for me.

original: devebhyaḥ adhi jātaḥ asi somasya asi sakhā hitaḥ / sa prāṇāya vyānāya cakṣuṣe me asmai mṛḍa //
analyzed: devebhyaḥ adhi jātaḥ asi somasya asi sakhā hitaḥ   sa prāṇāya vyānāya cakṣuṣe me asmai mṛḍa  /
translated: Born for the Gods art thou: thou art the friend of Soma set apart. Be gracious unto him for breath, for through-breathing, for his eye.

original: udaṅ jātaḥ himavataḥ sa prācyām nīyase janam / tatra kuṣṭhasya nāmāni uttamāni vi bhejire /
analyzed: udaṅ jātaḥ himavataḥ sa prācyām nīyase janam   tatra kuṣṭhasya nāmāni uttamāni vi bhejire  /
translated: Born in the north, on Himavat, thou art conducted to the folk. There they have fixed the names of Kuṣṭha, the very best.

original: uttamaḥ nāma kuṣṭhasi uttamaḥ nāma te pitā / yakṣmam ca sarvam nāśaya takmānam ca arasam kṛdhi //
analyzed: uttamaḥ nāma kuṣṭhasi uttamaḥ nāma te pitā   yakṣmam ca sarvam nāśaya takmānam ca arasam kṛdhi  /
translated: Best of all names art thou, O Kuṣṭha, and best of all is thy father's name. Destroy thou all disease, and make consumption powerless to harm.🔽The malady of head and eyes, the malady of every limb,

original: śīrṣa āmayam upahatyām akṣyoḥ tanvaḥ rapaḥ / kuṣṭhaḥ tat sarvam niḥ karat daivam samaha vṛṣṇyam //
analyzed: śīrṣa āmayam upahatyām akṣyoḥ tanvaḥ rapaḥ   kuṣṭhaḥ tat sarvam niḥ karat daivam samaha vṛṣṇyam  /
translated: May Kuṣṭha drive it all away, and give us strength that comes from heaven.🔽Night is thy mother, and the Sky thy sire, and Aryaman thy grandsire.

original: rātrī mātā nabhaḥ pitā aryamā te pitāmahaḥ / silācī nāma vai asi sā devānām asi svasā /
analyzed: rātrī mātā nabhaḥ pitā aryamā te pitāmahaḥ   silācī nāma vai asi sā devānām asi svasā  /
translated: Thou art called Silachi by name: thou art a sister of the Gods.

original: yaḥ tvā pibati jīvati trāyase puruṣam tvam / bhartrī hi śaśvatām asi janānām ca nyañcanī //
analyzed: yaḥ tvā pibati jīvati trāyase puruṣam tvam    bhartrī hi śaśvatām asi janānām ca nyañcanī  /
translated: He who drinks thee lives, thou savest man, thou art the saviour of all men, and the refuge of the people.

original: vṛkṣam vṛkṣam ā rohasi vṛṣaṇyantī iva kanyalā / jayantī pratyātiṣṭhantī sparaṇī nāma vai asi /
analyzed: vṛkṣam vṛkṣam ā rohasi vṛṣaṇyantī iva kanyalā   jayantī pratyātiṣṭhantī sparaṇī nāma vai asi  /
translated: Thou mountest every tree as if thou wouldst sport, O thou who art called the healer, O thou who art victorious, and comest back again.

original: yat daṇḍena yat iṣvā yat vāruḥ harasā kṛtam / tasya tvam asi niṣkṛtiḥ sā imam niḥ kṛdhi pūruṣam /
analyzed: yat daṇḍena yat iṣvā yat vāruḥ harasā kṛtam   tasya tvam asi niṣkṛtiḥ sā imam niḥ kṛdhi pūruṣam  /
translated: Whatever is done by rod, by bow, by weapon, by the force of the wind, thou art the expiation of that. Expel thou this man.🔽From the auspicious Plakṣa tree, from the Aśvattha, from the Khadira, from the Dhava,

original: bhadrāt plakṣāt niḥ tiṣṭhasi aśvatthāt khadirāt dhavāt / bhadrāt nyagrodhāt parṇāt sā naḥ ehi arundhati //
analyzed: bhadrāt plakṣāt niḥ tiṣṭhasi aśvatthāt khadirāt dhavāt    bhadrāt nyagrodhāt parṇāt sā naḥ ehi arundhati  /
translated: From the auspicious Nyagrodha, from the Parṇa tree, come hither, O Arundhatī.🔽O thou of golden hue, O thou of happy lot, O thou whose colour is like the sun, O thou most beautiful,

original: hiraṇya varṇe subhage sūrya varṇe vapuṣṭame / rutam gacchāsi niṣkṛte niṣkṛtiḥ nāma vai asi /🔽hiraṇya varṇe subhage śuṣme lomaśa vakṣane / apām asi svasā lākṣe vātaḥ ha ātmā babhūva te /
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇe subhage sūrya varṇe vapuṣṭame   rutam gacchāsi niṣkṛte niṣkṛtiḥ nāma vai asi  / hiraṇya varṇe subhage śuṣme lomaśa vakṣane   apām asi svasā lākṣe vātaḥ ha ātmā babhūva te  /
translated: Thou goest to the sound, O thou who art called the healer. Thou art indeed called the expiation.🔽O thou of golden hue, O thou of happy lot, O thou whose body is covered with long hair,🔽Thou art the sister of the waters, O Lakṣā. The wind hath become thy spirit.🔽The son of thy uncle, Silācī, is thy father, O thou of the variegated hue.

original: silācī nāma kānīnaḥ ajababhru pitā tava / aśvaḥ yamasya yaḥ śyāvaḥ tasya hāsnā asi ukṣitā /
analyzed: silācī nāma kānīnaḥ ajababhru pitā tava    aśvaḥ yamasya yaḥ śyāvaḥ tasya hāsnā asi ukṣitā  /
translated: The dark horse of Yama, his foam is thy milk.

original: aśvasya asnaḥ saṃpatitā sā vṛkṣām abhi siṣyade / sarā patatriṇī bhūtvā sā naḥ ehi arundhati //
analyzed: aśvasya asnaḥ saṃpatitā sā vṛkṣām abhi siṣyade   sarā patatriṇī bhūtvā sā naḥ ehi arundhati  /
translated: The horse's foam hath fallen down, and hath flowed over the trees. Becoming a bird with rapid wings, come hither to us, O Arundhati.

original: brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt vi sīmataḥ su rucaḥ venaḥ āvaḥ / sa budhnyāḥ upamāḥ asya viṣṭhāḥ sataḥ ca yonim asataḥ ca vi var /
analyzed: brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt vi sīmataḥ su rucaḥ venaḥ āvaḥ    sa budhnyāḥ upamāḥ asya viṣṭhāḥ sataḥ ca yonim asataḥ ca vi var  /
translated: The Brahman, born first in the beginning, Vena hath brought forth from the region of the sky, of good appearance. His are the deep, the measured out, the unmeasured out abodes.

original: an āptāḥ ye vaḥ prathamāḥ yāni karmāṇi cakrire / vīrān naḥ atra mā dabhan tat vaḥ etat puras dadhe /
analyzed: an āptāḥ ye vaḥ prathamāḥ yāni karmāṇi cakrire   vīrān naḥ atra mā dabhan tat vaḥ etat puras dadhe  /
translated: Those who have not attained to you, who have performed your first deeds, do not deceive us here, O heroes. This I place before you.

original: sahasra dhāre eva te sam asvaran divaḥ nāke madhu jihvāḥ asaścataḥ / tasya spaśaḥ na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ padepade pāśinaḥ santi setave /
analyzed: sahasra dhāre eva te sam asvaran divaḥ nāke madhu jihvāḥ asaścataḥ    tasya spaśaḥ na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ padepade pāśinaḥ santi setave  /
translated: They have all sung together in the vault of heaven, the honey-tongued, the undecaying ones. His impetuous ones do not close their eyes, in every place are the snares of the wicked to be laid.

original: pari u su pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ / dviṣaḥ tat adhi arṇavena īyase sanisrasaḥ nāma asi trayodaśaḥ māsaḥ indrasya gṛhaḥ /
analyzed: pari u su pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ   dviṣaḥ tat adhi arṇavena īyase sanisrasaḥ nāma asi trayodaśaḥ māsaḥ indrasya gṛhaḥ  /
translated: Go forth to the winning of booty, O thou of good gifts, go round the enemies, O thou of mighty power. Thou goest over that with the flood. Thy name is Sanisrasa. Thou art the thirteenth month, the house of Indra.

original: nu etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā / tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ /
analyzed: nu etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā                 iha su mṛḍatam naḥ  /
translated: With this have thou pleased him, O N.N., svāhā. O Soma and Rudra, armed with sharp weapons, with sharp missiles, be gracious to us here, O ye two who are kind.

original: ava etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā / tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ /
analyzed: ava etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā                 iha su mṛḍatam naḥ  /
translated: With this have thou driven away N.N. Svâhâ! Sharp-weaponed, sharp-spear-pointed, kindly to us be ye, Soma and Rudra, here be gracious unto us.

original: apa etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā / tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ /
analyzed: apa etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā                iha su mṛḍatam naḥ  /
translated: With this have thou driven away N.N. Svâhâ! Sharp-weaponed, sharp-spear-pointed, kindly to us be ye, Soma and Rudra, here be gracious unto us.

original: mumuktam asmān duritāt avadyāt juṣethām yajñam amṛtam asmāsu dhattam /
analyzed: mumuktam asmān duritāt avadyāt juṣethām yajñam amṛtam asmāsu dhattam  /
translated: Deliver us from sin and blame. Accept the sacrifice. Bestow upon us immortality.

original: cakṣuṣaḥ hete manasaḥ hete brahmaṇaḥ hete tapasaḥ ca hete / menyā meniḥ asi amenayaḥ te santu ye asmām abhyaghāyanti //
analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ hete manasaḥ hete brahmaṇaḥ hete tapasaḥ ca hete      menyā meniḥ asi amenayaḥ te santu ye asmām abhyaghāyanti  /
translated: Thou art the shaft of eye, the shaft of mind, the shaft of prayer, the shaft of fervour. Thou art the shaft of the shaft. Let those be shaftless who hate us.

original: yaḥ asmān cakṣuṣā manasā cittyā ākūtyā ca yaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / tvam tān agne menyā menīn kṛṇu svāhā /
analyzed: yaḥ asmān cakṣuṣā manasā cittyā ākūtyā ca yaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt     tvam tān agne menyā menīn kṛṇu svāhā  /
translated: He who with eye and thought and will and purpose, with evil purpose, would attack us, make him, O Agni, shaftless and without a shaft. Svâhâ!

original: indrasya gṛhaḥ asi / tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena /
analyzed: indrasya gṛhaḥ asi   tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena  /
translated: Thou art the house of Indra. I enter thee, I take my refuge in thee, all-possessing, all-manly, all-souled, all-bodied, with all that I have.

original: indrasya śarmā asi / tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena /🔽indrasya varmā asi / tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena /
analyzed: indrasya śarmā asi   tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena  / indrasya varmā asi   tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena  /
translated: Thou art the protection of Indra. To thee I come for refuge. I enter thee for refuge. All-possessing, all-man, all-souled, all-bodied, with what I have I enter thee.🔽Thou art the armour of Indra. To thee I come for refuge. I enter thee for refuge. All-possessing, all-man, all-souled, all-bodied, with what I have I enter thee.

original: indrasya varūtham asi / tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena /
analyzed: indrasya varūtham asi   tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me asti tena  /
translated: Thou art the shelter of Indra. To thee I come for refuge. I enter thee for refuge. All-possessing, all-man, all-souled, all-bodied, with what I have I enter thee.

original: ā naḥ bhara mā pari stha arāte mā naḥ rakṣīḥ dakṣiṇām nīyamānām / namaḥ vīrtsāyāḥ asamṛddhaye namaḥ astu arātaye /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara mā pari stha arāte mā naḥ rakṣīḥ dakṣiṇām nīyamānām   namaḥ vīrtsāyāḥ asamṛddhaye namaḥ astu arātaye  /
translated: Bring to us, do not pass by. Do not lead away our southern quarter. Homage to the failure of the wish, homage to the spiteful one.

original: yam arāte purodhatse puruṣam parirāpiṇam / namaḥ te tasmai kṛṇmaḥ mā vanim vyathayīḥ mama //
analyzed: yam arāte purodhatse puruṣam parirāpiṇam   namaḥ te tasmai kṛṇmaḥ mā vanim vyathayīḥ mama  /
translated: The man, O spiteful one, whom thou hast in thy keeping, to him we pay homage. Do not thou destroy my hope.

original: pra naḥ vaniḥ deva kṛtā divā naktam ca kalpatām / arātim anupremaḥ vayam namaḥ astu arātaye /
analyzed: pra naḥ vaniḥ deva kṛtā divā naktam ca kalpatām   arātim anupremaḥ vayam namaḥ astu arātaye  /
translated: May the wish granted by the gods be fulfilled for us by day and night. We follow the spiteful one. Homage to the spiteful one.

original: sarasvatīm anumatim bhagam yantaḥ havāmahe / vācam juṣṭām madhumatīm avādiṣam devānām deva hūtiṣu /
analyzed: sarasvatīm anumatim bhagam yantaḥ havāmahe   vācam juṣṭām madhumatīm avādiṣam devānām deva hūtiṣu  /
translated: Following Sarasvatî, and Anumati, and Bhaga, we invoke, I have uttered a welcome speech, sweet to the Gods, in the invocation of the Gods.

original: yam yācāmi aham vācā sarasvatyā manaḥ yujā / śraddhā tam adya vindatu dattā somena babhruṇā /
analyzed: yam yācāmi aham vācā sarasvatyā manaḥ yujā    śraddhā tam adya vindatu dattā somena babhruṇā  /
translated: The wish which I with speech implore, with mind allied to Sarasvatî, Let Faith this day obtain for me, given with Soma and the brown.

original: mā vanim mā vācam naḥ vīrtsīḥ ubhau indra agnī ā bharatām naḥ vasūni / sarve naḥ adya ditsantaḥ arātim prati haryata /
analyzed: mā vanim mā vācam naḥ vīrtsīḥ ubhau indra agnī ā bharatām naḥ vasūni   sarve naḥ adya ditsantaḥ arātim prati haryata  /
translated: Waste not our thought, waste not our speech: bring thou to us, O Indra-Agni, treasures manifold. All ye this day, inclined to give, turn your thoughts to our distress.

original: paras apehi asamṛddhe vi te hetim nayāmasi / veda tvā aham nimīvantīm nitudantīm arāte /
analyzed: paras apehi asamṛddhe vi te hetim nayāmasi    veda tvā aham nimīvantīm nitudantīm arāte  /
translated: Go hence, depart, thou who art fruitless: we send thy dart away. I know thee, O thou Demoness, who creepest near and stingest sore.

original: uta nagnā bobhuvatī svapnayā sacase janam / arāte cittam vīrtsanti ākūtim puruṣasya ca /🔽yā mahatī mahā unmānā viśvāḥ āśāḥ vyānaśe / tasyai hiraṇyakeśyai nirṛtyai akaram namaḥ /
analyzed: uta nagnā bobhuvatī svapnayā sacase janam    arāte cittam vīrtsanti ākūtim puruṣasya ca  / yā mahatī mahā unmānā viśvāḥ āśāḥ vyānaśe   tasyai hiraṇyakeśyai nirṛtyai akaram namaḥ  /
translated: Naked thou goest forth, a prowling sorceress, and with a dream thou hauntest men. The heart of man thou rendest, O thou Demoness, and his intention.🔽She who is great, of mighty magic, who hath spread herself o'er all the regions, To her, the golden-haired, the mighty, the Demoness, I pay my homage.

original: hiraṇya varṇā subhagā hiraṇyakaśipuḥ mahī / tasyai hiraṇya drāpaye arātyai akaram namaḥ //
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇā subhagā hiraṇyakaśipuḥ mahī   tasyai hiraṇya drāpaye arātyai akaram namaḥ  /
translated: Golden-hued, auspicious, with a golden crest, the mighty one, To her, the Demoness, the golden-draped, I pay my homage.

original: vaikaṅkatena idhmena devebhyaḥ ājyam vaha / agne tām iha mādaya sarve ā yantu me havam /
analyzed: vaikaṅkatena idhmena devebhyaḥ ājyam vaha   agne tām iha mādaya sarve ā yantu me havam  /
translated: With the fuel of the Vaikaṅkata tree, carry the ghee to the gods. O Agni, delight them here. Let all come to my invocation.

original: indra ā yāhi me havam idam kariṣyāmi tat śṛṇu / ime aindrāḥ atisarāḥ ākūtim sam namantu me / tebhiḥ śakema vīryam jātavedaḥ tanū vaśin //
analyzed: indra ā yāhi me havam idam kariṣyāmi tat śṛṇu   ime aindrāḥ atisarāḥ ākūtim sam namantu me   tebhiḥ śakema vīryam jātavedaḥ tanū vaśin  /
translated: Come, O Indra, to my invocation. I will do this, listen to it. These Atisaras belonging to Indra, let them all turn their thoughts to me. By them, O Jātavedas, may we be able to accomplish our task, O powerful one.

original: yat asau amutas devāḥ adevaḥ saṃścikīrṣati / mā tasya agniḥ havyam vākṣīt dhavam devāḥ asya mā upa guḥ mama eva havam etana /
analyzed: yat asau amutas devāḥ adevaḥ saṃścikīrṣati    mā tasya agniḥ havyam vākṣīt dhavam devāḥ asya mā upa guḥ mama eva havam etana  /
translated: If that godless one from yonder, O gods, desires to harm us, may Agni not carry his oblation. May the gods not approach his invocation. Let them come to mine alone.

original: ati dhāvata atisarāḥ indrasya vacasā hata / avim vṛkaḥ iva mathnīta sa vaḥ jīvan mā moci prāṇam asya api nahyata /
analyzed: ati dhāvata atisarāḥ indrasya vacasā hata    avim vṛkaḥ iva mathnīta sa vaḥ jīvan mā moci prāṇam asya api nahyata  /
translated: Run past, O Atisaras, struck down by the word of Indra. Crush him like a wolf crushes a sheep. Let him not escape you alive. Bind his breath.

original: yam amī purodadhire brahmāṇam apabhūtaye / indra sa te adhaspadam tam prati asyāmi mṛtyave //
analyzed: yam amī purodadhire brahmāṇam apabhūtaye    indra sa te adhaspadam tam prati asyāmi mṛtyave  /
translated: Whom they have placed in front for the destruction of the Brahmans, O Indra, I send him to death as your footstool.

original: yadi preyuḥ deva purā brahma varmāṇi cakrire / tanū pānam paripāṇam kṛṇvānāḥ yat upocire sarvam tat arasam kṛdhi //
analyzed: yadi preyuḥ deva purā brahma varmāṇi cakrire   tanū pānam paripāṇam kṛṇvānāḥ yat upocire sarvam tat arasam kṛdhi  /
translated: If they have gone to the abode of the gods and made the Brahmans their armor, making a coat of mail and protection, whatever they have said, make all that ineffective.

original: yān asau atisarān cakāra kṛṇavat ca yān / tvam tān indra vṛtrahan pratīcaḥ punar ā kṛdhi yathā amum tṛṇa hām janam /
analyzed: yān asau atisarān cakāra kṛṇavat ca yān       tvam tān indra vṛtrahan pratīcaḥ punar ā kṛdhi yathā amum tṛṇa hām janam  /
translated: Those whom he has overcome, and those whom he has made to overcome, O Indra, thou, O Vr̥itra-slayer, make them turn them back again, as thou hast done to this people who have overcome us.

original: yathā indraḥ udvācanam labdhvā cakre adhaspadam / kṛṇve aham adharān tathā amūn śaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā indraḥ udvācanam labdhvā cakre adhaspadam   kṛṇve aham adharān tathā amūn śaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ  /
translated: As Indra, having gained the victory, made his enemies lie low, so do I make these lie low, for all the years that are to come.

original: atra enān indra vṛtrahan ugraḥ marmaṇi vidhya / atra eva enān abhi tiṣṭha indra medi aham tava / anu tvā indra ā rabhāmahe syāma sumatau tava /🔽dive svāhā //
analyzed: atra enān indra vṛtrahan ugraḥ marmaṇi vidhya   atra eva enān abhi tiṣṭha indra medi aham tava    anu tvā indra ā rabhāmahe syāma sumatau tava  / dive svāhā
translated: Here, O Indra, Vr̥itra-slayer, pierce them in the vitals with thy bolt. Here, O Indra, stand thou up erect, I am thy friend. We, Indra, cleave to thee: may we enjoy thy gracious love.🔽To Heaven hail!

original: pṛthivyai svāhā //🔽antarikṣāya svāhā //
analyzed: pṛthivyai svāhā  antarikṣāya svāhā
translated: To Earth hail!🔽To the Firmament hail!

original: antarikṣāya svāhā //🔽dive svāhā //
analyzed: antarikṣāya svāhā  dive svāhā
translated: To the Firmament hail!🔽To Heaven hail!

original: pṛthivyai svāhā //
analyzed: pṛthivyai svāhā
translated: To Earth hail!

original: sūryaḥ me cakṣuḥ vātaḥ prāṇaḥ antarikṣam ātmā pṛthivī śarīram / astṛtaḥ nāma aham ayam asmi saḥ ātmānam ni dadhe dyāvāpṛthivībhyām gopīthāya //
analyzed: sūryaḥ me cakṣuḥ vātaḥ prāṇaḥ antarikṣam ātmā pṛthivī śarīram   astṛtaḥ nāma aham ayam asmi saḥ ātmānam ni dadhe dyāvāpṛthivībhyām gopīthāya  /
translated: The sun is my eye, the wind my breath, the atmosphere my body, the earth my frame. I am he who is called Uninjured. I have placed myself in heaven and earth for protection.

original: ud āyuḥ ud balam ud kṛtam ud kṛtyām ud manīṣām ud indriyam / āyuṣkṛt āyuṣpatnī svadhāvantau gopāḥ me stam gopāyatam mā / ātma sadau me stam mā mā hiṃsiṣṭam /
analyzed: ud āyuḥ ud balam ud kṛtam ud kṛtyām ud manīṣām ud indriyam  / āyuṣkṛt āyuṣpatnī svadhāvantau gopāḥ me stam gopāyatam mā   ātma sadau me stam mā mā hiṃsiṣṭam  /
translated: Upward my life, upward my strength, upward my vigour, upward my thought, upward my power. Ye two, giver and giveress of life, ye two, guardians of my life, guard me. Be ye two my life's abode. Injure me not.

original: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā prācyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / etat saḥ ṛchāt /🔽aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / etat saḥ ṛchāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā prācyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt   etat saḥ ṛchāt  / aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt   etat saḥ ṛchāt  /
translated: Thou art my armour of stone. Let him who from the eastern region would smite me with impiety, let him be smitten therewith.🔽Thou art my armour of stone. Let him who from the southern region would smite me with impiety, let him be smitten therewith.

original: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / etat saḥ ṛchāt /🔽aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā udīcyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / etat saḥ ṛchāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt   etat saḥ ṛchāt  / aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā udīcyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt   etat saḥ ṛchāt  /
translated: Thou art my armour of stone. Let him who from the western region would smite me with impiety, let him be smitten therewith.🔽Thou art my armour of stone. Let him who from the northern region would smite me with impiety, let him be smitten therewith.

original: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / etat saḥ ṛchāt /🔽aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / etat saḥ ṛchāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt   etat saḥ ṛchāt  / aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt   etat saḥ ṛchāt  /
translated: Thou art my armour of stone. Let him who from the region of the zenith would smite me with impiety, let him be smitten therewith.🔽Thou art my armour of stone. Let him who from the region of the nadir would smite me with impiety, let him be smitten therewith.

original: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā diśām antardeśebhyaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt / etat saḥ ṛchāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me asi yaḥ mā diśām antardeśebhyaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt   etat saḥ ṛchāt  /
translated: Thou art my armour of stone. Let him who from the intermediate regions would smite me with impiety, let him be smitten therewith.

original: bṛhatā manaḥ upa hvaye mātariśvanā prāṇa apānau / sūryāt cakṣuḥ antarikṣāt śrotram pṛthivyāḥ śarīram / sarasvatyāḥ vācam upa hvayāmahe manaḥ yujā /
analyzed: bṛhatā manaḥ upa hvaye mātariśvanā prāṇa apānau   sūryāt cakṣuḥ antarikṣāt śrotram pṛthivyāḥ śarīram   sarasvatyāḥ vācam upa hvayāmahe manaḥ yujā  /
translated: I invoke the mind with Brihat, the out- and in-breath with Maruts, the eye from the sun, the ear from the atmosphere, the body from the earth, the speech from Sarasvati, yoked with the mind.

original: katham mahe asurāya abravīḥ iha katham pitre haraye tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ / pṛśnim varuṇa dakṣiṇām dadāvān punarmagha tvam manasā acikitsīḥ /
analyzed: katham mahe asurāya abravīḥ iha katham pitre haraye tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ   pṛśnim varuṇa dakṣiṇām dadāvān punarmagha tvam manasā acikitsīḥ  /
translated: How didst thou speak to the great Asura here? How to the father, O thou of wondrous prowess? Varuna, the giver of the dappled cow as guerdon, thou, O Punarmâgha, didst think in thy mind.

original: na kāmena punarmaghaḥ bhavāmi sam cakṣe kam pṛśnim etām upāje / kena nu tvam atharvan kāvyena kena jātena asi jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: na kāmena punarmaghaḥ bhavāmi sam cakṣe kam pṛśnim etām upāje    kena nu tvam atharvan kāvyena kena jātena asi jātavedāḥ  /
translated: I will not be Punarmâgha through desire. I look on him who gives this dappled cow. By what art thou, O Atharvan, what is thy wisdom? By what birth art thou Jâtavedas?

original: satyam aham gabhīraḥ kāvyena satyam jātena asmi jātavedāḥ / na me dāsaḥ nāryaḥ mahitvā vratam mīmāya yat aham dhariṣye //
analyzed: satyam aham gabhīraḥ kāvyena satyam jātena asmi jātavedāḥ    na me dāsaḥ nāryaḥ mahitvā vratam mīmāya yat aham dhariṣye  /
translated: I am profound by truth, by wisdom; by truth I am Jâtavedas by birth. Neither slave nor freeman shall be my equal in greatness, if I observe the vow which I shall take.

original: na tvat anyaḥ kavitaraḥ na medhayā dhīrataraḥ varuṇa svadhāvan / tvam tā viśvā bhuvanāni vettha sa cit nu tvat janaḥ māyī bibhāya //
analyzed: na tvat anyaḥ kavitaraḥ na medhayā dhīrataraḥ varuṇa svadhāvan    tvam tā viśvā bhuvanāni vettha sa cit nu tvat janaḥ māyī bibhāya  /
translated: None other than thou, O Varuna, the self-existent, is more wise, none is wiser than thou in wisdom. Thou knowest all these worlds. Even the magician fears thee, O thou of magic power.

original: tvam hi aṅga varuṇa svadhāvan viśvā vettha janima su praṇīte / kim rajasaḥ enā paraḥ anyat asti enā kim pareṇa avaram amura /
analyzed: tvam hi aṅga varuṇa svadhāvan viśvā vettha janima su praṇīte   kim rajasaḥ enā paras anyat asti enā kim pareṇa avaram amura  /
translated: For thou, O Varuṇa, O thou of true law, knowest, O thou who art well guided, all generations. What is there higher than the realm of air? What is there lower than the realm of air?

original: ekam rajasaḥ enā paras anyat asti enā paras ekena durṇaśam cit arvāk / tat te vidvān varuṇa pra bravīmi adhas vacasaḥ paṇayaḥ bhavantu nīcais dāsāḥ upa sarpantu bhūmim /
analyzed: ekam rajasaḥ enā paras anyat asti enā paras ekena durṇaśam cit arvāk   tat te vidvān varuṇa pra bravīmi adhas vacasaḥ paṇayaḥ bhavantu nīcais dāsāḥ upa sarpantu bhūmim  /
translated: One thing is higher than the realm of air; another thing is higher than the one. By one (thing) even the hard to conquer is conquered. This I declare to thee, O Varuṇa, who knowest it. Let the Pāṇis be beneath thy sway. Let the Dāsas creep low to the earth.

original: tvam hi aṅga varuṇa bravīṣi punarmagheṣu avadyāni bhūri / mā u su paṇīn abhi etāvataḥ bhūt mā tvā vocan arādhasam janāsaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi aṅga varuṇa bravīṣi punarmagheṣu avadyāni bhūri   mā u su paṇīn abhi etāvataḥ bhūt mā tvā vocan arādhasam janāsaḥ  /
translated: For thou, O Varuṇa, dost speak of many faults among the Pāṇis, O thou of renewed bounty. Let me not be one of the Pāṇis. Let not men call thee one who is not worshipped.

original: mā mā vocan arādhasam janāsaḥ punar te pṛśnim jaritar dadāmi / stotram me viśvam ā yāhi śacībhiḥ antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu /
analyzed: mā mā vocan arādhasam janāsaḥ punar te pṛśnim jaritar dadāmi    stotram me viśvam ā yāhi śacībhiḥ antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu  /
translated: Let not men call thee one who is not worshipped. Again I give thee the dappled (cow), O singer. With all thy powers come thou to my praise, within all human habitations.

original: ā te stotrāṇi udyatāni yantu antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu / dehi nu me yat me a dattaḥ asi yujyaḥ me sapta padaḥ sakhā asi /
analyzed: ā te stotrāṇi udyatāni yantu antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu   dehi nu me yat me a dattaḥ asi yujyaḥ me sapta padaḥ sakhā asi  /
translated: Let my uplifted praises come to thee, within all human habitations. Give me what thou hast given me. Thou art my yoke-fellow. Thou art my friend of seven steps.

original: samā nau bandhuḥ varuṇa samā jā veda aham tat yat nau eṣā samā jā / dadāmi tat yat te a dattaḥ asmi yujyaḥ te sapta padaḥ sakhā asmi /
analyzed: samā nau bandhuḥ varuṇa samā jā veda aham tat yat nau eṣā samā jā    dadāmi tat yat te a dattaḥ asmi yujyaḥ te sapta padaḥ sakhā asmi  /
translated: Our kinship is the same, O Varuṇa, the same our birth. I know that this our birth is the same. I give thee that which I have not given thee. I am thy friend, the seven-stepped one.

original: devaḥ devāya gṛṇate vayodhāḥ vipraḥ viprāya stuvate sumedhāḥ / ajījanaḥ hi varuṇa svadhāvan atharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum / tasmai u rādhaḥ kṛṇuhi su praśastam sakhā naḥ asi paramam ca bandhuḥ //
analyzed: devaḥ devāya gṛṇate vayodhāḥ vipraḥ viprāya stuvate sumedhāḥ    ajījanaḥ hi varuṇa svadhāvan atharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum   tasmai u rādhaḥ kṛṇuhi su praśastam sakhā naḥ asi paramam ca bandhuḥ  /
translated: God, thou art the life-bestower to the singing God, the wise one to the wise one who lauds thee. For thou, O Varuṇa, self-ruling, hast begotten Atharvan, thy father, kinsman of the Gods. To him bestow a gift most excellent and fair: thou art our friend, our nearest kinsman.

original: samiddhaḥ adya manuṣaḥ duroṇe devaḥ devān yajasi jātavedaḥ / ā ca vaha mitra mahaḥ cikitvān tvam dūtaḥ kaviḥ asi pracetāḥ /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ adya manuṣaḥ duroṇe devaḥ devān yajasi jātavedaḥ    ā ca vaha mitra mahaḥ cikitvān tvam dūtaḥ kaviḥ asi pracetāḥ  /
translated: This day, O God, in the house of the man who worships, thou, Jâtavedas, offerest the Gods their due. And bring thou hither with thy thought the great Friend. Thou art the envoy, the wise, the thoughtful Sage.

original: tanūnapāt pathaḥ ṛtasya yānāt madhvā samañjan svadaya su jihva / manmāni dhībhiḥ uta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā ca kṛṇuhi adhvaram naḥ /
analyzed: tanūnapāt pathaḥ ṛtasya yānāt madhvā samañjan svadaya su jihva     manmāni dhībhiḥ uta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā ca kṛṇuhi adhvaram naḥ  /
translated: Tanûnapât, along the paths of sacrifice, sweetening with sweetness, make thou pleasant for us. With hymns and thoughts, and with our sacrifice, delighting, make thou our sacrifice acceptable to the Gods.

original: ājuhvānaḥ īḍyaḥ bandyaḥ ca ā yāhi agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ / tvam devānām asi yahva hotā saḥ enān yakṣīṣitaḥ yajīyān //
analyzed: ājuhvānaḥ īḍyaḥ bandyaḥ ca ā yāhi agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ   tvam devānām asi yahva hotā saḥ enān yakṣi iṣitaḥ yajīyān  /
translated: To be invoked, to be adored, to be exalted, come, O Agni, in accord with the Vasus. Thou art the young Hotar of the Gods: so bring them hither, best to serve, best to implore.

original: prācīnam barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ vastoḥ asyāḥ vṛjyate agre ahnām / vi u prathate vitaram varīyaḥ devebhyaḥ aditaye syonam /🔽vyacasvatīḥ urviyāḥ vi śrayantām patibhyaḥ na janayaḥ śumbhamānāḥ / devīḥ dvāraḥ bṛhatīḥ viśvaminvāḥ devebhyaḥ bhavata suprāyaṇāḥ /
analyzed: prācīnam barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ vastoḥ asyāḥ vṛjyate agre ahnām    vi u prathate vitaram varīyaḥ devebhyaḥ aditaye syonam  / vyacasvatīḥ urviyāḥ vi śrayantām patibhyaḥ na janayaḥ śumbhamānāḥ   devīḥ dvāraḥ bṛhatīḥ viśvaminvāḥ devebhyaḥ bhavata suprāyaṇāḥ  /
translated: The ancient sacred grass is strewn in front, according to the region of this earth, before the days. It spreads itself in ample breadth, most wide, to the Gods, to Aditi, to be a pleasant resting-place.🔽Let the wide spacious doors, like women decking them- selves for their husbands, be thrown open widely. Ye Goddesses, ye mighty doors, that open every way, be easy of access to the Gods.

original: ā suṣvayantī yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatām ni yonau / divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī su rukme adhi śriyam śukrapiśam dadhāne /
analyzed: ā yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatām ni yonau     divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī su rukme adhi śriyam śukrapiśam dadhāne  /
translated: The two Dawns, one to be invoked, the other to be worshipped, are decking them for sacrifice. O ye celestial Maidens, ye two mighty ones, of fair bright ornaments, bestowing on us the light of heaven, which is both pure and bright, sit on your seat, in your proper place.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā su vācā mimānā yajñam manuṣaḥ yajadhyai / pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnam jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā su vācā mimānā yajñam manuṣaḥ yajadhyai    pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnam jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā  /
translated: Ye two celestial Hotars, first by your fair speech, ye who must be adored by man, must mark the sacrifice. Ye who must be invoked in sacrifices, direct ye the light of the East, and point out the region of the East.

original: ā naḥ yajñam bhāratī tūyam etu iḍā manuṣvat iha cetayantī / tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam syonam sarasvatīḥ su apasaḥ sadantām /
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam bhāratī tūyam etu iḍā manuṣvat iha cetayantī    tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam syonam sarasvatīḥ su apasaḥ sadantām  /
translated: Let Bharani come quickly to our sacrifice, let Ida sit here in her proper place, mindful of men. Let Sarasvatî, and the two divine sisters, the two fair ones, sit on this pleasant sacred grass.

original: yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpaiḥ apiṃśat bhuvanāni viśvā / tam adya hotar iṣitaḥ yajīyān devam tvaṣṭāram iha yakṣi vidvān /
analyzed: yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpaiḥ apiṃśat bhuvanāni viśvā   tam adya hotar iṣitaḥ yajīyān devam tvaṣṭāram iha yakṣi vidvān  /
translated: Him, O Hotar, most skilled in worship, this day, urged on, do thou, O wise one, worship here, the God Tvashtar.

original: upa avasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānām pāthaḥ ṛtuthā havīṃṣi / vanaspatiḥ śamitā devaḥ agniḥ svadantu havyam madhunā ghṛtena /
analyzed: upa avasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānām pāthaḥ ṛtuthā havīṃṣi   vanaspatiḥ śamitā devaḥ agniḥ svadantu havyam madhunā ghṛtena  /
translated: Pouring it forth, adjusting it to itself, the paths of the Gods, the oblations in due season, the tree, the oblation-bearer, the God Agni, let the oblation be relished with honey and ghee.

original: sadyas jātaḥ vi amimīta yajñam agniḥ devānām abhavat purogāḥ / asya hotuḥ praśiṣi ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtam haviḥ adantu devāḥ /🔽dadiḥ hi mahyam varuṇaḥ divaḥ kaviḥ vacobhiḥ ugraiḥ ni riṇāmi te viṣam / khātam akhātam uta saktam agrabham irā iva dhanvan ni jajāsa te viṣam /
analyzed: sadyas jātaḥ vi amimīta yajñam agniḥ devānām abhavat purogāḥ    asya hotuḥ praśiṣi ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtam haviḥ adantu devāḥ  / dadiḥ hi mahyam varuṇaḥ divaḥ kaviḥ vacobhiḥ ugraiḥ ni riṇāmi te viṣam   khātam akhātam uta saktam agrabham irā iva dhanvan ni jajāsa te viṣam  /
translated: As soon as born he meted out the sacrifice: Agni became the leader of the Gods. In the command of this Hotar, in the word of truth, let the Gods enjoy the oblation offered with Svâhâ.🔽For thou hast given me, O thou of heaven, the boon: with mighty words I draw out thy poison. I have seized the poison that is dug in and not dug in, and that which clings: thy poison hath burst forth like a swelling in the desert.

original: yat te apodakam viṣam tat te etāsu agrabham / gṛhṇāmi te madhyamam uttamam rasam uta avamam bhiyasā neśat āt u te /
analyzed: yat te apodakam viṣam tat te etāsu agrabham   gṛhṇāmi te madhyamam uttamam rasam uta avamam bhiyasā neśat āt u te  /
translated: The poison that is in thy feet, that have I seized in those (plants). I seize thy middle, thy highest, and thy lowest juice: through fear of me let it move not from thy body.

original: vṛṣā me ravaḥ nabhasā na tanyatuḥ ugreṇa te vacasā bādhaḥ āt u te / aham tam asya nṛbhiḥ agrabham rasam tamasaḥ iva jyotiḥ ud etu sūryaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā me ravaḥ nabhasā na tanyatuḥ ugreṇa te vacasā bādhaḥ āt u te    aham tam asya nṛbhiḥ agrabham rasam tamasaḥ iva jyotiḥ ud etu sūryaḥ  /
translated: My voice is strong, like thunder in the sky. With thy terrible word I have overcome the foe. I have seized his sap with the men, as the light of the sun rises from the darkness.

original: cakṣuṣā te cakṣuḥ hanmi viṣeṇa hanmi te viṣam / ahe mriyasva mā jīvīḥ pratyak abhi etu tvā viṣam /
analyzed: cakṣuṣā te cakṣuḥ hanmi viṣeṇa hanmi te viṣam   ahe mriyasva mā jīvīḥ pratyak abhi etu tvā viṣam
translated: With thine eye I slay thine eye, with poison I slay thy poison. O snake, die, do not live! Let poison turn against thee.

original: kairāta pṛśnaḥ upatṛṇya babhro ā me śṛṇuta asitāḥ alīkāḥ / mā me sakhyuḥ stāmānam api ṣṭhāta āśrāvayantaḥ ni viṣe ramadhvam /
analyzed: kairāta pṛśnaḥ upatṛṇya babhro ā me śṛṇuta asitāḥ alīkāḥ   mā me sakhyuḥ stāmānam api ṣṭhāta āśrāvayantaḥ ni viṣe ramadhvam  /
translated: O Kairata, O Prisni, O Upatruni, O Babhru, O Asita, O Alikas, listen to me. Do not approach the abode of my friend, but announce yourselves and remain in the poison.🔽Of the black, of the Timata, of the Babhru, of the Apoduka,

original: asitasya taimātasya babhroḥ apodakasya ca / sātrāsāhasya aham manyoḥ ava jyām iva dhanvanaḥ vi muñcāmi rathān iva /
analyzed: asitasya taimātasya babhroḥ apodakasya ca    sātrāsāhasya aham manyoḥ ava jyām iva dhanvanaḥ vi muñcāmi rathān iva  /
translated: Of Satrasaha, of Manyu, I loosen the bowstring, as it were, of a bow, I loosen the chariots, as it were.🔽The Aligi, the Viligi, the father, the mother,

original: āligī ca viligī ca pitā ca matā ca / vidma vaḥ sarvatas bandhu arasāḥ kim kariṣyatha //
analyzed: āligī ca viligī ca pitā ca matā ca   vidma vaḥ sarvatas bandhu arasāḥ kim kariṣyatha  /
translated: We know your kinship from all sides. O tasteless ones, what will you do?🔽The daughter of Urugula, born a slave of Asakni,

original: urugūlāyāḥ duhitā jātā dāsī asiknyā / prataṅkam dadruṣīṇām sarvāsām arasam viṣam /
analyzed: urugūlāyāḥ duhitā jātā dāsī asiknyā    prataṅkam dadruṣīṇām sarvāsām arasam viṣam  /
translated: The spreading, the spreading of the poisonous ones, the poison of all is tasteless.

original: karṇā śvāvidh tat abravīt gireḥ avacarantikā / yāḥ kāḥ ca imāḥ khanitrimāḥ tāsām arasatamam viṣam /
analyzed: karṇā śvāvidh tat abravīt gireḥ avacarantikā    yāḥ kāḥ ca imāḥ khanitrimāḥ tāsām arasatamam viṣam  /
translated: The mole, the digger of the hill, hath said this: all these that dig the ground, Of all these plants the deadliest poison is.

original: tābuvam na tābuvam na gha id tvam asi tābuvam / tābuvena arasam viṣam /
analyzed: tābuvam na tābuvam na gha id tvam asi tābuvam    tābuvena arasam viṣam
translated: Thou art not, O thou plant, a Ta-bu-va, nor is the Ta-bu-va a Ta-bu-va. With the Ta-bu-va I render the poison powerless.

original: tastuvam na tastuvam na gha id tvam asi tastuvam / tastuvena arasam viṣam /
analyzed: tastuvam na tastuvam na gha id tvam asi tastuvam    tastuvena arasam viṣam
translated: Thou art not, O thou plant, a Tu-stu-va, nor is the Tu-stu-va a Tu-stu-va. With the Tu-stu-va I render the poison powerless.

original: suparṇaḥ tvā anu avindat sūkaraḥ tvā akhanat nasā / dipsā oṣadhe tvam dipsantam ava kṛtyā kṛtam jahi //
analyzed: suparṇaḥ tvā anu avindat sūkaraḥ tvā akhanat nasā   dipsā oṣadhe tvam dipsantam ava kṛtyā kṛtam jahi  /
translated: The bird of prey hath found thee out, the boar hath dug thee up with his snout. O plant, thou that art called Dip-sa, destroy the man who practises witchcraft.

original: ava jahi yātudhānān ava kṛtyā kṛtam jahi / atha u yaḥ asmān dipsati tam u tvam jahi oṣadhe /
analyzed: ava jahi yātudhānān ava kṛtyā kṛtam jahi    atha u yaḥ asmān dipsati tam u tvam jahi oṣadhe  /
translated: Destroy the sorcerers, destroy the man who practises witchcraft. Destroy also him who practises witchcraft against us, O plant.

original: riśyasya iva parīśāsam parikṛtya pari tvacaḥ / kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte devāḥ niṣkam iva prati muñcata /
analyzed: riśyasya iva parīśāsam parikṛtya pari tvacaḥ   kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte devāḥ niṣkam iva prati muñcata  /
translated: As one would cut off the skin of a Rishya deer, so do ye, O Gods, cut off the witchcraft from the man who practises witchcraft, as one would cut off a bracelet.

original: punar kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte hasta gṛhya parā naya / samakṣam asmai ā dhehi yathā kṛtyā kṛtam hanat /
analyzed: punar kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte hasta gṛhya parā naya   / samakṣam asmai ā dhehi yathā kṛtyā kṛtam hanat  /
translated: Taking the witchcraft back again from the man who practises witchcraft, drive it away. Place it before him, that he who practises witchcraft may be destroyed.

original: kṛtyāḥ santu kṛtyā kṛte śapathaḥ śapathīyate / sukhaḥ rathaḥ iva vartatām kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar /
analyzed: kṛtyāḥ santu kṛtyā kṛte śapathaḥ śapathīyate    sukhaḥ rathaḥ iva vartatām kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar  /
translated: Let the spell be accomplished, let the curse be imprecated. Let it go forth like a well-oiled car, the spell against the spell-maker.

original: yadi strī yadi vā pumān kṛtyām cakāra pāpmane / tām u tasmai nayāmasi aśvam iva aśva abhidhānyā /
analyzed: yadi strī yadi vā pumān kṛtyām cakāra pāpmane   tām u tasmai nayāmasi aśvam iva aśva abhidhānyā  /
translated: If a woman or a man has wrought a spell for evil, we send it back to him, like a horse with a horse-whip.

original: yadi vā asi deva kṛtā yadi vā puruṣaiḥ kṛtā / tām tvā punar nayāmasi indreṇa sayujā vayam /
analyzed: yadi vā asi deva kṛtā yadi vā puruṣaiḥ kṛtā   tām tvā punar nayāmasi indreṇa sayujā vayam  /
translated: If thou art made by the gods or by men, we send thee back again. We with Indra as our ally.

original: agne pṛtanāṣāh pṛtanāḥ sahasva / punar kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte pratiharaṇena harāmasi //
analyzed: agne pṛtanāṣāh pṛtanāḥ sahasva   punar kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte pratiharaṇena harāmasi  /
translated: O Agni, conqueror in battle, overcome the battles. We drive back the spell with the counter-spell against the spell-maker.

original: kṛta vyadhani vidhya tam yaḥ cakāra tam id jahi / na tvām acakruṣe vayam vadhāya sam śiśīmahi //
analyzed: kṛta vyadhani vidhya tam yaḥ cakāra tam id jahi   na tvām acakruṣe vayam vadhāya sam śiśīmahi
translated: Pierce him who has pierced thee, slay him who has wrought thee. We sharpen thee not for destruction, but for slaying him who has wrought thee.

original: putraḥ iva pitaram gaccha svajaḥ iva abhiṣṭhitaḥ daśa / bandham iva avakrāmī gaccha kṛtye kṛtyā kṛtam punar /
analyzed: putraḥ iva pitaram gaccha svajaḥ iva abhiṣṭhitaḥ daśa    bandham iva avakrāmī gaccha kṛtye kṛtyā kṛtam punar  /
translated: Go like a son to his father, like a brother to his kinsman, like a guest to his host. Go to the spell-maker, O spell, and return to him who wrought thee.

original: ud eṇī iva vāraṇī abhiskandam mṛgī iva / kṛtyā kartāram ṛchatu /
analyzed: ud eṇī iva vāraṇī abhiskandam mṛgī iva  / kṛtyā kartāram ṛchatu
translated: Like a doe, like a hind, leap thou upon the maker of the spell.

original: iṣvā ṛjīyaḥ patatu dyāvāpṛthivī tam prati / sā tam mṛgam iva gṛhṇātu kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar /
analyzed: iṣvā ṛjīyaḥ patatu dyāvāpṛthivī tam prati   sā tam mṛgam iva gṛhṇātu kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar  /
translated: Let the arrow fly from heaven and earth against the man who hates us. Let it seize him as a lion seizes a deer, and let the spell return to him who wrought the spell.

original: agniḥ iva etu pratikūlam anukūlam iva udakam / sukhaḥ rathaḥ iva vartatām kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar /
analyzed: agniḥ iva etu pratikūlam anukūlam iva udakam   sukhaḥ rathaḥ iva vartatām kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar
translated: Let it come back to him like fire against the wind, like water against the current. Like a well-wheeled car let it return to him who wrought the spell.

original: ekā ca me daśa ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: ekā ca me daśa ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: One and ten, O Plant, are my defenders. Born of truth, O thou who hast truth for thy guerdon, make my honey sweeter than the sweet.

original: dve ca me viṃśatiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: dve ca me viṃśatiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: Two and twenty, O Plant, are my defenders. Born of truth, O thou who hast truth for thy guerdon, make my honey sweeter than the sweet.

original: tisraḥ ca me triṃśat ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ ca me triṃśat ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: Three and thirty, O Plant, are my defenders. Born of truth, O thou who hast truth for thy guerdon, make my honey sweeter than the sweet.

original: catasraḥ ca me catvāriṃśat ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ ca me catvāriṃśat ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: Four and forty, O Plant, are my defenders. Born of truth, O thou who hast truth for thy guerdon, make my honey sweeter than the sweet.

original: pañca ca me pañcāśat ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ //
analyzed: pañca ca me pañcāśat ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: Five and fifty, O Plant, are my defenders. Born of truth, O thou who hast truth for thy guerdon, make my honey sweeter than the sweet.

original: ṣaṭ ca me ṣaṣṭiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭ ca me ṣaṣṭiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: And six and sixty, O Plant, be my expounders, thou who art born of truth, O thou of true protection. Make me sweet with sweetness.

original: sapta ca me saptatiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: sapta ca me saptatiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: And seven and seventy, O Plant, be my expounders, thou who art born of truth, O thou of true protection. Make me sweet with sweetness.

original: aṣṭa ca me aśītiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /🔽nava ca me navatiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa ca me aśītiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  / nava ca me navatiḥ ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: And eight and eighty, O Plant, be my expounders, thou who art born of truth, O thou of true protection. Make me sweet with sweetness.🔽And nine and ninety, O Plant, be my expounders, thou who art born of truth, O thou of true protection. Make me sweet with sweetness.

original: daśa ca me śatam ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ //
analyzed: daśa ca me śatam ca me apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: And ten and a hundred, O Plant, be my expounders, thou who art born of truth, O thou of true protection. Make me sweet with sweetness.

original: śatam ca me sahasram ca apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe / ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ /
analyzed: śatam ca me sahasram ca apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe    ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ  /
translated: And a hundred and a thousand, O Plant, be my expounders, thou who art born of truth, O thou of true protection. Make me sweet with sweetness.

original: yadi eka vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi eka vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art single-horned, let loose. If thou art hornless, let loose.

original: yadi dvi vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi dvi vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art two-horned, let loose. If thou art hornless, let loose.

original: yadi trivṛsaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi trivṛsaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art three-horned, let loose. If thou art hornless, let loose.

original: yadi catur vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi catur vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art four-horned, let loose. If thou art hornless, let loose.

original: yadi pañca vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi pañca vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art fivefold, bull, beget, thou art powerless.

original: yadi ṣaṣ vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //🔽yadi sapta vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi ṣaṣ vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi  yadi sapta vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art sixfold, bull, beget, thou art powerless.🔽If thou art sevenfold, bull, beget, thou art powerless.

original: yadi aṣṭa vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //🔽yadi nava vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi aṣṭa vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi  yadi nava vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art eightfold, bull, beget, thou art powerless.🔽If thou art ninefold, bull, beget, thou art powerless.

original: yadi daśa vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi daśa vṛṣaḥ asi sṛja arasaḥ asi
translated: If thou art tenfold, bull, beget, thou art powerless.

original: yadi ekādaśaḥ asi saḥ apodakaḥ asi //
analyzed: yadi ekādaśaḥ asi saḥ apodakaḥ asi
translated: If thou art elevenfold, thou art footless.

original: te avadan prathamāḥ brahma kilbiṣe akūpāraḥ salilaḥ mātariśvā / vīḍu harāḥ tapaḥ ugram mayaḥ bhūḥ āpaḥ devīḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtasya /
analyzed: te avadan prathamāḥ brahma kilbiṣe akūpāraḥ salilaḥ mātariśvā    vīḍu harāḥ tapaḥ ugram mayaḥ bhūḥ āpaḥ devīḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtasya  /
translated: They spake, the first, to Brahma's crime, Akupâra, Salila, and Mâtariṣvan. The Vîdûharas, having become a terrible heat, the divine Waters, the first-born of Order.

original: somaḥ rājā prathamaḥ brahma jāyām punar prāyacchat a hṛṇīyamānaḥ / anvartitā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ āsīt agniḥ hotā hasta gṛhyā nināya //
analyzed: somaḥ rājā prathamaḥ brahma jāyām punar prāyacchat a hṛṇīyamānaḥ   anvartitā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ āsīt agniḥ hotā hasta gṛhyā nināya  /
translated: King Soma, the first, gave back the Brahman's wife, being displeased. Varuṇa followed, and Mitra was present. The Priest Agni took her by the hand and led her.

original: hastena eva grāhyaḥ ādhiḥ asyāḥ brahma jāyā iti ced avocat / na dūtāya praheyā tasthe eṣā tathā rāṣṭram gupitam kṣatriyasya /
analyzed: hastena eva grāhyaḥ ādhiḥ asyāḥ brahma jāyā iti ced avocat    na dūtāya praheyā tasthe eṣā tathā rāṣṭram gupitam kṣatriyasya  /
translated: If he should say, 'The Brahman's wife is to be taken by the hand alone,' the pledge is to be taken by the hand. She is not to be sent away as a messenger. So is the guarded realm of the Kshatriya.

original: yām āhuḥ tārakā eṣā vikeśī iti duchunām grāmam avapadyamānām / sā brahma jāyā vi dunoti rāṣṭram yatra prāpādi śaśaḥ ulkuṣīmān /
analyzed: yām āhuḥ tārakā eṣā vikeśī iti duchunām grāmam avapadyamānām    sā brahma jāyā vi dunoti rāṣṭram yatra prāpādi śaśaḥ ulkuṣīmān  /
translated: She, the wife of the Brahman, destroys the kingdom, where the hare has appeared with the glow-worm.

original: brahmacārī carati veviṣat viṣaḥ sa devānām bhavati ekam aṅgam / tena jāyām anu avindat bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītām juhvam na devāḥ /
analyzed: brahmacārī carati veviṣat viṣaḥ sa devānām bhavati ekam aṅgam   tena jāyām anu avindat bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītām juhvam na devāḥ  /
translated: The student wanders about, moving in his course, he becomes one limb of the gods. By him Brihaspati found his wife, whom Soma had led away, the oblation-bearer, whom the gods had taken.

original: devāḥ vai etasyām avadanta pūrve sapta ṛṣayaḥ tapasā ye niṣeduḥ / bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasya apanītā durdhām dadhāti parame vyoman /
analyzed: devāḥ vai etasyām avadanta pūrve sapta ṛṣayaḥ tapasā ye niṣeduḥ   bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasya apanītā durdhām dadhāti parame vyoman  /
translated: The gods spoke on this subject in the beginning, the seven Rishis who sat there by their penance. The terrible wife of the Brahman has been carried off; she places the difficult to bear in the highest heaven.🔽Those embryos that are destroyed, and the world that is torn asunder,

original: ye garbhāḥ avapadyante jagat yat ca apalupyate / vīrāḥ ye tṛhyante mithas brahma jāyāḥ hinasti tān /
analyzed: ye garbhāḥ avapadyante jagat yat ca apalupyate   vīrāḥ ye tṛhyante mithas brahma jāyāḥ hinasti tān  /
translated: The heroes that are tormented by each other, the wife of the Brahman destroys them.🔽And also those ten husbands of the woman who were before, who were not Brahmans,

original: uta yat patayaḥ daśa striyāḥ pūrve abrāhmaṇāḥ / brahmā ced hastam agrahīt saḥ eva patiḥ ekadhā /
analyzed: uta yat patayaḥ daśa striyāḥ pūrve abrāhmaṇāḥ   brahmā ced hastam agrahīt saḥ eva patiḥ ekadhā  /
translated: If the Brahman takes her hand, he alone is the husband.

original: brāhmaṇaḥ eva patiḥ na rājanyaḥ na vaiśyaḥ / tat sūryaḥ prabruvan eti pañcabhyaḥ mānavebhyaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ eva patiḥ na rājanyaḥ na vaiśyaḥ   tat sūryaḥ prabruvan eti pañcabhyaḥ mānavebhyaḥ
translated: The Brahman alone is the husband, not the Kshatriya, not the Vaishya. This the sun proclaims as he rises for the five human beings.

original: punar vai devāḥ adaduḥ punar manuṣyāḥ adaduḥ / rājānaḥ satyam gṛhṇānāḥ brahma jāyām punar daduḥ /
analyzed: punar vai devāḥ adaduḥ punar manuṣyāḥ adaduḥ   rājānaḥ satyam gṛhṇānāḥ brahma jāyām punar daduḥ  /
translated: The Gods have given her back again, and men have given her back again. The Kings, accepting truth, have given the Brahman's wife again.

original: punar dāya brahma jāyām kṛtvā devaiḥ nikilbiṣam / ūrjam pṛthivyāḥ bhaktvā uru gāyam upāsate /
analyzed: punar dāya brahma jāyām kṛtvā devaiḥ nikilbiṣam   ūrjam pṛthivyāḥ bhaktvā uru gāyam upāsate  /
translated: The Brahman's wife, having given back the gift, and made the Gods sinless, Having obtained the food of earth, they worship the wide-spreading One.

original: na asya jāyā śata vāhī kalyāṇī talpam ā śaye / yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā /
analyzed: na asya jāyā śata vāhī kalyāṇī talpam ā śaye   yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā  /
translated: No blessed wife of hundred gifts will lie upon the couch of him In whose dominion the Brahman's wife is held in bondage by the fool.

original: na vikarṇaḥ pṛthu śirāḥ tasmin veśmani jāyate / yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā /🔽na asya kṣattā niṣka grīvaḥ sūnānām eti agratas / yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā /
analyzed: na vikarṇaḥ pṛthu śirāḥ tasmin veśmani jāyate   yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā  / na asya kṣattā niṣka grīvaḥ sūnānām eti agratas   yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā  /
translated: No son is born in that house with ears like horns and head like spread, In whose dominion the Brahman's wife is held in bondage by the fool.🔽No warder with a golden neck goes in front of him to meet the slaughter, In whose dominion the Brahman's wife is held in bondage by the fool.

original: na asya śvetaḥ kṛṣṇakarṇaḥ dhuri yuktaḥ mahīyate / yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā /
analyzed: na asya śvetaḥ kṛṣṇakarṇaḥ dhuri yuktaḥ mahīyate   yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā  /
translated: No white horse with black ears yoked to the pole is honoured by him, In whose dominion the Brahman's wife is held in bondage by the fool.

original: na asya kṣetre puṣkariṇī nāṇḍīkam jāyate bisam / yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā /
analyzed: na asya kṣetre puṣkariṇī nāṇḍīkam jāyate bisam   yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā  /
translated: No lotus-plant with bulb and stalk is born in his field or in his lake, In whose dominion the Brahman's wife is held in bondage by the fool.

original: na asmai pṛśnim vi duhanti ye asyāḥ doham upāsate / yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā /
analyzed: na asmai pṛśnim vi duhanti ye asyāḥ doham upāsate   yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā  /
translated: They milk no spotted cow for him who waits upon the milking of this one, In the realm where the Brāhman's wife is shut up by a cruel master.

original: na asya dhenuḥ kalyāṇī na anaḍvān sahate dhuram / vijāniḥ yatra brahmaṇaḥ rātrim vasati pāpayā /
analyzed: na asya dhenuḥ kalyāṇī na anaḍvān sahate dhuram    vijāniḥ yatra brahmaṇaḥ rātrim vasati pāpayā  /
translated: Neither his milch-cow nor his bull will bear the yoke, Where the Brāhman's wife, a stranger, passes the night in misery.

original: na etām te devāḥ adaduḥ tubhyam nṛpate attave / mā brāhmaṇasya rājanya gām jighatso anādyām /
analyzed: na etām te devāḥ adaduḥ tubhyam nṛpate attave    mā brāhmaṇasya rājanya gām jighatsaḥ anādyām  /
translated: The Gods have not given her to thee, O King, to eat, nor this cow of the Brāhman, O King, to thy hunger.

original: akṣa drugdhaḥ rājanyaḥ pāpaḥ ātma parājitaḥ / sa brāhmaṇasya gām adyāt adya jīvāni mā śvas /
analyzed: akṣa drugdhaḥ rājanyaḥ pāpaḥ ātma parājitaḥ   sa brāhmaṇasya gām adyāt adya jīvāni mā śvas  /
translated: The wicked Kṣattriya, who hates the dice, is vanquished by his own self. Let him eat the Brāhman's cow, and live to-day, not to-morrow.

original: āviṣṭita agha viṣā pṛdākūḥ iva carmaṇā / sā brāhmaṇasya rājanya tṛṣṭā eṣā gauḥ anādyā /
analyzed: āviṣṭita agha viṣā pṛdākūḥ iva carmaṇā    sā brāhmaṇasya rājanya tṛṣṭā eṣā gauḥ anādyā  /
translated: The cow is covered with a skin of sin, as with a garment, O Kṣattriya. This cow of the Brāhman is to be avoided, she is not to be eaten.

original: niḥ vai kṣatram nayati hanti varcaḥ agniḥ iva ārabdhaḥ vi dunoti sarvam / yaḥ brāhmaṇam manyate annam eva sa viṣasya pibati taimātasya /
analyzed: niḥ vai kṣatram nayati hanti varcaḥ agniḥ iva ārabdhaḥ vi dunoti sarvam   yaḥ brāhmaṇam manyate annam eva sa viṣasya pibati taimātasya  /
translated: The Kṣattriya leads away the Brāhman's wealth, he destroys his glory, like a kindled fire he consumes all. He who thinks the Brāhman's food is food for himself, drinks poison, the poison of the T'aima.

original: yaḥ enam hanti mṛdum manyamānaḥ deva pīyuḥ dhana kāmaḥ na cittāt / sam tasya indraḥ hṛdaye agnim indhe ubhe enam dviṣṭaḥ nabhasī carantam /
analyzed: yaḥ enam hanti mṛdum manyamānaḥ deva pīyuḥ dhana kāmaḥ na cittāt     sam tasya indraḥ hṛdaye agnim indhe ubhe enam dviṣṭaḥ nabhasī carantam  /
translated: Indra kindles fire in his heart, and he, hated by both, moves between the two worlds.🔽The Brahman must not be injured, like the fire that delights in the dear oblation.

original: na brāhmaṇaḥ hiṃsitavyaḥ agniḥ priya tanoḥ iva / somaḥ hi asya dāyādaḥ indraḥ asya abhiśasti pāḥ /
analyzed: na brāhmaṇaḥ hiṃsitavyaḥ agniḥ priya tanoḥ iva   somaḥ hi asya dāyādaḥ indraḥ asya abhiśasti pāḥ  /
translated: Soma is his heir, Indra is his protector from imprecation.🔽He bites the hundred-ribbed one, but cannot bite the one without ribs.

original: śata apāṣṭhām ni girati tām na śaknoti niḥkhidam / annam yaḥ brahmaṇām malvaḥ svādu admi iti manyate /
analyzed: śata apāṣṭhām ni girati tām na śaknoti niḥkhidam    annam yaḥ brahmaṇām malvaḥ svādu admi iti manyate  /
translated: The Brahman's food, the sweet-eating one, thinks he is eating.🔽The tongue becomes the bowstring, the voice the bow, the teeth sharpened by austerity the arrows.

original: jihvā jyā bhavati kulmalam vāc nāḍīkā dantāḥ tapasā abhidigdhāḥ / tebhiḥ brahmā vidhyati deva pīyūn hṛd balaiḥ dhanurbhiḥ deva jūtaiḥ /
analyzed: jihvā jyā bhavati kulmalam vāc nāḍīkā dantāḥ tapasā abhidigdhāḥ   tebhiḥ brahmā vidhyati deva pīyūn hṛd balaiḥ dhanurbhiḥ deva jūtaiḥ  /
translated: With these the Brahman pierces the violator of the gods, with heart-strong, god-sent bows.🔽The Brahmans, with sharp arrows and weapons, shoot an arrow that never fails.

original: tīkṣṇa iṣavaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ hetimantaḥ yām asyanti śaravyām na sā mṛṣā / anuhāya tapasā manyunā ca uta durāt ava bhindanti enam /
analyzed: tīkṣṇa iṣavaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ hetimantaḥ yām asyanti śaravyām na sā mṛṣā   anuhāya tapasā manyunā ca uta durāt ava bhindanti enam  /
translated: Blowing with austerity and wrath, they pierce him from afar.🔽Those who, not being kings, ate the Brahman's cow, a thousand, ten hundred,

original: ye sahasram arājan āsan daśa śatāḥ uta / te brāhmaṇasya gām jagdhvā vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan //
analyzed: ye sahasram arājan āsan daśa śatāḥ uta    te brāhmaṇasya gām jagdhvā vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan  /
translated: the Vaitahavya people were defeated.

original: gauḥ eva tān hanyamānā vaitahavyām avātirat / ye kesara prābandhāyāḥ caramājām apeciran /
analyzed: gauḥ eva tān hanyamānā vaitahavyām avātirat   ye kesara prābandhāyāḥ caramājām apeciran  /
translated: The cow, indeed, drove them away, the Vaitahavyas, who had gone to the last stage of life, having taken the hair-tuft.

original: eka śatam tāḥ janatāḥ yāḥ bhūmiḥ vyadhūnuta / prajām hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyam parābhavan /
analyzed: eka śatam tāḥ janatāḥ yāḥ bhūmiḥ vyadhūnuta   prajām hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyam parābhavan  /
translated: Those hundred and one peoples whom the earth shook off, having injured the Brahmana, they were utterly defeated.

original: deva pīyuḥ carati martyeṣu gara gīrṇaḥ bhavati asthi bhūyān / yaḥ brāhmaṇam deva bandhum hinasti na sa pitṛyāṇam api eti lokam /
analyzed: deva pīyuḥ carati martyeṣu gara gīrṇaḥ bhavati asthi bhūyān   yaḥ brāhmaṇam deva bandhum hinasti na sa pitṛyāṇam api eti lokam  /
translated: The sinner against a Brahmana, a kinsman of the gods, wanders among mortals, swallowed by poison, becoming a skeleton. He does not go to the world of the fathers.

original: agniḥ vai naḥ padavāyaḥ somaḥ dāyādaḥ ucyate / hantā abhiśasta indraḥ tathā tat vedhasaḥ viduḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ vai naḥ padavāyaḥ somaḥ dāyādaḥ ucyate   hantā abhiśasta indraḥ tathā tat vedhasaḥ viduḥ  /
translated: Agni is our foot-soldier, Soma is said to be our heir. Indra is the slayer of the cursed, so the wise know it to be.

original: iṣuḥ iva digdhā nṛpate pṛdākūḥ iva gopate / sā brāhmaṇasya iṣuḥ ghorā tayā vidhyati pīyataḥ /
analyzed: iṣuḥ iva digdhā nṛpate pṛdākūḥ iva gopate      sā brāhmaṇasya iṣuḥ ghorā tayā vidhyati pīyataḥ  /
translated: O king, it is like an anointed arrow, like a snake, O lord of the people. That is the terrible arrow of the Brahmana, with which he pierces the guilty.

original: atimātram avardhanta na ud iva divam aspṛśan / bhṛgum hiṃsitvā sṛñjayāḥ vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan /
analyzed: atimātram avardhanta na ud iva divam aspṛśan   bhṛgum hiṃsitvā sṛñjayāḥ vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan  /
translated: They grew exceedingly, as if they touched the sky. The Sṛñjayas, the Vaitahavyas, were defeated, having injured Bhṛgu.

original: ye bṛhatsāmānam āṅgirasam ārpayan brāhmaṇam janāḥ / petvaḥ teṣām ubhaya adam aviḥ tokāni āvayat //
analyzed: ye bṛhatsāmānam āṅgirasam ārpayan brāhmaṇam janāḥ   petvaḥ teṣām ubhaya adam aviḥ tokāni āvayat  /
translated: Those people who threw down the Brāhmaṇa, the Bṛhatsāman, the son of Aṅgiras, their cow, which gives both ways, became barren, and destroyed their offspring.

original: ye brāhmaṇam pratyaṣṭhīvan ye vā asmin śulkam īṣire / asnaḥ te madhye kulyāyāḥ keśān khādantaḥ āsate /
analyzed: ye brāhmaṇam pratyaṣṭhīvan ye vā asmin śulkam īṣire   asnaḥ te madhye kulyāyāḥ keśān khādantaḥ āsate  /
translated: In the middle of this stream of water, with their hair hanging down, they sit, gnawing the bones.🔽When the Brāhman's cow is slaughtered, as far as she goes about,

original: brahmagavī pacyamānā yāvat sā abhi vijaṅgahe / tejaḥ rāṣṭrasya niḥ hanti na vīraḥ jāyate vṛṣā /
analyzed: brahmagavī pacyamānā yāvat sā abhi vijaṅgahe     tejaḥ rāṣṭrasya niḥ hanti na vīraḥ jāyate vṛṣā  /
translated: She takes away the splendour of the kingdom, and no hero is born, no bull.🔽Her entrails are cruel, her flesh is parched, her milk is drunk,

original: krūram asyāḥ āśasanam tṛṣṭam piśitam asyate / kṣīram yat asyāḥ pīyate tat vai pitṛṣu kilbiṣam /
analyzed: krūram asyāḥ āśasanam tṛṣṭam piśitam asyate   kṣīram yat asyāḥ pīyate tat vai pitṛṣu kilbiṣam  /
translated: That is the sin which lies in the Fathers.🔽The king who, thinking himself mighty, desires to injure a Brāhman,

original: ugraḥ rājā manyamānaḥ brāhmaṇam yaḥ jighatsati / parā tat sicyate rāṣṭram brāhmaṇaḥ yatra jīyate /
analyzed: ugraḥ rājā manyamānaḥ brāhmaṇam yaḥ jighatsati   parā tat sicyate rāṣṭram brāhmaṇaḥ yatra jīyate  /
translated: His kingdom is smitten away, where a Brāhman is vanquished.🔽Eight-footed, four-eyed, four-eared, four-jawed,

original: aṣṭāpadī catur akṣī catur śrotrā catur hanuḥ / dvi āsyā dvi jihvā bhūtvā sā rāṣṭram ava dhūnute brahmajyasya //
analyzed: aṣṭāpadī catur akṣī catur śrotrā catur hanuḥ   dvi āsyā dvi jihvā bhūtvā sā rāṣṭram ava dhūnute brahmajyasya  /
translated: Two-mouthed, two-tongued, she becomes, and shakes the kingdom of the Brāhman-slayer.🔽That kingdom leaks away like water from a broken boat.

original: tat vai rāṣṭram ā sravati nāvam bhinnām iva udakam / brahmāṇam yatra hiṃsanti tat rāṣṭram hanti duchunā /
analyzed: tat vai rāṣṭram ā sravati nāvam bhinnām iva udakam   brahmāṇam yatra hiṃsanti tat rāṣṭram hanti duchunā  /
translated: Where they injure the Brāhman, there the kingdom is smitten by misfortune.

original: tam vṛkṣāḥ apa sedhanti chāyām naḥ mā upa gāḥ iti / yaḥ brāhmaṇasya sat dhanam abhi nārada manyate /
analyzed: tam vṛkṣāḥ apa sedhanti chāyām naḥ mā upa gāḥ iti   yaḥ brāhmaṇasya sat dhanam abhi nārada manyate  /
translated: He who, O Narada, thinks to appropriate the good, the wealth of a Brahmana,

original: viṣam etat deva kṛtam rājā varuṇaḥ abravīt / na brāhmaṇasya gām jagdhvā rāstre jāgāra kaḥ cana /
analyzed: viṣam etat deva kṛtam rājā varuṇaḥ abravīt   na brāhmaṇasya gām jagdhvā rāstre jāgāra kaḥ cana  /
translated: This poison, made by the gods, was declared by Varuna the king. No one has ever slept in his kingdom after eating the cow of a Brahmana.🔽Those nine hundred and nine which the earth shook off,

original: nava eva tāḥ navatayaḥ yāḥ bhūmiḥ vyadhūnuta / prajām hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyam parābhavan /
analyzed: nava eva tāḥ navatayaḥ yāḥ bhūmiḥ vyadhūnuta   prajām hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyam parābhavan  /
translated: having injured the Brahmana's offspring, they became incapable of bearing.🔽That which they fasten on the dead, the shroud which covers the feet,

original: yām mṛtāya anubadhnanti kūdyam pada yopanīm / tat vai brahmajya te devāḥ upastaraṇam abruvan /🔽aśrūṇi kṛpamānasya yāni jītasya vāvṛtuḥ / tam vai brahmajya te devāḥ apām bhāgam adhārayan //
analyzed: yām mṛtāya anubadhnanti kūdyam pada yopanīm   tat vai brahmajya te devāḥ upastaraṇam abruvan  / aśrūṇi kṛpamānasya yāni jītasya vāvṛtuḥ   tam vai brahmajya te devāḥ apām bhāgam adhārayan  /
translated: that the gods have declared to be the covering of him who injures a Brahmana.🔽The tears which the defeated one sheds, weeping in his grief,

original: yena mṛtam snapayanti śmaśrūṇi yena undate / tam vai brahmajya te devāḥ apām bhāgam adhārayan //
analyzed: yena mṛtam snapayanti śmaśrūṇi yena undate      tam vai brahmajya te devāḥ apām bhāgam adhārayan  /
translated: that the gods have appointed to be the share of him who injures a Brahmana.

original: na varṣam maitrāvaruṇam brahmajyam abhi varṣati / na asmai samitiḥ kalpate na mitram nayate vaśam //
analyzed: na varṣam maitrāvaruṇam brahmajyam abhi varṣati    na asmai samitiḥ kalpate na mitram nayate vaśam  /
translated: The rain does not fall on him who injures a Brahmana, nor on Maitravaruna. No assembly is formed for him, no friend leads him to submission.

original: uccais ghoṣaḥ dundubhiḥ satvanāyan vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛtaḥ usṛiyābhiḥ / vācam kṣuṇuvānaḥ damayan sapatnān siṃhaḥ iva jeṣyan abhi taṃstanīhi //
analyzed: uccais ghoṣaḥ dundubhiḥ satvanāyan vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛtaḥ usṛiyābhiḥ    vācam kṣuṇuvānaḥ damayan sapatnān siṃhaḥ iva jeṣyan abhi taṃstanīhi  /
translated: roaring with a voice, subduing foes, like a lion eager to conquer, beat him who is to be beaten.🔽He has roared like a lion, firmly bound, bellowing like a bull to a cow in season.

original: siṃhaḥ iva astānīt druvayaḥ vibaddhaḥ abhikrandan ṛṣabhaḥ vāsitām iva / vṛṣā tvam vadhrayaḥ te sapatnāḥ aindraḥ te śuṣmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ iva astānīt druvayaḥ vibaddhaḥ abhikrandan ṛṣabhaḥ vāsitām iva    vṛṣā tvam vadhrayaḥ te sapatnāḥ aindraḥ te śuṣmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ  /
translated: You are a bull, your enemies are eunuchs. Your strength is Indra's, conquering the spiteful.🔽Like a bull in the herd, conquering with might, bellowing, winning booty,

original: vṛṣā iva yūthe sahasā vidānaḥ gavyan abhi ruva saṃdhanājit / śucā vidhya hṛdayam pareṣām hitvā grāmān pracyutāḥ yantu śatravaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā iva yūthe sahasā vidānaḥ gavyan abhi ruva saṃdhanājit     śucā vidhya hṛdayam pareṣām hitvā grāmān pracyutāḥ yantu śatravaḥ  /
translated: pierce with grief the hearts of the foe. Let the enemies, driven from their homes, go away.🔽Uniting the armies, taking up life upwards, grasping in many ways, look around.🔽Sound forth the divine voice, O drum, the creator. Bring the knowledge of the foes.

original: saṃjayan pṛtanāḥ ūrdhvam āyuḥ gṛhyāḥ gṛhṇānaḥ bahudhā vi cakṣva / daivīm vācam dundubhe ā gurasva vedhāḥ śatrūṇām upa bharasva vedaḥ /
analyzed: saṃjayan pṛtanāḥ ūrdhvam āyuḥ gṛhyāḥ gṛhṇānaḥ bahudhā vi cakṣva    daivīm vācam dundubhe ā gurasva vedhāḥ śatrūṇām upa bharasva vedaḥ  /
translated: Listen to the voice of the drum, speaking with care, heard by the wise, the leader, the announcer.

original: dundubheḥ vācam prayatām vadantīm āśṛṇvatī nāthitā ghoṣa buddhā / nārī putram dhāvatu hasta gṛhya amitrī bhītā samare vadhānām /
analyzed: dundubheḥ vācam prayatām vadantīm āśṛṇvatī nāthitā ghoṣa buddhā    nārī putram dhāvatu hasta gṛhya amitrī bhītā samare vadhānām  /
translated: Let the woman run with her son, taking him by the hand, the enemy, frightened in battle, of the slaughter.

original: pūrvaḥ dundubhe pra vadāsi vācam bhūmyāḥ pṛṣṭhe vada rocamānaḥ / amitra senām abhijañjabhānaḥ dyumat vada dundubhe sūnṛtāvat /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ dundubhe pra vadāsi vācam bhūmyāḥ pṛṣṭhe vada rocamānaḥ   amitra senām abhijañjabhānaḥ dyumat vada dundubhe sūnṛtāvat  /
translated: Thou, O Drum, speakest first thy voice, on the back of the earth speak, shining one, speak. Shaking the host of the foe, speak aloud, O Drum, with glory and truth.

original: antarā ime nabhasī ghoṣaḥ astu pṛthak te dhvanayaḥ yantu śībham / abhi kranda stanaya utpipānaḥ śloka kṛt mitra tūryāya svardhī /
analyzed: antarā ime nabhasī ghoṣaḥ astu pṛthak te dhvanayaḥ yantu śībham   abhi kranda stanaya utpipānaḥ śloka kṛt mitra tūryāya svardhī  /
translated: Let there be a sound between these two firmaments: let thy voices go forth separately, quickly. Roar, thunder, O thou that art filled with rain, making a noise, with friends for thy companions, prosperous.

original: dhībhiḥ kṛtaḥ pra vadāti vācam ud dharṣaya satvanām āyudhāni / indramedī satvanaḥ ni hvayasva mitraiḥ amitrām ava jaṅghanīhi //🔽saṃkrandanaḥ pravadaḥ dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ praveda kṛt bahudhā grāma ghoṣī / śriyaḥ vanvanaḥ vayunāni vidvān kīrtim bahubhyaḥ vi hara dvirāje /
analyzed: dhībhiḥ kṛtaḥ pra vadāti vācam ud dharṣaya satvanām āyudhāni   indramedī satvanaḥ ni hvayasva mitraiḥ amitrām ava jaṅghanīhi  / saṃkrandanaḥ pravadaḥ dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ praveda kṛt bahudhā grāma ghoṣī    śriyaḥ vanvanaḥ vayunāni vidvān kīrtim bahubhyaḥ vi hara dvirāje  /
translated: He, made by the thoughts, uttereth his voice: make the weapons of the strong to leap upwards. O thou that art allied with Indra, call hither the strong: with friends crush the enemies.🔽The roarer, the speaker, the bold warrior, the maker of noise, in many ways proclaiming the village cry, winning glories, knowing the ways, distribute fame among many, O thou that hast two kings.

original: śreyaḥ ketaḥ vasu jit sahīyān saṃgrāma jit saṃśitaḥ brahmaṇā asi / aṃśūn iva grāvā adhiṣavaṇe adriḥ gavyan dundubhe adhi nṛtya vedaḥ /
analyzed: śreyaḥ ketaḥ vasu jit sahīyān saṃgrāma jit saṃśitaḥ brahmaṇā asi   aṃśūn iva grāvā adhiṣavaṇe adriḥ gavyan dundubhe adhi nṛtya vedaḥ  /
translated: Thou art the banner of what is better, the winner of wealth, the stronger, the conqueror in battle, sharpened by prayer. As the stone in the mortar, O Drum, that winneth cattle, dance upon the Adhris.

original: śatrūṣāh nīṣāt abhimātiṣāhaḥ gaveṣaṇaḥ sahamānaḥ udbhid / vāgvī iva mantram pra bharasva vācam sāṃgrāma jityāya iṣam ud vada iha /
analyzed: śatrūṣāh nīṣāh abhimātiṣāhaḥ gaveṣaṇaḥ sahamānaḥ udbhid    vāgvī iva mantram pra bharasva vācam sāṃgrāma jityāya iṣam ud vada iha  /
translated: like a priest, utter thy voice, utter thy voice for victory in battle and for food.🔽Unfailing, swift, impartial, most active, conqueror of foes, leader, invincible,

original: acyuta cyut samadaḥ gamiṣṭhaḥ mṛdhaḥ jetā puraeta ayodhyaḥ / indreṇa guptaḥ vidathā nicikyat dhṛddyotanaḥ dviṣatām yāhi śībham /
analyzed: acyuta cyut samadaḥ gamiṣṭhaḥ mṛdhaḥ jetā puraeta ayodhyaḥ   indreṇa guptaḥ vidathā nicikyat dhṛddyotanaḥ dviṣatām yāhi śībham  /
translated: guarded by Indra, observing the rites, piercing the heart, go quickly to the enemies.🔽Drive away the heart, drive away the mind, O Dundubhi, among the enemies.

original: vihṛdayam vaimanasyam vada amitreṣu dundubhe / vidveṣam kaśmaśam bhayam amitreṣu ni dadhmasi ava enān dundubhe jahi //
analyzed: vihṛdayam vaimanasyam vada amitreṣu dundubhe    vidveṣam kaśmaśam bhayam amitreṣu ni dadhmasi ava enān dundubhe jahi  /
translated: We place among the enemies hatred, strife, fear and terror. O Dundubhi, crush them down!🔽Trembling with mind, with eye, and with the heart,

original: udvepamānāḥ manasā cakṣuṣā hṛdayena ca / dhāvantu bibhyataḥ amitrāḥ pratrāsena ājye hute /
analyzed: udvepamānāḥ manasā cakṣuṣā hṛdayena ca    dhāvantu bibhyataḥ amitrāḥ pratrāsena ājye hute  /
translated: let the enemies flee, terrified, when the oil-libation is offered for terror.🔽Born of the tree, collected with the cows, of all races,

original: vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛtaḥ usriyābhiḥ viśva gotryaḥ / pratrāsam amitrebhyaḥ vada ājyena abhighāritaḥ /
analyzed: vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛtaḥ usriyābhiḥ viśva gotryaḥ   pratrāsam amitrebhyaḥ vada ājyena abhighāritaḥ  /
translated: give terror to the enemies, speak, anointed with ghee.🔽As the wild beasts tremble before a man,

original: yathā mṛgāḥ saṃvijante āraṇyāḥ puruṣāt adhi / eva tvam dundubhe amitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya //
analyzed: yathā mṛgāḥ saṃvijante āraṇyāḥ puruṣāt adhi  / eva tvam dundubhe amitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya  /
translated: so, O Dundubhi, cry out against the enemies, terrify them, and confound their minds.

original: yathā vṛkāt aja avayaḥ dhāvanti bahu bibhyatīḥ / eva tvam dundubhe amitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya //
analyzed: yathā vṛkāt aja avayaḥ dhāvanti bahu bibhyatīḥ   eva tvam dundubhe amitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya  /
