translated: As the young kids run from the wolf, trembling in many a fright, So, O Drum, beat the foemen, terrify them, and confound their thoughts.

original: yathā śyenāt patatriṇaḥ saṃvijante ahardivi siṃhasya stanathoḥ yathā / eva tvam dundubhe amitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya //
analyzed: yathā śyenāt patatriṇaḥ saṃvijante ahardivi siṃhasya stanathoḥ yathā  / eva tvam dundubhe amitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya  /
translated: As from the flying hawk the birds fly up in the air, as from the lion's roar, So, O Drum, beat the foemen, terrify them, and confound their thoughts.

original: parā amitrān dundubhinā hariṇasya ajinena ca / sarve devāḥ atitrasan ye saṃgrāmasya īṣate /
analyzed: parā amitrān dundubhinā hariṇasya ajinena ca    sarve devāḥ atitrasan ye saṃgrāmasya īṣate  /
translated: Drive off the foemen with the Drum and with the antelope's hide. All the Gods have been terrified, those who are fain for battle's din.

original: yaiḥ indraḥ prakrīḍate pad ghoṣaiḥ chāyayā saha / taiḥ amitrāḥ trasantu naḥ amī ye yanti anīkaśas /🔽jyā ghoṣāḥ dundubhayaḥ abhi krośantu yāḥ diśaḥ / senāḥ parājitāḥ yatīḥ amitrāṇām anīkaśas /
analyzed: yaiḥ indraḥ prakrīḍate pad ghoṣaiḥ chāyayā saha   taiḥ amitrāḥ trasantu naḥ amī ye yanti anīkaśas  / jyā ghoṣāḥ dundubhayaḥ abhi krośantu yāḥ diśaḥ   senāḥ parājitāḥ yatīḥ amitrāṇām anīkaśas  /
translated: With which the joyous Indra plays, with the loud sound and with the shade, With these let the foemen tremble, these who come in order to the fight.🔽Let the twang of the bow-string and the war-cries of the troops resound in all the regions of the sky. Let the defeated armies of the foemen come in order to the fight.

original: āditya cakṣuḥ ā datsva marīcayaḥ anu dhāvata / patsaṅginīḥ ā sajantu vigate bāhu vīrye /
analyzed: āditya cakṣuḥ ā datsva marīcayaḥ anu dhāvata   patsaṅginīḥ ā sajantu vigate bāhu vīrye  /
translated: Give them the eye of the Sun, let the rays run after them. Let the wives cling to their husbands, let the arms be strong in the fight.

original: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ indreṇa yujā pra mṛnīta śatrūn / somaḥ rājā varuṇaḥ rājā mahādevaḥ uta mṛtyuḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ indreṇa yujā pra mṛnīta śatrūn   somaḥ rājā varuṇaḥ rājā mahādevaḥ uta mṛtyuḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Ye, O ye Maruts, fierce, with dappled horses, united with Indra, crush the foemen. King Soma, King Varuna, and Mahadeva, and Death, and Indra,

original: etāḥ deva senāḥ sūrya ketavaḥ sacetasaḥ / amitrān naḥ jayantu svāhā /
analyzed: etāḥ deva senāḥ sūrya ketavaḥ sacetasaḥ   amitrān naḥ jayantu svāhā
translated: These are the Gods' armies, with the Sun for their ensign, of one mind. Let them conquer our enemies. All hail!🔽Let Agni drive Consumption hence, Soma, the press-stone, Varuna of pure strength,

original: agniḥ takmānam apa bādhatām itas somaḥ grāvā varuṇaḥ pūta dakṣāḥ / vediḥ barhiḥ samidhaḥ śośucānāḥ apa dveṣāṃsi amuyā bhavantu /🔽ayam yaḥ viśvān haritān kṛṇoṣi ucchocayan agniḥ iva abhidunvan / adhā hi takman arasaḥ hi bhūyāḥ adhā nyaṅ adharān vā parehi /
analyzed: agniḥ takmānam apa bādhatām itas somaḥ grāvā varuṇaḥ pūta dakṣāḥ   vediḥ barhiḥ samidhaḥ śośucānāḥ apa dveṣāṃsi amuyā bhavantu  / ayam yaḥ viśvān haritān kṛṇoṣi ucchocayan agniḥ iva abhidunvan    adhā hi takman arasaḥ hi bhūyāḥ adhā nyaṅ adharān vā parehi  /
translated: The altar, the strew, the kindling-sticks, blazing, and all our hatreds with the Amui.🔽This Agni, who consumes all herbs, who burns and scorches like a fire,🔽So, Consumption! be thou sapless. So go thou downward, or away.🔽The rough, the rough-born, the destroyer, like the red-hued,

original: yaḥ paruṣaḥ pāruṣeyaḥ avadhvaṃsaḥ iva aruṇaḥ / takmānam viśvadhā vīrya adharāñcam parā suva /
analyzed: yaḥ paruṣaḥ pāruṣeyaḥ avadhvaṃsaḥ iva aruṇaḥ    takmānam viśvadhā vīrya adharāñcam parā suva  /
translated: Consumption, in every place, drive downward, drive thou far away.🔽I send thee downward, making obeisance to Consumption.

original: adharāñcam pra hiṇomi namaḥ kṛtvā takmane / śakambharasya muṣṭi hā punar etu mahā vṛṣān /
analyzed: adharāñcam pra hiṇomi namaḥ kṛtvā takmane   śakambharasya muṣṭi hā punar etu mahā vṛṣān  /
translated: Let him return to the great bulls, the crusher of the fist of Sakambhara.

original: okaḥ asya mūjavantaḥ okaḥ asya mahā vṛṣāḥ / yāvat jātaḥ takman tāvān asi balhikeṣu nyocaraḥ /
analyzed: okaḥ asya mūjavantaḥ okaḥ asya mahā vṛṣāḥ   yāvat jātaḥ takman tāvān asi balhikeṣu nyocaraḥ  /
translated: His home are the mighty and the strong, his home are the great bulls. As great as thou art born, O Thunder, so great art thou in the Balhikas.

original: takman vyāla vi gada vyaṅga bhūri yāvaya / dāsīm niṣṭakvarīm icha tām vajreṇa sam arpaya //
analyzed: takman vyāla vi gada vyaṅga bhūri yāvaya   dāsīm niṣṭakvarīm icha tām vajreṇa sam arpaya  /
translated: O Thunder, O snake, O disease, O cripple, drive away the many. Seek the slave-woman, the stammerer, and with thy bolt crush her.

original: takman mūjavataḥ gaccha balhikān vā parastarām / śūdrām icha prapharvyam tām takman vi iva dhūnuhi //
analyzed: takman mūjavataḥ gaccha balhikān vā parastarām   / śūdrām icha prapharvyam tām takman vi iva dhūnuhi  /
translated: O Thunder, go to the strong, or to the Balhikas yet further. Seek the Sudra woman, the cripple, and, O Thunder, shake her as one shakes off a garment.

original: mahāvṛṣāt mūjavataḥ bandhu addhi paretya / pra etāni takmane brūmaḥ anya kṣetrāṇi vai imā /
analyzed: mahāvṛṣāt mūjavataḥ bandhu addhi paretya   pra etāni takmane brūmaḥ anya kṣetrāṇi vai imā  /
translated: From the great bull, from the strong, eat thou, O Thunder, having gone to others. These other fields we offer to the Thunder.

original: anya kṣetre na ramase vaśī san mṛḍayāsi naḥ / abhūt u prārthaḥ takmā sa gamiṣyati balhikān /
analyzed: anya kṣetre na ramase vaśī san mṛḍayāsi naḥ   abhūt u prārthaḥ takmā sa gamiṣyati balhikān  /
translated: Thou dost not delight in other fields, being a master thou art gracious to us. The Thunder hath been appeased: he will go to the Balhikas.

original: yat tvam śītaḥ atho rūraḥ saha kāsāvepayaḥ / bhīmāḥ te takman hetayaḥ tābhiḥ sma pari vṛṅgdhi naḥ /
analyzed: yat tvam śītaḥ atho rūraḥ saha kāsā avepayaḥ    bhīmāḥ te takman hetayaḥ tābhiḥ sma pari vṛṅgdhi naḥ  /
translated: When thou art cold, and also hot, with cough and shivering, O Thunder, terrible are thy darts, O Thunder: with them do thou surround us.

original: mā sma etān sakhīn kuruthāḥ balāsam kāsam udyugam / mā sma atas arvāṅ aiḥ punar tat tvā takman upa bruve /
analyzed: mā sma etān sakhīn kuruthāḥ balāsam kāsam udyugam   mā sma atas arvāṅ aiḥ punar tat tvā takman upa bruve  /
translated: Make not these friends of thine, the cough, the shivering, and the fever. Do not come hither from that place. This, O Thunder, I tell thee.

original: takman bhrātrā balāsena svasrā kāsikayā saha / pāpmā bhrātṛvyeṇa saha gaccha amum araṇam janam /
analyzed: takman bhrātrā balāsena svasrā kāsikayā saha   pāpmā bhrātṛvyeṇa saha gaccha amum araṇam janam  /
translated: Go, Fever, with thy brother Wind, with thy sister Cough, and with thy kinsman Palsy, with thy brother-in-law Consumption, to that man whom we hate.

original: tṛtīyakam vitṛtīyam sadandim uta śāradam / takmānam śītam rūram graiṣmam nāśaya vārṣikam /
analyzed: tṛtīyakam vitṛtīyam sadandim uta śāradam    takmānam śītam rūram graiṣmam nāśaya vārṣikam  /
translated: The third, the thirdless, the ever-recurring, the autumnal, the winter, the cold, the hot, the rainy, the summer Fever we destroy.

original: gandhāribhyaḥ mūjavadbhyaḥ aṅgebhyaḥ magadhebhyaḥ / praiṣyan janam iva śevadhim takmānam pari dadmasi //
analyzed: gandhāribhyaḥ mūjavadbhyaḥ aṅgebhyaḥ magadhebhyaḥ   praiṣyan janam iva śevadhim takmānam pari dadmasi  /
translated: From the Gandharis, from the Mujavats, from the Angas, from the Magadhas, we banish Fever, as one banishes a guest, as one banishes a thief.

original: ote me dyāvāpṛthivī otā devī sarasvatī / otau me indraḥ ca agniḥ ca krimim jambhayatām iti /
analyzed: ote me dyāvāpṛthivī otā devī sarasvatī    otau me indraḥ ca agniḥ ca krimim jambhayatām iti  /
translated: The Heaven and the Earth are bound for me, the Goddess Sarasvatî is bound. Bound is Indra and bound is Agni: let them crush the worm to pieces.

original: asya indra kumārasya krimīn dhanapate jahi / hatāḥ viśvāḥ arātayaḥ ugreṇa vacasā mama /
analyzed: asya indra kumārasya krimīn dhanapate jahi    hatāḥ viśvāḥ arātayaḥ ugreṇa vacasā mama  /
translated: Crush, O Indra, Lord of wealth, the worms of this thy servant. Destroyed are all the evil spirits by the terrible words of mine.

original: yaḥ akṣyau parisarpati yaḥ nāse parisarpati / datām yaḥ madhyam gacchati tam krimim jambhayāmasi //
analyzed: yaḥ akṣyau parisarpati yaḥ nāse parisarpati    datām yaḥ madhyam gacchati tam krimim jambhayāmasi  /
translated: We crush the worm that creeps about the eyes, that creeps about the nostrils, that goes to the middle of the lips.

original: sarūpau dvau virūpau dvau kṛṣṇau dvau rohitau dvau / babhruḥ ca babhrukarṇaḥ ca gṛdhraḥ kokaḥ ca te hatāḥ /
analyzed: sarūpau dvau virūpau dvau kṛṣṇau dvau rohitau dvau    babhruḥ ca babhrukarṇaḥ ca gṛdhraḥ kokaḥ ca te hatāḥ  /
translated: Two of the same hue, two of different hue, two black, two red, the brown and the brown-eared, the vulture and the crow, these are destroyed.

original: ye krimayaḥ śiti kakṣāḥ ye kṛṣṇāḥ śiti bāhavaḥ / ye ke ca viśva rūpāḥ tān krimīn jambhayāmasi //
analyzed: ye krimayaḥ śiti kakṣāḥ ye kṛṣṇāḥ śiti bāhavaḥ   ye ke ca viśva rūpāḥ tān krimīn jambhayāmasi  /
translated: The worms that have white shoulders, the black ones with white arms, And all of every form, these worms we crush to pieces.

original: ud purastāt sūryaḥ eti viśva dṛṣṭaḥ adṛṣṭa hā / dṛṣṭān ca ghnan adṛṣṭān ca sarvān ca pramṛṇan krimīn /
analyzed: ud purastāt sūryaḥ eti viśva dṛṣṭaḥ adṛṣṭa hā   dṛṣṭān ca ghnan adṛṣṭān ca sarvān ca pramṛṇan krimīn  /
translated: The sun rises in the east, the all-seeing, the destroyer of the unseen. Slaying the seen and the unseen, crushing all the worms.🔽The worms that crawl on the ground, that crawl on the trees, that move about, that are swift,

original: yeva āṣāsaḥ kaṣkaṣāsaḥ ejatkāḥ śipavitnukāḥ / dṛṣṭaḥ ca hanyatām krimiḥ uta adṛṣṭaḥ ca hanyatām /
analyzed: yeva āṣāsaḥ kaṣkaṣāsaḥ ejatkāḥ śipavitnukāḥ    dṛṣṭaḥ ca hanyatām krimiḥ uta adṛṣṭaḥ ca hanyatām  /
translated: Let the seen worm be slain, let the unseen worm be slain.

original: hataḥ yevāṣaḥ krimīṇām hataḥ nadanimā uta / sarvān ni maṣmaṣākaram dṛṣadā khalvān iva /
analyzed: hataḥ yevāṣaḥ krimīṇām hataḥ nadanimā uta  / sarvān ni maṣmaṣākaram dṛṣadā khalvān iva  /
translated: Slain are the worms that crawl on the ground, slain are the worms that crawl on the trees. I have crushed all with a stone like a water-pot.🔽The three-headed, three-backed worm, the variegated, the swift,

original: tri śīrṣāṇam trikakudam krimim sāraṅgam arjunam / śṛṇāmi asya pṛṣṭīḥ api vṛścāmi yat śiraḥ /

translated: I crush its ribs, I cut off its head.

original: atri vat vaḥ krimayaḥ hanmi kaṇva vat jamadagni vat / agastyasya brahmaṇā sam pinaṣmi aham krimīn /
analyzed: atri vat vaḥ krimayaḥ hanmi kaṇva vat jamadagni vat    agastyasya brahmaṇā sam pinaṣmi aham krimīn  /
translated: Like Atri, O worms, I slay you, like Kanva, like Jamadagni. With the Brahman of Agastya I crush the worms.

original: hataḥ rājā krimīṇām uta eṣām sthapatiḥ hataḥ / hataḥ hata mātā krimiḥ hata bhrātā hata svasā /

translated: Slain is the king of the worms, and their lord is slain. Slain is the mother of the worm, slain is the brother, slain is the sister.

original: parvatāt divaḥ yoneḥ aṅgāt aṅgāt samābhṛtam / śepaḥ garbhasya retaḥ dhāḥ sarau parṇam iva ā dadhat /
analyzed: parvatāt divaḥ yoneḥ aṅgāt aṅgāt samābhṛtam   śepaḥ garbhasya retaḥ dhāḥ sarau parṇam iva ā dadhat  /
translated: From the mountain, from the womb of heaven, from limb to limb collected is the seed, the germ of life, the germ of growth, as a leaf is folded up.

original: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānām garbham ādadhe / eva ā dadhāmi te garbham tasmai tvām avase huve //
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānām garbham ādadhe   eva ā dadhāmi te garbham tasmai tvām avase huve  /
translated: As this great earth hath held the germ of life of all that is, so do I lay the germ of life within thee: for that I call on thee, for that I pray.

original: garbham dhehi sinīvāli garbham dhehi sarasvati / garbham te aśvinā ubhā dhattām puṣkara srajā /
analyzed: garbham dhehi sinīvāli garbham dhehi sarasvati   / garbham te aśvinau ubhā dhattām puṣkara srajā  /
translated: Place the germ within her, O Sinivāli, place the germ within her, O Sarasvatî. Let both the Asvins, crowned with lotus-wreaths, place the germ within her.

original: garbham te mitrāvaruṇau garbham devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ / garbham te indraḥ ca agniḥ ca garbham dhātā dadhātu te /
analyzed: garbham te mitrāvaruṇau garbham devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ   garbham te indraḥ ca agniḥ ca garbham dhātā dadhātu te  /
translated: Let Mitra-Varuṇa place the germ within her, let the God Br̥ihaspati place the germ within her. Let Indra and let Agni, let the God who fashions place the germ within her.

original: viṣṇuḥ yonim kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu / ā siñcatu prajāpatiḥ dhātā garbham dadhātu te /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ yonim kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu   ā siñcatu prajāpatiḥ dhātā garbham dadhātu te  /
translated: Let Vishnu make the womb ready, let Tvashtar form the body. Let Prajâpati pour in, let the Ordainer place the germ within her.

original: yat veda rājā varuṇaḥ yat vā devī sarasvatī / yat indraḥ vṛtra hā veda tat garbha karaṇam piba /
analyzed: yat veda rājā varuṇaḥ yat vā devī sarasvatī   yat indraḥ vṛtra hā veda tat garbha karaṇam piba  /
translated: What Varuna the King hath known, what Sarasvatî the Goddess hath known, what Indra hath known, the Vritra-slayer, drink thou the germ-producing draught.

original: garbhaḥ asi oṣadhīnām garbhaḥ vanaspatīnām / garbhaḥ viśvasya bhūtasya saḥ agne garbham ā iha dhāḥ /
analyzed: garbhaḥ asi oṣadhīnām garbhaḥ vanaspatīnām   garbhaḥ viśvasya bhūtasya saḥ agne garbham ā iha dhāḥ  /
translated: Thou art the germ of plants and herbs, thou art the germ of forest trees, thou art the germ of every being. O Agni, place the germ within her.

original: adhi skanda vīrayasva garbham ā dhehi yonyām / vṛṣā asi vṛṣṇyāvan prajāyai tvā nayāmasi //
analyzed: adhi skanda vīrayasva garbham ā dhehi yonyām   vṛṣā asi vṛṣṇyāvan prajāyai tvā nayāmasi  /
translated: Descend, be strong, place in the womb the germ. Thou art a vigorous male: we lead thee on to generation.

original: vi jihīṣva bārhatsāme garbhaḥ te yonim ā śayām / aduḥ te devāḥ putram soma pāḥ ubhayāvinam /
analyzed: vi jihīṣva bārhatsāme garbhaḥ te yonim ā śayām    aduḥ te devāḥ putram soma pāḥ ubhayāvinam  /
translated: Stretch out thy neck, O thou of Bharata's psalm. The germ hath lain within thy womb. The Gods have given thee, Son, a share on both sides.

original: dhātar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ / pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave /
analyzed: dhātar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ   pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave  /
translated: O Dhatr, with the best form, on this woman's two sides,🔽Impregnate her with a male child, in the tenth month, for delivery.🔽O Tvastr, with the best form, on this woman's two sides,

original: tvaṣṭar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ / pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave /
analyzed: tvaṣṭar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ   pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave  /
translated: Impregnate her with a male child, in the tenth month, for delivery.🔽O Savitr, with the best form, on this woman's two sides,

original: savitar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ / pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave /
analyzed: savitar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ   pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave  /

original: prajāpate śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ / pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave /
analyzed: prajāpate śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ   pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave  /
translated: Impregnate her with a male child, in the tenth month, for delivery.

original: yajūṃṣi yajñe samidhaḥ svāhā agniḥ pravidvān iha vaḥ yunaktu /
analyzed: yajūṃṣi yajñe samidhaḥ svāhā agniḥ pravidvān iha vaḥ yunaktu
translated: The Yajus formulas in the sacrifice, the kindling sticks, Svāhā! May Agni, the wise one, yoke you here.

original: yunaktu devaḥ savitā prajānan asmin yajñe mahiṣaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: yunaktu devaḥ savitā prajānan asmin yajñe mahiṣaḥ svāhā
translated: May the wise god Savitr, the bull, yoke you in this sacrifice, Svāhā!

original: indraḥ ukthāmadāni asmin yajñe pravidvān yunaktu su yujaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: indraḥ ukthāmadāni asmin yajñe pravidvān yunaktu su yujaḥ svāhā
translated: May Indra, the wise one, yoke the reciters and givers of praise in this sacrifice, well yoked, Svāhā!

original: pra eṣāḥ yajñe nividaḥ svāhā śiṣṭāḥ patnībhiḥ vahata iha yuktāḥ //
analyzed: pra eṣāḥ yajñe nividaḥ svāhā śiṣṭāḥ patnībhiḥ vahata iha yuktāḥ
translated: These Nivids in the sacrifice, Svāhā! The remaining ones, carried by the wives, are yoked here.

original: chandāṃsi yajñe marutaḥ svāhā mātā iva putram pipṛta iha yuktāḥ //
analyzed: chandāṃsi yajñe marutaḥ svāhā mātā iva putram pipṛta iha yuktāḥ
translated: The meters in the sacrifice, the Maruts, Svāhā! Nourish like a mother her son, yoked here!

original: ā iyam agan barhiṣā prokṣaṇībhiḥ yajñam tanvānā aditiḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ā iyam agan barhiṣā prokṣaṇībhiḥ yajñam tanvānā aditiḥ svāhā
translated: Here hath come Aditi with the strew and sprinklings, performing sacrifice, with Svâhâ.

original: viṣṇuḥ yunaktu bahudhā tapāṃsi asmin yajñe su yujaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ yunaktu bahudhā tapāṃsi asmin yajñe su yujaḥ svāhā
translated: Let Vishnu yoke the many austerities, in this sacrifice, well-yoked, with Svâhâ.

original: tvaṣṭā yunaktu bahudhā nu rūpāḥ asmin yajñe yunaktu su yujaḥ svāhā /

translated: Let Tvashtar yoke the many forms, in this sacrifice, let him yoke the well-yoked, with Svâhâ.

original: bhagaḥ yunaktu āśiṣaḥ nu asmai asmin yajñe pravidvān yunaktu su yujaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: bhagaḥ yunaktu āśiṣaḥ nu asmai asmin yajñe pravidvān yunaktu su yujaḥ svāhā

original: somaḥ yunaktu bahudhā payāṃsi asmin yajñe su yujaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: somaḥ yunaktu bahudhā payāṃsi asmin yajñe su yujaḥ svāhā

analyzed: devaḥ deveṣu devaḥ pathaḥ anakti madhvā ghṛtena

analyzed: agniḥ srucaḥ adhvareṣu prayakṣu sa yakṣat asya mahimānam agneḥ

analyzed: vanaspate ava sṛja rarāṇaḥ   tmanā devebhyaḥ agniḥ havyam śamitā svadayatu  /
translated: O Vanaspati, let loose, rejoicing, of thine own accord, to the gods. Let Agni, the preparer, make the offering sweet.

original: agne svāhā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ / indrāya yajñam viśve devāḥ haviḥ idam juṣantām /
analyzed: agne svāhā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ   indrāya yajñam viśve devāḥ haviḥ idam juṣantām  /
translated: O Agni, make it acceptable, O all-knower, to Indra the sacrifice. May the All-gods rejoice in this oblation.

original: nava prāṇān navabhiḥ sam mimīte dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya / harite trīṇi rajate trīṇi ayasi trīṇi tapasā āviṣṭitāni //

translated: He measures the nine breaths with the nine (verses); for long life, for a hundred years. Three in the green (grass), three in the silver, three in the iron, penetrated by heat.

original: agniḥ sūryaḥ candramāḥ bhūmiḥ āpaḥ dyauḥ antarikṣam pradiśaḥ diśaḥ ca / ārtavāḥ ṛtubhiḥ saṃvidānāḥ anena mā trivṛtā pārayantu /

translated: Agni, the sun, the moon, the earth, the waters, the sky, the atmosphere, the quarters and the intermediate directions, the seasons, in agreement with the half-months, let them deliver me with this threefold (verse).

original: trayaḥ poṣāḥ trivṛti śrayantām anaktu pūṣā payasā ghṛtena / annasya bhūmā puruṣasya bhūmā bhūmā paśūnām te iha śrayantām //
analyzed: trayaḥ poṣāḥ trivṛti śrayantām anaktu pūṣā payasā ghṛtena    annasya bhūmā puruṣasya bhūmā bhūmā paśūnām te iha śrayantām  /
translated: Let the three nourishments rest in the threefold (verse). Let Pusan anoint it with milk and ghee. The abundance of food, the abundance of men, the abundance of cattle, let them rest here.

original: imam ādityāḥ vasunā sam ukṣata imam agne vardhaya vavṛdhānaḥ / imam indra sam sṛja vīryeṇa asmin trivṛt śrayatām poṣayiṣṇu //

translated: The Adityas sprinkle him with wealth. O Agni, make him grow, having grown. O Indra, unite him with strength. Let the threefold nourishment rest in him.

original: bhūmiḥ tvā pātu haritena viśva bhṛt agniḥ pipartu ayasā sajoṣāḥ / vīrudbhiḥ te arjunam saṃvidānam dakṣam dadhātu sumanasyamānam /

original: tredhā jātam janmanā idam hiraṇyam agneḥ ekam priyatamam babhūva somasya ekam hiṃsitasya parāpatat / apām ekam vedhasām retaḥ āhuḥ tat te hiraṇyam trivṛt astu āyuṣe /

translated: This gold, born threefold by birth, became one most dear to Agni, one fell down from the injured Soma. They say one is the seed of the waters and the creators. Let that gold of thine be threefold for thy life.

original: tri āyuṣam jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tri āyuṣam / tredhā amṛtasya cakṣaṇam trīṇi āyūṃṣi te akaram /

translated: The three Suparnas, the three-versed, when they came together, the one-syllabled Shakra, he carried off Death together with immortality, concealing all evils.

original: sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ / sahamūrān anu daha kravya adaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ //
analyzed: sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ   sahamūrān anu daha kravya adaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ  /
translated: From of old, O Agni, thou destroyest the fiends: the Rakshas have not conquered thee in battle. Burn them with their Mūras, O flesh-eater: let not thy heavenly dart escape them.

original: samāhara jātavedaḥ yat dhṛtam yat parābhṛtam / gātrāṇi asya vardhantām aṃśuḥ iva ā pyāyatām ayam /
analyzed: samāhara jātavedaḥ yat dhṛtam yat parābhṛtam   gātrāṇi asya vardhantām aṃśuḥ iva ā pyāyatām ayam  /
translated: O Jâtavedas, bring together what is held and what is scattered abroad. Let his limbs grow, and let him swell like a shoot.

original: somasya iva jātavedaḥ aṃśuḥ ā pyāyatām ayam / agne virapśinam medhyam a yakṣmam kṛṇu jīvatu //
analyzed: somasya iva jātavedaḥ aṃśuḥ ā pyāyatām ayam   agne virapśinam medhyam a yakṣmam kṛṇu jīvatu  /
translated: Let him swell like a shoot of Soma, O Jâtavedas. Make him, O Agni, free from consumption, meet for sacrifice: let him live long.

original: etāḥ te agne samidhaḥ piśāca jambhanīḥ / tāḥ tvam juṣasva prati ca enāḥ gṛhāṇa jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ te agne samidhaḥ piśāca jambhanīḥ   tāḥ tvam juṣasva prati ca enāḥ gṛhāṇa jātavedaḥ  /
translated: These, O Agni, are thy kindling-sticks that crush the Piśâkas. Accept them gladly, O thou Jâtavedas, and take them to thyself.

original: tārṣṭā aghīḥ agne samidhaḥ prati gṛhṇāhi arciṣā / jahātu kravyād rūpam yaḥ asya māṃsam jihīrṣati //
analyzed: tārṣṭā aghīḥ agne samidhaḥ prati gṛhṇāhi arciṣā   jahātu kravyād rūpam yaḥ asya māṃsam jihīrṣati  /
translated: O Agni, take with thy flame the kindling-sticks that crush the Târkshya. Let him who would devour the flesh abandon his voracious nature.

original: āvataḥ te āvataḥ parāvataḥ te āvataḥ / iha eva bhava mā nu gāḥ mā pūrvān anu gāḥ pitṝn asum badhnāmi te dṛḍham //
analyzed: āvataḥ te āvataḥ parāvataḥ te āvataḥ      / iha eva bhava mā nu gāḥ mā pūrvān anu gāḥ pitṝn asum badhnāmi te dṛḍham  /
translated: From near and far away, O Agni, from the farthest distance, stay here: go not away. Go not to the Fathers who have gone before. I bind fast life within thee.

original: yat tvā abhiceruḥ puruṣaḥ svaḥ yat araṇaḥ janaḥ / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te /
analyzed: yat tvā abhiceruḥ puruṣaḥ svaḥ yat araṇaḥ janaḥ   unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te  /
translated: If any man, O Agni, hath wronged thee, or the people who are in the wood, I speak to thee with both my hands, O thou who savest from distress.

original: yat dudrohitha śepiṣe striyai puṃse acittyā / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te /
analyzed: yat dudrohitha śepiṣe striyai puṃse acittyā   / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te  /
translated: If thou hast hated, hast been angry with a woman or a thoughtless man, I speak to thee with both my hands, O thou who savest from distress.

original: yat enasaḥ mātṛ kṛtāt śeṣe pitṛ kṛtāt ca yat / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te /
analyzed: yat enasaḥ mātṛ kṛtāt śeṣe pitṛ kṛtāt ca yat  / unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te  /
translated: From the remainder of the sin committed by thy mother, and from that committed by thy father,🔽From the sin committed by thy mother, from the sin committed by thy father, thy brother, thy sister, thy kinsmen, thy friends,

original: yat te mātā yat te pitā jamiḥ bhrātā ca sarjataḥ / pratyak sevasva bheṣajam jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā /🔽iha edhi puruṣa sarveṇa manasā saha / dūtau yamasya mānu gāḥ adhi jīva purā ihi //
analyzed: yat te mātā yat te pitā jamiḥ bhrātā ca sarjataḥ    pratyak sevasva bheṣajam jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā  / iha edhi puruṣa sarveṇa manasā saha    dūtau yamasya mā anu gāḥ adhi jīva purā ihi  /
translated: From the sin committed by thy mother, by thy father, by thy brother, by thy sister, by thy kinsmen, by thy friends,🔽Come hither, man, with all thy mind. Go back, O man, to life again. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.

original: anuhūtaḥ punar ehi vidvān udayanam pathaḥ / ārohaṇam ākramaṇam jīvataḥ jīvataḥ ayanam //🔽mā bibheḥ na mariṣyasi jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā / niḥ avocam aham yakṣmam aṅgebhyaḥ aṅga jvaram tava /
analyzed: anuhūtaḥ punar ehi vidvān udayanam pathaḥ   ārohaṇam ākramaṇam jīvataḥ jīvataḥ ayanam  / mā bibheḥ na mariṣyasi jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā   niḥ avocam aham yakṣmam aṅgebhyaḥ aṅga jvaram tava  /
translated: Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.

original: aṅga bhedaḥ aṅga jvaraḥ yaḥ ca te hṛdaya āmayaḥ / yakṣmaḥ śyenaḥ iva prāpaptat vacā sāḍhaḥ parastarām /🔽ṛṣī bodha pratībodhau asvapnaḥ yaḥ ca jāgṛviḥ / tau te prāṇasya goptārau divā naktam ca jāgṛtām /
analyzed: aṅga bhedaḥ aṅga jvaraḥ yaḥ ca te hṛdaya āmayaḥ   yakṣmaḥ śyenaḥ iva prāpaptat vacā sāḍhaḥ parastarām  /🔽ṛṣī bodha pratībodhau asvapnaḥ yaḥ ca jāgṛviḥ   tau te prāṇasya goptārau divā naktam ca jāgṛtām  /
translated: Come hither, man, thou who art called. Go back to life, O man, to life. Go back to life, O man, to life.🔽Come hither, man

original: ayam agniḥ upasadyaḥ iha sūryaḥ ud etu te / udehi mṛtyoḥ gambhīrāt kṛṣṇāt cit tamasaḥ pari /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ upasadyaḥ iha sūryaḥ ud etu te    udehi mṛtyoḥ gambhīrāt kṛṣṇāt cit tamasaḥ pari  /
translated: Here let the Sun rise up to thee, this Agni who is to be approached. Rise up from Death's profound abyss, from out the darkness of the gloom.

original: namaḥ yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave namaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ uta ye nayanti / utpāraṇasya yaḥ veda tam agnim puras dadhe asmai ariṣṭatātaye /
analyzed: namaḥ yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave namaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ uta ye nayanti   utpāraṇasya yaḥ veda tam agnim puras dadhe asmai ariṣṭatātaye  /
translated: Homage to Yama, homage be paid to Death, homage to Fathers who conduct the soul. I place before me Agni whom the man who knows the rite to pass beyond all danger must adore.

original: aitu prāṇaḥ aitu manaḥ aitu cakṣuḥ atho balam / śarīram asya sam vidām tat padbhyām prati tiṣṭhatu //
analyzed: aitu prāṇaḥ aitu manaḥ aitu cakṣuḥ atho balam   śarīram asya sam vidām tat padbhyām prati tiṣṭhatu
translated: Let breath return, let thought return, let eye and vigour come again. Let this man's body be united with his feet.

original: prāṇena agne cakṣuṣā sam sṛja imam sam īraya tanvā sam balena / vettha amṛtasya mā nu gāt mā nu bhūmi gṛhaḥ bhuvat /
analyzed: prāṇena agne cakṣuṣā sam sṛja imam sam īraya tanvā sam balena   vettha amṛtasya mā nu gāt mā nu bhūmi gṛhaḥ bhuvat  /
translated: With breath and eye, O Agni, join him, unite him with his body and his strength. Know thou the Immortal One: let him not go, let him not be a dweller in the house of earth.

original: mā te prāṇaḥ upa dasat mā u apānaḥ api dhāyi te / sūryaḥ tvā adhipatiḥ mṛtyoḥ udāyacchatu raśmibhiḥ /
analyzed: mā te prāṇaḥ upa dasat mā u apānaḥ api dhāyi te   sūryaḥ tvā adhipatiḥ mṛtyoḥ udāyacchatu raśmibhiḥ  /
translated: Let not thy breath forsake thee, let not thy expiration fail thee. Let Sûrya, Lord of Death, lift thee up with his rays.

original: iyam antar vadati jihvā baddhā paniṣpadā / tvayā yakṣmam niḥ avocam śatam ropīḥ ca takmanaḥ /
analyzed: iyam antar vadati jihvā baddhā paniṣpadā    tvayā yakṣmam niḥ avocam śatam ropīḥ ca takmanaḥ  /
translated: This tongue within the mouth, bound fast, and powerless to move, With thee I have expelled disease, a hundred pains, and fever's burning heat.

original: ayam lokaḥ priyatamaḥ devānām aparājitaḥ / yasmai tvam iha mṛtyave diṣṭaḥ puruṣa jajñiṣe / sa ca tvā anu hvayāmasi mā purā jarasaḥ mṛthāḥ //
analyzed: ayam lokaḥ priyatamaḥ devānām aparājitaḥ   yasmai tvam iha mṛtyave diṣṭaḥ puruṣa jajñiṣe   sa ca tvā anu hvayāmasi mā purā jarasaḥ mṛthāḥ  /
translated: We call thee back again. Do not die before thy time.🔽The witchcraft they have wrought in thy raw flesh, the witchcraft they have wrought in thy mixed grain,

original: yām te cakruḥ āme pātre yām cakruḥ miśra dhānye / āme māṃse kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ āme pātre yām cakruḥ miśra dhānye   āme māṃse kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  /
translated: The witchcraft they have wrought in thy raw flesh, I take away again.🔽The witchcraft they have wrought in thy he-goat, the witchcraft they have wrought in thy ewe,

original: yām te cakruḥ kṛkavākau aje vā yām kurīriṇi / avyām te kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ kṛkavākau aje vā yām kurīriṇi   avyām te kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  /
translated: The witchcraft they have wrought in thy she-goat, I take away again.🔽The witchcraft they have wrought in thy one-hoofed beasts, the witchcraft they have wrought in thy two-footed beasts,

original: yām te cakruḥ ekaśaphe paśūnām ubhayādati / gardabhe kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ ekaśaphe paśūnām ubhayādati  / gardabhe kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  /
translated: The witchcraft they have wrought in thy ass, I take away again.🔽The witchcraft they have wrought in thy rootless plant, the witchcraft they have wrought in thy man-like plant,

original: yām te cakruḥ amūlāyām valagam vā narācyām / kṣetre te kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ amūlāyām valagam vā narācyām   kṣetre te kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  /
translated: The witchcraft they have wrought in thy field, I take away again.🔽The witchcraft they have wrought in thy Gārhapatya, the witchcraft they have wrought in thy eastern fire,

original: yām te cakruḥ gārhapatye pūrvāgnau uta duścitaḥ / śālāyām kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ gārhapatye pūrvāgnau uta duścitaḥ    śālāyām kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  /
translated: The witchcraft they have wrought in thy hall, I take away again.

original: yām te cakruḥ sabhāyām yām cakruḥ adhidevane / akṣeṣu kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /🔽yām te cakruḥ senāyām yām cakruḥ iṣvāyudhe / dundubhau kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /🔽yām te kṛtyām kūpe avadadhuḥ śmaśāne vā nicakhnuḥ / sadmani kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ sabhāyām yām cakruḥ adhidevane   akṣeṣu kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  / yām te cakruḥ senāyām yām cakruḥ iṣvāyudhe    dundubhau kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  / yām te kṛtyām kūpe avadadhuḥ śmaśāne vā nicakhnuḥ   sadmani kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām  /
translated: The spell which they have wrought in the assembly, the spell which they have wrought at gambling, The spell which they have wrought in the dice, I send it back again to them.🔽The spell which they have wrought in the army, the spell which they have wrought in the bow, The spell which they have wrought in the drum, I send it back again to them.🔽The spell which they have laid in the well, the spell which they have buried in the cemetery, The spell which they have wrought in the house, I send it back again to them.

original: yām te cakruḥ puruṣa āsthe agnau saṃkasuke ca yām / mrokam nirdāham kravya adam punar prati harāmi tām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ puruṣa āsthe agnau saṃkasuke ca yām    mrokam nirdāham kravya adam punar prati harāmi tām  /
translated: The spell which they have wrought in the human bones, the spell which they have wrought in the fire, the spell which they have wrought in the Mroka, the spell which they have wrought in the flesh-devouring fire, I send it back again to them.

original: apathena ā jabhāra enām tām pathā itas pra hiṇmasi / adhīraḥ maryā adhīrebhyaḥ sam jabhāra acittyā /
analyzed: apathena ā jabhāra enām tām pathā itas pra hiṇmasi   adhīraḥ maryā adhīrebhyaḥ sam jabhāra acittyā  /
translated: He has brought it by a by-path: we send it hence by the right path. The foolish man has brought it from the foolish: he has brought it from the thoughtless.

original: yaḥ cakāra na śaśāka kartum śaśre pādam aṅgurim / cakāra bhadram asmabhyam abhagaḥ bhagavadbhyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ cakāra na śaśāka kartum śaśre pādam aṅgurim    cakāra bhadram asmabhyam abhagaḥ bhagavadbhyaḥ  /
translated: He who has wrought it, but has not been able to do it, has cut his foot and his finger. He has done us good: the unlucky man has brought luck to the lucky.

original: kṛtyā kṛtam valaginam mūlinam śapatheyyam / indraḥ tam hantu mahatā vadhena agniḥ vidhyatu astayā /
analyzed: kṛtyā kṛtam valaginam mūlinam śapatheyyam   indraḥ tam hantu mahatā vadhena agniḥ vidhyatu astayā  /
translated: The spell-maker, the maker of spells, the root-maker, the maker of curses, Indra slay him with a mighty weapon: let Agni pierce him with his dart.

original: doṣaḥ gāya bṛhat gāya dyumat dhehi / ātharvaṇaḥ stuhi devam savitāram /
analyzed: doṣaḥ gāya bṛhat gāya dyumat dhehi   ātharvaṇaḥ stuhi devam savitāram  /
translated: Sing, O Gāya, sing forth the great song, bring the splendid one. O son of Atharvan, praise god Savitar.

original: tam u stuhi yaḥ antar sindhau sūnuḥ / satyasya yuvānam adrogha vācam su śevam /
analyzed: tam u stuhi yaḥ antar sindhau sūnuḥ   satyasya yuvānam adrogha vācam su śevam  /
translated: Praise him who is the son within the sea, the young one of truth, of guileless speech, most gracious.

original: sa ghā naḥ devaḥ savitā sāviṣat amṛtāni bhūri / ubhe suṣṭutī sugātave /
analyzed: sa ghā naḥ devaḥ savitā sāviṣat amṛtāni bhūri    ubhe suṣṭutī sugātave  /
translated: May that god Savitar grant us many immortal blessings, both hymns to be sung for prosperity.

original: indrāya somam ṛtvijaḥ sunota ca dhāvata / stotuḥ yaḥ vacaḥ śṛṇavat dhavam ca me /
analyzed: indrāya somam ṛtvijaḥ sunota ca dhāvata   stotuḥ yaḥ vacaḥ śṛṇavat dhavam ca me  /
translated: O priests, press Soma for Indra, and run with it. May he who hears the singer's speech listen to my call.

original: ā yam viśanti indavaḥ vayaḥ na vṛkṣam andhasaḥ / virapśin vi mṛdhaḥ jahi rakṣasvinīḥ /
analyzed: ā yam viśanti indavaḥ vayaḥ na vṛkṣam andhasaḥ   virapśin vi mṛdhaḥ jahi rakṣasvinīḥ  /
translated: Into whom the drops enter, as the juices into a tree, O you who have a wide mouth, destroy the Raksases who spread evil.

original: sunota soma pāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe / yuvā jeta īśānaḥ sa puruṣṭutaḥ /
analyzed: sunota soma pāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe   yuvā jete īśānaḥ sa puruṣṭutaḥ  /
translated: Press Soma for the Soma-drinker, press Soma for Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt. The young conqueror, the lord, he who is praised by many.

original: pātam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ / apām napāt sindhavaḥ sapta pātana pātu naḥ viṣṇuḥ uta dyauḥ /
analyzed: pātam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ   apām napāt sindhavaḥ sapta pātana pātu naḥ viṣṇuḥ uta dyauḥ  /
translated: May Indra-Pusan, Aditi, the Maruts protect us. May the seven sons of the waters, the rivers, protect us. May Vishnu and the sky protect us.

original: pātām naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī abhiṣṭaye pātu grāvā pātu somaḥ naḥ aṃhasaḥ / pātu naḥ devī subhagā sarasvatī pātu agniḥ śivā ye asya pāyavaḥ /
analyzed: pātām naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī abhiṣṭaye pātu grāvā pātu somaḥ naḥ aṃhasaḥ   pātu naḥ devī subhagā sarasvatī pātu agniḥ śivā ye asya pāyavaḥ  /
translated: May Dyaus and Prithivī protect us for help. May the stone, may Soma protect us from distress. May the blessed goddess Sarasvatī protect us. May Agni, and the auspicious attendants of him, protect us.

original: pātām naḥ deva aśvinā śubhaḥ patī uṣāsānakta uta naḥ uruṣyatām / apām napāt abhihrutī gayasya cit deva tvaṣṭar vardhaya sarvatātaye /
analyzed: pātām naḥ deva aśvinā śubhaḥ patī uṣāsānakta uta naḥ uruṣyatām    apām napāt abhihrutī gayasya cit deva tvaṣṭar vardhaya sarvatātaye  /
translated: Protect us, O ye Gods, O ye Aṣvins, Lords of splendour: guard us, O Dawn and Night, and keep us safe. O Son of Waters, O Tvaṣṭar, God, increase thou the worshipper's prosperity for all his life.

original: tvaṣṭā me daivyam vacaḥ parjanyaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ / putraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ aditiḥ nu pātu naḥ duṣṭaram trāyamāṇam sahaḥ //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā me daivyam vacaḥ parjanyaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ   putraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ aditiḥ nu pātu naḥ duṣṭaram trāyamāṇam sahaḥ  /
translated: Tvaṣṭar, Parjanya, Brahmanaspati, and the divine speech of mine, and Aditi with her sons and brothers, let them protect us. May the invincible strength of Trayamâna protect us.

original: aṃśaḥ bhagaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ / apa tasya dveṣaḥ gamet abhihrutaḥ yāvayat śatrum antitam /
analyzed: aṃśaḥ bhagaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ    apa tasya dveṣaḥ gamet abhihrutaḥ yāvayat śatrum antitam  /
translated: May Aṁśa, Bhaga, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Aditi, and the Maruts protect us. May the hatred of him who hateth us pass away. May he drive away the foe who is near at hand.

original: dhiye sam aśvinā prāvatam naḥ uruṣyāḥ naḥ urujman aprayuchan / dyauḥ pitar yāvaya duchunā yā /
analyzed: dhiye sam aśvinā prāvatam naḥ uruṣyāḥ naḥ urujman aprayuchan    dyauḥ pitar yāvaya duchunā yā  /
translated: O ye Aṣvins, further our thought. Protect us, O ye of wide dominion, never failing. O father Dyaus, drive away our grief and pain.

original: ud enam uttaram naya agne ghṛtena āhuta / sam enam varcasā sṛja prajayā ca bahum kṛdhi //
analyzed: ud enam uttaram naya agne ghṛtena āhuta   sam enam varcasā sṛja prajayā ca bahum kṛdhi  /
translated: Lead him up to the highest place, O Agni, offered with the ghee. Unite him with splendour, and make him abundant for life.

original: indra imam prataram kṛdhi sajātānām asat vaśī / rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam sṛja jīvātave jarase naya //
analyzed: indra imam prataram kṛdhi sajātānām asat vaśī    rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam sṛja jīvātave jarase naya  /
translated: O Indra, make him a leader, the lord of his people. Unite him with the increase of wealth. Lead him to life and old age.

original: yasya kṛṇmaḥ haviḥ gṛhe tam agne vardhaya tvam / tasmai somaḥ adhi bravat ayam ca brahmaṇas patiḥ /
analyzed: yasya kṛṇmaḥ haviḥ gṛhe tam agne vardhaya tvam   tasmai somaḥ adhi bravat ayam ca brahmaṇas patiḥ  /
translated: Him, O Agni, whom we honour in our house, do thou exalt. Let Soma and this Brahmanaspati exalt him.🔽Brahmanaspati, the god who is hostile to us,

original: yaḥ asmān brahmaṇas pate a devaḥ abhimanyate / sarvam tam randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: yaḥ asmān brahmaṇas pate a devaḥ abhimanyate    sarvam tam randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate  /
translated: all of him thou makest easy prey for me, for the sacrificer who presses out the Soma.🔽The evil-wisher who, O Soma, is hostile to us, who is our rival,

original: yaḥ naḥ soma su śaṃsinaḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ ādideśati / vajreṇa asya mukhe jahi sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ soma su śaṃsinaḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ ādideśati   vajreṇa asya mukhe jahi sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati  /
translated: crush him with thy bolt, that he may go away crushed to pieces.🔽He who, O Soma, is hostile to us, whether he be a kinsman or a stranger,

original: yaḥ naḥ soma abhidāsati sanābhiḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ / apa tasya balam tira mahī iva dyauḥ vadhatmanā /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ soma abhidāsati sanābhiḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ    apa tasya balam tira mahī iva dyauḥ vadhatmanā  /
translated: crush his strength, O mighty one, as the heaven crushes the earth.🔽By that path, O Soma, by which the guileless friends, the Âdityas, go,

original: yena soma aditiḥ pathā mitrāḥ vā yanti adruhaḥ / tena naḥ avasā gahi //
analyzed: yena soma aditiḥ pathā mitrāḥ vā yanti adruhaḥ   tena naḥ avasā gahi  /
translated: come thou to us with that help.

original: yena soma sāhantyā asurān randhayāsi naḥ / tena naḥ adhi vocata /
analyzed: yena soma sāhantyā asurān randhayāsi naḥ   tena naḥ adhi vocata  /
translated: By that, O Soma, whereby thou hast made the Asuras easy to be subdued for us,🔽by that do thou protect us.🔽By that whereby ye have chosen the powers of the Asuras, O gods,

original: yena devāḥ asurāṇām ojāṃsi avṛṇīdhvam / tena naḥ śarma yacchata /
analyzed: yena devāḥ asurāṇām ojāṃsi avṛṇīdhvam   tena naḥ śarma yacchata  /
translated: by that do ye grant us protection.🔽As the liana embraces the tree on every side,

original: yathā vṛkṣam libujā samantam pariṣasvaje / eva pari svajasva mām yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ /
analyzed: yathā vṛkṣam libujā samantam pariṣasvaje    eva pari svajasva mām yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ  /
translated: so embrace me, that I may love thee, that I may not be separated from thee.

original: yathā suparṇaḥ prapatan pakṣau nihanti bhūmyām / eva ni hanmi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ /
analyzed: yathā suparṇaḥ prapatan pakṣau nihanti bhūmyām    eva ni hanmi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ  /
translated: As the great eagle, when he flies, beats with his wings the ground, so I beat down thy heart, that thou mayst love me only, and none else but me.

original: yathā ime dyāvāpṛthivī sadyas paryeti sūryaḥ / eva pari emi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ime dyāvāpṛthivī sadyas paryeti sūryaḥ    eva pari emi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagāḥ asaḥ  /
translated: As the sun in a moment encircles both the earth and heaven, so I encompass thy heart, that thou mayst love me only, and none else but me.

original: vāñcha me tanvam pādau vāñcha akṣyau vāñcha sakthyau / akṣyau vṛṣaṇyantyāḥ keśāḥ mām te kāmena śuṣyantu //
analyzed: vāñcha me tanvam pādau vāñcha akṣyau vāñcha sakthyau   akṣyau vṛṣaṇyantyāḥ keśāḥ mām te kāmena śuṣyantu  /
translated: I claim thy body, I claim thy feet, I claim thy eyes, I claim thy thighs. The eyes of thee who art so lovely, and thy hair, shall wither through love of me.

original: mama tvā doṣaṇi śriṣam kṛṇomi hṛdaya śriṣam / yathā mama kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi //
analyzed: mama tvā doṣaṇi śriṣam kṛṇomi hṛdaya śriṣam    yathā mama kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi  /
translated: I make thee mine in the region of the thighs, I make thee mine in the region of the heart, that thou mayst love me in my thoughts, and come to me with love.

original: yāsām nābhiḥ ārehaṇam hṛdi saṃvananam kṛtam gāvaḥ ghṛtasya mātaraḥ amūm sam vānayantu me //
analyzed: yāsām nābhiḥ ārehaṇam hṛdi saṃvananam kṛtam gāvaḥ ghṛtasya mātaraḥ amūm sam vānayantu me
translated: The cows, the mothers of ghee, whose navel is the place of meeting, whose heart is the place of love, let them bring her to me.

original: pṛthivyai śrotrāya vanaspatibhyaḥ agnaye adhipataye svāhā /
analyzed: pṛthivyai śrotrāya vanaspatibhyaḥ agnaye adhipataye svāhā
translated: To the earth, to hearing, to the trees, to Agni as overlord, Hail!

original: prāṇāya antarikṣāya vayobhyaḥ vāyave adhipataye svāhā //
analyzed: prāṇāya antarikṣāya vayobhyaḥ vāyave adhipataye svāhā
translated: To the breath, to the atmosphere, to the birds, to Vayu as overlord, Hail!

original: dive cakṣuṣe nakṣatrebhyaḥ sūryāya adhipataye svāhā /
analyzed: dive cakṣuṣe nakṣatrebhyaḥ sūryāya adhipataye svāhā
translated: To the sky, to the eye, to the stars, to the sun as overlord, Hail!

original: śamīm aśvatthe ārūḍhaḥ tatra puṃsuvanam kṛtam / tat vai putrasya vedanam tat strīṣu ā bharāmasi //🔽puṃsi vai retaḥ bhavati tat striyām anu sicyate / tat vai putrasya vedanam tat prajāpatiḥ abravīt //
analyzed: śamīm aśvatthe ārūḍhaḥ tatra puṃsuvanam kṛtam   tat vai putrasya vedanam tat strīṣu ā bharāmasi  / puṃsi vai retaḥ bhavati tat striyām anu sicyate   tat vai putrasya vedanam tat prajāpatiḥ abravīt
translated: The rite of the consecration of a male child was performed when the god of love was mounted on the Asvattha tree. That is the cause of the birth of a son. We bring that into the women.🔽The seed is in the male, and it is poured into the female. That is the cause of the birth of a son. That Prajapati has declared.

original: prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ sinīvālī acīkḷpat / straiṣūyam anyatra dadhat pumāṃsam u dadhat iha /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ sinīvālī acīkḷpat   straiṣūyam anyatra dadhat pumāṃsam u dadhat iha  /
translated: Prajapati, Anumati, and Sinivali have ordained that the embryo should be formed in one place, and the male child in another.

original: pari dyām iva sūryaḥ ahīnām janima agamam / rātrī jagat iva anyat dhaṃsāt tena te vāraye viṣam /
analyzed: pari dyām iva sūryaḥ ahīnām janima agamam   rātrī jagat iva anyat dhaṃsāt tena te vāraye viṣam  /
translated: I have come to the birth of the snakes, as the sun to the sky. I have come to the birth of the snakes, as the night to the other world. By that I ward off thy poison.

original: yat brahmabhiḥ yat ṛṣibhiḥ yat devaiḥ viditam purā / yat bhūtam bhavyam āsanvat tena te vāraye viṣam /
analyzed: yat brahmabhiḥ yat ṛṣibhiḥ yat devaiḥ viditam purā   yat bhūtam bhavyam āsanvat tena te vāraye viṣam  /
translated: What was known of old by the Brahmans, by the Rishis, by the gods, what is past, what is present, what is to be, by that I ward off thy poison.

original: madhvā pṛñce nadyaḥ parvatāḥ girayaḥ madhu / madhu paruṣṇī śīpālā śam āsne astu śam hṛde /
analyzed: madhvā pṛñce nadyaḥ parvatāḥ girayaḥ madhu    madhu paruṣṇī śīpālā śam āsne astu śam hṛde  /
translated: The rivers, the mountains, the hills are anointed with honey. Honey is in the Parushni, in the Sipala, in the Asna, in the heart. Let it be for thy welfare.

original: namaḥ deva vadhebhyaḥ namaḥ rāja vadhebhyaḥ / atho ye viśyānām vadhāḥ tebhyaḥ mṛtyo namaḥ astu te /
analyzed: namaḥ deva vadhebhyaḥ namaḥ rāja vadhebhyaḥ   atho ye viśyānām vadhāḥ tebhyaḥ mṛtyo namaḥ astu te  /
translated: Homage to the slayers of the gods, homage to the slayers of the kings. And homage to thee, O Death, for the slayers of the people.

original: namaḥ te adhivākāya parāvākāya te namaḥ / sumatyai mṛtyo te namaḥ durmatyai te idam namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ te adhivākāya parāvākāya te namaḥ    sumatyai mṛtyo te namaḥ durmatyai te idam namaḥ  /
translated: To thee, O Death, be homage paid, to thy Adhivaktra homage, and to thy Paravaktra homage. To thy good will, O Death, homage! to thy bad will homage!

original: namaḥ te yātudhānebhyaḥ namaḥ te bheṣajebhyaḥ / namaḥ te mṛtyo mūlebhyaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ idam namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te yātudhānebhyaḥ namaḥ te bheṣajebhyaḥ   namaḥ te mṛtyo mūlebhyaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ idam namaḥ  /
translated: Homage to thee, O Death, for thy Yatudhanas, homage for thy medicines. Homage to thee, O Death, for thy roots, homage to thy Brahmans.

original: asthi sraṃsam paru sraṃsam āsthitam hṛdaya āmayam / balāsam sarvam nāśaya aṅgeṣṭhāḥ yaḥ ca parvasu //🔽niḥ balāsam balāsinaḥ kṣiṇomi muṣkaram yathā / chinadmi asya bandhanam mūlam urvārvā iva /
analyzed: asthi sraṃsam paru sraṃsam āsthitam hṛdaya āmayam   balāsam sarvam nāśaya aṅgeṣṭhāḥ yaḥ ca parvasu  / niḥ balāsam balāsinaḥ kṣiṇomi muṣkaram yathā    chinadmi asya bandhanam mūlam urvārvā iva  /
translated: The disease that breaks the bones, that breaks the joints, that settles in the heart, all wasting, drive thou far away, that which is in the limbs and in the joints.🔽I drive away the wasting malady of him who wastes away, as 'twere a withered leaf. I cut the fetters that bind him fast, as 'twere the root of Urvâ.

original: niḥ balāsā itas pra pata aśuṅgaḥ śiśukaḥ yathā / atha u itas iva hāyanaḥ apa drāhi avīra hā /
analyzed: niḥ balāsā itas pra pata aśuṅgaḥ śiśukaḥ yathā    atha u itas iva hāyanaḥ apa drāhi avīra hā  /
translated: Go hence, thou wasting malady, like a swift-gliding little bird. Or like a youngling of a year, fly hence, O thou who slayest not the brave.

original: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām tava vṛkṣāḥ upastayaḥ / upastiḥ astu saḥ asmākam yaḥ asmām abhidāsati //
analyzed: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām tava vṛkṣāḥ upastayaḥ   upastiḥ astu saḥ asmākam yaḥ asmām abhidāsati  /
translated: Thou art the best of plants: the trees are thy supporters. Let him be our supporter who assails us with malignity.

original: sabandhuḥ ca asabandhuḥ ca yaḥ asmām abhidāsati / teṣām sā vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ /
analyzed: sabandhuḥ ca asabandhuḥ ca yaḥ asmām abhidāsati   teṣām sā vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ  /
translated: Let him who injures us, whether he be kin or stranger, be as stubble to us, as the lowest of all trees.

original: yathā somaḥ oṣadhīnām uttamaḥ haviṣām kṛtaḥ / talāśāḥ vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ oṣadhīnām uttamaḥ haviṣām kṛtaḥ   talāśāḥ vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ  /
translated: As the Tālaśā is the best of trees, so may I be the best of all.

original: ābayaḥ anābayaḥ rasaḥ te ugraḥ ābayo / ā te karambham admasi / ā te karambham admasi /
analyzed: ābayo anābayaḥ rasaḥ te ugraḥ ābayo    ā te karambham admasi    ā te karambham admasi
translated: The juice that is within thee, O Karambha, is strong and intoxicating. We eat thy Karambha. We eat thy Karambha.

original: vihahlaḥ nāma te pitā madāvatī nāma te mātā / sa hina tvam asi yaḥ tvam ātmānam āvayaḥ //
analyzed: vihahlaḥ nāma te pitā madāvatī nāma te mātā    sa hina tvam asi yaḥ tvam ātmānam āvayaḥ
translated: Thy father is named Vihahlu, thy mother is named Madāvatī. Thou art that which thou art, since thou hast chosen thyself.

original: tauvilike avelaya ava ayam ailaba ailayīt / babhruḥ ca babhrukarṇaḥ ca apehi niḥ āla /
analyzed: tauvilike avelaya ava ayam ailaba ailayīt    babhruḥ ca babhrukarṇaḥ ca apehi niḥ āla  /
translated: O Taufilike, O Avelaya, O Ayam, O Ailaba, Ailayit, O Babhru, O Babhrukarṇa, go away, go away, O Nial.

original: alasāla asi pūrva silāñjāla asi uttarā / nīlāgalasāla //
analyzed: alasāla asi pūrva silāñjāla asi uttarā nīlāgalasāla
translated: Thou art Alasala in the east, thou art Silāñjala in the north, thou art Nīlāgalasāla.🔽As this great earth hath received the germ of all existing things,

original: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānām garbham ādadhe / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānām garbham ādadhe   eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave  /
translated: So may thy germ be firmly fixed that thou mayst bring forth a son.🔽As this great earth supports these forest trees,

original: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra imān vanaspatīn / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra imān vanaspatīn    eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave  /
translated: So may thy germ be firmly fixed that thou mayst bring forth a son.🔽As this great earth supports the mountains and the hills,

original: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra parvatān girīn / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra parvatān girīn    eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave  /
translated: So may thy germ be firmly fixed that thou mayst bring forth a son.

original: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra viṣṭhitam jagat / eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra viṣṭhitam jagat eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave  /
translated: As this great Earth supports the world that hath been settled in its place, So may thy child be firmly fixed to give thee life again, O Savitar.

original: īrṣyāyāḥ dhrājim prathamām prathamasyāḥ uta aparām / agnim hṛdayyam śokam tam te niḥ vāpayāmasi //
analyzed: īrṣyāyāḥ dhrājim prathamām prathamasyāḥ uta aparām    agnim hṛdayyam śokam tam te niḥ vāpayāmasi  /
translated: The first and second course of Jealousy, the grief that dwells within thy heart, The sorrow that is in thy heart, that we extract from thee, O man.

original: yathā bhūmiḥ mṛta manāḥ mṛtāt mṛta manastarā / yathā uta mamruṣaḥ manaḥ eva īrṣyoḥ mṛtam manaḥ /
analyzed: yathā bhūmiḥ mṛta manāḥ mṛtāt mṛta manastarā   yathā uta mamruṣaḥ manaḥ eva īrṣyoḥ mṛtam manaḥ  /
translated: As the earth is more dead than the dead, and the dead more dead than the earth, As the mind of one who is dead is more dead than the dead itself, so is the mind of one who is jealous.

original: adaḥ yat te hṛdi śritam manaskam patayiṣṇukam / tatas te īrṣyām muñcāmi niḥ ūṣmāṇam dṛteḥ iva /🔽punantu mā deva janāḥ punantu manavaḥ dhiyā / punantu viśvā bhūtāni pavamānaḥ punātu mā /🔽pavamānaḥ punātu mā kratve dakṣāya jīvase / atha u ariṣṭatātaye /🔽ubhābhyām deva savitar pavitreṇa savena ca / asmān punīhi cakṣase /
analyzed: adaḥ yat te hṛdi śritam manaskam patayiṣṇukam   tatas te īrṣyām muñcāmi niḥ ūṣmāṇam dṛteḥ iva  /🔽punantu mā deva janāḥ punantu manavaḥ dhiyā   punantu viśvā bhūtāni pavamānaḥ punātu mā  /🔽pavamānaḥ punātu mā kratve dakṣāya jīvase    atha u ariṣṭatātaye 🔽ubhābhyām deva savitar pavitreṇa savena ca    asmān punīhi cakṣase

original: agneḥ iva asya dahataḥ eti śuṣmiṇaḥ uta iva mattaḥ vilapan apāyati / anyam asmat icchatu kam cit avrataḥ tapuḥ vadhāya namaḥ astu takmane /
analyzed: agneḥ iva asya dahataḥ eti śuṣmiṇaḥ uta iva mattaḥ vilapan apāyati    anyam asmat icchatu kam cit avrataḥ tapuḥ vadhāya namaḥ astu takmane  /
translated: He goes like one consumed by fire, the mighty one, and as if intoxicated he wails and falls away. Let him choose for himself some other than us, the lawless one, for the slaying of the sinner. Homage be to Takman.

original: namaḥ rudrāya namaḥ astu takmane namaḥ rājñe varuṇāya tviṣīmate / namaḥ dive namaḥ pṛthivyai namaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ rudrāya namaḥ astu takmane namaḥ rājñe varuṇāya tviṣīmate   namaḥ dive namaḥ pṛthivyai namaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ
translated: Homage to Rudra, homage to Takman, homage to the radiant King Varuna. Homage to heaven, homage to earth, homage to the plants.

original: ayam yaḥ abhiśocayiṣṇuḥ viśvā rūpāṇi haritā kṛṇoṣi / tasmai te aruṇāya babhrave namaḥ kṛṇomi vanyāya takmane /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ abhiśocayiṣṇuḥ viśvā rūpāṇi haritā kṛṇoṣi   tasmai te aruṇāya babhrave namaḥ kṛṇomi vanyāya takmane  /
translated: This one who is so eager to burn, who assumes all forms and makes them green, to that red, tawny one of yours, the wild Takman, I offer homage.

original: imāḥ yāḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ tāsām ha bhūmiḥ uttamā / tāsām adhi tvacaḥ aham bheṣajam sam u jagrabham //
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ tāsām ha bhūmiḥ uttamā   tāsām adhi tvacaḥ aham bheṣajam sam u jagrabham  /
translated: These three earths, of which the lowest is the earth, on the skin of these I have taken the healing remedy.

original: śreṣṭham asi bheṣajānām vasiṣṭham vīrudhānām / somaḥ bhagaḥ iva yāmeṣu deveṣu varuṇaḥ yathā /
analyzed: śreṣṭham asi bheṣajānām vasiṣṭham vīrudhānām   somaḥ bhagaḥ iva yāmeṣu deveṣu varuṇaḥ yathā  /
translated: Thou art the best of healing herbs, the most excellent of plants. Like Soma, thou art blessed among the gods, like Varuna.

original: revatīḥ anādhṛṣaḥ siṣāsavaḥ siṣāsatha / uta stha keśa dṛmhaṇīḥ atha u ha keśa vardhanīḥ /
analyzed: revatīḥ anādhṛṣaḥ siṣāsavaḥ siṣāsatha    uta stha keśa dṛmhaṇīḥ atha u ha keśa vardhanīḥ  /
translated: Ye are prosperous, invincible, longing for victory, longing for victory. Ye are also hair-strengtheners, and also hair-growers.

original: kṛṣṇam niyānam harayaḥ suparṇāḥ apaḥ vasānāḥ divam ud patanti / te āvavṛtran sadanāt ṛtasya āt id ghṛtena pṛthivīm vi ūduḥ /🔽payasvatīḥ kṛṇutha apaḥ oṣadhīḥ śivāḥ yat ejatha marutaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ / ūrjam ca tatra sumatim ca pinvata yatra naraḥ marutaḥ siñcatha madhu //
analyzed: kṛṣṇam niyānam harayaḥ suparṇāḥ apaḥ vasānāḥ divam ud patanti   te āvavṛtran sadanāt ṛtasya āt id ghṛtena pṛthivīm vi ūduḥ  / payasvatīḥ kṛṇutha apaḥ oṣadhīḥ śivāḥ yat ejatha marutaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ    ūrjam ca tatra sumatim ca pinvata yatra naraḥ marutaḥ siñcatha madhu  /
translated: The black-backed, the golden-winged birds, clothed in water, fly up to heaven. They have turned back from the seat of truth, and have bedewed the earth with ghee.🔽Make the waters and the plants full of milk, O Maruts, when ye move along, O ye whose breasts are bright with gems. Increase the strength and the favour there, O Maruts, where ye sprinkle honey, O ye men.

original: uda prutaḥ marutaḥ tām iyarta vṛṣṭiḥ yā viśvā nivataḥ pṛṇāti / ejāti glahā kanyā iva tunnairum tundānā patyā iva jāyā /
analyzed: uda prutaḥ marutaḥ tām iyarta vṛṣṭiḥ yā viśvā nivataḥ pṛṇāti   ejāti glahā kanyā iva tunnairum tundānā patyā iva jāyā  /
translated: The rain which the Maruts, the swift ones, send forth fills all the hollow places. The rain comes down with a loud noise, like a maiden with her breasts rising, like a wife with her husband.

original: sasruṣīḥ tat apasaḥ divā naktam ca sasruṣīḥ / vareṇya kratuḥ aham apaḥ devīḥ upa hvaye /
analyzed: sasruṣīḥ tat apasaḥ divā naktam ca sasruṣīḥ   vareṇya kratuḥ aham apaḥ devīḥ upa hvaye  /
translated: The waters are to be praised by day and night, the waters are to be praised. I call the divine waters, I who have a desirable will.

original: otāḥ āpaḥ karmaṇyāḥ muñcantu itas praṇītaye / sadyas kṛṇvantu etave /
analyzed: otāḥ āpaḥ karmaṇyāḥ muñcantu itas praṇītaye   sadyas kṛṇvantu etave  /
translated: The waters are set in motion, they are ready for the work. Let them go forth to the leading forward. Let them quickly make it ready for the sacrifice.

original: devasya savituḥ save karma kṛṇvantu mānuṣāḥ / śam naḥ bhavantu apaḥ oṣadhīḥ śivāḥ /
analyzed: devasya savituḥ save karma kṛṇvantu mānuṣāḥ   śam naḥ bhavantu apaḥ oṣadhīḥ śivāḥ
translated: Let men perform the rite in the impulse of God Savitar. Be gracious to us, O waters and plants.

original: himavataḥ pra sravanti sindhau samaha saṅgamaḥ / āpaḥ ha mahyam tat devīḥ dadan hṛd dyota bheṣajam /
analyzed: himavataḥ pra sravanti sindhau samaha saṅgamaḥ   āpaḥ ha mahyam tat devīḥ dadan hṛd dyota bheṣajam  /
translated: In the river which flows from the Himalaya, there is a great confluence. May the waters, the goddesses, grant me that heart-illuminating remedy.

original: yat me akṣyoḥ ādidyota pārṣṇyoḥ prapadoḥ ca yat / āpaḥ tat sarvam niḥ karan bhiṣajām subhiṣaktamāḥ /
analyzed: yat me akṣyoḥ ādidyota pārṣṇyoḥ prapadoḥ ca yat    āpaḥ tat sarvam niḥ karan bhiṣajām subhiṣaktamāḥ  /
translated: Whatever has been injured in my eyes, in my heels and toes, may the waters remove all that, the best of physicians, the most skillful healers.

original: sindhu patnīḥ sindhu rājñīḥ sarvāḥ yāḥ nadyaḥ sthana / datta naḥ tasya bheṣajam tena vaḥ bhunajāmahai /
analyzed: sindhu patnīḥ sindhu rājñīḥ sarvāḥ yāḥ nadyaḥ sthana   datta naḥ tasya bheṣajam tena vaḥ bhunajāmahai  /
translated: The wives of the rivers, the queens of the rivers, all of you who are rivers, grant us the remedy for that. Through that we will enjoy you.

original: pañca ca yāḥ pañcāśat ca saṃyanti manyāḥ abhi / itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva /
analyzed: pañca ca yāḥ pañcāśat ca saṃyanti manyāḥ abhi   itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva  /
translated: And those five and fifty which come together on the neck, may all those depart from here like the words of one who is despised.

original: sapta ca yāḥ saptatiḥ ca saṃyanti graivyāḥ abhi / itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva /
analyzed: sapta ca yāḥ saptatiḥ ca saṃyanti graivyāḥ abhi   itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva  /
translated: And those seven and seventy which come together on the throat, may all those depart from here like the words of one who is despised.

original: nava ca yāḥ navatiḥ ca saṃyanti skandhyāḥ abhi / itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva /
analyzed: nava ca yāḥ navatiḥ ca saṃyanti skandhyāḥ abhi   itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva  /
translated: And those nine and ninety which come together on the shoulders, may all those depart from here like the words of one who is despised.

original: ava mā pāpman sṛja vaśī san mṛdayā asi naḥ / ā mā bhadrasya loke pāpman dhehi a vihrutam /
analyzed: ava mā pāpman sṛja vaśī san mṛdayā asi naḥ    ā mā bhadrasya loke pāpman dhehi a vihrutam  /
translated: Cast me off, O sin, being powerful, be gentle to us. Lead me not, O sin, into the world of the good, uninjured.

original: yaḥ naḥ pāpman na jahāsi tam u tvā jahimaḥ vayam / pathām anu vyāvartane anyam pāpmā anu padyatām /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ pāpman na jahāsi tam u tvā jahimaḥ vayam   pathām anu vyāvartane anyam pāpmā anu padyatām  /
translated: O sin, we drive thee away, if thou dost not leave us of thine own accord. Turn thee away from our paths, and let the sin fall on another.

original: anyatra asmat ni ucyatu sahasra akṣaḥ amartyaḥ / yam dveṣāma tam ṛchatu yam u dviṣmaḥ tam id jahi //
analyzed: anyatra asmat ni ucyatu sahasra akṣaḥ amartyaḥ   yam dveṣāma tam ṛchatu yam u dviṣmaḥ tam id jahi  /
translated: Let the thousand-eyed immortal drive thee far away from us. Let the sin fall on him whom we hate. Kill him whom we hate.

original: devāḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ yat ichan dūtaḥ nirṛtyāḥ idam ājagāma / tasmai arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtim śam naḥ astu dvipade śam catuṣpade /🔽śivaḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ naḥ astu anāgāḥ devāḥ śakunaḥ gṛham naḥ / agniḥ hi vipraḥ juṣatām haviḥ naḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī naḥ vṛṇaktu //
analyzed: devāḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ yat ichan dūtaḥ nirṛtyāḥ idam ājagāma   tasmai arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtim śam naḥ astu dvipade śam catuṣpade  / śivaḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ naḥ astu anāgāḥ devāḥ śakunaḥ gṛham naḥ   agniḥ hi vipraḥ juṣatām haviḥ naḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī naḥ vṛṇaktu  /
translated: The dove, O Gods, sent by Destruction, hath come hither as a messenger of Death. To him let us offer praise, let us make atonement. To us be peace, to our bipeds and quadrupeds.🔽To us be the dove auspicious, sent by Destruction. Let the bird, O Gods, be harmless to our house. Let the priest Agni accept our offering. Let the missile flying through the air spare us.

original: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhāti asmān āṣṭrī padam kṛṇute agnidhāne / śivaḥ gobhyaḥ uta puruṣebhyaḥ naḥ astu mā naḥ devāḥ iha hiṃsīt kapota /
analyzed: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhāti asmān āṣṭrī padam kṛṇute agnidhāne    śivaḥ gobhyaḥ uta puruṣebhyaḥ naḥ astu mā naḥ devāḥ iha hiṃsīt kapota  /
translated: The missile flying through the air does not smite us. The bird makes its nest in the place for the sacred grass. To us be the dove auspicious, to our cattle and our men. Let it not harm us here, O Gods, the dove.

original: ṛcā kapotam nudata praṇodam iṣam madantaḥ pari gām nayāmaḥ / saṃlobhayantaḥ duritā padāni hitvā naḥ ūrjam pra padāt pathiṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: ṛcā kapotam nudata praṇodam iṣam madantaḥ pari gām nayāmaḥ    saṃlobhayantaḥ duritā padāni hitvā naḥ ūrjam pra padāt pathiṣṭhaḥ  /
translated: Drive off the dove, the messenger of evil, with a verse of praise. Rejoicing in our food, we lead the cow around.

original: pari ime agnim arṣata pari ime gām aneṣata / deveṣu akrata śravaḥ kaḥ imān ā dadharṣati //
analyzed: pari ime agnim arṣata pari ime gām aneṣata    deveṣu akrata śravaḥ kaḥ imān ā dadharṣati  /
translated: These have flowed round this Agni, these have brought the cow hither. They have gained glory among the gods. Who will dare to despise these?

original: yaḥ prathamaḥ pravatam āsasāda bahubhyaḥ panthām an upaspaśānaḥ / yaḥ asya īśe dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ tasmai yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave //
analyzed: yaḥ prathamaḥ pravatam āsasāda bahubhyaḥ panthām an upaspaśānaḥ   yaḥ asya īśe dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ tasmai yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave  /
translated: He who first hath gained the path, the way for many, not to be looked on, who is lord of his own two-footed and four-footed creatures, to him, to Yama, to Death be homage paid.

original: amūn hetiḥ patatriṇī ni etu yat ulūkaḥ vadati mogham etat / yat vā kapota padam agnau kṛṇoti //
analyzed: amūn hetiḥ patatriṇī ni etu yat ulūkaḥ vadati mogham etat   yat vā kapota padam agnau kṛṇoti  /
translated: Let the darting bird fly down upon them. Vain is the cry of the owl. In vain the dove hath made its nest in the fire.

original: yau te dūtau nirṛte idam etaḥ a prahitau prahitau vā gṛham naḥ / kapota ulūkābhyām a padam tat astu /
analyzed: yau te dūtau nirṛte idam etaḥ a prahitau prahitau vā gṛham naḥ    kapota ulūkābhyām a padam tat astu  /
translated: The two messengers of thine, O Nirriti, who come hither, sent or unsent to our house, let the cry of the dove and the owl be vain.

original: avairahatyāya idam ā papatyāt su vīra tāyai idam ā sasadyāt / parāṅ eva parā vada parācīm anu saṃvatam / yathā yamasya tvā gṛhe arasam praticākaśān ābhūkam praticākaśān /
analyzed: avairahatyāya idam ā papatyāt su vīra tāyai idam ā sasadyāt    parāṅ eva parā vada parācīm anu saṃvatam    yathā yamasya tvā gṛhe arasam praticākaśān ābhūkam praticākaśān  /
translated: Far away, far away speak thou, along the year that goes away, that in the house of Yama I may look upon thee as without strength, that I may look upon thee as a slave.

original: devāḥ imam madhunā saṃyutam yavam sarasvatyām adhi maṇau acarkṛṣuḥ / indraḥ āsīt sīra patiḥ śatakratuḥ kīnāśāḥ āsan marutaḥ sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ imam madhunā saṃyutam yavam sarasvatyām adhi maṇau acarkṛṣuḥ   indraḥ āsīt sīra patiḥ śatakratuḥ kīnāśāḥ āsan marutaḥ sudānavaḥ  /
translated: The gods have ploughed this barley, mixed with honey, in the pot on the Sarasvati. Indra was the lord of the plough, he of a hundred powers; the Maruts, the bountiful, were the ploughmen.

original: yaḥ te madaḥ avakeśaḥ vikeśaḥ yena abhihasyam puruṣam kṛṇoṣi / ārāt tvat anyā vanāni vṛkṣi tvam śami śata valśā vi roha /
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ avakeśaḥ vikeśaḥ yena abhihasyam puruṣam kṛṇoṣi   ārāt tvat anyā vanāni vṛkṣi tvam śami śata valśā vi roha  /
translated: The intoxication which thou hast, which makes the hair stand on end, whereby thou makest a man to laugh, far from thee are other woods which thou wilt destroy. Thou, O Sami, shalt shoot forth with a hundred branches.

original: bṛhat palāśe subhage varṣa vṛddhe ṛtāvari / mātā iva putrebhyaḥ mṛḍa keśebhyaḥ śami //
analyzed: bṛhat palāśe subhage varṣa vṛddhe ṛtāvari   mātā iva putrebhyaḥ mṛḍa keśebhyaḥ śami  /
translated: O thou with the great leaf, O fortunate one, thou that growest in the rain, O thou that art rich in truth, be gracious to the hair, O mother, as to thy sons.

original: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras / pitaram ca prayan svar /
analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras    pitaram ca prayan svar  /
translated: This dappled bull hath come, he hath sat down before his mother and his father, and hath gone to heaven.

original: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānataḥ / vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ svar /
analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānataḥ   vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ svar  /
translated: He moves within the light, by his inspiration and his expiration. The great bull hath disclosed the heaven.

original: triṃśat dhāmā vi rājati vāc pataṅgaḥ aśiśriyat / prati vastoḥ ahar dyubhiḥ //
analyzed: triṃśat dhāmā vi rājati vāc pataṅgaḥ aśiśriyat   prati vastoḥ ahar dyubhiḥ
translated: The Bird of Air hath settled in the place of thirty lights, and hath assumed the form of Day.

original: antardāve juhuta su etat yātudhāna kṣayaṇam ghṛtena / ārāt rakṣāṃsi prati daha tvam agne na naḥ gṛhāṇām upa tītapāsi //
analyzed: antardāve juhuta su etat yātudhāna kṣayaṇam ghṛtena    ārāt rakṣāṃsi prati daha tvam agne na naḥ gṛhāṇām upa tītapāsi  /
translated: In the internal fire-place offer this oblation of ghee, the slaughter of the Yatudhana. From afar, O Agni, burn thou the Rakshas: come not near our houses to destroy them.

original: rudraḥ vaḥ grīvāḥ aśarait piśācāḥ pṛṣṭīḥ vaḥ api śṛṇātu yātudhānāḥ / vīrudh vaḥ viśvatovīryā yamena sam ajīgamat /
analyzed: rudraḥ vaḥ grīvāḥ aśarait piśācāḥ pṛṣṭīḥ vaḥ api śṛṇātu yātudhānāḥ   vīrudh vaḥ viśvatovīryā yamena sam ajīgamat  /
translated: Rudra hath pierced your necks, O Pisâchas. Let the Yâtudhânas tear your sides. The plant hath come to you, all-powerful, to Yama.

original: abhayam mitrāvaruṇau iha astu naḥ arciṣā attriṇaḥ nudatam pratīcaḥ / mā jñātāram mā pratiṣṭhām vidanta mithas vighnānāḥ upa yantu mṛtyum //
analyzed: abhayam mitrāvaruṇau iha astu naḥ arciṣā attriṇaḥ nudatam pratīcaḥ   mā jñātāram mā pratiṣṭhām vidanta mithas vighnānāḥ upa yantu mṛtyum  /
translated: Here, O Mitra-Varuṇa, be ye a refuge for us. With your flame drive ye away the greedy demons. Let them not find the knower, nor the place of rest. Let them go to their own destruction, to death.

original: yasya idam ā rajaḥ yujaḥ tuje janā navam svar / indrasya rantyam bṛhat //
analyzed: yasya idam ā rajaḥ yujaḥ tuje janā navam svar    indrasya rantyam bṛhat  /
translated: Whose is this realm, whose are these people, who is he that hath come to the new light? The great abode of Indra is this.

original: na ādhṛṣaḥ ā dadhṛṣate dhṛṣāṇaḥ dhṛṣitaḥ śavaḥ / purā yathā vyathiḥ śravaḥ indrasya naḥ ādhṛṣe śavaḥ //
analyzed: na ādhṛṣaḥ ā dadhṛṣate dhṛṣāṇaḥ dhṛṣitaḥ śavaḥ   purā yathā vyathiḥ śravaḥ indrasya naḥ ādhṛṣe śavaḥ
translated: The daring one, daring, hath not dared to dare. As of old, so now, let not the fear of Indra's might prevail against us.

original: sa naḥ dadātu tām rayim urum piśaṅga saṃdṛśam / indraḥ patiḥ tuviṣṭamaḥ janeṣu ā /🔽pra agnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām / sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ dadātu tām rayim urum piśaṅga saṃdṛśam   indraḥ patiḥ tuviṣṭamaḥ janeṣu ā  pra agnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām   sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he vouchsafe us that wealth, vast and bright-hued, Indra, the most mighty Lord among the people.🔽Send forth your voice to Agni, to the Bull of all the people. May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yaḥ rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati agniḥ tigmena śociṣā / sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ /🔽yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvataḥ tiras dhanva atirocate / sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati agniḥ tigmena śociṣā   sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ  / yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvataḥ tiras dhanva atirocate    sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ  /
translated: Agni who drives away the Raksases with his sharp flame, may he lead us beyond our foes.🔽He who shines beyond the furthermost, beyond the desert, may he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yaḥ viśvā abhi vipaśyati bhuvanā sam ca paśyati / sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā abhi vipaśyati bhuvanā sam ca paśyati   sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ  /
translated: He who beholds all things, and sees together all existing things, may he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yaḥ asya pāre rajasaḥ śukraḥ agniḥ ajāyata / sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ /🔽vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ ūtaye ā pra yātu parāvataḥ / agniḥ naḥ suṣṭutīḥ upa /
analyzed: yaḥ asya pāre rajasaḥ śukraḥ agniḥ ajāyata   sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ  vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ ūtaye ā pra yātu parāvataḥ   agniḥ naḥ suṣṭutīḥ upa  /
translated: The bright Agni who hath been born beyond this world of life, may he lead us beyond our foes.🔽Vaisvânara, come hitherward to give us aid from yonder world: let Agni come to our lauds.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ āgamat imam yajñam sajūs upa / agniḥ uktheṣu aṃhasu /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ āgamat imam yajñam sajūs upa   agniḥ uktheṣu aṃhasu  /
translated: Vaisvânara hath come to this our sacrifice, to sit with us: Agni at our invocations and our woes.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ aṅgirasām stomam uktham ca cākḷpat / ā eṣu dyumnam svar yamat //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ aṅgirasām stomam uktham ca cākḷpat ā eṣu dyumnam svar yamat
translated: Vaisvânara hath ordered the Angirases' hymn and laud: to these hath he sent splendour and the light of heaven.

original: ṛtāvānam vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣaḥ patim / ajasram gharmam īmahe //
analyzed: ṛtāvānam vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣaḥ patim ajasram gharmam īmahe
translated: We seek the Holy One, the All-pervading, the Lord of the light of truth, the never-failing heat.

original: sa viśvā prati cākḷpa ṛtūṃr ud sṛjate vaśī / yajñasya vayaḥ uttiran /
analyzed: sa viśvā prati cākḷpe ṛtūṃr ud sṛjate vaśī   yajñasya vayaḥ uttiran
translated: He, the powerful, hath measured out all things, and loosed the seasons, passing over the life of sacrifice.

original: agniḥ pareṣu dhāmasu kāmaḥ bhūtasya bhavyasya / samrāt ekaḥ vi rājati //
analyzed: agniḥ pareṣu dhāmasu kāmaḥ bhūtasya bhavyasya   samrāt ekaḥ vi rājati  /
translated: Agni, the wish of what hath been and what shall be, is Sovran Lord, sole King of all the worlds.

original: upa prāgāt sahasrākṣaḥ yuktvā śapathaḥ ratham / śaptāram anvichat mama vṛkaḥ iva avimataḥ gṛham /
analyzed: upa prāgāt sahasrākṣaḥ yuktvā śapathaḥ ratham    śaptāram anvichat mama vṛkaḥ iva avimataḥ gṛham  /
translated: The thousand-eyed hath come to us, yoking his chariot, Oaths, and hath sought the man who hath sworn falsely, as a wolf seeks his lair.

original: pari naḥ vṛṅgdhi śapatha hradam agniḥ iva ā dahan / śaptāram atra naḥ jahi divaḥ vṛkṣam iva aśaniḥ /
analyzed: pari naḥ vṛṅgdhi śapatha hradam agniḥ iva ā dahan    śaptāram atra naḥ jahi divaḥ vṛkṣam iva aśaniḥ
translated: O Oaths, avoid us, as a fire avoids a lake. Slay thou the man who sweareth falsely, as the lightning of heaven a tree.

original: yaḥ naḥ śapāt a śapataḥ śapataḥ yaḥ ca naḥ śapāt / śune peṣṭram iva avakṣāmam tam prati asyāmi mṛtyave /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ śapāt a śapataḥ śapataḥ yaḥ ca naḥ śapāt    śune peṣṭram iva avakṣāmam tam prati asyāmi mṛtyave  /
translated: The man who sweareth falsely against us, or who sweareth against the man who sweareth falsely against us, him I hurl as 'twere a clod of earth at a dog against Death.

original: siṃhe vyāghraḥ uta yā pṛdākau tviṣiḥ agnau brāhmaṇe sūrye yā / indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā /
analyzed: siṃhe vyāghraḥ uta yā pṛdākau tviṣiḥ agnau brāhmaṇe sūrye yā    indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā  /
translated: The splendour that is in the lion, in the tiger, in the leopard, in the flame, in the Brahman, in the sun, the Goddess who hath brought forth the prosperous Indra, may she come to us, agreeing with us in glory.

original: yā hastini dvīpini yā hiraṇye tviṣiḥ apsu goṣu yā puruṣeṣu / indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā /
analyzed: yā hastini dvīpini yā hiraṇye tviṣiḥ apsu goṣu yā puruṣeṣu   indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā  /
translated: The Goddess who hath brought forth the blessed Indra, may she come to us, agreeing with us in glory.🔽The splendour that is in the chariot, in the wheels, in the bull's strength, in the wind, in Parjanya's vigour,

original: rathe akṣeṣu ṛṣabhasya vāje vāte parjanye varuṇasya śuṣme / indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā /
analyzed: rathe akṣeṣu ṛṣabhasya vāje vāte parjanye varuṇasya śuṣme    indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā  /
translated: The Goddess who hath brought forth the blessed Indra, may she come to us, agreeing with us in glory.🔽The splendour that is in the Kshatriya, in the drum, in the extended (bow), in the horse's strength, in man's skill,

original: rājanye dundubhau āyatāyām aśvasya vāje puruṣasya māyau / indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā samvidānā /
analyzed: rājanye dundubhau āyatāyām aśvasya vāje puruṣasya māyau   indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā samvidānā  /
translated: The Goddess who hath brought forth the blessed Indra, may she come to us, agreeing with us in glory.🔽Let the glorious offering, O Indra, be increased, a thousandfold strong, well-fashioned, well-made,

original: yaśaḥ haviḥ vardhatām indra jūtam sahasra vīryam su bhṛtam sahaskṛtam / prasarsrāṇam anu dīrghāya cakṣase haviṣmantam mā vardhaya jyeṣṭhatātaye /
analyzed: yaśaḥ haviḥ vardhatām indra jūtam sahasra vīryam su bhṛtam sahaskṛtam    prasarsrāṇam anu dīrghāya cakṣase haviṣmantam mā vardhaya jyeṣṭhatātaye  /
translated: Stretching out after the far-reaching eye, increase the worshipper for the sake of pre-eminence.🔽Let us approach the glorious Indra with glory, let us honour him with homage, the glorious one.

original: achā naḥ indram yaśasam yaśobhiḥ yaśasvinam namasānāḥ vidhema / sa naḥ rāsva rāṣṭram indra jūtam tasya te rātau yaśasaḥ syāma /
analyzed: achā naḥ indram yaśasam yaśobhiḥ yaśasvinam namasānāḥ vidhema    sa naḥ rāsva rāṣṭram indra jūtam tasya te rātau yaśasaḥ syāma  /
translated: Grant us a kingdom, O Indra, urged on by the offering; in the enjoyment of that bounty of thine may we be glorious.

original: yaśāḥ indraḥ yaśāḥ agniḥ yaśāḥ somaḥ ajāyata / yaśāḥ viśvasya bhūtasya aham asmi yaśastamaḥ /
analyzed: yaśāḥ indraḥ yaśāḥ agniḥ yaśāḥ somaḥ ajāyata   yaśāḥ viśvasya bhūtasya aham asmi yaśastamaḥ  /
translated: Indra is glorious, glorious is Agni, glorious was Soma born. I am the most glorious of all existing things.

original: abhayam dyāvāpṛthivī iha astu naḥ abhayam somaḥ savitā naḥ kṛṇotu / abhayam naḥ astu uru antarikṣam sapta ṛṣīṇām ca haviṣā abhayam naḥ astu /
analyzed: abhayam dyāvāpṛthivī iha astu naḥ abhayam somaḥ savitā naḥ kṛṇotu   abhayam naḥ astu uru antarikṣam sapta ṛṣīṇām ca haviṣā abhayam naḥ astu  /
translated: May Heaven and Earth be free from danger for us here. May Soma and Savitar make us free from danger. May the wide air be free from danger for us. May the oblation of the seven Rishis make us free from danger.

original: asmai grāmāya pradiśaḥ catasraḥ ūrjam su bhūtam svasti savitā naḥ kṛṇotu / a śatru indraḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu anyatra rājñām abhi yātu manyuḥ /
analyzed: asmai grāmāya pradiśaḥ catasraḥ ūrjam su bhūtam svasti savitā naḥ kṛṇotu   a śatru indraḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu anyatra rājñām abhi yātu manyuḥ  /
translated: May Savitar make for this village and for the four quarters of the world prosperity and strength and well-being. May Indra make us free from enemies and free from danger. Let the kings' wrath turn elsewhere than towards us.

original: anamitram naḥ adharāt anamitram naḥ uttarāt / indra anamitram naḥ paścāt anamitram puras kṛdhi //
analyzed: anamitram naḥ adharāt anamitram naḥ uttarāt   indra anamitram naḥ paścāt anamitram puras kṛdhi  /
