translated: With the caul of snow we cover thee, O house. Be thou cold to others, but to us be thou a remedy. May Agni make a remedy.🔽O Viśvajit, give to Trāyamānā. O Trāyamānā, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: trāyamāṇe viśvajite mā pari dehi / viśvajit dvipād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam /
analyzed: trāyamāṇe viśvajite mā pari dehi   viśvajit dvipād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam  /
translated: O Trāyamānā, give to Viśvajit. O Viśvajit, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: viśvajit kalyāṇyai mā pari dehi / kalyāṇi dvipād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam /
analyzed: viśvajit kalyāṇyai mā pari dehi   kalyāṇi dvipād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam  /
translated: Give me to the auspicious one who conquers all. O auspicious one, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: kalyāṇi sarva vide mā pari dehi / sarva vid dvi pād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam /
analyzed: kalyāṇi sarva vide mā pari dehi   / sarva vid dvi pād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam  /
translated: Give me to the all-knowing one who is auspicious. O all-knowing one, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: tvam naḥ medhe prathamā gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ ā gahi / tvam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ tvam naḥ asi yajñiyā /
analyzed: tvam naḥ medhe prathamā gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ ā gahi   tvam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ tvam naḥ asi yajñiyā  /
translated: Come to us first, O intelligence, with cattle and horses. You are the ray of the sun, you are our worthy one.

original: medhām aham prathamām brahmaṇvatīm brahma jūtām ṛṣiṣṭutām / prapītām brahmacāribhiḥ devānām avase huve /
analyzed: medhām aham prathamām brahmaṇvatīm brahma jūtām ṛṣiṣṭutām   prapītām brahmacāribhiḥ devānām avase huve  /
translated: I invoke the first intelligence, full of Brahman, impelled by Brahman, praised by the sages, drunk by the celibate students, for the sake of the gods.

original: yām medhām ṛbhavaḥ viduḥ yām medhām asurāḥ viduḥ / ṛṣayaḥ bhadrām medhām yām viduḥ tām mayi ā veśayāmasi //
analyzed: yām medhām ṛbhavaḥ viduḥ yām medhām asurāḥ viduḥ   ṛṣayaḥ bhadrām medhām yām viduḥ tām mayi ā veśayāmasi  /
translated: The intelligence which the Rbhus know, the intelligence which the Asuras know, the auspicious intelligence which the sages know, we place that in me.

original: yām ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ medhām medhāvinaḥ viduḥ / tayā mām adya medhayā agne medhāvinam kṛṇu //
analyzed: yām ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ medhām medhāvinaḥ viduḥ   tayā mām adya medhayā agne medhāvinam kṛṇu  /
translated: The intelligence which the sages who create beings and are intelligent know, with that intelligence make me intelligent today, O Agni.

original: medhām sāyam medhām prātar medhām madhyandinam pari / medhām sūryasya raśmibhiḥ vacasā veśayāmahe /
analyzed: medhām sāyam medhām prātar medhām madhyandinam pari   medhām sūryasya raśmibhiḥ vacasā veśayāmahe  /
translated: In the evening, in the morning, at midday, we place the intelligence with the rays of the sun and with our words.

original: pippalī kṣipta bheṣajī uta atividdha bheṣajī / tām devāḥ sam akalpayan iyam jīvitavai alam /
analyzed: pippalī kṣipta bheṣajī uta atividdha bheṣajī   tām devāḥ sam akalpayan iyam jīvitavai alam  /
translated: The Pepper is the medicine for one who has swallowed poison, and the medicine for one who has been deeply pierced. The Gods have made it ready, this is the medicine for life.

original: pippalyaḥ sam avadanta āyatīḥ jananāt adhi / yam jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: pippalyaḥ sam avadanta āyatīḥ jananāt adhi   yam jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ  /
translated: The future Pepper-grains have spoken from the time of birth: 'The man whom we shall find alive shall not be harmed.'

original: asurāḥ tvā ni akhanan devāḥ tvā ud avapan punar / vātīkṛtasya bheṣajīm atho kṣiptasya bheṣajīm /
analyzed: asurāḥ tvā ni akhanan devāḥ tvā ud avapan punar    vātīkṛtasya bheṣajīm atho kṣiptasya bheṣajīm  /
translated: The Asuras have dug thee up, the Gods have caused thee to spring up again. The medicine for one who has swallowed poison, and the medicine for one who has been deeply pierced.

original: pratnaḥ hi kam īḍyaḥ adhvareṣu sanāt ca hotā navyaḥ ca satsi / svām ca agne tanvam piprāyasva asmabhyam ca saubhagam ā yajasva //
analyzed: pratnaḥ hi kam īḍyaḥ adhvareṣu sanāt ca hotā navyaḥ ca satsi    svām ca agne tanvam piprāyasva asmabhyam ca saubhagam ā yajasva  /
translated: For thou art ancient, meet for praise at sacrifices: thou sittest as Hotar from of old and now. So, Agni, cherish thou thy body, and to us bring felicity and worship.

original: jyeṣṭha ghnyām jātaḥ vicṛtoḥ yamasya mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam / ati enam neṣat duritāni viśvā dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya /
analyzed: jyeṣṭha ghnyām jātaḥ vicṛtoḥ yamasya mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam    ati enam neṣat duritāni viśvā dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  /
translated: Born in the Jyeshthakanya, from the root of Yama's tree, protect him from the spreading plague. May he lead him beyond all evils, for a hundred autumns, for a life of lengthened years.

original: vyāghre ahni ajaniṣṭa vīraḥ nakṣatra jāḥ jāyamānaḥ su vīraḥ / sa mā vadhīt pitaram vardhamānaḥ mā mātaram pra minīt janitrīm /
analyzed: vyāghre ahni ajaniṣṭa vīraḥ nakṣatra jāḥ jāyamānaḥ su vīraḥ    sa mā vadhīt pitaram vardhamānaḥ mā mātaram pra minīt janitrīm  /
translated: On the day of the tiger was the hero born, the son of the stars, born with brave sons. Let him, as he grows in strength, slay not his father, nor wrong his mother who gave him birth.

original: imam me agne puruṣam mumugdhi ayam yaḥ baddhaḥ su yataḥ lālapīti / atas adhi te kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam yadā anunmaditaḥ asati /
analyzed: imam me agne puruṣam mumugdhi ayam yaḥ baddhaḥ su yataḥ lālapīti   atas adhi te kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam yadā anunmaditaḥ asati  /
translated: Set free this man of mine, O Agni, this who bound and well-yoked is wailing. Henceforth let him make thee offering when he is not beside himself with frenzy.

original: agniḥ te ni śamayatu yadi te manaḥ udyutam / kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam yathā an unmaditaḥ asasi //
analyzed: agniḥ te ni śamayatu yadi te manaḥ udyutam   kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam yathā an unmaditaḥ asasi  /
translated: Let Agni soothe thy spirit if it be distraught. I, knowing, make a medicine that thou mayst not be beside thyself with frenzy.

original: deva enasāt unmaditam unmattam rakṣasaḥ pari / kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam yadā an unmaditaḥ asati //
analyzed: deva enasāt unmaditam unmattam rakṣasaḥ pari   kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam yadā an unmaditaḥ asati  /
translated: Distracted by a god, beside thyself with frenzy, or seized by a fiend, I, knowing, make a medicine that thou mayst not be beside thyself with frenzy.

original: punar tvā duḥ apsarasaḥ punar indraḥ punar bhagaḥ / punar tvā duḥ viśve devāḥ yathā anunmaditaḥ asasi /
analyzed: punar tvā duḥ apsarasaḥ punar indraḥ punar bhagaḥ   punar tvā duḥ viśve devāḥ yathā anunmaditaḥ asasi  /
translated: The Apsarases restore thee, Indra, Bhaga, restore thee. All the Gods restore thee, that thou mayst not be beside thyself with frenzy.

original: mā jyeṣṭham vadhīt ayam agne eṣām mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam / sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan tubhyam devāḥ anu jānantu viśve /
analyzed: mā jyeṣṭham vadhīt ayam agne eṣām mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam    sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan tubhyam devāḥ anu jānantu viśve  /
translated: Let not this man slay his eldest brother. O Agni, guard him from the root-destroyer. Knowing, untie the snares of the Grahi. Let all the Gods approve thee for this.

original: ud muñca pāśān tvam agne eṣām trayaḥ tribhiḥ utsitāḥ yebhiḥ āsan / sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan pitāputrau mātaram muñca sarvān /
analyzed: ud muñca pāśān tvam agne eṣām trayaḥ tribhiḥ utsitāḥ yebhiḥ āsan    sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan pitāputrau mātaram muñca sarvān  /
translated: Untie the snares, O Agni, of these three, set free with three, wherewith they were entangled. Knowing, untie the snares of the Grahi, and set free the father, the son, and the mother.

original: yebhiḥ pāśaiḥ parivittaḥ vibaddhaḥ aṅgeaṅge ārpitaḥ utsitaḥ ca / vi te mucyantam vimucaḥ hi santi bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva //🔽trite devāḥ amṛjata etat enaḥ tritaḥ enat manuṣyeṣu mamṛje / tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu //
analyzed: yebhiḥ pāśaiḥ parivittaḥ vibaddhaḥ aṅgeaṅge ārpitaḥ utsitaḥ ca   vi te mucyantam vimucaḥ hi santi bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva  / trite devāḥ amṛjata etat enaḥ tritaḥ enat manuṣyeṣu mamṛje   tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu  /
translated: From these let thy bonds be loosed, for they are bonds to be unloosed. O Pusan, thou who slayest the unborn, wipe out our sins.

original: marīcīḥ dhūmān pra viśa anu pāpman udārān gacchota vā nīhārān / nadīnam phenām anu tān vi naśya bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva //
analyzed: marīcīḥ dhūmān pra viśa anu pāpman udārān gaccha uta vā nīhārān   nadīnam phenām anu tān vi naśya bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva  /
translated: O sin, enter the rays of light, the mists, and go to the thick clouds. Follow the foam of the rivers, and perish with them. O Pusan, thou who slayest the unborn, wipe out our sins.🔽The gods wiped out this sin of theirs upon Trita. Trita wiped it out among mankind.

original: dvādaśadhā nihitam tritasya apamṛṣṭam manuṣya enasāni / tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu //🔽yat devāḥ deva heḍanam devāsaḥ cakṛma vayam / ādityāḥ tasmāt naḥ yuyam ṛtasya ṛtena muñcata /
analyzed: dvādaśadhā nihitam tritasya apamṛṣṭam manuṣya enasāni    tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu  / yat devāḥ deva heḍanam devāsaḥ cakṛma vayam   ādityāḥ tasmāt naḥ yuyam ṛtasya ṛtena muñcata  /
translated: If a crocodile has seized thee thence, may the gods destroy it for thee with the Brahman.🔽Whatever sin against the gods we have committed, O ye gods, O ye Âdityas, deliver us therefrom by the way of holy order.

original: ṛtasya ṛtena ādityāḥ yajatrāḥ muñcata iha naḥ / yajñam yat yajña vāhasaḥ śikṣantaḥ na upaśekima /
analyzed: ṛtasya ṛtena ādityāḥ yajatrāḥ muñcata iha naḥ   yajñam yat yajña vāhasaḥ śikṣantaḥ na upaśekima  /
translated: By the way of holy order, O ye Âdityas, ye holy ones, deliver us here. If, striving to win the sacrifice, we have approached the sacrifice which the sacrificers guard.

original: medasvatā yajamānāḥ srucā ājyāni juhvataḥ / akāmāḥ viśve vaḥ devāḥ śikṣantaḥ na upa śekima /
analyzed: medasvatā yajamānāḥ srucā ājyāni juhvataḥ   akāmāḥ viśve vaḥ devāḥ śikṣantaḥ na upa śekima  /
translated: The gods, all of you, being free from desire, we, being taught, have not been able to approach.🔽Whatever sins we have committed, knowingly or unknowingly,

original: yat vidvāṃsaḥ yat a vidvāṃsaḥ enāṃsi cakṛma vayam / yūyam naḥ tasmāt muñcata viśve devāḥ sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: yat vidvāṃsaḥ yat a vidvāṃsaḥ enāṃsi cakṛma vayam   yūyam naḥ tasmāt muñcata viśve devāḥ sajoṣasaḥ  /
translated: You all, O gods, being of the same mind, release us from that.🔽If I have committed a sin while awake or while sleeping,

original: yadi jāgrat yadi svapan enaḥ enasyaḥ akaram / bhūtam mā tasmāt bhavyam ca drupadāt iva muñcatām /
analyzed: yadi jāgrat yadi svapan enaḥ enasyaḥ akaram    bhūtam mā tasmāt bhavyam ca drupadāt iva muñcatām  /
translated: May the past and the future free me from it, as from a snare.🔽Freed like one from a snare, sweating like one who has bathed from dirt,

original: drupadāt iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snātvā malāt iva / pūtam pavitreṇa iva ājyam viśve śumbhantu mā enasaḥ /
analyzed: drupadāt iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snātvā malāt iva   pūtam pavitreṇa iva ājyam viśve śumbhantu mā enasaḥ  /
translated: May all purify me from sin, like clarified butter purified by the strainer.

original: yat yāmam cakruḥ nikhanantaḥ agre kārṣīvaṇāḥ anna vidaḥ na vidyayā / vaivasvate rājani tat juhomi atha yajñiyam madhumat astu naḥ annam /
analyzed: yat yāmam cakruḥ nikhanantaḥ agre kārṣīvaṇāḥ anna vidaḥ na vidyayā   vaivasvate rājani tat juhomi atha yajñiyam madhumat astu naḥ annam  /
translated: The Kārṣīvaṇas, who know food by knowledge, having dug it up in the beginning, have made it to be carried. I offer that to the king Vivasvat. Then may our food be fit for sacrifice and full of honey.

original: vaivasvataḥ kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam madhu bhāgaḥ madhunā sam sṛjāti / mātuḥ yat enaḥ iṣitam naḥ āgan yat vā pitā aparāddhaḥ jihīde /
analyzed: vaivasvataḥ kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam madhu bhāgaḥ madhunā sam sṛjāti    mātuḥ yat enaḥ iṣitam naḥ āgan yat vā pitā aparāddhaḥ jihīde  /
translated: May Vivasvat make the portion. The honey-share mixes with honey. Whatever sin we have committed against the mother, or if the father has done wrong and is distressed,

original: yadi idam mātuḥ yadi pituḥ naḥ pari bhrātuḥ putrāt cetasaḥ enaḥ āgan / yāvantaḥ asmān pitaraḥ sacante teṣām sarveṣām śivaḥ astu manyuḥ /
analyzed: yadi idam mātuḥ yadi pituḥ naḥ pari bhrātuḥ putrāt cetasaḥ enaḥ āgan   yāvantaḥ asmān pitaraḥ sacante teṣām sarveṣām śivaḥ astu manyuḥ  /
translated: As many as our fathers follow after us, may the wrath of all of them be turned aside.

original: apamityam a pratīttam yat asmi yamasya yena balinā carāmi / idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi tvam pāśān vicṛtam vettha sarvān /
analyzed: apamityam a pratīttam yat asmi yamasya yena balinā carāmi    idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi tvam pāśān vicṛtam vettha sarvān  /
translated: The debt which I have contracted, O Agni, which I have not paid, by which I am bound to Yama,

original: iha eva santaḥ prati dadmaḥ enat jīvāḥ jīvebhyaḥ ni harāmaḥ enat / apamitya dhānyam yat jaghasā aham idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi //
analyzed: iha eva santaḥ prati dadmaḥ enat jīvāḥ jīvebhyaḥ ni harāmaḥ enat    apamitya dhānyam yat jaghasā aham idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi  /
translated: Here, indeed, we give it back, we living men give it to the living. The debt which I have swallowed, O Agni, of unmeasured food,🔽Free from debt in this world, free from debt in the other, free from debt in the third world may we be.

original: anṛṇāḥ asmin anṛṇāḥ parasmin tṛtīye loke anṛṇāḥ syāma / ye deva yānāḥ pitṛyāṇaḥ ca lokāḥ sarvān pathaḥ anṛṇāḥ ā kṣiyema /
analyzed: anṛṇāḥ asmin anṛṇāḥ parasmin tṛtīye loke anṛṇāḥ syāma   ye deva yānāḥ pitṛyāṇaḥ ca lokāḥ sarvān pathaḥ anṛṇāḥ ā kṣiyema  /
translated: All the paths which lead to the world of the gods and to the world of the fathers, may we reach them free from debt.🔽The sins which we have committed with our hands, seeking the favour of the dice,

original: yat dhastābhyām cakṛma kilbiṣāṇi akṣāṇām gatnum upalipsamānāḥ / ugraṃpaśye ugrajitau tat adya apsarasau anu dattām ṛṇam naḥ /
analyzed: yat dhastābhyām cakṛma kilbiṣāṇi akṣāṇām gatnum upalipsamānāḥ   ugraṃpaśye ugrajitau tat adya apsarasau anu dattām ṛṇam naḥ  /
translated: To Ugrapasyu and Ugrajit, to them today let the two Apsarases give back our debt.

original: ugram paśye rāṣṭrabhṛt kilbiṣāṇi yat akṣa vṛttam anu dattam naḥ etat / ṛṇāt naḥ naḥ ṛṇam ertsamānaḥ yamasya loke adhirajjuḥ āyat //
analyzed: ugram paśye rāṣṭrabhṛt kilbiṣāṇi yat akṣa vṛttam anu dattam naḥ etat   ṛṇāt naḥ naḥ ṛṇam ertsamānaḥ yamasya loke adhirajjuḥ āyat  /
translated: I see the terrible, the King of the realm, the sins which we have committed in the play at dice. From debt to debt, from us who are eager for debt, the noose of Yama is stretched out in the world of Yama.🔽To whom I go for debt, whose wife I approach, whom I go to as a suppliant, O gods,

original: yasmai ṛṇam yasya jāyām upaimi yam yācamānaḥ abhyaimi devāḥ / te vācam vādiṣuḥ mā uttarām mat deva patnī apsarasau adhītam /
analyzed: yasmai ṛṇam yasya jāyām upaimi yam yācamānaḥ abhyaimi devāḥ   te vācam vādiṣuḥ mā uttarām mat deva patnī apsarasau adhītam  /
translated: may they speak this word to me, not another. O divine ladies, O Apsarases, I have learned this.🔽If I make a debt, not gambling, and do not intend to pay, O Agni, I remember it.

original: yat a dīvyan ṛṇam aham kṛṇomi a dāsyan agne uta saṃgṛṇāmi / vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ adhipāḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ ud id nayāti su kṛtasya lokam /
analyzed: yat a dīvyan ṛṇam aham kṛṇomi a dāsyan agne uta saṃgṛṇāmi    vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ adhipāḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ ud id nayāti su kṛtasya lokam  /
translated: Vaisvānara, the lord, the best, leads me up to the world of the virtuous.🔽To Vaisvānara I announce the debt, if there is a debt among the gods in the assembly.

original: vaiśvānarāya prati vedayāmi yadi ṛṇam saṃgaraḥ devatāsu / saḥ etān pāśān vicṛtam veda sarvān atha pakvena saha sam bhavema /
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya prati vedayāmi yadi ṛṇam saṃgaraḥ devatāsu    saḥ etān pāśān vicṛtam veda sarvān atha pakvena saha sam bhavema  /
translated: May he know how to untie all these bonds, and then may we be united with the cooked food.🔽May Vaisvānara, the purifier, purify me, if I run to the assembly with hope.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ pavitā mā punātu yat saṃgaram abhidhāvāmi āśām / an ājānan manasā yācamānaḥ yat tatra enaḥ apa tat suvāmi //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ pavitā mā punātu yat saṃgaram abhidhāvāmi āśām    an ājānan manasā yācamānaḥ yat tatra enaḥ apa tat suvāmi  /
translated: Not knowing, asking with the mind, whatever sin there is in that, I remove it.

original: yat antarikṣam pṛthivīm uta dyām yat mātaram pitaram vā jihiṃsima / ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti sukṛtasya lokam /
analyzed: yat antarikṣam pṛthivīm uta dyām yat mātaram pitaram vā jihiṃsima    ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti sukṛtasya lokam  /
translated: from that may this our Gārhapatya Agni bear us upwards to the world of good action.🔽Earth is our mother, Aditi our birth-place, our brother is the air, to guard us from imprecation.

original: bhūmiḥ mātā aditiḥ naḥ janitram bhrātā antarikṣam abhiśastyā naḥ / dyauḥ naḥ pitā pitryāt śam bhavāti jāmim ṛtvā mā ava patsi lokāt /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ mātā aditiḥ naḥ janitram bhrātā antarikṣam abhiśastyā naḥ    dyauḥ naḥ pitā pitryāt śam bhavāti jāmim ṛtvā mā ava patsi lokāt  /
translated: May our father Heaven prosper us from the father's side, and after I have visited my sister, may I not fall from the world.🔽Where the well-wishers rejoice, the well-doers, having left the sickness of their own bodies,

original: yatra suhārdaḥ su kṛtaḥ madanti vihāya rogam tanvaḥ svāyāḥ / aślonāḥ aṅgaiḥ a hrutāḥ svarge tatra paśyema pitarau ca putrān /
analyzed: yatra suhārdaḥ su kṛtaḥ madanti vihāya rogam tanvaḥ svāyāḥ   aślonāḥ aṅgaiḥ a hrutāḥ svarge tatra paśyema pitarau ca putrān  /
translated: without disease of limbs, not fallen, in heaven, there may we see our parents and our children.🔽Loosen the bonds that bind us, the upper and the lower bonds of Varuna,

original: viṣāṇā pāśān vi sya adhi asmat ye uttamāḥ adhamāḥ vāruṇāḥ ye / duṣvapnyam duritam ni sva asmat atha gacchema su kṛtasya lokam /
analyzed: viṣāṇā pāśān vi sya adhi asmat ye uttamāḥ adhamāḥ vāruṇāḥ ye    duṣvapnyam duritam ni sva asmat atha gacchema su kṛtasya lokam  /
translated: and cast away from us evil dreams and misfortune, and then may we go to the world of the righteous.🔽If thou art bound with wood or with a rope, if thou art bound with earth or with speech,

original: yat dāruṇi badhyase yat ca rajjvām yat bhūmyām badhyase yat ca vācā / ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti su kṛtasya lokam /
analyzed: yat dāruṇi badhyase yat ca rajjvām yat bhūmyām badhyase yat ca vācā   ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti su kṛtasya lokam  /
translated: from that may this our Gārhapatya Agni bear us upwards to the world of the righteous.

original: ud agātām bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake / preha amṛtasya yacchatām praitu baddhaka mocanam /
analyzed: ud agātām bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake   preha amṛtasya yacchatām praitu baddhaka mocanam  /
translated: The two bright stars, the two auspicious ones, have risen, the two that search,🔽Granting us here the gift of life. Let the releaser of the bound go forth.

original: vi jihīṣva lokam kṛṇu bandhāt muñcāsi baddhakam / yonyāḥ iva pracyutaḥ garbhaḥ pathaḥ sarvām anu kṣiya //🔽etam bhāgam pari dadāmi vidvān viśvakarman prathama jāḥ ṛtasya / asmābhiḥ dattam jarasaḥ parastāt achinnam tantum anu sam tarema /🔽tatam tantum anu eke taranti yeṣām dattam pitryam āyanena / a bandhu eke dadataḥ prayacchantaḥ dātum ced śikṣān sa svarge eva /🔽anvārabhethām anusaṃrabhethām etam lokam śraddadhānāḥ sacante / yat vām pakvam pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye dampatī sam śrayethām //

original: yajñam yantam manasā bṛhantam anvārohāmi tapasā sayoniḥ / upahūtāḥ agne jarasaḥ parastāt tṛtīye nāke sadhamādam madema /

translated: I mount with thought, with fervour, with my kindred, the lofty sacrifice that moveth onward. O Agni, I have called you to the old age beyond, in the third heaven may we rejoice in banquet.

original: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi / yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ aham indraḥ marutvān sa dadātu tat me /🔽etam sadhasthāḥ pari vaḥ dadāmi yam śevadhim āvahāt jātavedaḥ / anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti tam sma jānīta parame vyoman /
analyzed: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi   yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ aham indraḥ marutvān sa dadātu tat me  / etam sadhasthāḥ pari vaḥ dadāmi yam śevadhim āvahāt jātavedaḥ   anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti tam sma jānīta parame vyoman  /
translated: Pure, cleansed, these women, meet for sacrifice, I place apart in the hands of the priests. What I desire I sprinkle you with this. May Indra with the Maruts grant that to me.🔽This treasure which Jâtavedas hath brought hither I give you to enjoy, ye dwellers of the house. The sacrificer will come to you in safety. Mark him, ye Gods, in the highest heaven.

original: jānīta sma enam parame vyoman devāḥ sadhasthāḥ vida lokam atra / anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti iṣṭāpūrtam sma kṛṇuta āvis asmai /
analyzed: jānīta sma enam parame vyoman devāḥ sadhasthāḥ vida lokam atra   anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti iṣṭāpūrtam sma kṛṇuta āvis asmai  /
translated: Mark him, ye Gods, in the highest heaven. Ye Gods who dwell together, know this world. The sacrificer will come to you in safety. Make ye known to him the fruit of his devotion.

original: devāḥ pitaraḥ pitaraḥ devāḥ / yaḥ asmi saḥ asmi //
analyzed: devāḥ pitaraḥ pitaraḥ devāḥ   yaḥ asmi saḥ asmi
translated: Gods are the Fathers, Fathers are the Gods. I am he who I am.

original: sa pacāmi sa dadāmi / sa yaje sa dattāt mā yūṣam /
analyzed: sa pacāmi sa dadāmi   sa yaje sa dattāt mā yūṣam
translated: I cook, I give, I sacrifice. May he give me food.

original: nāke rājan prati tiṣṭha tatra etat prati tiṣṭhatu / viddhi pūrtasya naḥ rājan sa deva sumanāḥ bhava //
analyzed: nāke rājan prati tiṣṭha tatra etat prati tiṣṭhatu   viddhi pūrtasya naḥ rājan sa deva sumanāḥ bhava  /
translated: Stand in the sky, O King, and there let this stand. Know thou of our full oblation, O thou God, and be well pleased.

original: divaḥ nu mām bṛhataḥ antarikṣāt apām stokaḥ abhī apaptat rasena / sam indriyena payasā aham agne chandobhiḥ yajñaiḥ su kṛtām kṛtena /
analyzed: divaḥ nu mām bṛhataḥ antarikṣāt apām stokaḥ abhī apaptat rasena    sam indriyena payasā aham agne chandobhiḥ yajñaiḥ su kṛtām kṛtena  /
translated: From the high firmament and from the sky a drop hath fallen on me with the sap of waters. With power and milk, O Agni, with the metres and the sacrifices, and with the deeds of pious men.

original: yadi vṛkṣāt abhyapaptat phalam tat yadi antarikṣāt saḥ u vāyuḥ eva / yatra aspṛkṣat tanvaḥ yat ca vāsasaḥ āpaḥ nudantu nirṛtim parācais /
analyzed: yadi vṛkṣāt abhyapaptat phalam tat yadi antarikṣāt saḥ u vāyuḥ eva   yatra aspṛkṣat tanvaḥ yat ca vāsasaḥ āpaḥ nudantu nirṛtim parācais  /
translated: If the fruit hath fallen from the tree, or from the sky, it is the wind itself. Where it hath touched the body or the clothes, let the waters drive away misfortune far away.

original: abhyañjanam surabhi sā samṛddhiḥ hiraṇyam varcaḥ tat u pūtrimam eva / sarvā pavitrā vitatā adhi asmat tat mā tārīt nirṛtiḥ mā u arātiḥ /
analyzed: abhyañjanam surabhi sā samṛddhiḥ hiraṇyam varcaḥ tat u pūtrimam eva   sarvā pavitrā vitatā adhi asmat tat mā tārīt nirṛtiḥ mā u arātiḥ  /
translated: The ointment is fragrant, that is prosperity. The gold is splendour, that is the gift itself. Let all the sieve, spread out above us, keep us. Let not misfortune, nor ill-will, overcome us.

original: vanaspate vīḍu aṅgaḥ hi bhūyāḥ asmad sakhā prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ / gobhiḥ saṃnaddhaḥ asi vīḍayasva āsthātā te jayatu jetvāni //
analyzed: vanaspate vīḍu aṅgaḥ hi bhūyāḥ asmad sakhā prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ   gobhiḥ saṃnaddhaḥ asi vīḍayasva āsthātā te jayatu jetvāni  /
translated: O Tree, be firm of limb, be a strong friend to us, a hero-winner. Thou art bound with the cows: strengthen thyself. Let him who stays with thee win all victories.

original: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari ojaḥ udbhṛtam vanaspatibhyaḥ pari ābhṛtam sahaḥ / apām ojmānam pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam indrasya vajram haviṣā ratham yaja //
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari ojaḥ udbhṛtam vanaspatibhyaḥ pari ābhṛtam sahaḥ    apām ojmānam pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam indrasya vajram haviṣā ratham yaja  /
translated: The strength that hath been gathered from the sky and earth, the might that hath been brought together from the trees, The strength of waters compassed round with milk, the car of Indra, the thunderbolt, I worship with oblation.

original: indrasya ojaḥ marutām anīkam mitrasya garbhaḥ varuṇasya nābhiḥ / saḥ imām naḥ havya dātim juṣāṇaḥ deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya //
analyzed: indrasya ojaḥ marutām anīkam mitrasya garbhaḥ varuṇasya nābhiḥ    saḥ imām naḥ havya dātim juṣāṇaḥ deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya  /
translated: The strength of Indra, the host of the Maruts, the babe of Mitra, the navel of Varuna, Accepting this our offering, O God-drawn chariot, receive our oblations.

original: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyam purutrā te vanvatām viṣṭhitam jagat / sa dundubhe sajūs indreṇa devaiḥ dūrāt davīyaḥ apa sedha śatrūn /
analyzed: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyam purutrā te vanvatām viṣṭhitam jagat    sa dundubhe sajūs indreṇa devaiḥ dūrāt davīyaḥ apa sedha śatrūn  /
translated: Bellow against the earth and sky. Let all the world bow to thy wide-extended sway. Thou, O drum, in unison with Indra and the Gods, drive away foes from far away and nearer still.

original: ā krandaya balam ojaḥ naḥ ā dhāḥ abhi stana duritā bādhamānaḥ / apa sedha dundubhe duchunām itas indrasya muṣṭiḥ asi vīḍayasva /
analyzed: ā krandaya balam ojaḥ naḥ ā dhāḥ abhi stana duritā bādhamānaḥ   apa sedha dundubhe duchunām itas indrasya muṣṭiḥ asi vīḍayasva  /
translated: Roar out, O drum, and give us strength and power. Beat down and drive away our enemies. Drive thou away from us, O drum, all evil things. Thou art the fist of Indra: show thy firmness.

original: pra amūm jaya abhīme jayantu ketumat dundubhiḥ vāvadītu / sam aśva parṇāḥ patantu naḥ naraḥ asmākam indra rathinaḥ jayantu /
analyzed: pra amūm jaya abhīme jayantu ketumat dundubhiḥ vāvadītu   sam aśva parṇāḥ patantu naḥ naraḥ asmākam indra rathinaḥ jayantu  /
translated: Roar out for victory to this one, and let these be victorious. Let the war-drum speak forth with its banner. Let our men fly about with wings of horses. Let our car-warriors, O Indra, be victorious.

original: vidradhasya balāsasya lohitasya vanaspate / visalpakasya auṣadhe mā ud śiṣaḥ piśitam cana /
analyzed: vidradhasya balāsasya lohitasya vanaspate    visalpakasya auṣadhe mā ud śiṣaḥ piśitam cana  /
translated: Of the inflammation, O Plant, leave not a particle behind.🔽The two which stand in thy flanks, O abscess, the two which cling to thy testicles,

original: yau te balāsa tiṣṭhataḥ kakṣe muṣkau apaśritau / veda aham tasya bheṣajam cīpudruḥ abhicakṣaṇam /
analyzed: yau te balāsa tiṣṭhataḥ kakṣe muṣkau apaśritau   veda aham tasya bheṣajam cīpudruḥ abhicakṣaṇam  /
translated: I know the remedy for that, the healing of the Chiputru.🔽The abscess in the limbs, in the ears, in the eyes, the inflammation,🔽We drive away the inflammation, the abscess, the heart-disease.

original: yaḥ aṅgyaḥ yaḥ karṇyaḥ yaḥ akṣyoḥ visalpakaḥ / vi vṛhāmaḥ visalpakam vidradham hṛdaya āmayam / parā tam a jñātam yakṣmam adharāñcam suvāmasi //
analyzed: yaḥ aṅgyaḥ yaḥ karṇyaḥ yaḥ akṣyoḥ visalpakaḥ   vi vṛhāmaḥ visalpakam vidradham hṛdaya āmayam   parā tam a jñātam yakṣmam adharāñcam suvāmasi  /
translated: The unknown, downward-going consumption we heal away from thee.🔽When the stars made Shakadhuma their king,

original: śakadhūmam nakṣatrāṇi yat rājānam akurvata / bhadra aham asmai prāyacchan idam rāṣṭram asāt iti /
analyzed: śakadhūmam nakṣatrāṇi yat rājānam akurvata    bhadra aham asmai prāyacchan idam rāṣṭram asāt iti
translated: They gave him good luck, saying, 'This kingdom is thine.'🔽Good luck to us at noon, good luck to us in the evening,

original: bhadra aham naḥ madhyaṃdine bhadra aham sāyam astu naḥ / bhadra aham naḥ ahnām prātā rātrī bhadra aham astu naḥ /
analyzed: bhadra aham naḥ madhyaṃdine bhadra aham sāyam astu naḥ    bhadra aham naḥ ahnām prātā rātrī bhadra aham astu naḥ  /
translated: Good luck to us in the morning of the days, good luck to us in the night.🔽Good luck to us from day and night, from the stars, from the sun and moon,

original: ahar rātrābhyām nakṣatrebhyaḥ suryācandramasābhyām / bhadra aham asmabhyam rājan śakadhūma tvam kṛdhi //
analyzed: ahar rātrābhyām nakṣatrebhyaḥ suryācandramasābhyām    bhadra aham asmabhyam rājan śakadhūma tvam kṛdhi  /
translated: Good luck, O king, do thou, O Shakadhuma, make for us.

original: yaḥ naḥ bhadra aham akaraḥ sāyam naktam atho divā / tasmai te nakṣatra rāja śakadhūma sadā namaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ bhadra aham akaraḥ sāyam naktam atho divā    tasmai te nakṣatra rāja śakadhūma sadā namaḥ  /
translated: The good luck which thou hast given us in the evening, at night, and also by day, To thee, O King of Stars, to thee, O Sakadhuma, be constant adoration.

original: bhagena mā śāṃśapena sākam indreṇa medinā / kṛṇomi bhaginam mā apa drāntu arātayaḥ /🔽yena vṛkṣām abhyabhavaḥ bhagena varcasā saha / tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ /
analyzed: bhagena mā śāṃśapena sākam indreṇa medinā   kṛṇomi bhaginam mā apa drāntu arātayaḥ  yena vṛkṣām abhyabhavaḥ bhagena varcasā saha   tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ
translated: With Bhaga, with the Sâṃśapâ people, with Indra, with the bountiful, I make myself a Bhaga-winning man. Let not the evil spirits come nigh me.🔽With that same Bhaga wherewith thou hast overcome the trees with splendour and with might, Therewith make me a Bhaga-winning man. Let not the evil spirits come nigh me.

original: yaḥ andhaḥ yaḥ punaḥsaraḥ bhagaḥ vṛkṣeṣu āhitaḥ / tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ andhaḥ yaḥ punaḥsaraḥ bhagaḥ vṛkṣeṣu āhitaḥ   tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ  /
translated: With that same Bhaga, with that might of thine which is in the blind and in the lame, Which is deposited in the trees, make me a Bhaga-winning man. Let not the evil spirits come nigh me.

original: ratha jitām rātha jiteyīnām apsarasām ayam smaraḥ / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //🔽asau me smaratāt iti priyaḥ me smaratāt iti / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
analyzed: ratha jitām rātha jiteyīnām apsarasām ayam smaraḥ    devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu  / asau me smaratāt iti priyaḥ me smaratāt iti    devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu  /
translated: This is the longing of the Apsarases, the daughters of the Rishis, the daughters of the Gods. O Gods, send forth your longing: let him long after me.🔽Let him long after me, let my dear one long after me. O Gods, send forth your longing: let him long after me.

original: yathā mama smarāt asau na amuṣya aham kadā cana / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
analyzed: yathā mama smarāt asau na amuṣya aham kadā cana    devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu  /
translated: As I never long after him, as he never longs after me, O Gods, send forth your longing: let him long after me.

original: ud mādayata marutaḥ ud antarikṣa mādaya / agne ud mādaya tvam asau mām anu śocatu /
analyzed: ud mādayata marutaḥ ud antarikṣa mādaya   agne ud mādaya tvam asau mām anu śocatu  /
translated: Delight the Maruts, delight the atmosphere, delight, O Agni, delight him, let him delight in me.

original: ni śīrṣataḥ ni pattataḥ ādhyaḥ ni tirāmi te / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
analyzed: ni śīrṣataḥ ni pattataḥ ādhyaḥ ni tirāmi te    devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu  /
translated: From the head, from the feet, from the middle, I drive away thy grief. O Gods, send forth your memory, let him delight in me.

original: anumate anu idam manyasva akute sam idam namaḥ / devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu //
analyzed: anumate anu idam manyasva akute sam idam namaḥ   devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu  /
translated: O Anumati, approve this, this adoration is for thee. O Gods, send forth your memory, let him delight in me.

original: yat dhāvasi tri yojanam pañca yojanam āśvinam / tatas tvam punar āyasi putrāṇām naḥ asaḥ pitā /🔽yam devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā /🔽yam viśve devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā /
analyzed: yat dhāvasi tri yojanam pañca yojanam āśvinam   tatas tvam punar āyasi putrāṇām naḥ asaḥ pitā  / yam devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā    tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā  / yam viśve devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā    tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā  /
translated: When thou runnest three leagues, five leagues, to the Asvins, thence thou returnest again, our father, the friend of our sons.🔽The grief which the Gods have poured into the waters, burning within, together with the pain, that I torment thee by the law of Varuna.🔽The grief which all the Gods have poured into the waters, burning within, together with the pain, that I torment thee by the law of Varuna.

original: yam indrāṇī smaram asiñcat apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā /
analyzed: yam indrāṇī smaram asiñcat apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā    tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā  /
translated: The grief which Indrani has poured into the waters, burning within, together with the pain, that I torment thee by the law of Varuna.

original: yam indra agnī smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā /
analyzed: yam indra agnī smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā    tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā  /
translated: The sin which Indra and Agni have poured into the waters, burning within, together with the body, I burn that sin away by the law of Varuna.

original: yam mitrāvaruṇau smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā / tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā /
analyzed: yam mitrāvaruṇau smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha adhyā    tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā  /
translated: The sin which Mitra and Varuna have poured into the waters, burning within, together with the body, I burn that sin away by the law of Varuna.

original: yaḥ imām devaḥ mekhalām ābabandha yaḥ saṃnanāha yaḥ u naḥ yuyoja / yasya devasya praśiṣā carāmaḥ sa pāram ichāt saḥ u naḥ vi muñcāt /
analyzed: yaḥ imām devaḥ mekhalām ābabandha yaḥ saṃnanāha yaḥ u naḥ yuyoja   yasya devasya praśiṣā carāmaḥ sa pāram ichāt saḥ u naḥ vi muñcāt  /
translated: The God who tied this girdle round me, who girt it on, who yoked it to me, by the command of what God do we go? May he desire the end (of the penance), may he release us.

original: āhutā asi abhihuta ṛṣīṇām asi āyudham / pūrvā vratasya prāśnatī vīra ghnī bhava mekhale /
analyzed: āhutā asi abhihuta ṛṣīṇām asi āyudham   pūrvā vratasya prāśnatī vīra ghnī bhava mekhale  /
translated: Thou art invoked, thou art invoked by the Rishis as their weapon. Eating first of the vow, be thou a slayer of heroes, O girdle.

original: mṛtyoḥ aham brahmacārī yat asmi niryācan bhūtāt puruṣam yamāya / tam aham brahmaṇā tapasā śrameṇa anayā enam mekhalayā sināmi //
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ aham brahmacārī yat asmi niryācan bhūtāt puruṣam yamāya   tam aham brahmaṇā tapasā śrameṇa anayā enam mekhalayā sināmi  /
translated: O Death, I am a Brahmachāri, begging for the sake of the living being, for Yama. I bind him with this Brahmacharya, penance, and labour, with this girdle.

original: śraddhāyāḥ duhitā tapasaḥ adhi jātā svasā ṛṣīṇām bhūta kṛtām babhūva / sā naḥ mekhale matim ā dhehi medhām atha u naḥ dhehi tapaḥ indriyam ca /
analyzed: śraddhāyāḥ duhitā tapasaḥ adhi jātā svasā ṛṣīṇām bhūta kṛtām babhūva   sā naḥ mekhale matim ā dhehi medhām atha u naḥ dhehi tapaḥ indriyam ca  /
translated: The daughter of faith, born of penance, she became the sister of the Rishis who created beings. O girdle, give us thought, give us wisdom, and give us penance and power.

original: yām tvā pūrve bhūta kṛtaḥ ṛṣayaḥ paribedhire / sā tvam pari svajasva mām dīrgha āyu tvāya mekhale /
analyzed: yām tvā pūrve bhūta kṛtaḥ ṛṣayaḥ paribedhire    sā tvam pari svajasva mām dīrgha āyu tvāya mekhale  /
translated: Which thou, O Mekhalâ, the ancient Rishis, the creators of beings, have fastened on, Do thou embrace me closely for the sake of long life.

original: ayam vajraḥ tarpayatām ṛtasya ava asya rāṣṭram apa hantu jīvitam / śṛṇātu grīvāḥ pra śṛṇātu uṣṇihāḥ vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ /
analyzed: ayam vajraḥ tarpayatām ṛtasya ava asya rāṣṭram apa hantu jīvitam   śṛṇātu grīvāḥ pra śṛṇātu uṣṇihāḥ vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ  /
translated: Let this thunderbolt of truth, let it destroy his kingdom and his life. Let it break his neck and crush his shoulders, as the Lord of Strength did Vritra's.

original: adharaḥ adharaḥ uttarebhyaḥ gūḍhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ mā ud sṛpat / vajreṇa avahataḥ śayām /
analyzed: adharaḥ adharaḥ uttarebhyaḥ gūḍhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ mā ud sṛpat   vajreṇa avahataḥ śayām  /
translated: Lower and lower than the higher ones, concealed beneath the earth, let him not rise again. Let him lie down, struck down by the thunderbolt.

original: yaḥ jināti tam anviccha yaḥ jināti tam id jahi / jinataḥ vajra tvam sīmantam anvañcam anu pātaya //
analyzed: yaḥ jināti tam anviccha yaḥ jināti tam id jahi    jinataḥ vajra tvam sīmantam anvañcam anu pātaya  /
translated: Seek out the man who conquers, slay the man who conquers. O Thunderbolt, let the crest of the conqueror be broken and cast down.

original: yat aśnāmi balam kurve ittham vajram ā dade / skandhān amuṣya śātayan vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ /🔽yat pibāmi sam pibāmi samudraḥ iva saṃpibaḥ / prāṇān amuṣya saṃpāya sam pibāmaḥ amum vayam /
analyzed: yat aśnāmi balam kurve ittham vajram ā dade    skandhān amuṣya śātayan vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ  / yat pibāmi sam pibāmi samudraḥ iva saṃpibaḥ   prāṇān amuṣya saṃpāya sam pibāmaḥ amum vayam  /
translated: When I eat, I make strength, thus I take the thunderbolt. As the Lord of Strength did Vritra's, I crush the limbs of him.🔽When I drink, I drink together, as the ocean drinks together. I drink together the breath of him. We drink together him.

original: yat girāmi sam girāmi samudraḥ iva saṃgiraḥ / prāṇān amuṣya saṃgīrya sam girāmaḥ amum vayam /
analyzed: yat girāmi sam girāmi samudraḥ iva saṃgiraḥ   prāṇān amuṣya saṃgīrya sam girāmaḥ amum vayam  /
translated: When I chew, I chew together, as the ocean chews together. I chew together the breath of him. We chew together him.

original: devī devyām adhi jātā pṛthivyām asi oṣadhe / tām tvā nitatni keśebhyaḥ dṛṃhaṇāya khanāmasi //
analyzed: devī devyām adhi jātā pṛthivyām asi oṣadhe   tām tvā nitatni keśebhyaḥ dṛṃhaṇāya khanāmasi  /
translated: Thou, Plant, art born upon the Goddess, born upon the Earth, O Plant. We dig thee up, O Nitatni, for the strengthening of thy hair.

original: dṛṃha pratnān janaya a jātān jātān u varṣīyasaḥ kṛdhi //
analyzed: dṛṃha pratnān janaya a jātān jātān u varṣīyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: Strengthen the old, produce the young, and make the young still stronger.🔽The hair that falls away from thee, the hair that is cut off with the root,

original: yaḥ te keśaḥ avapadyate sa mūlaḥ yaḥ ca vṛścate / idam tam viśva bheṣajyā abhi siñcāmi vīrudhā /
analyzed: yaḥ te keśaḥ avapadyate sa mūlaḥ yaḥ ca vṛścate    idam tam viśva bheṣajyā abhi siñcāmi vīrudhā  /
translated: With this all-curing Plant I sprinkle it.🔽The Plant which Jamadagni dug for his daughter to make her hair grow,

original: yām jamadagniḥ akhanat duhitre keśa vardhanīm / tām vītahavyaḥ ābharat asitasya gṛhebhyaḥ //🔽abhīśunā meyāḥ āsan vyāmena anumeyāḥ / keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari /🔽dṛṃha mūlam āgram yaccha vi madhyam yāmaya oṣadhe / keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari /
analyzed: yām jamadagniḥ akhanat duhitre keśa vardhanīm    tām vītahavyaḥ ābharat asitasya gṛhebhyaḥ  / abhīśunā meyāḥ āsan vyāmena anumeyāḥ   keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari  / dṛṃha mūlam āgram yaccha vi madhyam yāmaya oṣadhe   keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari  /
translated: That Vītahavya brought from the house of Asita.🔽They have been measured by the whip, they have been measured by the span. Let thy black hairs grow like reeds about thy head.🔽Strengthen the root, raise up the top, and make the middle firm, O Plant. Let thy black hairs grow like reeds about thy head.

original: tvam vīrudhām śreṣṭhatamā abhiśrutā asi oṣadhe / imam me adya puruṣam klībam opaśinam kṛdhi //
analyzed: tvam vīrudhām śreṣṭhatamā abhiśrutā asi oṣadhe   imam me adya puruṣam klībam opaśinam kṛdhi  /
translated: Thou, O Plant, art most renowned of all the Plants that grow upon the earth. Make this man impotent for me this day, make him a shrivelled thing.

original: klībam kṛdhi opaśinam atha u kurīriṇam kṛdhi / atha asya indraḥ grāvabhyām ubhe bhinattu āṇḍyau /
analyzed: klībam kṛdhi opaśinam atha u kurīriṇam kṛdhi    atha asya indraḥ grāvabhyām ubhe bhinattu āṇḍyau  /
translated: Make him a eunuch, make him impotent, make him a cripple. Then let Indra with his two stones crush his two testicles.

original: klība klībam tvā akaram vadhre vadhrim tvā akaram arasa arasam tvā akaram / kurīram asya śīrṣaṇi kumbam ca adhinidadhmasi //
analyzed: klība klībam tvā akaram vadhre vadhrim tvā akaram arasa arasam tvā akaram    kurīram asya śīrṣaṇi kumbam ca adhinidadhmasi  /
translated: I have made thee a eunuch, O eunuch, I have made thee a cripple, O cripple, I have made thee impotent, O impotent one. On his head we lay a cap of skin and a potsherd.

original: ye te nādyau deva kṛte yayoḥ tiṣṭhati vṛṣṇyam / te te bhinadmi śamyayā amuṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ /
analyzed: ye te nādyau deva kṛte yayoḥ tiṣṭhati vṛṣṇyam   te te bhinadmi śamyayā amuṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ  /
translated: Thy two testicles, O God-made man, wherein thy virility is contained, I crush with a hammer on the scrotum of so and so.

original: yathā naḍam kaśipune striyaḥ bhindanti aśmanā / eva bhinadmi te śepaḥ amuṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ /
analyzed: yathā naḍam kaśipune striyaḥ bhindanti aśmanā    eva bhinadmi te śepaḥ amuṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ  /
translated: As women with a stone crush a reed in a basket, so I crush thy penis on the scrotum of so and so.

original: nyastikā rurohitha subhagaṃkaraṇī mama / śatam tava pratānāḥ trayastriṃśat nitānāḥ /
analyzed: nyastikā rurohitha subhagaṃkaraṇī mama    śatam tava pratānāḥ trayastriṃśat nitānāḥ  /
translated: Thou hast mounted, O Nyastika, thou who makest me happy and fortunate. A hundred are thy windings, thirty-three thy turnings.

original: tayā sahasraparṇyā hṛdayam śoṣayāmi te //
analyzed: tayā sahasraparṇyā hṛdayam śoṣayāmi te
translated: With thee who hast a thousand leaves I dry up his heart.

original: śuṣyatu mayi te hṛdayam atho śuṣyatu āsyam / atho ni śuṣya mām kāmena atho śuṣka āsyā cara /
analyzed: śuṣyatu mayi te hṛdayam atho śuṣyatu āsyam   atho ni śuṣya mām kāmena atho śuṣka āsyā cara  /
translated: Let thy heart dry up in me, let thy mouth dry up. Let thy love for me dry up. Go away with a dry mouth.

original: saṃvananī samuṣpalā babhru kalyāṇi sam nuda / amūm ca mām ca sam nuda samānam hṛdayam kṛdhi //
analyzed: saṃvananī samuṣpalā babhru kalyāṇi sam nuda    amūm ca mām ca sam nuda samānam hṛdayam kṛdhi  /
translated: O Samvanani, O Samushpala, O Babhru, O Kalyani, drive her and me together. Drive us together, and make our hearts one.

original: yathā udakam apapuṣaḥ apaśuṣyati āsyam / eva ni śuṣya mām kāmena atho śuṣka āsyā cara /
analyzed: yathā udakam apapuṣaḥ apaśuṣyati āsyam   eva ni śuṣya mām kāmena atho śuṣka āsyā cara  /
translated: As a man who has no cattle is dried up in his mouth, so be thou dried up in thy love for me, and go thy way with a dry mouth.

original: yathā nakulaḥ vichidya saṃdadhāti ahim punar / eva kāmasya vichinnam sam dhehi vīryāvati //
analyzed: yathā nakulaḥ vichidya saṃdadhāti ahim punar   eva kāmasya vichinnam sam dhehi vīryāvati  /
translated: As the mongoose severs and again unites the snake, so unite again the severed love of me, O thou who hast power.🔽The two tigers that are fastened, that are hungry, that would devour father and mother,

original: yau vyāghrau avarūdhau jighatsataḥ pitaram mātaram ca / tau dantam brahmaṇas pate śivau kṛṇu jātavedaḥ /🔽vrīhim attam yavam attam atho māṣam atho tilam / eṣa vām bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ ratna dheyāya dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca /
analyzed: yau vyāghrau avarūdhau jighatsataḥ pitaram mātaram ca    tau dantam brahmaṇas pate śivau kṛṇu jātavedaḥ  / vrīhim attam yavam attam atho māṣam atho tilam     eṣa vām bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ ratna dheyāya dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca  /
translated: O Brahmanaspati, O Jâtavedas, make those two teeth of thine propitious.🔽Eat rice, eat barley, eat beans, eat sesame. This portion is set apart for you, O teeth, to be bestowed as treasure. Do not injure father or mother.

original: upahūtau sayujau syonau dantau su maṅgalau / anyatra vām ghoram tanvaḥ paraitu dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca /
analyzed: upahūtau sayujau syonau dantau su maṅgalau   anyatra vām ghoram tanvaḥ paraitu dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca  /
translated: The two teeth, invoked, yoked, tender, auspicious, let the terrible part of you go elsewhere. Do not injure father or mother.

original: vāyuḥ enāḥ samākarat tvaṣṭā poṣāya dhriyatām / indraḥ ābhyaḥ adhi bravat rudraḥ bhūmne cikitsatu /
analyzed: vāyuḥ enāḥ samākarat tvaṣṭā poṣāya dhriyatām   indraḥ ābhyaḥ adhi bravat rudraḥ bhūmne cikitsatu  /
translated: Vayu hath brought them together. Let Tvashtar be ready to increase their growth. Let Indra speak graciously to these (cows). Let Rudra heal them for abundance.

original: lohitena svadhitinā mithunam karṇayoḥ kṛdhi / akartām aśvinā lakṣma tat astu prajayā bahu //
analyzed: lohitena svadhitinā mithunam karṇayoḥ kṛdhi   akartām aśvinā lakṣma tat astu prajayā bahu  /
translated: With the red knife make a pair of them by the ears. Let the Asvins make the mark. Let that be abundant with offspring.

original: yathā cakruḥ deva asurāḥ yathā manuṣyāḥ uta / eva sahasra poṣāya kṛṇutam lakṣmā aśvinā /
analyzed: yathā cakruḥ deva asurāḥ yathā manuṣyāḥ uta   eva sahasra poṣāya kṛṇutam lakṣmā aśvinā  /
translated: As the gods and Asuras did, as men have done, so for a thousandfold increase make the mark, O Asvins.

original: ud śrayasva bahuḥ bhava svena mahasā yava / mṛṇīhi viśvā pātrāṇi mā tvā divyā aśaniḥ vadhīt /
analyzed: ud śrayasva bahuḥ bhava svena mahasā yava   mṛṇīhi viśvā pātrāṇi mā tvā divyā aśaniḥ vadhīt  /
translated: Rise up, become many, with thine own greatness, O barley. Fill all the vessels. Let not the heavenly bolt slay thee.

original: āśṛṇvantam yavam devam yatra tvā āchāvadāmasi / tat ud śrayasva dyauḥ iva samudraḥ iva edhi akṣitaḥ /
analyzed: āśṛṇvantam yavam devam yatra tvā āchāvadāmasi   tat ud śrayasva dyauḥ iva samudraḥ iva edhi akṣitaḥ  /
translated: We call on thee, O barley, the god, when we address thee, as one who hearest. Rise up then like the sky, be like the sea, be inexhaustible.

original: akṣitāḥ te upasadaḥ akṣitāḥ santu rāśayaḥ / pṛṇantaḥ akṣitāḥ santu attāraḥ santu akṣitāḥ /
analyzed: akṣitāḥ te upasadaḥ akṣitāḥ santu rāśayaḥ   pṛṇantaḥ akṣitāḥ santu attāraḥ santu akṣitāḥ  /
translated: Exhaustible be thy stores, inexhaustible thy heaps. Let the givers be inexhaustible, let the eaters be inexhaustible.🔽They who have brought the first word by thought or by mind, or they who have uttered the truths,

original: dhītī vā ye anayan vācaḥ agram manasā vā ye avadan ṛtāni / tṛtīyena brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānāḥ turīyeṇa amanvata nāma dhenoḥ /
analyzed: dhītī vā ye anayan vācaḥ agram manasā vā ye avadan ṛtāni    tṛtīyena brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānāḥ turīyeṇa amanvata nāma dhenoḥ  /
translated: increasing by the third Brahman, they have agreed in the fourth upon the name of the milch cow.

original: sa veda putraḥ pitaram sa mātaram sa sūnuḥ bhuvat sa bhuvat punarmaghaḥ / sa dyām aurṇot antarikṣam svar saḥ idam viśvam abhavat saḥ ābharat //
analyzed: sa veda putraḥ pitaram sa mātaram sa sūnuḥ bhuvat sa bhuvat punarmaghaḥ    sa dyām aurṇot antarikṣam svar saḥ idam viśvam abhavat saḥ ābharat  /
translated: He is the son who knows his father, he is the mother, he is the son, he is the one who has become great again. He has filled the sky, the atmosphere, and heaven. He has become all this universe, and he has brought it forth.🔽Atharvan, the father, the kinsman of the gods, the embryo of the mother, the life of the father, the youth,

original: atharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum mātuḥ garbham pituḥ asum yuvānam / yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ //
analyzed: atharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum mātuḥ garbham pituḥ asum yuvānam    yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ  /
translated: Who has thought of this sacrifice with his mind, speak to us of him here, speak of him here.

original: ayā viṣṭhā janayan karvarāṇi sa hi ghṛṇiḥ uruḥ varāya gātuḥ / sa pratyudait dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram svayā tanvā tanvam airayata //
analyzed: ayā viṣṭhā janayan karvarāṇi sa hi ghṛṇiḥ uruḥ varāya gātuḥ    sa pratyudait dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram svayā tanvā tanvam airayata  /
translated: This Viṣṭha, begetting the firm things, he indeed is the wide-ruling path for the choice one. He has gone forth to the first sweet support, he has moved his own body with his own body.🔽With one and with ten, O well-offered one, with two for the sake of sacrifice, and with twenty,

original: ekayā ca daśabhiḥ ca su hute dvābhyām iṣṭaye viṃśatyā ca / tisṛbhiḥ ca vahase triṃśatā ca viyugbhiḥ vāyo iha tāḥ vi muñca //
analyzed: ekayā ca daśabhiḥ ca su hute dvābhyām iṣṭaye viṃśatyā ca   tisṛbhiḥ ca vahase triṃśatā ca viyugbhiḥ vāyo iha tāḥ vi muñca  /
translated: With three and with thirty, O Vāyu, with the separated ones, release them here.🔽The gods worshipped the sacrifice with the sacrifice. Those were the first established laws.

original: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan / te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ /
analyzed: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan   te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ  /
translated: They, the great ones, attend on the vault of heaven, where the ancient Sadhyas are the gods.

original: yajñaḥ babhūva saḥ ā babhūva sa pra jajñe saḥ u vāvṛdhe punar / sa devānām adhipatiḥ babhūva saḥ asmāsu draviṇam ā dadhātu //
analyzed: yajñaḥ babhūva saḥ ā babhūva sa pra jajñe saḥ u vāvṛdhe punar    sa devānām adhipatiḥ babhūva saḥ asmāsu draviṇam ā dadhātu  /
translated: He was the sacrifice, he became, he was born, he grew great again. He became the overlord of the gods. May he bestow wealth upon us.🔽When the gods with oblation worshipped the gods, the immortal ones with mortal mind,

original: yat devāḥ devān haviṣā ayajanta amartyān manasā martyena / madema tatra parame vyoman paśyema tat uditau sūryasya //
analyzed: yat devāḥ devān haviṣā ayajanta amartyān manasā martyena   madema tatra parame vyoman paśyema tat uditau sūryasya  /
translated: May we rejoice there in the highest heaven, and see that rising of the sun.🔽When the gods spread the sacrifice with the oblation of man,

original: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā yajñam devāḥ atanvata / asti nu tasmāt ojīyaḥ yat vihavyena ijire /
analyzed: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā yajñam devāḥ atanvata   asti nu tasmāt ojīyaḥ yat vihavyena ijire  /
translated: There is something stronger than that, that they worshipped with the oblation of the bird.🔽The foolish gods worshipped with a dog, in many ways they worshipped with the limbs of a cow.

original: mugdhāḥ devāḥ uta śunā ayajanta uta goḥ aṅgaiḥ purudhā ayajanta / yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ //
analyzed: mugdhāḥ devāḥ uta śunā ayajanta uta goḥ aṅgaiḥ purudhā ayajanta    yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ  /
translated: He who has thought upon this sacrifice with his mind, proclaim him to us here, speak of him here.

original: aditiḥ dyauḥ aditiḥ antarikṣam aditiḥ mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ / viśve devāḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ aditiḥ jātam aditiḥ janitvam /
analyzed: aditiḥ dyauḥ aditiḥ antarikṣam aditiḥ mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ   viśve devāḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ aditiḥ jātam aditiḥ janitvam  /
translated: Aditi is the sky, Aditi is the atmosphere, Aditi is the mother, he is the father, he is the son. Aditi is all the gods, Aditi is the five peoples. Aditi is the born, Aditi is the generating.

original: mahīm u su mātaram suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase havāmahe / tuvi kṣatrām ajarantīm urūcīm su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim //
analyzed: mahīm u su mātaram suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase havāmahe   tuvi kṣatrām ajarantīm urūcīm su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim  /
translated: The mighty, undecaying, far-extending Earth, Aditi, who gives fair shelter, and is good to guide.🔽The Earth, the heaven, that ne'er may be deceived, that giveth sure protection, Aditi, who guides aright,

original: su trāmāṇam pṛthivīm dyām anehasam su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim / daivīm nāvam svaritrām anāgasaḥ asravantīm ā ruhema svastaye /
analyzed: su trāmāṇam pṛthivīm dyām anehasam su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim    daivīm nāvam svaritrām anāgasaḥ asravantīm ā ruhema svastaye  /
translated: We will ascend the ship of Gods, that never breaks, that never sinks, that never can be wrecked, for our welfare.🔽We with our hymn exalt the mighty Mother of the steed's impetuous force, Aditi by name,

original: vājasya nu prasave mātaram mahīm aditim nāma vacasā karāmahe / yasyāḥ upasthe uru antarikṣam sā naḥ śarma tri varūtham ni yacchāt /
analyzed: vājasya nu prasave mātaram mahīm aditim nāma vacasā karāmahe    yasyāḥ upasthe uru antarikṣam sā naḥ śarma tri varūtham ni yacchāt  /
translated: In whose far-spreading lap is spread the spacious air: may she vouchsafe us shelter with threefold guard.🔽I have done service to the sons of Diti and to the sons of Aditi, to the Gods of high renown, who never may be tempted.

original: diteḥ putrāṇām aditeḥ akāriṣam ava devānām bṛhatām anarmaṇām / teṣām hi dhāma gabhiṣak samudriyam na enān namasā paraḥ asti kaścana /
analyzed: diteḥ putrāṇām aditeḥ akāriṣam ava devānām bṛhatām anarmaṇām    teṣām hi dhāma gabhiṣak samudriyam na enān namasā paraḥ asti kaścana  /
translated: For their dominion is the sea's, the all-sustaining: none may surpass them with his homage.

original: bhadrāt adhi śreyaḥ prehi bṛhaspatiḥ puraetā te astu / atha imam asyāḥ vare ā pṛthivyāḥ āreśatrum kṛṇuhi sarva vīram /
analyzed: bhadrāt adhi śreyaḥ prehi bṛhaspatiḥ puraetā te astu  / atha imam asyāḥ vare ā pṛthivyāḥ āreśatrum kṛṇuhi sarva vīram  /
translated: Go hence to what is better than this blessing: let Br̥ihaspati be thy leader onward. Now make this man, on this fair earth, a lord of princes, with all men's homage.

original: prapathe pathām ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ / ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā ca carati prajānan //
analyzed: prapathe pathām ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ    ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā ca carati prajānan  /
translated: On the highroads hath Pûshan been produced, on the highroads of the heavens, on the highroads of earth. He in both places most delightful, know- ing, moves to and fro. 10

original: pūṣā imāḥ āśāḥ anu veda sarvāḥ saḥ asmām abhayatamena neṣat / svasti dāḥ āghṛṇiḥ sarva vīraḥ a prayucchan puras etu prajānan //
analyzed: pūṣā imāḥ āśāḥ anu veda sarvāḥ saḥ asmām abhayatamena neṣat    svasti dāḥ āghṛṇiḥ sarva vīraḥ a prayucchan puras etu prajānan  /
translated: Pûshan knoweth all these regions well. May he conduct us by the safest pathway. Giver of bliss, the gladdener, all-heroic, may he, the watchful, go before us, knowing. 11

original: pūṣan tava vrate vayam na riṣyema kadā cana / stotāraḥ te iha smasi //
analyzed: pūṣan tava vrate vayam na riṣyema kadā cana   / stotāraḥ te iha smasi  /
translated: O Pûshan, never may we suffer wrong while we are in thy keeping here. We are thy praisers here. 12

original: pari pūṣā parastāt hastam dadhātu dakṣiṇam / punar naḥ naṣṭam ājatu sam naṣṭena gamemahi //
analyzed: pari pūṣā parastāt hastam dadhātu dakṣiṇam   punar naḥ naṣṭam ājatu sam naṣṭena gamemahi  /
translated: May Pûshan place his right hand on our backs, and lead us safely o’er the desert places. May he restore to us what we have lost, and with our lost may we return again. 13

original: yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayuḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ yaḥ sumnayuḥ su havaḥ yaḥ su datraḥ / yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayuḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ yaḥ sumnayuḥ su havaḥ yaḥ su datraḥ   yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ  /
translated: That breast of thine which is refreshing, friendly, prompt to succour, easy to invoke, bountiful, wherewith thou furtherest all precious things, O Sarasvatî, bestow that here for us to use. 14

original: yaḥ te pṛthu stanayitnuḥ yaḥ ṛṣvaḥ daivaḥ ketuḥ viśvam ābhūṣati idam / mā naḥ vadhīḥ vidyutā deva sasyam mā uta vadhiḥ raśmibhiḥ sūryasya /
analyzed: yaḥ te pṛthu stanayitnuḥ yaḥ ṛṣvaḥ daivaḥ ketuḥ viśvam ābhūṣati idam   mā naḥ vadhīḥ vidyutā deva sasyam mā uta vadhiḥ raśmibhiḥ sūryasya  /
translated: That lofty and far-spreading thunder-cloud of thine, that heavenly ensign which spreadeth out o’er all this world, spare thou our corn, O God, with thy lightnings, and destroy it not, nor with the sunbeams of the day. 15

original: sabhā ca mā samitiḥ ca avatām prajāpateḥ duhitarau saṃvidāne / yena saṃgacchāḥ upa mā sa śikṣāt cāru vadāni pitaraḥ saṃgateṣu /
analyzed: sabhā ca mā samitiḥ ca avatām prajāpateḥ duhitarau saṃvidāne   yena saṃgacchāḥ upa mā sa śikṣāt cāru vadāni pitaraḥ saṃgateṣu  /
translated: May the Assembly and the Meeting, the two daughters of Prajapati, agree together. With him may I be united, and let him be obedient to me. Let us speak kindly, O Fathers, in the assemblies.

original: vidma te sabhe nāma nariṣṭā nāma vai asi / ye te ke ca sabhāsadaḥ te me santu savācasaḥ /
analyzed: vidma te sabhe nāma nariṣṭā nāma vai asi   ye te ke ca sabhāsadaḥ te me santu savācasaḥ  /
translated: I know thy name, O Assembly: thou art called the Unharmed. All those who sit in the Assembly, let them be obedient to my will.

original: eṣām aham samāsīnānām varcaḥ vijñānam ā dade / asyāḥ sarvasyāḥ saṃsadaḥ mām indra bhaginam kṛṇu //
analyzed: eṣām aham samāsīnānām varcaḥ vijñānam ā dade   asyāḥ sarvasyāḥ saṃsadaḥ mām indra bhaginam kṛṇu  /
translated: From these who sit together I have taken away their splendour and their knowledge. Of all this assembly make me, O Indra, the most fortunate.

original: yat vaḥ manaḥ parāgatam yat baddham iha vā iha vā / tat vaḥ ā vartayāmasi mayi vaḥ ramatām manaḥ /🔽yathā sūryaḥ nakṣatrāṇām udyan tejāṃsi ādade / eva strīṇām ca puṃsām ca dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade /
analyzed: yat vaḥ manaḥ parāgatam yat baddham iha vā iha vā   tat vaḥ ā vartayāmasi mayi vaḥ ramatām manaḥ  / yathā sūryaḥ nakṣatrāṇām udyan tejāṃsi ādade   eva strīṇām ca puṃsām ca dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade  /
translated: Your mind that has gone away, that is bound here or there, that we bring back to you. Let your mind find pleasure in me.🔽Just as the rising sun takes away the light of the stars, so I take away the splendour of the women and men who hate me.

original: yāvantaḥ mā sapatnānām āyantam pratipaśyatha / udyan sūryaḥ iva suptānām dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ mā sapatnānām āyantam pratipaśyatha    udyan sūryaḥ iva suptānām dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade  /
translated: As many as of my enemies you see coming against me, I take away the splendour of the sleeping haters, as the rising sun (takes away the splendour of the stars).

original: abhi tyam devam savitāram oṇyoḥ kavi kratum / arcāmi satya savam ratna dhām abhi priyam matim //
analyzed: abhi tyam devam savitāram oṇyoḥ kavi kratum   arcāmi satya savam ratna dhām abhi priyam matim
translated: I praise that God Savitar, the wise, between the two bowls. I praise the true impeller, the bestower of treasure, and the dear thought.

original: urdhvā yasya amatiḥ bhās adidyutat savīmani / hiraṇya pāṇiḥ amimīta sukratuḥ kṛpāt svar /
analyzed: urdhvā yasya amatiḥ bhās adidyutat savīmani   hiraṇya pāṇiḥ amimīta sukratuḥ kṛpāt svar  /
translated: Whose thought is lofty, whose light hath shone forth in his own might, The golden-handed, the wise one, hath measured the sky from the sky.

original: sāvīḥ hi deva prathamāya pitre varṣmāṇam asmai varimāṇam asmai / atha asmabhyam savitar vāryāṇi divodivaḥ ā suva bhūri paśvaḥ /
analyzed: sāvīḥ hi deva prathamāya pitre varṣmāṇam asmai varimāṇam asmai    atha asmabhyam savitar vāryāṇi divodivaḥ ā suva bhūri paśvaḥ  /
translated: For the first time, O God Savitar, to the father, to him, the height, the greatness, to him. Then, O Savitar, to us, bestow the boons, from heaven, from heaven, bestow much cattle.

original: damūnāḥ devaḥ savitā vareṇyaḥ dadhat ratnam pitṛbhyaḥ āyūṃṣi / pibāt somam mamadat enam iṣṭe parijmā cit kramate asya dharmaṇi //
analyzed: damūnāḥ devaḥ savitā vareṇyaḥ dadhat ratnam pitṛbhyaḥ āyūṃṣi   pibāt somam mamadat enam iṣṭe parijmā cit kramate asya dharmaṇi  /
translated: The God Savitar, the guest-loving, the excellent, bearing treasure to the fathers, to the long life, Let him drink the Soma, let him be glad in this sacrifice. Even the running one goes in his own way.

original: tām savitar satya savām su citrām āham vṛṇe sumatim viśva vārām / yām asya kaṇvaḥ aduhat prapīnām sahasra dhārām mahiṣaḥ bhagāya //
analyzed: tām savitar satya savām su citrām ā aham vṛṇe sumatim viśva vārām    yām asya kaṇvaḥ aduhat prapīnām sahasra dhārām mahiṣaḥ bhagāya  /
translated: That variegated, most true, most excellent favour of thee, O Savitar, I choose, which brings all blessings, Which the mighty Kanva milked for Bhaga, the full one, with a thousand streams.

original: bṛhaspate savitar vardhaya enam jyotaya enam mahate saubhagāya / saṃśitam cit saṃtaram sam śiśādhi viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspate savitar vardhaya enam jyotaya enam mahate saubhagāya   saṃśitam cit saṃtaram sam śiśādhi viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ  /
translated: O Brhaspati, O Savitar, increase him, make him shine for great bliss. Sharpen thou even the sharpened, the swift one. Let all the Gods rejoice in him.

original: dhātā dadhātu naḥ rayim īśānaḥ jagataḥ patiḥ / sa naḥ pūrṇena yacchatu //
analyzed: dhātā dadhātu naḥ rayim īśānaḥ jagataḥ patiḥ   sa naḥ pūrṇena yacchatu  /
translated: May the disposer, the lord of the world, bestow wealth on us. May he bestow on us the full (gift).

original: dhātā dadhātu dāśuṣe prācīm jīvātum akṣitām / vayam devasya dhīmahi sumatim viśva rādhasaḥ /
analyzed: dhātā dadhātu dāśuṣe prācīm jīvātum akṣitām    vayam devasya dhīmahi sumatim viśva rādhasaḥ  /
translated: May Dhatr grant the worshipper long life that shall never have an end. May we attain the favour of the God who bestoweth all things good.

original: dhātā viśvā vāryā dadhātu prajā kāmāya dāśuṣe duroṇe / tasmai devāḥ amṛtam sam vyayantu viśve devāḥ aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: dhātā viśvā vāryā dadhātu prajā kāmāya dāśuṣe duroṇe   tasmai devāḥ amṛtam sam vyayantu viśve devāḥ aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ  /
translated: May Dhatr grant all blessings to the man who longs for progeny in his abode. May the All-Gods, the immortal Gods, and Aditi accordant grant him life.

original: dhātā rātiḥ savitā idam juṣantām prajāpatiḥ nidhi patiḥ naḥ agniḥ / tvaṣṭā viṣṇuḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ yajamānāya draviṇam dadhātu /
analyzed: dhātā rātiḥ savitā idam juṣantām prajāpatiḥ nidhi patiḥ naḥ agniḥ    tvaṣṭā viṣṇuḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ yajamānāya draviṇam dadhātu  /
translated: May Dhatr, Rati, Savitar accept this gift. May Prajâpati, may Agni, Lord of treasures, Tvashtar, Vishnu, granting progeny, bestow riches on the sacrificer.

original: pra nabhasva pṛthivi bhinddhi idam divyam nabhaḥ / udnaḥ divyasya naḥ dhātar īśānaḥ vi syāḥ dṛtim //
analyzed: pra nabhasva pṛthivi bhinddhi idam divyam nabhaḥ   udnaḥ divyasya naḥ dhātar īśānaḥ vi syāḥ dṛtim  /
translated: Open thyself, O Earth, and burst this heavenly covering of the cloud. O Dhatr, Lord of the heavenly rain, be thou the opener of the skin.

original: na ghraṃs tatāpa na himaḥ jaghāna pra nabhatām pṛthivī jīra dānuḥ / āpaḥ cit asmai ghṛtam id kṣaranti yatra somaḥ sadam id tatra bhadram //
analyzed: na ghraṃs tatāpa na himaḥ jaghāna pra nabhatām pṛthivī jīra dānuḥ    āpaḥ cit asmai ghṛtam id kṣaranti yatra somaḥ sadam id tatra bhadram  /
translated: Neither the heat hath scorched it, nor the cold hath injured it. Let the Earth, the bountiful, open herself. Even for him the waters flow as 'twere with oil. Where the Soma is, there is bliss for ever.

original: prajāpatiḥ janayati prajāḥ imāḥ dhātā dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ / saṃjānānāḥ saṃmanasaḥ sayonayaḥ mayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ dadhātu //
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ janayati prajāḥ imāḥ dhātā dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ   saṃjānānāḥ saṃmanasaḥ sayonayaḥ mayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ dadhātu  /
translated: Prajapati begets these creatures. May the Creator, well-disposed, bestow them. United in thought, in will, and in offspring, may the Lord of increase bestow increase upon me.🔽May Anumati today approve our sacrifice among the gods,

original: anu adya naḥ anumatiḥ yajñam deveṣu manyatām / agniḥ ca havyavāhanaḥ bhavatām dāśuṣe mama /
analyzed: anu adya naḥ anumatiḥ yajñam deveṣu manyatām   agniḥ ca havyavāhanaḥ bhavatām dāśuṣe mama  /
translated: and Agni, the bearer of oblations, be favourable to me, the worshipper.🔽Do thou, O Anumati, approve of this, and grant us peace.

original: anu id anumate tvam maṃsase śam ca naḥ kṛdhi / juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi rarāsva naḥ /
analyzed: anu id anumate tvam maṃsase śam ca naḥ kṛdhi   juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi rarāsva naḥ  /
translated: Accept the offered oblation, and grant us offspring, O goddess.🔽May he who approves approve our wealth with offspring, never failing.

original: anu manyatām anumanyamānaḥ prajāvantam rayim a kṣīyamāṇam / tasya vayam heḍasi mā api bhūma su mṛḍīke asya sumatau syāma /🔽yat te nāma su havam su praṇīte anumate anumatam sudānu / tena naḥ yajñam pipṛhi viśva vāre rayim naḥ dhehi subhage su vīram /
analyzed: anu manyatām anumanyamānaḥ prajāvantam rayim a kṣīyamāṇam     tasya vayam heḍasi mā api bhūma su mṛḍīke asya sumatau syāma  / yat te nāma su havam su praṇīte anumate anumatam sudānu    tena naḥ yajñam pipṛhi viśva vāre rayim naḥ dhehi subhage su vīram  /
translated: May we not incur his displeasure, but enjoy his most gracious favour.🔽Whatever is thy name, O thou who art easily invoked, O thou who art well directed, O Anumati, approved by the good, by that (name) do thou fill this sacrifice of mine, O thou who art all-powerful. Grant us wealth, O blessed one, with brave sons.🔽Anumati has come to this sacrifice for the sake of a good field and good sons, for the well-born.

original: ā imam yajñam anumatiḥ jagāma su kṣetra tāyai su vīra tāyai su jātam / bhadrā hi asyāḥ pramatiḥ babhūva sā imam yajñam avatu deva gopā /
analyzed: ā imam yajñam anumatiḥ jagāma su kṣetra tāyai su vīra tāyai su jātam    bhadrā hi asyāḥ pramatiḥ babhūva sā imam yajñam avatu deva gopā  /
translated: For her gracious favour has been good. May she, the guardian goddess, protect this sacrifice of ours.

original: anumatiḥ sarvam idam babhūva yat tiṣṭhati carati yat u ca viśvam ejati / tasyāḥ te devi sumatau syāma anumate anu hi maṃsase naḥ /
analyzed: anumatiḥ sarvam idam babhūva yat tiṣṭhati carati yat u ca viśvam ejati    tasyāḥ te devi sumatau syāma anumate anu hi maṃsase naḥ  /
translated: Anu-matî was all this that is and moves and all that liveth. In her good grace, O Goddess, may we be, O Anu-matî, for thou hast pity on us all.

original: sameta viśve vacasā patim divaḥ ekaḥ vibhūḥ atithiḥ janānām / sa pūrvyaḥ nūtanam āvivāsat tam vartaniḥ anu vāvṛte ekam id puru /
analyzed: sameta viśve vacasā patim divaḥ ekaḥ vibhūḥ atithiḥ janānām    sa pūrvyaḥ nūtanam āvivāsat tam vartaniḥ anu vāvṛte ekam id puru  /
translated: All the Gods have come together in accord to the Lord of heaven. He, the One, the All-pervading, the Guest of men, hath entered the new house of the ancient one. The path of him who is alone, O men, is far away.

original: ayam sahasram ā naḥ dṛśe kavīnām matiḥ jyotiḥ vidharmaṇi //🔽bradhnaḥ samīcīḥ uṣasaḥ sam airayan / arepasaḥ sacetasaḥ svasare manyumattamāḥ cite goḥ //
analyzed: ayam sahasram ā naḥ dṛśe kavīnām matiḥ jyotiḥ vidharmaṇi  bradhnaḥ samīcīḥ uṣasaḥ sam airayan   arepasaḥ sacetasaḥ svasare manyumattamāḥ cite goḥ  /
translated: This thousandfold light of the sages, this thought, hath come to us to be seen in the path of the law.🔽The far-reaching Dawns have sent forth the far-reaching (rays of the sun), free from stain, of one mind, in the abode of the sky, most wrathful in the mind of the created cow.

original: dauṣvapnyam daurjīvityam rakṣaḥ abhvam arāyyaḥ / durṇāmnīḥ sarvāḥ durvācaḥ tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi //
analyzed: dauṣvapnyam daurjīvityam rakṣaḥ abhvam arāyyaḥ   durṇāmnīḥ sarvāḥ durvācaḥ tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi  /
translated: Evil dreams, evil living, demon, terror, want, all evil names and evil words, we drive away from us.

original: yat naḥ indraḥ akhanat yat agniḥ viśve devāḥ marutaḥ yat su arkāḥ / tat asmabhyam savitā satya dharmā prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ ni yacchāt /
analyzed: yat naḥ indraḥ akhanat yat agniḥ viśve devāḥ marutaḥ yat su arkāḥ   tat asmabhyam savitā satya dharmā prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ ni yacchāt  /
translated: What treasure Indra hath dug out for us, what treasure Agni, what treasure the All-Gods, the Maruts, the well-praised, may Savitar, whose law is truth, and Pragâpati and Anumati bestow on us.

original: yayoḥ ojasā skabhitā rajāṃsi yau vīryaiḥ vīratamā śaviṣṭhā / yau patyete apratītau sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrvahūtiḥ /
analyzed: yayoḥ ojasā skabhitā rajāṃsi yau vīryaiḥ vīratamā śaviṣṭhā   yau patyete apratītau sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrvahūtiḥ  /
translated: Who are unresisted by their strength, to Vishnu and Varuna go the first invocations.🔽By whose law this world shines forth, and spreads itself in all directions,🔽Before the God's law and his strength, to Vishnu and Varuna go the first invocations.

original: yasya idam pradiśi yat virocate pra ca anati vi ca caṣṭe śacībhiḥ / purā devasya dharmaṇā sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrva hūtiḥ /
analyzed: yasya idam pradiśi yat virocate pra ca anati vi ca caṣṭe śacībhiḥ    purā devasya dharmaṇā sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrva hūtiḥ  /
translated: I will proclaim the mighty deeds of Vishnu, who hath measured the earthly regions.

original: viṣṇoḥ nu kam pra vocam vīryāṇi yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāṃsi / yaḥ askabhāyat uttaram sadhastham vicakramāṇaḥ tredhā uru gāyaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ nu kam pra vocam vīryāṇi yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāṃsi   yaḥ askabhāyat uttaram sadhastham vicakramāṇaḥ tredhā uru gāyaḥ  /
translated: He who hath established the loftiest abode, the far-reaching, the wide-extended, the three-stepped.🔽That strength of Vishnu they extol, the terrible beast who moves slow, dwelling in the mountain,

original: pra tat viṣṇuḥ stavate vīryāṇi mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ / parāvataḥ ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ /
analyzed: pra tat viṣṇuḥ stavate vīryāṇi mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ   parāvataḥ ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ  /
translated: May he come from the farthest distance, from the most remote.🔽In whose three wide strides all the worlds are contained,

original: yasya uruṣu triṣu vikramaneṣu adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā / uru viṣṇo vi kramasva uru kṣayāya naḥ kṛdhi / ghṛtam ghṛta yone piba prapra yajñapatim tira /
analyzed: yasya uruṣu triṣu vikramaneṣu adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā   uru viṣṇo vi kramasva uru kṣayāya naḥ kṛdhi   ghṛtam ghṛta yone piba prapra yajñapatim tira  /
translated: O Vishnu, step widely, make wide room for us. Drink the ghee, O ghee-born one, pass over to the lord of sacrifice.

original: idam viṣṇuḥ vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padā / samūḍham asya paṃsure /
analyzed: idam viṣṇuḥ vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padā    samūḍham asya paṃsure  /
translated: This Vishnu hath strode forth, and hath set his foot in three places. His foot hath been well planted in the dust.

original: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ adābhyaḥ / itas dharmāṇi dhārayan //
analyzed: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ adābhyaḥ   itas dharmāṇi dhārayan
translated: Vishnu hath strode forth with three steps, the guardian, the infallible. Thence supporting all the laws.

original: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yatas vratāni paspaśe / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yatas vratāni paspaśe    indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: Behold the works of Vishnu, whence he hath looked on the observances. He is the friend of Indra, meet for worship.

original: tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam sadā paśyanti sūrayaḥ / divi iva cakṣuḥ ātatam //
analyzed: tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam sadā paśyanti sūrayaḥ    divi iva cakṣuḥ ātatam  /
translated: The wise ever behold that highest place of Vishnu, as it were an eye stretched out in heaven.

original: divaḥ viṣṇo uta pṛthivyāḥ mahaḥ viṣṇo uroḥ antarikṣāt / hastau pṛṇasva bahubhiḥ vasavyaiḥ āprayaccha dakṣiṇāt ā uta savyāt /
analyzed: divaḥ viṣṇo uta pṛthivyāḥ mahaḥ viṣṇo uroḥ antarikṣāt    hastau pṛṇasva bahubhiḥ vasavyaiḥ āprayaccha dakṣiṇāt ā uta savyāt  /
translated: O Vishnu, from the sky, and from the earth, and from the wide region of air, O Vishnu, fill thy hands with many treasures. Give us from the right and from the left.

original: iḍā eva asmām anu vastām vratena yasyāḥ pade punate devayantaḥ / ghṛtapadī śakvarī soma pṛṣṭhā upa yajñam asthita vaiśvadevī /
analyzed: iḍā eva asmām anu vastām vratena yasyāḥ pade punate devayantaḥ   / ghṛtapadī śakvarī soma pṛṣṭhā upa yajñam asthita vaiśvadevī  /
translated: Let Idâ, who is to be served with the vow, dwell with us, in whose place those who honour the gods are purified. She who hath feet of ghee, who is Shakvari, who hath Soma for her back, the all-embracing one, hath taken her place at the sacrifice.

original: vedaḥ svastiḥ drughaṇaḥ svastiḥ paraśuḥ vediḥ paraśuḥ naḥ svasti / haviṣkṛtaḥ yajñiyāḥ yajña kāmāḥ te devāsaḥ yajñam imam juṣantām /
analyzed: vedaḥ svastiḥ drughaṇaḥ svastiḥ paraśuḥ vediḥ paraśuḥ naḥ svasti    haviṣkṛtaḥ yajñiyāḥ yajña kāmāḥ te devāsaḥ yajñam imam juṣantām  /
translated: The Veda is our welfare, the axe is our welfare, the altar is our welfare, the axe is our welfare. Ye who have prepared the oblation, ye who are meet for sacrifice, ye who delight in sacrifice, accept this sacrifice of ours, O ye gods.

original: agnāviṣṇū mahi tat vām mahitvam pāthaḥ ghṛtasya guhyasya nāma / damedame sapta ratnā dadhānau prati vām jihvā ghṛtam ā caraṇyāt /
analyzed: agnāviṣṇū mahi tat vām mahitvam pāthaḥ ghṛtasya guhyasya nāma    damedame sapta ratnā dadhānau prati vām jihvā ghṛtam ā caraṇyāt  /
translated: O Agni and Vishnu, great is your majesty, the path of the secret ghee is named. In every house, holding seven treasures, may your tongues lick the ghee towards you.

original: agnāviṣṇū mahi dhāma priyam vām vīthaḥ ghṛtasya guhyā juṣāṇau / damedame suṣṭutyā vāvṛdhānau prati vām jihvā ghṛtam ud caraṇyāt /
analyzed: agnāviṣṇū mahi dhāma priyam vām vīthaḥ ghṛtasya guhyā juṣāṇau   damedame suṣṭutyā vāvṛdhānau prati vām jihvā ghṛtam ud caraṇyāt  /
translated: O Agni and Vishnu, great is the abode that is dear to you, rejoicing in the secret path of ghee. In every house, growing through good praise, may your tongues lick the ghee towards you.

original: svāktam me dyāvāpṛthivī svāktam mitraḥ akaḥ ayam / svāktam me brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ svāktam savitā karat /🔽indra ūtibhiḥ bahulābhiḥ naḥ adya yāvat śreṣṭhābhiḥ maghavan śūra jinva / yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi adhara saḥ padīṣṭa yam u dviṣmaḥ tam u prāṇaḥ jahātu /
analyzed: svāktam me dyāvāpṛthivī svāktam mitraḥ akaḥ ayam    svāktam me brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ svāktam savitā karat  / indra ūtibhiḥ bahulābhiḥ naḥ adya yāvat śreṣṭhābhiḥ maghavan śūra jinva   yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi adhara saḥ padīṣṭa yam u dviṣmaḥ tam u prāṇaḥ jahātu  /
translated: May Dyaus and Prithivī anoint me, may Mitra anoint me, this one. May Brahmanaspati anoint me, may Savitar anoint me.🔽With your abundant and most excellent aids, O Indra, today, O bountiful one, O hero, inspire us. Let him who hates us be below our feet, let the breath forsake him whom we hate.

original: upa priyam panipnatam yuvānam āhutīvṛdham / aganma bibhrataḥ namaḥ dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me /
analyzed: upa priyam panipnatam yuvānam āhutīvṛdham   aganma bibhrataḥ namaḥ dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me  /
translated: We have come to the dear, much-invoked, youthful one, who waxes strong through oblations. Bearing our homage, may he make my life long.

original: sam mā siñcantu marutaḥ sam pūṣā sam bṛhaspatiḥ / sam mā ayam agniḥ siñcatu prajayā ca dhanena ca dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me /
analyzed: sam mā siñcantu marutaḥ sam pūṣā sam bṛhaspatiḥ   sam mā ayam agniḥ siñcatu prajayā ca dhanena ca dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me  /
translated: May the Maruts pour it on me, may Pûshan, may Brihaspati. May this Agni pour it on me. Give me long life, and offspring, and wealth.

original: agne jātān pra nuda me sapatnān prati a jātān jātavedaḥ nudasva / adhaspadam kṛṇuṣva ye pṛtanyavaḥ anāgasaḥ te vayam aditaye syāma /
analyzed: agne jātān pra nuda me sapatnān prati a jātān jātavedaḥ nudasva   adhaspadam kṛṇuṣva ye pṛtanyavaḥ anāgasaḥ te vayam aditaye syāma  /
translated: O Agni, drive away my foes who are born: drive thou away, O Jâtavedas, those unborn. Crush thou beneath thee those who fain would fight with us. Free from all sin may we be unto Aditi.

original: pra anyān sapatnān sahasā sahasva prati a jātān jātavedaḥ nudasva / idam rāṣṭram pipṛhi saubhagāya viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ /
analyzed: pra anyān sapatnān sahasā sahasva prati a jātān jātavedaḥ nudasva    idam rāṣṭram pipṛhi saubhagāya viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ  /
translated: With might, with overpowering might, drive thou away our other foes. Drive thou away, O Jâtavedas, those unborn. Make this our people prosper for good fortune. Let all the Gods rejoice in him.🔽These hundred ribs of thine, and these a thousand veins,

original: imāḥ yāḥ te śatam hirāḥ sahasram dhamanīḥ uta / tāsām te sarvāsām aham aśmanā bilam api adhām /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ te śatam hirāḥ sahasram dhamanīḥ uta    tāsām te sarvāsām aham aśmanā bilam api adhām  /
translated: of all of these I have with stone closed up the cavity.🔽From the higher womb I make the lower one for thee: let not thy progeny or thou be overcome.

original: param yoneḥ avaram te kṛṇomi mā tvā prajā abhi bhūt mā uta sūtuḥ / asvam tvā aprajasam kṛṇomi aśmānam te apidhānam kṛṇomi //
analyzed: param yoneḥ avaram te kṛṇomi mā tvā prajā abhi bhūt mā uta sūtuḥ   asvam tvā aprajasam kṛṇomi aśmānam te apidhānam kṛṇomi  /
translated: I make thee barren, childless: I make thy covering a stone.

original: akṣyau nau madhu saṃkāśe anīkam nau samañjanam / antar kṛṣṇuṣva mām hṛdi manaḥ id nau saha asati //
