analyzed: akṣyau nau madhu saṃkāśe anīkam nau samañjanam   antar kṛṣṇuṣva mām hṛdi manaḥ id nau saha asati  /
translated: Our eyes are like unto honey, our faces are anointed well. In my heart hide thyself, and let our minds be ever one.

original: abhi tvā manu jātena dadhāmi mama vāsasā / yāthā asaḥ mama kevalaḥ na anyāsām kīrtayāḥ cana /
analyzed: abhi tvā manu jātena dadhāmi mama vāsasā   yāthā asaḥ mama kevalaḥ na anyāsām kīrtayāḥ cana  /
translated: I clothe thee with my garment, O my husband, that thou mayst be mine only, and never speak the praises of another.

original: idam khanāmi bheṣajam māṃpaśyam abhirorudam / parāyataḥ nivartanam āyataḥ pratinandanam /
analyzed: idam khanāmi bheṣajam māṃpaśyam abhirorudam    parāyataḥ nivartanam āyataḥ pratinandanam  /
translated: I dig this medicine, the healing balm, that I may look on thee. That thou mayst turn from far away, and come again to me.

original: yena nicakre āsurī indram devebhyaḥ pari / tena ni kurve tvām aham yathā te asāni su priyā /
analyzed: yena nicakre āsurī indram devebhyaḥ pari   tena ni kurve tvām aham yathā te asāni su priyā  /
translated: With that wherewith the Asura-woman made Indra the Gods' supreme, With that I make thee subject to me, that thou mayst be most dear to me.

original: pratīcī somam asi pratīcī uta sūryam / pratīcī viśvān devān tām tvā achāvadāmasi //
analyzed: pratīcī somam asi pratīcī uta sūryam   pratīcī viśvān devān tām tvā achāvadāmasi  /
translated: Thou art the Western Soma, thou art the Western Sun, Thou art the Western all the Gods: we bring thee hitherward to us.

original: aham vadāmi na id tvam sabhāyām aha tvam vada / mama id asaḥ tvam kevalaḥ na anyāsām kīrtayāḥ cana /
analyzed: aham vadāmi na id tvam sabhāyām aha tvam vada   mama id asaḥ tvam kevalaḥ na anyāsām kīrtayāḥ cana  /
translated: I speak, not thou: in the assembly I am he who speaks. Thou art mine only: never speak the praises of another.

original: yadi vā asi tirojanam yadi vā nadyaḥ tiraḥi / iyam ha mahyam tvām oṣadhiḥ baddhvā iva nyānayat /
analyzed: yadi vā asi tirojanam yadi vā nadyaḥ tiraḥi   / iyam ha mahyam tvām oṣadhiḥ baddhvā iva nyānayat  /
translated: If thou art over the rivers, or over the mountains, This herb hath bound thee, as 'twere, and brought thee hither to me.

original: divyam suparṇam payasam bṛhantam apām garbham vṛṣabham oṣadhīnām / abhīpataḥ vṛṣṭyā tarpayantam ā naḥ goṣṭhe rayiṣṭhām sthāpayāti //
analyzed: divyam suparṇam payasam bṛhantam apām garbham vṛṣabham oṣadhīnām    abhīpatas vṛṣṭyā tarpayantam ā naḥ goṣṭhe rayiṣṭhām sthāpayāti  /
translated: The heavenly bird, the mighty one who dwells in waters, the bull of plants, the germ of waters, him who satisfies with rain from heaven, him who is rich in wealth, I cause to settle in our cow-pen.

original: yasya vratam paśavaḥ yanti sarve yasya vrate upatiṣṭhante āpaḥ / yasya vrate puṣṭa patiḥ niviṣṭaḥ tam sarasvantam avase havāmahe /
analyzed: yasya vratam paśavaḥ yanti sarve yasya vrate upatiṣṭhante āpaḥ   yasya vrate puṣṭa patiḥ niviṣṭaḥ tam sarasvantam avase havāmahe  /
translated: Whose is the lord of increase that is settled in the pasture, him, the wealthy, we invoke for help.🔽To the bountiful one who comes to the worshipper, to the wealthy one, to the lord of increase, to the one who has most wealth,

original: ā pratyañcam dāśuṣe dāśvaṃsam sarasvantam puṣṭa patim rayiṣṭhām / rāyaḥ poṣam śravasyum vasānāḥ iha sadanam rayīṇām /
analyzed: ā pratyañcam dāśuṣe dāśvaṃsam sarasvantam puṣṭa patim rayiṣṭhām    rāyaḥ poṣam śravasyum vasānāḥ iha sadanam rayīṇām  /
translated: To the lord of riches who desires fame, we, putting on (ourselves) the abode of riches here,🔽The hawk, looking on men, showing the end (of the journey), has passed over the deserts and the waters.

original: ati dhanvāni ati apaḥ tatarda śyenaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ avasāna darśaḥ / taran viśvāni avarā rajaṃsi indreṇa sakhyā śivaḥ ā jagamyāt //
analyzed: ati dhanvāni ati apaḥ tatarda śyenaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ avasāna darśaḥ   taran viśvāni avarā rajaṃsi indreṇa sakhyā śivaḥ ā jagamyāt  /
translated: May he, with Indra for his friend, go happily over all the lower regions,🔽The hawk, looking on men, the divine bird, thousand-footed, a hundred-born, giving life,

original: śyenaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sahasra pād śata yoniḥ vayodhāḥ / sa naḥ ni yacchāt vasu yat parābhṛtam asmākam astu pitṛṣu svadhāvat /
analyzed: śyenaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sahasra pād śata yoniḥ vayodhāḥ    sa naḥ ni yacchāt vasu yat parābhṛtam asmākam astu pitṛṣu svadhāvat  /
translated: May he lead us to the wealth that is beyond. Let us have among the fathers our own portion.🔽O Soma and Rudra, drive away the disease that has entered our house.

original: somārudrā vi vṛhatam viṣūcīm amīvā yā naḥ gayam āviveśa / bādhethām dūram nirṛtim parācais kṛtam cit enaḥ pra mumuktam asmat /
analyzed: somārudrā vi vṛhatam viṣūcīm amīvā yā naḥ gayam āviveśa    bādhethām dūram nirṛtim parācais kṛtam cit enaḥ pra mumuktam asmat  /
translated: Drive ye away far away Destruction. Free us even from the sin that we have committed.

original: somārudrā yuvam etāni asmat viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam / ava syatam muñcatam yat naḥ asat tanūṣu baddham kṛtam enaḥ asmat /
analyzed: somārudrā yuvam etāni asmat viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam   ava syatam muñcatam yat naḥ asat tanūṣu baddham kṛtam enaḥ asmat  /
translated: O Soma and Rudra, grant ye us these remedies for all our bodies. Be gracious, loose whatever sin we have committed against our bodies.

original: śivāḥ te ekāḥ aśivāḥ te ekāḥ sarvāḥ bibharṣi sumanasyamānaḥ / tisraḥ vācaḥ nihitāḥ antar asmin tāsām ekā vi papāta anu ghoṣam //
analyzed: śivāḥ te ekāḥ aśivāḥ te ekāḥ sarvāḥ bibharṣi sumanasyamānaḥ   tisraḥ vācaḥ nihitāḥ antar asmin tāsām ekā vi papāta anu ghoṣam  /
translated: Some of them are friendly to thee, some are unfriendly to thee: all of them thou bearest, well-pleased. Three voices are deposited within him: one of these hath flown forth after the sound.

original: ubhā jigyathuḥ na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraḥ cana enayoḥ / indraḥ ca viṣṇo yat apaspṛdhethām tredhā sahasram vi tat airayethām //
analyzed: ubhā jigyathuḥ na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraḥ cana enayoḥ    indraḥ ca viṣṇo yat apaspṛdhethām tredhā sahasram vi tat airayethām  /
translated: Ye both have conquered, ye have not been conquered: neither of you hath been vanquished in this contest. O Indra and Vishnu, when ye strove together, ye divided the thousand into three parts.🔽Brought from the people, from the universal people, from the river,

original: janāt viśvajanīnāt sindhutaḥ pari ābhṛtam / dūrāt tvā manye udbhṛtam īrṣyāyāḥ nāma bheṣajam /
analyzed: janāt viśvajanīnāt sindhutaḥ pari ābhṛtam   dūrāt tvā manye udbhṛtam īrṣyāyāḥ nāma bheṣajam  /
translated: I deem thee brought from far away, the medicine for the name of envy.🔽Like a fire that burns, like a conflagration that burns separately,

original: agneḥ iva asya dahataḥ dāvasya dahataḥ pṛthak / etām etasya īrṣyām udra agnim iva śamaya //
analyzed: agneḥ iva asya dahataḥ dāvasya dahataḥ pṛthak    etām etasya īrṣyām udra agnim iva śamaya  /
translated: like a fire, O Udra, appease this envy of his.🔽O Sinîvâlî, thou of ample store, who art the sister of the Gods,

original: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā / juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi didiḍḍhi naḥ /
analyzed: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā   juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi didiḍḍhi naḥ  /
translated: accept the offered sacrifice, and grant us progeny, O Goddess.

original: yā su bāhuḥ su aṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahu sūvarī / tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana /
analyzed: yā su bāhuḥ su aṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahu sūvarī    tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana  /
translated: To her, the mistress of the clan, to Sinîvâlî, offer your oblation.

original: yā viśpatnī indram asi pratīcī sahasra stukā abhiyantī devī / viṣṇoḥ patni tubhyam rātā havīṃṣi patim devi rādhase codayasva /🔽kuhūm devīm su kṛtam vidmanā apasam asmin yajñe su havā johavīmi / sā naḥ rayim viśva vāram ni yacchāt dadātu vīram śata dāyam ukthyam /
analyzed: yā viśpatnī indram asi pratīcī sahasra stukā abhiyantī devī    viṣṇoḥ patni tubhyam rātā havīṃṣi patim devi rādhase codayasva  / kuhūm devīm su kṛtam vidmanā apasam asmin yajñe su havā johavīmi    sā naḥ rayim viśva vāram ni yacchāt dadātu vīram śata dāyam ukthyam  /
translated: Thou who art mistress of the clan, art Indra's consort, looking to the east, O Goddess, with a thousand shoots, advancing. O Vishnu's consort, to thee are offered oblations. O Goddess, urge thy lord to give us wealth.🔽I call to this our sacrifice, with prayer, the Goddess Kuhu, the well-disposed, the skilful. May she bestow upon us wealth that brings all blessings, and give us a son to be extolled, the giver of a hundred gifts.

original: kuhūḥ devānām amṛtasya patnī havyā naḥ asya haviṣaḥ juṣeta / śṛnotu yajñam uśatī naḥ adya rāyaḥ poṣam cikituṣī dadhātu //
analyzed: kuhūḥ devānām amṛtasya patnī havyā naḥ asya haviṣaḥ juṣeta    śṛnotu yajñam uśatī naḥ adya rāyaḥ poṣam cikituṣī dadhātu  /
translated: Kuhu, the consort of the Gods, the Goddess of immortal life, may she accept our offering of this our oblation. May she, who loves the sacrifice, hear it to-day, and grant us increase of possessions and of wealth.

original: rākām aham su havā suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā / sīvyatu apaḥ sūcyā āchidyamānayā dadātu vīram śata dāyam ukthyam /
analyzed: rākām aham su havā suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā    sīvyatu apaḥ sūcyā āchidyamānayā dadātu vīram śata dāyam ukthyam  /
translated: I call on Râkâ, easy to invoke, with fair hymns: may the auspicious Goddess hear us and be gracious to us. May she with needle that is never blunted sew up the waters. May she give us a son to be extolled, the giver of a hundred gifts.

original: yāḥ te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśasaḥ yābhiḥ dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni / tābhiḥ naḥ adya sumanāḥ upāgahi sahasrāpoṣam subhage rarāṇā /🔽devānām patnīḥ uśatīḥ avantu naḥ prāvantu naḥ tujaye vājasātaye / yāḥ pārthivāsaḥ yāḥ apām api vrate tāḥ naḥ devīḥ su havāḥ śarma yacchantu //
analyzed: yāḥ te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśasaḥ yābhiḥ dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni   tābhiḥ naḥ adya sumanāḥ upāgahi sahasrāpoṣam subhage rarāṇā  / devānām patnīḥ uśatīḥ avantu naḥ prāvantu naḥ tujaye vājasātaye   yāḥ pārthivāsaḥ yāḥ apām api vrate tāḥ naḥ devīḥ su havāḥ śarma yacchantu  /
translated: O Rāka, all thy gracious favours, all thy gifts of beauty, wherewith thou bestowest wealth on the worshipper, With all of these come thou to us this day, O blessed one, bestowing a thousandfold increase of wealth.🔽May the loving wives of the Gods protect us, may they help us to victory and the winning of booty. Those who dwell on earth, and those who are in the realm of the waters, may those Goddesses, easy to invoke, grant us protection.

original: uta gnāḥ vyantu deva patnīḥ indrāṇī agnāyī aśvinī rāj / ā rodasī varunānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīḥ yaḥ ṛtuḥ janīnām /
analyzed: uta gnāḥ vyantu deva patnīḥ indrāṇī agnāyī aśvinī rāj   ā rodasī varunānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīḥ yaḥ ṛtuḥ janīnām  /
translated: And may the wives of the Gods, the Gnas, be gracious to us: may the wife of Indra, the wife of Agni, the wife of the Asvins, the wife of Pusan, the wife of the All-Gods, the wife of the Maruts, the wife of Brhaspati, the wife of the Visve Devas, the wife of the Sadhyas, the wife of Indra, the wife of Agni, the wife of the Asvins, the wife of Pusan, may the wife of Varuna hear the two world-halves. May the Goddesses be gracious to us, according to the season of women.🔽As the thunderbolt, irresistible, slays the tree every day,

original: yathā vṛkṣam aśaniḥ viśvāhā hanti aprati / eva aham adya kitavān akṣaiḥ badhyāsam aprati /
analyzed: yathā vṛkṣam aśaniḥ viśvāhā hanti aprati    eva aham adya kitavān akṣaiḥ badhyāsam aprati  /
translated: So may I slay the gamblers today with the dice, without fail.🔽Of the swift and the slow, of the people who are not hostile,

original: turāṇām aturāṇām viśām avarjuṣīṇām / samaitu viśvatas bhagaḥ antarhastam kṛtam mama /
analyzed: turāṇām aturāṇām viśām avarjuṣīṇām    samaitu viśvatas bhagaḥ antarhastam kṛtam mama  /
translated: May Bhaga come from all sides and enter my hand.🔽I praise Agni, the good protector, with homage. Here, being engaged, may he remove our sin.

original: īḍe agnim svāvasum namobhiḥ iha prasaktaḥ vi cayat kṛtam naḥ / rathaiḥ iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇam marutām stomam ṛdhyām //
analyzed: īḍe agnim svāvasum namobhiḥ iha prasaktaḥ vi cayat kṛtam naḥ   rathaiḥ iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇam marutām stomam ṛdhyām  /
translated: I shall carry him, as if with chariots, who bestows strength. I shall accomplish the praise of the Maruts, turning to the right.

original: vayam jayema tvayā yujā vṛtam asmākam aṃśam ud ava bharebhare / asmabhyam indra varīyaḥ sugam kṛdhi pra śatrūṇām maghavan vṛṣṇyā ruja //
analyzed: vayam jayema tvayā yujā vṛtam asmākam aṃśam ud ava bharebhare    asmabhyam indra varīyaḥ sugam kṛdhi pra śatrūṇām maghavan vṛṣṇyā ruja  /
translated: crush thou the Vrishnis, Maghavan, the foemen down.🔽I have subdued thee, I have overcome thee, I have subdued thee, I have overcome thee.

original: ajaiṣam tvā saṃlikhitam ajaiṣam uta saṃrudham / avim vṛkaḥ yathā mathat eva mathnāmi te kṛtam /
analyzed: ajaiṣam tvā saṃlikhitam ajaiṣam uta saṃrudham    avim vṛkaḥ yathā mathat eva mathnāmi te kṛtam  /
translated: As a wolf tears an ass, so do I tear thy deed.🔽He who is fain for Godspeed wins the fight, as 'twere, by fraud: the housewife gathers up her store at eve.

original: uta prahām atidīvā jayati kṛtam iva śvaghnī vi cinoti kāle / yaḥ deva kāmaḥ na dhanam ruṇaddhi sam id tam rāyaḥ sṛjati svadhābhiḥ //
analyzed: uta prahām atidīvā jayati kṛtam iva śvaghnī vi cinoti kāle    yaḥ deva kāmaḥ na dhanam ruṇaddhi sam id tam rāyaḥ sṛjati svadhābhiḥ  /
translated: To us, O ye all Gods, give wealth in cattle and in corn, and in food, O ye all Gods.🔽May we with cattle pass beyond distress and want, and with corn hunger, O ye all Gods.

original: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena vā kṣudham puruhūta viśve / vayam rājasu prathamā dhanāni ariṣṭāsaḥ vṛjanībhiḥ jayema /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena vā kṣudham puruhūta viśve    vayam rājasu prathamā dhanāni ariṣṭāsaḥ vṛjanībhiḥ jayema  /
translated: May we, O ye all Gods, be foremost in the winning of the spoil, and with our bands gain riches, O ye all Gods.🔽Victory is placed on my left hand, and success on my right.

original: kṛtam me dakṣiṇe haste jayaḥ me savyaḥ āhitaḥ / go jit bhūyāsam aśva jit dhanaṃjayaḥ hiraṇya jit /
analyzed: kṛtam me dakṣiṇe haste jayaḥ me savyaḥ āhitaḥ   go jit bhūyāsam aśva jit dhanaṃjayaḥ hiraṇya jit  /
translated: May I win cattle, win horses, win wealth, win gold.🔽The dice have given me a fruitful throw, as 'twere a milch-cow.

original: akṣāḥ phalavatīm dyuvam datta gām kṣīriṇīm iva / sam mā kṛtasya dhārayā dhanuḥ snāvnā iva nahyata /
analyzed: akṣāḥ phalavatīm dyuvam datta gām kṣīriṇīm iva    sam mā kṛtasya dhārayā dhanuḥ snāvnā iva nahyata  /
translated: Bind me with the stream of what is done, as with a bowstring.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghayoḥ / indraḥ purastāt uta madhyataḥ naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varīyaḥ kṛṇotu //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghayoḥ   indraḥ purastāt uta madhyataḥ naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varīyaḥ kṛṇotu  /
translated: May Brihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, and from the sinner. May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us ample riches.

original: saṃjñānam naḥ svebhiḥ saṃjñānam araṇebhiḥ / saṃjñānam aśvinā yuvam iha asmāsu ni yacchatam //
analyzed: saṃjñānam naḥ svebhiḥ saṃjñānam araṇebhiḥ   saṃjñānam aśvinā yuvam iha asmāsu ni yacchatam  /
translated: Grant us the knowledge of our own, the knowledge of our strangers' lore. Ye Aṣvins Twain, grant us the knowledge here that ye may have it in your keeping.

original: sam jānāmahai manasā sam cikitvāḥ mā yuṣmahi manasā daivyena / mā ghoṣāḥ ud sthuḥ bahule vinirhate mā iṣuḥ paptat indrasya ahani āgate /
analyzed: sam jānāmahai manasā sam cikitvāḥ mā yuṣmahi manasā daivyena   mā ghoṣāḥ ud sthuḥ bahule vinirhate mā iṣuḥ paptat indrasya ahani āgate  /
translated: Let us agree in heart and mind, let us not disagree in heart with the celestial host. Let not the many loud voices rise against us, let not the arrow come from Indra's side.

original: amutrabhūyāt adhi yat yamasya bṛhaspate abhiśasteḥ amuñcaḥ / prati auhatām aśvinā mṛtyum asmat devānām agne bhiṣajā śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: amutrabhūyāt adhi yat yamasya bṛhaspate abhiśasteḥ amuñcaḥ   prati auhatām aśvinā mṛtyum asmat devānām agne bhiṣajā śacībhiḥ  /
translated: When, Br̥ihaspati, thou freedst from the noose of Yama, who is yonder, the man who had been seized, The Asvins, with the powers of the physicians of the Gods, removed from us the dart of death.

original: sam krāmatam mā jahītam śarīram prāṇa apānau te sayujau iha stām / śatam jīva śaradaḥ vardhamānaḥ agniḥ te gopāḥ adhipāḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: sam krāmatam mā jahītam śarīram prāṇa apānau te sayujau iha stām    śatam jīva śaradaḥ vardhamānaḥ agniḥ te gopāḥ adhipāḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ  /
translated: Come hither, do not turn aside: let not thy body fail thee. Let thy breath and thy out-breath here be united. Live a hundred winters, waxing old in age. Thy guardian and protector is Agni, thy Vasishṭha.

original: āyuḥ yat te atihitam parācais apānaḥ prāṇaḥ punar ā tau itām / agniḥ tat āhār nirṛteḥ upasthāt tat ātmani punar ā veśayāmi te /
analyzed: āyuḥ yat te atihitam parācais apānaḥ prāṇaḥ punar ā tau itām   agniḥ tat āhār nirṛteḥ upasthāt tat ātmani punar ā veśayāmi te  /
translated: Thy life that hath been carried away to the distance, let thy out-breath and thy in-breath return again. Agni hath brought it from the presence of Destruction: I bring it back again into thy body.

original: mā imam prāṇaḥ ha āsīt mā u apānaḥ avahāya parā gāt / saptarṣibhyaḥ enam pari dadāmi te enam svasti jarase vahantu /
analyzed: mā imam prāṇaḥ ha āsīt mā u apānaḥ avahāya parā gāt    saptarṣibhyaḥ enam pari dadāmi te enam svasti jarase vahantu  /
translated: Let not thy breath depart, leaving this body of thine. I give it to the Seven Rishis. Let them carry it to old age in safety.

original: pra viṣatam prāṇa apānau anaḍvāhau iva vrajam / ayam jarimnaḥ śevadhiḥ ariṣṭaḥ iha vardhatām /
analyzed: pra viṣatam prāṇa apānau anaḍvāhau iva vrajam    ayam jarimnaḥ śevadhiḥ ariṣṭaḥ iha vardhatām  /
translated: Go forth, O Breath, and out-breath, as two bulls to the pasture. Let this, the life of old age, increase here uninjured.

original: ā te prāṇam suvāmasi parā yakṣmam suvāmi te / āyuḥ naḥ viśvatas dadhat ayam agniḥ vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: ā te prāṇam suvāmasi parā yakṣmam suvāmi te    āyuḥ naḥ viśvatas dadhat ayam agniḥ vareṇyaḥ  /
translated: I restore thy breath to thee: I drive away thy inward sickness. May this most excellent Agni, bestowing life on us from all sides,

original: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari rohantaḥ nākam uttamam / devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam /
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari rohantaḥ nākam uttamam   devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam  /
translated: Rising from this darkness, we have reached the highest vault of heaven. We have come to the God Sûrya, the light most excellent, among the Gods.

original: ṛcam sāma yajāmahe yābhyām karmāṇi kurvate / ete sadasi rājataḥ yajñam deveṣu yacchataḥ /
analyzed: ṛcam sāma yajāmahe yābhyām karmāṇi kurvate    ete sadasi rājataḥ yajñam deveṣu yacchataḥ  /
translated: We worship the Rich and Sâman, by which the rites are performed. These two, in the assembly, like kings, direct the sacrifice among the Gods.

original: ṛcam sāma yat aprākṣam haviḥ ojaḥ yajuḥ balam / eṣa mā tasmāt mā hiṃsīt vedaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ śacīpate /
analyzed: ṛcam sāma yat aprākṣam haviḥ ojaḥ yajuḥ balam    eṣa mā tasmāt mā hiṃsīt vedaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ śacīpate  /
translated: May this Veda, asked, do me no harm, O Lord of Strength.🔽Those paths of thine which lead from heaven, whereby thou movest all things here,

original: ye te panthānaḥ ava divaḥ yebhiḥ viśvam airayaḥ / tebhiḥ sumnayā dhehi naḥ vaso //
analyzed: ye te panthānaḥ ava divaḥ yebhiḥ viśvam airayaḥ   / tebhiḥ sumnayā dhehi naḥ vaso  /
translated: Therewith, O Vasu, grant us bliss.🔽From the black serpent, from the spotted, from the sidelong-gliding one,

original: tiraści rājeḥ asitāt pṛdākoḥ pari saṃbhṛtam / tat kaṅka parvaṇaḥ viṣam iyam vīrudh anīnaśat /
analyzed: tiraści rājeḥ asitāt pṛdākoḥ pari saṃbhṛtam   tat kaṅka parvaṇaḥ viṣam iyam vīrudh anīnaśat  /
translated: This plant hath driven far away the poison of the Kanka-snake.🔽This plant is born of honey, is honey-dripping, full of sweetness, sweet with sweetness.

original: iyam vīrudh madhu jātā madhuścut madhulā madhūḥ / sā vihrutasya bheṣajī atho maśaka jambhanī //
analyzed: iyam vīrudh madhu jātā madhuścut madhulā madhūḥ    sā vihrutasya bheṣajī atho maśaka jambhanī  /
translated: It is a remedy for one who stumbles, and a charm to drive away the gnats.🔽From whatever place the bite hath come, from whatever place the sting,

original: yatas daṣṭam yatas dhītam tatas te niḥ hvayāmasi / arbhasya tṛpra daṃśinaḥ maśakasya arasam viṣam /
analyzed: yatas daṣṭam yatas dhītam tatas te niḥ hvayāmasi   arbhasya tṛpra daṃśinaḥ maśakasya arasam viṣam  /
translated: From thence we charm away thy poison, O thou many-coloured, many-stinged gnat.🔽Thou who art crooked, twisted, deformed, who makest crooked faces, crooked limbs,

original: ayam yaḥ vakraḥ viparuḥ vyaṅgaḥ mukhāni vakrā vṛjinā kṛṇoṣi / tāni tvam brahmaṇas pate iṣīkām iva sam namaḥ /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ vakraḥ viparuḥ vyaṅgaḥ mukhāni vakrā vṛjinā kṛṇoṣi   tāni tvam brahmaṇas pate iṣīkām iva sam namaḥ  /
translated: These, O Brahmanaspati, thou bendest like a reed.🔽The poison of the tasteless grub, the creeping, crawling insect,

original: arasasya śarkoṭasya nīcīnasya upasarpataḥ / viṣam hi asya ādiṣi atha u enam ajījabham //
analyzed: arasasya śarkoṭasya nīcīnasya upasarpataḥ viṣam hi asya ādiṣi atha u enam ajījabham
translated: I have discovered in his body, and now I have subdued him.

original: na te bāhvoḥ balam asti na śīrṣe na uta madhyataḥ / atha kim pāpayā amuyā puche bibharṣi arbhakam //
analyzed: na te bāhvoḥ balam asti na śīrṣe na uta madhyataḥ   atha kim pāpayā amuyā puche bibharṣi arbhakam  /
translated: There is no strength in thy arms, nor in thy head, nor in thy middle. Then why, O wicked one, dost thou carry a child on thy tail?

original: adanti tvā pipīlikāḥ vi vṛścanti mayūryaḥ / sarve bhala bravātha śārkoṭam arasam viṣam /
analyzed: adanti tvā pipīlikāḥ vi vṛścanti mayūryaḥ   sarve bhala bravātha śārkoṭam arasam viṣam  /
translated: The ants eat thee, the peacocks tear thee in pieces. All speak evil of thee, O scorpion, thy poison is powerless.

original: yaḥ ubhābhyām praharasi puchena ca āsyena ca / āsye na te viṣam kim u te puchadhau asat /
analyzed: yaḥ ubhābhyām praharasi puchena ca āsyena ca   āsye na te viṣam kim u te puchadhau asat  /
translated: Thou who smitest with both, with thy tail and with thy mouth, in thy mouth is no poison. How much less in thy tail?

original: yat āśasā vadataḥ me vicukṣubhe yat yācamānasya carataḥ janām anu / yat ātmani tanvaḥ me viriṣṭam sarasvatī tat ā pṛṇat ghṛtena /
analyzed: yat āśasā vadataḥ me vicukṣubhe yat yācamānasya carataḥ janām anu   yat ātmani tanvaḥ me viriṣṭam sarasvatī tat ā pṛṇat ghṛtena  /
translated: What I have said with a curse, what I have stirred up as I have begged my way among the people, what I have injured in my own body, may Sarasvatî make good to me with ghee.

original: sapta kṣaranti siśave marutvate pitre putrāsaḥ api avīvṛtan ṛtāni / ubhe id asya ubhe asya rājate ubhe yatete ubhe asya puṣyataḥ /
analyzed: sapta kṣaranti siśave marutvate pitre putrāsaḥ api avīvṛtan ṛtāni    ubhe id asya ubhe asya rājate ubhe yatete ubhe asya puṣyataḥ  /
translated: Seven flow to the young Marutvat, to the father: the sons have turned to the eternal laws. Both are his, both shine forth as his, both are active, both prosper as his.

original: indrāvaruṇā suta pau imam sutam somam pibatam madyam dhṛta vratau / yuvaḥ rathaḥ adhvaraḥ deva vītaye prati svasaram upa yātu pītaye /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā suta pau imam sutam somam pibatam madyam dhṛta vratau    yuvaḥ rathaḥ adhvaraḥ deva vītaye prati svasaram upa yātu pītaye  /
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, drink this pressed Soma, the gladdening drink, ye whose law is sure. Your chariot is the sacrifice: come to your home to drink the draught.

original: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām / idam vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayethām /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām    idam vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayethām  /
translated: Indra and Varuna, ye mighty, drink ye of the most gladdening juice of the strong Soma. This your cup is filled: sit ye down on this sacred grass, and rejoice yourselves.🔽He who curses us when we do not curse, and he who curses us when we do curse,

original: yaḥ naḥ śapāt a śapataḥ śapataḥ yaḥ ca naḥ śapāt / vṛkṣaḥ iva vidyutā hataḥ ā mūlāt anu śuṣyatu //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ śapāt a śapataḥ śapataḥ yaḥ ca naḥ śapāt    vṛkṣaḥ iva vidyutā hataḥ ā mūlāt anu śuṣyatu  /
translated: Like a tree struck by lightning, may he wither away from the root.🔽Bearing strength, seeking wealth, of good understanding, with a harmless, friendly eye,

original: ūrjam bibhrat vasu vaniḥ sumedhāḥ aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa / gṛhān aimi sumanāḥ vandamānaḥ ramadhvam mā bibhīta mat /
analyzed: ūrjam bibhrat vasu vaniḥ sumedhāḥ aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa   gṛhān aimi sumanāḥ vandamānaḥ ramadhvam mā bibhīta mat  /
translated: I come to the houses, well-disposed, with reverence. Rejoice, be not afraid of me.🔽These houses are full of joy, rich in strength and milk,

original: ime gṛhāḥ mayobhuvaḥ ūrjasvantaḥ payasvantaḥ / pūrṇāḥ vāmena tiṣṭhantaḥ te naḥ jānantu āyataḥ //
analyzed: ime gṛhāḥ mayobhuvaḥ ūrjasvantaḥ payasvantaḥ   pūrṇāḥ vāmena tiṣṭhantaḥ te naḥ jānantu āyataḥ  /
translated: full of good things, standing. May they know me when I come.🔽To whom he goes when he is away, in whom he has much delight,

original: yeṣām adhyeti pravasan yeṣu saumanasaḥ bahuḥ / gṛhān upa hvayāmahe te naḥ jānantu āyataḥ //
analyzed: yeṣām adhyeti pravasan yeṣu saumanasaḥ bahuḥ   gṛhān upa hvayāmahe te naḥ jānantu āyataḥ  /
translated: to the houses we call. May they know me when I come.🔽Called hither are the rich friends, the sweet companions,

original: upahūtāḥ bhūri dhanāḥ sakhāyaḥ svādu saṃmudaḥ / akṣudhyāḥ atṛṣyāḥ sta gṛhāḥ mā asmat bibhītana /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ bhūri dhanāḥ sakhāyaḥ svādu saṃmudaḥ   akṣudhyāḥ atṛṣyāḥ sta gṛhāḥ mā asmat bibhītana  /
translated: the houses, not to be starved or thirsted, be not afraid of us.

original: upahūtāḥ iha gāvaḥ upahūtāḥ aja avayaḥ / atha u annasya kīlālaḥ upahūtaḥ gṛheṣu /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ iha gāvaḥ upahūtāḥ aja avayaḥ    atha u annasya kīlālaḥ upahūtaḥ gṛheṣu  /
translated: The cows are called hither, the goats and sheep are called hither,🔽and the sweet essence of food is called hither in the houses.

original: sūnṛtāvantaḥ subhagāḥ irāvantaḥ hasāmudāḥ / atṛṣyāḥ akṣudhyāḥ sta gṛhāḥ mā asmat bibhītana /
analyzed: sūnṛtāvantaḥ subhagāḥ irāvantaḥ hasāmudāḥ   atṛṣyāḥ akṣudhyāḥ sta gṛhāḥ mā asmat bibhītana  /
translated: Rich in good food, full of delight, full of joy, full of gladness are the houses. Be not afraid of us, O houses.

original: iha eva sta mā anu gāta viśvā rūpāṇi puṣyata / aiṣyāmi bhadreṇa saha bhūyāṃsaḥ bhavatā mayā /
analyzed: iha eva sta mā anu gāta viśvā rūpāṇi puṣyata   aiṣyāmi bhadreṇa saha bhūyāṃsaḥ bhavatā mayā  /
translated: Here only stay, and cherish all our forms. I will come with the good. May we be more numerous than thou.

original: yat agne tapasā tapaḥ upatapyāmahe tapaḥ / priyāḥ śrutasya bhūyāsma āyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ //
analyzed: yat agne tapasā tapaḥ upatapyāmahe tapaḥ   priyāḥ śrutasya bhūyāsma āyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ  /
translated: O Agni, as we practise austerity by austerity, may we become dear to the heard, long-lived, and wise.

original: agne tapaḥ tapyāmahe upa tapyāmahe tapaḥ / śrutāni śṛṇvantaḥ vayam āyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ //
analyzed: agne tapaḥ tapyāmahe upa tapyāmahe tapaḥ   śrutāni śṛṇvantaḥ vayam āyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ
translated: O Agni, we practise austerity, we practise austerity. Hearing the heard, may we be long-lived and wise.

original: ayam agniḥ sat patiḥ vṛddha vṛṣṇaḥ rathī iva pattīn ajayat purohitaḥ / nābhā pṛthivyām nihitaḥ davidyutat adhaspadam kṛṇutām ye pṛtanyavaḥ /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ sat patiḥ vṛddha vṛṣṇaḥ rathī iva pattīn ajayat purohitaḥ   nābhā pṛthivyām nihitaḥ davidyutat adhaspadam kṛṇutām ye pṛtanyavaḥ  /
translated: This Agni, the lord of the good, the charioteer, like a charioteer, has conquered the foot-soldiers, the Vrishnas. Set in the navel of the earth, he shines. Let those who are hostile make him their lower foot.

original: pṛtanājitam sahamānam agnim ukthyaiḥ havāmahe paramāt sadhasthāt / sa naḥ parṣat ati durgāṇi viśvā kṣāmat devaḥ ati duritāni agniḥ /
analyzed: pṛtanājitam sahamānam agnim ukthyaiḥ havāmahe paramāt sadhasthāt   sa naḥ parṣat ati durgāṇi viśvā kṣāmat devaḥ ati duritāni agniḥ  /
translated: We invoke Agni, the conqueror of armies, the victorious, with hymns, from the highest abode. May that God Agni carry us over all difficulties, may he deliver us from evil.

original: idam yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakuniḥ abhiniṣpatan apīpatat / āpaḥ mā tasmāt sarvasmāt duritāt pāntu aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: idam yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakuniḥ abhiniṣpatan apīpatat    āpaḥ mā tasmāt sarvasmāt duritāt pāntu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: The evil that the black bird hath brought upon us as it flew away, from all that sin and sorrow may the Waters save and keep me safe.

original: idam yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakuniḥ avāmṛkṣat nirṛte te mukhena / agniḥ mā tasmāt enasaḥ gārhapatyaḥ pra muñcatu //
analyzed: idam yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakuniḥ avāmṛkṣat nirṛte te mukhena   agniḥ mā tasmāt enasaḥ gārhapatyaḥ pra muñcatu  /
translated: The evil that the black bird hath brought upon us with the mouth of Nirriti, from that sin may Agni, the Gārhapatya fire, set me free.

original: pratīcīna phalaḥ hi tvam apāmārga rurohitha / sarvān mat śapathām adhi varīyaḥ yavayāḥ itas /🔽yat duṣkṛtam yat śamalam yat vā cerima pāpayā / tvayā tat viśvatomukha apāmārga apa mṛjmahe /
analyzed: pratīcīna phalaḥ hi tvam apāmārga rurohitha   / sarvān mat śapathām adhi varīyaḥ yavayāḥ itas  yat duṣkṛtam yat śamalam yat vā cerima pāpayā    tvayā tat viśvatomukha apāmārga apa mṛjmahe  /
translated: Thou, O Apāmārga, hast grown with thy fruit turned to the west. Out of all the curses that are on me, win thou the highest prize from hence.🔽Whatever sin we have committed, whatever evil thing we have done, with thee, O Apāmārga, who hast thy face on every side, we cleanse ourselves from all.

original: śyāvadatā kunakhinā baṇḍena yat saha āsima / apāmārga tvayā vayam sarvam tat apa mṛjmahe /
analyzed: śyāvadatā kunakhinā baṇḍena yat saha āsima   apāmārga tvayā vayam sarvam tat apa mṛjmahe  /
translated: If we have sat with the black-toothed, the ill-nailed, the worthless one, with thee, O Apāmārga, we cleanse ourselves from all that sin.

original: yadi antarikṣe yadi vātaḥ āsa yadi vṛkṣeṣu yadi vā ulapeṣu / yat aśravan paśavaḥ udyamānam tat brāhmaṇam punar asmān upaitu /
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe yadi vātaḥ āsa yadi vṛkṣeṣu yadi vā ulapeṣu   yat aśravan paśavaḥ udyamānam tat brāhmaṇam punar asmān upaitu  /
translated: If it be in the air, if it be in the wind, if it be in the trees, if it be in the plants, the sound which the cattle have heard when they were driven forth, may that Brahman come back to us again.

original: punar mā aitu indriyam punar ātmā draviṇam brāhmaṇam ca / punar agnayaḥ dhiṣṇyāḥ yathāsthāma kalpayantām iha eva /
analyzed: punar mā aitu indriyam punar ātmā draviṇam brāhmaṇam ca   punar agnayaḥ dhiṣṇyāḥ yathāsthāma kalpayantām iha eva  /
translated: Let my power come back to me, my soul, my wealth, and my Brâhmanhood. Let the sacred fires return to their proper places, and be settled here.🔽O Sarasvatî, in thy divine observances, O Goddess, in thy abodes,

original: sarasvati vrateṣu te divyeṣu devi dhāmasu / juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi rarāsva naḥ /
analyzed: sarasvati vrateṣu te divyeṣu devi dhāmasu   juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi rarāsva naḥ  /
translated: Accept the offered oblation: give us offspring, O Goddess.

original: idam te havyam ghṛtavat sarasvatī idam pitṝṇām haviḥ āsyam yat / imāni te uditā śamtamāni tebhiḥ vayam madhumantaḥ syāma /
analyzed: idam te havyam ghṛtavat sarasvatī idam pitṝṇām haviḥ āsyam yat   imāni te uditā śamtamāni tebhiḥ vayam madhumantaḥ syāma  /
translated: This oblation of thine, O Sarasvatî, is rich in ghee: this is the mouth of the Fathers' oblation. These most propitious offerings of thine have been presented. By them may we be rich in honey.

original: śivā naḥ śaṃtamā bhava su mṛḍīkā sarasvati / mā te yuyoma saṃdṛśaḥ /
analyzed: śivā naḥ śaṃtamā bhava su mṛḍīkā sarasvati   mā te yuyoma saṃdṛśaḥ  /
translated: Be thou propitious, most propitious to us, O Sarasvatî, be thou very gracious. Let us not cross thy will.

original: śam naḥ vātaḥ vātu śam naḥ tapatu sūryaḥ / ahāni śam bhavantu naḥ śam rātrī prati dhīyatām / śam uṣāḥ naḥ vi uchatu //
analyzed: śam naḥ vātaḥ vātu śam naḥ tapatu sūryaḥ   ahāni śam bhavantu naḥ śam rātrī prati dhīyatām   śam uṣāḥ naḥ vi uchatu  /
translated: Auspicious to us blow the wind: auspicious to us shine the sun. Auspicious be the days to us: auspicious be the nights to us. Auspicious to us rise the dawn.🔽Whatever he offers in sacrifice with mind, with speech, with oblations, with ghee, with the Yagus,

original: yat kim ca asau manasā yat ca vācā yajñaiḥ juhoti haviṣā yajuṣā / tat mṛtyunā nirṛtiḥ saṃvidānā purā satyāt āhutim hantu asya /
analyzed: yat kim ca asau manasā yat ca vācā yajñaiḥ juhoti haviṣā yajuṣā    tat mṛtyunā nirṛtiḥ saṃvidānā purā satyāt āhutim hantu asya  /
translated: Let Death, agreeing with Destruction, slay his oblation before it reaches its goal.

original: yātudhānāḥ nirṛtiḥ āt u rakṣaḥ te asya ghnantu anṛtena satyam / indra iṣitāḥ devāḥ ājam asya mathnantu mā tat sam pādi yat asau juhoti //
analyzed: yātudhānāḥ nirṛtiḥ āt u rakṣaḥ te asya ghnantu anṛtena satyam   indra iṣitāḥ devāḥ ājam asya mathnantu mā tat sam pādi yat asau juhoti  /
translated: Let the demons, let the sorcerers, let the Rakshas slay him with the untruth of his falsehood. Let the Gods, sent by Indra, crush his sacrifice. Let not that be accomplished which he offers.

original: ajira adhirājau śyenau saṃpātinau iva / ājyam pṛtanyataḥ hatām yaḥ naḥ kaḥ ca abhyaghāyati //
analyzed: ajira adhirājau śyenau saṃpātinau iva    ājyam pṛtanyataḥ hatām yaḥ naḥ kaḥ ca abhyaghāyati  /
translated: Ajira and Adhira, like two hawks that swoop together, have slain the sacrifice of him who is afar from us, whoever he may be who injures us.

original: apāñcau te ubhau bāhū api nahyāmi āsyam / agneḥ devasya manyunā tena te avadhiṣam haviḥ //🔽api nahyāmi te bāhū api nahyāmi āsyam / agneḥ ghorasya manyunā tena avadhiṣam haviḥ //
analyzed: apāñcau te ubhau bāhū api nahyāmi āsyam   agneḥ devasya manyunā tena te avadhiṣam haviḥ  / api nahyāmi te bāhū api nahyāmi āsyam   agneḥ ghorasya manyunā tena avadhiṣam haviḥ  /
translated: I bind thy two arms behind thy back, I bind thy mouth. By the wrath of the God Agni I have destroyed thy sacrifice.🔽I bind thy two arms behind thy back, I bind thy mouth. By the wrath of the terrible Agni I have destroyed thy sacrifice.

original: pari tvā agne puram vayam vipram sahasya dhīmahi / dhṛṣat varṇam divedive hantāram bhaṅgurāvataḥ /
analyzed: pari tvā agne puram vayam vipram sahasya dhīmahi    dhṛṣat varṇam divedive hantāram bhaṅgurāvataḥ  /
translated: We will make thee a fort, O Agni, a stronghold, O sage, O thou of mighty sway, invincible in thine aspect, day by day, the slayer of the treacherous.

original: ud tiṣṭhata ava paśyata indrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam / yadi śrātam juhotana yadi a śrātam mamattana /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata ava paśyata indrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam   yadi śrātam juhotana yadi a śrātam mamattana  /
translated: Rise up and look upon the portion of Indra, meet for the rite. If it be dressed, offer it; if it be not dressed, rejoice you in it.

original: śrātam haviḥ ā u su indra pra yāhi jagāma sūraḥ adhvanaḥ vi madhyam / pari tvā āsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapāḥ na vrāja patim carantam /
analyzed: śrātam haviḥ ā u su indra pra yāhi jagāma sūraḥ adhvanaḥ vi madhyam   pari tvā āsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapāḥ na vrāja patim carantam  /
translated: Come, Indra, to the offered food: the Sun hath gone to the mid-point of his path. Thy friends, the treasures, sit around thee, as the clansmen round the lord of the homestead as he moves along.

original: śrātam manye ūdhani śrātam agnau su śṛtam manye tat ṛtam navīyaḥ / mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ piba indra vajrin puru kṛt juṣāṇaḥ /
analyzed: śrātam manye ūdhani śrātam agnau su śṛtam manye tat ṛtam navīyaḥ   mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ piba indra vajrin puru kṛt juṣāṇaḥ  /
translated: I think the offering is on the udder, I think it is well-cooked in the fire, I think that truth is ever new. Drink, O Indra, the essence of the midday libation, O thou of many deeds, rejoicing, O thou that hast the thunderbolt.

original: samiddhaḥ agniḥ vṛṣaṇā rathī divaḥ taptaḥ gharmaḥ duhyate vām iṣe madhu / vayam hi vām purudamāsaḥ aśvinā havāmahe sadhamādeṣu kāravaḥ /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ vṛṣaṇā rathī divaḥ taptaḥ gharmaḥ duhyate vām iṣe madhu   vayam hi vām purudamāsaḥ aśvinā havāmahe sadhamādeṣu kāravaḥ  /
translated: O ye Bulls, Agni is kindled, the charioteer of heaven: the heated caldron is milked for you for food and for mead. For we, O ye Aṣvins, are the most liberal worshippers: the bards invoke you at the feasts of Soma.

original: samiddhaḥ agniḥ aśvinā taptaḥ vām gharme ā gatam / duhyante nūnam vṛṣaṇā iha dhenavaḥ dasrā madanti vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ aśvinā taptaḥ vām gharme ā gatam   duhyante nūnam vṛṣaṇā iha dhenavaḥ dasrā madanti vedhasaḥ  /
translated: O ye Aṣvins, Agni is kindled: come to your heated caldron. The milch-kine, O ye Bulls, are now being milked for you. The wondrous ones rejoice, the sages.

original: iva ahākṛtaḥ śuciḥ deveṣu yajñaḥ yaḥ aśvinoḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ / tam u viśve amṛtāsaḥ juṣāṇāḥ gandharvasya prati āsnā rihanti //
analyzed: iva ahākṛtaḥ śuciḥ deveṣu yajñaḥ yaḥ aśvinoḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ   tam u viśve amṛtāsaḥ juṣāṇāḥ gandharvasya prati āsnā rihanti  /
translated: The sacrifice to the Aṣvins, pure, unsoiled, like the sky, is kindled, O ye Bulls, the caldron of the gods is heated. The All-Gods, rejoicing, kiss it, as the Gandharva kisses his beloved.

original: yat usriyāsu āhutam ghṛtam payaḥ ayam sa vām aśvinā bhāgaḥ ā gatam / mādhvī dhartārā vidathasya satpatī taptam gharmam pibatam divaḥ /
analyzed: yat usriyāsu āhutam ghṛtam payaḥ ayam sa vām aśvinā bhāgaḥ ā gatam   mādhvī dhartārā vidathasya satpatī taptam gharmam pibatam divaḥ  /
translated: The milk and ghee that is poured as an offering upon the cows, this is your share, O Asvins. Come! Sweet to the bees, supporters of the sacrifice, lords of the people, drink the heated Gharma from heaven.

original: taptaḥ vām gharmaḥ nakṣatu sva hotā pra vām adhvaryuḥ caratu payasvān / madhoḥ dugdhasya aśvinā tanāyāḥ vītam pātam payasaḥ usriyāyāḥ /🔽upa drava payasā go dhuk oṣam ā gharme siñca payaḥ usriyāyāḥ / vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyaḥ anuprayāṇam uṣasaḥ vi rājati //
analyzed: taptaḥ vām gharmaḥ nakṣatu sva hotā pra vām adhvaryuḥ caratu payasvān   madhoḥ dugdhasya aśvinā tanāyāḥ vītam pātam payasaḥ usriyāyāḥ  / upa drava payasā go duh oṣam ā gharme siñca payaḥ usriyāyāḥ    vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyaḥ anuprayāṇam uṣasaḥ vi rājati  /
translated: Let the heated Gharma please you, O you two, and your own Hotar. Let your Adhvaryu move about with the sweet one. O Asvins, drink the milk of the cow that yields milk for the pot, that is milked for the pot.🔽Come, O milk, to the milk-pail, as a cow to the milking. Pour the milk into the hot vessel. Savitar, the excellent one, has disclosed the vault. He shines along the course of the dawn.

original: upa hvaye su dughām dhenum etām su hastaḥ go dhuk uta dohat enām / śreṣṭham savam savitā sāviṣat naḥ abhīddhaḥ gharmaḥ tat u su pra vocat /
analyzed: upa hvaye su dughām dhenum etām su hastaḥ go duh uta dohat enām    śreṣṭham savam savitā sāviṣat naḥ abhīddhaḥ gharmaḥ tat u su pra vocat  /
translated: I invoke this well-milking cow, easy to milk, with good udders. May the milker milk her well. May Savitar pour forth for us the most excellent milk. The heated Gharma has been lit. That he will surely tell us.

original: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasu patnī vasūnām vatsam ichantī manasā nyāgan / duhām aśvibhyām payaḥ aghnyā iyam sā vardhatām mahate saubhagāya //
analyzed: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasu patnī vasūnām vatsam icchantī manasā nyāgan    duhām aśvibhyām payaḥ aghnyā iyam sā vardhatām mahate saubhagāya  /
translated: The wife of the Vasus, humming, has come hither, longing in her heart for her calf. This cow, which yields milk for the Asvins, may she yield milk. May she increase for great good fortune.

original: juṣṭaḥ damūnāḥ atithiḥ duroṇe imam naḥ yajñam upa yāhi vidvān / viśvāḥ agne abhiyujaḥ vihatya śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni //
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ damūnāḥ atithiḥ duroṇe imam naḥ yajñam upa yāhi vidvān    viśvāḥ agne abhiyujaḥ vihatya śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni  /
translated: Beloved, the guest who warms the house, come thou to this our sacrifice, knowing full well. Having destroyed all enemies, O Agni, bring us food to feed us.

original: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāni uttamāni santu / sam jāspatyam suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭha mahāṃsi //
analyzed: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāni uttamāni santu   / sam jāspatyam suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭha mahāṃsi  /
translated: O Agni, strive for great good fortune: let thy glories be most excellent. Make thou our sway secure and easy. Overcome the great resources of our enemies.

original: sūyavasāt bhagavatī hi bhūyāḥ adhā vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma / addhi tṛṇam aghnye viśvadānīm piba śuddham udakam ācarantī /
analyzed: sūyavasāt bhagavatī hi bhūyāḥ adhā vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma   addhi tṛṇam aghnye viśvadānīm piba śuddham udakam ācarantī  /
translated: Be thou, O blessed one, the bestower of good pasture: may we be happy through thy grace. Eat the grass, O thou of harmless mouth, at all times. Drink the pure water, as thou goest along.

original: apacitām lohinīnām kṛṣṇā mātā iti śuśruma / muneḥ devasya mūlena sarvāḥ vidhyāmi tāḥ aham /
analyzed: apacitām lohinīnām kṛṣṇā mātā iti śuśruma   muneḥ devasya mūlena sarvāḥ vidhyāmi tāḥ aham  /
translated: Of the raw-flesh-eaters, the red ones, the black, the mother, we have heard. With the root of the sage's plant I pierce them all.

original: vidhyāmi āsām prathamām vidhyāmi uta madhyamām / idam jaghanyām āsām ā chinadmi stukām iva /
analyzed: vidhyāmi āsām prathamām vidhyāmi uta madhyamām   idam jaghanyām āsām ā chinadmi stukām iva
translated: I pierce the first, I pierce the middle one, I cut the last of these as if it were a knot.

original: tvāṣṭreṇa aham vacasā vi te īrṣyām amīmadam / atha u yaḥ manyuḥ te pate tam u te śamayāmasi //
analyzed: tvāṣṭreṇa aham vacasā vi te īrṣyām amīmadam   atha u yaḥ manyuḥ te pate tam u te śamayāmasi  /
translated: With Tvashtar's word I have dispelled thy jealousy, and also, O lord, thy wrath. We have appeased it.

original: vratena tvam vratapate samaktaḥ viśvāhā sumanāḥ dīdihi iha / tam tvā vayam jātavedaḥ samiddham prajāvantaḥ upa sadema sarve /
analyzed: vratena tvam vratapate samaktaḥ viśvāhā sumanāḥ dīdihi iha   tam tvā vayam jātavedaḥ samiddham prajāvantaḥ upa sadema sarve  /
translated: By this our rite, O Lord of Rites, be pleased, and shine upon us ever with a gracious look. To thee, O Jâtavedas, kindled well, may we all come, with our children, for our weal.

original: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ / mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ rudrasya hetiḥ vṛṇaktu //
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ   mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ rudrasya hetiḥ vṛṇaktu  /
translated: Rich in children, shining in the field of corn, the pure waters shall drink at the good drinking-place. Let no thief rule over you, nor he who injures men. Let the dart of Rudra pass you by.

original: pada jñāḥ stha ramatayaḥ saṃhitāḥ viśva nāmnīḥ / upa mā devīḥ devebhiḥ eta / imam goṣṭham idam sadaḥ ghṛtena asmān sam ukṣata /
analyzed: pada jñāḥ stha ramatayaḥ saṃhitāḥ viśva nāmnīḥ    upa mā devīḥ devebhiḥ eta   imam goṣṭham idam sadaḥ ghṛtena asmān sam ukṣata  /
translated: Ye are the knowers of the place, the gladdening, the gathered, the all-named. Come to me, O Goddesses, with the Gods. Besprinkle with ghee this our cow-pen, this our assembly, and us.

original: ā susrasaḥ susrasaḥ asatībhyaḥ asattarāḥ / sehoḥ arasatarāḥ havaṇāt vikledīyasīḥ /
analyzed: ā susrasaḥ susrasaḥ asatībhyaḥ asattarāḥ   sehoḥ arasatarāḥ havaṇāt vikledīyasīḥ  /
translated: Flow on, flow on, more inauspicious than the inauspicious, more sapless than the sapless, more sluggish than the sluggish.

original: yāḥ graivyāḥ apacitaḥ atha u yāḥ upapakṣyāḥ / vijāmni yāḥ apacitaḥ svayaṃsrasaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ graivyāḥ apacitaḥ atha u yāḥ upapakṣyāḥ   vijāmni yāḥ apacitaḥ svayaṃsrasaḥ  /
translated: Those which are in the neck, those which are in the wings, those which are in the entrails, flow of themselves.

original: yaḥ kīkasāḥ praśṛṇāti talīdyam avatiṣṭhati / niḥ hāḥ tam sarvam jāyānyam yaḥ kaḥ ca kakudi śritaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kīkasāḥ praśṛṇāti talīdyam avatiṣṭhati   niḥ hāḥ tam sarvam jāyānyam yaḥ kaḥ ca kakudi śritaḥ  /
translated: He who breaks the ribs, who stands on the breast-bone, all that is alien to the wife, whatever is on the top of the spine.

original: pakṣī jāyānyaḥ patati saḥ ā viśati pūruṣam / tat akṣitasya bheṣajam ubhayoḥ su kṣatasya ca /
analyzed: pakṣī jāyānyaḥ patati saḥ ā viśati pūruṣam   tat akṣitasya bheṣajam ubhayoḥ su kṣatasya ca  /
translated: The bird, the other's wife, that flies away, enters a man. That is the remedy for the unwounded, and for both the wounded and the unwounded.

original: vidma vai te jāyānya jānam yatas jāyānya jāyase / katham ha tatra tvam hanaḥ yasya kṛṇmaḥ haviḥ gṛhe //
analyzed: vidma vai te jāyānya jānam yatas jāyānya jāyase    katham ha tatra tvam hanaḥ yasya kṛṇmaḥ haviḥ gṛhe  /
translated: We know thy home, O Jāyanīya, from which thou art born, O Jāyanīya. How then wilt thou strike him for whom we make the offering in his house?

original: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtra hā śūra samare vasūnām / mādhyandine savane ā vṛṣasva rayiṣṭhānaḥ rayim asmāsu dhehi //
analyzed: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtra hā śūra samare vasūnām    mādhyandine savane ā vṛṣasva rayiṣṭhānaḥ rayim asmāsu dhehi  /
translated: Boldly drink Soma in the bowl, O Indra, hero, Vr̥itra-slayer, in the fight for treasures. At the midday libation be inspirited. Thou who hast most abundant wealth, bestow wealth on us.

original: sāṃtapanāḥ idam haviḥ marutaḥ tat jujuṣṭana / asmākotī riśādasaḥ /
analyzed: sāṃtapanāḥ idam haviḥ marutaḥ tat jujuṣṭana   asmākotī riśādasaḥ  /
translated: O ye Sāntapanas, accept this oblation, O Maruts, ye who are to be delighted with it. Ye who are most bountiful, ye who destroy the foe.

original: yaḥ naḥ martaḥ marutaḥ durhṛṇāyuḥ tiras cittāni vasavaḥ jighāṃsati / druhaḥ pāśān prati muñcatām saḥ tapiṣṭhena tapasā hantana tam /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ martaḥ marutaḥ durhṛṇāyuḥ tiras cittāni vasavaḥ jighāṃsati    druhaḥ pāśān prati muñcatām saḥ tapiṣṭhena tapasā hantana tam  /
translated: The man who is of evil mind, O Maruts, who would fain injure us, O Vasus, even from afar, may he be caught in the noose of the malignant one. Destroy him with the hottest heat.

original: samvatsarīṇāḥ marutaḥ su arkāḥ uru kṣayāḥ sa gaṇāḥ mānuṣāsaḥ / te asmat pāśān pra muñcantu enasaḥ sāṃtapanāḥ matsarāḥ mādayiṣṇavaḥ /
analyzed: samvatsarīṇāḥ marutaḥ su arkāḥ uru kṣayāḥ sa gaṇāḥ mānuṣāsaḥ    te asmat pāśān pra muñcantu enasaḥ sāṃtapanāḥ matsarāḥ mādayiṣṇavaḥ  /
translated: The Maruts, who dwell a year, who are well-praised, who have wide abodes, who are associated with men, may they deliver us from the bonds of sin. May the Sāntapanas, the envious, the joyous, deliver us.

original: vi te muñcāmi raśanām vi yoktram vi niyojanam / iha eva tvam ajasraḥ edhi agne /🔽asmai kṣatrāṇi dhārayantam agne yunajmi tvā brahmaṇā daivyena / dīdihi asmabhyam draviṇā iha bhadram pra imam vocaḥ haviḥ dām devatāsu //
analyzed: vi te muñcāmi raśanām vi yoktram vi niyojanam    iha eva tvam ajasraḥ edhi agne  / asmai kṣatrāṇi dhārayantam agne yunajmi tvā brahmaṇā daivyena   dīdihi asmabhyam draviṇā iha bhadram pra imam vocaḥ haviḥ dām devatāsu  /
translated: I loose thy bond, thy cord, thy fastening: here, O thou Ever-waxing One, be thou, O Agni.🔽I yoke thee with the divine prayer, O Agni, to bear the sway of kings. Shine thou upon us: give us wealth and bliss. Declare this offering to the Gods who eat oblations.

original: yat te devāḥ akṛṇvan bhāgadheyam amāvāsye saṃvasantaḥ mahitvā / tena naḥ yajñam pipṛhi viśva vāre rayim naḥ dhehi subhage su vīram /
analyzed: yat te devāḥ akṛṇvan bhāgadheyam amāvāsye saṃvasantaḥ mahitvā    tena naḥ yajñam pipṛhi viśva vāre rayim naḥ dhehi subhage su vīram  /
translated: The share which the Gods have assigned to thee, O New-moon, dwelling together in greatness, therewith fill thou our sacrifice, O thou who art all things. Give us wealth, O thou who art blessed with heroic sons.

original: aham eva asmi amāvāsyāḥ mām ā vasanti su kṛtaḥ mayi ime / mayi devāḥ ubhaye sādyāḥ ca indra jyeṣṭhāḥ sam agacchanta sarve /
analyzed: aham eva asmi amāvāsyāḥ mām ā vasanti su kṛtaḥ mayi ime    mayi devāḥ ubhaye sādyāḥ ca indra jyeṣṭhāḥ sam agacchanta sarve  /
translated: I am the New-moon. In me the pious dwell. In me the Gods, the Sadhyas, and the Maruts, all with Indra at their head, have met together.

original: āgan rātrī saṅgamanī vasūnām ūrjam puṣṭam vasu āveśayantī / amāvāsyāyai haviṣa vidhema ūrjam duhānā payasā naḥ āgan /
analyzed: āgan rātrī saṅgamanī vasūnām ūrjam puṣṭam vasu āveśayantī    amāvāsyāyai haviṣa vidhema ūrjam duhānā payasā naḥ āgan  /
translated: Night hath come hither, the gatherer of treasures, bringing food, strength, and wealth. To the New-moon's oblation let us offer. She, the milker of food, hath come to us.

original: amāvāsye na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūḥ jajāna / yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayiṇām /
analyzed: amāvāsye na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūḥ jajāna   yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayiṇām  /
translated: On the new moon day, none other than thou, O all-surpassing one, hast produced these forms. Whatever desires we have in offering to thee, let that be ours. May we be lords of riches.

original: paurṇamāsī jigāya / tasyām devaiḥ saṃvasantaḥ mahitvā nākasya pṛṣṭhe sam iṣā madema /
analyzed: paurṇamāsī jigāya   tasyām devaiḥ saṃvasantaḥ mahitvā nākasya pṛṣṭhe sam iṣā madema  /
translated: The full moon has conquered. Dwelling with the gods in greatness on that day, may we rejoice in the height of heaven with food.

original: vṛṣabham vājinam vayam paurṇamāsam yajāmahe / sa naḥ dadātu akṣitām rayim anupadasvatīm /
analyzed: vṛṣabham vājinam vayam paurṇamāsam yajāmahe    sa naḥ dadātu akṣitām rayim anupadasvatīm  /
translated: We worship the full moon, the strong bull. May he grant us wealth that never decays, that never fails.

original: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūḥ jajāna / yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām /
analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūḥ jajāna   yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām  /
translated: O Prajapati, none other than thou, O all-surpassing one, hast produced all these forms. Whatever desires we have in offering to thee, let that be ours. May we be lords of riches.

original: paurṇamāsī prathamā yajñiyā āsīt ahnām rātrīṇām ati śarvareṣu / ye tvām yajñaiḥ yajñiye ardhayanti amī te nāke su kṛtaḥ praviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: paurṇamāsī prathamā yajñiyā āsīt ahnām rātrīṇām ati śarvareṣu   ye tvām yajñaiḥ yajñiye ardhayanti amī te nāke su kṛtaḥ praviṣṭāḥ  /
translated: The full moon was the first to be worthy of sacrifice, in the days and nights, beyond the cold seasons. Those who delight thee with sacrifices, O worthy one, these well-doers have entered thy heaven.

original: pūrva aparam carataḥ mayayā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ arṇavam / viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe ṛtūṃr anyaḥ vidadhat jāyase navaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ mayayā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ arṇavam    viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe ṛtūṃr anyaḥ vidadhat jāyase navaḥ  /
translated: These two move in succession by their own power. The two children playing around the ocean. One observes all the worlds. The other, creating the seasons, is born anew.

original: navaḥ navaḥ bhavasi jāyamānaḥ ahnām ketuḥ uṣasām eṣi agram / bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāsi āyan pra candramaḥ tirase dhīrgham āyuḥ /
analyzed: navaḥ navaḥ bhavasi jāyamānaḥ ahnām ketuḥ uṣasām eṣi agram    bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāsi āyan pra candramaḥ tirase dhīrgham āyuḥ  /
translated: Ever and ever more art thou reborn: thou goest as the ensign of the days before the dawn. As thou goest on thy way thou dealest out the Gods' portion. Thou, O Moon, prolongest life.

original: somasya amśaḥ yudhām pate anūnaḥ nāma vai asi / anūnam darśa mā kṛdhi prajayā ca dhanena ca /🔽darśaḥ asi darśataḥ asi samagraḥ asi samantaḥ / samagraḥ samantaḥ bhūyāsam gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ gṛhaiḥ dhanena /
analyzed: somasya amśaḥ yudhām pate anūnaḥ nāma vai asi    anūnam darśa mā kṛdhi prajayā ca dhanena ca  / darśaḥ asi darśataḥ asi samagraḥ asi samantaḥ    samagraḥ samantaḥ bhūyāsam gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ gṛhaiḥ dhanena  /
translated: Thou art a portion of Soma, Lord of battles, thou art called Anûna. Make me not Anûna, O Darsa, in offspring and in wealth.🔽Thou art Darsa, thou art Darshata, thou art Samgra, thou art Samanta. May I be Samgra, Samanta, with cattle, with horses, with offspring, with beasts, with houses, with wealth.

original: yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tasya tvam prāṇena ā pyāyasva / ā vayam pyāsiṣīmahi gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ gṛhaiḥ dhanena /
analyzed: yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tasya tvam prāṇena ā pyāyasva   ā vayam pyāsiṣīmahi gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ gṛhaiḥ dhanena  /
translated: Grow thou with the breath of him who hateth us, and of him whom we hate. May we grow with cattle, with horses, with offspring, with beasts, with houses, with wealth.

original: yam devāḥ aṃśum āpyāyayanti yam akṣitam akṣitāḥ bhakṣayanti / tena asmān indraḥ varuṇaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ā pyāyayantu bhuvanasya gopāḥ /
analyzed: yam devāḥ aṃśum āpyāyayanti yam akṣitam akṣitāḥ bhakṣayanti   tena asmān indraḥ varuṇaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ā pyāyayantu bhuvanasya gopāḥ  /
translated: The stalk which the Gods make to swell, which the Immortals eat without fail, therewith let Indra, Varuṇa, Brihaspati, the guardians of the world, make us to swell.

original: abhi arcata suṣṭutim gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta / imam yajñam nayata devatā naḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ madhumat pavantām /
analyzed: abhi arcata suṣṭutim gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta    imam yajñam nayata devatā naḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ madhumat pavantām  /
translated: Sing forth your hymn of praise, the race for cattle: bestow on us the blessings of your bounty. Lead ye this sacrifice of ours to the Gods: let streams of ghee flow, and be rich in sweetness.

original: mayi agre agnim gṛhṇāmi saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena / mayi prajām mayi āyuḥ dadhāmi svāhā mayi agnim /
analyzed: mayi agre agnim gṛhṇāmi saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena   mayi prajām mayi āyuḥ dadhāmi svāhā mayi agnim
translated: In me first I take Agni with lordship, with splendour, with strength. In me I lay down offspring, in me life. Hail! In me Agni.

original: iha eva agne adhi dhāraya rayim mā tvā ni kran pūrva cittāḥ nikāriṇaḥ / kṣatreṇa agne suyamam astu tubhyam upasattā vardhatām te a niṣṭṛtaḥ /🔽anu agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat anu ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ / anu sūryaḥ uṣasaḥ anu raśmīn anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa /
analyzed: iha eva agne adhi dhāraya rayim mā tvā ni kran pūrva cittāḥ nikāriṇaḥ   kṣatreṇa agne suyamam astu tubhyam upasattā vardhatām te a niṣṭṛtaḥ  / anu agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat anu ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ   anu sūryaḥ uṣasaḥ anu raśmīn anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa  /
translated: Here, O Agni, do thou keep wealth: let not thy former benefactors, O Agni, neglect thee. By thy lordship, O Agni, let there be easy access to thee: let thy worshipper prosper, well-settled.🔽Agni hath looked upon the van of the Dawns: first of all Jâtavedas hath he looked upon the days. He hath looked on the Dawns and on the rays of Sûrya, and hath entered into heaven and earth.

original: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat prati ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ / prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna /
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat prati ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ   prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna  /
translated: Agni hath looked upon the van of the Dawns: first of all Jâtavedas hath he looked upon the days. He hath looked on the rays of Sûrya in their many forms, and hath extended over heaven and earth.

original: ghṛtam te agne divye sadhasthe ghṛtena tvām manuḥ adyā sam indhe / ghṛtam te devīḥ naptyaḥ ā vahantu ghṛtam tubhyam duhratām gāvaḥ agne /
analyzed: ghṛtam te agne divye sadhasthe ghṛtena tvām manuḥ adyā sam indhe   ghṛtam te devīḥ naptyaḥ ā vahantu ghṛtam tubhyam duhratām gāvaḥ agne  /
translated: O Agni, thy ghee is in the heavenly abode. With ghee Manu kindles thee this day. Let the divine granddaughters bring thee ghee. Let the cows yield thee ghee, O Agni.

original: apsu te rājan varuṇa gṛhaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ mitaḥ / tatas dhṛta vrataḥ rājā sarvā dhāmāni muñcatu //
analyzed: apsu te rājan varuṇa gṛhaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ mitaḥ   tatas dhṛta vrataḥ rājā sarvā dhāmāni muñcatu  /
translated: In the waters, O king Varuna, is thy golden measured abode. Thence let the king who keeps his vows loose all the elements.

original: dāmnaḥ udāmnaḥ rājan itas varuṇa muñca naḥ / yat āpaḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti yat ūcima tatas varuṇa muñca naḥ /
analyzed: dāmnaḥ udāmnaḥ rājan itas varuṇa muñca naḥ   yat āpaḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti yat ūcima tatas varuṇa muñca naḥ  /
translated: From the bond, O king Varuna, from the bond above, from this bond, O Varuna, loose us. What we have said, 'The waters are harmless,' and 'Varuna,' from that, O Varuna, loose us.

original: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamam śrathāya / adha vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma /
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamam śrathāya   adha vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma  /
translated: Loosen thou the highest bond of Varuna from us, loosen the lowest, loosen the middle one for luck. So may we, O Aditya, in thy vow, be sinless and free from guilt towards Aditi.

original: pra asmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān ye uttamāḥ adhamāḥ vāruṇāḥ ye / duṣvapnyam duritam ni sva asmat atha gacchema su kṛtasya lokam /
analyzed: pra asmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān ye uttamāḥ adhamāḥ vāruṇāḥ ye   duṣvapnyam duritam ni sva asmat atha gacchema su kṛtasya lokam  /
translated: Loosen thou all the bonds of Varuna from us, the highest, the lowest, the Varuna bonds in the middle. Drive thou evil dream and evil deed away from us, and then may we go to the world of the virtuous.

original: anādhṛṣyaḥ jātavedāḥ amartyaḥ virāj agne kṣatra bhṛt dīdihi iha / viśvāḥ amīvāḥ pramuñcan mānuṣībhiḥ śivābhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ gayam /
analyzed: anādhṛṣyaḥ jātavedāḥ amartyaḥ virāj agne kṣatra bhṛt dīdihi iha    viśvāḥ amīvāḥ pramuñcan mānuṣībhiḥ śivābhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ gayam  /
translated: Unassailable, immortal, Jâtavedas, Agni, King, support of sway, shine thou forth here. Freeing from all diseases, from the human, this day, with blessings, guard our dwelling.

original: indra kṣatram abhi vāmam ojaḥ ajāyathāḥ vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām / apānudaḥ janam amitrayantam urum devebhyaḥ akṛṇoḥ u lokam /
analyzed: indra kṣatram abhi vāmam ojaḥ ajāyathāḥ vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām   apānudaḥ janam amitrayantam urum devebhyaḥ akṛṇoḥ u lokam  /
translated: Thou, Indra, hast been born for sway and bliss and power over the people, O most strong. Thou hast repelled the man who fain would war with us, and hast made room for Gods to sit at sacrifice.

original: mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ parāvataḥ ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ / sṛkam saṃśāya pavim indra tigmam vi śatrūn tāḍhi vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva /
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ parāvataḥ ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ   sṛkam saṃśāya pavim indra tigmam vi śatrūn tāḍhi vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva  /
translated: Like some dread beast of prey that wanders o'er the hills, let him depart to distant goal from this our land. Sharpening thy whetted point, O Indra, drive away our foes and cast our enemies beneath thy feet.

original: tyam u su vājinam deva jūtam sahovānam tarutāram rathānām / ariṣṭa nemim pṛtanājim āśum svastaye tārkṣyam iha ā huvema /
analyzed: tyam u su vājinam deva jūtam sahovānam tarutāram rathānām    ariṣṭa nemim pṛtanājim āśum svastaye tārkṣyam iha ā huvema  /
translated: We will invoke for our felicity here that swift steed, urged by the Gods, that conquers in the fight, that easily overcomes the chariots, that hath a rim that never breaks, that rushes to the fray.

original: trātāram indram avitāram indram have ihave su havam śūram indram / huve nu śakram puruhūtam indram svasti naḥ indraḥ maghavā kṛṇotu //
analyzed: trātāram indram avitāram indram have ihave su havam śūram indram    huve nu śakram puruhūtam indram svasti naḥ indraḥ maghavā kṛṇotu  /
translated: We will invoke here Indra, the protector, Indra, the succourer, the hero, easy to be called, Indra, the wielder of the bolt, invoked of many. May Indra, the bountiful, make us prosperous.

original: yaḥ agnau rudraḥ yaḥ apsu antar yaḥ oṣadhīḥ vīrudhaḥ āviveśa / yaḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni ca ākḷpe tasmai rudrāya namaḥ astu agnaye /
analyzed: yaḥ agnau rudraḥ yaḥ apsu antar yaḥ oṣadhīḥ vīrudhaḥ āviveśa   yaḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni ca ākḷpe tasmai rudrāya namaḥ astu agnaye  /
translated: Who hath measured out all these existing things, to that Rudra, to Agni, be homage.

original: apehi ariḥ asi ariḥ vai asi viṣe viṣam apṛkthāḥ viṣam id vai apṛkthāḥ / ahim eva abhyapehi tam jahi //
analyzed: apehi ariḥ asi ariḥ vai asi viṣe viṣam apṛkthāḥ viṣam id vai apṛkthāḥ   ahim eva abhyapehi tam jahi  /
translated: Go hence, thou art an enemy, thou art indeed an enemy. In poison thou hast laid poison, in poison indeed thou hast laid poison.🔽Go to the serpent, slay him.

original: apaḥ divyāḥ acāyiṣam rasena sam apṛkṣmahi / payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā /
analyzed: apaḥ divyāḥ acāyiṣam rasena sam apṛkṣmahi    payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā  /
translated: I have drawn the heavenly waters, and with their juice have sprinkled myself. Rich in milk, O Agni, have I come. Unite me with splendour.

original: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā / vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā   vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: Unite me with splendour, O Agni, unite me with offspring, unite me with life. May the gods know me, may Indra know me with the Rishis.

original: idam āpaḥ pra vahata avadyam ca malam ca yat / yat ca abhidudroha anṛtam yat ca śepe abhīruṇam //
analyzed: idam āpaḥ pra vahata avadyam ca malam ca yat    yat ca abhidudroha anṛtam yat ca śepe abhīruṇam  /
translated: O ye waters, carry away this sin and this impurity of mine. Whatever I have hated, whatever I have cursed in wrath,

original: edhaḥ asi edhiṣīya samidh asi sam edhiṣīya / tejaḥ asi tejaḥ mayi dhehi //
analyzed: edhaḥ asi edhiṣīya samidh asi sam edhiṣīya    tejaḥ asi tejaḥ mayi dhehi
translated: Thou art fuel, be thou kindled. Thou art a kindler, be thou kindled. Thou art splendour, bestow splendour on me.

original: api vṛśca purāṇa vat vratateḥ iva guṣpitam / ojaḥ dāsasya dambhaya //
analyzed: api vṛśca purāṇa vat vratateḥ iva guṣpitam    ojaḥ dāsasya dambhaya  /
translated: Cut it off as of old, as if from a rope that is rotting. Destroy the Dâsa's strength.

original: vayam tat asya sambhṛtam vasu indrena vi bhajāmahai / mlāpayāmi bhrajaḥ śibhram varuṇasya vratena te /
analyzed: vayam tat asya sambhṛtam vasu indrena vi bhajāmahai   mlāpayāmi bhrajaḥ śibhram varuṇasya vratena te  /
translated: We will divide this wealth of his, accumulated by Indra, among ourselves. I make the bright, the shining, disappear by the ordinance of Varuna.

original: yathā śepaḥ apāyātai strīṣu ca asat anāvayāḥ / avasthasya knadīvataḥ śāṅkurasya nitodinaḥ / yat ātatam ava tat tanu yat uttatam ni tat tanu //
analyzed: yathā śepaḥ apāyātai strīṣu ca asat anāvayāḥ    avasthasya knadīvataḥ śāṅkurasya nitodinaḥ   yat ātatam ava tat tanu yat uttatam ni tat tanu  /
translated: As the penis has gone away from the women, so let it be useless to the adulteress. Of the one who lies in wait, the one who is always ready to pounce, the one who is always eager, whatever is stretched out, make that shrink; whatever is extended, make that shrink.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā svavām avobhiḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ / bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma /
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā svavām avobhiḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ   bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma  /
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the mighty, be gracious to us with his favours, the all-knower. May he drive away hatred, may he make us fearless. May we be lords of good heroism.

original: sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asmat ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu / tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma /
analyzed: sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asmat ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu    tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma  /
translated: May that good protector, the mighty Indra, drive away from us even distant hatred. May we enjoy the favour of that adorable one, and have a share in his good will and happiness.

original: indreṇa manyunā vayam abhi syāma pṛtanyataḥ / ghnantaḥ vṛtrāṇi aprati /
analyzed: indreṇa manyunā vayam abhi syāma pṛtanyataḥ    ghnantaḥ vṛtrāṇi aprati  /
translated: With Indra's wrath may we subdue our enemies, slaying the foes that are beyond our reach.

original: dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā ava somam nayāmasi / yathā naḥ indraḥ kevalīḥ viśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ karat /
analyzed: dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā ava somam nayāmasi    yathā naḥ indraḥ kevalīḥ viśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ karat  /
translated: With firm oblation we lead forward the firm Soma, that Indra may make our people all of one mind and unanimous.

original: ud asya śyāvau vithurau gṛdhrau dyām iva petatuḥ / ucchocana praśocanau asya ucchocanau hṛdaḥ /
analyzed: ud asya śyāvau vithurau gṛdhrau dyām iva petatuḥ   ucchocana praśocanau asya ucchocanau hṛdaḥ  /
translated: His two vultures, black and weak, have flown away, as it were, to the sky. His two vultures, burning and scorching, have flown away from his heart.

original: aham enau ud atiṣṭhipam gāvau śrānta sadau iva / kurkurau iva kūjantau udavantau vṛkau iva /
analyzed: aham enau ud atiṣṭhipam gāvau śrānta sadau iva   kurkurau iva kūjantau udavantau vṛkau iva
translated: I have set them up again, as it were, two oxen tired out with bearing. Like two dogs barking, like two wolves fighting, like two bulls butting.🔽The two that sting from a distance, the two that sting at close quarters, and the two that sting together,

original: ātodinau nitodinau atho saṃtodinau uta / api nahyāmi asya meḍhram yaḥ itas strī pumān jabhāra //
analyzed: ātodinau nitodinau atho saṃtodinau uta    api nahyāmi asya meḍhram yaḥ itas strī pumān jabhāra  /
translated: I bind fast his penis, he who has taken away from here a woman or a man.

original: asadan gāvaḥ sadane apaptat vasatim vayaḥ / āsthāne parvatāḥ asthuḥ sthāmni vṛkkau atiṣṭhipam /
analyzed: asadan gāvaḥ sadane apaptat vasatim vayaḥ    āsthāne parvatāḥ asthuḥ sthāmni vṛkkau atiṣṭhipam  /
translated: The cows have sat down in their place, the bird has flown to its resting-place. The mountains have stood in their place. I have set the two kidneys in their place.

original: yat adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotar cikitvan avṛṇīmahi iha / dhruvam ayaḥ dhruvam uta śaviṣṭhai pravidvān yajñam upa yāhi somam /
analyzed: yat adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotar cikitvan avṛṇīmahi iha    dhruvam ayaḥ dhruvam uta śaviṣṭhai pravidvān yajñam upa yāhi somam  /
translated: Since, O wise one, we have chosen thee here today, O Hotar, in this sacrifice, to be firm, O thou most powerful, come to the sacrifice, come to the Soma, knowing the way.

original: sam indra naḥ manasā neṣa gobhiḥ sam sūribhiḥ harivan sam svastyā / sam brahmaṇā deva hitam yat asti sam devānām sumatau yajñiyānām /
analyzed: sam indra naḥ manasā neṣa gobhiḥ sam sūribhiḥ harivan sam svastyā    sam brahmaṇā deva hitam yat asti sam devānām sumatau yajñiyānām  /
translated: Lead us together, O Indra, with the mind, with the cows, with the princes, O thou who lovest the Maruts, with well-being. Lead us together with the Brahman that is dear to the gods, together with the favour of the worshipful gods.

original: yān āvahaḥ uśataḥ deva devān tān preraya sve agne sadhasthe / jakṣivāṃsaḥ papivāṃsaḥ madhūni asmai dhatta vasavaḥ vasūni //
analyzed: yān āvahaḥ uśataḥ deva devān tān preraya sve agne sadhasthe    jakṣivāṃsaḥ papivāṃsaḥ madhūni asmai dhatta vasavaḥ vasūni  /
translated: Those whom thou carriest, O God, the eager Gods, send them, O Agni, to their own abode. Having eaten and drunk the sweet juices, bestow on him, O Vasus, treasures and wealth.

original: sugā vaḥ devāḥ sadanāḥ akarma yaḥ ājagma savane mā juṣāṇāḥ / vahamānāḥ bharamāṇāḥ svā vasūni vasum gharmam divam ā rohata anu //
analyzed: sugā vaḥ devāḥ sadanāḥ akarma yaḥ ājagma savane mā juṣāṇāḥ   vahamānāḥ bharamāṇāḥ svā vasūni vasum gharmam divam ā rohata anu  /
translated: Easy to you, O Gods, are the seats which ye have made: come ye, rejoicing, to the libation which we pour. Bearing and bringing your own treasures, ascend the radiant heaven, the treasure of the good.

original: yajña yajñam gaccha yajñapatim gaccha / svām yonim gaccha svāhā /
analyzed: yajña yajñam gaccha yajñapatim gaccha    svām yonim gaccha svāhā
translated: Go to the sacrifice, O sacrifice, go to the lord of the sacrifice. Go to thy own birthplace. Hail!

original: eṣa te yajñaḥ yajñapate sahasūktavākaḥ / su vīryaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: eṣa te yajñaḥ yajñapate sahasūktavākaḥ    su vīryaḥ svāhā
translated: This is thy sacrifice, O lord of the sacrifice, with good praises, with good hero deeds. Hail!

original: vaṣaṭ dhutebhyaḥ vaṣaṭ a hutebhyaḥ / devāḥ gātu vidaḥ gātum vittvā gātum ita /
analyzed: vaṣaṭ dhutebhyaḥ vaṣaṭ a hutebhyaḥ   devāḥ gātu vidaḥ gātum vittvā gātum ita  /
translated: Vashat to the offered, vashat to the unoffered. O Gods, finders of the way, having found the way, go the way.🔽O Lord of mind, this our sacrifice among the Gods in heaven,

original: manasaḥ pate imam naḥ divi deveṣu yajñam / svāhā divi svāhā pṛthivyām svāhā antarikṣe svāhā vāte dhām svāhā /
analyzed: manasaḥ pate imam naḥ divi deveṣu yajñam   svāhā divi svāhā pṛthivyām svāhā antarikṣe svāhā vāte dhām svāhā
translated: Hail in heaven, hail in earth, hail in the atmosphere, hail in the wind, hail in the abode.

original: sam barhiḥ aktam haviṣā ghṛtena sam indreṇa vasunā sam marudbhiḥ / sam devaiḥ viśva devebhiḥ aktam indram gacchatu haviḥ svāhā /
analyzed: sam barhiḥ aktam haviṣā ghṛtena sam indreṇa vasunā sam marudbhiḥ    sam devaiḥ viśva devebhiḥ aktam indram gacchatu haviḥ svāhā  /
translated: The strewn grass is anointed with the sacrificial food, with ghee, with Indra, with wealth, with the Maruts. Anointed with the All-Gods, let the oblation go to Indra. Hail!

original: pari stṛṇīhi pari dhehi vedim mā jāmim moṣīḥ amuyā śayānām / hotṛṣadanam haritam hiraṇyayam niṣkāḥ ete yajamānasya loke /
analyzed: pari stṛṇīhi pari dhehi vedim mā jāmim moṣīḥ amuyā śayānām    hotṛṣadanam haritam hiraṇyayam niṣkāḥ ete yajamānasya loke  /
translated: Strew thou the grass, spread out the altar: harm not the sister lying in the dust. The priest's seat, green and golden, are these ornaments in the world of the Sacrificer.

original: paryāvarte duṣvapnyāt pāpāt svapnyāt abhūtyāḥ / brahma aham antaram kṛṇve parā svapna mukhāḥ śucaḥ /
analyzed: paryāvarte duṣvapnyāt pāpāt svapnyāt abhūtyāḥ   brahma aham antaram kṛṇve parā svapna mukhāḥ śucaḥ  /
translated: I turn away from evil dreams, from dreams of sin and want of food. I make myself a shelter in the Brahman: away from me fly dreams and sorrows.

original: yat svapne annam aśnāmi na prātar adhigamyate / sarvam tat astu me śivam nahi tat dṛṣyate divā /
analyzed: yat svapne annam aśnāmi na prātar adhigamyate    sarvam tat astu me śivam nahi tat dṛṣyate divā  /
translated: If in my dream I eat food that is not obtained in the morning, may all that be auspicious to me, for it is not seen in the day.

original: namaskṛtya dyāvāpṛthivībhyām antarikṣāya mṛtyave / mekṣāmi ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhat mā mā hiṃsiṣuḥ īśvarāḥ /
analyzed: namaskṛtya dyāvāpṛthivībhyām antarikṣāya mṛtyave   mekṣāmi ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhat mā mā hiṃsiṣuḥ īśvarāḥ  /
translated: Having bowed to Heaven and Earth, to the atmosphere and to Death, I urinate standing upright. May the powerful ones not injure me.

original: kaḥ asyāḥ naḥ druhaḥ avadyavatyai ud neṣyati kṣatriyaḥ vasyaḥ ichan / kaḥ yajña kāmaḥ kaḥ u pūrti kāmaḥ kaḥ deveṣu vanute dīrgham āyuḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ asyāḥ naḥ druhaḥ avadyavatyai ud neṣyati kṣatriyaḥ vasyaḥ ichan   kaḥ yajña kāmaḥ kaḥ u pūrti kāmaḥ kaḥ deveṣu vanute dīrgham āyuḥ  /
translated: Which Kshatriya, seeking prosperity, will lead us out of this evil of enmity, which is full of blame? Who desires sacrifice, who desires completion, who among the gods wins long life?

original: kaḥ pṛśnim dhenum varuṇena dattām atharvane su dughām nitya vatsām / bṛhaspatinā sakhyam juṣaṇaḥ yathāvaśam tanvaḥ kalpayāti //
analyzed: kaḥ pṛśnim dhenum varuṇena dattām atharvane su dughām nitya vatsām    bṛhaspatinā sakhyam juṣaṇaḥ yathāvaśam tanvaḥ kalpayāti  /
translated: Who will obtain the dappled cow, always giving milk, given by Varuna to Atharvan, and unite with Brihaspati in friendship, and arrange his body as he wishes?

original: apakrāman pauruṣeyāt vṛṇānaḥ daivyam vacaḥ / praṇītīḥ abhyāvartasva viśvebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ saha /
analyzed: apakrāman pauruṣeyāt vṛṇānaḥ daivyam vacaḥ   praṇītīḥ abhyāvartasva viśvebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ saha  /
translated: Turning away from human speech, choosing the word of God, Turn thee again to the offerings, with all thy friends.

original: yat asmṛti cakṛma kim cit agne upārima caraṇe jātavedaḥ / tatas pāhi tvam naḥ pracetaḥ śubhe sakhibhyaḥ amṛta tvam astu naḥ /
analyzed: yat asmṛti cakṛma kim cit agne upārima caraṇe jātavedaḥ    tatas pāhi tvam naḥ pracetaḥ śubhe sakhibhyaḥ amṛta tvam astu naḥ  /
translated: Whatever we have done, O Agni, in ignorance, whatever we have done amiss, O Jâtavedas, From all that sin, O thou of wondrous insight, keep thou us safe, O God, for our friends' welfare. May we enjoy the gift of life.

original: ava divaḥ tārayanti sapta sūryasya raśmayaḥ / āpaḥ samudriyāḥ dhārāḥ tāḥ śalyam asisrasan /
analyzed: ava divaḥ tārayanti sapta sūryasya raśmayaḥ   āpaḥ samudriyāḥ dhārāḥ tāḥ śalyam asisrasan  /
translated: Seven rays of Sûrya bear him up from heaven, the streams of ocean's waters. They have drawn forth the dart.

original: yaḥ naḥ stāyat dipsati yaḥ naḥ āvis svaḥ vidvān araṇaḥ vā naḥ agne / pratīcī etu araṇī datvatī tān mā eṣām agne vā astu bhūt mā u apatyam /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ stāyat dipsati yaḥ naḥ āvis svaḥ vidvān araṇaḥ vā naḥ agne   pratīcī etu araṇī datvatī tān mā eṣām agne vā astu bhūt mā u apatyam  /
translated: He who would fain attack us, who would fain deceive us, O Agni, who would fain injure us, O God, who knows the light, — may the returning dart turn back upon them. Let not their seed nor offspring be.

original: yaḥ naḥ suptān jāgrataḥ vā abhidāsāt tiṣṭhataḥ vā carataḥ jātavedaḥ / vaiśvānareṇa sayujā sajoṣāḥ tān pratīcaḥ niḥ daha jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ suptān jāgrataḥ vā abhidāsāt tiṣṭhataḥ vā carataḥ jātavedaḥ    vaiśvānareṇa sayujā sajoṣāḥ tān pratīcaḥ niḥ daha jātavedaḥ  /
translated: He who would fain attack us, whether we be awake or sleeping, standing or walking, O Jâtavedas, — with Vaisvânara, accordant, of one mind, O Jâtavedas, burn them up with thy reverse.

original: idam ugrāya babhrave namaḥ yaḥ akṣeṣu tanū vaśī / ghṛtena kalim śikṣāmi sa naḥ mṛḍāti īdṛśe /
analyzed: idam ugrāya babhrave namaḥ yaḥ akṣeṣu tanū vaśī   ghṛtena kalim śikṣāmi sa naḥ mṛḍāti īdṛśe  /
translated: To him the terrible, the tawny, this adoration, who is the Lord of bodies in the dice. With oil I appease the quarrel. May he be gracious to us in this matter.

original: ghṛtam apsarābhyaḥ vaha tvam agne pāṃsūn akṣebhyaḥ sikatāḥ apaḥ ca / yathābhagam havya dātim juṣāṇāḥ madanti devāḥ ubhayāni havyā /
analyzed: ghṛtam apsarābhyaḥ vaha tvam agne pāṃsūn akṣebhyaḥ sikatāḥ apaḥ ca   yathābhagam havya dātim juṣāṇāḥ madanti devāḥ ubhayāni havyā  /
translated: O Agni, bear the ghee to the Apsarases, the dust to the dice, the sand and the water. The Gods, rejoicing in the oblation, according to their share, enjoy the two kinds of offerings.

original: apsarasaḥ sadhamādam madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryam ca / tāḥ me hastau sam sṛjantu ghṛtena sapatnam me kitavam randhayantu //🔽ādinavam pratidīvne ghṛtena asmām abhi kṣara / vṛkṣam iva aśanyā jahi yaḥ asmān pratidīvyati //🔽yaḥ naḥ dyuve dhanam idam cakāra yaḥ akṣāṇām glahanam śeṣaṇam ca / sa naḥ devaḥ haviḥ idam juṣāṇaḥ gandharvebhiḥ sadhamādam madema /🔽saṃvasavaḥ iti vaḥ nāmadheyam ugraṃpaśyāḥ rāṣṭrabhṛtaḥ hi akṣāḥ / tebhyaḥ vaḥ indavaḥ haviṣā vidhema vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām /
analyzed: apsarasaḥ sadhamādam madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryam ca    tāḥ me hastau sam sṛjantu ghṛtena sapatnam me kitavam randhayantu  /🔽ādinavam pratidīvne ghṛtena asmām abhi kṣara   vṛkṣam iva aśanyā jahi yaḥ asmān pratidīvyati  /🔽yaḥ naḥ dyuve dhanam idam cakāra yaḥ akṣāṇām glahanam śeṣaṇam ca    sa naḥ devaḥ haviḥ idam juṣāṇaḥ gandharvebhiḥ sadhamādam madema  /🔽saṃvasavaḥ iti vaḥ nāmadheyam ugraṃpaśyāḥ rāṣṭrabhṛtaḥ hi akṣāḥ   tebhyaḥ vaḥ indavaḥ haviṣā vidhema vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām  /
translated: The Apsarases rejoice in the banquet between the oblation-holder and the sun. May they unite my hands with ghee.
