original: devān yat nāthitaḥ huve brahmacaryam yat ūṣima / akṣān yat babhrūn ālabhe te naḥ mṛḍantu īdṛśe /
analyzed: devān yat nāthitaḥ huve brahmacaryam yat ūṣima   akṣān yat babhrūn ālabhe te naḥ mṛḍantu īdṛśe  /
translated: When I have called on Gods for aid, when I have lived the life of prayer, When I have offered up the brown dice, may they be gracious unto us in this our need.

original: agne indraḥ ca dāśuṣe hataḥ vṛtrāṇi aprati / ubhā hi vṛtra hantamā /
analyzed: agne indraḥ ca dāśuṣe hataḥ vṛtrāṇi aprati   ubhā hi vṛtra hantamā  /
translated: Indra and Agni, when the worshipper hath slain his foes, are both of them Vritra-slayers.

original: yābhyām ajayan svar agre eva yau ātasthatuḥ bhuvanāni viśvā / pra carṣaṇī vṛṣaṇā vajra bāhū agnim indram vṛtra haṇā huve aham /
analyzed: yābhyām ajayan svar agre eva yau ātasthatuḥ bhuvanāni viśvā   pra carṣaṇī vṛṣaṇā vajra bāhū agnim indram vṛtra haṇā huve aham  /
translated: By whom they conquered light, who first established all living things, the two most active, mighty, thunder-wielding Vritra-slayers, I invoke, Agni and Indra, for the slaughter of my foes.

original: upa tvā devaḥ agramīt camasena bṛhaspatiḥ / indra gīrbhiḥ naḥ ā viśa yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: upa tvā devaḥ agramīt camasena bṛhaspatiḥ    indra gīrbhiḥ naḥ ā viśa yajamānāya sunvate  /
translated: The God hath drawn nigh unto thee with the ladle, O Brihaspati. O Indra, come to us with songs, to him who sheds the juice and worships thee.

original: indrasya kukṣiḥ asi soma dhānaḥ ātmā devānām uta mānuṣāṇām / iha prajāḥ janaya yāḥ te āsu yāḥ anyatra iha tāḥ te ramantām /
analyzed: indrasya kukṣiḥ asi soma dhānaḥ ātmā devānām uta mānuṣāṇām    iha prajāḥ janaya yāḥ te āsu yāḥ anyatra iha tāḥ te ramantām  /
translated: Thou art the belly of Indra, the reservoir of Soma, the soul of Gods and men. Here beget the creatures that are in these, and let those that are elsewhere delight themselves in thee.

original: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahivrate / āpaḥ sapta susruvuḥ devīḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahivrate    āpaḥ sapta susruvuḥ devīḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Auspicious are Heaven and Earth, most gracious, of great majesty. The seven divine streams have flowed hither: may they deliver us from woe.

original: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta / atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt /
analyzed: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta  / atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt  /
translated: Deliver me from imprecation, from Varuna's noose also, And from the bond of Yama, from all transgression against God.

original: tṛṣṭike tṛṣṭa vandanaḥ ud amūm chindhi tṛṣṭike / yathā kṛta dviṣṭāsaḥ amuṣmai śepyāvate /
analyzed: tṛṣṭike tṛṣṭa vandanaḥ ud amūm chindhi tṛṣṭike   yathā kṛta dviṣṭāsaḥ amuṣmai śepyāvate  /
translated: O Triskandhaka, O Triskandhaka, rend her asunder, that she may be given to him who hates her.

original: tṛṣṭā asi tṛṣṭikā viṣā viṣātakī asi / parivṛktā yathā asasi ṛṣabhasya vaśā iva /
analyzed: tṛṣṭā asi tṛṣṭikā viṣā viṣātakī asi   parivṛktā yathā asasi ṛṣabhasya vaśā iva
translated: Thou art the Triskandhaka, the poison, the poisoner. As thou art the Triskandhaka, so art thou the Vasha of the bull.

original: ā te dade vakṣaṇābhyaḥ ā te aham hṛdayāt dade / ā te mukhasya saṅkāśāt sarvam te varcaḥ ā dade /
analyzed: ā te dade vakṣaṇābhyaḥ ā te aham hṛdayāt dade   ā te mukhasya saṅkāśāt sarvam te varcaḥ ā dade  /
translated: I take from thee thy heart, I take from thy breast, I take from thy heart. I take from the mouth's edge all thy beauty.

original: pra itas yantu vyādhyaḥ pra anudhyāḥ pra u aśastayaḥ / agniḥ rakṣasvinīḥ hantu somaḥ hantu durasyatīḥ /🔽pra pata itas pāpi lakṣmi naśyetaḥ pra amutas pata / ayasmayena aṅkena dviṣate tvā sajāmasi //
analyzed: pra itas yantu vyādhyaḥ pra anudhyāḥ pra u aśastayaḥ   agniḥ rakṣasvinīḥ hantu somaḥ hantu durasyatīḥ  / pra pata itas pāpi lakṣmi naśya itas pra amutas pata   ayasmayena aṅkena dviṣate tvā sajāmasi  /
translated: Hence let diseases go away, let griefs depart, let curses go away. Let Agni slay the Rākṣasas, let Soma slay the evil-minded.🔽Hence, O thou of evil mark, fly away, vanish hence, vanish away. With an iron hook we bind thee fast to the foe.

original: yā mā lakṣmīḥ patayālūḥ ajuṣṭā abhicaskanda vandanā iva vṛkṣam / anyatra asmat savitar tām itas dhāḥ hiraṇya hastaḥ vasu naḥ rarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yā mā lakṣmīḥ patayālūḥ ajuṣṭā abhicaskanda vandanā iva vṛkṣam    anyatra asmat savitar tām itas dhāḥ hiraṇya hastaḥ vasu naḥ rarāṇaḥ  /
translated: The inauspicious luck that rushes upon me like a creeper climbing a tree, O Savitar, cast that away from us hence, thou who hast a golden hand, bestowing wealth on us.

original: eka śatam lakṣmyaḥ martyasya sākam tanvā januṣaḥ adhi jātāḥ / tāsām pāpiṣṭhāḥ niḥ itas pra hiṇmaḥ śivāḥ asmabhyam jātavedaḥ niyaccha /
analyzed: eka śatam lakṣmyaḥ martyasya sākam tanvā januṣaḥ adhi jātāḥ   tāsām pāpiṣṭhāḥ niḥ itas pra hiṇmaḥ śivāḥ asmabhyam jātavedaḥ niyaccha  /
translated: A hundred and one Laksmis are born with the body of a mortal man. Of these, the most sinful we banish hence away. The auspicious ones, O Jâtavedas, keep for us.

original: etāḥ enāḥ vyākaram khile gāḥ viṣṭhitāḥ iva / ramantām puṇyā lakṣmīḥ yāḥ pāpīḥ tāḥ anīnaśam //
analyzed: etāḥ enāḥ vyākaram khile gāḥ viṣṭhitāḥ iva   ramantām puṇyā lakṣmīḥ yāḥ pāpīḥ tāḥ anīnaśam  /
translated: These evils have I scattered like scattered kine upon the plain. Let the auspicious Laksmis stay, the sinful have I driven hence.

original: namaḥ rūrāya cyavanāya nodanāya dhṛṣṇave / namaḥ śītāya pūrva kāma kṛtvane /
analyzed: namaḥ rūrāya cyavanāya nodanāya dhṛṣṇave   namaḥ śītāya pūrva kāma kṛtvane  /
translated: Homage to Rûra, to Cyavana, to Noudana, to Dhrisna. Homage to Sîta, to the one who acts according to his wish.

original: yaḥ anyedyus ubhayadyus abhyeti imam maṇḍūkam / abhi etu avrataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ anyedyus ubhayadyus abhyeti imam maṇḍūkam    abhi etu avrataḥ
translated: He who comes to-morrow or the day after to-morrow, let him come to this frog. Let him come who is not vowed.

original: ā mandraiḥ indra haribhiḥ yāhi mayūra romabhiḥ / mā tvā ke cit vi yaman vim na pāśinaḥ ati dhanva iva tām ihi //
analyzed: ā mandraiḥ indra haribhiḥ yāhi mayūra romabhiḥ   mā tvā ke cit vi yaman vim na pāśinaḥ ati dhanva iva tām ihi  /
translated: Come, Indra, with thy merry Bays whose hairs are gold, with peacocks' plumes. Let none disturb thee, as a hunter disturbs his game. Pass by as 'twere a desert plain.

original: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somaḥ tvā rājā amṛtena anu vastām / uroḥ varīyaḥ varuṇaḥ te kṛṇotu jayantam tvā anu devāḥ madantu /
analyzed: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somaḥ tvā rājā amṛtena anu vastām    uroḥ varīyaḥ varuṇaḥ te kṛṇotu jayantam tvā anu devāḥ madantu  /
translated: I cover all thy vital parts with mail. Let Soma, King, anoint thee with the balm of life. Let Varuna give thee a wider space for thy breast. Let the Gods rejoice in thee as thou art conquering.

original: antakāya mṛtyave namaḥ prānāḥ apānāḥ iha te ramantām / iha ayam astu puruṣaḥ saha asunā sūryasya bhāge amṛtasya loke /
analyzed: antakāya mṛtyave namaḥ prānāḥ apānāḥ iha te ramantām   iha ayam astu puruṣaḥ saha asunā sūryasya bhāge amṛtasya loke  /
translated: Homage to Death, to the Destroyer. Let thy in-breathings and out-breathings delight thee here. Here let this man be with his life, in the region of the sun, in the world of immortality.

original: ud enam bhagaḥ agrabhīt ud enam somaḥ aṃśumān / ud enam marutaḥ devāḥ ud indra agnī svastaye /
analyzed: ud enam bhagaḥ agrabhīt ud enam somaḥ aṃśumān   ud enam marutaḥ devāḥ ud indra agnī svastaye  /
translated: Bhaga hath lifted him up, and Soma with his rays, and the Maruts, and the Gods, and Indra and Agni for his weal.

original: iha te asuḥ iha prāṇaḥ iha āyuḥ iha te manaḥ / ud tvā nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyaḥ daivyā vacā bharāmasi //
analyzed: iha te asuḥ iha prāṇaḥ iha āyuḥ iha te manaḥ    ud tvā nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyaḥ daivyā vacā bharāmasi  /
translated: Here is thy life, here is thy breath, here is thy spirit, here thy soul. From the noose of Nirrti we draw thee up with this divine address.

original: ud krāma atas puruṣa mā ava patthāḥ mṛtyoḥ paḍvīṣam avamuñcamānaḥ / mā chitthāḥ asmāt lokāt agneḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśaḥ /
analyzed: ud krāma atas puruṣa mā ava patthāḥ mṛtyoḥ paḍvīṣam avamuñcamānaḥ   mā chitthāḥ asmāt lokāt agneḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśaḥ  /
translated: Rise up from hence, O man, fall not into the pit of Death, unloosing thy bonds. Be not thou sundered from this world, from the sight of Agni and the Sun.

original: tubhyam vātaḥ pavatām mātariśvā tubhyam varṣantu amṛtāni āpaḥ / sūryaḥ te tanve śam tapāti tvām mṛtyuḥ dayatām mā pra meṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: tubhyam vātaḥ pavatām mātariśvā tubhyam varṣantu amṛtāni āpaḥ   sūryaḥ te tanve śam tapāti tvām mṛtyuḥ dayatām mā pra meṣṭhāḥ  /
translated: Let the wind Vata blow on thee, let the waters rain on thee their dews. Let the Sun shine health and comfort on thy body. Be gracious, O Death, do not afflict me.

original: udyānam te puruṣa na avayānam jīvātum te dakṣatātim kṛnomi / ā hi roha imam amṛtam sukham ratham atha jirviḥ vidatham ā vadāsi //
analyzed: udyānam te puruṣa na avayānam jīvātum te dakṣatātim kṛnomi    ā hi roha imam amṛtam sukham ratham atha jirviḥ vidatham ā vadāsi  /
translated: I make for thee, O man, thy going forth, not thy returning. I make for thee the gaining of life and strength. So mount this car of immortality, of bliss. Then, O thou living soul, thou speakest in the assembly.

original: mā te manaḥ tatra gāt mā tiras bhūt mā jīvebhyaḥ pra madaḥ mā anu gāḥ pitṝn / viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu tvā iha /
analyzed: mā te manaḥ tatra gāt mā tiras bhūt mā jīvebhyaḥ pra madaḥ mā anu gāḥ pitṝn    viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu tvā iha  /
translated: Let not thy spirit go thither, let it not be hidden away. Let it not go to the Fathers, let it not depart from the living. Let all the Gods here guard thee.

original: mā gatānām ā dīdhīthāḥ ye nayanti parāvatam / ā roha tamasaḥ jyotiḥ ehi ā te hastau rabhāmahe //
analyzed: mā gatānām ā dīdhīthāḥ ye nayanti parāvatam    ā roha tamasaḥ jyotiḥ ehi ā te hastau rabhāmahe  /
translated: Think not of those who have gone hence, who lead thee far away. Come up to the light from the darkness. We take thy hands.

original: śyāmaḥ ca tvā mā śabalaḥ ca preṣitau yamasya yau pathirakṣī śvānau / arvāṅ ehi mā vi dīdhyaḥ mā atra tiṣṭhaḥ parāṅmanāḥ /
analyzed: śyāmaḥ ca tvā mā śabalaḥ ca preṣitau yamasya yau pathirakṣī śvānau    arvāṅ ehi mā vi dīdhyaḥ mā atra tiṣṭhaḥ parāṅmanāḥ  /
translated: The dark one and the speckled one, the two dogs of Yama, the guardians of the path, have sent thee. Come hither. Be not disquieted. Stand not here with thy mind turned away.

original: mā etam panthām anu gāḥ bhīmaḥ eṣa yena pūrvam neyatha tam bravīmi / tamaḥ etat puruṣa mā pra patthāḥ bhayam parastāt abhayam te arvāk // tamaḥ etat puruṣa mā pra patthāḥ bhayam parastāt abhayam te arvāk // te arvāk // tamaḥ etat puruṣa mā pra patthāḥ bhayam parastāt abhayam te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te arvāk // te ar
