original: rakṣantu tvā agnayaḥ ye apsu antā rakṣatu tvā manuṣyāḥ yam indhate / vaiśvānaraḥ rakṣatu jātavedāḥ divyaḥ tvā mā pra dhāk vidyutā saha /
analyzed: rakṣantu tvā agnayaḥ ye apsu antā rakṣatu tvā manuṣyāḥ yam indhate    vaiśvānaraḥ rakṣatu jātavedāḥ divyaḥ tvā mā pra dhāk vidyutā saha  /
translated: Go not, O man, this way: it is a fearful way, I tell thee, by which thou wentest forth. Go not to that darkness: beyond it is a terror. Safe be the way that le

original: mā tvā kravyād abhi maṃstārāt saṃkasukāt cara rakṣatu tvā dyauḥ rakṣatu / pṛthivī sūryaḥ ca tvā rakṣatām candramāḥ ca / antarikṣam rakṣatu deva hetyāḥ //
analyzed: mā tvā kravyād abhi maṃstā ārāt saṃkasukāt cara rakṣatu tvā dyauḥ rakṣatu  / pṛthivī sūryaḥ ca tvā rakṣatām candramāḥ ca   antarikṣam rakṣatu deva hetyāḥ  /
translated: Let not the flesh-devouring bird look down upon thee, nor the wolf, nor the jackal. Let Dyaus protect thee, let Pṛthivī protect thee, let Sūrya protect thee, let Candramas protect thee. Let the sky protect thee from the god's curse.

original: bodhaḥ ca tvā pratibodhaḥ ca rakṣatām asvapnaḥ ca tvā anavadrāṇaḥ ca rakṣatām / gopāyan ca tvā jāgṛviḥ ca rakṣatām / gopāyan ca tvā jāgṛviḥ ca rakṣatām / gopāyan ca tvā jāgṛviḥ ca rakṣatām /
analyzed: bodhaḥ ca tvā pratibodhaḥ ca rakṣatām asvapnaḥ ca tvā anavadrāṇaḥ ca rakṣatām              ca rakṣatām        ca rakṣatām        ca tvā jāgṛviḥ ca rakṣatām       /
translated: Let Bodha and Pratibodha protect thee, let Asvapna and Anavradhana protect thee. Let Gopa and Jagrvi protect thee. Let Gopa and Jagrvi protect thee. Let Gopa and Jagrvi protect thee.

original: te tvā rakṣantu te tvā gopāyantu tebhyaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: te tvā rakṣantu te tvā gopāyantu tebhyaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: May they protect thee, may they guard thee. Homage to them, to them Svâhâ!

original: jīvebhyaḥ tvā samude vāyuḥ indraḥ dhātā dadhātu savitā trāyamāṇaḥ / mā tvā prāṇaḥ balam ha āsīt asum te anu hvayāmasi //
analyzed: jīvebhyaḥ tvā samude vāyuḥ indraḥ dhātā dadhātu savitā trāyamāṇaḥ   mā tvā prāṇaḥ balam ha āsīt asum te anu hvayāmasi  /
translated: For living beings let Vâyu, let Indra, let Dhâtar, let Savitar the guardian, set thee free. Let not thy breath, thy strength, thy life depart from thee. We summon back thy spirit.

original: mā tvā jambhaḥ saṃhanuḥ mā tamaḥ vidat mā jihvā barhiḥ pramayuḥ kathā syāḥ / ud tvā ādityāḥ vasavaḥ bharantu ud indra agnī svastaye /
analyzed: mā tvā jambhaḥ saṃhanuḥ mā tamaḥ vidat mā jihvā barhiḥ pramayuḥ kathā syāḥ    ud tvā ādityāḥ vasavaḥ bharantu ud indra agnī svastaye  /
translated: Let not thy jaw, thy neck, thy darkness know thee. Let not thy tongue, thy sacrificial grass, be burnt. Let the Âdityas, let the Vasus bear thee up. Let Indra and Agni bear thee up for welfare.

original: ud tvā dyauḥ ud pṛthivī ud prajāpatiḥ agrabhīt / ud tvā mṛtyoḥ oṣadhayaḥ soma rājñīḥ apīparan /
analyzed: ud tvā dyauḥ ud pṛthivī ud prajāpatiḥ agrabhīt    ud tvā mṛtyoḥ oṣadhayaḥ soma rājñīḥ apīparan  /
translated: The heaven and the earth and Prajapati have raised thee up. The plants, the queens of Soma, have delivered thee from death.

original: ayam devāḥ iha eva astu ayam mā amutra gāt itas / imam sahasra vīryeṇa mṛtyoḥ ud pārayāmasi //
analyzed: ayam devāḥ iha eva astu ayam mā amutra gāt itas    imam sahasra vīryeṇa mṛtyoḥ ud pārayāmasi  /
translated: Here let him be, O Gods, and here let him not go to yonder world. With a thousand powers we rescue him from death.

original: ud tvā mṛtyoḥ apīparam sam dhamantu vayodhasaḥ / mā tvā vyasta keśyaḥ mā tvā agharudaḥ rudan /
analyzed: ud tvā mṛtyoḥ apīparam sam dhamantu vayodhasaḥ   mā tvā vyasta keśyaḥ mā tvā agharudaḥ rudan  /
translated: From death have I delivered thee: let the life-giving winds blow thee together. Let not the women with dishevelled hair, let not the weeping mourners see thee.

original: āhārṣam avidam tvā punar āgāḥ punarṇavaḥ / sarva aṅga sarvam te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuḥ ca te avidam /
analyzed: āhārṣam avidam tvā punar āgāḥ punarṇavaḥ    sarva aṅga sarvam te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuḥ ca te avidam  /
translated: I have brought thee, I have found thee. Thou hast come back again, renewed and fresh. I have found thee whole with all thy limbs, with all thy sight, with all thy life.

original: vi avāt te jyotiḥ abhūt apa tvat tamaḥ akramīt / apa tvat mṛtyum nirṛtim apa yakṣmam ni dadhmasi // //
analyzed: vi avāt te jyotiḥ abhūt apa tvat tamaḥ akramīt   apa tvat mṛtyum nirṛtim apa yakṣmam ni dadhmasi
translated: Thy light hath shone forth, the darkness hath passed away from thee. From thee we have removed both death and want of life, and all consumption.

original: ā rabhasva imām amṛtasya śnuṣṭim a chidyamānā jaradaṣṭiḥ astu te / asum te āyuḥ punar ā bharāmi rajaḥ tamaḥ mā upa gāḥ mā pra meṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: ā rabhasva imām amṛtasya śnuṣṭim a chidyamānā jaradaṣṭiḥ astu te    asum te āyuḥ punar ā bharāmi rajaḥ tamaḥ mā upa gāḥ mā pra meṣṭhāḥ  /
translated: Take thou this share of immortality. Let not thy teeth decay. Let not thy sight decay. I bring thee back thy life again. Go not to the realm of dust, go not to the realm of gloom.

original: jīvatām jyotiḥ abhyehi arvāṅ ā tvā harāmi śata śāradāya / avamuñcat mṛtyu pāśān aśastim drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram te dadhāmi //
analyzed: jīvatām jyotiḥ abhyehi arvāṅ ā tvā harāmi śata śāradāya   avamuñcat mṛtyu pāśān aśastim drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram te dadhāmi  /
translated: Come hither, Jyotis, come to us alive: I bring thee back again to live a hundred winters. I loose thee from the noose of Death, from curse and slander. I give thee lengthened life, a path to walk upon.

original: vātāt te prānam avidam sūryāt cakṣuḥ aham tava / yat te manaḥ tvayi tat dhārayāmi sam vitsva aṅgaiḥ vada jihvayā ālapan /
analyzed: vātāt te prānam avidam sūryāt cakṣuḥ aham tava    yat te manaḥ tvayi tat dhārayāmi sam vitsva aṅgaiḥ vada jihvayā ālapan  /
translated: From the wind I have gained thy breath, and from the sun thy sight. Thy mind that is in thee I retain. Be united with thy limbs, speak with thy tongue, and talk.

original: prāṇena tvā dvipadām catuṣpadām agnim iva jātam abhi sam dhamāmi / namaḥ te mṛtyo cakṣuṣe namaḥ prāṇāya te akaram /
analyzed: prāṇena tvā dvipadām catuṣpadām agnim iva jātam abhi sam dhamāmi   namaḥ te mṛtyo cakṣuṣe namaḥ prāṇāya te akaram  /
translated: With the breath of men and beasts I warm thee, as 'twere a kindled fire. I have paid homage to thy eye, O Death, and homage to thy breath.

original: ayam jīvatu mā mṛtaḥ imam sam īrayāmasi / kṛṇomi asmai bheṣajam mṛtyo mā puruṣam vadhīḥ //
analyzed: ayam jīvatu mā mṛtaḥ imam sam īrayāmasi   kṛṇomi asmai bheṣajam mṛtyo mā puruṣam vadhīḥ  /
translated: Let this one live, not die: we bring him back to life again. I make this medicine for him. O Death, slay not the man.

original: jīvalām naghāriṣām jīvantīm oṣadhīm aham / trāyamāṇām sahamānām sahasvatīm iha huve asmai ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: jīvalām naghāriṣām jīvantīm oṣadhīm aham    trāyamāṇām sahamānām sahasvatīm iha huve asmai ariṣṭatātaye  /
translated: The plant that lives, that conquers pain, that lives, the plant that saves and conquers, I invoke here for this man's safety.

original: adhi brūhi mā rabhathāḥ sṛja imam tava eva san sarva hāyāḥ iha astu / bhava aśarvau mṛḍatam śarma yacchatam apasidhya duritam dhattam āyuḥ /
analyzed: adhi brūhi mā rabhathāḥ sṛja imam tava eva san sarva hāyāḥ iha astu   bhava aśarvau mṛḍatam śarma yacchatam apasidhya duritam dhattam āyuḥ  /
translated: Speak out, seize him not: let him go free. Let all his cattle here remain to thee. Be gracious, Bhava and Sarva: grant him protection. Remove his sin and give him life.

original: asmai mṛtyo adhi brūhi imam dayasva ud itas ayam etu / ariṣṭaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ su śrut jarasā śata hāyanaḥ ātmanā bhujam aśnutām /
analyzed: asmai mṛtyo adhi brūhi imam dayasva ud itas ayam etu    ariṣṭaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ su śrut jarasā śata hāyanaḥ ātmanā bhujam aśnutām  /
translated: For him, O Death, I pray: be gracious to him. Let him come forth from hence. Let him be free from sickness, with all his limbs, with good hearing, with long life, a hundred winters. May he enjoy his life to the full.

original: devānām hetiḥ pari tvā vṛṇaktu pārayāmi tvā rajasaḥ ud tvā mṛtyoḥ apīparam / ārāt agnim kravya adam nirūham jīvātave te paridhim dadhāmi //
analyzed: devānām hetiḥ pari tvā vṛṇaktu pārayāmi tvā rajasaḥ ud tvā mṛtyoḥ apīparam   ārāt agnim kravya adam nirūham jīvātave te paridhim dadhāmi  /
translated: May the dart of the gods choose thee. I lead thee over the dust. I have brought thee out of death. I set thee free from the devouring Agni. I place thee in a safe place for thy life.

analyzed: yat te niyānam rajasam mṛtyo an avadharṣyam   pathaḥ imam tasmāt rakṣantaḥ brahma asmai varma kṛṇmasi
translated: The path of thine, O Death, which goest through the air, which is irresistible, from that we guard this man. We make this prayer a coat of mail for him.

original: kṛṇomi te prāṇa apānau jarām mṛtyum dīrgham āyuḥ svasti / vaivasvatena prahitān yama dūtān carataḥ apa sedhāmi sarvān /
analyzed: kṛṇomi te prāṇa apānau jarām mṛtyum dīrgham āyuḥ svasti   vaivasvatena prahitān yama dūtān carataḥ apa sedhāmi sarvān  /
translated: I make for thee the out-breathing, the in-breathing, old age, death, long life, and welfare. I drive away all the messengers of Yama, sent by Vivasvan.

original: ārāt arātim nirṛtim paras grāhim kravya adaḥ piśācān / rakṣaḥ yat sarvam durbhūtam tat tamaḥ iva apa hanmasi //
analyzed: ārāt arātim nirṛtim paras grāhim kravya adaḥ piśācān    rakṣaḥ yat sarvam durbhūtam tat tamaḥ iva apa hanmasi  /
translated: Far from us be hostility, destruction, the grasping fiend, the flesh-devouring Pishachas, The Rakshas, and all evil: as with darkness we dispel them all.

original: agneḥ ta prānam amṛtāt āyuṣmataḥ vanve jātavedasaḥ / yathā na riṣyāḥ amṛtaḥ sajūs asaḥ tat te kṛṇomi tat u te sam ṛdhyatām /🔽śive te stām dyāvāpṛthivī asaṃtāpe abhiśriyau / śam te sūryaḥ ā tapatu śam vātaḥ vātu te hṛde / śivāḥ abhi kṣarantu tvāpaḥ divyāḥ payasvatīḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ ta prānam amṛtāt āyuṣmataḥ vanve jātavedasaḥ   yathā na riṣyāḥ amṛtaḥ sajūs asaḥ tat te kṛṇomi tat u te sam ṛdhyatām  / śive te stām dyāvāpṛthivī asaṃtāpe abhiśriyau   śam te sūryaḥ ā tapatu śam vātaḥ vātu te hṛde   śivāḥ abhi kṣarantu tvāpaḥ divyāḥ payasvatīḥ  /
translated: I bring thee the breath of Agni, of immortal life, of Jâtavedas, That thou mayst not be injured, that thou mayst live, that thou mayst be united with thy kindred. I do this for thee: let it prosper for thee.🔽Be the two worlds, Heaven and Earth, propitious to thee, not burning, but most gracious. Let the Sun shine pleasantly on thee: let the wind blow pleasantly to thy heart. Let the heavenly waters, rich in milk, flow pleasantly to thee.

original: śivāḥ te santu oṣadhayaḥ ud tvā ahārṣam adharasyāḥ uttarām pṛthivīm abhi / tatra tvā ādityau rakṣatām sūryācandramasau ubhā //🔽yat te vāsaḥ paridhānam yām nīvim kṛṇuṣe tvam / śivam te tanve tat kṛṇmaḥ saṃsparśe adrūkṣṇam astu te /
analyzed: śivāḥ te santu oṣadhayaḥ ud tvā ahārṣam adharasyāḥ uttarām pṛthivīm abhi tatra tvā ādityau rakṣatām sūryācandramasau ubhā  yat te vāsaḥ paridhānam yām nīvim kṛṇuṣe tvam    śivam te tanve tat kṛṇmaḥ saṃsparśe adrūkṣṇam astu te  /
translated: Be the plants propitious to thee. I have brought thee up from the lower to the higher earth. There let the two Adityas, the Sun and the Moon, protect thee.🔽The garment which thou wearest, the girdle which thou bindest on, we make that pleasant for thy body: let it be soft to the touch.

original: yat kṣureṇa marcayatā su tejasā vaptā vapasi keśa śmaśru / śubham mukham mā naḥ āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ /
analyzed: yat kṣureṇa marcayatā su tejasā vaptā vapasi keśa śmaśru    śubham mukham mā naḥ āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ  /
translated: When with the sharp, well-tempered razor the barber shaves thee, let him not cut thy skin. Let him not cut thy skin.

original: śivau te stām vrīhi yavau abalāsau adomadhau / etau yakṣmam vi bādhete etau muñcataḥ aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: śivau te stām vrīhi yavau abalāsau adomadhau   etau yakṣmam vi bādhete etau muñcataḥ aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Let thy two Shivas be the barley and the wheat, the weak and the strong, the sweet and the bitter. These two drive away disease, these two deliver from affliction.

original: yat aśnāsi yat pibasi dhānyam kṛṣyāḥ payaḥ / yat ādyam yat anādyam sarvam te annam aviṣam kṛṇomi //
analyzed: yat aśnāsi yat pibasi dhānyam kṛṣyāḥ payaḥ   yat ādyam yat anādyam sarvam te annam aviṣam kṛṇomi  /
translated: Whatever thou eatest, whatever thou drinkest, the corn of the field, the milk, the first and the last, all that food of thine I make for thee free from poison.

original: ahne ca tvā rātraye ca ubhābhyām pari dadmasi / arāyebhyaḥ jighatsubhyaḥ imam me pari rakṣata // //
analyzed: ahne ca tvā rātraye ca ubhābhyām pari dadmasi   arāyebhyaḥ jighatsubhyaḥ imam me pari rakṣata
translated: To the day and to the night, to both of them we commit thee. From the Rākshasas, from those who would hunger thee, do ye both preserve him.

original: śatam te ayutam hāyanān dve yuge trīṇi catvāri kṛṇmaḥ / indra agnī viśve devāḥ te anu manyantām a hṛṇīyamānāḥ /
analyzed: śatam te ayutam hāyanān dve yuge trīṇi catvāri kṛṇmaḥ   indra agnī viśve devāḥ te anu manyantām a hṛṇīyamānāḥ  /
translated: We make for thee a hundred, a thousand years, two ages, three, four. Let Indra, Agni, and the All-Gods approve of thee, not grudging.

original: śarade tvā hemantāya vasantāya grīṣmāya pari dadmasi / varṣāṇi tubhyam syonāni yeṣu vardhante oṣadhīḥ /🔽mṛtyuḥ īśe dvipadām mṛtyuḥ īśe catuṣpadām / tasmāt tvām mṛtyoḥ gopateḥ ud bharāmi sa mā bibheḥ //
analyzed: śarade tvā hemantāya vasantāya grīṣmāya pari dadmasi   varṣāṇi tubhyam syonāni yeṣu vardhante oṣadhīḥ  / mṛtyuḥ īśe dvipadām mṛtyuḥ īśe catuṣpadām   tasmāt tvām mṛtyoḥ gopateḥ ud bharāmi sa mā bibheḥ  /
translated: For the autumn, for the winter, for the spring, for the summer we commit thee. For thy pleasant rainy seasons, in which the plants grow up.🔽Death is the lord of bipeds, death is the lord of quadrupeds. From that death, O lord of the cow, I deliver thee. Fear not.

original: saḥ ariṣṭa na mariṣyasi na mariṣyasi mā bibheḥ / na vai tatra mriyante naḥ yanti adhamam tamaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ ariṣṭa na mariṣyasi na mariṣyasi mā bibheḥ   na vai tatra mriyante naḥ yanti adhamam tamaḥ  /
translated: Thou shalt not die, thou shalt not die. Fear not. For there they do not die, they go not to the lowest darkness.

original: sarvaḥ vai tatra jīvati gauḥ aśvaḥ puruṣaḥ paśuḥ / yatra idam brahma kriyate paridhiḥ jīvanāya kam /
analyzed: sarvaḥ vai tatra jīvati gauḥ aśvaḥ puruṣaḥ paśuḥ   yatra idam brahma kriyate paridhiḥ jīvanāya kam  /
translated: Where this Brahman is performed, the enclosing-stick for the life of all.

original: pari tvā pātu samānebhyaḥ abhicārāt sabandhubhyaḥ / amamriḥ bhava amṛtaḥ atijīvaḥ mā te hāsiṣuḥ asavaḥ śarīram /
analyzed: pari tvā pātu samānebhyaḥ abhicārāt sabandhubhyaḥ    amamriḥ bhava amṛtaḥ atijīvaḥ mā te hāsiṣuḥ asavaḥ śarīram  /
translated: May it protect thee from thy equals, from thy kinsmen, from thy neighbours, from thy relatives, from thy foes. Be thou immortal, live thou a hundred winters. Let not thy vital airs forsake thy body.🔽The hundred and one forms of death, the many dangers to be overcome,

original: ye mṛtyavaḥ eka śatam yāḥ nāṣṭrāḥ atitāryāḥ / muñcantu tasmāt tvām devāḥ agneḥ vaiśvānarāt adhi /
analyzed: ye mṛtyavaḥ eka śatam yāḥ nāṣṭrāḥ atitāryāḥ   muñcantu tasmāt tvām devāḥ agneḥ vaiśvānarāt adhi  /
translated: From all of these may the Gods deliver thee, from Agni Vaisvânara.🔽Thou art the body of Agni, the preserver, the slayer of Raksases, the slayer of foes,

original: agneḥ śarīram asi pārayiṣṇu rakṣaḥ hā asi sapatna hā / atha u amīva cātanaḥ pūtudruḥ nāma bheṣajam // //
analyzed: agneḥ śarīram asi pārayiṣṇu rakṣaḥ hā asi sapatna hā   atha u amīva cātanaḥ pūtudruḥ nāma bheṣajam
translated: And also the averter of disease, the medicine called Pûtudru.🔽I warm me to the vigorous slayer of Raksases: I come to the most spacious shelter, to the Friend.

original: rakṣaḥ haṇam vājinam ā jigharmi mitram prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma / śiśānaḥ agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam /
analyzed: rakṣaḥ haṇam vājinam ā jigharmi mitram prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma    śiśānaḥ agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam  /
translated: Agni, sharpened by the rites, is glowing. May he by day and night preserve us from affliction.

original: ayaḥ daṃṣṭraḥ arciṣā yātudhānān upa spṛśa jātavedaḥ samiddhaḥ / ā jihvayā mūradevān rabhasva kravya adaḥ vṛṣṭvā api dhatsva āsan /
analyzed: ayaḥ daṃṣṭraḥ arciṣā yātudhānān upa spṛśa jātavedaḥ samiddhaḥ   ā jihvayā mūradevān rabhasva kravya adaḥ vṛṣṭvā api dhatsva āsan  /
translated: With thy flame, O Jâtavedas, well enkindled, strike the Râkshasas with iron teeth. Devour the Mûrdhatas with thy tongue. Eat thou the flesh, O thou who eatest raw flesh, and cast them down.

original: ubhā ubhayāvin upa dhehi daṃṣṭrau hiṃsraḥ śiśānaḥ avaram param ca / uta antarikṣe pari yāhi agne jambhaiḥ sam dhehi abhi yātudhānān /
analyzed: ubhā ubhayāvin upa dhehi daṃṣṭrau hiṃsraḥ śiśānaḥ avaram param ca     uta antarikṣe pari yāhi agne jambhaiḥ sam dhehi abhi yātudhānān  /
translated: O thou who art both, O thou who art of both kinds, set thy two fangs in the lower and the upper (world). Fierce, sharpened, O Agni, go round in the atmosphere; with thy jaws crush the Yātudhānas.

original: agne tvacam yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsra aśaniḥ harasā hantu enam / pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyād kraviṣṇuḥ vi cinotu enam /
analyzed: agne tvacam yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsra aśaniḥ harasā hantu enam    pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyād kraviṣṇuḥ vi cinotu enam  /
translated: Rend the skin of the Yātudhāna, O Agni; let the fierce thunderbolt with its flame slay him. Sharpen, O all-knower, his joints; let the flesh-devouring, greedy one tear him limb from limb.

original: yatra idānīm paśyasi jātavedaḥ tiṣṭhantam agne uta vā carantam / uta antarikṣe patantam yātudhānam tam astā vidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ /🔽yajñaiḥ iṣūḥ saṃnamamānaḥ agne iva ācā śalyām aśanibhiḥ dihānaḥ / tābhiḥ vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīcaḥ bāhūn prati bhaṅgdhi eṣām /
analyzed: yatra idānīm paśyasi jātavedaḥ tiṣṭhantam agne uta vā carantam    uta antarikṣe patantam yātudhānam tam astā vidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ  / yajñaiḥ iṣūḥ saṃnamamānaḥ agne iva ācā śalyām aśanibhiḥ dihānaḥ    tābhiḥ vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīcaḥ bāhūn prati bhaṅgdhi eṣām  /
translated: Where now thou seest him, O all-knower, standing, O Agni, or walking, Or the Yātudhāna flying in the atmosphere, sharpen thy dart, O thou who art sharpened, and pierce him.🔽Sharpening thy arrows with sacrifices, O Agni, anointing them with oil, O thou who art born of the waters, With them pierce the Yātudhānas in the heart; break their arms, that they may be turned away.

original: uta ārabdhān spṛnuhi jātavedaḥ uta ārebhāṇām ṛṣṭibhiḥ yātudhānān / agne pūrvaḥ ni jahi śośucānaḥ āma adaḥ kṣviṅkāḥ tam adantu enīḥ /
analyzed: uta ārabdhān spṛnuhi jātavedaḥ uta ārebhāṇām ṛṣṭibhiḥ yātudhānān    agne pūrvaḥ ni jahi śośucānaḥ āma adaḥ kṣviṅkāḥ tam adantu enīḥ  /
translated: Tear thou in pieces, O all-knower, those that are already seized, and with thy spears those Yātudhānas that are about to be seized. First, O Agni, slay the glowing one; let the black-spotted bitches devour the raw-eater.

original: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ saḥ agne yātudhānaḥ yaḥ idam kṛṇoti / tam ā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛ cakṣasaḥ cakṣuṣe randhaya enam /
analyzed: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ saḥ agne yātudhānaḥ yaḥ idam kṛṇoti   tam ā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛ cakṣasaḥ cakṣuṣe randhaya enam  /
translated: Here speak thou forth, O Agni, who and whence is he, the fiend who does this thing. Seize him, O thou most youthful God, with fuel: for the eye of man make thou his eye-sight blind.

original: tīkṣṇena agne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñam prāñcam vasubhyaḥ pra naya pracetaḥ / hiṃsram rakṣāṃsi abhi śośucānam mā tvā dabhan yātudhānāḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ /
analyzed: tīkṣṇena agne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñam prāñcam vasubhyaḥ pra naya pracetaḥ   hiṃsram rakṣāṃsi abhi śośucānam mā tvā dabhan yātudhānāḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ  /
translated: With keen eye, O Agni, guard the sacrifice: lead it forward to the Vasus, O thou wise one. Let not the fiends, O thou who lookest on mankind, harm thee, the fierce one, shining on the Raksases.

original: nṛ cakṣāḥ rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi prati śṛṇīhi agrā / tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca / tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca // tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca // tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca // tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā m
analyzed: nṛ cakṣāḥ rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi prati śṛṇīhi agrā    tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca   tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca     tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca                 / agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca           /
translated: Look round thee on all sides, O thou who lookest on mankind, and crush the Raksases in three places. With thy flame, O Agni, crush his ribs, and cut the Yatudhana's root in three places. With thy flame, O Agni, crush his ribs, and cut the Yatudhana's root in three places. With thy flame, O Agni, crush his ribs, and cut the Yatudhana's root in three places. With thy flame, O Agni, crush his ribs, and cut the Yatudhana's root in three places.

original: tris yātudhānaḥ prasitim te etu ṛtam yaḥ agne anṛtena hanti / tam arciṣā sphūrjayan jātavedaḥ samakṣam enam gṛṇate ni yuṅgdhi //
analyzed: tris yātudhānaḥ prasitim te etu ṛtam yaḥ agne anṛtena hanti   tam arciṣā sphūrjayan jātavedaḥ samakṣam enam gṛṇate ni yuṅgdhi  /
translated: Thrice let the Yatudhana come within thy jaws, O Agni, him who with unrighteousness assails with righteousness. Him, O thou Jâtavedas, with thy flame consume, and for the singer's sake lay thou his body bare.

original: yat agne adya mithunā śapātaḥ yat vācaḥ tṛṣṭam janayanta rebhāḥ / manyoḥ manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān /
analyzed: yat agne adya mithunā śapātaḥ yat vācaḥ tṛṣṭam janayanta rebhāḥ    manyoḥ manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān  /
translated: Whatever curse, O Agni, hath been uttered to-day, whatever angry word the singers have produced, The arrow shot from the mind and spirit is born: therewith pierce thou the Yâtudhânas to the heart.

original: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parā agne rakṣaḥ harasā śṛṇīhi / parā arciṣā mūradevān śṛṇīhi parā asutṛpaḥ śośucataḥ śṛṇīhi //
analyzed: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parā agne rakṣaḥ harasā śṛṇīhi   parā arciṣā mūradevān śṛṇīhi parā asutṛpaḥ śośucataḥ śṛṇīhi  /
translated: With heat consume thou Yâtudhânas: with flame, O Agni, burn the Râkshasas away. Burn thou the demon-worshippers with thy light up, burn thou the niggards who delight not in the rite.

original: parā adya devāḥ vṛjinam śṛṇantu pratyak enam śapathāḥ yantu sṛṣṭāḥ / vācā stenam śaravaḥ ṛchantu marman viśvasya etu prasitim yātudhānaḥ /
analyzed: parā adya devāḥ vṛjinam śṛṇantu pratyak enam śapathāḥ yantu sṛṣṭāḥ   vācā stenam śaravaḥ ṛchantu marman viśvasya etu prasitim yātudhānaḥ  /
translated: Let the Gods drive away wickedness this day: let the accursed spells return to those who sent them. Let the reproach fall back upon the slanderer: let the Yâtudhânas go to every ruin.

original: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yaḥ aśvyena paśunā yātudhānaḥ / yaḥ aghnyāyāḥ bharati kṣīram agne teṣām śīrṣāṇi harasā api vṛśca /
analyzed: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yaḥ aśvyena paśunā yātudhānaḥ    yaḥ aghnyāyāḥ bharati kṣīram agne teṣām śīrṣāṇi harasā api vṛśca  /
translated: He who is smeared with blood of human kind, he who is stained with blood of horse or beast, He who supplies the cow with milk, O Agni, crush thou their heads to pieces with thy flame.

original: viṣam gavām yātudhānāḥ bharantām ā vṛścantām aditaye durevāḥ / para eṇān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgam oṣadhīnām jayantām /🔽saṃvatsarīṇam payaḥ usriyāyāḥ tasya mā aśīt yātudhānaḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ / pīyūṣam agne yatamaḥ titṛpsāt tam pratyañcam arciṣā vidhya marmaṇi //
analyzed: viṣam gavām yātudhānāḥ bharantām ā vṛścantām aditaye durevāḥ    para eṇān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgam oṣadhīnām jayantām  / saṃvatsarīṇam payaḥ usriyāyāḥ tasya mā aśīt yātudhānaḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ   pīyūṣam agne yatamaḥ titṛpsāt tam pratyañcam arciṣā vidhya marmaṇi  /
translated: Let the Yatudhanas bear away the poison which the cows have swallowed. Let them be torn by Aditi's wolves. Let the God Savitar deliver them to the foe. Let them be vanquished, let them be deprived of their share of herbs.🔽Let not the Yatudhana, man-beholder, enjoy the milk of the cow which is a year's food. Let not the one who longs for the sweet drink, O Agni, let him be pierced by thy flame in his vitals.

original: sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ / sahamūrān anu daha kravya adaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ //
analyzed: sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ   sahamūrān anu daha kravya adaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ  /
translated: From of old, O Agni, thou slayest the Yatudhanas: the Rakshas have not conquered thee in battle. Burn them with their Mûras, O devourer of raw flesh: let not thy heavenly dart escape them.

original: tvam naḥ agne adharāt udaktaḥ tvam paścāt uta rakṣā purastāt / prati tye te ajarāsaḥ tapiṣṭhāḥ agha śaṃsam śośucataḥ dahantu /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne adharāt udaktaḥ tvam paścāt uta rakṣā purastāt    prati tye te ajarāsaḥ tapiṣṭhāḥ agha śaṃsam śośucataḥ dahantu  /
translated: From below, O Agni, from above, from behind, and from the front, protect us. Let thy most burning, undecaying flames burn the sinner who burns against us.

original: viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati sma rakṣasaḥ jahi / agne tigmena śociṣā tapuḥ agrābhiḥ arcibhiḥ /
analyzed: viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati sma rakṣasaḥ jahi   agne tigmena śociṣā tapuḥ agrābhiḥ arcibhiḥ  /
translated: With poison, O thou of unsteady glance, destroy the Rakshas. O Agni, with thy sharp flame, with thy glowing, pointed flames.

original: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ āvis viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā / pra adevīḥ māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣobhyaḥ vinikṣe /
analyzed: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ āvis viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā   pra adevīḥ māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣobhyaḥ vinikṣe  /
translated: Agni shines forth with his great light, and with his greatness makes all things manifest. He conquers the godless and evil-working illusions. He sharpens his horns to strike the Rakshas.

original: ye te śṛṅge ajare jātavedaḥ tigma hetī brahma saṃśite / tābhyām durhārdam abhidāsantam kimīdinam / pratyañcam arciṣā jātavedaḥ vi nikṣva /🔽indrāsomā tapatam rakṣaḥ ubjatam ni arpayatam vṛṣaṇā tamaḥ vṛdhaḥ / parā śṛṇītam acitaḥ ni oṣatam hatam nudethām ni śiśītam attriṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye te śṛṅge ajare jātavedaḥ tigma hetī brahma saṃśite    tābhyām durhārdam abhidāsantam kimīdinam   pratyañcam arciṣā jātavedaḥ vi nikṣva  / indrāsomā tapatam rakṣaḥ ubjatam ni arpayatam vṛṣaṇā tamaḥ vṛdhaḥ   parā śṛṇītam acitaḥ ni oṣatam hatam nudethām ni śiśītam attriṇaḥ  /
translated: With those two horns of thine, O all-knowing one, that are ever young, that have sharp points, and are sharpened by prayer, with them, O Jâtavedas, crush the wicked-hearted Kimîdin, who reviles us, who is turned towards us, with thy flame.🔽O Indra and Soma, scorch the Rakshas, crush them down, O ye mighty ones, increase the darkness. Destroy the godless, slay them, drive them away, and cool the Kimîdins who feed on raw flesh.

original: indrāsomā sam agha śaṃsam abhi agham tapuḥ yayastu caruḥ agnimān iva / brahma dviṣe kravya ade ghora cakṣase dveṣaḥ dhattam an avāyam kimīdine /
analyzed: indrāsomā sam agha śaṃsam abhi agham tapuḥ yayastu caruḥ agnimān iva    brahma dviṣe kravya ade ghora cakṣase dveṣaḥ dhattam an avāyam kimīdine  /
translated: O Indra and Soma, smite down the sinner who offends, who is more wicked than the wicked, who is like a fire of dry wood. Lay ye upon the hater of prayer, the flesh-devourer, of terrible glance, the hatred that shall never pass away.

original: indrāsomāḥ duṣkṛtaḥ vavre antar anārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam / yatas na eṣām punar ekaḥ cana udayat tat vām astu sahase manyumat śavaḥ /🔽indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ vadham sam pṛthivyāḥ agha śaṃsāya tarhaṇam / ud takṣatam svaryam parvatebhyaḥ yena rakṣaḥ vāvṛdhānam nijūrvathaḥ /
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ duṣkṛtaḥ vavre antar anārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam   yatas na eṣām punar ekaḥ cana udayat tat vām astu sahase manyumat śavaḥ  / indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ vadham sam pṛthivyāḥ agha śaṃsāya tarhaṇam    ud takṣatam svaryam parvatebhyaḥ yena rakṣaḥ vāvṛdhānam nijūrvathaḥ  /
translated: O Indra and Soma, pierce ye through the sinner, in the pit that hath no bottom, in the darkness. Let not one of them rise up again from thence. Let that be your strength, your wrath for victory.🔽O Indra and Soma, hurl ye down the weapon of heaven, the thunderbolt from earth against the wicked. Raise ye the light from out the mountains, wherewith ye drive away the Raksas that hath waxed in strength.

original: indrāsomāḥ vartayatam divaḥ pari agni taptebhiḥ yuvam aśma hanmabhiḥ / tapuḥ vadhebhiḥ ajarebhiḥ attriṇaḥ ni parśāne vidhyatam yantu nisvaram /
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ vartayatam divaḥ pari agni taptebhiḥ yuvam aśma hanmabhiḥ   tapuḥ vadhebhiḥ ajarebhiḥ attriṇaḥ ni parśāne vidhyatam yantu nisvaram  /
translated: O Indra and Soma, roll ye down from heaven the weapon, ye with stones heated in the fire, with burning darts, with knives that never grow old, that eat not up their substance. Pierce them through to the very bone. Let them go forth with a whimper.

original: indrāsomā pari vām bhūtu viśvatas iyam matiḥ kakṣyā aśvā iva vājinā / yām vām hotrām parihinomi medhayā imā brahmāṇi nṛpatī iva jinvatam /
analyzed: indrāsomā pari vām bhūtu viśvatas iyam matiḥ kakṣyā aśvā iva vājinā   yām vām hotrām parihinomi medhayā imā brahmāṇi nṛpatī iva jinvatam  /
translated: O Indra and Soma, let this thought of ours, like a chariot-horse, go round about you both, from heaven and earth, the thought which I offer you with reverence. Exhilarate these prayers of mine as princes.

original: prati smarethām tujayadbhiḥ evaiḥ hatam druhaḥ rakṣasaḥ bhaṅgurāvataḥ / indrāsomāḥ duṣkṛte mā sugam bhūt yaḥ mā kadā cit abhidāsati druhuḥ /🔽yaḥ mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhiḥ vacobhiḥ / āpaḥ iva kāśinā samgṛbhītāḥ asan astu asataḥ indra vaktā /
analyzed: prati smarethām tujayadbhiḥ evaiḥ hatam druhaḥ rakṣasaḥ bhaṅgurāvataḥ    indrāsomāḥ duṣkṛte mā sugam bhūt yaḥ mā kadā cit abhidāsati druhuḥ  / yaḥ mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhiḥ vacobhiḥ   āpaḥ iva kāśinā samgṛbhītāḥ asan astu asataḥ indra vaktā  /
translated: Remember ye, with those who conquer, Indra and Soma, the slain, the broken, the treacherous Rakshas. Easy of access be the wicked man to me, O Indra and Soma, who ever injures me.🔽He who with evil thought and wicked words reviles me as I go my way, may he, O Indra, be as one who hath no helper, as one who hath no tongue.

original: ye pāka śaṃsam viharante evaiḥ ye vā bhadram dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ / ahaye vā tān pradadātu somaḥ ā vā dadhātu nirṛteḥ upaṣṭhe //
analyzed: ye pāka śaṃsam viharante evaiḥ ye vā bhadram dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ   ahaye vā tān pradadātu somaḥ ā vā dadhātu nirṛteḥ upaṣṭhe  /
translated: Those who with evil thoughts destroy the sacrifice, or with their nature's poison defile the good, to the Āditya, to the Marut, to the Brahman, to the God Savitar, to the God Varuṇa, to the God Agni, to the God Indra, to the God Brihaspati, to the God Pūṣan, to the God Tvaṣṭar, to the God Vāyu, to the God Viṣṇu, to the God Parjanya, to the God Mitra, to the God Aryaman, to the God Bhaga, to the God Sarasvatī, to the God Sarasvat, to the God Pūṣan, to the God Varuṇa, to the God Dhātar, to the God Indra, to the God Indra-Agni, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu, to the God Indra-Varuṇa, to the God Indra-Soma, to the God Indra-Parjanya, to the God Indra-Brhaspati, to the God Indra-Tvaṣṭar, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa-Soma, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa-Soma-Brhaspati, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa-Soma-Brhaspati-Tvaṣṭar, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa-Soma-Brhaspati-Tvaṣṭar-Pūṣan, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa-Soma-Brhaspati-Tvaṣṭar-Pūṣan-Aryaman, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa-Soma-Brhaspati-Tvaṣṭar-Pūṣan-Aryaman-Bhaga, to the God Indra-Viṣṇu-Varuṇa-Soma-Br

original: na vai u somaḥ vṛjinam hinoti na kṣatriyam mithuyā dhārayantam / hanti rakṣaḥ hanti āsat vadantam ubhau indrasya prasitau śayāte /
analyzed: na vai u somaḥ vṛjinam hinoti na kṣatriyam mithuyā dhārayantam   hanti rakṣaḥ hanti āsat vadantam ubhau indrasya prasitau śayāte  /
translated: The Soma injures not the man who practises deceit, nor the Kshatriya who upholds the truth. He slays the Rakshas, he slays the man who speaks untruth: both lie entangled in the snare of Indra.

original: yadi vā aham anṛta devaḥ asmi mogham vā devām apyūhe agne / kim asmabhyam jātavedaḥ hṛṇīṣe drogha vācaḥ te nirṛtham sacantām /
analyzed: yadi vā aham anṛta devaḥ asmi mogham vā devām apyūhe agne   kim asmabhyam jātavedaḥ hṛṇīṣe drogha vācaḥ te nirṛtham sacantām  /
translated: If I am one who worships false gods, O Agni, or if I have in vain invoked the Gods, why art thou angry with us, O thou all-knower? Let the false words of thee the treacherous bring thee misfortune.

original: adyā murīya yadi yātudhānaḥ asmi yadi vāyuḥ tatapa puruṣasya / adhā sa vīraiḥ daśabhiḥ vi yūyāḥ yaḥ mā mogham yātudhāna iti āha /
analyzed: adyā murīya yadi yātudhānaḥ asmi yadi vāyuḥ tatapa puruṣasya    adhā sa vīraiḥ daśabhiḥ vi yūyāḥ yaḥ mā mogham yātudhāna iti āha  /
translated: If I am a Yatudhana to-day, or if I have scorched a man in anger, then be thou separated from thy ten sons, who hast called me a false Yatudhana.

original: yaḥ mā ayātum yātudhāna iti āha yaḥ vā rakṣāḥ śiciḥ asmi iti āha / indraḥ tam hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantoḥ adhamaḥ padīṣṭa /
analyzed: yaḥ mā ayātum yātudhāna iti āha yaḥ vā rakṣāḥ śiciḥ asmi iti āha    indraḥ tam hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantoḥ adhamaḥ padīṣṭa  /
translated: He who hath called me a Yatudhana though I am no Yatudhana, or who hath called me a Rakshas though I am no Rakshas, let Indra slay him with a mighty weapon: let him be the lowest of all living things.

original: pra yā jigāti khargalā iva naktam apa druhuḥ tanvam gūhamānā / vavram anantam ava sā padīṣṭia grāvāṇaḥ ghnantu rakṣasaḥ upabdaiḥ /
analyzed: pra yā jigāti khargalā iva naktam apa druhuḥ tanvam gūhamānā   vavram anantam ava sā padīṣṭia grāvāṇaḥ ghnantu rakṣasaḥ upabdaiḥ  /
translated: She who goeth forth like a she-ass at night, concealing her body, the wicked one, let her go to her endless prison. Let the pressing-stones with their noise slay the Rakshas.

original: vi tiṣṭhadhvam marutaḥ vikṣu ichata gṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ sam pinaṣṭan / vayaḥ ye bhūtvā patayanti naktabhiḥ ye vā ripaḥ dadhire deve adhvare /🔽pra vartaya divaḥ aśmānam indra soma śitam maghavan sam śiśādhi / prāktaḥ apāktaḥ adharāt udaktaḥ abhi jahi rakṣasaḥ parvatena /
analyzed: vi tiṣṭhadhvam marutaḥ vikṣu ichata gṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ sam pinaṣṭan   vayaḥ ye bhūtvā patayanti naktabhiḥ ye vā ripaḥ dadhire deve adhvare  / pra vartaya divaḥ aśmānam indra soma śitam maghavan sam śiśādhi    prāktas apāktas adharāt udaktas abhi jahi rakṣasaḥ parvatena  /
translated: Those who, becoming birds, fly through the night, or who have made themselves our foes in the God's worship,🔽Turn thou the stone of heaven, O Indra, whetted with Soma, O Maghavan, sharpen it well. From east and west, from north and south, smite down the Rākshasas with the stone.

original: ete u tye patayanti śva yātavaḥ indram dipsanti dipsavaḥ adābhyam / śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ // śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ // śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ // śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ // śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ // śiśīte śakr
analyzed: ete u tye patayanti śva yātavaḥ indram dipsanti dipsavaḥ adābhyam    śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ    śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ   / śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ  / śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ  / śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nunam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ  / śiśīte śakraḥ
translated: These, verily, are flying, the swift-coursing ones, the spiteful ones, the spiteful ones, are seeking to injure the unassailable Indra. Śakra sharpens the weapon for the spiteful ones. Now let him hurl the thunderbolt at the demons.

original: indraḥ yātūnām abhavat parāśaraḥ havirmathīnām abhi āvivāsatām / abhi id u śakraḥ paraśuḥ yathā vanam pātrā iva bhindan sataḥ etu rakṣasaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ yātūnām abhavat parāśaraḥ havirmathīnām abhi āvivāsatām    abhi id u śakraḥ paraśuḥ yathā vanam pātrā iva bhindan sataḥ etu rakṣasaḥ  /
translated: Indra hath been the foeman of the Yātudhānas, the destroyer of the Yātudhānas who would fain devour us. As a wood with an axe, so may Śakra cleave the Rākshasas as they sit, as they sit.

original: ulūka yātum śuśulūka yātum jahi śva yātum uta koka yātum / suparṇa yātum uta gṛdhra yātum dṛṣadā iva pra mṛṇa rakṣaḥ indra /
analyzed: ulūka yātum śuśulūka yātum jahi śva yātum uta koka yātum    suparṇa yātum uta gṛdhra yātum dṛṣadā iva pra mṛṇa rakṣaḥ indra
translated: Kill the owl-Yātudhāna, kill the bat-Yātudhāna, kill the dog-Yātudhāna, kill the crow-Yātudhāna, kill the bird-Yātudhāna, kill the vulture-Yātudhāna. Crush the Rākshasas as with a stone, O Indra.

original: mā naḥ rakṣaḥ abhi naṭ yātumāvat apocchantu mithunāḥ ye kimīdinaḥ / pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātu aṃhasaḥ antarikṣam divyāt pātu asmān /🔽indra jahi pumāṃsam yātudhānam uta striyam māyayā śāśadānām / vigrīvāsaḥ mūradevāḥ ṛdantu mā te dṛśan sūryam uccarantam /
analyzed: mā naḥ rakṣaḥ abhi naṭ yātumāvat apocchantu mithunāḥ ye kimīdinaḥ    pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātu aṃhasaḥ antarikṣam divyāt pātu asmān  /🔽indra jahi pumāṃsam yātudhānam uta striyam māyayā śāśadānām    vigrīvāsaḥ mūradevāḥ ṛdantu mā te dṛśan sūryam uccarantam  /
translated: Let not the Rākshasa, the Yātudhāna, overcome us. Let the pairs of Kimīdins be destroyed. Let the earth protect us from the earthly woe, let the sky protect us from the heavenly woe.

original: prati cakṣva vi cakṣva indraḥ ca soma jāgṛtam / rakṣobhyaḥ vadham asyatam aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ // // / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /🔽ayam pratisaraḥ maṇiḥ vīraḥ vīrāya badhyate / vīryavān sapatna hā śūra vīraḥ paripāṇaḥ su maṅgalaḥ /
analyzed: prati cakṣva vi cakṣva indraḥ ca soma jāgṛtam     rakṣobhyaḥ vadham asyatam aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ  ayam pratisaraḥ maṇiḥ vīraḥ vīrāya badhyate   vīryavān sapatna hā śūra vīraḥ paripāṇaḥ su maṅgalaḥ  /
translated: Look forth and look around. Be watchful, Indra and Soma. Shoot the dart at the Raksases, the bolt at the sorcerers.🔽This is the string of the Amulet, the hero bound for the hero. Full of vigour, slaying foes, a hero, a hero's guard, auspicious,

original: ayam maṇiḥ sapatna hā su vīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaḥ ugraḥ / pratyak kṛtyā dūṣayan eti vīraḥ /
analyzed: ayam maṇiḥ sapatna hā su vīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaḥ ugraḥ   pratyak kṛtyā dūṣayan eti vīraḥ  /
translated: This Amulet, slaying foes, full of heroes, strong, mighty, conquering, terrible,

original: anena indraḥ maṇinā vṛtram ahan anena asurān parābhāvayat manīṣī / anena ajayat dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime anena ajayat pradiśaḥ catasraḥ /
analyzed: anena indraḥ maṇinā vṛtram ahan anena asurān parābhāvayat manīṣī   anena ajayat dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime anena ajayat pradiśaḥ catasraḥ  /
translated: With this Amulet Indra slew Vr̥itra, with this the wise one overcame the Asuras. With this he conquered both the heavens and earth, with this he won the four-and-forty regions.

original: ayam srāktyaḥ maṇiḥ pratīvartaḥ pratisaraḥ / ojasvān vimṛdhaḥ vaśī saḥ asmān pātu sarvatas /
analyzed: ayam srāktyaḥ maṇiḥ pratīvartaḥ pratisaraḥ    ojasvān vimṛdhaḥ vaśī saḥ asmān pātu sarvatas  /
translated: This is the Amulet of the Sraktya, the counteracting, the returning Amulet. Full of vigour, unconquered, ruling, may it guard us on every side.

original: tat agniḥ āha tat u somaḥ āha bṛhaspatiḥ savitā tat indraḥ / te me devāḥ purohitāḥ pratīcīḥ kṛtyāḥ pratisaraiḥ ajantu //
analyzed: tat agniḥ āha tat u somaḥ āha bṛhaspatiḥ savitā tat indraḥ   te me devāḥ purohitāḥ pratīcīḥ kṛtyāḥ pratisaraiḥ ajantu  /
translated: Agni hath said it, Soma hath said it, Br̥ihaspati, Savitar, Indra have said it. May the Gods, my fore-sacrificers, with their spells drive back the witchcraft that is aimed at me.

original: antar dadhe dyāvāpṛthivī uta ahar uta sūryam / te me devāḥ purohitāḥ pratīcīḥ kṛtyāḥ pratisaraiḥ ajantu //
analyzed: antar dadhe dyāvāpṛthivī uta ahar uta sūryam   te me devāḥ purohitāḥ pratīcīḥ kṛtyāḥ pratisaraiḥ ajantu  /
translated: I have concealed the heaven and earth and day and also the sun. May the Gods, my fore-sacrificers, with their spells drive back the witchcraft that is aimed at me.🔽The people who make for themselves the amulet of the Sraktya,

original: ye srāktyam maṇim janāḥ varmāṇi kṛṇvate / sūryaḥ iva divam āruhya vi kṛtyā bādhate vaśī /
analyzed: ye srāktyam maṇim janāḥ varmāṇi kṛṇvate   sūryaḥ iva divam āruhya vi kṛtyā bādhate vaśī  /
translated: Ascend the heaven as the sun, and the powerful one repels the witchcraft.🔽With the amulet of the Sraktya, with the wise one as with a sage,

original: srāktyena maṇinā ṛṣiṇā iva manīṣiṇā / ajaiṣam sarvāḥ pṛtanāḥ vi mṛdhaḥ hanmi rakṣasaḥ /
analyzed: srāktyena maṇinā ṛṣiṇā iva manīṣiṇā    ajaiṣam sarvāḥ pṛtanāḥ vi mṛdhaḥ hanmi rakṣasaḥ  /
translated: I have conquered all the battles, I have slain the Raksases.🔽The witchcraft of the Angirases, the witchcraft of the Asuras,🔽The witchcraft that is self-made, and that which others bring against us,

original: yāḥ kṛtyāḥ āṅgirasīḥ yāḥ kṛtyāḥ āsurīḥ yāḥ / kṛtyāḥ svayaṃkṛtāḥ yāḥ u ca anyebhiḥ ābhṛtāḥ / ubhayīḥ tāḥ parā yantu parāvataḥ navatim nāvyāḥ ati /
analyzed: yāḥ kṛtyāḥ āṅgirasīḥ yāḥ kṛtyāḥ āsurīḥ yāḥ   kṛtyāḥ svayaṃkṛtāḥ yāḥ u ca anyebhiḥ ābhṛtāḥ   ubhayīḥ tāḥ parā yantu parāvataḥ navatim nāvyāḥ ati  /
translated: May all these go away to the farthest distance, to the ninety-nine navies.🔽Let the Gods fasten on him the amulet, the armour, Indra, Vishnu, Savitar, Rudra, Agni,

original: asmai maṇim varma badhnantu devāḥ indraḥ viṣṇuḥ savitā rudraḥ agniḥ / prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī virāj vaiśvānaraḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca sarve / / / /
analyzed: asmai maṇim varma badhnantu devāḥ indraḥ viṣṇuḥ savitā rudraḥ agniḥ prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī virāj vaiśvānaraḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca sarve
translated: Prajapati, Parameshthin, Virāj, Vaisvānara, and all the Rishis.

original: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām anaḍvān jagatām iva vyāghraḥ śvapadām iva / yam aichāma avidāma tam pratispāśanam antitam /
analyzed: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām anaḍvān jagatām iva vyāghraḥ śvapadām iva   yam aichāma avidāma tam pratispāśanam antitam  /
translated: Best art thou of the plants, as the ox is the best of those that move in herds, as the tiger is the best of those that walk on four feet. We have found him whom we sought, the nearest foe to drive away.

original: saḥ id vyāghraḥ bhavati atha u siṃhaḥ atha u vṛṣā / atha u sapatna karśanaḥ yaḥ bibharti imam maṇim //
analyzed: saḥ id vyāghraḥ bhavati atha u siṃhaḥ atha u vṛṣā   atha u sapatna karśanaḥ yaḥ bibharti imam maṇim
translated: He becomes a tiger, then a lion, then a bull, then a scorner of his foes, he who bears this Amulet.

original: na enam ghnanti apsarasaḥ na gandharvāḥ na martyāḥ / sarvāḥ diśaḥ vi rājati yaḥ bibharti imam maṇim //
analyzed: na enam ghnanti apsarasaḥ na gandharvāḥ na martyāḥ    sarvāḥ diśaḥ vi rājati yaḥ bibharti imam maṇim  /
translated: Neither Apsarases, nor Gandharvas, nor men slay him. He shines forth over all the regions who bears this Amulet.

original: kaśyapaḥ tvām asṛjata kaśyapaḥ tvā sam airayat / abibhar tvā indraḥ mānuṣe bibhrat saṃśreṣiṇe ajayat / maṇim sahasra vīryam varma devāḥ akṛṇvata /
analyzed: kaśyapaḥ tvām asṛjata kaśyapaḥ tvā sam airayat    abibhar tvā indraḥ mānuṣe bibhrat saṃśreṣiṇe ajayat   maṇim sahasra vīryam varma devāḥ akṛṇvata  /
translated: Kaśyapa created thee, Kaśyapa set thee in motion. Indra bore thee, bearing thee to the man who should be joined to thee. The Gods made the Amulet of a thousand powers a coat of mail.

original: yaḥ tvā kṛtyābhiḥ yaḥ tvā dīkṣābhiḥ yajñaiḥ yaḥ tvā jighāṃsati / pratyak tvam indra tam jahi vajreṇa śata parvaṇā /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā kṛtyābhiḥ yaḥ tvā dīkṣābhiḥ yajñaiḥ yaḥ tvā jighāṃsati    pratyak tvam indra tam jahi vajreṇa śata parvaṇā  /
translated: He who would slay thee with curses, with consecrations, with sacrifices, Indra, with thy hundred-knotted thunderbolt drive him away from thee.

original: ayam id vai pratīvartaḥ ojasvān saṃjayaḥ maṇiḥ / prajām dhanam ca rakṣatu paripāṇaḥ su maṅgalaḥ /
analyzed: ayam id vai pratīvartaḥ ojasvān saṃjayaḥ maṇiḥ   prajām dhanam ca rakṣatu paripāṇaḥ su maṅgalaḥ  /
translated: This Amulet, the powerful, the victorious, the averter, the protector, the auspicious, let it guard my offspring and my wealth.

original: asapatnam naḥ adharāt asapatnam naḥ uttarāt / indra asapatnam naḥ paścāt jyotiḥ śūra puras kṛdhi //
analyzed: asapatnam naḥ adharāt asapatnam naḥ uttarāt   indra asapatnam naḥ paścāt jyotiḥ śūra puras kṛdhi  /
translated: No foe to us from downward, no foe to us from upward, no foe to us from westward, O Indra, the hero, grant us light from eastward.

original: varma me dyāvāpṛthivī varma ahar varma sūryaḥ / varma me indraḥ ca agniḥ ca varma dhātā dadhātu me /
analyzed: varma me dyāvāpṛthivī varma ahar varma sūryaḥ   varma me indraḥ ca agniḥ ca varma dhātā dadhātu me  /
translated: Heaven and Earth be my armour, the day be my armour, the sun be my armour. Indra and Agni be my armour. May the Creator give me the armour.

original: aindrāgnam varma bahulam yat ugram viśve devāḥ na atividhyanti sarve / tat me tanvam trāyatām sarvatas bṛhat āyuṣmān jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asāni //
analyzed: aindrāgnam varma bahulam yat ugram viśve devāḥ na atividhyanti sarve   tat me tanvam trāyatām sarvatas bṛhat āyuṣmān jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asāni  /
translated: The many-formed, strong armour of Indra and Agni, which all the Gods cannot pierce, may that armour protect my body on every side. May I be long-lived, with old age that comes in time.

original: ā mārukṣat deva maṇiḥ mahyāḥ ariṣṭatātaye / imam methim abhisaṃviśadhvam tanūpānam tri varūtham ojase /
analyzed: ā mārukṣat deva maṇiḥ mahyāḥ ariṣṭatātaye    imam methim abhisaṃviśadhvam tanūpānam tri varūtham ojase  /
translated: The divine gem has been fastened on me for the sake of great security from harm. Sit ye all upon this altar, ye three-fold, for protection of my body, for strength.

original: asmin indraḥ ni dadhātu nṛmṇam imam devāsaḥ abhisaṃviśadhvam / dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya āyuṣmān jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asat /
analyzed: asmin indraḥ ni dadhātu nṛmṇam imam devāsaḥ abhisaṃviśadhvam   dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya āyuṣmān jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asat  /
translated: Here let Indra bestow strength. Sit ye all upon this altar, O ye Gods, for the sake of long life, of a hundred autumns. May I be long-lived, with old age that comes in time.

original: svasti dāḥ viśām patiḥ vṛtra hā vimṛdhaḥ vaśī / indraḥ badhnātu te maṇim jigīvām aparājitaḥ / soma pāḥ abhayaṅkaraḥ vṛṣā / yau te mātā unmamārja jātāyāḥ pati vedanau / durṇāmā tatra mā gṛdhat aliṃśaḥ uta vatsapaḥ /
analyzed: svasti dāḥ viśām patiḥ vṛtra hā vimṛdhaḥ vaśī    indraḥ badhnātu te maṇim jigīvām aparājitaḥ   soma pāḥ abhayaṅkaraḥ vṛṣā   yau te mātā unmamārja jātāyāḥ pati vedanau   durṇāmā tatra mā gṛdhat aliṃśaḥ uta vatsapaḥ  /
translated: there let the ill-named one not seize you, nor the one with a tail, nor the calf-sucker.🔽Palala and Anupalala, Sharku, Kokam, Malimluca, Palijaka,

original: palāla anupalālau śarkum kokam malimlucam palījakam / āśreṣam vavrivāsasam ṛkṣagrīvam pramīlinam /
analyzed: palāla anupalālau śarkum kokam malimlucam palījakam    āśreṣam vavrivāsasam ṛkṣagrīvam pramīlinam
translated: Ashresa, Vavrīvasa, Rkṣagrīva, Pramīlina.🔽Do not surround, do not creep up, do not creep between the thighs.

original: mā sam vṛtaḥ mā upa sṛpaḥ ūrū mā ava sṛpaḥ antarā / kṛṇomi asyai bheṣajam bajam durṇāma cātanam /🔽durṇāmā ca sunāmā ca ubhā samvṛtam ichataḥ / arāyān apa hanmaḥ sunāmā straiṇam ichatām /
analyzed: mā sam vṛtaḥ mā upa sṛpaḥ ūrū mā ava sṛpaḥ antarā   kṛṇomi asyai bheṣajam bajam durṇāma cātanam  / durṇāmā ca sunāmā ca ubhā samvṛtam ichataḥ    arāyān apa hanmaḥ sunāmā straiṇam ichatām  /
translated: I make for her this remedy, the spell that drives away the ill-named one.🔽The ill-named and the well-named both seek to embrace her.🔽We drive away the Rākṣasas, let the well-named one seek the female.🔽The black-haired one, the one with a mane, the Asura, the one born from a stump, and the one with a goiter,

original: yaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ keśī asura stamba jaḥ uta tuṇḍikaḥ / arāyān asyāḥ muṣkābhyām bhaṃsasaḥ apa hanmasi //
analyzed: yaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ keśī asura stamba jaḥ uta tuṇḍikaḥ    arāyān asyāḥ muṣkābhyām bhaṃsasaḥ apa hanmasi  /
translated: we drive away from her groins, from her womb, the Rākṣasas.🔽The one who sniffs, the one who licks, the one who eats raw flesh, and the one who kisses,

original: anujighram pramṛśantam kravya adam uta reriham / arāyām śvakiṣkiṇaḥ bajaḥ piṅgaḥ anīnaśat /
analyzed: anujighram pramṛśantam kravya adam uta reriham    arāyām śvakiṣkiṇaḥ bajaḥ piṅgaḥ anīnaśat  /
translated: the Rākṣasa with a dog's bark, the tawny spell has destroyed.

original: yaḥ tvā svapne nipadyate bhrātā bhūtvā pitā iva ca / bajaḥ tān sahatām itas klība rūpān tirīṭinaḥ /🔽yaḥ tvā svapantīm tsarati yaḥ tvā dipsati jāgratīm / chāyām iva pra tān sūryaḥ parikrāman anīnaśat /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā svapne nipadyate bhrātā bhūtvā pitā iva ca  / bajaḥ tān sahatām itas klība rūpān tirīṭinaḥ  / yaḥ tvā svapantīm tsarati yaḥ tvā dipsati jāgratīm    chāyām iva pra tān sūryaḥ parikrāman anīnaśat  /
translated: The spell shall drive them hence, the impotent, the shamed, who, in the form of brother or of father, lies with thee in sleep.🔽The Sun, as he goes round, hath wasted those who seek to violate thee sleeping or awake, as 'twere a shadow.

original: yaḥ kṛṇoti mṛta vatsām avatokām imām striyam / tam oṣadhe tvam nāśaya asyāḥ kamalam añjivam /
analyzed: yaḥ kṛṇoti mṛta vatsām avatokām imām striyam   tam oṣadhe tvam nāśaya asyāḥ kamalam añjivam  /
translated: The man who makes this woman childless, or bereft of living children, him, O Plant, destroy, and let her have a son to deck her lap.

original: ye śālāḥ parinṛtyanti sāyam gardabha nādinaḥ / kusūlāḥ ye ca kukṣilāḥ kakubhāḥ karumāḥ srimāḥ / tān oṣadhe tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya // // tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya // // tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya // // tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya // // tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya // // tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya // // tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya // // tvam gandhena viṣūcīnā
analyzed: ye śālāḥ parinṛtyanti sāyam gardabha nādinaḥ   kusūlāḥ ye ca kukṣilāḥ kakubhāḥ karumāḥ srimāḥ   tān oṣadhe tvam gandhena viṣūcīnān vi nāśaya
translated: The bags of grain, the bags of meal, the bags of chaff, the bags of straw, the bags of grain, the bags of meal, the bags of chaff, the bags of straw,🔽Drive them away, O Plant, with thy smell, drive them away with thy smell.🔽Those that are called Kukundhas, Kukirabhas, that bear Krittis and Dursas,

original: ye ku kundhāḥ ku kirabhāḥ kṛttīḥ dūrśāni bibhrati / klībāḥ iva pranṛtyantaḥ vane ye kurvate ghoṣam tān itas nāśayāmasi //
analyzed: ye ku kundhāḥ ku kirabhāḥ kṛttīḥ dūrśāni bibhrati   klībāḥ iva pranṛtyantaḥ vane ye kurvate ghoṣam tān itas nāśayāmasi  /
translated: That dance like eunuchs and make a noise in the forest, we drive them away from here.🔽Those that cannot endure the sun when it shines from yonder heaven,

original: ye sūryam na titikṣante ātapantam amum divaḥ / arāyān basta vāsinaḥ durgandhīn lohita āsyān makakān nāśayāmasi //
analyzed: ye sūryam na titikṣante ātapantam amum divaḥ   / arāyān basta vāsinaḥ durgandhīn lohita āsyān makakān nāśayāmasi  /
translated: The Rakshasas, the goat-clad, the stinking, the red-mouthed monkeys, we drive them away.

original: yaḥ ātmānam atimātram aṃse ādhāya bibhrati / strīṇām śroṇi pratodinaḥ indra rakṣāṃsi nāśaya //
analyzed: yaḥ ātmānam atimātram aṃse ādhāya bibhrati    strīṇām śroṇi pratodinaḥ indra rakṣāṃsi nāśaya  /
translated: The hip-goaders of women, O Indra, destroy the Rakshasas.🔽Those who go in front with their arms, bearing horns in their hands,

original: ye pūrve badhvaḥ yanti haste śṛṅgāni bibhrataḥ / āpākesthāḥ prahāsinaḥ stambe ye kurvate jyotiḥ tān itas nāśayāmasi //
analyzed: ye pūrve badhvaḥ yanti haste śṛṅgāni bibhrataḥ   āpākesthāḥ prahāsinaḥ stambe ye kurvate jyotiḥ tān itas nāśayāmasi  /
translated: Who dwell in the oven, laughing, who make a light in the stump, we drive them away from here.🔽Those whose steps are behind, whose heels are in front, whose faces are in front,🔽The Khala-born, the Shakhadhuma-born, the Urunda, and those who are Matmata, the pot-testicles, the slow-moving ones,

original: yeṣām paścāt prapadāni puras pārṣṇīḥ puras mukhā / khala jāḥ śakadhūma jāḥ uruṇḍāḥ ye ca maṭmaṭāḥ kumbha muṣkāḥ ayāśavaḥ / tān asyāḥ brahmaṇas pate pratībodhena nāśaya //
analyzed: yeṣām paścāt prapadāni puras pārṣṇīḥ puras mukhā   khala jāḥ śakadhūma jāḥ uruṇḍāḥ ye ca maṭmaṭāḥ kumbha muṣkāḥ ayāśavaḥ   tān asyāḥ brahmaṇas pate pratībodhena nāśaya  /
translated: Those, O Brahmanaspati, with the counter-knowledge, destroy.🔽Those with rolling eyes, those who are not auspicious, those who are without reins, let them be lame.

original: paryasta akṣāḥ a pracaṅkaśāḥ astraiṇāḥ santu paṇḍagāḥ / ava bheṣaja pādaya yaḥ imām saṃvivṛtsati a patiḥ sva patim striyam /
analyzed: paryasta akṣāḥ a pracaṅkaśāḥ astraiṇāḥ santu paṇḍagāḥ   ava bheṣaja pādaya yaḥ imām saṃvivṛtsati a patiḥ sva patim striyam  /
translated: O medicine, bring down the one who desires to unite this woman who has a husband with one who is not her husband.🔽The one who makes the hair stand on end, who makes one tremble, who makes one shudder,🔽The one who approaches, the Udumbara, the Tundela, and the Shaluda,

original: uddharṣiṇam muni keśam jambhayantam marīmṛśam / upeṣantam udumbalam tuṇḍelam uta śāluḍam / padā pra vidhya pārṣṇyā sthālīm gauḥ iva spandanā /
analyzed: uddharṣiṇam muni keśam jambhayantam marīmṛśam   upeṣantam udumbalam tuṇḍelam uta śāluḍam   padā pra vidhya pārṣṇyā sthālīm gauḥ iva spandanā  /
translated: With the heel pierce with the foot the pot, as a cow shakes a pot.

original: yaḥ te garbham pratimṛśāt jātam vā mārayāti te / piṅgaḥ tam ugra dhanvā kṛṇotu hṛdayāvidham /
analyzed: yaḥ te garbham pratimṛśāt jātam vā mārayāti te   piṅgaḥ tam ugra dhanvā kṛṇotu hṛdayāvidham  /
translated: The tawny archer, fierce of bow, shall make him strike his heart, who shall attack thy babe, or slay it when it is born.

original: ye amnaḥ jatān mārayanti sūtikāḥ anuśerate / strī bhāgān piṅgaḥ gandharvān vātaḥ abhram iva ajatu //
analyzed: ye amnaḥ jatān mārayanti sūtikāḥ anuśerate    strī bhāgān piṅgaḥ gandharvān vātaḥ abhram iva ajatu  /
translated: The tawny Gandharva, the winds shall drive away the women who, after the birth of babes, destroy them, and who lie down beside the lying-in chamber.🔽Let him bear off what is appointed for him. Let him not fall a prey to thee. Let the two fierce medicines, the two that are to be worn as amulets, protect thy babe.🔽Let the two fierce medicines, the two that are to be worn as amulets, protect thy babe.🔽Let the two fierce medicines, the two that are to be worn as amulets, protect thy babe.

original: parisṛṣṭam dharayatu yat dhitam mā ava pādi tat / garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau nīvi bhāryau // garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau nīvi bhāryau // garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau nīvi bhāryau // garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau nīvi bhāryau // garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau nīvi bhāryau // garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau nīvi bhāryau // garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau nīvi bhāryau // garbham te ugrau rakṣatām bheṣajau
analyzed: parisṛṣṭam dharayatu yat dhitam mā ava pādi tat
translated: Let the two fierce medicines, the two that are to be worn as amulets, protect thy babe.

original: pavīnasāt taṅgalvāt chāyakāt uta nagnakāt / prajāyai patye tvā piṅgaḥ pari pātu kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: pavīnasāt taṅgalvāt chāyakāt uta nagnakāt     prajāyai patye tvā piṅgaḥ pari pātu kimīdinaḥ  /
translated: from the husband of the woman who bears a child, may the tawny-coloured Kimīdin demon protect thee.🔽From the two-mouthed, four-eyed, five-footed, fingerless,

original: dvi āsyāt catur akṣāt pañca padāt anaṅgureḥ / vṛntāt abhi prasarpataḥ pari pāhi varīvṛtāt /
analyzed: dvi āsyāt catur akṣāt pañca padāt anaṅgureḥ    vṛntāt abhi prasarpataḥ pari pāhi varīvṛtāt  /
translated: from the one who creeps from the stalk, from the one who creeps around, protect him from the one who creeps about.🔽Those who eat raw flesh, and those who eat the flesh of men,

original: ye āmam māṃsam adanti pauruṣeyam ca ye kraviḥ / garbhān khādanti keśavāḥ tān itas nāśayāmasi //
analyzed: ye āmam māṃsam adanti pauruṣeyam ca ye kraviḥ   garbhān khādanti keśavāḥ tān itas nāśayāmasi  /
translated: those who eat the embryos, those who eat the hair, we drive them away from here.🔽Those who creep from the sun, as a daughter-in-law from her father-in-law,

original: ye sūryāt parisarpanti snuṣā iva śvaśurāt adhi / bajaḥ ca teṣām piṅgaḥ ca hṛdaye adhi ni vidhyatām /
analyzed: ye sūryāt parisarpanti snuṣā iva śvaśurāt adhi  / bajaḥ ca teṣām piṅgaḥ ca hṛdaye adhi ni vidhyatām  /
translated: may the thunderbolt and the tawny one pierce their hearts.

original: piṅga rakṣa jāyamānam mā pumāṃsam striyam kran / āṇḍa ādaḥ garbhāt mā dabhan bādhasva itas kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: piṅga rakṣa jāyamānam mā pumāṃsam striyam kran   āṇḍa ādaḥ garbhāt mā dabhan bādhasva itas kimīdinaḥ  /
translated: O tawny one, protect the child as it is born, do not make it a woman. Do not harm the embryo in the womb. Drive away the Kimīdin demons from here.

original: aprajāstvam mārtavatsam āt rodam agham āvayam / vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat // vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat // vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat // vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat // vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat // vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat // vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat // vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye
analyzed: aprajāstvam mārtavatsam āt rodam agham āvayam  / vṛkṣāt iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat        iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat       iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat       iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat        iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat          iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat          iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat         iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati muñca tat         iva srajam kṛtvā apriye prati m
translated: As a garland made of flowers from a tree, so I bind up the sin of childlessness, the grief of widowhood, and send it forth against the one who hates us.

original: yāḥ babhravaḥ yāḥ ca śukrāḥ rohiṇīḥ uta pṛśnayaḥ / asiknīḥ kṛṣṇāḥ oṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ achāvadāmasi //
analyzed: yāḥ babhravaḥ yāḥ ca śukrāḥ rohiṇīḥ uta pṛśnayaḥ   asiknīḥ kṛṣṇāḥ oṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ achāvadāmasi  /
translated: The tawny, the white, the red, the spotted, the ashen, the black plants, all of them we summon hither.

original: trāyantām imam purusam yakṣmāt deva iṣitāt adhi / yāsām dyauḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā samudraḥ mūlam vīrudhām babhūva /
analyzed: trāyantām imam purusam yakṣmāt deva iṣitāt adhi    yāsām dyauḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā samudraḥ mūlam vīrudhām babhūva  /
translated: Let these plants deliver this man from consumption sent by the gods. Whose father is the sky, whose mother is the earth, whose root is the ocean, are the plants.

original: āpaḥ agram divyāḥ oṣadhayaḥ / tāḥ te yakṣmam enasyam aṅgāt aṅgāt anīnaśan /
analyzed: āpaḥ agram divyāḥ oṣadhayaḥ   tāḥ te yakṣmam enasyam aṅgāt aṅgāt anīnaśan  /
translated: The waters are the first, the heavenly plants. They have removed thy malady, thy sin, from every limb.

original: prastṛṇatī stambinīḥ eka śuṅgāḥ pratanvatīḥ oṣadhīḥ ā vadāmi / aṃśumatīḥ kaṇḍinīḥ yāḥ viśākhāḥ hvayāmi te vīrudhaḥ vaiśvadevīḥ ugrāḥ puruṣa jīvanīḥ /
analyzed: prastṛṇatī stambinīḥ eka śuṅgāḥ pratanvatīḥ oṣadhīḥ ā vadāmi   aṃśumatīḥ kaṇḍinīḥ yāḥ viśākhāḥ hvayāmi te vīrudhaḥ vaiśvadevīḥ ugrāḥ puruṣa jīvanīḥ  /
translated: I call the plants that spread and grow in tufts, the single-sprouted, and the creeping, and the branching. I call the plants that grow in clusters, and the stalks, and those that have a root, the Virûdhas, the all-gods' plants, the strong, that give a man new life.

original: yat vaḥ sahaḥ sahamānāḥ vīryam yat ca vaḥ balam / tena imam asmāt yakṣmāt puruṣam muñcata oṣadhīḥ atho kṛṇomi bheṣajam /
analyzed: yat vaḥ sahaḥ sahamānāḥ vīryam yat ca vaḥ balam   tena imam asmāt yakṣmāt puruṣam muñcata oṣadhīḥ atho kṛṇomi bheṣajam  /
translated: The strength that ye possess, O ye who conquer, and all your power and might, Therewith deliver ye this man from this disease, O Plants, and I will make a medicine for him.

original: jīvalām naghāriṣām jīvantīm oṣadhīm aham / arundhatīm unnayantīm puṣpām madhumatīm iha huve asmai ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: jīvalām naghāriṣām jīvantīm oṣadhīm aham    arundhatīm unnayantīm puṣpām madhumatīm iha huve asmai ariṣṭatātaye  /
translated: The plant that lives, that conquers sin, that lives again, the plant that heals, Arundhatî, that lifts the man to heaven, the plant that bears sweet flowers, I call to give this man security from harm.

original: iha ā yantu pracetasaḥ medinīḥ vacasaḥ mama / yathā imam pārayāmasi puruṣam duritāt adhi //
analyzed: iha ā yantu pracetasaḥ medinīḥ vacasaḥ mama   yathā imam pārayāmasi puruṣam duritāt adhi  /
translated: Hither let the far-seeing plants, the balmy herbs, come to my call, That we may lead this man across to safety from his malady.

original: agneḥ ghāsaḥ apām garbhaḥ yāḥ rohanti punarṇavāḥ / dhruvāḥ sahasra nāmnīḥ bheṣajīḥ santu ābhṛtāḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ ghāsaḥ apām garbhaḥ yāḥ rohanti punarṇavāḥ    dhruvāḥ sahasra nāmnīḥ bheṣajīḥ santu ābhṛtāḥ  /
translated: The food of Agni, the waters' germ, the plants that spring to life again, The firm, the thousand-named, the healing plants, may they be brought to us.

original: avakā ulbāḥ udaka ātmānaḥ oṣadhayaḥ / vyṛṣantu duritam tīkṣṇa śṛṅgyaḥ /
analyzed: avakā ulbāḥ udaka ātmānaḥ oṣadhayaḥ   vyṛṣantu duritam tīkṣṇa śṛṅgyaḥ  /
translated: The plants have Avakâ for their germ, and water for their soul. Let them, with sharp horns, rend away my sin.🔽The fierce plants which are freed from Varunâ's noose, which drive away all poison,🔽And those which drive away the malady of jaundice, and those which drive away the witchcraft of the Kṛtyâs, let these plants come hither.

original: unmuñcantīḥ vivaruṇāḥ ugrāḥ yāḥ viṣa dūṣanāḥ / atha u balāsana aśanīḥ kṛtyāḥ dūṣaṇīḥ ca yāḥ tāḥ iha ā yantu oṣadhīḥ // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /
analyzed: unmuñcantīḥ vivaruṇāḥ ugrāḥ yāḥ viṣa dūṣanāḥ   atha u balāsana aśanīḥ kṛtyāḥ dūṣaṇīḥ ca yāḥ tāḥ iha ā yantu oṣadhīḥ
translated: The plants which have been bought, the most efficacious, which have been praised,

original: apakrītāḥ sahīyasīḥ vīrudhaḥ yāḥ abhiṣṭutāḥ / trāyantām asmin grāme gām aśvam puruṣam paśum /
analyzed: apakrītāḥ sahīyasīḥ vīrudhaḥ yāḥ abhiṣṭutāḥ   trāyantām asmin grāme gām aśvam puruṣam paśum  /
translated: protect in this village the cattle, the horse, the man, the beast.

original: madhumat mūlam madhumat agram āsām madhumat madhyam vīrudhām babhūva / madhumat parṇam madhumat puṣpam āsām madhoḥ sambhaktāḥ amṛtasya bhakṣaḥ ghṛtam annam duhratām go purogavam /
analyzed: madhumat mūlam madhumat agram āsām madhumat madhyam vīrudhām babhūva  / madhumat parṇam madhumat puṣpam āsām madhoḥ sambhaktāḥ amṛtasya bhakṣaḥ ghṛtam annam duhratām go purogavam  /
translated: The root of these plants is full of honey, their top is full of honey, their middle is full of honey. The leaf of these plants is full of honey, their flower is full of honey. They are compounded of honey, the food of immortality. Let them yield butter and food, with the cow as their leader.🔽As many and as great as are the plants on earth,

original: yāvatīḥ kiyatīḥ ca imāḥ pṛthivyām adhi oṣadhīḥ / tāḥ mā sahasra parṇyaḥ mṛtyoḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yāvatīḥ kiyatīḥ ca imāḥ pṛthivyām adhi oṣadhīḥ   tāḥ mā sahasra parṇyaḥ mṛtyoḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: may they, the plants with a thousand leaves, deliver me from death and misery.

original: vaiyāghraḥ maṇiḥ vīrudhām trāyamānaḥ abhiśasti pāḥ / amīvāḥ sarvāḥ rakṣāṃsi apa hantu adhi dūram asmat /
analyzed: vaiyāghraḥ maṇiḥ vīrudhām trāyamānaḥ abhiśasti pāḥ   amīvāḥ sarvāḥ rakṣāṃsi apa hantu adhi dūram asmat  /
translated: May all diseases, all malignant influences, be driven far away from us.🔽As from a lion's or a tiger's mouth, as from a burning fire,

original: siṃhasya iva stanathoḥ sam vijante agneḥ iva vijante ābhṛtābhyaḥ / gavām yakṣmaḥ puruṣāṇām vīrudbhiḥ atinuttaḥ nāvyāḥ etu srotyāḥ //
analyzed: siṃhasya iva stanathoḥ sam vijante agneḥ iva vijante ābhṛtābhyaḥ    gavām yakṣmaḥ puruṣāṇām vīrudbhiḥ atinuttaḥ nāvyāḥ etu srotyāḥ  /
translated: The cattle's malady is driven out by plants and herbs, and carried down the streams.🔽The plants that are set free from Agni Vaisvânara,

original: mumucānāḥ oṣadhayaḥ agneḥ vaiśvānarāt adhi / bhūmim saṃtanvatīḥ ita yāsām rājā vanaspatiḥ /
analyzed: mumucānāḥ oṣadhayaḥ agneḥ vaiśvānarāt adhi   bhūmim saṃtanvatīḥ ita yāsām rājā vanaspatiḥ  /
translated: That spread themselves along the ground, whose King is Vanaṣpati,🔽The plants that grow on mountains and on level ground, the Ângirasas' offspring,

original: yāḥ rohanti āṅgirasīḥ parvateṣu sameṣu ca / tāḥ naḥ payasvatīḥ śivāḥ oṣadhīḥ santu śam hṛde /
analyzed: yāḥ rohanti āṅgirasīḥ parvateṣu sameṣu ca   tāḥ naḥ payasvatīḥ śivāḥ oṣadhīḥ santu śam hṛde  /
translated: Be these to us propitious, rich in milk, and kind to our heart.🔽The plants that I know, and those that with mine eye behold,

original: yāḥ ca aham veda vīrudhaḥ yāḥ ca paśyāmi cakṣuṣā / ajñātāḥ jānīmaḥ ca yāḥ yāsu vidma ca saṃbhṛtam /
analyzed: yāḥ ca aham veda vīrudhaḥ yāḥ ca paśyāmi cakṣuṣā   ajñātāḥ jānīmaḥ ca yāḥ yāsu vidma ca saṃbhṛtam  /
translated: The unknown and the known, in which we know that power is stored,🔽All plants together, let them listen to my words,

original: sarvāḥ samagrāḥ oṣadhīḥ bodhantu vacasaḥ mama / yathā imam pārayāmasi puruṣam duritāt adhi //
analyzed: sarvāḥ samagrāḥ oṣadhīḥ bodhantu vacasaḥ mama   yathā imam pārayāmasi puruṣam duritāt adhi  /
translated: That we may lead this man across all misery and woe.

original: aśvatthaḥ darbhaḥ vīrudhām somaḥ rājā amṛtam haviḥ / vrīhiḥ yavaḥ ca bheṣajau divasi putrau amartyau // vrīhiḥ yavaḥ ca bheṣajau divasi putrau amartyau // vrīhiḥ yavaḥ ca bheṣajau divasi putrau amartyau // vrīhiḥ yavaḥ ca bheṣajau divasi putrau amartyau // vrīhiḥ yavaḥ ca bheṣajau divasi putrau amartyau // vrīhiḥ yavaḥ ca bheṣajau divasi putrau amartyau // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //
analyzed: aśvatthaḥ darbhaḥ vīrudhām somaḥ rājā amṛtam haviḥ         ca             ca
translated: The Vrīhi and the Yava are the two healing medicines, the two immortal Sons of Heaven.🔽The Vrīhi and the Yava are the two healing medicines, the two immortal Sons of Heaven.

original: ud jihīdhve stanayati abhikrandati oṣadhīḥ / yadā vaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ parjanyaḥ retasāvati //
analyzed: ud jihīdhve stanayati abhikrandati oṣadhīḥ    yadā vaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ parjanyaḥ retasāvati  /
translated: Ye roar and bellow when the thunder-cloud resounds, and make the plants rejoice, When, O ye spotted Cows of heaven, Parjanya sends you fertilizing rain.

original: tasya amṛtasya imam balam puruṣam payayāmasi / atha u kṛṇomi bheṣajam yathā asat śata hāyanaḥ //
analyzed: tasya amṛtasya imam balam puruṣam payayāmasi    atha u kṛṇomi bheṣajam yathā asat śata hāyanaḥ  /
translated: Of that immortal food we make this man to be of mighty strength. And I bestow the healing balm that he may live a hundred years.

original: varāhaḥ veda vīrudham nakulaḥ veda bheṣajīm / sarpāḥ gandharvāḥ yāḥ viduḥ tāḥ asmai avase huve /
analyzed: varāhaḥ veda vīrudham nakulaḥ veda bheṣajīm   sarpāḥ gandharvāḥ yāḥ viduḥ tāḥ asmai avase huve  /
translated: The Boar knows the healing herb, the mongoose knows the medicine. The Serpents, the Gandharvas, those which they know, I call to aid this man.

original: yāḥ suparṇāḥ āṅgirasīḥ divyāḥ yāḥ raghataḥ viduḥ / vayāṃsi haṃsāḥ yāḥ viduḥ yāḥ ca sarve patatriṇaḥ / mṛgāḥ yāḥ viduḥ oṣadhīḥ tāḥ asmai avase huve /
analyzed: yāḥ suparṇāḥ āṅgirasīḥ divyāḥ yāḥ raghataḥ viduḥ   vayāṃsi haṃsāḥ yāḥ viduḥ yāḥ ca sarve patatriṇaḥ   mṛgāḥ yāḥ viduḥ oṣadhīḥ tāḥ asmai avase huve  /
translated: The birds of fair feathers, the Angirases, those which the Rishis know, the birds, the swans, those which all winged creatures know, the beasts, those which the deer know, I call to aid this man.

original: yāvatīnām oṣadhīnām gāvaḥ prāśnanti aghnyāḥ yavatīnām aja avayaḥ / tāvatīḥ tubhyam oṣadhīḥ śarma yacchantu ābhṛtāḥ //
analyzed: yāvatīnām oṣadhīnām gāvaḥ prāśnanti aghnyāḥ yavatīnām aja avayaḥ   tāvatīḥ tubhyam oṣadhīḥ śarma yacchantu ābhṛtāḥ  /
translated: As many herbs as cattle eat, as many goats and sheep, so many herbs, brought hither, shall give thee shelter and protection.

original: yāvatīṣu manuṣyāḥ bheṣajam bhiṣajaḥ viduḥ / tāvatīḥ viśva bheṣajīḥ ā bharāmi tvām abhi //
analyzed: yāvatīṣu manuṣyāḥ bheṣajam bhiṣajaḥ viduḥ    viśva bheṣajīḥ ā bharāmi tvām abhi  /
translated: As many herbs as men, as many physicians know for medicine, so many, all-healing herbs I bring to thee.

original: puṣpavatīḥ prasūmatīḥ phalinīḥ aphalāḥ uta / saṃmātaraḥ iva duhrām asmai ariṣṭatātaye /
analyzed: puṣpavatīḥ prasūmatīḥ phalinīḥ aphalāḥ uta    saṃmātaraḥ iva duhrām asmai ariṣṭatātaye  /
translated: Rich in flowers, rich in blossoms, rich in fruits, and those that bear no fruit, as mothers to their son, so yield ye milk for his protection.

original: ud tvā ahārṣam pañca śalāt atha u daśa śalāt uta / atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt // atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt // atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt // atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt // atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt // // tvā u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt // // tvā
analyzed: ud tvā ahārṣam pañca śalāt atha u daśa śalāt uta  / atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt   atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt    atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt
translated: From the fetter of Yama, and from every sin against the Gods.🔽From the fetter of Yama, and from every sin against the Gods.🔽Let Indra, the strong, the hero, the breaker-down of forts, crush thee,

original: indraḥ manthatu manthitā śakraḥ śūraḥ puraṃdaraḥ / yathā hanāma senāḥ amitrāṇām sahasraśas /🔽pūti rajjuḥ upadhmānī pūtim senām kṛṇotu amūm / dhūmam agnim parādṛśyā amitrāḥ hṛtsu ā dadhatām bhayam //
analyzed: indraḥ manthatu manthitā śakraḥ śūraḥ puraṃdaraḥ    yathā hanāma senāḥ amitrāṇām sahasraśas  / pūti rajjuḥ upadhmānī pūtim senām kṛṇotu amūm    dhūmam agnim parādṛśyā amitrāḥ hṛtsu ā dadhatām bhayam  /
translated: That we may slay the armies of our foes by thousands.🔽Let the foul rope, the bellows, make this army foul and impure.🔽Let the foe, beholding smoke and fire, be seized with terror in his heart.🔽O A'svattha, crush them down: O Khadira, devour them up.

original: amūn aśvattha niḥ śṛṇīhi khāda amūn khadira ajiram / tājat bhaṅgaḥ iva bhajantām hantu enān vadhakaḥ vadhaiḥ /
analyzed: amūn aśvattha niḥ śṛṇīhi khāda amūn khadira ajiram   tājat bhaṅgaḥ iva bhajantām hantu enān vadhakaḥ vadhaiḥ  /
translated: Let them be broken like a reed: let the Destroyer slay them with his shafts.

original: paruṣān amūn paruṣa āhvaḥ kṛṇotu hantu enān vadhakaḥ vadhaiḥ / kṣipram śaraḥ iva bhajantām bṛhat jālena saṃditāḥ /
analyzed: paruṣān amūn paruṣa āhvaḥ kṛṇotu hantu enān vadhakaḥ vadhaiḥ   kṣipram śaraḥ iva bhajantām bṛhat jālena saṃditāḥ  /
translated: Let the one who calls himself the harsh one make these harsh; let the one who calls himself the slayer slay them with his weapons. Let them be broken like a great reed bound with a strong net.

original: antarikṣam jālam āsīt jāla daṇḍāḥ diśaḥ mahīḥ / tena abhidhāya dasyūnām śakraḥ senām apāvapat /
analyzed: antarikṣam jālam āsīt jāla daṇḍāḥ diśaḥ mahīḥ   tena abhidhāya dasyūnām śakraḥ senām apāvapat  /
translated: The sky was the net, the quarters of the earth were the net-posts. With that did Sakra drive away the Dasyus' host, having encompassed them.

original: bṛhat hi jālam bṛhataḥ śakrasya vājinīvataḥ / tena śatrūn abhi sarvān ni ubja yathā na mucyātai katamaḥ cana eṣām /
analyzed: bṛhat hi jālam bṛhataḥ śakrasya vājinīvataḥ    tena śatrūn abhi sarvān ni ubja yathā na mucyātai katamaḥ cana eṣām  /
translated: For great is the net of the great, of mighty Sakra, the bountiful. With that do thou crush all the enemies, so that not one of them may escape.

original: bṛhat te jālam bṛhataḥ indra śūra sahasra arghasya śata vīryasya / tena śatam sahasram ayutam nyarbudam jaghāna śakraḥ dasyūnām abhidhāya senayā /
analyzed: bṛhat te jālam bṛhataḥ indra śūra sahasra arghasya śata vīryasya   tena śatam sahasram ayutam nyarbudam jaghāna śakraḥ dasyūnām abhidhāya senayā  /
translated: Great is thy net, O great Indra, of thee whose price is a thousand, whose strength is a hundred. With that did Sakra slay a hundred thousand, a myriad, a myriad times ten thousand of the Dasyus, having encompassed them with his host.

original: ayam lokaḥ jālam āsīt śakrasya mahataḥ mahān / tena aham indra jālena amūn tamasā abhi dadhāmi sarvān /
analyzed: ayam lokaḥ jālam āsīt śakrasya mahataḥ mahān   tena aham indra jālena amūn tamasā abhi dadhāmi sarvān  /
translated: This great world was the great net of mighty Sakra. With that net of Indra I encompass all these with darkness.

original: sediḥ ugrā vyṛddhiḥ ārtiḥ ca anapavācanā / śramaḥ tandrīḥ ca mohaḥ ca taiḥ amūn abhi dadhāmi sarvān /
analyzed: sediḥ ugrā vyṛddhiḥ ārtiḥ ca anapavācanā    śramaḥ tandrīḥ ca mohaḥ ca taiḥ amūn abhi dadhāmi sarvān  /
translated: Weakness, terrible destruction, calamity, and what cannot be cured, toil, sloth, and bewilderment, with these I encompass all these.

original: mṛtyave amūn pra yacchāmi mṛtyu pāśaiḥ amī sitāḥ / mṛtyoḥ ye aghalāḥ dūtāḥ tebhyaḥ enān prati nayāmi baddhvā / / / tebhyaḥ enān prati nayāmi baddhvā / // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // tebhyaḥ enān prati nayāmi baddhvā // // // // // // // // // tebhyaḥ enān prati nayāmi baddhvā // // // // // // // // // // tebhyaḥ enān prati nayāmi baddhvā // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //
analyzed: mṛtyave amūn pra yacchāmi mṛtyu pāśaiḥ amī sitāḥ   mṛtyoḥ ye aghalāḥ dūtāḥ tebhyaḥ enān prati nayāmi baddhvā           enān prati nayāmi baddhvā
translated: I lead them to the messengers of Death, the wicked ones, bound fast.

original: nayata amūn mṛtyu dūtāḥ yama dūtāḥ apombhata / paraḥsahasrā hanyantām tṛṇa īḍhu enān matyam bhavasya /
analyzed: nayata amūn mṛtyu dūtāḥ yama dūtāḥ apombhata    paraḥsahasrāḥ hanyantām tṛṇa īḍhu enān matyam bhavasya  /
translated: Lead them away, ye messengers of Death, ye messengers of Yama, crush them. Let a thousand perish, ten thousand perish: let them be trodden down by Death's foot.

original: sādhyāḥ ekam jāla daṇḍam udyatya yanti ojasā / rudrāḥ ekam vasavaḥ ekam ādityaiḥ ekaḥ udyataḥ /
analyzed: sādhyāḥ ekam jāla daṇḍam udyatya yanti ojasā   rudrāḥ ekam vasavaḥ ekam ādityaiḥ ekaḥ udyataḥ  /
translated: The Sadhyas, raising up one net-staff, go forth with might. The Rudras one, the Vasus one, the Adityas one is raised on high.

original: viśve devāḥ upariṣṭāt ubjantaḥ yantu ojasā / madhyena ghnantaḥ yantu senām aṅgirasaḥ mahīm /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ upariṣṭāt ubjantaḥ yantu ojasā   madhyena ghnantaḥ yantu senām aṅgirasaḥ mahīm  /
translated: Let the All-Gods from above go forward, trampling with might. Let the Angirases go in the midst, slaying the army, mighty ones.

original: vanaspatīn vānaspatyān oṣadhīḥ uta vīrudhaḥ / dvipād catuṣpād iṣṇāmi yathā senām amūm hanan //
analyzed: vanaspatīn vānaspatyān oṣadhīḥ uta vīrudhaḥ    dvipād catuṣpād iṣṇāmi yathā senām amūm hanan  /
translated: I send forth trees and plants, herbs and creepers, two-footed and four-footed, that they may slay this army.

original: gandharva apsarasaḥ sarpān devān puṇyajanān pitṝn / dṛṣṭān adṛṣṭān iṣṇāmi yathā senām amūm hanan /
analyzed: gandharva apsarasaḥ sarpān devān puṇyajanān pitṝn    dṛṣṭān adṛṣṭān iṣṇāmi yathā senām amūm hanan  /
translated: Gandharvas, Apsarases, serpents, gods, holy men, fathers, seen and unseen, I send forth, that they may slay this army.

original: ime uptāḥ mṛtyu pāśāḥ yān ākramya na mucyase / amuṣyāḥ hantu senāyāḥ idam kūṭam sahasraśas /
analyzed: ime uptāḥ mṛtyu pāśāḥ yān ākramya na mucyase   amuṣyāḥ hantu senāyāḥ idam kūṭam sahasraśas  /
translated: These snares of death are spread, stepping on which one is not freed. For this army to be slain, this is the thousandfold snare.

original: gharmaḥ samiddhaḥ agninā ayam homaḥ sahasrahaḥ / bhavaḥ ca pṛśni bāhuḥ ca śarva senām amūm hatam //
analyzed: gharmaḥ samiddhaḥ agninā ayam homaḥ sahasrahaḥ    bhavaḥ ca pṛśni bāhuḥ ca śarva senām amūm hatam  /
translated: This oblation with Agni, kindled with the Gharma, is offered, slaying a thousand. Bhava and Prsanibaha, O Sarva, slay this army.

original: mṛtyoḥ āṣam ā padyantām kṣudham sedim vadham bhayam / indraḥ ca akṣu jālābhyām śarva senām amūm hatam /
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ āṣam ā padyantām kṣudham sedim vadham bhayam   indraḥ ca akṣu jālābhyām śarva senām amūm hatam  /
translated: Let them fall into the jaws of death, hunger, exhaustion, slaughter, and fear. Indra and Akshujalla, O Sarva, slay this army.

original: parājitāḥ pra trasata amitrāḥ nuttāḥ dhāvata brahmaṇā / bṛhaspati pranuttānām mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana /
analyzed: parājitāḥ pra trasata amitrāḥ nuttāḥ dhāvata brahmaṇā    bṛhaspati pranuttānām mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana  /
translated: Vanquished, flee in fear, O enemies! Driven away, run with Brahma! Let no one release those whom Brihaspati has driven away.

original: ava padyantām eṣām āyudhāni mā śakan pratidhām iṣum / atha eṣām bahu bibhyatām iṣavaḥ ghnantu marmaṇi //
analyzed: ava padyantām eṣām āyudhāni mā śakan pratidhām iṣum   atha eṣām bahu bibhyatām iṣavaḥ ghnantu marmaṇi  /
translated: Let their weapons fail them, let them not be able to draw their bows. Then let their arrows slay them in their vital parts, as they flee in great fear.
