original: kutas tau jātau katamaḥ saḥ ardhaḥ kasmāt lokāt katamasyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ / vatsau virājaḥ salilāt ud ā etām tau tvā pṛchāmi katareṇa dugdhā /
analyzed: kutas tau jātau katamaḥ saḥ ardhaḥ kasmāt lokāt katamasyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ   vatsau virājaḥ salilāt ud ā etām tau tvā pṛcchāmi katareṇa dugdhā  /
translated: The two calves of Virāj from the waters have risen. I ask thee, by which of them have they been milked?

original: yaḥ akrandayat salilam mahitvā yonim kṛtvā tri bhujam śayānaḥ / vatsaḥ kāmadughaḥ virājaḥ sa guhā cakre tanvaḥ parācais /
analyzed: yaḥ akrandayat salilam mahitvā yonim kṛtvā tri bhujam śayānaḥ   vatsaḥ kāmadughaḥ virājaḥ sa guhā cakre tanvaḥ parācais  /
translated: The calf of the wish-milking Cow of plenty, hath set his bodies far away in secret.🔽The three great ones of which the fourth divides the speech,

original: yāni trīṇi bṛhanti yeṣām caturtham viyunakti vācam / brahma enat vidyāt tapasā vipaścit yasmin ekam yujyate yasmin ekam /
analyzed: yāni trīṇi bṛhanti yeṣām caturtham viyunakti vācam    brahma enat vidyāt tapasā vipaścit yasmin ekam yujyate yasmin ekam  /
translated: Let the Brahman know that by austerity, the wise one, in which one is joined, in which one is joined.🔽The Samans of the Brihat are formed from the sixth upon the five,

original: bṛhataḥ pari sāmāni ṣaṣṭhāt pañca adhi nirmitā / bṛhat bṛhatyāḥ nirmitam kutas adhi bṛhatī mitā /
analyzed: bṛhataḥ pari sāmāni ṣaṣṭhāt pañca adhi nirmitā   bṛhat bṛhatyāḥ nirmitam kutas adhi bṛhatī mitā  /
translated: The Brihat is formed from the Brihatī, from where is the Brihatī measured?🔽The Brihatī is formed from the measure of the mother, the measure of the mother above,

original: bṛhatī pari mātrāyāḥ mātuḥ mātrā adhi nirmitā / māyā ha jajñe māyāyāḥ māyāyāḥ mātalī pari /
analyzed: bṛhatī pari mātrāyāḥ mātuḥ mātrā adhi nirmitā   māyā ha jajñe māyāyāḥ māyāyāḥ mātalī pari  /
translated: The illusion was born from the illusion, from the illusion the motherly one around.🔽The image of Vaisvānara is above the sky, as far as Agni has extended the two worlds,

original: vaiśvānarasya pratimā upari dyauḥ yāvat rodasī vibabādhe agniḥ / tatas ṣaṣṭhāt ā amutas yanti stomāḥ ud itas yanti abhi ṣaṣṭham ahnaḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya pratimā upari dyauḥ yāvat rodasī vibabādhe agniḥ   tatas ṣaṣṭhāt ā amutas yanti stomāḥ ud itas yanti abhi ṣaṣṭham ahnaḥ  /
translated: From there the praises come from the sixth, from here they come to the sixth of the day.

original: ṣaṭ tvā pṛchāmaḥ ṛṣayaḥ kaśyapa ime tvam hi yuktam yuyukṣe yogyam ca / virājam āhuḥ brahmaṇaḥ pitaram tām naḥ vi dhehi yatidhā sakhibhyaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭ tvā pṛcchāmaḥ ṛṣayaḥ kaśyapa ime tvam hi yuktam yuyukṣe yogyam ca    virājam āhuḥ brahmaṇaḥ pitaram tām naḥ vi dhehi yatidhā sakhibhyaḥ  /
translated: We ask thee, O six-footed one, the seven Rishis, and Kasyapa, for thou dost yoke the yoke-worthy and the yoke-able. They call the Brahman's father by the name of Viraj. Do thou allot her to us and to our friends in due order.

original: yām pracyutām anu yajñāḥ pracyavantaḥ upatiṣṭhante upatiṣṭhamānām / yasyāḥ vrate prasave yakṣam ejati sā virāj ṛṣayaḥ parame vyoman /
analyzed: yām pracyutām anu yajñāḥ pracyavantaḥ upatiṣṭhante upatiṣṭhamānām    yasyāḥ vrate prasave yakṣam ejati sā virāj ṛṣayaḥ parame vyoman  /
translated: After her who is fallen, the sacrifices, falling, stand, and after her who is standing, standing. In whose vow the Yaksha moves in the impulse, she is Viraj. The Rishis in the highest heaven.

original: a prāṇaiti prāṇena prāṇatīnām virāj svarājam abhi eti paścāt / viśvam mṛśantīm abhirūpām virājam paśyanti tve na tve paśyanti enām /
analyzed: a prāṇaiti prāṇena prāṇatīnām virāj svarājam abhi eti paścāt    viśvam mṛśantīm abhirūpām virājam paśyanti tve na tve paśyanti enām  /
translated: She goes without breath, with the breath of those that breathe. Viraj goes behind, self-ruling. They see the all-embracing, beautiful Viraj, but they do not see her face to face.

analyzed: kaḥ virājaḥ mithuna tvam pra veda kaḥ ṛtūn kaḥ u kalpam asyāḥ  / kramān kaḥ asyāḥ katidhā vidugdhān kaḥ asyāḥ dhāma katidhā vyuṣṭīḥ
translated: Who knows the twin nature of Virāj, who the seasons and the order of this (universe)? Who knows her steps in their various divisions? Who her lights and their various manifestations?

original: iyam eva sā yā prathamā vyauchat āsu itarāsu carati praviṣṭā / mahāntaḥ asyām mahimānaḥ antar vadhūḥ jigāya navagat janitrī /
analyzed: iyam eva sā yā prathamā vyauchat āsu itarāsu carati praviṣṭā   mahāntaḥ asyām mahimānaḥ antar vadhūḥ jigāya navagat janitrī  /
translated: This is she who first shone forth; she moves within the others having entered them. Great glories are within her; the bride has conquered, the newly-wedded mother.

original: chandaḥ pakṣe uṣasā pepiśāne samānam yonim anu sam careme / sūrya patnī sam carataḥ prajānatī ketumatī ajare bhūri retasā /
analyzed: chandaḥ pakṣe uṣasā pepiśāne samānam yonim anu sam cara ime    sūrya patnī sam carataḥ prajānatī ketumatī ajare bhūri retasā  /
translated: On the wing of the metre, the two dawns have united; we shall go together to the common birthplace. The wife of the sun moves together, knowing, the bannered one, the undecaying one, with abundant seed.

original: ṛtasya panthām anu tisraḥ āguḥ trayaḥ gharmāḥ anu retaḥ āguḥ / prajām ekā jinvati ūrjam ekā rāṣṭram ekā rakṣati devayūnām /
analyzed: ṛtasya panthām anu tisraḥ āguḥ trayaḥ gharmāḥ anu retaḥ āguḥ   prajām ekā jinvati ūrjam ekā rāṣṭram ekā rakṣati devayūnām  /
translated: The three have come along the path of truth, the three hot seasons have come along with seed. One quickens offspring, one gives strength, one guards the people of the gods.

original: agnīṣomau adadhuḥ yā turīyā āsīt yajñasya pakṣau ṛṣayaḥ kalpayantaḥ / gāyatrīm triṣṭubham jagatīm anuṣṭubham bṛhat arkīm yajamānāya svar ābharantīm /
analyzed: agnīṣomau adadhuḥ yā turīyā āsīt yajñasya pakṣau ṛṣayaḥ kalpayantaḥ   gāyatrīm triṣṭubham jagatīm anuṣṭubham bṛhat arkīm yajamānāya svar ābharantīm  /
translated: Agni and Soma have established the fourth, the sages, when they formed the two wings of the sacrifice, the Gayatri, the Tristubh, the Jagati, the Anustubh, the Brihat, the Arki, which brings heaven to the sacrificer.

original: pañca vyuṣṭīḥ anu pañca dohāḥ gām pañca nāmnīm ṛtavaḥ anu pañca / pañca diśaḥ pañcadaśena kḷptāḥ tāḥ eka mūrdhnīḥ abhi lokam ekam /🔽ṣaṭ jātāḥ bhūtā prathama jāḥ ṛtasya ṣaṭ u sāmāni ṣaṭ aham vahanti / ṣaṣ yogam sīram anu sāmasāma ṣaṭ āhuḥ dyāvāpṛthivīḥ ṣaṭ urvīḥ /
analyzed: pañca vyuṣṭīḥ anu pañca dohāḥ gām pañca nāmnīm ṛtavaḥ anu pañca    pañca diśaḥ pañcadaśena kḷptāḥ tāḥ eka mūrdhnīḥ abhi lokam ekam  / ṣaṭ jātāḥ bhūtā prathama jāḥ ṛtasya ṣaṭ u sāmāni ṣaṭ aham vahanti   ṣaṣ yogam sīram anu sāmasāma ṣaḍ āhuḥ dyāvāpṛthivīḥ ṣaṭ urvīḥ  /
translated: The five dawns, the five milkings, the cow with five names, the five seasons, the five regions measured by the fifteen, they have one head, they look to one world.🔽The six beings, the first-born of truth, the six Sâmans, the six days carry (the sacrifice); the plough with six yokes, according to the Sâman-Sâman, they declare the six heavens and earths, the six wide (regions).

original: ṣaṭ āhuḥ śītān ṣaṭ u māsaḥ uṣṇān ṛtum naḥ brūta yatamaḥ atiriktaḥ / sapta suparṇāḥ kavayaḥ ni seduḥ sapta chandāṃsi anu sapta dīkṣāḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭ āhuḥ śītān ṣaṭ u māsaḥ uṣṇān ṛtum naḥ brūta yatamaḥ atiriktaḥ   sapta suparṇāḥ kavayaḥ ni seduḥ sapta chandāṃsi anu sapta dīkṣāḥ  /
translated: They declare the six cold, the six hot months; tell us the season which is the superabundant one. The seven wise birds have sat down, the seven metres, the seven consecrations.

original: sapta homāḥ samidhaḥ ha sapta madhūni sapta ṛtavaḥ ha sapta / sapta ājyāni pari bhūtam āyan tāḥ sapta gṛdhrāḥ iti śuśruma vayam /
analyzed: sapta homāḥ samidhaḥ ha sapta madhūni sapta ṛtavaḥ ha sapta   / sapta ājyāni pari bhūtam āyan tāḥ sapta gṛdhrāḥ iti śuśruma vayam  /
translated: Seven are the libations of ghee that have gone round the world. We have heard that these are the seven vultures.🔽The metres are seven, each increasing by four, one being contained in each of the others.

original: sapta chandāṃsi catur uttarāṇi anyaḥ anyasmin adhi ārpitāni / katham stomāḥ prati tiṣṭhanti teṣu tāni stomeṣu katham ārpitāni //
analyzed: sapta chandāṃsi catur uttarāṇi anyaḥ anyasmin adhi ārpitāni   katham stomāḥ prati tiṣṭhanti teṣu tāni stomeṣu katham ārpitāni  /
translated: How do the Stomas rest in them? How are they contained in the Stomas?🔽How is the Jagati in the Trayastrimsa? How is the Anustubh? How is the Ekavimsa?🔽How is the Jagati in the Trayastrimsa? How is the Anustubh? How is the Ekavimsa?🔽How is the Jagati in the Trayastrimsa? How is the Anustubh? How is the Ekavimsa?

original: trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ // trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ // trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ // trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ // trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ // trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ // trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ // traya
analyzed: trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ    trayastriṃśena jagatī katham anuṣṭubh katham ekaviṃśaḥ        katham
translated: How is the Jagati in the Trayastrimsa? How is the Anustubh? How is the Ekavimsa?

original: aṣṭa jātāḥ bhūtā prathama jāḥ ṛtasya aṣṭa indraḥ ṛtvijaḥ daivyāḥ ye / aṣṭa yoniḥ aditiḥ aṣṭa putra astamīm rātrim abhi havyam eti /
analyzed: aṣṭa jātāḥ bhūtā prathama jāḥ ṛtasya aṣṭa indraḥ ṛtvijaḥ daivyāḥ ye aṣṭa yoniḥ aditiḥ aṣṭa putra astamīm rātrim abhi havyam eti  /
translated: Aditi, the eight-womb, with eight sons, goes to the oblation in the evening.

original: ittham śreyaḥ manyamānā idam āgamam yuṣmākam sakhye aham asmi śevā / samāna janmā kratuḥ asti vaḥ śivaḥ sa vaḥ sarvāḥ sam carati prajānan /
analyzed: ittham śreyaḥ manyamānā idam āgamam yuṣmākam sakhye aham asmi śevā    samāna janmā kratuḥ asti vaḥ śivaḥ sa vaḥ sarvāḥ sam carati prajānan  /
translated: Thinking this to be better, I have come to you. I am your servant in your friendship. There is an auspicious sacrifice common to you all, which he, knowing all, performs for you.

original: aṣṭa indrasya ṣaṭ yamasya ṛṣīṇām sapta saptadhā / apaḥ manuṣyān oṣadhīḥ tām u pañca anu secire /
analyzed: aṣṭa indrasya ṣaṭ yamasya ṛṣīṇām sapta saptadhā   apaḥ manuṣyān oṣadhīḥ tām u pañca anu secire  /
translated: Eight of Indra, six of Yama, seven of the Rishis are divided into seven parts.

original: kevalī indrāya duduhe hi gṛṣṭiḥ vaśam pīyūṣam prathamam duhānā / atha atarpayat caturaḥ caturdhā devān manuṣyān asurān uta ṛṣīn /
analyzed: kevalī indrāya duduhe hi gṛṣṭiḥ vaśam pīyūṣam prathamam duhānā   atha atarpayat caturaḥ caturdhā devān manuṣyān asurān uta ṛṣīn  /
translated: The cow Dudhi milked the first milk, the essence, for the solitary Indra. Then she satisfied the four in four ways - the gods, men, demons and Rishis.

original: kaḥ nu gauḥ kaḥ eka ṛṣiḥ kim u dhāma kāḥ āśiṣaḥ / yakṣam pṛthivyām ekavṛt eka ṛtuḥ katamaḥ nu saḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ nu gauḥ kaḥ eka ṛṣiḥ kim u dhāma kāḥ āśiṣaḥ   yakṣam pṛthivyām ekavṛt eka ṛtuḥ katamaḥ nu saḥ  /
translated: What is the cow? Who is the one Rishi? What is the essence? What are the blessings? The Yaksha lives on the earth, in one place, in one season. Which one is he?

original: virāj vai idam agre āsīt tasyāḥ jātāyāḥ sarvam abibhet iyam eva idam bhaviṣyati iti //
analyzed: virāj vai idam agre āsīt tasyāḥ jātāyāḥ sarvam abibhet iyam eva idam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Virat existed here in the beginning. When she was born, everything was afraid, thinking, She will become this.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā gārhapatye ni akrāmat / gṛhamedhī gṛhapatiḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā gārhapatye ni akrāmat   / gṛhamedhī gṛhapatiḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She stepped forth. She stepped into the Garhapatya. He who knows thus becomes a householder who has a home.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā āhavanīye ni akrāmat / yanti asya devāḥ deva hūtim priyaḥ devānām bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā āhavanīye ni akrāmat    yanti asya devāḥ deva hūtim priyaḥ devānām bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She stepped forth. She stepped into the Ahavaniya. The gods come to his invocation of the gods. He becomes dear to the gods who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā dakṣiṇāgnau ni akrāmat / yajña ṛtaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ vāsateyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /🔽sā ud akrāmat sā sabhāyām ni akrāmat / yanti asya sabhām sabhyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /🔽sā ud akrāmat sā samitau ni akrāmat / yanti asya samitim sāmityaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā dakṣiṇāgnau ni akrāmat   yajña ṛtaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ vāsateyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  / sā ud akrāmat sā sabhāyām ni akrāmat   yanti asya sabhām sabhyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  / sā ud akrāmat sā samitau ni akrāmat   yanti asya samitim sāmityaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She stepped forth. She stepped into the Dakshina fire. He who knows thus becomes worthy of the Dakshina, the Dakshina-worthy, the Dakshina-recipient.🔽She stepped forth. She stepped into the assembly. The assembly comes to him. He becomes a member of the assembly who knows thus.🔽She stepped forth. She stepped into the council. The council comes to him. He becomes a member of the council who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā āmantraṇe ni akrāmat / yanti asya āmantraṇam āmantraṇīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda / / // // // // // //
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā āmantraṇe ni akrāmat   yanti asya āmantraṇam āmantraṇīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: She stepped forth. She stepped into the invitation. The invitation comes to him. He becomes worthy of invitation who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā antarikṣe caturdhā vikrāntā atiṣṭhat //
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā antarikṣe caturdhā vikrāntā atiṣṭhat
translated: She stepped forth. She stood in the atmosphere, having spread herself in four directions.

original: tām deva manuṣyāḥ abruvan iyam eva tat veda yat ubhayaḥ upajīvema imām upa hvayāmahai iti //
analyzed: tām deva manuṣyāḥ abruvan iyam eva tat veda yat ubhayaḥ upajīvema imām upa hvayāmahai iti
translated: The gods and men said to her, 'She knows what we want. Let us invoke her.'

original: tām upāhvayanta //
analyzed: tām upāhvayanta
translated: They invoked her.

original: ūrjaḥ ehi svadhaḥ ehi sūnṛte ehi irāvatī ehi iti //
analyzed: ūrjaḥ ehi svadhaḥ ehi sūnṛte ehi irāvatī ehi iti
translated: 'Come, O strength! Come, O food! Come, O joy! Come, O prosperity!'

original: tasyāḥ indraḥ vatsaḥ āsīt gāyatrī abhidhānī abhram ūdhar //
analyzed: tasyāḥ indraḥ vatsaḥ āsīt gāyatrī abhidhānī abhram ūdhar
translated: Her calf was Indra; the Gayatri was her pail; the cloud was her udder.

original: bṛhat ca rathaṃtaram ca dvau stanau āstām yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca dvau //
analyzed: bṛhat ca rathaṃtaram ca dvau stanau āstām yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca dvau
translated: The Brihat and the Rathantara were her two teats; the Yajñāyajñiya and the Vāmadevya were her two.

original: oṣadhīḥ eva rathaṃtareṇa devāḥ aduhran vyacaḥ bṛhatā //
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ eva rathaṃtareṇa devāḥ aduhran vyacaḥ bṛhatā
translated: The gods milked the plants with the Rathantara, the spaces with the Brihat.

original: apaḥ vāmadevyena yajñam yajñāyajñiyena //
analyzed: apaḥ vāmadevyena yajñam yajñāyajñiyena
translated: The waters with the Vāmadevya, the sacrifice with the Yajñāyajñiya.

original: oṣadhīḥ eva asmai rathaṃtaram duhe vyacaḥ bṛhat //
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ eva asmai rathaṃtaram duhe vyacaḥ bṛhat
translated: The Rathantara milks for him the plants, the Brihat the spaces,

original: apaḥ vāmadevyam yajñam yajñāyajñiyam ya veda // // // // śatru vāmadevyam yajñam yajñāyajñiyam ya veda // // // // śatru vāmadevyam yajñam yajñāyajñiyam ya veda // // // // śatru śatru vāmadevyam yajñam yajñāyajñiyam ya veda // // // // / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /🔽sā ud akrāmat sā vanaspatīn āgacchat tām vanaspatayaḥ aghnata sā saṃvatsare sam abhavat / tasmāt vanaspatīnām saṃvatsare vṛkṇam api rohati vṛścate asya apriyaḥ bhrātṛvyaḥ yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: apaḥ vāmadevyam yajñam yajñāyajñiyam ya veda                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              sā ud akrāmat sā vanaspatīn āgacchat tām vanaspatayaḥ aghnata sā saṃvatsare sam abhavat   tasmāt vanaspatīnām saṃvatsare vṛkṇam api rohati vṛścate asya apriyaḥ bhrātṛvyaḥ yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: He who knows the waters, the Vama-deva hymn, the sacrifice, the sacrifice-to-the-sacrifices, conquers his foe.🔽She went forth. She came to the trees. The trees slew her. She became united in a year. Therefore, of the trees, even what is cut down in a year grows again. His foe, his enemy, is cut off who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā pitṝn āgacchat tām pitaraḥ aghnata sā māsi sam abhavat / tasmāt pitṛbhyaḥ māsi upamāsyam dadati pra pitṛyāṇam panthām jānāti yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā pitṝn āgacchat tām pitaraḥ aghnata sā māsi sam abhavat   tasmāt pitṛbhyaḥ māsi upamāsyam dadati pra pitṛyāṇam panthām jānāti yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She went forth. She came to the Fathers. The Fathers slew her. She became united in a month. Therefore, in a month, they give food to the Fathers. He knows the path to the Fathers who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā devān āgacchat tām devāḥ aghnata sā ardha māse sam abhavat / tasmāt devebhyaḥ ardha māse vaṣaṭ kurvanti pra deva yānam panthām jānāti yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā devān āgacchat tām devāḥ aghnata sā ardha māse sam abhavat    tasmāt devebhyaḥ ardha māse vaṣaṭ kurvanti pra deva yānam panthām jānāti yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She went forth; she came to the gods; the gods slew her; she was restored in half a month. Therefore at the end of half a month they utter 'Vasat' to the gods. He who knows thus finds the path to the gods.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā manuṣyān āgacchat tām manuṣyāḥ aghnata sā sadyas sam abhavat / tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda / tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda / tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda / tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda / tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā manuṣyān āgacchat tām manuṣyāḥ aghnata sā sadyas sam abhavat  / tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda   tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda    tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda    tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa asya gṛhe haranti yaḥ evam veda     tasmāt manuṣyebhyaḥ ubhayadyus upa haranti upa
translated: She went forth; she came to men; men slew her; she was restored in one day. Therefore they offer to men on both days; they bring (the Soma) to his house who knows thus. Therefore they offer to men on both days; they bring (the Soma) to his house who knows thus. Therefore they offer to men on both days; they bring (the Soma) to his house who knows thus. Therefore they offer to men on both days; they bring (the Soma) to his house who knows thus. Therefore they offer to men on both days; they bring (the Soma) to his house who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā asurān āgacchat tām asurāḥ upāhvayanta māyaḥ ehi iti / tasyāḥ virocanaḥ prāhrādiḥ vatsaḥ āsīt ayaspātram pātram / tām dvi mūrdhā ārtvyaḥ adhok tām māyām eva adhok //
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā asurān āgacchat tām asurāḥ upāhvayanta māyo ehi iti   tasyāḥ virocanaḥ prāhrādiḥ vatsaḥ āsīt ayaspātram pātram   tām dvi mūrdhā ārtvyaḥ adhok tām māyām eva adhok  /
translated: She went forth; she came to the Asuras. The Asuras called to her, 'Come hither, Magic!' Her calf was Virocana, the son of Prahrāda, and her pail was of iron. Dvimūr-dha, the son of Aṛṣṭanemi, milked her. He milked out Magic itself.

original: tām māyām asurāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
analyzed: tām māyām asurāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: The Asuras live on that Magic. He who knows thus becomes worthy of offerings.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā pitṝn āgacchat tām pitaraḥ upāhvayanta svadhaḥ ehi iti / tasyāḥ yamaḥ rājā vatsaḥ āsīt rajata pātram pātram / tām antakaḥ mārtyavaḥ adhok tām svadhām eva adhok / tām svadhām pitaraḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā pitṝn āgacchat tām pitaraḥ upāhvayanta svadhaḥ ehi iti   tasyāḥ yamaḥ rājā vatsaḥ āsīt rajata pātram pātram   tām antakaḥ mārtyavaḥ adhok tām svadhām eva adhok    tām svadhām pitaraḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She went forth; she came to the Fathers. The Fathers called to her, 'Come hither, Svâhâ!' Her calf was Yama, the king, and her pail was of silver. Antaka, the son of Mârtyu, milked her. He milked out Svâhâ itself. The Fathers live on that Svâhâ. He who knows thus becomes worthy of offerings.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā manuṣyān āgacchat tām manuṣyāḥ upāhvayanterāvatī ehi iti / tasyāḥ manuḥ vaivasvataḥ vatsaḥ āsīt pṛthivī pātram / tām pṛthī vainyaḥ adhok tām kṛṣim ca sasyam ca adhok / te svadhām kṛṣim ca sasyam ca manuṣyāḥ upa jīvanti kṛṣṭa rādhiḥ upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā manuṣyān āgacchat tām manuṣyāḥ upāhvayanterāvatī ehi iti   tasyāḥ manuḥ vaivasvataḥ vatsaḥ āsīt pṛthivī pātram   tām pṛthī vainyaḥ adhok tām kṛṣim ca sasyam ca adhok    te svadhām kṛṣim ca sasyam ca manuṣyāḥ upa jīvanti kṛṣṭa rādhiḥ upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She went forth. She came to men. Men invoked her, saying, 'Come hither, O thou that hast a share in food.' Her calf was Manu Vaivasvata; her vessel was the earth. Pṛthu Vainya milked her. He milked food and corn. Men live on that food and corn, on that prosperity of the ploughed land. He becomes prosperous who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā sapta ṛṣīn āgacchat tām sapta ṛṣayaḥ upāhvayanta brahmaṇvatī ehi iti / tasyāḥ somaḥ rājā vatsaḥ āsīt chandaḥ pātram / tām bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ adhok tām brahma ca tapaḥ ca adhok / tat brahma ca tapaḥ ca sapta ṛṣayaḥ upa jīvanti brahmavarcasī upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā sapta ṛṣīn āgacchat tām sapta ṛṣayaḥ upāhvayanta brahmaṇvatī ehi iti  / tasyāḥ somaḥ rājā vatsaḥ āsīt chandaḥ pātram   tām bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ adhok tām brahma ca tapaḥ ca adhok    tat brahma ca tapaḥ ca sapta ṛṣayaḥ upa jīvanti brahmavarcasī upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She went forth. She came to the seven Rṣis. The seven Rṣis invoked her, saying, 'Come hither, O thou that hast Brahman in thee.' Her calf was Soma, the king; her vessel was the metres. Bṛhaspati Aṅgiras milked her. He milked the Brahman and penance. The seven Rṣis live on that Brahman and penance. He becomes prosperous who knows thus.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā devān āgacchat tām devāḥ upāhvayanta ūrjaḥ ehi iti / tasyāḥ indraḥ vatsaḥ āsīt camasaḥ pātram / tām devaḥ savitā adhok tām ūrjām eva adhok / tām ūrjām devāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā devān āgacchat tām devāḥ upāhvayanta ūrjaḥ ehi iti   tasyāḥ indraḥ vatsaḥ āsīt camasaḥ pātram   tām devaḥ savitā adhok tām ūrjām eva adhok    tām ūrjām devāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: It went forth. It came to the gods. The gods invoked it, saying, 'Come hither, O strength!' Indra was its calf; the cup was the vessel. The god Savitr milked it. He milked out strength. The gods live on that strength. He who knows thus becomes fit to be lived on.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā gandharva apsarasaḥ āgacchat tām gandharva apsarasaḥ upāhvayanta puṇya gandhaḥ ehi iti / tasyāḥ citrarathaḥ saurya varcasaḥ vatsaḥ āsīt puṣkara parṇam pātram / tām vasu ruciḥ saurya varcasaḥ adhok tām puṇyam eva gandham adhok / tam puṇyam gandham gandharva apsarasaḥ upa jīvanti puṇya gandhiḥ upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā gandharva apsarasaḥ āgacchat tām gandharva apsarasaḥ upāhvayanta puṇya gandhaḥ ehi iti   tasyāḥ citrarathaḥ saurya varcasaḥ vatsaḥ āsīt puṣkara parṇam pātram   tām vasu ruciḥ saurya varcasaḥ adhok tām puṇyam eva gandham adhok    tam puṇyam gandham gandharva apsarasaḥ upa jīvanti puṇya gandhiḥ upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: It went forth. It came to the Gandharvas and Apsarases. The Gandharvas and Apsarases invoked it, saying, 'Come hither, O sweet scent!' Citraratha, of the Sûrya-Varcas race, was its calf; the lotus leaf was the vessel. Vasu-ruchî, of the Sûrya-Varcas race, milked it. He milked out the sweet scent. The Gandharvas and Apsarases live on that sweet scent. He who knows thus becomes sweet-smelling and fit to be lived on.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā itarajanān āgacchat tām itarajanāḥ upāhvayanta tirodhaḥ ehi iti / tasyāḥ kuberaḥ vaiśravaṇaḥ vatsaḥ āsīt āma pātram pātram / tām rajata nābhiḥ kaberakaḥ adhok tām tirodhām eva adhok / tām tirodhām a tirajanā pitaraḥ upa jīvanti tiras dhatte sarvam pāpmānam upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā itarajanān āgacchat tām itarajanāḥ upāhvayanta tirodhaḥ ehi iti  / tasyāḥ kuberaḥ vaiśravaṇaḥ vatsaḥ āsīt āma pātram pātram  / tām rajata nābhiḥ kaberakaḥ adhok tām tirodhām eva adhok      tām tirodhām a tirajanā pitaraḥ upa jīvanti tiras dhatte sarvam pāpmānam upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: She went forth, and came to the other people. The other people called to her, 'Come hither, O Tîrîdhâ.' Her calf was Kubera Vaishravana, her vessel was a vessel of unbaked clay. Rajatânâbha Kabera cut her. He cut Tîrîdhâ. The other people, the Fathers, live on that Tîrîdhâ. He hides all evil. He becomes fit to be lived on by him who knows this.

original: sā ud akrāmat sā sarpān āgacchat tām sarpāḥ upāhvayanta viṣavatī ehi iti / tasyāḥ takṣakaḥ vaiśaleyaḥ vatsaḥ āsīt alābu pātram pātram / tām dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ airāvataḥ adhok tām viṣam eva adhok / tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda / / tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda / / tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda / / tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa
analyzed: sā ud akrāmat sā sarpān āgacchat tām sarpāḥ upāhvayanta viṣavatī ehi iti   tasyāḥ takṣakaḥ vaiśaleyaḥ vatsaḥ āsīt alābu pātram pātram   tām dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ airāvataḥ adhok tām viṣam eva adhok    tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda      tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda       tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa jīvanti upajīvanīyaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda       tat viṣam sarvāḥ upa j
translated: It went forth. It came to the snakes. The snakes called to it, 'Come hither, thou that hast poison.' Its calf was Takshaka, the son of Vaisalin, its vessel was a gourd. Dhritarashtra, the son of Airavata, milked it. He milked out poison. On that poison all creatures live. He becomes an object of support who knows thus.

original: tat yasmai evam viduṣe alābunā abhiṣiñcet pratyāhanyāt //
analyzed: tat yasmai evam viduṣe alābunā abhiṣiñcet pratyāhanyāt
translated: He who would sprinkle with a gourd for one who knows thus would strike back.

original: na ca pratyāhanyāt manasā tvā pratyāhanmi iti pratyāhanyāt //
analyzed: na ca pratyāhanyāt manasā tvā pratyāhanmi iti pratyāhanyāt
translated: He should not strike back. 'With the mind I strike thee back,' thus he should strike back.

original: yat pratyāhanti viṣam eva tat pratyāhanti //
analyzed: yat pratyāhanti viṣam eva tat pratyāhanti
translated: When he strikes back, he strikes back poison.

original: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ antarikṣāt samudrāt agneḥ vātāt madhukaśāḥ hi jajñe / tām cāyitvā amṛtam vasānām hṛdbhiḥ prajāḥ prati nandanti sarvāḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ antarikṣāt samudrāt agneḥ vātāt madhukaśāḥ hi jajñe    tām cāyitvā amṛtam vasānām hṛdbhiḥ prajāḥ prati nandanti sarvāḥ  /
translated: From heaven, from earth, from air's mid-region, from sea, from Agni, from the wind was born the sweet-voiced Maid. All creatures, when they see her, clothed in immortality, rejoice with glad hearts.

original: mahat payaḥ viśva rūpam asyāḥ samudrasya tvota retaḥ āhuḥ / yatas aiti madhukaśā rarāṇā tat prāṇaḥ tat amṛtam niviṣṭam /
analyzed: mahat payaḥ viśva rūpam asyāḥ samudrasya tvota retaḥ āhuḥ   yatas aiti madhukaśā rarāṇā tat prāṇaḥ tat amṛtam niviṣṭam  /
translated: They call her the great milk of universal form, the seed of the ocean. Thence comes the sweet-voiced Maid, rejoicing. Therein is breath and immortality established.

original: paśyanti asyāḥ caritam pṛthivyām pṛthak naraḥ bahudhā mīmāṃsamānāḥ / agneḥ vātāt madhukaśāḥ hi jajñe marutām ugrā naptiḥ /
analyzed: paśyanti asyāḥ caritam pṛthivyām pṛthak naraḥ bahudhā mīmāṃsamānāḥ   agneḥ vātāt madhukaśāḥ hi jajñe marutām ugrā naptiḥ  /
translated: Men on the earth, beholding her, in many a way discuss her varied course. From Agni, from the wind was born the sweet-voiced Maid, the Maruts' mighty daughter.

original: mātā ādityānām duhitā vasūnām prāṇaḥ prajānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ / hiraṇya varṇā madhu kaśā ghṛtācī mahān bhargaḥ carati martyeṣu /
analyzed: mātā ādityānām duhitā vasūnām prāṇaḥ prajānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ    hiraṇya varṇā madhu kaśā ghṛtācī mahān bhargaḥ carati martyeṣu  /
translated: She is the mother of Âdityas, the daughter of the Vasus, the breath of living creatures, the navel of immortality. She, golden-hued, sweet-voiced, rich in ghee, a mighty light, moves among mortals.

original: madhoḥ kaśām ajanayanta devāḥ tasyāḥ garbhaḥ abhavat viśva rūpaḥ / tam jātam taruṇam piparti mātā sa jātaḥ viśvā bhuvanā vi caṣṭe /
analyzed: madhoḥ kaśām ajanayanta devāḥ tasyāḥ garbhaḥ abhavat viśva rūpaḥ   tam jātam taruṇam piparti mātā sa jātaḥ viśvā bhuvanā vi caṣṭe  /
translated: The Gods have generated the sweet-voiced Maid. Her universal form was in her womb. The mother nourishes the babe when he is born, the youngling. When born he looks upon all living creatures.

original: kaḥ tam pra veda kaḥ u tam ciketa yaḥ asyāḥ hṛdaḥ kalaśaḥ soma dhānaḥ akṣitaḥ / brahmā sumedhāḥ saḥ asmin madeta /
analyzed: kaḥ tam pra veda kaḥ u tam ciketa yaḥ asyāḥ hṛdaḥ kalaśaḥ soma dhānaḥ akṣitaḥ   brahmā sumedhāḥ saḥ asmin madeta  /
translated: Who knows him, who understands him, who knows the imperishable jar of her heart, the Soma-receptacle? The Brahman, the wise one, he is the inspirer of this joy.

original: sa tau pra veda saḥ u tau ciketa yau asyāḥ stanau sahasra dhārau akṣitau / ūrjam duhāte an apasphurantau /
analyzed: sa tau pra veda saḥ u tau ciketa yau asyāḥ stanau sahasra dhārau akṣitau    ūrjam duhāte an apasphurantau  /
translated: He knows them, he understands them, who knows her two breasts with a thousand streams, the imperishable ones. They yield strength, they cause it to flow, without fail.

original: hiṅkarikratī bṛhatī vayodhāḥ uccairghoṣā abhyeti yā vratam / trīn gharmān abhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyum payate payobhiḥ /
analyzed: hiṅkarikratī bṛhatī vayaḥ dhāḥ uccairghoṣā abhyeti yā vratam   trīn gharmān abhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyum payate payobhiḥ  /
translated: The loud-sounding one, the great one, the life-giver, who goes to the vow with a loud sound, the one who lows to the three cauldrons, she melts the fat and fills with milk.

original: yām āpīnām upasīdanti āpaḥ śākvarāḥ vṛṣabhāḥ ye svarājaḥ / te varṣanti te varṣayanti tat vide kāmam ūrjam āpaḥ //
analyzed: yām āpīnām upasīdanti āpaḥ śākvarāḥ vṛṣabhāḥ ye svarājaḥ   te varṣanti te varṣayanti tat vide kāmam ūrjam āpaḥ  /
translated: The waters, the bulls, the self-ruling ones, who approach the swollen one, they rain, they cause to rain. She knows that desire, the strength, the waters.

original: stanayitnuḥ te vāc prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmam kṣipasi bhūmyām adhi / agneḥ vātāt madhu kaśā hi jajñe marutām ugrā naptiḥ // //
analyzed: stanayitnuḥ te vāc prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmam kṣipasi bhūmyām adhi    agneḥ vātāt madhu kaśā hi jajñe marutām ugrā naptiḥ
translated: Your voice, O Prajapati, is the thunder. You, the bull, cast forth strength upon the earth. The honey-whip was born from Agni and Vata, the fierce granddaughter of the Maruts.

original: yathā somaḥ prātaḥsavane aśvinoḥ bhavati priyaḥ / eva me aśvinā varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ prātaḥsavane aśvinoḥ bhavati priyaḥ   eva me aśvinā varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām  /
translated: Just as Soma becomes dear to the Ashvins at the morning pressing, so, O Ashvins, may splendor be established in me.

original: yathā somaḥ dvitīye savane indra agnyoḥ bhavati priyaḥ / eva me indra agnī varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ dvitīye savane indra agnyoḥ bhavati priyaḥ   eva me indra agnī varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām  /
translated: So, O Indra and Agni, may splendour be bestowed in me.🔽As Soma is dear to the Ribhus at the third pressing,

original: yathā somaḥ tṛtīye savane ṛbhūṇām bhavati priyaḥ / eva me ṛbhavaḥ varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ tṛtīye savane ṛbhūṇām bhavati priyaḥ   eva me ṛbhavaḥ varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām  /
translated: So, O Ribhus, may splendour be bestowed in me.

original: madhu janiṣīya madhu vaṃsiṣīya / payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā /
analyzed: madhu janiṣīya madhu vaṃsiṣīya   payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā  /
translated: Beget honey, O honey-maker, produce honey. I have come, O Agni, with milk. Unite me with splendour.

original: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā / vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā   vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: Unite me, O Agni, with splendour, with offspring, with life. May the gods know this of me, may Indra know it with the Rishis.🔽As the honey-makers collect honey on honey,

original: yathā madhu madhukṛtaḥ saṃbharanti madhau adhi / eva me aśvinā varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām /
analyzed: yathā madhu madhukṛtaḥ saṃbharanti madhau adhi   / eva me aśvinā varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām  /
translated: So, O Asvins, may splendour be bestowed in me.🔽As the bees besmear this honey on honey,

original: yathā makṣāḥ idam madhu nyañjanti madhau adhi / eva me aśvinā varcaḥ tejaḥ balam ojaḥ ca dhriyatām //
analyzed: yathā makṣāḥ idam madhu nyañjanti madhau adhi   / eva me aśvinā varcaḥ tejaḥ balam ojaḥ ca dhriyatām  /
translated: So, O Asvins, may splendour, energy, strength, and vigour be bestowed in me.🔽The honey that is in the mountains, in the hills, in the cows, in the horses,

original: yat giriṣu parvateṣu goṣu aśveṣu yat madhu / surāyām sicyamānāyām yat tatra madhu tat mayi //
analyzed: yat giriṣu parvateṣu goṣu aśveṣu yat madhu    surāyām sicyamānāyām yat tatra madhu tat mayi  /
translated: The honey that is in the flowing Soma, may that honey be in me.

original: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā madhunā aṅktam śubhaḥ patī / yathā varcasvatīm vācam āvadāni janām anu /
analyzed: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā madhunā aṅktam śubhaḥ patī   yathā varcasvatīm vācam āvadāni janām anu  /
translated: O Asvins, Lords of splendour, anoint me with the honey of the Sârasvata plant, That I may speak a speech full of life and vigour among the people.

original: stanayitnuḥ te vāc prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmam kṣipasi bhūmyām divi / tām paśavaḥ upa jīvanti sarve tena u seṣam ūrjam piparti //
analyzed: stanayitnuḥ te vāc prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmam kṣipasi bhūmyām divi   tām paśavaḥ upa jīvanti sarve tena u seṣam ūrjam piparti  /
translated: Thy voice, O Prajâpati, is the thunder; thou, the strong one, castest thy vigour on the earth and in the sky. All creatures live by that; thereby thou fillest the residue with nourishment.

original: pṛthivī daṇḍaḥ antarikṣam garbhaḥ dyauḥ kaśā vidyut prakaśaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ binduḥ //
analyzed: pṛthivī daṇḍaḥ antarikṣam garbhaḥ dyauḥ kaśā vidyut prakaśaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ binduḥ
translated: The earth is thy staff, the atmosphere thy womb, the heaven thy whip, the lightning thy golden-hued flash, the drop.

original: yaḥ vai kaśāyāḥ sapta madhūni veda madhumān bhavati / brāhmaṇaḥ ca rājā ca dhenuḥ ca anaḍvān ca vrīhiḥ ca yavaḥ ca madhu saptamam /
analyzed: yaḥ vai kaśāyāḥ sapta madhūni veda madhumān bhavati   brāhmaṇaḥ ca rājā ca dhenuḥ ca anaḍvān ca vrīhiḥ ca yavaḥ ca madhu saptamam  /
translated: He who knows the seven kinds of honey in the whip becomes rich in honey. The Brahman, the king, the cow, the ox, the rice, the barley, and the honey are the seventh.

original: madhumān bhavati madhumat asya āhāryam bhavati / madhumataḥ lokān jayati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: madhumān bhavati madhumat asya āhāryam bhavati   madhumataḥ lokān jayati yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: He becomes rich in honey; his food becomes rich in honey; he wins worlds rich in honey, who knows thus.

original: yat vīdhre stanayati prajāpatiḥ eva tat prajābhyaḥ prādur bhavati / tasmāt prācīnopavītaḥ tiṣṭhe prajāpate anu mā budhyasva iti / anu enam prajāḥ anu prajāpatiḥ budhyate yaḥ evam veda / / tasmāt prācīnopavītaḥ tiṣṭhe prajāpate anu mā budhyasva iti / anu enam prajāḥ anu prajāpatiḥ budhyate yaḥ evam veda / / taḥ evam veda / / tat evam veda / / tat evam veda / / tat evam veda / / tat evam veda / / tat evam veda / / tat evam veda / / tat
analyzed: yat vīdhre stanayati prajāpatiḥ eva tat prajābhyaḥ prādur bhavati     tasmāt prācīnopavītaḥ tiṣṭhe prajāpate anu mā budhyasva iti   anu enam prajāḥ anu prajāpatiḥ budhyate yaḥ evam veda      tasmāt prācīnopavītaḥ tiṣṭhe prajāpate anu mā budhyasva iti    anu enam prajāḥ anu prajāpatiḥ budhyate yaḥ evam veda        tat evam veda       tat evam veda       tat evam veda      tat evam veda      tat evam veda      tat evam veda      tat evam veda      tat evam veda
translated: When it thunders in the clouds, then Prajapati appears to the creatures. Therefore, standing with the sacred thread over the right shoulder, he should say, Follow me, O Prajapati. The creatures and Prajapati follow him who knows thus.

original: sapatna hanam ṛṣabham ghṛtena kāmam śikṣāmi haviṣā ājyena / nīcais sapatnān mama padaya tvam abhiṣṭutaḥ mahatā vīryeṇa /
analyzed: sapatna hanam ṛṣabham ghṛtena kāmam śikṣāmi haviṣā ājyena   nīcais sapatnān mama padaya tvam abhiṣṭutaḥ mahatā vīryeṇa  /
translated: The bull that slays rivals, I instruct with ghee, with sacrificial oblation, according to my desire. With great strength, extolled, make my rivals low.

original: yat me manasaḥ na priyam cakṣuṣaḥ yat me babhasti na abhinandati / tat duṣvapnyam prati muñcāmi sapatne kāmam stutvā ud aham bhideyam //
analyzed: yat me manasaḥ na priyam cakṣuṣaḥ yat me babhasti na abhinandati    tat duṣvapnyam prati muñcāmi sapatne kāmam stutvā ud aham bhideyam  /
translated: Whatever is not pleasing to my mind, whatever does not delight my eye, that evil dream I release upon my rival. Having praised my desire, I would break it up.

original: duṣvapnyam kāma duritam ca kama aprajastām asvagatām avartim / ugraḥ īśānaḥ prati muñca tasmin yaḥ asmabhyam aṃhūraṇā cikitsāt /
analyzed: duṣvapnyam kāma duritam ca kama aprajastām asvagatām avartim    ugraḥ īśānaḥ prati muñca tasmin yaḥ asmabhyam aṃhūraṇā cikitsāt  /
translated: The fierce and mighty One cast back upon him who seeks to injure us and wishes us no good.🔽Drive them away, O Kāma, drive them far away, those who are my rivals. Let them turn back again.

original: nudasva kāma pra nudasva kāma āvartim yantu mama ye sapatnāḥ / teṣām nuttānām adhamā tamāṃsi agne vāstūni niḥ daha tvam /
analyzed: nudasva kāma pra nudasva kāma āvartim yantu mama ye sapatnāḥ   teṣām nuttānām adhamā tamāṃsi agne vāstūni niḥ daha tvam  /
translated: Let them, thus driven back, sink down into the deepest darkness. Burn up their homes, O Agni.🔽That daughter of thine, Kāma, is called the milch-cow, the Vāk, the Virāj, whom the sages call.

original: sā te kāma duhitā dhenuḥ ucyate yām āhuḥ vācam kavayaḥ virājam / tayā sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pari enān prāṇaḥ paśavaḥ jīvanam vṛṇaktu //
analyzed: sā te kāma duhitā dhenuḥ ucyate yām āhuḥ vācam kavayaḥ virājam    tayā sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pari enān prāṇaḥ paśavaḥ jīvanam vṛṇaktu  /
translated: With her surround my rivals on all sides. Let my breath, cattle, and life surround them.🔽By the desire of Indra, by the will of King Varuṇa, by the might of Viṣṇu, by the impulse of Savitar,

original: kāmasya indrasya varuṇasya rājñaḥ viṣṇoḥ balena savituḥ savena / agneḥ hotreṇa pra nude sapatnām chambī iva nāvam udakeṣu dhīraḥ /
analyzed: kāmasya indrasya varuṇasya rājñaḥ viṣṇoḥ balena savituḥ savena    agneḥ hotreṇa pra nude sapatnām chambī iva nāvam udakeṣu dhīraḥ  /
translated: By the priesthood of Agni, I drive away my rivals, like a skilful man drives a boat through the water.🔽My desire, my strong desire, my overseer, my steed, let him make me free from rivals.

original: adhyakṣaḥ vājī mama kāmaḥ ugraḥ kṛṇotu mahyam asapatnam eva / viśve devāḥ mama nātham bhavantu sarve devāḥ havam ā yantu me imam /
analyzed: adhyakṣaḥ vājī mama kāmaḥ ugraḥ kṛṇotu mahyam asapatnam eva   viśve devāḥ mama nātham bhavantu sarve devāḥ havam ā yantu me imam  /
translated: May all the Gods be my protectors. May all the Gods come hither to this my invocation.

original: idam ājyam ghṛtavat juṣāṇāḥ kāma jyeṣṭhāḥ iha mādayadhvam / kṛṇvantaḥ mahyam asapatnam eva /
analyzed: idam ājyam ghṛtavat juṣāṇāḥ kāma jyeṣṭhāḥ iha mādayadhvam   kṛṇvantaḥ mahyam asapatnam eva  /
translated: Accepting this ghee-rich oblation, O gods, be joyful here, with desire as your foremost. Granting me freedom from enemies.

original: indra agnī kāma sa ratham hi bhūtvā nīcais sapatnān mama pādayāthaḥ / teṣām pannānām adhamā tamāṃsi agne vāstūni anunirdaha tvam /
analyzed: indra agnī kāma sa ratham hi bhūtvā nīcais sapatnān mama pādayāthaḥ   teṣām pannānām adhamā tamāṃsi agne vāstūni anunirdaha tvam  /
translated: O Indra and Agni, becoming the chariot of desire, you two should bring down my enemies to a low position. O Agni, after those fallen ones have gone to the lowest darkness, burn down their abodes.

original: jahi tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ andhā tamāṃsi ava pādaya enān / nirindriyāḥ arasāḥ santu sarve mā te jīviṣuḥ katamat cana ahar // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // santu sarve mā te jīviṣuḥ katamat cana ahar // // //
analyzed: jahi tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ andhā tamāṃsi ava pādaya enān   nirindriyāḥ arasāḥ santu sarve mā te jīviṣuḥ katamat cana ahar                                       santu sarve      santu sarve mā te jīviṣuḥ katamat cana ahar                                       santu sarve mā te jīviṣuḥ katamat cana ahar
translated: O Kāma, kill my enemies. Cast them into blinding darkness. Let all of them be powerless and lifeless. Let none of them live even for a single day.

original: avadhīt kāmaḥ mama ye sapatnāḥ urum lokam akarat mahyam edhatum / mahyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ mahyam ṣaṭ urvīḥ ghṛtam ā vahantu //
analyzed: avadhīt kāmaḥ mama ye sapatnāḥ urum lokam akarat mahyam edhatum    mahyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ mahyam ṣaṭ urvīḥ ghṛtam ā vahantu  /
translated: Kāma has killed my enemies. He has made a vast world for me to prosper. Let the four quarters bow to me. Let the six expanses bring ghee to me.

original: te adharāñcaḥ pra plavantām chinnā nauḥ iva bandhanāt / na sāyaka praṇuttānām punar asti nivartanam /
analyzed: te adharāñcaḥ pra plavantām chinnā nauḥ iva bandhanāt   na sāyaka praṇuttānām punar asti nivartanam  /
translated: Let them fall downward, like a boat cut from its moorings. For those struck down by arrows, there is no turning back.

original: agniḥ yavaḥ indraḥ yavaḥ somaḥ yavaḥ / yava yāvānaḥ devāḥ yavayantu enam /
analyzed: agniḥ yavaḥ indraḥ yavaḥ somaḥ yavaḥ   yava yāvānaḥ devāḥ yavayantu enam
translated: Agni is the corn, Indra is the corn, Soma is the corn. May the corn-loving Gods drive him to the corn.

original: a sarva vīraḥ caratu praṇuttaḥ dveṣyaḥ mitrānām parivargyaḥ svānām / uta pṛthivyām ava syanti vidyutaḥ ugraḥ vaḥ devaḥ pra mṛṇat sapatnān /
analyzed: a sarva vīraḥ caratu praṇuttaḥ dveṣyaḥ mitrānām parivargyaḥ svānām    uta pṛthivyām ava syanti vidyutaḥ ugraḥ vaḥ devaḥ pra mṛṇat sapatnān  /
translated: Let him go forth, bereft of all his people, despised by friends, an outcast from his kin. Let the lightnings flash upon the earth, and let your fierce God drive your foes away.

original: cyutā ca iyam bṛhatī acyutā ca vidyut bibharti stanayitnūn ca sarvān / udyan ādityaḥ draviṇena tejasā nīcais sapatnān nudatām me sahasvān //
analyzed: cyutā ca iyam bṛhatī acyutā ca vidyut bibharti stanayitnūn ca sarvān    udyan ādityaḥ draviṇena tejasā nīcais sapatnān nudatām me sahasvān  /
translated: This lightning, great and mighty, bears all the lightnings and the thunderbolts. Let the rising sun, with wealth and splendour, drive my foes away, and let the mighty one prevail.

original: yat te kāma śarma tri varūtham udbhu brahma varma vitatam an ativyādhyam kṛtam / tena sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pari enān prāṇaḥ paśavaḥ jīvanam vṛṇaktu //
analyzed: yat te kāma śarma tri varūtham udbhu brahma varma vitatam an ativyādhyam kṛtam    tena sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pari enān prāṇaḥ paśavaḥ jīvanam vṛṇaktu  /
translated: O Kāma, with that threefold shelter of thine, that Brahman armour, spread out and invincible, which thou hast, therewith encompass my foes on every side. Let my breath, my cattle, and my life encompass them on every side.

original: yena devāḥ asurān prāṇudanta yena indraḥ dasyūn adhamam tamaḥ nināya / tena tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ tān asmāt lokāt pra nudasva dūram /
analyzed: yena devāḥ asurān prāṇudanta yena indraḥ dasyūn adhamam tamaḥ nināya   tena tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ tān asmāt lokāt pra nudasva dūram  /
translated: With that wherewith the Gods drove away the Asuras, and Indra the Dasyus to the lowest darkness, with that, O Kāma, drive thou my foes far away from this world.

original: yathā devāḥ asurān prāṇudanta yathā indraḥ dasyūn adhamam tamaḥ babādhe / tathā tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ tān asmāt lokāt pra nudasva dūram /
analyzed: yathā devāḥ asurān prāṇudanta yathā indraḥ dasyūn adhamam tamaḥ babādhe   tathā tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ tān asmāt lokāt pra nudasva dūram  /
translated: As the Gods drove away the Asuras, as Indra smote the Dasyus down into the lowest darkness,🔽So, O thou Kāma, drive my rivals far away from this world and from this place.

original: kāmaḥ jajñe prathamaḥ na enam devāḥ āpuḥ pitaraḥ na martyāḥ / tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛnomi //
analyzed: kāmaḥ jajñe prathamaḥ na enam devāḥ āpuḥ pitaraḥ na martyāḥ   tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛnomi  /
translated: Kāma was born the first. The Gods have not obtained him, nor the Fathers, nor men.🔽Therefore thou art greater than all, great for ever. To thee, O Kāma, I offer this adoration.🔽As far as heaven and earth extend in compass, as far as waters spread, as far as Agni,

original: yāvatī dyāvāpṛthivī varimṇā yāvat āpaḥ siṣyaduḥ yāvat agniḥ / tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi // tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi // tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi // tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi // tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi // tatas tvam a
analyzed: yāvatī dyāvāpṛthivī varimṇā yāvat āpaḥ siṣyaduḥ yāvat agniḥ   tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi   tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi    tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi    tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi     tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi        tatas tvam asi
translated: Therefore thou art greater than all, great for ever. To thee, O Kāma, I offer this adoration.

original: yāvatīḥ diśaḥ pradiśaḥ viṣūcīḥ yāvatīḥ āśāḥ abhicakṣaṇāḥ divaḥ / tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi //
analyzed: yāvatīḥ diśaḥ pradiśaḥ viṣūcīḥ yāvatīḥ āśāḥ abhicakṣaṇāḥ divaḥ    tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi  /
translated: From all of these thou art the greater, mighty in all things: to thee, O Kāma, I offer this my homage.🔽As many bees there are, and gnats, and gadflies, as many flies and creeping things that haunt the trees,

original: yāvatīḥ bhṛṅgāḥ jatvaḥ kurūravaḥ yāvatīḥ vaghāḥ vṛkṣa sarpyaḥ babhūvuḥ / tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi //
analyzed: yāvatīḥ bhṛṅgāḥ jatvaḥ kurūravaḥ yāvatīḥ vaghāḥ vṛkṣa sarpyaḥ babhūvuḥ   tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi  /
translated: From all of these thou art the greater, mighty in all things: to thee, O Kāma, I offer this my homage.🔽Thou art greater than the standing, than the sitting, than the sleeping, than the waking, than the sea, O Kāma, O Manyu.

original: jyāyān nimiṣataḥ asi tiṣṭhataḥ jyāyān samudrāt asi kāma manyo / tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛnomi //
analyzed: jyāyān nimiṣataḥ asi tiṣṭhataḥ jyāyān samudrāt asi kāma manyo   tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛnomi  /
translated: From all of these thou art the greater, mighty in all things: to thee, O Kāma, I offer this my homage.🔽No wind at all attains to Kāma, no fire, no sun, no moon.

original: na vai vātaḥ cana kāmam āpnoti na agniḥ sūryaḥ na uta candramāḥ / tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi //
analyzed: na vai vātaḥ cana kāmam āpnoti na agniḥ sūryaḥ na uta candramāḥ   tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi  /
translated: From all of these thou art the greater, mighty in all things: to thee, O Kāma, I offer this my homage.

analyzed: upamitām pratimitām atho parimitām uta  / śālāyāḥ viśva vārāyāḥ naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi  /
translated: The measured, the counter-measured, and the measured round about, The fastenings of the house of all-sustaining Visva we loose.

original: yat te naddham viśva vāre pāśaḥ granthiḥ ca yaḥ kṛtaḥ / bṛhaspatiḥ iva aham balam vācā vi sraṃsayāmi tat /
analyzed: yat te naddham viśva vāre pāśaḥ granthiḥ ca yaḥ kṛtaḥ   bṛhaspatiḥ iva aham balam vācā vi sraṃsayāmi tat  /
translated: The bond that binds thee, O all-sustaining one, the noose and the knot that is made, Like Brihaspati I loosen with speech that power.

original: ā yayāma sam babarha granthīn cakāra te dṛḍhān / parūṃṣi vidvām śastāḥ iva indreṇa vi cṛtāmasi //
analyzed: ā yayāma sam babarha granthīn cakāra te dṛḍhān   parūṃṣi vidvām śastāḥ iva indreṇa vi cṛtāmasi  /
translated: We loosen the bonds which they have drawn together, the knots which they have made so fast. We loosen them as 'twere with a sharp-edged knife, as 'twere with Indra's aid.🔽The bonds of thy bamboos, of thy wicker-work, of thy grass, of thy straw,🔽Of thy wings, O thou all-sustaining one, we loosen and untie.

original: vaṃśānām te nahanānām prāṇāhasya tṛṇasya ca / pakṣāṇām viśva vāre te naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi //🔽saṃdaṃśānām paladānām pariṣvañjalyasya ca / idam mānasya patnyā naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi //

translated: The bonds of thy pinions, of thy cross-bars, of thy enclosing-sticks,🔽Of thy hearth, O wife of Man, we loosen and untie.🔽The pegs which they have driven in for thee, O house, to make thee stand,

original: yāni te antar śikyāni ābedhuḥ raṇyāya kam / pra te tāni cṛtāmasi śivā mānasya patni naḥ uddhitā tanve bhava /

translated: We draw them out for thee: be thou propitious to our bodies, O wife of Man. Be thou raised up.

original: yaḥ tvā śāle nimimāya saṃjabhāra vanaspatīn / prajāyai cakre tvā śāle parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ /🔽namaḥ tasmai namaḥ dātre śālāpataye ca kṛṇmaḥ / namaḥ agnaye pracarate puruṣāya ca te namaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā śāle nimimāya saṃjabhāra vanaspatīn   prajāyai cakre tvā śāle parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ  / namaḥ tasmai namaḥ dātre śālāpataye ca kṛṇmaḥ   namaḥ agnaye pracarate puruṣāya ca te namaḥ  /
translated: the house hath Prajapati, the Lord of creatures, made for offspring.🔽To him we offer worship, and to the giver of the house, and to the lord of the house.🔽To Agni who moveth we offer worship, and to the man we offer worship.

original: gobhyaḥ aśvebhyaḥ namaḥ yat śālāyām vijāyate / vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśān cṛtāmasi //
analyzed: gobhyaḥ aśvebhyaḥ namaḥ yat śālāyām vijāyate   vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśān cṛtāmasi  /
translated: To the cows and to the horses we offer worship, that which is born in the house.🔽In offspring and in progeny we unloose thy bonds.

original: agnim antar chādayasi puruṣān paśubhiḥ saha / vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśān cṛtāmasi //
analyzed: agnim antar chādayasi puruṣān paśubhiḥ saha    vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśān cṛtāmasi  /
translated: Thou shuttest in the fire, and men together with the cattle. In the house that is full of children and of wealth, we loose the bonds that held thee.

original: antarā dyām ca pṛthivīm ca yat vyacaḥ tena śālām prati gṛhṇāmi te imām / yat antarikṣam rajasaḥ vimānam tat kṛṇve aham udaram śevadhibhyaḥ / tena śālām prati gṛhṇāmi tasmai /
analyzed: antarā dyām ca pṛthivīm ca yat vyacaḥ tena śālām prati gṛhṇāmi te imām   yat antarikṣam rajasaḥ vimānam tat kṛṇve aham udaram śevadhibhyaḥ   tena śālām prati gṛhṇāmi tasmai  /
translated: The space that is between the heaven and the earth, with that I take possession of this house for thee. The region of the air that is beyond the clouds, that I make a belly for the household gods. With that I take possession of the house for him.

original: ūrjasvatī payasvatī pṛthivyām nimitā mitā / viśva annam bibhratī śāle mā hiṃsīḥ pratigṛhṇataḥ /
analyzed: ūrjasvatī payasvatī pṛthivyām nimitā mitā    viśva annam bibhratī śāle mā hiṃsīḥ pratigṛhṇataḥ  /
translated: Rich in food and in milk, built on the earth, measured and marked out. Bearing all food, O house, do no harm to him who receives thee.

original: tṛṇaiḥ āvṛtā paladān vasānā rātriḥ iva śālā jagataḥ niveśanī / mitā pṛthivyām tiṣṭhasi hastinī iva padvatī /
analyzed: tṛṇaiḥ āvṛtā paladān vasānā rātriḥ iva śālā jagataḥ niveśanī   mitā pṛthivyām tiṣṭhasi hastinī iva padvatī  /
translated: Covered with grass, clothed in dust, the house is the resting-place of the moving world, as it were the night. Measured on the earth, thou standest like a four-footed elephant.

original: iṭasya te vi cṛtāmi apinaddham aporṇuvan / varuṇena samubjitām mitraḥ prātar vi ubjatu //
analyzed: iṭasya te vi cṛtāmi apinaddham aporṇuvan    varuṇena samubjitām mitraḥ prātar vi ubjatu  /
translated: I untie the knot of the reed, I loosen that which is bound. May Varuṇa, who hath bound it, in the morning loosen it again.

original: brahmaṇā śālām nimitām kavibhiḥ nimitām mitām / indra agnī rakṣatām śālām amṛtau somyam sadaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇā śālām nimitām kavibhiḥ nimitām mitām   indra agnī rakṣatām śālām amṛtau somyam sadaḥ  /
translated: The house that is built by prayer, that is built by the sages, may Indra and Agni, the immortal ones, guard the house, the seat of Soma.

analyzed: kulāye adhi kulāyam kośe kośaḥ samubjitaḥ    tatra martaḥ vi jāyate yasmāt viśvam prajāyate   tatra martaḥ vi jāyate yasmāt viśvam prajāyate           vi jāyate yasmāt viśvam prajāyate           vi jāyate yasmāt viśvam prajāyate            vi jāyate yasmāt viśvam prajāyate
translated: There the mortal is born, whence all things are born.🔽She who is built with two wings, four wings, six wings,

original: yā dvi pakṣā catuṣpakṣā ṣaṣ pakṣā yā nimīyate / aṣṭāpakṣām daśa pakṣām śālām mānasya patnīm agniḥ garbhaḥ iva ā śaye /
analyzed: yā dvi pakṣā catuṣpakṣā ṣaṣ pakṣā yā nimīyate   aṣṭāpakṣām daśa pakṣām śālām mānasya patnīm agniḥ garbhaḥ iva ā śaye  /
translated: The hall with eight wings, ten wings, the wife of Manu, Agni lies within her as an embryo.

original: pratīcīm tvā pratīcīnaḥ śāle praimi a hiṃsatīm / agniḥ hi antar āpaḥ ca ṛtasya prathamāḥ dvār /
analyzed: pratīcīm tvā pratīcīnaḥ śāle praimi a hiṃsatīm   agniḥ hi antar āpaḥ ca ṛtasya prathamāḥ dvār  /
translated: I have embraced thee, O Pratiça, the hall, with my back, the harmless one. For Agni is within, and the waters are the first doors of holy order.

original: imāḥ āpaḥ pra bharāmi a yakṣmāḥ yakṣma nāśanīḥ / gṛhān upa pra sīdāmi amṛtena saha agninā /
analyzed: imāḥ āpaḥ pra bharāmi a yakṣmāḥ yakṣma nāśanīḥ   gṛhān upa pra sīdāmi amṛtena saha agninā  /
translated: I bring these waters, free from sickness, that destroy all sickness. With the immortal Agni I enter the house.

original: mā naḥ pāśam prati mucaḥ guruḥ bhāraḥ laghuḥ bhava / vadhūm iva tvā śāle yatrakāmam bharāmasi //🔽prācyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ pāśam prati mucaḥ guruḥ bhāraḥ laghuḥ bhava   vadhūm iva tvā śāle yatrakāmam bharāmasi  / prācyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: Loosen not the bond that binds us: heavy is the burden, make it light. As a bride, O house, we bear thee where we list.🔽To the house of the eastern region, homage to the greatness, Hail! to the Gods who deserve the Hail!

original: dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ //🔽pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ //
analyzed: dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ  pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: To the house of the southern region, homage to the greatness, Hail! to the Gods who deserve the Hail!🔽To the house of the western region, homage to the greatness, Hail! to the Gods who deserve the Hail!

original: udīcyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ //🔽dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ //
analyzed: udīcyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ  dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: To the house of the northern region, homage to the greatness, Hail! to the Gods who deserve the Hail!🔽To the house of the region that stands firm, homage to the greatness, Hail! to the Gods who deserve the Hail!

original: ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ //
analyzed: ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: To the house of the upper region, homage to the greatness, Hail! to the Gods who deserve the Hail!

original: sāhasraḥ tveṣaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ payasvān viśvā rūpāṇi vakṣaṇāsu bibhrat / bhadram dātre yajamānāya śīkṣan bārhaspatyaḥ usriyaḥ tantum ātān //
analyzed: sāhasraḥ tveṣaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ payasvān viśvā rūpāṇi vakṣaṇāsu bibhrat   bhadram dātre yajamānāya śīkṣan bārhaspatyaḥ usriyaḥ tantum ātān  /
translated: Benefiting the giver and the sacrificer, the bull of Brhaspati, the domestic animal, hath stretched the thread.🔽He who hath become the image of the waters, the lord of all, like the goddess Earth,

original: apām yaḥ agne pratimā babhūva prabhūḥ sarvasmai pṛthivī iva devī / pitā vatsānām patiḥ aghnyānām sāhasre poṣe api naḥ kṛṇotu //
analyzed: apām yaḥ agne pratimā babhūva prabhūḥ sarvasmai pṛthivī iva devī    pitā vatsānām patiḥ aghnyānām sāhasre poṣe api naḥ kṛṇotu  /
translated: The father of the calves, the lord of the milch cows, may he in a thousandfold increase favour us.🔽The male, the inward one, the mighty, full of sap, the bull bears the lump of wealth.

original: pumān antarvān sthaviraḥ payasvān vasoḥ kabandham ṛṣabhaḥ bibharti / tam indrāya pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ hutam agniḥ vahatu jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: pumān antarvān sthaviraḥ payasvān vasoḥ kabandham ṛṣabhaḥ bibharti   tam indrāya pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ hutam agniḥ vahatu jātavedāḥ  /
translated: Let Agni bear it to Indra by the paths which the gods travel, the oblation offered in the fire.🔽The father of the calves, the lord of the milch cows, and also the father of the great bellowing bulls,

original: pitā vatsānām patiḥ aghnyānām atho pitā mahatām gargarāṇām / vatsaḥ jarāyu pratidhuk pīyūṣaḥ āmikṣā ghṛtam tat u asya retaḥ /
analyzed: pitā vatsānām patiḥ aghnyānām atho pitā mahatām gargarāṇām    vatsaḥ jarāyu pratidhuk pīyūṣaḥ āmikṣā ghṛtam tat u asya retaḥ  /
translated: The calf, the after-birth, the young shoot, the curds, the ghee, that is his seed.🔽This is the portion of the gods, the lump of the waters, the sap of the plants, of ghee.

original: devānām bhāgaḥ upanāhaḥ eṣaḥ apām rasaḥ oṣadhīnām ghṛtasya / somasya bhakṣam avṛṇīta śakraḥ bṛhan adriḥ abhavat yat śarīram /
analyzed: devānām bhāgaḥ upanāhaḥ eṣaḥ apām rasaḥ oṣadhīnām ghṛtasya   somasya bhakṣam avṛṇīta śakraḥ bṛhan adriḥ abhavat yat śarīram  /
translated: Indra chose the food of Soma. The great mountain became his body.

original: somena pūrṇam kalaśam bibharṣi tvastā rupāṇām janitā paśūnām / śivāḥ te santu prajanvaḥ iha yāḥ imāḥ ni asmabhyam svadhite yaccha yāḥ amūḥ /
analyzed: somena pūrṇam kalaśam bibharṣi tvastā rupāṇām janitā paśūnām    śivāḥ te santu prajanvaḥ iha yāḥ imāḥ ni asmabhyam svadhite yaccha yāḥ amūḥ  /
translated: Thou bearest in thy hand the full-filled jar, thou art the father of all forms, the creator of cattle. Be these thy kindly gifts here, O axe, which are these, and those yonder.

original: ājam bibharti ghṛtam asya retaḥ sāhasraḥ poṣaḥ tam u yajñam āhuḥ / indrasya rūpam ṛṣabhaḥ vasānaḥ saḥ asmān devāḥ śiva aitu dattaḥ /
analyzed: ājam bibharti ghṛtam asya retaḥ sāhasraḥ poṣaḥ tam u yajñam āhuḥ   indrasya rūpam ṛṣabhaḥ vasānaḥ saḥ asmān devāḥ śiva aitu dattaḥ  /
translated: He bears the goat, his seed is ghee, his nourishment is a thousandfold: that sacrifice they call. The bull, wearing the form of Indra, him, O gods, give ye to us, kindly given.

original: indrasya ojaḥ varuṇasya bāhū aśvinoḥ aṃsau marutām iyam kakud / bṛhaspatim saṃbhṛtam etam āhuḥ ye dhīrāsaḥ kavayaḥ ye manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: indrasya ojaḥ varuṇasya bāhū aśvinoḥ aṃsau marutām iyam kakud    bṛhaspatim saṃbhṛtam etam āhuḥ ye dhīrāsaḥ kavayaḥ ye manīṣiṇaḥ  /
translated: The strength of Indra, the arms of Varuna, the shoulders of the Asvins, this hump of the Maruts. Him, Brihaspati, they call collected, those who are wise, the sages, the thoughtful.

original: daivīḥ viśaḥ payasvān ā tanoṣi tvām indram tvām sarasvantam āhuḥ / sahasram saḥ eka mukhā dadāti yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṛṣabham ājuhoti //
analyzed: daivīḥ viśaḥ payasvān ā tanoṣi tvām indram tvām sarasvantam āhuḥ   sahasram saḥ eka mukhā dadāti yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṛṣabham ājuhoti  /
translated: Thou, O milch cow, stretchest out the divine clans. Thee they call Indra, thee Sarasvant. A thousandfold does he give with his mouth who, a Brahman, offers the bull.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ savitā te vayaḥ dadhau tvaṣṭuḥ vāyoḥ pari ātmā te ābhṛtaḥ / antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiḥ te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām / / tvā / antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiḥ te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām / / tvā / antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiḥ te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām // tvā / antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiḥ te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām // tvā / antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiḥ te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ savitā te vayaḥ dadhau tvaṣṭuḥ vāyoḥ pari ātmā te ābhṛtaḥ   antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiḥ te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I offer thee in spirit in the firmament. Let both the heavens and earth be thy two sacrificial strew-grass.

original: yaḥ indraḥ iva deveṣu goṣu eti vivāvadat / tasya ṛṣabhasya aṅgāni brahmā sam stautu bhadrayā /
analyzed: yaḥ indraḥ iva deveṣu goṣu eti vivāvadat    tasya ṛṣabhasya aṅgāni brahmā sam stautu bhadrayā  /
translated: He who, like Indra among the Gods, goes to the kine with loud roar, Let the priest with fair hymn praise the limbs of that bull.

original: pārśve āstām anumatyā bhagasya āstām anūvṛjau / aṣṭhīvantau abravīt mitraḥ mama etau kevalau iti /
analyzed: pārśve āstām anumatyā bhagasya āstām anūvṛjau   aṣṭhīvantau abravīt mitraḥ mama etau kevalau iti
translated: The ribs were of Anumati, the flanks were of Bhaga, the two ribs on the back were of Anu. Mitra said, 'These two ribs are mine alone.'

original: bhasat āsīt ādityānām śroṇī āstām bṛhaspateḥ / pucham vātasya devasya tena dhūnoti oṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: bhasat āsīt ādityānām śroṇī āstām bṛhaspateḥ   pucham vātasya devasya tena dhūnoti oṣadhīḥ  /
translated: The loins were of the Âdityas, the hips were of Brihaspati. The tail is of the God Vâta, wherewith he shakes the plants.

original: gudāḥ āsan sinīvālyāḥ sūryāyāḥ tvacam abruvan / utthātuḥ abruvan pade ṛṣabham yat akalpayan /
analyzed: gudāḥ āsan sinīvālyāḥ sūryāyāḥ tvacam abruvan   utthātuḥ abruvan pade ṛṣabham yat akalpayan  /
translated: The anus was Sinivali's, and Surya they declared to be the skin. When they appointed the bull to be the foot of him who rises,

original: kroḍaḥ āsīt jāmiśaṃsasya somasya klaśaḥ dhṛtaḥ / devāḥ saṃgatya yat sarve ṛṣabham vyakalpayan //
analyzed: kroḍaḥ āsīt jāmiśaṃsasya somasya klaśaḥ dhṛtaḥ   devāḥ saṃgatya yat sarve ṛṣabham vyakalpayan  /
translated: The womb of Soma, the kinsman's foe, was made the vessel to contain him. When the Gods all together appointed the bull,

original: te kuṣṭhikāḥ saramāyai kurmebhyaḥ adadhuḥ śaphān / ūbadhyam asya kītebhyaḥ śva vartebhyaḥ adhārayan //
analyzed: te kuṣṭhikāḥ saramāyai kurmebhyaḥ adadhuḥ śaphān    ūbadhyam asya kītebhyaḥ śva vartebhyaḥ adhārayan  /
translated: They gave the hooves to the snakes, the claws to Saramâ. They placed the hump upon the shoulders of the camels.

original: śṛṅgābhyām rakṣaḥ ṛṣati avartim hanti cakṣuṣā / śṛṇoti bhadram karṇābhyām gavām yaḥ patiḥ aghnyaḥ //
analyzed: śṛṅgābhyām rakṣaḥ ṛṣati avartim hanti cakṣuṣā   śṛṇoti bhadram karṇābhyām gavām yaḥ patiḥ aghnyaḥ  /
translated: With his horns he pierces Raksases, with his eye he slays misfortune. With his ears he hears what is good, the bull who is the lord of kine and of the sheep.

original: śata yājam sa yajate na enam dunvanti agnayaḥ / jinvanti viśve tam devāḥ yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṛṣabham ājuhoti //
analyzed: śata yājam sa yajate na enam dunvanti agnayaḥ   jinvanti viśve tam devāḥ yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṛṣabham ājuhoti  /
translated: He who offers sacrifice a hundred times is not tormented by the fires. All the Gods animate him who, a Brâhman, offers up the bull.

original: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ ṛṣabham dattvā varīyaḥ kṛṇute manaḥ / puṣṭim saḥ aghnyānām sve goṣṭhe ava paśyate /
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ ṛṣabham dattvā varīyaḥ kṛṇute manaḥ   puṣṭim saḥ aghnyānām sve goṣṭhe ava paśyate  /
translated: Having given a bull to the Brâhman priests, he makes his mind more blessed. He sees in his own fold the increase of his cattle.

original: gāvaḥ santu prajāḥ santu atha u astu tanū balam / tat sarvam anu manyantām devāḥ ṛṣabha dāyine /
analyzed: gāvaḥ santu prajāḥ santu atha u astu tanū balam   tat sarvam anu manyantām devāḥ ṛṣabha dāyine  /
translated: Let there be kine, let there be offspring, and let there be strength in our bodies. Let all the Gods approve the man who gives a bull.

original: ayam pipānaḥ indraḥ id rayim dadhātu cetanīm / ayam dhenum su dughām nitya vatsām vaśam duhām vipaścitam paras divaḥ /🔽piśaṅga rūpaḥ nabhasaḥ vayodhāḥ aindraḥ śuṣmaḥ viśva rūpaḥ naḥ āgan / āyuḥ asmabhyam dadhat prajām ca rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacatām /
analyzed: ayam pipānaḥ indraḥ id rayim dadhātu cetanīm   ayam dhenum su dughām nitya vatsām vaśam duhām vipaścitam paras divaḥ  / piśaṅga rūpaḥ nabhasaḥ vayodhāḥ aindraḥ śuṣmaḥ viśva rūpaḥ naḥ āgan   āyuḥ asmabhyam dadhat prajām ca rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacatām  /
translated: May this Indra, when he hath drunk, bestow wealth and understanding on us. May he milk for us the cow who yields all wishes, the cow who always yields milk and is ever with her calf.🔽The golden-hued, the life-bestower of the cloud, Indra's strength, of every form, hath come to us. Granting us life and offspring, let him come to us with the increase of our wealth.

original: upa iha upaparcana asmin goṣṭhe upa pṛñca naḥ / upa ṛṣabhasya yat retaḥ upa indra tava vīryam /
analyzed: upa iha upaparcana asmin goṣṭhe upa pṛñca naḥ   / upa ṛṣabhasya yat retaḥ upa indra tava vīryam  /
translated: Here, O thou who givest help, in this our cow-pen, help thou our cattle. Help thou the bull's seed, help thou the strength that is in thee, O Indra.

original: etam vaḥ yuvānam prati dadhmaḥ atra tena krīḍantīḥ carata vaśām anu / mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam / / mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam // mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam // mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam // mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rā
analyzed: etam vaḥ yuvānam prati dadhmaḥ atra tena krīḍantīḥ carata vaśām anu  / mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam      mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam     mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam             hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam              hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāya
translated: Be not ye angry with us, ye blessed ones, but with your blessings of wealth and increase come ye unto us.

original: ā naya etam ā rabhasva su kṛtām lokam api gacchatu prajānan / tīrtvā tamāṃsi bahudhā mahānti ajaḥ nākam ā kramatām tṛtīyam /
analyzed: ā naya etam ā rabhasva su kṛtām lokam api gacchatu prajānan   tīrtvā tamāṃsi bahudhā mahānti ajaḥ nākam ā kramatām tṛtīyam  /
translated: Bring him hither, seize him: let him go to the world of the righteous, knowing the way. Having passed through the many and great darknesses, let the Goat mount the third vault of the sky.

original: indrāya bhāgam pari tvā nayāmi asmin yajñe yajamānāya sūrim / ye naḥ dviṣanti anu tān rabhasva anāgasaḥ yajamānasya vīrāḥ /
analyzed: indrāya bhāgam pari tvā nayāmi asmin yajñe yajamānāya sūrim   ye naḥ dviṣanti anu tān rabhasva anāgasaḥ yajamānasya vīrāḥ  /
translated: I lead thee to Indra's share, to the lord of this sacrifice, to the sacrificer. Seize those who hate us: the sacrificer's heroes are sinless.

original: pañca odanaḥ pañcadhā vi kramatām ākraṃsyamānaḥ trīṇi jyotīṃṣi / ījānānām su kṛtām prehi madhyam tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayasva //

translated: Let the five-platter sacrifice be divided fivefold, as it is about to be offered. Let it approach the three lights of those who have sacrificed well. Go to the midst of the third heaven above. Settle there.

original: ajā roha su kṛtām yatra lokaḥ śarabhaḥ na cattaḥ ati durgāni eṣaḥ / pañca odanaḥ brahmaṇe dīyamānaḥ sa dātāram tṛptyā tarpayāti //

translated: Ascend, O goat, to the world of the virtuous. Like a sharabha, pass over the difficult places. The five-platter sacrifice, when given to the Brahman, satisfies the giver with contentment.

original: ajaḥ tri nāke tridive tri pṛṣṭhe nākasya pṛṣṭhe dadivāṃsam dadhāti / pañca odanaḥ brahmaṇe dīyamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā asi ekā / / pañca odanaḥ brahmaṇe dīyamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā asi ekā / / pañca odanaḥ brahmaṇe dīyamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā asi ekā / / tri dīyamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughāḥ asi
analyzed: ajaḥ tri nāke tridive tri pṛṣṭhe nākasya pṛṣṭhe dadivāṃsam dadhāti                  asi                   asi
