original: etat vaḥ jyotiḥ pitaraḥ tṛtīyam pañca odanam brahmaṇe ajam dadāti / ajaḥ tamāṃsi apa hanti dūram asmin loke śraddadhānena dattaḥ /
analyzed: etat vaḥ jyotiḥ pitaraḥ tṛtīyam pañca odanam brahmaṇe ajam dadāti   ajaḥ tamāṃsi apa hanti dūram asmin loke śraddadhānena dattaḥ  /
translated: This is your third light, O Fathers. He gives a goat to the Brahman for the five-rice offering. The goat drives away the darkness far away, given in this world by one who has faith.

original: ījānānām su kṛtām lokam īpsan pañca odanam brahmaṇe ajam dadāti / sa vyāptim abhi lokam jaya etam śivaḥ asmabhyam pratigṛhītaḥ astu //
analyzed: ījānānānām su kṛtām lokam īpsan pañca odanam brahmaṇe ajam dadāti   sa vyāptim abhi lokam jaya etam śivaḥ asmabhyam pratigṛhītaḥ astu  /
translated: Desiring the world of the well-sacrificed who have sacrificed, he gives a goat to the Brahman for the five-rice offering. He conquers this world, which is pervaded by him. May the accepted one be auspicious to us.

original: ajaḥ hi agneḥ ajaniṣṭa śokāt vipraḥ viprasya sahasaḥ vipaścit / iṣṭam pūrtam abhipūrtam vaṣaṭkṛtam tat devāḥ ṛtuśas kalpayantu /
analyzed: ajaḥ hi agneḥ ajaniṣṭa śokāt vipraḥ viprasya sahasaḥ vipaścit   iṣṭam pūrtam abhipūrtam vaṣaṭkṛtam tat devāḥ ṛtuśas kalpayantu  /
translated: For Agni was born from the goat's womb, the sage, the wise one, from the sage's seed. The offered, the fulfilled, the fulfilled and consecrated, may the gods arrange it according to the seasons.

original: amotam vāsaḥ dadyāt hiraṇyam api dakṣiṇām / tathā lokān sam āpnoti ye divyāḥ ye ca pārthivāḥ /
analyzed: amotam vāsaḥ dadyāt hiraṇyam api dakṣiṇām   tathā lokān sam āpnoti ye divyāḥ ye ca pārthivāḥ  /
translated: One should give a garment that has not been worn, and also gold as a sacrificial fee. Thus one attains the worlds, both the heavenly and the earthly.

original: etāḥ tvā ajāḥ upa yantu dhārāḥ somyāḥ devīḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhāḥ madhuścutaḥ / stabhān pṛthivīm uta dyām nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi sapta raśmau /
analyzed: etāḥ tvā ajāḥ upa yantu dhārāḥ somyāḥ devīḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhāḥ madhuścutaḥ   stabhān pṛthivīm uta dyām nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi sapta raśmau  /
translated: Let these streams of yours, O goat, approach, the divine ones with ghee on their backs, dripping honey, support the earth and the sky on the back of the vault, on the seven rays.

original: ajaḥ asi aja svargaḥ asi tvayā lokam aṅgirasaḥ prājānan / tam lokam puṇyam pra jñeṣam /
analyzed: ajaḥ asi aja svargaḥ asi tvayā lokam aṅgirasaḥ prājānan   tam lokam puṇyam pra jñeṣam  /
translated: Thou art the goat, O goat, thou art the heaven. By thee the Angirases knew the world. May I know that blessed world.🔽By which thou carriest a thousand, by which all wealth, O Agni,

original: yena sahasram vahasi yena agne sarvavedasam / tena imam yajñam naḥ vaha svar deveṣu gantave /
analyzed: yena sahasram vahasi yena agne sarvavedasam    tena imam yajñam naḥ vaha svar deveṣu gantave  /
translated: by that carry this sacrifice of ours to the heaven, to go to the gods.

original: ajaḥ pakvaḥ svarge loke dadhāti pañca odanaḥ nirṛtim bādhamānaḥ / tena lokān sūryavataḥ jayema /
analyzed: ajaḥ pakvaḥ svarge loke dadhāti pañca odanaḥ nirṛtim bādhamānaḥ   tena lokān sūryavataḥ jayema  /
translated: The cooked goat, the five-rice, bestows the heavenly world, repelling destruction. By that may we win the worlds that have the sun.🔽What thou hast laid in the Brāhman, what in the people, what drops of the five-rice of the goat,

original: yam brāhmaṇe nidadhe yam ca vikṣu yā vipruṣaḥ odanānām ajasya / sarvam tat agne su kṛtasya loke jānīta an naḥ saṃgamane pathīnām /
analyzed: yam brāhmaṇe nidadhe yam ca vikṣu yā vipruṣaḥ odanānām ajasya      sarvam tat agne su kṛtasya loke jānīta an naḥ saṃgamane pathīnām  /
translated: all that, O Agni, in the world of the good, know for us, at the meeting of the paths.

original: ajaḥ vai idam agne vi akramata tasya uraḥ iyam abhavat dyauḥ pṛṣṭiham / antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī // antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī // antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī // antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī // antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī // //
analyzed: ajaḥ vai idam agne vi akramata tasya uraḥ iyam abhavat dyauḥ pṛṣṭiham    antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī    antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī
translated: The atmosphere his middle, the regions his sides, the two oceans his belly.🔽The atmosphere his middle, the regions his sides, the two oceans his belly.🔽The atmosphere his middle, the regions his sides, the two oceans his belly.

original: satyam ca rtam ca cakṣuṣī viśvam satyam śraddhā prāṇaḥ virāj śiraḥ / eṣa vai aparimitaḥ yajñaḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ /
analyzed: satyam ca rtam ca cakṣuṣī viśvam satyam śraddhā prāṇaḥ virāj śiraḥ   eṣa vai aparimitaḥ yajñaḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ  /
translated: Truth and Law are his eyes, the All is his truth, faith his breath, the Virāj his head. This is the unlimited sacrifice, the goat with the five kinds of food.

original: aparimitam eva yajñam āpnoti aparimitam lokam ava runddhe / yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti //
analyzed: aparimitam eva yajñam āpnoti aparimitam lokam ava runddhe   yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti  /
translated: He obtains the unlimited sacrifice, wins the unlimited world, he who gives the goat with the five kinds of food, with the Dakṣiṇā light.

original: na asya asthīni bhindyāt na majjñaḥ niḥ dhayet / sarvam enam samādāya idam idam pra veśayet //
analyzed: na asya asthīni bhindyāt na majjñaḥ niḥ dhayet   sarvam enam samādāya idam idam pra veśayet  /
translated: He must not break any of its bones, nor let any of the marrow be lost. Taking it all together, he must put it into this and that (part of the altar).

original: idam idam eva asya rūpam bhavati tena enam sam gamayati / iṣam mahaḥ ūrjam asmai duhe yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti /🔽pañca rukmā pañca navāni vastrā pañca asmai dhenavaḥ kāmadughāḥ bhavanti / yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti /
analyzed: idam idam eva asya rūpam bhavati tena enam sam gamayati   iṣam mahaḥ ūrjam asmai duhe yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti  / pañca rukmā pañca navāni vastrā pañca asmai dhenavaḥ kāmadughāḥ bhavanti   yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti  /
translated: This is his form, this is his form. He unites him with it. He milks out food, strength, and vigour for him who gives the five-platter he-goat with the sacrificial fee.🔽Five pieces of gold, five new garments, five milch cows that yield all that is desired, are his who gives the five-platter he-goat with the sacrificial fee.

original: pañca rukmāḥ jyotiḥ asmai bhavanti varma vāsāṃsi tanve bhavanti / svargam lokam aśnute yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti //
analyzed: pañca rukmāḥ jyotiḥ asmai bhavanti varma vāsāṃsi tanve bhavanti    svargam lokam aśnute yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti  /
translated: Five pieces of gold are his light, garments are his armour for his body. He attains the heavenly world who gives the five-platter he-goat with the sacrificial fee.🔽She who having known one husband, then finds another, a second,

original: yā pūrvam patim vittvā atha anyam vindate aparam / pañca odanam ca tau ajam dadātaḥ na vi yoṣataḥ /
analyzed: yā pūrvam patim vittvā atha anyam vindate aparam   pañca odanam ca tau ajam dadātaḥ na vi yoṣataḥ  /
translated: They two, the five-platter he-goat, give, and are not separated.

original: samāna lokaḥ bhavati punarbhuvā aparaḥ patiḥ / yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti /
analyzed: samāna lokaḥ bhavati punarbhuvā aparaḥ patiḥ   yaḥ ajam pañca odanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti  /
translated: The second husband becomes of the same world as the one who has had another husband. He who gives the five-platter he-goat with the sacrificial fee.🔽Having given a cow with a calf that follows her, an ox, a mattress,

original: anupūrva vatsām dhenum anaḍvāham upabarhaṇam / vāsaḥ hiraṇyam dattvā te yanti divam uttamām /
analyzed: anupūrva vatsām dhenum anaḍvāham upabarhaṇam    vāsaḥ hiraṇyam dattvā te yanti divam uttamām  /
translated: a garment, and gold, they go to the highest heaven.

original: yaḥ vai naidāgham nāma rtum veda / eṣa vai naidāghaḥ nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ / niḥ eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam dahati bhavati ātmanā / yaḥ vai kurvantam nāma rtum veda / kurvatīm kurvatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte / eṣa vai kurvat nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ / yaḥ vai saṃyantam nāma rtum veda / saṃyatīm saṃyatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte / eṣa vai saṃyat nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca
analyzed: yaḥ vai naidāgham nāma rtum veda   eṣa vai naidāghaḥ nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ   niḥ eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam dahati bhavati ātmanā   yaḥ vai kurvantam nāma rtum veda   kurvatīm kurvatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte     eṣa vai kurvat nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ   yaḥ vai saṃyantam nāma rtum veda   saṃyatīm saṃyatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte      eṣa vai saṃyat nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca oda
translated: He who knows the season called the Summer, the Summer season is that, to wit, the five-platter offering of the he-goat. He burns away the prosperity of his hateful foe, and becomes prosperous himself. He who knows the season called the Doing, the Doing season is that, to wit, the five-platter offering of the he-goat. He bestows upon himself the prosperity of his hateful foe, the Doing season is that, to wit, the five-platter offering of the he-goat. He who knows the season called the Joining, the Joining season is that, to wit, the five-platter offering of the he-goat. He bestows upon himself the prosperity of his hateful foe, the Joining season is that, to wit, the five-platter offering of the he-goat.

original: tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi // // tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi // // tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi // // tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi // // tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi // // tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi // // t
analyzed: tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi      tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi        tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi        tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi        tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi         tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi         tāḥ
translated: May they protect thee, this (child) for thee. To them I offer this oblation of ghee.

original: yaḥ vidyāt brahma pratyakṣam parūṃṣi yasya saṃbhārāḥ ṛcaḥ yasya anūkyam /
analyzed: yaḥ vidyāt brahma pratyakṣam parūṃṣi yasya saṃbhārāḥ ṛcaḥ yasya anūkyam  /
translated: He who knows Brahman directly, whose limbs are the sacrificial requisites, whose back is the Ṛg verses,

original: sāmāni yasya lomāni yajuḥ hṛdayam ucyate paristaraṇam id dhaviḥ //
analyzed: sāmāni yasya lomāni yajuḥ hṛdayam ucyate paristaraṇam id haviḥ
translated: whose hair is the Sāman chants, whose heart is said to be the Yajur mantras, and whose strewing is the sacrificial offering.

original: yat vai atithi patiḥ atithīn pratipaśyati devayajanam prekṣate //
analyzed: yat vai atithi patiḥ atithīn pratipaśyati devayajanam prekṣate
translated: When the host of guests sees the guests, he sees the sacrificial ground.

original: yat abhivadati dīkṣām upaiti yat udakam yācati apaḥ pra nayati //
analyzed: yat abhivadati dīkṣām upaiti yat udakam yācati apaḥ pra nayati
translated: When he speaks, he enters on the consecration. When he asks for water, he leads the waters forward.

original: yāḥ eva yajñe āpaḥ praṇīyante tāḥ eva tāḥ //🔽yat tarpaṇam āharanti yaḥ eva agnīṣomīyaḥ paśuḥ badhyate saḥ eva saḥ //
analyzed: yāḥ eva yajñe āpaḥ praṇīyante tāḥ eva tāḥ  yat tarpaṇam āharanti yaḥ eva agnīṣomīyaḥ paśuḥ badhyate saḥ eva saḥ
translated: The waters which are led forward at the sacrifice are those same (waters).🔽The libation which they bring is the same as the animal which is bound for Agni and Soma.

original: yat āvasathān kalpayanti sadaḥ havirdhānāni eva tat kalpayanti //
analyzed: yat āvasathān kalpayanti sadaḥ havirdhānāni eva tat kalpayanti  /
translated: When they prepare the dwelling-places, they prepare the Sadas, the Havirdhâna, and the Âgnîdhrîya.

original: yat upastṛṇanti barhiḥ eva tat //🔽yat upari śayanam āharanti svargam eva tena lokam ava runddhe //
analyzed: yat upastṛṇanti barhiḥ eva tat  yat upari śayanam āharanti svargam eva tena lokam ava runddhe
translated: When they strew (grass), it is the sacrificial grass.🔽When they bring the upper couch, thereby he wins the heavenly world.

original: yat kaśipu upabarhaṇam āharanti paridhayaḥ eva te //🔽yat āñjana abhyañjanam āharanti ājyam eva tat //🔽yat purā pariveṣāt svādam āharanti purodāśau eva tau //
analyzed: yat kaśipu upabarhaṇam āharanti paridhayaḥ eva te  yat āñjana abhyañjanam āharanti ājyam eva tat  yat purā pariveṣāt svādam āharanti purodāśau eva tau
translated: When they bring the cushion and pillow, they are the enclosing-sticks.🔽When they bring the collyrium and ointment, they are the Âgya.🔽When they bring the sweet food before the distribution (of the sacrificial food), they are the two cakes.

original: yat aśana kṛtam hvayanti haviṣkṛtam eva tat dhvayanti //🔽ye vrīhayaḥ yavāḥ nirupyante aṃśavaḥ eva te //🔽yāni ulūkhala musalāni grāvāṇaḥ eva te //
analyzed: yat aśana kṛtam hvayanti haviṣkṛtam eva tat dhvayanti  / ye vrīhayaḥ yavāḥ nirupyante aṃśavaḥ eva te  yāni ulūkhala musalāni grāvāṇaḥ eva te
translated: When they call for the food which is prepared, they call for the food which is prepared for the offering.🔽The rice and barley which are poured out are the rays.🔽The mortar and pestle are the pressing-stones.

original: śūrpam pavitram tuṣāḥ ṛjīṣā abhiṣavaṇīḥ āpaḥ //
analyzed: śūrpam pavitram tuṣāḥ ṛjīṣā abhiṣavaṇīḥ āpaḥ
translated: The winnowing basket is the strainer, the husks are the refuse, the water is the sprinkling water.

original: sruc darviḥ na īkṣaṇam āyavanam droṇakalaśāḥ kumbhyaḥ vāyavyāni pātrāṇi iyam eva kṛṣṇājinam // //
analyzed: sruc darviḥ na īkṣaṇam āyavanam droṇakalaśāḥ kumbhyaḥ vāyavyāni pātrāṇi iyam eva kṛṣṇājinam  /
translated: The ladle is the spoon, the eye-paint is the looking-glass, the wooden trough and the jars are the water-vessels, the wind-vessels are the vessels for the wind, and the black antelope skin is this (earth) itself.

original: yajamānabrāhmaṇam vai etat atithi patiḥ kurute yat āhāryāṇi prekṣate idam bhūyaḥ idam iti //
analyzed: yajamānabrāhmaṇam vai etat atithi patiḥ kurute yat āhāryāṇi prekṣate idam bhūyaḥ idam iti
translated: The host of the guest performs this Brâhmana of the sacrificer, when he looks at the things to be brought, (saying), 'This more, this less.'

original: yat āha bhūyas ud hara iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsam kurute //🔽upa harati havīṃṣi ā sādayati //
analyzed: yat āha bhūyas ud hara iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsam kurute  upa harati havīṃṣi ā sādayati
translated: When he says, 'Bring more,' he thereby makes the breath more abundant.🔽He brings the sacrificial dishes and places them (on the Vedi).

original: teṣām āsannānām atithiḥ ātman juhoti //
analyzed: teṣām āsannānām atithiḥ ātman juhoti
translated: When they are near, the guest sacrifices in himself.

original: srucā hastena prāṇe yūpe srukkāreṇa vaṣaṭkāreṇa //
analyzed: srucā hastena prāṇe yūpe srukkāreṇa vaṣaṭkāreṇa
translated: With the ladle, with the hand, on the post which is the breath, with the Sruk-call, with the Vashat-call.

original: ete vai priyāḥ ca apriyāḥ ca rtvijaḥ svargam lokam gamayanti yat atithayaḥ //
analyzed: ete vai priyāḥ ca apriyāḥ ca rtvijaḥ svargam lokam gamayanti yat atithayaḥ
translated: These, to wit, the guests, lead the dear and the hateful priests to the world of heaven.

original: sa yaḥ evam vidvān na dviṣan aśnīyāt na dviṣataḥ annam aśnīyāt na mīmāṃsitasya na mīmāṃsamānasya //🔽sarvaḥ vai eṣa jagdha pāpmā yasya annam aśnanti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān na dviṣan aśnīyāt na dviṣataḥ annam aśnīyāt na mīmāṃsitasya na mīmāṃsamānasya  / sarvaḥ vai eṣa jagdha pāpmā yasya annam aśnanti
translated: He who, knowing this, should not eat while hating, nor eat the food of one who hates, nor (eat) of one who is hesitating, nor of one who is hesitating,🔽all whose food they eat, has all his sin eaten away.

original: sarvaḥ vai esaḥ a jagdha pāpmā yasya annam na aśnanti //
analyzed: sarvaḥ vai esaḥ a jagdha pāpmā yasya annam na aśnanti
translated: All whose food they do not eat, has all his sin not eaten away.

original: sarvadā vai eṣa yukta grāvā ārdra pavitraḥ vitata adhvaraḥ āhṛta yajñakratuḥ yaḥ upaharati //🔽prājāpatyaḥ vai etasya yajñaḥ vitataḥ yaḥ upaharati //
analyzed: sarvadā vai eṣa yukta grāvā ārdra pavitraḥ vitata adhvaraḥ āhṛta yajñakratuḥ yaḥ upaharati  prājāpatyaḥ vai etasya yajñaḥ vitataḥ yaḥ upaharati
translated: The stone is always set, the strainer is wet, the sacrifice is spread out, the sacrificial rite is performed, by him who offers the guest-meal.🔽The sacrifice of Prajapati is spread out for him who offers the guest-meal.

original: prajāpateḥ vai eṣa vikramān anuvikramate yaḥ upaharati //
analyzed: prajāpateḥ vai eṣa vikramān anuvikramate yaḥ upaharati
translated: He who offers the guest-meal follows the steps of Prajapati.🔽The guest is the Ahavaniya fire, the guest is the Garhapatya fire, the guest is the Dakshina fire.

original: saḥ āhavanīyaḥ yaḥ veśmani saḥ gārhapatyaḥ yasmin pacanti saḥ dakṣiṇāgniḥ // / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /🔽iṣṭam ca vai eṣa pūrtam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti //🔽payaḥ ca vai eṣa rasam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti //🔽ūrjām ca vai eṣa sphātim ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti //
analyzed: saḥ āhavanīyaḥ yaḥ veśmani saḥ gārhapatyaḥ yasmin pacanti saḥ dakṣiṇāgniḥ  iṣṭam ca vai eṣa pūrtam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti  / payaḥ ca vai eṣa rasam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti  / ūrjām ca vai eṣa sphātim ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti  /
translated: He who eats before the guest eats the sacrifice and the fulfilment of the house.🔽He who eats before the guest eats the milk and the juice of the house.🔽He who eats before the guest eats the strength and the abundance of the house.

original: prajām vai eṣa paśūn ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti //
analyzed: prajām vai eṣa paśūn ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti  /
translated: He who eats before the guest eats the offspring and the cattle of the house.

original: kīrtim vai eṣa yaśaḥ ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti //
analyzed: kīrtim vai eṣa yaśaḥ ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti  /
translated: He who eats before the guest eats, eats away the glory and fame of the house.

original: śriyam vai eṣa saṃvidam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti //
analyzed: śriyam vai eṣa saṃvidam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ atitheḥ aśnāti  /
translated: He who eats before the guest eats, eats away the prosperity and the agreement of the house.

original: eṣa vai atithiḥ yat śrotriyaḥ tasmāt pūrvaḥ na aśnīyāt //
analyzed: eṣa vai atithiḥ yat śrotriyaḥ tasmāt pūrvaḥ na aśnīyāt
translated: The guest is he who is learned in the Veda; therefore one should not eat before him.

original: aśitāvati atithau aśnīyāt yajñasya sātma tvāya yajñasya a vichedāya tat vratam //
analyzed: aśitāvati atithau aśnīyāt yajñasya sātma tvāya yajñasya a vichedāya tat vratam
translated: One should eat when the guest has eaten, for the completeness of the sacrifice, for the non-interruption of the sacrifice. That is the rule.

original: etat vai u svādīyaḥ yat adhigavam kṣīram vā māṃsam vā tat eva na aśnīyāt // //🔽sa yaḥ evam vidvān kṣīram upasicya upaharati / yāvat agniṣṭomena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe /
analyzed: etat vai u svādīyaḥ yat adhigavam kṣīram vā māṃsam vā tat eva na aśnīyāt         sa yaḥ evam vidvān kṣīram upasicya upaharati     agniṣṭomena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe  /
translated: This is indeed the most delicious, namely, milk or meat with ghee. One should not eat that.🔽He who, knowing thus, offers with milk sprinkled on it, obtains as much as one obtains by performing the Agniṣṭoma well-performed.

original: sa yaḥ evam vidvān sarpiḥ upasicya upaharati / yāvat atirātreṇa iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān sarpiḥ upasicya upaharati   yāvat atirātreṇa iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe  /
translated: He who, knowing thus, offers with ghee sprinkled on it, obtains as much as one obtains by performing the Atirātra well-performed.

original: sa yaḥ evam vidvān madhūpasicya upaharati / yāvat sattra sadyena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān madhūpasicya upaharati    yāvat sattra sadyena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe  /
translated: He who, knowing this, offers (the Soma) after sprinkling it with honey, obtains thereby as much as he would obtain by performing a Sattra (sacrifice) well-performed and successful.

original: sa yaḥ evam vidvān māṃsam upasicya upaharati / yāvat dvādaśa ahena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān māṃsam upasicya upaharati   yāvat dvādaśa ahena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe  /
translated: He who, knowing this, offers (the Soma) after sprinkling it with meat, obtains thereby as much as he would obtain by performing a twelve-day (sacrifice) well-performed and successful.

original: sa yaḥ evam vidvān udakam upasicya upaharati / prajānām prajananāya gacchati pratiṣṭhām priyaḥ prajānām bhavati yaḥ evam vidvān upasicya upaharati // //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān udakam upasicya upaharati   prajānām prajananāya gacchati pratiṣṭhām priyaḥ prajānām bhavati yaḥ evam vidvān upasicya upaharati
translated: He who, knowing this, offers (the Soma) after sprinkling it with water, goes to the begetting of offspring and to a firm foundation. He becomes dear to the people, he who, knowing this, offers (the Soma) after sprinkling it with water.

original: tasmai uṣāḥ hiṅ kṛṇoti savitā pra stauti / bṛhaspatiḥ ūrjayā ud gāyati tvaṣṭā puṣṭyā prati harati viśve devāḥ nidhanam /
analyzed: tasmai uṣāḥ hiṅ kṛṇoti savitā pra stauti   bṛhaspatiḥ ūrjayā ud gāyati tvaṣṭā puṣṭyā prati harati viśve devāḥ nidhanam  /
translated: To him Dawn utters the syllable 'Him'; Savitr sings the Prastava; Brihaspati with strength sings the Udgitha; Tvastr with growth responds; the All-gods form the Nidhana.

original: nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
analyzed: nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes the Nidhana of prosperity, offspring, and cattle, he who knows this.

original: tasmai udyan sūryaḥ hiṅ kṛṇoti saṃgavaḥ pra stauti / madhyandinaḥ ud gāyati aparāhṇaḥ prati harati astaṃyat nidhanam / nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: tasmai udyan sūryaḥ hiṅ kṛṇoti saṃgavaḥ pra stauti   madhyandinaḥ ud gāyati aparāhṇaḥ prati harati astaṃyat nidhanam   nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda  /

analyzed: saḥ upahūtaḥ lokeṣu bhakṣayati upahūtaḥ tasmin yat divi viśva rūpam

original: saḥ upahūtaḥ upahūtaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ upahūtaḥ upahūtaḥ
translated: He, being invited, is invited.

original: āpnoti imam lokam āpnoti amum //
analyzed: āpnoti imam lokam āpnoti amum
translated: He obtains this world, he obtains the other world.

analyzed: jyotiṣmataḥ lokān jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus conquers the worlds of the luminous ones.

original: prajāpatiḥ ca parameṣṭhī ca śṛṅge indraḥ śiraḥ agniḥ lalāṭam yamaḥ kṛkāṭam /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ ca parameṣṭhī ca śṛṅge indraḥ śiraḥ agniḥ lalāṭam yamaḥ kṛkāṭam  /
translated: Prajapati and Parameshthi are the horns, Indra is the head, Agni is the forehead, Yama is the neck.

original: somaḥ rājā mastiṣkaḥ dyauḥ uttarahanuḥ pṛthivī adharahanuḥ //
analyzed: somaḥ rājā mastiṣkaḥ dyauḥ uttarahanuḥ pṛthivī adharahanuḥ
translated: Soma the king is the brain, the sky is the upper jaw, the earth is the lower jaw.

original: vidyut jihvā marutaḥ dantāḥ revatiḥ grīvāḥ kṛttikā skandhāḥ gharmaḥ vahaḥ //
analyzed: vidyut jihvā marutaḥ dantāḥ revatiḥ grīvāḥ kṛttikā skandhāḥ gharmaḥ vahaḥ
translated: Lightning is the tongue, the Maruts are the teeth, Revati is the neck, the Krittikas are the shoulders, the hot-rayed sun is the back.

original: viśvam vāyuḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ kṛṣṇadram vidharaṇī niveṣyaḥ //
analyzed: viśvam vāyuḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ kṛṣṇadram vidharaṇī niveṣyaḥ
translated: The universe is the wind, the heavenly world is the black antelope skin, the earth is the seat.

original: śyenaḥ krotaḥ antarikṣam pājasyam bṛhaspatiḥ kakud bṛhatīḥ kīkasāḥ /
analyzed: śyenaḥ krotaḥ antarikṣam pājasyam bṛhaspatiḥ kakud bṛhatīḥ kīkasāḥ
translated: The hawk is the sacrificial post, the atmosphere is the sacrificial enclosure, Brihaspati is the hump, the Brihatis are the ribs.

original: devānām patnīḥ pṛṣṭayaḥ upasadaḥ parśavaḥ //
analyzed: devānām patnīḥ pṛṣṭayaḥ upasadaḥ parśavaḥ
translated: The wives of the gods are the ribs, the Upasads are the flanks.

original: mitraḥ ca varuṇaḥ ca aṃsau tvaṣṭā ca aryamā ca doṣaṇī mahādevaḥ bāhū //
analyzed: mitraḥ ca varuṇaḥ ca aṃsau tvaṣṭā ca aryamā ca doṣaṇī mahādevaḥ bāhū
translated: Mitra and Varuna are the shoulders, Tvashtra and Aryaman are the forearms, Mahadeva are the arms.

original: indrāṇī bhasat vāyuḥ pucham pavamānaḥ bālāḥ //
analyzed: indrāṇī bhasad vāyuḥ pucham pavamānaḥ bālāḥ
translated: Indra's wife is the tongue, Vayu is the tail, and Pavamana is the hair.

original: brahma ca kṣatram ca śroṇī balam ūrū //
analyzed: brahma ca kṣatram ca śroṇī balam ūrū
translated: Brahma and Kshatra are the hips, and strength is the thighs.

original: dhātā ca savitā ca aṣṭhīvantau jaṅghā gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ kuṣṭhikāḥ aditiḥ śaphāḥ //
analyzed: dhātā ca savitā ca aṣṭhīvantau jaṅghā gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ kuṣṭhikāḥ aditiḥ śaphāḥ  /
translated: Dhatr and Savita are the knee-bones, the Gandharvas and Apsaras are the hoofs, and Aditi is the claws.

original: cetaḥ hṛdayam yakṛt medhā vratam purītat //
analyzed: cetaḥ hṛdayam yakṛt medhā vratam purītat
translated: The mind is the heart, the liver is wisdom, the lungs are the vow.

original: kṣudh kukṣiḥ irā vaniṣṭhuḥ parvatāḥ plāśayaḥ //🔽krodhaḥ vṛkkau manyuḥ āṇḍau prajā śepaḥ //
analyzed: kṣudh kukṣiḥ irā vaniṣṭhuḥ parvatāḥ plāśayaḥ  krodhaḥ vṛkkau manyuḥ āṇḍau prajā śepaḥ
translated: Hunger is the belly, food is the entrails, and the mountains are the ribs.🔽Anger is the kidneys, resentment is the testicles, and offspring is the penis.

original: nadī sūtrī varṣasya patayaḥ stanā stanayitnuḥ ūdhar //
analyzed: nadī sūtrī varṣasya patayaḥ stanā stanayitnuḥ ūdhar
translated: The river is the womb, the lords of the rain are the breasts, and thunder is the udder.

original: viśva vyacāḥ carma oṣadhayaḥ lomāni nakṣatrāṇi rūpam //
analyzed: viśva vyacāḥ carma oṣadhayaḥ lomāni nakṣatrāṇi rūpam
translated: The all-encompassing sky is the skin, and the stars are the form.

original: deva janāḥ gudāḥ manuṣyāḥ āntrāṇi atrāḥ udaram //
analyzed: deva janāḥ gudāḥ manuṣyāḥ āntrāṇi atrāḥ udaram
translated: The gods are the intestines, humans are the entrails, and the demons are the belly.

original: rakṣāṃsi lohitam itarajanā ūbadhyam //
analyzed: rakṣāṃsi lohitam itarajanau ūbadhyam
translated: The Rakshasas are the blood, and other people are the entrails.

original: abhram pībaḥ majjā nidhanam //
analyzed: abhram pībaḥ majjā nidhanam
translated: The clouds are the marrow, and the final oblation is the end.

original: agniḥ āsīnaḥ utthitaḥ aśvinā //
analyzed: agniḥ āsīnaḥ utthitaḥ aśvinā
translated: Agni is seated, and the Ashvins are standing.

analyzed: indraḥ prāṅ tiṣṭhan dakṣiṇā tiṣṭhan yamaḥ
translated: Indra is standing to the east, and Yama is standing to the south.

analyzed: pratyaṅ tiṣṭhan dhātā udaṅ tiṣṭhan savitā
translated: Dhatr is standing to the west, and Savita is standing to the north.

original: tṛṇāni prāptaḥ somaḥ rājā //

analyzed: mitra īkṣamāṇaḥ āvṛttaḥ ānandaḥ

analyzed: yujyamānaḥ vaiśvadevaḥ yuktaḥ prajāpatiḥ vimuktaḥ sarvam
