translated: O Waters, that which is your water, your golden germ within the waters, meet for sacrifice, the place of sacrifice to Gods,– I send it forth beyond him: let it not injure me. With it we send him forth beyond, him who hates us and whom we hate. Him would I slay and burn away with this prayer, this rite, this hymn.

original: yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ apām aśmā pṛśniḥ divyaḥ apsu antar yajuṣyaḥ deva yajanaḥ / idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi / tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / tam vadheyam tam stṛṣīya anena brahmaṇā anena karmaṇā anayā menyā // //
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ apām aśmā pṛśniḥ divyaḥ apsu antar yajuṣyaḥ deva yajanaḥ   idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi   tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   tam vadheyam tam stṛṣīya anena brahmaṇā anena karmaṇā anayā menyā
translated: O Waters, that which is your water, your variegated stone of heaven within the waters, meet for sacrifice, the place of sacrifice to Gods,– I send it forth beyond him: let it not injure me. With it we send him forth beyond, him who hates us and whom we hate. Him would I slay and burn away with this prayer, this rite, this hymn.

original: yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ apām agnayaḥ apsu antar yajuṣyaḥ deva yajanaḥ / idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi / tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / tam vadheyam tam stṛṣīya anena brahmaṇā anena karmaṇā anayā menyā // //
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ apām agnayaḥ apsu antar yajuṣyaḥ deva yajanaḥ   idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi   tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   tam vadheyam tam stṛṣīya anena brahmaṇā anena karmaṇā anayā menyā
translated: Ye Waters, ye who are the Waters' Agni, who dwell in waters, who are worshipped with the Yajus, with the Gods' worship, I send forth this one beyond you. Let him not over-take me. With him we send forth him who hates us and whom we hate. Him would I slay, him would I torment, with this prayer, this rite, this hymn.🔽Whatever falsehood we have spoken since the last new moon,

original: yat arvācīnam traihāyaṇāt anṛtam kim codima / āpaḥ mā tasmāt sarvasmāt duritāt pāntu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yat arvācīnam traihāyaṇāt anṛtam kim codima   āpaḥ mā tasmāt sarvasmāt duritāt pāntu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: from all that evil may the Waters save us, and from distress.

original: samudram vaḥ pra hiṇomi svām yonim apītana / ariṣṭāḥ sarva hāyasaḥ mā ca naḥ kim cana amamat /
analyzed: samudram vaḥ pra hiṇomi svām yonim apītana   ariṣṭāḥ sarva hāyasaḥ mā ca naḥ kim cana amamat  /
translated: I send you forth to the ocean: return to your own abode. Unharmed, with all our people, and let nothing be amiss with us.

original: a riprāḥ āpaḥ apa ripram asmat / pra asmat enaḥ duritam su pratīkāḥ pra duṣvapnyam pra malam vahantu //
analyzed: a riprāḥ āpaḥ apa ripram asmat    pra asmat enaḥ duritam su pratīkāḥ pra duṣvapnyam pra malam vahantu  /
translated: Ye Waters, free from guile, remove all guile from us. Ye beauteous ones, remove from us all sin and evil dream.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā pṛthivī saṃśitaḥ agni tejāḥ / pṛthivīm anu vi krame aham pṛthivyāḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /🔽viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā antarikṣa saṃśitaḥ vāyu tejāḥ / antarikṣam anu vi krame aham antarikṣāt tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā pṛthivī saṃśitaḥ agni tejāḥ   pṛthivīm anu vi krame aham pṛthivyāḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  / viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā antarikṣa saṃśitaḥ vāyu tejāḥ   antarikṣam anu vi krame aham antarikṣāt tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened on earth, having Agni for thy strength. After the earth I step. From the earth we banish him who hates us and whom we hate. Let him not live, let his breath depart.🔽Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened in the air, having Vayu for thy strength. After the air I step. From the air we banish him who hates us and whom we hate. Let him not live, let his breath depart.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā dyau saṃśitaḥ sūrya tejāḥ / divam anu vi krame aham divaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jivīt tam prānaḥ jahātu //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā dyau saṃśitaḥ sūrya tejāḥ   divam anu vi krame aham divaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jivīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened in heaven, having Surya for thy strength. After the heaven I step. From the heaven we banish him who hates us and whom we hate. Let him not live, let his breath depart.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā diś saṃśitaḥ manaḥ tejāḥ / diśaḥ anu vi krame aham digbhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā diś saṃśitaḥ manaḥ tejāḥ   diśaḥ anu vi krame aham digbhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art the step of Vishnu, slaying foes, sharpened to points, the mind, the energy. I step along the points. From the points we banish him who hates us, whom we hate. Let him not live, let breath forsake him.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā āśā saṃśitaḥ vāta tejāḥ / āśāḥ anu vi krame aham āśābhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā āśā saṃśitaḥ vāta tejāḥ   āśāḥ anu vi krame aham āśābhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art the step of Vishnu, slaying foes, sharpened to edges, the wind, the energy. I step along the edges. From the edges we banish him who hates us, whom we hate. Let him not live, let breath forsake him.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā ṛc saṃśitaḥ sāma tejāḥ / ṛcaḥ anu vi krame aham ṛgbhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu // // // tam jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā ṛc saṃśitaḥ sāma tejāḥ   ṛcaḥ anu vi krame aham ṛgbhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu
translated: Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened by the Rich, with the Saman for thy might. After the Rich I step. From the Rich we banish him who hateth us, whom we hate. Let him not live, let breath forsake him.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā yajña saṃśitaḥ brahma tejāḥ / yajñam anu vi krame aham yajñāt tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā yajña saṃśitaḥ brahma tejāḥ   yajñam anu vi krame aham yajñāt tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened by the Sacrifice, with the Brahman for thy might. After the Sacrifice I step. From the Sacrifice we banish him who hateth us, whom we hate. Let him not live, let breath forsake him.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā oṣadhī saṃśitaḥ soma tejāḥ / oṣadhīḥ anu vi krame aham oṣadhībhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /🔽viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā apsu saṃśitaḥ varuṇa tejāḥ / apaḥ anu vi krame aham adbhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā oṣadhī saṃśitaḥ soma tejāḥ   oṣadhīḥ anu vi krame aham oṣadhībhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  / viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā apsu saṃśitaḥ varuṇa tejāḥ   apaḥ anu vi krame aham adbhyaḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened on plants, with Soma for thy vigour. After the plants I step. From the plants we banish him who hates us or whom we dislike. Let him not live, let breath forsake him.🔽Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened on waters, with Varuna for thy vigour. After the waters I step. From the waters we banish him who hates us or whom we dislike. Let him not live, let breath forsake him.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā kṛṣi saṃśitaḥ anna tejāḥ / kṛṣim anu vi krame aham kṛṣyāḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā kṛṣi saṃśitaḥ anna tejāḥ   kṛṣim anu vi krame aham kṛṣyāḥ tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes, sharpened on tillage, with food for thy vigour. After tillage I step. From tillage we banish him who hates us or whom we dislike. Let him not live, let breath forsake him.

original: visṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā prāṇa saṃśitaḥ puruṣa tejāḥ / prāṇam anu vi krame aham prāṇāt tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ / sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu /
analyzed: visṇoḥ kramaḥ asi sapatna hā prāṇa saṃśitaḥ puruṣa tejāḥ   prāṇam anu vi krame aham prāṇāt tam niḥ bhajāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ   sa mā jīvīt tam prānaḥ jahātu  /
translated: Thou art the step of Vishnu, the slayer of foes, sharpened by the breath of men. Following the breath I step along. From the breath we banish him who hates us, whom we hate. Let him not live, let the breath forsake him.

original: jitam asmākam udbhinnam asmākam abhi aṣṭhām viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ arātīḥ / idam aham āmuṣyāyaṇasya amuṣyāḥ putrasya varcaḥ tejaḥ prāṇam āyuḥ ni veṣṭayāmi idam enam adharāñcam pādayāmi //
analyzed: jitam asmākam udbhinnam asmākam abhi aṣṭhām viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ arātīḥ   idam aham āmuṣyāyaṇasya amuṣyāḥ putrasya varcaḥ tejaḥ prāṇam āyuḥ ni veṣṭayāmi idam enam adharāñcam pādayāmi  /
translated: Ours is the victory, ours is the triumph. We have overcome all enemies and foes. I bind fast the splendour, the glow, the breath, the life of N.N., son of N.N. I cast him down beneath me.

original: sūryasya āvṛtam anvāvarte dakṣiṇām anu āvṛtam / sā me draviṇam yacchatu sā me brāhmaṇa varcasam /
analyzed: sūryasya āvṛtam anvāvarte dakṣiṇām anu āvṛtam    sā me draviṇam yacchatu sā me brāhmaṇa varcasam  /
translated: I follow the course of the sun, I follow the southern course. May it grant me wealth, may it grant me the splendour of a Brāhman.

original: diśaḥ jyotiṣmatīḥ abhyāvarte / tāḥ me draviṇam yacchantu tāḥ me brāhmaṇa varcasam /
analyzed: diśaḥ jyotiṣmatīḥ abhyāvarte   tāḥ me draviṇam yacchantu tāḥ me brāhmaṇa varcasam  /
translated: I turn to the luminous quarters. May they grant me wealth, may they grant me the splendour of a Brāhman.

original: sapta ṛṣīn abhyāvarte / te me draviṇam yacchantu te me brāhmaṇa varcasam /
analyzed: sapta ṛṣīn abhyāvarte   te me draviṇam yacchantu te me brāhmaṇa varcasam  /
translated: I turn to the seven Rishis. May they grant me wealth, may they grant me the splendour of a Brāhman.

original: vaiśvānarasya daṃṣṭrābhyām hetiḥ tam sam adhāt abhi / iyam tam psātu āhutiḥ samidh devī sahīyasī /
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya daṃṣṭrābhyām hetiḥ tam sam adhāt abhi    iyam tam psātu āhutiḥ samidh devī sahīyasī  /
translated: With the fangs of Vaisvânara, the dart hath he, the foe, encompassed round. May this oblation, this most mighty Goddess kindling-stick, consume him.

original: rājñaḥ varuṇasya bandhaḥ asi / saḥ amum āmuṣyāyaṇam amuṣyāḥ putram anne prāṇe badhāna //
analyzed: rājñaḥ varuṇasya bandhaḥ asi   saḥ amum āmuṣyāyaṇam amuṣyāḥ putram anne prāṇe badhāna  /
translated: Thou art the bond of King Varuna. Bind him, the son of such a one, of such a family, in food, in breath.

original: yat te annam bhuvaḥ pate ākṣiyati pṛthivīm anu / tasya naḥ tvam bhuvaḥ pate saṃprayaccha prajāpate /
analyzed: yat te annam bhuvaḥ pate ākṣiyati pṛthivīm anu   tasya naḥ tvam bhuvaḥ pate saṃprayaccha prajāpate  /
translated: The food, O Lord of the Earth, which thou hast scattered over the earth, of that, O Lord of the Earth, O Lord of creatures, grant us a portion.

original: apaḥ divyāḥ acāyiṣam rasena sam apṛkṣmahi / payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā /
analyzed: apaḥ divyāḥ acāyiṣam rasena sam apṛkṣmahi    payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā  /
translated: I have obtained the heavenly waters: with their juice I have anointed myself. Rich in milk, O Agni, have I come: with splendour unite me.

original: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā / vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā   vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: With splendour, O Agni, unite me: unite me with offspring, with life. May the Gods know me, and may Indra know me with the Rishis.🔽What couple, O Agni, today curseth, what angry words the Râkshasas utter,

original: yat agne adya mithunā śapataḥ yat vācaḥ tṛṣṭam janayanta rebhāḥ / manyoḥ manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān /
analyzed: yat agne adya mithunā śapataḥ yat vācaḥ tṛṣṭam janayanta rebhāḥ    manyoḥ manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān  /
translated: The arrow of wrath and of mind is shot: therewith pierce thou the Yâtudhânas to the heart.

original: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parā agne rakṣaḥ harasā śṛṇīhi / parā arciṣā mūradevām chṛṇīhi parā asutṛpaḥ śośucataḥ śṛṇīhi //
analyzed: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parā agne rakṣaḥ harasā śṛṇīhi   parā arciṣā mūradevām śṛṇīhi parā asutṛpaḥ śośucataḥ śṛṇīhi  /
translated: With heat destroy the Yatudhanas, O Agni, with flame destroy the Rakshas, O thou strong one. Destroy the godless with thy flame, destroy the greedy and the envious.

original: apām asmai vajram pra harāmi catur bhṛṣṭim śīrṣa bhidyāya vidvān / saḥ asya aṅgāni pra śṛṇātu sarvā tat me devāḥ anu jānantu viśve / /
analyzed: apām asmai vajram pra harāmi catur bhṛṣṭim śīrṣa bhidyāya vidvān   saḥ asya aṅgāni pra śṛṇātu sarvā tat me devāḥ anu jānantu viśve
translated: I hurl against him the thunderbolt of the waters, the four-edged one, knowing how to cleave the head. May it cleave all his limbs. May all the Gods approve this of me.

original: arātīyoḥ bhrātṛvyasya durhārdaḥ dviṣataḥ śiraḥ / api vṛścāmi ojasā /
analyzed: arātīyoḥ bhrātṛvyasya durhārdaḥ dviṣataḥ śiraḥ   api vṛścāmi ojasā
translated: The head of the spiteful foe, of the malevolent brother, of the hateful enemy, I cut off with might.

original: varma mahyam ayam maṇiḥ phālāt jātaḥ kariṣyati / pūrṇaḥ manthena mā agamat rasena saha varcasā /
analyzed: varma mahyam ayam maṇiḥ phālāt jātaḥ kariṣyati   pūrṇaḥ manthena mā agamat rasena saha varcasā  /
translated: This amulet, born from the plough, shall make for me a coat of mail. May it come to me with the churning, with sap and splendour.

original: yat tvā śikvaḥ parāvadhīt takṣā hastena vāsyā / āpaḥ tvā tasmat jīvalāḥ punantu śucayaḥ śucim /
analyzed: yat tvā śikvaḥ parāvadhīt takṣā hastena vāsyā    āpaḥ tvā tasmat jīvalāḥ punantu śucayaḥ śucim  /
translated: The saw that cut thee off, the carpenter with his axe, the waters, the life-giving, the pure ones, let them purify thee, the pure one, from that.

original: hiraṇya sraj ayam maṇiḥ śraddhām yajñam mahaḥ dadhat / gṛhe vasatu naḥ atithiḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇya sraj ayam maṇiḥ śraddhām yajñam mahaḥ dadhat gṛhe vasatu naḥ atithiḥ
translated: This amulet, with a garland of gold, bestowing faith, sacrifice, and greatness, shall dwell as our guest in our house.

original: tasmai ghṛtam suram madhu annam annam kṣadāmahe / sa naḥ pitā iva putrebhyaḥ śreyaḥ śreyaḥ cikitsatu bhūyas bhūyas śvas śvas devebhyaḥ maṇiḥ etya //🔽yam abadhnāt bṛhaspatiḥ maṇim phālam ghṛtaścutam ugram kadhiram ojase / tam agniḥ prati amuñcata saḥ asmai duhe ājyam bhūyas bhūyas śvas śvas tena tvam dviṣataḥ jahi //
analyzed: tasmai ghṛtam suram madhu annam annam kṣadāmahe    sa naḥ pitā iva putrebhyaḥ śreyaḥ śreyaḥ cikitsatu bhūyas bhūyas śvas śvas devebhyaḥ maṇiḥ etya  / yam abadhnāt bṛhaspatiḥ maṇim phālam ghṛtaścutam ugram kadhiram ojase   tam agniḥ prati amuñcata saḥ asmai duhe ājyam bhūyas bhūyas śvas śvas tena tvam dviṣataḥ jahi  /
translated: To him we offer food and food, and honey and ghee, and pleasant drink. May he, like a father to his sons, provide us with better and better. translated: Tell us that post, what is he indeed?🔽In whom all the thirty-three gods are fixed,

original: yatra ṛṣayaḥ prathama jāḥ ṛcaḥ sāma yajuḥ mahī / eka ṛṣiḥ yasmin ārpitaḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ /

translated: In whom the one sage is set, tell us that post, what is he indeed?🔽In whom immortality and death are fixed,

original: yatra amṛtam ca mṛtyuḥ ca puruṣe adhi samāhite / samudraḥ yasya nāḍyaḥ puruṣe adhi samāhitāḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ /

translated: In whom the ocean, whose channels are the body's veins, is set, tell us that post, what is he indeed?🔽In whom the four quarters stand as the first channels,

original: yasya catasraḥ pradiśaḥ nāḍyaḥ tiṣṭhanti prathamāḥ / yajñaḥ yatra parākrāntaḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ /
analyzed: yasya catasraḥ pradiśaḥ nāḍyaḥ tiṣṭhanti prathamāḥ   yajñaḥ yatra parākrāntaḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ  /
translated: In whom the sacrifice is performed, tell us that post, what is he indeed?

original: ye puruṣe brahma viduḥ te viduḥ parameṣṭhinam / yaḥ veda parameṣṭhinam yaḥ ca veda prajāpatim / jyeṣṭham ye brāhmaṇam viduḥ te skambham anusaṃviduḥ /
analyzed: ye puruṣe brahma viduḥ te viduḥ parameṣṭhinam   yaḥ veda parameṣṭhinam yaḥ ca veda prajāpatim   jyeṣṭham ye brāhmaṇam viduḥ te skambham anusaṃviduḥ  /
translated: They who know Brahman in man, they know the Supreme Lord. He who knows the Supreme Lord, and he who knows Prajapati, and they who know the eldest Brahman, they know Skambha.

original: yasya śiraḥ vaiśvānaraḥ cakṣuḥ aṅgirasaḥ abhavan / aṅgāni yasya yātavaḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ /
analyzed: yasya śiraḥ vaiśvānaraḥ cakṣuḥ aṅgirasaḥ abhavan   aṅgāni yasya yātavaḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ  /
translated: Whose head is Vaisvānara, whose eye became Aṅgiras, whose limbs are the Yāta-vrata hymns, tell me who he is, what is he?

original: yasya brahma mukham āhuḥ jihvām madhukaśām uta / virājam ūdhar yasya āhuḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ /
analyzed: yasya brahma mukham āhuḥ jihvām madhukaśām uta   / virājam ūdhar yasya āhuḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ  /
translated: Whose mouth they call Brahman, whose tongue the honey-dripping tongue, whose udder they call Virāj, tell me who he is, what is he?

original: yasmāt ṛcaḥ apātakṣan yajuḥ yasmāt apākaṣan / sāmāni yasya lomāni atharva aṅgirasaḥ mukham skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ // // brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ // // // // // // // katamaḥ svid eva saḥ // // // // // // // // // // // katamaḥ svid eva saḥ // // // // // // // // // // // katamaḥ svid eva saḥ // // // // // // // // // // // katamaḥ svid eva saḥ // // // // // // // katamaḥ svid eva sa
analyzed: yasmāt ṛcaḥ apātakṣan yajuḥ yasmāt apākaṣan   sāmāni yasya lomāni atharva aṅgirasaḥ mukham skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ
translated: Tell me, who is he?🔽Tell me, who is he?🔽Tell me, who is he?🔽Tell me, who is he?🔽Tell me, who is he?🔽People know the non-existent as the support, as the highest.

original: asat cākhām pratiṣṭhantīm paramam iva janāḥ viduḥ / uta u sat manyante avare ye te śākhām upāsate /
analyzed: asat cākhām pratiṣṭhantīm paramam iva janāḥ viduḥ   uta u sat manyante avare ye te śākhām upāsate  /
translated: But those who attend on its branches think it is existent.🔽Where the Adityas, Rudras, and Vasus are assembled,

original: yatra ādityāḥ ca rudrāḥ ca vasavaḥ ca samāhitāḥ / bhūtam ca yatra bhavyam ca sarve lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ /
analyzed: yatra ādityāḥ ca rudrāḥ ca vasavaḥ ca samāhitāḥ   bhūtam ca yatra bhavyam ca sarve lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ  /
translated: where the past and future, and all the worlds are established, tell me, who is he?

original: yasya trayastriṃśat devāḥ nidhim rakṣanti sarvadā / nidhim tam adya kaḥ veda yam devāḥ abhirakṣatha /
analyzed: yasya trayastriṃśat devāḥ nidhim rakṣanti sarvadā   nidhim tam adya kaḥ veda yam devāḥ abhirakṣatha  /
translated: Whose treasure the Thirty-three Gods ever keep watch and ward. Who knows that treasure now, which ye, O Gods, keep watch and ward?

original: yatra devāḥ brahma vidaḥ brahma jyeṣṭham upāsate / yaḥ vai tān vidyāt pratyakṣam sa brahmā veditā syāt /
analyzed: yatra devāḥ brahma vidaḥ brahma jyeṣṭham upāsate   yaḥ vai tān vidyāt pratyakṣam sa brahmā veditā syāt  /
translated: Where the Gods who know the Brahman worship the Brahman as the eldest. He who knows them face to face would be the Brahman knower.

original: bṛhantaḥ nāma te devāḥ ye asataḥ pari jajñire / ekam tat aṅgam skambhasya asat āhuḥ paras janāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhantaḥ nāma te devāḥ ye asataḥ pari jajñire   ekam tat aṅgam skambhasya asat āhuḥ paras janāḥ  /
translated: Those Gods are called the Great, who were born from the Non-existent. That one part of Skambha, the Non-existent, men call the highest.

original: yatra skambhaḥ prajanayan purāṇam vyavartayat / ekam tat aṅgam skambhasya purāṇam anusaṃviduḥ //
analyzed: yatra skambhaḥ prajanayan purāṇam vyavartayat   ekam tat aṅgam skambhasya purāṇam anusaṃviduḥ
translated: Where Skambha, begetting the ancient, set it in motion. That one part of Skambha, the ancient, they know.

original: yasya trayastriṃśat devāḥ aṅge gātrāḥ vibhejire / tān vai trayastriṃśat devān eke braham vidaḥ viduḥ /
analyzed: yasya trayastriṃśat devāḥ aṅge gātrāḥ vibhejire   tān vai trayastriṃśat devān eke braham vidaḥ viduḥ  /
translated: Whose limbs the Thirty-three Gods divided. Some who know the Brahman know those Thirty-three Gods as the Brahman.

original: hiraṇya garbham paramam anatyudyam janāḥ viduḥ / skambhaḥ tat agre prāsiñcat hiraṇyam loke antarā /
analyzed: hiraṇya garbham paramam anatyudyam janāḥ viduḥ   skambhaḥ tat agre prāsiñcat hiraṇyam loke antarā
translated: Men know the golden embryo as the highest, the unborn. Skambha first poured forth the gold in the world.

original: skambhe lokāḥ skambhe tapaḥ skambhe adhi ṛtam āhitam / skambha tvā veda pratyakṣam indre sarvam samāhitam /
analyzed: skambhe lokāḥ skambhe tapaḥ skambhe adhi ṛtam āhitam   skambha tvā veda pratyakṣam indre sarvam samāhitam  /
translated: In Skambha are the worlds, in Skambha is heat, in Skambha is the truth that is set. Skambha, I know thee in truth, in Indra all is set.🔽In Indra are the worlds, in Indra is heat, in Indra is the truth that is set. Indra, I know thee in truth, in Skambha all is established.🔽In Indra I know thee in truth, in Skambha all is established.

original: indre lokāḥ indre tapaḥ indre adhi ṛtam āhitam / indram tvā veda pratyakṣam skambhe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam // indram tvā veda pratyakṣam skambhe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam // indram tvā veda pratyakṣam skambhe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam // indram tvā veda pratyakṣam skambhe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam // indram tvā veda pratyakṣam skambhe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam // indram tvā veda pratyakṣam skambhe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam // indram tvā veda pratyakṣam skambhe sarvam pratiṣṭh
analyzed: indre lokāḥ indre tapaḥ indre adhi ṛtam āhitam
translated: In Indra I know thee in truth, in Skambha all is established.🔽In Indra I know thee in truth, in Skambha all is established.🔽In Indra I know thee in truth, in Skambha all is established.🔽In Indra I know thee in truth, in Skambha all is established.

original: nāma nāmnā johavīti purā sūryāt purā uṣasaḥ / yat ajaḥ prathamam saṃbabhūva sa ha tat sva rājyam iyāya yasmāt na anyat param asti bhūtam //
analyzed: nāma nāmnā johavīti purā sūryāt purā uṣasaḥ   yat ajaḥ prathamam saṃbabhūva sa ha tat sva rājyam iyāya yasmāt na anyat param asti bhūtam  /
translated: He invokes the name by name before the sun, before the dawn, when the goat was first born, he went to that own kingdom, from which there is no other being higher.

original: yasya bhūmiḥ pramā antarikṣam uta udaram / divam yaḥ cakre mūrdhānam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ /
analyzed: yasya bhūmiḥ pramā antarikṣam uta udaram        yaḥ cakre mūrdhānam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ  /
translated: who made the heaven the head, to that highest Brahman homage!🔽To him whose eye is the sun, and the moon the new one every month,

original: yasya sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ candramāḥ ca punarṇavaḥ / agnim yaḥ cakre āsyam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ /
analyzed: yasya sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ candramāḥ ca punarṇavaḥ   agnim yaḥ cakre āsyam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ  /
translated: who made the mouth the fire, to that highest Brahman homage!🔽To him whose breath and expiration are the wind, and the eye the Angirases,

original: yasya vātaḥ prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ aṅgirasaḥ abhavan / diśaḥ yaḥ cakre prajñānīḥ tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ /
analyzed: yasya vātaḥ prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ aṅgirasaḥ abhavan    diśaḥ yaḥ cakre prajñānīḥ tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ  /
translated: who made the quarters of the world wise, to that highest Brahman homage!🔽Skambha supports these two, heaven and earth; Skambha supports the wide atmosphere;

original: skambhaḥ dādhāra dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime skambhaḥ dādhāra uru antarikṣam / skambhaḥ dādhāra pradiśaḥ ṣaṭ urvīḥ skambhaḥ idam viśvam bhuvanam ā viveśa /
analyzed: skambhaḥ dādhāra dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime skambhaḥ dādhāra uru antarikṣam   skambhaḥ dādhāra pradiśaḥ ṣaḍ urvīḥ skambhaḥ idam viśvam bhuvanam ā viveśa  /
translated: Skambha supports the six wide directions; Skambha has entered this whole world.🔽He who was born from toil and heat, and filled all the worlds,

original: yaḥ śramāt tapasaḥ jātaḥ lokān sarvān samānaśe / somam yaḥ cakre kevalam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śramāt tapasaḥ jātaḥ lokān sarvān samānaśe    somam yaḥ cakre kevalam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ  /
translated: who made the Soma his own, to that highest Brahman homage!🔽How does the wind not tire? How does the mind not delight?

original: katham vātaḥ na ilayati katham na ramate manaḥ / kim āpaḥ satyam prepsantīḥ na ilayanti kadā cana /
analyzed: katham vātaḥ na ilayati katham na ramate manaḥ   kim āpaḥ satyam prepsantīḥ na ilayanti kadā cana  /
translated: What is the truth that the waters ever seek, that they never tire?

original: mahat yakṣam bhuvanasya madhye tapasi krāntam salilasya pṛṣṭhe / tasmin śrayante ye u ke ca devāḥ vṛkṣasya skandhaḥ paritas iva śākhāḥ //
analyzed: mahat yakṣam bhuvanasya madhye tapasi krāntam salilasya pṛṣṭhe   tasmin śrayante ye u ke ca devāḥ vṛkṣasya skandhaḥ paritas iva śākhāḥ  /
translated: The great Yaksha in the midst of the world, who hath been passed over in the penance on the back of the waters, in whom all the gods, whatever they be, rest, as the branches of a tree on the trunk.

original: yasmai hastābhyām pādābhyām vācā śrotreṇa cakṣuṣā / yasmai devāḥ sadā balim prayacchanti vimite amitam skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ /
analyzed: yasmai hastābhyām pādābhyām vācā śrotreṇa cakṣuṣā    yasmai devāḥ sadā balim prayacchanti vimite amitam skambham tam brūhi katamaḥ svid eva saḥ  /
translated: To whom they offer the eternal sacrifice with hands, feet, speech, ears, and eyes, to whom the gods always give an unlimited oblation in the measured (world), tell me who is that supporter.

original: apa tasya hatam tamaḥ vyāvṛttaḥ sa pāpmanā / sarvāṇi tasmin jyotīṃṣi yāni trīṇi prajāpatau /
analyzed: apa tasya hatam tamaḥ vyāvṛttaḥ sa pāpmanā      / sarvāṇi tasmin jyotīṃṣi yāni trīṇi prajāpatau  /
translated: His darkness is destroyed, he is turned away from sin, in him are all the three lights which are in Prajapati.

original: yaḥ vetasam hiraṇyayam tiṣṭhantam salile veda / sa vai guhyaḥ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vetasam hiraṇyayam tiṣṭhantam salile veda   sa vai guhyaḥ prajāpatiḥ  /
translated: He who knows the golden reed which stands in the water, he is the hidden Prajapati.

original: tantram eke yuvatī virūpe abhyākrāmam vayataḥ ṣaṣ mayūkham / pra anyā tantūn tirate dhatte anyā na apa vṛñjāte na gamātaḥ antam /
analyzed: tantram eke yuvatī virūpe abhyākrāmam vayataḥ ṣaṣ mayūkham    pra anyā tantūn tirate dhatte anyā na apa vṛñjāte na gamātaḥ antam  /
translated: One of them is a young girl, the other is misshapen, they have come together, the six-rayed one. One of them stretches out the threads, the other places them. They do not part, they do not go to an end.

original: tayoḥ aham parinṛtyantyoḥ iva na vi jānāmi yatarā parastāt / pumān enat vayati ud gṛṇanti pumān enat vi jabhāra adhi nāke /
analyzed: tayoḥ aham parinṛtyantyoḥ iva na vi jānāmi yatarā parastāt   pumān enat vayati ud gṛṇanti pumān enat vi jabhāra adhi nāke  /
translated: Of those two, as if dancing around, I do not know which is the better. The male weaves it, they sing it forth, the male has divided it on the sky.

original: yaḥ bhūtam ca bhavyam ca sarvam yaḥ ca adhitiṣṭhati / su aryasya ca kevalam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ bhūtam ca bhavyam ca sarvam yaḥ ca adhitiṣṭhati    su aryasya ca kevalam tasmai jyeṣṭhāya brahmaṇe namaḥ  /
translated: and the pure essence of the well-governed soul, to him, the highest Brahman, be homage.

original: skambhena ime viṣṭabhite dyauḥ ca bhūmiḥ ca tiṣṭhataḥ / skambhaḥ idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat nimiṣat ca yat /
analyzed: skambhena ime viṣṭabhite dyauḥ ca bhūmiḥ ca tiṣṭhataḥ   skambhaḥ idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat nimiṣat ca yat  /
translated: By Skambha these two are upheld, heaven and earth stand firm. Skambha is this whole world, that which breathes and that which blinks.

original: tisraḥ ha prajāḥ atyāyam āyan ni anyāḥ arkam abhitas aviśanta / bṛhan ha tasthau rajasaḥ vimānaḥ haritaḥ hariṇīḥ ā viveśa /
analyzed: tisraḥ ha prajāḥ atyāyam āyan ni anyāḥ arkam abhitas aviśanta   bṛhan ha tasthau rajasaḥ vimānaḥ haritaḥ hariṇīḥ ā viveśa  /
translated: Three times the people passed beyond the flood, and others entered the sun on both sides. The great one stood in the unmeasured realm, the tawny one entered the tawny ones.

original: dvādaśa pradhayaḥ cakram ekam trīṇi nabhyāni kaḥ u tat ciketa / tatra āhatāḥ trīṇi śatāni śaṅkavaḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ ca khīlāḥ avicācalāḥ ye /
analyzed: dvādaśa pradhayaḥ cakram ekam trīṇi nabhyāni kaḥ u tat ciketa   tatra āhatāḥ trīṇi śatāni śaṅkavaḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ ca khīlāḥ avicācalāḥ ye  /
translated: Twelve are the circuits, the wheel is one, three are the naves. Who knows that? There are three hundred pins struck in, and sixty unshaken pegs.

original: idam savitar vi jānīhi ṣaṭ yamāḥ ekaḥ ekajaḥ / tasmin ha apitvam ichante yaḥ eṣām ekaḥ ekajaḥ /
analyzed: idam savitar vi jānīhi ṣaṭ yamāḥ ekaḥ ekajaḥ   tasmin ha apitvam ichante yaḥ eṣām ekaḥ ekajaḥ  /
translated: Know this, O Savitar, the six are the Yamas, one is the one-born. In him they desire to have their being, he who is their one-born.

original: āvis san nihitam guhā jarat nāma mahat padam / tatra idam sarvam ārpitam ejat prāṇat pratiṣṭhitam //
analyzed: āvis san nihitam guhā jarat nāma mahat padam   tatra idam sarvam ārpitam ejat prāṇat pratiṣṭhitam  /
translated: This ancient great place, hidden and manifest, is there all this is laid, that moves and breathes, and that which stands still.

original: eka cakram vartate eka nemi sahasra akṣaram pra puras ni paścā / ardhena viśvam bhuvanam jajāna yat asya ardham kva tat babhūva /
analyzed: eka cakram vartate eka nemi sahasra akṣaram pra puras ni paścā    ardhena viśvam bhuvanam jajāna yat asya ardham kva tat babhūva  /
translated: The single-wheeled moves on, with one sole nave, with thousand spokes, with front and back directed forward. With half he generated all the world of life: where is the other half of him, where is it?

original: pañca vāhī vahati agram eṣām praṣṭayaḥ yuktāḥ anusaṃvahanti / a yātam asya dadṛśe na yātam param nedīyaḥ avaram davīyaḥ /
analyzed: pañca vāhī vahati agram eṣām praṣṭayaḥ yuktāḥ anusaṃvahanti   a yātam asya dadṛśe na yātam param nedīyaḥ avaram davīyaḥ  /
translated: The five-ploughed ploughs the foremost of these: the yokes, yoked, follow, bearing up the plough. The unploughed field of his is seen, not ploughed, further than near, lower than high.

original: tiryak bilaḥ camasaḥ ūrdhva budhnaḥ tasmin yaśaḥ nihitam viśva rūpam / tat āsate ṛṣayaḥ sapta sākam ye asya gopāḥ mahataḥ babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tiryak bilaḥ camasaḥ ūrdhva budhnaḥ tasmin yaśaḥ nihitam viśva rūpam   tat āsate ṛṣayaḥ sapta sākam ye asya gopāḥ mahataḥ babhūvuḥ  /
translated: The bowl is a hole, with bottom above, wherein is laid the glory of all forms. In it the seven Rishis sit together, who have become the guardians of the great one.

original: yā purastāt yujyate yā ca paścāt yā viśvatas yujyate yā ca sarvatas / yayā yajñaḥ prāṅ tāyate tām tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // // tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // // // tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // // / tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // / tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // / tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // / tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // / tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām // / tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛc
analyzed: yā purastāt yujyate yā ca paścāt yā viśvatas yujyate yā ca sarvatas    yayā yajñaḥ prāṅ tāyate tām tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām      tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām         tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām         tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām         tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām        tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām        tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām       tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām       tvā pṛcchāmi katamā sā ṛcām       t
translated: I ask thee about that. Which is that of the Ṛc verses?🔽I ask thee about that. Which is that of the Ṛc verses?🔽I ask thee about that. Which is that of the Ṛc verses?

original: yat ejati patati yat ca tiṣṭhati prāṇat a prāṇat nimiṣat ca yat bhuvat / tat dādhāra pṛthivīm viśva rūpam tat saṃbhūya bhavati ekam eva /
analyzed: yat ejati patati yat ca tiṣṭhati prāṇat a prāṇat nimiṣat ca yat bhuvat    tat dādhāra pṛthivīm viśva rūpam tat saṃbhūya bhavati ekam eva  /
translated: That which moves, falls, and stands still, that which breathes and does not breathe, that which blinks and does not, that which has form, it supports the earth. Having come together, it becomes one only.

original: anantam vitatam purutra anantam antavat ca ā samante / te nākapālaḥ carati vicinvan vidvān bhūtam uta bhavyam asya /
analyzed: anantam vitatam purutra anantam antavat ca ā samante     te nākapālaḥ carati vicinvan vidvān bhūtam uta bhavyam asya  /
translated: Infinite, extended, manifold, infinite, and limited, at the end. He, the guardian of the vault, moves about, discerning, knowing the past and the future of this.

original: prajāpatiḥ carati garbhe antar a dṛśyamānaḥ bahudhā vi jāyate / ardhena viśvam bhuvanam jajāna yat asya ardham katamaḥ sa ketuḥ /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ carati garbhe antar a dṛśyamānaḥ bahudhā vi jāyate    ardhena viśvam bhuvanam jajāna yat asya ardham katamaḥ sa ketuḥ  /
translated: Prajapati moves within the womb, unseen, and is born in many ways. By half he created the whole world. What is his other half? What is its sign?

original: ūrdhvam bharantam udakam kumbhena iva udahāryam / paśyanti sarve cakṣuṣā na sarve manasā viduḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhvam bharantam udakam kumbhena iva udahāryam   paśyanti sarve cakṣuṣā na sarve manasā viduḥ  /
translated: All see him borne aloft like a water-pot filled with water, but not all know him with the mind.

original: dūre pūrṇena vasati dūre ūnena hīyate / mahat yakṣam bhuvanasya madhye tasmai balim rāṣṭrabhṛtaḥ bharanti //
analyzed: dūre pūrṇena vasati dūre ūnena hīyate    mahat yakṣam bhuvanasya madhye tasmai balim rāṣṭrabhṛtaḥ bharanti  /
translated: He dwells far away with the full, far away with the deficient he is diminished. The great mystery is in the middle of the world. The rulers of the kingdom bring him an offering.

original: yatas sūryaḥ udeti astam yatra ca gacchati / tat eva manye aham jyeṣṭham tat u na ati eti kim cana /
analyzed: yatas sūryaḥ udeti astam yatra ca gacchati   tat eva manye aham jyeṣṭham tat u na ati eti kim cana  /
translated: From where the sun rises and where it goes to set, I consider that to be the most excellent. Nothing surpasses it.

original: ye arvāk madhye uta vā purāṇam vedam vidvāṃsam abhitas vadanti / ādityam eva te pari vadanti sarve agnim dvitīyam trivṛtam ca haṃsam /
analyzed: ye arvāk madhye uta vā purāṇam vedam vidvāṃsam abhitas vadanti    ādityam eva te pari vadanti sarve agnim dvitīyam trivṛtam ca haṃsam  /
translated: Those who speak around the learned one, whether he is younger, of middle age, or older, they all speak around the sun. All of them speak around the second Agni, the Trivrit swan.

original: sahasrāhṇyam viyatau asya pakṣau hareḥ haṃsasya patataḥ svargam / sa devān sarvān urasi upadadya saṃpaśyan yāti bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: sahasrāhṇyam viyatau asya pakṣau hareḥ haṃsasya patataḥ svargam    sa devān sarvān urasi upadadya saṃpaśyan yāti bhuvanāni viśvā  /
translated: The two wings of the thousand-year-old swan, the moving one, the swift one, the one who flies to heaven, carrying all the gods on his chest, he goes beholding all the worlds.

original: satyena ūrdhvaḥ tapati brahmaṇā arvāṅ vi paśyati / prāṇena tiryaṅ prāṇati yasmin jyeṣṭham adhi śritam /
analyzed: satyena ūrdhvaḥ tapati brahmaṇā arvāṅ vi paśyati   prāṇena tiryaṅ prāṇati yasmin jyeṣṭham adhi śritam  /
translated: By truth he shines upward; by prayer he looks downward. By breath he breathes transversely, in whom the highest is contained.🔽He who knows thee, O Agni, the two kindling-sticks with which thou art enkindled as wealth, he, being wise, should think himself the highest; he should know the great Brahman.

original: yaḥ vai te vidyāt araṇī yābhyām nirmathyate vasu / sa vidvān jyeṣṭham manyeta sa vidyāt brāhmaṇam mahat // sa vidvān jyeṣṭham manyeta sa vidyāt brāhmaṇam mahat // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //
analyzed: yaḥ vai te vidyāt araṇī yābhyām nirmathyate vasu   sa vidvān jyeṣṭham manyeta sa vidyāt brāhmaṇam mahat   sa vidvān jyeṣṭham manyeta sa vidyāt brāhmaṇam mahat
translated: He who knows thee, O Agni, the two kindling-sticks with which thou art enkindled as wealth, he, being wise, should think himself the highest; he should know the great Brahman.

original: apād agre sam abhavat saḥ agre svar ābharat / catuṣpād bhūtvā bhogyaḥ sarvam ādatta bhojanam //
analyzed: apād agre sam abhavat saḥ agre svar ābharat   catuṣpād bhūtvā bhogyaḥ sarvam ādatta bhojanam  /
translated: He was without feet in the beginning; he became four-footed. Having become four-footed, he took all food as his enjoyment.

original: bhogyaḥ bhavat atha u annam adat bahu / yaḥ devam uttarāvantam upāsātai sanātanam /
analyzed: bhogyaḥ bhavat atha u annam adat bahu   yaḥ devam uttarāvantam upāsātai sanātanam  /
translated: He became an enjoyer, and then he ate much food. He who worships the eternal God who is above,

original: sanātanam enam āhuḥ uta adya syāt punarṇavaḥ / ahar rātre pra jāyete anyaḥ anyasya rūpayoḥ //
analyzed: sanātanam enam āhuḥ uta adya syāt punarṇavaḥ   ahar rātre pra jāyete anyaḥ anyasya rūpayoḥ  /
translated: they call him eternal, and he shall be new again today. Day and night are born, one from the other's form.

original: śatam sahasram ayutam nyarbudam asaṃkhyeyam svam asmin niviṣṭam / tat asya ghnanti abhipaśyataḥ eva tasmāt devaḥ rocat eṣaḥ etat /
analyzed: śatam sahasram ayutam nyarbudam asaṃkhyeyam svam asmin niviṣṭam   tat asya ghnanti abhipaśyataḥ eva tasmāt devaḥ rocat eṣaḥ etat  /
translated: A hundred, a thousand, ten thousand, a myriad, an incalculable number of my own (souls) are settled in this (body). They kill it even while he looks on. Therefore this God shines forth, this (soul).

original: bālāt ekam aṇīyaskam uta ekam na iva dṛśyate / tatas pariṣvajīyasī devatā sā mama priyā /
analyzed: bālāt ekam aṇīyaskam uta ekam na iva dṛśyate   tatas pariṣvajīyasī devatā sā mama priyā  /
translated: One is smaller than a child, and one is not seen at all. Greater than that is the deity, and she is dear to me.

original: iyam kalyāṇā ajarā martyasya amṛtā gṛhe / yasmai kṛtā śaye sa yaḥ cakāra jajāra saḥ /
analyzed: iyam kalyāṇā ajarā martyasya amṛtā gṛhe   yasmai kṛtā śaye sa yaḥ cakāra jajāra saḥ  /
translated: This auspicious, immortal one in the house of the mortal is made for him who lies down, and he who made it was born.

original: tvam strī tvam pumān asi tvam kumāraḥ uta vā kumārī //
analyzed: tvam strī tvam pumān asi tvam kumāraḥ uta vā kumārī
translated: You are a woman, you are a man, you are a boy, or even a girl.

original: tvam jīrṇaḥ daṇḍena vañcasi tvam jātaḥ bhavasi viśvatomukhaḥ //
analyzed: tvam jīrṇaḥ daṇḍena vañcasi tvam jātaḥ bhavasi viśvatomukhaḥ
translated: You are old, you deceive with a staff, you are born, you have a face in every direction.

original: uta eṣām pitā uta vā putraḥ eṣām uta eṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ uta vā kaniṣṭhaḥ / ekaḥ ha devaḥ manasi praviṣṭaḥ prathamaḥ jātaḥ saḥ u garbhe antar /
analyzed: uta eṣām pitā uta vā putraḥ eṣām uta eṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ uta vā kaniṣṭhaḥ    ekaḥ ha devaḥ manasi praviṣṭaḥ prathamaḥ jātaḥ saḥ u garbhe antar  /
translated: He is the father of these, or the son of these, or the eldest of these, or the youngest. One God has entered the mind, born first, he is in the womb.

original: pūrṇāt pūrṇam ud acati pūrṇam pūrṇena sicyate / uta u tat adya vidyāma yatas tat pariṣicyate /
analyzed: pūrṇāt pūrṇam ud acati pūrṇam pūrṇena sicyate    uta u tat adya vidyāma yatas tat pariṣicyate  /
translated: From the full (moon) the full (moon) rises, the full (moon) is sprinkled with the full (moon). And may we know that today from which it is sprinkled.

original: eṣā sanatnī sanam eva jātā eṣā purāṇī pari sarvam babhūva / mahī devī uṣasaḥ vibhātī sā ekena ekena miṣatā vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi caṣṭe // vi
analyzed: eṣā sanatnī sanam eva jātā eṣā purāṇī pari sarvam babhūva  / mahī devī uṣasaḥ vibhātī sā ekena ekena miṣatā vi caṣṭe   vi caṣṭe
translated: This ancient one was born for ever-lasting life. This ancient one hath spread herself over all things. The great Goddess, the shining Dawns, She looks around with one and the same eye.

original: aviḥ vai nāma devatā ṛtena āste parīvṛtā / tasyāḥ rūpeṇa ime vṛkṣāḥ haritāḥ harita srajaḥ /
analyzed: aviḥ vai nāma devatā ṛtena āste parīvṛtā   tasyāḥ rūpeṇa ime vṛkṣāḥ haritāḥ harita srajaḥ  /
translated: The deity named Avi, surrounded by the Ritu, sits. By her form these trees are green, with green garlands.

original: anti santam na jahāti anti santam na paśyati / devasya paśya kāvyam na mamāra na jīryati //
analyzed: anti santam na jahāti anti santam na paśyati    devasya paśya kāvyam na mamāra na jīryati  /
translated: She does not abandon him who is near, she does not see him who is near. Behold the creation of the god, he neither dies nor grows old.

original: apūrveṇa iṣitāḥ vācaḥ tāḥ vadanti yathāyatham / vadantīḥ yatra gacchanti tat āhuḥ brāhmaṇam mahat //
analyzed: apūrveṇa iṣitāḥ vācaḥ tāḥ vadanti yathāyatham   vadantīḥ yatra gacchanti tat āhuḥ brāhmaṇam mahat  /
translated: The words that are sent forth by the unseen one, they speak as they are. Where the speaking ones go, that they call the great Brahman.

original: yatra devāḥ ca manuṣyāḥ cārāḥ nābhau iva śritāḥ / apām tvā puṣpam pṛchāmi yatra tat māyayā hitam /
analyzed: yatra devāḥ ca manuṣyāḥ cārāḥ nābhau iva śritāḥ   apām tvā puṣpam pṛcchāmi yatra tat māyayā hitam  /
translated: Whereon the Gods and men are seated, as on the navel of the earth, I ask of you the flower of the waters, whereon that is placed by magic power.

original: yebhiḥ vātaḥ iṣitaḥ pravāti ye dadante pañca diśaḥ sadhrīcīḥ / ye āhutim atyamanyanta devāḥ apām netāraḥ katame te āsan /
analyzed: yebhiḥ vātaḥ iṣitaḥ pravāti ye dadante pañca diśaḥ sadhrīcīḥ   ye āhutim atyamanyanta devāḥ apām netāraḥ katame te āsan  /
translated: By whom the wind is sent forth when it blows, who give the five regions with the region of the east, who have despised the oblation, the Gods, who were the leaders of the waters?

original: imām eṣām pṛthivīm vaste ekaḥ antarikṣam pari ekaḥ babhūva / divam eṣām dadate yaḥ vidhartā viśvāḥ āśāḥ prati rakṣanti eke /🔽yaḥ vidyāt sūtram vitatam yasmin otāḥ prajāḥ imāḥ / sūtram sūtrasya yaḥ vidyāt sa vidyāt brāhmaṇam mahat /
analyzed: imām eṣām pṛthivīm vaste ekaḥ antarikṣam pari ekaḥ babhūva   divam eṣām dadate yaḥ vidhartā viśvāḥ āśāḥ prati rakṣanti eke  / yaḥ vidyāt sūtram vitatam yasmin otāḥ prajāḥ imāḥ   sūtram sūtrasya yaḥ vidyāt sa vidyāt brāhmaṇam mahat  /
translated: One of them clothes himself with this earth, one hath become the atmosphere, one gives them the heaven, the disposer, one of them guards all the regions.🔽He who knows the extended thread, on which these people are strung, who knows the thread of the thread, he knows the great Brāhman.

original: veda aham sūtram vitatam yasmin otāḥ prajāḥ imāḥ / sūtram sūtrasya aham veda atha u yat brāhmaṇam mahat /
analyzed: veda aham sūtram vitatam yasmin otāḥ prajāḥ imāḥ   sūtram sūtrasya aham veda atha u yat brāhmaṇam mahat  /
translated: I know the extended thread, on which these people are strung, I know the thread of the thread, and also the great Brāhman.

original: yat antarā dyāvāpṛthivī agniḥ ait pradahan viśvadāvyaḥ / yatra atiṣṭhan eka patnīḥ parastāt kva iva āsīt mātariśvā tadānīm /
analyzed: yat antarā dyāvāpṛthivī agniḥ ait pradahan viśvadāvyaḥ   yatra atiṣṭhan eka patnīḥ parastāt kva iva āsīt mātariśvā tadānīm  /
translated: When Agni, the all-consuming, went between heaven and earth, burning, when the one-wife stood beyond, where was Mātariśvan then?

original: apsu āsīt mātariśvā praviṣṭaḥ praviṣṭāḥ devāḥ salilāni āsan //
analyzed: apsu āsīt mātariśvā praviṣṭaḥ praviṣṭāḥ devāḥ salilāni āsan
translated: In the waters was Matarisvan, who entered in; the gods entered into the waters.

original: bṛhan ha tasthau rajasaḥ vimānaḥ pavamānaḥ haritaḥ ā viveśa /
analyzed: bṛhan ha tasthau rajasaḥ vimānaḥ pavamānaḥ haritaḥ ā viveśa
translated: He hath stood forth, the lofty one, beyond the region; Pavamâna hath entered into the green ones.

original: uttareṇa iva gayatrīm amṛte adhi vi cakrame / sāmnā ye sāma saṃviduḥ ajaḥ tat dadṛśe kva /
analyzed: uttareṇa iva gayatrīm amṛte adhi vi cakrame   sāmnā ye sāma saṃviduḥ ajaḥ tat dadṛśe kva  /
translated: As it were on the north of the Gayatri, on immortality he hath spread himself out. They who know the Sâman know the Sâman's secret. The goat hath seen that.🔽The dweller in the house, the gatherer of treasures, like the God Savitar of true decrees,

original: niveśanaḥ saṃgamanaḥ vasūnām devaḥ iva savitā satya dharmā / indraḥ na tasthau samare dhanānām /
analyzed: niveśanaḥ saṃgamanaḥ vasūnām devaḥ iva savitā satya dharmā   indraḥ na tasthau samare dhanānām  /
translated: Like Indra hath he stood in the battle for the spoil.

original: puṇḍarīkam nava dvāram tribhiḥ guṇebhiḥ āvṛtam / tasmin yat yakṣam ātmanvat tat vai brahma vidaḥ viduḥ /
analyzed: puṇḍarīkam nava dvāram tribhiḥ guṇebhiḥ āvṛtam   tasmin yat yakṣam ātmanvat tat vai brahma vidaḥ viduḥ  /
translated: The lotus with its nine gates, encompassed by three qualities, wherein is the self-existent Yaksha, that know the knowers of Brahman.

translated: Knowing Him, one is not afraid of death, of one's own self, the Wise, the Immortal, the Youthful.🔽Knowing Him, one is not afraid of death, of one's own self, the Wise, the Immortal, the Youthful.

original: aghāyatām api nahyā mukhāni sapatneṣu vajram arpaya etam / indreṇa dattā prathamā śata odanā bhrātṛvya ghnī yajamānasya gātuḥ /
analyzed: aghāyatām api nahyāḥ mukhāni sapatneṣu vajram arpaya etam  / indreṇa dattā prathamā śata odanā bhrātṛvya ghnī yajamānasya gātuḥ  /
translated: Pointing the mouths of the enemies towards the ground, hurl this thunderbolt at them. Given by Indra, the first hundred-oblation offering is the sacrificer's path to destroy his enemies.

original: vediḥ te carma bhavatu barhiḥ lomāni yāni te / eṣā tvā raśanā agrabhīt grāvā tvā eṣaḥ adhi nṛtyatu //
analyzed: vediḥ te carma bhavatu barhiḥ lomāni yāni te    eṣā tvā raśanā agrabhīt grāvā tvā eṣaḥ adhi nṛtyatu  /
translated: Let the altar be your skin, the sacrificial grass your hairs, this rope has seized you, let this stone dance upon you.

original: bālāḥ te prokṣaṇīḥ santu jīhvā sam mārṣṭu aghnye / śuddhā tvam yajñiyā bhūtvā divam prehi śata odane /
analyzed: bālāḥ te prokṣaṇīḥ santu jīhvā sam mārṣṭu aghnye   śuddhā tvam yajñiyā bhūtvā divam prehi śata odane  /
translated: Let the young shoots be thy sprinklings, O milch-cow, let thy tongue be the wiper. Being purified and fit for sacrifice, go to the sky, O hundred-platter.

original: yaḥ śata odanām pacati kāmapreṇa sa kalpate / prītāḥ hi asya ṛtvijaḥ sarve yanti yathāyatham //
analyzed: yaḥ śata odanām pacati kāmapreṇa sa kalpate   prītāḥ hi asya ṛtvijaḥ sarve yanti yathāyatham  /
translated: He who cooks the hundred-platter becomes fit for what he desires, for his priests are all pleased and go according to their wish.

original: sa svargam ā rohati yatra adaḥ tridivam divaḥ / apūpa nābhim kṛtvā yaḥ dadāti śata odanām //
analyzed: sa svargam ā rohati yatra adaḥ tridivam divaḥ   apūpa nābhim kṛtvā yaḥ dadāti śata odanām  /
translated: He ascends to heaven, to the place of the three heavens of heaven, he who, making the cake his navel, gives the hundred-platter.

original: sa tān lokān sam āpnoti ye divyāḥ ye ca pārthivāḥ / hiraṇyajyotiṣam kṛtvā yaḥ dadāti śata odanām //
analyzed: sa tān lokān sam āpnoti ye divyāḥ ye ca pārthivāḥ   hiraṇyajyotiṣam kṛtvā yaḥ dadāti śata odanām  /
translated: He attains all those worlds, both heavenly and earthly, he who, making the golden light, gives the hundred-platter.

original: ye te devi śamitāraḥ paktāraḥ ye ca te janāḥ / te tvā sarve gopsyanti mā ebhyaḥ bhaiṣīḥ śata odane /
analyzed: ye te devi śamitāraḥ paktāraḥ ye ca te janāḥ   te tvā sarve gopsyanti mā ebhyaḥ bhaiṣīḥ śata odane  /
translated: O Goddess, those who cook and prepare thee, and those who are thy people, may they all protect thee. Fear not them, O hundred-platter.

original: vasavaḥ tvā dakṣiṇatas uttarāt marutaḥ tvā / ādityāḥ paścāt gopsyanti sā agniṣṭomam ati drava /
analyzed: vasavaḥ tvā dakṣiṇatas uttarāt marutaḥ tvā   ādityāḥ paścāt gopsyanti sā agniṣṭomam ati drava  /
translated: The Vasus will protect thee from the south, the Maruts from the north, the Adityas from the west. Go beyond the Agnistoma.

original: devāḥ pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ gandharva apsarasaḥ ca ye / te tvā sarve gopsyanti sā atirātram ati drava /
analyzed: devāḥ pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ gandharva apsarasaḥ ca ye te tvā sarve gopsyanti sā atirātram ati drava  /
translated: The gods, the fathers, the men, the Gandharvas and the Apsarases, may they all protect thee. Go beyond the Atirâtra.

original: ghṛtam prokṣantī subhagā devī devān gamiṣyati / paktāram aghnye mā hiṃsīḥ divam prehi śata odane /

translated: The Goddess, sprinkling ghee, auspicious, will go to the Gods. Do not harm the cook, O cow; go to the sky, O hundred-platter.

translated: After thee hath Agni entered, after thee hath Soma entered, O Cow. Thy back, O blessed one, is Parjanya, thy udders are the lightnings, O Cow.

translated: Thou milkest out the waters first, the fields thou milkest out the second time, O Cow. The third time thou milkest out the kingdom, food and milk, O Cow.🔽When thou, O thou of true gifts, stoodest near, milked by the Âdityas,

original: yat ādityaiḥ hūyamānā upātiṣṭha ṛtavari / indraḥ sahasram pātrān somam tvā apāyayat vaśe /
analyzed: yat ādityaiḥ hūyamānā upātiṣṭha ṛtavari    indraḥ sahasram pātrān somam tvā apāyayat vaśe  /
translated: Indra made thee drink a thousand bowls of Soma, O Cow.

original: yat anūcī indram aiḥ āt tvā ṛṣabhaḥ ahvayat / tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe // tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe // tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe // tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe // tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe // tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe // tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram krud
analyzed: yat anūcī indram aiḥ āt tvā ṛṣabhaḥ ahvayat      tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe   tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe    tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe    tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe    tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe     tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ aharat vaśe     tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddha
translated: Therefore, O Vr̥itra-slayer, in wrath thou hast taken away the milk, the milk of her who yields the milky draught.🔽Therefore, O Vr̥itra-slayer, in wrath thou hast taken away the milk, the milk of her who yields the milky draught.🔽Therefore, O Vr̥itra-slayer, in wrath thou hast taken away the milk, the milk of her who yields the milky draught.🔽When, angry, thou, O Lord of wealth, hast taken away her milk,

original: yat te kruddhaḥ dhanapatiḥ ā kṣīram aharat vaśe / idam tat adya nākaḥ triṣu pātreṣu rakṣati //
analyzed: yat te kruddhaḥ dhanapatiḥ ā kṣīram aharat vaśe    idam tat adya nākaḥ triṣu pātreṣu rakṣati  /
translated: The milk which she, the Cow, to-day preserves in three receptacles.🔽The Cow hath brought that Soma to the three receptacles,

original: triṣu pātreṣu tam somam ā devī aharat vaśā / atharvā yatra dīkṣitaḥ barhiṣi āsta hiraṇyaye /
analyzed: triṣu pātreṣu tam somam ā devī aharat vaśā    atharvā yatra dīkṣitaḥ barhiṣi āsta hiraṇyaye  /
translated: Where, consecrated, Atharvan sat upon the golden grass.🔽With Soma have I come together, with all that hath a foot.

original: sam hi somena āgata sam u sarveṇa padvatā / vaśā samudram adhi aṣṭhat gandharvaiḥ kalibhiḥ saha /
analyzed: sam hi somena āgata sam u sarveṇa padvatā    vaśā samudram adhi aṣṭhat gandharvaiḥ kalibhiḥ saha  /
translated: The Cow hath sat upon the sea with the Gandharvas and the Kâli tribes.

original: sam hi vātena agata sam u sarvaiḥ patatribhiḥ / vaśā samudre prānṛtyat ṛcaḥ sāmāni bibhratī /
analyzed: sam hi vātena agata sam u sarvaiḥ patatribhiḥ   vaśā samudre prānṛtyat ṛcaḥ sāmāni bibhratī  /
translated: Thou hast come hither with the wind, and with all winged things together. The Cow hath danced upon the sea, bearing the Richas and the Sâmans.

original: sam hi sūryeṇa āgata sam u sarveṇa cakṣuṣā / vaśā samudram ati akhyat bhadrā jyotīṃṣi bibhratī /🔽abhīvṛtā hiraṇyena yat atiṣṭhaḥ ṛtāvari / aśvaḥ samudraḥ bhūtvā adhi askandat vaśe tvā /
analyzed: sam hi sūryeṇa āgata sam u sarveṇa cakṣuṣā   vaśā samudram ati akhyat bhadrā jyotīṃṣi bibhratī  / abhīvṛtā hiraṇyena yat atiṣṭhaḥ ṛtāvari   aśvaḥ samudraḥ bhūtvā adhi askandat vaśe tvā  /
translated: Thou hast come hither with the Sun, and with all eye-sight together. The Cow hath looked across the sea, bearing auspicious things and stars.🔽When, O thou of truth, thou stoodest covered with gold, the Horse, becoming the sea, hath leaped upon thee, O Cow.

original: tat bhadrāḥ sam agacchanta vaśā deṣṭrī atho svadhā / atharvā yatra dīkṣitaḥ barhiṣī āsta hiraṇyaye /
analyzed: tat bhadrāḥ sam agacchanta vaśā deṣṭrī atho svadhā    atharvā yatra dīkṣitaḥ barhiṣī āsta hiraṇyaye  /
translated: The auspicious ones have met together, the Cow, the prophetess, and also Svadhâ. Where the initiated Atharvan sat on the two sacrificial grass-blades of gold,

original: vaśā mātā rājanyasya vaśā mātā svadhe tava / vaśāyāḥ yajñe āyudham tatas cittam ajāyata /
analyzed: vaśā mātā rājanyasya vaśā mātā svadhe tava    vaśāyāḥ yajñe āyudham tatas cittam ajāyata  /
translated: The Cow is the mother of the Râganya, the Cow is the mother of Svadhâ. From the Cow's sacrificial implement at the sacrifice the mind was born.

original: ūrdhvaḥ binduḥ ud acarat brahmaṇaḥ kakudāt adhi / tatas tvam jajñiṣe vaśe tatas hotā ajāyata /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ binduḥ ud acarat brahmaṇaḥ kakudāt adhi   tatas tvam jajñiṣe vaśe tatas hotā ajāyata  /
translated: The upward drop hath moved from the summit of holy power. From that, O Cow, thou wast born, and from that the Hotar was produced.

original: āsnaḥ te gāthāḥ abhavan uṣṇihābhyaḥ balam vaśe / pājasyāt jajñe yajñaḥ stanebhyaḥ raśmayaḥ tava / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / // // // // // // // //
analyzed: āsnaḥ te gāthāḥ abhavan uṣṇihābhyaḥ balam vaśe   pājasyāt jajñe yajñaḥ stanebhyaḥ raśmayaḥ tava
translated: From thy jaws have sprung the Gathas, from thy withers strength and sway. From thy hump was sacrifice produced, from thy teats thy rays have sprung.

original: īrmābhyām ayanam jātam sakthibhyām ca vaśe tava / āntrebhyaḥ jajñire atrāḥ udarāt adhi vīrudhaḥ /
analyzed: īrmābhyām ayanam jātam sakthibhyām ca vaśe tava    āntrebhyaḥ jajñire atrāḥ udarāt adhi vīrudhaḥ  /
translated: From thy flanks hath been produced thy course, and from thy thighs thy sway. From thy entrails have been born the waters, from thy belly the plants.

original: yat udaram varuṇasya anuprāviśathāḥ vaśe / tatas tvā brahmā ud ahvayat sa hi netram avet tava /
analyzed: yat udaram varuṇasya anuprāviśathāḥ vaśe    tatas tvā brahmā ud ahvayat sa hi netram avet tava  /
translated: Since thou hast entered into Varuna's belly, into his sway, From thence hath Brahman called thee forth, for he hath known thy eye.

original: sarve garbhāt avepanta jāyamānāt asūsvaḥ / sasūva hi tām āhu vaśā iti brahmabhiḥ kḷptaḥ sa hi asyāḥ bandhuḥ /
analyzed: sarve garbhāt avepanta jāyamānāt asūsvaḥ   sasūva hi tām āhu vaśā iti brahmabhiḥ kḷptaḥ sa hi asyāḥ bandhuḥ  /
translated: All trembled from the womb, when about to be born, from the mother. For she hath brought forth, and they call her Vasha. By the Brahmans is she made ready, for he is her kinsman.

original: yudhaḥ ekaḥ sam sṛjati yaḥ asyāḥ ekaḥ id vaśī / tarāṃsi yajñāḥ abhavan tarasām cakṣuḥ abhavat vaśā /
analyzed: yudhaḥ ekaḥ sam sṛjati yaḥ asyāḥ ekaḥ id vaśī   tarāṃsi yajñāḥ abhavan tarasām cakṣuḥ abhavat vaśā  /
translated: One only, the warrior, unites her, he only is her lord. Sacrifices have become her limbs, her eye hath become swiftness.

original: vaśā yajñam prati agṛhṇāt vaśā sūryam adhārayat / vaśāyām antar aviśat odanaḥ brahmaṇā saha /
analyzed: vaśā yajñam prati agṛhṇāt vaśā sūryam adhārayat   vaśāyām antar aviśat odanaḥ brahmaṇā saha  /
translated: The Vasha hath taken the sacrifice, the Vasha hath held the sun. In the Vasha hath the rice entered with the Brahman.

original: vaśām eva amṛtam āhuḥ vaśām mṛtyum upāsate / vaśā idam sarvam abhavat devāḥ manuṣyāḥ asurāḥ pitaraḥ ṛṣayaḥ /
analyzed: vaśām eva amṛtam āhuḥ vaśām mṛtyum upāsate   vaśā idam sarvam abhavat devāḥ manuṣyāḥ asurāḥ pitaraḥ ṛṣayaḥ  /
translated: The cow is called immortality; the cow they worship as death. The cow became all this, gods, men, demons, fathers, and seers.

original: yaḥ evam vidyāt sa vaśām prati gṛhṇīyāt / tathā hi yajñaḥ sarvapād duhe dātre an apasphuran //
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidyāt sa vaśām prati gṛhṇīyāt   tathā hi yajñaḥ sarvapād duhe dātre an apasphuran  /
translated: He who knows thus may accept a cow. Thus the sacrifice, with all its feet, yields milk to the giver, without fail.

original: tisraḥ jihvāḥ varuṇasya antar dīdyati āsani / tāsām yā madhye rājati sā vaśā duṣpratigrahā /
analyzed: tisraḥ jihvāḥ varuṇasya antar dīdyati āsani   tāsām yā madhye rājati sā vaśā duṣpratigrahā  /
translated: Three tongues of Varuna are shining in the lightning. Of these, the one in the middle shines as a queen, that cow is hard to accept.

original: caturdhā retaḥ abhavat vaśāyāḥ / āpaḥ turīyam amṛtam turīyam yajñaḥ turīyam paśavaḥ turīyam /
analyzed: caturdhā retaḥ abhavat vaśāyāḥ   āpaḥ turīyam amṛtam turīyam yajñaḥ turīyam paśavaḥ turīyam  /
translated: The seed of the cow became fourfold: water is one fourth, nectar is one fourth, sacrifice is one fourth, and cattle are one fourth.

original: vaśā dyauḥ vaśā pṛthivī vaśā viṣṇuḥ prajāpatiḥ / vaśāyāḥ dugdham apiban sādhyāḥ vasavaḥ ca ye /
analyzed: vaśā dyauḥ vaśā pṛthivī vaśā viṣṇuḥ prajāpatiḥ   vaśāyāḥ dugdham apiban sādhyāḥ vasavaḥ ca ye
translated: The cow is heaven, the cow is earth, the cow is Vishnu, the cow is Prajapati. The Sadhyas and the Vasus drank the milk of the cow.

original: vaśāyāḥ dugdham pītvā sādhyāḥ vasavaḥ ca ye / te vai bradhnasya viṣṭapi payaḥ asyāḥ upāsate /
analyzed: vaśāyāḥ dugdham pītvā sādhyāḥ vasavaḥ ca ye    te vai bradhnasya viṣṭapi payaḥ asyāḥ upāsate  /
translated: Having drunk the milk of the cow, the Sadhyas and the Vasus, they attend upon the milk of this spread of the sun.

original: somam enām eke duhre ghṛtam eke upāsate / ye evam viduṣe vaśām daduḥ te gatāḥ tridivam divaḥ /
analyzed: somam enām eke duhre ghṛtam eke upāsate   ye evam viduṣe vaśām daduḥ te gatāḥ tridivam divaḥ  /
translated: Some milk her for Soma, some attend upon her as ghee. Those who have given a cow to one who knows thus have gone to the third heaven of heaven.

original: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ vaśām dattvā sarvān lokān sam aśnute / ṛtam hi asyām ārpitam api brahma atho tapaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ vaśām dattvā sarvān lokān sam aśnute   ṛtam hi asyām ārpitam api brahma atho tapaḥ  /
translated: By giving a barren cow to the Brahmanas, one obtains all the worlds. Truth, indeed, is placed in her, as well as Brahman and austerity.🔽This whole (universe) has become a barren cow, as far as the sun looks on.🔽This whole (universe) has become a barren cow, as far as the sun looks on.🔽This whole (universe) has become a barren cow, as far as the sun looks on.🔽This whole (universe) has become a barren cow, as far as the sun looks on.🔽This whole (universe) has become a barren cow, as far as the sun looks on.🔽This whole (universe) has become a barren cow, as far as the sun looks on.
