analyzed: vaśā idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati    vaśā idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati         idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati   /   idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati  /   idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati  /   idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati  /   idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati  /   idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati  /   idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati  /   idam sarvam abhava
translated: This whole (universe) has become a barren cow, as far as the sun looks on.

original: agne jāyasva aditiḥ nāthitā iyam brahmaudanam pacati putra kāmā / sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ te tvā manthantu prajayā saha iha /
analyzed: agne jāyasva aditiḥ nāthitā iyam brahmaudanam pacati putra kāmā   sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ te tvā manthantu prajayā saha iha  /
translated: O Agni, be born, this Aditi, the suppliant, is cooking a Brahmic rice-gruel, O son, desiring offspring. May the seven Rishis, the creators of beings, churn you here with offspring.

original: kṛṇuta dhūmam vṛṣaṇaḥ sakhāyaḥ adroghāvitā vācam acha / ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāh su vīraḥ yena devāḥ asahanta dasyūn /
analyzed: kṛṇuta dhūmam vṛṣaṇaḥ sakhāyaḥ adroghāvitā vācam acha    ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāh su vīraḥ yena devāḥ asahanta dasyūn  /
translated: Make smoke, O ye strong ones, O my friends, with speech free from guile, and come hither. This Agni is the conqueror in battle, the good hero, by whom the gods overcame the Dasyus.

original: agne ajaniṣṭhāḥ mahate vīryāya brahmaudanāya paktave jātavedaḥ / sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ te tvā ajījanan asyai rayim sarva vīram ni yaccha /
analyzed: agne ajaniṣṭhāḥ mahate vīryāya brahmaudanāya paktave jātavedaḥ    sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ te tvā ajījanan asyai rayim sarva vīram ni yaccha  /
translated: O Agni, thou hast been born for great manly power, for the Brahmana's rice to be cooked, O all-knower. The seven Rishis, the creators of beings, have begotten thee. Bestow on him wealth with all heroes.

original: samiddhaḥ agne samidhā sam idhyasva vidvān devān yajñiyān ā iha vakṣaḥ / tebhyaḥ haviḥ śrapayam jātavedaḥ uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agne samidhā sam idhyasva vidvān devān yajñiyān ā iha vakṣaḥ    tebhyaḥ haviḥ śrapayam jātavedaḥ uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam  /
translated: O Agni, kindled with fuel, be kindled here, knowing the gods worthy of sacrifice, bring them hither. For them, O all-knower, cook the oblation, and raise this man to the highest vault of heaven.

original: tredhā bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yaḥ purā vaḥ devānām pitṝṇām martyānām / aṃśām jānīdhvam vi bhajāmi tān vaḥ yaḥ devānām saḥ imām pārayāti //
analyzed: tredhā bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yaḥ purā vaḥ devānām pitṝṇām martyānām    aṃśām jānīdhvam vi bhajāmi tān vaḥ yaḥ devānām saḥ imām pārayāti  /
translated: The portion that was formerly divided into three parts for you, for the gods, the fathers, and mortals, know the shares, I divide them for you. He who belongs to the gods, he shall lead this one across.

original: agne sahasvān abhibhūḥ abhi id asi nīcaḥ ni ubja dviṣataḥ sapatnān / iyam mātrā mīyamānā mitā ca sajātān te bali hṛtaḥ kṛṇotu /
analyzed: agne sahasvān abhibhūḥ abhi id asi nīcaḥ ni ubja dviṣataḥ sapatnān    iyam mātrā mīyamānā mitā ca sajātān te bali hṛtaḥ kṛṇotu  /
translated: O Agni, thou art the conqueror, the overcomer. Crush down the wicked, the foes. Let this measure, being measured and measured out, make the kinsmen pay tribute to thee.

original: sākam sajātaiḥ payasā saha edhi ud ubja enām mahate vīryāya / ūrdhvaḥ nākasya adhi roha viṣṭapam svargaḥ lokaḥ iti yam vadanti /
analyzed: sākam sajātaiḥ payasā saha edhi ud ubja enām mahate vīryāya   ūrdhvaḥ nākasya adhi roha viṣṭapam svargaḥ lokaḥ iti yam vadanti  /
translated: With thy own people, with the milk, be thou united. Lift her up for great strength. Rise up to the height of the vault of the sky, which they call the world of heaven.

original: iyam mahī prati gṛhṇātu carma pṛthivī devī sumanasyamānā / atha gacchema sukṛtasya lokam /
analyzed: iyam mahī prati gṛhṇātu carma pṛthivī devī sumanasyamānā    atha gacchema sukṛtasya lokam  /
translated: May this great earth, the skin, receive the Soma, the goddess, the earth, with a glad heart. Then may we go to the world of good deeds.

original: etau grāvāṇau sayujā yuṅdhi carmaṇi nirbindhi aṃśūn yajamānāya sādhu / avaghnatī ni jahi ye imām pṛtanyavaḥ ūrdhvam prajām udbharanti ud ūha /
analyzed: etau grāvāṇau sayujā yuṅdhi carmaṇi nirbindhi aṃśūn yajamānāya sādhu   avaghnatī ni jahi ye imām pṛtanyavaḥ ūrdhvam prajām udbharanti ud ūha  /
translated: Yoke these two pressing-stones together with the yoke on the skin. Pierce the fibres for the sacrificer's sake. As thou beatest, slay those who are hostile to this (earth), who raise up the people upwards. Lift up the people.

original: gṛhāṇa grāvāṇau sakṛtau vīra haste ā te devāḥ yajñiyāḥ yajñam aguḥ / trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi // trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi // trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi // trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi // trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ t
analyzed: gṛhāṇa grāvāṇau sakṛtau vīra haste ā te devāḥ yajñiyāḥ yajñam aguḥ   trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi   trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi    trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi    trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi    trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te sam
translated: Take the two stones, O Hero, in thy hand. The Gods who are to be worshipped have come to thy sacrifice. The three boons which thou hast asked for in thy striving, I grant thee here in full.

original: iyam te dhītiḥ idam u te janitram gṛhṇātu tvām aditiḥ śūra putrā / parā punīhi yaḥ imām pṛtanyavaḥ asyai rayim sarva vīram ni yaccha /
analyzed: iyam te dhītiḥ idam u te janitram gṛhṇātu tvām aditiḥ śūra putrā    parā punīhi yaḥ imām pṛtanyavaḥ asyai rayim sarva vīram ni yaccha  /
translated: This is thy thought, this is thy birthplace. May Aditi, O Hero, take thee. Purify the foes who have attacked this (earth). Bestow upon her wealth with all heroes.

original: upaśvase druvaye sīdata yūyam vi vicyadhvam yajñiyāsaḥ tuṣaiḥ / śriyā samānān ati sarvān syāma adhaspadam dviṣataḥ pādayāmi //
analyzed: upaśvase druvaye sīdata yūyam vi vicyadhvam yajñiyāsaḥ tuṣaiḥ   śriyā samānān ati sarvān syāma adhaspadam dviṣataḥ pādayāmi  /
translated: Breathe upon her, make her firm, sit ye down. Be ye scattered, ye who are meet for sacrifice, with the chaff. May we surpass all those who are our equals in prosperity. I cast the foot of the hateful one beneath.

original: parehi nāri punar ehi kṣipram apām tvā goṣṭhaḥ adhi arukṣat bharāya / tāsām gṛhṇītāt yatamāḥ yajñiyāḥ asan vibhājya dhīrītarāḥ jahītāt /
analyzed: parehi nāri punar ehi kṣipram apām tvā goṣṭhaḥ adhi arukṣat bharāya   tāsām gṛhṇītāt yatamāḥ yajñiyāḥ asan vibhājya dhīrītarāḥ jahītāt  /
translated: Go, woman, go again and come to us quickly. The cow-pen of the waters hath risen up for bearing (the oblation). Of these, take those which are most pure and meet for sacrifice. Having divided them, drive away the others.

original: emāḥ aguḥ yoṣitaḥ śumbhamānāḥ ud tiṣṭha nāri tavasam rabhasva / su patnī patyā prajayā prajāvatī ā tvā agan yajñaḥ prati kumbham gṛbhāya //
analyzed: ā imāḥ aguḥ yoṣitaḥ śumbhamānāḥ ud tiṣṭha nāri tavasam rabhasva    su patnī patyā prajayā prajāvatī ā tvā agan yajñaḥ prati kumbham gṛbhāya  /
translated: These women have come, adorning themselves. Rise up, woman, be strong and bold. Be a good wife, rich in children, with children. To thee hath come sacrifice. Take the pot.

original: ūrjaḥ bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yaḥ purā vaḥ ṛṣi praśiṣṭā apaḥ ā bhara etāḥ / ayam yajñaḥ gātu vid nātha vid prajā vid ugraḥ paśu vid vīra vid vaḥ astu /
analyzed: ūrjaḥ bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yaḥ purā vaḥ ṛṣi praśiṣṭā apaḥ ā bhara etāḥ    ayam yajñaḥ gātu vid nātha vid prajā vid ugraḥ paśu vid vīra vid vaḥ astu  /
translated: The share of strength which was placed before you, O waters, brought by the Rishis, bring that hither. May this sacrifice of yours be a finder of the way, a finder of the lord, a finder of offspring, a finder of strength, a finder of heroes.

original: agne caruḥ yajñiyaḥ tvā adhi arukṣat śuciḥ tapiṣṭhaḥ tapasā tapa enam / ārṣeyāḥ daivāḥ abhisaṃgatya bhāgam imam tapiṣṭhāḥ ṛtubhiḥ tapantu /
analyzed: agne caruḥ yajñiyaḥ tvā adhi arukṣat śuciḥ tapiṣṭhaḥ tapasā tapa enam    ārṣeyāḥ daivāḥ abhisaṃgatya bhāgam imam tapiṣṭhāḥ ṛtubhiḥ tapantu  /
translated: The sacrificial oblation, O Agni, hath risen up to thee. Pure, most burning, with heat burn him with heat. Having come together, the Rishis, the divine ones, let the most burning ones heat this share with the seasons.

original: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ āpaḥ carum ava sarpantu śubhrāḥ / aduḥ prajām bahulām paśūn naḥ paktā odanasya su kṛtām etu lokam /
analyzed: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ āpaḥ carum ava sarpantu śubhrāḥ   aduḥ prajām bahulām paśūn naḥ paktā odanasya su kṛtām etu lokam  /
translated: Let these pure, cleansed, holy women, and these bright waters, glide over the oblation. Grant us much offspring and cattle. Let the cooker of the rice-pap go to the world of the virtuous.

original: brahmaṇā śuddhāḥ uta pūtāḥ ghṛtena somasya aṃśavaḥ taṇḍulāḥ yajñiyāḥ ime / apaḥ pra viśata prati gṛhṇātu vaḥ caruḥ imam paktvā su kṛtām eta lokam /
analyzed: brahmaṇā śuddhāḥ uta pūtāḥ ghṛtena somasya aṃśavaḥ taṇḍulāḥ yajñiyāḥ ime   apaḥ pra viśata prati gṛhṇātu vaḥ caruḥ imam paktvā su kṛtām eta lokam  /
translated: Enter the waters. Let the cooked rice accept you. Having cooked this, go to the world of the virtuous.

original: uruḥ prathasva mahatā mahimnā sahasra pṛṣṭhaḥ su kṛtasya loke / pitāmahāḥ pitaraḥ prajā upajā aham paktā pañcadaśaḥ te asmi /
analyzed: uruḥ prathasva mahatā mahimnā sahasra pṛṣṭhaḥ su kṛtasya loke   pitāmahāḥ pitaraḥ prajā upajā aham paktā pañcadaśaḥ te asmi  /
translated: Be vast, spread with great majesty, with a thousand backs in the world of the well-done. Grandfathers, fathers, offspring, I am the cook, the fifteenth among you.🔽With a thousand backs, a hundred streams, inexhaustible, the Brahman rice, leading to the gods, heavenly,

original: sahasra pṛṣṭhaḥ śata dhāraḥ akṣitaḥ brahmaudanaḥ deva yānaḥ svar gaḥ / amūn te ā dadhāmi prajayā reṣaya enān bali hārāya mṛḍatāt mahyam eva / /
analyzed: sahasra pṛṣṭhaḥ śata dhāraḥ akṣitaḥ brahmaudanaḥ deva yānaḥ svar gaḥ   amūn te ā dadhāmi prajayā reṣaya enān bali hārāya mṛḍatāt mahyam eva
translated: I place these for you with offspring. Delight in them. For the one who brings the Bali offering, be gracious. Be gracious to me.🔽Rise up, make this altar grow with offspring. Drive away the Raksases. Make it cross over.

original: udehi vedim prajayā vardhaya enām nudasva rakṣaḥ prataram dhehi enām / śriyā samānān ati sarvān syāma adhaspadam dviṣataḥ pādayāmi //
analyzed: udehi vedim prajayā vardhaya enām nudasva rakṣaḥ prataram dhehi enām    śriyā samānān ati sarvān syāma adhaspadam dviṣataḥ pādayāmi  /
translated: May I surpass all those who are equal to me in prosperity. I place the feet of the hateful ones below.🔽Turn back to this (altar) with the cattle. Face this (altar) with the deities.

original: abhyāvartasva paśubhiḥ saha enām pratyaṅ enām devatābhiḥ saha edhi / mā tvā prāpat śapathaḥ mā abhicāraḥ sve kṣetre anamīvā vi rāja /
analyzed: abhyāvartasva paśubhiḥ saha enām pratyaṅ enām devatābhiḥ saha edhi   mā tvā prāpat śapathaḥ mā abhicāraḥ sve kṣetre anamīvā vi rāja  /
translated: Let not the curse nor the sorcery reach you. Be free from disease in your own field.

original: ṛtena taṣṭā manasā hitā eṣā brahmaudanasya vihitā vediḥ agre / aṃsadhrīm śuddhām upa dhehi nāri tatra odanam sādaya daivānām /
analyzed: ṛtena taṣṭā manasā hitā eṣā brahmaudanasya vihitā vediḥ agre   aṃsadhrīm śuddhām upa dhehi nāri tatra odanam sādaya daivānām  /
translated: This altar is prepared by the Rishis, the ancient sages, for the Brahmana's rice. O woman, place upon it the pure and well-shaped ladle. There, place the rice for the gods.🔽This ladle, the second, fashioned by Aditi, which the seven Rishis, the creators of beings, have made,

original: aditeḥ hastām srucam etām dvitīyām sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ yām akṛṇvan / sā gātrāṇi viduṣī odanasya darviḥ vedyām adhi enam cinotu //
analyzed: aditeḥ hastām srucam etām dvitīyām sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ yām akṛṇvan    sā gātrāṇi viduṣī odanasya darviḥ vedyām adhi enam cinotu  /
translated: May that ladle, knowing the parts of the rice, place it on the altar.

original: śṛtam tvā havyam upa sīdantu daivāḥ niḥsṛpya agneḥ punar enān pra sīda / somena pūtaḥ jaṭhare sīda brahmaṇām ārṣeyāḥ te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ /
analyzed: śṛtam tvā havyam upa sīdantu daivāḥ niḥsṛpya agneḥ punar enān pra sīda   somena pūtaḥ jaṭhare sīda brahmaṇām ārṣeyāḥ te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ  /
translated: Let the gods sit down to your cooked oblation. Having gone forth from the fire, return to them again. Purified by the Soma, sit in the stomach of the Brahmanas. Let not those who eat you be harmed by the Rishis.

original: soma rājan saṃjñānam ā vapa ebhyaḥ subrāhmaṇāḥ yatame tvā upasīdān / ṛṣīn ārṣeyān tapasaḥ adhi jātān brahmaudane su havā johavīmi //
analyzed: soma rājan saṃjñānam ā vapa ebhyaḥ subrāhmaṇāḥ yatame tvā upasīdān   ṛṣīn ārṣeyān tapasaḥ adhi jātān brahmaudane su havā johavīmi  /
translated: O Soma, king, spread the meeting place for them. The good Brahmanas have come to you. I invoke the Rishis, the descendants of the Rishis, born from austerity, in the Brahmana's rice, O easy to invoke one.

original: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi / yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ aham indraḥ marutvān sa dadāt idam me /
analyzed: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi   yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ aham indraḥ marutvān sa dadāt idam me  /
translated: Pure, purified, these women, worthy of sacrifice, I place separately in the hands of the Brahmanas. With whatever desire I sprinkle you, may Indra with the Maruts grant this to me.

original: idam me jyotiḥ amṛtam hiraṇyam pakvam kṣetrāt kāmadughā me eṣā / idam dhanam ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu kṛṇve panthām pitṛṣu yaḥ svargaḥ /🔽agnau tuṣān ā vapa jātavedasi paras kambūkām apa mṛḍḍhi dūram / etam śuśruma gṛharājasya bhāgam atho vidma nirṛteḥ bhāgadheyam /
analyzed: idam me jyotiḥ amṛtam hiraṇyam pakvam kṣetrāt kāmadughā me eṣā    idam dhanam ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu kṛṇve panthām pitṛṣu yaḥ svargaḥ  / agnau tuṣān ā vapa jātavedasi paras kambūkām apa mṛḍḍhi dūram     etam śuśruma gṛharājasya bhāgam atho vidma nirṛteḥ bhāgadheyam  /
translated: This gold of mine is light and immortal. This cow of mine, when milked, yields all desires. This wealth I place in the Brahmanas. I make the path for the Fathers which is heaven.🔽In the fire, O all-knower, cast the husks. Drive away the chaff to a distance. We have heard this to be the share of the king of the house. And we know the portion of Nirriti.

analyzed: śrāmyataḥ pacataḥ viddhi sunvataḥ panthām svargam adhi rohaya enam    yena rohāt param āpadya yat vayaḥ uttamam nākam paramam vyoma
translated: Know the path of him who toils, who cooks, who presses out the Soma. Raise him up to heaven, by which he may ascend to the highest life, to the highest vault of the sky.

original: babhreḥ adhvaryo mukham etat vi mṛḍḍhi ājyāya lokam kṛṇuhi pravidvān / ghṛtena gātrāḥ anu sarvā vi mṛḍḍhi kṛṇve panthām pitṛṣu yaḥ svar gaḥ /
analyzed: babhreḥ adhvaryo mukham etat vi mṛḍḍhi ājyāya lokam kṛṇuhi pravidvān   ghṛtena gātrāḥ anu sarvā vi mṛḍḍhi kṛṇve panthām pitṛṣu yaḥ svar gaḥ  /
translated: O Babhru, Adhvaryu, heal this mouth of thine, and, knowing well, make room for it to take the oil. With oil heal all its members, and I make a path for thee to the Fathers' heaven.

original: babhre rakṣaḥ samadam ā vapa ebhyaḥ a brāhmaṇāḥ yatame tvā upasīdān / purīṣiṇaḥ prathamānāḥ purastāt ārṣeyāḥ te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ /
analyzed: babhre rakṣaḥ samadam ā vapa ebhyaḥ a brāhmaṇāḥ yatame tvā upasīdān   purīṣiṇaḥ prathamānāḥ purastāt ārṣeyāḥ te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ  /
translated: O Babhru, cast the Raksas and the strife among them upon those who are not Brahmans and who wait on thee. Let not the eaters, the first, the spreading, the descendants of the Rishis, be harmed by thee.

original: ārṣeyeṣu ni dadhe odana tvā nānā ārṣeyāṇām api asti atra / agniḥ me goptā marutaḥ ca sarve viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu pakvam /
analyzed: ārṣeyeṣu ni dadhe odana tvā nānā ārṣeyāṇām api asti atra  / agniḥ me goptā marutaḥ ca sarve viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu pakvam  /
translated: In the descendants of the Rishis I place thee, O cake. There is a place here for the descendants of many Rishis. Let Agni be my guardian, and all the Maruts, and let all the gods guard the cooked (cake).

original: yajñam duhānam sadam id prapīnam pumāṃsam dhenum sadanam rayīṇām / prajā amṛta tvam uta dīrgham āyuḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ upa tvā sadema /
analyzed: yajñam duhānam sadam id prapīnam pumāṃsam dhenum sadanam rayīṇām    prajā amṛta tvam uta dīrgham āyuḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ upa tvā sadema  /
translated: The sacrifice, milking (the cow), ever full, the male, the milch cow, the seat of riches, offspring, immortality, and long life, with the increase of wealth may we sit down by thee.

original: vṛṣabhaḥ asi svarge ṛṣīn ārṣeyān gaccha / su kṛtām loke sīda tatra nau saṃskṛtam /
analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ asi svarge ṛṣīn ārṣeyān gaccha   su kṛtām loke sīda tatra nau saṃskṛtam  /
translated: Thou art the bull. Go to the Rishis, the descendants of the Rishis. Sit in the world of the virtuous. There is our preparation.

original: samācinuṣva anusaṃprayāhi agne pathaḥ kalpaya deva yānān / etaiḥ su kṛtaiḥ anu gacchema yajñam nāke tiṣṭhantam adhi sapta raśmau /
analyzed: samācinuṣva anusaṃprayāhi agne pathaḥ kalpaya deva yānān    etaiḥ su kṛtaiḥ anu gacchema yajñam nāke tiṣṭhantam adhi sapta raśmau  /
translated: Make ready, follow after, O Agni, prepare the paths that lead to Gods. With these good deeds may we go to the sacrifice that standeth in the sky upon the seven-rayed one.🔽By that light, O ye Gods, wherewith ye have gone up to heaven, having cooked the Brahmana's mess of rice and reached the world of good works, by that we go to the world of good works, ascending to the heaven, to the highest firmament.🔽By that we go to the world of good works, ascending to the heaven, to the highest firmament.🔽By that we go to the world of good works, ascending to the heaven, to the highest firmament.

original: yena devāḥ jyotiṣā dyām udāyan brahmaudanam paktvā su kṛtasya lokam / tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam // tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam // tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam // tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam // tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam // tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nāk
analyzed: yena devāḥ jyotiṣā dyām udāyan brahmaudanam paktvā su kṛtasya lokam   tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam   tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam   tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam   tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam    tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam    tena geṣma su kṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttama
translated: By that we go to the world of good works, ascending to the heaven, to the highest firmament.

original: bhava śarvau mṛḍatam mā abhi yātam bhūtapatī paśupatī namaḥ vām / pratihitām āyatām mā vi srāṣṭam mā naḥ hiṃsiṣṭam dvipadaḥ mā catuṣpadaḥ /
analyzed: bhava śarvau mṛḍatam mā abhi yātam bhūtapatī paśupatī namaḥ vām    pratihitām āyatām mā vi srāṣṭam mā naḥ hiṃsiṣṭam dvipadaḥ mā catuṣpadaḥ  /
translated: Be gracious, O Bhava and Sarva, do not approach us. Lords of creatures, Lords of cattle, adoration be to you. Do not extend the arrow shot at us. Do not harm us, our bipeds or our quadrupeds.

original: śune kroṣṭre mā śarīrāṇi kartam ali klavebhyaḥ gṛdhrebhyaḥ ye ca kṛṣṇāḥ aviṣyavaḥ / makṣikāḥ te paśupate vayāṃsi te vighase mā vidanta /
analyzed: śune kroṣṭre mā śarīrāṇi kartam ali klavebhyaḥ gṛdhrebhyaḥ ye ca kṛṣṇāḥ aviṣyavaḥ   makṣikāḥ te paśupate vayāṃsi te vighase mā vidanta  /
translated: Make not our bodies food for the dog and jackal, for the raven and the vulture, and for those black vermin that infest the corpse. Flies and birds of prey, O Lord of cattle, let them not find thy oblation.

original: krandāya te prāṇāya yāḥ ca te bhava ropayaḥ / namaḥ te rudra kṛṇmaḥ sahasrākṣāya amartya /
analyzed: krandāya te prāṇāya yāḥ ca te bhava ropayaḥ   namaḥ te rudra kṛṇmaḥ sahasrākṣāya amartya  /
translated: To thy cry, to thy breath, to thy darts, O Bhava, we offer adoration. To thee, O Rudra, we offer adoration, to the Immortal One with thousand eyes.

original: purastāt te namaḥ kṛṇmaḥ uttarāt adharāt uta / abhīvargāt divaḥ pari antarikṣāya te namaḥ /
analyzed: purastāt te namaḥ kṛṇmaḥ uttarāt adharāt uta  / abhīvargāt divaḥ pari antarikṣāya te namaḥ  /
translated: We offer adoration to thee from the east, from the north, from the south, from above, from below, from the wide region, from the sky, from the air, adoration to thee.

original: mukhāya te paśupate yāni cakṣūṃṣi te bhava / tvace rūpāya saṃdṛśe pratīcīnāya te namaḥ //
analyzed: mukhāya te paśupate yāni cakṣūṃṣi te bhava    tvace rūpāya saṃdṛśe pratīcīnāya te namaḥ  /
translated: To thy mouth, O Lord of cattle, and to thine eyes, O Bhava, to thy skin, to thy beauty, to thy form, to thy back, to the west, adoration to thee.

original: aṅgebhyaḥ te udarāya jihvāyāḥ āsyāya te / dadbhyaḥ gandhāya te namaḥ /
analyzed: aṅgebhyaḥ te udarāya jihvāyāḥ āsyāya te   dadbhyaḥ gandhāya te namaḥ  /
translated: To thy limbs, to thy belly, to thy tongue, to thy mouth, to thy teeth, to thy smell, adoration to thee.

original: astrā nīla śikhaṇḍena sahasrākṣeṇa vājinā / rudreṇa ardhaka ghātinā tena mā sam arāmahi //
analyzed: astrā nīla śikhaṇḍena sahasrākṣeṇa vājinā   rudreṇa ardhaka ghātinā tena mā sam arāmahi  /
translated: With the thousand-eyed, blue-crested weapon, with the weapon of the thousand-eyed Rudra, the slayer of half, may we not offend him.

original: sa naḥ bhavaḥ pari vṛṇaktu viśvatas āpaḥ iva agniḥ pari vṛṇaktu naḥ bhavaḥ / mā naḥ abhi māṃsta namaḥ astu asmai //
analyzed: sa naḥ bhavaḥ pari vṛṇaktu viśvatas āpaḥ iva agniḥ pari vṛṇaktu naḥ bhavaḥ   mā naḥ abhi māṃsta namaḥ astu asmai  /
translated: May Bhava protect us on every side, may Bhava protect us like the waters and the fire. May Bhava protect us. Let him not slay us. To him be homage.

original: catuḥ namaḥ aṣṭa kṛtvas bhavāya daśa kṛtvas paśupate namaḥ te / tava ime pañca paśavaḥ vibhaktāḥ gāvaḥ aśvāḥ puruṣāḥ aja avayaḥ /
analyzed: catuḥ namaḥ aṣṭa kṛtvas bhavāya daśa kṛtvas paśupate namaḥ te    tava ime pañca paśavaḥ vibhaktāḥ gāvaḥ aśvāḥ puruṣāḥ aja avayaḥ  /
translated: Four times, eight times homage to Bhava, ten times homage to thee, O Lord of Beasts. These fivefold creatures are allotted to thee: kine, horses, men, goats, and sheep.

original: tava catasraḥ pradiśaḥ tava dyauḥ tava pṛthivī tava idam ugrā uru antarikṣam / tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu / tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu / tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu / tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu / tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu / tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu / tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu
analyzed: tava catasraḥ pradiśaḥ tava dyauḥ tava pṛthivī tava idam ugrā uru antarikṣam    tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu    tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu    tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu    //
translated: Thine are the four quarters, thine is the sky, thine is the earth, thine is this wide air, O mighty One. Thine is all this that hath life, that moveth on the earth. Thine is all this that hath life, that moveth on the earth. Thine is all this that hath life, that moveth on the earth. Thine is all this that hath life, that moveth on the earth. Thine is all this that hath life, that moveth on the earth. Thine is all this that hath life, that moveth on the earth. Thine is all this that hath life, that moveth on the earth.

original: uruḥ kośaḥ vasu dhānaḥ tava ayam yasmin imā viśvā bhuvanāni antar / sa naḥ mṛḍa paśupate namaḥ te paras kroṣṭāraḥ abhibhāḥ śvānaḥ paras yantu agharudaḥ vikeśyaḥ /
analyzed: uruḥ kośaḥ vasu dhānaḥ tava ayam yasmin imā viśvā bhuvanāni antar   sa naḥ mṛḍa paśupate namaḥ te paras kroṣṭāraḥ abhibhāḥ śvānaḥ paras yantu agharudaḥ vikeśyaḥ  /
translated: This is thy wide treasure-house, O Lord of Beasts, wherein are all these living things. Be gracious unto us, O Lord of Beasts: to thee be homage! Far away be jackals, far away be dogs, far away be wailing with dishevelled hair.

original: dhanuḥ bibharṣi haritam hiraṇyayam sahasra ghnim śata vadham śikhaṇḍin / rudrasya iṣuḥ carati deva hetiḥ tasyai namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas /
analyzed: dhanuḥ bibharṣi haritam hiraṇyayam sahasra ghnim śata vadham śikhaṇḍin    rudrasya iṣuḥ carati deva hetiḥ tasyai namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas  /
translated: Thou bearest the green bow, made of gold, O thou of the crest of hair, which killeth a hundred, which killeth a thousand. Rudra's arrow goeth forth, the weapon of the Gods. To it be adoration in whatever place it be from hence.

original: yaḥ abhiyātaḥ nilayate tvām rudra nicikīrṣati / paścāt anuprayuṅkṣe tam viddhasya padanīḥ iva /
analyzed: yaḥ abhiyātaḥ nilayate tvām rudra nicikīrṣati   paścāt anuprayuṅkṣe tam viddhasya padanīḥ iva  /
translated: He who, O Rudra, advanceth against thee, and seeketh to assail thee, I follow after him, as after one who hath been pierced, and is going to his death.

original: bhava rudrau sayujā saṃvidānau ubhau ugrau carataḥ vīryāya / tābhyām namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas /
analyzed: bhava rudrau sayujā saṃvidānau ubhau ugrau carataḥ vīryāya   tābhyām namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas
translated: Bhava and Rudra, yoked together, in accord, both of you terrible, go forth to show your might. To them be adoration in whatever place they be from hence.

original: namaḥ te astu āyate namaḥ astu parāyate / namaḥ te rudra tiṣṭhate āsīnāya uta te namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te astu āyate namaḥ astu parāyate   namaḥ te rudra tiṣṭhate āsīnāya uta te namaḥ  /
translated: Homage to thee when thou goest away, homage to thee when thou comest back. Homage to thee, O Rudra, when thou standest, and also homage to thee when thou art seated.

original: namaḥ sāyam namaḥ prātar namaḥ rātryāḥ namaḥ divā / bhavāya ca śarvāya ca ubhābhyām akaram namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ sāyam namaḥ prātar namaḥ rātryāḥ namaḥ divā   bhavāya ca śarvāya ca ubhābhyām akaram namaḥ  /
translated: Homage to thee at evening, homage to thee at morn, homage to thee by night, homage to thee by day. To Bhava and to Sarva I have paid my homage both.

original: sahasrākṣam atipaśyam purastāt rudram asyantam bahudhā vipaścitam / mā upārāma jihvayā īyamānam /
analyzed: sahasrākṣam atipaśyam purastāt rudram asyantam bahudhā vipaścitam    mā upārāma jihvayā īyamānam  /
translated: The thousand-eyed, the far-beholding Rudra, who looketh on all things, who is wise in many a way, who shooteth forth his shafts, let him not harm us.

original: śyāva aśvam kṛṣṇam asitam mṛṇantam bhīmam ratham keśinaḥ pādayantam / pūrve pratīmaḥ namaḥ astu asmai /
analyzed: śyāva aśvam kṛṣṇam asitam mṛṇantam bhīmam ratham keśinaḥ pādayantam   pūrve pratīmaḥ namaḥ astu asmai  /
translated: The black, the dark, the grim, the grim-visaged car of Keçin, which they urge on, we welcome in the east. To him be homage.

original: mā naḥ abhi srāḥ matyam deva hetim mā naḥ krudhaḥ paśupate namaḥ te / anyatra asmat divyām śākhām vi dhūnu //
analyzed: mā naḥ abhi srāḥ matyam deva hetim mā naḥ krudhaḥ paśupate namaḥ te    anyatra asmat divyām śākhām vi dhūnu  /
translated: Do not shoot at us, O God, thy weapon of the mind. Be not angry with us, O Lord of Beasts: to thee be homage. Shake elsewhere than from us thy heavenly branch.

analyzed: mā naḥ hiṃsīḥ adhi naḥ brūhi pari naḥ vṛṅdhi mā krudhaḥ   mā tvayā sam arāmahi
translated: Do not injure us: speak to us kindly: surround us: be not angry with us. May we not provoke thee to anger.

original: mā naḥ goṣu puruṣeṣu mā gṛdhaḥ naḥ aja aviṣu / anyatra ugra vi vartaya piyārūṇām prajām jahi //
analyzed: mā naḥ goṣu puruṣeṣu mā gṛdhaḥ naḥ aja aviṣu   anyatra ugra vi vartaya piyārūṇām prajām jahi  /
translated: Do not be angry with our cattle, our men, our goats and sheep. Turn thy wrath elsewhere than from us. Destroy the offspring of the Piyârûs.

original: yasya takmā kāsikā hetiḥ ekam aśvasya iva vṛṣaṇaḥ krandaḥ eti / abhipūrvam nirṇayate namaḥ astu asmai /
analyzed: yasya takmā kāsikā hetiḥ ekam aśvasya iva vṛṣaṇaḥ krandaḥ eti   abhipūrvam nirṇayate namaḥ astu asmai  /
translated: Whose dart, O Takman, is the cough, whose cry, like that of a strong horse, goes forth, who goes forth, who settles down in front: to him be homage.

original: yaḥ antarikṣe tiṣṭhati viṣṭabhitaḥ a yajvanaḥ pramṛṇan deva pīyūn / tasmai namaḥ daśabhiḥ śakvarībhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ antarikṣe tiṣṭhati viṣṭabhitaḥ a yajvanaḥ pramṛṇan deva pīyūn    tasmai namaḥ daśabhiḥ śakvarībhiḥ  /
translated: He who stands in the firmament, firmly established, crushing the godless and the worshippers of idols, To him homage with ten Śakvari verses.

original: tubhyam āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ mṛgāḥ vane hitāḥ haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunāḥ vayāṃsi / tava yakṣam paśupate apsu antar tubhyam kṣaranti divyāḥ āpaḥ vṛdhe /
analyzed: tubhyam āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ mṛgāḥ vane hitāḥ haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunāḥ vayāṃsi    tava yakṣam paśupate apsu antar tubhyam kṣaranti divyāḥ āpaḥ vṛdhe  /
translated: To thee belong the wild beasts, the birds of the forest, the swans, the eagles, the birds, the insects. Thy Yakṣa, O Lord of cattle, is in the waters. For thy increase the heavenly waters flow to thee.

original: śiṃśumārāḥ ajagarāḥ purīkayā jaṣāḥ matsyāḥ rajasā yebhyaḥ asyasi / na te dūram na pariṣṭhā asti te bhava sadyas sarvām pari paśyasi bhūmim pūrvasmāt dhaṃsi uttarasmin samudre /
analyzed: śiṃśumārāḥ ajagarāḥ purīkayāḥ jaṣāḥ matsyāḥ rajasā yebhyaḥ asyasi    na te dūram na pariṣṭhā asti te bhava sadyas sarvām pari paśyasi bhūmim pūrvasmāt dhaṃsi uttarasmin samudre  /
translated: The porpoises, the pythons, the fishes, for whom thou art spread with dust in the ocean, For thee there is no distance, no remoteness. Thou, O Bhava, beholdest all the earth at once. Thou goest from the eastern to the western ocean.

original: mā naḥ rudra takmanā mā viṣeṇa mā naḥ sam srāḥ divyena agninā / anyatra asmat vidyutam pātaya etām /
analyzed: mā naḥ rudra takmanā mā viṣeṇa mā naḥ sam srāḥ divyena agninā    anyatra asmat vidyutam pātaya etām  /
translated: Do not strike us, O Rudra, with thy dart, nor with thy poison, nor crush us with thy heavenly fire. Send this lightning elsewhere than towards us.

original: bhavaḥ divaḥ bhavaḥ īśe pṛthivyāḥ bhavaḥ ā papre uru antarikṣam / tasyai namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas /
analyzed: bhavaḥ divaḥ bhavaḥ īśe pṛthivyāḥ bhavaḥ ā papre uru antarikṣam   tasyai namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas  /
translated: Bhavat is of heaven, Bhavat is the lord of earth, Bhavat hath filled the wide atmosphere. To him be homage in whatever quarter of the sky he is.

original: bhava rājan yajamānāya mṛḍa paśūnām hi paśupatiḥ babhūtha / yaḥ śraddadhāti santi devāḥ iti catuṣpade dvipade asya mṛḍa /
analyzed: bhava rājan yajamānāya mṛḍa paśūnām hi paśupatiḥ babhūtha   yaḥ śraddadhāti santi devāḥ iti catuṣpade dvipade asya mṛḍa  /
translated: Be gracious, O King, to the sacrificer: thou hast become the Lord of cattle, Lord of Beasts. Be gracious to his four-footed and his two-footed creatures, who believes that Gods exist.

original: mā naḥ mahāntam uta mā naḥ arbhakam mā naḥ vahantam uta mā naḥ vakṣyataḥ / mā naḥ hiṃsīḥ pitaram mātaram ca svām tanvam rudra mā rīriṣaḥ naḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ mahāntam uta mā naḥ arbhakam mā naḥ vahantam uta mā naḥ vakṣyataḥ   mā naḥ hiṃsīḥ pitaram mātaram ca svām tanvam rudra mā rīriṣaḥ naḥ  /
translated: Harm not our great one, harm not our infant: harm not our man who carries, harm not our carrier. Harm not our father, harm not our mother, harm not thyself, O Rudra, harm not our own.

original: rudrasya elabakārebhyaḥ a saṃsūkta gilebhyaḥ / idam mahā āsyebhyaḥ śvabhyaḥ akaram namaḥ //
analyzed: rudrasya elabakārebhyaḥ a saṃsūkta gilebhyaḥ   idam mahā āsyebhyaḥ śvabhyaḥ akaram namaḥ
translated: To Rudra's Elabakara, to the unchewed morsels of his jaws, to these great-mouthed dogs I offer this my homage.

original: śyāmam ayaḥ asya māṃsāni lohitam asya lohitam //🔽trapu bhasma haritam varṇaḥ puṣkaram asya gandhaḥ //
analyzed: śyāmam ayaḥ asya māṃsāni lohitam asya lohitam  trapu bhasma haritam varṇaḥ puṣkaram asya gandhaḥ
translated: His flesh is black iron, his blood is his blood.🔽His colour is tin and ashes, his smell is that of a lotus.

original: khalaḥ pātram sphyau aṃsau īṣe anūkye //
analyzed: khalaḥ pātram sphyau aṃsau īṣe anūkye
translated: The trough is his chest, the two Sphyas are his shoulders, the two plough-sticks are his two flanks.

original: āntrāṇi jatravaḥ gudāḥ varatrāḥ //
analyzed: āntrāṇi jatravaḥ gudāḥ varatrāḥ
translated: The entrails are his entrails, the intestines are his girdles.

original: iyam eva pṛthivī kumbhī bhavati rādhyamānasya odanasya dyauḥ apidhānam //
analyzed: iyam eva pṛthivī kumbhī bhavati rādhyamānasya odanasya dyauḥ apidhānam
translated: This very earth is the cauldron of the rice that is being cooked, the sky is the cover.

original: sītāḥ parśavaḥ sikatāḥ ūbadhyam //🔽ṛtam hasta avanejanam kulyā upasecanam //
analyzed: sītāḥ parśavaḥ sikatāḥ ūbadhyam  ṛtam hasta avanejanam kulyā upasecanam
translated: The furrows are the ribs, the sand is the caul.🔽Truth is the rinsing of the hands, the channel is the sprinkling.

original: ṛcā kumbhī adhihitā ārtvijyena preṣitā //
analyzed: ṛcā kumbhī adhihitā ārtvijyena preṣitā
translated: The cauldron is placed with a Rc verse, sent forth by the office of the Ṛtvik.

original: brahmaṇā parigṛhītā sāmnā paryūḍhā //🔽bṛhat āyavanam rathantaram darviḥ //
analyzed: brahmaṇā parigṛhītā sāmnā paryūḍhā  bṛhat āyavanam rathantaram darviḥ
translated: It is taken round with the Sāman, embraced with the Sāman.🔽The Bṛhat is the ladle, the Rathantara is the stirring-stick.

original: ṛtavaḥ paktāraḥ ārtavāḥ sam indhate //
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ paktāraḥ ārtavāḥ sam indhate
translated: The seasons are the cooks, the half-seasons kindle (the fire).

original: odanena yajñavataḥ sarve lokāḥ samāpyāḥ //
analyzed: odanena yajñavataḥ sarve lokāḥ samāpyāḥ
translated: By the rice all the worlds are gained of him who has the sacrifice.

original: yasmin samudraḥ dyauḥ bhūmiḥ trayaḥ avara param śritāḥ //
analyzed: yasmin samudraḥ dyauḥ bhūmiḥ trayaḥ avara param śritāḥ
translated: In whom the three, the ocean, the sky, and the earth, are contained above and below.

original: yasya devāḥ akalpanta ucchiṣṭe ṣaṭ aśītayaḥ //
analyzed: yasya devāḥ akalpanta ucchiṣṭe ṣaṭ aśītayaḥ
translated: In whose leavings the gods, eighty-six in number, have their abode.

original: tam tvā odanasya pṛchāmi yaḥ asya mahimā mahān //
analyzed: tam tvā odanasya pṛcchāmi yaḥ asya mahimā mahān
translated: Thee, O rice, we ask about the greatness of him who is great.

original: sa yaḥ odanasya mahimānam vidyāt //
analyzed: sa yaḥ odanasya mahimānam vidyāt
translated: He who knows the greatness of the rice-pap

original: na alpaḥ iti brūyāt na anupasecanaḥ iti na idam ca kim ca iti //
analyzed: na alpaḥ iti brūyāt na anupasecanaḥ iti na idam ca kim ca iti
translated: should not say, 'It is not small,' 'It is not without a drink,' 'It is not this and that.'

original: yāvat dātā abhimanasyeta tat na ati vadet //
analyzed: yāvat dātā abhimanasyeta tat na ati vadet
translated: As far as the giver would think, so much he should not exceed.

original: brahma vādinaḥ vadanti parāñcam odanam prāśīḥ pratyañcam iti //
analyzed: brahma vādinaḥ vadanti parāñcam odanam prāśīḥ pratyañcam iti
translated: The theologians say, 'You have eaten the rice-pap with its face turned away, with its face turned towards you.'

original: tvam odanam prāśīḥ tvām odana iti //
analyzed: tvam odanam prāśīḥ tvām odana iti
translated: 'You have eaten the rice-pap, the rice-pap has eaten you.'

original: parāñcam ca enam prāśīḥ prāṇāḥ tvā hāsyanti iti enam āha //
analyzed: parāñcam ca enam prāśīḥ prāṇāḥ tvā hāsyanti iti enam āha
translated: 'You have eaten the rice-pap with its face turned away, your vital breaths will leave you,' he says to him.

original: pratyañcam ca enam prāśīḥ apānāḥ tvā hāsyanti iti enam āha //
analyzed: pratyañcam ca enam prāśīḥ apānāḥ tvā hāsyanti iti enam āha
translated: 'You have eaten the rice-pap with its face turned towards you, your out-breathings will leave you,' he says to him.

original: na eva aham odanam na mām odanaḥ //
analyzed: na eva aham odanam na mām odanaḥ
translated: 'Neither the rice-pap nor the rice-pap me,

analyzed: odane eva odanam prāśīt
translated: He ate rice with rice.

original: tatas ca enam anyena śīrṣṇā prāśīḥ yena ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan / jyeṣṭhataḥ te prajā mariṣyati iti enam āha / tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam / bṛhaspatinā śīrṣṇā / tena enam prāśiṣam tena enam ajīgamam / eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ / sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyena śīrṣṇā prāśīḥ yena ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan   jyeṣṭhataḥ te prajā mariṣyati iti enam āha   tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam   bṛhaspatinā śīrṣṇā   tena enam prāśiṣam tena enam ajīgamam    eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ   sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda   yaḥ evam veda    yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: Then eat of it with the other end, with that end whereby the ancient Rishis ate of it. 'Thy offspring will die from the eldest downwards,' he says to him. I did not eat of it with the end that was turned towards me, nor with the end that was turned away from me, nor with the end that was turned crosswise. With the head of Brihaspati I ate of it. With it I have conquered it. This is the rice which has all its limbs, all its ribs, all its body. He who knows thus becomes one who has all his limbs, all his ribs, all his body.

original: tatas ca enam anyābhyām śrotrābhyām prāśīḥ yābhyām ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan / badhiraḥ bhaviṣyasi iti enam āha / tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam / dyāvāpṛthivībhyām śrotrābhyām / tābhyām enam prāśiṣam tābhyām enam ajīgamam / eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ / sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam veda /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyābhyām śrotrābhyām prāśīḥ yābhyām ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan   badhiraḥ bhaviṣyasi iti enam āha   tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam   dyāvāpṛthivībhyām śrotrābhyām   tābhyām enam prāśiṣam tābhyām enam ajīgamam    eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ    sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda    yaḥ evam veda  /
translated: Then eat him with the other two ears with which the Rishis of old ate him. Thou wilt become deaf,' he says to him. I did not eat him with the ears turned towards me, nor with the ears turned away from me, nor with the ears turned crosswise. With the ears of heaven and earth I ate him. With them I approached him. This is the whole-limbed, whole-jointed, whole-bodied rice. Whole-limbed, whole-jointed, whole-bodied he becomes who knows thus.

original: tatas ca enam anyābhyām hastābhyām prāśīḥ yābhyām ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan / brāhmaṇam haniṣyasi iti enam āha / tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam / ṛtasya hastābhyām / tābhyām enam prāśiṣam tābhyām enam ajīgamam / eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ / sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam veda / /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyābhyām hastābhyām prāśīḥ yābhyām ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan   brāhmaṇam haniṣyasi iti enam āha   tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam   ṛtasya hastābhyām   tābhyām enam prāśiṣam tābhyām enam ajīgamam    eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ    sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda    yaḥ evam veda      /
translated: Then with two other hands of thine eat him, with which the Rishis of old ate him. 'Thou wilt slay the Brahman,' he says to him. I have not eaten him with a hand turned towards me, nor with a hand turned away from me, nor with a hand turned crosswise. With the hands of truth, with them I have eaten him, with them I have won him. This is the whole-limbed, whole-skinned, whole-bodied rice. Whole-limbed, whole-skinned, whole-bodied he becomes who knows this.

original: tatas ca enam anyayā pratiṣṭhayā prāśīḥ yayā ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan / a pratiṣṭhānaḥ anāyatanaḥ mariṣyasi iti enam āha / tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam / satye pratiṣṭhāya / tayā enam prāśiṣam tayā enam ajīgamam / eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ / sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam veda / yaḥ evam
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyayā pratiṣṭhayā prāśīḥ yayā ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan   a pratiṣṭhānaḥ anāyatanaḥ mariṣyasi iti enam āha   tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam   satye pratiṣṭhāya   tayā enam prāśiṣam tayā enam ajīgamam    eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ    sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda   yaḥ evam veda   yaḥ evam veda    yaḥ evam veda    yaḥ evam veda
translated: Having rested on truth, with that I ate him, with that I conquered him. This is the rice which has all its limbs, all its ribs, all its body. He becomes one who has all his limbs, all his ribs, all his body, who knows this.

original: etat vai bradhnasya viṣṭapam yat odanaḥ //
analyzed: etat vai bradhnasya viṣṭapam yat odanaḥ
translated: This is the expanse of the sun, which is rice.

analyzed: bradhna lokaḥ bhavati bradhnasya viṣṭapi śrayate yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes the world of the sun, he is established in the sun's abode, who knows this.

analyzed: etasmāt vai odanāt trayastriṃśatam lokān niḥ amimīta prajāpatiḥ           etasmāt vai odanāt trayastriṃśatam lokān niḥ amimīta prajāpatiḥ
translated: From this very rice-pap Prajapati measured out the thirty-three worlds.

original: teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata // // // // // // teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata // // // // // // // teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata // // // // // // // teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata // // // // // // // teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata // // // // // // // teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata // // // // // // // teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata // // // // // // // teṣām prajñānāya yajñam a
analyzed: teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata            teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata            teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata
translated: For their understanding he created the sacrifice.🔽For their understanding he created the sacrifice.🔽For their understanding he created the sacrifice.

analyzed: sa yaḥ evam viduṣaḥ upadraṣṭā bhavati prāṇam ruṇaddhi  na ca prāṇam ruṇaddhi sarva jyānim jīyate  /
translated: He who thus knows, and is the observer of one who knows thus, restrains the breath.🔽He does not restrain the breath, he is conquered by all the diseases.

analyzed: jyānim jīyate purā enam jarasaḥ prāṇaḥ jahāti
translated: He is conquered by the diseases, before old age the breath leaves him.

original: prāṇāya namaḥ yasya sarvam idam vaśe / yaḥ bhūtaḥ sarvasya īśvaraḥ yasmin sarvam pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: prāṇāya namaḥ yasya sarvam idam vaśe   yaḥ bhūtaḥ sarvasya īśvaraḥ yasmin sarvam pratiṣṭhitam  /
translated: Homage to the breath, in whom all this is under control, who is the existent, the lord of all, in whom all is established.

original: namaḥ te prāṇa krandāya namaḥ te stanayitnave / namaḥ te prāṇa vidyute namaḥ te prāṇa varṣate /
analyzed: namaḥ te prāṇa krandāya namaḥ te stanayitnave   namaḥ te prāṇa vidyute namaḥ te prāṇa varṣate  /
translated: Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, as the roaring one! Homage to thee as the thunderer! Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, as the lightning! Homage to thee as the showerer!

original: yat prāṇaḥ stanayitnunā abhikrandati oṣadhīḥ / pra vīyante garbhān dadhate atha u bahvīḥ vi jāyante //
analyzed: yat prāṇaḥ stanayitnunā abhikrandati oṣadhīḥ   pra vīyante garbhān dadhate atha u bahvīḥ vi jāyante  /
translated: When Prāṇa, with the thunder, roars to the plants, they conceive, they bring forth seed, and many a one is born.

original: yat prāṇe ṛtau āgate abhikrandati oṣadhīḥ / sarvam tadā pra modate yat kim ca bhūmyām adhi //
analyzed: yat prāṇe ṛtau āgate abhikrandati oṣadhīḥ    sarvam tadā pra modate yat kim ca bhūmyām adhi  /
translated: When Prāṇa, when the season comes, roars to the plants, then all is glad and joyful, whatever is upon the earth.

original: yadā prāṇaḥ abhyavarṣīt varṣeṇa pṛthivīm mahīm / paśavaḥ tat pra modante mahaḥ vai naḥ bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: yadā prāṇaḥ abhyavarṣīt varṣeṇa pṛthivīm mahīm   paśavaḥ tat pra modante mahaḥ vai naḥ bhaviṣyati  /
translated: When Prāṇa hath rained down upon the great and mighty earth, then the cattle rejoice, thinking, Great shall be our store.

original: abhivṛṣṭāḥ oṣadhayaḥ prāṇena sam avādiran / āyuḥ vai naḥ prātītaraḥ sarvā naḥ surabhīḥ akaḥ /🔽namaḥ te astu āyate namaḥ astu parāyate / namaḥ te prāṇa tiṣṭhate āsīnāya uta te namaḥ /
analyzed: abhivṛṣṭāḥ oṣadhayaḥ prāṇena sam avādiran   āyuḥ vai naḥ prātītaraḥ sarvā naḥ surabhīḥ akaḥ  / namaḥ te astu āyate namaḥ astu parāyate   namaḥ te prāṇa tiṣṭhate āsīnāya uta te namaḥ  /
translated: The plants, when sprinkled by the rain, have cried aloud to Prāṇa. He hath given us life, and made all fragrant for us.🔽Homage to thee when thou goest forth, homage to thee when thou comest back. Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, when thou standest up, and homage to thee when thou art seated.

original: namaḥ te prāṇa prāṇate namaḥ astu apānate / parācīnāya te namaḥ pratīcīnāya te namaḥ sarvasmai te idam namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te prāṇa prāṇate namaḥ astu apānate   parācīnāya te namaḥ pratīcīnāya te namaḥ sarvasmai te idam namaḥ  /
translated: Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, when thou art inhaling, homage to thee when thou art exhaling. Homage to thee when thou goest away, homage to thee when thou comest back. To all of thee this homage.

original: yā te prāṇa priyā tanūḥ yā u te prāṇa preyasī / atha u yat bheṣajam tava tasya naḥ dhehi jīvase /
analyzed: yā te prāṇa priyā tanūḥ yā u te prāṇa preyasī    atha u yat bheṣajam tava tasya naḥ dhehi jīvase  /
translated: That form of thine, O Prāṇa, which is dear, and that which is most beloved, And also that which is thy medicine, give us thereof that we may live.

original: prāṇaḥ prajāḥ anu vaste pitā putram iva priyam / prāṇaḥ ha sarvasya īśvaraḥ yat ca prāṇati yat ca na /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ prajāḥ anu vaste pitā putram iva priyam   prāṇaḥ ha sarvasya īśvaraḥ yat ca prāṇati yat ca na  /
translated: Prāṇa clothes himself with the people, as a father with his dear son. Prāṇa is the Lord of all, of what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: prāṇaḥ mṛtyuḥ prāṇaḥ takmā prāṇam devāḥ upāsate / prāṇaḥ ha satya vādinam uttame loke ā dadhat /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ mṛtyuḥ prāṇaḥ takmā prāṇam devāḥ upāsate   prāṇaḥ ha satya vādinam uttame loke ā dadhat  /
translated: Prāṇa is Death, Prāṇa is Takman; the Gods worship Prāṇa. Prāṇa has set the truthful man in the highest world.

original: prāṇaḥ virāj prāṇaḥ deṣṭrī prāṇam sarve upāsate / prāṇaḥ ha sūryaḥ candramāḥ prāṇam āhuḥ prajāpatim /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ virāj prāṇaḥ deṣṭrī prāṇam sarve upāsate   prāṇaḥ ha sūryaḥ candramāḥ prāṇam āhuḥ prajāpatim  /
translated: Prāṇa is Virāj, Prāṇa is the guide; all things worship Prāṇa. Prāṇa is the Sun, Prāṇa is the Moon; Prāṇa they call the Lord of creatures.

original: prāṇa apānau vrīhi yavau anaḍvān prāṇaḥ ucyate / yave ha prāṇaḥ āhitaḥ apānaḥ vrīhiḥ ucyate /
analyzed: prāṇa apānau vrīhi yavau anaḍvān prāṇaḥ ucyate   yave ha prāṇaḥ āhitaḥ apānaḥ vrīhiḥ ucyate  /
translated: Prāṇa and Apāna are the barley and the wheat; the ox is said to be Prāṇa. In the wheat is laid Prāṇa; Apāna is said to be the barley.

original: apānati prāṇati puruṣaḥ garbhe antarā / yadā tvam prāṇa jinvasi atha sa jāyate punar /
analyzed: apānati prāṇati puruṣaḥ garbhe antarā  / yadā tvam prāṇa jinvasi atha sa jāyate punar  /
translated: The man breathes out and breathes in within the womb. When thou, O Prāṇa, quickenest him, then he is born again.

original: prāṇam āhuḥ mātariśvānam vātaḥ ha prāṇaḥ ucyate / prāṇe ha bhūtam bhavyam ca prāṇe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: prāṇam āhuḥ mātariśvānam vātaḥ ha prāṇaḥ ucyate   prāṇe ha bhūtam bhavyam ca prāṇe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam  /
translated: They call Prāṇa the wind, Mātariśvan; the wind is said to be Prāṇa. In Prāṇa is the past and future; in Prāṇa all things are established.

original: ātharvaṇīḥ āṅgirasīḥ daivīḥ manuṣya jāḥ uta / oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante yadā tvam prāṇa jinvasi //
analyzed: ātharvaṇīḥ āṅgirasīḥ daivīḥ manuṣya jāḥ uta    oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante yadā tvam prāṇa jinvasi  /
translated: The plants are born when thou, O Prāṇa, givest life.🔽When Prāṇa hath rained down upon the mighty earth,

original: yadā prāṇaḥ abhyavarṣīt varṣeṇa pṛthivīm mahīm / oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante atha u yāḥ kāḥ ca vīrudhaḥ /
analyzed: yadā prāṇaḥ abhyavarṣīt varṣeṇa pṛthivīm mahīm   oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante atha u yāḥ kāḥ ca vīrudhaḥ  /
translated: The plants are born, and all the herbs that grow.🔽He who knows this Prāṇa of thine, and in whom thou art established,

original: yaḥ te prāṇa idam veda yasmin ca asi pratiṣṭhitaḥ / sarve tasmai balim harān amuṣmin loke uttame /
analyzed: yaḥ te prāṇa idam veda yasmin ca asi pratiṣṭhitaḥ   sarve tasmai balim harān amuṣmin loke uttame  /
translated: To him let all things pay tribute in yonder highest world.🔽As all these creatures pay tribute to thee, O Prāṇa,

original: yathā prāṇa bali hṛtaḥ tubhyam sarvāḥ prajāḥ imāḥ / eva tasmai balim harān yaḥ tvā śṛṇavat suśravaḥ /
analyzed: yathā prāṇa bali hṛtaḥ tubhyam sarvāḥ prajāḥ imāḥ   eva tasmai balim harān yaḥ tvā śṛṇavat suśravaḥ  /
translated: So let all things pay tribute to him who hears thee, O thou of fair renown.

original: antar garbhaḥ carati devatāsu ābhūtaḥ bhūtaḥ saḥ u jāyate punar / sa bhūtaḥ bhavyam bhaviṣyat pitā putram pra viveśa śacībhiḥ // śacībhiḥ // // //
analyzed: antar garbhaḥ carati devatāsu ābhūtaḥ bhūtaḥ saḥ u jāyate punar   sa bhūtaḥ bhavyam bhaviṣyat pitā putram pra viveśa śacībhiḥ
translated: The germ moves within the deities, unborn, and being born is born again. The being enters the future being, the father his son, with mighty powers.

original: ekam pādam na ud khidati salilāt dhaṃsaḥ uccaran / yat aṅga sa tam utkhidet na eva adya na śvas syāt / na rātrī na ahar syāt na vi uchet kadā cana /
analyzed: ekam pādam na ud khidati salilāt dhaṃsaḥ uccaran   yat aṅga sa tam utkhidet na eva adya na śvas syāt   na rātrī na ahar syāt na vi uchet kadā cana  /
translated: The swan, rising from the water, lifts not his foot alone. If he should lift it up, there would be neither to-day nor to-morrow. There would be neither night nor day, nor would the sun ever rise.

original: aṣṭācakram vartate eka nemi sahasra akṣaram pra puras ni paścā / ardhena viśvam bhuvanam jajāna yat asya ardham katamaḥ sa ketuḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭācakram vartate eka nemi sahasra akṣaram pra puras ni paścā    ardhena viśvam bhuvanam jajāna yat asya ardham katamaḥ sa ketuḥ  /
translated: The eight-wheeled car moves on with one wheel only, with a thousand spokes, with a thousand eyes, with a thousand tongues, with a thousand arms. By half of it he begat the universe. What is the other half? What is its sign?

original: yaḥ asya viśva janmanaḥ īśe viśvasya ceṣṭataḥ / anyeṣu kṣipradhanvane tasmai prāṇa namaḥ astu te /
analyzed: yaḥ asya viśva janmanaḥ īśe viśvasya ceṣṭataḥ    anyeṣu kṣipradhanvane tasmai prāṇa namaḥ astu te  /
translated: He who is the Lord of all that is born in this world, and of all that moves, to others who are swift to draw the bow, to him, O Breath, be homage paid.

original: yaḥ asya sarva janmanaḥ īśe sarvasya ceṣṭataḥ / atandraḥ brahmaṇā dhīraḥ prāṇaḥ mā anu tiṣṭhatu //
analyzed: yaḥ asya sarva janmanaḥ īśe sarvasya ceṣṭataḥ    atandraḥ brahmaṇā dhīraḥ prāṇaḥ mā anu tiṣṭhatu  /
translated: He who is the Lord of all that is born in this world, and of all that moves, the watchful one, the wise with prayer, may Breath attend on me.

original: ūrdhvaḥ supteṣu jāgāra nanu tiryak ni padyate / na suptam asya supteṣu anu śuśrāva kaḥ cana /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ supteṣu jāgāra nanu tiryak ni padyate   na suptam asya supteṣu anu śuśrāva kaḥ cana  /
translated: He who, while others sleep, is ever wakeful, who lies extended crosswise, who never sleeps, whom none hath ever heard asleep among the sleeping.

original: prāṇa mā mat paryāvṛtaḥ na mat anyaḥ bhaviṣyasi / apām garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi // // garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi // // garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi // // garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi // // garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi // // garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi // // garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi // // garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tv
analyzed: prāṇa mā mat paryāvṛtaḥ na mat anyaḥ bhaviṣyasi    apām garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi           iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi          iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi            iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi               iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi
translated: O Breath, return not from me: none else than I shall be thy home. As 'twere the babe of waters, for life's sake I bind thee fast in me.

original: brahmacārīṣṇan carati rodasī ubhe tasmin devāḥ saṃmanasaḥ bhavanti / sa dādhāra pṛthivīm divam ca saḥ ācāryam tapasā piparti //
analyzed: brahmacārīṣṇan carati rodasī ubhe tasmin devāḥ saṃmanasaḥ bhavanti   sa dādhāra pṛthivīm divam ca saḥ ācāryam tapasā piparti  /
translated: The Brahman youth, the mighty one, moves on between the two world-halves. The Gods are all of one accord in him. He supports the earth and heaven. He, by his fervour, cherishes the teacher.

original: brahmacāriṇam pitaraḥ deva janāḥ pṛthak devāḥ anusaṃyanti sarve / gandharvāḥ enam anu āyan trayastriṃśat tri śatāḥ ṣaṣ sahasrāḥ sarvān sa devān tapasā piparti //
analyzed: brahmacāriṇam pitaraḥ deva janāḥ pṛthak devāḥ anusaṃyanti sarve    gandharvāḥ enam anu āyan trayastriṃśat tri śatāḥ ṣaṣ sahasrāḥ sarvān sa devān tapasā piparti  /
translated: The Fathers, the Gods, and all the Deities severally attend the student. The Gandharvas have come to him, thirty-three, three hundred, and six thousand. By his austerities he nourishes all the Gods.

original: ācāryaḥ upanayamānaḥ brahmacāriṇam kṛṇute garbham antar / tam rātrīḥ tisraḥ udare bibharti tam jātam draṣṭum abhisaṃyanti devāḥ /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ upanayamānaḥ brahmacāriṇam kṛṇute garbham antar   tam rātrīḥ tisraḥ udare bibharti tam jātam draṣṭum abhisaṃyanti devāḥ  /
translated: The Teacher, when he leads the student forth, makes him an embryo, and bears him in his bosom for three nights. The Gods assemble to behold him when he is born.

original: iyam samidh pṛthivī dyauḥ dvitīyā uta antarikṣam samidhā pṛṇāti / brahmacārī samidhā mekhalayā śrameṇa lokān tapasā piparti //
analyzed: iyam samidh pṛthivī dyauḥ dvitīyā uta antarikṣam samidhā pṛṇāti   brahmacārī samidhā mekhalayā śrameṇa lokān tapasā piparti  /
translated: This earth is the fuel, and the second heaven is the fuel. He fills the fuel, the air, with fuel. The student with the girdle of fuel, by toil and austerity, nourishes the worlds.

original: pūrvaḥ jātaḥ brahmaṇaḥ brahmacārī gharmam vasānaḥ tapasā ud atiṣṭhat / tasmāt jātam brāhmaṇam brahma jyeṣṭham devāḥ ca sarve amṛtena sākam /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ jātaḥ brahmaṇaḥ brahmacārī gharmam vasānaḥ tapasā ud atiṣṭhat   tasmāt jātam brāhmaṇam brahma jyeṣṭham devāḥ ca sarve amṛtena sākam  /
translated: The student was born first of Brahma. He rose up by austerity, clothed in the heat. From him was born the Brahman, the eldest of the Gods, and all the Gods with immortality.

original: brahmacārī eti samidhā samiddhaḥ kārṣṇam vasānaḥ dīkṣitaḥ dīrgha śmaśruḥ / sa sadyas eti pūrvasmāt uttaram samudram lokān saṃgṛbhya muhur ācarikrat /
analyzed: brahmacārī eti samidhā samiddhaḥ kārṣṇam vasānaḥ dīkṣitaḥ dīrgha śmaśruḥ    sa sadyas eti pūrvasmāt uttaram samudram lokān saṃgṛbhya muhur ācarikrat  /
translated: Comes quickly to the sea beyond the eastern sea, and often returns, having gathered up the worlds.🔽The Brahmachāri, begetting Brahma, the waters, the world, Prajāpati, the Supreme Lord, Virāj,

original: brahmacārī janayan brahma apaḥ lokam prajāpatim parameṣṭhinam virājam / garbhaḥ bhūtvā amṛtasya yonau indraḥ ha bhūtvā asurān tatarha /🔽ācāryaḥ tatakṣa nabhasī ubhe ime urvī gambhīre pṛthivīm divam ca / te rakṣati tapasā brahmacārī tasmin devāḥ saṃmanasaḥ bhavanti //
analyzed: brahmacārī janayan brahma apaḥ lokam prajāpatim parameṣṭhinam virājam    garbhaḥ bhūtvā amṛtasya yonau indraḥ ha bhūtvā asurān tatarha  / ācāryaḥ tatakṣa nabhasī ubhe ime urvī gambhīre pṛthivīm divam ca   te rakṣati tapasā brahmacārī tasmin devāḥ saṃmanasaḥ bhavanti  /

translated: The beasts that dwell on earth, in heaven, and in the forest, and the deer, And birds and winged creatures: may they deliver us from woe.

analyzed: bhava śarvau idam brūmaḥ rudram paśupatiḥ ca yaḥ    iṣūḥ yāḥ eṣām saṃvidma tāḥ naḥ santu sadā śivāḥ  /
translated: We call on Bhava and on Sarva, and on Rudra and on Pasupati. May the swift arrows of these Gods be ever propitious unto us.

original: sapta ṛṣīn vai idam brūmaḥ apaḥ devīḥ prajāpatim / pitṝn yama śreṣṭhān brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: sapta ṛṣīn vai idam brūmaḥ apaḥ devīḥ prajāpatim   pitṝn yama śreṣṭhān brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: To the Fathers, to the Pitris, to the chiefest of the Yamas. May they deliver us from woe.🔽The Gods who dwell in heaven, and they who dwell in middle air,

original: ye devāḥ diviṣadaḥ antarikṣa sadaḥ ca ye / pṛthivyām śakrāḥ ye śritāḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: ye devāḥ diviṣadaḥ antarikṣa sadaḥ ca ye    pṛthivyām śakrāḥ ye śritāḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: And those who on the earth have settled, may they deliver us from woe.🔽The Âdityas, Rudras, Vasus, the Gods who dwell in heaven, the Atharvans,

original: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ divi devāḥ atharvāṇaḥ / aṅgirasaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ divi devāḥ atharvāṇaḥ    aṅgirasaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: The Angirasas, the wise, may they deliver us from woe.🔽We speak to sacrifice, to him who sacrifices, to the Rikas, to the healing Sâmans,

original: yajñam brūmaḥ yajamānam ṛcaḥ sāmāni bheṣajā / yajūṃṣi hotrāḥ brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yajñam brūmaḥ yajamānam ṛcaḥ sāmāni bheṣajā   yajūṃṣi hotrāḥ brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: To the Yagus, to the Hotars. May they deliver us from woe.🔽We speak to the five kingdoms of the plants, to the chiefest of them, Soma,

original: pañca rājyāni vīrudhām soma śreṣṭhāni brūmaḥ / darbhaḥ bhaṅgaḥ yavaḥ sahaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: pañca rājyāni vīrudhām soma śreṣṭhāni brūmaḥ   darbhaḥ bhaṅgaḥ yavaḥ sahaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: To Darbha, to the stalk, to barley, to strength. May they deliver us from woe.🔽We speak to the Râkshasas, to the serpents, to the Fathers, to the Pûmnavadas,

original: arāyān brūmaḥ rakṣāṃsi sarpān puṇyajanān pitṝn / mṛtyūn eka śatam brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: arāyān brūmaḥ rakṣāṃsi sarpān puṇyajanān pitṝn    mṛtyūn eka śatam brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: To the hundred and one kinds of death. May they deliver us from woe.🔽We speak to the Seasons, to the Lords of Seasons, to the half-seasons, to the years,

original: ṛtūn brūmaḥ ṛtupatīn ārtavān uta hāyanān / samāḥ saṃvatsarān māsān te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtūn brūmaḥ ṛtupatīn ārtavān uta hāyanān   samāḥ saṃvatsarān māsān te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: To the years, to the months. May they deliver us from woe.

original: eta devāḥ dakṣiṇatas paścāt prāñcaḥ udeta / purastāt uttarāt śakrāḥ viśve devāḥ sametya te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /🔽viśvān devān idam brūmaḥ satya sandhān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ / viśvābhiḥ patnībhiḥ saha te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: eta devāḥ dakṣiṇatas paścāt prāñcaḥ udeta    purastāt uttarāt śakrāḥ viśve devāḥ sametya te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  / viśvān devān idam brūmaḥ satya sandhān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ    viśvābhiḥ patnībhiḥ saha te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Come hither, O ye Gods, from the south, from the west, from the east, from the north. May the All-Gods, having met together, deliver us from woe.🔽To the All-Gods we speak this word, the truth-binders, the strengtheners of truth, with all their wives together. May they deliver us from woe.

original: sarvān devān idam brūmaḥ satya sandhān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ / sarvābhiḥ patnībhiḥ saha te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /

translated: To all the Gods we speak this word, the truth-binders, the strengtheners of truth, with all their wives together. May they deliver us from woe.

original: bhūtam brūmaḥ bhūta patim bhūtānām uta yaḥ vaśī / bhūtāni sarvā saṃgatya te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: bhūtam brūmaḥ bhūta patim bhūtānām uta yaḥ vaśī    bhūtāni sarvā saṃgatya te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: To the Bhûtas we speak this word, to the Lord of the Bhûtas, and to he who is the ruler of the Bhûtas. Having met together, may all the Bhûtas deliver us from woe.

original: yāḥ devīḥ pañca pradiśaḥ ye devāḥ dvādaśa ṛtavaḥ / saṃvatsarasya ye daṃṣṭrāḥ te naḥ santu sadā śivāḥ /

translated: The five goddesses of the regions, the twelve Gods of the seasons, the teeth of the year, may they be ever gracious unto us.

original: ucchiṣṭe nāma rūpam ca ucchiṣṭe loke āhitaḥ / ucchiṣṭaḥ indraḥ ca agniḥ ca viśvam antar samāhitam /
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe nāma rūpam ca ucchiṣṭe loke āhitaḥ   ucchiṣṭaḥ indraḥ ca agniḥ ca viśvam antar samāhitam  /
translated: In the Residue is name and form, in the Residue the world is laid. In the Residue are Indra and Agni, and all things are contained.

original: ucchiṣṭe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvam bhūtam samāhitam / āpaḥ samudraḥ ucchiṣṭe candramāḥ vātaḥ āhitaḥ /
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvam bhūtam samāhitam   āpaḥ samudraḥ ucchiṣṭe candramāḥ vātaḥ āhitaḥ  /
translated: In the Residue are heaven and earth, and all things that be are contained. In the Residue are waters, ocean, moon, and wind.

original: san ucchiṣṭe asan ca ubhau mṛtyuḥ vājaḥ prajāpatiḥ / laukyāḥ ucchiṣṭe āyattāḥ vraḥ ca draḥ ca api śrīḥ mayi //
analyzed: san ucchiṣṭe asan ca ubhau mṛtyuḥ vājaḥ prajāpatiḥ    laukyāḥ ucchiṣṭe āyattāḥ vraḥ ca draḥ ca api śrīḥ mayi  /
translated: In the leavings is the existent and the non-existent, both death and strength, and Pragâpati. In the leavings are the worldly (objects) dependent, Vras and Dras, and even prosperity in me.

original: dṛḍhaḥ dṛṃha sthiraḥ nyaḥ brahma viśvasṛjaḥ daśa / nābhim iva sarvatas cakram ucchiṣṭe devatāḥ śritāḥ /
analyzed: dṛḍhaḥ dṛṃha sthiraḥ nyaḥ brahma viśvasṛjaḥ daśa    nābhim iva sarvatas cakram ucchiṣṭe devatāḥ śritāḥ  /
translated: Firm, firm, stand, steady, fixed: the ten Brahmans, the creators of the world. As the navel is of the wheel, in the leavings the deities are dependent.

original: ṛc sāma yajuḥ ucchiṣṭaḥ udgīthaḥ prastutam stutam / hiṅkāraḥ ucchiṣṭe svaraḥ sāmnaḥ meḍiḥ ca tat mayi /
analyzed: ṛc sāma yajuḥ ucchiṣṭaḥ udgīthaḥ prastutam stutam    hiṅkāraḥ ucchiṣṭe svaraḥ sāmnaḥ meḍiḥ ca tat mayi  /
translated: The Rik, the Sâman, the Yagus, the Udgîtha, the Prastotra, the Sûkta, the Hînakâra, in the leavings is the tone of the Sâman, and the Medhâ is in me.

original: aindrāgnam pāvamānam mahānāmnīḥ mahāvratam / ucchiṣṭe yajñasya aṅgāni antar garbhe iva mātari /
analyzed: aindrāgnam pāvamānam mahānāmnīḥ mahāvratam    ucchiṣṭe yajñasya aṅgāni antar garbhe iva mātari  /
translated: The Aindra-Agnîka, the Pâvamânî, the Mahânâmnikâ, the Mahâvrata, in the leavings are the members of the sacrifice, as in the womb of the mother.

original: rājasūyam vājapeyam agniṣṭomaḥ tat adhvaraḥ / arka aśvamedhau ucchiṣṭe jīvabarhiḥ madintamaḥ /🔽agnyādheyam atha u dīkṣā kāmapraḥ chandasā saha / utsannāḥ yajñāḥ satrāṇi ucchiṣṭe adhi samāhitāḥ /
analyzed: rājasūyam vājapeyam agniṣṭomaḥ tat adhvaraḥ   arka aśvamedhau ucchiṣṭe jīvabarhiḥ madintamaḥ  / agnyādheyam atha u dīkṣā kāmapraḥ chandasā saha    utsannāḥ yajñāḥ satrāṇi ucchiṣṭe adhi samāhitāḥ  /
translated: The Râgasûya, the Vâgapeya, the Agnishtoma, that sacrifice, the Arka, the Asvamedha, in the leavings is the most gladdening Jîva-Vahri.🔽The laying of the sacred fires, the consecration, the desire-satisfying metre together with the metres, the interrupted sacrifices, the sacrificial sessions, in the leavings are they fixed.

original: agnihotram ca śraddhā ca vaṣaṭkāraḥ vratam tapaḥ / dakṣiṇeṣṭam pūrtam ca ucchiṣṭe adhi samāhitāḥ /
analyzed: agnihotram ca śraddhā ca vaṣaṭkāraḥ vratam tapaḥ   dakṣiṇeṣṭam pūrtam ca ucchiṣṭe adhi samāhitāḥ  /
translated: The Agnihotra, faith, the Vashat-call, the vow, penance, the sacrifice with gifts, the fulfilment, in the leavings are they fixed.

original: eka rātraḥ dvi rātraḥ sadyaḥkrīḥ prakrīḥ ukthyaḥ / otam nihitam ucchiṣṭe yajñasya aṇūni vidyayā // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /
analyzed: eka rātraḥ dvi rātraḥ sadyaḥkrīḥ prakrīḥ ukthyaḥ   otam nihitam ucchiṣṭe yajñasya aṇūni vidyayā
translated: The woven, the placed, the remnants of the sacrifice, the subtle parts by knowledge.🔽The four-night rite, the five-night rite, the six-night rite, both together,

original: catur rātraḥ pañca rātraḥ ṣaṣ rātraḥ ca ubhayaḥ saha / ṣoḍaśī sapta rātraḥ ca ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve ye yajñāḥ amṛte hitāḥ /
analyzed: catur rātraḥ pañca rātraḥ ṣaṣ rātraḥ ca ubhayaḥ saha   ṣoḍaśī sapta rātraḥ ca ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve ye yajñāḥ amṛte hitāḥ  /
translated: The Sodashi, and the seven-night rite, all the sacrifices that are established in immortality are born from the remnants.🔽The doorkeeper, the conclusion, the Vishvajit, and the Abhijit,

original: pratīhāraḥ nidhanam viśvajit ca abhijit ca yaḥ / sāhnā atirātrau ucchiṣṭe dvādaśa ahaḥ api tat mayi /
analyzed: pratīhāraḥ nidhanam viśvajit ca abhijit ca yaḥ    sāhnā atirātrau ucchiṣṭe dvādaśa ahaḥ api tat mayi  /
translated: The Sahna and the Atiratra in the remnants, and the twelve-day rite is also in me.🔽Truth, humility, peace, natural law, strength, immortality, and victory,

original: sūnṛtā saṃnatiḥ kṣemaḥ svadhā ūrjā amṛtam sahaḥ / ucchiṣṭe sarve pratyañcaḥ kāmāḥ kāmena tātṛpuḥ /
analyzed: sūnṛtā saṃnatiḥ kṣemaḥ svadhā ūrjā amṛtam sahaḥ   ucchiṣṭe sarve pratyañcaḥ kāmāḥ kāmena tātṛpuḥ  /
translated: All desires turned towards the remnants have been satisfied by desire in the remnants.🔽The nine layers of the oceans are established on the remnants above the sky,

original: nava bhūmīḥ samudrāḥ ucchiṣṭe adhi śritāḥ divaḥ / ā sūryaḥ bhāti ucchiṣṭe ahar rātre api tat mayi //
analyzed: nava bhūmīḥ samudrāḥ ucchiṣṭe adhi śritāḥ divaḥ   ā sūryaḥ bhāti ucchiṣṭe ahar rātre api tat mayi  /
translated: The sun shines in the remnants, and the day and night are also in me.

original: upahavyam viṣūvantam ye ca yajñāḥ guhā hitāḥ / bibharti bhartā viśvasya ucchiṣṭaḥ janituḥ pitā /
analyzed: upahavyam viṣūvantam ye ca yajñāḥ guhā hitāḥ   bibharti bhartā viśvasya ucchiṣṭaḥ janituḥ pitā  /
translated: The Ucchiṣṭa, the supporter of the world, the father of the begetter, bears.🔽The Ucchiṣṭa is the father of the begetter, the grandson of the immortal great-grandsire.

original: pitā janituḥ ucchiṣṭaḥ asoḥ pautraḥ pitāmahaḥ / sa kṣiyati viśvasya īśānaḥ vṛṣā bhūmyām atighnyaḥ //
analyzed: pitā janituḥ ucchiṣṭaḥ asoḥ pautraḥ pitāmahaḥ    sa kṣiyati viśvasya īśānaḥ vṛṣā bhūmyām atighnyaḥ  /
translated: He, the powerful lord of all, the bull, is laid upon the earth, the most bountiful.🔽Truth, righteousness, penance, kingdom, labour, duty, and work,

original: ṛtam satyam tapaḥ rāṣṭram śramaḥ dharmaḥ ca karma ca / bhūtam bhaviṣyat ucchiṣṭe vīryam lakṣmīḥ balam bale /

translated: The past and future are in the Ucchiṣṭa, strength, prosperity, and power in power.🔽Prosperity, vigour, intention, the Kshatriya, the kingdom, the six regions,

original: samṛddhiḥ ojaḥ ākūtiḥ kṣatram rāṣṭram ṣaṭ urvyaḥ / saṃvatsaraḥ adhi ucchiṣṭaḥ iḍā praiṣāḥ grahāḥ haviḥ /
analyzed: samṛddhiḥ ojaḥ ākūtiḥ kṣatram rāṣṭram ṣaṭ urvyaḥ    saṃvatsaraḥ adhi ucchiṣṭaḥ iḍā praiṣāḥ grahāḥ haviḥ  /
translated: The year is in the Ucchiṣṭa, the Idâ, the Praiṣas, the Grahas, the oblations.🔽The four Hotâs, the Âprîs, the Chaturmasyas, the Nîvidas,

original: caturhotāraḥ āpriyaḥ cāturmāsyāni nīvidaḥ / ucchiṣṭe yajñāḥ hotrāḥ paśubandhāḥ tat iṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: caturhotāraḥ āpriyaḥ cāturmāsyāni nīvidaḥ   ucchiṣṭe yajñāḥ hotrāḥ paśubandhāḥ tad iṣṭayaḥ  /
translated: The sacrifices, the Hotras, the animal bonds, the Tishthas are in the Ucchiṣṭa.

original: śarkarāḥ sikatāḥ aśmānaḥ oṣadhayaḥ vīrudhaḥ tṛṇā / abhrāṇi vidyutaḥ varṣam ucchiṣṭe saṃśritā śritā /
analyzed: śarkarāḥ sikatāḥ aśmānaḥ oṣadhayaḥ vīrudhaḥ tṛṇā   abhrāṇi vidyutaḥ varṣam ucchiṣṭe saṃśritā śritā  /
translated: The clouds, the lightning, the rain, in the Ucchiṣṭa are the dependent and supported.

original: rāddhiḥ prāptiḥ samāptiḥ vyāptiḥ mahaḥ edhatuḥ / atyāptiḥ ucchiṣṭe bhūtiḥ ca ahitā nihitā hitā /
analyzed: rāddhiḥ prāptiḥ samāptiḥ vyāptiḥ mahaḥ edhatuḥ    atyāptiḥ ucchiṣṭe bhūtiḥ ca ahitā nihitā hitā  /
translated: The attainment, the acquisition, the completion, the pervasion, the greatness, the growth,🔽The over-attainment, in the Ucchiṣṭa is the prosperity, the laid, the laid down, the beneficial.🔽And what breathes with breath, what sees with the eye,

original: yat ca prāṇati prāṇena yat ca paśyati cakṣuṣā / ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ /
analyzed: yat ca prāṇati prāṇena yat ca paśyati cakṣuṣā   / ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ  /
translated: From the Ucchiṣṭa were all born, the gods in heaven, dependent on heaven.

analyzed: ṛcaḥ sāmāni chandāṃsi purāṇam yajuṣā saha    ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ  /
translated: From the Residue were born the Rich, the Samans, the metres, the Purana, and the Yajus, all the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven.

original: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā / ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ /🔽ānandāḥ modāḥ pramudaḥ abhīmoda mudaḥ ca ye / ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā     ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ  / ānandāḥ modāḥ pramudaḥ abhīmoda mudaḥ ca ye ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ  /
translated: From the Residue were born the out-breathing and the in-breathing, the eye and the ear, and that which is not and that which is, all the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven.🔽From the Residue were born all the joys, the gladdening, the exulting, the rejoicing, the gladness, the delights, all the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven.

analyzed: devāḥ pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ gandharva apsarasaḥ ca ye ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ diviśritaḥ
translated: From the Residue were born the gods, the fathers, men, the Gandharvas and the Apsarases, all the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven.

original: yat manyuḥ jāyām āvahat saṃkalpasya gṛhāt adhi / ke āsan janyāḥ ke varāḥ kaḥ u jyeṣṭha varaḥ abhavat /
analyzed: yat manyuḥ jāyām āvahat saṃkalpasya gṛhāt adhi   ke āsan janyāḥ ke varāḥ kaḥ u jyeṣṭha varaḥ abhavat  /
translated: When Manyu took to wife the daughter of Sankalpa, who were the bride's kinsmen, who the bride's friends, who was the chief of all the bride's friends?

original: tapaḥ ca eva āstām karma ca antar mahati arṇave / te āsan janyāḥ te varāḥ brahma jyeṣṭha varaḥ abhavat /
analyzed: tapaḥ ca eva āstām karma ca antar mahati arṇave   te āsan janyāḥ te varāḥ brahma jyeṣṭha varaḥ abhavat  /
translated: Penance and Action were in the great deep. They were the guests, they the excellent ones. The Brahman was the best of the excellent ones.

original: daśa sākam ajāyanta devāḥ devebhyaḥ purā / yaḥ vai tān vidyāt pratyakṣam sa vai adya mahat vadet /
analyzed: daśa sākam ajāyanta devāḥ devebhyaḥ purā   yaḥ vai tān vidyāt pratyakṣam sa vai adya mahat vadet  /
translated: Ten together were born, the gods, before the gods. He who knows them directly, he would speak today the great thing.

original: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā / vyāna udānau vāc manaḥ te vai ākūtim āvahan //
analyzed: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā    vyāna udānau vāc manaḥ te vai ākūtim āvahan  /
translated: The out-breath and in-breath, the eye and ear, that which is imperishable and that which is perishable, the transverse and upward breaths, speech and mind, they brought forth the intention.

original: a jātāḥ āsan ṛtavaḥ atha u dhātā bṛhaspatiḥ / indra agnī aśvinā tarhi kam te jyeṣṭham upāsata /
analyzed: a jātāḥ āsan ṛtavaḥ atha u dhātā bṛhaspatiḥ   indra agnī aśvinā tarhi kam te jyeṣṭham upāsata  /
translated: The seasons were unborn, then Dhatr and Brihaspati, Indra and Agni and the two Asvins. Whom did they then honor as the eldest?

original: tapaḥ ca eva āstām karma ca antar mahati arṇave / tapaḥ ha jajñe karmaṇaḥ tat te jyeṣṭham upāsata /
analyzed: tapaḥ ca eva āstām karma ca antar mahati arṇave   tapaḥ ha jajñe karmaṇaḥ tat te jyeṣṭham upāsata  /
translated: Penance and Action were in the great deep. From Action was born Penance. They honor that as the eldest.

original: yetaḥ āsīt bhūmiḥ pūrvā yām addhātayaḥ id viduḥ / yaḥ vai tām vidyāt nāmathā sa manyeta purāṇa vid /
analyzed: yā itas āsīt bhūmiḥ pūrvā yām addhātayaḥ id viduḥ   yaḥ vai tām vidyāt nāmathā sa manyeta purāṇa vid  /
translated: From where was the earth before, which the ancient seers knew? He who would know that truly, he would think himself an ancient seer.

original: kutas indraḥ kutas somaḥ kutas agniḥ ajāyata / kutas tvaṣṭā sam abhavat kutas dhātā ajāyata /
analyzed: kutas indraḥ kutas somaḥ kutas agniḥ ajāyata   kutas tvaṣṭā sam abhavat kutas dhātā ajāyata  /
translated: From where was Indra born? From where was Soma born? From where was Agni born? From where was Tvastr produced? From where was Dhatr born?

original: indrāt indraḥ somāt somaḥ agneḥ agniḥ ajāyata / tvaṣṭā ha jajñe tvaṣṭuḥ dhātuḥ dhātā ajāyata /
analyzed: indrāt indraḥ somāt somaḥ agneḥ agniḥ ajāyata   tvaṣṭā ha jajñe tvaṣṭuḥ dhātuḥ dhātā ajāyata  /
translated: Indra from Indra, Soma from Soma, Agni from Agni was born. Tvastr was born from Tvastr, and Dhatr from Dhatr was born.

original: saṃsicaḥ nāma te devāḥ ye saṃbhārān samabharan / sarvam saṃsicya martyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan //
analyzed: saṃsicaḥ nāma te devāḥ ye saṃbhārān samabharan    sarvam saṃsicya martyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan  /
translated: The Gods who are called the Saṃsiças, they who have gathered up the Saṃbhāra, have filled the whole mortal world with Saṃsiça, and the Gods have entered into man.

original: ūrū pādau aṣṭhīvantau śiraḥ hastau atha u mukham / pṛṣṭīḥ barjahye pārśve kaḥ tat sam adadhāt ṛṣiḥ /
analyzed: ūrū pādau aṣṭhīvantau śiraḥ hastau atha u mukham   pṛṣṭīḥ barjahye pārśve kaḥ tat sam adadhāt ṛṣiḥ  /
translated: The thighs, the feet, the knee-bones, the head, the hands, and then the mouth, the back, the neck, the ribs, the sides, who was the Rishi who put them all together?

original: śiraḥ hastau atho mukham jihvām grīvāḥ ca kīkasāḥ / tvacā prāvṛtya sarvam tat saṃdhā sam adadhāt mahī /
analyzed: śiraḥ hastau atho mukham jihvām grīvāḥ ca kīkasāḥ   tvacā prāvṛtya sarvam tat saṃdhā sam adadhāt mahī  /
translated: The head, the hands, and then the mouth, the tongue, the neck, and the jaws, the whole of this he covered with the skin, and the mighty Sandhā put them all together.

original: yat tat śarīram aśayat saṃdhayā saṃhitam mahat / yena idam adya rocate kaḥ asmin varṇam ābharat //
analyzed: yat tat śarīram aśayat saṃdhayā saṃhitam mahat yena idam adya rocate kaḥ asmin varṇam ābharat
translated: When that great body lay there, put together with the bones and joints, who gave it colour, whereby it shines to-day?

original: sarve devāḥ upāśikṣan tat ajānāt vadhūḥ satī / īśā vaśasya yā jāyā sā asmin varṇam ābharat /
analyzed: sarve devāḥ upāśikṣan tat ajānāt vadhūḥ satī    īśā vaśasya yā jāyā sā asmin varṇam ābharat  /
translated: All the Gods were assembled there: the young wife knew it, and she, the wife of the Lord of power, gave it colour.

original: yadā tvaṣṭā vyatṛṇat pitā tvaṣṭuḥ yaḥ uttaraḥ / gṛham kṛtvā martyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan //
analyzed: yadā tvaṣṭā vyatṛṇat pitā tvaṣṭuḥ yaḥ uttaraḥ   gṛham kṛtvā martyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan  /
translated: When Tvastr cut asunder his father, the one who was Tvastr's elder, and made a mortal body, the Gods entered into man.

original: svapnaḥ vai tandrīḥ nirṛtiḥ pāpmānaḥ nāma devatāḥ / jarā khālatyam pālityam śarīram anu prāviśan //
analyzed: svapnaḥ vai tandrīḥ nirṛtiḥ pāpmānaḥ nāma devatāḥ   jarā khālatyam pālityam śarīram anu prāviśan
translated: Sleep, sloth, and Nirrti, the deity whose name is sin, old age, baldness, and grey hairs have entered into the body.

original: steyam duṣkṛtam vṛjinam satyam yajñaḥ yaśaḥ bṛhat / balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan // balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan // balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan // balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan // balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan // balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan // balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan // balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram
