translated: Prosperity and adversity, the blessings and curses,

original: bhūtiḥ ca vai abhūtiḥ ca rātayaḥ arātayaḥ ca yāḥ / kṣudhaḥ ca sarvāḥ tṛṣṇāḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan //
analyzed: bhūtiḥ ca vai abhūtiḥ ca rātayaḥ arātayaḥ ca yāḥ    kṣudhaḥ ca sarvāḥ tṛṣṇāḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan  /
translated: all the hungers and thirsts entered the body.🔽Blame and no blame, and what is 'kill' and 'not kill',

original: nindāḥ ca vai anindāḥ ca yat ca hanta iti na iti ca / śarīram śraddhā dakṣiṇā aśraddhā ca anu prāviśan //
analyzed: nindāḥ ca vai anindāḥ ca yat ca hanta iti na iti ca   / śarīram śraddhā dakṣiṇā aśraddhā ca anu prāviśan  /
translated: faith and the sacrificial fee and lack of faith entered the body.

original: vidyāḥ ca vai avidyāḥ ca yat ca anyat upadeśyam / śarīram brahma prāviśat ṛcaḥ sāma atha u yajuḥ /🔽ānandāḥ modāḥ pramudaḥ abhīmoda mudaḥ ca ye / hasaḥ nariṣṭāḥ nṛttāni śarīram anu prāviśan //
analyzed: vidyāḥ ca vai avidyāḥ ca yat ca anyat upadeśyam    śarīram brahma prāviśat ṛcaḥ sāma atha u yajuḥ  / ānandāḥ modāḥ pramudaḥ abhīmoda mudaḥ ca ye hasaḥ nariṣṭāḥ nṛttāni śarīram anu prāviśan
translated: The body has entered into Brahman, the Ṛc verses, the Sāman chants, and the Yajuṣ formulas.🔽The joys, the delights, the great delights, the exultations, the joys,🔽And the laughter, the festivities, the dances have all entered into the body.🔽The conversations, the loud talks, the loud laughter, the loud chatter,

original: ālāpāḥ ca pralāpāḥ ca abhīlāpa lapaḥ ca ye / śarīram sarve prāviśan āyujaḥ prayujaḥ yujaḥ //
analyzed: ālāpāḥ ca pralāpāḥ ca abhīlāpa lapaḥ ca ye śarīram sarve prāviśan āyujaḥ prayujaḥ yujaḥ  /
translated: All have entered into the body, the connected, the disconnected, the connected.🔽The inhalation and exhalation, the eye, the ear, the non-destruction and the destruction,

original: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā / vyāna udānau vāc manaḥ śarīreṇa te īyante /
analyzed: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā    vyāna udānau vāc manaḥ śarīreṇa te īyante  /
translated: The vyāna and udāna breaths, the speech and the mind, with the body they go.🔽The blessings, the instructions, the combined instructions, the specific instructions,

original: āśiṣaḥ ca praśiṣaḥ ca saṃśiṣaḥ viśiṣaḥ ca yāḥ / cittāni sarve saṃkalpāḥ śarīram anu prāviśan //
analyzed: āśiṣaḥ ca praśiṣaḥ ca saṃśiṣaḥ viśiṣaḥ ca yāḥ   cittāni sarve saṃkalpāḥ śarīram anu prāviśan  /
translated: All the intentions and resolutions have entered into the body.🔽The dwelling, the dwelling in the house, the hurrying, the pitiable, and the secret,

original: āsteyīḥ ca vāsteyīḥ ca tvaraṇāḥ kṛpaṇāḥ ca yāḥ / guhyāḥ śukrāḥ sthūlāḥ apaḥ tāḥ bībhatsau asādayan //
analyzed: āsteyīḥ ca vāsteyīḥ ca tvaraṇāḥ kṛpaṇāḥ ca yāḥ   / guhyāḥ śukrāḥ sthūlāḥ apaḥ tāḥ bībhatsau asādayan  /
translated: The bright, the gross waters, they have entered into the disgusting.🔽Having made the bone the fuel, they have entered into the eight waters.

original: asthi kṛtvā samidham tat aṣṭa apaḥ asādayan / retaḥ kṛtvā ājyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan //
analyzed: asthi kṛtvā samidham tat aṣṭa apaḥ asādayan   retaḥ kṛtvā ājyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan  /
translated: Having made the semen the clarified butter, the gods have entered into the man.

original: yāḥ āpaḥ yāḥ ca devatāḥ yāḥ virāj brahmaṇā saha / śarīram brahma prāviśat śarīre adhi prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ āpaḥ yāḥ ca devatāḥ yāḥ virāj brahmaṇā saha   / śarīram brahma prāviśat śarīre adhi prajāpatiḥ  /
translated: The Waters, and the Deities, and Vîraj, with Brahman, have entered into the body of Brahman. In the body Prajâpati hath taken up his station.

original: sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ vātaḥ prāṇam puruṣasya vi bhejire / atha asya itaram ātmānam devāḥ prāyacchan agnaye /
analyzed: sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ vātaḥ prāṇam puruṣasya vi bhejire    atha asya itaram ātmānam devāḥ prāyacchan agnaye  /
translated: The Sun hath taken the eye, the Wind the breath of man. The other self of him the Gods have given to Agni.

original: tasmāt vai vidvān puruṣam idam brahma iti manyate / sarvāḥ hi asmin devatāḥ gāvaḥ goṣṭhe iva āsate /
analyzed: tasmāt vai vidvān puruṣam idam brahma iti manyate    sarvāḥ hi asmin devatāḥ gāvaḥ goṣṭhe iva āsate  /
translated: Therefore the learned one esteems a man as Brahman, for in him all the Gods dwell together, as cows in the cow-pen.

original: prathamena pramāreṇa tredhā viṣvaṅ vi gacchati / adaḥ ekena gacchati adaḥ ekena gacchati iha ekena ni sevate /
analyzed: prathamena pramāreṇa tredhā viṣvaṅ vi gacchati   adaḥ ekena gacchati adaḥ ekena gacchati iha ekena ni sevate  /
translated: With the first stroke he goes in three directions. With one he goes away, with one he goes away, with one he settles here.

original: apsu stīmāsu vṛddhāsu śarīram antarā hitam / tasmim śavaḥ adhi antarā tasmāt śavaḥ adhi ucyate // // // // //
analyzed: apsu stīmāsu vṛddhāsu śarīram antarā hitam   tasmin śavaḥ adhi antarā tasmāt śavaḥ adhi ucyate
translated: In the waters, in the swelling waters, the body is laid. In the body the corpse is laid. Therefore the corpse is called a body.

original: ye bāhavaḥ yāḥ iṣavaḥ dhanvanām vīryāṇi ca / asīn paraśūn āyudham citta ākūtam ca yat hṛdi / sarvam tat arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya //
analyzed: ye bāhavaḥ yāḥ iṣavaḥ dhanvanām vīryāṇi ca   asīn paraśūn āyudham citta ākūtam ca yat hṛdi    sarvam tat arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya  /
translated: The arms, the shafts, the powers of the bowmen, the swords, axes, weapons, and what thought is in the heart, all this, O Arvuda, make visible to us against our enemies, and show them forth in full.

original: ud tiṣṭhata sam nahyadhvam mitrāḥ deva janāḥ yūyam / saṃdṛṣṭāḥ guptāḥ vaḥ santu yā naḥ mitrāṇi arbude /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata sam nahyadhvam mitrāḥ deva janāḥ yūyam   saṃdṛṣṭāḥ guptāḥ vaḥ santu yā naḥ mitrāṇi arbude  /
translated: Arise, ye Gods, ye men, and gird yourselves together. Ye who are seen and guarded, be our friends, O Arbudi.

original: ud tiṣṭhatam ā rabhetām ādāna saṃdānābhyām / amitrāṇām senāḥ abhi dhattam arbude /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhatam ā rabhetām ādāna saṃdānābhyām   amitrāṇām senāḥ abhi dhattam arbude  /
translated: Arise, and take ye up your arms, with your two weapons, taking and girding on. Cast down the armies of our foes, O Arbudi.

original: arbudiḥ nāma yaḥ devaḥ īśānaḥ ca nyarbudiḥ / yābhyām antarikṣam āvṛtam iyam ca pṛthivī mahī / tābhyām indra medibhyām aham jitam anu emi senayā /
analyzed: arbudiḥ nāma yaḥ devaḥ īśānaḥ ca nyarbudiḥ   yābhyām antarikṣam āvṛtam iyam ca pṛthivī mahī   tābhyām indra medibhyām aham jitam anu emi senayā  /
translated: The God who is named Arbudi, and Ny arbudi who rules, with whom the wide mid-air is encompassed, and this great earth, with those two, O Indra, I follow with my army the victory.

original: ud tiṣṭha tvam deva jana arbude senayā saha / bhañjan amitrāṇām senām bhogebhiḥ pari vāraya //
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha tvam deva jana arbude senayā saha    bhañjan amitrāṇām senām bhogebhiḥ pari vāraya  /
translated: Arise, O God, O Arbudi, with thy host. Breaking the armies of our foes, surround them with thy coils.

original: sapta jātān nyarbudaḥ udārāṇām samīkṣayan / tebhiḥ tvam ājye hute sarvaiḥ ud tiṣṭha senayā /
analyzed: sapta jātān nyarbudaḥ udārāṇām samīkṣayan    tebhiḥ tvam ājye hute sarvaiḥ ud tiṣṭha senayā  /
translated: Ny arbudi, beholding the seven sons of Udarâ, with them, when the libation is poured, arise, O Arbudi, with thy host.

original: pratighnāna aśru mukhī kṛdhukarṇī ca krośatu / vikeśī puruṣe hate radite arbude tava /
analyzed: pratighnāna aśru mukhī kṛdhukarṇī ca krośatu  / vikeśī puruṣe hate radite arbude tava  /
translated: Let her who breaks her teeth, and cries with tearful face, and with her ears laid back, let her, whose hair is dishevelled, when her man is slain, O Arbudi, when thou art crushed,

original: saṃkarṣantī karūkaram manasā putram ichantī / patim bhrātaram āt svān radite arbude tava /
analyzed: saṃkarṣantī karūkaram manasā putram ichantī    patim bhrātaram āt svān radite arbude tava  /
translated: Let her who drags her hands, and longs with yearning heart for son, for husband, for her brother, for her own, O Arbudi, when thou art crushed,

original: ali klavāḥ jāṣka madāḥ gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ / dhvāṅkṣāḥ śakunayaḥ tṛpyantu amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava /
analyzed: ali klavāḥ jāṣka madāḥ gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ   dhvāṅkṣāḥ śakunayaḥ tṛpyantu amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava  /
translated: the crows and the birds be satisfied, looking at our enemies, when thou hast crushed the Arvuda.🔽And let every beast of prey, every fly, every worm,🔽be satisfied on the human corpse, when thou hast crushed the Arvuda.

analyzed: atho sarvam śvāpadam makṣikā tṛpyatu krimiḥ   pauruṣeye adhi kuṇape radite arbude tava  ā gṛhṇītam sam bṛhatam prāṇa apānāt nyarbude    nivāśāḥ ghoṣāḥ sam yantu amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava  /
translated: Take hold of him, embrace him, crush him, O Arvuda, between the in-breathing and the out-breathing.🔽Let the cries of the people be united, looking at our enemies, when thou hast crushed the Arvuda.🔽Make them tremble, make them quake with fear, unite the enemies in fear.

original: ud vepaya sam vijantām bhiyā amitrān sam sṛja / uru grāhaiḥ bāhu aṅkaiḥ vidhya amitrān nyarbude /
analyzed: ud vepaya sam vijantām bhiyā amitrān sam sṛja    uru grāhaiḥ bāhu aṅkaiḥ vidhya amitrān nyarbude  /
translated: With wide-extending arms and hands pierce the enemies, O Arvuda.🔽Let their arms be paralysed, and the thought that is in their hearts.

original: muhyantu eṣām bāhavaḥ citta ākūtam ca yat dhṛdi / mā eṣām ud śeṣi kim cana radite arbude tava /
analyzed: muhyantu eṣām bāhavaḥ citta ākūtam ca yat dhṛdi   mā eṣām ud śeṣi kim cana radite arbude tava  /
translated: Let nothing whatever remain of them, when thou hast crushed the Arvuda.

original: pratighnānāḥ sam dhāvantu uraḥ paṭaurau āghnānāḥ / aghāriṇīḥ vikeśyaḥ rudatyaḥ puruṣe hate radite arbude tava /
analyzed: pratighnānāḥ sam dhāvantu uraḥ paṭaurau āghnānāḥ   aghāriṇīḥ vikeśyaḥ rudatyaḥ puruṣe hate radite arbude tava  /
translated: The women who burn, the women with dishevelled hair, weeping, when a man is slain, when a man is wounded, O Arbudi, let them go.🔽The Apsarases with dogs, and the Rūpakas, and the Arbudas,🔽In the inner vessel, licking, licking, the Risha, the ill-placed, the seeker of evil,

original: śvanvatīḥ apsarasaḥ rūpakāḥ uta arbude / antaḥpātre rerihatīm riśām durṇihita eṣiṇīm / sarvāḥ tāḥ arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya //

translated: The serpents, the other people, the Rakshasas,🔽The four-tusked, the black-toothed, the pot-buttocks, the blood-mouthed,

original: catur daṃṣṭrām chyāvadataḥ kumbha muṣkām asṛk mukhān / su abhyasāḥ ye ca udbhyasāḥ /
analyzed: catur daṃṣṭrām chyāvadataḥ kumbha muṣkām asṛk mukhān   su abhyasāḥ ye ca udbhyasāḥ  /
translated: Those who are well-practiced, and those who are practiced,

original: ud vepaya tvam arbude amitrāṇām amūḥ sicaḥ / jayan ca jiṣṇuḥ ca amitrām jayatām indramedinau /
analyzed: ud vepaya tvam arbude amitrāṇām amūḥ sicaḥ   jayan ca jiṣṇuḥ ca amitrām jayatām indramedinau  /
translated: Shake them, O Arbudi, the banners of the enemies.🔽The enemy is slain, O Nyarbudi, he lies crushed and mangled.

original: prablīnaḥ mṛditaḥ śayām hataḥ amitraḥ nyarbude / agni jihvāḥ dhūma śikhāḥ jayantīḥ yantu senayā /
analyzed: prablīnaḥ mṛditaḥ śayām hataḥ amitraḥ nyarbude    agni jihvāḥ dhūma śikhāḥ jayantīḥ yantu senayā  /
translated: Let the flames of Agni, with smoke for crests, go forth with their host, victorious.

original: tayā arbude praṇuttānām indraḥ hantu varaṃvaram / amitrāṇām śacīpatiḥ mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana // amitrāṇām śacīpatiḥ mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana // amitrāṇām śacīpatiḥ mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /
analyzed: tayā arbude praṇuttānām indraḥ hantu varaṃvaram    amitrāṇām śacīpatiḥ mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana    amitrāṇām śacīpatiḥ mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana
translated: With that, O Arbudi, drive thou down the foes whom thou hast smitten, and let Indra, the Lord of Strength, slay each and all of them. Let not one of them escape the Lord of Strength, the foes of these, the foes of these, the foes of these.

original: ud kasantu hṛdayāni ūrdhvaḥ prāṇaḥ ud īṣatu / śauṣkāsyam anu vartatām amitrān mā uta mitriṇaḥ /
analyzed: ud kasantu hṛdayāni ūrdhvaḥ prāṇaḥ ud īṣatu   śauṣkāsyam anu vartatām amitrān mā uta mitriṇaḥ  /
translated: Let their hearts burst asunder, let their breath go upward and away. Let them turn to the dry and withered, let not our friends turn to them.

original: ye ca dhīrāḥ ye ca adhīrāḥ parāñcaḥ badhirāḥ ca ye / tamasā ye ca tūparāḥ atho basta abhivāsinaḥ / sarvān tām arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya //
analyzed: ye ca dhīrāḥ ye ca adhīrāḥ parāñcaḥ badhirāḥ ca ye tamasā ye ca tūparāḥ atho basta abhivāsinaḥ   / sarvān tām arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya  /
translated: Those who are wise and those who are not, those who are far away and those who are near, those who are in darkness and those who are in the light, those who are in the desert and those who are in the cave, all of them, O Arbudi, make thou visible to our enemies, and show them forth in their nakedness.

original: arbudiḥ ca triṣandhiḥ ca amitrān naḥ vi vidhyatām / yathā eṣām indra vṛtrahan hanāma śacīpate amitrāṇām sahasraśas /

translated: Let Arbudi and Trisandhi pierce our enemies, That we may slay, O Indra, Vritra-slayer, Lord of power, thousands of foes.

original: vanaspatīn vānaspatyān oṣadhīḥ uta vīrudhaḥ / gandharva apsarasaḥ sarpān devān puṇyajanān pitṝn / sarvān tām arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya //

translated: The trees and plants, the herbs and creepers, the Gandharvas and Apsarases, the serpents, the gods, the holy men, the fathers, all these, O Arbudi, make visible to us against our enemies, and show them forth in ample measure.

original: īśām vaḥ marutaḥ devaḥ ādityaḥ brahmaṇaspatiḥ / īśām vaḥ indraḥ ca agniḥ ca dhātā mitraḥ prajāpatiḥ / īśām vaḥ ṛṣayaḥ cakruḥ amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava /

translated: The God Aditya, the Maruts, Brahmanaspati, Indra and Agni, Dhatr, Mitra, Prajapati, the Rishis have made you their sovereign, when they looked on your enemies. In your wrath, O Arbudi.

translated: Rise up, ye Lords of all, and gird yourselves. Ye Gods, ye men, be ye victorious in this battle, and stand ye in your several places.

original: ud tiṣṭhata sam nahyadhvam udārāḥ ketubhiḥ saha / sarpāḥ itarajanāḥ rakṣāṃsi amitrān anu dhāvata /

original: sarvān lokān sam ajayan devāḥ āhutyā anayā / bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ vajram yam asiñcata asura kṣayaṇam vadham /
analyzed: sarvān lokān sam ajayan devāḥ āhutyā anayā    bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ vajram yam asiñcata asura kṣayaṇam vadham  /

original: bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ vajram yam asiñcata asura kṣayaṇam vadham / tena aham amūm senām ni limpāmi bṛhaspate amitrān hanmi ojasā /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ vajram yam asiñcata asura kṣayaṇam vadham   tena aham amūm senām ni limpāmi bṛhaspate amitrān hanmi ojasā  /
translated: With that I smear this army, O Brihaspati, I slay the foemen with my might.

original: sarve devāḥ atyāyanti ye aśnanti vaṣaṭkṛtam / imām juṣadhvam āhutim itas jayata mā amutas /
analyzed: sarve devāḥ atyāyanti ye aśnanti vaṣaṭkṛtam    imām juṣadhvam āhutim itas jayata mā amutas  /
translated: All the Gods go to the feast who eat the portion offered with the cry of Vashat. Accept this oblation. Conquer ye hence, not from yonder side.

original: sarve devāḥ atyāyantu triṣandheḥ āhutiḥ priyā / saṃdhām mahatīm rakṣata yayā agre asurāḥ jitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve devāḥ atyāyantu triṣandheḥ āhutiḥ priyā   saṃdhām mahatīm rakṣata yayā agre asurāḥ jitāḥ  /
translated: All the Gods go to the feast, the dear oblation of the three-times-seven. Guard ye the mighty bond whereby of old the Asuras were conquered.

original: vāyuḥ amitrāṇām iṣu agrāṇi āñcatu / indraḥ eṣām bāhūn prati bhanaktu mā śakan pratidhām iṣum / ādityaḥ eṣām astram vi nāśayatu candramāḥ yutām agatasya panthām //
analyzed: vāyuḥ amitrāṇām iṣu agrāṇi āñcatu   indraḥ eṣām bāhūn prati bhanaktu mā śakan pratidhām iṣum   ādityaḥ eṣām astram vi nāśayatu candramāḥ yutām agatasya panthām  /
translated: Let Vayu bend the arrow-points of the foemen. Let Indra cleave their arms, that they may not be able to draw their bows. Let Âditya destroy their weapons. Let the Moon take away the path of him who cometh nigh.🔽If they have gone to the strongholds of the Gods, and made their armour of the sacred hymns,

original: yadi preyuḥ deva purā brahma varmāṇi cakrire / tanū pānam paripāṇam kṛṇvānāḥ yat upocire sarvam tat arasam kṛdhi //
analyzed: yadi preyuḥ deva purā brahma varmāṇi cakrire   tanū pānam paripāṇam kṛṇvānāḥ yat upocire sarvam tat arasam kṛdhi  /
translated: And have prepared a coat of mail and guard to keep them safe, make all that powerless and void of strength.

original: kravyādā anuvartayat mṛtyunā ca purohitam / triṣandhe prehi senayā jaya amitrān pra padyasva //
analyzed: kravyādā anuvartayat mṛtyunā ca purohitam   triṣandhe prehi senayā jaya amitrān pra padyasva  /
translated: The flesh-eaters following, and Death as their leader,🔽Go with thy host to the three-moated city, conquer the foes, and fall upon them.

original: triṣandhe tamasā tvam amitrān pari vāraya / pṛṣadājya praṇuttānām mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana /
analyzed: triṣandhe tamasā tvam amitrān pari vāraya   pṛṣadājya praṇuttānām mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana  /
translated: O three-moated city, thou with darkness, surround the foes.🔽Of those driven away by the speckled butter, let no one be set free.🔽Let the speckled one alight upon the arrows of the foes.🔽Let the armies of the foes be confounded to-day, O Nyarbudi.

analyzed: śitipadī sam patatu amitrāṇām amūḥ sicaḥ   muhyantu adya amūḥ senāḥ amitrāṇām nyarbude
translated: Confounded be the foes, O Nyarbudi, slay their best and their worst.

original: mūḍhāḥ amitrāḥ nyarbude jahi eṣām varaṃvaram / anayā jahi senayā /
analyzed: mūḍhāḥ amitrāḥ nyarbude jahi eṣām varaṃvaram    anayā jahi senayā  /
translated: With this host slay them.

original: yaḥ ca kavacī yaḥ ca akavacaḥ amitraḥ yaḥ ca ajmani / jyā pāśaiḥ kavaca pāśaiḥ ajmanā abhihataḥ śayām /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kavacī yaḥ ca akavacaḥ amitraḥ yaḥ ca ajmani    jyā pāśaiḥ kavaca pāśaiḥ ajmanā abhihataḥ śayām  /
translated: The foe who is mailed and the foe who is unmailed, and he who is on the field of battle,🔽Struck down by the bow-string and the mail-snare, let him lie on the ground.

original: ye varmiṇaḥ ye avarmāṇaḥ amitrāḥ ye ca varmiṇaḥ / sarvān tām arbude hatām śvānaḥ adantu bhūmyām /
analyzed: ye varmiṇaḥ ye avarmāṇaḥ amitrāḥ ye ca varmiṇaḥ    sarvān tām arbude hatām śvānaḥ adantu bhūmyām  /
translated: The foes who are in armour and those who are not, and those who are in armour, all of them, O Arvuda, slay them. Let the dogs devour them on the ground.

original: ye rathinaḥ ye a rathāḥ asādāḥ ye ca sādinaḥ / sarvān adantu tān hatān gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye rathinaḥ ye a rathāḥ asādāḥ ye ca sādinaḥ    sarvān adantu tān hatān gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ  /
translated: Those who are on chariots, those who are without chariots, those who are seated, and those who are mounted, all of them, let the vultures, eagles, and birds devour them when slain.

original: sahasra kuṇapā śetām āmitrī senā samare vadhānām / vividdhā kakaja ākṛtā /
analyzed: sahasra kuṇapā śetām āmitrī senā samare vadhānām    vividdhā kakaja ākṛtā
translated: Let the hostile army lie down with a thousand wounds in battle, to be slain, pierced, and mutilated.

original: marmāvidham roruvatam suparṇaiḥ adantu duścitam mṛditam śayānam / yaḥ imām pratīcīm āhutim amitraḥ naḥ yuyutsati //
analyzed: marmāvidham roruvatam suparṇaiḥ adantu duścitam mṛditam śayānam    yaḥ imām pratīcīm āhutim amitraḥ naḥ yuyutsati  /
translated: Let the vultures tear him limb from limb, the one who injures our vital parts, who roars, who is ill-fated, crushed, and lying down, the foe who fights against us and this offering to the west.

analyzed: yām devāḥ anutiṣṭhanti yasyāḥ na asti virādhanam      tayā indraḥ hantu vṛtra hā vajreṇa triṣandhinā             hantu
translated: With that which Gods observe, with that which none may disobey, Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, slay with his three-jointed thunderbolt.

original: satyam bṛhat ṛtam ugram dīkṣā tapaḥ brahma yajñaḥ pṛthivīm dhārayanti / sā naḥ bhūtasya bhavyasya patnī urum lokam pṛthivī naḥ kṛṇotu //
analyzed: satyam bṛhat ṛtam ugram dīkṣā tapaḥ brahma yajñaḥ pṛthivīm dhārayanti    sā naḥ bhūtasya bhavyasya patnī urum lokam pṛthivī naḥ kṛṇotu  /
translated: Truth, lofty, mighty, holy, penance, sacrifice, and prayer support the earth. May she, the consort of the past and future, make us room, and let the earth be kind to us.

original: asaṃbādham madhyataḥ mānavānām yasyāḥ udvataḥ pravataḥ samam bahu / nānā vīryāḥ oṣadhīḥ yā bibharti pṛthivī naḥ prathatām rādhyatām naḥ /
analyzed: asaṃbādham madhyataḥ mānavānām yasyāḥ udvataḥ pravataḥ samam bahu    nānā vīryāḥ oṣadhīḥ yā bibharti pṛthivī naḥ prathatām rādhyatām naḥ  /
translated: The earth that bears the many plants of various kinds, the earth that is a level plain between the hills, the earth that is unhindered in the midst of men,– may she be wide to us and favour us the folk.

original: yasyām samudraḥ uta sindhuḥ āpaḥ yasyām annam kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ / yasyām idam jinvati prāṇat ejat sā naḥ bhūmiḥ pūrvapeye dadhātu //
analyzed: yasyām samudraḥ uta sindhuḥ āpaḥ yasyām annam kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ   yasyām idam jinvati prāṇat ejat sā naḥ bhūmiḥ pūrvapeye dadhātu  /
translated: In whom this moving and this breathing creature hath life and growth, may that Earth grant us the first enjoyment of her food.🔽In whom are the four regions of the earth, in whom the food of men have had their being,

original: yasyāḥ catasraḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ yasyām annam kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ / yā bibharti bahudhā prāṇat ejat sā naḥ bhūmiḥ goṣu api anne dadhātu //
analyzed: yasyāḥ catasraḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ yasyām annam kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ   yā bibharti bahudhā prāṇat ejat sā naḥ bhūmiḥ goṣu api anne dadhātu  /
translated: Who in many ways supports this moving and this breathing creature, may that Earth grant us food in our cattle and in our food.🔽In whom the ancient generations have moved, in whom the Gods have overcome the Asuras,

original: yasyām pūrve pūrva janāḥ vicakrire yasyām devāḥ asurān abhyavartayan / gavām aśvānām vayasaḥ ca viṣṭhā bhagam varcaḥ pṛthivī naḥ dadhātu //
analyzed: yasyām pūrve pūrva janāḥ vicakrire yasyām devāḥ asurān abhyavartayan    gavām aśvānām vayasaḥ ca viṣṭhā bhagam varcaḥ pṛthivī naḥ dadhātu  /
translated: In whom are the abodes of the strength of cattle and of horses, may the Earth grant us fortune and splendour.🔽The supporter of all, the treasure of wealth, the foundation, the golden-breasted, the abode of the world,

original: viśvaṃbharā vasu dhānī pratiṣṭhā hiraṇya vakṣāḥ jagataḥ niveśanī / vaiśvānaram bibhratī bhūmiḥ agnim indra ṛṣabhā draviṇe naḥ dadhātu /
analyzed: viśvaṃbharā vasu dhānī pratiṣṭhā hiraṇya vakṣāḥ jagataḥ niveśanī    vaiśvānaram bibhratī bhūmiḥ agnim indra ṛṣabhā draviṇe naḥ dadhātu  /
translated: Bearing the fire of universal light, may the Earth, like Indra the bull, grant us riches.🔽Whom the sleepless Gods, at all times, protect, the Earth, the wide Earth, the Earth that never deceives,

original: yām rakṣanti asvapnāḥ viśvadānīm devāḥ bhūmim pṛthivīm apramādam / sā naḥ madhu priyam duhām atha u ukṣatu varcasā /
analyzed: yām rakṣanti asvapnāḥ viśvadānīm devāḥ bhūmim pṛthivīm apramādam    sā naḥ madhu priyam duhām atha u ukṣatu varcasā  /
translated: May she yield us sweet honey, and may she sprinkle us with ghee.

original: yā arṇave adhi salilam agre āsīt yām māyābhiḥ anvacarat manīṣiṇaḥ / yasyāḥ hṛdayam parame vyoman satyena āvṛtam amṛtam pṛthivyāḥ / sā naḥ bhūmiḥ tviṣim balam rāṣṭre dadhātu uttame /🔽yasyām āpaḥ paricarāḥ samānīḥ ahar rātre apramādam kṣaranti / sā naḥ bhūmiḥ bhūri dhārā payaḥ duhām atha u ukṣatu varcasā /
analyzed: yā arṇave adhi salilam agre āsīt yām māyābhiḥ anvacarat manīṣiṇaḥ    yasyāḥ hṛdayam parame vyoman satyena āvṛtam amṛtam pṛthivyāḥ    sā naḥ bhūmiḥ tviṣim balam rāṣṭre dadhātu uttame  / yasyām āpaḥ paricarāḥ samānīḥ ahar rātre apramādam kṣaranti    sā naḥ bhūmiḥ bhūri dhārā payaḥ duhām atha u ukṣatu varcasā  /
translated: May that Earth give us splendour and strength in the highest kingdom.🔽In whom the waters flow together, day and night flow without fail,🔽May that Earth, with many streams, yield milk for us, and let her bedew us with sap.🔽The Earth which Indra, the Lord of Strength, made for himself, free from enemies,

original: indraḥ yām cakre ātmane anamitrām śacīpatiḥ / sā naḥ bhūmiḥ vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ // / vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ // vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ // vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ // vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ // vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ // vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ // vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ yām cakre ātmane anamitrām śacīpatiḥ   sā naḥ bhūmiḥ vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ
translated: May that Earth grant me room, as a mother to her son, may she grant me milk.

original: girayaḥ te parvatāḥ himavantaḥ araṇyam te pṛthivi syonam astu / babhrum kṛṣṇām rohiṇīm viśva rūpām dhruvām bhūmim pṛthivīm indra guptām / a jītaḥ a hataḥ akṣataḥ adhi aṣṭhām pṛthivīm aham /
analyzed: girayaḥ te parvatāḥ himavantaḥ araṇyam te pṛthivi syonam astu    babhrum kṛṣṇām rohiṇīm viśva rūpām dhruvām bhūmim pṛthivīm indra guptām   a jītaḥ a hataḥ akṣataḥ adhi aṣṭhām pṛthivīm aham  /
translated: The earth have I obtained, unconquered, unwounded, unhurt.

original: yat te madhyam pṛthivi yat ca nabhyam yāḥ te ūrjaḥ tanvaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ / tāsu naḥ dhehi abhi naḥ pavasva mātā bhūmiḥ putraḥ aham pṛthivyāḥ parjanyaḥ pitā saḥ u naḥ pipartu //
analyzed: yat te madhyam pṛthivi yat ca nabhyam yāḥ te ūrjaḥ tanvaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ   tāsu naḥ dhehi abhi naḥ pavasva mātā bhūmiḥ putraḥ aham pṛthivyāḥ parjanyaḥ pitā saḥ u naḥ pipartu  /
translated: The middle of thee, O Earth, and what is in thy womb, and all the forms of strength that have been formed in thee, in them place us, and purify us. I am the son of Earth, the mother is the earth. May Parjanya, the father, deliver us.🔽On whom they lay the altar, on whom all the craftsmen spread the sacrifice,

original: yasyām vedim parigṛhṇanti bhūmyām yasyām yajñam tanvate viśvakarmāṇaḥ / yasyām mīyante svaravaḥ pṛthivyām ūrdhvāḥ śukrāḥ āhutyāḥ purastāt / sā naḥ bhūmiḥ vardhayat vardhamānā /
analyzed: yasyām vedim parigṛhṇanti bhūmyām yasyām yajñam tanvate viśvakarmāṇaḥ   yasyām mīyante svaravaḥ pṛthivyām ūrdhvāḥ śukrāḥ āhutyāḥ purastāt    sā naḥ bhūmiḥ vardhayat vardhamānā  /
translated: On whom the stakes are set up in the earth, the bright ones standing erect before the oblation, may that earth prosper us, prospering.

original: yaḥ naḥ dveṣat pṛthivi yaḥ pṛtanyāt yaḥ abhidāsāt manasā yaḥ vadhena / tam naḥ bhūme randhaya pūrva kṛtvari /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dveṣat pṛthivi yaḥ pṛtanyāt yaḥ abhidāsāt manasā yaḥ vadhena   tam naḥ bhūme randhaya pūrva kṛtvari  /
translated: O Earth, him who hates us, him who is hostile, him who looks on us with anger, him who would slay us, O Earth, deliver up to us, O thou who hast done this aforetime.

original: tvat jātāḥ tvayi caranti martyāḥ tvam bibharṣi dvipadaḥ tvam catuṣpadaḥ / tava ime pṛthivi pañca mānavāḥ yebhyaḥ jyotiḥ amṛtam martyebhyaḥ udyan sūryaḥ raśmibhiḥ ātanoti //
analyzed: tvat jātāḥ tvayi caranti martyāḥ tvam bibharṣi dvipadaḥ tvam catuṣpadaḥ    tava ime pṛthivi pañca mānavāḥ yebhyaḥ jyotiḥ amṛtam martyebhyaḥ udyan sūryaḥ raśmibhiḥ ātanoti  /
translated: From thee have sprung, in thee do mortals move, thou bearest bipeds and thou bearest quadrupeds. These five men, Earth, are thine, for whom the light and immortality, the Sun, rising with his rays, spreads out.

original: tāḥ naḥ prajāḥ sam duhratām samagrāḥ vācaḥ madhu pṛthivi dhehi mahyam //
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ prajāḥ sam duhratām samagrāḥ vācaḥ madhu pṛthivi dhehi mahyam
translated: May all these creatures yield us plenteous milk. O Earth, give me the sweetness of thy speech.

original: viśvasvam mātaram oṣadhīnām dhruvām bhūmim pṛthivīm dharmaṇā dhṛtām / śivām syonām anu carema viśvahā /
analyzed: viśvasvam mātaram oṣadhīnām dhruvām bhūmim pṛthivīm dharmaṇā dhṛtām   śivām syonām anu carema viśvahā  /
translated: The universal Mother of the plants, the firm Earth, Prithivī, supported by the Law, auspicious, kind, may we all go after her for ever.

original: mahat sadhastham mahatī babhūvitha mahān vegaḥ ejathuḥ vepathuḥ te / mahān tvā indraḥ rakṣati apramādam / sā naḥ bhūme pra rocaya hiraṇyasya iva saṃdṛśi mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana /
analyzed: mahat sadhastham mahatī babhūvitha mahān vegaḥ ejathuḥ vepathuḥ te    mahān tvā indraḥ rakṣati apramādam   sā naḥ bhūme pra rocaya hiraṇyasya iva saṃdṛśi mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana  /
translated: Thou hast become great in the great abode. Great is thy rush and shaking. Great Indra guards thee from negligence. Be thou propitious to us, O Earth, in the sight of gold. Let no one hate us.

original: agniḥ bhūmyām oṣadhīṣu agnim āpaḥ bibhrati agniḥ aśmasu / agniḥ antar puruṣeṣu goṣu aśveṣu agnayaḥ /

translated: Agni is in the earth, in the plants; the waters bear Agni. Agni is in the stones. Agni is in the men, in the cows, in the horses.

translated: Mortals kindle Agni, the bearer of oblations, dear to the ghee.

original: agni vāsāḥ pṛthivī asitajñūḥ tviṣīmantam saṃśitam mā kṛṇotu //
analyzed: agni vāsāḥ pṛthivī asitajñūḥ tviṣīmantam saṃśitam mā kṛṇotu  /
translated: Agni, whose garment is the earth, whose girdle is the ocean, may he make me bright and shining.🔽On the earth they offer the sacrifice to the gods, the oblation, well-prepared.

original: bhūmyām devebhyaḥ dadati yajñam havyam araṃkṛtam / bhūmyām manuṣyāḥ jīvanti svadhayā annena martyāḥ / sā naḥ bhūmiḥ prāṇam āyuḥ dadhātu jaradaṣṭim mā pṛthivī kṛṇotu /
analyzed: bhūmyām devebhyaḥ dadati yajñam havyam araṃkṛtam   bhūmyām manuṣyāḥ jīvanti svadhayā annena martyāḥ   sā naḥ bhūmiḥ prāṇam āyuḥ dadhātu jaradaṣṭim mā pṛthivī kṛṇotu  /
translated: On the earth men live by their own food, mortals. May that earth grant us breath and life. May the earth make our vision long-lasting.

original: yaḥ te gandhaḥ pṛthivi saṃbabhūva yam bibhrati oṣadhayaḥ yam āpaḥ / yam gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ca bhejire tena mā surabhim kṛṇu mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana /
analyzed: yaḥ te gandhaḥ pṛthivi saṃbabhūva yam bibhrati oṣadhayaḥ yam āpaḥ   yam gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ca bhejire tena mā surabhim kṛṇu mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana  /
translated: The scent that dwells in thee, O Earth, which herbs and waters bear, which Gandharvas and Apsarases have worn, — make me thereby sweet-smelling. Let no man hate us.

original: yaḥ te gandhaḥ puṣkaram āviveśa yam saṃjabhruḥ sūryāyāḥ vivāhe / amartyāḥ pṛthivi gandham agre tena mā surabhim kṛṇu mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana /
analyzed: yaḥ te gandhaḥ puṣkaram āviveśa yam saṃjabhruḥ sūryāyāḥ vivāhe   amartyāḥ pṛthivi gandham agre tena mā surabhim kṛṇu mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana  /
translated: The scent that hath entered thee, O lotus-born, which they have mixed at the marriage of Sûryâ, the scent which mortals first received from thee, O Earth, — make me thereby sweet-smelling. Let no man hate us.

original: yaḥ te gandhaḥ puruṣeṣu strīṣu puṃsu bhagaḥ ruciḥ / yaḥ aśveṣu vīreṣu yaḥ mṛgeṣu uta hastiṣu / kanyāyām varcaḥ yat bhūme tena asmān api sam sṛja mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana /
analyzed: yaḥ te gandhaḥ puruṣeṣu strīṣu puṃsu bhagaḥ ruciḥ   yaḥ aśveṣu vīreṣu yaḥ mṛgeṣu uta hastiṣu   kanyāyām varcaḥ yat bhūme tena asmān api sam sṛja mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana  /
translated: The scent that dwells in men, in women, in the male, in fortune, in delight, that dwells in horses, in heroes, in the deer, and in the elephants, the splendour that is in the maiden, O Earth, — make me thereby sweet-smelling. Let no man hate us.

original: śilā bhūmiḥ aśmā pāṃsuḥ sā bhūmiḥ saṃdhṛtā dhṛtā / tasyai hiraṇya vakṣase pṛthivyāḥ akaram namaḥ /
analyzed: śilā bhūmiḥ aśmā pāṃsuḥ sā bhūmiḥ saṃdhṛtā dhṛtā   / tasyai hiraṇya vakṣase pṛthivyāḥ akaram namaḥ  /
translated: The stone, the earth, the rock, the dust, that is the earth, supported, firmly held. To her whose bosom is of gold I pay this adoration, of the earth.

original: yasyām vṛkṣāḥ vānaspatyāḥ dhruvāḥ tiṣṭhanti viśvahā / pṛthivīm viśva dhāyasam dhṛtām achāvadāmasi //
analyzed: yasyām vṛkṣāḥ vānaspatyāḥ dhruvāḥ tiṣṭhanti viśvahā   pṛthivīm viśva dhāyasam dhṛtām achāvadāmasi  /
translated: On whom the trees, the plants, the firm ones stand for ever, the earth, the supporter of all things, we call, the firmly-fixed, to aid.

analyzed: yāḥ te prācīḥ pradiśaḥ yāḥ udīcīḥ yāḥ te bhūme adharāt yāḥ ca paścāt    syonāḥ tāḥ mahyam carate bhavantu mā ni paptam bhuvane śiśriyāṇaḥ  /
translated: Those of thine that are the eastern and the northern regions, those that are beneath thee and those that are behind thee, O Earth, be they propitious to me as I move along. Let me not fall, let me not be hurt as I lie upon the world.

original: mā naḥ paścāt mā purastāt nudiṣṭhāḥ mā uttarāt adharāt uta / svasti bhūme naḥ bhava mā vidan paripanthinaḥ varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham /

translated: Drive us not away from behind, drive us not away from before, drive us not away from above, drive us not away from below. Be thou propitious to us, O Earth. Let not the robbers find us. Turn away the weapon.

original: yāvat te abhi vipaśyāmi bhūme sūryeṇa medinā / tāvat me cakṣuḥ mā mā iṣṭa uttarām uttarām samām /
analyzed: yāvat te abhi vipaśyāmi bhūme sūryeṇa medinā    tāvat me cakṣuḥ mā mā iṣṭa uttarām uttarām samām  /
translated: As far as I behold thee, O Earth, with the sun as my companion, so far let my eye be, let it not fail me, year after year.

original: yat śayānaḥ paryāvarte dakṣiṇam sakhyam abhi bhūme pārśvam uttānāḥ tvā pratīcīm yat pṛṣṭībhiḥ adhiśemahe / mā hiṃsīḥ tatra naḥ bhūme sarvasya pratiśīvari //
analyzed: yat śayānaḥ paryāvarte dakṣiṇam sakhyam abhi bhūme pārśvam uttānāḥ tvā pratīcīm yat pṛṣṭībhiḥ adhiśemahe    mā hiṃsīḥ tatra naḥ bhūme sarvasya pratiśīvari  /
translated: When I turn over on my right side, O Earth, as I lie down, when I stretch myself on my back, when I lie on my belly, O Earth, let not thy ribs hurt me. Hurt me not, O Earth, in any of these positions, but in all be gracious to me.

original: yat te bhūme vikhanāmi kṣipram tat api rohatu / mā te marma vimṛgvari mā te hṛdayam arpipam /

translated: What I dig of thine, O Earth, let it quickly grow up again. Hurt not my vital parts, O thou of varied form, nor pierce my heart.

original: nidhim bibhratī bahudhā guhā vasu maṇim hiraṇyam pṛthivī dadātu me / vasūni naḥ vasu dāḥ rāsamānā devī dadhātu sumanasyamānā /

translated: Giving us wealth, may the Goddess, well-disposed, grant us riches as we dig for them.🔽Bearing in many a place her people, speaking in many a tongue, the earth, the many-natured, the many-soiled,

original: janam bibhratī bahudhā vivācasam nānā dharmāṇam pṛthivī yathaukasam / sahasram dhārāḥ draviṇasya me duhām dhruvā iva dhenuḥ an apasphurantī /
analyzed: janam bibhratī bahudhā vivācasam nānā dharmāṇam pṛthivī yathaukasam    sahasram dhārāḥ draviṇasya me duhām dhruvā iva dhenuḥ an apasphurantī  /
translated: May she yield me a thousand streams of wealth, like a firm cow, never failing to give milk.

original: yaḥ te sarpaḥ vṛścikaḥ tṛṣṭa daṃśmā hemanta jabdhaḥ bhṛmalaḥ guhā śaye / krimiḥ jinvat pṛthivi yat yat ejati prāvṛṣi tat naḥ sarpat mā upa sṛpat yat śivam tena naḥ mṛḍa /
analyzed: yaḥ te sarpaḥ vṛścikaḥ tṛṣṭa daṃśmā hemanta jabdhaḥ bhṛmalaḥ guhā śaye   krimiḥ jinvat pṛthivi yat yat ejati prāvṛṣi tat naḥ sarpat mā upa sṛpat yat śivam tena naḥ mṛḍa  /
translated: The serpent which is in thee, O Earth, the scorpion, the stinging insect, the spider, the worm, the insect which lieth hidden in the winter, O thou who art covered with grass, — all these, O Earth, do thou drive away from us. Do not approach us with thy sting. Be gracious unto us with thy pleasant side.

original: ye te panthānaḥ bahavaḥ janāyanāḥ rathasya vartmānasaḥ ca yātave / yaiḥ saṃcaranti ubhaye bhadra pāpāḥ tam panthānam jayema anamitram ataskaram yat śivam tena naḥ mṛḍa //
analyzed: ye te panthānaḥ bahavaḥ janāyanāḥ rathasya vartmānasaḥ ca yātave   yaiḥ saṃcaranti ubhaye bhadra pāpāḥ tam panthānam jayema anamitram ataskaram yat śivam tena naḥ mṛḍa  /
translated: Those many paths of thine, O Earth, which are for men to travel, the ways for the chariot to go, by which the good and the evil go together, — may we win that path, which is free from foes, free from robbers. Be gracious unto us with thy pleasant side.

original: malvam bibhratī guru bhṛt bhadra pāpasya nidhanam titikṣuḥ / varāheṇa pṛthivī saṃvidānā sūkarāya vi jihīte mṛgāya /
analyzed: malvam bibhratī guru bhṛt bhadra pāpasya nidhanam titikṣuḥ    varāheṇa pṛthivī saṃvidānā sūkarāya vi jihīte mṛgāya  /
translated: Bearing the dwarf, bearing the heavy weight, the abode of good and evil, enduring, — the Earth, agreeing with the boar, hath spread herself out for the boar, for the deer.

original: ye te āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ mṛgāḥ vane hitāḥ siṃhāḥ vyāghrāḥ puruṣādaḥ caranti / ulam vṛkam pṛthivi duchunām itas ṛkṣīkām rakṣaḥ apa bādhaya asmat /
analyzed: ye te āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ mṛgāḥ vane hitāḥ siṃhāḥ vyāghrāḥ puruṣādaḥ caranti   ulam vṛkam pṛthivi duchunām itas ṛkṣīkām rakṣaḥ apa bādhaya asmat  /
translated: Those wild beasts of thine, O Earth, the forest animals, the lions, the tigers, and the man-eaters that roam about, — the wolf, the jackal, the hyena, the bear, the Rākṣasa, drive all these away from us, O Earth.

original: ye gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ye cārāyāḥ kimīdinaḥ / piśācān sarvā rakṣāṃsi tān asmat bhūme yāvaya // // //
analyzed: ye gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ye cārāyāḥ kimīdinaḥ   piśācān sarvā rakṣāṃsi tān asmat bhūme yāvaya
translated: The Gandharvas, the Apsarases, the Āraṇyas, and the Kīmīdins, — all the Piśācas and the Rākṣasas, drive them away from us, O Earth.

original: yām dvipādaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ saṃpatanti haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunāḥ vayāṃsi / yasyām vātaḥ mātariśvā īyate rajāṃsi kṛṇvan cyāvayan ca vṛkṣān / vātasya pravām upavām anu vāti arciḥ /
analyzed: yām dvipādaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ saṃpatanti haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunāḥ vayāṃsi   yasyām vātaḥ mātariśvā īyate rajāṃsi kṛṇvan cyāvayan ca vṛkṣān    vātasya pravām upavām anu vāti arciḥ  /
translated: The flame blows after the wind's out-breath and in-breath.🔽On which the black and the red are joined, the day and the night, appointed on the earth,

original: yasyām kṛṣṇam aruṇam ca saṃhite ahar rātre vihite bhūmyām adhi / varṣeṇa bhūmiḥ pṛthivī vṛtā āvṛtā sā naḥ dadhātu bhadrayā priye dhāmani dhāmani //
analyzed: yasyām kṛṣṇam aruṇam ca saṃhite ahar rātre vihite bhūmyām adhi  / varṣeṇa bhūmiḥ pṛthivī vṛtā āvṛtā sā naḥ dadhātu bhadrayā priye dhāmani dhāmani  /
translated: The earth is covered, the earth is surrounded by the rain. May she place us in her most auspicious abode, in every abode.

original: dyauḥ ca me idam pṛthivī ca antarikṣam ca me vyacaḥ / agniḥ sūryaḥ āpaḥ medhām viśve devāḥ ca sam daduḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ ca me idam pṛthivī ca antarikṣam ca me vyacaḥ   agniḥ sūryaḥ āpaḥ medhām viśve devāḥ ca sam daduḥ  /
translated: May Dyaus and this earth and the wide air, and Agni, Sûrya, and the waters, and all the Gods, have granted me.

original: aham asmi sahamānaḥ uttaraḥ nāma bhūmyām / abhīṣāh asmi viśvāṣāh āśām āśām viṣāsahiḥ //
analyzed: aham asmi sahamānaḥ uttaraḥ nāma bhūmyām   abhīṣāh asmi viśvāṣāh āśām āśām viṣāsahiḥ  /
translated: I am the conqueror, the superior, by name on earth. I am the conqueror of all, the conqueror of every wish, the conqueror of every region.🔽When, O Goddess, thou didst first move forward, urged by the Gods, to greatness,

original: adaḥ yat devi prathamānā purastāt devaiḥ uktā vyasarpaḥ mahitvam / ā tvā subhūtam aviśat tadānīm akalpayathāḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ /
analyzed: adaḥ yat devi prathamānā purastāt devaiḥ uktā vyasarpaḥ mahitvam   ā tvā subhūtam aviśat tadānīm akalpayathāḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ  /
translated: Then the good fortune of the Gods entered into thee. Then thou didst make the four quarters.

original: ye grāmāḥ yat araṇyam yāḥ sabhāḥ adhi bhūmyām / ye saṃgrāmāḥ samitayaḥ teṣu cāru vadema te /
analyzed: ye grāmāḥ yat araṇyam yāḥ sabhāḥ adhi bhūmyām   ye saṃgrāmāḥ samitayaḥ teṣu cāru vadema te  /
translated: The villages, the woods, the assemblies on the earth, the battles, the gatherings, in all these places may we speak fair words to you.

original: aśvaḥ iva rajaḥ dudhuve vi tān janān yaḥ ākṣiyan pṛthivīm yāt ajāyata / mandrā agretvarī bhuvanasya gopāḥ vanaspatīnām gṛbhiḥ oṣadhīnām /
analyzed: aśvaḥ iva rajaḥ dudhuve vi tān janān yaḥ ākṣiyan pṛthivīm yāt ajāyata    mandrā agretvarī bhuvanasya gopāḥ vanaspatīnām gṛbhiḥ oṣadhīnām  /
translated: Like a horse he hath scattered the people who sought to stay him when he sprang to life. He, the delightful, the leader of the world, the guardian of the trees and plants, the friend of herbs.

original: yat vadāmi madhumat tat vadāmi yat īkṣe tat vananti mā / tviṣīmān asmi jūtimān ava anyān hanmi dodhataḥ //
analyzed: yat vadāmi madhumat tat vadāmi yat īkṣe tat vananti mā    tviṣīmān asmi jūtimān ava anyān hanmi dodhataḥ  /
translated: What I say is sweet, I say what is sweet. What I see, that is sweet to me. I am radiant, I am strong. I strike down the others who rush against me.

original: śantivā surabhiḥ syonā kīlālodhnī payasvatī / bhūmiḥ adhi bravītu me pṛthivī payasā saha /
analyzed: śantivā surabhiḥ syonā kīlāla udhnī payasvatī   / bhūmiḥ adhi bravītu me pṛthivī payasā saha  /
translated: May the earth, the propitious, sweet-smelling, pleasant, rich in milk and water, speak to me, may the earth, the mother, speak to me with her milk.

original: yām anvaichat dhaviṣā viśvakarmā antar arṇave rajasi praviṣṭām / bhujiṣyam pātram nihitam guhā yat āvis bhoge abhavat mātṛmadbhyaḥ //
analyzed: yām anvaichat dhaviṣā viśvakarmā antar arṇave rajasi praviṣṭām    bhujiṣyam pātram nihitam guhā yat āvis bhoge abhavat mātṛmadbhyaḥ  /
translated: The earth which Viśvakarman sought with oblation, which had entered the region within the ocean, the vessel which was laid away in secret, which became manifest to the mothers in the enjoyment.

original: tvam asi āvapanī janānām aditiḥ kāmadughā paprathānā / yat te ūnam tat te ā pūrayāti prajāpatiḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtasya /
analyzed: tvam asi āvapanī janānām aditiḥ kāmadughā paprathānā   yat te ūnam tat te ā pūrayāti prajāpatiḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtasya  /
translated: Thou art the bestower of children on men, Aditi, the milch-cow, the all-satisfying, the all-extending. Whatever is wanting in thee, that is supplied by Prajāpati, the first-born of holy order.

original: upasthāḥ te anamīvāḥ a yakṣmāḥ asmabhyam santu pṛthivi prasūtāḥ / dīrgham naḥ āyuḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ vayam tubhyam bali hṛtaḥ syāma /
analyzed: upasthāḥ te anamīvāḥ a yakṣmāḥ asmabhyam santu pṛthivi prasūtāḥ   dīrgham naḥ āyuḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ vayam tubhyam bali hṛtaḥ syāma  /
translated: Let thy services be free from sickness and disease, O Earth, and bring us forth to life. Let us, with long life, be thy worshippers, and bring thee our tribute.🔽O Earth, my Mother, place me well and happily, and give me a good foundation. Agreeing with the wise one of the day, place me in prosperity and in abundance.🔽O Earth, my Mother, place me well and happily, and give me a good foundation. Agreeing with the wise one of the day, place me in prosperity and in abundance.

original: bhūme mātar ni dhehi mā bhadrayā su pratiṣṭhitam / saṃvidānā divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām // // // // divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām // // // // // // // divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām // // // // // // // // // // divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām // // // // // // // divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām //
analyzed: bhūme mātar ni dhehi mā bhadrayā su pratiṣṭhitam    saṃvidānā divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām           divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām
translated: O Earth, my Mother, place me well and happily, and give me a good foundation. Agreeing with the wise one of the day, place me in prosperity and in abundance.

original: naḍam ā roha na te atra loke idam sīsam bhāgadheyam te ehi / yaḥ goṣu yakṣmaḥ puruṣeṣu yakṣmaḥ tena tvam sākam adharāṅ parehi /
analyzed: naḍam ā roha na te atra loke idam sīsam bhāgadheyam te ehi   yaḥ goṣu yakṣmaḥ puruṣeṣu yakṣmaḥ tena tvam sākam adharāṅ parehi  /
translated: Climb the reed, there is no place for thee here. This lead is thy portion. Come hither. Whatever disease is in cattle and in men, with that disease go thou away with them to the nethermost distance.

original: agha śaṃsa duḥśaṃsābhyām kareṇa anukareṇa ca / yakṣmam ca sarvam tena itas mṛtyum ca niḥ ajāmasi //
analyzed: agha śaṃsa duḥśaṃsābhyām kareṇa anukareṇa ca   yakṣmam ca sarvam tena itas mṛtyum ca niḥ ajāmasi  /
translated: And from all Consumption and from Death we drive away this man.

original: niḥ itas mṛtyum nirṛtim niḥ arātim ajāmasi / yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi tam addhi agne akravyād yam u dviṣmaḥ tam u te pra suvāmasi //
analyzed: niḥ itas mṛtyum nirṛtim niḥ arātim ajāmasi   yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi tam addhi agne akravyād yam u dviṣmaḥ tam u te pra suvāmasi  /
translated: From this place we drive away Death, and Nirr̥iti, and Arāṭi. Devour him who hateth us, O Agni, devour him whom we hate.🔽If it be Agni Kavyavāhana or the tiger that hath entered this our fold,

original: yadi agniḥ kravyād yadi vā vyāghraḥ imam goṣṭham praviveśa anyokāḥ / tam māṣa ājyam kṛtvā pra hiṇomi dūram sa gacchatu apsuṣadaḥ api agnīn /
analyzed: yadi agniḥ kravyād yadi vā vyāghraḥ imam goṣṭham praviveśa anyokāḥ   tam māṣa ājyam kṛtvā pra hiṇomi dūram sa gacchatu apsuṣadaḥ api agnīn  /
translated: I send him far away, making him a cake of beans. Let him go to the waters and to the fires that dwell in them.🔽If in anger ye have driven thee away, O Agni, in the wrath of men when one is dead,

original: yat tvā kruddhāḥ pracakruḥ manyunā puruṣe mṛte / su kalpam agne tat tvayā punar tvā ud dīpayāmasi //
analyzed: yat tvā kruddhāḥ pracakruḥ manyunā puruṣe mṛte    su kalpam agne tat tvayā punar tvā ud dīpayāmasi  /
translated: That, O Agni, is well ordered by thee. We light thee up again.🔽The Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, the Brahman, the Vasu-rule, O Agni, have re-established thee.

original: punar tvā ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ punar brahmā vasu nītiḥ agne / punar tvā brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ ādhāt dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya /
analyzed: punar tvā ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ punar brahmā vasu nītiḥ agne   punar tvā brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ ādhāt dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  /
translated: Brahmanaspati hath re-established thee for life that shall be long, for life of hundred winters.

original: yaḥ agniḥ kravyād praviveśa naḥ gṛham imam paśyan itaram jātavedasam / tam harāmi pitṛ yajñāya dūram sa gharmam indhām parame sadhasthe /
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ kravyād praviveśa naḥ gṛham imam paśyan itaram jātavedasam    tam harāmi pitṛ yajñāya dūram sa gharmam indhām parame sadhasthe  /
translated: The Agni who hath entered as a flesh-eater into our house, behold this other Jâtavedas. Him I remove afar to the Fathers' worship, him to the highest seat with fuel, Gharma.

original: kravya adam agnim pra hiṇomi dūram yama rājñaḥ gacchatu ripra vāhaḥ / iha ayam itaraḥ jātavedāḥ devaḥ devebhyaḥ havyam vahatu prajānan //
analyzed: kravya adam agnim pra hiṇomi dūram yama rājñaḥ gacchatu ripra vāhaḥ   iha ayam itaraḥ jātavedāḥ devaḥ devebhyaḥ havyam vahatu prajānan  /
translated: I send away the flesh-eating Agni: let him go to the King of Death, the bearer of oblations. Here let this other Jâtavedas, the God, bearing oblations to the Gods, be wise.

original: kravya adam agnim iṣitaḥ harāmi janān dṛṃhantam vajreṇa mṛtyum / ni tam śāsmi gārhapatyena vidvān pitṝṇām loke api bhāgaḥ astu /
analyzed: kravya adam agnim iṣitaḥ harāmi janān dṛṃhantam vajreṇa mṛtyum   ni tam śāsmi gārhapatyena vidvān pitṝṇām loke api bhāgaḥ astu  /
translated: I send away the flesh-eating Agni, the mortal, with the bolt, the firming of the people. I, knowing, will instruct him by the Gârhapatya: let him have a share in the Fathers' world.

original: kravya adam agnim śaśamānam ukthyam pra hiṇomi pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ / mā deva yānaiḥ punar ā gāḥ atra eva edhi pitṛṣu jāgṛhi tvam // tvam // tvam // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /
analyzed: kravya adam agnim śaśamānam ukthyam pra hiṇomi pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ   mā deva yānaiḥ punar ā gāḥ atra eva edhi pitṛṣu jāgṛhi tvam tvam tvam
translated: I send away the flesh-eating Agni, the worshipper, the worthy of lauds, by the Fathers' paths. Come not again by the Gods' paths: here be thou, and among the Fathers watch thou over us.

original: sam indhate saṃkasukam svastaye śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ / jahāti ripram ati enaḥ eti samiddhaḥ agniḥ supunā punāti //
analyzed: sam indhate saṃkasukam svastaye śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ   jahāti ripram ati enaḥ eti samiddhaḥ agniḥ supunā punāti  /
translated: They kindle the well-covered fire for welfare, pure, bright, and purifying. When kindled, Agni purifies, and removes the stain, and passes over the sin.

original: devaḥ agniḥ saṃkasukaḥ divaḥ pṛṣṭhāni āruhat / mucyamānaḥ niḥ eṇasaḥ amok asmān aśastyāḥ /
analyzed: devaḥ agniḥ saṃkasukaḥ divaḥ pṛṣṭhāni āruhat   mucyamānaḥ niḥ eṇasaḥ amok asmān aśastyāḥ  /
translated: The divine fire, the well-covered, has ascended the heights of heaven. Freed from the noose, may it free us from misfortune.

original: asmin vayam saṃkasuke agnau riprāṇi mṛjmahe / abhūma yajñiyāḥ śuddhāḥ pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat /
analyzed: asmin vayam saṃkasuke agnau riprāṇi mṛjmahe   abhūma yajñiyāḥ śuddhāḥ pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat  /
translated: In this well-covered fire we cleanse our stains. May we become worthy of sacrifice, pure. May it prolong our lives.

original: saṃkasukaḥ vikasukaḥ nirṛthaḥ yaḥ ca nisvaraḥ / te te yakṣmam savedasaḥ dūrāt dūram anīnaśan //🔽yaḥ naḥ aśveṣu vīreṣu yaḥ naḥ goṣu aja aviṣu / kravya adam niḥ nudāmasi yaḥ agniḥ jana yopanaḥ /
analyzed: saṃkasukaḥ vikasukaḥ nirṛthaḥ yaḥ ca nisvaraḥ   te te yakṣmam savedasaḥ dūrāt dūram anīnaśan  / yaḥ naḥ aśveṣu vīreṣu yaḥ naḥ goṣu aja aviṣu   kravya adam niḥ nudāmasi yaḥ agniḥ jana yopanaḥ  /
translated: The well-covered, the uncovered, the misfortune, and the one who is mute, these, together with their own wealth, have driven away from us far away the consumption.🔽We banish the flesh-eater who is among our horses, our heroes, our cows, our goats and sheep. We banish the fire that destroys the people.

original: anyebhyaḥ tvā puruṣebhyaḥ gobhyaḥ aśvebhyaḥ tvā / niḥ kravya adam nudāmasi yaḥ agniḥ jīvita yopanaḥ /
analyzed: anyebhyaḥ tvā puruṣebhyaḥ gobhyaḥ aśvebhyaḥ tvā    niḥ kravya adam nudāmasi yaḥ agniḥ jīvita yopanaḥ  /
translated: We banish the flesh-eater from other men, from cows, from horses. We banish the fire that destroys life.

original: yasmin devāḥ amṛjata yasmin manuṣyāḥ uta / tasmin ghṛta stāvaḥ mṛṣṭvā tvam agne divam ruha /
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ amṛjata yasmin manuṣyāḥ uta  / tasmin ghṛta stāvaḥ mṛṣṭvā tvam agne divam ruha  /
translated: In whom the gods have cleansed themselves, in whom also men, in him, O Agni, having cleansed myself with ghee, may you ascend to heaven.

original: samiddhaḥ agne āhuta sa naḥ mā abhyapakramīḥ / atra eva dīdihi dyavi jyok ca sūryam dṛśe /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agne āhuta sa naḥ mā abhyapakramīḥ   atra eva dīdihi dyavi jyok ca sūryam dṛśe  /
translated: Enkindled, O Agni, offered to, do not thou go away from us. Shine here only in the sky, and long behold the sun.

original: sīse mṛḍḍhvam naḍe mṛḍḍhvam agnau saṃkasuke ca yat / atha u avyām rāmāyām śīrṣaktim upabarhaṇe //🔽avyām asiknyām mṛṣṭvā śuddhāḥ bhavata yajñiyāḥ // avyām asiknyām mṛṣṭvā śuddhāḥ bhavata yajñiyāḥ // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /🔽param mṛtyo anu parehi panthām yaḥ te eṣaḥ itaraḥ deva yānāt / cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi iha ime vīrāḥ bahavaḥ bhavantu //
analyzed: sīse mṛḍḍhvam naḍe mṛḍḍhvam agnau saṃkasuke ca yat atha u avyām rāmāyām śīrṣaktim upabarhaṇe  avyām asiknyām mṛṣṭvā śuddhāḥ bhavata yajñiyāḥ   avyām asiknyām mṛṣṭvā śuddhāḥ bhavata yajñiyāḥ  param mṛtyo anu parehi panthām yaḥ te eṣaḥ itaraḥ deva yānāt    cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi iha ime vīrāḥ bahavaḥ bhavantu  /
translated: Be gracious to the lead, be gracious to the reed, to the fire, to the Sankusuka, and to the Avya and the Rama, to the head, to the pillow.🔽Having cleansed themselves on the Avya and the Asnikni, they become pure and meet for sacrifice.🔽Go, O Death, along the path that leadeth beyond this world, the path that leadeth to the gods, and is different from that which leadeth to mortals. To thee, O Death, who hast eyes and hearest, I say this: let these many heroes be here.

original: ime jīvāḥ vi mṛtaiḥ āvavṛtran abhūt bhadrā deva hutiḥ naḥ adya / prāñcaḥ agāma nṛtaye hasāya su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema /
analyzed: ime jīvāḥ vi mṛtaiḥ āvavṛtran abhūt bhadrā deva hutiḥ naḥ adya   prāñcaḥ agāma nṛtaye hasāya su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema  /
translated: These living have turned away from the dead. Blessed be the offering to the gods this day. We have gone forward to the dance, to joy. With brave sons let us speak in the assembly.

original: imam jīvebhyaḥ paridhim dadhāmi mā eṣām nu gāt aparaḥ artham etam / śatam jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīḥ tiras mṛtyum dadhatām parvatena /
analyzed: imam jīvebhyaḥ paridhim dadhāmi mā eṣām nu gāt aparaḥ artham etam    śatam jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīḥ tiras mṛtyum dadhatām parvatena  /
translated: I set this limit round about for living things: let not one of them pass over this to harm us. A hundred lengthened autumns may they live, and let them pass beyond Death's realm by Tvashtar's favour.

original: ā rohata āyuḥ jarasam vṛṇānāḥ anupūrvam yatamānāḥ yati stha / tān vaḥ tvaṣṭā su janimā sa joṣāḥ sarvam āyuḥ nayatu jīvanāya /
analyzed: ā rohata āyuḥ jarasam vṛṇānāḥ anupūrvam yatamānāḥ yati stha    tān vaḥ tvaṣṭā su janimā sa joṣāḥ sarvam āyuḥ nayatu jīvanāya  /
translated: Ascend, and, seeking life and lengthened days, strive each to win his proper place and portion. May Tvashtar, easy to be served, accordant, lead you all to life that lasts for ever.

original: yathā ahāni anupūrvam bhavanti yathā rtavaḥ ṛtubhiḥ yanti sākam / yathā na pūrvam aparaḥ jahāti eva dhātar āyūṃṣi kalpaya eṣām /🔽aśmanvatī rīyate sam rabhadhvam vīrayadhvam pra tarata sakhāyaḥ / atrā jahīta ye asan durevāḥ anamīvān ud tarema abhi vājān /
analyzed: yathā ahāni anupūrvam bhavanti yathā rtavaḥ ṛtubhiḥ yanti sākam   yathā na pūrvam aparaḥ jahāti eva dhātar āyūṃṣi kalpaya eṣām  / aśmanvatī rīyate sam rabhadhvam vīrayadhvam pra tarata sakhāyaḥ   atrā jahīta ye asan durevāḥ anamīvān ud tarema abhi vājān  /
translated: As days succeed each other in their order, and seasons with the seasons come together, As one precedes and one follows, O Ordainer, so order their life-terms, O thou who givest life.🔽The stream that flows with stones: be swift to meet it, strive, O my friends, to win the race together. Leave here the men who are malign and wicked: with those who are well-meaning rise to riches.

original: ud tiṣṭhata pra tarata sakhāyaḥ aśmanvatī nadī syandate iyam / atrā jahīta ye asan aśivāḥ śivān syonān ud tarema abhi vājān /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata pra tarata sakhāyaḥ aśmanvatī nadī syandate iyam   atrā jahīta ye asan aśivāḥ śivān syonān ud tarema abhi vājān  /
translated: Rise up, and strive to win the race, my friends. This stream that flows with stones is running hither. Leave here the men who are malign and wicked: with those who are well-meaning rise to riches.

original: vaiśvadevīm varcasā ā rabhadhvam śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ / atikrāmantaḥ duritā padāni śatam himāḥ sarva vīrāḥ madema /
analyzed: vaiśvadevīm varcasā ā rabhadhvam śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ   atikrāmantaḥ duritā padāni śatam himāḥ sarva vīrāḥ madema  /
translated: Take ye the lustre of the All-gods, and be ye pure, bright, and shining, Passing over the steps of sin, and may we, all heroes, live a hundred winters.

original: udīcīnaiḥ pathibhiḥ vāyumadbhiḥ atikrāmantaḥ avarān parebhiḥ / tris sapta kṛtvas ṛṣayaḥ paretāḥ mṛtyum prati auhan pada yopanena /
analyzed: udīcīnaiḥ pathibhiḥ vāyumadbhiḥ atikrāmantaḥ avarān parebhiḥ   tris sapta kṛtvas ṛṣayaḥ paretāḥ mṛtyum prati auhan pada yopanena  /
translated: By paths that lead to heaven, and are filled with wind, passing the lower, and the higher, The Rishis have gone thrice seven times, and have carried death away by the removal of the foot.

analyzed: mṛtyoḥ padam yopayantaḥ eta drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ   āsīnāḥ mṛtyum nudata sadhasthe atha jīvāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema
translated: Removing the foot of death, bestowing a longer life, a wider way, Sitting, drive ye death away from your dwelling-place, and then, alive, let us speak in the assembly.

original: imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā sam spṛśantām / anaśravaḥ anamīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre /
analyzed: imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā sam spṛśantām    anaśravaḥ anamīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre  /
translated: Let these women, widows no more, good wives, touch one another with ointment of clarified butter, Without tears, without sickness, with good treasures, let the women first ascend the bed.

original: vyākaromi haviṣā aham etau tau brahmaṇā vi aham kalpayāmi / svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ ajarām kṛṇomi dīrgheṇa āyuṣā sam imān sṛjāmi //
analyzed: vyākaromi haviṣā aham etau tau brahmaṇā vi aham kalpayāmi    svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ ajarām kṛṇomi dīrgheṇa āyuṣā sam imān sṛjāmi  /
translated: I make these two with sacrificial food, I make them fit for worship with the Brahman. I make the Fathers' portion undecaying, and with long life I join these living mortals.

original: yaḥ naḥ agniḥ pitaraḥ hṛtsu antar āviveśa amṛtaḥ martyeṣu / mayi aham tam pari gṛhṇāmi devam mā saḥ asmān dvikṣata mā vayam tam /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ agniḥ pitaraḥ hṛtsu antar āviveśa amṛtaḥ martyeṣu    mayi aham tam pari gṛhṇāmi devam mā saḥ asmān dvikṣata mā vayam tam  /
translated: The Agni who, immortal, hath entered within the hearts of mortal men, of us the Fathers, I take that God to myself. Let him not hate us, nor be angry with us.

original: apāvṛtya gārhapatyāt kravyādā preta dakṣiṇā / priyam pitṛbhyaḥ ātmane brahmabhyaḥ kṛṇuta priyam /
analyzed: apāvṛtya gārhapatyāt kravyādā preta dakṣiṇā   priyam pitṛbhyaḥ ātmane brahmabhyaḥ kṛṇuta priyam  /
translated: Turning away from the Gārhapatya, the flesh-devouring one, go away to the south. Make it dear to the Fathers, to the soul, to the Brahmans.

original: dvi bhāga dhanam ādāya pra kṣiṇāti avartyā / agniḥ putrasya jyeṣṭhasya yaḥ kravyād a nirāhitaḥ /
analyzed: dvi bhāga dhanam ādāya pra kṣiṇāti avartyā   agniḥ putrasya jyeṣṭhasya yaḥ kravyād a nirāhitaḥ  /
translated: Taking the wealth of the eldest son, he turns away the flesh-devouring one who is not driven away.

original: yat kṛṣate yat vanute yat ca vasnena vindate / sarvam martyasya tat na asti kravyād ced a nirāhitaḥ //
analyzed: yat kṛṣate yat vanute yat ca vasnena vindate     / sarvam martyasya tat na asti kravyād ced a nirāhitaḥ  /
translated: Whatever he ploughs, whatever he reaps, whatever he gains by his own labour, all that is not his if the flesh-devouring one is not driven away.

original: a yajñiyaḥ hata varcāḥ bhavati na enena haviḥ attave / chinatti kṛṣyā goḥ dhanāt yam kravyād anuvartate /
analyzed: a yajñiyaḥ hata varcāḥ bhavati na enena haviḥ attave   chinatti kṛṣyā goḥ dhanāt yam kravyād anuvartate  /
translated: He becomes unfit for sacrifice, his splendour is destroyed, he is not fit to eat the sacrificial food. He cuts off the ploughman from his plough, from his wealth of kine, whom the flesh-devouring one follows.

original: muhur gṛdhyaiḥ pra vadati ārtim martyaḥ nītya / kravya ad yān agniḥ antikāt anuvidvān vitāvati //
analyzed: muhur gṛdhyaiḥ pra vadati ārtim martyaḥ nītya   kravya ad yān agniḥ antikāt anuvidvān vitāvati  /
translated: The mortal man, who often speaks of his distress to the vultures, is led to destruction. Agni, who knows, drives away the flesh-devouring demons from the distance.

original: grāhyāḥ gṛhāḥ sam sṛjyante striyāḥ yat mriyate patiḥ / brahmā eva vidvān eṣyaḥ yaḥ kravya adam nirādadhat //
analyzed: grāhyāḥ gṛhāḥ sam sṛjyante striyāḥ yat mriyate patiḥ   brahmā eva vidvān eṣyaḥ yaḥ kravya adam nirādadhat  /
translated: The houses of the grasping ones are united, when a wife's husband dies. Only a knowing Brahman should be invited, who places the flesh-eater away.

original: āpaḥ mā tasmāt śumbhantu agneḥ saṃkasukāt ca yat / // // mā tasmāt śumbhantu agneḥ saṃkasukāt ca yat //
analyzed: āpaḥ mā tasmāt śumbhantu agneḥ saṃkasukāt ca yat         mā tasmāt śumbhantu agneḥ saṃkasukāt ca yat
translated: May the waters cleanse me from that, from the burning heat of Agni, from that which is here. May the waters cleanse me from that, from the burning heat of Agni, from that which is here.

original: tāḥ adharāt udīcīḥ āvavṛtran prajānaitīḥ pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ / parvatasya vṛṣabhasya adhi pṛṣṭhe navāḥ caranti saritaḥ purāṇīḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ adharāt udīcīḥ āvavṛtran prajānaitīḥ pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ   parvatasya vṛṣabhasya adhi pṛṣṭhe navāḥ caranti saritaḥ purāṇīḥ  /
translated: Those (waters) have turned back from below upwards, the wise ones by the paths which the gods travel. On the back of the mountain, the bull, the new and the ancient rivers flow.

original: agne akravyād niḥ kravyādam nuda devayajanam vaha //
analyzed: agne akravyād niḥ kravyādam nuda devayajanam vaha
translated: O Agni, drive away the flesh-eater, drive out the flesh-eater, carry him to the place of sacrifice.

original: imam kravyād ā viveśa ayam kravyādam anu agāt / vyāghrau kṛtvā nānānam tam harāmi śiva aparam /
analyzed: imam kravyād ā viveśa ayam kravyādam anu agāt   vyāghrau kṛtvā nānānam tam harāmi śiva aparam  /
translated: This flesh-eater has entered this one, this flesh-eater has followed this one. Having made the two tigers different, I carry away the auspicious other one.

original: antardhiḥ devānām paridhiḥ manuṣyāṇām agniḥ gārhapatyaḥ ubhayān antarā śritaḥ //
analyzed: antardhiḥ devānām paridhiḥ manuṣyāṇām agniḥ gārhapatyaḥ ubhayān antarā śritaḥ
translated: The fire of the household is the screen of the gods, the fence of men, placed between both.

original: jīvānām āyuḥ pra tira tvam agne pitṝṇām lokam api gacchantu ye mṛtāḥ / su gārhapatyaḥ vitapan arātim uṣām uṣām śreyasīm dhehi asmai /
analyzed: jīvānām āyuḥ pra tira tvam agne pitṝṇām lokam api gacchantu ye mṛtāḥ    su gārhapatyaḥ vitapan arātim uṣām uṣām śreyasīm dhehi asmai  /
translated: Thou, O Agni, givest life to living creatures: let those who are dead go to the Fathers' region. Easy to tend, driving away misfortune, give him each morning that is better than the last.

original: sarvān agne sahamānaḥ sapatnān aiṣām ūrjam rayim asmāsu dhehi //
analyzed: sarvān agne sahamānaḥ sapatnān ā eṣām ūrjam rayim asmāsu dhehi
translated: O Agni, overcoming all their enemies, bestow upon us their strength and wealth.

original: imam indram vahnim paprim anvārabhadhvam sa vaḥ niḥ vakṣat duritāt avadyāt / tena apa hata śarum āpatantam tena rudrasya pari pāta āstām /
analyzed: imam indram vahnim paprim anvārabhadhvam sa vaḥ niḥ vakṣat duritāt avadyāt    tena apa hata śarum āpatantam tena rudrasya pari pāta āstām  /
translated: Take hold of this Indra, this Agni, this bearer, he shall lead you out from misfortune and disgrace. With him drive ye away the dart that flieth: with him be ye protected from Rudra's side.

original: anaḍvāham plavam anvārabhadhvam sa vaḥ niḥ vakṣat duritāt avadyāt / ā rohata savituḥ nāvam etām ṣaḍbhiḥ urvībhiḥ amatim tarema /
analyzed: anaḍvāham plavam anvārabhadhvam sa vaḥ niḥ vakṣat duritāt avadyāt   ā rohata savituḥ nāvam etām ṣaḍbhiḥ urvībhiḥ amatim tarema  /
translated: Take hold of the raft, the ox, the bearer: he shall lead you out from misfortune and disgrace. Climb ye into this ship of Savitar: with six broad courses let us pass across distress.

original: ahar rātre anu eṣi bibhrat kṣemyaḥ tiṣṭhan prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ / an āturān sumanasaḥ talpa bibhrat jyok eva naḥ puruṣa gandhiḥ edhi //
analyzed: ahar rātre anu eṣi bibhrat kṣemyaḥ tiṣṭhan prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ   an āturān sumanasaḥ talpa bibhrat jyok eva naḥ puruṣa gandhiḥ edhi  /
translated: Bearing the day and night, standing secure, a good deliverer, with brave men, bearing those who are not sick and cheerful, long-lived, O thou that hast the smell of man, be thou to us.

original: te devebhyaḥ ā vṛścante pāpam jīvanti sarvadā / kravya ad yān agniḥ antikāt aśvaḥ iva anuvapate naḍam / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: te devebhyaḥ ā vṛścante pāpam jīvanti sarvadā   kravya ad yān agniḥ antikāt aśvaḥ iva anuvapate naḍam
translated: They tear themselves away from the Gods, and always live a sinful life. The flesh-devouring one, whom Agni, like a horse, unyoketh from the stake,🔽Those who are faithless, greedy for wealth, and feed on raw flesh,

original: ye aśraddhā dhana kāmyā kravyādā samāsate / te vai anyeṣām kumbhīm paryādadhati sarvadā /
analyzed: ye aśraddhā dhana kāmyā kravyādā samāsate    te vai anyeṣām kumbhīm paryādadhati sarvadā
translated: They always set the pot of others to boil for themselves.

original: pra iva pipatiṣati manasā muhur ā vartate punar / kravya ad yān agniḥ antikāt anuvidvān vitāvati //
analyzed: pra iva pipatiṣati manasā muhur ā vartate punar   kravya ad yān agniḥ antikāt anuvidvān vitāvati  /
translated: He falls as it were, and often turns back in his mind. The flesh-devouring one, whom Agni, the all-knowing one, hath unyoked from the stake,

original: aviḥ kṛṣṇā bhāgadheyam paśūnām sīsam kravyād api candram te āhuḥ / māṣāḥ piṣṭāḥ bhāgadheyam te havyam araṇyānyāḥ gahvaram sacasva /
analyzed: aviḥ kṛṣṇā bhāgadheyam paśūnām sīsam kravyād api candram te āhuḥ   māṣāḥ piṣṭāḥ bhāgadheyam te havyam araṇyānyāḥ gahvaram sacasva  /
translated: The black ewe is the share of the cattle, lead is the share of the flesh-devouring one, and tin is thy share, they say. The ground beans are thy share, the oblation. Dwell in the deep forest of the wild fig tree.🔽Having offered the old reed, the sesame cake, the stick, the stake,

original: iṣīkām jaratīm iṣṭvā tilpiñjam daṇḍanam naḍam / tam indraḥ idhmam kṛtvā yamasya agnim nirādadhau //
analyzed: iṣīkām jaratīm iṣṭvā tilpiñjam daṇḍanam naḍam    tam indraḥ idhmam kṛtvā yamasya agnim nirādadhau  /
translated: Indra having made that a kindling-stick, set down Yama's fire.

original: pratyañcam arkam pratyarpayitvā pravidvān panthām vi hi āviveśa / parā amīṣām asūn dideśa dīrgheṇa āyuṣā sam imān sṛjāmi // //
analyzed: pratyañcam arkam pratyarpayitvā pravidvān panthām vi hi āviveśa   parā amīṣām asūn dideśa dīrgheṇa āyuṣā sam imān sṛjāmi
translated: Having turned the sun around to meet us, having found the path, he hath entered it. I send away the lives of these (men). I bind these (men) with long life.

original: pumān puṃsaḥ adhi tiṣṭha carma ihi tatra hvayasva yatamā priyā te / yāvantau agre prathamam sameyathuḥ tat vām vayaḥ yama rājye samānam /
analyzed: pumān puṃsaḥ adhi tiṣṭha carma ihi tatra hvayasva yatamā priyā te   yāvantau agre prathamam sameyathuḥ tat vām vayaḥ yama rājye samānam  /
translated: Go to the skin of the male, sit on the skin of the male. There call to thee those who are dear to thee. As many as thou hast first met together, that is your common age in Yama's kingdom.

original: tāvat vām cakṣuḥ tati vīryāṇi tāvat tejaḥ tatidhā vājināni / agniḥ śarīram sacate yadā edhaḥ adha pakvāt mithunā sam bhavāthaḥ //
analyzed: tāvat vām cakṣuḥ tati vīryāṇi tāvat tejaḥ tatidhā vājināni    agniḥ śarīram sacate yadā edhaḥ adha pakvāt mithunā sam bhavāthaḥ  /
translated: So much is your eye, so much your strength, so much your splendour, so much your vigour. When the body of Agni is kindled, then from the cooked (food) you are born together as a pair.

original: sam asmin loke sam u deva yāne sam smā sametam yama rājyeṣu / pūtau pavitraiḥ upa tat dhvayethām yat yat retaḥ adhi vām saṃbabhūva //
analyzed: sam asmin loke sam u deva yāne sam smā sametam yama rājyeṣu   pūtau pavitraiḥ upa tat dhvayethām yat yat retaḥ adhi vām saṃbabhūva  /
translated: Together in this world, together on the path of the gods, together have you met in Yama's kingdom. Purified by the purifiers, you should enjoy that which you have obtained. Whatever seed has come together in you,

original: āpaḥ putrāsaḥ abhi sam viśadhvam imam jīvam jīva dhanyāḥ sametya / tāsām bhajadhvam amṛtam yam āhuḥ odanam pacati vām janitrī /
analyzed: āpaḥ putrāsaḥ abhi sam viśadhvam imam jīvam jīva dhanyāḥ sametya    tāsām bhajadhvam amṛtam yam āhuḥ odanam pacati vām janitrī  /
translated: O waters, sons, come together to this living one, to this living one, endowed with wealth. Having come together, enjoy that which they call the immortal, the food which your mother cooks for you.

original: yam vām pitā pacati yam ca mātā riprāt nirmuktyai śamalāt ca vācaḥ / saḥ odanaḥ śata dhāraḥ svargaḥ ubhe vi āpa nabhasī mahitvā /
analyzed: yam vām pitā pacati yam ca mātā riprāt nirmuktyai śamalāt ca vācaḥ    saḥ odanaḥ śata dhāraḥ svargaḥ ubhe vi āpa nabhasī mahitvā  /
translated: That food, O heaven and earth, is blessed with a hundred streams. With your great power you have filled both the regions of the sky.🔽Both the regions of the sky, and both the worlds which are the heavenly abodes of those who sacrifice and conquer,

original: ubhe nabhasī ubhayān ca lokān ye yajvanām abhijitāḥ svargāḥ / teṣām jyotiṣmān madhumān yaḥ agre tasmin putraiḥ jarasi sam śrayethām //
analyzed: ubhe nabhasī ubhayān ca lokān ye yajvanām abhijitāḥ svargāḥ   teṣām jyotiṣmān madhumān yaḥ agre tasmin putraiḥ jarasi sam śrayethām  /
translated: In the most radiant and most sweet of these, O son, may you and your wife take refuge in your old age.🔽You must reach the eastern quarter, you must reach it, and those who have faith in it will follow you.

original: prācīm prācīm pradiśam ā rabhethām etam lokam śraddadhānāḥ sacante / yat vām pakvam pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye daṃpatī sam śrayethām /🔽dakṣiṇām diśam abhi nakṣamāṇau paryāvartethām abhi pātram etat / tasmin vām yamaḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ pakvāya śarma bahulam ni yacchāt /
analyzed: prācīm prācīm pradiśam ā rabhethām etam lokam śraddadhānāḥ sacante    yat vām pakvam pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye daṃpatī sam śrayethām  / dakṣiṇām diśam abhi nakṣamāṇau paryāvartethām abhi pātram etat    tasmin vām yamaḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ pakvāya śarma bahulam ni yacchāt  /
translated: For the sake of the protection of that food of yours which is cooked in the fire, you must take refuge together, you husband and wife.🔽You must turn to the southern quarter, you must turn to it, and this vessel must turn to it.🔽In it may Yama, in agreement with the Fathers, bestow on you a dwelling full of bliss, when it is cooked.🔽This is the western quarter, the best of all the quarters, in which Soma is the lord and the kind one.

original: pratīcī diśām iyam id varam yasyām somaḥ adhipāḥ mṛḍitā ca / tasyām śrayethām su kṛtaḥ sacethām adhā pakvāt mithunā sam bhavāthaḥ //
analyzed: pratīcī diśām iyam id varam yasyām somaḥ adhipāḥ mṛḍitā ca    tasyām śrayethām su kṛtaḥ sacethām adhā pakvāt mithunā sam bhavāthaḥ  /
translated: In it you must take refuge, you who have done good deeds, and there you must be united. From the cooked food you must be born again as a pair.

original: uttaram rāṣṭram prajaya uttarāvat diśām udīcī kṛṇavat naḥ agram / pāṅktam chandaḥ puruṣaḥ babhūva viśvaiḥ viśva aṅgaiḥ saha sam bhavema // pāṅktam chandaḥ puruṣaḥ babhūva viśvaiḥ viśva aṅgaiḥ saha sam bhavema // pāṅktam chandaḥ puruṣaḥ babhūva viśvaiḥ viśva aṅgaiḥ saha sam bhavema // pāṅktam chandaḥ puruṣaḥ babhūva viśvaiḥ viśva aṅgaiḥ saha sam bhavema // pāṅktam chandaḥ puruṣaḥ babhūva viśvaiḥ viśva🔽dhruvā iyam virāj namaḥ astu asyai śivā putrebhyaḥ uta mahyam astu / sā naḥ devī adite viśva vāraḥ iryaḥ iva gopāḥ abhi rakṣa pakvam /
