original: yat yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ā iha gatvā tsaran viṣaktam bile āsasāda / yat vā dāsī ārdra hastā samaṅkte ulūkhalam musalam śumbhata apaḥ /
analyzed: yat yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ā iha gatvā tsaran viṣaktam bile āsasāda   yat vā dāsī ārdra hastā samaṅkte ulūkhalam musalam śumbhata apaḥ  /
translated: Or whatever the slave, with wet hands, hath anointed, the mortar and the pestle, purify the waters.🔽This stone, wide-based, giving life, purified by the strainers, drive away the Rakshas.

original: ayam grāvā pṛthu budhnaḥ vayodhāḥ pūtaḥ pavitraiḥ apa hantu rakṣaḥ / ā roha carma mahi śarma yaccha mā daṃpatī pautram agham ni gātām /
analyzed: ayam grāvā pṛthu budhnaḥ vayodhāḥ pūtaḥ pavitraiḥ apa hantu rakṣaḥ    ā roha carma mahi śarma yaccha mā daṃpatī pautram agham ni gātām  /
translated: Mount the skin, give great protection. Let not the pair, the husband and wife, go to the son's sin.🔽The tree hath come to us with the Gods, driving away the Rakshas and the Pisakas.

original: vanaspatiḥ saha devaiḥ naḥ āgan rakṣaḥ piśācām apabādhamānaḥ / saḥ ud śrayātai pra vadāti vācam tena lokām abhi sarvān jayema /
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ saha devaiḥ naḥ āgan rakṣaḥ piśācām apabādhamānaḥ   saḥ ud śrayātai pra vadāti vācam tena lokām abhi sarvān jayema  /
translated: Let him rise up and utter speech. By him may we conquer all the worlds.🔽The cattle have taken to themselves seven kinds of wisdom, he who is the brightest among them, and he who hath made them.

original: sapta medhān paśavaḥ pari agṛhṇan yaḥ eṣām jyotiṣmān uta yaḥ cakarśa / trayastriṃśat devatāḥ tān sacante sa naḥ svargam abhi neṣa lokam /
analyzed: sapta medhān paśavaḥ pari agṛhṇan yaḥ eṣām jyotiṣmān uta yaḥ cakarśa   trayastriṃśat devatāḥ tān sacante sa naḥ svargam abhi neṣa lokam  /
translated: The thirty-three Gods attend on them. He shall lead us to the world of heaven.

original: svargam lokam abhi naḥ nayāsi sam jāyayā saha putraiḥ syāma / gṛhṇāmi hastam anu mā aitu atra mā naḥ tārīt nirṛtiḥ mā u arātiḥ /
analyzed: svargam lokam abhi naḥ nayāsi sam jāyayā saha putraiḥ syāma  / gṛhṇāmi hastam anu mā aitu atra mā naḥ tārīt nirṛtiḥ mā u arātiḥ  /
translated: Thou leadest us to the world of heaven. With our offspring and our children may we be united. I take thy hand. Follow me hither. Let not Nirrti nor Arati forsake us.

original: grāhim pāpmānam ati tām ayāma tamaḥ vi asya pra vadāsi valgu / vānaspatyaḥ udyataḥ mā jihiṃsīḥ mā taṇḍulam vi śarīḥ devayantam /🔽viśva vyacāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ bhaviṣyan sayoniḥ lokam upa yāhi etam / varṣa vṛddham upa yaccha śūrpam tuṣam palāvān apa tat vinaktu /
analyzed: grāhim pāpmānam ati tām ayāma tamaḥ vi asya pra vadāsi valgu   vānaspatyaḥ udyataḥ mā jihiṃsīḥ mā taṇḍulam vi śarīḥ devayantam  / viśva vyacāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ bhaviṣyan sayoniḥ lokam upa yāhi etam    varṣa vṛddham upa yaccha śūrpam tuṣam palāvān apa tat vinaktu  /
translated: We have passed over the grasping evil spirit, and thou, O winnowing basket, dost drive away its darkness. Do not injure the god-adoring rice, O product of the forest, when thou art raised up. Do not crush the rice-grain.🔽Becoming all-pervading, with ghee as thy back, approach this world as thy proper place. Approach the winnowing basket, increased by the rain. Let it remove the chaff and the husks.

original: trayaḥ lokāḥ saṃmitāḥ brāhmaṇena dyauḥ eva asau pṛthivī antarikṣam / aṃśūn gṛbhītvā anvārabhethām ā pyāyantām punar ā yantu śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam // śūrpam //
analyzed: trayaḥ lokāḥ saṃmitāḥ brāhmaṇena dyauḥ eva asau pṛthivī antarikṣam    aṃśūn gṛbhītvā anvārabhethām ā pyāyantām punar ā yantu śūrpam
translated: The three worlds are measured by the Brāhmaṇa: this is the heaven, this the earth, and this the atmosphere. Having seized the fibres, you should touch them. Let them swell again and return to the winnowing basket.

original: pṛthak rūpāṇi bahudhā paśūnām eka rūpaḥ bhavasi sam samṛddhyā / etām tvacam lohinīm tām nudasva grāvā śumbhāti malagaḥ iva vastrā /
analyzed: pṛthak rūpāṇi bahudhā paśūnām eka rūpaḥ bhavasi sam samṛddhyā    etām tvacam lohinīm tām nudasva grāvā śumbhāti malagaḥ iva vastrā  /
translated: Thou art of many forms, in many places, in the cattle's form. Thou art one form in prosperity. Drive thou away this bloody skin. The stone polishes it like a garment.

original: pṛthivīm tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi tanūḥ samānī vikṛtā te eṣā / yat yat dyuttam likhitam arpaṇena tena mā susroḥ brahmaṇā api tat vapāmi //
analyzed: pṛthivīm tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi tanūḥ samānī vikṛtā te eṣā    yat yat dyuttam likhitam arpaṇena tena mā susroḥ brahmaṇā api tat vapāmi  /
translated: I place thee on the earth, on earth, thy body is the same, but changed in form. Whatever is lost, whatever is marked, whatever is taken away, by that I cut off thy hair with the hair-cutter's prayer.

original: janitrī iva prati haryā asi sūnum sam tvā dadhāmi pṛthivīm pṛthivyā / ukhā kumbhī vedyām mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ yajñāyudhaiḥ ājyena atiṣaktā /
analyzed: janitrī iva prati haryā asi sūnum sam tvā dadhāmi pṛthivīm pṛthivyā    ukhā kumbhī vedyām mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ yajñāyudhaiḥ ājyena atiṣaktā  /
translated: Like a mother thou receivest thy son. I unite thee with the earth, with earth. Be not disquieted in the pan, in the cauldron, in the altar, with the sacrificial implements, with the butter.

original: agniḥ pacan rakṣatu tvā purastāt indraḥ rakṣatu dakṣiṇatas marutvān / varuṇaḥ tvā dṛṃhāt dharuṇe pratīcyāḥ uttarāt tvā somaḥ sam dadātai /
analyzed: agniḥ pacan rakṣatu tvā purastāt indraḥ rakṣatu dakṣiṇatas marutvān   varuṇaḥ tvā dṛṃhāt dharuṇe pratīcyāḥ uttarāt tvā somaḥ sam dadātai  /
translated: Let Agni, the cook, protect thee in the east, let Indra, with the Maruts, protect thee in the south. Let Varuna strengthen thee in the west, let Soma give thee up to the north.

original: pūtāḥ pavitraiḥ pavante abhrāt divam ca yanti pṛthivīm ca lokān / tāḥ jīvalāḥ jīva dhanyāḥ pratiṣṭhāḥ pātre āsiktāḥ pari agniḥ indhām /
analyzed: pūtāḥ pavitraiḥ pavante abhrāt divam ca yanti pṛthivīm ca lokān   tāḥ jīvalāḥ jīva dhanyāḥ pratiṣṭhāḥ pātre āsiktāḥ pari agniḥ indhām  /
translated: The pure ones are purified by the strainers, and go to the sky and to the world of earth. They, the living, the life-bestowing, the foundations, sprinkled in the vessel, are surrounded by the fire.

original: ā yanti divaḥ pṛthivīm sacante bhūmyāḥ sacante adhi antarikṣam / śuddhāḥ satīḥ tāḥ u śumbhantaḥ eva tāḥ naḥ svargam abhi lokam nayantu //🔽uta iva prabhvīḥ uta saṃmitāsaḥ uta śukrāḥ śucayaḥ ca amṛtāsaḥ / tāḥ odanam daṃpatibhyām praśiṣṭāḥ āpaḥ śikṣantīḥ pacata sunāthāḥ //
analyzed: ā yanti divaḥ pṛthivīm sacante bhūmyāḥ sacante adhi antarikṣam   śuddhāḥ satīḥ tāḥ u śumbhantaḥ eva tāḥ naḥ svargam abhi lokam nayantu  / uta iva prabhvīḥ uta saṃmitāsaḥ uta śukrāḥ śucayaḥ ca amṛtāsaḥ   tāḥ odanam daṃpatibhyām praśiṣṭāḥ āpaḥ śikṣantīḥ pacata sunāthāḥ  /
translated: They come from heaven, they follow earth, they follow after what is on the earth, and what is in the air. Pure as they are, they make themselves beautiful. May they lead us to the world of heaven.🔽The powerful, the equal, the bright, the pure, and the immortal,🔽The waters, commanded by the husband and wife, are boiling the rice, well-guarded, as they learn.

original: saṃkhyātāḥ stokāḥ pṛthivīm sacante prāṇa apānaiḥ saṃmitāḥ oṣadhībhiḥ / asaṃkhyātāḥ opyamānāḥ suvarṇāḥ sarvam vyāpuḥ śucayaḥ śuci tvam /
analyzed: saṃkhyātāḥ stokāḥ pṛthivīm sacante prāṇa apānaiḥ saṃmitāḥ oṣadhībhiḥ   asaṃkhyātāḥ opyamānāḥ suvarṇāḥ sarvam vyāpuḥ śucayaḥ śuci tvam  /
translated: The measured drops follow the earth, equal to the in-breath and out-breath, to the plants. The unmeasured, poured out, of good color, the pure, have filled all with purity.

original: ud yodhanti abhi valganti taptāḥ phenam asyanti bahulān ca bindūn / yoṣā iva dṛṣṭvā patim ṛtviyāya etaiḥ taṇḍulaiḥ bhavata sam āpaḥ /
analyzed: ud yodhanti abhi valganti taptāḥ phenam asyanti bahulān ca bindūn   yoṣā iva dṛṣṭvā patim ṛtviyāya etaiḥ taṇḍulaiḥ bhavata sam āpaḥ  /
translated: They boil, they leap up, they foam, they send forth many drops. Like a woman looking at her husband for the season, so do the waters become with these grains.

original: ud thāpaya sīdataḥ budhne enān adbhiḥ ātmānam abhi sam spṛśantām / amāsi pātraiḥ udakam yat etat mitāḥ taṇḍulāḥ pradiśaḥ yadi imāḥ // //
analyzed: ud thāpaya sīdataḥ budhne enān adbhiḥ ātmānam abhi sam spṛśantām   amāsi pātraiḥ udakam yat etat mitāḥ taṇḍulāḥ pradiśaḥ yadi imāḥ
translated: Lift them up, O cauldron, from the bottom, let them touch themselves with the water. The water which is in the vessel, the measured grains, and these quarters.

original: pra yaccha parśum tvarayā harausam a hiṃsantaḥ oṣadhīḥ dāntu parvan / vāsām somaḥ pari rājyam babhūva amanyutā naḥ vīrudhaḥ bhavantu /
analyzed: pra yaccha parśum tvarayā harausam a hiṃsantaḥ oṣadhīḥ dāntu parvan   vāsām somaḥ pari rājyam babhūva amanyutā naḥ vīrudhaḥ bhavantu  /
translated: Throw down thy axe, O Harisu, quickly, and let the corn be harmless to the plants. Soma hath taken to himself the sovereignty. Let the plants be kind to us.

original: navam barhiḥ odanāya stṛṇīta priyam hṛdaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ valgu astu / tasmin devāḥ saha daivīḥ viśantu imam prāśnantu ṛtubhiḥ niṣadya //
analyzed: navam barhiḥ odanāya stṛṇīta priyam hṛdaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ valgu astu   tasmin devāḥ saha daivīḥ viśantu imam prāśnantu ṛtubhiḥ niṣadya  /
translated: For the boiled mess strew fresh grass: let it be dear to the heart, to the eye, and pleasant. Let the Gods and the heavenly hosts enter it. Let them sit down and eat it in due season.

original: vanaspate stīrṇam ā sīda barhiḥ agniṣṭobhaiḥ saṃmitaḥ devatābhiḥ / tvaṣṭrā iva rūpam su kṛtam svadhityā enāḥ ā ihāḥ pari pātre dadṛśrām //
analyzed: vanaspate stīrṇam ā sīda barhiḥ agniṣṭobhaiḥ saṃmitaḥ devatābhiḥ   tvaṣṭrā iva rūpam su kṛtam svadhityā enāḥ ā ihāḥ pari pātre dadṛśrām  /
translated: O Tree, sit on the strewn grass, measured by the Agnistoma, with the deities. As Tvashtar with his axe hath fashioned a well-made form, so may we see it here in the dish.

original: ṣaṣṭyām śaratsu nidhi pāḥ abhīchāt svar pakvena abhi aśnavātai / upa enam jīvān pitaraḥ ca putrāḥ etam svargam gamaya antam agneḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭyām śaratsu nidhi pāḥ abhīchāt svar pakvena abhi aśnavātai    upa enam jīvān pitaraḥ ca putrāḥ etam svargam gamaya antam agneḥ  /
translated: For sixty autumns let the guardians of the treasure look on it. Let them enjoy it with the well-cooked heaven. Let the living fathers and the sons raise it up. Send this man to the world of heaven, O Agni.

original: dhartā dhriyasva dharuṇe pṛthivyāḥ acyutam tvā devatāḥ cyāvayantu / tam tvā daṃpatī jīvantau jīva putrau ud vāsayātaḥ pari agnidhānāt /
analyzed: dhartā dhriyasva dharuṇe pṛthivyāḥ acyutam tvā devatāḥ cyāvayantu   tam tvā daṃpatī jīvantau jīva putrau ud vāsayātaḥ pari agnidhānāt  /
translated: Stand firm, O supporter, on the earth's foundation. Let the deities move thee not, O steadfast one. Let the living pair, the parents, and the living son raise thee up from the place where the fire is kept.

original: sarvān samāgāḥ abhijitya lokān yāvantaḥ kāmāḥ sam atītṛpaḥ tān / vi gāhethām āyavanam ca darviḥ ekasmin pātre adhi ud hara enam /
analyzed: sarvān samāgāḥ abhijitya lokān yāvantaḥ kāmāḥ sam atītṛpaḥ tān    vi gāhethām āyavanam ca darviḥ ekasmin pātre adhi ud hara enam  /
translated: the ladle and the winnowing basket, enter the house. Pour this (oblation) into the one vessel.🔽Spread it out, extend it in front, sprinkle this vessel with ghee.

original: upa stṛṇīhi prathaya purastāt ghṛtena pātram abhi ghāraya etat / vāśrā iva usrā taruṇam stanasyum imam devāsaḥ abhihiṅkṛṇota /
analyzed: upa stṛṇīhi prathaya purastāt ghṛtena pātram abhi ghāraya etat   vāśrā iva usrā taruṇam stanasyum imam devāsaḥ abhihiṅkṛṇota  /
translated: Like two milch-cows the two press the young one of the udder. To him, O gods, give the cry of Hail!🔽Thou hast spread out, thou hast made this world. Let heaven be extended, wide, and infinite.

original: upa astarīḥ akaraḥ lokam etam uruḥ prathatām asamaḥ svargaḥ / tasmim chrayātai mahiṣaḥ suparṇaḥ devāḥ enam devatābhyaḥ pra yacchān //
analyzed: upa astarīḥ akaraḥ lokam etam uruḥ prathatām asamaḥ svargaḥ   tasmim chrayātai mahiṣaḥ suparṇaḥ devāḥ enam devatābhyaḥ pra yacchān  /
translated: On that let the bull, the bird, settle. Let the gods deliver him to the deities.🔽Whatever the wife cooks, you two, one after another, or the husband, one after another, over you.

original: yat yat jāyā pacati tvat paraḥ paraḥ patiḥ vā jāye tvat tiras / sam tat sṛjethām saha vām tat astu saṃpādayantau saha lokam ekam /
analyzed: yat yat jāyā pacati tvat paras paras patiḥ vā jāye tvat tiras    sam tat sṛjethām saha vām tat astu saṃpādayantau saha lokam ekam  /
translated: Bring that together. Let that be yours. Making that complete, you two attain one world together.

original: yāvantaḥ asyāḥ pṛthivīm sacante asmat putrāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ / sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān // sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān // sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān // sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān // sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān // sarvān tām upa
analyzed: yāvantaḥ asyāḥ pṛthivīm sacante asmat putrāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ  / sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān    sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān     sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān        / sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān        /
translated: All of them thou must summon to the vessel, the children coming together, knowing the navel.🔽All of them thou must summon to the vessel, the children coming together, knowing the navel.🔽The streams of Vasu, filled with honey and mingled with ghee, the navel of immortality,

original: vasoḥ yāḥ dhārāḥ madhunā prapīnāḥ ghṛtena miśrāḥ amṛtasya nābhayaḥ / sarvāḥ tāḥ ava rundhe svargaḥ ṣaṣṭyām śaratsu nidhi pāḥ abhīchāt /
analyzed: vasoḥ yāḥ dhārāḥ madhunā prapīnāḥ ghṛtena miśrāḥ amṛtasya nābhayaḥ    sarvāḥ tāḥ ava rundhe svargaḥ ṣaṣṭyām śaratsu nidhi pāḥ abhīchāt  /
translated: All of them he stops up. The guardian of the treasure longs for the treasure in sixty autumns in heaven.🔽The guardian of the treasure longs for the treasure. Let those who are other than us be powerless on every side.

original: nidhim nidhi pāḥ abhi enam ichāt anīśvarāḥ abhitas santu ye anye / asmābhiḥ dattaḥ nihitaḥ svargaḥ tribhiḥ kāṇḍaiḥ trīn svargān arukṣat /
analyzed: nidhim nidhi pāḥ abhi enam ichāt anīśvarāḥ abhitas santu ye anye    asmābhiḥ dattaḥ nihitaḥ svargaḥ tribhiḥ kāṇḍaiḥ trīn svargān arukṣat  /
translated: The heaven given by us is placed. With three sections he has ascended three heavens.

original: agniḥ rakṣaḥ tapatu yat videvam kravyād piśācaḥ iha mā pra pāsta / nudāmaḥ enam apa rudhmaḥ asmat ādityāḥ enam aṅgirasaḥ sacantām /
analyzed: agniḥ rakṣaḥ tapatu yat videvam kravyād piśācaḥ iha mā pra pāsta   nudāmaḥ enam apa rudhmaḥ asmat ādityāḥ enam aṅgirasaḥ sacantām  /
translated: Let Agni burn the Rakshas that knoweth not, let the flesh-eating Pisacha not approach me here. We drive him off, we thrust him from us. Let the Âdityas and the Angirasas be with us.

original: ādityebhyaḥ aṅgirobhyaḥ madhu idam ghṛtena miśram prati vedayāmi / śuddha hastau brāhmaṇasya a nihatya etam svargam su kṛtau a pītam /
analyzed: ādityebhyaḥ aṅgirobhyaḥ madhu idam ghṛtena miśram prati vedayāmi    śuddha hastau brāhmaṇasya a nihatya etam svargam su kṛtau a pītam  /
translated: To the Âdityas and the Angiras I offer this honey mixed with ghee. With unpolluted hands, O Brâhmana, having slain him, drink ye this draught of heaven, ye righteous ones.

original: idam prāpam uttamam kāṇḍam asya yasmāt lokāt parameṣṭhī samāpa / ā siñca sarpiḥ ghṛtavat sam aṅgdhi eṣa bhāgaḥ aṅgirasaḥ naḥ atra /
analyzed: idam prāpam uttamam kāṇḍam asya yasmāt lokāt parameṣṭhī samāpa   ā siñca sarpiḥ ghṛtavat sam aṅgdhi eṣa bhāgaḥ aṅgirasaḥ naḥ atra  /
translated: This is the highest part of him, the part from which the Supreme Lord came. Pour out the ghee, make it flow like oil. This is the portion of the Angirases here.

original: satyāya ca tapase devatābhyaḥ nidhim śevadhim pari dadmaḥ etam / mā naḥ dyūte ava gāt mā samityām mā sma anyasmai ud sṛjata purā mat /
analyzed: satyāya ca tapase devatābhyaḥ nidhim śevadhim pari dadmaḥ etam    mā naḥ dyūte ava gāt mā samityām mā sma anyasmai ud sṛjata purā mat  /
translated: To Truth, to Austerity, to the Gods, we give this treasure, this good thing. Let it not fail us in the gambling match, nor in the assembly. Give it not to any one else before me.

original: aham pacāmi aham dadāmi mama id u karman karuṇe adhi jāyā / kaumāraḥ lokaḥ ajaniṣṭa putraḥ anvārabhethām vayaḥ uttarāvat /
analyzed: aham pacāmi aham dadāmi mama id u karman karuṇe adhi jāyā   kaumāraḥ lokaḥ ajaniṣṭa putraḥ anvārabhethām vayaḥ uttarāvat  /
translated: I cook, I give. In my work, O Karuṇa, is my wife. The son of the youthful world was born. Ye shall take hold of life, as it is better for you.

original: na kilbiṣam atra na ādhāraḥ asti na yat mitraiḥ samamamānaḥ eti / anūnam pātram nihitam naḥ etat paktāram pakvaḥ punar ā viśāti /
analyzed: na kilbiṣam atra na ādhāraḥ asti na yat mitraiḥ samamamānaḥ eti   anūnam pātram nihitam naḥ etat paktāram pakvaḥ punar ā viśāti  /
translated: Here is no sin, no place for sin to rest, where no unfriendly rivalry with friends is known. This vessel of ours is not incomplete: the cooked food enters again the cook.

original: priyam priyāṇām kṛṇavāma tamaḥ te yantu yatame dviṣanti / dhenuḥ anaḍvān vayaḥ vayaḥ āyat eva pauruṣeyam apa mṛtyum nudantu /
analyzed: priyam priyāṇām kṛṇavāma tamaḥ te yantu yatame dviṣanti   dhenuḥ anaḍvān vayaḥ vayaḥ āyat eva pauruṣeyam apa mṛtyum nudantu  /
translated: Let us make thee dearer than the dearest: let them go to the place where they hate. The cow, the bull, the bird, the bird have come: let them drive away the mortal foe of man.

original: sam agnayaḥ viduḥ anyaḥ anyam yaḥ oṣadhīḥ sacate yaḥ ca sindhūn / yāvantaḥ devāḥ divi ātapanti hiraṇyam jyotiḥ pacataḥ babhūva / yāvantaḥ devāḥ divi ātapanti hiraṇyam jyotiḥ pacataḥ babhūva // // tapanti hiraṇyam jyotiḥ pacataḥ babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti babhūva // // tapanti ba
analyzed: sam agnayaḥ viduḥ anyaḥ anyam yaḥ oṣadhīḥ sacate yaḥ ca sindhūn   yāvantaḥ devāḥ divi ātapanti hiraṇyam jyotiḥ pacataḥ babhūva    yāvantaḥ devāḥ divi ātapanti hiraṇyam jyotiḥ pacataḥ babhūva       tapanti hiraṇyam jyotiḥ pacataḥ babhūva
translated: The fires know one another, each one that dwells with the plants and each one that dwells with the streams. As many gods as there are that shine in the sky, gold has become the light that cooks them. As many gods as there are that shine in the sky, gold has become the light that cooks them.

original: eṣā tvacām puruṣe sam babhūva anagnāḥ sarve paśavaḥ ye anye / kṣatreṇa ātmānam pari dhāpayāthaḥ amotam vāsaḥ mukham odanasya /
analyzed: eṣā tvacām puruṣe sam babhūva anagnāḥ sarve paśavaḥ ye anye   kṣatreṇa ātmānam pari dhāpayāthaḥ amotam vāsaḥ mukham odanasya  /
translated: This was the skin of the man who was the first-born of all. All other animals are unclothed. With the Kshatra ye have clothed your bodies. The garment that is unworn is the face of the cake.

original: yat akṣeṣu vadāḥ yat samityām yat vā vadāḥ anṛtam vitta kāmyā / samānam tantum abhi samvasānau tasmin sarvam śamalam sādayāthaḥ /🔽varṣam vanuṣva api gaccha devān tvacaḥ dhūmam pari ud pātayāsi / viśva vyacāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ bhaviṣyan sa yoniḥ lokam upa yāhi etam /
analyzed: yat akṣeṣu vadāḥ yat samityām yat vā vadāḥ anṛtam vitta kāmyā    samānam tantum abhi samvasānau tasmin sarvam śamalam sādayāthaḥ  / varṣam vanuṣva api gaccha devān tvacaḥ dhūmam pari ud pātayāsi    viśva vyacāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ bhaviṣyan sa yoniḥ lokam upa yāhi etam  /
translated: Whatever thou hast said at dice or in assembly, or whatever falsehood thou hast spoken from desire of wealth, -in the common thread of life, in the union of the two, lay ye all your sin.🔽Go to the rain, go to the Gods. Thou sendest forth the smoke from the skin. Becoming all-encompassing, with ghee on thy back, go to thy proper place, to this world.

original: tanvam svargaḥ bahudhā vi cakre yathā vidaḥ ātman anya varṇām / apājait kṛṣṇām ruśatīm punānaḥ yā lohinī tām te agnau juhomi //
analyzed: tanvam svargaḥ bahudhā vi cakre yathā vidaḥ ātman anya varṇām   apājait kṛṣṇām ruśatīm punānaḥ yā lohinī tām te agnau juhomi  /

original: prācyai tvā diśe agnaye adhipataye asitāya rakṣitre ādityāya iṣumate / etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ / diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema /🔽dakṣiṇāyai tvā diśaḥ indrāya adhipataye tiraścirājaye rakṣitre yamāya iṣumate / etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ / diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema /
analyzed: prācyai tvā diśe agnaye adhipataye asitāya rakṣitre ādityāya iṣumate    etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ    diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema  / dakṣiṇāyai tvā diśaḥ indrāya adhipataye tiraścirājaye rakṣitre yamāya iṣumate    etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ    diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema  /
translated: For the eastern region, to Agni as overlord, to Asita as guardian, to the Adityas as armed with arrows, we give this in charge. Do ye guard it for us from this side. Lead us to old age, to old age and death. Do ye give us in charge, and then let us be united with the cooked food.🔽For the southern region, to Indra as overlord, to the serpent as guardian, to Yama as armed with arrows, we give this in charge. Do ye guard it for us from this side. Lead us to old age, to old age and death. Do ye give us in charge, and then let us be united with the cooked food.

original: pratīcyai tvā diśe varuṇāya adhipataye pṛdākave rakṣitre annāya iṣumate / etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ / diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema /
analyzed: pratīcyai tvā diśe varuṇāya adhipataye pṛdākave rakṣitre annāya iṣumate    etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ   diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema  /
translated: For the western region, to Varuna as overlord, to the serpent as guardian, to food as armed with arrows, we give this in charge. Do ye guard it for us from this side. Lead us to old age, to old age and death. Do ye give us in charge, and then let us be united with the cooked food.

original: udīcyai tvā diśe somāya adhipataye svajāya rakṣitre aśanyāḥ iṣumatyai / etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ / diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema /
analyzed: udīcyai tvā diśe somāya adhipataye svajāya rakṣitre aśanyāḥ iṣumatyai    etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ   diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema  /
translated: Thee for the northern region, to Soma, the overlord, to Svaja, the guardian, to the arrow of lightning. We give him up to you: do ye protect him for us. Lead him to us, to old age, to life. Let old age give him to Death, and then let us be united with the cooked.

original: dhruvāyai tvā diśe viṣṇave adhipataye kalmāṣa grīvāya rakṣitre oṣadhībhyaḥ iṣumatībhyaḥ / etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ / diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema /
analyzed: dhruvāyai tvā diśe viṣṇave adhipataye kalmāṣa grīvāya rakṣitre oṣadhībhyaḥ iṣumatībhyaḥ   etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ    diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema  /
translated: Thee for the firm region, to Vishnu, the overlord, to Kalmashapada, the guardian, to the arrowy plants. We give him up to you: do ye protect him for us. Lead him to us, to old age, to life. Let old age give him to Death, and then let us be united with the cooked.

original: ūrdhvāyai tvā diśe bṛhaspataye adhipataye śvitrāya rakṣitre varṣāya iṣumate / etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ / diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema / / tat sam bhavema / / tat naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema / / tat saha sam bhavema /
analyzed: ūrdhvāyai tvā diśe bṛhaspataye adhipataye śvitrāya rakṣitre varṣāya iṣumate    etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ   diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema
translated: To the upper quarter, to Brihaspati as overlord, to the white-hued as protector, to the rain-bearing arrow, we consign this (corpse). Guard it for us from the side of the living. Lead our people to the full life. Lead us to old age. Let old age lead us to death. Then let us be united with the cooked (food).

original: dadāmi iti eva brūyāt anu ca enām abhutsata / vaśām brahmabhyaḥ yācadbhyaḥ tat prajāvat apatyavat /
analyzed: dadāmi iti eva brūyāt anu ca enām abhutsata    vaśām brahmabhyaḥ yācadbhyaḥ tat prajāvat apatyavat  /
translated: Let him say, 'I give,' and let him rejoice in her. The barren cow to the Brahmans who ask for her, that is with offspring and with progeny.

original: prajayā sa vi krīṇīte paśubhiḥ ca upa dasyati / yaḥ ārṣeyebhyaḥ yācadbhyaḥ devānām gām na ditsati /
analyzed: prajayā sa vi krīṇīte paśubhiḥ ca upa dasyati    yaḥ ārṣeyebhyaḥ yācadbhyaḥ devānām gām na ditsati  /
translated: He barters with offspring and with cattle who to the Rishis who ask for her, the cow of the gods, does not give.

original: kūṭayā asya sam śīryante śloṇayā kāṭam ardati / baṇḍayā dahyante gṛhāḥ kāṇayā dīyate svam /
analyzed: kūṭayā asya sam śīryante śloṇayā kāṭam ardati   baṇḍayā dahyante gṛhāḥ kāṇayā dīyate svam  /
translated: Her joints are broken with a splinter, her back is bent with a hump, her house is burnt with a cripple, her own (property) is given with a one-eyed (person).

original: vilohitaḥ adhiṣṭhānāt śaknaḥ vindati gopatim / tathā vaśāyāḥ saṃvidyam duradabhnā hi ucyase /
analyzed: vilohitaḥ adhiṣṭhānāt śaknaḥ vindati gopatim    tathā vaśāyāḥ saṃvidyam duradabhnā hi ucyase  /
translated: The red-coloured one, from the place of rest, finds the lord of the cows. So also from the existence of the barren cow, thou art called the hard-to-cure.

original: padoḥ asyāḥ adhiṣṭhānāt viklinduḥ nāma vindati / anāmanāt sam śīryante yāḥ mukhena upajighrati /
analyzed: padoḥ asyāḥ adhiṣṭhānāt viklinduḥ nāma vindati   anāmanāt sam śīryante yāḥ mukhena upajighrati  /
translated: From the place of rest of her feet, the one named Viklindhu finds. From the mouth, those which she kisses, are scattered.

original: yaḥ asyāḥ karṇau āskunoti ā sa deveṣu vṛścate / lakṣma kurve iti manyate kanīyaḥ kṛṇute svam /🔽yat asyāḥ kasmai cit bhogāya bālān kaḥ cit prakṛntati / tatas kiśorāḥ mriyante vatsān ca ghātukaḥ vṛkaḥ /🔽yat asyāḥ gopatau satyāḥ loma dhvāṅkṣaḥ ajīhiḍat / tatas kumārāḥ mriyante yakṣmaḥ vindati anāmanāt /
analyzed: yaḥ asyāḥ karṇau āskunoti ā sa deveṣu vṛścate    lakṣma kurve iti manyate kanīyaḥ kṛṇute svam  / yat asyāḥ kasmai cit bhogāya bālān kaḥ cit prakṛntati   tatas kiśorāḥ mriyante vatsān ca ghātukaḥ vṛkaḥ  / yat asyāḥ gopatau satyāḥ loma dhvāṅkṣaḥ ajīhiḍat   tatas kumārāḥ mriyante yakṣmaḥ vindati anāmanāt  /
translated: He who presses her ears, he is cut off among the gods. Thinking 'I make a mark', he makes himself smaller.🔽If anyone cuts off her teats for anyone's enjoyment, then the young ones die, and the wolf kills the calves.🔽If the crow pecks at the hair of her who is the lord of the cows, then the young men die, and consumption finds the mouth.

original: yat asyāḥ palpūlanam śakṛt dāsī samasyati / tatas aparūpam jāyate tasmāt a vyeṣyat enasaḥ /
analyzed: yat asyāḥ palpūlanam śakṛt dāsī samasyati   tatas aparūpam jāyate tasmāt a vyeṣyat enasaḥ  /
translated: If the slave mixes her dung with the water in which she has washed, then an ugly child is born. Therefore one should not mix it with sin.

original: yaḥ asya syāt vaśā bhogaḥ anyām icheta tarhi saḥ / hiṃste a dattā puruṣam yācitām ca na ditsati //
analyzed: yaḥ asya syāt vaśā bhogaḥ anyām icheta tarhi saḥ    hiṃste a dattā puruṣam yācitām ca na ditsati  /
translated: If he who has a cow in calf should wish for another, then he is guilty of a sin. He injures a man who has not given her to him, and is unwilling to give her when asked.

original: yathā śevadhiḥ nihitaḥ brāhmaṇānām tathā vaśā / tām etat achāyanti yasmin kasmin ca jāyate /
analyzed: yathā śevadhiḥ nihitaḥ brāhmaṇānām tathā vaśā    tām etat achāyanti yasmin kasmin ca jāyate  /
translated: As a cow in calf is placed in the charge of Brahmans, so is a cow in calf. They claim her, wherever she may be born.

original: svam etat achāyanti yat vaśām brāhmaṇāḥ abhi / yathā enān anyasmin jinīyāt eva asyāḥ nirodhanam /
analyzed: svam etat achāyanti yat vaśām brāhmaṇāḥ abhi    yathā enān anyasmin jinīyāt eva asyāḥ nirodhanam  /
translated: They claim her as their own, the Brahmans who have a cow in calf. As if he were to win her from another, so is her keeping back.

original: caret eva traihāyaṇāt a vijñāta gadā satī / vaśām ca vidyāt nārada brāhmaṇāḥ tarhi eṣyāḥ /
analyzed: caret eva traihāyaṇāt a vijñāta gadā satī    vaśām ca vidyāt nārada brāhmaṇāḥ tarhi eṣyāḥ  /
translated: She may be kept for three years, if her disease is not known. And let him know, Narada, that the Brahmans are then to be invited.

original: yaḥ enām avaśām āha devānām nihitam nidhim / ubhau tasmai bhavāśarvau parikramya iṣum asyataḥ /🔽yaḥ asyāḥ ūdhaḥ na veda atha u asyāḥ stanān uta / ubhayena eva asmai duhe dātum ced aśakat vaśām /
analyzed: yaḥ enām avaśām āha devānām nihitam nidhim    ubhau tasmai bhavāśarvau parikramya iṣum asyataḥ  / yaḥ asyāḥ ūdhaḥ na veda atha u asyāḥ stanān uta  / ubhayena eva asmai duhe dātum ced aśakat vaśām  /
translated: He who calls her a cow in calf, the treasure of the gods, to him both Bhava and Sarva, having gone round him, shoot their arrows.🔽He who knows not her udder, nor her teats, to him she yields milk on both sides, if he is able to give a cow in calf.

original: duradabhnā enam ā śaye yācitām ca na ditsati / na asmai kāmāḥ sam ṛdhyante yām a dattvā cikīrṣati /
analyzed: duradabhnā enam ā śaye yācitām ca na ditsati   na asmai kāmāḥ sam ṛdhyante yām a dattvā cikīrṣati  /
translated: He who does not give her when asked, he will lie down, hard to be roused. His wishes are not fulfilled, if he wishes to do anything without having given her.

original: devāḥ vaśām ayācat mukham kṛtvā brāhmaṇam / teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ // teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ // // teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ // // teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ // // teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ // // teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ // // teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ // // teṣām s
analyzed: devāḥ vaśām ayācat mukham kṛtvā brāhmaṇam       teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ    teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ  /   teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ  /   teṣām sarveṣām adadat heḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ  /
translated: To all of them he gave a share: the man goes forth to meet his doom.🔽To all of them he gave a share: the man goes forth to meet his doom.

original: heḍam paśūnām ni eti brāhmaṇebhyaḥ adadat vaśām / devānām nihitam bhāgam martyaḥ ced nipriyāyate //
analyzed: heḍam paśūnām ni eti brāhmaṇebhyaḥ adadat vaśām    devānām nihitam bhāgam martyaḥ ced nipriyāyate  /
translated: He gave the cow Vâsâ to the Brâhmanas, and the share of the cattle to all of them. If a mortal man would go to the Gods, who have taken up their abode in the cow,

original: yat anye śatam yāceyuḥ brāhmaṇāḥ go patim vaśām / atha enām devāḥ abruvan evam ha viduṣaḥ vaśā /
analyzed: yat anye śatam yāceyuḥ brāhmaṇāḥ go patim vaśām    atha enām devāḥ abruvan evam ha viduṣaḥ vaśā  /
translated: If a hundred other Brâhmanas should beg the cow Vâsâ of the lord of the cattle, then the Gods said to her: 'So, indeed, is the cow of him who knows this.

original: yaḥ evam viduṣe a dattvā atha anyebhyaḥ dadat vaśām / durgā tasmai adhiṣṭhāne pṛthivī sahadevatā /
analyzed: yaḥ evam viduṣe a dattvā atha anyebhyaḥ dadat vaśām      durgā tasmai adhiṣṭhāne pṛthivī sahadevatā  /
translated: He who, knowing this, gives the cow Vâsâ to others before giving her to him who knows this, to him, in his abode, the Earth with all her Gods is hard to conquer.

original: devāḥ vaśām ayācan yasmin agre ajāyata / tām etām vidyāt nāradaḥ saha devaiḥ ud ājata /
analyzed: devāḥ vaśām ayācan yasmin agre ajāyata   tām etām vidyāt nāradaḥ saha devaiḥ ud ājata  /
translated: The Gods asked Vasha, who was born first, for her. Let Narada know her, and let him rise up with the Gods.

original: anapatyam alpa paśum vaśā kṛṇoti pūruṣam / brāhmaṇaiḥ ca yācitām atha enām nipriyāyate //
analyzed: anapatyam alpa paśum vaśā kṛṇoti pūruṣam    brāhmaṇaiḥ ca yācitām atha enām nipriyāyate  /
translated: Vasha makes a man childless and poor, if he is asked for her by Brahmanas, and then does not give her to them.

original: agnīṣomābhyām kāmāya mitrāya varuṇāya ca / tebhyaḥ yācanti brāhmaṇāḥ teṣu ā vṛścate adadat /
analyzed: agnīṣomābhyām kāmāya mitrāya varuṇāya ca   tebhyaḥ yācanti brāhmaṇāḥ teṣu ā vṛścate adadat  /
translated: For Agni and Soma, for Love, for Mitra and Varuna, the Brahmanas ask for her. He who does not give her to them is cut off from them.

original: yāvat asyāḥ go patiḥ na upaśṛṇuyāt ṛcaḥ svayam / caret asya tāvat goṣu na asya śrutvā gṛhe vaset /
analyzed: yāvat asyāḥ go patiḥ na upaśṛṇuyāt ṛcaḥ svayam   caret asya tāvat goṣu na asya śrutvā gṛhe vaset  /
translated: As long as the lord of the cow does not hear the verses himself, so long let him wander among the cows. Let him not dwell in his house after hearing them.

original: yaḥ asyāḥ ṛcaḥ upaśrutya atha goṣu acīcarat / āyuḥ ca tasya bhūtim ca devāḥ vṛścanti hīḍitāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ asyāḥ ṛcaḥ upaśrutya atha goṣu acīcarat    āyuḥ ca tasya bhūtim ca devāḥ vṛścanti hīḍitāḥ  /
translated: The Gods, if angered, cut off the life and prosperity of him who, after hearing these verses of hers, does not then wander among the cows.

original: vaśā carantī bahudhā devānām nihitaḥ nidhiḥ / āvis kṛṇuṣva rūpāṇi yadā sthāma jighāṃsati //
analyzed: vaśā carantī bahudhā devānām nihitaḥ nidhiḥ   āvis kṛṇuṣva rūpāṇi yadā sthāma jighāṃsati  /
translated: Vasha, wandering in many ways, is the treasure of the Gods. Make manifest your forms when you wish to win strength.

original: manasā sam kalpayati tat devām api gacchati / tatas ha brahmāṇaḥ vaśām upaprayanti yācitum //
analyzed: manasā sam kalpayati tat devām api gacchati   tatas ha brahmāṇaḥ vaśām upaprayanti yācitum  /
translated: She is mentally conceived, and then goes to the Gods. Then the Brahmanas approach Vasha to ask for her.

original: svadhākāreṇa pitṛbhyaḥ yajñena devatābhyaḥ / dānena rājanyaḥ vaśāyāḥ mātuḥ heḍam na gacchati //
analyzed: svadhākāreṇa pitṛbhyaḥ yajñena devatābhyaḥ   dānena rājanyaḥ vaśāyāḥ mātuḥ heḍam na gacchati  /
translated: by gifts the Kshatriya escapes the mother's curse on the cow.

original: vaśā mātā rājanyasya tathā saṃbhūtam agraśas / tasyāḥ āhuḥ anarpaṇam yat brahmabhyaḥ pradīyate /
analyzed: vaśā mātā rājanyasya tathā saṃbhūtam agraśas   tasyāḥ āhuḥ anarpaṇam yat brahmabhyaḥ pradīyate  /
translated: The cow is the mother of the Kshatriya, and so it is from her that he is born. They say that she is not to be given away, if she is given to the Brahmans.🔽As one might snatch away the ghee that is held in the ladle for Agni,

original: yathā ājyam pragṛhītam ālumpet srucaḥ agnaye / eva ha brahmabhyaḥ vaśām agnaye ā vṛścate adadat /
analyzed: yathā ājyam pragṛhītam ālumpet srucaḥ agnaye   eva ha brahmabhyaḥ vaśām agnaye ā vṛścate adadat  /
translated: so does he snatch away the cow from the Brahmans, who, giving her to Agni, does not give her to the Brahmans.

original: puroḍāśa vatsā su dughā loke asmai upa tiṣṭhati / sā asmai sarvān kāmān vaśā pradaduṣe duhe /
analyzed: puroḍāśa vatsā su dughā loke asmai upa tiṣṭhati   sā asmai sarvān kāmān vaśā pradaduṣe duhe  /
translated: The cow, whose calf is the sacrificial cake, yields milk in this world to him. She yields to him all his desires, who gives the cow.

original: sarvān kāmān yama rājye vaśā pradaduṣe duhe / atha āhuḥ nārakam lokam nirundhānasya yācitām /
analyzed: sarvān kāmān yama rājye vaśā pradaduṣe duhe   atha āhuḥ nārakam lokam nirundhānasya yācitām  /
translated: All his desires does the cow yield to him, who gives the cow in Yama's kingdom. But they say that he who gives her when asked, is shut out from the world of the Fathers.

original: pravīyamānā carati kruddhā gopataye vaśā / vehatam mā manyamānaḥ mṛtyoḥ pāśeṣu badhyatām /
analyzed: pravīyamānā carati kruddhā gopataye vaśā    vehatam mā manyamānaḥ mṛtyoḥ pāśeṣu badhyatām  /
translated: The cow, when being milked, goes about angry with the cowherd. Let him not think that she is killed, but let him be caught in the snares of Death.🔽He who thinks that she is killed, and cooks the cow that is not his own,

original: yaḥ vehatam manyamānaḥ amā ca pacate vaśām / api asya putrān pautrān ca yācayate bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vehatam manyamānaḥ amā ca pacate vaśām    api asya putrān pautrān ca yācayate bṛhaspatiḥ  /
translated: even Brihaspati asks for his sons and grandsons.

original: mahat eṣā ava tapati carantī goṣu gauḥ api / atha u ha gopataye vaśādaduṣe viṣam duhe /
analyzed: mahat eṣā ava tapati carantī goṣu gauḥ api   atha u ha gopataye vaśādaduṣe viṣam duhe  /
translated: This great one burns as she moves, the Cow among the cows. And then the Cow yields milk for the cowherd who does her no harm.

analyzed: priyam paśūnām bhavati yat brahmabhyaḥ pradīyate   atha u vaśāyāḥ tat priyam yat devatrā haviḥ syāt
translated: It is dear to cattle when it is given to the Brahmans. And it is dear to the cow when the offering is made to the gods.

original: yāḥ vaśāḥ udakalpayan devāḥ yajñāt udetya / tāsām viliptyam bhīmām udākuruta nāradaḥ //
analyzed: yāḥ vaśāḥ udakalpayan devāḥ yajñāt udetya   tāsām viliptyam bhīmām udākuruta nāradaḥ
translated: The cows which the gods brought forth from the sacrifice, Nārada brought forth the most terrible of them all, the one which is marked with spots.

original: tām devāḥ amīmāṃsanta vaśeyam avaśā iti / tām abravīt nāradaḥ eṣā vaśānām vaśatamā iti //
analyzed: tām devāḥ amīmāṃsanta vaśā iyam avaśā iti   tām abravīt nāradaḥ eṣā vaśānām vaśatamā iti  /
translated: The gods doubted whether she was a cow or not a cow. Nārada said to them, 'She is the most cow-like of all cows.'

original: kati nu vaśāḥ nārada yāḥ tvam vettha manuṣya jāḥ / tāḥ tvā pṛchāmi vidvāṃsam kasyāḥ na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: kati nu vaśāḥ nārada yāḥ tvam vettha manuṣya jāḥ   tāḥ tvā pṛcchāmi vidvāṃsam kasyāḥ na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ  /
translated: How many kinds of cows, O Nārada, do you know among men? We ask you, O wise one, whose milk a non-Brahman may not eat.

original: viliptyā bṛhaspate yā ca sūta vaśā vaśā / tasyāḥ na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ yaḥ āśaṃseta bhūtyām /
analyzed: viliptyā bṛhaspate yā ca sūta vaśā vaśā         na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ yaḥ āśaṃseta bhūtyām  /
translated: Let no non-Brahmin eat of her, who hopes for prosperity.🔽Homage to thee, O Narada, who knowest the Vāśā cow well.

original: namaḥ te astu nārada anuṣṭhu viduṣe vaśā / katamāsām bhīmatamā yām a dattvā parābhavet /
analyzed: namaḥ te astu nārada anuṣṭhu viduṣe vaśā   katamāsām bhīmatamā yām a dattvā parābhavet  /
translated: Which of them is the most terrible, not giving which one would be defeated?🔽The Vilīptī, O Brihaspati, and the Sūta, and the Vāśā cow,

original: viliptī yā bṛhaspate atho sūta vaśā vaśā / tasyāḥ na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ yaḥ āśaṃseta bhūtyām /
analyzed: viliptī yā bṛhaspate atho sūta vaśā vaśā      tasyāḥ na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ yaḥ āśaṃseta bhūtyām  /
translated: Let no non-Brahmin eat of her, who hopes for prosperity.

original: trīṇi vai vaśā jātāni viliptī sūta vaśā vaśā / tāḥ pra yacchet brahmabhyaḥ saḥ anāvraskaḥ prajāpatau /
analyzed: trīṇi vai vaśā jātāni viliptī sūta vaśā vaśā    tāḥ pra yacchet brahmabhyaḥ saḥ anāvraskaḥ prajāpatau  /
translated: Three kinds of Vāśā cows have been produced, the Vilīptī, the Sūta, and the Vāśā.🔽Let him give them to the Brahmins, he is not to be blamed by Prajapati.

original: etat vaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ haviḥ iti manvīta yācitaḥ / vaśām ced enam yāceyuḥ yāḥ bhīma ādaduṣaḥ gṛhe /
analyzed: etat vaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ haviḥ iti manvīta yācitaḥ   vaśām ced enam yāceyuḥ yāḥ bhīma ādaduṣaḥ gṛhe  /
translated: If they should ask him for a Vāśā cow, he should think, This is your oblation, O Brahmins, if they should ask him for it.🔽The gods reproached him, saying, He has not given us the Vāśā cow.

original: devāḥ vaśām pari avadat na naḥ adāt iti hīḍitāḥ / etābhiḥ ṛgbhiḥ bhedam tasmāt vai sa parābhavat //
analyzed: devāḥ vaśām pari avadat na naḥ adāt iti hīḍitāḥ   etābhiḥ ṛgbhiḥ bhedam tasmāt vai sa parābhavat  /
translated: By these verses he split it, and therefore he was defeated.🔽And Bheda did not give the Vāśā cow, when asked by Indra.

original: uta enām bhedaḥ na adadāt vaśām indreṇa yācitaḥ / tasmāt tam devāḥ āgasaḥ avṛścan aham uttare /
analyzed: uta enām bhedaḥ na adadāt vaśām indreṇa yācitaḥ   tasmāt tam devāḥ āgasaḥ avṛścan aham uttare  /
translated: Therefore the gods cut him down for his offense, and I for the next.

original: ye vaśāyāḥ adānāya vadanti parirāpiṇaḥ / indrasya manyave jālmāḥ ā vṛścante acittyā /
analyzed: ye vaśāyāḥ adānāya vadanti parirāpiṇaḥ   indrasya manyave jālmāḥ ā vṛścante acittyā  /
translated: they are cut off by the wrath of Indra, the foolish by their own folly.

original: ye go patim parāṇīya atha āhuḥ mā dadāḥ iti / rudrasya āstām te hetīm pari yanti acittyā /
analyzed: ye go patim parāṇīya atha āhuḥ mā dadāḥ iti   rudrasya āstām te hetīm pari yanti acittyā  /
translated: Those who, having brought the lord of the cows, then say, Do not give her,🔽they go around the missiles of Rudra, the foolish by their own folly.🔽If one who has eaten the cow to be offered, whether offered or not offered, and the one who cooks it,

original: yadi hutam yadi a hutām amā ca pacate vaśām / devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛchati // devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛchati // devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛchati // devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛchati // devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛchati // devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛchati // devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛc🔽śrameṇa tapasā sṛṣṭā brahmaṇā vittā ṛte śritā /
analyzed: yadi hutam yadi a hutām amā ca pacate vaśām                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 śrameṇa tapasā sṛṣṭāḥ brahmaṇā vittāḥ ṛte śritā
translated: having offended the gods and the Brahmins, goes away from the straight paths.🔽Created by austerity and toil, discovered by Brahman, resting in the truth,

original: satyena āvṛtā śriyā prāvṛtā yaśasā parīvṛtā //
analyzed: satyena āvṛtā śriyā prāvṛtā yaśasā parīvṛtā
translated: surrounded by truth, covered by glory, encompassed by fame.

original: svadhayā parihitā śraddhayā paryūḍhā dīkṣayā guptā yajñe pratiṣṭhitā lokaḥ nidhanam //
analyzed: svadhayā parihitā śraddhayā paryūḍhā dīkṣayā guptā yajñe pratiṣṭhitā lokaḥ nidhanam
translated: Restrained by its own nature, supported by faith, protected by initiation, established in the sacrifice, the world is its end.

original: brahma padava ayam brāhmaṇaḥ adhipatiḥ //
analyzed: brahma padava ayam brāhmaṇaḥ adhipatiḥ
translated: This Brahman is the abode, this Brahman is the lord.

original: tām ādadānasya brahmagavīm jinataḥ brāhmaṇam kṣatriyasya //🔽krāmati sūnṛtā vīryam punyā lakṣmī / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: tām ādadānasya brahmagavīm jinataḥ brāhmaṇam kṣatriyasya  krāmati sūnṛtā vīryam punyā lakṣmī
translated: When a Kshatriya takes hold of the Brahman cow and seizes the Brahman,

original: ojaḥ ca tejaḥ ca sahaḥ ca balam ca vāc ca indriyam ca śrīḥ ca dharmaḥ ca //
analyzed: ojaḥ ca tejaḥ ca sahaḥ ca balam ca vāc ca indriyam ca śrīḥ ca dharmaḥ ca
translated: the truth, the heroism, the merit, the glory, the prosperity, the power, the splendor, the endurance, the strength, the speech, the senses, the beauty, the righteousness,

original: brahma ca kṣatram ca rāṣṭram ca viśaḥ ca tviṣiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca varcaḥ ca draviṇam ca //
analyzed: brahma ca kṣatram ca rāṣṭram ca viśaḥ ca tviṣiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca varcaḥ ca draviṇam ca
translated: the Brahman, the Kshatriya, the kingdom, the people, the radiance, the fame, the brilliance, the wealth,

original: āyuḥ ca rūpam ca nāma ca kīrtiḥ ca prāṇaḥ ca apānaḥ ca cakṣuḥ ca śrotram ca //
analyzed: āyuḥ ca rūpam ca nāma ca kīrtiḥ ca prāṇaḥ ca apānaḥ ca cakṣuḥ ca śrotram ca
translated: the life, the form, the name, the glory, the inhalation, the exhalation, the eye, the ear,

original: payaḥ ca rasaḥ ca annam ca annādyam ca rtam ca satyam ca iṣṭam ca pūrtam ca prajā ca paśavaḥ ca /
analyzed: payaḥ ca rasaḥ ca annam ca annādyam ca rtam ca satyam ca iṣṭam ca pūrtam ca prajā ca paśavaḥ ca  /
translated: the milk, the juice, the food, the first fruits of food, the truth, the vow, the fulfillment of vows, the offspring, the cattle,

original: sā eṣā bhīmā brahmagavī aghaviṣā sākṣāt kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā //
analyzed: sā eṣā bhīmā brahma gavī agha viṣā sākṣāt kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā
translated: That terrible Brahman cow, poisonous to the wicked, is the Kṛtyā herself, covered with a turban.

original: sarvāṇi asyām ghorāṇi sarve ca mṛtyavaḥ //
analyzed: sarvāṇi asyām ghorāṇi sarve ca mṛtyavaḥ
translated: All the terrible things and all the deaths are in her.

original: sarvāṇi asyām krūrāṇi sarve puruṣa vadhāḥ //
analyzed: sarvāṇi asyām krūrāṇi sarve puruṣa vadhāḥ
translated: All the cruel things and all the killers of men are in her.

original: sā brahmajyam deva pīyum brahmagavī ādīyamānā mṛtyoḥ padvīṣaḥ ā dyati //
analyzed: sā brahmajyam deva pīyum brahmagavī ādīyamānā mṛtyoḥ padvīṣaḥ ā dyati  /
translated: That Brahman cow, when seized, seizes the Brahman-eater, the god-drinker, by the feet of Death.

original: meniḥ śatavadhā hi sā brahmajyasya kṣitiḥ hi sā //
analyzed: meniḥ śatavadhā hi sā brahmajyasya kṣitiḥ hi sā
translated: For she is the hundred-fold wound, she is the ground of the Brahman-eater.

original: tasmāt vai brāhmaṇānām gauḥ durādharṣā vijānatā //
analyzed: tasmāt vai brāhmaṇānām gauḥ durādharṣā vijānatā
translated: Therefore the cow of the Brahmins is hard to overcome for one who knows.

original: vajraḥ dhāvantī vaiśvānaraḥ udvītā //
analyzed: vajraḥ dhāvantī vaiśvānaraḥ udvītā
translated: The running one is the thunderbolt, the lifted one is Vaiśvānara.

original: hetiḥ śaphān utkhidantī mahādevaḥ apekṣamāṇā //🔽kṣura paviḥ īkṣamāṇā vāśyamānā abhi sphūrjati //
analyzed: hetiḥ śaphān utkhidantī mahādevaḥ apekṣamāṇā  kṣura paviḥ īkṣamāṇā vāśyamānā abhi sphūrjati
translated: The one lifting the hooves is the weapon, the one looking on is Mahādeva.🔽The one looking on with sharp hooves, the one neighing, roars forth.

original: mṛtyuḥ hiṅkṛṇvati ugraḥ devaḥ pucham paryasyantī //
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ hiṅkṛṇvati ugraḥ devaḥ pucham paryasyantī
translated: Death, the fierce god, makes a hissing sound, the one shaking the tail.

original: sarva jyā niḥ karṇau varīvarjayantī rājayakṣmaḥ mehantī //🔽meniḥ duhyamānā śīrṣaktiḥ dugdhā //🔽sediḥ upatiṣṭhantī mithas yodhaḥ parāmṛṣṭā //
analyzed: sarva jyā niḥ karṇau varīvarjayantī rājayakṣmaḥ mehantī  meniḥ duhyamānā śīrṣaktiḥ dugdhā  sediḥ upatiṣṭhantī mithas yodhaḥ parāmṛṣṭā
translated: The one turning around with all the bowstrings is the king's consumption, the one urinating.🔽The one being milked is the wound, the one milked is the head-ache.🔽The one standing near is the fatigue, the one seized in mutual combat is the battle.

original: śaravyā mukhe apinahyamānaḥ ṛtiḥ hanyamānā //
analyzed: śaravyā mukhe apinahyamānaḥ ṛtiḥ hanyamānā
translated: The one put in the mouth as an arrow is the pain, the one struck is the injury.

original: agha viṣā nipatantī tamaḥ nipatitā /🔽anugacchantī prāṇān upa dāsayati brahmagavī brahmajyasya // brahmagavī brahmajyasya // brahmagavī brahmajyasya // brahmagavī brahmajyasya // brahmagavī brahmajyasya // brahmagavī brahmajyasya // brahmagavī brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya // brahmajyasya /
analyzed: agha viṣā nipatantī tamaḥ nipatitā  anugacchantī prāṇān upa dāsayati brahma gavī brahmajyasya   brahmagavī brahmajyasya   / brahmagavī brahmajyasya  / brahmagavī brahmajyasya  / brahmagavī brahmajyasya  / brahmagavī brahmajyasya  / brahmagavī brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  / brahmajyasya  /
translated: The poison of sin falls, fallen is the darkness.🔽Following, it takes away the life-breath of one who sacrifices to Brahman.🔽The cow of Brahman, when being divided, brings enmity.

original: vairam vikṛtyamānā pautra ādyam vibhājyamānā //🔽deva hetiḥ hriyamāṇā vyṛddhiḥ hṛtā //🔽pāpmā adhidhīyamānā pāruṣyam avadhīyamānā //
analyzed: vairam vikṛtyamānā pautra ādyam vibhājyamānā  deva hetiḥ hriyamāṇā vyṛddhiḥ hṛtā  pāpmā adhidhīyamānā pāruṣyam avadhīyamānā
translated: The divine weapon, when being carried away, brings destruction.🔽Sin, when being placed upon, brings harshness.

original: viṣam prayasyantī takmā prayastā //
analyzed: viṣam prayasyantī takmā prayastā
translated: Poison, when being prepared, brings consumption.

original: agham pracyamānā duṣvapnyam pakvā //
analyzed: agham pracyamānā duṣvapnyam pakvā
translated: Sin, when being performed, brings bad dreams.

original: mūla barhaṇī paryākriyamāṇā kṣitiḥ paryākṛtā //
analyzed: mūla barhaṇī paryākriyamāṇā kṣitiḥ paryākṛtā
translated: The earth, when it is ploughed, is ploughed up to the roots.

original: asaṃjñā gandhena śuc uddhriyamāṇā āśīviṣa uddhṛtā //
analyzed: asaṃjñā gandhena śuc uddhriyamāṇā āśīviṣa uddhṛtā
translated: The snake, when it is lifted up by the smell of the unconscious, is lifted up.

original: abhūtiḥ upahriyamāṇā parābhūtiḥ upahṛtā //🔽śarvaḥ kruddhaḥ piśyamānā śimidā piśitā //
analyzed: abhūtiḥ upahriyamāṇā parābhūtiḥ upahṛtā  śarvaḥ kruddhaḥ piśyamānā śimidā piśitā
translated: When it is offered, it is defeated.🔽When it is chewed, it is chewed by the angry Shiva.

original: avartiḥ aśyamānā nirṛtiḥ aśitā //
analyzed: avartiḥ aśyamānā nirṛtiḥ aśitā
translated: When it is eaten, it is eaten by the angry Shiva.

original: aśitā lokāt chinatti brahmagavī brahmajyam asmāt ca amuṣmāt ca // // // //
analyzed: aśitā lokāt chinatti brahmagavī brahmajyam asmāt ca amuṣmāt ca
translated: The cow of Brahman, when eaten, cuts off the sacrificer of Brahman from this world and from the next.

original: tasyāḥ āhananam kṛtyā meniḥ āśasanam valagaḥ ūbadhyam //
analyzed: tasyāḥ āhananam kṛtyā meniḥ āśasanam valagaḥ ūbadhyam  /
translated: The striking of it is the witchcraft, the malice, the sorcery, the spell, the noose.

original: asvagatā parihṇu tā //
analyzed: asvagatā parihṇu tā
translated: It is unsuccessful, it is rejected.

original: agniḥ kravyād bhūtvā brahmagavī brahmajyam praviśya atti //
analyzed: agniḥ kravyād bhūtvā brahmagavī brahmajyam praviśya atti
translated: The cow of Brahman, having become a flesh-eating fire, enters the sacrificer of Brahman and eats him.

original: sarvā asya aṅgā parvā mūlāni vṛścati //
analyzed: sarvā asya aṅgā parvā mūlāni vṛścati
translated: It cuts off all his limbs, joints, and roots.

original: chinatti asya pitṛ bandhu parā bhāvayati mātṛ bandhu //
analyzed: chinatti asya pitṛ bandhu parā bhāvayati mātṛ bandhu
translated: It cuts off his paternal relatives and destroys his maternal relatives.

original: vivāhām jñātīn sarvān api kṣāpayati brahmagavī brahmajyasya kṣatriyeṇa a punardīyamānā //
analyzed: vivāhām jñātīn sarvān api kṣāpayati brahmagavī brahmajyasya kṣatriyeṇa a punardīyamānā
translated: The cow of Brahman, when not given back by a Kshatriya, destroys all his relatives, even the married ones, the sacrificer of Brahman.

original: avāstum enam asvagam aprajasam karoti apara aparaṇaḥ bhavati kṣīyate //
analyzed: avāstum enam asvagam aprajasam karoti apara aparaṇaḥ bhavati kṣīyate
translated: It makes him homeless, unsuccessful, and childless. He becomes poorer and poorer, he is destroyed.

original: kṣipram vai tasya āhanane gṛdhrāḥ kurvata ailabam //🔽kṣipram vai tasya adahanam pari nṛtyanti keśinīḥ āghnānāḥ pāṇinā urasi kurvāṇāḥ pāpam ailabam /
analyzed: kṣipram vai tasya āhanane gṛdhrāḥ kurvata ailabam  kṣipram vai tasya adahanam pari nṛtyanti keśinīḥ āghnānāḥ pāṇinā urasi kurvāṇāḥ pāpam ailabam  /
translated: The vultures quickly make a loud noise for him.🔽The Keishinīs quickly dance around his funeral pyre, striking their breasts with their hands, making a loud noise of evil.

original: kṣipram vai tasya vāstuṣu vṛkāḥ kurvata ailabam //
analyzed: kṣipram vai tasya vāstuṣu vṛkāḥ kurvata ailabam
translated: The wolves quickly make a loud noise in his house.

original: kṣipram vai tasya pṛchanti yat tat āsīt idam nu tāt iti //
analyzed: kṣipram vai tasya pṛcchanti yat tat āsīt idam nu tāt iti  /
translated: They quickly ask him, What was that? What is this now?

original: chindhi ā chindhi pra chindhi api kṣāpaya kṣāpaya //
analyzed: chindhi ā chindhi pra chindhi api kṣāpaya kṣāpaya
translated: Cut! Cut! Cut off! Cut off! Destroy! Destroy!

original: ādadānam āṅgirasi brahmajyam upa dāsaya //
analyzed: ādadānam āṅgirasi brahmajyam upa dāsaya
translated: O descendant of Aṅgiras, bring down the one who seizes the sacrificial fee.

original: vaiśvadevī hi ucyase kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā //
analyzed: vaiśvadevī hi ucyase kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā
translated: You are said to be the weapon of the Viśvedevas, wrapped in a turban.

original: oṣantī samoṣantī brahmaṇaḥ vajraḥ //
analyzed: oṣantī samoṣantī brahmaṇaḥ vajraḥ
translated: The thunderbolt of the Brahman, burning and burning together.

original: kṣura paviḥ mṛtyuḥ bhūtvā vi dhāva tvam //🔽ā datse jinatām varcaḥ iṣṭam pūrtam ca āśiṣaḥ //
analyzed: kṣura paviḥ mṛtyuḥ bhūtvā vi dhāva tvam  ā datse jinatām varcaḥ iṣṭam pūrtam ca āśiṣaḥ
translated: Becoming a razor-edged death, run away!🔽You give the winner glory, the desired fulfillment, and blessings.

original: ādāya jītam jītāya loke amuṣmin pra yacchasi //
analyzed: ādāya jītam jītāya loke amuṣmin pra yacchasi
translated: Having won, you bestow upon the victor in this world what has been won.

original: aghnye padavīḥ bhava brāhmaṇasya abhiśastyā /
analyzed: aghnye padavīḥ bhava brāhmaṇasya abhiśastyā
translated: O cow, be the path for the Brahman's curse.

original: meniḥ śaravyā bhava aghāt aghaviṣā bhava //
analyzed: meniḥ śaravyā bhava aghāt aghaviṣā bhava
translated: Be a dart to be avoided, be harmless to the harmless.

original: aghnye pra śiraḥ jahi brahmajyasya kṛta āgasaḥ deva pīyoḥ arādhasaḥ //
analyzed: aghnye pra śiraḥ jahi brahmajyasya kṛta āgasaḥ deva pīyoḥ arādhasaḥ
translated: The God-despising, faithless man.🔽Let Agni burn the evil-doer, crushed and ground to pieces by thee.🔽Let Agni burn the evil-doer, crushed and ground to pieces by thee.🔽Let Agni burn the evil-doer, crushed and ground to pieces by thee.🔽Let Agni burn the evil-doer, crushed and ground to pieces by thee.

original: vṛśca pra vṛśca sam vṛśca daha pra daha sam daha //
analyzed: vṛśca pra vṛśca sam vṛśca daha pra daha sam daha
translated: Cut, cut, cut off, burn, burn, burn.

original: brahmajyam devī aghnyaḥ ā mūlāt anusaṃdaha //
analyzed: brahmajyam devī aghnyaḥ ā mūlāt anusaṃdaha
translated: O Goddess Cow, burn down to the roots the sinner who injures prayer.

original: yathā ayāt yama sādanāt pāpa lokān parāvataḥ //
analyzed: yathā ayāt yama sādanāt pāpa lokān parāvataḥ
translated: As he who goes from Yama's seat to the world of evil, to the farthest distance,

original: eva tvam devī aghnye brahmajyasya kṛta āgasaḥ deva pīyoḥ arādhasaḥ //
analyzed: eva tvam devī aghnye brahmajyasya kṛta āgasaḥ deva pīyoḥ arādhasaḥ
translated: Even so, O Goddess Cow, do thou to the sinner who injures prayer, the sinner, the God-despising, faithless man.

original: vajreṇa śata parvaṇā tīkṣṇena kṣura bhṛṣṭinā //
analyzed: vajreṇa śata parvaṇā tīkṣṇena kṣura bhṛṣṭinā
translated: With the sharp hundred-knotted thunderbolt, whetted on a stone.

original: pra skandhān pra śiraḥ jahi //🔽lomāni asya sam chindhi tvacam asya vi veṣṭaya //🔽māṃsāni asya śātaya snāvāni asya sam vṛha //
analyzed: pra skandhān pra śiraḥ jahi  lomāni asya sam chindhi tvacam asya vi veṣṭaya  māṃsāni asya śātaya snāvāni asya sam vṛha
translated: Cut off his ribs, cut off his head.🔽Cut off his hair, unroll his skin.🔽Tear his flesh, tear out his entrails.

original: asthīni asya pīḍaya majjānam asya niḥ jahi //
analyzed: asthīni asya pīḍaya majjānam asya niḥ jahi
translated: Crush his bones, drive out his marrow.

original: sarvā asya aṅgā parvāṇi vi śrathaya //
analyzed: sarvā asya aṅgā parvāṇi vi śrathaya
translated: Loosen all his limbs and joints.

original: agniḥ enam kravyād pṛthivyāḥ nudatām ud oṣatu vāyuḥ antarikṣāt mahataḥ varimṇaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ enam kravyād pṛthivyāḥ nudatām ud oṣatu vāyuḥ antarikṣāt mahataḥ varimṇaḥ  /
translated: Let Agni the flesh-eater drive him from the earth, let Vayu drive him from the great expanse of the atmosphere.

analyzed: sūryaḥ enam divaḥ pra nudatām ni oṣatu
translated: Let Surya drive him from the sky.

original: udehi vājin yaḥ apsu antar idam rāṣṭram pra viśa sūnṛtāvat / yaḥ rohitaḥ viśvam idam jajāna sa tvā rāṣṭrāya su bhṛtam bibhartu //
analyzed: udehi vājin yaḥ apsu antar idam rāṣṭram pra viśa sūnṛtāvat    yaḥ rohitaḥ viśvam idam jajāna sa tvā rāṣṭrāya su bhṛtam bibhartu  /
translated: Rise up, O steed, who art within the waters, enter this kingdom full of joy. The red one who has produced all this, may he sustain thee well-nourished for the kingdom.

original: ud vājaḥ ā gan yaḥ apsu antar viśaḥ ā roha tvad yonayaḥ yāḥ / somam dadhānaḥ apaḥ oṣadhīḥ gāḥ catuṣpadaḥ dvipadaḥ ā veśaya iha /
analyzed: ud vājaḥ ā gan yaḥ apsu antar viśaḥ ā roha tvad yonayaḥ yāḥ   / somam dadhānaḥ apaḥ oṣadhīḥ gāḥ catuṣpadaḥ dvipadaḥ ā veśaya iha  /
translated: Rise up, O strength, that art within the waters. Ascend thy people, they whose birth is thine. Placing the Soma, the plants, the waters, the cattle, the four-footed and the two-footed here.

original: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ indreṇa yujā pra mṛṇīta śatrūn / ā vaḥ rohitaḥ śṛṇavat sudānavaḥ triṣaptāsaḥ marutaḥ svādu saṃmudaḥ /
analyzed: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ indreṇa yujā pra mṛṇīta śatrūn   ā vaḥ rohitaḥ śṛṇavat sudānavaḥ triṣaptāsaḥ marutaḥ svādu saṃmudaḥ  /
translated: Ye fierce Maruts, with Indra for your ally, crush down the enemies, ye whose mother is Pr̥iṣni. Let the red steed hear you, O ye bountiful ones, the Maruts with the three-stringed lutes, the gladdening draught.

original: ruhaḥ ruroha rohitaḥ ā ruroha garbhaḥ janīnām januṣām upastham / tābhiḥ saṃrabdham anu avindan ṣaṭ urvīḥ gātum prapaśyan iha rāṣṭram āhāḥ //
analyzed: ruhaḥ ruroha rohitaḥ ā ruroha garbhaḥ janīnām januṣām upastham   tābhiḥ saṃrabdham anu avindan ṣaṭ urvīḥ gātum prapaśyan iha rāṣṭram āhāḥ  /
translated: The red one hath ascended, hath ascended the birth-place of the generations, the womb of the born. With them he hath united. They have found the six wide regions. Looking on the way, he hath declared the kingdom here.

original: ā te rāṣṭram iha rohitaḥ ahārṣīt vi āsthat mṛdhaḥ abhayam te abhūt / tasmai te dyāvāpṛthivī revatībhiḥ kāmam duhātām iha śakvarībhiḥ /
analyzed: ā te rāṣṭram iha rohitaḥ ahārṣīt vi āsthat mṛdhaḥ abhayam te abhūt    tasmai te dyāvāpṛthivī revatībhiḥ kāmam duhātām iha śakvarībhiḥ  /
translated: The red one hath brought thy kingdom hither. He hath dispersed thy foes. Thou hast become fearless. For thee let Heaven and Earth, with their rich streams, here yield the wish with their Shakvari streams.

original: rohitaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna tatra tantum parameṣṭhī tatāna / tatra śiśriye ajaḥ eka pādaḥ adṛṃhat dyāvāpṛthivī balena /
analyzed: rohitaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna tatra tantum parameṣṭhī tatāna   tatra śiśriye ajaḥ eka pādaḥ adṛṃhat dyāvāpṛthivī balena
translated: The red one hath brought forth Heaven and Earth. There the Supreme Ordainer hath stretched the thread. There the one-footed goat hath perched. With might he hath established Heaven and Earth.

original: rohitaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī adṛṃhat tena sva stabhitam tena nākaḥ / tena antarikṣam vimitāḥ rajāṃsi tena devāḥ amṛtam anu avindan /
analyzed: rohitaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī adṛṃhat tena sva stabhitam tena nākaḥ   tena antarikṣam vimitāḥ rajāṃsi tena devāḥ amṛtam anu avindan  /
translated: The red one hath established heaven and earth: by him the sky is propped, by him the firmament. By him the regions of the air are measured out, and by him the Gods have found the nectar's place.

original: vi rohitaḥ amṛśat viśva rūpam samākurvāṇaḥ praruhaḥ ruhaḥ ca / divam rūḍhvā mahatā mahimnā sam te rāṣṭram anaktu payasā ghṛtena /
analyzed: vi rohitaḥ amṛśat viśva rūpam samākurvāṇaḥ praruhaḥ ruhaḥ ca    divam rūḍhvā mahatā mahimnā sam te rāṣṭram anaktu payasā ghṛtena  /
translated: The red one hath surveyed all forms, arranging the plants that grow on ground and those that spring from seeds. Having ascended heaven with mighty majesty, may he anoint thy kingdom with milk and with ghee.

original: yāḥ te ruhaḥ praruhaḥ yāḥ te āruhaḥ yābhiḥ āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam / tāsām brahmaṇā payasā vavṛdhānaḥ viśi rāṣṭre jāgṛhi rohitasya //
analyzed: yāḥ te ruhaḥ praruhaḥ yāḥ te āruhaḥ yābhiḥ āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam    tāsām brahmaṇā payasā vavṛdhānaḥ viśi rāṣṭre jāgṛhi rohitasya  /
translated: Thy plants that spring from ground and those that spring from seeds, wherewith thou fillest heaven and air's mid-region, — with the milk of these, increased by prayer and holy verse, watch thou the people in the realm of Rohita.

original: yaḥ te viśaḥ tapasaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ vatsam gāyatrīm anu tāḥ iha āguḥ / tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ // tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ // tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ // tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ // tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ // tāḥ tvā viśa
analyzed: yaḥ te viśaḥ tapasaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ vatsam gāyatrīm anu tāḥ iha āguḥ    tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ    tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ    tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ     tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ  / tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatsaḥ abhi etu rohitaḥ  / tāḥ tvā viśantu
translated: With gracious spirit let them enter into thee. Let the Cow's loving Calf come nigh to thee.

original: ūrdhvaḥ rohitaḥ adhi nāke asthāt viśvā rūpāṇi janayan yuvā kaviḥ / tigmena agniḥ jyotiṣā vi bhāti tṛtīye cakre rajasi priyāṇi //
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ rohitaḥ adhi nāke asthāt viśvā rūpāṇi janayan yuvā kaviḥ   tigmena agniḥ jyotiṣā vi bhāti tṛtīye cakre rajasi priyāṇi  /
translated: The Red Steer hath ascended the vault on high, the youthful Sage, producing every form and shape. With sharpened light Agni shines forth, his dearest joys in the third sphere, in the region of the air.

original: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ jātavedāḥ ghṛta āhutaḥ soma pṛṣṭhaḥ su vīraḥ / mā mā hāsīt nāthitaḥ na id tvā jahāni go poṣam ca me vīra poṣam ca dhehi /
analyzed: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ jātavedāḥ ghṛta āhutaḥ soma pṛṣṭhaḥ su vīraḥ   mā mā hāsīt nāthitaḥ na id tvā jahāni go poṣam ca me vīra poṣam ca dhehi  /
translated: The Bull, the Youthful God, with thousand horns, offered with sacred oil, whose back is Soma juice, the Hero's Friend. Let him not leave me when I call on him. I will not leave thee. Grant me increase of wealth in kine and heroes.

original: rohitaḥ yajñasya janitā mukham ca rohitāya vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi / rohitam devāḥ yanti sumanasyamānāḥ sa mā rohaiḥ sāmityai rohayatu //
analyzed: rohitaḥ yajñasya janitā mukham ca rohitāya vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi    rohitam devāḥ yanti sumanasyamānāḥ sa mā rohaiḥ sāmityaiḥ rohayatu  /
translated: The Red One is the begetter and the face of sacrifice. To the Red One I offer with speech, with hearing, with mind. The gods go to the Red One, well-disposed. May he raise me up with the Red Ones for prosperity.

original: rohitaḥ yajñam vi adadhāt viśvakarmaṇe tasmāt tejāṃsi upa mā imāni āguḥ / voceyam te nābhim bhuvanasya adhi majmani //
analyzed: rohitaḥ yajñam vi adadhāt viśvakarmaṇe tasmāt tejāṃsi upa mā imāni āguḥ   voceyam te nābhim bhuvanasya adhi majmani  /
translated: The Red One has established the sacrifice for all-working Vishvakarman. Therefore these radiant things have come to me. I will speak to thee, O navel, in the midst of the world.

original: ā tvā ruroha bṛhatī uta paṅktiḥ ā kakubh varcasā jātavedaḥ / ā tvā ruroha uṣṇihā akṣaraḥ vaṣaṭkāraḥ ā tvā ruroha rohitaḥ retasā saha /
analyzed: ā tvā ruroha bṛhatī uta paṅktiḥ ā kakubh varcasā jātavedaḥ    ā tvā ruroha uṣṇihā akṣaraḥ vaṣaṭkāraḥ ā tvā ruroha rohitaḥ retasā saha  /
translated: The Brihatî and the Paṅkti have mounted thee, O Jâtavedas, and the Kakup with its radiance. The Uṣṇih metre and the syllable 'Vashat' have mounted thee. The Red One has mounted thee with his seed.

original: ayam vaste garbham pṛthivyāḥ divam vaste ayam antarikṣam / ayam bradhnasya viṣṭapi svar lokān vi ānaśe /
analyzed: ayam vaste garbham pṛthivyāḥ divam vaste ayam antarikṣam   ayam bradhnasya viṣṭapi svar lokān vi ānaśe  /
translated: This one clothes the embryo of the earth. This one clothes the sky. This one clothes the atmosphere. This one has distributed the heavenly worlds in the wide expanse of the sun.

original: vācaḥ pate pṛthivī naḥ syonā syonā yoniḥ talpā naḥ su śevā / iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari agniḥ āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu /
analyzed: vācaḥ pate pṛthivī naḥ syonā syonā yoniḥ talpā naḥ su śevā    iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari agniḥ āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu  /
translated: O Lord of Speech, may the earth be propitious to us, a propitious womb and resting place for us, a good friend. May our life be here itself. May Parameshthin, O Agni, endow thee with life and splendour.

original: vācaḥ pate ṛtavaḥ pañca ye nau vaiśvakarmaṇāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ / iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari rohitaḥ āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu /
analyzed: vācaḥ pate ṛtavaḥ pañca ye nau vaiśvakarmaṇāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ    iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari rohitaḥ āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu  /
translated: O Lord of Speech, the five seasons which have come to us, the all-working ones, may they be here for us. May our life be here for us, O friend. May Parameshthin, O Red One, endow thee with life and splendour.

original: vācaḥ pate saumanasam manaḥ ca goṣṭhe naḥ gāḥ janaya yoniṣu prajāḥ / iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari aham āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu //
analyzed: vācaḥ pate saumanasam manaḥ ca goṣṭhe naḥ gāḥ janaya yoniṣu prajāḥ   iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari aham āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu  /
translated: O Lord of Speech, give us joy and mind, generate cows in our cowpen, offspring in our wombs. May our life be here for us, O friend. May I, O Parameshthin, endow thee with life and splendour.

original: yam tvā pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭiḥ vahati rohita / śubhā yāsi riṇan apaḥ //
analyzed: yam tvā pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭiḥ vahati rohita    śubhā yāsi riṇan apaḥ
translated: The spotted mare, the swift one, which bears thee on the chariot, O red one, when thou goest to the waters, beautiful, driving away (foes).

original: anuvratā rohiṇī rohitasya sūriḥ suvarṇā bṛhatī suvarcāḥ / tayā vājān viśva rūpām jayema tayā viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhi syāma /
analyzed: anuvratā rohiṇī rohitasya sūriḥ suvarṇā bṛhatī suvarcāḥ    tayā vājān viśva rūpām jayema tayā viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhi syāma  /
translated: The red one's follower is the red one's, the leader's, the golden one, the great one, of good radiance. By her may we win the treasures of all forms, by her may we conquer all the battles.

original: idam sadaḥ rohiṇī rohitasya asau panthāḥ pṛṣatī yena yāti / tām gandharvāḥ kaśyapāḥ ud nayanti tām rakṣanti kavayaḥ apramādam /
analyzed: idam sadaḥ rohiṇī rohitasya asau panthāḥ pṛṣatī yena yāti    tām gandharvāḥ kaśyapāḥ ud nayanti tām rakṣanti kavayaḥ apramādam  /
translated: This is the seat of Rohita the Red, this is the path of the dappled one by which he goes. The Gandharvas, the Kasyapas, lead her up, the wise ones guard her with heedfulness.

original: sūryasya aśvāḥ harayaḥ ketumantaḥ sadā vahanti amṛtāḥ sukham ratham / ghṛta pāvāḥ rohitaḥ bhrājamānaḥ divam devaḥ pṛṣatīm ā viveśa /
analyzed: sūryasya aśvāḥ harayaḥ ketumantaḥ sadā vahanti amṛtāḥ sukham ratham    ghṛta pāvāḥ rohitaḥ bhrājamānaḥ divam devaḥ pṛṣatīm ā viveśa  /
translated: The tawny horses of the Sun, the bannered ones, ever bear his chariot, immortal, blissful. The red one, fed with ghee, shining, the god, hath entered the dappled heaven.

original: yaḥ rohitaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ pari agnim pari sūryam babhūva / yaḥ viṣṭabhnāti pṛthivīm divam ca tasmāt devāḥ adhi sṛṣṭīḥ sṛjante /
analyzed: yaḥ rohitaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ pari agnim pari sūryam babhūva   yaḥ viṣṭabhnāti pṛthivīm divam ca tasmāt devāḥ adhi sṛṣṭīḥ sṛjante  /
translated: The red bull, with his sharp horns, hath encompassed the fire and the sun. He who supports the earth and the sky, from him the gods create the beings.

original: rohitaḥ divam āruhat mahataḥ pari arṇavāt / sarvaḥ ruroha rohitaḥ ruhaḥ /
analyzed: rohitaḥ divam āruhat mahataḥ pari arṇavāt   sarvaḥ ruroha rohitaḥ ruhaḥ  /
translated: The red one hath mounted the heaven from the great ocean. The red one hath mounted all the heights.

original: vi mimīṣva payasvatīm ghṛtācīm devānām dhenuḥ an apaspṛś eṣā / indraḥ somam pibatu kṣemaḥ astu agniḥ pra stautu vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva /
analyzed: vi mimīṣva payasvatīm ghṛtācīm devānām dhenuḥ an apaspṛś eṣā    indraḥ somam pibatu kṣemaḥ astu agniḥ pra stautu vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva  /
translated: Measure out the rich in milk, the ladle. This cow of the gods is not to be surpassed. Let Indra drink the Soma. Let all be well. Let Agni praise. Drive away the enemies.

original: samiddhaḥ agniḥ samidhānaḥ ghṛta vṛddhaḥ ghṛta āhutaḥ / abhīṣāh viśvāṣāh agniḥ sapatnān hantu ye mama /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ samidhānaḥ ghṛta vṛddhaḥ ghṛta āhutaḥ   abhīṣāh viśvāṣāh agniḥ sapatnān hantu ye mama  /
translated: Agni is kindled, well-kindled, increased with ghee, offered with ghee. Agni, the conqueror of all, the victor, shall slay my enemies.

original: hantu enān pra dahatu ariḥ yaḥ naḥ pṛtanyati / kravyādā agninā vayam sapatnān pra dahāmasi //🔽avācīnān ava jahi indra vajreṇa bāhumān / adha sapatnān māmakān agneḥ tejobhiḥ ādiṣi // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //
analyzed: hantu enān pra dahatu ariḥ yaḥ naḥ pṛtanyati   kravyādā agninā vayam sapatnān pra dahāmasi  / avācīnān ava jahi indra vajreṇa bāhumān   adha sapatnān māmakān agneḥ tejobhiḥ ādiṣi
translated: Destroy them, let the foe consume them who assails us. With the devouring fire we burn our rivals.🔽Drive them away, O Indra, with thy thunderbolt, drive them away with thy right arm. Drive away my enemies with the flames of Agni.

original: agne sapatnān adharān pādaya asmat vyathayā sajātam utpipānam bṛhaspate / indra agnī mitrāvaruṇau adhare padyantām a pratimanyūyamānāḥ /
analyzed: agne sapatnān adharān pādaya asmat vyathayā sajātam utpipānam bṛhaspate    indra agnī mitrāvaruṇau adhare padyantām a pratimanyūyamānāḥ  /
translated: O Agni, cast down our foes to the lowest place. O Brihaspati, crush the spiteful enemy who thirsts for us. O Indra and Agni, O Mitra and Varuna, let them fall to the lowest place, not to be pitied.

original: udyan tvam deva sūrya sapatnān ava me jahi / ava enān aśmanā jahi te yantu adhamam tamaḥ /
analyzed: udyan tvam deva sūrya sapatnān ava me jahi   ava enān aśmanā jahi te yantu adhamam tamaḥ  /
translated: O God Surya, rising, destroy our foes. Destroy them with thy thunderbolt. Let them go to the lowest darkness.

original: vatsaḥ virājaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ matīnām ā ruroha śukra pṛṣṭhaḥ antarikṣam / ghṛtena arkam abhi arcanti vatsam brahma santam brahmaṇā vardhayanti //
analyzed: vatsaḥ virājaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ matīnām ā ruroha śukra pṛṣṭhaḥ antarikṣam   ghṛtena arkam abhi arcanti vatsam brahma santam brahmaṇā vardhayanti  /
translated: The calf of Virāj, the bull of hymns, hath mounted to the region of the bright sky. They glorify the Sun with holy oil, the calf, the Brahman, with the Brahman they exalt.

original: divam ca roha pṛthivīm ca roha rāṣṭram ca roha draviṇam ca roha / prajām ca roha amṛtam ca roha rohitena tanvam sam spṛṣasva //
analyzed: divam ca roha pṛthivīm ca roha rāṣṭram ca roha draviṇam ca roha    prajām ca roha amṛtam ca roha rohitena tanvam sam spṛṣasva  /
translated: Rise to the heaven, rise to the earth, rise to the kingdom, rise to wealth. Rise to the people, rise to immortality. With the red fish touch thou thy body.

original: ye devāḥ rāṣṭrabhṛtaḥ abhitas yanti sūryam / taiḥ te rohitaḥ samvidānaḥ rāṣṭram dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ /
analyzed: ye devāḥ rāṣṭrabhṛtaḥ abhitas yanti sūryam   taiḥ te rohitaḥ samvidānaḥ rāṣṭram dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ  /
translated: The Gods who round about the Sun are bearers of the kingdom, with these accordant may the red fish give thee a kingdom, well-pleased.

original: ud tvā yajñāḥ brahma pūtāḥ vahanti adhva gataḥ harayaḥ tvā vahanti / tiras samudram ati rocase arṇavam /
analyzed: ud tvā yajñāḥ brahma pūtāḥ vahanti adhva gataḥ harayaḥ tvā vahanti    tiras samudram ati rocase arṇavam  /
translated: The sacrifices purified by prayer bear thee aloft, the tawny bearers bear thee on the path. Thou shinest over the sea, over the billowy deep.

original: rohite dyāvāpṛthivī adhi śrite vasu jiti go jiti saṃdhanājiti / sahasram yasya janimāni sapta ca voceyam te nābhim bhuvanasya adhi majmani //
analyzed: rohite dyāvāpṛthivī adhi śrite vasu jiti go jiti saṃdhanājiti  / sahasram yasya janimāni sapta ca voceyam te nābhim bhuvanasya adhi majmani  /
translated: O thou who dwellest on the red-hued heaven and earth, in the winning of wealth, of cattle, of treasures, whose generations are a thousand and seven, I will declare thy navel in the midst of the world.

original: yaśāḥ yāsi pradiśaḥ diśaḥ ca yaśāḥ paśūnām uta carṣaṇīnām / yaśāḥ pṛthivyāḥ adityāḥ upasthe aham bhūyāsam savitā iva cāruḥ /
analyzed: yaśāḥ yāsi pradiśaḥ diśaḥ ca yaśāḥ paśūnām uta carṣaṇīnām   yaśāḥ pṛthivyāḥ adityāḥ upasthe aham bhūyāsam savitā iva cāruḥ  /
translated: Thou art the glory of the regions and the points of the compass, the glory of cattle and of men. In the lap of Aditi, the glory of the earth, may I be beautiful as Savitar.

original: amutra san iha vettha itas san tāni paśyasi / itas paśyanti rocanam divi sūryam vipaścitam /
analyzed: amutra san iha vettha itas san tāni paśyasi    itas paśyanti rocanam divi sūryam vipaścitam  /
translated: Thou knowest him who is yonder, and he knoweth thee. From hence they see the light, the sun in heaven, the wise.🔽O God, thou thinkest on the Gods: within the ocean thou movest on. They kindle Agni common to all men: the sages know him well.🔽They kindle Agni common to all men: the sages know him well.🔽They kindle Agni common to all men: the sages know him well.🔽They kindle Agni common to all men: the sages know him well.
