analyzed: devaḥ devān marcayasi antar carasi arṇave    samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare   samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare   / samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare  / samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare  / samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare  / samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare  / samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare  / samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare  / samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ ka
translated: They kindle Agni common to all men: the sages know him well.🔽They kindle Agni common to all men: the sages know him well.🔽They kindle Agni common to all men: the sages know him well.

original: avas pareṇa paras enā avareṇa padā vatsam bibratī gauḥ ud asthāt / sā kadrīcī kam svid ardham parāgāt kva svid sūte nahi yūthe asmin /
analyzed: avas pareṇa paras enā avareṇa padā vatsam bibratī gauḥ ud asthāt    sā kadrīcī kam svid ardham parāgāt kva svid sūte nahi yūthe asmin  /
translated: With foot that treads the higher and the lower, the Cow that wears her calf hath risen erect. She hath gone far away, and where hath she lain down? Where hath she calved, not in this herd of ours?🔽

original: ekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpadī aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī / sahasra akṣarā bhuvanasya paṅktiḥ tasyāḥ samudrāḥ adhi vi kṣaranti /
analyzed: ekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpadī aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī    sahasra akṣarā bhuvanasya paṅktiḥ tasyāḥ samudrāḥ adhi vi kṣaranti  /
translated: With one foot, with two feet, with four feet, with eight feet, with nine feet hath she been made. The thousand-syllabled line of the world: from her the seas flow forth in streams.

original: ārohan dyām amṛtaḥ prāva me vacaḥ / ud tvā yajñāḥ brahma pūtāḥ vahanti adhva gataḥ harayaḥ tvā vahanti //
analyzed: ārohan dyām amṛtaḥ prāva me vacaḥ    ud tvā yajñāḥ brahma pūtāḥ vahanti adhva gataḥ harayaḥ tvā vahanti  /
translated: Ascending to the sky, immortal, my speech hath grown great. The sacrifices purified by prayer bear thee up, the swift-moving bays bear thee.

original: veda tat te amartya yat te ākramaṇam divi / yat te sadhastham parame vyoman /
analyzed: veda tat te amartya yat te ākramaṇam divi   yat te sadhastham parame vyoman  /
translated: I know that of thine, O Immortal One, which is thy station in the sky, which is thy seat in the highest firmament.

original: sūryaḥ dyām sūryaḥ pṛṭhivīm sūryaḥ āpaḥ ati paśyati / sūryaḥ bhūtasya ekam cakṣuḥ ā ruroha divam mahīm /
analyzed: sūryaḥ dyām sūryaḥ pṛṭhivīm sūryaḥ āpaḥ ati paśyati    sūryaḥ bhūtasya ekam cakṣuḥ ā ruroha divam mahīm  /
translated: The sun hath looked upon the sky, the sun hath looked upon the earth, the sun hath looked upon the waters. The sun is the one eye of every being. He hath mounted the sky and the earth.

original: urvīḥ āsan paridhayaḥ vediḥ bhūmiḥ akalpata / tatra etau agnī ādhatta himam ghraṃsam ca rohitaḥ /
analyzed: urvīḥ āsan paridhayaḥ vediḥ bhūmiḥ akalpata   tatra etau agnī ādhatta himam ghraṃsam ca rohitaḥ  /
translated: The enclosing-sticks were wide apart, the altar was the earth. There the red steed laid down these two fires, the frost and the snow.

original: himam ghraṃsam ca ādhāya yūpān kṛtvā parvatān / varṣa ājyau agnī ījāte rohitasya svarvidaḥ /
analyzed: himam ghraṃsam ca ādhāya yūpān kṛtvā parvatān    varṣa ājyau agnī ījāte rohitasya svarvidaḥ  /
translated: Having placed the snow and the frost, and made the mountains the sacrificial posts, the two Agnis, rain and clarified butter, sacrificed to Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: svarvidaḥ rohitasya brahmaṇā agniḥ sam idhyate / tasmāt ghraṃsaḥ tasmāt dhimaḥ tasmāt yajñaḥ ajāyata /
analyzed: svarvidaḥ rohitasya brahmaṇā agniḥ sam idhyate   tasmāt ghraṃsaḥ tasmāt dhimaḥ tasmāt yajñaḥ ajāyata  /
translated: The finder of heaven, Rohita, by Brahman is Agni kindled. From him the frost, from him the snow, from him the sacrifice was born.

original: brahmaṇā agnī vāvṛdhānau brahma vṛddhau brahma āhutau / brahma iddhau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇā agnī vāvṛdhānau brahma vṛddhau brahma āhutau    brahma iddhau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ  /
translated: By Brahman the two Agnis have grown great, by Brahman they have waxed strong, by Brahman they have been worshipped. By Brahman the two Agnis, kindled, sacrificed to Rohita, the finder of heaven.

analyzed: agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ
translated: The two Agnis, kindled, sacrificed to Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: yam vātaḥ pariśumbhati yam vā indraḥ brahmaṇaspatiḥ / brahma iddhau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ /
analyzed: yam vātaḥ pariśumbhati yam vā indraḥ brahmaṇaspatiḥ   brahma iddhau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ  /
translated: Whom the wind fans, whom Indra, the lord of prayer, whom the gods, the Maruts, the singers, have fanned, by Brahman the two Agnis, kindled, sacrificed to Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: vedim bhūmim kalpayitvā divam kṛtvā dakṣiṇām / ghraṃsam tat agnim kṛtvā cakāra viśvam ātmanvat varṣeṇa ājyena rohitaḥ /
analyzed: vedim bhūmim kalpayitvā divam kṛtvā dakṣiṇām   ghraṃsam tat agnim kṛtvā cakāra viśvam ātmanvat varṣeṇa ājyena rohitaḥ  /
translated: Having made the earth the altar, the heaven the sacrificial fee, having made the frost the Agni, he made all things full of soul with the rain, with the clarified butter, Rohita.

original: varṣam ājam ghraṃsaḥ agniḥ vediḥ bhūmiḥ akalpata / tatra etān parvatān agniḥ gīrbhiḥ ūrdhvām akalpayat /
analyzed: varṣam ājam ghraṃsaḥ agniḥ vediḥ bhūmiḥ akalpata   tatra etān parvatān agniḥ gīrbhiḥ ūrdhvām akalpayat  /
translated: The rain, the clarified butter, the frost, the Agni, the earth was made the altar. There Agni, with the hymns, made the mountains rise upwards.

original: gīrbhiḥ ūrdhvān kalpayitvā rohitaḥ bhūmim abravīt / tvayi idam sarvam jāyatām yat bhūtam yat ca bhāvyam //
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ ūrdhvān kalpayitvā rohitaḥ bhūmim abravīt   tvayi idam sarvam jāyatām yat bhūtam yat ca bhāvyam  /
translated: Having raised them up with hymns, the Red One spake to Earth: 'In thee let all this be produced, all that is and all that is to be.'

original: sa yajñaḥ prathamaḥ bhūtaḥ bhavyaḥ ajāyata / tasmāt ha jajñe idam sarvam yat kim ca idam virocate rohitena ṛṣiṇā ābhṛtam /
analyzed: sa yajñaḥ prathamaḥ bhūtaḥ bhavyaḥ ajāyata   tasmāt ha jajñe idam sarvam yat kim ca idam virocate rohitena ṛṣiṇā ābhṛtam  /
translated: That sacrifice, the first-born, was born, the past and future. From him was born this all that shineth. It was brought by the sage Rohita.

original: yaḥ ca gām padā sphurati pratyaṅ sūryam ca mehati / tasya vṛścāmi te mūlam na chāyām karavaḥ aparam /
analyzed: yaḥ ca gām padā sphurati pratyaṅ sūryam ca mehati   tasya vṛścāmi te mūlam na chāyām karavaḥ aparam  /
translated: I cut away the root of him who kicks with his foot and spits against the sun. I make no shadow for him.

original: yaḥ mā abhichāyam atyeṣi mām ca agnim ca antarā / tasya vṛścāmi te mūlam na chāyām karavaḥ aparam /
analyzed: yaḥ mā abhichāyam atyeṣi mām ca agnim ca antarā   / tasya vṛścāmi te mūlam na chāyām karavaḥ aparam  /
translated: I cut away the root of him who passeth by, who passeth between me and the fire. I make no shadow for him.

original: yaḥ adya deva sūrya tvām ca mām ca antarāyati / duṣvapnyam tasmim śamalam duritāni ca mṛjmahe //
analyzed: yaḥ adya deva sūrya tvām ca mām ca antarāyati     duṣvapnyam tasmim śamalam duritāni ca mṛjmahe  /
translated: I wipe away from him, O God Surya, who to-day passeth between thee and me, evil dreams, impurity, and all misfortune.

original: mā pra gāma pathaḥ vayam mā yajñāt indra sominaḥ / mānta sthuḥ naḥ arātayaḥ /
analyzed: mā pra gāma pathaḥ vayam mā yajñāt indra sominaḥ   mā anta sthuḥ naḥ arātayaḥ  /
translated: Let us not go astray from the path, O Indra, from the Soma sacrifice. Let not the evil spirits stay us.

original: yaḥ yajñasya prasādhanaḥ tantuḥ deveṣu ātataḥ / tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āhutam aśīmahi // tam āh
analyzed: yaḥ yajñasya prasādhanaḥ tantuḥ deveṣu ātataḥ   tam āhutam aśīmahi   tam āhutam aśīmahi
translated: May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽May we obtain that offered oblation.🔽His bright and shining rays ascend to heaven, the rays of Sûrya, he who looks on men,

original: ud asya ketavaḥ divi śukrāḥ bhrājantaḥ īrate / ādityasya nṛ cakṣasaḥ mahivratasya mīḍhuṣaḥ /
analyzed: ud asya ketavaḥ divi śukrāḥ bhrājantaḥ īrate    ādityasya nṛ cakṣasaḥ mahivratasya mīḍhuṣaḥ  /
translated: Of him of mighty sway, the bounteous God,–🔽The bird who with his flame directs the regions, the bird with goodly wings who flies through ocean,–

original: diśām prajñānām svarayantam arciṣā su pakṣam āśum patayantam arṇave / stavāma sūryam bhuvanasya gopām yaḥ raśmibhiḥ diśaḥ ābhāti sarvāḥ /
analyzed: diśām prajñānām svarayantam arciṣā su pakṣam āśum patayantam arṇave    stavāma sūryam bhuvanasya gopām yaḥ raśmibhiḥ diśaḥ ābhāti sarvāḥ  /
translated: We will extol Sûrya, the Guardian of the world, who with his rays illumes all regions of the sky.

original: yat prāṅ pratyaṅ svadhayā yāsi śībham nānā rūpe ahanī karṣi māyayā / tat āditya mahi tat te mahi śravaḥ yat ekaḥ viśvam pari bhūma jāyase /
analyzed: yat prāṅ pratyaṅ svadhayā yāsi śībham nānā rūpe ahanī karṣi māyayā   tat āditya mahi tat te mahi śravaḥ yat ekaḥ viśvam pari bhūma jāyase  /
translated: This, O Âditya, is thy greatness, this thy glory, that thou art born alone to overspread the whole wide earth.

original: vipaścitam taraṇim bhrājamānam vahanti yam haritaḥ sapta bahvīḥ / srutāt yam attriḥ divam unnināya tam tvā paśyanti pariyāntam ājim //
analyzed: vipaścitam taraṇim bhrājamānam vahanti yam haritaḥ sapta bahvīḥ   srutāt yam attriḥ divam unnināya tam tvā paśyanti pariyāntam ājim  /
translated: The seven bay steeds bear him the Sage, the Swift, the Shining One, the Many. He whom Atri brought from the stream to the sky, — they see thee going round the race-course.

original: mā tvā dabhan pariyāntam ājim svasti durgām ati yāhi śībham / divam ca sūrya pṛthivīm ca devīm ahar rātre vimimānaḥ yat eṣi //🔽svasti te sūrya carase rathāya yena ubhau antau pariyāsi sadyas / yam te vahanti haritaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvāḥ yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ /
analyzed: mā tvā dabhan pariyāntam ājim svasti durgām ati yāhi śībham    divam ca sūrya pṛthivīm ca devīm ahar rātre vimimānaḥ yat eṣi  / svasti te sūrya carase rathāya yena ubhau antau pariyāsi sadyas    yam te vahanti haritaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvāḥ yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ  /
translated: Let not the demons harm thee as thou goest round the race-course. Pass safely and swiftly over the difficult places. When thou goest, measuring day and night, the heaven and the earth, O Sun.🔽Hail to thy course, O Sun, and to thy chariot, whereby thou goest round to both the ends at once. Him whom thy best, thy fleetest, steeds, the tawny ones, bear, a hundred horses or, it may be, many more.

original: sukham sūrya ratham aṃśumantam syonam su vahnim adhi tiṣṭha vājinam / yam te vahanti haritaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvāḥ yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ /
analyzed: sukham sūrya ratham aṃśumantam syonam su vahnim adhi tiṣṭha vājinam    yam te vahanti haritaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvāḥ yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ  /
translated: O Sun, sit down on thy pleasant chariot, rich in rays, easy to ride, well-guided, strong, which thy best, thy fleetest, steeds, the tawny ones, bear, a hundred horses or, it may be, many more.

original: sapta sūryaḥ haritaḥ yātave rathe hiraṇya tvacasaḥ bṛhatīḥ ayukta / amoci śukraḥ rajasaḥ parastāt vidhūya devaḥ tamaḥ divam āruhat //
analyzed: sapta sūryaḥ haritaḥ yātave rathe hiraṇya tvacasaḥ bṛhatīḥ ayukta    amoci śukraḥ rajasaḥ parastāt vidhūya devaḥ tamaḥ divam āruhat  /
translated: The seven ruddy Suns hath he yoked to his golden-hued chariot, to travel through the vast expanse of heaven. The bright God hath loosed himself from the region of the sky, and, shaking off the darkness, hath ascended to heaven.

original: ud ketunā bṛhatā devaḥ āgan apāvṛk tamaḥ abhi jyotiḥ aśrait / divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sa vīraḥ vi akhyat aditeḥ putraḥ bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: ud ketunā bṛhatā devaḥ āgan apāvṛk tamaḥ abhi jyotiḥ aśrait    divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sa vīraḥ vi akhyat aditeḥ putraḥ bhuvanāni viśvā  /
translated: The God hath come with his great ensign, and hath opened the darkness, and hath looked upon the light. The divine eagle, the son of Aditi, hath spread out all the worlds.

original: udyan raśmīn ā tanuṣe viśvā rupāṇi puṣyasi / ubhā samudrau kratunā vi bhāsi sarvān lokān paribhūḥ bhrājamānaḥ //
analyzed: udyan raśmīn ā tanuṣe viśvā rupāṇi puṣyasi   ubhā samudrau kratunā vi bhāsi sarvān lokān paribhūḥ bhrājamānaḥ  /
translated: Rising, thou stretchest out thy rays, and causest all forms to wax. With might thou shinest over both the worlds of life. Thou, shining, hast overspread all the regions of the world.

original: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyayā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ arṇavam / viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe hairaṇyaiḥ anyam haritaḥ vahanti //
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyayā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ arṇavam    viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe hairaṇyaiḥ anyam haritaḥ vahanti  /
translated: These two, moving in opposite directions by their power, as children playing round the ocean, go their way. One of them looks over all the worlds. The other is borne by the golden-hued horses.

original: divi tvāttris adhārayat sūryā māsāya kartave / saḥ eṣi su dhṛtaḥ tapan viśvā bhūtā avacākaśat /
analyzed: divi tvāttris adhārayat sūryā māsāya kartave    saḥ eṣi su dhṛtaḥ tapan viśvā bhūtā avacākaśat  /
translated: In heaven the three Sûryas have established thee, to be the light of the month. Well-supported, thou goest forth, shining, and lookest down upon all things.

original: ubhau antau sam arṣasi vatsaḥ saṃmātarau iva / nanu etat itas purā brahma devāḥ amī viduḥ /
analyzed: ubhau antau sam arṣasi vatsaḥ saṃmātarau iva    nanu etat itas purā brahma devāḥ amī viduḥ  /
translated: Thou shinest between both the ends, as a calf between its two dams. Even this, before this, the gods have known, the Brahman, the immortal.

original: yat samudram anu śritam tat siṣāsati sūryaḥ / adhvā asya vitataḥ mahān pūrvaḥ ca aparaḥ ca yaḥ /
analyzed: yat samudram anu śritam tat siṣāsati sūryaḥ   adhvā asya vitataḥ mahān pūrvaḥ ca aparaḥ ca yaḥ  /
translated: His path is spread out far and wide, the path that leads to east and west.🔽He gains it by his rapid speed, and then no more is he beheld:

original: tam sam āpnoti jūtibhiḥ tatas na apa cikitsati / tena amṛtasya bhakṣam devānām na ava rundhate //🔽ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ / dṛśe viśvāya sūryam //
analyzed: tam sam āpnoti jūtibhiḥ tatas na apa cikitsati    tena amṛtasya bhakṣam devānām na ava rundhate  / ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ    dṛśe viśvāya sūryam  /
translated: So they, the Immortals, never shut the Gods' enjoyment of the draught.🔽The banners bear on high that God, the all-observing Sûrya, up,🔽That he may look on all the world.🔽As the light-giving stars of heaven move on in their appointed course,

original: apa tye tāyavaḥ yathā nakṣatrāḥ yanti aktubhiḥ / sūrāya viśva cakṣase /
analyzed: apa tye tāyavaḥ yathā nakṣatrāḥ yanti aktubhiḥ   sūrāya viśva cakṣase  /
translated: To Sûrya, the all-seeing One.🔽His rays are seen, his banners spread among the people, as they move,

original: adṛśran asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janām anu / bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā /
analyzed: adṛśran asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janām anu bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā
translated: Shining like flames of burnished gold.🔽O Sûrya, thou art he who gives all life, all-seeing, light-bestower:

original: taraṇiḥ viśva darśataḥ jyotiṣkṛt asi sūrya / viśvam ā bhāsi rocana /
analyzed: taraṇiḥ viśva darśataḥ jyotiṣkṛt asi sūrya   viśvam ā bhāsi rocana
translated: Thou shinest out upon all life.

original: pratyaṅ devānām viśaḥ pratyaṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // // // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe // / pratyaṅ viśvam🔽yena pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantam janām anu / tvam varuṇa paśyasi //
analyzed: pratyaṅ devānām viśaḥ pratyaṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ    pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 yena pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantam janām anu   tvam varuṇa paśyasi  /
translated: Thou goest to the tribes of Gods, thou goest to the tribes of men,🔽To look on all the world of light.🔽With what bright eye thou lookest down upon the people as they move,

original: vi dyām eṣi rajaḥ pṛthu ahar mimānaḥ aktubhiḥ / paśyan janmāni sūrya //
analyzed: vi dyām eṣi rajaḥ pṛthu ahar mimānaḥ aktubhiḥ   paśyan janmāni sūrya
translated: O Varuṇa, thou lookest down.🔽Thou goest through the spacious realm of heaven, measuring with thy rays,🔽Beholding, O Sûrya, all the world of light.

original: sapta tvā haritaḥ rathe vahanti deva sūrya / śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇam /
analyzed: sapta tvā haritaḥ rathe vahanti deva sūrya    śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇam  /
translated: Seven tawny coursers bring thee on thy car, O God Sûrya,🔽Him of the golden hair, the very wise.

original: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūraḥ rathasya naptyaḥ / tābhiḥ yāti sva yuktibhiḥ //
analyzed: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūraḥ rathasya naptyaḥ   tābhiḥ yāti sva yuktibhiḥ
translated: The seven bright maidens of the Sun's car are yoked,🔽Wherewith he travels, well-yoked, to his appointed place.

original: rohitaḥ divam āruhat tapasā tapasvī / sa yonim aiti saḥ u jāyate punar sa devānām adhipatiḥ babhūva //
analyzed: rohitaḥ divam āruhat tapasā tapasvī   sa yonim aiti saḥ u jāyate punar sa devānām adhipatiḥ babhūva  /
translated: The red one hath ascended to the sky, the ascetic through his fervour. He goeth to his birthplace, and is born again. He hath become the Sovran Lord of Gods.

original: yaḥ viśvacarṣaṇiḥ uta viśvatomukhaḥ yaḥ viśvataspāṇiḥ uta viśvataspṛthaḥ / sam bāhubhyām bharati sam patatraiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī janayan devaḥ ekaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvacarṣaṇiḥ uta viśvatomukhaḥ yaḥ viśvataspāṇiḥ uta viśvataspṛthaḥ    sam bāhubhyām bharati sam patatraiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī janayan devaḥ ekaḥ  /
translated: He who hath all men for his face, who hath all men for his hands and feet, who hath all men for his sides, the God who with his arms and wings spreadeth out heaven and earth, and bringeth them together, he alone is the Father of all.

original: eka pād dvipadaḥ bhūyaḥ vi cakrame dvipād tripādam abhi eti paścāt / dvipād ha ṣaṣ padaḥ bhūyaḥ vi cakrame te eka padaḥ tanvam sam āsate /
analyzed: eka pād dvipadaḥ bhūyas vi cakrame dvipād tripādam abhi eti paścāt   dvipād ha ṣaṣ padaḥ bhūyas vi cakrame te eka padaḥ tanvam sam āsate  /
translated: The one-footed one hath stepped beyond the two-footed one; the two-footed one hath stepped beyond the three-footed one from behind. The two-footed one hath stepped beyond the four-footed one; the one-footed one and the two-footed one have come together in their body.

original: atandraḥ yāsyan haritaḥ yat āsthāt dve rūpe kṛṇute rocamānaḥ / ketumān udyan sahamānaḥ rajāṃsi viśvāḥ āditya pravataḥ vi bhāsi //
analyzed: atandraḥ yāsyan haritaḥ yat āsthāt dve rūpe kṛṇute rocamānaḥ   ketumān udyan sahamānaḥ rajāṃsi viśvāḥ āditya pravataḥ vi bhāsi  /
translated: When the sleepless one, the green-hued one, hath mounted, he maketh two forms, shining forth. The bannered one, rising, overcoming the regions, thou shinest forth, O Âditya, on all the mountains.

original: baṭ mahām asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahām asi / mahān te mahataḥ mahimā tvam āditya mahām asi /
analyzed: baṭ mahām asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahām asi    mahān te mahataḥ mahimā tvam āditya mahām asi  /
translated: Great art thou, O Sûrya, great, O Âditya, art thou. Great is thy greatness, O thou Great One, O Âditya, thou art great.

analyzed: tigmaḥ vibhrājan tanvam śiśānaḥ araṃgamāsaḥ pravataḥ rarāṇaḥ   jyotiṣmān pakṣī mahiṣaḥ vayodhāḥ viśvāḥ āsthāt pradiśaḥ kalpamānaḥ  /
translated: The luminous bird, the mighty one, the life-giver, having attained all the quarters, being formed.🔽The wonderful banner and army of the gods, the luminous sun rising to the quarters,

original: citram devānām ketuḥ anīkam jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūryaḥ udyan / divākaraḥ ati dyumnaiḥ tamāṃsi viśvātārīt duritāni śukraḥ /
analyzed: citram devānām ketuḥ anīkam jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūryaḥ udyan    divākaraḥ ati dyumnaiḥ tamāṃsi viśvātārīt duritāni śukraḥ  /
translated: The sun, with his bright rays, has dispelled the darkness, the pure one has driven away all evils.🔽The wonderful army of the gods has risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.

original: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ / āprāt dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca /
analyzed: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ    āprāt dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca  /
translated: The sun has reached the heaven, the earth, and the atmosphere. The sun is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.🔽We see thee, O Savitar, whom they call the soaring, red-winged one, in the middle of the sky, the swift one, shining,

original: uccā patantam aruṇam suparṇam madhye divaḥ taraṇim bhrājamānam / paśyama tvā savitāram yam āhuḥ ajasram jyotiḥ yat avindat attriḥ /
analyzed: uccā patantam aruṇam suparṇam madhye divaḥ taraṇim bhrājamānam   paśyama tvā savitāram yam āhuḥ ajasram jyotiḥ yat avindat attriḥ  /
translated: The ceaseless light which Atri found.🔽I, fearing, longing for a protector, approach the bird, the son of Aditi, running on the back of the sky, the swift one.

original: divaḥ pṛṣṭhe dhāvamānam suparṇam adityāḥ putram nātha kāmaḥ upa yāmi bhītaḥ / sa naḥ sūrya pra tira dīrgham āyuḥ mā riṣāma sumatau te syāma /
analyzed: divaḥ pṛṣṭhe dhāvamānam suparṇam adityāḥ putram nātha kāmaḥ upa yāmi bhītaḥ   sa naḥ sūrya pra tira dīrgham āyuḥ mā riṣāma sumatau te syāma  /
translated: O Surya, grant us long life. May we be in thy favour, free from sin.

original: sahasrāhṇyam viyatau asya pakṣau hareḥ haṃsasya patataḥ svargam / sa devān sarvān urasi upadadya saṃpaśyan yāti bhuvanāni viśvā /🔽rohitaḥ kālaḥ abhavat rohitaḥ agre prajāpatiḥ / rohitaḥ yajñānām mukham rohitaḥ svar ābharat //

translated: The earth is upheld by truth, the sky is upheld by the sun. The Ādityas stand by the Ṛte, the moon is established in the sky.

original: somena ādityāḥ balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī / atha u nakṣatrāṇām eṣām upasthe somaḥ āhitaḥ /
analyzed: somena ādityāḥ balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī    atha u nakṣatrāṇām eṣām upasthe somaḥ āhitaḥ  /
translated: The Ādityas are strong by the Soma, the earth is great by the Soma. And the Soma is placed in the lap of these stars.

original: somam manyate papivān yat saṃpiṃṣanti oṣadhim / somam yam brahmāṇaḥ viduḥ na tasya aśnāti pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: somam manyate papivān yat saṃpiṃṣanti oṣadhim    somam yam brahmāṇaḥ viduḥ na tasya aśnāti pārthivaḥ  /
translated: He who drinks the Soma thinks, 'When they crush the plant, they crush the Soma.' The Soma which the Brāhmaṇas know, of that the earthly one does not eat.

original: yat tvā soma prapibanti tatas ā pyāyase punar / vāyuḥ somasya rakṣitā samānām māsaḥ ākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: yat tvā soma prapibanti tatas ā pyāyase punar   vāyuḥ somasya rakṣitā samānām māsaḥ ākṛtiḥ
translated: When they drink thee, O Soma, then thou swellest again. Vāyu is the protector of Soma, the month is the form of the equal ones.

original: āchad vidhānaiḥ gupitaḥ bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ / grāvṇām id śṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: āchad vidhānaiḥ gupitaḥ bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ   grāvṇām id śṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ  /
translated: Thou art concealed by the Barhis rites, O Soma, thou art guarded. Thou standest, listening, in the mortar: the earthly one cannot devour thee.

original: cittiḥ āḥ upabarhaṇam cakṣuḥ āḥ abhyañjanam / dyauḥ bhūmiḥ kośe āsīt yat ayāt sūryā patim /
analyzed: cittiḥ āḥ upabarhaṇam cakṣuḥ āḥ abhyañjanam   dyauḥ bhūmiḥ kośe āsīt yat ayāt sūryā patim  /
translated: Thought is thy pillow, sight thy ointment. The heaven and earth were the case when Surya went to her lord.

original: raibhī āsīt anudeyī nārāśaṃsī nyocanī / suryāyāḥ bhadram id vāsaḥ gāthayati pariṣkṛtā /

translated: The Rāibhi was her attendant, the Nārāśaṁsī her attendant who milked the cow. The well-adorned song praises the auspicious robe of Sūryā.

translated: The hymns were the counter-hymns, the metre Opaśa was the girdle. The Asvins were the two excellent horses of Sūryā, Agni was the leader.

original: somaḥ vadhūyuḥ abhavat aśvinā āstām ubhā varā / sūryām yat patye śaṃsantīm manasā savitā adadāt /
analyzed: somaḥ vadhūyuḥ abhavat aśvinā āstām ubhā varā   sūryām yat patye śaṃsantīm manasā savitā adadāt  /

analyzed: ṛc sāmābhyām abhihitau gāvau te sāmanau aitām   śrotre te cakre āstām divi panthāḥ carācaraḥ
translated: The two oxen are mentioned by the Ṛc and Sāman, the two Sāman verses went to you. The two ears were your wheels, the path in the sky is moving and unmoving.

original: śucī te cakre yātyā vyānaḥ akṣaḥ āhataḥ / anaḥ manasmayam sūryā ārohat prayatī patim /
analyzed: śucī te cakre yātyā vyānaḥ akṣaḥ āhataḥ   anaḥ manasmayam sūryā ārohat prayatī patim  /
translated: Your wheels are pure, the exhalation goes, the axle is struck. The chariot made of mind of Surya went to her husband, striving.

analyzed: sūryāyāḥ vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yam avāsṛjat   maghāsu hanyante gāvaḥ phalgunīṣu vi uhyate  /
translated: From the carrying of Surya, Savitar has let loose the one who went. The cows are killed in the Magha (lunar mansion), in the Phalguni (lunar mansion) they are scattered.

In the womb of holy order, in the world of the righteous, be thou propitious to Sahasrabhala.

analyzed: bhagaḥ tvā itas nayatu hasta gṛhya aśvinā tvā pra vahatām rathena    gṛhān gaccha gṛha patnī yathā asaḥ vaśinī tvam vidatham ā vadāsi       gṛhān gaccha gṛha patnī yathā asaḥ vaśinī tvam vidatham ā vadāsi  /
translated: Go to the house, a matron, as thou art, a mistress in thy home, and speak to us in the assembly.

original: iha priyam prajāyai te sam ṛdhyatām asmin gṛhe gārhapatyāya jāgṛhi / enā patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva atha jirviḥ vidatham ā vadāsi //
analyzed: iha priyam prajāyai te sam ṛdhyatām asmin gṛhe gārhapatyāya jāgṛhi   enā patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva atha jirviḥ vidatham ā vadāsi  /
translated: Here let thy love of offspring be fulfilled: in this house watch thou as mistress of the home. With this thy husband touch thou with thy body: then, O thou Jirvi, speak to us in the assembly.

original: iha eva stam mā vi yauṣṭam viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnutam / krīḍantau putraiḥ naptṛbhiḥ modamānau svastakau /
analyzed: iha eva stam mā vi yauṣṭam viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnutam   krīḍantau putraiḥ naptṛbhiḥ modamānau svastakau  /
translated: Here be ye joyful: win all life to its full measure. Sporting with sons and grandsons, rejoicing, happy,

original: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ arṇavam / viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe ṛtūṃr anyaḥ vidadhat jāyase navaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ arṇavam    viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe ṛtūṃr anyaḥ vidadhat jāyase navaḥ  /
translated: These two, moving in the east and west, are the two illusions. They, as two children, have gone round the sea.🔽One of them looks over all the worlds. The other, ordaining the seasons, is born anew.

original: navaḥ navaḥ bhavasi jāyamānaḥ ahnām ketuḥ uṣasām eṣi agram / bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāsi āyan pra candramaḥ tirase dīrgham āyuḥ /
analyzed: navaḥ navaḥ bhavasi jāyamānaḥ ahnām ketuḥ uṣasām eṣi agram    bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāsi āyan pra candramaḥ tirase dīrgham āyuḥ  /
translated: Ever new art thou when born. Thou goest as the ensign of the days before the dawn. Thou, as thou comest, dealest out the Gods their share. Thou, Moon, prolongest life with lengthened lustre.

original: parā dehi śāmulyam brahmabhyaḥ vi bhaja vasu / kṛtyā eṣā padvatī bhūtvā jāyā viśate patim /
analyzed: parā dehi śāmulyam brahmabhyaḥ vi bhaja vasu   kṛtyā eṣā padvatī bhūtvā jāyā viśate patim  /
translated: Give to the Brahmans the community's share. Deal out the wealth. This magic, having become a bird, enters the husband as a wife.

original: nīlalohitam bhavati kṛtyā āsaktiḥ vi ajyate / edhante asyāḥ jñātayaḥ patiḥ bandheṣu badhyate /
analyzed: nīlalohitam bhavati kṛtyā āsaktiḥ vi ajyate   edhante asyāḥ jñātayaḥ patiḥ bandheṣu badhyate  /
translated: It becomes blue and red. The magic bond is loosened. Her kinsmen prosper. The husband is bound in fetters.

original: aślīlā tanūḥ bhavati ruśatī pāpayā amuyā / patiḥ yat vadhvaḥ vāsasaḥ svam aṅgam abhyūrṇute /
analyzed: aślīlā tanūḥ bhavati ruśatī pāpayā amuyā   patiḥ yat vadhvaḥ vāsasaḥ svam aṅgam abhyūrṇute  /
translated: It becomes a body foul and loathsome, evil and wicked. When the husband rubs his own limbs with the bride's garment.

original: āśasanam viśasanam atho adhivikartanam / sūryāyāḥ paśya rūpāṇi tāni brahma uta śumbhati //
analyzed: āśasanam viśasanam atho adhivikartanam    sūryāyāḥ paśya rūpāṇi tāni brahma uta śumbhati  /
translated: The cutting, the incision, and the carving, behold the forms of Sûryâ. These the Brahman decks with ornament.

original: tṛṣṭam etat kaṭukam a pāṣṭhavat viṣavat na etat attave / sūryām yaḥ brahmā veda saḥ id vādhūyam arhati //
analyzed: tṛṣṭam etat kaṭukam a pāṣṭhavat viṣavat na etat attave   sūryām yaḥ brahmā veda saḥ id vādhūyam arhati  /
translated: This is bitter, pungent, like a razor's edge, like poison, not to be eaten. He who knows the Sûryâ as the Brahman, he alone is worthy to be the bridegroom.

original: saḥ id tat syonam harati brahmā vāsaḥ su maṅgalam / prāyaścittim yaḥ adhyeti yena jāyā na riṣyati // // //
analyzed: saḥ id tat syonam harati brahmā vāsaḥ su maṅgalam   prāyaścittim yaḥ adhyeti yena jāyā na riṣyati
translated: He, the Brahman, carries off this lovely garment, auspicious, the expiation which he studies, by which the wife is not destroyed.

original: yuvam bhagam sam bharatam samṛddham ṛtam vadantau ṛtodyeṣu / brahmaṇas pate patim asyai rocaya cāru saṃbhalaḥ vadatu vācam etām /🔽iha id asātha na paras gamātha imam gāvaḥ prajayā vardhayātha / śubham yatīḥ usriyāḥ soma varcasaḥ viśve devāḥ kran iha vaḥ manāṃsi //
analyzed: yuvam bhagam sam bharatam samṛddham ṛtam vadantau ṛtodyeṣu   brahmaṇas pate patim asyai rocaya cāru saṃbhalaḥ vadatu vācam etām  / iha id asātha na paras gamātha imam gāvaḥ prajayā vardhayātha    śubham yatīḥ usriyāḥ soma varcasaḥ viśve devāḥ kran iha vaḥ manāṃsi  /
translated: You two, O Bhaga, fill him with prosperity, speaking the truth in the assemblies of the truthful. O Lord of Brahmans, make him the husband of this (woman). Let the bridegroom speak this speech.🔽Here have you come, go not away again. O cows, increase this (man) with offspring. O you who go to the auspicious, who are full of Soma, O all ye gods, here let your minds be fixed.

original: imam gāvaḥ prajayā sam viśātha ayam devānām na mināti bhāgam / asmai vaḥ pūṣā marutaḥ ca sarve asmai vaḥ dhātā savitā suvāti //
analyzed: imam gāvaḥ prajayā sam viśātha ayam devānām na mināti bhāgam    asmai vaḥ pūṣā marutaḥ ca sarve asmai vaḥ dhātā savitā suvāti  /
translated: O cows, unite with this (man) with offspring and with a family. He does not violate the share of the gods. For you all, O Pûshan and the Maruts, for him let Dhâtar and Savitar send prosperity.

original: anṛkṣarāḥ ṛjavaḥ santu panthanaḥ yebhiḥ sakhāyaḥ yanti naḥ vareyam / sam bhagena sam aryamṇā sam dhātā sṛjatu varcasā /🔽yat ca varcaḥ akṣeṣu surāyām ca yat āhitam / yat goṣu aśvinā varcaḥ tena imām varcasā avatam /
analyzed: anṛkṣarāḥ ṛjavaḥ santu panthanaḥ yebhiḥ sakhāyaḥ yanti naḥ vareyam    sam bhagena sam aryamṇā sam dhātā sṛjatu varcasā  / yat ca varcaḥ akṣeṣu surāyām ca yat āhitam   yat goṣu aśvinā varcaḥ tena imām varcasā avatam  /
translated: Let the paths be free from ruggedness, straight, by which our friends go to the choice-worthy place. With prosperity, with nobility, with the Ordainer, may he unite with splendour.🔽The splendour that is in the eyes and that which is in the Surâ,🔽The splendour that is in the cows, O Aśvins, with that splendour do ye sprinkle this (woman).🔽With that wherewith ye slew the great dragon, O Aśvins, with that wherewith ye slew the demon,

original: yena mahānaghnyā jaghanam aśvinā yena vā surā / yena akṣāḥ abhyaṣicyanta tena imām varcasā avatam /
analyzed: yena mahānaghnyā jaghanam aśvinā yena vā surā    yena akṣāḥ abhyaṣicyanta tena imām varcasā avatam  /
translated: With that wherewith the dice were sprinkled, with that splendour do ye sprinkle this (woman).🔽He who shines without fuel in the waters, whom the sages invoke at the sacrifices,

original: yaḥ anidhmaḥ dīdayat apsu antar yam viprāsaḥ īḍate adhvareṣu / apām napāt madhumatīḥ apaḥ dāḥ yābhiḥ indraḥ vāvṛdhe vīryāvān /
analyzed: yaḥ anidhmaḥ dīdayat apsu antar yam viprāsaḥ īḍate adhvareṣu    apām napāt madhumatīḥ apaḥ dāḥ yābhiḥ indraḥ vāvṛdhe vīryāvān  /
translated: O son of the waters, give waters rich in sweetness, wherewith Indra waxed strong in hero might.

original: idam aham ruśantam grābham tanū dūṣim apohāmi / yaḥ bhadraḥ rocanaḥ tam ud acāmi //
analyzed: idam aham ruśantam grābham tanū dūṣim apohāmi   yaḥ bhadraḥ rocanaḥ tam ud acāmi  /
translated: This I remove, the shining seizure, the disfigurer of the body, which is good, which shines. I cleanse it upwards.

original: ā asyai brāhmaṇāḥ snapanīḥ harantu avīra ghnīḥ ud ajantu āpaḥ / aryamṇaḥ agnim pari etu pūṣan pratīkṣante śvaśuraḥ devaraḥ ca /
analyzed: ā asyai brāhmaṇāḥ snapanīḥ harantu avīra ghnīḥ ud ajantu āpaḥ   aryamṇaḥ agnim pari etu pūṣan pratīkṣante śvaśuraḥ devaraḥ ca  /
translated: Let the Brahmans carry away for her the waters that destroy not the hero. Let the waters that give strength raise her up. Let Pûshan go round the fire of Aryaman. The father-in-law and the brother-in-law wait (for her).

original: śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva / / śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva / / śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva / / śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva / śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva / śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva / ś
analyzed: śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva            te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva         te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva        te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva       te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva      te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva
translated: May the waters be auspicious to thee, with a hundred purifiers. Be thou united with thy husband's body.🔽In the chariot's space, in the yoke's space, in the pole's space, O Indra, thou of a hundred powers,

original: khe rathasya khe anasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato / apālām indra tris pūtvā akṛṇoḥ sūrya tvacam /
analyzed: khe rathasya khe anasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato    apālām indra tris pūtvā akṛṇoḥ sūrya tvacam  /
translated: Thou hast made the sun's skin threefold, O Indra, the protector.🔽Desiring good will, offspring, good fortune, and wealth,

original: āśāsānā saumanasam prajām saubhāgyam rayim / patyuḥ anuvratā bhūtvā sam nahyasva amṛtāya kam /
analyzed: āśāsānā saumanasam prajām saubhāgyam rayim   patyuḥ anuvratā bhūtvā sam nahyasva amṛtāya kam  /
translated: Becoming obedient to thy husband, bind thyself for the sake of immortality.🔽As the mighty Sindhu begat on the rivers the universal sovereignty,

original: yathā sindhuḥ nadīnām sāmrājyam suṣuve vṛṣā / eva tvam samrājñī edhi patyuḥ astam paretya //
analyzed: yathā sindhuḥ nadīnām sāmrājyam suṣuve vṛṣā     eva tvam samrājñī edhi patyuḥ astam paretya  /
translated: Even so do thou become a queen, O woman, after thou hast gone to thy husband's house.

original: samrājñī edhi śvaśureṣu samrājñī uta devṛṣu / nanānduḥ samrājñī edhi samrājñī uta śvaśrvāḥ /
analyzed: samrājñī edhi śvaśureṣu samrājñī uta devṛṣu   nanānduḥ samrājñī edhi samrājñī uta śvaśrvāḥ
translated: Be a queen among your fathers-in-law, a queen among the kinsmen of thy lord. Be a queen among thy mothers-in-law, a queen among thy sisters-in-law.

original: yāḥ akṛntan avayan yāḥ ca tatnire yāḥ devīḥ antām abhitas adadanta / tāḥ tvā jarase sam vyayantu āyuṣmatī idam pari dhatsva vāsaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ akṛntan avayan yāḥ ca tatnire yāḥ devīḥ antām abhitas adadanta    tāḥ tvā jarase sam vyayantu āyuṣmatī idam pari dhatsva vāsaḥ  /
translated: Those who have spun and woven, those who have made the cloth, those Goddesses who have given the borders on both sides, may they bestow thee on thy husband for a long life. Thou, being long-lived, put on this garment.

original: jīvam rudanti vi nayanti adhvaram dīrghām anu prasitim dīdhyuḥ naraḥ / vāmam pitṛbhyaḥ ye idam samīrire mayaḥ patibhyaḥ janaye pariṣvaje /
analyzed: jīvam rudanti vi nayanti adhvaram dīrghām anu prasitim dīdhyuḥ naraḥ    vāmam pitṛbhyaḥ ye idam samīrire mayaḥ patibhyaḥ janaye pariṣvaje  /
translated: They weep for the living, they lead the sacrifice away; the men have made a long preparation. The good thing which they have sent to the Fathers, the joy which they have sent to the lords of the house, embrace it.

original: syonam dhruvam prajāyai dhārayāmi te aśmānam devyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ upasthe / tam ā tiṣṭha anumādyā su varcāḥ dīrgham te āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu //
analyzed: syonam dhruvam prajāyai dhārayāmi te aśmānam devyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ upasthe   tam ā tiṣṭha anumādyā su varcāḥ dīrgham te āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu  /
translated: I place for thee the smooth stone, firm, for the sake of offspring, on the lap of the Goddess Earth. Step thou on it, O thou of good face, without being faint-hearted. Let Savitar make thy life long.

original: yena agniḥ asyāḥ bhūmyāḥ hastam jagrāha dakṣiṇam / tena gṛhṇāmi te hastam mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ mayā saha prajayā ca dhanena ca /
analyzed: yena agniḥ asyāḥ bhūmyāḥ hastam jagrāha dakṣiṇam   tena gṛhṇāmi te hastam mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ mayā saha prajayā ca dhanena ca  /
translated: With that right hand wherewith thou, O Agni, hast taken hold of this earth's right hand, therewith I take thy hand. Be not thou faint-hearted with me, with offspring and with wealth.

original: devaḥ te savitā hastam gṛhṇātu somaḥ rājā suprajasam kṛṇotu / agniḥ subhagām jatavedāḥ patye patnīm jaradaṣṭim kṛṇotu //
analyzed: devaḥ te savitā hastam gṛhṇātu somaḥ rājā suprajasam kṛṇotu   agniḥ subhagām jatavedāḥ patye patnīm jaradaṣṭim kṛṇotu  /
translated: May Savitar the God take thy hand, may Soma, the King, make thee rich in noble sons. May Agni, the all-knowing, make thee happy, a wife to thy husband, with life that lasts a hundred winters.

original: gṛhṇāmi te saubhaga tvāya hastam mayā patyā jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asaḥ / bhagaḥ aryamā savitā puraṃdhiḥ mahyam tvā aduḥ gārhapatyāya devāḥ // bhagaḥ aryamā savitā puraṃdhiḥ mahyam tvā aduḥ gārhapatyāya devāḥ // // bhagaḥ aryamā savitā puraṃdhiḥ mahyam tvā aduḥ gārhapatyāya devāḥ // //
analyzed: gṛhṇāmi te saubhaga tvāya hastam mayā patyā jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asaḥ  / bhagaḥ aryamā savitā puraṃdhiḥ mahyam tvā aduḥ gārhapatyāya devāḥ   bhagaḥ aryamā savitā puraṃdhiḥ mahyam tvā aduḥ gārhapatyāya devāḥ             /
translated: I take thy hand for good luck. Be thou a wife to me, and live a hundred winters. Bhaga, Aryaman, Savitar, the Goddess of the house, have given thee to me for my house-wife.

original: bhagaḥ te hastam agrahīt savitā hastam agrahīt / patnī tvam asi dharmaṇā aham gṛhapatiḥ tava /
analyzed: bhagaḥ te hastam agrahīt savitā hastam agrahīt   patnī tvam asi dharmaṇā aham gṛhapatiḥ tava  /
translated: Bhaga took thy hand, Savitar took thy hand. Thou art a wife by law, I am thy house-lord.

original: mama iyam astu poṣyā mahyam tvā adāt bṛhaspatiḥ / mayā patyā prajāvati sam jīva śaradaḥ śatam /
analyzed: mama iyam astu poṣyā mahyam tvā adāt bṛhaspatiḥ   mayā patyā prajāvati sam jīva śaradaḥ śatam  /
translated: Let her be mine to cherish. Brihaspati gave her to me. With me as thy husband, rich in children, live a hundred autumns.

original: tvaṣṭā vāsaḥ vi adadhāt śubhe kam bṛhaspateḥ praśiṣā kavīnām / tena imām nārīm savitā bhagaḥ ca sūryām iva pari dhattām prajayā /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā vāsaḥ vi adadhāt śubhe kam bṛhaspateḥ praśiṣā kavīnām    tena imām nārīm savitā bhagaḥ ca sūryām iva pari dhattām prajayā  /
translated: Tvashtar hath clothed her in a robe of beauty, by the direction of Brihaspati the sages. With this let Savitar and Bhaga clothe her, as 'twere the Sun's consort, with a progeny.

original: indra agnī dyāvāpṛthivī mātariśvā mitrāvaruṇā bhagaḥ aśvinā ubhā / bṛhaspatiḥ marutaḥ brahma somaḥ imām nārim prajayā vardhayantu //
analyzed: indra agnī dyāvāpṛthivī mātariśvā mitrāvaruṇā bhagaḥ aśvinā ubhā    bṛhaspatiḥ marutaḥ brahma somaḥ imām nārim prajayā vardhayantu  /
translated: Indra and Agni, Heaven and Earth, and Matarisvan, Mitra, Varuna, Bhaga, the Asvins twain, Brihaspati, the Maruts, Brahman, Soma, let these increase this woman with a progeny.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaḥ sūryāyāḥ śīrṣe keśām akalpayat / tena imām aśvinā nārīm patye sam śobhayāmasi //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaḥ sūryāyāḥ śīrṣe keśām akalpayat   tena imām aśvinā nārīm patye sam śobhayāmasi  /
translated: Brihaspati first on the head of Sûryâ arranged the tresses of her hair. With this we deck this woman for her husband's sake, O Asvins.

original: idam tat rūpam yat avasta yoṣā jāyām jijñāse manasā carantīm / tām anu artiṣye sakhibhiḥ navagvaiḥ kaḥ imān vidvān vi cacarta pāśān /
analyzed: idam tat rūpam yat avasta yoṣā jāyām jijñāse manasā carantīm    tām anu artiṣye sakhibhiḥ navagvaiḥ kaḥ imān vidvān vi cacarta pāśān  /
translated: This is the form which the young woman assumes when she, the wife, moves about with mind intent on finding a lover. I will win her with friends of the Navagva class. Who, knowing this, has loosed these bonds asunder?

original: aham vi syāmi mayi rūpam asyāḥ vedat id paśyat manasaḥ kulāyam / na steyam admi manasā ud amucye svayam śrathnānaḥ varuṇasya pāśān /
analyzed: aham vi syāmi mayi rūpam asyāḥ vedat id paśyat manasaḥ kulāyam   na steyam admi manasā ud amucye svayam śrathnānaḥ varuṇasya pāśān  /
translated: I will separate myself from her. The form of her is in me. I know the nest of her mind. I do not eat her stolen goods. I am released by my own will from Varuna's bonds.

original: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt yena tvā abadhnāt savitā su śevāḥ / urum lokam sugam atra panthām kṛṇomi tubhyam sahapatnyai vadhu //
analyzed: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt yena tvā abadhnāt savitā su śevāḥ   urum lokam sugam atra panthām kṛṇomi tubhyam sahapatnyai vadhu  /
translated: I loose thee from the noose of Varuna, wherewith, auspicious Savitar, he hath bound thee. I make thee room and easy path to travel, thee and thy husband, O thou Maiden.

original: ud yacchadhvam apa rakṣaḥ hanātha imam nārīm su kṛte dadhāta / dhātā vipaścit patim asyai viveda bhagaḥ rājā puraḥ etu prajānan //
analyzed: ud yacchadhvam apa rakṣaḥ hanātha imam nārīm su kṛte dadhāta   dhātā vipaścit patim asyai viveda bhagaḥ rājā puras etu prajānan  /
translated: Lift up the sieve, destroy the Raksases, and give this woman to the man who worships. The wise Ordainer hath assigned her husband. Let Bhaga, King, go forth, the all-discerning.

original: bhagaḥ tatakṣa caturaḥ pādān bhagaḥ tatakṣa catvāri uṣpalāni / tvaṣṭā pipeśa madhyataḥ anu vardhrān sā naḥ astu su maṅgalī /
analyzed: bhagaḥ tatakṣa caturaḥ pādān bhagaḥ tatakṣa catvāri uṣpalāni   tvaṣṭā pipeśa madhyataḥ anu vardhrān sā naḥ astu su maṅgalī  /
translated: Bhaga hath fashioned the four feet, and Bhaga hath fashioned the four hoofs. Tvashtar hath wrought the middle part, and hath increased the girth. May she be auspicious to us.

original: su kiṃśukam vahatum viśva rūpam hiraṇya varṇam suvṛtam su cakram / ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokam syonam patibhyaḥ vahatum kṛṇu tvam /
analyzed: su kiṃśukam vahatum viśva rūpam hiraṇya varṇam suvṛtam su cakram   ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokam syonam patibhyaḥ vahatum kṛṇu tvam  /
translated: The chariot, O thou Maiden, is the kinsman of the Sun, of many forms, golden-hued, well-made, well-wheeled. Ascend the chariot, O thou Maiden, to the world of immortality. Be thou auspicious to thy husband.

original: a bhrātṛ ghnīm varuṇā paśu ghnīm bṛhaspate / indrāpati ghnīm putriṇīm ā asmabhyam savitar vaha //
analyzed: a bhrātṛ ghnīm varuṇā paśu ghnīm bṛhaspate   indrāpati ghnīm putriṇīm ā asmabhyam savitar vaha  /
translated: Varuna, spare her who hath no brother, spare her who hath no son, O Indra's consort. Spare her who hath no son, O Brhaspati. O Savitar, bring her to us.

original: mā hiṃsiṣṭam kumāryam sthūṇe deva kṛte pathi / śālāyāḥ devyāḥ dvāram syonam kṛṇmaḥ vadhū patham /
analyzed: mā hiṃsiṣṭam kumāryam sthūṇe deva kṛte pathi    śālāyāḥ devyāḥ dvāram syonam kṛṇmaḥ vadhū patham  /
translated: Harm not the tender infant, O ye Pillars, ye who stand in the path made by the Gods. We make the door of the Goddess of the house easy to pass, a way for the bride.

analyzed: brahma aparam yujyatām brahma pūrvam brahma antatas madhyatas brahma sarvatas   anāvyādhām deva purām prapadya śivā syonā pati loke vi rāja
translated: Let the Brahman be joined to the Brahman, let the Brahman be in the beginning, in the middle, at the end, let the Brahman be on every side. Entering the city of the Gods, unharmed, be thou propitious, easy to dwell with, shine in the world of thy husband.

original: tubhyam agre pari avahan sūryām vahatunā saha / sa naḥ patibhyaḥ jāyām dāḥ agne prajayā saha /
analyzed: tubhyam agre pari avahan sūryām vahatunā saha    sa naḥ patibhyaḥ jāyām dāḥ agne prajayā saha  /
translated: First they brought the Sun together with the sacrifice for thee. Do thou, O Agni, give this wife to her husbands together with offspring.

original: punar patnīm agniḥ adāt āyuṣā saha varcasā / dīrgha āyuḥ asyāḥ yaḥ patiḥ jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam /
analyzed: punar patnīm agniḥ adāt āyuṣā saha varcasā    dīrgha āyuḥ asyāḥ yaḥ patiḥ jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam  /
translated: Agni has given back the wife together with life and splendour. Long-lived be this one's husband, may he live a hundred autumns.

original: somasya jāyā prathamam gandharvaḥ te aparaḥ patiḥ / tṛtīyaḥ agniḥ te patiḥ turīyaḥ te manuṣya jāḥ /
analyzed: somasya jāyā prathamam gandharvaḥ te aparaḥ patiḥ   tṛtīyaḥ agniḥ te patiḥ turīyaḥ te manuṣya jāḥ  /
translated: Soma's wife first, then a Gandharva was thy second lord. Agni is thy third husband, and thy fourth is he who is of human kind.

original: somaḥ dadat gandharvāya gandharvaḥ dadat agnaye / rayim ca putrān ca adāt agniḥ mahyam atha u imām /
analyzed: somaḥ dadat gandharvāya gandharvaḥ dadat agnaye   rayim ca putrān ca adāt agniḥ mahyam atha u imām  /
translated: Soma gave thee to the Gandharva, the Gandharva gave thee to Agni. Agni gave thee to me, and wealth and sons.

original: ā vām agan sumatiḥ vājinīvasū ni aśvinā hṛtsu kāmāḥ araṃsata / abhūtam gopāḥ mithunā śubhaḥ patī priyāḥ aryamṇaḥ duryām aśīmahi //
analyzed: ā vām agan sumatiḥ vājinīvasū ni aśvinā hṛtsu kāmāḥ araṃsata    abhūtam gopāḥ mithunā śubhaḥ patī priyāḥ aryamṇaḥ duryām aśīmahi  /
translated: Your favour, O ye Lords of splendour, hath come to us. The wishes in our hearts have found delight, O Aṣvins. Ye have become the guardians, ye the happy pair. We have obtained the dear abode of Aryaman.

original: sā mandasānā manasā śivena rayim dhehi sarva vīram vacasyam / sugam tīrtham su prapāṇam śubhaḥ patī sthāṇum pathiṣṭhām apa durmatim hatam /
analyzed: sā mandasānā manasā śivena rayim dhehi sarva vīram vacasyam    sugam tīrtham su prapāṇam śubhaḥ patī sthāṇum pathiṣṭhām apa durmatim hatam  /
translated: With a mind well pleased and gracious, give us wealth, O ye who are to be implored, with store of hero sons, and easy access, and a fair approach, O ye who are to be implored. Drive ye away from us the standing sin.

original: yāḥ oṣadhayaḥ yāḥ nadyaḥ yāni kṣetrāṇi yāḥ vanā / tāḥ tvā vadhu prajāvatīm patye rakṣantu rakṣasaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhayaḥ yāḥ nadyaḥ yāni kṣetrāṇi yāḥ vanā   tāḥ tvā vadhu prajāvatīm patye rakṣantu rakṣasaḥ  /
translated: All herbs, all rivers, all the fields, and all the woods, let these, O young wife, guard thee, rich in children, from the Raksases.

original: ā imam panthām arukṣāma sugam svastivāhanam / yasmin vīraḥ na riṣyati anyeṣām vindate vasu //
analyzed: ā imam panthām arukṣāma sugam svastivāhanam    yasmin vīraḥ na riṣyati anyeṣām vindate vasu  /
translated: We have ascended this auspicious path, which brings all blessings, on which the hero meets with no misfortune, but wins the wealth of others.

original: idam su me naraḥ śṛṇuta yayā āśiṣā daṃpatī vāmam aśnutaḥ / ye gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ca devīḥ eṣu vānaspatyeṣu ye adhi tasthuḥ / syonāḥ te asyai vadhvai bhavantu mā hiṃsiṣuḥ vahatum uhyamānam /
analyzed: idam su me naraḥ śṛṇuta yayā āśiṣā daṃpatī vāmam aśnutaḥ   ye gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ca devīḥ eṣu vānaspatyeṣu ye adhi tasthuḥ   syonāḥ te asyai vadhvai bhavantu mā hiṃsiṣuḥ vahatum uhyamānam  /
translated: Hearken to this my word, ye men, with which the wedded pair obtain all bliss. The Gandharvas and the Goddesses who dwell in these our trees and plants, Be kind and gracious to this bride, and let them not molest the car that bears her.

original: ye vadhvaḥ candram vahatum yakṣmāḥ yanti janān anu / punar tān yajñiyāḥ devāḥ nayantu yatas āgatāḥ // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /
analyzed: ye vadhvaḥ candram vahatum yakṣmāḥ yanti janān anu   punar tān yajñiyāḥ devāḥ nayantu yatas āgatāḥ
translated: The wasting maladies that follow the bride and the car, and the people, Let the divine physicians bring them back again from whence they came.

original: mā vidan paripanthinaḥ ye āsīdanti daṃpatī / sugena durgam atītām apa drāntu arātayaḥ /
analyzed: mā vidan paripanthinaḥ ye āsīdanti daṃpatī    sugena durgam atītām apa drāntu arātayaḥ  /
translated: Let not the enemies find them, who follow the wedded pair. Let the evil spirits fly away, and let the bride go safely over the difficult places by the easy way.

original: sam kāśayāmi vahatum brahmaṇā gṛhaiḥ aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa / paryāṇaddham viśva rūpam yat asti syonam patibhyaḥ savitā tat kṛṇotu //
analyzed: sam kāśayāmi vahatum brahmaṇā gṛhaiḥ aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa    paryāṇaddham viśva rūpam yat asti syonam patibhyaḥ savitā tat kṛṇotu  /
translated: I join the bride to the car with prayer, with houses, with a harmless eye, with a friendly look. Whatever is wrapped up in all forms, let the bountiful God make it comfortable for the husband.

original: śivā nārī iyam astam āgan imam dhātā lokam asyai dideśa / tām aryamā bhagaḥ aśvinā ubhā prajāpatiḥ prajayā vardhayantu /
analyzed: śivā nārī iyam astam āgan imam dhātā lokam asyai dideśa    tām aryamā bhagaḥ aśvinā ubhā prajāpatiḥ prajayā vardhayantu  /
translated: This woman is auspicious. She has come to this world. The Creator has assigned this world to her. May Aryaman, Bhaga, the two Asvins, and Prajapati increase her with offspring.

original: ātmanvatī urvarā nārī iyam āgan tasyām naraḥ vapata bījam asyām / sā vaḥ prajām janayat vakṣaṇābhyaḥ bibhratī dugdham ṛṣabhasya retaḥ /
analyzed: ātmanvatī urvarā nārī iyam āgan tasyām naraḥ vapata bījam asyām    sā vaḥ prajām janayat vakṣaṇābhyaḥ bibhratī dugdham ṛṣabhasya retaḥ  /
translated: This woman is a fertile field, full of life. She has come. In her the men sow the seed. May she, bearing the milk of the bull's seed, generate offspring for you from her womb.

original: prati tiṣṭha virāj asi viṣṇuḥ iva iha sarasvati / sinīvāli pra jāyatām bhagasya sumatau asat /
analyzed: prati tiṣṭha virāj asi viṣṇuḥ iva iha sarasvati    sinīvāli pra jāyatām bhagasya sumatau asat  /
translated: Stand firm, O Virāj, thou art like Viṣṇu here, O Sarasvatī. Let Sinīvālī beget offspring. Let her be in the good grace of Bhaga.

original: ud vaḥ ūrmiḥ śamyā hantu āpaḥ yoktrāṇi muñcata / mā aduṣkṛtau vyenasau aghnyau aśunam āratām /🔽aghora cakṣuḥ a pati ghnī syonā śagmā su śevā su yamā gṛhebhyaḥ / vīrasūḥ devṛ kāmā sam tvayā edhiṣīmahi sumasyamānā /
analyzed: ud vaḥ ūrmiḥ śamyā hantu āpaḥ yoktrāṇi muñcata   mā aduṣkṛtau vyenasau aghnyau aśunam āratām  / aghora cakṣuḥ a pati ghnī syonā śagmā su śevā su yamā gṛhebhyaḥ    vīrasūḥ devṛ kāmā sam tvayā edhiṣīmahi sumasyamānā  /
translated: Let your wave, O Shamyā, drive away. Let the waters loose the yoking thongs. Let not the two unoffending cows, the two guiltless, be slain by the bird.🔽Be thou propitious to our homes, O Agni, not fierce of eye, not slaying our lords, kindly, prosperous, easy to invoke, and well-disposed. May we be prosperous through thee, O thou who givest birth to heroes and lovest the Gods.

original: a devṛ ghnī a pati ghnī iha edhi śivā paśubhyaḥ su yamā su varcāḥ / prajāvatī vīrasūḥ devṛ kāmā syonā imam agnim gārhapatyam saparya //
analyzed: a devṛ ghnī a pati ghnī iha edhi śivā paśubhyaḥ su yamā su varcāḥ   prajāvatī vīrasūḥ devṛ kāmā syonā imam agnim gārhapatyam saparya  /
translated: Be thou here, O Agni, not slaying the Gods, not slaying our lords, kindly to cattle, easy to invoke, of fair splendour. Giving birth to heroes, loving the Gods, be thou propitious to this our household fire.

original: ud tiṣṭha itas kim ichanti idam āgāḥ aham tvā iḍe abhibhūḥ svāt gṛhāt / śūnya eṣī nirṛte yājagantha ud tiṣṭha arāte pra pata mā iha raṃsthāḥ /🔽yadā gārhapatyam asaparyait pūrvam agnim vadhūḥ iyam / adhā sarasvatyai nāri pitṛbhyaḥ ca namaḥ kuru //
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha itas kim ichanti idam āgāḥ aham tvā iḍe abhibhūḥ svāt gṛhāt    śūnya eṣī nirṛte yājagantha ud tiṣṭha arāte pra pata mā iha raṃsthāḥ  / yadā gārhapatyam asaparyait pūrvam agnim vadhūḥ iyam    adhā sarasvatyai nāri pitṛbhyaḥ ca namaḥ kuru  /
translated: Arise from hence. What seekest thou here? I, O Idâ, am thy lord from thy own home. O Nirriti, thou hast come hither seeking the void. Arise, O Arati, fly hence. Stay not here.🔽When she, the bride, has tended the Gârhapatya, the first fire, then do honour to Sarasvatî, and to the Fathers, O woman.

original: śarma varma etat ā hara asyai nāryāḥ upastire / sinīvāli pra jāyatām bhagasya sumatau asat /
analyzed: śarma varma etat ā hara asyai nāryāḥ upastire    sinīvāli pra jāyatām bhagasya sumatau asat  /
translated: Bring hither the protection, the shield, for this woman to lie upon. Let Sinîvâlî beget offspring, and be in the good grace of Bhaga.

original: yam balbajam nyasyatha carma ca upastṛṇīthana / tat ā rohatu su prajā yā kanyā vindate patim /
analyzed: yam balbajam nyasyatha carma ca upastṛṇīthana   tat ā rohatu su prajā yā kanyā vindate patim  /
translated: The reed which ye have laid down, and the hide which ye have spread over it, thereon let the maiden ascend, who finds a husband, and begets good offspring.

original: upa stṛṇīhi balbajam adhi carmaṇi rohite / tatra upaviśya suprajāḥ imam agnim saparyatu //
analyzed: upa stṛṇīhi balbajam adhi carmaṇi rohite    tatra upaviśya suprajāḥ imam agnim saparyatu  /
translated: Spread the reed, spread the hide of the red bull. Thereon, sitting down, let her, well-born, tend this Agni.

original: ā roha carma upa sīda agnim eṣa devaḥ hanti rakṣāṃsi sarvā / iha prajām janaya patye asmai su jyaiṣṭhyaḥ bhavat putraḥ te eṣaḥ /
analyzed: ā roha carma upa sīda agnim eṣa devaḥ hanti rakṣāṃsi sarvā    iha prajām janaya patye asmai su jyaiṣṭhyaḥ bhavat putraḥ te eṣaḥ  /
translated: Ascend the hide, sit down by the fire. This God slays all the Râkshasas. Here beget thou offspring for this husband. Be thou the eldest, this son of thine.

original: vi tiṣṭhantām mātuḥ asyāḥ upasthāt nānā rūpāḥ paśavaḥ jāyamānāḥ / su maṅgalī upa sīda imam agnim saṃpatnī prati bhūṣa iha devān /🔽su maṅgalī prataraṇī gṛhāṇām su śevā patye śvaśurāya śaṃbhūḥ / syonā śvaśrvai pra gṛhān viśaḥ imān /
analyzed: vi tiṣṭhantām mātuḥ asyāḥ upasthāt nānā rūpāḥ paśavaḥ jāyamānāḥ   su maṅgalī upa sīda imam agnim saṃpatnī prati bhūṣa iha devān  / su maṅgalī prataraṇī gṛhāṇām su śevā patye śvaśurāya śaṃbhūḥ   syonā śvaśrvai pra gṛhān viśaḥ imān  /
translated: Let the young animals of various forms be born from the womb of this mother. Auspicious, sit down by this Agni. Be a good wife to the Gods here.🔽Auspicious, leading to prosperity, be gracious to the houses, kind to husband, father-in-law, and all. Be gentle to thy mother-in-law, and to these people.

original: syonā bhava śvaśurebhyaḥ syonā patye gṛhebhyaḥ / syonā asyai sarvasyai viśe syonā puṣṭāya eṣām bhava /
analyzed: syonā bhava śvaśurebhyaḥ syonā patye gṛhebhyaḥ   syonā asyai sarvasyai viśe syonā puṣṭāya eṣām bhava  /
translated: Be gentle to thy fathers-in-law, gentle to thy husband in thy house, gentle to this whole people, gentle to the increase of these.

original: su maṅgalīḥ iyam vadhūḥ imām sameta paśyata / saubhāgyam asyai dattvā daurbhāgyaiḥ viparetana /
analyzed: su maṅgalīḥ iyam vadhūḥ imām sameta paśyata    saubhāgyam asyai dattvā daurbhāgyaiḥ viparetana  /
translated: Look on this auspicious bride, all of you together. Having given her good fortune, turn away from her all misfortune.

original: yāḥ durhārdaḥ yuvatayaḥ yāḥ ca iha jaratīḥ api / varcaḥ nu asyai sam datta atha astam viparetana /
analyzed: yāḥ durhārdaḥ yuvatayaḥ yāḥ ca iha jaratīḥ api   varcaḥ nu asyai sam datta atha astam viparetana  /
translated: The young maidens who are malicious, and the old women who are here, — Give her the lustre of youth. Then turn away from her.

original: rukma prastaraṇam vahyam viśvā rūpāṇi bibhratam / ārohat sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // // // sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // // sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // // sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // // sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // // sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // // sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // // sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam // //
analyzed: rukma prastaraṇam vahyam viśvā rūpāṇi bibhratam     ārohat sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam
translated: The Sun's Savitri has mounted, for great good fortune.

original: ā roha talpam sumanasyamānā iha prajām janaya patye asmai / indrāṇī iva su budhā budhyamānā jyotiḥ agrāḥ uṣasaḥ prati jāgarāsi //
analyzed: ā roha talpam sumanasyamānā iha prajām janaya patye asmai   / indrāṇī iva su budhā budhyamānā jyotiḥ agrāḥ uṣasaḥ prati jāgarāsi  /
translated: Mount the couch, full of joy, and here beget offspring for this husband of thine. Like Savitri, the wife of Indra, full of wisdom, with light before thee, watch thou for the Dawns.

original: devāḥ agre ni apadyanta patnīḥ sam aspṛśanta tanvaḥ tanūbhiḥ / sūryā iva nāri viśva rūpā mahitvā prajāvatī patyā sam bhava iha /
analyzed: devāḥ agre ni apadyanta patnīḥ sam aspṛśanta tanvaḥ tanūbhiḥ   sūryā iva nāri viśva rūpā mahitvā prajāvatī patyā sam bhava iha  /
translated: The Gods first entered the womb, the wives touched their bodies with their bodies. Like the Sun, O woman, of all forms, through greatness, be united with thy husband, full of offspring.

original: ud tiṣṭha itas viśvāvaso namasā iḍāmahe tvā / jāmim icha pitṛṣadam nyaktām sa te bhāgaḥ januṣā tasya viddhi /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha itas viśvāvaso namasā iḍāmahe tvā   jāmim icha pitṛṣadam nyaktām sa te bhāgaḥ januṣā tasya viddhi  /
translated: Arise from hence, O Viśvāvasu: with homage we worship thee. Seek thou thy sister dwelling with the Fathers: that is thy portion: know it as such.

original: apsarasaḥ sadhamādam madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryam ca / tāḥ te janitram abhi tāḥ parehi namaḥ te gandharva ṛtunā kṛṇomi //
analyzed: apsarasaḥ sadhamādam madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryam ca    tāḥ te janitram abhi tāḥ parehi namaḥ te gandharva ṛtunā kṛṇomi  /
translated: The Apsarases rejoice in the banquet between the oblation-holder and the Sun. Go to them, to thy birthplace: to thee, O Gandharva, I pay homage with the season.

original: namaḥ gandharvasya namase namaḥ bhāmāya cakṣuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ / viśvāvaso brahmaṇā te namaḥ abhi jāyāḥ apsarasaḥ parehi /
analyzed: namaḥ gandharvasya namase namaḥ bhāmāya cakṣuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ   viśvāvaso brahmaṇā te namaḥ abhi jāyāḥ apsarasaḥ parehi  /
translated: To the Gandharva's homage we pay homage, and to Bhāman and to Cakṣus we pay homage. O Viśvāvasu, with prayer I pay thee homage: go to thy wives, the Apsarases.

original: rāyāḥ vayam sumanasaḥ syāma ud itas gandharvam āvīvṛtāma / agan sa devaḥ paramam sadhastham aganma yatra pratirantaḥ āyuḥ /
analyzed: rāyāḥ vayam sumanasaḥ syāma ud itas gandharvam āvīvṛtāma    agan sa devaḥ paramam sadhastham aganma yatra pratirantaḥ āyuḥ  /
translated: With kindly thoughts may we be with the wealthy: we have aroused the Gandharva from hence. The God hath gone to the highest habitation: we have gone where they prolong our life.

original: sam pitarau ṛtviye sṛjethām mātā pitā ca retasaḥ bhavāthaḥ / maryaḥ iva yoṣām adhi rohaya enām prajām kṛṇvāthām iha puṣyatam rayim //
analyzed: sam pitarau ṛtviye sṛjethām mātā pitā ca retasaḥ bhavāthaḥ   maryaḥ iva yoṣām adhi rohaya enām prajām kṛṇvāthām iha puṣyatam rayim  /
translated: Ye twain, Father and Mother, meet for worship, beget the seed, and be ye both a father. As a young man upon his bride so mount ye: here create ye offspring, and increase your wealth.

original: tām pūṣam śivatamām erayasva yasyām bījam manuṣyāḥ vapanti / yā naḥ ūrū uśatī viśrayāti yasyām uśantaḥ praharema śepaḥ //
analyzed: tām pūṣam śivatamām erayasva yasyām bījam manuṣyāḥ vapanti   yā naḥ ūrū uśatī viśrayāti yasyām uśantaḥ praharema śepaḥ  /
translated: Send forth that Pûshan, most auspicious, to the house, in whom men sow the seed that brings forth fruit. May she, the loving one, embrace our thighs, in whom, the loving one, we may embrace each other.

original: ā roha ūrum upa dhatsva hastam pari svajasva jāyām sumanasyamānaḥ / prajām kṛṇvāthām iha modamānau dīrgham vām āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu //
analyzed: ā roha ūrum upa dhatsva hastam pari svajasva jāyām sumanasyamānaḥ    prajām kṛṇvāthām iha modamānau dīrgham vām āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu  /
translated: Ascend the thigh, place on it thy hand, and with a joyful heart embrace thy wife. Here, rejoicing, beget ye children. May Savitar prolong your life.

original: ā vām prajām janayatu prajāpatiḥ ahar rātrābhyām sam anaktu aryamā / a durmaṅgalī pati lokam ā viśa imam śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade // //
analyzed: ā vām prajām janayatu prajāpatiḥ ahar rātrābhyām sam anaktu aryamā   a durmaṅgalī pati lokam ā viśa imam śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: May Prajâpati beget your offspring. May Aryaman anoint you with day and night. Be thou, O blessed one, a happy wife to thy husband. Be thou a blessing to our bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: devaiḥ dattam manunā sākam etat vādhūyam vāsaḥ vadhvaḥ ca vastram / yaḥ brahmaṇe cikituṣe dadāti saḥ id rakṣāṃsi talpāni hanti //
analyzed: devaiḥ dattam manunā sākam etat vādhūyam vāsaḥ vadhvaḥ ca vastram   yaḥ brahmaṇe cikituṣe dadāti saḥ id rakṣāṃsi talpāni hanti  /
translated: This bridal garment which the bride hath worn, and this the bridegroom's robe which Manu gave, He who bestows them on the priest who knows the rite, destroys the Râkshasas and all the demons.

original: yam me dattaḥ brahma bhāgam vadhūyoḥ vādhūyam vāsaḥ vadhvaḥ ca vastram / yuvam brahmaṇe anumanyamānau bṛhaspate sākam indraḥ ca dattam /
analyzed: yam me dattaḥ brahma bhāgam vadhūyoḥ vādhūyam vāsaḥ vadhvaḥ ca vastram   yuvam brahmaṇe anumanyamānau bṛhaspate sākam indraḥ ca dattam  /
translated: The bridal garment which the bride hath worn, and this the bridegroom's robe which I have given, Ye, Indra and Brihaspati, approving this, have granted it to the priest.

original: syonāt yoneḥ adhi badhyamānau hasāmudau mahasā modamānau / sugū su putrau su gṛhau tarāthaḥ jīvau uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: syonāt yoneḥ adhi badhyamānau hasāmudau mahasā modamānau    sugū su putrau su gṛhau tarāthaḥ jīvau uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ  /
translated: Bound to the kindly womb, rejoicing in the joy of mighty ones, well-housed, well-born, well-bred, ye two, ye live through the shining dawns.

original: navam vasānaḥ surabhiḥ su vāsāḥ udāgām jīvaḥ uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ / āṇḍāt patatrī iva amukṣi viśvasmāt enasaḥ pari /
analyzed: navam vasānaḥ surabhiḥ su vāsāḥ udāgām jīvaḥ uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ   āṇḍāt patatrī iva amukṣi viśvasmāt enasaḥ pari  /
translated: Clad in fresh garments, sweet, well-dressed, the living one hath risen to the shining dawns. From every sin have I delivered him as from a shell, as one who flieth.

original: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahivrate / āpaḥ sapta susruvuḥ devīḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahivrate    āpaḥ sapta susruvuḥ devīḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: Auspicious are the two, Heaven and Earth, in the last boon, in the great vow. The seven divine streams have flowed. May they deliver us from woe.

original: sūryāyai devebhyaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya ca / ye bhūtasya pracetasaḥ tebhyaḥ idam akaram namaḥ //
analyzed: sūryāyai devebhyaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya ca   ye bhūtasya pracetasaḥ tebhyaḥ idam akaram namaḥ  /
translated: To Sûrya, to the Gods, to Mitra, to Varuna, to those who know the world, to them have I made this adoration.

original: yaḥ ṛte cit abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhyaḥ ātṛdaḥ / saṃdhātā saṃdhim maghavā purūvasuḥ niṣkartā vihrutam punar /
analyzed: yaḥ ṛte cit abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhyaḥ ātṛdaḥ    saṃdhātā saṃdhim maghavā purūvasuḥ niṣkartā vihrutam punar  /
translated: He who, even when not worshipped, from of old, before the ribs (of the altar are laid down), is the giver of food, the bountiful one, the fulfiller, the maker anew of what is broken.

original: apa asmat tamaḥ ucchatu nīlam piśaṅgam uta lohitam yat / nirdahanī yā pṛṣātakī asmin tām sthāṇau adhi ā sajāmi //
analyzed: apa asmat tamaḥ ucchatu nīlam piśaṅgam uta lohitam yat    nirdahanī yā pṛṣātakī asmin tām sthāṇau adhi ā sajāmi  /
translated: Let the darkness depart from us, the blue, the yellow, and the red. Let the burning, the spotted, which is in this (man), I place upon the stump.

original: yāvatīḥ kṛtyāḥ upavāsane yāvantaḥ rājñaḥ varuṇasya pāśāḥ / vyṛddhayaḥ yāḥ asamṛddhayaḥ yāḥ asmin tāḥ sthāṇau adhi sādayāmi //
analyzed: yāvatīḥ kṛtyāḥ upavāsane yāvantaḥ rājñaḥ varuṇasya pāśāḥ   vyṛddhayaḥ yāḥ asamṛddhayaḥ yāḥ asmin tāḥ sthāṇau adhi sādayāmi  /
translated: All the failures and all the shortcomings that are in this (man), on the post I lay them down.🔽My dearest body, that which is my garment, may it fear not.🔽In front of it, O tree, make thou a fold, that we may not be injured.🔽In front of it, O tree, make thou a fold, that we may not be injured.🔽In front of it, O tree, make thou a fold, that we may not be injured.

analyzed: uśatīḥ kanyalāḥ imāḥ pitṛ lokāt patim yatīḥ    ava dīkṣām asṛkṣata svāhā  bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan   varcaḥ goṣu praviṣṭam yat tena imām sam sṛjāmasi  / bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan   tejaḥ goṣu praviṣṭam yat tena imām sam sṛjāmasi  /

All-hail!🔽The All-Gods, sent forth by Brihaspati, have established her, the splendour that hath entered into cows. translated: The All-Gods, sent forth by Brihaspati, have established her, the sap that hath entered into cows. With that we make this one to prosper.

translated: from that sin let Agni and Savitar deliver thee.🔽This woman here, who brings the water-jar, who scatters barley-grains,

original: yat āsandyām upadhāne yat vā upavāsane kṛtam / vivāhe kṛtyām yām cakruḥ āsnāne tām ni dadhmasi //
analyzed: yat āsandyām upadhāne yat vā upavāsane kṛtam    vivāhe kṛtyām yām cakruḥ āsnāne tām ni dadhmasi  /
translated: The mischief that was wrought at the marriage-ceremony, when the bride was seated on the couch, or when she was dressed,🔽or when they bathed, we lay upon the head of Sambala.🔽The evil deed, the sin that we have brought into the marriage-ceremony,

analyzed: yat duṣkṛtam yat śamalam vivāhe vahatau ca yat    tat saṃbhalasya kambale mṛjmahe duritam vayam  /
translated: on the skin of Sambala we wipe away our sin.🔽Having laid the sin upon the skin of Sambala, and wiped away our sin upon the skin,

translated: we have become pure and meet for sacrifice. May this prolong our days of life.

original: kṛtrimaḥ kaṇṭakaḥ śatadan yaḥ eṣaḥ / apa asyāḥ keśyam malam apa śīrṣaṇyam likhāt /

translated: The artificial thorn, the hundred-pointed one, may this remove the dirt from her head and the pain of her head.

translated: The former ones who have gone away, who have been led forth, having given to this one offspring and wealth, may they lead her along the path of the departed. This one has won the brilliant world with good offspring.

translated: Go to the house, the housewife as thou art. May Savitar prolong thy days of life.

analyzed: saḥ arajyata tatas rājanyaḥ ajāyata

analyzed: sa viśaḥ sabandhūn annam annādyam abhyudatiṣṭhat

original: viśām ca vai sa sabandhūnām ca annasya ca annādyasya ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
analyzed: viśām ca vai sa sabandhūnām ca annasya ca annādyasya ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of the people, his kinsmen, food, and the enjoyment of food, he who knows this.

original: sa viśaḥ anu vi acalat //
analyzed: sa viśaḥ anu vi acalat
translated: He moved along the people.

original: tam sabhā ca samitiḥ ca senā ca surā ca anuvyacalan //
analyzed: tam sabhā ca samitiḥ ca senā ca surā ca anuvyacalan
translated: The assembly, the gathering, the army, and the liquor followed him.

original: sabhāyāḥ ca vai sa samiteḥ ca senāyāḥ ca surāyāḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
analyzed: sabhāyāḥ ca vai sa samiteḥ ca senāyāḥ ca surāyāḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of the assembly, the gathering, the army, and the liquor, he who knows this.

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ rājñaḥ atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet //
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ rājñaḥ atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet
translated: Now, if a Vratya, knowing this, should come to the house of a king as a guest,

original: śreyāṃsam enam ātmanaḥ mānayet tathā kṣatrāya na ā vṛścate tathā rāṣṭrāya na vṛścate /
analyzed: śreyāṃsam enam ātmanaḥ mānayet tathā kṣatrāya na ā vṛścate tathā rāṣṭrāya na vṛścate  /
translated: He should honour him as superior to himself, so that he does not injure the Kshatriya, so that he does not injure the kingdom.

original: atas vai brahma ca kṣatram ca ud atiṣṭhatām te abrūtām kam pra viśāva iti //🔽bṛhaspatim eva brahma praviśatu indram kṣatram tathā vai iti //
analyzed: atas vai brahma ca kṣatram ca ud atiṣṭhatām te abrūtām kam pra viśāva iti  bṛhaspatim eva brahma praviśatu indram kṣatram tathā vai iti
translated: From that the Brahman and the Kshatriya arose. They said: 'Which one shall we enter?'🔽'Let the Brahman enter Brihaspati, let the Kshatriya enter Indra.' So it was.

original: atas vai bṛhaspatim eva brahma prāviśat indram kṣatram /
analyzed: atas vai bṛhaspatim eva brahma prāviśat indram kṣatram
translated: From that the Brahman entered Brihaspati, the Kshatriya Indra.

original: iyam vai u pṛthivī bṛhaspatiḥ dyauḥ eva indraḥ //
analyzed: iyam vai u pṛthivī bṛhaspatiḥ dyauḥ eva indraḥ
translated: This earth is Brihaspati, the sky is Indra.

original: ayam vai u agniḥ brahmā asau ādityaḥ kṣatram //
analyzed: ayam vai u agniḥ brahmā asau ādityaḥ kṣatram
translated: This Agni is the Brahman, yonder sun is the Kshatriya.

original: ā enam brahma gacchati brahmavarcasī bhavati //
analyzed: ā enam brahma gacchati brahmavarcasī bhavati
translated: The Brahman comes to him, he becomes resplendent.

original: yaḥ pṛthivīm bṛhaspatim agnim brahma veda //
analyzed: yaḥ pṛthivīm bṛhaspatim agnim brahma veda
translated: He who knows the earth as Brihaspati, Agni as the Brahman,

original: ā enam indriyam gacchati indriyavān bhavati //
analyzed: ā enam indriyam gacchati indriyavān bhavati
translated: power comes to him, he becomes powerful.

original: yaḥ ādityam kṣatram divam indram veda //
analyzed: yaḥ ādityam kṣatram divam indram veda
translated: He who knows the sun as the Kshatriya, the sky as Indra,

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet //
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet
translated: to him whose house a Vratya, knowing this, comes as a guest,

original: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya kva avātsīḥ vrātya udakam vrātya
analyzed: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya kva avātsīḥ vrātya udakam vrātya
translated: he should himself go out to meet him and say: 'Vratya, where have you dwelt? Vratya, where will you go? Vratya,

original: vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu vrātya🔽te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti // //
analyzed: vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu vrātya  te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti
translated: As thou desirest, O Vrātya, so be it.

original: yat enam āha vrātya kva avātsīḥ iti pathaḥ eva tena deva yānān ava rundhe //
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya kva avātsīḥ iti pathaḥ eva tena deva yānān ava rundhe
translated: When he says to him, 'O Vrātya, where hast thou dwelt?' thereby he secures for him the paths leading to the gods.

original: yat enam āha vrātya udakam iti apaḥ eva tena ava rundhe //🔽yat enam āha vrātya tarpayantu iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsam kurute //
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya udakam iti apaḥ eva tena ava rundhe  yat enam āha vrātya tarpayantu iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsam kurute
translated: When he says to him, 'O Vrātya, water!' thereby he secures water for him.🔽When he says to him, 'O Vrātya, let them satisfy thee!' thereby he makes his breath more abundant.

original: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu iti priyam eva tena ava rundhe //
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu iti priyam eva tena ava rundhe
translated: When he says to him, 'O Vrātya, as thou likest, so be it!' thereby he secures what is agreeable to him.

original: ā enam priyam gacchati priyaḥ priyasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
analyzed: ā enam priyam gacchati priyaḥ priyasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He goes to what is agreeable to him, and becomes agreeable to the agreeable one, who knows thus.

original: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu iti vaśam eva tena ava rundhe //
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu iti vaśam eva tena ava rundhe
translated: When he says to him, 'O Vrātya, as thou wilt, so be it!' thereby he secures what is agreeable to him.

original: ā enam vaśaḥ gacchati vaśī vaśinām bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
analyzed: ā enam vaśaḥ gacchati vaśī vaśinām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He goes to what is agreeable to him, and becomes agreeable to the agreeable one, who knows thus.

original: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti nikāmam eva tena ava rundhe //
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti nikāmam eva tena ava rundhe
translated: When he says to him, 'O Vrātya, as thou desirest, so be it!' thereby he secures what is desired by him.

original: ā enam nikāmaḥ gacchati nikāme nikāmasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda //
analyzed: ā enam nikāmaḥ gacchati nikāme nikāmasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He goes to him as he desires, and he becomes as he desires, who knows this.

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ uddhṛteṣu agniṣu adhiśrite agnihotre atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet //
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ uddhṛteṣu agniṣu adhiśrite agnihotre atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet
translated: Now, if a Vratya, knowing this, should come to the house as a guest, after the fires have been taken out and the Agnihotra has been placed on the fire,

original: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya ati sṛja hoṣyāmi iti //
analyzed: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya ati sṛja hoṣyāmi iti
translated: he should himself rise up and say to him, 'Vratya, give me permission, I will offer.'

original: sa ca atisṛjet juhuyāt na ca atisṛjet na juhuyāt //
analyzed: sa ca atisṛjet juhuyāt na ca atisṛjet na juhuyāt
translated: He should give permission, and he should offer; he should not give permission, and he should not offer.

original: sa yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: He who offers after being given permission by a Vratya who knows this

original: pra pitṛ yāṇam panthām jānāti pra deva yānam //
analyzed: pra pitṛ yāṇam panthām jānāti pra deva yānam
translated: knows the path to the fathers and the path to the gods.

original: na deveṣu ā vṛścate hutam asya bhavati //
analyzed: na deveṣu ā vṛścate hutam asya bhavati
translated: He is not cut off from the gods, his offering is made.

original: pari asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
analyzed: pari asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: His abode remains in this world, who offers after being given permission by a Vratya who knows this.

original: atha yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
analyzed: atha yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: Now, he who offers without being given permission by a Vratya who knows this

original: na pitṛ yāṇam panthām jānāti na deva yānam //
analyzed: na pitṛ yāṇam panthām jānāti na deva yānam
translated: does not know the path to the fathers and the path to the gods.

original: ā deveṣu vṛścate a hutam asya bhavati //
analyzed: ā deveṣu vṛścate a hutam asya bhavati
translated: He is cut off from the gods, his offering is not made.

original: na asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti //
analyzed: na asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: No place of his remains in this world, who sacrifices without being permitted by a Vratya who knows this.

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ ekām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ ekām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: Now, he who has a Vratya in his house for one night, who knows this,

analyzed: ye pṛthivyām puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe  /
translated: he thereby secures for himself the blessed worlds which are on earth.

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ dvitīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ dvitīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
