analyzed: ye antarikṣe puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: he thereby secures for himself the blessed worlds which are in the atmosphere.

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ tṛtīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ tṛtīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: Now, he who has a Vratya in his house for a third night, who knows this,

original: ye divi puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe //
analyzed: ye divi puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: he thereby secures for himself the blessed worlds which are in the sky.

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ caturthīm rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ caturthīm rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: He who knows thus, for him, if a Vrātya, knowing thus, stays as a guest in his house for the fourth night,

analyzed: ye puṇyānām puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: he thereby wins for him the most meritorious of the meritorious worlds.

original: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ aparimitāḥ rātrīḥ atithiḥ gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ aparimitāḥ rātrīḥ atithiḥ gṛhe vasati  /
translated: He who knows thus, for him, if a Vrātya, knowing thus, stays as a guest in his house for an unlimited number of nights,

analyzed: ye eva aparimitāḥ puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: he thereby wins for him the most unlimited meritorious worlds.

analyzed: atha yasya avrātyaḥ vrātyabruvaḥ nāma bibhratī atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet
translated: Now if a non-Vratya, who is not a Vratya, but bears the name of a Vratya, should come to one's house as a guest,

original: karṣet enam na ca enam karṣet //
analyzed: karṣet enam na ca enam karṣet
translated: one should drag him, and yet one should not drag him.

analyzed: asyai devatāyai udakam yācāmi imām devatām vāsaye imām imām devatām pari veveṣmi iti enam pari veviṣyāt
translated: 'For this deity I ask for water; I will entertain this deity; I will search out this deity', he should search for it.

analyzed: tasyām eva asya tat devatāyām hutam bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: In that deity is offered what is offered by him who knows thus.

original: sa yat prācīm diśam anu vyacalat mārutam śardhaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manaḥ anna adam kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat prācīm diśam anu vyacalat mārutam śardhaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manaḥ anna adam kṛtvā  /
translated: When he moved along the eastern quarter, he moved along having become the Marut host, having made mind the eater of food.

analyzed: manasā anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with his food-eating mind.

original: sa yat dakṣiṇām diśam anu vyacalat indraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat balam anna adam kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat dakṣiṇām diśam anu vyacalat indraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat balam anna adam kṛtvā  /
translated: When he moved along the southern quarter, he moved along having become Indra, having made strength food-eating.

analyzed: balena anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with the strength of one who does not eat food.

analyzed: adbhiḥ anna ādībhiḥ annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with water and food.

original: sa yat udīcīm diśam anu vyacalat somaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat saptarṣibhiḥ hute āhutim annādīm kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat udīcīm diśam anu vyacalat somaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat saptarṣibhiḥ hute āhutim annādīm kṛtvā  /
translated: When he moved on to the northern direction, he moved on having become King Soma, having made an offering to the seven sages an offering that is food.

analyzed: āhutyā annādya annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with food.

original: sa yat dhruvām diśam anu vyacalat viṣṇuḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat virājam annādīm kṛtvā / /
analyzed: sa yat dhruvām diśam anu vyacalat viṣṇuḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat virājam annādīm kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the firm region, he moved along having become Vishnu, having made it the food-eating Viraj.

analyzed: virājā annādya annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food and food.

original: sa yat paśūn anu vyacalat rudraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat oṣadhīḥ anna ādīḥ kṛtvā / /
analyzed: sa yat paśūn anu vyacalat rudraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat oṣadhīḥ anna ādīḥ kṛtvā
translated: When he moved away after the cattle, he moved away having become Rudra, having made the plants food-eaters.

analyzed: oṣadhībhiḥ anna ādībhiḥ annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with the plants and other things that begin with food.

original: sa yat pitṝn anu vyacalat yamaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat svadhākāram anna adam kṛtvā / /
analyzed: sa yat pitṝn anu vyacalat yamaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat svadhākāram anna adam kṛtvā  /
translated: When he went away after the Fathers, King Yama went away after him, having made Svadha the food-eater.

analyzed: svadhākāreṇa anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with the syllable svadhā, the eater of food.

original: sa yat manuṣyān anu vyacalat agniḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat svāhākāram anna adam kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat manuṣyān anu vyacalat agniḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat svāhākāram anna adam kṛtvā  /
translated: When he moved away from men, he moved away having become Agni, having made the Svāhā-call the eater of food.

analyzed: svāhākāreṇa anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with the Svâhâ-call, with the eater of food.

original: sa yat ūrdhvām diśam anu vyacalat bṛhaspatiḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat vaṣaṭkāram anna adam kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat ūrdhvām diśam anu vyacalat bṛhaspatiḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat vaṣaṭkāram anna adam kṛtvā  /
translated: When he moved on to the region above, he moved on having become Brihaspati, having made the Vasat-call the eater of food.

analyzed: vaṣaṭkāreṇa anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with the Vasat call, which is the eater of food.

original: sa yat devān anu vyacalat īśānaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manyum anna adam kṛtvā / /
analyzed: sa yat devān anu vyacalat īśānaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manyum anna adam kṛtvā
translated: When he moved away following the gods, he moved away having become the Lord, having made wrath the eater of food.

analyzed: manyunā anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with the eater of food, with anger.

original: sa yat prajāḥ anu vyacalat prajāpatiḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat prāṇam anna adam kṛtvā / /
analyzed: sa yat prajāḥ anu vyacalat prajāpatiḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat prāṇam anna adam kṛtvā
translated: When he moved away after the creatures, he moved away becoming Prajapati, making the eater of food the life-breath.

analyzed: prāṇena anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with the eater of food, with breath.

original: sa yat sarvān antardeśān anu vyacalat parameṣṭhī bhūtvā anuvyacalat brahma anna adam kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat sarvān antardeśān anu vyacalat parameṣṭhī bhūtvā anuvyacalat brahma anna adam kṛtvā  /
translated: When he moved along all the intermediate regions, he moved along having become Parameshthin, having made Brahman the eater of food.

analyzed: brahmaṇā anna adena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus eats food with Brahman as his eater.

original: tasya vrātyasya //
analyzed: tasya vrātyasya
translated: Of that Vrātya

original: sapta prāṇāḥ sapta apānāḥ sapta vyānāḥ //
analyzed: sapta prāṇāḥ sapta apānāḥ sapta vyānāḥ
translated: there are seven prāṇas, seven apānas, seven vyānas.

original: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ prāṇaḥ ūrdhvaḥ nāma ayam saḥ agniḥ //🔽yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ prāṇaḥ prauḍhaḥ nāma asau saḥ ādityaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ prāṇaḥ ūrdhvaḥ nāma ayam saḥ agniḥ  yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ prāṇaḥ prauḍhaḥ nāma asau saḥ ādityaḥ
translated: His first prāṇa, named upward, is this fire.🔽His second prāṇa, named expanded, is that sun.

original: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ prāṇaḥ abhyūḍhaḥ nāma asau sa candramāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ prāṇaḥ abhyūḍhaḥ nāma asau sa candramāḥ
translated: His third prāṇa, named well-expanded, is that moon.

original: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ prāṇaḥ vibhūḥ nāma ayam sa pavamānaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ prāṇaḥ vibhūḥ nāma ayam sa pavamānaḥ
translated: His fourth prāṇa, named expanded, is this Pavamāna.

original: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ prāṇaḥ yoniḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ āpaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ prāṇaḥ yoniḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ āpaḥ
translated: His fifth breath, which is called the Womb, are these waters.

original: yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ prāṇaḥ priyaḥ nāma te ime paśavaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ prāṇaḥ priyaḥ nāma te ime paśavaḥ
translated: His sixth breath, which is called the Beloved, are these cattle.

original: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ prāṇaḥ aparimitaḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ prajāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ prāṇaḥ aparimitaḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: His seventh breath, which is called the Infinite, are these creatures.

original: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ apānaḥ sā paurṇamāsī //
analyzed: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ apānaḥ sā paurṇamāsī
translated: His first downward breath is the Full Moon.

original: yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ apānaḥ sā aṣṭakā //
analyzed: yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ apānaḥ sā aṣṭakā
translated: His second downward breath is the Eighth Day.

original: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ apānaḥ sā amāvāsyā //
analyzed: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ apānaḥ sā amāvāsyā
translated: His third downward breath is the New Moon.

original: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ apānaḥ sā śraddhā //
analyzed: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ apānaḥ sā śraddhā
translated: His fourth downward breath is Faith.

original: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ apānaḥ sā dīkṣā //🔽yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ apānaḥ sa yajñaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ apānaḥ sā dīkṣā  yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ apānaḥ sa yajñaḥ
translated: His fifth downward breath is Consecration.🔽His sixth downward breath is the Sacrifice.

original: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ apānaḥ tāḥ imāḥ dakṣiṇāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ apānaḥ tāḥ imāḥ dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: His seventh downward breath are these sacrificial gifts.

original: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ vyānaḥ sā iyam bhūmiḥ //🔽yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ vyānaḥ tat antarikṣam //
analyzed: yaḥ asya prathamaḥ vyānaḥ sā iyam bhūmiḥ  yaḥ asya dvitīyaḥ vyānaḥ tat antarikṣam
translated: His first cross-breathing is this earth.🔽His second cross-breathing is that atmosphere.

original: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ vyānaḥ sā dyauḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya tṛtīyaḥ vyānaḥ sā dyauḥ
translated: His third cross-breathing is that sky.

original: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ vyānaḥ tāni nakṣatrāṇi //
analyzed: yaḥ asya caturthaḥ vyānaḥ tāni nakṣatrāṇi
translated: His fourth cross-breathing are those stars.

original: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ vyānaḥ te ṛtavaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya pañcamaḥ vyānaḥ te ṛtavaḥ
translated: His fifth cross-breathing are those seasons.

original: yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ vyānaḥ te ārtavāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya ṣaṣṭhaḥ vyānaḥ te ārtavāḥ
translated: His sixth cross-breathing are those half-months.

original: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ vyānaḥ sa saṃvatsaraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya saptamaḥ vyānaḥ sa saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: His seventh Vyana is the year.

original: samānam artham pari yanti devāḥ saṃvatsaram vai etat ṛtavaḥ anupariyanti vrātyam ca //
analyzed: samānam artham pari yanti devāḥ saṃvatsaram vai etat ṛtavaḥ anupariyanti vrātyam ca
translated: The gods go round the same object. The seasons go round the year, the Vrātya.

original: yat ādityam abhisaṃviśanti amāvāsyām ca eva tat paurṇamāsīm ca //
analyzed: yat ādityam abhisaṃviśanti amāvāsyām ca eva tat paurṇamāsīm ca
translated: When they enter the sun, that is the new moon and the full moon.

original: ekam tat eṣām amṛta tvam iti āhutiḥ eva //
analyzed: ekam tat eṣām amṛta tvam iti āhutiḥ eva
translated: That is their one immortality. The offering itself.

original: tasya vrātyasya //
analyzed: tasya vrātyasya
translated: Of that Vrātya.

original: yat asya dakṣiṇam akṣi asau saḥ ādityaḥ yat asya savyam akṣi asau sa candramāḥ //
analyzed: yat asya dakṣiṇam akṣi asau saḥ ādityaḥ yat asya savyam akṣi asau sa candramāḥ
translated: His right eye is that sun. His left eye is that moon.

original: yaḥ asya dakṣiṇaḥ karṇaḥ ayam saḥ agniḥ yaḥ asya savyaḥ karṇaḥ ayam sa pavamānaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya dakṣiṇaḥ karṇaḥ ayam saḥ agniḥ yaḥ asya savyaḥ karṇaḥ ayam sa pavamānaḥ
translated: His right ear is that fire. His left ear is that Pavamāna.

original: ahorātre nāsike ditiḥ ca aditiḥ ca śīrṣa kapāle saṃvatsaraḥ śiraḥ //
analyzed: ahorātre nāsike ditiḥ ca aditiḥ ca śīrṣa kapāle saṃvatsaraḥ śiraḥ
translated: Day and night are the nostrils. Diti and Aditi are the skull bones. The year is the head.

original: ahnā pratyaṅ vrātyaḥ rātryā prāk namaḥ vrātyāya //
analyzed: ahnā pratyaṅ vrātyaḥ rātryā prāk namaḥ vrātyāya
translated: The Vrātya goes to the west by day, to the east by night. Homage to the Vrātya!

original: atisṛṣṭaḥ apām vṛṣabhaḥ atisṛṣṭāḥ agnayaḥ divyāḥ //🔽rujan parirujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan //
analyzed: atisṛṣṭaḥ apām vṛṣabhaḥ atisṛṣṭāḥ agnayaḥ divyāḥ  rujan parirujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan
translated: The bull of the waters is released. The heavenly fires are released.🔽Breaking, breaking through, killing, destroying,

original: mrokaḥ manohā khanaḥ nirdāhaḥ ātma dūṣiḥ tanū dūṣiḥ //
analyzed: mrokaḥ manohā khanaḥ nirdāhaḥ ātma dūṣiḥ tanū dūṣiḥ
translated: the evil-minded, the digger, the burner, the self-corrupter, the body-corrupter,

original: idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi //
analyzed: idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi
translated: I send this forth to him: let him not come hither to me.

original: tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ //
analyzed: tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ asmān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: With this we send forth to him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: apām agram asi samudram vaḥ abhyavasṛjāmi //🔽yaḥ apsu agniḥ ati tam sṛjāmi mrokam khanim tanū dūṣim //
analyzed: apām agram asi samudram vaḥ abhyavasṛjāmi  yaḥ apsu agniḥ ati tam sṛjāmi mrokam khanim tanū dūṣim  /
translated: Thou art the fore-front of the waters: I send you forth to the ocean.🔽I send forth the fire that is in you, the fire that digs the pit, the fire that defiles the body.

original: yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ agniḥ āviveśa saḥ eṣa yat vaḥ ghoram tat etat //
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ agniḥ āviveśa saḥ eṣa yat vaḥ ghoram tat etat
translated: The fire that hath entered you, O waters, that is he. What is terrible in you, that is he.

original: indrasya vaḥ indriyeṇa abhi siñcet //🔽a riprāḥ āpaḥ apa ripram asmat //
analyzed: indrasya vaḥ indriyeṇa abhi siñcet  a riprāḥ āpaḥ apa ripram asmat
translated: With the power of Indra I sprinkle you.🔽Ye waters, free from stain, make me free from stain.

original: pra asmat enaḥ vahantu pra duṣvapnyam vahantu //🔽śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyata apaḥ śivayā tanvā upa spṛśata tvacam me //
analyzed: pra asmat enaḥ vahantu pra duṣvapnyam vahantu  śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyata apaḥ śivayā tanvā upa spṛśata tvacam me
translated: Carry away from me sin, carry away evil dreams.🔽Look upon me with a gracious eye: with your gracious body touch my skin.

original: śivān agnīn apsuṣadaḥ havāmahe mayi kṣatram varcaḥ ā dhatta devīḥ //
analyzed: śivān agnīn apsuṣadaḥ havāmahe mayi kṣatram varcaḥ ā dhatta devīḥ
translated: We call on the auspicious fires that dwell in the waters: O goddesses, bestow on me in my body strength and splendour.

original: niḥ durarmaṇyaḥ ūrjā madhumatī vāc //🔽madhumatī stha madhumatīm vācam udeyam //
analyzed: niḥ durarmaṇyaḥ ūrjā madhumatī vāc  madhumatī stha madhumatīm vācam udeyam
translated: Free from all evil, rich in food, is speech.🔽Ye are rich in food: may I rise with a rich in food speech.

original: upahūtaḥ me gopāḥ upahūtaḥ gopīthaḥ //
analyzed: upahūtaḥ me gopāḥ upahūtaḥ gopīthaḥ
translated: The guardian is invoked by me: the guardian of the guard is invoked.

original: su śrutau karṇau bhadra śrutau karṇau bhadram ślokam śrūyāsam //
analyzed: su śrutau karṇau bhadra śrutau karṇau bhadram ślokam śrūyāsam
translated: May I hear the auspicious sound.

original: suśrutiḥ ca mā upaśrutiḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām sauparṇam cakṣuḥ ajasram jyotiḥ //
analyzed: suśrutiḥ ca mā upaśrutiḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām sauparṇam cakṣuḥ ajasram jyotiḥ
translated: May the hearing of the good and the hearing of the auspicious not forsake me. May the eagle's eye be my everlasting light.

original: ṛṣīṇām prastaraḥ asi namaḥ astu daivāya prastarāya //
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām prastaraḥ asi namaḥ astu daivāya prastarāya
translated: You are the bundle of the Rishis. Homage to the divine bundle.

original: mūrdhā aham rayīṇām mūrdhā samānānām bhūyāsam //
analyzed: mūrdhā aham rayīṇām mūrdhā samānānām bhūyāsam
translated: I am the head of riches. May I be the head of equals.

original: rujaḥ ca mā venaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām mūrdhā ca mā vidharmā ca mā hāsiṣṭām //🔽urvaḥ ca mā camasaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām dhartā ca mā dharuṇaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām //
analyzed: rujaḥ ca mā venaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām mūrdhā ca mā vidharmā ca mā hāsiṣṭām  / urvaḥ ca mā camasaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām dhartā ca mā dharuṇaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām  /
translated: May Ruja and Vena not forsake me. May the head and the law not forsake me.🔽May Urva and the cup not forsake me. May the supporter and the prop not forsake me.

original: vimokaḥ ca me ārdra paviḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām ārdra dānuḥ ca mā mātariśvā ca mā hāsiṣṭām //
analyzed: vimokaḥ ca me ārdra paviḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām ārdra dānuḥ ca mā mātariśvā ca mā hāsiṣṭām  /
translated: May the release and the wet wick not forsake me. May the wet cloud and the wind not forsake me.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ me ātmā nṛmaṇāḥ nāma hṛdyaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ me ātmā nṛmaṇāḥ nāma hṛdyaḥ
translated: Brihaspati is my soul, named Nrimana, dwelling in the heart.

original: asaṃtāpam me hṛdayam urvī gavyūtiḥ samudraḥ asmi vidharmaṇā //
analyzed: asaṃtāpam me hṛdayam urvī gavyūtiḥ samudraḥ asmi vidharmaṇā
translated: My heart is free from distress. The wide expanse is the ocean, I am free from the law.

original: nābhiḥ aham rayīṇām nābhiḥ samānānām bhūyāsam //
analyzed: nābhiḥ aham rayīṇām nābhiḥ samānānām bhūyāsam
translated: I am the navel of riches. May I be the navel of equals.

original: svāsat asi sūṣāḥ amṛtaḥ martya īśu ā //
analyzed: svāsad asi sūṣāḥ amṛtaḥ martya īśu ā
translated: You are the good, the good wife, the immortal, the mortal, the arrow.

original: mā mām prāṇaḥ ha āsīt mā u apānaḥ avahāya parā gāt //
analyzed: mā mām prāṇaḥ ha āsīt mā u apānaḥ avahāya parā gāt
translated: Let not my expiration nor my inspiration leave me and depart.

original: sūryaḥ mā ahnaḥ pātu agniḥ pṛthivyāḥ vāyuḥ antarikṣāt yamaḥ manuṣyebhyaḥ sarasvatī pārthivebhyaḥ //
analyzed: sūryaḥ mā ahnaḥ pātu agniḥ pṛthivyāḥ vāyuḥ antarikṣāt yamaḥ manuṣyebhyaḥ sarasvatī pārthivebhyaḥ  /
translated: Let the Sun protect me from the day, let Agni from the earth, let Vayu from the atmosphere, let Yama from men, let Sarasvati from earthly beings.

original: prāṇa apanau mā mā hāsiṣṭam mā jane pra meṣi //
analyzed: prāṇa apanau mā mā hāsiṣṭam mā jane pra meṣi
translated: Let not expiration and inspiration forsake me, let me not go away from the people.

original: svasti adya uṣasaḥ doṣasaḥ ca sarve āpaḥ sarva gaṇaḥ aśīya //
analyzed: svasti adya uṣasaḥ doṣasaḥ ca sarve āpaḥ sarva gaṇaḥ aśīya  /
translated: Prosperity to the dawns of to-day and of to-morrow! I would win all the waters, the whole multitude.

original: śakvarī stha paśavaḥ mā upa stheṣuḥ mitrāvaruṇau me prāṇa apānau agniḥ me dakṣam dadhātu /
analyzed: śakvarī stha paśavaḥ mā upa stheṣuḥ mitrāvaruṇau me prāṇa apānau agniḥ me dakṣam dadhātu  /
translated: Ye are the Shakvari verses; let cattle settle on my lap. Let Mitra and Varuna be my expiration and inspiration. Let Agni bestow strength on me.

original: vidma te svapna janitram grāhyāḥ putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ / antakaḥ asi mṛtyuḥ asi / tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi //
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram grāhyāḥ putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ   antakaḥ asi mṛtyuḥ asi    tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi  /
translated: We know thy birthplace, O Sleep, thou art the son of Grahi, the creation of Yama. Thou art the Ender, thou art Death. We know thee thus, O Sleep. Protect us, O Sleep, from evil dreams.

analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram nirṛtyāḥ putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ  vidma te svapna janitram abhūtyāḥ putraḥ asi yamasya  / vidma te svapna janitram nirbhūtyāḥ putraḥ asi  /
translated: We know thy birthplace, O Sleep; thou art the son of Destruction, the instrument of Yama.🔽We know thy birthplace, O Sleep; thou art the son of Want of Prosperity.🔽We know thy birthplace, O Sleep; thou art the son of Defeat.

original: vidma te svapna janitram parābhūtyāḥ putraḥ asi // //
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram parābhūtyāḥ putraḥ asi  /
translated: We know thy birthplace, O Sleep; thou art the son of Misery.

original: vidma te svapna janitram deva jāmīnām putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ / antakaḥ asi mṛtyuḥ asi / tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi //
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram deva jāmīnām putraḥ asi yamasya karaṇaḥ   antakaḥ asi mṛtyuḥ asi   tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi  /
translated: We know thy birth, O Sleep, thou art the son of the Dames of Heaven, the instrument of Yama. Thou art the Ender, thou art Death. We know thee thus, O Sleep. Keep us, O Sleep, from evil dreams.

original: ajaiṣma adya āsanām adya amūm anāgasaḥ vayam //🔽uṣaḥ yasmāt duṣvapnyāt abhaiṣma apa tat ucchatu //🔽dviṣate tat parā vaha śapate tat parā vaha //
analyzed: ajaiṣma adya āsanām adya amūm anāgasaḥ vayam  uṣaḥ yasmāt duṣvapnyāt abhaiṣma apa tat ucchatu  dviṣate tat parā vaha śapate tat parā vaha
translated: We have conquered today, we have overcome today, we are sinless.🔽From whatever evil dream I have dreamed, O Dawn, may that pass away from us.🔽Bear that away to him who hateth us and to whom we are hateful.

original: yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tasmai enat gamayāmaḥ //🔽uṣā devī vācā saṃvidānā vāc devī uṣasā saṃvidānā //
analyzed: yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tasmai enat gamayāmaḥ  uṣāḥ devī vācā saṃvidānā vāc devī uṣasā saṃvidānā
translated: To him whom we hate and who hateth us, to him we send it.🔽Dawn, the Goddess, in accord with Speech, Speech, the Goddess, in accord with Dawn,

original: uṣaḥ patiḥ vācaḥ patinā saṃvidānaḥ vācaḥ patinā saṃvidānaḥ //
analyzed: uṣaḥ patiḥ vācaḥ patinā saṃvidānaḥ vācaḥ patinā saṃvidānaḥ
translated: Dawn's Lord in accord with the Lord of Speech, the Lord of Speech in accord with him,

original: te amuṣmai parā vahantu arāyān durṇāmnaḥ sadānvāḥ /
analyzed: te amuṣmai parā vahantu arāyān durṇāmnaḥ sadānvāḥ

original: kumbhīkāḥ dūṣīkāḥ pīyakān //

analyzed: an āgamiṣyataḥ varān avitteḥ saṃkalpān amucyāḥ druhaḥ pāśān
translated: the curses of those who come not, the purposes of the ignorant, the snares of treachery,

original: tena enam vidhyāmi abhūtyā enam vidhyāmi nirbhūtyā enam vidhyāmi parābhūtyā enam vidhyāmi grāhya enam vidhyāmi tamasā enam vidhyāmi

Set me in the place of welfare in the highest heaven.

analyzed: prajāpateḥ āvṛtaḥ brahmaṇā varmaṇā aham kaśyapasya jyotiṣā varcasā ca   jaradaṣṭiḥ kṛta vīryaḥ vihāyāḥ sahasra āyuḥ su kṛtaḥ careyam  /
translated: By Prajapati's covering, by the Brahman's armour, by Kasyapa's light and splendour, may I live, with long life, with strength, with vigour, with a thousand years, and with good deeds.

original: parivṛtaḥ brahmaṇā varmaṇā aham kaśyapasya jyotiṣā varcasā ca / mā mā prāpan iṣavaḥ daivyāḥ yāḥ mā mānuṣīḥ avasṛṣṭāḥ vadhāya /
analyzed: parivṛtaḥ brahmaṇā varmaṇā aham kaśyapasya jyotiṣā varcasā ca   mā mā prāpan iṣavaḥ daivyāḥ yāḥ mā mānuṣīḥ avasṛṣṭāḥ vadhāya  /
translated: I am surrounded by the Brahman armour, by the light and splendour of Kasyapa. Let not the divine arrows reach me, nor those shot by men for slaughter.

original: ṛtena guptaḥ ṛtubhiḥ ca sarvaiḥ bhūtena guptaḥ bhavyena ca aham / mā mā prāpat pāpmā mā uta mṛtyuḥ antar dadhe aham salilena vācaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtena guptaḥ ṛtubhiḥ ca sarvaiḥ bhūtena guptaḥ bhavyena ca aham   mā mā prāpat pāpmā mā uta mṛtyuḥ antar dadhe aham salilena vācaḥ  /
translated: Guarded by the Rta and by all the seasons, guarded by the past and by the future, let not sin or death reach me. I hide myself in the water from the words (of the wicked).

original: agniḥ mā goptā pari pātu viśvatas udyan sūryaḥ nudatām mṛtyu pāśān / vyuchantīḥ uṣasaḥ parvatāḥ dhruvāḥ sahasram prāṇāḥ mayi ā yatantām / vyuchantīḥ uṣasaḥ parvatāḥ dhruvāḥ sahasram prāṇāḥ mayi ā yatantām / / /
analyzed: agniḥ mā goptā pari pātu viśvatas udyan sūryaḥ nudatām mṛtyu pāśān   vyuchantīḥ uṣasaḥ parvatāḥ dhruvāḥ sahasram prāṇāḥ mayi ā yatantām
translated: May Agni, the protector, guard me on every side. May the rising sun remove the snares of death. May the rising dawns, the firm mountains, and the thousand breaths be fixed in me. May the rising dawns, the firm mountains, and the thousand breaths be fixed in me.

original: u cit sakhāyam sakhyā vavṛtyām tiras puru cit arṇavam jaganvān / pituḥ napātam ā dadhīta vedhāḥ adhi kṣami prataram dīdhyānaḥ /
analyzed: u cit sakhāyam sakhyā vavṛtyām tiras puru cit arṇavam jaganvān    pituḥ napātam ā dadhīta vedhāḥ adhi kṣami prataram dīdhyānaḥ  /
translated: Even from afar I have turned to my friend, having crossed over many a sea. The creator should place the grandson of the father, reflecting on the ford across the earth.🔽Even from afar I have turned to my friend, having crossed over many a sea. The creator should place the grandson of the father, reflecting on the ford across the earth.

original: na te sakhā sakhyam vaṣṭi etat salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavati / mahaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ divaḥ dhartāraḥ urviyā pari khyan /
analyzed: na te sakhā sakhyam vaṣṭi etat salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavati    mahaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ divaḥ dhartāraḥ urviyā pari khyan  /
translated: Not this thy friend approves thy friendship, that thou art of various form and varied hue. The mighty sons of Asura, the Heroes, the upholders of the heavens, are spread around.

original: uśanti gha te amṛtāsaḥ etat ekasya cit tyajasam martyasya / ni te manaḥ manasi dhāyi asme janyuḥ patiḥ tanvam ā viviṣyāḥ /
analyzed: uśanti gha te amṛtāsaḥ etat ekasya cit tyajasam martyasya    ni te manaḥ manasi dhāyi asme janyuḥ patiḥ tanvam ā viviṣyāḥ  /
translated: The Immortals have declared this to thee: the mortal man who is alone is subject to decay. Thy heart is fixed in me, in us is thy heart: thou shalt return, a loving husband, to thy wife.

original: na yat purā cakṛma kad ha nūnam ṛtam vadantaḥ anṛtam rapema / gandharvaḥ apsu apyā ca yoṣā sā nau nābhiḥ paramam jāmi tat nau /🔽garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kaḥ devaḥ tvaṣṭā savitā viśva rūpaḥ / nakir asya pra minanti vratāni veda nau asya pṛthivī uta dyauḥ /
analyzed: na yat purā cakṛma kad ha nūnam ṛtam vadantaḥ anṛtam rapema   gandharvaḥ apsu apyā ca yoṣā sā nau nābhiḥ paramam jāmi tat nau  / garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kaḥ devaḥ tvaṣṭā savitā viśva rūpaḥ   nakir asya pra minanti vratāni veda nau asya pṛthivī uta dyauḥ  /
translated: What we have done aforetime, what we have left undone, we now, speaking the truth, confess as falsehood. The Gandharva is the bride, the water is the bride: this is our bond, our closest kinship.🔽Who is our Father, who our Mother, who our kinsman, who our friend? Who is the God, the Maker, Savitar, of all forms? None breaketh his decrees. Earth and the heavens know this of him.

original: kaḥ adya yuṅkte dhuri gāḥ ṛtasya śimīvataḥ bhāminaḥ durhṛṇāyūn / āsanniṣūn hṛtsvasaḥ mayobhūn yaḥ eṣām bhṛtyām ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt /
analyzed: kaḥ adya yuṅkte dhuri gāḥ ṛtasya śimīvataḥ bhāminaḥ durhṛṇāyūn    āsanniṣūn hṛtsvasaḥ mayobhūn yaḥ eṣām bhṛtyām ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt  /
translated: Who now hath yoked to his car-pole the two Bay Steeds of holy Law, the strong, the vigorous, the swift to act, the kindly, with the arrow in the rest? He who hath given them food shall live.

original: kaḥ asya veda prathamasya ahnaḥ kaḥ īm dadarśa kaḥ iha pra vocat / bṛhat mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kad u bravaḥ āhanaḥ vīcyā nṝn /
analyzed: kaḥ asya veda prathamasya ahnaḥ kaḥ īm dadarśa kaḥ iha pra vocat    bṛhat mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kad u bravaḥ āhanaḥ vīcyā nṝn  /
translated: Who knows the first of days? Who hath beheld it? Who here will tell it? Lofty is the nature of Mitra and Varuna. What will ye say to men, O ye who move the people?

original: yamasya mā yamyam kāmaḥ āgan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya / jāyā iva patye tanvam riricyām vi cit vṛhā iva rathyā iva cakrā /
analyzed: yamasya mā yamyam kāmaḥ āgan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya   jāyā iva patye tanvam riricyām vi cit vṛhā iva rathyā iva cakrā  /
translated: Let not my wish for Yama's self come nigh me, that I may lie with him in the selfsame womb. Let me avoid his body as a wife her husband. Let me avoid him as a great pit, as a car-wheel.

original: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣanti ete devānām spaśaḥ iha ye caranti / anyena mat āhanaḥ yāhi tūyam tena vi vṛha rathyā iva cakrā /
analyzed: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣanti ete devānām spaśaḥ iha ye caranti   anyena mat āhanaḥ yāhi tūyam tena vi vṛha rathyā iva cakrā  /
translated: They neither stand nor move: the Gods' inspectors here who move about. Go thou away, O man, with something else than me. Roll thou away from me as a car-wheel rolls.

original: rātrībhiḥ asmai ahabhiḥ daśasyet sūryasya cakṣuḥ muhur ud mimīyāt / divā pṛthivyāḥ mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya vivṛhāt ajāmi // divā pṛthivyāḥ mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya vivṛhāt ajāmi // divā pṛthivyāḥ mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya vivṛhāt ajāmi // divā pṛthivyāḥ mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya vivṛhāt ajāmi // divā pṛthivyāḥ mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya vivṛhāt ajāmi // divā pṛthivyāḥ mithunā sab🔽ā gha tā gacchān uttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavan ajāmi / upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhum anyam ichasva subhage patim mat /
analyzed: rātrībhiḥ asmai ahabhiḥ daśasyet sūryasya cakṣuḥ muhur ud mimīyāt    divā pṛthivyāḥ mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya vivṛhāt ajāmi                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   ā gha tā gacchān uttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavan ajāmi    upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhum anyam ichasva subhage patim mat  /
translated: With earth and heaven, the pair, may he be gracious, with Yama's sisters, with his kin, and kinsmen.🔽Go thou to those superior years wherein the sisters have made peace with him who is not kin. Raise up thy voice to the Bull, seek out another husband, O blessed dame, than me.

original: kim bhrātā asat yat anātham bhavāti kim u svasā yat nirṛtiḥ nigacchāt / kāma mūtā bahu etat rapāmi tanvā me tanvam sam pipṛgdhi //
analyzed: kim bhrātā asat yat anātham bhavāti kim u svasā yat nirṛtiḥ nigacchāt   kāma mūtā bahu etat rapāmi tanvā me tanvam sam pipṛgdhi  /
translated: What is a brother to a woman when she is helpless? What is a sister when misfortune comes? I tell thee this, O Kāma, because thou art my body: embrace me with thy body.

original: na te nātham yamī atra aham asmi na te tanūm tanvā sam papṛcyām / anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na te bhrātā subhage vaṣṭi etat /
analyzed: na te nātham yamī atra aham asmi na te tanūm tanvā sam papṛcyām   anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na te bhrātā subhage vaṣṭi etat  /
translated: I am not thy protector here, I am not thy companion. I will not embrace thy body with my body. With another than me make thou love. Thy brother, O happy girl, will not approve of this.

original: na vai u te tanūm tanvā sam pipṛcyām pāpam āhuḥ yaḥ svasāram nigacchāt / asaṃyat etat manasaḥ hṛdaḥ me bhrātā svasuḥ śayane yat śayīya /
analyzed: na vai u te tanūm tanvā sam pipṛcyām pāpam āhuḥ yaḥ svasāram nigacchāt   asaṃyat etat manasaḥ hṛdaḥ me bhrātā svasuḥ śayane yat śayīya  /
translated: I will not embrace thy body with my body. They call it sin when one approaches his sister. This is not the will of my heart, my mind, that I should lie on the bed of my brother with my sister.

original: bata asi yama na eva te manaḥ hṛdayam ca avidām ā / anyā kila tvām kakṣyā iva yuktam pari svajātau libujā iva vṛkṣam /
analyzed: bata asi yama na eva te manaḥ hṛdayam ca avidām ā   / anyā kila tvām kakṣyā iva yuktam pari svajātau libujā iva vṛkṣam  /
translated: O Yama, I know not thy mind nor thy heart. Another, they say, embraces thee as a girdle embraces one who is bound, as a creeper embraces a tree.

original: anyam u su yami anyaḥ u tvām pari svajātau libujā iva vṛkṣam / tasya vā tvam manaḥ ichā sa vā tava adhā kṛṇuṣva saṃvidam su bhadrām /
analyzed: anyam u su yami anyaḥ u tvām pari svajātau libujā iva vṛkṣam    tasya vā tvam manaḥ ichā sa vā tava adhā kṛṇuṣva saṃvidam su bhadrām  /
translated: Let another embrace him, and let him embrace thee, as a creeper embraces a tree. Seek thou his mind, and let him seek thine. Make ye a very happy agreement.

original: trīṇi chandāṃsi kavayaḥ vi yetire puru rūpam darśatam viśva cakṣaṇam / āpaḥ vātāḥ oṣadhayaḥ tāni ekasmin bhuvane ārpitāni //
analyzed: trīṇi chandāṃsi kavayaḥ vi yetire puru rūpam darśatam viśva cakṣaṇam    āpaḥ vātāḥ oṣadhayaḥ tāni ekasmin bhuvane ārpitāni  /
translated: The sages have spread out three metres, the wondrous, the manifold, the all-observing. Water, wind, and plants, these are placed in one world.

original: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvaḥ aditeḥ adābhyaḥ / viśvam sa veda varuṇaḥ yathā dhiyā sa yajñiyaḥ yajati yajñiyān ṛtūn /
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvaḥ aditeḥ adābhyaḥ   viśvam sa veda varuṇaḥ yathā dhiyā sa yajñiyaḥ yajati yajñiyān ṛtūn  /
translated: The Bull hath milked for the Bull the milk of heaven, the young, the unassailable, of Aditi. He knows all things as Varuṇa knoweth them by prayer. He, meet for worship, worships holy seasons.

original: rapat gandharvīḥ apyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātu naḥ manaḥ / iṣṭasya madhye aditiḥ ni dhātu naḥ bhrātā naḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ prathamaḥ vi vocati //
analyzed: rapat gandharvīḥ apyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātu naḥ manaḥ   iṣṭasya madhye aditiḥ ni dhātu naḥ bhrātā naḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ prathamaḥ vi vocati  /
translated: Let the Gandharva's wife and the two Maidens guard our mind within the sound of this our song. In the mid-point of what is to be desired may Aditi establish us. Our eldest Brother, first-born, must make us known.

original: so cit nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatī uṣāḥ uvāsa manave svarvatī / yat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan // tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan // tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan // tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan // tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan // tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram v
analyzed: sā u cit nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatī uṣāḥ uvāsa manave svarvatī    yat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan   tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan    tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan     tat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan                  anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan
translated: When they have generated Agni, who is kindled, who is to be kindled, as Hotar for the solemn rite.🔽When they have generated Agni, who is kindled, who is to be kindled, as Hotar for the solemn rite.

original: adha tyam drapsam vibhvam vicakṣanam viḥ ābharat iṣiraḥ śyenaḥ adhvare / yadī viśaḥ vṛṇate dasmam āryāḥ agnim hotāram adha dhīḥ ajāyata /
analyzed: adha tyam drapsam vibhvam vicakṣanam viḥ ābharat iṣiraḥ śyenaḥ adhvare   yadī viśaḥ vṛṇate dasmam āryāḥ agnim hotāram adha dhīḥ ajāyata  /
translated: The active hawk hath brought to us this active drop, the all-observing, to the sacrifice, When the Ârya tribes elect the wondrous Agni as Hotar of the solemn rite. The thought was born.

original: sadā asi raṇvaḥ yavasā iva puṣyate hotrābhiḥ agne manuṣaḥ su adhvaraḥ / viprasya vā yat śaśamānaḥ ukthyaḥ vājam sasavān upayāsi bhūribhiḥ //
analyzed: sadā asi raṇvaḥ yavasā iva puṣyate hotrābhiḥ agne manuṣaḥ su adhvaraḥ   viprasya vā yat śaśamānaḥ ukthyaḥ vājam sasavān upayāsi bhūribhiḥ  /
translated: Thou art ever kind, and growest like the corn, O Agni, with the lauds of man who offers well. When, as a sage who strives to win, thou comest with many to the sacrifice, to gather spoil.

original: ud īraya pitarā jāraḥ ā bhagam iyakṣati haryataḥ hṛttaḥ iṣyati / vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhaḥ taviṣyate asuraḥ vepate matī /
analyzed: ud īraya pitarā jāraḥ ā bhagam iyakṣati haryataḥ hṛttaḥ iṣyati   vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhaḥ taviṣyate asuraḥ vepate matī  /
translated: The lover lifts his parents up to Bhaga: the eager one speeds forth from his heart's desire. The priest is glorified, the rite is honoured: the Asura is magnified, the thought is moved.

original: yaḥ te agne sumatim martaḥ akhyat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa pra śṛṇve / iṣam dadhānaḥ vahamānaḥ aśvaiḥ ā sa dyumān amavān bhūṣati dyūn /
analyzed: yaḥ te agne sumatim martaḥ akhyat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa pra śṛṇve    iṣam dadhānaḥ vahamānaḥ aśvaiḥ ā sa dyumān amavān bhūṣati dyūn  /
translated: The man, O Agni, who hath won thy favour, O Son of Strength, him thou must hear to aid. Bearing and holding food with his attendant steeds, he shines resplendent, and his days are full of bliss.

original: śrudhi naḥ agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā ratham amṛtasya dravitnum / ā naḥ vaha rodasī deva putre mākir devānām apa bhūḥ iha syāḥ /
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā ratham amṛtasya dravitnum    ā naḥ vaha rodasī deva putre mākir devānām apa bhūḥ iha syāḥ  /
translated: Hear us, O Agni, in the seat of congregation: yoke the car of the Immortal One, that moves with speed. Bring hither both the worlds, O thou whom Gods have begotten: be not thou here a stranger to the Gods.

original: yat agne eṣā samitiḥ bhavāti devī deveṣu yajata yajatra / ratnā ca yat vibhajāsi svadhāvas bhāgam naḥ atra vasumantam vītāt /
analyzed: yat agne eṣā samitiḥ bhavāti devī deveṣu yajata yajatra   ratnā ca yat vibhajāsi svadhāvas bhāgam naḥ atra vasumantam vītāt  /
translated: When, O Agni, this assembly is gathered, O God, among the Gods, O thou who art to be adored, And when thou, O thou of thine own nature, distributest the treasures, then give us our share, rich in good things.

original: anu agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat anu ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ / anu sūryaḥ uṣasaḥ anu raśmīn dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa /
analyzed: anu agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat anu ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ   anu sūryaḥ uṣasaḥ anu raśmīn dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa  /
translated: Agni hath looked upon the foremost of the Dawns, and Jâtavedas first upon the days. The Sun hath looked upon the Dawns and on the rays: he hath pervaded Heaven and Earth.

original: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat prati ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ / prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna /🔽dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtena abhiśrāve bhavataḥ satya vācā / devaḥ yat martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdat hotā pratyaṅ svam asum yan /🔽devaḥ devān paribhūḥ ṛtena vaha naḥ havyam prathamaḥ cikitvān / dhūmaketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīkaḥ mandraḥ hotā nityaḥ vācā yajīyān // // //
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat prati ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ   prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna  / dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtena abhiśrāve bhavataḥ satya vācā    devaḥ yat martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdat hotā pratyaṅ svam asum yan  / devaḥ devān paribhūḥ ṛtena vaha naḥ havyam prathamaḥ cikitvān   dhūmaketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīkaḥ mandraḥ hotā nityaḥ vācā yajīyān
translated: Agni hath looked upon the foremost of the Dawns, and Jâtavedas first upon the days. The Sun hath looked upon the rays of light in many a place, and hath extended Heaven and Earth.🔽Heaven and Earth, O ye two, are first by holy law, and are to be adored with true devotion, When the God, making the mortals ready for worship, sitteth as Hotar in his own abode.🔽God, overlord by holy law of the Gods, bring thou our offering, first, as one who knoweth. Thou, whose banner is smoke, enkindled with fuel, the pleasant Hotar, ever present, best at sacrifice.

original: arcāmi vām vardhāya apaḥ ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutam rodasī me / ahā yat devāḥ asu nītim āyan madhvā naḥ atra pitarā śiśītām /
analyzed: arcāmi vām vardhāya apaḥ ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutam rodasī me  ahā yat devāḥ asu nītim āyan madhvā naḥ atra pitarā śiśītām  /
translated: I worship you to prosper you, O Waters, and you, O Heaven and Earth, who have your home in oil. When, O ye Gods, ye came to the abode of life, do ye, O Parents, make us pure with meath.

original: svāvṛt devasya amṛtam yadī goḥ atas jātāsaḥ dhārayantaḥ urvī / viśve devāḥ anu tat te yajuḥ guḥ duhe yat enī divyam ghṛtam vār /
analyzed: svāvṛt devasya amṛtam yadī goḥ atas jātāsaḥ dhārayantaḥ urvī    viśve devāḥ anu tat te yajuḥ guḥ duhe yat enī divyam ghṛtam vār  /
translated: The God's immortal nature, which is thine, O Cow, from which, supporting all the world, ye sprang, - The Universal Gods have followed that command of thine, when thou, the dappled one, yieldest the heavenly food.

original: kim svid naḥ rājā jagṛhe kad asya ati vratam cakṛma kaḥ vi veda / mitraḥ cit hi ṣmā juhurāṇaḥ devām ślokaḥ na yātām api vājaḥ asti /
analyzed: kim svid naḥ rājā jagṛhe kad asya ati vratam cakṛma kaḥ vi veda   mitraḥ cit hi ṣmā juhurāṇaḥ devām ślokaḥ na yātām api vājaḥ asti  /
translated: What hath the King taken from us? What have we done amiss against his law? Who knoweth it? For even Mitra, when he is angry, will not spare the Gods. The hymn hath not been offered, nor is there strength.

original: durmantu atra amṛtasya nāma sa lakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavāti / yamasya yaḥ manavate sumantu agne tam ṛṣva pāhi a prayuchan /
analyzed: durmantu atra amṛtasya nāma sa lakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavāti    yamasya yaḥ manavate sumantu agne tam ṛṣva pāhi a prayuchan  /
translated: The name of Amrit is hard to find here. The mark is hard to find when it is of various forms. He who, O Agni, hath a good mind to the thought of Yama, protect thou, O lofty one, him, O thou that art not to be deceived.

original: yasmin devāḥ vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante / sūrye jyotiḥ adadhuḥ māsi aktūn pari dyotanim carataḥ ajasrā /
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante    sūrye jyotiḥ adadhuḥ māsi aktūn pari dyotanim carataḥ ajasrā  /
translated: In what assembly the Gods rejoice themselves, in what place of Vivasvan they support themselves, - In the Sun they have placed the light, in the Moon the stars. The two go round the world, never resting.

original: yasmin devāḥ manmani saṃcaranti apīcye na vayam asya vidma / mitraḥ naḥ atra aditiḥ anāgān savitā devaḥ varuṇāya vocat /
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ manmani saṃcaranti apīcye na vayam asya vidma   mitraḥ naḥ atra aditiḥ anāgān savitā devaḥ varuṇāya vocat  /
translated: In what thought the Gods move, in what hidden place, we know it not. Mitra and Aditi have not deceived us. Savitar the God hath told it to Varuna.

original: sakhāyaḥ ā śiṣāmahe brahma indrāya vajriṇe / stuṣe u su nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ ā śiṣāmahe brahma indrāya vajriṇe   stuṣe u su nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave  /
translated: We, O friends, have prepared the prayer for Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt. I will praise him, the most generous, the daring one.

original: śavasā hi asi śrutaḥ vṛtra hatyena vṛtra hā / maghaiḥ maghonaḥ ati śūra dāśasi //
analyzed: śavasā hi asi śrutaḥ vṛtra hatyena vṛtra hā   maghaiḥ maghonaḥ ati śūra dāśasi  /
translated: For thou art famous, O thou Vr̥itra-slayer, by might, by slaying Vr̥itra, thou the Hero. Thou givest to the bounteous ones their bounties.

original: stegaḥ na kṣām ati eṣi pṛthivīm mahī naḥ vātāḥ iha vāntu bhūmau / mitraḥ naḥ atra varuṇaḥ yujamānaḥ agniḥ vane na vi asṛṣṭa śokam /
analyzed: stegaḥ na kṣām ati eṣi pṛthivīm mahī naḥ vātāḥ iha vāntu bhūmau   mitraḥ naḥ atra varuṇaḥ yujamānaḥ agniḥ vane na vi asṛṣṭa śokam  /
translated: Thou passest over the earth as a swift courser: may the winds blow here upon the ground for us. May Mitra, Varuṇa, and the God who yokes, as in the wood, Agni, unloose our grief.

original: stuhi śrutam garta sadam janānām rājānam bhīmam upahatnum ugram / mṛḍā jaritre rudra stavānaḥ anyam asmat te ni vapantu senyam // // // // // // // // // jaritre rudra stavānaḥ anyam asmat te ni vapantu senyam // // //
analyzed: stuhi śrutam garta sadam janānām rājānam bhīmam upahatnum ugram    mṛḍā jaritre rudra stavānaḥ anyam asmat te ni vapantu senyam
translated: Praise thou the famous one, the terrible King, the mighty, the impetuous, who dwelleth in the cave. Be gracious, O Rudra, to the singer: let thy dart pass by us to another man.

original: sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne / sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt /
analyzed: sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne    sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt  /
translated: The pious call on Sarasvatî: they call on Sarasvatî when sacrifice is offered. The pious call on Sarasvatî: may Sarasvatî grant treasure to the worshipper.

original: sarasvatīm pitaraḥ havante dakṣinā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ / āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ā dhehi asme /
analyzed: sarasvatīm pitaraḥ havante dakṣinā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ   āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ā dhehi asme  /
translated: The Fathers call on Sarasvatî, who lead the sacrifice to the south. Sit on this sacred grass and rejoice you: give us food free from all pain and trouble.

original: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayātha ukthaiḥ svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī / sahasra argham iḍaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi //
analyzed: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayātha ukthaiḥ svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī    sahasra argham iḍaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi  /
translated: O Sarasvatî, with whom thou goest to the chariot, with lauds, O Goddess, rejoicing in the Fathers' power, - Give to the sacrificer here a share in food of thousandfold value, and the increase of his wealth.

original: ud īratām avaraḥ ud parāsaḥ ud madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ / asum ye īyuḥ avṛkāḥ ṛta jñāḥ te naḥ avantu pitaraḥ haveṣu /
analyzed: ud īratām avaraḥ ud parāsaḥ ud madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ   asum ye īyuḥ avṛkāḥ ṛta jñāḥ te naḥ avantu pitaraḥ haveṣu  /
translated: Up from below, up from above, up from the middle let the Fathers rise, the Fathers who have gone to rest, the guileless, righteous, harmless ones. May these our Fathers help us in the solemn rites.

original: ā aham pitṝn suvidatrām avitsi napātam ca vikramaṇam ca viṣṇoḥ / barhiṣadaḥ ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvaḥ te iha āgamiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: ā aham pitṝn suvidatrām avitsi napātam ca vikramaṇam ca viṣṇoḥ    barhiṣadaḥ ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvaḥ te iha āgamiṣṭhāḥ  /
translated: I have obtained the Pitrs who are easy to win, the son of Napat, and the step of Vishnu. Those who, as Pitrs, enjoy the juice of the Soma on the sacred grass, are most to be worshipped here.

original: idam pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ astu adya ye pūrvāsaḥ ye aparāsaḥ īyuḥ / ye pārthive rajasi ā niṣaktāḥ ye vā nūnam suvṛjanāsu dikṣu /
analyzed: idam pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ astu adya ye pūrvāsaḥ ye aparāsaḥ īyuḥ   ye pārthive rajasi ā niṣaktāḥ ye vā nūnam suvṛjanāsu dikṣu  /
translated: To the Pitrs be adoration this day, to those who have gone by, to those who have gone hereafter, to those who have settled in the dust of the earth, or who now are in the regions of the good folk.

original: mātalī kavyaiḥ yamaḥ aṅgirobhiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ / yān ca devāḥ vāvṛdhuḥ ye ca devān te naḥ avantu pitaraḥ haveṣu /
analyzed: mātalī kavyaiḥ yamaḥ aṅgirobhiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ   yān ca devāḥ vāvṛdhuḥ ye ca devān te naḥ avantu pitaraḥ haveṣu  /
translated: With the Kavyas, with the Angirases, with the Rkvans, with the Brihat, with the Rathantara, with the Vâmadevya, with the Bhrgu, with the Âditya, with the Vasus, with the Rudras, with the Âdityas, with the All-Gods, with the Sâma, with the Rik, with the Yajus, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with the Svadha, with the Svâhâ, with

original: svāduḥ kila ayam madhumān uta ayam tīvraḥ kila ayam rasavān uta ayam / uta u nu asya papivāṃsam indram na kaḥ cana sahate āhaveṣu /
analyzed: svāduḥ kila ayam madhumān uta ayam tīvraḥ kila ayam rasavān uta ayam    uta u nu asya papivāṃsam indram na kaḥ cana sahate āhaveṣu  /
translated: This one is sweet, this one is full of meath, this one is strong, this one is full of juice. And none at all can match in fight the Indra who hath drunk of this.

original: pareyivāṃsam pravataḥ mahīḥ iti bahubhyaḥ panthām an upaspaśānam / vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā saparyata /
analyzed: pareyivāṃsam pravataḥ mahīḥ iti bahubhyaḥ panthām an upaspaśānam    vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā saparyata  /
translated: To Yama, King of those who go in front, to Yama who looks on many a path, to Yama, the all-seeing, the assembly of men, offer oblation with your sacred verse.🔽Yama first discovered the way for us: this pasture of the kine is not to be deceived. Where our forefathers have gone before us, knowing the paths, along the ways that lead to bliss.🔽Where our forefathers have gone before us, knowing the paths, along the ways that lead to bliss.🔽Where our forefathers have gone before us, knowing the paths, along the ways that lead to bliss.

original: yamaḥ naḥ gātum prathamaḥ viveda na eṣā gavyūtiḥ apabhartavai u / yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ // yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ // yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ // yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ // yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu
analyzed: yamaḥ naḥ gātum prathamaḥ viveda na eṣā gavyūtiḥ apabhartavai u  yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ   yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ    yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ
translated: Where our forefathers have gone before us, knowing the paths, along the ways that lead to bliss.

original: barhiṣadaḥ pitaraḥ ūti arvāk imā vaḥ havyā cakṛma juṣadhvam / te ā gatāvasā śaṃtamena adhāḥ naḥ śam yos arapaḥ dadhāta /
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ pitaraḥ ūti arvāk imā vaḥ havyā cakṛma juṣadhvam   te ā gatāvasā śaṃtamena adhāḥ naḥ śam yos arapaḥ dadhāta  /
translated: O Fathers who sit on sacred grass, come hitherward: accept these offerings we have made you. Come ye to us with most auspicious favour, and grant us shelter and security.

original: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇatas niṣadya idam naḥ haviḥ abhi gṛṇantu viśve / mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cit naḥ yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma /
analyzed: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇatas niṣadya idam naḥ haviḥ abhi gṛṇantu viśve   mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cit naḥ yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma  /
translated: Seated on the right hand side, bending their knees, may all the Fathers accept this our oblation. Injure us not, O Fathers, in any matter, for sin we have committed against you.

original: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatum kṛṇoti tena idam viśvam bhuvanam sam eti / yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā mahaḥ jāyā vivasvataḥ nanāśa //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatum kṛṇoti tena idam viśvam bhuvanam sam eti   yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā mahaḥ jāyā vivasvataḥ nanāśa  /
translated: Tvashtar prepares a way for his daughter: thereby this universe is brought together. The great consort of Vivasvan, Yama's mother, is lost as she is being carried about.

original: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūryāṇaiḥ yena te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ / ubhā rājānau svadhayā madantau yamam paśyāsi varuṇam ca devam /
analyzed: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūryāṇaiḥ yena te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ   ubhā rājānau svadhayā madantau yamam paśyāsi varuṇam ca devam  /
translated: Go forward, go upon the paths that are frequented, by which thy sires and grandsires have gone before thee. Look on Yama and on the God Varuna, the two Kings who rejoice in their wonted manner.

original: apeta vīta vi ca sarpata atas asmai etam pitaraḥ lokam akran / ahobhiḥ adbhiḥ aktubhiḥ vyaktam yamaḥ dadāti avasānam asmai /
analyzed: apeta vīta vi ca sarpata atas asmai etam pitaraḥ lokam akran   ahobhiḥ adbhiḥ aktubhiḥ vyaktam yamaḥ dadāti avasānam asmai  /
translated: Go hence, depart, and wander through the regions: for him have ye prepared this world, O Fathers. With days and waters and the rays of morning, Yama grants him a place of rest and comfort.

original: uśantaḥ tvā idhīmahi uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi / uśan uśataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave /
analyzed: uśantaḥ tvā idhīmahi uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi    uśan uśataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave  /
translated: We kindle thee, O thou who art to be desired, we kindle thee, O thou who art to be desired. Desiring, bring the desiring Fathers hither to eat the sacrificial food.

original: dyumantaḥ tvā idhīmahi dyumantaḥ sam idhīmahi / dyumān dyumataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave /
analyzed: dyumantaḥ tvā idhīmahi dyumantaḥ sam idhīmahi    dyumān dyumataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave  /
translated: We kindle thee, O thou who art glorious, we kindle thee, O thou who art glorious. Glorious, bring the glorious Fathers hither to eat the sacrificial food.

original: aṅgirasaḥ naḥ pitaraḥ navagvāḥ atharvāṇaḥ bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ / teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma /
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ naḥ pitaraḥ navagvāḥ atharvāṇaḥ bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ   teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma  /
translated: May we be in the favour, in the gracious favour of these our worthy Fathers, the Angirases, the Navagvas, the Atharvans, the Bhrigus, the sons of Soma.

original: aṅgirobhiḥ yajñiyaiḥ ā gahi iha yama vairūpaiḥ iha mādayasva / vivasvantam huve yaḥ pitā te asmin barhiṣi ā niṣadya //
analyzed: aṅgirobhiḥ yajñiyaiḥ ā gahi iha yama vairūpaiḥ iha mādayasva   vivasvantam huve yaḥ pitā te asmin barhiṣi ā niṣadya  /
translated: Come hither with the Angirases, the worthy, come hither, O Yama, with the Virups. I invoke Vivasvan, thy father, to sit down on this sacred grass.

original: imam yama prastaram ā hi roha aṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ / ā tvā mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ vahantu enāḥ rājan haviṣaḥ mādayasva //
analyzed: imam yama prastaram ā hi roha aṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ   ā tvā mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ vahantu enāḥ rājan haviṣaḥ mādayasva  /
translated: O Yama, ascend this sacred grass, in union with the Angirases, the Fathers. Let the hymns, O King, brought by the sages, carry thee hither. Rejoice in these oblations.

original: yamāya somaḥ pavate yamāya kriyate haviḥ / yamam ha yajñaḥ gacchati agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yamāya somaḥ pavate yamāya kriyate haviḥ   yamam ha yajñaḥ gacchati agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ  /
translated: For Yama the Soma is purified, for Yama the sacrificial food is prepared. The sacrifice goes to Yama, announced by Agni as its messenger.🔽For Yama the Soma is purified, for Yama the sacrificial food is prepared. The sacrifice goes to Yama, announced by Agni as its messenger.

original: yamāya madhumattamam juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata / idam namaḥ ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrvajebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ /
analyzed: yamāya madhumattamam juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata    idam namaḥ ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrvajebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ  /
translated: To Yama offer the sweetest meath, and then depart. This homage to the Rishis, to the elder, to the earlier, to the makers of the path.

original: yamāya ghṛtavat payaḥ rājñe haviḥ juhotana / sa naḥ jīveṣu ā yamet dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase /
analyzed: yamāya ghṛtavat payaḥ rājñe haviḥ juhotana    sa naḥ jīveṣu ā yamet dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase  /
translated: To Yama, to the King, offer the milk with ghee, the oblation. May he lead us to life, to long life, that we may live.

original: mā enam agne vi dahaḥ mā abhi śūśucaḥ mā asya tvacam cikṣipaḥ mā śarīram / śṛtam yadā karasi jātavedaḥ atha īm enam pra hiṇutāt pitṝn upa /
analyzed: mā enam agne vi dahaḥ mā abhi śūśucaḥ mā asya tvacam cikṣipaḥ mā śarīram   śṛtam yadā karasi jātavedaḥ atha īm enam pra hiṇutāt pitṝn upa  /
translated: Burn him not, O Agni, scorch him not, O Agni, rend not his skin, rend not his flesh. When thou hast made him ready, O all-knower, then send him to the Fathers.

original: yadā śṛtam kṛṇavaḥ jātavedaḥ atha imam enam pari dattāt pitṛbhyaḥ / yadā u gacchāti asu nītim etām atha devānām vaśanīḥ bhavāti //
analyzed: yadā śṛtam kṛṇavaḥ jātavedaḥ atha imam enam pari dattāt pitṛbhyaḥ   yadā u gacchāti asu nītim etām atha devānām vaśanīḥ bhavāti  /
translated: When thou hast made him ready, O all-knower, then give him to the Fathers. When he hath gone to the abode of the Fathers, then he becomes obedient to the Gods.

original: trikadrukebhiḥ pavate ṣaṭ urvīḥ ekam id bṛhat / triṣṭubh gāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tāḥ yamaḥ ārpitā /
analyzed: trikadrukebhiḥ pavate ṣaṭ urvīḥ ekam id bṛhat   triṣṭubh gāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tāḥ yamaḥ ārpitā  /
translated: He purifies himself with the Trikadrukas, with the six wide realms, with the one great one. The Tristubh, the Gayatri, all the metres are laid in Yama.

original: sūryam cakṣuṣā gaccha vātam ātmanā divam ca gaccha pṛthivīm ca dharmabhiḥ / apaḥ vā gaccha yadi tatra te hitam oṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ /🔽ajaḥ bhāgaḥ tapasaḥ tam tapasva tam te śociḥ tapatu tam te arciḥ / yāḥ te śivāḥ tanvaḥ jātavedaḥ tābhiḥ vaha enam su kṛtām u lokam /
analyzed: sūryam cakṣuṣā gaccha vātam ātmanā divam ca gaccha pṛthivīm ca dharmabhiḥ   apaḥ vā gaccha yadi tatra te hitam oṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ  / ajaḥ bhāgaḥ tapasaḥ tam tapasva tam te śociḥ tapatu tam te arciḥ   yāḥ te śivāḥ tanvaḥ jātavedaḥ tābhiḥ vaha enam su kṛtām u lokam  /
translated: Go with thine eye to Sûrya, with thy spirit to the wind. Go to the heaven and earth with all thy righteous acts. Or if it be thy wish, go to the waters. In the plants settle thy body.🔽The goat is the portion of penance: him do thou torment. Let thy flame burn him, let thy flame torment him. With those most gracious forms of thine, O Jâtavedas, bear him to the world of good men.

original: yāḥ te śocayaḥ raṃhayaḥ jātavedaḥ yābhiḥ āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam / ajam yantam anu tāḥ sam ṛṇvatām atha itarābhiḥ śivatamābhiḥ śṛtam kṛdhi //
analyzed: yāḥ te śocayaḥ raṃhayaḥ jātavedaḥ yābhiḥ āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam   ajam yantam anu tāḥ sam ṛṇvatām atha itarābhiḥ śivatamābhiḥ śṛtam kṛdhi  /
translated: Thy flames, thy swift impetuous forces, Jâtavedas, wherewith thou fillest heaven and earth, Let them unite with him who goes as goat. Then with the rest, most gracious, make him ready.

original: ava sṛja punar agne pitṛbhyaḥ yaḥ te āhutaḥ carati svadhāvān / āyuḥ vasānaḥ upa yātu śeṣaḥ sam gacchatām tanvā su varcāḥ // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //🔽ati drava śvānau sārameyau catur akṣau śabalau sādhunā pathā / adha pitṝn suvidatrām apīhi yamena ye sadhamādam madanti //
analyzed: ava sṛja punar agne pitṛbhyaḥ yaḥ te āhutaḥ carati svadhāvān    āyuḥ vasānaḥ upa yātu śeṣaḥ sam gacchatām tanvā su varcāḥ  ati drava śvānau sārameyau catur akṣau śabalau sādhunā pathā    adha pitṝn suvidatrām apīhi yamena ye sadhamādam madanti  /
translated: Send forth again, O Agni, to the Fathers, he who, served with sacred food, moves self-sustained. Let him return with lengthened life, and let him, bright with splendour, join him in his proper form.🔽Run past the two dogs, the mastiffs, the four-eyed, the dappled, by the good path. Go to the Fathers who are most friendly. With Yama rejoice in the banquet they enjoy.

original: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau catur akṣau pathiṣadī nṛ cakṣasā / tābhyām rājan pari dhehi enam svasti asmai anamīvam ca dhehi //
analyzed: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau catur akṣau pathiṣadī nṛ cakṣasā      tābhyām rājan pari dhehi enam svasti asmai anamīvam ca dhehi  /
translated: The two dogs, O Yama, who are thy guardians, the four-eyed, the dappled, who sit on the path, with human eyes, with them, O King, surround this man. Give him prosperity and freedom from disease.

original: urūṇasau asutṛpau udumbalau yamasya dūtau carataḥ janām anu / tau asmabhyam dṛśaye sūryāya punar dātām asum adya iha bhadram /
analyzed: urūṇasau asutṛpau udumbalau yamasya dūtau carataḥ janām anu   tau asmabhyam dṛśaye sūryāya punar dātām asum adya iha bhadram  /
translated: The two wide-tressed, insatiable, Udumbara trees, the two messengers of Yama, go about among the people. May they give us back our life, for the sight of the sun, for good fortune here today.

original: somaḥ ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtam ekaḥ upāsate / yebhyaḥ madhu pradhāvati tān cit eva api gacchatāt /
analyzed: somaḥ ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtam ekaḥ upāsate   yebhyaḥ madhu pradhāvati tān cit eva api gacchatāt  /
translated: To some the Soma flows, to some they worship with ghee. To those to whom the honey runs, go even to them.

original: ye cit pūrve ṛta sātāḥ ṛta jātāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ / ṛṣīn tapasvataḥ yama tapaḥ jām api gacchatāt /
analyzed: ye cit pūrve ṛta sātāḥ ṛta jātāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ    ṛṣīn tapasvataḥ yama tapaḥ jām api gacchatāt  /
translated: Those who were the first to keep the Law, born of Law, increasers of Law, the sages who have won perfection, go even to them.

original: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāḥ tapasā ye svar yayuḥ / tapaḥ ye cakrire mahaḥ tān cit eva api gacchatāt /
analyzed: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāḥ tapasā ye svar yayuḥ   tapaḥ ye cakrire mahaḥ tān cit eva api gacchatāt  /
translated: Those whom no one can overcome by penance, those who have gone to heaven by penance, those who have performed great penance, go even to them.

original: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāsaḥ ye svar tanūtyajaḥ / ye vā sahasra dakṣiṇāḥ tām cit eva api gacchatāt /
analyzed: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāsaḥ ye svar tanūtyajaḥ   ye vā sahasra dakṣiṇāḥ tām cit eva api gacchatāt  /
translated: Those heroes who fight in battles, those who have sacrificed their bodies for heaven, those who have given a thousand as a sacrificial fee, go even to them.

original: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayaḥ ye gopāyanti sūryam / ṛṣīn tapasvataḥ yama tapaḥ jām api gacchatāt /
analyzed: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayaḥ ye gopāyanti sūryam    ṛṣīn tapasvataḥ yama tapaḥ jām api gacchatāt  /
translated: The sages who have a thousand ways of knowing, who protect the sun, the sages who have won perfection, go even to them.

original: syonāḥ asmai bhava pṛthivī anṛkṣarā niveśanī / yaccha asmai śarma saprathāḥ /
analyzed: syonāḥ asmai bhava pṛthivī anṛkṣarā niveśanī   yaccha asmai śarma saprathāḥ
translated: Be soft and free from thorns for him, O Earth, easy to tread on. Give him protection that shall spread far and wide.

original: asaṃbādhe pṛthivyāḥ urau loke ni dhīyasva / svadhā yāḥ cakṛṣe jīvan tāḥ te santu madhuścutaḥ // // // // // // // svadhā yāḥ cakṛṣe jīvan tāḥ te santu madhuścutaḥ // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //
analyzed: asaṃbādhe pṛthivyāḥ urau loke ni dhīyasva    svadhāḥ yāḥ cakṛṣe jīvan tāḥ te santu madhuścutaḥ
translated: Sweet juices be they that thou hast prepared while living.

original: hvayāmi te manasā manaḥ iha imān gṛhām upa jujuṣāṇaḥ ehi / sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena syonāḥ tvā vātāḥ upa vāntu śagmāḥ /
analyzed: hvayāmi te manasā manaḥ iha imān gṛhām upa jujuṣāṇaḥ ehi   / sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena syonāḥ tvā vātāḥ upa vāntu śagmāḥ  /
translated: I call thy mind to mind, come hither to these houses, accepting them. Unite with the Fathers, with Yama. Let the gentle winds blow upon thee, bringing bliss.🔽The Maruts, the Udavahas, the Upavasus, making thee cool with the goat, let them sprinkle thee with rain.

original: ud tvā vahantu marutaḥ udavāhāḥ udaprutaḥ / ajena kṛṇvantaḥ śītam varṣeṇa ukṣantu bāl iti /
analyzed: ud tvā vahantu marutaḥ udavāhāḥ udaprutaḥ   ajena kṛṇvantaḥ śītam varṣeṇa ukṣantu bāl iti  /
translated: The Maruts, the Udavahas, the Upavasus, making thee cool with the goat, let them sprinkle thee with rain.

original: ud ahvam āyuḥ āyuṣe kratve dakṣāya jīvase / svān gacchatu te manaḥ adha pitṝn upa drava /
analyzed: ud ahvam āyuḥ āyuṣe kratve dakṣāya jīvase    svān gacchatu te manaḥ adha pitṝn upa drava  /
translated: I call thee up for life, for life, for wisdom, for power, for living. Let thy mind go to its own. Go to the Fathers below.

original: mā te manaḥ māsoḥ mā aṅgānām mā rasasya te / mā te hāsta tanvaḥ kim cana iha /
analyzed: mā te manaḥ mā asoḥ mā aṅgānām mā rasasya te   mā te hāsta tanvaḥ kim cana iha  /
translated: Let not thy mind be lost, let not thy limbs, let not thy vigour fail thee. Let nothing be amiss with thy body.

original: mā tvā vṛkṣaḥ sam bādhiṣṭa mā devī pṛthivī mahī / lokam pitṛṣu vittvā edhasva yama rājasu /
analyzed: mā tvā vṛkṣaḥ sam bādhiṣṭa mā devī pṛthivī mahī    lokam pitṛṣu vittvā edhasva yama rājasu  /
translated: Let not the tree, let not the great goddess Earth, harm thee. Having found a place among the Fathers, grow thou strong among the Kings of the Dead.

original: yat te aṅgam atihitam parācais apānaḥ prāṇaḥ yaḥ u vā te paretaḥ / tat te saṃgatya pitaraḥ sanīḍāḥ ghāsāt ghāsam punar ā veśayantu //
analyzed: yat te aṅgam atihitam parācais apānaḥ prāṇaḥ yaḥ u vā te paretaḥ   tat te saṃgatya pitaraḥ sanīḍāḥ ghāsāt ghāsam punar ā veśayantu  /
translated: Thy limb that is misplaced, thy breath that is gone, or thy life that is departed, let the Fathers, the Sisters, the Brothers, restore to thee from the food to the food again.

original: apa imam jīvāḥ arudhan gṛhebhyaḥ tam niḥ vahata pari grāmāt itas / mṛtyuḥ yamasya āsīt dūtaḥ pracetāḥ asūn pitṛbhyaḥ gamayām cakāra /
analyzed: apa imam jīvāḥ arudhan gṛhebhyaḥ tam niḥ vahata pari grāmāt itas    mṛtyuḥ yamasya āsīt dūtaḥ pracetāḥ asūn pitṛbhyaḥ gamayām cakāra  /
translated: The living have shut him out from his home: drive him forth from the village, from this place. Death was the messenger of Yama: the wise one has sent the life-breath to the Fathers.

original: ye dasyavaḥ pitṛṣu praviṣṭāḥ jñāti mukhāḥ a huta adaḥ caranti / parāpuraḥ nipuraḥ ye bharanti agniḥ tān asmāt pra dhamāti yajñāt /
analyzed: ye dasyavaḥ pitṛṣu praviṣṭāḥ jñāti mukhāḥ a huta adaḥ caranti   parāpuraḥ nipuraḥ ye bharanti agniḥ tān asmāt pra dhamāti yajñāt  /
translated: Those robbers who have entered the Fathers, who move about among the kinsmen, who eat without being offered, who carry off the goods of others, of the village and of the town, let Agni drive them from this sacrifice.

original: sam viśantu iha pitaraḥ svā naḥ syonam kṛṇvantaḥ pratirante āyuḥ / tebhyaḥ śakema haviṣā nakṣamāṇāḥ jyok jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīḥ /
analyzed: sam viśantu iha pitaraḥ svāḥ naḥ syonam kṛṇvantaḥ pratirante āyuḥ   tebhyaḥ śakema haviṣā nakṣamāṇāḥ jyok jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīḥ  /
translated: Here let the Fathers enter into our house, and make it pleasant, and prolong our life. Seeking them with our offering, may we be able to live many long years, living to old age.

original: yām te dhenum nipṛṇāmi yam u kṣīre odanam / tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ // tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ // tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ // tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ // tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ // tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ // tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ // tena janasyāsaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat a
analyzed: yām te dhenum nipṛṇāmi yam u kṣīre odanam       tena janasya asaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ    tena janasya asaḥ bhartā yaḥ atra asat ajīvanaḥ               atra asat ajīvanaḥ
translated: The cow which I give thee, and the rice-milk which I give thee, therewith be thou a supporter of the man who is here, who is without life.

original: aśvāvatīm pra tara yā su śevā rkṣākam vā prataram navīyaḥ / yaḥ tvā jaghāna vadhyaḥ saḥ astu mā saḥ anyat vidata bhāgadheyam /
analyzed: aśvāvatīm pra tara yā su śevā rkṣākam vā prataram navīyaḥ   yaḥ tvā jaghāna vadhyaḥ saḥ astu mā saḥ anyat vidata bhāgadheyam  /
translated: Go to the ford that is rich in horses, or to the newer ford that is rich in cattle. He who hath slain thee, let him be slain. Let him not find another share.

original: yamaḥ paraḥ avaraḥ vivasvān tatas param na ati paśyāmi kim cana / yame adhvaraḥ adhi me niviṣṭaḥ bhuvaḥ vivasvān anvātatāna /
analyzed: yamaḥ paraḥ avaraḥ vivasvān tatas param na ati paśyāmi kim cana   yame adhvaraḥ adhi me niviṣṭaḥ bhuvaḥ vivasvān anvātatāna  /
translated: Yama is the highest, Vivasvan is the lowest. Beyond that I see nothing at all. The sacrifice is established in Yama. Vivasvan hath extended it on earth.

original: apāgūhan amṛtām martyebhyaḥ kṛtvā savarṇām adadhuḥ vivasvate / uta aśvinau abharat yat tat āsīt ajahāt u dvā mithunā saraṇyūḥ /
analyzed: apāgūhan amṛtām martyebhyaḥ kṛtvā savarṇām adadhuḥ vivasvate     uta aśvinau abharat yat tat āsīt ajahāt u dvā mithunā saraṇyūḥ  /
translated: They hid the Immortal One from mortal men, and made a likeness of him for Vivasvan. The two Asvins took upon them what he was, and Saranyu left two pairs behind her.

original: ye nikhātāḥ ye paroptāḥ ye dagdhāḥ ye ca uddhitāḥ / sarvān tān agne ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave /
analyzed: ye nikhātāḥ ye paroptāḥ ye dagdhāḥ ye ca uddhitāḥ   sarvān tān agne ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave  /
translated: Those that are buried, those that are above ground, those that are burnt, and those that are dug up, O Agni, bring all these Fathers hither to the feast of our oblation.

original: ye agni dagdhāḥ ye an agni dagdhāḥ madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante / tvam tān vettha yadi te jātavedaḥ svadhayā yajñam svadhitim juṣantām /
analyzed: ye agni dagdhāḥ ye an agni dagdhāḥ madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante   tvam tān vettha yadi te jātavedaḥ svadhayā yajñam svadhitim juṣantām  /
translated: Those who are burnt by fire, those who are not burnt by fire, who rejoice in the mid-air with their own nature, thou knowest them, O all-knowing one. Let them enjoy the sacrifice with their own nature, and the sacrificial ladle.

original: śam tapa mā ati tapaḥ agne mā tanvam tapaḥ / vaṇeṣu śuṣmaḥ astu te pṛthivyām astu yat dharaḥ //
analyzed: śam tapa mā ati tapaḥ agne mā tanvam tapaḥ   vaṇeṣu śuṣmaḥ astu te pṛthivyām astu yat dharaḥ
translated: Do not burn too much, O Agni, do not burn thy body too much. Let thy strength be in the woods, let thy heat be in the earth.

original: dadāmi asmai avasānam etat yaḥ eṣaḥ āgan mama ced abhūt iha / yamaḥ cikitvān prati etat āha mama eṣa rāyaḥ upa tiṣṭhatām iha /
analyzed: dadāmi asmai avasānam etat yaḥ eṣaḥ āgan mama ced abhūt iha    yamaḥ cikitvān prati etat āha mama eṣa rāyaḥ upa tiṣṭhatām iha  /
translated: I give him this resting-place, if he has been mine who has come hither. Yama, the wise, says this to him: 'Let him attend to my wealth here.'

original: imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai / śate śaratsu naḥ u purā /
analyzed: imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai   śate śaratsu naḥ u purā  /
translated: We measure this span, that he may not die before his time, in a hundred autumns, and in more than that.

original: pra imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai / śate śaratsu naḥ u purā /
analyzed: pra imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai   / śate śaratsu naḥ u purā  /
translated: We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.
