translated: We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.🔽We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.

original: niḥ imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai / śate śaratsu na u purā /
analyzed: niḥ imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai    śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: We measure out this span of life that it may not pass away before its time, Before a hundred autumns come.

original: ud imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai / śate śaratsu naḥ u purā /🔽sam imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai / śate śaratsu naḥ u purā /
analyzed: ud imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai    śate śaratsu naḥ u purā  / sam imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai   / śate śaratsu naḥ u purā  /
translated: We measure out this span of life, that we may live a hundred winters, and a hundred summers more.🔽We measure out this span of life, that we may live a hundred winters, and a hundred summers more.

original: amāsi mātrām svar agām āyuṣmān bhūyāsam / yathā aparam na māsātai śate śaratsu na u purā /
analyzed: amāsi mātrām svar agām āyuṣmān bhūyāsam   yathā aparam na māsātai śate śaratsu na u purā  /
translated: I have come to the span of life of my mother. May I live long. That I may live a hundred winters, and a hundred summers more.

original: prāṇaḥ apānaḥ vyānaḥ āyuḥ cakṣuḥ dṛśaye sūryāya / a paripareṇa pathā yama rājñaḥ pitṝn gaccha /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ apānaḥ vyānaḥ āyuḥ cakṣuḥ dṛśaye sūryāya   a paripareṇa pathā yama rājñaḥ pitṝn gaccha  /
translated: The out-breath, the in-breath, the through-breath, life, sight for the seeing of the sun, go by the path that goes not astray to the Fathers, to King Yama.🔽Those who have gone away, the first to sacrifice, leaving behind enmities, childless,

original: ye agravaḥ śaśamānāḥ pareyuḥ hitvā dveṣāṃsi anapatyavantaḥ / te dyām uditya avidanta lokam nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi dīdhyānāḥ /
analyzed: ye agravaḥ śaśamānāḥ pareyuḥ hitvā dveṣāṃsi anapatyavantaḥ   te dyām uditya avidanta lokam nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi dīdhyānāḥ  /
translated: They, having gone up to heaven, have found the world, shining above the ridge of the vault.🔽The lowest heaven is full of water, the middle one is full of pilu trees,

original: udanvatī dyauḥ avamā pīlumatī iti madhyamā / tṛtīyā ha pradyauḥ iti yasyām pitaraḥ āsate /
analyzed: udanvatī dyauḥ avamā pīlumatī iti madhyamā   tṛtīyā ha pradyauḥ iti yasyām pitaraḥ āsate  /
translated: The third is the heaven where the Fathers dwell.🔽Those who are the Fathers of the Father, the Grandfathers, who have entered the wide air,

original: ye na pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ ye āviviśuḥ uru antarikṣam / ye ākṣiyanti pṛthivīm uta dyām tebhyaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ namasā vidhema /
analyzed: ye na pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ ye āviviśuḥ uru antarikṣam   ye ākṣiyanti pṛthivīm uta dyām tebhyaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ namasā vidhema  /
translated: Who look on the earth and the sky, to those Fathers let us pay homage with reverence.

original: idam id vai u na aparam divi paśyasi sūryam / mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi // // // // // //
analyzed: idam id vai u na aparam divi paśyasi sūryam   mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi
translated: This is the Sun, and not another, which thou seest in the sky. As a mother her son, so do thou, O Earth, cover him with thy bosom.

original: idam id vai u na aparam jarasi anyat itas aparam / jāyā patim iva vāsasā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi //
analyzed: idam id vai u na aparam jarasi anyat itas aparam   / jāyā patim iva vāsasā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi  /
translated: This is the Sun, and not another, which thou seest yonder beyond this. As a wife her husband, so do thou, O Earth, cover him with thy bosom.

original: abhi tvā ūrṇomi pṛthivyāḥ mātuḥ vastreṇa bhadrayā / jīveṣu bhadram tat mayi svadhā pitṛṣu sā tvayi //🔽agnīṣomā pathikṛtā syonam devebhyaḥ ratnam dadhathuḥ vi lokam / upa preṣyantam pūṣaṇam yaḥ vahāti añjoyānaiḥ pathibhiḥ tatra gacchatam /
analyzed: abhi tvā ūrṇomi pṛthivyāḥ mātuḥ vastreṇa bhadrayā   jīveṣu bhadram tat mayi svadhā pitṛṣu sā tvayi  / agnīṣomā pathikṛtā syonam devebhyaḥ ratnam dadhathuḥ vi lokam   upa preṣyantam pūṣaṇam yaḥ vahāti añjoyānaiḥ pathibhiḥ tatra gacchatam  /
translated: I cover thee with the auspicious garment of the mother Earth. In me be that which is good for the living. In thee be that which is the food of the Fathers.🔽O Agni and Soma, ye who make the path, bestow on the Gods the lovely treasure, the light. Go ye to Pusan, whom ye carry, whom they urge forward, by the paths that are anointed.

original: pūṣā tvā itas cyāvayatu pra vidvān an aṣṭa paśuḥ bhuvanasya gopāḥ / sa tvā etebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyaḥ agniḥ devebhyaḥ suvi datriyebhyaḥ /
analyzed: pūṣā tvā itas cyāvayatu pra vidvān an aṣṭa paśuḥ bhuvanasya gopāḥ    sa tvā etebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyaḥ agniḥ devebhyaḥ suvi datriyebhyaḥ  /
translated: May Pusan, the all-knowing, the guardian of the world, the undying, send thee forth from hence. May he deliver thee to these Fathers of thine. May Agni to the Gods who give good gifts deliver thee.

original: āyuḥ viśvāyuḥ pari pātu tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt / yatra āsate su kṛtaḥ yatra te īyuḥ tatra tvā devaḥ savitā dadhātu //
analyzed: āyuḥ viśvāyuḥ pari pātu tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt   yatra āsate su kṛtaḥ yatra te īyuḥ tatra tvā devaḥ savitā dadhātu  /
translated: May life, all-life, protect thee. May Pûshan guard thee on the path before us. Where dwell the pious, where they have gone, thither may Savitar the God establish thee.

original: imau yunajmi te vahnī asunītāya voḍhave / tābhyām yamasya sādanam samitiḥ ca ava gacchatāt /
analyzed: imau yunajmi te vahnī asunītāya voḍhave   tābhyām yamasya sādanam samitiḥ ca ava gacchatāt  /
translated: I yoke these two thy steeds, the Asvins, for thy car, the bearer. By them to Yama's dwelling-place, to his assembly, go thou down.

original: etat tvā vāsaḥ prathamam nu āgan apa etat ūha yat iha ābibhar purā / iṣṭāpūrtam anusaṃkrāma vidvān yatra te dattam bahudhā vibandhuṣu /
analyzed: etat tvā vāsaḥ prathamam nu āgan apa etat ūha yat iha ābibhar purā    iṣṭāpūrtam anusaṃkrāma vidvān yatra te dattam bahudhā vibandhuṣu  /
translated: This robe hath been the first to clothe thee here. I take away this garment which thou wearest. Go thou to the place of sacrifice, well knowing the fulfilment of thy wishes, where to thy kinsmen thou hast given much wealth.

original: agneḥ varma pari gobhiḥ vyayasva sam prorṇuṣva medasā pīvasā ca / na id tvā dhṛṣṇuḥ harasā jarhṛṣāṇaḥ dadhṛṣāṇaḥ vidhakṣan parīṅkhayātai /
analyzed: agneḥ varma pari gobhiḥ vyayasva sam prorṇuṣva medasā pīvasā ca    na id tvā dhṛṣṇuḥ harasā jarhṛṣāṇaḥ dadhṛṣāṇaḥ vidhakṣan parīṅkhayātai  /
translated: Put on the robe of Agni, clothe thee in the cows. Anoint thyself with fat and marrow. Let not the bold, impetuous, burning, greedy Dhatr, when he hath seized thee, pass thee by.🔽Taking the staff from the hand of him who is departing, with hearing, with glory, with strength,

original: daṇḍam hastāt ādadānaḥ gatāsoḥ saha śrotreṇa varcasā balena / atra eva tvam iha vayam su vīrāḥ viśvāḥ mṛdhaḥ abhimātīḥ jayema /
analyzed: daṇḍam hastāt ādadānaḥ gatāsoḥ saha śrotreṇa varcasā balena    atra eva tvam iha vayam su vīrāḥ viśvāḥ mṛdhaḥ abhimātīḥ jayema  /
translated: Here only stay thou. We here with brave sons shall conquer all our enemies and all insulting foes.

original: dhanuḥ hastāt ādadānaḥ mṛtasya saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena / samāgṛbhāya vasu bhūri puṣṭam arvāṅ tvam ehi upa jīva lokam // // vasu bhūri puṣṭam arvāṅ tvam ehi upa jīva lokam // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //
analyzed: dhanuḥ hastāt ādadānaḥ mṛtasya saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena      samāgṛbhāya vasu bhūri puṣṭam arvāṅ tvam ehi upa jīva lokam
translated: This woman, choosing the world of her husband, lies down to rest near thee, O mortal, who art going to the world of the dead.

original: iyam nārī pati lokam vṛṇānā ni padyate upa tvā martya pretam / dharmam purāṇam anupālayantī tasyai prajām draviṇam ca iha dhehi //
analyzed: iyam nārī pati lokam vṛṇānā ni padyate upa tvā martya pretam     dharmam purāṇam anupālayantī tasyai prajām draviṇam ca iha dhehi  /
translated: Following the ancient law, may she obtain offspring and wealth here.

original: ud īrṣva nārī abhi jīva lokam gatāsum etam upa śeṣaḥ ehi / hasta grābhasya dadhiṣoḥ tava idam patyuḥ janitvam abhi sam babhūtha /
analyzed: ud īrṣva nārī abhi jīva lokam gatāsum etam upa śeṣaḥ ehi   hasta grābhasya dadhiṣoḥ tava idam patyuḥ janitvam abhi sam babhūtha  /
translated: Rise up, O woman, to the world of the living. Come to the remainder of this one who is gone to rest.🔽This is thy husband's heritage, which thou hast obtained by the grasping of hands and the sipping of Soma.

original: apaśyam yuvatim nīyamānām jīvām mṛtebhyaḥ pariṇīyamānām / andhena yat tamasā prāvṛtā āsīt prāktaḥ apācīm anayam tat enām /
analyzed: apaśyam yuvatim nīyamānām jīvām mṛtebhyaḥ pariṇīyamānām    andhena yat tamasā prāvṛtā āsīt prāktas apācīm anayam tat enām  /
translated: I saw a young woman being led away, alive, being led away from the dead. When she was covered with the blind darkness, I led her from the east to the west.

original: prajānati aghnye jīva lokam devānām panthām anusaṃcarantī / ayam te gopatiḥ tam juṣasva svargam lokam adhi rohaya enam /
analyzed: prajānati aghnye jīva lokam devānām panthām anusaṃcarantī    ayam te gopatiḥ tam juṣasva svargam lokam adhi rohaya enam  /
translated: The cow knows the world of the living, following the path of the gods. This is your master, accept him. Raise him up to the heavenly world.🔽To the sky, to the reed, to the crossing of the rivers,

original: upa dyām upa vetasam avattaraḥ nadīnām / agne pittam apām asi /
analyzed: upa dyām upa vetasam avattaraḥ nadīnām    agne pittam apām asi
translated: O Agni, thou art the bile of the waters.🔽O Agni, what thou hast burnt, that do thou extinguish again.

original: yam tvam agne samadahaḥ tam u niḥ vāpaya punar / kyāmbūḥ atra rohatu śāṇḍadūrvā vyalkaśā /
analyzed: yam tvam agne samadahaḥ tam u niḥ vāpaya punar   kyāmbūḥ atra rohatu śāṇḍadūrvā vyalkaśā  /
translated: Let the Kâmbû plant grow here, the Sând-dûrvâ, the Vyalka plant.🔽This is one of thine, this is one of thine; with the third light enter thou.

original: idam te ekam puras u te ekam tṛtīyena jyotiṣā sam viśasva / saṃveśane tanvā cāruḥ edhi priyaḥ devānām parame sadhasthe /
analyzed: idam te ekam puras u te ekam tṛtīyena jyotiṣā sam viśasva    saṃveśane tanvā cāruḥ edhi priyaḥ devānām parame sadhasthe  /
translated: In the union of thy body be thou fair, dear to the gods in the highest abode.🔽Rise up, go forward, run. Make a home for thyself in the watery abode.

original: ud tiṣṭha prehi pra dravaukaḥ kṛṇuṣva salile sadhasthe / tatra tvam pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ sam somena madasva sam svadhābhiḥ //
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha prehi pra dravaukaḥ kṛṇuṣva salile sadhasthe      tatra tvam pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ sam somena madasva sam svadhābhiḥ  /
translated: There, in union with the fathers, rejoice with Soma, with the oblations.

original: pra cyavasva tanvam sam bharasva mā te gātrā vi hāyi mā u śarīram / manaḥ niviṣṭam anusaṃviśasva yatra bhūmeḥ juṣase tatra gaccha /
analyzed: pra cyavasva tanvam sam bharasva mā te gātrā vi hāyi mā u śarīram   manaḥ niviṣṭam anusaṃviśasva yatra bhūmeḥ juṣase tatra gaccha  /
translated: Move forward, gather up thy body. Let not thy limbs be scattered, let not thy body. Settle down thy mind, and go to sleep. Go to the place where thou wilt find thy rest.

original: varcasā mām pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ añjantu devāḥ madhunā ghṛtena / cakṣuṣe mā prataram tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu // // tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu // // tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu // // tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu // // tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu // // tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu // // tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu // // tār
analyzed: varcasā mām pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ añjantu devāḥ madhunā ghṛtena    cakṣuṣe mā prataram tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu             mā         /
translated: Let the Fathers who drink the Soma make me bright with splendour, let the Gods make me bright with honey and with ghee. Making me pass over to the eye, let them increase my life to old age, let them increase my sight to old age.

original: varcasā mām sam anaktu agniḥ medhām me viṣṇuḥ ni anaktu āsan / rayim me viśve ni yacchantu devāḥ syonāḥ māpaḥ pavanaiḥ punantu /
analyzed: varcasā mām sam anaktu agniḥ medhām me viṣṇuḥ ni anaktu āsan    rayim me viśve ni yacchantu devāḥ syonāḥ māpaḥ pavanaiḥ punantu  /
translated: Let Agni anoint me with splendour. Let Visnu anoint me with wisdom. Let all the Gods bestow wealth on me. Let the kindly waters, with the winds, make me pure.

original: mitrāvaruṇā pari mām adhātām ādityāḥ mā svaravaḥ vardhayantu / varcaḥ me indraḥ ni anaktu hastayoḥ jaradaṣṭim mā savitā kṛṇotu //
analyzed: mitrāvaruṇā pari mām adhātām ādityāḥ mā svaravaḥ vardhayantu   varcaḥ me indraḥ ni anaktu hastayoḥ jaradaṣṭim mā savitā kṛṇotu  /
translated: May Mitra-Varuṇa invest me round about: may the Âdityas make my voice to wax in strength. May Indra pour the splendour in my hands: may Savitar make me to look with vigour.🔽Him who first died of mortal men, him who first went to this world of life,

original: yaḥ mamāra prathamaḥ martyānām yaḥ preyāya prathamaḥ lokam etam / vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā saparyata //
analyzed: yaḥ mamāra prathamaḥ martyānām yaḥ preyāya prathamaḥ lokam etam    vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā saparyata  /
translated: To Yama, the son of Vivasvan, the gatherer of men, the king, offer oblation.

original: parā yāta pitaraḥ ā ca yāta ayam vaḥ yajñaḥ madhunā samaktaḥ / dattaḥ asmabhyam draviṇā iha bhadram rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram dadhāta /
analyzed: parā yāta pitaraḥ ā ca yāta ayam vaḥ yajñaḥ madhunā samaktaḥ   dattaḥ asmabhyam draviṇā iha bhadram rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram dadhāta  /
translated: Go away, ye Fathers, and come hither: this sacrifice is yours, anointed with honey. Give us here wealth with noble heroes.🔽Kanva, Kakshivan, Purumîd, Agastya, Shyâvâshva, Sobhari, Archanâna,

original: kaṇvaḥ kakṣīvān purumīḍhaḥ agastyaḥ śyāvāśvaḥ sobharī arcanānāḥ / viśvāmitraḥ ayam jamadagniḥ atriḥ avantu naḥ kaśyapaḥ vāmadevaḥ /
analyzed: kaṇvaḥ kakṣīvān purumīḍhaḥ agastyaḥ śyāvāśvaḥ sobharī arcanānāḥ   viśvāmitraḥ ayam jamadagniḥ atriḥ avantu naḥ kaśyapaḥ vāmadevaḥ  /
translated: Visvâmitra, Jamadagni, Atri, may they protect us, Kasyapa, Vâmadevya.🔽Visvâmitra, Jamadagni, Vasistha, Bharadvaja, Gautama, Vâmadevya,

original: viśvāmitra jamadagne vasiṣṭha bharadvāja gotama vāmadeva / śardiḥ naḥ atriḥ agrabhīt namobhiḥ su saṃśāsaḥ pitaraḥ mṛḍata naḥ /
analyzed: viśvāmitra jamadagne vasiṣṭha bharadvāja gotama vāmadeva    śardiḥ naḥ atriḥ agrabhīt namobhiḥ su saṃśāsaḥ pitaraḥ mṛḍata naḥ  /
translated: Atri hath seized us here with reverence: be gracious unto us, O Fathers, well-governed.

original: kasye mṛjānāḥ ati yanti ripram āyuḥ dadhānāḥ prataram navīyaḥ / āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena adha syāma surabhayaḥ gṛheṣu /
analyzed: kasye mṛjānāḥ ati yanti ripram āyuḥ dadhānāḥ prataram navīyaḥ    āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena adha syāma surabhayaḥ gṛheṣu  /
translated: Whose is the stain that they remove, bestowing life that is more new and sure? May we be prosperous in our homes, waxing in strength with offspring and with wealth.

original: añjate vi añjate sam añjate kratum rihanti madhunā abhi añjate / sindhoḥ ucchvāse patayantam ukṣaṇam hiraṇya pāvāḥ paśum āsu gṛhnate /
analyzed: añjate vi añjate sam añjate kratum rihanti madhunā abhi añjate     /                      gṛhnate  /
translated: They anoint, they anoint apart, they anoint together; they kiss the sacrifice, they anoint it with mead. The bull that flies in the wind of the river, the beast of prey, the gold-coloured, they seize in their houses.

original: yat vaḥ mudram pitaraḥ somyam ca tena u sacadhvam sva yaśasaḥ hi bhūta / te arvāṇaḥ kavayaḥ ā śṛṇota suvidatrāḥ vidathe huyamānāḥ /
analyzed: yat vaḥ mudram pitaraḥ somyam ca tena u sacadhvam sva yaśasaḥ hi bhūta    te arvāṇaḥ kavayaḥ ā śṛṇota suvidatrāḥ vidathe huyamānāḥ  /
translated: O Fathers, with that which is your most delightful and your Soma-worthy drink, be united therewith, for ye are glorious. Ye wise ones, come hitherward, easy to invoke, when offered in the sacrifice.

original: ye atrayaḥ aṅgirasaḥ navagvāḥ iṣṭāvantaḥ rātiṣācaḥ dadhānāḥ / dakṣiṇāvantaḥ su kṛtaḥ ye u sthāsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam // dakṣiṇāvantaḥ su kṛtaḥ ye u sthāsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // //🔽adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāsaḥ agne ṛtam āśaśānāḥ / śuci id ayan dīdhyataḥ ukthaśasaḥ kṣāmāḥ bhindantaḥ aruṇīḥ apa vran /
analyzed: ye atrayaḥ aṅgirasaḥ navagvāḥ iṣṭāvantaḥ rātiṣācaḥ dadhānāḥ   dakṣiṇāvantaḥ su kṛtaḥ ye u stha āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam   dakṣiṇāvantaḥ su kṛtaḥ ye u stha āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāsaḥ agne ṛtam āśaśānāḥ   śuci id ayan dīdhyataḥ ukthaśasaḥ kṣāmāḥ bhindantaḥ aruṇīḥ apa vran  /
translated: Ye Angirases, ye Navagvas, who have gained the prize, who are bestowers of gifts, who have received sacrificial gifts, who are well-skilled, who are seated here, rejoice on this sacred grass.🔽Now, as our sires of old, O Agni, have done, seeking the eternal law, pure, thoughtful, singing praises, have cleft the red clouds and passed away.

original: su karmānaḥ su rucaḥ devayantaḥ ayaḥ na devāḥ janimā dhamantaḥ / śucantaḥ agnim vāvṛdhantaḥ indram urvīm gavyām pariṣadam naḥ akran /
analyzed: su karmānaḥ su rucaḥ devayantaḥ ayaḥ na devāḥ janimā dhamantaḥ   śucantaḥ agnim vāvṛdhantaḥ indram urvīm gavyām pariṣadam naḥ akran  /
translated: The Gods, well-skilled, of fair forms, serving the Gods, blowing, as 'twere, the iron of their birth, rejoicing in Agni, strengthening Indra, have made our assembly wide and rich in kine.

original: ā yūthā iva kṣumati paśvaḥ akhyat devānām janimānti ugraḥ / martāsaḥ cit urvaśīḥ akṛpran vṛdhe cit aryaḥ uparasya āyoḥ /
analyzed: ā yūthā iva kṣumati paśvaḥ akhyat devānām janimānti ugraḥ   martāsaḥ cit urvaśīḥ akṛpran vṛdhe cit aryaḥ uparasya āyoḥ  /
translated: As one who marks the herds in time of hunger, the Mighty One hath looked on the generations of the Gods. Even mortal men have won the spacious regions, for the increase of the living man who strives.

original: akarma te su apasaḥ abhūmaḥ ṛtam avasran uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ / viśvam tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ /
analyzed: akarma te su apasaḥ abhūmaḥ ṛtam avasran uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ   viśvam tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ  /
translated: We have not done thy will, O thou of fair forms: the Dawns have passed away, the lights of Order. All that is blessed which the Gods protect and favour, may we speak boldly in the synod, with brave sons.

original: indraḥ mā marutvān prācyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /🔽dhātā mā nirṛtyāḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /
analyzed: indraḥ mā marutvān prācyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari  / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  / dhātā mā nirṛtyāḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari  / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  /
translated: May Indra with the Maruts protect me from the eastern region, the earth that is shaken by the arms, as by the sky above. We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods here.🔽May Dhatr protect me from the southern region of misfortune, the earth that is shaken by the arms, as by the sky above. We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods here.

original: aditiḥ mā ādityaiḥ pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /
analyzed: aditiḥ mā ādityaiḥ pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari  / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  /
translated: May Aditi with the Adityas protect me from the western region, the earth that is shaken by the arms, as by the sky above. We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods here.

original: somaḥ mā viśvaiḥ devaiḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /🔽dhartā ha tvā dharuṇaḥ dhārayātai ūrdhvam bhānum savitā dyām iva upari / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /
analyzed: somaḥ mā viśvaiḥ devaiḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari  / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  / dhartā ha tvā dharuṇaḥ dhārayātai ūrdhvam bhānum savitā dyām iva upari  / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  /
translated: May Soma, with all the Gods, protect me from the northern quarter, as the earth, thrown by the arm, protects the sky above. We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the sharers of oblations here of the Gods.🔽May the supporter, the prop, support thee, the light upwards, as Savitar the sky above. We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the sharers of oblations here of the Gods.

translated: In the region above, enclosed on every side, I place thee in the power of Svadha, fallen from the arms, like the earth above the sky. We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, the gods who have a share in the oblation here.

original: dhartā asi dharunaḥ asi vaṃsa gaḥ asi //
analyzed: dhartā asi dharunaḥ asi vaṃsa gaḥ asi
translated: You are the supporter, you are the supporter of the supporter, you are the supporter of the supporter of the supporter.

original: uda pūḥ asi madhu pūḥ asi vāta pūḥ asi //
analyzed: uda pūḥ asi madhu pūḥ asi vāta pūḥ asi
translated: You are the water-filled, you are the honey-filled, you are the wind-filled.

original: itas ca mā amutas ca avatām yame iva yatamāne yat ā etam / pra vām bharan mānuṣāḥ devayantaḥ ā sīdatām svam u lokam vidāne /
analyzed: itas ca mā amutas ca avatām yame iva yatamāne yat ā etam    pra vām bharan mānuṣāḥ devayantaḥ ā sīdatām svam u lokam vidāne  /
translated: From here and from there may they protect us, as if striving for Yama. As men who delight in the gods carry you, may they sit in their own world, which I have made.

original: svāsasthe bhavatam indave naḥ yuje vām brahma pūrvyam namobhiḥ / vi ślokaḥ eti pathyā iva sūriḥ śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtāsaḥ etat /

translated: Be easy to dwell with for our Soma, I yoke you with ancient prayer and salutations. The path goes forth like a swift-moving charioteer. May all the immortal gods listen to this.

original: devebhyaḥ kam avṛṇīta mṛtyum prajāyai kim amṛtam na avṛṇīta / bṛhaspatiḥ yajñam atanuta ṛṣiḥ priyām yamaḥ tanvam ā rireca //
analyzed: devebhyaḥ kam avṛṇīta mṛtyum prajāyai kim amṛtam na avṛṇīta   bṛhaspatiḥ yajñam atanuta ṛṣiḥ priyām yamaḥ tanvam ā rireca  /
translated: The sage Brihaspati hath fashioned the sacrifice: Yama hath extended his dear body.🔽Thou, O Agni, O all-knower, being invoked, having made the offerings fragrant,

original: tvam agne īḍitaḥ jātavedaḥ avāṭ havyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvā / prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā havīṃṣi /
analyzed: tvam agne īḍitaḥ jātavedaḥ avāṭ havyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvā   prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā havīṃṣi  /
translated: hast given them to the Fathers: they have eaten them with their own food. Eat thou, O God, the offered oblations.

original: āsīnāsaḥ aruṇīnām upasthe rayim dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya / putrebhyaḥ pitaraḥ tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata te iha ūrjam dadhāta /
analyzed: āsīnāsaḥ aruṇīnām upasthe rayim dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya   putrebhyaḥ pitaraḥ tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata te iha ūrjam dadhāta  /
translated: Seated on the lap of the red-hued (cows), bestow wealth on the mortal who offers. O Fathers, grant to your sons their share of that good thing, and bestow strength upon them here.

original: agniṣvāttāḥ pitaraḥ ā iha gacchata sadaḥsadaḥ sadata su praṇītayaḥ / attaḥ havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣi rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram dadhāta /🔽upahūtāḥ naḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu / te ā gamantu te iha śruvantu adhi bruvantu te avantu asmān /
analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ pitaraḥ ā iha gacchata sadaḥsadaḥ sadata su praṇītayaḥ   attaḥ havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣi rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram dadhāta  / upahūtāḥ naḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu   te ā gamantu te iha śruvantu adhi bruvantu te avantu asmān  /
translated: The Fathers who have Agni for their world, come hither, sit on the sacred grass, well-ordered, seat yourselves. Eat the oblations set upon the sacred grass, and bestow upon us wealth with all heroic powers.🔽The Fathers who are worthy of Soma have been invited to the dear places of worship on the sacred grass. May they come hither, may they listen to us. May they speak to us, may they protect us.

original: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ anūjahire soma pītham vasiṣṭhāḥ / tebhiḥ yamaḥ samrarāṇaḥ havīṃṣi uśan uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu //
analyzed: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ anūjahire soma pītham vasiṣṭhāḥ    tebhiḥ yamaḥ samrarāṇaḥ havīṃṣi uśan uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu  /
translated: Our sires of sires, our sires of grandsires, who have been born again, the most venerable, who have drunk the Soma juice. With them let Yama, rejoicing, eat the oblations, rejoicing with the joyful ones, according to his desire.

original: ye tātṛṣuḥ devatrā jehamānāḥ hotrāvidaḥ stoma taṣṭāsaḥ arkaiḥ / ā agne yāhi sahasram deva vandaiḥ satyaiḥ kavibhiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ /
analyzed: ye tātṛṣuḥ devatrā jehamānāḥ hotrāvidaḥ stoma taṣṭāsaḥ arkaiḥ   ā agne yāhi sahasram deva vandaiḥ satyaiḥ kavibhiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ  /
translated: Those who have thirsted in the region of the gods, who have been born again, the knowers of the sacrificial call, the singers of hymns, the makers of the laud, with the thousand divine adorations, O Agni, come hither with the true, the wise, the Rishis, the sitters in the sacred heat.

original: ye satyāsaḥ haviḥ adaḥ haviṣpāḥ indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham tureṇa / ā agne yāhi suvidatrebhiḥ arvāṅ paraiḥ pūrvaiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ /
analyzed: ye satyāsaḥ haviḥ adaḥ haviṣpāḥ indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham tureṇa    ā agne yāhi suvidatrebhiḥ arvāṅ paraiḥ pūrvaiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ  /
translated: Come hither, O Agni, with the bountiful ones, with the later and the earlier Rishis, the sitters in the sacred heat.🔽Creep to this mother, to the earth, wide, spacious, propitious earth,

original: upa sarpa mātaram bhūmim etām uru vyacasam pṛthivīm su śevām / ūrṇamradāḥ pṛthivī dakṣiṇāvataḥ eṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt /
analyzed: upa sarpa mātaram bhūmim etām uru vyacasam pṛthivīm su śevām   ūrṇamradāḥ pṛthivī dakṣiṇāvataḥ eṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt  /
translated: The earth that clothes itself in wool, may she protect thee on the way in front, on the right hand.🔽Open thyself, O earth, do not press him sore, be easy of access to him, easy to mount.🔽As a mother to her son, so, O earth, cover him.🔽As a mother to her son, so, O earth, cover him.🔽As a mother to her son, so, O earth, cover him.

analyzed: ud śvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ su upāyanā asmai bhava su upasarpaṇā      mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi    mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi          putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi   /
translated: As a mother to her son, so, O earth, cover him.

original: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasram mite upa hi śrayantām / te gṛhāsaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ syonāḥ viśvāhā asmai śaraṇāḥ santu atra /
analyzed: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasram mite upa hi śrayantām    te gṛhāsaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ syonāḥ viśvāhā asmai śaraṇāḥ santu atra  /
translated: Let the earth, swelling, stand firm, and let them rest on a thousand supports. May these houses, dropping ghee, be pleasant to him, and may they be his shelter here for all time.

original: ud te stabhnāmi pṛthivīm tvat pari imam logam nidadhan mā u aham riṣam / etām sthūṇām pitaraḥ dhārayanti te tatra yamaḥ sādanā te kṛṇotu //
analyzed: ud te stabhnāmi pṛthivīm tvat pari imam logam nidadhan mā u aham riṣam    etām sthūṇām pitaraḥ dhārayanti te tatra yamaḥ sādanā te kṛṇotu  /
translated: I raise thee up, O Earth, I lay this log on thee: harm me not. The Fathers hold this pillar: there let Yama make thee a resting-place.

original: imam agne camasam mā vi jihvaraḥ priyaḥ devānām uta somyānām / ayam yaḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ tasmin devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām /
analyzed: imam agne camasam mā vi jihvaraḥ priyaḥ devānām uta somyānām    ayam yaḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ tasmin devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām  /
translated: Do not, O Agni, let this cup go by thee, dear to the Gods and those who love the Soma. This cup which Gods have drunk, let the Gods rejoice therein, immortal Gods.

original: atharvā pūrṇam camasam yam indrāya abibhar vājinīvate / tasmin kṛṇoti su kṛtasya bhakṣam tasmin induḥ pavate viśvadānim //
analyzed: atharvā pūrṇam camasam yam indrāya abibhar vājinīvate     tasmin kṛṇoti su kṛtasya bhakṣam tasmin induḥ pavate viśvadānim  /
translated: The full cup which Atharvan brought to Indra, to the strong God, In that he makes the draught of righteous action: in that the Moon flows forth, the giver of all boons.

original: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpaḥ uta vā śvāpadaḥ / agniḥ tat viśvāt agadam kṛṇotu somaḥ ca yaḥ brāhmaṇām āviveśa /
analyzed: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpaḥ uta vā śvāpadaḥ    agniḥ tat viśvāt agadam kṛṇotu somaḥ ca yaḥ brāhmaṇām āviveśa  /
translated: If a black bird, a serpent, an ant, or a beast of prey has hurt thee, may Agni make thee whole from all that, and Soma, which has entered into the Brahmans.

original: payasvatīḥ oṣadhayaḥ payasvat māmakam payaḥ / apām payasaḥ yat payaḥ tena mā saha śumbhatu //
analyzed: payasvatīḥ oṣadhayaḥ payasvat māmakam payaḥ   apām payasaḥ yat payaḥ tena mā saha śumbhatu  /
translated: Rich in milk are the plants, rich in milk is my milk. With the milk of the waters, with that milk may they sprinkle me.

original: imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā sam spṛśantām / anaśravaḥ anamīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre /
analyzed: imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā sam spṛśantām    anaśravaḥ anamīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre  /
translated: These women, widows no more, good wives, let them touch with ointment of clarified butter. Without tears, without sickness, with good treasures, let the women first ascend the place of birth.

original: sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena iṣṭāpūrtena parame vyoman / hitvā avadyam punar astam ehi sam gacchatām tanvā su varcāḥ /
analyzed: sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena iṣṭāpūrtena parame vyoman    hitvā avadyam punar astam ehi sam gacchatām tanvā su varcāḥ  /
translated: Go to the Fathers, go to Yama, with the sacrifice and the fulfilment of sacrifice, in the highest heaven. Leaving the sin, go back to the place of the sun. Go to the union with thy body, O thou of good splendour.

original: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ ye āviviśuḥ uru antarikṣam / tebhyaḥ svarāt asunītiḥ naḥ adya vatha avaśam tanvaḥ kalpayāti /
analyzed: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ ye āviviśuḥ uru antarikṣam   tebhyaḥ svarāt asunītiḥ naḥ adya vatha avaśam tanvaḥ kalpayāti  /
translated: Our fathers who were our grandfathers, who have entered the wide air, for them today let the voice of the Asura lady make all our bodies free from sin.

original: vivasvān naḥ abhayam kṛṇotu yaḥ sutrāmā jīra dānuḥ sudānuḥ / iha ime vīrāḥ bahavaḥ bhavantu gomat aśvavat mayi astu puṣṭam /
analyzed: vivasvān naḥ abhayam kṛṇotu yaḥ sutrāmā jīra dānuḥ sudānuḥ    iha ime vīrāḥ bahavaḥ bhavantu gomat aśvavat mayi astu puṣṭam  /
translated: Here may these many heroes be. May prosperity in cattle and horses be in me.🔽May Vivasvan place us in immortality. Let death depart from us. Let immortality come to us.

original: vivasvān naḥ amṛta tve dadhātu paraitu mṛtyuḥ amṛtam naḥ aitu / imān rakṣatu puruṣān ā jarimṇaḥ mā u su eṣām asavaḥ yamam guḥ /
analyzed: vivasvān naḥ amṛta tve dadhātu paraitu mṛtyuḥ amṛtam naḥ aitu   imān rakṣatu puruṣān ā jarimṇaḥ mā u su eṣām asavaḥ yamam guḥ  /
translated: May he protect these men from old age. Let not their life go to Yama.

original: yaḥ dadhre antarikṣe na mahnā pitṝṇām kaviḥ pramatiḥ matīnām / tam arcata viśvamitrāḥ havirbhiḥ sa naḥ yamaḥ prataram jīvase dhāt /
analyzed: yaḥ dadhre antarikṣe na mahnā pitṝṇām kaviḥ pramatiḥ matīnām   tam arcata viśvamitrāḥ havirbhiḥ sa naḥ yamaḥ prataram jīvase dhāt  /
translated: He who hath taken to himself in greatness the Pitrs' region, the sage, the thought of thoughts,– Him, all ye men, adore with offerings. May he, Yama, grant us a way to life.

original: ā rohata divam uttamām ṛṣayaḥ mā bibhītana / soma pāḥ soma pāyinaḥ idam vaḥ kriyate haviḥ aganma jvotiḥ uttamam /
analyzed: ā rohata divam uttamām ṛṣayaḥ mā bibhītana   soma pāḥ soma pāyinaḥ idam vaḥ kriyate haviḥ aganma jvotiḥ uttamam  /
translated: Ascend ye to the highest heaven, O Rishis, fear not. Ye who have drunk Soma, and caused others to drink it, this oblation is prepared for you. We have attained to the highest light.

original: pra ketunā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti / divaḥ cit antāt upamām ud ānaṭ apām upasthe mahiṣaḥ vavardha /
analyzed: pra ketunā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti   divaḥ cit antāt upamām ud ānaṭ apām upasthe mahiṣaḥ vavardha  /
translated: With his great flame Agni shines forth, the bull roars to the two world-halves. From the ends of the sky he hath sent up his measure, the great one hath grown in the lap of the waters.

original: nāke suparṇam upa yat patantam hrdā venantaḥ abhyacakṣata tvā / hiraṇya pakṣam varuṇasya dūtam yamasya yonau śakunam bhuranyum //
analyzed: nāke suparṇam upa yat patantam hrdā venantaḥ abhyacakṣata tvā     / hiraṇya pakṣam varuṇasya dūtam yamasya yonau śakunam bhuranyum  /
translated: When ye with your hearts' desire beheld the bird flying up to the vault of the sky, the bird of gold, the messenger of Varuna, the swift bird in the womb of Yama.

original: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā / śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi //
analyzed: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā   / śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi  /
translated: O Indra, bring us strength as a father to his sons. Instruct us, O thou much-invoked, in this our work. May we, living, attain to the light.

original: apūpa apihitān kumbhān yān te devāḥ adhārayan / te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ /
analyzed: apūpa apihitān kumbhān yān te devāḥ adhārayan   te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ  /
translated: The pots that are covered with cakes which the gods have set apart for thee, may they be for thee, O Yama, full of sweet food, full of honey, dropping with ghee.

original: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrā svadhāvatīḥ / tāḥ te santu vibhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām /
analyzed: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrā svadhāvatīḥ   tāḥ te santu vibhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām  /
translated: The grains which I strew for thee, O Self-Existent One, mixed with sesame, let them be for thee abundant and powerful. Let King Yama approve of them.

original: punar dehi vanaspate yaḥ eṣa nihitaḥ tvayi / yathā yamasya sādane āsātau vidathāḥ vadan /
analyzed: punar dehi vanaspate yaḥ eṣa nihitaḥ tvayi   yathā yamasya sādane āsātau vidathāḥ vadan  /
translated: Give back to him, O Tree, what is laid up in thee. As he, speaking falsehoods, lies in Yama's abode,

original: ā rabhasva jātavedaḥ tejasvat dharaḥ astu te / śarīram asya sam dahātha enam dehi su kṛtām u loke /
analyzed: ā rabhasva jātavedaḥ tejasvat dharaḥ astu te   śarīram asya sam dahātha enam dehi su kṛtām u loke  /
translated: Take hold of him, O Jâtavedas. Let thy flame be strong. Burn up his body, and then give him to the righteous in the world of light.

original: ye te pūrve parāgatāḥ apare pitaraḥ ca ye / tebhyaḥ ghṛtasya kulyā etu śata dhārā vyundatī /
analyzed: ye te pūrve parāgatāḥ apare pitaraḥ ca ye tebhyaḥ ghṛtasya kulyā etu śata dhārā vyundatī  /
translated: Those who have gone before thee, and those who have come after, and those who are thy fathers, for them let the stream of ghee flow, a hundred streams running down.

original: etat ā roha vayaḥ unmṛjānaḥ svāḥ iha bṛhat u dīdayante / abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra // // // abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra // // // tvā iha bṛhat u dīdayante / abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra // // // tvā iha bṛhat u dīdayante / abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra //
analyzed: etat ā roha vayaḥ unmṛjānaḥ svāḥ iha bṛhat u dīdayante     abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra        abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra        tvā iha bṛhat u dīdayante   abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra        tvā iha bṛhat u dīdayante    abhi prehi madhyataḥ mā apa hāsthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra        tvā iha bṛ
translated: Here shine the lights that are thine own. Go forward, and be not afraid. Be the first to enter the Fathers' world which is here.

original: ā rohata janitrīm jātavedasaḥ pitṛ yānaiḥ sam vaḥ ā rohayāmi / avāṭ havya iṣitaḥ havyavāhaḥ ījānam yuktāḥ su kṛtām dhatta loke /
analyzed: ā rohata janitrīm jātavedasaḥ pitṛ yānaiḥ sam vaḥ ā rohayāmi   avāṭ havya iṣitaḥ havyavāhaḥ ījānam yuktāḥ su kṛtām dhatta loke  /
translated: Ascend your mother, O ye Jâtavedasas. I cause you to ascend with the Fathers' vehicles. The bearer of oblations, eager for the offering, yoked, bestows the sacrificer in the world of good works.

original: devāḥ yajñam ṛtavaḥ kalpayanti haviḥ puroḍāśam srucaḥ yajñāyudhāni / tebhiḥ yāhi pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ yaiḥ ījānāḥ svargam yanti lokam /
analyzed: devāḥ yajñam ṛtavaḥ kalpayanti haviḥ puroḍāśam srucaḥ yajñāyudhāni    tebhiḥ yāhi pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ yaiḥ ījānāḥ svargam yanti lokam  /
translated: The Gods, the Seasons, prepare the sacrifice, the oblation, sacrificial cake, the ladles, and the sacrificial vessels. Go by those paths which the Gods travel, by which sacrificers go to the world of heaven.

original: ṛtasya panthām anu paśya sādhu aṅgirasaḥ su kṛtaḥ yena yanti / tebhiḥ yāhi pathibhiḥ svargam yatra ādityāḥ madhu bhakṣayanti tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayasva //
analyzed: ṛtasya panthām anu paśya sādhu aṅgirasaḥ su kṛtaḥ yena yanti   tebhiḥ yāhi pathibhiḥ svargam yatra ādityāḥ madhu bhakṣayanti tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayasva  /
translated: Look thou upon the path of holy Order, the path which good Angirases have travelled. Go by those paths to heaven, where the Âdityas, in the third firmament, enjoy the sweetness.

original: trayaḥ suparṇāḥ uparasya māyū nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi viṣṭapi śritāḥ / svargāḥ lokāḥ amṛtena viṣṭhāḥ iṣam ūrjam yajamānāya duhrām /🔽juhūḥ dādhāra dyām upabhṛt antarikṣam dhruvā dādhāra pṛthivīm pratiṣṭhām / prati imām lokāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhāḥ svargāḥ kāmaṃkāmam yajamānāya duhrām /
analyzed: trayaḥ suparṇāḥ uparasya māyū nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi viṣṭapi śritāḥ   svargāḥ lokāḥ amṛtena viṣṭhāḥ iṣam ūrjam yajamānāya duhrām  / juhūḥ dādhāra dyām upabhṛt antarikṣam dhruvā dādhāra pṛthivīm pratiṣṭhām   prati imām lokāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhāḥ svargāḥ kāmaṃkāmam yajamānāya duhrām  /
translated: Three Suparṇas, the sons of Virāj, are seated on the back of the vault of the sky, on the ridgepole. The heavenly worlds are filled with immortality. Yield food and strength to the sacrificer.🔽The Juhû supports the sky, the Upabhṛt the air, the Dhruvâ supports the earth, the foundation. Let these worlds, filled with ghee, the heavenly, yield to the sacrificer all his heart can wish.

original: dhruvaḥ ā roha pṛthivīm viśva bhojasam antarikṣam upabhṛt ā kramasva / juhu dyām gaccha yajamānena sākam sruveṇa vatsena diśaḥ prapīnāḥ sarvāḥ dhukṣva a hṛṇyamānaḥ /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ ā roha pṛthivīm viśva bhojasam antarikṣam upabhṛt ā kramasva   juhu dyām gaccha yajamānena sākam sruveṇa vatsena diśaḥ prapīnāḥ sarvāḥ dhukṣva a hṛṇyamānaḥ  /
translated: Ascend the Dhruva, the earth, the all-supporting. Step thou, O Upabhṛt, into the atmosphere. Go, O Juhû, to the sky, together with the sacrificer. With the Sruva as thy calf, in all the spacious regions, yield thou all things, and be not remiss.

original: tīrthaiḥ taranti pravataḥ mahīḥ iti yajña kṛtaḥ su kṛtaḥ yena yanti / atra adadhuḥ yajamānāya lokam diśaḥ bhūtāni yat akalpayanta /🔽aṅgirasām ayanam pūrvaḥ agniḥ ādityānām ayanam gārhapatyaḥ dakṣiṇānām ayanam dakṣiṇāgniḥ / mahimānam agneḥ vihitasya brahmaṇā samaṅgaḥ sarvaḥ upa yāhi śagmaḥ //
analyzed: tīrthaiḥ taranti pravataḥ mahīḥ iti yajña kṛtaḥ su kṛtaḥ yena yanti    atra adadhuḥ yajamānāya lokam diśaḥ bhūtāni yat akalpayanta  / aṅgirasām ayanam pūrvaḥ agniḥ ādityānām ayanam gārhapatyaḥ dakṣiṇānām ayanam dakṣiṇāgniḥ   / mahimānam agneḥ vihitasya brahmaṇā samaṅgaḥ sarvaḥ upa yāhi śagmaḥ  /
translated: By holy rites they cross the mountains and the floods, the pious who have gone to heaven by sacrifice. Here they have laid a world for him who worships, when they have measured out the regions and the beings.🔽The eastern fire is the Angirases' pathway, the Gārhapatya is the path of Ādityas, the Dakshina fire is the path of the Dakshinas. With all thy body, O Agni, well-ordered, with all thy members come to us in comfort.

original: pūrvaḥ agniḥ tvā tapatu śam purastāt śam paścāt tapatu gārhapatyaḥ / dakṣiṇāgniḥ te tapatu śarma varma uttaratas madhyatas antarikṣāt diśaḥ diśaḥ agne pari pāhi ghorāt /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ agniḥ tvā tapatu śam purastāt śam paścāt tapatu gārhapatyaḥ   dakṣiṇāgniḥ te tapatu śarma varma uttaratas madhyatas antarikṣāt diśaḥ diśaḥ agne pari pāhi ghorāt  /
translated: Let the eastern fire burn thee in comfort, let the Gārhapatya burn thee in comfort from behind. Let the Dakshina fire burn thee in comfort from the south, in comfort from the north. From the middle, from the sky, from all directions, O Agni, guard him from the fearful.

analyzed: yūyam agne śaṃtamābhiḥ tanūbhiḥ ījānam abhi lokam svargam   aśvāḥ bhūtvā pṛṣṭi vāhaḥ vahātha yatra devaiḥ sadhamādam madanti
translated: Ye, Agni, with your most auspicious bodies, have brought the worshipper to the world of heaven. Becoming horses, bearing on your back, ye have borne him to the place where the Gods rejoice in the general joy.

original: śam agne paścāt tapa śam purastāt śam uttarāt śam adharāt tapa enam / ekaḥ tredhā vihitaḥ jātavedaḥ samyak enam dhehi su kṛtām u loke /
analyzed: śam agne paścāt tapa śam purastāt śam uttarāt śam adharāt tapa enam    ekaḥ tredhā vihitaḥ jātavedaḥ samyak enam dhehi su kṛtām u loke  /
translated: Be thou, O Agni, propitious from the west, propitious from the east, propitious from the north, propitious from the south. Do thou, O Jâtavedas, the one threefold-placed, set him rightly in the world of good action.

original: śam agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ ā rabhantām prājāpatyam medhyam jātavedasaḥ / śṛtam kṛṇvantaḥ iha mā ava cikṣipan /
analyzed: śam agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ ā rabhantām prājāpatyam medhyam jātavedasaḥ   śṛtam kṛṇvantaḥ iha mā ava cikṣipan  /
translated: Let the enkindled fires seize him, the pure one, the holy one, O Jâtavedas. While they make him ready, let them not cast him off here.

original: yajñaḥ eti vitataḥ kalpamānaḥ ījānam abhi lokam svargam / tam agnayaḥ sarva hutam juṣantām prājāpatyam medhyam jātavedasaḥ /
analyzed: yajñaḥ eti vitataḥ kalpamānaḥ ījānam abhi lokam svargam   tam agnayaḥ sarva hutam juṣantām prājāpatyam medhyam jātavedasaḥ  /
translated: The sacrifice, extended, being prepared, goeth to the worshipper to the world of heaven. May the all-consuming fires accept my sacrifice, the pure, the holy, O ye Jâtavedas.

original: ījānaḥ citam ārukṣat agnim nākasya pṛṣṭhāt divam utpatiṣyan / tasmai pra bhāti nabhasaḥ jyotiṣīmān svargaḥ panthāḥ su kṛte deva yānaḥ /
analyzed: ījānaḥ citam ārukṣat agnim nākasya pṛṣṭhāt divam utpatiṣyan    tasmai pra bhāti nabhasaḥ jyotiṣīmān svargaḥ panthāḥ su kṛte deva yānaḥ  /
translated: The worshipper hath mounted the piled altar, about to fly up to heaven from the back of the sky. To him shineth the path of the pious, the path of the gods, the path of heaven, the light of the sky.

original: agniḥ hotā adhvaryuḥ te bṛhaspatiḥ indraḥ brahmā dakṣiṇatas te astu / hutaḥ ayam saṃsthitaḥ yajñaḥ eti yatra pūrvam ayanam hutānām /🔽apūpavān kṣīravān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /🔽apūpavān dadhivān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā adhvaryuḥ te bṛhaspatiḥ indraḥ brahmā dakṣiṇatas te astu   hutaḥ ayam saṃsthitaḥ yajñaḥ eti yatra pūrvam ayanam hutānām  / apūpavān kṣīravān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  / apūpavān dadhivān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  /
translated: Let Agni be thy Hotar, let Brihaspati be thy Adhvaryu, let Indra be thy Brahman on the south. This sacrifice, offered and completed, goeth to the place whither the former sacrifices have gone.🔽Here let the cake with curds and the cake with ghee sit down. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, who are sharers of the offered (sacrifices) here, the gods.🔽Here let the cake with curds and the cake with milk sit down. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, who are sharers of the offered (sacrifices) here, the gods.

original: apūpavān drapsavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /
analyzed: apūpavān drapsavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  /
translated: Here let the cake with curds and the cake with drops sit down. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, who are sharers of the offered (sacrifices) here, the gods.

original: apūpavān ghṛtavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /🔽apūpavān māṃsavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha // //
analyzed: apūpavān ghṛtavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  / apūpavān māṃsavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: Let the cake, the ghee, and the oblation come hither. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, those who have a share in the oblations of the gods, who are here.🔽Let the cake, the meat, and the oblation come hither. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, those who have a share in the oblations of the gods, who are here.

original: apūpavān annavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /🔽apūpavān madhumān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /🔽apūpavān rasavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /
analyzed: apūpavān annavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  / apūpavān madhumān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  / apūpavān rasavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  /
translated: Let the cake, the food, and the oblation come hither. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, those who have a share in the oblations of the gods, who are here.🔽Let the cake, the honey, and the oblation come hither. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, those who have a share in the oblations of the gods, who are here.🔽Let the cake, the juice, and the oblation come hither. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, those who have a share in the oblations of the gods, who are here.

original: apūpavān apavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu / loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha /
analyzed: apūpavān apavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu   loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  /
translated: Let the cake, the water, and the oblation come hither. We worship the makers of room and the makers of paths, those who have a share in the oblations of the gods, who are here.

original: apūpa apihitān kumbhān yān te devāḥ adhārayan / te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ /
analyzed: apūpa apihitān kumbhān yān te devāḥ adhārayan   te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ  /
translated: Let these be thine, rich in food, rich in honey, dropping fatness.🔽The grains of corn which I strew for thee, mixed with sesame, rich in food,

original: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ / tāḥ te santu udbhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām //
analyzed: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ   tāḥ te santu udbhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām  /
translated: Let these be thine, abundant, prosperous. Let the King Yama approve them for thee.

original: akṣitim bhūyasīm //
analyzed: akṣitim bhūyasīm
translated: The inexhaustible, the most extensive.🔽The drop hath fallen on the earth, on the sky, on this place and on the former one.

original: drapsaḥ caskanda pṛthivīm anu dyām imam ca yonim anu yaḥ ca pūrvaḥ / samānam yonim anu samcarantam drapsam juhomi anu sapta hotrāḥ /
analyzed: drapsaḥ caskanda pṛthivīm anu dyām imam ca yonim anu yaḥ ca pūrvaḥ   samānam yonim anu samcarantam drapsam juhomi anu sapta hotrāḥ  /
translated: The drop that moveth along the common place of birth I offer with the seven oblations.🔽The hundred-streamed Vayu, the sun, the finder of heaven, the men's eyes behold thy wealth.

original: śata dhāram vāyum arkam svar vidam nṛ cakṣasaḥ te abhi cakṣate rayim / ye pṛnanti pra ca yacchanti sarvadā te duhrate dakṣiṇām sapta mātaram /
analyzed: śata dhāram vāyum arkam svar vidam nṛ cakṣasaḥ te abhi cakṣate rayim   ye pṛnanti pra ca yacchanti sarvadā te duhrate dakṣiṇām sapta mātaram  /
translated: They who always give and grant, they milk the seven mothers, the sacrificial fee.

original: ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman // ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman // ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman // ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman // mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman // //
analyzed: ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman    ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman    ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman
translated: In the highest heaven, O Agni, do no harm to Aditi who rejoices in strength among the people.

original: etat te devaḥ savitā vāsaḥ dadāti bhartave / tat tvam yamasya rājye vasānaḥ tārpyam cara /
analyzed: etat te devaḥ savitā vāsaḥ dadāti bhartave   tat tvam yamasya rājye vasānaḥ tārpyam cara  /
translated: This garment the god Savitar gives thee to wear. Wearing it in Yama's realm, move about in the woollen garment.

original: dhānā dhenuḥ abhavat vatsaḥ asyāḥ tilaḥ abhavat / tām vai yamasya rājye akṣitām upa jīvati //🔽etāḥ te asau dhenavaḥ kāmadughāḥ bhavantu / enīḥ śyenīḥ sarūpāḥ virūpāḥ tila vatsāḥ upa tiṣṭhantu tvā atra /
analyzed: dhānā dhenuḥ abhavat vatsaḥ asyāḥ tilaḥ abhavat    tām vai yamasya rājye akṣitām upa jīvati  / etāḥ te asau dhenavaḥ kāmadughāḥ bhavantu    śyenīḥ sarūpāḥ virūpāḥ tila vatsāḥ upa tiṣṭhantu tvā atra  /
translated: The grain became the milch cow, her calf was sesame. In Yama's realm one lives on her who never fails.🔽May these thy cows, yielding whatever is desired, be for thee. The dappled, the dark, the varied, the misshapen, with calves of sesame, may they attend on thee here.

original: enīḥ dhānāḥ hariṇīḥ śyenīḥ asya kṛṣṇāḥ dhānāḥ rohiṇīḥ dhenavaḥ te / tila vatsāḥ ūrjam asmai duhānāḥ viśvāhā santu an apasphurantīḥ /
analyzed: enīḥ dhānāḥ hariṇīḥ śyenīḥ asya kṛṣṇāḥ dhānāḥ rohiṇīḥ dhenavaḥ te    tila vatsāḥ ūrjam asmai duhānāḥ viśvāhā santu an apasphurantīḥ  /
translated: The dappled grain, the tawny, the dark, the black grain, the red cows of thine, with calves of sesame, yielding strength to him, may they be for him for all his life, never failing.

original: vaiśvānare haviḥ idam juhomi sāhasram śata dhāram utsam / sa bibharti pitaram pitāmahān prapitāmahān bibharti pinvamānaḥ //
analyzed: vaiśvānare haviḥ idam juhomi sāhasram śata dhāram utsam    sa bibharti pitaram pitāmahān prapitāmahān bibharti pinvamānaḥ  /
translated: I offer this oblation to Vaisvānara, the inexhaustible, the hundred-streamed, the thousand-streamed spring. It supports the father, the grandfather, the great-grandfather, swelling.

original: sahasra dhāram śata dhāram utsam akṣitam vyacyamānam salilasya pṛṣṭhe / ūrjam duhānam an apasphurantam upāsate pitaraḥ svadhābhiḥ //
analyzed: sahasra dhāram śata dhāram utsam akṣitam vyacyamānam salilasya pṛṣṭhe   ūrjam duhānam an apasphurantam upāsate pitaraḥ svadhābhiḥ  /
translated: The thousand-streamed, the hundred-streamed spring, inexhaustible, extended on the back of the waters, milking strength, not failing, the Fathers attend upon it with their own oblations.

original: idam kasāmbu cayanena citam tat sajātāḥ ava paśyateta / martyaḥ ayam amṛta tvam eti tasmai gṛhān kṛṇuta yāvatsabandhu //
analyzed: idam kasāmbu cayanena citam tat sajātāḥ ava paśyata ita  / martyaḥ ayam amṛta tvam eti tasmai gṛhān kṛṇuta yāvatsabandhu  /
translated: This one, built by the builder Kasāmbu, let the kinsmen look upon it. This mortal one goes to immortality. Make for him a home with all his kindred.

original: iha eva edhi dhana saniḥ iha cittaḥ ihakratuḥ / iha edhi vīryavattaraḥ vayodhāḥ aparāhataḥ //
analyzed: iha eva edhi dhana saniḥ iha cittaḥ ihakratuḥ   iha edhi vīryavattaraḥ vayodhāḥ aparāhataḥ  /
translated: Here be thou, O Dhanasani, here be thy heart, here be thy mind. Here be thou more vigorous, prolonging life, uninjured.

original: putram pautram abhitarpayantīḥ āpaḥ madhumatīḥ imāḥ / svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ amṛtam duhānāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ ubhayān tarpayantu //
analyzed: putram pautram abhitarpayantīḥ āpaḥ madhumatīḥ imāḥ   svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ amṛtam duhānāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ ubhayān tarpayantu  /
translated: These waters, full of sweetness, satisfying the son and the grandson, milking oblation and immortality for the Fathers, may the divine waters satisfy both sides.

original: āpaḥ agnim pra hiṇuta pitṝn upa imam yajñam pitaraḥ me juṣantām / āsīnām ūrjam upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchān // // // // // // // // // // upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchān // // // upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchān // // upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchān // // upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchān // // upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchā
analyzed: āpaḥ agnim pra hiṇuta pitṝn upa imam yajñam pitaraḥ me juṣantām    āsīnām ūrjam upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchān
translated: The Fathers who have gone to the other world, who sit upon the sacred grass, and whom the ladle delights, may they be gracious to this sacrifice of ours.

original: sam indhate amartyam havyavāham ghṛta priyam / sa veda nihitān nidhīn pitṝn parāvataḥ gatān /
analyzed: sam indhate amartyam havyavāham ghṛta priyam   sa veda nihitān nidhīn pitṝn parāvataḥ gatān  /
translated: They kindle the Immortal, the bearer of oblations, dear to the ghee, who knows the treasures laid away, the Fathers who have gone to the other world.

original: yam te mantham yam odananam yat māṃsam nipṛṇāmi te / te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ /
analyzed: yam te mantham yam odananam yat māṃsam nipṛṇāmi te   te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ  /
translated: The gruel, the rice-pap, the meat which I spread out for thee, may they be for thee full of sweet juice, full of meath, dropping with ghee.

original: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ / tāḥ te santu udbhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām //
analyzed: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ   tāḥ te santu udbhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām  /
translated: The grains which I strew for thee, mixed with sesame, and meet for worship, may they be for thee abundant and powerful. May Yama, the king, approve of them for thee.

original: idam pūrvam aparam niyānam yena te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ / purogavāḥ ye abhisācaḥ asya te tvā vahanti su kṛtām u lokam /
analyzed: idam pūrvam aparam niyānam yena te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ   purogavāḥ ye abhisācaḥ asya te tvā vahanti su kṛtām u lokam  /
translated: This is the former, this the later resting-place, by which thy sires of old have gone to heaven. The leaders of this one, who have gone before thee, bear thee to the world of virtuous men.

original: sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne / sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt /
analyzed: sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne    sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt  /
translated: They who are pious call upon Sarasvatî, when the sacrifice is being performed, upon Sarasvatî. The pious call upon Sarasvatî. May Sarasvatî bestow a boon on him who offers sacrifice.

original: sarasvatīm pitaraḥ havante dakṣiṇāḥ yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ / āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ā dhehi asme /
analyzed: sarasvatīm pitaraḥ havante dakṣiṇāḥ yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ   āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ā dhehi asme  /
translated: The Fathers call upon Sarasvatî, who lead the sacrifice to the south. Sit down upon this sacred grass and rejoice you. Bestow upon us food without disease.

original: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayātha ukthaiḥ svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī / sahasra argham iḍaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi //
analyzed: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayātha ukthaiḥ svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī    sahasra argham iḍaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi  /
translated: O Sarasvatî, thou who goest with the chariot, rejoicing in the hymns and in the spirits of the Fathers, O thou who art worshipped with a thousand gifts, bestow upon the sacrificer a portion of food and increase of wealth.

original: pṛthivīm tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi devaḥ naḥ dhātā pra tirāti āyuḥ / parāparā etā vasu vid vaḥ astu adhā mṛtāḥ pitṛṣu sam bhavantu /🔽ā pra cyavethām apa tat mṛjethām yat vām abhibhāḥ atra ūcuḥ / asmāt etam aghnyau tat vaśīyaḥ dātuḥ pitṛṣu ihabhojanau mama /
analyzed: pṛthivīm tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi devaḥ naḥ dhātā pra tirāti āyuḥ   parāparā etā vasu vid vaḥ astu adhā mṛtāḥ pitṛṣu sam bhavantu  / ā pra cyavethām apa tat mṛjethām yat vām abhibhāḥ atra ūcuḥ   asmāt etam aghnyau tat vaśīyaḥ dātuḥ pitṛṣu ihabhojanau mama  /
translated: I place thee on the earth, on earth's place. May the God Dhatr lengthen our life. May this be yours, O Fathers, to enjoy, to find good things, far and near. May they who are dead be united with the Fathers.🔽Go ye away, and wipe that out which here they have said against you. Ye two, O innocent ones, are better than he. Ye two, the givers, are to be honoured among the Fathers, and to be fed by me.

original: dakṣiṇā bhadrataḥ naḥ anena dattā su dughā vayodhāḥ / yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān / yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān / yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān // yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān // yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān // yauvane jīvān upapṛñcat
analyzed: dakṣiṇā bhadrataḥ naḥ anena dattā su dughā vayodhāḥ    yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān    yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān    yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān          upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān        upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān        upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparā
translated: The milch-cow, the giver of life, has been given to us by this (sacrifice), bountiful, on the right hand. May old age, which in youth refreshes the living, lead them to the Fathers. May old age, which in youth refreshes the living, lead them to the Fathers. May old age, which in youth refreshes the living, lead them to the Fathers.

original: idam pitṛbhyaḥ pra bharāmi barhiḥ jīvam devebhyaḥ uttaram stṛṇāmi / tat ā roha puruṣa medhyaḥ bhavan prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam /
analyzed: idam pitṛbhyaḥ pra bharāmi barhiḥ jīvam devebhyaḥ uttaram stṛṇāmi   tat ā roha puruṣa medhyaḥ bhavan prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam  /
translated: I strew this sacred grass for the Fathers, I spread the living upper one for the Gods. Thereon, O man, become meet for sacrifice: may the Fathers recognize thee when thou goest.

original: prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam / yathā aparu tanvam sam bharasva gātrāṇi te brahmaṇā kalpayāmi //
analyzed: prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam    yathā aparu tanvam sam bharasva gātrāṇi te brahmaṇā kalpayāmi  /
translated: May the Fathers recognize thee when thou goest. As thou shalt form a new body, so I fit together thy limbs with prayer.

original: parṇaḥ rājā apidhānam carūṇām ūrjaḥ balam sahaḥ ojaḥ naḥ āgan / āyuḥ jīvebhyaḥ vidadhat dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya /
analyzed: parṇaḥ rājā apidhānam carūṇām ūrjaḥ balam sahaḥ ojaḥ naḥ āgan   āyuḥ jīvebhyaḥ vidadhat dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  /
translated: King Parna, the coverlet of the oblations, strength, power, might, and vigour have come to us. Granting life to living creatures, for life that lasts a hundred autumns.

original: ūrjaḥ bhāgaḥ yaḥ imam jajāna aśma annānām ādhipatyam jagāma / tam arcata viśvamitrāḥ havirbhiḥ sa naḥ yamaḥ prataram jīvase dhāt /
analyzed: ūrjaḥ bhāgaḥ yaḥ imam jajāna aśma annānām ādhipatyam jagāma   tam arcata viśvamitrāḥ havirbhiḥ sa naḥ yamaḥ prataram jīvase dhāt  /
translated: He who hath been born, the portion of strength, hath become the lord of those who eat the stone. Him, all ye friends, worship with offerings. May that Yama grant us a way to long life.

original: yathā yamāya harmyam avapan pañca mānavāḥ / eva ā vapāmi harmyam yathā me bhūrayaḥ asata /
analyzed: yathā yamāya harmyam avapan pañca mānavāḥ   / eva ā vapāmi harmyam yathā me bhūrayaḥ asata  /
translated: As the five men built a house for Yama, so I build a house that my wealth may be abundant.

original: idam hiraṇyam bibhṛhi yat te pitā abibhar purā / svargam yataḥ pituḥ hastam niḥ mṛḍḍhi dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: idam hiraṇyam bibhṛhi yat te pitā abibhar purā    svargam yataḥ pituḥ hastam niḥ mṛḍḍhi dakṣiṇam  /
translated: Bear this gold, as thy father bore it of old. From heaven take thou the right hand of thy father.

original: ye ca jīvāḥ ye ca mṛtāḥ ye jātāḥ ye ca yajñiyāḥ / tebhyaḥ ghṛtasya kulyā etu madhu dhārā vyundatī /
analyzed: ye ca jīvāḥ ye ca mṛtāḥ ye jātāḥ ye ca yajñiyāḥ   tebhyaḥ ghṛtasya kulyā etu madhu dhārā vyundatī  /
translated: Those living, those dead, those born, those worthy of sacrifice, for them let the stream of ghee flow, with a stream of honey trickling down.

original: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ sūraḥ ahnām pratarītā uṣasām divaḥ / prāṇaḥ sindhūnām kalaśām acikradat indrasya hārdim āviśat manīṣayā /
analyzed: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ sūraḥ ahnām pratarītā uṣasām divaḥ    prāṇaḥ sindhūnām kalaśām acikradat indrasya hārdim āviśat manīṣayā  /
translated: The bull, the all-seeing one, flows among the thoughts, the sun, the leader of the days, the dawns, the sky. The breath of the rivers, he has roared in the jars, he has entered the heart of Indra with his thought.

original: tveṣaḥ te dhūmaḥ ūrṇotu divi sam śukraḥ ātataḥ / sūraḥ na hi dyutā tvam kṛpā pāvaka rocase /
analyzed: tveṣaḥ te dhūmaḥ ūrṇotu divi sam śukraḥ ātataḥ   sūraḥ na hi dyutā tvam kṛpā pāvaka rocase  /
translated: Let thy smoke rise up to the sky, let thy bright flame be stretched out in heaven. Thou shinest, O purifying flame, like the sun with thy radiance.

original: pra vai eti induḥ indrasya niṣkṛtim sakhā sakhyuḥ na pra mināti saṃgiraḥ / maryaḥ iva yoṣāḥ sam arṣase somaḥ kalaśe śata yāmanā pathā // // / // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // /
analyzed: pra vai eti induḥ indrasya niṣkṛtim sakhā sakhyuḥ na pra mināti saṃgiraḥ   maryaḥ iva yoṣāḥ sam arṣase somaḥ kalaśe śata yāmanā pathā
translated: The drop advances to Indra's purification. The friend does not transgress the promise to his friend. Like a youth to a maiden, O Soma, thou art pressed together. Thou goest in a hundred paths to the jar.

original: akṣan amīmadanta hi ava priyām adhūṣata / astoṣata sva bhānavaḥ viprāḥ yaviṣṭhāḥ īmahe /
analyzed: akṣan amīmadanta hi ava priyām adhūṣata    astoṣata sva bhānavaḥ viprāḥ yaviṣṭhāḥ īmahe  /
translated: They have eaten, they have rejoiced, they have sung praises to the dear one. The self-shining sages have praised. We invoke the youngest.

original: ā yāta pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ / āyuḥ asmabhyam dadhataḥ prajām ca rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam /
analyzed: ā yāta pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ    āyuḥ asmabhyam dadhataḥ prajām ca rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam  /
translated: Come hither, O ye Fathers, worthy of the Soma, by the deep paths which lead to the Fathers, Granting us life and offspring, and with the increase of wealth be ye united with us.

original: parā yāta pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pūryāṇaiḥ / adhā māsi punar ā yāta naḥ gṛhān haviḥ attum suprajasaḥ su vīrāḥ /
analyzed: parā yāta pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pūryāṇaiḥ   adhā māsi punar ā yāta naḥ gṛhān haviḥ attum suprajasaḥ su vīrāḥ  /
translated: Go hence, O ye Fathers, worthy of the Soma, by the deep paths which lead to the Fathers. Then come again to us in a month's time, O ye of good offspring and good heroes, to our houses to eat the sacrificial food.

original: yat vaḥ agniḥ ajahāt ekam aṅgam pitṛ lokam gamayam jātavedāḥ / tat vaḥ etat punar ā pyāyayāmi sa aṅgāḥ svarge pitaraḥ mādayadhvam //
analyzed: yat vaḥ agniḥ ajahāt ekam aṅgam pitṛ lokam gamayam jātavedāḥ   tat vaḥ etat punar ā pyāyayāmi sa aṅgāḥ svarge pitaraḥ mādayadhvam  /
translated: That one limb of yours which the all-knowing Agni has sent away to the world of the Fathers, that I restore to you again. O Fathers in heaven, rejoice with the whole body.

original: abhūt dūtaḥ prahitaḥ jātavedāḥ sāyam nyahnaḥ upavandyaḥ nṛbhiḥ / prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā havīṃṣi /
analyzed: abhūt dūtaḥ prahitaḥ jātavedāḥ sāyam nyahnaḥ upavandyaḥ nṛbhiḥ   prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā havīṃṣi  /
translated: He has been the messenger, the envoy, the all-knowing one, to be worshipped by men at evening and at noon. Thou hast given to the Fathers, they have eaten with their own oblation. Eat thou, O God, the offered sacrifices.

original: asau hā iha te manaḥ kakutsalam iva jāmayaḥ / abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi //
analyzed: asau hā iha te manaḥ kakutsalam iva jāmayaḥ    abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi  /
translated: This is thy heart, O Earth, which is here, as it were, trembling. Cover it over with thy belly.

original: śumbhantām lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ pitṛṣadane tvā loke ā sādayāmi //
analyzed: śumbhantām lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ pitṛṣadane tvā loke ā sādayāmi
translated: Let the worlds which are the seat of the Fathers be filled. In the world which is the seat of the Fathers I settle thee.

original: ye asmākam pitaraḥ teṣām barhiḥ asi //
analyzed: ye asmākam pitaraḥ teṣām barhiḥ asi
translated: Thou art the strew for those Fathers of ours.

original: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam śrathāya / adha vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma /
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam śrathāya   adha vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma  /
translated: Loosen thou from us, O Varuna, the highest, loosen the lowest bond that holds us. So may we, O Âditya, in thy service, be sinless and free from guilt before Aditi.

original: pra asmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān yaiḥ samāme badhyate yaiḥ vyāme / adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ // adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ // adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ // adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ // adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ // tvayā rājan gupitāḥ ra
analyzed: pra asmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān yaiḥ samāme badhyate yaiḥ vyāme    adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ   / adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ  / adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ  / adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ  / adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ  / adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni
translated: From all the bonds, O Varuna, deliver us, wherewith we are bound, whether by night or day. So may we live a hundred winters, guarded and protected by thee, O King.

original: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svadhā namaḥ //🔽somāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ //
analyzed: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svadhā namaḥ  somāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ
translated: To Agni Kavyavâhana (bearer of the sacred poetry) Svâhâ! adoration!🔽To Soma Pitrimat (accompanied by the Fathers) Svâhâ! adoration!

original: pitṛbhyaḥ somavadbhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ //
analyzed: pitṛbhyaḥ somavadbhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ
translated: To the Fathers who have the Soma Svâhâ! adoration!

original: yamāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ //
analyzed: yamāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ
translated: To Yama Pitrimat Svâhâ! adoration!

original: etat te pratatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu //
analyzed: etat te pratatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu
translated: This is for thee, O great-grandsire, and Svâhâ! for those who follow thee.

original: etat te tatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu //
analyzed: etat te tatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu
translated: This is for you, O great-grandfather, and for those who follow you.

original: etat te tata svadhā //🔽svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ pṛthiviṣadbhyaḥ //
analyzed: etat te tata svadhā  svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ pṛthiviṣadbhyaḥ
translated: This is for you, O great-grandfather.🔽Svādḥā to the Fathers who dwell on the earth.

original: svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ antarikṣa sadbhyaḥ //🔽namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ ūrje namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ rasāya //🔽namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ bhāmāya namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ manyave //
analyzed: svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ antarikṣa sadbhyaḥ  namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ ūrje namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ rasāya  / namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ bhāmāya namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ manyave
translated: Svādḥā to the Fathers who dwell in the atmosphere.🔽Homage to you, O Fathers, for your strength. Homage to you, O Fathers, for your life.🔽Homage to you, O Fathers, for your radiance. Homage to you, O Fathers, for your anger.

original: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat ghoram tasmai namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat krūram tasmai //
analyzed: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat ghoram tasmai namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat krūram tasmai
translated: Homage to you, O Fathers, for your terrible [nature]. Homage to you, O Fathers, for your cruel [nature].

original: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat śivam tasmai namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat syonam tasmai //
analyzed: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat śivam tasmai namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat syonam tasmai
translated: Homage to you, O Fathers, for your auspicious [nature]. Homage to you, O Fathers, for your gentle [nature].

original: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ svadhā vaḥ pitaraḥ //🔽ye atra pitaraḥ pitaraḥ ye atra yūyam stha yuṣmān te anu yūyam teṣām śreṣṭhāḥ bhūyāstha //
analyzed: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ svadhā vaḥ pitaraḥ  ye atra pitaraḥ pitaraḥ ye atra yūyam stha yuṣmān te anu yūyam teṣām śreṣṭhāḥ bhūyāstha
translated: Homage to you, O Fathers. Svādḥā to you, O Fathers.🔽Those who are here, O Fathers, and you who are here, may they follow you. May you be the best of them.

original: ye iha pitaraḥ jīvāḥ iha vayam smaḥ / asmān te anu vayam teṣām śreṣṭhāḥ bhūyāsma /
analyzed: ye iha pitaraḥ jīvāḥ iha vayam smaḥ   asmān te anu vayam teṣām śreṣṭhāḥ bhūyāsma  /
translated: Those who are here, O Fathers, and we who are here, may they follow us. May we be the best of them.

original: ā tvā agne idhīmahi dyumantam deva ajaram / yat gha sā te panīyasī samidh dīdayati dyavi / iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara //
analyzed: ā tvā agne idhīmahi dyumantam deva ajaram   yat gha sā te panīyasī samidh dīdayati dyavi    iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara  /
translated: O Agni, we will kindle thee, the glorious, undecaying God, Whose fuel, most acceptable to thee, shines forth in heaven. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

original: saṃsam sravantu nadyaḥ sam vātāḥ sam patatriṇaḥ / yajñam imam vardhayata giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi //
analyzed: saṃsam sravantu nadyaḥ saṃ vātāḥ saṃ patatriṇaḥ   yajñam imam vardhayata giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi  /
translated: Let the rivers flow together, let the winds blow together, let the birds fly together. Strengthen this sacrifice of mine. I offer with the oblation of the Sam-srava.

original: imam homāḥ yajñam avata imam saṃsrāvaṇāḥ uta yajñam imam vardhayata giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi //
analyzed: imam homāḥ yajñam avata imam saṃsrāvaṇāḥ uta yajñam imam vardhayata giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi
translated: Let the Homa offerings come to this sacrifice, let the Sam-srava offerings come to this sacrifice. Strengthen this sacrifice of mine. I offer with the oblation of the Sam-srava.

original: rūpam rūpam vayaḥ vayaḥ saṃrabhya enam pari svaje / yajñam imam catasraḥ pradiśaḥ vardhayantu saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi //🔽śam te āpaḥ haimavatīḥ śam u te santu utsyāḥ / śam te saniṣyadāḥ āpaḥ śam u te santu varṣyāḥ //
analyzed: rūpam rūpam vayaḥ vayaḥ saṃrabhya enam pari svaje    yajñam imam catasraḥ pradiśaḥ vardhayantu saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi  / śam te āpaḥ haimavatīḥ śam u te santu utsyāḥ   śam te saniṣyadāḥ āpaḥ śam u te santu varṣyāḥ  /
translated: Taking each form and each age, embrace him well. Let the four quarters of heaven strengthen this sacrifice of mine. I offer with the oblation of the Sam-srava.🔽Be the Himalayan waters propitious to thee, and be the waters of the springs propitious to thee. Be the waters that will bring thee good propitious to thee, and be the rain-waters propitious to thee.

original: śam te āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ śam te santu anūpyāḥ / śam te khanitrimāḥ āpaḥ śam yāḥ kumbhebhiḥ ābhṛtāḥ //
analyzed: śam te āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ śam te santu anūpyāḥ   śam te khanitrimāḥ āpaḥ śam yāḥ kumbhebhiḥ ābhṛtāḥ  /
translated: Be the waters of the desert propitious to thee, and be the waters of the marshes propitious to thee. Be the waters dug out by the spade propitious to thee, and be the waters brought in jars propitious to thee.

original: anabhrayaḥ khanamānāḥ viprāḥ gambhīre apasaḥ / bhiṣagbhyaḥ bhiṣaktarāḥ āpaḥ achā vadāmasi //
analyzed: anabhrayaḥ khanamānāḥ viprāḥ gambhīre apasaḥ   bhiṣagbhyaḥ bhiṣaktarāḥ āpaḥ achā vadāmasi  /
translated: we call to us the waters, more healing than the healers.🔽Of the waters of the sky, of the waters of the streams,

original: apām aha divyānām apām srotasyānām / apām aha praṇejane aśvāḥ bhavatha vājinaḥ /
analyzed: apām aha divyānām apām srotasyānām   apām aha praṇejane aśvāḥ bhavatha vājinaḥ
translated: of the waters of the people, O ye strong horses, be ye.🔽Those auspicious waters, the waters that make us free from consumption,

original: tāḥ apaḥ śivāḥ apaḥ a yakṣmaṃkaraṇīḥ apaḥ / yathā eva tṛpyate mayaḥ tāḥ te ā datta bhesajīḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ apaḥ śivāḥ apaḥ a yakṣmaṃkaraṇīḥ apaḥ    yathā eva tṛpyate mayaḥ tāḥ te ā datta bhesajīḥ  /
translated: as the patient is satisfied, those healing waters have I given to thee.🔽From the sky, from the earth, from the atmosphere, from the trees, from the plants,

original: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt vanaspatibhyaḥ adhi oṣadhībhyaḥ / yatra yatra vibhṛtaḥ jātavedāḥ tatas stutaḥ juṣamāṇaḥ naḥ ehi //
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt vanaspatibhyaḥ adhi oṣadhībhyaḥ   yatra yatra vibhṛtaḥ jātavedāḥ tatas stutaḥ juṣamāṇaḥ naḥ ehi  /
translated: from wherever, O all-knowing one, thou hast been distributed, come hither to us, praised, accepting (our worship).🔽Thy greatness which is in the waters, in the woods, which is in the plants, in cattle, in the waters,

original: yaḥ te apsu mahimā yaḥ vaneṣu yaḥ oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar / agne sarvāḥ tanvaḥ sam rabhasva tābhiḥ naḥ ehi draviṇaḥ dāḥ ajasraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te apsu mahimā yaḥ vaneṣu yaḥ oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar    agne sarvāḥ tanvaḥ sam rabhasva tābhiḥ naḥ ehi draviṇaḥ dāḥ ajasraḥ  /
translated: O Agni, with all thy forms be united. With them come to us, O imperishable one, as a giver of wealth.🔽Thy greatness which is among the gods in heaven, thy form which hath entered the Fathers,

original: yaḥ te deveṣu mahimā svargaḥ yā te tanuḥ pitṛṣu āviveśa / puṣṭiḥ yā te manuṣyeṣu paprathe agne tayā rayim asmāsu dhehi //
analyzed: yaḥ te deveṣu mahimā svargaḥ yā te tanuḥ pitṛṣu āviveśa   puṣṭiḥ yā te manuṣyeṣu paprathe agne tayā rayim asmāsu dhehi  /
translated: thy prosperity which hath spread among men, O Agni, by that bestow wealth on us.

original: śrutkarṇāya kavaye vedyāya vacobhiḥ vākaiḥ upa yāmi rātim / yatas bhayam abhayam tat naḥ astu ava devānām yaja heḍaḥ agne /
analyzed: śrutkarṇāya kavaye vedyāya vacobhiḥ vākaiḥ upa yāmi rātim    yatas bhayam abhayam tat naḥ astu ava devānām yaja heḍaḥ agne  /
translated: To him who heareth, to the sage, to him who is to be worshipped, with words and hymns I come for favour. Let that be our security from fear which is the Gods'. Drive away, O Agni, the spiteful demon.

original: yām āhutim prathamām atharvā yā jātā yā havyam akṛṇot jātavedāḥ / tām te etām prathamaḥ johavīmi tābhiḥ tuptaḥ vahatu havyam agniḥ agnaye svāhā /
analyzed: yām āhutim prathamām atharvā yā jātā yā havyam akṛṇot jātavedāḥ    tām te etām prathamaḥ johavīmi tābhiḥ tuptaḥ vahatu havyam agniḥ agnaye svāhā  /
translated: The first oblation which Atharvan offered, which he, the all-knowing, made an offering of, that same oblation I offer first to thee. Gratified with these, may Agni bear our offering. To Agni Svâhâ!
