translated: Golden-hued, undecaying, rich in heroes, with old age for thy death, dwell with thy people. This Agni saith, this Soma saith, this Br̥ihaspati, this Indra, O thou Golden-hued.

original: a śrāntasya tvā manasā yunajmi prathamasya ca / utkūlam udvahaḥ bhava uduhya prati dhāvatāt /
analyzed: a śrāntasya tvā manasā yunajmi prathamasya ca   / utkūlam udvahaḥ bhava uduhya prati dhāvatāt  /
translated: With the unwearied mind I yoke thee, of the first, of the last. Be thou a boat that sails up stream, and come back with a full sail.

original: agneḥ prajātam pari yat hiraṇyam amṛtam dadhre adhi martyeṣu / yaḥ enat veda saḥ id enam arhati jarā mṛtyuḥ bhavati yaḥ bibharti //
analyzed: agneḥ prajātam pari yat hiraṇyam amṛtam dadhre adhi martyeṣu   yaḥ enat veda saḥ id enam arhati jarā mṛtyuḥ bhavati yaḥ bibharti  /
translated: The gold that sprang from Agni, which immortal life hath taken to itself among mankind, He only is its master who knows this. He who wears it becomes subject to old age and death.

original: yat dhiraṇyam sūryeṇa suvarṇam prajāvantaḥ manavaḥ pūrve īṣire / tat tvā candram varcasā sam sṛjati āyuṣmān bhavati yaḥ bibharti //
analyzed: yat dhiraṇyam sūryeṇa suvarṇam prajāvantaḥ manavaḥ pūrve īṣire   tat tvā candram varcasā sam sṛjati āyuṣmān bhavati yaḥ bibharti  /
translated: The gold which the ancient Manu, rich in offspring, wore, the gold which the sun made bright, That gold, O thou of bright rays, unites thee with splendour. He who wears it becomes possessed of long life.

original: āyuṣe tvā varcase tvā ojase ca balāya ca / yathā hiraṇya tejasā vibhāsāsi janān anu /
analyzed: āyuṣe tvā varcase tvā ojase ca balāya ca    yathā hiraṇya tejasā vibhāsāsi janān anu  /
translated: For life, for splendour, for strength and power, even as thou, O gold, shinest among men with thy radiance,

original: yat veda rājā varuṇaḥ veda devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ / indraḥ yat vṛtra hā veda tat te āyuṣyam bhuvat tat te varcasyam bhuvat /
analyzed: yat veda rājā varuṇaḥ veda devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ   indraḥ yat vṛtra hā veda tat te āyuṣyam bhuvat tat te varcasyam bhuvat  /
translated: What Varuna the king knows, what the god Brihaspati knows, what Indra knows, the Vr̥itra-slayer, may that be for thy life, may that be for thy splendour.

original: gobhiḥ tvā pātu ṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣā tvā pātu vājibhiḥ / vāyuḥ tvā brahmaṇā pātu indraḥ tvā pātu indriyaiḥ /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tvā pātu ṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣā tvā pātu vājibhiḥ   vāyuḥ tvā brahmaṇā pātu indraḥ tvā pātu indriyaiḥ
translated: Let the bull guard thee with the cows, let the strong one guard thee with the strong, let Vayu guard thee with the Brahman, let Indra guard thee with the powers.

original: somaḥ tvā pātu oṣadhībhiḥ nakṣatraiḥ pātu sūryaḥ / mādbhyaḥ tvā candraḥ vṛtra hā vātaḥ prāṇena rakṣatu /🔽tisraḥ divaḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ trīṇi antarikṣāṇi caturaḥ samudrān / trivṛtam stomam trivṛtaḥ āpaḥ āhuḥ tāḥ tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ tvā pātu oṣadhībhiḥ nakṣatraiḥ pātu sūryaḥ   mādbhyaḥ tvā candraḥ vṛtra hā vātaḥ prāṇena rakṣatu  / tisraḥ divaḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ trīṇi antarikṣāṇi caturaḥ samudrān    trivṛtam stomam trivṛtaḥ āpaḥ āhuḥ tāḥ tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ  /
translated: Let Soma guard thee with the plants, let Sûrya guard thee with the stars, let the moon guard thee with the waters, let Vâyu guard thee with the wind, the Vr̥itra-slayer.🔽Three are the heavens, three are the earths, three are the airs, four are the oceans. The Trivrit hymn, the Trivrit waters, they call. May they protect thee with the Trivrit, with the Trivrit ones.

original: trīn nākān trīn samudrān trīn bradhnān trīn vaiṣṭapān / trīn mātariśvanaḥ trīn sūryān goptṝn kalpayāmi te /
analyzed: trīn nākān trīn samudrān trīn bradhnān trīn vaiṣṭapān   trīn mātariśvanaḥ trīn sūryān goptṝn kalpayāmi te  /
translated: Three firmaments, three oceans, three expanses, three abodes, three Mâtariṣvans, three suns, I appoint for thee to be thy guardians.

original: ghṛtena tvā sam ukṣāmi agne ājyena vardhayan / agneḥ candrasya sūryasya mā prāṇam māyinaḥ dabhan //
analyzed: ghṛtena tvā sam ukṣāmi agne ājyena vardhayan   agneḥ candrasya sūryasya mā prāṇam māyinaḥ dabhan  /
translated: With oil I sprinkle thee, O Agni, with ghee, making thee grow. Let not the enchanters harm the breath of Agni, Moon, and Sun.

original: mā vaḥ prāṇam mā vaḥ apānam mā haraḥ māyinaḥ dabhan / bhrājantaḥ viśva vedasaḥ devāḥ daivyena dhāvata /
analyzed: mā vaḥ prāṇam mā vaḥ apānam mā haraḥ māyinaḥ dabhan   bhrājantaḥ viśva vedasaḥ devāḥ daivyena dhāvata  /
translated: Let not the enchanters harm your breath, your expiration, or your inspiration. Shining, O ye all-knowers, ye Gods, run your God-appointed course.

original: prāṇena agnim sam sṛjati vātaḥ prāṇena saṃhitaḥ / prāṇena viśvatomukham sūryam devāḥ ajanayan //
analyzed: prāṇena agnim sam sṛjati vātaḥ prāṇena saṃhitaḥ   prāṇena viśvatomukham sūryam devāḥ ajanayan  /
translated: With breath they join together Agni, with breath the wind is joined. With breath the Gods have generated the all-observing Sun.

original: āyuṣā āyuḥ kṛtām jīva āyuṣmān jīva mā mṛthāḥ / prāṇena ātmanvatām jīva mā mṛtyoḥ ud agāḥ vaśam //🔽devānām nihitam nidhim yam indraḥ anvavindat pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ / āpaḥ hiraṇyam jugupuḥ trivṛdbhiḥ tāḥ tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ //
analyzed: āyuṣā āyuḥ kṛtām jīva āyuṣmān jīva mā mṛthāḥ   prāṇena ātmanvatām jīva mā mṛtyoḥ ud agāḥ vaśam  / devānām nihitam nidhim yam indraḥ anvavindat pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ   āpaḥ hiraṇyam jugupuḥ trivṛdbhiḥ tāḥ tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ  /
translated: With life prolong the life thou hast: live long, live on, and die no more. With breath of those who have a soul live on: go not to death's subjection.🔽The treasure which the Gods have laid away, which Indra found by paths that Gods may travel, which the three-formed hath guarded in the waters, may they with triple guard protect this treasure.

original: trayastriṃśat devatāḥ trīṇi ca vīryāṇi priyāyamāṇāḥ jugupuḥ apsu antar / asmin candre adhi yat hiraṇyam tena ayam kṛṇavat vīryāṇi //
analyzed: trayastriṃśat devatāḥ trīṇi ca vīryāṇi priyāyamāṇāḥ jugupuḥ apsu antar    asmin candre adhi yat hiraṇyam tena ayam kṛṇavat vīryāṇi  /
translated: The thirty-three Gods and the three powers, loving each other, have guarded in the waters the gold which is in the moon. May it make this man strong with that power.

original: ye devāḥ divi ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam //🔽ye devāḥ antarikṣe ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam //
analyzed: ye devāḥ divi ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam  ye devāḥ antarikṣe ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam
translated: Ye Gods who are eleven in heaven, ye Gods, accept this offering.🔽Ye Gods who are eleven in the atmosphere, ye Gods, accept this offering.

original: ye devā pṛthivyām ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam //
analyzed: ye devā pṛthivyām ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam
translated: Ye Gods who are eleven on earth, ye Gods, accept this offering.

original: asapatnam purastāt paścāt naḥ abhayam kṛtam / savitā mā dakṣiṇatas uttarāt mā śacīpatiḥ /
analyzed: asapatnam purastāt paścāt naḥ abhayam kṛtam   savitā mā dakṣiṇatas uttarāt mā śacīpatiḥ  /
translated: Make ye a path for us on every side, ye Gods, a path that none may interrupt.🔽May the Âdityas guard me from the sky, may the Âgnis guard me from the earth. May Indra-Agni guard me from the front, may the two Asvins from the right, may the Lord of Strength from the left.

original: divaḥ me ādityāḥ rakṣantu bhūmyāḥ rakṣantu agnayaḥ / indra agnī rakṣatām mā purastāt aśvinau abhitas śarma yacchatām / tiraścīn aghnyā rakṣatu jātavedāḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ me sarvatas santu varma /
analyzed: divaḥ me ādityāḥ rakṣantu bhūmyāḥ rakṣantu agnayaḥ   indra agnī rakṣatām mā purastāt aśvinau abhitas śarma yacchatām   tiraścīn aghnyā rakṣatu jātavedāḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ me sarvatas santu varma  /
translated: May the all-creating Gods guard me on every side.

original: imam badhnāmi te maṇim dīrgha āyu tvāya tejase / darbham sapatna dambhanam dviṣataḥ tapanam hṛdaḥ /
analyzed: imam badhnāmi te maṇim dīrgha āyu tvāya tejase   darbham sapatna dambhanam dviṣataḥ tapanam hṛdaḥ  /
translated: This charm I bind upon thee for long life and energy, the Darbha that subdueth foes, that burneth up the heart of him who hateth us.

original: dviṣataḥ tāpayan hṛdaḥ śatrūṇām tāpayan manaḥ / durhārdaḥ sarvān tvam darbha gharmaḥ iva abhīn saṃtāpayan /
analyzed: dviṣataḥ tāpayan hṛdaḥ śatrūṇām tāpayan manaḥ   durhārdaḥ sarvān tvam darbha gharmaḥ iva abhīn saṃtāpayan  /
translated: Burning the heart of him who hateth us, scorching the spirit of our enemies, thou, Darbha, who destroyest all malignity, burn thou like fire all those who fain would do us harm.

original: gharmaḥ iva abhitapan darbha dviṣataḥ nitapan maṇe / hṛdaḥ sapatnānām bhinddhi indraḥ iva virujam balam /
analyzed: gharmaḥ iva abhitapan darbha dviṣataḥ nitapan maṇe   hṛdaḥ sapatnānām bhinddhi indraḥ iva virujam balam  /
translated: Like the sun burning, O Darbha, burning, O Amulet, the enemies, Pierce through the hearts of our adversaries, as Indra pierces through the unyielding strength.

original: bhinddhi darbha sapatnānām hṛdayam dviṣatām maṇe / udyan tvacam iva bhūmyāḥ śiraḥ eṣām vi pātaya //🔽bhinddhi darbha sapatnān me bhinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ / bhinddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ bhinddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe /🔽chinddhi darbha sapatnān me chinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ / chinddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ chinddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: bhinddhi darbha sapatnānām hṛdayam dviṣatām maṇe    udyan tvacam iva bhūmyāḥ śiraḥ eṣām vi pātaya  / bhinddhi darbha sapatnān me bhinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ   bhinddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ bhinddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  / chinddhi darbha sapatnān me chinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ   chinddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ chinddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: Pierce through, O Darbha, the hearts of our adversaries, O Amulet, Pierce through the skin of these, as the rising sun pierces through the earth, and lay their heads low.🔽Pierce through, O Darbha, my adversaries, pierce through those who fight against me. Pierce through all the evil-hearted ones for me, pierce through my enemies, O Amulet.🔽Cut off, O Darbha, my adversaries, cut off those who fight against me. Cut off all the evil-hearted ones for me, cut off my enemies, O Amulet.

original: vṛśca darbha sapatnān me vṛśca me pṛtanāyataḥ / vṛśca me sarvān durhārdaḥ vṛśca me dviṣataḥ maṇe /🔽kṛnta darbha sapatnān me kṛnta me pṛtanāyataḥ / kṛnta me sarvān durhārdaḥ kṛnta me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: vṛśca darbha sapatnān me vṛśca me pṛtanāyataḥ   vṛśca me sarvān durhārdaḥ vṛśca me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /🔽kṛnta darbha sapatnān me kṛnta me pṛtanāyataḥ   kṛnta me sarvān durhārdaḥ kṛnta me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: Cut asunder, O Darbha, my adversaries, cut asunder those who fight against me. Cut asunder all the evil-hearted ones for me, cut asunder my enemies, O Amulet.🔽Mangle, O Darbha, my adversaries, mangle those who fight against me. Mangle all the evil-hearted ones for me, mangle my enemies, O Amulet.🔽Hew down, O Darbha, my adversaries, hew down those who fight against me. Hew down all the evil-hearted ones for me, hew down my enemies, O Amulet.

original: piṃśa darbha sapatnān me piṃśa me pṛtanāyataḥ / piṃśa me sarvān durhārdaḥ piṃśa me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: piṃśa darbha sapatnān me piṃśa me pṛtanāyataḥ   piṃśa me sarvān durhārdaḥ piṃśa me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: Crush my rivals, O Darbha, crush those who fight against me. Crush all evil-hearted ones for me, crush my enemies, O jewel.

original: vidhya darbha sapatnān me vidhya me pṛtanāyataḥ / vidhya me sarvān durhārdaḥ vidhya me dviṣataḥ maṇe /🔽nikṣa darbha sapatnān me nikṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ / nikṣa me sarvān durhārdaḥ nikṣa me dviṣataḥ maṇe /🔽tṛnddhi darbha sapatnān me tṛnddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ / tṛnddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ tṛnddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: vidhya darbha sapatnān me vidhya me pṛtanāyataḥ   vidhya me sarvān durhārdaḥ vidhya me dviṣataḥ maṇe  / nikṣa darbha sapatnān me nikṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ   nikṣa me sarvān durhārdaḥ nikṣa me dviṣataḥ maṇe  / tṛnddhi darbha sapatnān me tṛnddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ   tṛnddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ tṛnddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: Pierce, O Darbha, my rivals, pierce those who fight against me. Pierce all evil-hearted ones for me, pierce my enemies, O jewel.🔽Throw down, O Darbha, my rivals, throw down those who fight against me. Throw down all evil-hearted ones for me, throw down my enemies, O jewel.🔽Tear up, O Darbha, my rivals, tear up those who fight against me. Tear up all evil-hearted ones for me, tear up my enemies, O jewel.

original: runddhi darbha sapatnān me runddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ / runddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ runddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: runddhi darbha sapatnān me runddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ   runddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ runddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: Bind, O Darbha, my rivals, bind those who fight against me. Bind all evil-hearted ones for me, bind my enemies, O jewel.

original: mṛṇa darbha sapatnān me mṛṇa me pṛtanāyataḥ / mṛṇa me sarvān durhārdaḥ mṛṇa me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: mṛṇa darbha sapatnān me mṛṇa me pṛtanāyataḥ   mṛṇa me sarvān durhārdaḥ mṛṇa me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: Kill, O Darbha, my rivals, kill those who fight against me. Kill all evil-hearted ones for me, kill my enemies, O jewel.

original: mantha darbha sapatnān me mantha me pṛtanāyataḥ / mantha me sarvān durhārdaḥ mantha me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: mantha darbha sapatnān me mantha me pṛtanāyataḥ   mantha me sarvān durhārdaḥ mantha me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: O Darbha, crush my rivals, crush those who fight against me. Crush all my evil-hearted enemies, crush my haters, O jewel.

original: piṇḍḍhi darbha sapatnān me piṇḍḍhi me pṛtanāyataḥ / piṇḍḍhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ piṇḍḍhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe /🔽oṣa darbha sapatnān me oṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ / oṣa me sarvān durhārdaḥ oṣa me dviṣataḥ maṇe /🔽daha darbha sapatnān me daha me pṛtanāyataḥ / daha me sarvān durhārdaḥ daha me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: piṇḍḍhi darbha sapatnān me piṇḍḍhi me pṛtanāyataḥ   piṇḍḍhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ piṇḍḍhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  / oṣa darbha sapatnān me oṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ   oṣa me sarvān durhārdaḥ oṣa me dviṣataḥ maṇe  / daha darbha sapatnān me daha me pṛtanāyataḥ   daha me sarvān durhārdaḥ daha me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: O Darbha, bind my rivals, bind those who fight against me. Bind all my evil-hearted enemies, bind my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, burn my rivals, burn those who fight against me. Burn all my evil-hearted enemies, burn my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, consume my rivals, consume those who fight against me. Consume all my evil-hearted enemies, consume my haters, O jewel.

original: jahi darbha sapatnān me jahi me pṛtanāyataḥ / jahi me sarvān durhārdaḥ jahi me dviṣataḥ maṇe /
analyzed: jahi darbha sapatnān me jahi me pṛtanāyataḥ   jahi me sarvān durhārdaḥ jahi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  /
translated: O Darbha, slay my rivals, slay those who fight against me. Slay all my evil-hearted enemies, slay my haters, O jewel.

original: yat te darbha jarā mṛtyu śatam varmasu varma te / tena imam varmiṇam kṛtvā sapatnām jahi vīryaiḥ //
analyzed: yat te darbha jarā mṛtyu śatam varmasu varma te    tena imam varmiṇam kṛtvā sapatnām jahi vīryaiḥ
translated: Whatever old age and death are in you, O Darbha, a hundred armours among your armours, with that having made this one armoured, slay his rivals with your powers.

original: śatam te darbha varmāṇi sahasram vīryāṇi te / tam asmai viśve tvām devāḥ jarase bhartavai aduḥ /
analyzed: śatam te darbha varmāṇi sahasram vīryāṇi te   tam asmai viśve tvām devāḥ jarase bhartavai aduḥ  /
translated: You have a hundred armours, O Darbha, a thousand powers. All the gods have given you to this one to carry to old age.

original: tvām āhuḥ deva varma tvām darbha brahmaṇaḥ patim / tvām indrasya āhuḥ varma tvam rāṣṭrāṇi rakṣasi //
analyzed: tvām āhuḥ deva varma tvām darbha brahmaṇaḥ patim   tvām indrasya āhuḥ varma tvam rāṣṭrāṇi rakṣasi  /
translated: They call thee, Darbha, God-enwrapt, they call thee Brahma's consort. They call thee Indra's coat of mail: thou guardest all the realms of men.

original: sapatna kṣayaṇam darbha dviṣataḥ tapanam hṛdaḥ / maṇim kṣatrasya vardhanam tanū pānam kṛṇomi te /
analyzed: sapatna kṣayaṇam darbha dviṣataḥ tapanam hṛdaḥ   maṇim kṣatrasya vardhanam tanū pānam kṛṇomi te  /
translated: Darbha, the slayer of the foe, the scorcher of the man who hates, the heart's protector, strengthener of the prince, I make thy body's guard.

original: yat samudraḥ abhyakrandat parjanyaḥ vidyutā saha / tatas hiranyayaḥ binduḥ tatas darbhaḥ ajāyata //
analyzed: yat samudraḥ abhyakrandat parjanyaḥ vidyutā saha   tatas hiranyayaḥ binduḥ tatas darbhaḥ ajāyata  /
translated: When the sea roared and Parjanya with the lightning roared together, then the golden drop was born, and then the Darbha plant sprang forth.

original: audumbareṇa maṇinā puṣṭi kāmāya vedhasā / paśūṇām sarveṣām sphātim goṣṭhe me savitā karat /🔽yaḥ naḥ agniḥ gārhapatyaḥ paśūnām adhipāḥ asat / audumbaraḥ vṛṣā maṇiḥ sam mā sṛjatu puṣṭyā /
analyzed: audumbareṇa maṇinā puṣṭi kāmāya vedhasā   paśūṇām sarveṣām sphātim goṣṭhe me savitā karat  / yaḥ naḥ agniḥ gārhapatyaḥ paśūnām adhipāḥ asat    audumbaraḥ vṛṣā maṇiḥ sam mā sṛjatu puṣṭyā  /
translated: With the supporting amulet of Udumbara, the wish-fulfilling plant, may Savitar grant me increase of all cattle in my stable.🔽May the Udumbara gem, the bull, the lord of cattle, who is our household fire, unite me with prosperity.

original: karīṣiṇīm phalavatīm svadhām irām ca naḥ gṛhe / audumbarasya tejasā dhātā puṣṭim dadhātu me /
analyzed: karīṣiṇīm phalavatīm svadhām irām ca naḥ gṛhe    audumbarasya tejasā dhātā puṣṭim dadhātu me  /
translated: May the Creator grant me increase, with the splendour of the Udumbara, the house-holder, the fruit-bearing plant, and the sweet food that it contains.

original: yat dvipād ca catuṣpād ca yāni annāni ye rasāḥ / gṛhṇe aham tu eṣām bhūmānam bibhrat audumbaram maṇim //
analyzed: yat dvipād ca catuṣpād ca yāni annāni ye rasāḥ   gṛhṇe aham tu eṣām bhūmānam bibhrat audumbaram maṇim  /
translated: The increase of the two-footed and four-footed cattle, and of all the food and juices that are theirs, I take, bearing the Udumbara gem upon my breast.

original: puṣṭim paśūnām pari jagrabha aham catuṣpadām dvipadām yat ca dhānyam / payaḥ paśūnām rasam oṣadhīnām bṛhaspatiḥ savitā me ni yacchāt /
analyzed: puṣṭim paśūnām pari jagrabha aham catuṣpadām dvipadām yat ca dhānyam   payaḥ paśūnām rasam oṣadhīnām bṛhaspatiḥ savitā me ni yacchāt  /
translated: I have received the nourishment of cattle, of the four-footed and of the two-footed, and of all grain. Let Brihaspati and Savitar bestow upon me the milk of cattle and the sap of plants.

original: aham paśūnām adhipāḥ asāni mayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ dadhātu / mahyam audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ draviṇāni ni yacchatu //
analyzed: aham paśūnām adhipāḥ asāni mayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ dadhātu   mahyam audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ draviṇāni ni yacchatu  /
translated: May I be the lord of cattle: may the lord of increase bestow increase upon me. May the Audumbara gem bestow wealth upon me.

original: upa mā audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ prajayā ca dhanena ca / indreṇa jinvitaḥ maṇiḥ ā mā agan saha varcasā /
analyzed: upa mā audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ prajayā ca dhanena ca   indreṇa jinvitaḥ maṇiḥ ā mā agan saha varcasā  /
translated: The Audumbara gem has come to me with offspring and with wealth, the gem inspired by Indra, with splendour.

original: devaḥ maṇiḥ sapatna hā dhana sāḥ dhana sātaye / paśoḥ annasya bhūmānam gavām sphātim ni yacchatu //
analyzed: devaḥ maṇiḥ sapatna hā dhana sāḥ dhana sātaye   paśoḥ annasya bhūmānam gavām sphātim ni yacchatu  /
translated: The divine gem, the slayer of foes, the winner of wealth, for the winning of wealth, let it bestow upon me the abundance of cattle and corn.

original: yathā agre tvam vanaspate puṣṭhyā saha jajñiṣe / eva dhanasya me sphātim ā dadhātu sarasvatī /
analyzed: yathā agre tvam vanaspate puṣṭhyā saha jajñiṣe   eva dhanasya me sphātim ā dadhātu sarasvatī  /
translated: As in the beginning, O tree, thou wast born with increase, so let Sarasvatî bestow upon me the abundance of wealth.

original: ā me dhanam sarasvatī paya sphātim ca dhānyam / sinīvālī upa ā vahāt ayam ca audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ /
analyzed: ā me dhanam sarasvatī payaḥ sphātim ca dhānyam    sinīvālī upa ā vahāt ayam ca audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ  /
translated: Let Sarasvatî bring me wealth, milk, abundance of corn, and let Sinîvâlî bring it. Let this gem of the Audumbara tree bring it.

original: tvam maṇīṇām adhipāḥ vṛṣā asi tvayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ jajāna / tvayi ime vājāḥ draviṇāni sarva audumbaraḥ sa tvam asmat sahasva ārāt ārāt arātim amatim kṣudham ca /
analyzed: tvam maṇīṇām adhipāḥ vṛṣā asi tvayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ jajāna   tvayi ime vājāḥ draviṇāni sarva audumbaraḥ sa tvam asmat sahasva ārāt ārāt arātim amatim kṣudham ca  /
translated: Thou art the lord of gems, the mighty one: in thee the lord of increase hath produced increase. In thee are all these treasures and possessions. Be thou the fig-tree for us. Drive thou away from us want and hunger and hostility.

original: grāmaṇīḥ asi grāmaṇīḥ utthāya abhiṣiktaḥ abhi mā siñca varcasā / tejaḥ asi tejaḥ mayi dhāraya adhi rayiḥ asi rayim me dhehi //
analyzed: grāmaṇīḥ asi grāmaṇīḥ utthāya abhiṣiktaḥ abhi mā siñca varcasā   tejaḥ asi tejaḥ mayi dhāraya adhi rayiḥ asi rayim me dhehi  /
translated: Thou art the chief, the chief risen up and anointed. Anoint thou me with splendour. Thou art splendour. Hold thou splendour in me. Thou art wealth. Bestow thou wealth on me.

original: puṣṭiḥ asi puṣṭyāḥ mā sam aṅgdhi gṛhamedhī gṛhapatim mā kṛṇu / audumbaraḥ sa tvam asmāsu dhehi rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram ni yaccha rāyaḥ poṣāya prati muñce aham tvām /
analyzed: puṣṭiḥ asi puṣṭyāḥ mā sam aṅgdhi gṛhamedhī gṛhapatim mā kṛṇu   audumbaraḥ sa tvam asmāsu dhehi rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram ni yaccha rāyaḥ poṣāya prati muñce aham tvām  /
translated: Thou art increase. Unite me with increase. Make me the lord of a house. The fig-tree is thy name. Bestow thou wealth on us. Bestow thou on us riches with brave sons. I loose thee for the increase of our wealth.

original: ayam audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ vīraḥ vīrāya badhyate / sa naḥ sanim madhumatīm kṛṇotu rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram ni yacchāt /
analyzed: ayam audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ vīraḥ vīrāya badhyate   sa naḥ sanim madhumatīm kṛṇotu rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram ni yacchāt  /
translated: This fig-tree amulet, a hero, is bound on for a hero. May it make for us sweet gain. Bestow thou on us riches with brave sons.

original: śata kāṇḍaḥ duścyavanaḥ sahasra parṇaḥ uttiraḥ / darbhaḥ yaḥ ugraḥ oṣadhiḥ tam te badhnāmi āyuṣe /
analyzed: śata kāṇḍaḥ duścyavanaḥ sahasra parṇaḥ uttiraḥ    darbhaḥ yaḥ ugraḥ oṣadhiḥ tam te badhnāmi āyuṣe  /
translated: The Darbha grass, a thousand-leaved plant, with a hundred joints, hard to overthrow, is bound on thee for life, the strong plant which is the best of all.

original: na asya keśān pra vapanti na urasi tāḍam ā ghnate / yasmai a chinna parṇena darbhena śarma yacchati //
analyzed: na asya keśān pra vapanti na urasi tāḍam ā ghnate   yasmai a chinna parṇena darbhena śarma yacchati  /
translated: To whom he gives protection with a Darbha blade whose leaf is uncut.🔽Thy downy tuft is in the sky, O Plant: on earth is thy foundation.

original: divi te tūlam oṣadhe pṛthivyām asi niṣṭhitaḥ / tvayā sahasra kāṇḍena āyuḥ pra vardhayāmahe //
analyzed: divi te tūlam oṣadhe pṛthivyām asi niṣṭhitaḥ   tvayā sahasra kāṇḍena āyuḥ pra vardhayāmahe  /
translated: With thee, O Plant with thousand stalks, we strengthen out our life of days.🔽Thou hast pierced through the three wide realms of heaven, and through these three earths also.

original: tisraḥ divaḥ ati atṛṇat tisraḥ imāḥ pṛthivīḥ uta / tvayā aham durhārdaḥ jihvām ni tṛṇadmi vacāṃsi //
analyzed: tisraḥ divaḥ ati atṛṇat tisraḥ imāḥ pṛthivīḥ uta    tvayā aham durhārdaḥ jihvām ni tṛṇadmi vacāṃsi  /
translated: With thee I pierce the tongue and words of him who hates and injures me.🔽Thou art the conqueror: I am the conqueror. Both of us being conquerors,

original: tvam asi sahamānaḥ aham asmi sahasvān / ubhau sahasvantau bhūtvā sapatnān sahiṣīvahi //
analyzed: tvam asi sahamānaḥ aham asmi sahasvān   ubhau sahasvantau bhūtvā sapatnān sahiṣīvahi  /
translated: Let us conquer our adversaries.🔽Conquer for us our enemies, conquer those who fain would fight us.

original: sahasva naḥ abhimātim sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ / sahasva sarvān durhārdaḥ suhārdaḥ me bahūn kṛdhi //🔽darbheṇa deva jātena divi ṣṭambhena śaśvat id / tena aham śaśvataḥ janām asanam sanavāni ca /
analyzed: sahasva naḥ abhimātim sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ   sahasva sarvān durhārdaḥ suhārdaḥ me bahūn kṛdhi  / darbheṇa deva jātena divi ṣṭambhena śaśvat id   tena aham śaśvataḥ janām asanam sanavāni ca  /
translated: Conquer all those who hate us. Make many friends to love me well.🔽With Darbha, Plant divine, with him who props the sky,🔽With him I drive away from us all poverty and want.🔽Be gracious, Darbha, to the Brahman and the Rājan, to the Śūdra and the Ārya,

original: priyam mā darbha kṛṇu brahmarājanyābhyām śūdrāya ca āryāya ca / yasmai ca kāmayāmahe sarvasmai ca vipaśyate //
analyzed: priyam mā darbha kṛṇu brahmarājanyābhyām śūdrāya ca āryāya ca   yasmai ca kāmayāmahe sarvasmai ca vipaśyate  /
translated: To him whom we love well, and to all men who look on us with favour.

original: yaḥ jāyamānaḥ pṛthivīm adṛṃhat yaḥ astabhnāt antarikṣam divam ca / yam bibhratam nanu pāpmā viveda sa naḥ ayam darbhaḥ varuṇaḥ divā kaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ jāyamānaḥ pṛthivīm adṛṃhat yaḥ astabhnāt antarikṣam divam ca   yam bibhratam nanu pāpmā viveda sa naḥ ayam darbhaḥ varuṇaḥ divā kaḥ  /
translated: Whom, though he bears him up, sin never knew, may this our Darbha, Varuna, by day,

original: sapatna hā śata kāṇḍaḥ sahasvān oṣadhīnām prathamaḥ sam babhūva / sa naḥ ayam darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvatas tena sākṣīya pṛtanāḥ pṛtanyataḥ /
analyzed: sapatna hā śata kāṇḍaḥ sahasvān oṣadhīnām prathamaḥ sam babhūva   sa naḥ ayam darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvatas tena sākṣīya pṛtanāḥ pṛtanyataḥ  /
translated: The foe-destroyer, hundred-jointed, strong, hath been the first of plants. May this our Darbha guard us well on every side. Therewith subdue thou foes in fight.🔽Worth a thousand, hundred-jointed, rich in milk, the plant of waters, Agni of plants, the King,

original: sahasra arghaḥ śata kāṇḍaḥ payasvān apām agniḥ vīrudhām rājasūyam / sa naḥ ayam darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvatas devaḥ maṇiḥ āyuṣā sam sṛjāti naḥ /
analyzed: sahasra arghaḥ śata kāṇḍaḥ payasvān apām agniḥ vīrudhām rājasūyam     sa naḥ ayam darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvatas devaḥ maṇiḥ āyuṣā sam sṛjāti naḥ  /
translated: May this our Darbha guard us well on every side. The God, the gem, bestows long life on us.🔽Scraped from the butter, rich in meath and milk, firm-seated on the earth, unmoving, moving them,

original: ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān bhūmi dṛṃhaḥ acyutaḥ cyāvayiṣṇuḥ / nudan sapatnān adharān ca kṛṇvan darbhāḥ roha mahatām indriyeṇa /
analyzed: ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān bhūmi dṛṃhaḥ acyutaḥ cyāvayiṣṇuḥ   nudan sapatnān adharān ca kṛṇvan darbhāḥ roha mahatām indriyeṇa  /
translated: Driving away our foes and making them low, grow up, O Darbha, with the might of mighty ones.

original: tvam bhūmim ati eṣi ojasā tvam vedyām sīdasi cāruḥ adhvare / tvām pavitram ṛṣayaḥ abharanta tvam punīhi duritāni asmat /
analyzed: tvam bhūmim ati eṣi ojasā tvam vedyām sīdasi cāruḥ adhvare   tvām pavitram ṛṣayaḥ abharanta tvam punīhi duritāni asmat  /
translated: With might thou passest over the earth. Thou sittest lovely on the altar at the rite. The Rishis have brought thee as a purifying plant. Purify thou our sins and trespasses.

original: tīkṣṇaḥ rājā viṣāsahī rakṣaḥ hā viśvacarṣaṇiḥ / ojaḥ devānām balam ugram etat tam te badhnāmi jarase svastaye /
analyzed: tīkṣṇaḥ rājā viṣāsahī rakṣaḥ hā viśvacarṣaṇiḥ    ojaḥ devānām balam ugram etat tam te badhnāmi jarase svastaye  /
translated: Sharp is the King, poison-resisting, Raksas-slayer, all-men's Friend. This is the Gods' strength and mighty vigour. I bind it on for thee for lengthened life and bliss.

original: darbheṇa tvam kṛṇavat vīryāṇi darbham bibhrat ātmanā mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ / atiṣṭhāya varcasā adhānyān sūryaḥ iva ā bhāhi pradiśaḥ catasraḥ /
analyzed: darbheṇa tvam kṛṇavat vīryāṇi darbham bibhrat ātmanā mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ   atiṣṭhāya varcasā adhānyān sūryaḥ iva ā bhāhi pradiśaḥ catasraḥ  /
translated: With the Darbha grass thou shalt perform heroic deeds. Bearing the Darbha grass on thy body, be not faint. Standing with thy glory above thy fellows, shine forth on the four quarters like the sun.

original: jāṅgiḍaḥ asi jaṅgiḍaḥ rakṣitā asi jaṅgidaḥ / dvipād catuṣpād asmākam sarvam rakṣatu jaṅgidaḥ /
analyzed: jāṅgiḍaḥ asi jaṅgiḍaḥ rakṣitā asi jaṅgidaḥ    dvipād catuṣpād asmākam sarvam rakṣatu jaṅgidaḥ  /
translated: Thou art the Jangida, the protector, the Jangida. May the Jangida protect all our bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: yāḥ gṛtsyaḥ tri pañca āśīḥ śatam kṛtyā kṛtaḥ ca ye / sarvān vinaktu tejasaḥ arasām jaṅgidaḥ karat /
analyzed: yāḥ gṛtsyaḥ tri pañca āśīḥ śatam kṛtyā kṛtaḥ ca ye sarvān vinaktu tejasaḥ arasām jaṅgidaḥ karat  /
translated: The Gritsas, the three times five, and all the hundred sorcerers, may Jangida deprive them all of splendour and make them sapless.

original: arasam kṛtrimam nādam arasāḥ sapta visrasaḥ / apetaḥ jaṅgiḍāmatim iṣum astā iva śātaya //
analyzed: arasam kṛtrimam nādam arasāḥ sapta visrasaḥ   apetaḥ jaṅgiḍāmatim iṣum astā iva śātaya  /
translated: The sapless, artificial cry, the sapless seven-jointed one, drive away, O Jangida, the spell as one would drive away a shot arrow.

original: kṛtyā dūṣaṇaḥ eva ayam atha u arāti dūṣaṇaḥ / atha u sahasvān jaṅgiḍaḥ pra naḥ āyumṣi tāriṣat /
analyzed: kṛtyā dūṣaṇaḥ eva ayam atha u arāti dūṣaṇaḥ   atha u sahasvān jaṅgiḍaḥ pra naḥ āyumṣi tāriṣat  /
translated: This is the destroyer of sorcery, this is the destroyer of hostility, and this is the victorious Jangida. May he prolong our days of life.

original: sa jaṅgiḍasya mahimā pari naḥ pātu viśvatas / viṣkandham yena sāsaha saṃskandham ojaḥ ojasā /
analyzed: sa jaṅgiḍasya mahimā pari naḥ pātu viśvatas   viṣkandham yena sāsaha saṃskandham ojaḥ ojasā  /
translated: May the great power of Jangida protect us on every side, wherewith he conquered Viskindha, and with his own strength conquered Skandha.

original: tris tvā devāḥ ajanayat niṣṭhitam bhūmyām adhi / tam u tvā aṅgirāḥ iti brāhmaṇāḥ pūrvyāḥ viduḥ /
analyzed: tris tvā devāḥ ajanayat niṣṭhitam bhūmyām adhi   tam u tvā aṅgirāḥ iti brāhmaṇāḥ pūrvyāḥ viduḥ  /
translated: The Gods have generated thee thrice, firmly established on the earth. The ancient Brāhmans know thee well, O thou whom they call Aṅgiras.

original: na tvā pūrvāḥ oṣadhayaḥ na tvā taranti yāḥ navāḥ / vibādhaḥ ugraḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ paripāṇaḥ su maṅgalaḥ /
analyzed: na tvā pūrvāḥ oṣadhayaḥ na tvā taranti yāḥ navāḥ   vibādhaḥ ugraḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ paripāṇaḥ su maṅgalaḥ  /
translated: Neither the plants that spring up first, nor those that spring up later, surpass thee. Jangida is a mighty foe, a guardian, a very happy guard.

original: atha upadāna bhagavaḥ jāṅgiḍa amita vīrya / purā te ugrā grasataḥ upendraḥ vīryam dadau //
analyzed: atha upadāna bhagavaḥ jāṅgiḍa amita vīrya   purā te ugrā grasataḥ upendraḥ vīryam dadau
translated: Now, O blessed Jangida, whose power is infinite, Indra gave thee strength before thou wast a voracious eater.

original: ugraḥ id te vanaspate indraḥ ojmānam ā dadhau / amīvāḥ sarvāḥ cātayam jahi rakṣāṃsi oṣadhe //
analyzed: ugraḥ id te vanaspate indraḥ ojmānam ā dadhau amīvāḥ sarvāḥ cātayam jahi rakṣāṃsi oṣadhe
translated: Indra hath given thee, O tree, a mighty power. Drive thou away all maladies. Slay the Rākshasas, O plant.

original: āśarīkam viśarīkam balāsam pṛṣṭyāmayam / takmānam viśva śāradam arasām jaṅgiḍaḥ karat /
analyzed: āśarīkam viśarīkam balāsam pṛṣṭyāmayam   takmānam viśva śāradam arasām jaṅgiḍaḥ karat  /
translated: The disease that racks the limbs, the malady that racks the back, the wasting cough that racks the chest, Jangida maketh powerless.

original: indrasya nāma gṛhṇantaḥ ṛsayaḥ jaṅgidam daduḥ / devāḥ yam cakruḥ bheṣajam agre viṣkandha dūṣaṇam /
analyzed: indrasya nāma gṛhṇantaḥ ṛsayaḥ jaṅgidam daduḥ   devāḥ yam cakruḥ bheṣajam agre viṣkandha dūṣaṇam  /
translated: The Rishis, calling on the name of Indra, gave Jangida, whom the Gods made first of all a medicine to drive away Viskindha's poison.

original: sa naḥ rakṣatu jaṅgiḍaḥ dhana pālaḥ dhanā iva / devāḥ yam cakruḥ brāhmaṇāḥ paripāṇam arāti ham /
analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣatu jaṅgiḍaḥ dhana pālaḥ dhanā iva    devāḥ yam cakruḥ brāhmaṇāḥ paripāṇam arāti ham  /
translated: May Jangida, the guardian of wealth, protect us, as wealth. The Gods, the Brahmans, have made him a guardian, a slayer of foes.🔽The evil-hearted, the cruel, the eye of the wicked, the one who comes to evil,

original: durhārdaḥ saṃghoram cakṣuḥ pāpa kṛtvānam āgamam / tān tvam sahasracakṣo pratībodhena nāśaya paripāṇaḥ asi jaṅgiḍaḥ /
analyzed: durhārdaḥ saṃghoram cakṣuḥ pāpa kṛtvānam āgamam    tān tvam sahasracakṣo pratībodhena nāśaya paripāṇaḥ asi jaṅgiḍaḥ  /
translated: With a thousand eyes, destroy them with your watchful care. You are a guardian, O Jangida.🔽From the sky, from the earth, from the atmosphere, from the plants,

original: pari mā divaḥ pari mā pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt pari mā vīrudbhyaḥ / pari mā bhūtāt pari mā uta bhavyāt diśaḥ diśaḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ pātu asmān /
analyzed: pari mā divaḥ pari mā pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt pari mā vīrudbhyaḥ   pari mā bhūtāt pari mā uta bhavyāt diśaḥ diśaḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ pātu asmān  /
translated: From the past, from the future, from all directions, O Jangida, protect us.🔽The enmities created by the gods, and whatever other enmity there is,

original: yaḥ ṛṣṇavaḥ deva kṛtāḥ yaḥ uta u vavṛte anyaḥ / sarvān stān viśva bheṣajaḥ arasām jaṅgiḍaḥ karat /
analyzed: yaḥ ṛṣṇavaḥ deva kṛtāḥ yaḥ uta u vavṛte anyaḥ    sarvān stān viśva bheṣajaḥ arasām jaṅgiḍaḥ karat  /
translated: May the all-healing Jangida make all of them powerless.

original: śata vāraḥ anīnaśat yakṣmān rakṣāṃsi tejasā / ārohan varcasā saha maṇiḥ durṇāma cātanaḥ /
analyzed: śata vāraḥ anīnaśat yakṣmān rakṣāṃsi tejasā   ārohan varcasā saha maṇiḥ durṇāma cātanaḥ  /
translated: The hundred-threaded one has destroyed the consumptions and the Rakshasas with its splendor,🔽Ascending with splendor, the amulet that drives away evil names.🔽With its horns it drives away the Rakshas, with its root the witches,

original: śṛṅgābhyām rakṣaḥ nudate mūlena yātudhānyaḥ / madhyena yakṣmam bādhate na enam pāpmā ati tatrati //
analyzed: śṛṅgābhyām rakṣaḥ nudate mūlena yātudhānyaḥ   madhyena yakṣmam bādhate na enam pāpmā ati tatrati  /
translated: With its middle it repels consumption. Evil does not overcome it.

original: ye yakṣmāsaḥ arbhakāḥ mahāntaḥ ye ca śabdinaḥ / sarvām durṇāmahāḥ maṇiḥ śata vāraḥ anīnaśat /
analyzed: ye yakṣmāsaḥ arbhakāḥ mahāntaḥ ye ca śabdinaḥ    sarvām durṇāmahāḥ maṇiḥ śata vāraḥ anīnaśat  /
translated: The hundred-threaded Amulet, the charm of evil name, hath destroyed them all.🔽It hath produced a hundred heroes, and a hundred forms of phthisis hath it driven away.

original: śatam vīrān ajanayat śatam yakṣmān apāvapat / durṇāmnaḥ sarvān hatvā ava rakṣāṃsi dhūnute /
analyzed: śatam vīrān ajanayat śatam yakṣmān apāvapat    durṇāmnaḥ sarvān hatvā ava rakṣāṃsi dhūnute  /
translated: Having destroyed all evil names, it shakes off the Rākshasas.🔽This Amulet, the bull with golden horns, the hundred-threaded charm,

original: hiraṇya śṛṅgaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ śāta vāraḥ ayam maṇiḥ / durṇāmnaḥ sarvān tṛdhvā ava rakṣāṃsi akramīt /
analyzed: hiraṇya śṛṅgaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ śāta vāraḥ ayam maṇiḥ   durṇāmnaḥ sarvān tṛdhvā ava rakṣāṃsi akramīt  /
translated: Having destroyed all evil names, hath passed beyond the Rākshasas.🔽The hundred evil names of Gandharvas and of Apsarases,

original: śatam aham durṇāmnīnām gandharva apsarasām śatam / śatam śaśvanvatīnām śata vāreṇa vāraye //
analyzed: śatam aham durṇāmnīnām gandharva apsarasām śatam    śatam śaśvanvatīnām śata vāreṇa vāraye  /
translated: The hundred names of those who live for ever, I repel with the hundred-threaded charm.🔽This splendour hath come hither bestowed by Agni, glory, fame, strength, vigour, life, and power.

original: idam varcaḥ agninā dattam āgan bhargaḥ yaśaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ vayaḥ balam / trayastriṃśat yāni ca vīryāṇi tāni agniḥ pra dadātu me /🔽varcaḥ ā dhehi me tanvām sahaḥ ojaḥ vayaḥ balam / indriyāya tvā karmaṇe vīryāya prati gṛhṇāmi śata śāradāya //
analyzed: idam varcaḥ agninā dattam āgan bhargaḥ yaśaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ vayaḥ balam   trayastriṃśat yāni ca vīryāṇi tāni agniḥ pra dadātu me  / varcaḥ ā dhehi me tanvām sahaḥ ojaḥ vayaḥ balam    indriyāya tvā karmaṇe vīryāya prati gṛhṇāmi śata śāradāya  /
translated: May Agni grant me all the thirty-three heroic virtues.🔽Bestow thou splendour on my body, strength, vigour, life, and power. For energy, for action, for heroic might, I take thee for a hundred autumns.

original: ūrje tvā balāya tvā ojase sahase tvā / abhibhūyāya tvā rāṣṭra bhṛtyāya pari ūhāmi śata śāradāya //
analyzed: ūrje tvā balāya tvā ojase sahase tvā    abhibhūyāya tvā rāṣṭra bhṛtyāya pari ūhāmi śata śāradāya  /
translated: For strength, for power, for vigour, for endurance, for conquest, for supremacy, for the support of the kingdom, I invest thee for a hundred autumns.

original: ṛtubhyaḥ tvā ārtavebhyaḥ mādbhyaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaḥ / dhātre vidhātre samṛdhe bhūtasya pataye yaje //
analyzed: ṛtubhyaḥ tvā ārtavebhyaḥ mādbhyaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaḥ    dhātre vidhātre samṛdhe bhūtasya pataye yaje  /
translated: For thee, for Seasons, for the Years, for Months, for Days, for Dawns, I pay worship to the Lord of all that hath been born, to Dhātar, Vidhātar, Samṛiddhi.

original: na tam yakṣmāḥ arundhate na enam śapathaḥ aśnute / yam bheṣajasya gulguloḥ surabhiḥ gandhaḥ aśnute /
analyzed: na tam yakṣmāḥ arundhate na enam śapathaḥ aśnute   yam bheṣajasya gulguloḥ surabhiḥ gandhaḥ aśnute  /
translated: Neither consumption nor evil-working spell can reach him whom the fragrant smell of the medicinal Guggulu reaches.

original: viṣvañcaḥ tasmāt yakṣmāḥ mṛgāḥ aśvāḥ iva īrate / yat gulgulu saindhavam yat vā api asi samudriyam /
analyzed: viṣvañcaḥ tasmāt yakṣmāḥ mṛgāḥ aśvāḥ iva īrate   yat gulgulu saindhavam yat vā api asi samudriyam  /
translated: From him consumption and all the Yātudhānas fly away like horses, like deer. Whether thou art the Guggulu of the sea or that which comes from the ocean,

original: ubhayoḥ agrabham nāma asmai ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: ubhayoḥ agrabham nāma asmai ariṣṭatātaye
translated: I have taken both thy names for the sake of this man's welfare and security.

original: aitu devaḥ trāyamāṇaḥ kuṣṭhaḥ himavataḥ pari / takmānam sarvam nāśaya sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ /🔽trīṇi te kuṣṭha nāmāni nadyamāraḥ nadyāḥ ariṣaḥ / nadyāḥ ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat / yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atho divā /
analyzed: aitu devaḥ trāyamāṇaḥ kuṣṭhaḥ himavataḥ pari   takmānam sarvam nāśaya sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ  / trīṇi te kuṣṭha nāmāni nadyamāraḥ nadyāḥ ariṣaḥ    nadyāḥ ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat   yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atha u divā
translated: May the healing plant Kuṣṭha come from the Himavat, and drive away all consumption and all Yātudhānas.🔽Three are thy names, O Kuṣṭha: Nadī-māra, Nadī-ariṣa, Nadī-ariṣa. Let this man be free from disease, for whose sake I proclaim thee in the evening, in the morning, and in the day.

original: jīvalā nāma te mātā jīvantaḥ nāma te pitā / nadyāḥ ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat / yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyam prātar atho divā /
analyzed: jīvalā nāma te mātā jīvantaḥ nāma te pitā    nadyāḥ ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat   yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyam prātar atha u divā  /
translated: Thy mother's name is Jīvalā, thy father's name is Jīvanta. Let this man be free from disease, for whose sake I proclaim thee in the evening, in the morning, and in the day.

original: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām anaḍvān jagatām iva vyāghraḥ śvapadām iva / nadyāḥ ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat / yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyam prātar atho divā /
analyzed: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām anaḍvān jagatām iva vyāghraḥ śvapadām iva    nadyāḥ ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat   yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyam prātar atha u divā  /
translated: Best art thou of the plants, as the ox is the best of those that move in herds, as the tiger is the best of those that prowl on foot. Let not this man be harmed by the river.🔽Whom, O plant, I address in the evening, in the morning, and in the day, thrice to the Sambus, thrice to the Angiras, thrice to the Âdityas, thrice born to the All-Gods, that Kushtha, the universal remedy, stands with Soma.🔽The Asvattha, the seat of the gods, in the third heaven above us, there the watchful essence of immortality, thence was Kushtha born. That Kushtha, the universal remedy, stands with Soma.

original: tris śāmbubhyaḥ aṅgirebhyaḥ tris ādityebhyaḥ pari / tris jātaḥ viśva devebhyaḥ / sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati / aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi / tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam tatas kuṣṭhaḥ ajāyata / sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati / hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi / tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam tatas kuṣṭhaḥ ajāyata / sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sāka
analyzed: tris śāmbubhyaḥ aṅgirebhyaḥ tris ādityebhyaḥ pari   tris jātaḥ viśva devebhyaḥ sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati   aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi   tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam tatas kuṣṭhaḥ ajāyata     sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati   hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi   tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam tatas kuṣṭhaḥ ajāyata          sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam
translated: The golden ship sailed on, bound with gold, in the sky, there the watchful essence of immortality, thence was Kushtha born. That Kushtha, the universal remedy, stands with Soma.

original: śīrṣa śokam tṛtīyakam sa daṃdiḥ yaḥ ca hāyanaḥ / takmānam viśvadhā vīrya adharāñcam parā suva /
analyzed: śīrṣa śokam tṛtīyakam sa daṃdiḥ yaḥ ca hāyanaḥ   takmānam viśvadhā vīrya adharāñcam parā suva  /
translated: The headache, the third day fever, and the fever that comes yearly, drive away consumption in every form, drive it away to a distance.

original: yat me chidram manasaḥ yat ca vācaḥ sarasvatī manyumantam jagāma / viśvaiḥ tat devaiḥ saha saṃvidānaḥ sam dadhātu bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: yat me chidram manasaḥ yat ca vācaḥ sarasvatī manyumantam jagāma    viśvaiḥ tat devaiḥ saha saṃvidānaḥ sam dadhātu bṛhaspatiḥ  /
translated: Whatever defect there is in my mind or in my speech, Sarasvatî hath gone to the wrathful one. May he, in agreement with all the gods, put it together again, Brihaspati.

original: mā naḥ āpaḥ medhām mā brahma pra mathiṣṭana / suṣyadā yūyam syandadhvam upahūtaḥ aham sumedhāḥ varcasvī /
analyzed: mā naḥ āpaḥ medhām mā brahma pra mathiṣṭana   suṣyadā yūyam syandadhvam upahūtaḥ aham sumedhāḥ varcasvī  /
translated: Do not destroy our wisdom, O waters, nor our prayer. Flowing with good gifts, I am invoked, wise, radiant.

original: mā naḥ medhām mā naḥ dīkṣām mā naḥ hiṃsiṣṭam yat tapaḥ / śivāḥ naḥ śam santu āyuṣe śivāḥ bhavantu mātaraḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ medhām mā naḥ dīkṣām mā naḥ hiṃsiṣṭam yat tapaḥ   śivāḥ naḥ śam santu āyuṣe śivāḥ bhavantu mātaraḥ  /
translated: Do not injure our wisdom, do not injure our consecration, do not injure our penance. Be gracious to us, be gracious, O mothers, for our life.

original: yā naḥ pīparat aśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamaḥ tiras / tām asme rāsatām iṣam /
analyzed: yā naḥ pīparat aśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamaḥ tiras   tām asme rāsatām iṣam  /
translated: Which, O ye Aṣvins, hath sustained us, shining through the darkness, bestow ye on us that food.🔽The Rishis, seeking bliss, who first sat down to penance and consecration, finding the heaven,

original: bhadram ichantaḥ ṛṣayaḥ svar vidaḥ tapaḥ dīkṣām upaniṣeduḥ agre / tatas rāṣṭram balam ojaḥ ca jātam tat asmai devāḥ upasaṃnamantu //
analyzed: bhadram ichantaḥ ṛṣayaḥ svar vidaḥ tapaḥ dīkṣām upaniṣeduḥ agre   tatas rāṣṭram balam ojaḥ ca jātam tat asmai devāḥ upasaṃnamantu  /
translated: Thence was born the kingdom, the strength, and the vigour. To him let the gods bring that.

original: brahma hotā brahma yajñāḥ brahmaṇā svaravaḥ mitāḥ / adhvaryuḥ brahmaṇaḥ jātaḥ brahmaṇaḥ antarhitam haviḥ /
analyzed: brahma hotā brahma yajñāḥ brahmaṇā svaravaḥ mitāḥ   adhvaryuḥ brahmaṇaḥ jātaḥ brahmaṇaḥ antarhitam haviḥ  /
translated: Brahman is the Hotar, Brahman are the sacrifices, Brahman are the Svaras measured by Brahman. The Adhvaryu is born of Brahman, the oblation is hidden in Brahman.

original: brahma srucaḥ ghṛtavatīḥ brahmaṇā vediḥ uddhitā / brahma yajñasya tattvam ca ṛtvijaḥ ye haviṣkṛtaḥ / śamitāya svāhā /🔽aṃhaḥ muce pra bhare manīṣām ā sutrāvṇe sumatim āvṛṇānaḥ / imam indra prati havyam gṛbhāya satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ /
analyzed: brahma srucaḥ ghṛtavatīḥ brahmaṇā vediḥ uddhitā   brahma yajñasya tattvam ca ṛtvijaḥ ye haviṣkṛtaḥ   śamitāya svāhā  / aṃhaḥ muce pra bhare manīṣām ā sutrāvṇe sumatim āvṛṇānaḥ   imam indra prati havyam gṛbhāya satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ  /
translated: The Brahmanas are the ladles, filled with ghee; by the Brahmanas the altar is raised. The Brahmanas are the essence of the sacrifice, and the priests who offer the oblations. To the Samitri Svâhâ!🔽To him who frees from sin I offer my thought, bestowing favour on the good priest. Accept this offering, O Indra. Fulfilled be the sacrificer's desires.

original: aṃhaḥ mucam vrṣabham yajñiyānām virājantam prathamam adhvarāṇam / apām napātam aśvinā huve dhiyaḥ indriyeṇa te indriyam dattam ojaḥ //
analyzed: aṃhaḥ mucam vrṣabham yajñiyānām virājantam prathamam adhvarāṇam    apām napātam aśvinā huve dhiyaḥ indriyeṇa te indriyam dattam ojaḥ  /
translated: To him who frees from sin, the bull of sacrifices, who shines forth first of all the rites, to the son of the waters, to the Asvins, I call my thoughts. By thy power, O Indra, is given me power and strength.

original: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / agniḥ mā tatra nayatu agniḥ medhā dadhātu me / agnaye svāhā /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha   agniḥ mā tatra nayatu agniḥ medhā dadhātu me   agnaye svāhā  /
translated: Where the knowers of Brahma go with initiation and austerity, may Agni lead me there, may Agni bestow wisdom on me. To Agni Svâhâ!

original: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / vāyuḥ mā tatra nayatu vāyuḥ praṇān dadhātu me vāyave svāhā /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha    vāyuḥ mā tatra nayatu vāyuḥ praṇān dadhātu me vāyave svāhā  /
translated: Where the knowers of Brahma go with initiation and austerity, may Vâyu lead me there, may Vâyu bestow the vital airs on me. To Vâyu Svâhâ!

original: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / sūryaḥ mā tatra nayatu cakṣuḥ sūryaḥ dadhātu me / sūryāya svāhā /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha   sūryaḥ mā tatra nayatu cakṣuḥ sūryaḥ dadhātu me   sūryāya svāhā  /
translated: Where the knowers of Brahma go with initiation and austerity, may Sûrya lead me there, may Sûrya bestow the eye on me. To Sûrya Svâhâ!

original: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / candraḥ mā tatra nayatu manaḥ candraḥ dadhātu me / candrāya svāhā /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha   candraḥ mā tatra nayatu manaḥ candraḥ dadhātu me
translated: Where those who know the Brahman go with initiation and austerity, may the Moon lead me there, may the Moon bestow on me. To the Moon, hail!

original: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / somaḥ mā tatra nayatu payaḥ somaḥ dadhātu me / somāya svāhā /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha   somaḥ mā tatra nayatu payaḥ somaḥ dadhātu me    somāya svāhā  /
translated: Where those who know the Brahman go with initiation and austerity, may Soma lead me there, may Soma bestow on me. To Soma, hail!

original: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / indraḥ mā tatra nayatu balam indraḥ dadhātu me / indrāya svāhā /🔽yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / āpaḥ mā tatra nayatu amṛtam mā upa tiṣṭhatu / adbhyaḥ svāhā /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha   indraḥ mā tatra nayatu balam indraḥ dadhātu me    indrāya svāhā  yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha   āpaḥ mā tatra nayatu amṛtam mā upa tiṣṭhatu   adbhyaḥ svāhā
translated: Where those who know the Brahman go with initiation and austerity, may Indra lead me there, may Indra bestow on me. To Indra, hail!🔽Where those who know the Brahman go with initiation and austerity, may the Waters lead me there, may immortality stand by me. To the Waters, hail!

original: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha / brahmā mā tatra nayatu brahmā brahma dadhātu me / brahmaṇe svāhā /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha   brahmā mā tatra nayatu brahmā brahma dadhātu me
translated: Where those who know the Brahman go with initiation and austerity, may Brahman lead me there, may Brahman bestow Brahman on me. To Brahman, hail!

original: āyuṣaḥ asi prataraṇam vipram bheṣajam ucyase / tat āñjana tvam śaṃtāte śam āpaḥ abhayam kṛtam /
analyzed: āyuṣaḥ asi prataraṇam vipram bheṣajam ucyase   tat āñjana tvam śaṃtāte śam āpaḥ abhayam kṛtam  /
translated: Thou art the life's preserver, thou art called the physician of the Brāhman. Be thou that ointment to me, be ye waters a blessing and a protection.

original: yaḥ harimā jāyānyaḥ aṅgabhedaḥ viṣalpakaḥ / sarvam te yakṣmam aṅgebhyaḥ bahis niḥ hantu āñjanam //
analyzed: yaḥ harimā jāyānyaḥ aṅgabhedaḥ viṣalpakaḥ    sarvam te yakṣmam aṅgebhyaḥ bahis niḥ hantu āñjanam  /
translated: From all thy limbs, O ointment, drive thou out consumption far away.🔽The ointment that is born on earth, the blessed life-restorer of man,

original: āñjanam pṛthivyām jātam bhadram puruṣa jīvanam / kṛṇotu apramāyukam ratha jūtim anāgasam /
analyzed: āñjanam pṛthivyām jātam bhadram puruṣa jīvanam   kṛṇotu apramāyukam ratha jūtim anāgasam  /
translated: Let it make me live long, free from disease, with the speed of a car, and guiltless of sin.

original: prāṇa prāṇam trāyasva asave mṛḍa / nirṛte nirṛtyā naḥ pāśebhyaḥ muñca /
analyzed: prāṇa prāṇam trāyasva asave mṛḍa nirṛte nirṛtyāḥ naḥ pāśebhyaḥ muñca  /
translated: O Breath, save thou my breath, be gracious to my in-breathing. O Nirriti, deliver us from the noose of Nirriti.

original: sindhoḥ garbhaḥ asi vidyutām puṣpam / vātaḥ prāṇaḥ sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ divaḥ payaḥ /
analyzed: sindhoḥ garbhaḥ asi vidyutām puṣpam   vātaḥ prāṇaḥ sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ divaḥ payaḥ  /
translated: Thou art the germ of the river, the flower of the lightnings. The wind is the breath, the sun the eye, the milk of heaven.

original: devāñjana traikakuda pari mā pāhi viśvatas / na tvā taranti oṣadhayaḥ bāhyāḥ parvatīyāḥ uta /
analyzed: devāñjana traikakuda pari mā pāhi viśvatas    na tvā taranti oṣadhayaḥ bāhyāḥ parvatīyāḥ uta
translated: O ointment of the gods, O ointment of the three peaks, guard me on every side. Neither the plants of the field nor those of the mountains prevail against thee.

original: vi idam madhyam avāsṛpat rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ / amīvāḥ sarvāḥ cātayat nāśayat abhibhāḥ itas /🔽bahu idam rājan varuṇa anṛtam āha pūruṣaḥ / tasmāt sahasra vīrya muñca naḥ pari aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: vi idam madhyam avāsṛpat rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ   amīvāḥ sarvāḥ cātayat nāśayat abhibhāḥ itas  / bahu idam rājan varuṇa anṛtam āha pūruṣaḥ   tasmāt sahasra vīrya muñca naḥ pari aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: This hath crept into the midst, the Rakshas-slayer, the disease-chaser. He hath chased away all diseases, hath driven away the evil spirits from hence.🔽Much, O king Varuna, is the untruth that man speaketh. From that, O thou of a thousand powers, deliver us, and save us from woe.

original: yat āpaḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti yat ūcima / tasmāt sahasra vīrya muñca naḥ pari aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yat āpaḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti yat ūcima   tasmāt sahasra vīrya muñca naḥ pari aṃhasaḥ  /
translated: If we have said, O Varuna, 'The waters are not to be slain,' from that, O thou of a thousand powers, deliver us, and save us from woe.

original: mitraḥ ca tvā varuṇaḥ ca anupreyatuḥ āñjana / tau tvā anugatya dūram bhogāya punar ohatuḥ //
analyzed: mitraḥ ca tvā varuṇaḥ ca anupreyatuḥ āñjana   tau tvā anugatya dūram bhogāya punar ohatuḥ  /
translated: Let Mitra and Varuna, the ointment, follow thee. Having followed thee afar, let them bring thee back again for thy enjoyment.

original: ṛṇāt ṛṇam iva sam naya kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛtaḥ gṛham / cakṣuḥ mantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇāñjana /
analyzed: ṛṇāt ṛṇam iva sam naya kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛtaḥ gṛham   cakṣuḥ mantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇāñjana  /
translated: As from a debt one pays a debt, so lead thou the witchcraft back to the house of the witch. O ointment, crush the eyes of him who hateth prayer, crush his ribs.

original: yat asmāsu duṣvapnyam yat goṣu yat ca naḥ gṛhe / anāmagaḥ tam ca durhārdaḥ priyaḥ prati muñcatām /🔽apām ūrjaḥ ojasaḥ vāvṛdhānam agneḥ jātam adhi jātavedasaḥ / catur vīram parvatīyam yat āñjanam diśaḥ pradiśaḥ karat id śivāḥ te /
analyzed: yat asmāsu duṣvapnyam yat goṣu yat ca naḥ gṛhe   anāmagaḥ tam ca durhārdaḥ priyaḥ prati muñcatām  / apām ūrjaḥ ojasaḥ vāvṛdhānam agneḥ jātam adhi jātavedasaḥ    catur vīram parvatīyam yat āñjanam diśaḥ pradiśaḥ karat id śivāḥ te  /
translated: The evil dream that is in us, that is in our cattle, that is in our house, let the ointment, the friend, loose it from us, and let it fasten on him who hateth us.🔽The ointment that hath grown in strength from the strength of the waters and of Agni, that is born from the fire, the all-knower, that is fourfold, of the mountains, may it make all the regions and the intermediate regions propitious to thee.

original: catur vīram badhyate āñjanam te sarvāḥ diśaḥ abhayāḥ te bhavantu / dhruvaḥ tiṣṭhāsi savitā iva cāryaḥ imāḥ viśaḥ abhi harantu te balim /
analyzed: catur vīram badhyate āñjanam te sarvāḥ diśaḥ abhayāḥ te bhavantu   dhruvaḥ tiṣṭhāsi savitā iva cāryaḥ imāḥ viśaḥ abhi harantu te balim  /
translated: The ointment is bound on thee fourfold. Let all the regions be free from danger for thee. Firmly standest thou, like Savitar the God. Let all these people bring thee tribute.

original: ākṣva ekam maṇim ekam krṇuṣva snāhi ekena piba ekam eṣām / catur vīram nairṛtebhyaḥ caturbhyaḥ grāhyā bandhebhyaḥ pari pātu asmān /
analyzed: ākṣva ekam maṇim ekam krṇuṣva snāhi ekena piba ekam eṣām    catur vīram nairṛtebhyaḥ caturbhyaḥ grāhyā bandhebhyaḥ pari pātu asmān  /
translated: Make one of the gems thine own, make one of them thine own. Wash with one, drink with one of them. Let the fourfold ointment protect us from the fourfold Nirrti, from the fourfold bonds of death.

original: agniḥ mā agninā avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase / tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā /
analyzed: agniḥ mā agninā avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā
translated: May Agni protect me with Agni, for expiration, for inspiration, for life, for vigour, for strength, for splendour, for well-being, for prosperity, All-hail!

original: indraḥ mā indriyeṇa avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase / tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā /
analyzed: indraḥ mā indriyeṇa avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā  /
translated: May Indra protect me with power, for expiration, for inspiration, for life, for vigour, for strength, for splendour, for well-being, for prosperity, All-hail!

original: somaḥ mā saumyena avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase / tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā /
analyzed: somaḥ mā saumyena avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā  /
translated: May Soma protect me with the Soma, for expiration, for inspiration, for life, for vigour, for strength, for splendour, for well-being, for prosperity, All-hail!

original: bhagaḥ ma bhagena avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase / tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā /
analyzed: bhagaḥ ma bhagena avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā
translated: May Bhaga protect me with good fortune, for expiration, for inspiration, for life, for vigour, for strength, for splendour, for well-being, for prosperity, All-hail!

original: marutaḥ mā gaṇaiḥ avantu prāṇāya apāna āyuṣe varcase ojase tejase / svastaye subhūtaye svāhā /
analyzed: marutaḥ mā gaṇaiḥ avantu prāṇāya apāna āyuṣe varcase ojase tejase
translated: May the Maruts protect me with their bands, for expiration, for inspiration, for life, for vigour, for strength, for splendour, for well-being, for prosperity, All-hail!

original: prajāpatiḥ tvā badhnāt prathamam a stṛtam vīryāya kam / tat te badhnāmi āyuṣe varcase ojase ca balāya ca astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu //
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ tvā badhnāt prathamam a stṛtam vīryāya kam   tat te badhnāmi āyuṣe varcase ojase ca balāya ca astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu  /
translated: Prajapati first bound thee on for strength, for the uninjured (body). That I bind on thee for life, for vigour, for strength, and for power. Let the uninjured (body) protect thee.

original: ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhatu rakṣan apramādam astṛta imam mā tvā dabhan paṇayaḥ yātudhānāḥ / indraḥ iva dasyūn ava dhūnuṣva pṛtanyataḥ sarvām chatrūn vi sahasva astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhatu rakṣan apramādam astṛta imam mā tvā dabhan paṇayaḥ yātudhānāḥ   indraḥ iva dasyūn ava dhūnuṣva pṛtanyataḥ sarvām śatrūn vi sahasva astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu  /
translated: Let it stand erect, protecting thee, O Amulet, let not the demons, the Pāṇis, injure thee. As Indra shook the Dasyus, so shake thou the foe, overcome all enemies, O Amulet, that hast no rent. Let the Amulet protect thee well.

original: śatam ca na praharantaḥ nighnantaḥ na tastire / tasmin indraḥ pari adatta cakṣuḥ prāṇam atho balam a stṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: śatam ca na praharantaḥ nighnantaḥ na tastire   tasmin indraḥ pari adatta cakṣuḥ prāṇam atho balam a stṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu  /
translated: A hundred times they have not struck thee, a thousand times they have not pierced thee. In thee Indra hath placed eye, breath, and strength. Let the Amulet protect thee well.

original: indrasya tvā varmaṇā pari dhāpayāmaḥ yaḥ devānām adhirājaḥ babhūva / punar tvā devāḥ pra nayantu sarve a stṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: indrasya tvā varmaṇā pari dhāpayāmaḥ yaḥ devānām adhirājaḥ babhūva   punar tvā devāḥ pra nayantu sarve a stṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu  /
translated: We clothe thee with the armour of Indra, who hath become the overlord of the gods. Let all the gods again lead thee back. Let the Amulet protect thee well.

original: asmin maṇau eka śatam vīryāṇi sahasram prāṇāḥ asmin astṛte / vyāghraḥ śatrūn abhi tiṣṭha sarvān yaḥ tvā pṛtanyāt adharaḥ saḥ astu astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: asmin maṇau eka śatam vīryāṇi sahasram prāṇāḥ asmin astṛte    vyāghraḥ śatrūn abhi tiṣṭha sarvān yaḥ tvā pṛtanyāt adharaḥ saḥ astu astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu  /
translated: In this Amulet are a hundred powers, a thousand breaths are in this Amulet. As a tiger overcometh all the foes, so overcome all the foes. Let him who would fight against thee be beneath thee. Let the Amulet protect thee well.

original: ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān sahasra prāṇaḥ śata yoniḥ vayodhāḥ / śambhūḥ ca mayobhūḥ ca ūrjasvān ca payasvān ca āstṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān sahasra prāṇaḥ śata yoniḥ vayodhāḥ    śambhūḥ ca mayobhūḥ ca ūrjasvān ca payasvān ca āstṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu  /
translated: Beneficial, and full of joy, full of strength, and full of milk, may the spread protect thee.🔽As thou art the best, the most excellent, the irrepressible, the conqueror of foes,

original: yathā tvam uttaraḥ asaḥ asapatnaḥ sapatna hā / sajātānām asat vaśī tathā tvā savitā karat astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: yathā tvam uttaraḥ asaḥ asapatnaḥ sapatna hā    sajātānām asat vaśī tathā tvā savitā karat astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: The lord of kinsmen, even so may Savitar make thee. The spread protect thee.

original: ā rātri pārthivam rajaḥ pituḥ aprāyi dhāmabhiḥ / divaḥ sadāṃsi bṛhatī vi tiṣṭhase ā tveṣam vartate tamaḥ /
analyzed: ā rātri pārthivam rajaḥ pituḥ aprāyi dhāmabhiḥ    divaḥ sadāṃsi bṛhatī vi tiṣṭhase ā tveṣam vartate tamaḥ  /
translated: O Night, thou hast come with thy rays to the earthly region of thy father. Thou, the great one, dost extend the seats of heaven. The dark comes upon thee.

original: na yasyāḥ pāram dadṛśe na yoyuvat viśvam asyām ni viśate yat ejati / ariṣṭāsaḥ te urvi tamasvati rātri pāram aśīmahi bhadre pāram aśīmahi //
analyzed: na yasyāḥ pāram dadṛśe na yoyuvat viśvam asyām ni viśate yat ejati   ariṣṭāsaḥ te urvi tamasvati rātri pāram aśīmahi bhadre pāram aśīmahi  /
translated: Of whom no end is seen, nor one to yoke with, all that moves rests upon her. O Earth, unharmed by thee in the darkness, may we reach the end of the night. May we reach the happy end.🔽Those, O Night, who are thy human eyes, thy beholders, ninety-nine,

original: ye te rātri nṛ cakṣasaḥ draṣṭāraḥ navatiḥ nava / aśītiḥ santi aṣṭa uta u te sapta saptatiḥ /
analyzed: ye te rātri nṛ cakṣasaḥ draṣṭāraḥ navatiḥ nava     santi aṣṭa uta u te sapta saptatiḥ  /
translated: Eighty, and also eight, seven and seventy are they to thee.🔽Sixty and six, O prosperous one, fifty for happiness,

original: ṣaṣṭiḥ ca ṣaṭ ca revati pañcāśat pañca sumnayi / catvāraḥ catvāriṃśat ca trayaḥ triṃśat ca vājini //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ ca ṣaṭ ca revati pañcāśat pañca sumnayi    catvāraḥ catvāriṃśat ca trayaḥ triṃśat ca vājini  /
translated: Four and forty, three and thirty, O thou rich in spoil.

original: dvau ca te viṃśatiḥ ca te rātri ekādaśa avamāḥ / tebhiḥ naḥ adya pāyubhiḥ nu pāhi duhitar divaḥ /🔽rakṣā mākir naḥ agha śaṃsaḥ īśata mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ īśata / mā naḥ adya gavām stenaḥ māvīnām vṛkaḥ īśata /
analyzed: dvau ca te viṃśatiḥ ca te rātri ekādaśa avamāḥ    tebhiḥ naḥ adya pāyubhiḥ nu pāhi duhitar divaḥ  / rakṣā mākir naḥ agha śaṃsaḥ īśata mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ īśata   mā naḥ adya gavām stenaḥ māvīnām vṛkaḥ īśata  /
translated: Two and twenty are thine nights, O youngest Daughter of the Sky: With these thy guards this day protect us, O thou Goddess.🔽Let not the evil-wisher rule over us: let not the wicked man rule over us. Let not the thief of cattle rule over our kine, nor the wolf over our sheep.🔽

original: mā aśvānām bhadre taskaraḥ mā nṛṇām yātudhānyaḥ / paramebhiḥ pathibhiḥ stenaḥ dhāvatu taskaraḥ / pareṇa datvatī rajjuḥ pareṇa aghāyuḥ arṣatu //🔽adha rātri tṛṣṭa dhūmam a śīrṣāṇam ahim kṛṇu / hanū vṛkasya jambhayā stenam drupade jahi //🔽tvayi rātri vasāmasi svapiṣyāmasi jāgṛhi / gobhyaḥ naḥ śarma yaccha aśvebhyaḥ puruṣebhyaḥ /🔽atha u yāni ca yasmā ha yāni ca antar parīṇahi / tāni te pari dadmasi //🔽rātri mātar uṣase naḥ pari dehi / uṣāḥ naḥ ahne pari dadātu ahar tubhyam vibhāvari //
analyzed: mā aśvānām bhadre taskaraḥ mā nṛṇām yātudhānyaḥ    paramebhiḥ pathibhiḥ stenaḥ dhāvatu taskaraḥ   pareṇa datvatī rajjuḥ pareṇa aghāyuḥ arṣatu  /🔽adha rātri tṛṣṭa dhūmam a śīrṣāṇam ahim kṛṇu   hanū vṛkasya jambhayā stenam drupade jahi  /🔽tvayi rātri vasāmasi svapiṣyāmasi jāgṛhi   gobhyaḥ naḥ śarma yaccha aśvebhyaḥ puruṣebhyaḥ 🔽atha u yāni ca yasmai ha yāni ca antar parīṇahi    tāni te pari dadmasi  /🔽rātri mātar uṣase naḥ pari dehi   uṣāḥ naḥ ahne pari dadātu ahar tubhyam vibhāvari  /

original: yat kim ca idam patayati yat kim ca idam sarīsṛpam / yat kim ca parvata ayāsa tvam tasmāt tvam rātri pāhi naḥ /
analyzed: yat kim ca idam patayati yat kim ca idam sarīsṛpam   yat kim ca parvata ayāsa tvam tasmāt tvam rātri pāhi naḥ  /
translated: Whatever moves upon the earth, whatever creeps upon the ground, Whatever, O thou Daughter of the Hills, is in the mountains, from all of these, O Night, protect us.

original: sā paścāt pāhi sā puras sā uttarāt adharāt uta / gopāya naḥ vibhāvari stotāraḥ te iha smasi //
analyzed: sā paścāt pāhi sā puras sā uttarāt adharāt uta  / gopāya naḥ vibhāvari stotāraḥ te iha smasi  /
translated: Protect us from behind, protect us from before, protect us from above, protect us from below. O thou who givest light, preserve us. We are thy worshippers here.

original: ye rātrim anutiṣṭhanti ye ca bhūteṣu jāgrati / paśūn ye sarvān rakṣanti te naḥ ātmasu jāgrati te naḥ paśuṣu jāgrati //
analyzed: ye rātrim anutiṣṭhanti ye ca bhūteṣu jāgrati   paśūn ye sarvān rakṣanti te naḥ ātmasu jāgrati te naḥ paśuṣu jāgrati  /
translated: They who attend upon the Night, they who are watchful over all that lives, They who protect all cattle, they are watchful over our own selves. They are watchful over our cattle.

original: veda vai rātri te nāma ghṛtācī nāma vai asi / tām tvām bharadvājaḥ veda sā naḥ vitte adhi jāgrati //🔽iṣirā yoṣā yuvatiḥ damūnā rātrī devasya savituḥ bhagasya / aśva kṣabhā su havā saṃbhṛta śrīḥ ā paprau dyāvāpṛthivī mahitvā /
analyzed: veda vai rātri te nāma ghṛtācī nāma vai asi   tām tvām bharadvājaḥ veda sā naḥ vitte adhi jāgrati  / iṣirā yoṣā yuvatiḥ damūnā rātrī devasya savituḥ bhagasya   aśva kṣabhā su havā saṃbhṛta śrīḥ ā paprau dyāvāpṛthivī mahitvā  /
translated: I know thy name, O Night, thou art called Ghrtachi. Bharadvaja knows thee. Watch thou over our wealth.🔽The active, youthful, loving, hospitable Night, the grace of God Savitar and of Bhaga, The swift-moving, swift-hearing Night, whose glory is gathered, hath with her greatness filled the heaven and earth.

original: ati viśvāni aruhat gambhiraḥ varṣiṣṭham aruhanta śraviṣṭhāḥ / uśatī rātri anu sā bhadrā abhi tiṣṭhate mitraḥ iva svadhābhiḥ //
analyzed: ati viśvāni aruhat gambhiraḥ varṣiṣṭham aruhanta śraviṣṭhāḥ   uśatī rātri anu sā bhadrā abhi tiṣṭhate mitraḥ iva svadhābhiḥ  /
translated: She hath ascended above all the deeps. The most lofty have ascended the highest. The loving Night, auspicious, with her own powers, standeth over us as Mitra standeth.

original: varye vande subhage sujāte ājagan rātri sumanāḥ iha syām / asmān trāyasva naryāṇi jātāḥ atho yāni gavyāni puṣṭyā /
analyzed: varye vande subhage sujāte ājagan rātri sumanāḥ iha syām    asmān trāyasva naryāṇi jātāḥ atho yāni gavyāni puṣṭyā  /
translated: I praise the most excellent one, the fortunate one, the well-born one. O Night, may I be well-disposed here. Protect us, the men who are born, and also those things that are to be nourished through cattle.

original: siṃhasya rātri uśatī pīṃṣasya vyāghrasya dvīpinaḥ varcaḥ ā dade / aśvasya bradhnam puruṣasya māyum puru rūpāṇi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī /
analyzed: siṃhasya rātri uśatī pīṃṣasya vyāghrasya dvīpinaḥ varcaḥ ā dade   aśvasya bradhnam puruṣasya māyum puru rūpāṇi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī  /
translated: I take the splendor of the lion, the eager one, the tiger, the leopard, the panther. I take the swiftness of the horse, the vitality of man. You create many forms, shining one.

original: śivām rātrim anusūryam ca himasya mātā su havā naḥ astu / asya stomasya subhage ni bodha yena tvā vande viśvāsu dikṣu /
analyzed: śivām rātrim anusūryam ca himasya mātā su havā naḥ astu    asya stomasya subhage ni bodha yena tvā vande viśvāsu dikṣu  /
translated: May the auspicious night and the sunless day be an easy passage for us, and may the mother of snow be very approachable for us. O fortunate one, be aware of this praise, by which I worship you in all the directions.

original: stomasya naḥ vibhāvari rātri rājā iva joṣase / asāma sarva vīrāḥ bhavāma sarva vedasaḥ vyuchantīḥ anūṣasaḥ /
analyzed: stomasya naḥ vibhāvari rātri rājā iva joṣase    asāma sarva vīrāḥ bhavāma sarva vedasaḥ vyuchantīḥ anūṣasaḥ  /
translated: O Night, the spreader of light, you accept our praise like a king. May we be possessed of all heroes and all wealth. The rising dawns.

original: śamyā ha nāma dadhiṣe mama dipsanti ye dhanā / rātrīhi tān asutapāḥ yaḥ stenaḥ na vidyate yat punar na vidyate /
analyzed: śamyā ha nāma dadhiṣe mama dipsanti ye dhanā   rātrīhi tān asutapāḥ yaḥ stenaḥ na vidyate yat punar na vidyate  /
translated: You are called Shamya, O Night, because you give me wealth that is coveted. O Night, who has not drunk Soma, protect those who are thieves and cannot be found, and those who are again not to be found.

original: bhadrā asi rātri camasaḥ na viṣṭaḥ viṣvaṅ go rūpam yuvatiḥ bibharṣi / cakṣuṣmatī me uśatī vapūmṣi prati tvam divyā na kṣām amukthāḥ /🔽yaḥ adya stenaḥ āyati aghāyuḥ martyaḥ ripuḥ / rātrī tasya pratītya pra grīvāḥ pra śiraḥ hanat //🔽pra pādau na yathāyati pra hastau na yathā āśiṣat / yaḥ malimluḥ upāyati sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati / apāyati su apāyati śuṣke sthāṇau apāyati //🔽adha rātri tṛṣṭa dhūmam a śīrṣāṇam ahim kṛṇu / akṣau vṛkasya niḥ jahyāḥ tena tam drupade jahi //🔽ye te rātri anaḍvāhaḥ tīkṣṇa śṛṅgāḥ su āśavaḥ / tebhiḥ naḥ adya pārayāti durgāṇi viśvahā /
analyzed: bhadrā asi rātri camasaḥ na viṣṭaḥ viṣvaṅ go rūpam yuvatiḥ bibharṣi    cakṣuṣmatī me uśatī vapūmṣi prati tvam divyā na kṣām amukthāḥ  / yaḥ adya stenaḥ āyati aghāyuḥ martyaḥ ripuḥ   rātrī tasya pratītya pra grīvāḥ pra śiraḥ hanat  / pra pādau na yathā āyati pra hastau na yathā āśiṣat    yaḥ malimluḥ upāyati sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati   apāyati su apāyati śuṣke sthāṇau apāyati  / adha rātri tṛṣṭa dhūmam a śīrṣāṇam ahim kṛṇu   akṣau vṛkasya niḥ jahyāḥ tena tam drupade jahi  / ye te rātri anaḍvāhaḥ tīkṣṇa śṛṅgāḥ su āśavaḥ   tebhiḥ naḥ adya pārayāti durgāṇi viśvahā  /
translated: The mortal foe, the thief who cometh nigh this night, O Goddess, with evil thoughts, — thou, O Night, shalt crush his neck and cut off his head.

original: rātrim rātrim ariṣyantaḥ tarema tanvā vayam / gambhīram aplavāḥ iva na tareyuḥ arātayaḥ /
analyzed: rātrim rātrim ariṣyantaḥ tarema tanvā vayam   gambhīram aplavāḥ iva na tareyuḥ arātayaḥ  /
translated: Cut off his feet that he may not depart, cut off his hands that he may not strike again.
