original: yathā śāmyākaḥ prapatan apavān na anuvidyate / eva rātri pra pātaya yaḥ asmām abhyaghāyati //
analyzed: yathā śāmyākaḥ prapatan apavān na anuvidyate   / eva rātri pra pātaya yaḥ asmām abhyaghāyati  /
translated: So, O Night, fall thou upon the man who threatens us with evil.🔽Drive away the thief, the robber of the cow, the pilferer,

original: apa stenam vāsayaḥ go ajam uta taskaram / atha u yaḥ arvataḥ śiraḥ abhidhāya ninīṣati //
analyzed: apa stenam vāsayaḥ go ajam uta taskaram    atha u yaḥ arvataḥ śiraḥ abhidhāya ninīṣati  /
translated: And him who, having laid his hand upon the head of the horse, would lead it off.🔽O Night, auspicious Night, when thou distributest to-day the wealth of men,

original: yat adya rātri subhage vibhajanti ayaḥ vasu / yat etat asmān bhojaya yathā id anyān upāyasi //
analyzed: yat adya rātri subhage vibhajanti ayaḥ vasu   yat etat asmān bhojaya yathā id anyān upāyasi  /
translated: Give us a share of it, that we may feast, as thou goest to others.🔽To Ushas, O Night, deliver us all, free from guilt.

original: uṣase naḥ pari dehi sarvān rātri anāgasaḥ / uṣāḥ naḥ ahne ā bhajāt ahar tubhyam vibhāvari //
analyzed: uṣase naḥ pari dehi sarvān rātri anāgasaḥ   uṣāḥ naḥ ahne ā bhajāt ahar tubhyam vibhāvari  /
translated: May Ushas allot to us in the day. To thee, O Night, be glory.

original: ayutaḥ aham ayutaḥ me ātmā ayutam me cakṣuḥ ayutam me śrotram / ayutaḥ me prāṇaḥ ayutaḥ me apānaḥ ayutaḥ me vyānaḥ ayutaḥ aham sarvaḥ /
analyzed: ayutaḥ aham ayutaḥ me ātmā ayutam me cakṣuḥ ayutam me śrotram   ayutaḥ me prāṇaḥ ayutaḥ me apānaḥ ayutaḥ me vyānaḥ ayutaḥ aham sarvaḥ  /
translated: I am ten thousand, my soul is ten thousand, my eye is ten thousand, my ear is ten thousand. My in-breathing is ten thousand, my out-breathing is ten thousand, my through-breathing is ten thousand, I am all ten thousand.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave aśvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām prasūtaḥ ā rabhe //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave aśvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām prasūtaḥ ā rabhe
translated: Impelled by the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee.

original: kāmaḥ tat agre sam avartata manasaḥ retaḥ prathamam yat āsīt / sa kāma kāmena bṛhatā sayonī rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi //
analyzed: kāmaḥ tat agre sam avartata manasaḥ retaḥ prathamam yat āsīt    sa kāma kāmena bṛhatā sayonī rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi  /
translated: Desire was in the beginning spread out, the seed of thought, which the first existent was. Thou, Desire, with mighty longing for the prize, born of the same womb, vouchsafe increase of wealth to him who worships.

original: tvam kāma sahasā asi pratiṣṭhitaḥ vibhuḥ vibhāvā sakhaḥ ā sakhīyate / tvam ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sasahiḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ yajamānāya dhehi //
analyzed: tvam kāma sahasā asi pratiṣṭhitaḥ vibhuḥ vibhāvā sakhaḥ ā sakhīyate    tvam ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sasahiḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ yajamānāya dhehi  /
translated: Thou, Desire, art the established power of might, the all-pervading, the shining, the friend who is friendly to the friend. Thou art the mighty victor in battles. Give strength and vigour to the sacrificer.🔽To him who longs from far away, who offers gifts, who never fails,

original: dūrāt cakamānāya pratipāṇāya akṣaye / ā asmai aśṛṇvan āśāḥ kāmena ajanayan svar /
analyzed: dūrāt cakamānāya pratipāṇāya akṣaye   ā asmai aśṛṇvan āśāḥ kāmena ajanayan svar  /
translated: The regions have listened, and by desire have brought him bliss.🔽Desire has come to me, Desire from the heart, from the heart's centre.

original: kāmena mā kāmaḥ āgan hṛdayāt dhṛdayam pari / yat amīṣām adaḥ manaḥ tat aitu upa mām iha /
analyzed: kāmena mā kāmaḥ āgan hṛdayāt dhṛdayam pari   yat amīṣām adaḥ manaḥ tat aitu upa mām iha  /
translated: The mind of these that is within, let that come nigh unto me here.🔽Since we, O Desire, desirous of our wish, have made this offering to thee,

original: yat kāma kāmayamānāḥ idam kṛṇmasi te haviḥ / tat naḥ sarvam sam ṛdhyatām atha etasya haviṣaḥ vīhi svāhā /
analyzed: yat kāma kāmayamānāḥ idam kṛṇmasi te haviḥ   tat naḥ sarvam sam ṛdhyatām atha etasya haviṣaḥ vīhi svāhā  /
translated: may all that be fulfilled for us. Then taste this oblation, Hail!

original: kālaḥ aśvaḥ vahati sapta raśmiḥ sahasra akṣaḥ ajaraḥ bhūri retāḥ / tam ā rohanti kavayaḥ vipaścitaḥ tasya cakrā bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: kālaḥ aśvaḥ vahati sapta raśmiḥ sahasra akṣaḥ ajaraḥ bhūri retāḥ   tam ā rohanti kavayaḥ vipaścitaḥ tasya cakrā bhuvanāni viśvā  /
translated: The horse Time, with seven reins, a thousand eyes, undecaying, rich in seed, bears (the sun). The sages, the wise, ascend him. His wheels are all the worlds.

original: sapta cakrān vahati kālaḥ eṣa sapta asya nābhīḥ amṛtam nu akṣaḥ / saḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni añjat kālaḥ saḥ īyate prathamaḥ nu devaḥ /
analyzed: sapta cakrān vahati kālaḥ eṣa sapta asya nābhīḥ amṛtam nu akṣaḥ    saḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni añjat kālaḥ saḥ īyate prathamaḥ nu devaḥ  /
translated: This Kāla bears the seven wheels, his navel is sevenfold, his axle is immortal. He hath anointed all these worlds. He, Kāla, is the first God who goeth.

original: pūrṇaḥ kumbhaḥ adhi kāle āhitaḥ tam vai paśyāmaḥ bahudhā nu santam / saḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni pratyaṅ kālam tam āhuḥ parame vyoman /
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ kumbhaḥ adhi kāle āhitaḥ tam vai paśyāmaḥ bahudhā nu santam    saḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni pratyaṅ kālam tam āhuḥ parame vyoman  /
translated: The full jar is set upon Kāla. We see him in many places, though he is one. He, Kāla, is behind all these worlds. They call him Kāla in the highest heaven.

original: saḥ eva sam bhuvanāni ābharat saḥ eva sam bhuvanāni pari ait / pitā san abhavat putraḥ eṣām tasmāt vai na anyat param asti tejaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva sam bhuvanāni ābharat saḥ eva sam bhuvanāni pari ait   pitā san abhavat putraḥ eṣām tasmāt vai na anyat param asti tejaḥ  /
translated: He alone hath brought together the worlds. He alone hath gone round the worlds. He, being the father, hath become their son. There is no splendour higher than he.

original: kālaḥ amūm divam ajanayat kālaḥ imāḥ pṛthivīḥ uta / kāle ha bhūtam bhavyam ceṣitam ha vi tiṣṭhate //
analyzed: kālaḥ amūm divam ajanayat kālaḥ imāḥ pṛthivīḥ uta   kāle ha bhūtam bhavyam ceṣitam ha vi tiṣṭhate  /
translated: Kāla hath generated this sky, Kāla these earths. In Kāla we behold the past and future. In Kāla is the world of life established.

original: kālaḥ bhūtim asṛjata kāle tapati sūryaḥ / kāle ha viśvā bhūtāni kāle cakṣuḥ vi paśyati //
analyzed: kālaḥ bhūtim asṛjata kāle tapati sūryaḥ   kāle ha viśvā bhūtāni kāle cakṣuḥ vi paśyati  /
translated: Kāla hath created prosperity. In Kāla the sun shineth. In Kāla are all things. In Kāla the eye beholdeth.

original: kāle manaḥ kāle prāṇaḥ kāle nāma samāhitam / kālena sarvāḥ nandanti āgatena prajāḥ imāḥ /
analyzed: kāle manaḥ kāle prāṇaḥ kāle nāma samāhitam   kālena sarvāḥ nandanti āgatena prajāḥ imāḥ  /
translated: In Kāla is the mind, in Kāla the breath of life. In Kāla is the name established. By Kāla's coming all these creatures rejoice.

original: kāle tapaḥ kāle jyeṣṭham kāle brahma samāhitam / kālaḥ ha sarvasya īśvaraḥ yaḥ pitā āsīt prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: kāle tapaḥ kāle jyeṣṭham kāle brahma samāhitam   kālaḥ ha sarvasya īśvaraḥ yaḥ pitā āsīt prajāpateḥ  /
translated: In time is penance, in time is the eldest, in time is Brahman with his thought collected. Time is the Lord of all, he who was father of the Lord of creatures.

original: tena iṣitam tena jātam tat u tasmin pratiṣṭhitam / kālaḥ ha brahma bhūtvā bibharti parameṣṭhinam /
analyzed: tena iṣitam tena jātam tat u tasmin pratiṣṭhitam   kālaḥ ha brahma bhūtvā bibharti parameṣṭhinam  /
translated: By him impelled, by him produced, in him is that established. Time, becoming Brahman, supports the Supreme Lord.

original: kālaḥ prajāḥ asṛjata kālaḥ agre prajāpatim / svayaṃbhūḥ kaśyapaḥ kālāt tapaḥ kālāt ajāyata /
analyzed: kālaḥ prajāḥ asṛjata kālaḥ agre prajāpatim   svayaṃbhūḥ kaśyapaḥ kālāt tapaḥ kālāt ajāyata  /
translated: Time created creatures, Time created in the beginning the Lord of creatures. From Time sprang the self-existent Kaśyapa, from Time sprang penance.

original: kālāt āpaḥ sam abhavan kālāt brahma tapaḥ diśaḥ / kālena ud eti sūryaḥ kāle ni viśate punar /
analyzed: kālāt āpaḥ sam abhavan kālāt brahma tapaḥ diśaḥ   kālena ud eti sūryaḥ kāle ni viśate punar  /
translated: From Time the waters were produced, from Time Brahman, penance, and the quarters of heaven. By Time the sun rises, by Time he sets again.

original: kālena vātaḥ pavate kālena pṛthivī mahī / dyauḥ mahī kāle āhitā /
analyzed: kālena vātaḥ pavate kālena pṛthivī mahī   dyauḥ mahī kāle āhitā  /
translated: By Time the wind blows, by Time the earth is great, the heaven is great, by Time the worlds are established.

original: kālaḥ ha bhūtam bhavyam ca putraḥ ajanayat purā / kālāt ṛcaḥ sam abhavan yajuḥ kālāt ajāyata /
analyzed: kālaḥ ha bhūtam bhavyam ca putraḥ ajanayat purā   kālāt ṛcaḥ sam abhavan yajuḥ kālāt ajāyata  /
translated: Time in the days of old begat the past and future, and the son. From Time the Ṛc verses sprang, from Time the Yajuṣ was produced.

original: kālaḥ yajñam sam airayat devebhyaḥ bhāgam akṣitam / kāle gandharva apsarasaḥ kāle lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: kālaḥ yajñam sam airayat devebhyaḥ bhāgam akṣitam   kāle gandharva apsarasaḥ kāle lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ  /
translated: Time set the imperishable sacrifice in motion for the Gods to share. In Time the Gandharvas and Apsarases were born, in Time the worlds were established.

original: kāle ayam aṅgirāḥ devaḥ atharvā ca adhi tiṣṭhataḥ / imam ca lokam paramam ca lokam puṇyān ca lokān vidhṛtīḥ ca puṇyāḥ / sarvān lokān abhijitya brahmaṇā kālaḥ saḥ īyate paramaḥ nu devaḥ /
analyzed: kāle ayam aṅgirāḥ devaḥ atharvā ca adhi tiṣṭhataḥ    imam ca lokam paramam ca lokam puṇyān ca lokān vidhṛtīḥ ca puṇyāḥ    sarvān lokān abhijitya brahmaṇā kālaḥ saḥ īyate paramaḥ nu devaḥ  /
translated: Having conquered all the worlds by Brahman, Time goes forth, the highest God.

original: rātrim rātrim a prayātam bharantaḥ aśvāya iva tiṣṭhate ghāsam asmai / rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ mā te agne prativeśāḥ riṣāma /
analyzed: rātrim rātrim a prayātam bharantaḥ aśvāya iva tiṣṭhate ghāsam asmai    rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ mā te agne prativeśāḥ riṣāma  /
translated: Night after night, bringing him food as to a standing horse, rejoicing in the increase of wealth and food, may we, O Agni, not suffer harm as thy neighbours.

original: yā te vasoḥ vātaḥ iṣuḥ sā te eṣā tayā naḥ mṛḍa / rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ mā te agne prativeśāḥ riṣāma /🔽sāyam sāyam gṛhapatiḥ naḥ agniḥ prātar prātar saumanasasya dātā / vasoḥ vasoḥ vasu dānaḥ edhi vayam tvā indhānāḥ tanvam puṣema /
analyzed: yā te vasoḥ vātaḥ iṣuḥ sā te eṣā tayā naḥ mṛḍa   rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ mā te agne prativeśāḥ riṣāma  / sāyam sāyam gṛhapatiḥ naḥ agniḥ prātar prātar saumanasasya dātā   vasoḥ vasoḥ vasu dānaḥ edhi vayam tvā indhānāḥ tanvam puṣema  /
translated: O Vasu, thy arrow is the wind: with that be gracious to us. Rejoicing in the increase of wealth and food, may we, O Agni, not suffer harm as thy neighbours.🔽May Agni, the lord of the house, be gracious to us in the evening, and in the morning, may he be the giver of good will. Be thou the giver of wealth, O Vasu, of wealth, of wealth. May we, kindling thee, prosper our body.

original: prātar prātar gṛhapatiḥ naḥ agniḥ sāyaṃsāyam saumanasasya dātā / vasoḥ vasoḥ vasu dānaḥ edhi indhānāḥ tvā śataṃhimāḥ ṛdhema /
analyzed: prātar prātar gṛhapatiḥ naḥ agniḥ sāyaṃsāyam saumanasasya dātā   vasoḥ vasoḥ vasu dānaḥ edhi indhānāḥ tvā śataṃhimāḥ ṛdhema  /
translated: May Agni, the lord of the house, be gracious to us in the morning, and in the evening, may he be the giver of good will. Be thou the giver of wealth, O Vasu, of wealth, of wealth. Kindling thee, may we prosper a hundred winters.

original: a paścā dagdha annasya bhūyāsam / anna ādāya annapataye rudrāya namaḥ agnaye / sabhyaḥ sabhām me pāhi ye ca sabhyāḥ sabhāsadaḥ /
analyzed: a paścā dagdha annasya bhūyāsam   anna ādāya annapataye rudrāya namaḥ agnaye   sabhyaḥ sabhām me pāhi ye ca sabhyāḥ sabhāsadaḥ  /
translated: May I be not behind the eater of undigested food. Homage to Rudra, the eater of food, the lord of food, to Agni. O Sabhya, protect my assembly, and those who are in the assembly and those who sit in the assembly.

original: tvām indra puruhūta viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnavan / aharahar balim id te harantaḥ aśvāya iva tiṣṭhate ghāsam agne /
analyzed: tvām indra puruhūta viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnavan   aharahar balim id te harantaḥ aśvāya iva tiṣṭhate ghāsam agne  /
translated: O Indra, the much-invoked one, all men have divided your life into parts. Day by day they bring you tribute, as fodder for a standing horse, O Agni.

original: yamasya lokāt adhi ā babhūvitha pramadāḥ martyān pra yunakṣi dhīraḥ / ekākinā sa ratham yāsi vidvān svapnam mimānaḥ asurasya yonau /
analyzed: yamasya lokāt adhi ā babhūvitha pramadāḥ martyān pra yunakṣi dhīraḥ    ekākinā sa ratham yāsi vidvān svapnam mimānaḥ asurasya yonau  /
translated: You have come forth from Yama's world. The wise one yokes the delights to mortals. Alone, knowing, you go in a chariot, measuring sleep in the womb of the Asura.

original: bandhaḥ tvā agre viśva cayāḥ apaśyat purā rātryāḥ janitoḥ eke ahni / tatas svapna idam adhi ā babhūvitha bhiṣagbhyaḥ rūpam apagūhamānaḥ /
analyzed: bandhaḥ tvā agre viśva cayāḥ apaśyat purā rātryāḥ janitoḥ eke ahni    tatas svapna idam adhi ā babhūvitha bhiṣagbhyaḥ rūpam apagūhamānaḥ  /
translated: The fetter first saw you, O all-knowing one, before the birth of night, on one day. From there you have come forth to this sleep, concealing your form from the physicians.

original: bṛhat gāvāsurebhyaḥ adhi devān upāvartata mahimānam ichan / tasmai svapnāya dadhuḥ ādhipatyam trayastriṃśāsaḥ svar ānaśānāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhat gāvāsurebhyaḥ adhi devān upāvartata mahimānam ichan    tasmai svapnāya dadhuḥ ādhipatyam trayastriṃśāsaḥ svar ānaśānāḥ  /
translated: The great cow went to the gods from the Asuras, desiring greatness. To that sleep they gave lordship, the thirty-three gods, seeking heaven.

original: na etām viduḥ pitaraḥ na uta devāḥ yeṣām jalpiḥ carati antarā idam / trite svapnam adadhuḥ āptye naraḥ ādityāsaḥ varuṇena anuśiṣṭāḥ /🔽yasya krūram abhajanta duṣkṛtaḥ asvapnena sukṛtaḥ puṇyam āyuḥ / svar madasi parameṇa bandhunā tapyamānasya manasaḥ adhi jajñiṣe /🔽vidma te sarvāḥ parijāḥ purastāt vidma svapna yaḥ adhipāḥ iha te / yaśaśvinaḥ naḥ yaśasā iha pāhi ārāt dviṣebhiḥ apa yāhi dūram /🔽yathā kalām yathā śapham yathā ṛṇam samnayanti / eva duṣvapnyam sarvam apriye sam nayāmasi //
analyzed: na etām viduḥ pitaraḥ na uta devāḥ yeṣām jalpiḥ carati antarā idam   trite svapnam adadhuḥ āptye naraḥ ādityāsaḥ varuṇena anuśiṣṭāḥ  / yasya krūram abhajanta duṣkṛtaḥ asvapnena sukṛtaḥ puṇyam āyuḥ   svar madasi parameṇa bandhunā tapyamānasya manasaḥ adhi jajñiṣe  / vidma te sarvāḥ parijāḥ purastāt vidma svapna yaḥ adhipāḥ iha te   yaśaśvinaḥ naḥ yaśasā iha pāhi ārāt dviṣebhiḥ apa yāhi dūram  / yathā kalām yathā śapham yathā ṛṇam samnayanti    eva duṣvapnyam sarvam apriye sam nayāmasi  /
translated: The Fathers know it not, nor yet the Deities, whose is the Jampi that moves between these worlds. To Trita, to Aptûrya, men have given up their dreams, the Âdityas, at the bidding of Varuna.

original: sam rājānaḥ aguḥ sam ṛṇāmi aguḥ sam kuṣṭhāḥ aguḥ sam kalāḥ aguḥ / sam asmāsu yat duṣvapnyam niḥ dviṣate duṣvapnyam suvāma /
analyzed: sam rājānaḥ aguḥ sam ṛṇāmi aguḥ sam kuṣṭhāḥ aguḥ sam kalāḥ aguḥ    sam asmāsu yat duṣvapnyam niḥ dviṣate duṣvapnyam suvāma  /

original: devānām patnīnām garbha yamasya kara yaḥ bhadraḥ svapna / sa mama yaḥ pāpaḥ tat dviṣate pra hiṇmaḥ / mā tṛṣṭānām asi kṛṣṇa śakuneḥ mukham /
analyzed: devānām patnīnām garbha yamasya kara yaḥ bhadraḥ svapna   sa mama yaḥ pāpaḥ tat dviṣate pra hiṇmaḥ   mā tṛṣṭānām asi kṛṣṇa śakuneḥ mukham  /
translated: The embryo of the wives of the Gods, the handmaid of Yama, the auspicious dream, him who is evil to me, him who is evil to my foe, we send away.

original: tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa tvam svapna aśvaḥ iva kāyam aśvaḥ iva nīnāham / anā asmākam deva pīyum piyārum vapa yat asmāsu duṣvapnyam yat goṣu yat ca naḥ gṛhe /
analyzed: tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa tvam svapna aśvaḥ iva kāyam aśvaḥ iva nīnāham    anā asmākam deva pīyum piyārum vapa yat asmāsu duṣvapnyam yat goṣu yat ca naḥ gṛhe  /
translated: We know thee well, O Dream, as such: as a horse, O Dream, lead thou away our body, as a horse leads away the reins. Cut off the evil dream, the black bird's mouth, which is hateful to the Gods, which is hateful to us.🔽Let the hateful God, the Piyaru, cut off that evil dream from us, as if it were a necklace, which is in us, which is in our cattle, which is in our house.

original: anā asmākaḥ tat deva pīyuḥ piyāruḥ niṣkam iva prati muñcatām / nava aratnīn apamayāḥ asmākam tatas pari / duṣvapnyam sarvam dviṣate niḥ dayāmasi //
analyzed: anā asmākaḥ tat deva pīyuḥ piyāruḥ niṣkam iva prati muñcatām   nava aratnīn apamayāḥ asmākam tatas pari   duṣvapnyam sarvam dviṣate niḥ dayāmasi  /
translated: Let the hateful God, the Piyaru, let him loose as it were a necklace from us. Let him carry away from us the evil dream, the nine-jointed one. Let us be free from all evil dreams. We send them to the foe.

original: ghṛtasya jūtiḥ samanā sa devā saṃvatsaram haviṣā vardhayantī / śrotram cakṣuḥ prāṇaḥ achinnaḥ naḥ astu achinnāḥ vayam āyuṣaḥ varcasaḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtasya jūtiḥ samanā sa devā saṃvatsaram haviṣā vardhayantī   śrotram cakṣuḥ prāṇaḥ achinnaḥ naḥ astu achinnāḥ vayam āyuṣaḥ varcasaḥ  /
translated: The stream of ghee, the common one, the Gods, increasing the year with oblation, let our hearing, our sight, our breath be not cut off. Let us not be cut off from life and splendour.

original: upa asmān prāṇaḥ hvayatām upa prāṇam havāmahe / varcaḥ jagrāha pṛthivī antarikṣam varcaḥ somaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vidhattā /
analyzed: upa asmān prāṇaḥ hvayatām upa prāṇam havāmahe   varcaḥ jagrāha pṛthivī antarikṣam varcaḥ somaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vidhattā  /
translated: May Prana call us to himself, and we call to Prana. He hath taken splendour, the earth, the atmosphere. Let Brihaspati allot splendour, Soma.

original: varcasaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī saṃgrahaṇī babhūvathuḥ varcaḥ gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu sam carema / yaśasam gāvaḥ gopatim upa tiṣṭhanti āyatīḥ yaśaḥ gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu sam carema /
analyzed: varcasaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī saṃgrahaṇī babhūvathuḥ varcaḥ gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu sam carema   yaśasam gāvaḥ gopatim upa tiṣṭhanti āyatīḥ yaśaḥ gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu sam carema  /
translated: Ye twain, O Heaven and Earth, have become the gatherers of splendour. Having taken splendour, may we go along the earth. The kine, when they come, attend the lord of kine with glory. Having taken glory, may we go along the earth.

original: vrajam kṛṇudhvam sa hi vaḥ nṛpāṇaḥ varma ā sīvyadhvam bahulā pṛthūni / puraḥ kṛṇudhvam āyasīḥ a dhṛṣṭāḥ mā vaḥ susrot camasaḥ dṛṃhata tam /
analyzed: vrajam kṛṇudhvam sa hi vaḥ nṛpāṇaḥ varma ā sīvyadhvam bahulā pṛthūni   puraḥ kṛṇudhvam āyasīḥ a dhṛṣṭāḥ mā vaḥ susrot camasaḥ dṛṃhata tam  /
translated: Make ye a fold, for he is your king. Stitch ye a coat of mail, wide and spacious. Make ye an iron castle, hard to assail. Let not your well-wrought chalice be destroyed.

original: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtiḥ mukham ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi / imam yajñam vitatam viśvakarmaṇā devāḥ yantu sumanasyamānāḥ /
analyzed: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtiḥ mukham ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi    imam yajñam vitatam viśvakarmaṇā devāḥ yantu sumanasyamānāḥ  /
translated: The eye of sacrifice, the leader, and the mouth, with speech, with hearing, with the mind I worship. With all their hearts let the Gods come to this sacrifice which Vishvakarman hath extended.

original: ye devānām ṛtvijaḥ ye ca yajñiyāḥ yebhyaḥ havyam kriyate bhāgadheyam / imam yajñam saha patnībhiḥ etya yāvantaḥ devāḥ taviṣā mādayantām /
analyzed: ye devānām ṛtvijaḥ ye ca yajñiyāḥ yebhyaḥ havyam kriyate bhāgadheyam    imam yajñam saha patnībhiḥ etya yāvantaḥ devāḥ taviṣā mādayantām  /
translated: Those who are priests of the Gods, and those who are worthy of sacrifice, to whom the offering is made, the share, let them come to this sacrifice with their wives. Let the powerful Gods rejoice as many as there are.

original: tvam agne vrata pāḥ asi devaḥ ā martyeṣu ā / tvam yajñeṣu īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne vrata pāḥ asi devaḥ ā martyeṣu ā   tvam yajñeṣu īḍyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the guardian of vows, a God among mortals, thou art to be worshipped in sacrifices.

original: yat vaḥ vayam pramināma vratāni viduṣām devāḥ aviduṣṭarāsaḥ / agniḥ tat viśvāt ā pṛṇātu vidvān somasya yaḥ brāhmaṇām āviveśa /
analyzed: yat vaḥ vayam pramināma vratāni viduṣām devāḥ aviduṣṭarāsaḥ   agniḥ tat viśvāt ā pṛṇātu vidvān somasya yaḥ brāhmaṇām āviveśa  /
translated: If we, O Gods, ignorant and slow, have broken your ordinances, O ye that know, may Agni, the wise, make good all that to us. He who hath entered the Brahmans by the will of Soma.

original: ā devānām api panthām aganma yat śaknavāma tat anupravoḍhum / agniḥ vidvān sa yajāt saḥ id hotā saḥ adhvarān saḥ ṛtūn kalpayāti //
analyzed: ā devānām api panthām aganma yat śaknavāma tat anupravoḍhum   agniḥ vidvān sa yajāt saḥ id hotā saḥ adhvarān saḥ ṛtūn kalpayāti  /
translated: We have gone up the path of the Gods: we have done what we could: help us to complete it. May Agni, the wise, the priest, the offerer of sacrifice, he who ordains the sacrifices and the seasons.

original: vāc me āsan nasoḥ prāṇaḥ cakṣuḥ akṣṇoḥ śrotram karṇayoḥ / a palitāḥ keśāḥ a śoṇāḥ dantāḥ bahu bāhvoḥ balam /
analyzed: vāc me āsan nasoḥ prāṇaḥ cakṣuḥ akṣṇoḥ śrotram karṇayoḥ   a palitāḥ keśāḥ a śoṇāḥ dantāḥ bahu bāhvoḥ balam  /
translated: Let speech be in my mouth, let breath be in my nostrils, let eye be in my eyes, let ear be in my ears. Let my hair be white, my teeth red, my arms strong.

original: ūrvoḥ ojaḥ jaṅghayoḥ javaḥ pādayoḥ / pratiṣṭhā ariṣṭāni me sarvātmā anibhṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: ūrvoḥ ojaḥ jaṅghayoḥ javaḥ pādayoḥ   pratiṣṭhā ariṣṭāni me sarvātmā anibhṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Let strength be in my thighs, let swiftness be in my legs, let firmness be in my feet. Let all my limbs be sound and unimpaired.

original: tanūḥ tanvā me sahe dataḥ sarvam āyuḥ aśīya / syonam me sīda puruḥ pṛṇasva pavamānaḥ svarge /
analyzed: tanūḥ tanvā me sahe dataḥ sarvam āyuḥ aśīya    syonam me sīda puruḥ pṛṇasva pavamānaḥ svarge  /
translated: Let my body be strong with my body. Let me live all my life. Be thou gracious to me, O Puru, fill heaven with thy light, O Pavamana.

original: priyam mā kṛṇu deveṣu priyam rājasu mā kṛṇu / priyam sarvasya paśyataḥ uta śūdraḥ uta ārye /
analyzed: priyam mā kṛṇu deveṣu priyam rājasu mā kṛṇu   priyam sarvasya paśyataḥ uta śūdraḥ uta ārye  /
translated: Make me dear to the Gods, make me dear to the kings, make me dear to all who look on me, to the Sudra and to the Arya.

original: ud tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devān yajñena bodhaya / āyuḥ prāṇam prajām paśūn kīrtim yajamānam ca vardhaya //
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devān yajñena bodhaya   āyuḥ prāṇam prajām paśūn kīrtim yajamānam ca vardhaya  /
translated: Arise, O Lord of prayer, and with the sacrifice awaken the gods. Increase the life, the breath, the offspring, the cattle, the fame, and the sacrificer.

original: agne samidham āhārṣam bṛhate jātavedase / sa me śraddhām ca medhām ca jātavedāḥ pra yacchatu //
analyzed: agne samidham āhārṣam bṛhate jātavedase    sa me śraddhām ca medhām ca jātavedāḥ pra yacchatu  /
translated: O Agni, I have brought a piece of wood for the great all-knowing one. May the all-knowing one grant me faith and wisdom.

original: idhmena tvā jātavedaḥ samidhā vardhayāmasi / tathā tvam asmān vardhaya prajayā ca dhanena ca /
analyzed: idhmena tvā jātavedaḥ samidhā vardhayāmasi   tathā tvam asmān vardhaya prajayā ca dhanena ca  /
translated: With fuel, O all-knowing one, with a piece of wood we increase you. Thus increase us, too, with offspring and with wealth.

original: yat agne yāni kāni cit ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi / sarvam tat astu me śivam tat juṣasva yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: yat agne yāni kāni cit ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi   sarvam tat astu me śivam tat juṣasva yaviṣṭhya  /
translated: Whatever pieces of wood, O Agni, we put on you, may all that be auspicious to me. Accept that, O youngest one.

original: etāḥ te agne samidhaḥ tvam iddhaḥ samidh bhava / āyuḥ asmāsu dhehi amṛta tvam ācāryāya //
analyzed: etāḥ te agne samidhaḥ tvam iddhaḥ samidh bhava   āyuḥ asmāsu dhehi amṛta tvam ācāryāya  /
translated: These are your pieces of wood, O Agni. Having been kindled, be a piece of wood for me. Bestow life and immortality upon us, O teacher.🔽The golden eagle has mounted the sky with his flame. Those who seek to injure you as you fly up to the sky,

original: hariḥ suparṇaḥ divam āruhaḥ arciṣā ye tvā dipsanti divam utpatantam / ava tām jahi harasā jātavedaḥ a bibhyat ugraḥ arciṣā divam ā roha sūrya //
analyzed: hariḥ suparṇaḥ divam āruhaḥ arciṣā ye tvā dipsanti divam utpatantam   ava tām jahi harasā jātavedaḥ a bibhyat ugraḥ arciṣā divam ā roha sūrya  /
translated: strike them down with your heat, O all-knowing one. The terrible one, fearing nothing, mounts the sky with his flame, O Sun.

original: ayaḥ jālāḥ asurāḥ māyinaḥ ayasmayaiḥ pāśaiḥ aṅkinaḥ ye caranti / tān te randhayāmi harasā jātavedaḥ sahasra ṛṣṭiḥ sapatnān pramṛṇan pāhi vajraḥ /🔽paśyema śaradaḥ śatam //
analyzed: ayaḥ jālāḥ asurāḥ māyinaḥ ayasmayaiḥ pāśaiḥ aṅkinaḥ ye caranti   tān te randhayāmi harasā jātavedaḥ sahasra ṛṣṭiḥ sapatnān pramṛṇan pāhi vajraḥ  / paśyema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: The Asuras, the sorcerers, are of iron, with iron fetters, who move about bound. I pierce them with thy flame, O all-knower. With a thousand spikes, crushing the foes, guard me, O thunderbolt.🔽May we see a hundred autumns.

original: jīvema śaradaḥ śatam //🔽budhyema śaradaḥ śatam //
analyzed: jīvema śaradaḥ śatam  budhyema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we live a hundred autumns.🔽May we understand a hundred autumns.

original: rohema śaradaḥ śatam //🔽pūṣā ima śaradaḥ śatam //
analyzed: rohema śaradaḥ śatam  pūṣā ima śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we grow a hundred autumns.🔽May Pusan protect us a hundred autumns.

original: bhavema śaradaḥ śatam //🔽bhūṣema śaradaḥ śatam //
analyzed: bhavema śaradaḥ śatam  bhūṣema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we be a hundred autumns.🔽May we adorn ourselves a hundred autumns.

original: bhūyasīḥ śaradaḥ śatam //
analyzed: bhūyasīḥ śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we have a hundred autumns more.

original: avyasaḥ ca vyacasaḥ ca bilam vi syāmi māyayā / tābhyām uddhṛtya vedam atha karmāṇi kṛṇmahe /🔽jīvā stha jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam //
analyzed: avyasaḥ ca vyacasaḥ ca bilam vi syāmi māyayā   tābhyām uddhṛtya vedam atha karmāṇi kṛṇmahe  / jīvā stha jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam
translated: With the cave of the boundless and the spacious I will enter with magic. Having drawn out the Veda with those two, we perform the rites.🔽You are the living ones, may I live. May I live all my life.

original: upajīvā stha upa jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam /🔽saṃjīvāḥ stha sam jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam /
analyzed: upajīvā stha upa jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam  / saṃjīvāḥ stha sam jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam  /
translated: You are the living ones, may I live. May I live all my life.🔽You are the living ones, may I live. May I live all my life.

original: jīvalā stha jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam //
analyzed: jīvalā stha jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam
translated: You are the living ones, may I live. May I live all my life.

original: indra jīva sūrya jīva devāḥ jīvāḥ jīvyāsam aham / sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam /
analyzed: indra jīva sūrya jīva devāḥ jīvāḥ jīvyāsam aham sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam
translated: O Indra, live! O Sun, live! O gods, live! May I live. May I live all my life.

original: stutā mayā vara dā veda mātā pra codayantām pāvamānī dvijānām / āyuḥ prāṇam prajām paśum kīrtim draviṇam brahmavarcasam / mahyam dattvā vrajata brahma lokam /
analyzed: stutā mayā vara dā veda mātā pra codayantām pāvamānī dvijānām    āyuḥ prāṇam prajām paśum kīrtim draviṇam brahmavarcasam   mahyam dattvā vrajata brahma lokam  /
translated: Praised by me, O bestower of boons, O mother of the Vedas, may the Pavamana hymns incite the twice-born. Having given me longevity, vital energy, offspring, cattle, fame, wealth, and spiritual splendor, go to the world of Brahman.

original: yasmāt kośāt udabharāma vedam tasmin antar ava dadhmaḥ enam / kṛtam iṣṭam brahmaṇaḥ vīryeṇa tena mā devāḥ tapasā avata iha /
analyzed: yasmāt kośāt udabharāma vedam tasmin antar ava dadhmaḥ enam   kṛtam iṣṭam brahmaṇaḥ vīryeṇa tena mā devāḥ tapasā avata iha  /
translated: From that treasury from which we have brought forth the Veda, in that we place it again. Accomplished and offered through the power of Brahman, O gods, with that austerity of mine, do ye deliver me here.

original: indra tvā vṛṣabham vayam sute some havāmahe / sa pāhi madhvaḥ andhasaḥ /
analyzed: indra tvā vṛṣabham vayam sute some havāmahe    sa pāhi madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: O Indra, we invoke thee, the bull, at the pressed Soma, O thou who art to be praised with the loudest voice. Do thou, O lord of tawny steeds, protect us with thy favour.

original: marutaḥ yasya hi kṣaye pāthāḥ divaḥ vimahasaḥ / sa sugopātamaḥ janaḥ /
analyzed: marutaḥ yasya hi kṣaye pāthāḥ divaḥ vimahasaḥ    sa sugopātamaḥ janaḥ
translated: O Maruts, he whose abode is in the sky, who is of great glory, whose people are the best protected.

original: ukṣa annāya vaśā annāya soma pṛṣṭhāya vedhase / stomaiḥ vidhema agnaye /
analyzed: ukṣa annāya vaśā annāya soma pṛṣṭhāya vedhase   / stomaiḥ vidhema agnaye
translated: To him who eats the ox, who eats the barren cow, to him whose back is the Soma, to the creator, we will offer with praises to Agni.

original: marutaḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibantu //
analyzed: marutaḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibantu  /
translated: The Maruts, through the Potri, through the Sustu, through the Arka, may they drink the Soma according to the season.

original: agniḥ āgnīdhrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu //
analyzed: agniḥ āgnīdhrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu
translated: Agni, through the Agnidhra, through the Sustu, through the Arka, may he drink the Soma according to the season.

original: indraḥ brahmā brāhmaṇāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu //
analyzed: indraḥ brahmā brāhmaṇāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu
translated: Indra, through the Brahman, through the Brahmana, through the Sustu, through the Arka, may he drink the Soma according to the season.

original: devaḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu //
analyzed: devaḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu
translated: The God, the Giver of wealth, from the Pot-priest, from the well-praised, from the well-sung, let him drink the Soma by rule.

original: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam / ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama /
analyzed: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam   ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama  /
translated: Come hither, for thou lovest well: O Indra, drink this Soma here,🔽And sit upon this sacred grass.🔽Let thy two Bay Steeds yoked with prayer bring thee hither, O thou whose hair is gold, O Indra:

original: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā / upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu //
analyzed: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā    upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu  /
translated: Listen to our invocations.

original: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ / sutāvantaḥ havāmahe //🔽ā naḥ yāhi sutāvataḥ asmākam suṣṭutīḥ upa / pibā su śiprin andhasaḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ    sutāvantaḥ havāmahe  / ā naḥ yāhi sutāvataḥ asmākam suṣṭutīḥ upa   pibā su śiprin andhasaḥ
translated: We Brahmans, O thou Soma-drinker, we who offer Soma, we who have pressed the juice,🔽Call thee to aid with prayer.🔽Come to us, O thou whom many invocate: come to our songs of praise.

original: ā te siñcāmi kukṣyoḥ anu gātrā vi dhāvatu / gṛbhāya jihvayā madhu //
analyzed: ā te siñcāmi kukṣyoḥ anu gātrā vi dhāvatu   gṛbhāya jihvayā madhu  /
translated: Drink, O thou of the beautiful arms, the juice.🔽Let it be sweet for thee to taste, and pleasant to thy body:

original: svāduḥ te astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava / somaḥ śam astu te hṛde /
analyzed: svāduḥ te astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava    somaḥ śam astu te hṛde  /
translated: Let the Soma be sweet to thy heart.

original: ayam u tvā vicarṣaṇe janīḥ iva abhi saṃvṛtaḥ / pra somaḥ indra sarpatu /🔽tuvi grīvaḥ vapodaraḥ su bāhuḥ andhasaḥ sade / indraḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnate /
analyzed: ayam u tvā vicarṣaṇe janīḥ iva abhi saṃvṛtaḥ   pra somaḥ indra sarpatu  / tuvi grīvaḥ vapodaraḥ su bāhuḥ andhasaḥ sade   indraḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnate  /
translated: This Soma, O most active One, pressed out like juices of the plant,🔽Let it flow onward, O thou Bull, to thy two flanks.🔽Strong-necked, with ample belly, strong of arm, in the Soma's place,🔽Indra slays the Vr̥itras.🔽Go forward, Indra, thou art he who rules all wealth with might.

original: indra prehi puras tvam viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā / vṛtrāṇi vṛtraham jahi //
analyzed: indra prehi puras tvam viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā   vṛtrāṇi vṛtraham jahi  /
translated: Slayer of Vr̥itras, slay the Vr̥itras.

original: dīrghaḥ te astu aṅkuśaḥ yena vasu prayacchasi / yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: dīrghaḥ te astu aṅkuśaḥ yena vasu prayacchasi   yajamānāya sunvate
translated: Long be thy hook wherewith thou givest wealth to the sacrificer who presses out the juice.

original: ayam te indra somaḥ nipūtaḥ adhi barhiṣi / ehi īm asya drava piba /🔽śāci go śāci pūjana ayam raṇāya te sutaḥ / ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase /
analyzed: ayam te indra somaḥ nipūtaḥ adhi barhiṣi    ehi īm asya drava piba  / śāci go śāci pūjana ayam raṇāya te sutaḥ   ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase  /
translated: This Soma, O Indra, is purified upon the sacred grass: come, run to it and drink thereof.🔽O thou who lovest kine, who lovest gifts, this juice is shed for thee: thou, Aṣṭaka, art invoked.

original: yaḥ te śṛṅga vṛṣaḥ napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ / ni asmin dadhre ā manaḥ /🔽indra tvā vṛṣabham vayam sute some havāmahe / sa pāhi madhvaḥ andhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te śṛṅga vṛṣaḥ napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ   ni asmin dadhre ā manaḥ  indra tvā vṛṣabham vayam sute some havāmahe    sa pāhi madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: Thy bull, O Indra, who is like a horn, who springs and springs again, who springs from Kuṇḍapāyī, hath fixed his thought on thee.🔽O Indra, we invoke thee, bull, at this our Soma juice expressed: drink of the pleasant juice we shed.

original: indra kratu vidam sutam somam harya puruṣṭuta / pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim /
analyzed: indra kratu vidam sutam somam harya puruṣṭuta   pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim
translated: O Indra, lauded of many, drink the juice which wisdom hath produced, the Soma, O most wealthy One. Be strong, be satisfied with it.

original: indra pra naḥ dhitāvānam yajñam viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ / tira stavāna viśpate /🔽indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tava pra yanti satpate / kṣayam candrāsaḥ indavaḥ /
analyzed: indra pra naḥ dhitāvānam yajñam viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ   tira stavāna viśpate  / indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tava pra yanti satpate    kṣayam candrāsaḥ indavaḥ  /
translated: O Indra, Lord of the people, with all the Gods accept our sacrifice, well-ordered, praised by many.🔽O Indra, Lord of the brave, these Somas pressed are flowing to thee: the drops, the bright, are entering thy belly.

original: dadhiṣva jaṭhare sutam somam indra vareṇyam / tava dyukṣāsaḥ indavaḥ /
analyzed: dadhiṣva jaṭhare sutam somam indra vareṇyam   tava dyukṣāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: O Indra, in thy belly hold the Soma, the excellent juice, expressed: thy heavenly drops are ready for the draught.

original: girvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutam madhoḥ dhārābhiḥ ajyase / indra tvā adātam id yaśaḥ /
analyzed: girvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutam madhoḥ dhārābhiḥ ajyase   indra tvā adātam id yaśaḥ
translated: O thou who lovest song, protect our juice: thou art anointed with the streams of meath. Indra, thou hast bestowed fame on us.

original: abhi dyumnāni vaninaḥ indram sacante akṣitā / pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe /
analyzed: abhi dyumnāni vaninaḥ indram sacante akṣitā   pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe  /
translated: The inexhaustible powers of wealth attend on Indra, the lover of the song. The drinker of the Soma hath waxed in strength.

original: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi parāvataḥ ca vṛtrahan / imā juṣasva naḥ giraḥ /
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi parāvataḥ ca vṛtrahan   imā juṣasva naḥ giraḥ
translated: Come thou to us from near and from afar, O Vr̥itra-slayer! Accept these songs of ours.

original: yat antarā parāvatam arvāvatam ca hūyase / indra iha tatas ā gahi //
analyzed: yat antarā parāvatam arvāvatam ca hūyase   indra iha tatas ā gahi  /
translated: When thou art called on to come hither from the distance or from near, O Indra, come hither from that place.

original: ud gha id abhi śrutāmagham vṛṣabham narya apasam / astāram eṣi sūrya /
analyzed: ud gha id abhi śrutāmagham vṛṣabham narya apasam   astāram eṣi sūrya  /
translated: Thou goest to the bounteous giver, to the hero, to the man of active spirit, to the liberal man, O Sun.

original: nava yaḥ navatim puras bibheda bāhu ojasā / ahim ca vṛtrahā avadhīt /
analyzed: nava yaḥ navatim puras bibheda bāhu ojasā   ahim ca vṛtrahā avadhīt  /
translated: He who with might of his own arms hath cleft nine-and-ninety castles, and hath slain the Dragon, Vr̥itra's slayer.

original: sa naḥ indraḥ śivaḥ sakhā aśvāvat gomat yavamat / uru dhārā iva dohate /
analyzed: sa naḥ indraḥ śivaḥ sakhā aśvāvat gomat yavamat    uru dhārā iva dohate  /
translated: May that same Indra be a gracious Friend to us, bestowing horses, kine, and barley, like a well-filled reservoir.

original: indra kratu vidam sutam somam harya puruṣṭuta / pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim /
analyzed: indra kratu vidam sutam somam harya puruṣṭuta   pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim
translated: O Indra, Lord of power and might, drink Soma, O thou much-invoked, to please thee, be thou strong.

original: eva pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasva uta gīrbhiḥ / āvis sūryam kṛṇuhi pīpihi iṣaḥ jahi śatrūṃr abhi gāḥ indra tṛndhi //
analyzed: eva pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasva uta gīrbhiḥ   āvis sūryam kṛṇuhi pīpihi iṣaḥ jahi śatrūṃr abhi gāḥ indra tṛndhi  /
translated: So, as of old, drink thou, rejoice thee: listen to prayer and be exalted with the songs. Make the Sun visible, drink up the juices, slay our foes, O Indra, and set free the cattle.

original: arvāṅ ehi soma kāmam tvā āhuḥ ayam sutaḥ tasya pibā madāya / uru vyacāḥ jaṭhare ā vṛṣasva pitā iva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ /🔽āpūrṇaḥ asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sektā iva kośam siṣice pibadhyai / sam u priyāḥ āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇit abhi somāsaḥ indram /
analyzed: arvāṅ ehi soma kāmam tvā āhuḥ ayam sutaḥ tasya pibā madāya   uru vyacāḥ jaṭhare ā vṛṣasva pitā iva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ  / āpūrṇaḥ asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sektā iva kośam siṣice pibadhyai   sam u priyāḥ āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇit abhi somāsaḥ indram  /
translated: Come hitherward to us, O Soma: they have called thee hither, longing for thee. This juice is shed: drink of it to make thee glad. O thou of ample wealth, be satisfied in our capacious throat, and, like a sire, listen to us when we invoke thee.🔽The beaker is filled full for thee: hail! Like a besprinkler he hath sprinkled the reservoir to make thee drink. The dear ones have turned unto him for his delight: the Somas have encompassed Indra on the right.

original: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ / abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ    abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe  /
translated: We laud with songs that wondrous Indra, who alone is Lord of wealth, who joys in the juice of the Soma, as the cows low to the calf in the stalls. We laud with songs that Indra, who alone is Lord of wealth, who joys in the juice of the Soma, as the cows low to the calf in the stalls.

original: dyukṣam sudānum taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam girim na puru bhojasam / kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe /
analyzed: dyukṣam sudānum taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam girim na puru bhojasam    kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe  /
translated: The bountiful, the glorious, the strong, surrounded with his powers, like a mountain, the giver of much food, the strong, the mighty, the hundredfold, the thousandfold, we seek, as 'twere, the rain of kine.

original: tat tvā yāmi su vīryam tat brahma pūrvacittaye / yena yatibhyaḥ bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha //
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi su vīryam tat brahma pūrvacittaye   yena yatibhyaḥ bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha  /
translated: To that heroic power of thine, to that high thought, to that holy prayer, whereby thou gavest to Yati and to Bhrigu wealth in cattle, whereby thou holpest Prṣnigarbha.

original: yena samudram asṛjaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ tat indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ / sadyas saḥ asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yam kṣoṇīḥ anucakrade /
analyzed: yena samudram asṛjaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ tat indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ    sadyas saḥ asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yam kṣoṇīḥ anucakrade  /
translated: Whereby thou madest the great waters, the ocean, that, O Indra, is thy manly power. That majesty of thine shall never fail, which the earth and heaven have followed in their course.

original: ud u te madhumattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate / satrājitaḥ dhanasāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva /
analyzed: ud u te madhumattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate    satrājitaḥ dhanasāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva  /
translated: Uplifted are thy sweetest songs, thy hymns of praise, O Indra, they, The ever-conquering, winning wealth, unfailing aids, impetuous as cars.

original: kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryāḥ iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ / indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryāḥ iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ   indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran  /
translated: The Kaṇvas, Bhṛgus, and the Sādhyas have gained all that is to be obtained by song. The living men, exalting Indra with their hymns, have sung aloud to him who loves the solemn rite.

original: indraḥ pūrbhid ātirat dāsam arkaiḥ vidat vasuḥ dayamānaḥ vi śatrūn / brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhānaḥ bhūri dātraḥ āpṛṇat rodasī ubhe /
analyzed: indraḥ pūrbhid ātirat dāsam arkaiḥ vidat vasuḥ dayamānaḥ vi śatrūn    brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhānaḥ bhūri dātraḥ āpṛṇat rodasī ubhe  /
translated: Indra, the breaker-down of forts, hath with his beams extended the Dâsa's realm. The bounteous, gracious, hath discovered wealth, and with his arms hath filled both worlds.

original: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan / indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇām viśām daivīnām uta pūrva yāvā /
analyzed: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan   indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇām viśām daivīnām uta pūrva yāvā  /
translated: I send forth to the Immortal one my voice, adorning him, the impulse of thy mighty power. Indra, thou art the Lord of human habitations, and of the tribes of Gods, the first of all.

original: indraḥ vṛtram avṛṇot śardhanītiḥ pra māyinām amināt varpaṇītiḥ / ahan vyaṃsam uśadhak vaneṣu āvis dhenāḥ akṛṇot rāmyāṇām /
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtram avṛṇot śardhanītiḥ pra māyinām amināt varpaṇītiḥ   ahan vyaṃsam uśadhak vaneṣu āvis dhenāḥ akṛṇot rāmyāṇām  /
translated: Indra, with conquering might, hath compassed Vritra round, and overcome the enchanters' magic power. He hath slain Vyansa, the malicious, in the woods, and hath revealed the secret thoughts of those who love the kine.

original: indraḥ svarṣā janayan ahāni jigāya uśigbhiḥ pṛtanāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ / prārocayat manave ketum ahnām avindat jyotiḥ bṛhate raṇāya /
analyzed: indraḥ svarṣā janayan ahāni jigāya uśigbhiḥ pṛtanāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ   prārocayat manave ketum ahnām avindat jyotiḥ bṛhate raṇāya  /
translated: Indra, the self-dependent One, producing the days, hath conquered with the swift ones the battles, the protector. He hath set up for Manu the ensign of the days. He hath found the light for the great conflict.

original: indraḥ tujaḥ barhaṇāḥ ā viveśa nṛvat dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi / acetayat dhiyaḥ imā jaritre pra imam varṇam atirat śukram āsām /
analyzed: indraḥ tujaḥ barhaṇāḥ ā viveśa nṛvat dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi    acetayat dhiyaḥ imā jaritre pra imam varṇam atirat śukram āsām  /
translated: Indra hath entered the mighty pressing-place, bearing as a man many manly deeds. He hath awakened these thoughts for the singer. He hath spread abroad this bright colour of these (waters).

original: mahaḥ mahāni panayanti asya indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi / vṛjanena vṛjinān sam pipeṣa māyābhiḥ dasyūṃr abhibhūti ojāḥ /🔽yudhā indraḥ mahnā varivaḥ cakāra devebhyaḥ sat patiḥ carṣaṇiprāḥ / vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprāḥ ukthebhiḥ kavayaḥ gṛṇanti //
analyzed: mahaḥ mahāni panayanti asya indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi    vṛjanena vṛjinān sam pipeṣa māyābhiḥ dasyūṃr abhibhūti ojāḥ  / yudhā indraḥ mahnā varivaḥ cakāra devebhyaḥ sat patiḥ carṣaṇiprāḥ   vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprāḥ ukthebhiḥ kavayaḥ gṛṇanti  /
translated: They celebrate his great deeds, the great ones of Indra, his many well-performed works. With the dam he pressed the dam-builders. With his deluding powers he subdued the Dasyus, the mighty one.🔽Indra, the Lord of the brave, the hero, hath made room with his might and with his weapon for the Gods. The sages, the wise ones, in the seat of Vivasvan, celebrate those (deeds) of his with hymns.

original: satrāsāham vareṇyam sahaḥ dām sasavāṃsam svar apaḥ ca devīḥ / sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīm dyām uta imām indram madanti anu dhīraṇāsaḥ /
analyzed: satrāsāham vareṇyam sahaḥ dām sasavāṃsam svar apaḥ ca devīḥ    sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīm dyām uta imām indram madanti anu dhīraṇāsaḥ  /
translated: The invincible, the excellent, the strength-bestowing, the winner of the light, of the waters, and of the heavenly plants, he who hath gained this earth and this heaven, the sages rejoice in Indra with their hymns.

original: sasāna atyām uta sūryam sasāna indraḥ sasāna puru bhojasam gām / hiraṇyayam uta bhogam sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryam varṇam āvat /
analyzed: sasāna atyām uta sūryam sasāna indraḥ sasāna puru bhojasam gām    hiraṇyayam uta bhogam sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryam varṇam āvat  /
translated: He won the horse, he won the sun, he won the cow who gives abundant food, Indra. He won the golden treasure, and, slaying the Dasyus, he won the Aryan race.

original: indraḥ oṣadhīḥ asanot ahāni vanaspatīn asanot antarikṣam / bibheda balam nunude vivācaḥ atha abhavat damitā abhikratūnām /
analyzed: indraḥ oṣadhīḥ asanot ahāni vanaspatīn asanot antarikṣam   bibheda balam nunude vivācaḥ atha abhavat damitā abhikratūnām  /
translated: Indra hath won the plants, the days, the forest trees, the atmosphere, hath rent the strength, and chased the wicked words. Then hath he been the tamer of the turbulent and those who fain would fight.

original: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau / śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau    śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām  /
translated: We will invoke auspicious Maghavan Indra, best of heroes in this fight for booty. The terrible One who hearkens to our call in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, and wins treasures.

original: ud u brahmāṇi airata śravasya indram samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha / ā yaḥ viśvāni śavasā tatāna upaśrotā me īvataḥ vacāṃsi /
analyzed: ud u brahmāṇi airata śravasya indram samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha   ā yaḥ viśvāni śavasā tatāna upaśrotā me īvataḥ vacāṃsi  /
translated: To Indra have the holy prayers been raised, to him the most renowned, to aid in war, O Vasishtba, He who with might hath spread out all things, who hearkens to my words of praise.

original: ayāmi ghoṣaḥ indra deva jāmiḥ irajyanta yat śurudhaḥ vivāci / nahi svam āyuḥ cikite janeṣu tāni id aṃhāṃsi ati parṣi asmān /
analyzed: ayāmi ghoṣaḥ indra deva jāmiḥ irajyanta yat śurudhaḥ vivāci   nahi svam āyuḥ cikite janeṣu tāni id aṃhāṃsi ati parṣi asmān  /
translated: The shout of battle, O thou God, O Indra, hath arisen, when the contending armies cry. For men reckon not their own life's length. Do thou, O Indra, lead us past all these distresses.

original: yuje ratham gaveṣaṇam haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ / vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvā indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī jaghanvān /
analyzed: yuje ratham gaveṣaṇam haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ   vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvā indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī jaghanvān  /
translated: Yoke thy car, O thou who seekest the kine, with the two Bay Horses: the holy prayers have come to thee who lovest them. He hath filled full the two world-halves with his greatness: Indra hath laid the Vr̥itras low, the mighty.

original: āpaḥ cit pipyuḥ staryaḥ na gāvaḥ nakṣan ṛtam jaritāraḥ te indra / yāhi vāyuḥ na niyutaḥ naḥ achā tvam hi dhībhiḥ dayase vi vājān /
analyzed: āpaḥ cit pipyuḥ staryaḥ na gāvaḥ nakṣan ṛtam jaritāraḥ te indra   yāhi vāyuḥ na niyutaḥ naḥ achā tvam hi dhībhiḥ dayase vi vājān  /
translated: Even the waters have waxed great like milch-kine: the singers have obtained thy truth, O Indra. Come to us with thy team as 'twere with Vâyu: for thou with hymns bestowest ample riches.

original: te tvā madāḥ indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇam tuvi rādhasam jaritre / ekaḥ devatrā dayase hi martān asmin śūra savane mādayasva /
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇam tuvi rādhasam jaritre    ekaḥ devatrā dayase hi martān asmin śūra savane mādayasva  /
translated: Let these libations gladden thee, O Indra, the strong, the bounteous, for the singer's praises. For thou alone, O Hero, lovest mortals: rejoice thee at this our Soma-pressing.

original: eva id indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum vasiṣṭhāsaḥ abhi arcanti arkaiḥ / sa naḥ stutaḥ vīravat dhātu gomat yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ /
analyzed: eva id indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum vasiṣṭhāsaḥ abhi arcanti arkaiḥ   sa naḥ stutaḥ vīravat dhātu gomat yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  /
translated: Even thus the Vasishṭhas with their lauds exalt Indra the mighty, thunder-armed. May he, when lauded, grant us wealth in heroes and in cattle. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ turāṣāh chuṣmī rājā vṛtra hā soma pāvā / yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsat arvāk mādhyaṃdine savane matsat indraḥ /
analyzed: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ turāṣāh chuṣmī rājā vṛtra hā soma pāvā    yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsat arvāk mādhyaṃdine savane matsat indraḥ  /
translated: The vigorous, the thunder-armed, the strong, the conqueror of foes, the mighty King, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the Soma-drinker, yoking his two Bay Horses, may Indra come to us, may he rejoice at the midday sacrifice.

original: indraḥ ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate asmin yajñe mandasānāḥ vṛṣaṇvasū / ā vām viśantu indavaḥ svābhuvaḥ asme rayim sarva vīram ni yacchatam /
analyzed: indraḥ ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate asmin yajñe mandasānāḥ vṛṣaṇvasū   ā vām viśantu indavaḥ svābhuvaḥ asme rayim sarva vīram ni yacchatam  /
translated: Indra and Soma, drink ye both, O Br̥ihaspati, in this our sacrifice, rejoicing, ye whose wealth is great. Let the libations enter you, easy to win: bestow upon us wealth with plenteous store of heroes.

original: ā vaḥ vahantu saptayaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ raghu patvānaḥ pra jigāta bāhubhiḥ / sīdata barhiḥ uru vaḥ sadaḥ kṛtam mādayadhvam marutaḥ madhvaḥ andhasaḥ /
analyzed: ā vaḥ vahantu saptayaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ raghu patvānaḥ pra jigāta bāhubhiḥ   sīdata barhiḥ uru vaḥ sadaḥ kṛtam mādayadhvam marutaḥ madhvaḥ andhasaḥ  /
translated: Let your swift-moving, swiftly-speeding horses bring you hitherward, O Maruts, with your arms. Sit on the grass: a wide seat hath been made for you. O Maruts, rejoice you in the sweet juice of the juice.

original: imam stomam arhate jātavedase ratham iva sam mahema manīṣayā / bhadrā hi naḥ pramatiḥ asya saṃsadi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava /
analyzed: imam stomam arhate jātavedase ratham iva sam mahema manīṣayā    bhadrā hi naḥ pramatiḥ asya saṃsadi agne sakhye mā riṣāma vayam tava  /
translated: This laud we will exalt with thought, as 'twere a chariot, to the God who knoweth all that live, For his good spirit in the synod is to us a blessing. O Agni, let us never suffer harm through thee.

original: a ebhiḥ agne sa ratham yāhi arvāk nānā ratham vā vibhavaḥ hi aśvāḥ / patnīvataḥ triṃśatam trīn ca devān anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva /
analyzed: a ebhiḥ agne sa ratham yāhi arvāk nānā ratham vā vibhavaḥ hi aśvāḥ    patnīvataḥ triṃśatam trīn ca devān anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva  /
translated: Come hither, O thou Agni, with these steeds of thine, either with those that move in troops or those that fly afar: Bring hitherward the thirty-three and three Gods, with their wives, and make them glad along the path they travel.

original: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kad cit bharantaḥ avasyavaḥ / vāje citram havāmahe / vāje citram havāmahe /
analyzed: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kad cit bharantaḥ avasyavaḥ   vāje citram havāmahe    vāje citram havāmahe
translated: We, O thou matchless One, with humble homage will bring thee, as 'twere a chariot, to our aid, To thee, O wondrous one, in fight we pray, to thee, O wondrous one, we pray.

original: upa tvā karman ūtaye sa naḥ yuvā ugraḥ cakrāma yaḥ dhṛṣat / tvām id hi avitāram vavṛmahe sakhāyaḥ indra sānasim /
analyzed: upa tvā karman ūtaye sa naḥ yuvā ugraḥ cakrāma yaḥ dhṛṣat    tvām id hi avitāram vavṛmahe sakhāyaḥ indra sānasim  /
translated: To thee, O God, for help in work, he, the young, the strong, hath come, who is bold. For we have chosen thee, O Indra, as our protector, O friend, who givest good things.

original: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe / sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye /🔽haryaśvam sat patim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata / ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe    sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye  / haryaśvam sat patim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata   ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam  /
translated: Him who hath brought us this and this aforetime as a boon, him will I praise for you, O friends, Indra, to aid.🔽Him who is the lord of the brave, the hero who conquers men, him who hath rejoiced, him will I praise for you, O friends, Indra, to aid.🔽Him who hath given to the lauding (men) a hundred head of cattle and horses, him will I praise for you, O friends, Indra, to aid.🔽I bring my thought to the most bountiful, the mighty, the mighty lord, to him of true strength, to the strong one,

original: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satya śuṣmāya tavase matim bhare / apām iva pravaṇe yasya durdharam rādhaḥ viśvāyu śavase apāvṛtam /
analyzed: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satya śuṣmāya tavase matim bhare    apām iva pravaṇe yasya durdharam rādhaḥ viśvāyu śavase apāvṛtam  /
translated: whose wealth, like the current of the waters, is hard to check, is open to all living beings, to his sway.🔽Let all thy wishes be fulfilled, O thou who hast oblations, as the waters (flow) to the lower ground,

original: adha te viśvam anu hāsat iṣṭayaḥ āpaḥ nimnā iva savanā haviṣmataḥ / yat parvate na samaśīta haryataḥ indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ //
analyzed: adha te viśvam anu hāsat iṣṭayaḥ āpaḥ nimnā iva savanā haviṣmataḥ   yat parvate na samaśīta haryataḥ indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ  /
translated: when the golden thunderbolt of Indra, terrible, was tempered like a mountain.

original: asmai bhīmāya namasā sam adhvaraḥ uṣaḥ na śubhraḥ ā bhara panīyase / yasya dhāma śravase nāma indriyam jyotiḥ akāri haritaḥ nāyase /
analyzed: asmai bhīmāya namasā sam adhvaraḥ uṣaḥ na śubhraḥ ā bhara panīyase    yasya dhāma śravase nāma indriyam jyotiḥ akāri haritaḥ nāyase  /
translated: To him, the terrible, bring the sacrifice with reverence, as the bright (priest) brings the offering to the guest. Whose glory, for fame, for power, for light, hath been made like a chariot to be driven.

original: ime te indra te vayam puruṣṭuta ye tvā ārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso / nahi tvat anyaḥ girvaṇaḥ giraḥ sadhat kṣoṇīḥ iva prati naḥ harya tat vacaḥ /🔽bhūri te indra vīryam tava smasi asya stotuḥ maghavan kāmam ā pṛṇa / anu te dyauḥ bṛhatī vīryam mama iyam ca te pṛthivī neme ojase /
analyzed: ime te indra te vayam puruṣṭuta ye tvā ārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso    nahi tvat anyaḥ girvaṇaḥ giraḥ sadhat kṣoṇīḥ iva prati naḥ harya tat vacaḥ  / bhūri te indra vīryam tava smasi asya stotuḥ maghavan kāmam ā pṛṇa   anu te dyauḥ bṛhatī vīryam mama iyam ca te pṛthivī neme ojase  /
translated: These, O Indra, are thine, O thou who art much invoked, we who, O Lord of much wealth, are engaged in serving thee. For none other than thou, O lover of song, is there a place for the songs. As for the regions, so for this speech of ours.🔽Great is thy manly power, O Indra; we are thine. Fulfil, O bountiful one, the wish of this thy praiser. The lofty heaven, O Indra, and this earth are thine for thy mighty power.

original: tvam tam indra parvatam mahām urum vajreṇa vajrin parvaśas cakartitha / avāsṛjaḥ nivṛtāḥ sartavai apaḥ satrā viśvam dadhiṣe kevalam sahaḥ //
analyzed: tvam tam indra parvatam mahām urum vajreṇa vajrin parvaśas cakartitha    avāsṛjaḥ nivṛtāḥ sartavai apaḥ satrā viśvam dadhiṣe kevalam sahaḥ  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, with thy bolt, O thou who hast the bolt, hast shattered that great and wide mountain piecemeal. Thou hast let loose the waters that were shut up for the course (of the sun). Thou hast ever in thy possession all power.

original: udaprutaḥ na vayaḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ vāvadataḥ abhriyasya iva ghoṣāḥ / giri bhrajaḥ na ūrmayaḥ madantaḥ bṛhaspatim abhi arkāḥ anāvan //
analyzed: udaprutaḥ na vayaḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ vāvadataḥ abhriyasya iva ghoṣāḥ   giri bhrajaḥ na ūrmayaḥ madantaḥ bṛhaspatim abhi arkāḥ anāvan  /
translated: Like birds that fly up, like the sounds of one in the clouds that speaks, like the waves of a mountain torrent that delight, the hymns have sung forth to Brihaspati.

original: sam gobhiḥ aṅgirasaḥ nakṣamāṇaḥ bhagaḥ iva id aryamaṇam nināya / jane mitraḥ na dampatī anakti bṛhaspate vājayāśūṃr iva ājau /
analyzed: sam gobhiḥ aṅgirasaḥ nakṣamāṇaḥ bhagaḥ iva id aryamaṇam nināya   jane mitraḥ na dampatī anakti bṛhaspate vājayāśūṃr iva ājau  /
translated: The Angirases, seeking with the kine, brought Aryaman to Bhaga, as it were, to the guest. As a friend, Mitra, anoints the husband and wife in the people. O Brhaspati, the horses in the battle.

original: sādhvaryāḥ atithinīḥ iṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇāḥ anavadya rūpāḥ / bṛhaspatiḥ parvatebhyaḥ vitūryāḥ niḥ gāḥ ūpe yavam iva sthivibhyaḥ /🔽āpruṣāyat madhunā ṛtasya yonim avakṣipan arkaḥ ulkām iva dyoḥ / bṛhaspatiḥ uddharan aśmanaḥ gāḥ bhūmyāḥ udnā iva vi tvacam bibheda /
analyzed: sādhvaryāḥ atithinīḥ iṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇāḥ anavadya rūpāḥ   bṛhaspatiḥ parvatebhyaḥ vitūryāḥ niḥ gāḥ ūpe yavam iva sthivibhyaḥ  / āpruṣāyat madhunā ṛtasya yonim avakṣipan arkaḥ ulkām iva dyoḥ    bṛhaspatiḥ uddharan aśmanaḥ gāḥ bhūmyāḥ udnā iva vi tvacam bibheda  /
translated: The virtuous, the hospitable, the powerful, the desirable, the well-formed, of irreproachable beauty, Brhaspati, having driven the cows from the mountains, brought them forth like barley from the husks.🔽He who has sprinkled the womb of holy order with honey, like a spark of fire from the sky, Brhaspati, drawing the cows from the stone, as from a trough, cleft the skin of the earth.

original: apa jyotiṣā tamaḥ antarikṣat udnaḥ śīpālam iva vātaḥ ājat / bṛhaspatiḥ anumṛśyā valasyā abhram iva vātaḥ ā cakre ā gāḥ /
analyzed: apa jyotiṣā tamaḥ antarikṣat udnaḥ śīpālam iva vātaḥ ājat    bṛhaspatiḥ anumṛśyā valasyā abhram iva vātaḥ ā cakre ā gāḥ  /
translated: He who has driven away the darkness with light from the atmosphere, like the wind a lotus from the water, Brhaspati, having touched the cow with his mind, brought the cows, like the wind a cloud, to the people.

original: yadā valasya pīyataḥ jasum bhet bṛhaspatiḥ agni tapobhiḥ arkaiḥ / dadbhiḥ na jihvā pariviṣṭam ādat āvis nidhīṃr akṛṇot usriyāṇām /
analyzed: yadā valasya pīyataḥ jasum bhet bṛhaspatiḥ agni tapobhiḥ arkaiḥ   dadbhiḥ na jihvā pariviṣṭam ādat āvis nidhīṃr akṛṇot usriyāṇām  /
translated: When Brhaspati with the heat of Agni and the hymns of the Arka broke the strength of Vala, when he seized with his teeth what was enclosed by the tongue, he revealed the treasures of the cows.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ amata hi tyad āsām nāma svarīṇām sadane guhā yat / āṇḍā iva bhitvā śakunasya garbham ud usriyāḥ parvatasya tmanā ajat /🔽aśnā apinaddham madhu pari apaśyat matsyam na dīnaḥ udani kṣiyantam / niḥ tat jabhāra camasam na vṛkṣāt bṛhaspatiḥ viraveṇa vikṛtya /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ amata hi tyad āsām nāma svarīṇām sadane guhā yat    āṇḍā iva bhitvā śakunasya garbham ud usriyāḥ parvatasya tmanā ajat  / aśnā apinaddham madhu pari apaśyat matsyam na dīnaḥ udani kṣiyantam   niḥ tat jabhāra camasam na vṛkṣāt bṛhaspatiḥ viraveṇa vikṛtya  /
translated: Brihaspati hath thought upon the name of these, the names of those who sing aloud in secret, When, like the egg of bird, he cleft the womb of the mountain, and forth came the bright cows in their own nature.🔽He saw the honey wrapped in skins, as a fish lying in the deep, and he brought it forth, like a bowl from a tree, by his loud roar, Brihaspati, having rent it open.

original: sa uṣām avindat sa svar saḥ agnim saḥ arkeṇa vi babādhe tamāṃsi / bṛhaspatiḥ go vapuṣaḥ valasya niḥ majjānam na parvaṇaḥ jabhāra //🔽himā iva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinā akṛpayat valaḥ gāḥ / anānukṛtyam apunar cakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mithas uccarātaḥ /
analyzed: sa uṣām avindat sa svar saḥ agnim saḥ arkeṇa vi babādhe tamāṃsi   bṛhaspatiḥ go vapuṣaḥ valasya niḥ majjānam na parvaṇaḥ jabhāra  / himā iva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinā akṛpayat valaḥ gāḥ   anānukṛtyam apunar cakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mithas uccarātaḥ  /
translated: He found the Dawn, he found the light, he found the fire, and with the sun he drove away the darkness. Brihaspati, with his loud roar, brought forth the marrow from the joint of Vala, as he lay in the form of a cow.🔽As the frost destroys the leaves of the trees, so Brihaspati destroyed Vala's cows, and made them helpless. He made them helpless, so that they could not return, so that the sun and moon might rise and set alternately.

original: abhi śyāvam na kṛśanebhiḥ aśvam nakṣatrebhiḥ pitaraḥ dyām apiṃśan / rātryām tamaḥ adadhuḥ jyotiḥ ahan bṛhaspatiḥ bhinat adrim vidat gāḥ /
analyzed: abhi śyāvam na kṛśanebhiḥ aśvam nakṣatrebhiḥ pitaraḥ dyām apiṃśan   rātryām tamaḥ adadhuḥ jyotiḥ ahan bṛhaspatiḥ bhinat adrim vidat gāḥ  /
translated: The Fathers, with the dark horse, with the black skins, with the stars, have filled the heaven. They have put darkness in the night, and light in the day. Brihaspati cleft the rock, and found the cows.

original: idam akarma namaḥ abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīḥ anu ānonavīti / bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ saḥ aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sa nṛbhiḥ naḥ vayaḥ dhāt /
analyzed: idam akarma namaḥ abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīḥ anu ānonavīti   bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ saḥ aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sa nṛbhiḥ naḥ vayaḥ dhāt  /
translated: This is the rite of worship for the cloud, which follows many a one and makes them glad. May Br̥ihaspati, he who is rich in kine and steeds and heroes, grant us life with men.

original: achā me indram matayaḥ svarvidaḥ sadhrīcīḥ viśvāḥ uśatīḥ anūṣata / pari svajante janayaḥ yathā patim maryam na śundhyum maghavānam ūtaye /
analyzed: achā me indram matayaḥ svarvidaḥ sadhrīcīḥ viśvāḥ uśatīḥ anūṣata    pari svajante janayaḥ yathā patim maryam na śundhyum maghavānam ūtaye  /
translated: My hymns have sought to Indra, seeking heaven, all, longing for him, have sung aloud together. As the young maidens deck them for their husband, so have the people decked the bounteous hero.

original: na ghā tvadrik apa veti me manaḥ tve id kāmam puruhūta śiśraya / rājā iva dasma ni sadaḥ adhi barhiṣi asmin su some avapānam astu te /
analyzed: na ghā tvadrik apa veti me manaḥ tve id kāmam puruhūta śiśraya   rājā iva dasma ni sadaḥ adhi barhiṣi asmin su some avapānam astu te  /
translated: My mind, O thou who hast the thunder, never turns away from thee: in thee, O thou whom many invoke, I place my hope. As a king, O wondrous one, sit on the sacred grass: here be thy drinking of the fair-pressed Soma juice.

original: viṣūvṛt indraḥ amuteḥ uta kṣudhaḥ saḥ id rāyaḥ maghavā vasvaḥ īśate / tasya id ime pravaṇe sapta sindhavaḥ vayaḥ vardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ /
analyzed: viṣūvṛt indraḥ amuteḥ uta kṣudhaḥ saḥ id rāyaḥ maghavā vasvaḥ īśate    tasya id ime pravaṇe sapta sindhavaḥ vayaḥ vardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ  /
translated: Indra, who turns away from want and from distress, he, Maghavan, is Lord of wealth and of good things. To him these seven rivers in their downward course send forth their stream, to strengthen the strong Bull's vigour.

original: vayaḥ na vṛkṣam su palāśam āsadan somāsaḥ indram mandinaḥ camūṣadaḥ / pra eṣām anīkam śavasā davidyutat vidat svar manave jyotiḥ āryam //
analyzed: vayaḥ na vṛkṣam su palāśam āsadan somāsaḥ indram mandinaḥ camūṣadaḥ    pra eṣām anīkam śavasā davidyutat vidat svar manave jyotiḥ āryam  /
translated: The gladdening Somas, dropping in the wooden vats, have sat them down upon the tree with goodly foliage. The people have beheld his form that shines with power: he hath discovered heaven, the light that is most excellent for man.

original: kṛtam na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargam yat maghavā sūryam jayat / na tat te anyaḥ anu vīryam śakat na purāṇaḥ maghavan na uta nūtanaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtam na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargam yat maghavā sūryam jayat    na tat te anyaḥ anu vīryam śakat na purāṇaḥ maghavan na uta nūtanaḥ  /
translated: The bitch of heaven does not pick out the stake, when Maghavan, winning the sun, won the prize. None other than thee can equal this thy deed, neither the ancient nor the modern, O Maghavan.

original: viśam viśam maghavā pari aśāyata janānām dhenāḥ avacākaśat vṛṣā / yasya aha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati sa tīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ /
analyzed: viśam viśam maghavā pari aśāyata janānām dhenāḥ avacākaśat vṛṣā    yasya aha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati sa tīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ  /
translated: Maghavan hath lain down in every people's house: the Bull hath looked upon the people's songs of praise. He whom the strong, the mighty, in the Soma draughts delights, with the strong Somas conquers the foemen.

original: āpaḥ na sindhum abhi yat samakṣaran somāsaḥ indram kulyāḥ iva hradam / vardhanti viprāḥ mahaḥ asya sādane yavam na vṛṣṭiḥ divyena dānunā /🔽vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayat rajaḥsu ā yaḥ arya patnīḥ akṛṇot imāḥ apaḥ / sa sunvate maghavā jīra dānave avindat jyotiḥ manave haviṣmate /
analyzed: āpaḥ na sindhum abhi yat samakṣaran somāsaḥ indram kulyāḥ iva hradam   vardhanti viprāḥ mahaḥ asya sādane yavam na vṛṣṭiḥ divyena dānunā  / vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayat rajaḥsu ā yaḥ arya patnīḥ akṛṇot imāḥ apaḥ    sa sunvate maghavā jīra dānave avindat jyotiḥ manave haviṣmate  /
translated: As waters flow to the sea, as rills to the lake, so the Soma juices have flowed to Indra. The sages have increased his greatness in his seat, as the rain with the heavenly moisture the corn.🔽Like a bull in wrath he hath moved through the regions, he who hath made these waters the wives of the noble. He hath found light for the worshipper, for Manu, the bountiful, the liberal, Maghavan.

original: ud jāyatām paraśu jyotiṣā saha bhūyāḥ ṛtasya su dughā purāṇavat / vi rocatām aruṣaḥ bhānunā śuciḥ svar na śukram śuśucīta satpatiḥ /
analyzed: ud jāyatām paraśu jyotiṣā saha bhūyāḥ ṛtasya su dughā purāṇavat    vi rocatām aruṣaḥ bhānunā śuciḥ svar na śukram śuśucīta satpatiḥ  /
translated: Let the axe spring forth with the light: let the milch-cow of holy order yield as of old. Let the red light shine forth with splendour, pure: let the pure lord of the true shine forth like heaven.

original: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām / vayam rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām    vayam rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema  /
translated: With cattle may we pass over want and evil want, with barley every hunger, O Most-longed-For. May we, with princes, win the first prize-stuffs by this our winning.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghāyoḥ / indraḥ purastāt uta madhyataḥ naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghāyoḥ   indraḥ purastāt uta madhyataḥ naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu  /
translated: May Br̥ihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from the treacherous foe. May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya / dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya    dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  /
translated: Ye twain, O Br̥ihaspati and Indra, are Lords of the heavenly and of the earthly treasure. Grant riches even to the singer who is poor. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: vayam u tvā taditarthāḥ indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ / kaṇvāḥ ukthebhiḥ jarante /
analyzed: vayam u tvā taditarthāḥ indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ   kaṇvāḥ ukthebhiḥ jarante  /
translated: We, O Indra, with this object, we thy friends who strive to win thee, the Kaṇvas with our lauds, serve thee.

original: na gha īm anyat ā papana vajrin apasaḥ naviṣṭau / tava id u stomam ciketa /
analyzed: na gha īm anyat ā papana vajrin apasaḥ naviṣṭau   tava id u stomam ciketa  /
translated: Not otherwise, O Thunderer, in this our need, will I seek thee: I have known thy praise.

original: ichanti devāḥ sunvantam na svapnāya spṛhayanti / yanti pramādam atandrāḥ /
analyzed: ichanti devāḥ sunvantam na svapnāya spṛhayanti   yanti pramādam atandrāḥ
translated: The Gods desire him who sheds the juice: they do not long for sleep. They, ever watchful, come to him who is remiss.

original: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ vṛṣan / viddhi tu asya naḥ vaso /
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ abhi pra nonumaḥ vṛṣan   viddhi tu asya naḥ vaso
translated: We, O Indra, fain to win thee, O most mighty One, have sung aloud to thee. Mark thou this prayer of ours, O Vasu.

original: mā naḥ nide ca vaktave aryaḥ randhīḥ arāvne / tve api kratuḥ mama /🔽tvam varmā asi saprathaḥ puroyodhaḥ ca vṛtrahan / tvayā prati bruve yujā /
analyzed: mā naḥ nide ca vaktave aryaḥ randhīḥ arāvne   tve api kratuḥ mama  / tvam varmā asi saprathaḥ puroyodhaḥ ca vṛtrahan    tvayā prati bruve yujā  /
translated: Do not give up the man who reviles us, the wicked man who injures us. In thee is my will.🔽Thou art the armour, the wide protection, the champion in the van, O Vr̥itra-slayer. With thee for my ally I speak with confidence.

original: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca / indra tvā vartayāmasi //
analyzed: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca    indra tvā vartayāmasi
translated: For the slaying of Vritra, for the strength that conquers in the war, O Indra, we direct thee.

original: arvācīnam su te manaḥ uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato / indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ /
analyzed: arvācīnam su te manaḥ uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato    indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ  /
translated: Thy spirit and thine eye, O thou of a hundred powers, be turned hitherward. Let the priests make them so, O Indra.

original: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ īmahe / indra abhimātiṣāhye //
analyzed: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ īmahe   indra abhimātiṣāhye  /
translated: We invoke thee, O Indra, with all our songs, by the names of thee, O thou of a hundred powers, to aid us in our battles.

original: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi / indrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ /🔽indram vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve / bhareṣu vājasātaye /
analyzed: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi   indrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ  indram vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve    bhareṣu vājasātaye
translated: With the glories of him who is much invoked we magnify Indra, the upholder of the people.🔽I call on Indra, invoked of many, to slay Vr̥itra, to win us strength in battles.

original: vājeṣu sāsahiḥ bhava tvām īmahe śatakrato / indra vṛtrāya hantave /🔽dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravaḥsu ca / indra sākṣva abhimātiṣu /
analyzed: vājeṣu sāsahiḥ bhava tvām īmahe śatakrato    indra vṛtrāya hantave  / dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravaḥsu ca    indra sākṣva abhimātiṣu
translated: Be thou invincible in our battles. Thee, O thou of a hundred powers, we implore, O Indra, to slay Vr̥itra.🔽In glories, in the war's exultation, in the strife for fame, and in our battles, O Indra, be thou near to us.

original: śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim / indra somam śatakrato /
analyzed: śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim   indra somam śatakrato  /
translated: Guard thou the most impetuous, the most glorious, the watchful one, the Soma, O Indra, O thou of a hundred powers.

original: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu / indra tāni te ā vṛṇe /🔽agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram / ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi //
analyzed: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu   indra tāni te ā vṛṇe  / agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram    ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi  /
translated: O Indra, the hundred powers which thou hast given to the five peoples, O thou of a hundred powers, I choose those powers of thine.🔽O Indra, thou hast won great glory: win thou also invincible might. We exalt thy strength.

original: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atha u śakra parāvataḥ / u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi //
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atha u śakra parāvataḥ   u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi  /
translated: Come thou unto us from afar, O Indra, and also from near at hand, O Sakra. Come hither, O Indra, from that place, O thou of the thunderbolt, where thou art now.

original: indraḥ aṅgam mahat bhayam abhi sat apa cucyavat / sa hi sthiraḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ aṅgam mahat bhayam abhi sat apa cucyavat   sa hi sthiraḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Indra hath become a great and terrible terror: he hath overcome the foe, for he is firm and very mighty.

original: indraḥ ca mṛlayāti naḥ na naḥ paścāt agham naśat / bhadram bhavāti naḥ puras /
analyzed: indraḥ ca mṛlayāti naḥ na naḥ paścāt agham naśat   bhadram bhavāti naḥ puras
translated: Indra will be gracious unto us: let not sin lurk behind us. He will be gracious unto us in front.

original: indraḥ āśābhyaḥ pari sarvābhyaḥ abhayam karat / jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ āśābhyaḥ pari sarvābhyaḥ abhayam karat jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Indra from all the regions hath made us free from fear. The very mighty one shall conquer the foes.

original: ni u su vācam pra mahe bharāmahe giraḥ indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ / nu cit hi ratnam sasatām iva avidat na duṣṭutiḥ draviṇaḥ deṣu śasyate /
analyzed: ni u su vācam pra mahe bharāmahe giraḥ indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ   nu cit hi ratnam sasatām iva avidat na duṣṭutiḥ draviṇaḥ deṣu śasyate  /
translated: We will bring hitherward, to Vivasvan's son, to Indra, in his seat, our song and our fair hymn. For he hath found the treasure, as 'twere of those who sit at home: not fruitless is the praise of him who hath great wealth.

original: duraḥ aśvasya duraḥ indra goḥ asi duraḥ yavasya vasunaḥ inaḥ patiḥ / śikṣānaraḥ pradivaḥ akāma karśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ tam idam gṛṇīmasi //
analyzed: duraḥ aśvasya duraḥ indra goḥ asi duraḥ yavasya vasunaḥ inaḥ patiḥ   śikṣānaraḥ pradivaḥ akāma karśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ tam idam gṛṇīmasi  /
translated: The Friend of friends, who gives his gifts at will, who rules the men, who scorns the niggard, him we praise.🔽Most splendid, Indra, bounteous Lord, with these thy powers, with these thy beams, art thou surrounded on all sides with wealth.

original: śacīvas indra puru kṛt dyumattama tava id idam abhitas cekite vasu / atas saṃgṛbhya abhibhūtaḥ ā bhara mā tvāyataḥ jarituḥ kāmam ūnayīḥ /
analyzed: śacīvas indra puru kṛt dyumattama tava id idam abhitas cekite vasu   atas saṃgṛbhya abhibhūtaḥ ā bhara mā tvāyataḥ jarituḥ kāmam ūnayīḥ  /
translated: From this, O thou who gatherest up, O thou who overcomest, bring and give us. Do not thou disappoint the hope of thy worshipper who lauds thee.🔽With these thy powers, O thou of wondrous help, with these thy beams, driving away want with kine and horses,

original: ebhiḥ dyubhiḥ sumanāḥ ebhiḥ indubhiḥ nirundhānaḥ amatim gobhiḥ aśvinā / indreṇa dasyum darayantaḥ indubhiḥ yuta dveṣasaḥ sam iṣā rabhemahi //
analyzed: ebhiḥ dyubhiḥ sumanāḥ ebhiḥ indubhiḥ nirundhānaḥ amatim gobhiḥ aśvinā    indreṇa dasyum darayantaḥ indubhiḥ yuta dveṣasaḥ sam iṣā rabhemahi  /
translated: With Indra, with the beams, subduing the Dasyus, may we, united, win us food and hatred.🔽With wealth, O Indra, with food may we be united, with spoil, O thou of wondrous bounty, with lightnings.

original: sam indra rāyā sam iṣā rabhemahi sam vājebhiḥ puru ścandraiḥ abhidyubhiḥ / sam devyā pramatyā vīra śuṣmayā go agrayā aśvāvatyā rabhemahi //
analyzed: sam indra rāyā sam iṣā rabhemahi sam vājebhiḥ puru ścandraiḥ abhidyubhiḥ    sam devyā pramatyā vīra śuṣmayā go agrayā aśvāvatyā rabhemahi  /
translated: With the celestial favouring of thee, O thou of hero strength, with that which hath kine and horses, may we be united.🔽Those gladdening draughts have gladdened thee, those powers of thine, O Lord of the brave, those Soma juices in the battles with Vr̥itra,

original: te tvā madāḥ amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāsaḥ vṛtra hatyeṣu satpate / yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇi aprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ //
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāsaḥ vṛtra hatyeṣu satpate    yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇi aprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ  /
translated: When thou for Kārva, for the worshipper, slewest ten Vritras, and for the worshipper a thousand.

original: yudhā yudham upa gha id eṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puram sam idam haṃsi ojasā / namyā yat indra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayaḥ namucim nāma māyinam /
analyzed: yudhā yudham upa gha id eṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puram sam idam haṃsi ojasā   namyā yat indra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayaḥ namucim nāma māyinam  /
translated: In fight after fight thou goest forth to battle, and with thy might thou breakest down each castle. When thou, O Indra, with thy friend from afar, slewest Namuci the sorcerer, the worshipper.

original: tvam karañjam uta parṇayam vadhīḥ tejiṣṭhayā atithigvasya vartanī / tvam śatā vaṅgṛdasya abhinat puraḥ anānudaḥ pariṣūtāḥ ṛjiśvanā /
analyzed: tvam karañjam uta parṇayam vadhīḥ tejiṣṭhayā atithigvasya vartanī   tvam śatā vaṅgṛdasya abhinat puraḥ anānudaḥ pariṣūtāḥ ṛjiśvanā  /
translated: Thou slewest Karambha and Parṇaya, with the keenest dart of Atithigva. Thou, O Indra, with Ṛjiśvan's aid, didst overthrow the ninety forts of Vaṅgṛida, the forts that none might burst.

original: tvam etām jana rājñaḥ dvis daśā bandhunā suśravasā upajagmuṣaḥ / ṣaṣṭim sahasrā navatim nava śrutaḥ ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadā avṛṇak /
analyzed: tvam etām jana rājñaḥ dvis daśā bandhunā suśravasā upajagmuṣaḥ   ṣaṣṭim sahasrā navatim nava śrutaḥ ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadā avṛṇak  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, with thy friend, with thy great glory, didst aid the two and ten kings who came to thee. Thou, O Indra, with thy wheel, with thy car, didst crush the nine-and-ninety thousand Dushpras.
