original: tvam āvitha suśravasam tava ūtibhiḥ tava trāmabhiḥ indra tūrvayāṇam / tva asmai kutsam atithigvam āyum mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ //
analyzed: tvam āvitha suśravasam tava ūtibhiḥ tava trāmabhiḥ indra tūrvayāṇam    tva asmai kutsam atithigvam āyum mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, with thy help, with thy great succours, didst help the son of Tūrva, Sushravâsa. Thou, O Indra, for the young king, for the mighty, for the king who needeth none to guide him, didst give Kutsa, Atithigva, and Âyu.

original: yaḥ udṛci indra deva gopāḥ sakhāyaḥ te śivatamāḥ asāma / tvām stoṣāma tvayā su vīrāḥ drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ udṛci indra deva gopāḥ sakhāyaḥ te śivatamāḥ asāma    tvām stoṣāma tvayā su vīrāḥ drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ  /
translated: O Indra, may we be the friends of him who hath thee for his guardian in the fight, the most auspicious friends of thee. We will praise thee, O Indra, through thee, with good heroes, prolonging our life, bestowing a refuge.

original: abhi tvā vṛṣabhā sute sutam sṛjāmi pītaye / tṛmpā vi aśnuhi madam /
analyzed: abhi tvā vṛṣabha sute sutam sṛjāmi pītaye   tṛmpā vi aśnuhi madam
translated: I pour the juice for thee, O Bull, the juice that hath been pressed for thee, to drink. Quaff thou the gladdening draught.

original: mā tvā mūrāḥ aviṣyavaḥ mā upahasvānaḥ ā dabhan / mākīm brahma dviṣaḥ vanaḥ //
analyzed: mā tvā mūrāḥ aviṣyavaḥ mā upahasvānaḥ ā dabhan mākīm brahma dviṣaḥ vanaḥ
translated: Let not the foolish, nor the spiteful, nor the revilers harm thee, nor the Brahmans who hate prayer.

original: iha tvā goparīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase / saraḥ gauraḥ yathā piba /
analyzed: iha tvā goparīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase    saraḥ gauraḥ yathā piba
translated: Here let the milk-fed calves delight thee for the great enjoyment of the juice: drink as a bull drinks in a lake.

original: abhi pra gopatim girā indram arca yathā vide / sūnum satyasya satpatim /
analyzed: abhi pra gopatim girā indram arca yathā vide    sūnum satyasya satpatim  /
translated: Praise thou with song the Lord of kine, Indra, as one who knoweth him, the Son of Truth, the Lord of light.

original: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire aruṣīḥ adhi barhiṣi / yatra abhi saṃnavāmahe //
analyzed: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire aruṣīḥ adhi barhiṣi   yatra abhi saṃnavāmahe  /
translated: The ruddy coursers have been loosed upon the sacred grass, where we shall meet together.

original: indrāya gāvaḥ āśiram duduhre vajriṇe madhu / yat sīm upahvare vidat /
analyzed: indrāya gāvaḥ āśiram duduhre vajriṇe madhu   yat sīm upahvare vidat  /
translated: The milch-kine have for Indra, for the wielder of the bolt, shed forth the meath that gladdens him, which he hath found on high.

original: ā tū naḥ indra madryak ghuvānaḥ soma pītaye / haribhyām yāhi adrivas /
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra madryak ghuvānaḥ soma pītaye   haribhyām yāhi adrivas  /
translated: Come hither unto us, O Indra, much-invoked, on thy two Bays, O Thunderer, to drink the Soma.

original: sattaḥ hotā naḥ ṛtviyaḥ tistire barhiḥ ānuṣak / ayujran prātar adrayaḥ /
analyzed: sattaḥ hotā naḥ ṛtviyaḥ tistire barhiḥ ānuṣak   ayujran prātar adrayaḥ
translated: Sit as our Priest, O thou who knowest, on the sacred grass, and order duly all the rites. The stones have been adjusted.

original: imāḥ brahma brahma vāhaḥ kriyante ā barhiḥ sīda / vīhi śūra purolāśam /
analyzed: imāḥ brahma brahma vāhaḥ kriyante ā barhiḥ sīda    vīhi śūra purolāśam
translated: These holy prayers, O thou who bringest prayer, are offered up: sit on the sacred grass. Come, Hero, to the sacrificial cake.

original: rārandhi savaneṣu naḥ eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan / uktheṣu indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: rārandhi savaneṣu naḥ eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan    uktheṣu indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Be pleased with our libations, Vritra-slayer, with these our hymns, with our lauds, O Indra, Lord of the Bay Steeds.

original: matayaḥ soma pām urum rihanti śavasaḥ patim / indram vatsam na mātaraḥ /
analyzed: matayaḥ soma pām urum rihanti śavasaḥ patim   indram vatsam na mātaraḥ
translated: The songs caress the Lord of Strength, the vast, the drinker of the juice, Indra, as mother-cows their calf.

original: sa mandasva hi andhasaḥ rādhase tanvā mahe / na stotāram nide karaḥ //
analyzed: sa mandasva hi andhasaḥ rādhase tanvā mahe   na stotāram nide karaḥ  /
translated: So, for the sake of ample wealth, rejoice thee in the juice, O thou of mighty form: give not thy praiser up to scorn.

original: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ jarāmahe / uta tvam asmayuḥ vaso /🔽māre asmat vi mumucaḥ hari priya arvāṅ yāhi / indra svadhāvas matsva iha /
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ jarāmahe    uta tvam asmayuḥ vaso   mā āre asmat vi mumucaḥ hari priya arvāṅ yāhi   indra svadhāvas matsva iha
translated: We, Indra, fain for thee, with gifts have waxed strong: thou also, O good Lord, art fain for us.

original: arvāñcam tvā sukhe rathe vahatām indra keśinā / ghṛtasnū barhiḥ āsade /
analyzed: arvāñcam tvā sukhe rathe vahatām indra keśinā    ghṛtasnū barhiḥ āsade  /
translated: From far away deliver us from trouble: come hitherward, O much-invoked! O thou whom Bay Steeds carry, Indra, on a car that brings delight, to sit on sacred grass with streams of oil.

original: upa naḥ sutam ā gahi somam indra gavāśiram / haribhyām yaḥ te asmayuḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ sutam ā gahi somam indra gavāśiram    haribhyām yaḥ te asmayuḥ  /
translated: Come to the juice we shed for thee, to Soma, Indra, blent with milk, which, borne by tawny coursers, is thine own.

original: tam indra madam ā gahi barhiṣṭhām grāvabhiḥ sutam / kuvid nu asya tṛpṇavaḥ /
analyzed: tam indra madam ā gahi barhiṣṭhām grāvabhiḥ sutam    kuvid nu asya tṛpṇavaḥ  /
translated: To this, O Indra, come thou nigh, the draught most rich in sweets, effused with stones: wilt thou not be satisfied therewith?

original: indram itthā giraḥ mama achāguḥ iṣitāḥ itas / āvṛte soma pītaye /
analyzed: indram itthā giraḥ mama achāguḥ iṣitāḥ itas    āvṛte soma pītaye  /
translated: My songs have hastened hitherward to Indra, to be his guests: to him who sits within the house, to drink the Soma, to be glorified.

original: indram somasya pītaye stomaiḥ iha havāmahe / ukthebhiḥ kuvid āgamat /
analyzed: indram somasya pītaye stomaiḥ iha havāmahe    ukthebhiḥ kuvid āgamat  /
translated: To Indra with our lauds we call him hitherward to drink the juice of Soma here: will he not come unto our hymns?

original: indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato / jathare vājinīvaso /
analyzed: indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato    jathare vājinīvaso  /
translated: O Indra, these libations of the juice are shed: accept them, O thou of a hundred powers, in thy capacious throat, O thou who hast the spoil within thy grasp.

original: vidma hi tvā dhanaṃjayam vājeṣu dadhṛṣam kave / adha te sumnam īmahe /
analyzed: vidma hi tvā dhanaṃjayam vājeṣu dadhṛṣam kave    adha te sumnam īmahe  /
translated: For we have known thee, O thou who art to be praised in song, as the conqueror in battles, O wise one, as daring. We seek thy favour.

original: imam indra gavāśiram yavāśiram ca naḥ piba / āgatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam /
analyzed: imam indra gavāśiram yavāśiram ca naḥ piba   āgatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam  /
translated: Drink this, O Indra, which hath been pressed for thee, the draught which hath the smell of barley and of milk, coming as a bull.

original: tubhyaḥ id indra sve okye somam codāmi pītaye / eṣa rārantu te hṛdi //🔽tvām sutasya pītaye pratnam indra havāmahe / kuśikāsaḥ avasyavaḥ /
analyzed: tubhyaḥ id indra sve okye somam codāmi pītaye   eṣa rārantu te hṛdi  / tvām sutasya pītaye pratnam indra havāmahe    kuśikāsaḥ avasyavaḥ
translated: To thee, O Indra, in thine own abode I urge the Soma to be drunk. May this delight thy heart.🔽We, the ancient ones, O Indra, the Kuṣikas, call thee to the drinking of the juice.

original: aśvāvati prathamaḥ goṣu gacchati suprāvīḥ indra martyaḥ tava ūtibhiḥ / tam id pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhum āpaḥ yathā abhitas vicetasaḥ /
analyzed: aśvāvati prathamaḥ goṣu gacchati suprāvīḥ indra martyaḥ tava ūtibhiḥ   tam id pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhum āpaḥ yathā abhitas vicetasaḥ  /
translated: He who hath many horses, first of all obtains cattle, the mortal man, O Indra, through thy help. Him thou fillest with wealth more abundant, as the waters fill the ocean on every side.

original: āpaḥ na devīḥ upa yanti hotriyam avaḥ paśyanti vitatam yathā rajaḥ / prācais devāsaḥ pra nayanti devayum brahma priyam joṣayante varāḥ iva /
analyzed: āpaḥ na devīḥ upa yanti hotriyam avaḥ paśyanti vitatam yathā rajaḥ    prācais devāsaḥ pra nayanti devayum brahma priyam joṣayante varāḥ iva  /
translated: The divine waters approach the Hotri priest, and look on the extended sacrifice as on the region of the sky. The gods lead forward him who is devoted to them. They accept the Brahman, as if they were the boons.

original: adhi dvayoḥ adadhāḥ ukthyam vacaḥ yata srucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ / a saṃyattaḥ vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktiḥ yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: adhi dvayoḥ adadhāḥ ukthyam vacaḥ yata srucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ   a saṃyattaḥ vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktiḥ yajamānāya sunvate  /
translated: Thou hast placed the hymn-worthy word in the two (priests), who, the pair, offer to thee with uplifted ladles. He who is not joined to thee in thy vow dwells in peace and prospers. A good power is to the sacrificer who presses (the Soma).

original: āt aṅgirāḥ prathamam dadhire vayaḥ iddha agnayaḥ śamyāḥ ye su kṛtyayā / sarvam paṇeḥ sam avindanta bhojanam aśvāvantam gomantam ā paśum naraḥ /
analyzed: āt aṅgirāḥ prathamam dadhire vayaḥ iddha agnayaḥ śamyāḥ ye su kṛtyayā   sarvam paṇeḥ sam avindanta bhojanam aśvāvantam gomantam ā paśum naraḥ  /
translated: The Angirases first obtained life, they who had kindled fire, they who were skilled in good works. They found all food in the house of wealth, men, cattle, and all kinds of wealth.

original: yajñaiḥ atharvā prathamaḥ pathaḥ tate tatas sūryaḥ vrata pāḥ venaḥ ājani / ā gāḥ ājat uśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātam amṛtam yajāmahe /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ atharvā prathamaḥ pathaḥ tate tatas sūryaḥ vrata pāḥ venaḥ ājani   ā gāḥ ājat uśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātam amṛtam yajāmahe  /
translated: With sacrifices, first of all, Atharvan spread out the path. From him was born Sûrya, the guardian of vows, Vena. Together with him came the cow, the immortal one. We worship the one born of Yama.🔽When the grass is strewn for the sake of good offspring, or the hymn is proclaimed in the sky,

original: barhiḥ vā yat su apatyāya vṛjyate arkaḥ vā ślokam āghoṣate divi / grāvā yatra vadati karuḥ ukthyaḥ tasya id indraḥ abhipitveṣu raṇyati /
analyzed: barhiḥ vā yat su apatyāya vṛjyate arkaḥ vā ślokam āghoṣate divi   grāvā yatra vadati karuḥ ukthyaḥ tasya id indraḥ abhipitveṣu raṇyati  /
translated: where the pressing-stone speaks, the stone that deserves praise, there Indra delights in the drinking bouts.

original: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam / indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ /
analyzed: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam    indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ  /
translated: I send the strong drink, the true one, to the bull. I send it to thee, O thou of bay steeds, to the pressed (Soma). O Indra, rejoice here with the milk, with all the hymns, with Sûrya, when he is praised.

original: yoge yoge tavastaram vājevāje havāmahe / sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye /
analyzed: yoge yoge tavastaram vājevāje havāmahe    sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye
translated: In every need we call on him, the most mighty, in every race, in every battle.

original: ā gha gamat yadi śravat sahasriṇībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ / vājebhiḥ upa naḥ havam //
analyzed: ā gha gamat yadi śravat sahasriṇībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ    vājebhiḥ upa naḥ havam  /
translated: Let him come, if he will listen, with his thousands aids, with his powers, to our invocation.

original: anu pratnasya okasaḥ huve tuvi pratim naram / yam te pūrvam pitā huve /🔽yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ / rocante rocanā divi //
analyzed: anu pratnasya okasaḥ huve tuvi pratim naram   yam te pūrvam pitā huve  / yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ   rocante rocanā divi  /
translated: Thy father called on first.🔽They yoke the ruddy steed, the moving one, the dwellers in the sky,🔽The luminous lights shine in the heaven.🔽They yoke his two dear bay steeds to the car with yoking-poles,

original: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe / śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā /
analyzed: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe   śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā  /
translated: The red, the daring, bearing men.🔽Making a banner where no banner was, thou spreadest out the people's form.

original: ketum kṛṇvan aketave peśaḥ maryāḥ apeśase / sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ /
analyzed: ketum kṛṇvan aketave peśaḥ maryāḥ apeśase   sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: Thou hast been born with the Dawns.🔽If, Indra, I were like thee, sole lord of wealth,

original: yat indra aham yathā tvam īśīya vasvaḥ ekaḥ id / stotā me goṣakhā syāt /
analyzed: yat indra aham yathā tvam īśīya vasvaḥ ekaḥ id stotā me goṣakhā syāt  /
translated: My praiser should be a friend of mine to give me kine.🔽I would learn of him, I would give to the wise one, O Lord of Strength,

original: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyam śacīpate manīṣiṇe / yat aham gopatiḥ syām /
analyzed: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyam śacīpate manīṣiṇe   yat aham gopatiḥ syām
translated: If I were a lord of cattle.

original: dhenuḥ te indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate / gām aśvam pipyuṣī duhe /
analyzed: dhenuḥ te indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate    gām aśvam pipyuṣī duhe  /
translated: Thy bounty, Indra, is a milch-cow to the sacrificer who presses out (the Soma) for thee.🔽She yields a cow, a horse.

original: na te vartā asti rādhasaḥ indra devaḥ na martyaḥ / yat ditsasi stutaḥ magham //
analyzed: na te vartā asti rādhasaḥ indra devaḥ na martyaḥ   yat ditsasi stutaḥ magham
translated: No God, no mortal can resist the bounty which thou givest, Indra, when thou art praised.🔽The sacrifice strengthened Indra when he rolled the earth away,

original: yajñaḥ indram avardhayat yat bhūmim vi avartayat / cakrāṇaḥ opaśam divi //
analyzed: yajñaḥ indram avardhayat yat bhūmim vi avartayat   cakrāṇaḥ opaśam divi  /
translated: And made the sky his covering.

original: vāvṛdhānasya te vayam viśvā dhanāni jigyuṣaḥ / ūtim indraḥ ā vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: vāvṛdhānasya te vayam viśvā dhanāni jigyuṣaḥ   ūtim indraḥ ā vṛṇīmahe  /
translated: Who wouldst win all things worth the winning.🔽In the wild joy of Soma he hath spread out the firmament, the light,

original: vi antarikṣam atirat made somasya rocanā / indraḥ yat abhinat valam //
analyzed: vi antarikṣam atirat made somasya rocanā   indraḥ yat abhinat valam  /
translated: When Indra cleft the cloud asunder.🔽The kine have risen for Angiras: he hath revealed the things concealed.

original: ud gāḥ ājat aṅgirobhyaḥ āvis krṇvan guhā satīḥ / arvāñcam nunude valam /
analyzed: ud gāḥ ājat aṅgirobhyaḥ āvis krṇvan guhā satīḥ    arvāñcam nunude valam  /
translated: He hath sent backward the unwilling cloud.🔽The luminous realms of heaven, and all the firmset fastnesses,

original: indreṇa rocanā divaḥ dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca / sthirāṇi na parāṇude /
analyzed: indreṇa rocanā divaḥ dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca   / sthirāṇi na parāṇude  /
translated: Are set and stablished by Indra: none may overthrow them.

original: apām ūrmiḥ madan iva stomaḥ indra ajirāyate / vi te madāḥ arājiṣuḥ /
analyzed: apām ūrmiḥ madan iva stomaḥ indra ajirāyate    vi te madāḥ arājiṣuḥ  /
translated: Thy laud, O Indra, like a wave of waters, hath flowed forth to thee, O thou of rapid steeds.🔽Thy gladdening juices have been shed for thee.🔽For thou, O Indra, art the strengthener of the hymn, the strengthener of the laud,

original: tvam hi stoma vardhanaḥ indra asi uktha vardhanaḥ / stotṝṇām uta bhadra kṛt //
analyzed: tvam hi stoma vardhanaḥ indra asi uktha vardhanaḥ   stotṝṇām uta bhadra kṛt  /
translated: And ever good to those who sing thy praise.

original: indram id keśinā harī soma peyāya vakṣataḥ / upa yajñam su rādhasam /
analyzed: indram id keśinā harī soma peyāya vakṣataḥ   / upa yajñam su rādhasam
translated: With those two bays which thou controllest, O Indra, bring the Gods to drink the Soma juice,🔽To the feast, O most liberal Lord.🔽With the foam of the waters thou, O Indra, didst lift up the head of Namuci,

original: apām phenena namuceḥ śiraḥ indra ud avartayaḥ / viśvā yat ajaya spṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: apām phenena namuceḥ śiraḥ indra ud avartayaḥ   viśvā yat ajaya spṛdhaḥ  /
translated: When thou hadst won all battles.🔽When the Dasyu, with his magic arts, would rise to heaven and mount the sky,

original: māyābhiḥ utsisṛpsataḥ indra dyām ārurukṣataḥ / ava dasyūṃr adhūnuthāḥ //
analyzed: māyābhiḥ utsisṛpsataḥ indra dyām ārurukṣataḥ    ava dasyūṃr adhūnuthāḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, didst crush the Dasyus down.

original: asunvām indra saṃsadam viṣūcīm vi anāśayaḥ / soma pāḥ uttaraḥ bhavan //
analyzed: asunvām indra saṃsadam viṣūcīm vi anāśayaḥ   soma pāḥ uttaraḥ bhavan
translated: Thou, Indra, as the Soma-drinker, hast destroyed the Sunva's company, and driven it away.

original: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣam harī pra te vanve vanuṣaḥ haryatam madam / ghṛtam na yaḥ haribhiḥ cāru secate ā tvā viśantu hari varpasam giraḥ /
analyzed: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣam harī pra te vanve vanuṣaḥ haryatam madam   ghṛtam na yaḥ haribhiḥ cāru secate ā tvā viśantu hari varpasam giraḥ  /
translated: I will extol thy two Bay Steeds in solemn rite: I, fain to win, will win thy Bay Steeds' exhilarating drink. He whom the tawny drops bedew with oil, to thee let songs of praise enter, to thee whose form is bright as gold.

original: harim hi yonim abhi ye samasvaran hinvantaḥ harī divyam yathā sadaḥ / ā yam pṛṇanti haribhiḥ na dhenavaḥ indrāya śūśam harivantam arcata /🔽saḥ asya vajraḥ haritaḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ hariḥ nikāmaḥ hariḥ ā gabhastyoḥ / dyumnī su śipraḥ hari manyu sāyakaḥ indre ni rūpā haritā mimikṣire /
analyzed: harim hi yonim abhi ye samasvaran hinvantaḥ harī divyam yathā sadaḥ   ā yam pṛṇanti haribhiḥ na dhenavaḥ indrāya śūśam harivantam arcata  / saḥ asya vajraḥ haritaḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ hariḥ nikāmaḥ hariḥ ā gabhastyoḥ    dyumnī su śipraḥ hari manyu sāyakaḥ indre ni rūpā haritā mimikṣire  /
translated: They who have sung aloud to thee, the Bay Steeds' place, urging the Bay Steeds to the seat which is in heaven, Whom tawny-coloured cows fill full, as 'twere with oil, sing forth your hymn to Indra, rich in tawny Steeds.🔽His is the tawny iron thunderbolt, the tawny wish, the tawny in his arms. The tawny thought is in the mighty Indra's form, the tawny gleams are in the fair-cheeked Indra's form.

original: divi na ketuḥ adhi dhāyi haryataḥ vivyacat vajraḥ haritaḥ na raṃhyā / tudat ahim hari śipraḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ sahasra śokāḥ abhavat harimbharaḥ /
analyzed: divi na ketuḥ adhi dhāyi haryataḥ vivyacat vajraḥ haritaḥ na raṃhyā   tudat ahim hari śipraḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ sahasra śokāḥ abhavat harimbharaḥ  /
translated: The tawny-coloured Ensign hath been set in heaven: the tawny thunderbolt hath been extended like a dart. The tawny-coloured one, with cheeks of iron, hath smitten Ahi: he hath become a thousand-flames, a bearer of the tawny-coloured one.

original: tvaṃtvam aharyathāḥ upastutaḥ pūrvebhiḥ indra hari keśa yajvabhiḥ / tvam haryasi tava viśvam ukthyam asāmi rādhaḥ hari jāta haryatam //
analyzed: tvaṃtvam aharyathāḥ upastutaḥ pūrvebhiḥ indra hari keśa yajvabhiḥ   tvam haryasi tava viśvam ukthyam asāmi rādhaḥ hari jāta haryatam  /
translated: Thou, Indra, art to be invoked by those who have offered sacrifice, as thou wast invoked of old by those who worshipped, O thou whose hair is bright. Thou shinest forth: all that is worthy of lauds is thine. The gift of him whose birth is bright is to be extolled.

original: tā vajriṇam mandinam stomyam made indram rathe vahataḥ haryatā harī / purūṇi asmai savanāni haryate indrāya somāḥ harayaḥ dadhanvire /
analyzed: tā vajriṇam mandinam stomyam made indram rathe vahataḥ haryatā harī    purūṇi asmai savanāni haryate indrāya somāḥ harayaḥ dadhanvire  /
translated: His two Bay Horses, yoked to the car, bear Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the gladdener, to be praised, to the wild raptures of the juice. To him, the gladdener, are offered many libations. The bright Soma-drops have flowed for Indra.

original: aram kāmāya harayaḥ dadhamire sthirāya hinvan harayaḥ harī turā / arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ joṣam īyate saḥ asya kāmam harivantam ānaśe /
analyzed: aram kāmāya harayaḥ dadhamire sthirāya hinvan harayaḥ harī turā   arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ joṣam īyate saḥ asya kāmam harivantam ānaśe  /
translated: The bright ones have been made ready for the wish, for firmness have the bright ones urged the two Bay Steeds. He who comes to the banquet with the bright Bay Horses, has fulfilled the wish of him whose wealth is great.

original: hari śmaśāruḥ hari keśaḥ āyasaḥ turaspeye yaḥ hari pāḥ avardhata / arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ vājinīvasuḥ ati viśvā duritā pāriṣat dharī /
analyzed: hari śmaśāruḥ hari keśaḥ āyasaḥ turaspeye yaḥ hari pāḥ avardhata   arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ vājinīvasuḥ ati viśvā duritā pāriṣat dharī  /
translated: The bright one, with the bright beard, bright hair, bright armour, who hath been strengthened in the race for speed, who hath the bright Bays, he who hath bright Bay Horses, who is rich in spoil, shall with the bright steeds pass over all misfortunes.

original: śruvā iva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇī davidhvataḥ / pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjat dharī pītvā madasya haryatasya andhasaḥ /
analyzed: śruvā iva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇī davidhvataḥ   pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjat dharī pītvā madasya haryatasya andhasaḥ  /
translated: Whose two bright does have gone forth like two that hear, the two bright does for the swift course to the prize, when he, the bright one, hath been cleansed in the prepared drinking-vessel, after he hath drunk of the gladdening juice, the bright juice.

original: uta sma sadna haryatasya pastyoḥ atyaḥ na vājam harivān acikradat / mahī cit hi dhiṣaṇā aharyat ojasā bṛhat vayaḥ dadhiṣe haryataḥ cit ā /
analyzed: uta sma sadna haryatasya pastyoḥ atyaḥ na vājam harivān acikradat    mahī cit hi dhiṣaṇā aharyat ojasā bṛhat vayaḥ dadhiṣe haryataḥ cit ā  /
translated: And in the two delightful abodes of the true one, he hath roared like a horse, winning the prize. Even the great thought, O thou who art to be delighted, hath been delighted by thee in might: thou hast bestowed the lofty life, even on the delightful one.

original: ā rodasī haryamāṇaḥ mahitvā navyam navyam haryasi manma nu priyam / pra pastyam asura haryatam goḥ āvis kṛdhi haraye sūryāya /
analyzed: ā rodasī haryamāṇaḥ mahitvā navyam navyam haryasi manma nu priyam    pra pastyam asura haryatam goḥ āvis kṛdhi haraye sūryāya  /
translated: With thy delight thou hast filled the two world-halves: thou rejoicest in the new and new dear hymn. Make thou the home of the brown cow to be delighted: make the light to be seen for the brown-hued one.

original: ā tvā haryantam prayujaḥ janānām rathe vahantu hari śipram indra / pibā yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ haryan yajñam sadhamāde daśoṇim /
analyzed: ā tvā haryantam prayujaḥ janānām rathe vahantu hari śipram indra   pibā yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ haryan yajñam sadhamāde daśoṇim  /
translated: Let the teams of men bring thee hither, O thou that art to be delighted, on the car, O Indra, thou of the tawny eyebrows. Drink as thou art wont of the meath that is set forth: delighting, enjoy the sacrifice in the place of assembly, O thou of the tenfold region.

original: apāḥ pūrveṣām harivas sutānām atha u idam savanam kevalam te / mamaddhi somam madhumantam indra satrā vṛṣam jathare ā vṛṣasva /
analyzed: apāḥ pūrveṣām harivas sutānām atha u idam savanam kevalam te   mamaddhi somam madhumantam indra satrā vṛṣam jathare ā vṛṣasva  /
translated: Thou hast drunk of the juices of the former (sacrifices), O thou that hast tawny steeds: this libation is thine only. Rejoice in the sweet Soma, O Indra: always be thou strong in thy belly, O thou that art strong.

original: apsu dhūtasya harivas piba iha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharam pṛṇasva / mimikṣuḥ yam adrayaḥ indra tubhyam tebhiḥ vardhasva madam uktha vāhaḥ //
analyzed: apsu dhūtasya harivas piba iha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharam pṛṇasva   mimikṣuḥ yam adrayaḥ indra tubhyam tebhiḥ vardhasva madam uktha vāhaḥ  /
translated: O thou that hast tawny steeds, drink here of the juice washed in the waters: fill thy belly with the juice pressed by men. Indra, the pressing-stones have mingled thee for thee: wax strong with them, thou who carriest the hymn.

original: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam / indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ /
analyzed: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam    indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ  /
translated: I send the mighty draught, the true one, to the Bull: for thee, O thou of Bay steeds, I send the juice. Rejoice thee here, O Indra, with the milk, with all the hymns, with power, being praised.

original: ūtī śacīvas tava vīryeṇa vayaḥ dadhānāḥ uśijaḥ ṛta jñāḥ / prajāvat indra maṃsaḥ duroṇe tasthuḥ gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādyāsaḥ /
analyzed: ūtī śacīvas tava vīryeṇa vayaḥ dadhānāḥ uśijaḥ ṛta jñāḥ   prajāvat indra maṃsaḥ duroṇe tasthuḥ gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādyāsaḥ  /
translated: With thy help, O thou of mighty power, through thy hero might, the pious, seeking wealth, have gained life. In the house, O Indra, with offspring, with food, they have stood, the best at the feast, singing (thy praises).

original: yaḥ jātaḥ eva prathamaḥ manasvān devaḥ devān kratunā paryamūṣat / yasya śuṣmāt rodasī abhyasetām nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /🔽yaḥ pṛthivīm vyathamānām adṛṃhat yaḥ parvatān prakupitām aramṇāt / yaḥ antarikṣam vimame varīyaḥ yaḥ dyām astabhnāt sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ jātaḥ eva prathamaḥ manasvān devaḥ devān kratunā paryamūṣat    yasya śuṣmāt rodasī abhyasetām nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  / yaḥ pṛthivīm vyathamānām adṛṃhat yaḥ parvatān prakupitām aramṇāt   yaḥ antarikṣam vimame varīyaḥ yaḥ dyām astabhnāt sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: He who, even when born, the first, the wise one, by his will surrounded the Gods, the God, By whose impulse the two worlds should be shaken, by the greatness of his manliness, he is Indra, the people's Indra.🔽He who firmly established the trembling earth, who easily settled the mountains when they were angry, Who measured out the wide atmosphere, who supported the sky, he is Indra, the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ hatvā ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yaḥ gāḥ udājat apadhā valasya / yaḥ aśmanoḥ antar agnim jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hatvā ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yaḥ gāḥ udājat apadhā valasya   yaḥ aśmanoḥ antar agnim jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: He who, having slain the dragon, let loose the seven rivers, who drove forth the kine, and cleft Vala's stronghold, Who from between the two stones generated the fire, he is Indra, the people's Indra, in the battles.

original: yena imā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yaḥ dāsam varṇam adharam guhākaḥ / śvaghnī iva yaḥ jigīvām lakṣam ādat aryaḥ puṣṭāni sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yena imā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yaḥ dāsam varṇam adharam guhākaḥ    śvaghnī iva yaḥ jigīvām lakṣam ādat aryaḥ puṣṭāni sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: He by whom all these things were made to tremble, who hath hidden the low-born Dâsa's colour, Who, like a bitch, hath seized the mark to conquer, he, Indra, is the folk's dear Friend and Helper.

original: yam sma pṛchanti kuha sa iti ghoram uta īm āhuḥ na eṣaḥ asti iti enam / saḥ aryaḥ puṣṭīḥ vijaḥ iva ā mināti śrath asmai dhatta sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yam sma pṛcchanti kuha sa iti ghoram uta īm āhuḥ na eṣaḥ asti iti enam    saḥ aryaḥ puṣṭīḥ vijaḥ iva ā mināti śrath asmai dhatta sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Whom they ask, saying, Where is he, the terrible? and some say, He is not here at all. He, Indra, is the folk's dear Friend and Helper, who, like a robber, spoils the niggard's riches.

original: yaḥ radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yaḥ brahmaṇaḥ nādhamānasya kīreḥ / yukta grāvṇaḥ yaḥ avitā su śipraḥ suta somasya sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yaḥ brahmaṇaḥ nādhamānasya kīreḥ   yukta grāvṇaḥ yaḥ avitā su śipraḥ suta somasya sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: He who impels the poor man and the wealthy, the singer of the hymn who is in trouble, Who, fair of cheek, is helper of the presser of Soma, he, Indra, is the folk's dear Friend.

original: yasya aśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvaḥ yasya grāmāḥ yasya viśve rathāsaḥ / yaḥ sūryam yaḥ uṣasam jajāna yaḥ apām netā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yasya aśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvaḥ yasya grāmāḥ yasya viśve rathāsaḥ   yaḥ sūryam yaḥ uṣasam jajāna yaḥ apām netā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: He who hath horses, kine, and villages, and all the chariots, who hath generated Sûrya and the Dawn, who is the leader of the waters, he, Indra, is the folk's dear Friend.

original: yam krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare avare ubhayāḥ amitrāḥ / samānam cit ratham ātasthivāṃsā nānā havete sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yam krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare avare ubhayāḥ amitrāḥ    samānam cit ratham ātasthivāṃsā nānā havete sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Whom the two worlds, the upper and the lower, the foes, invoke together in their trouble, Who, though he ride the self-same car with them, is called by both, he, Indra, is the folk's dear Friend.

original: yasmāt naḥ ṛte vijayante janāsaḥ yam yudhyamānāḥ avase havante / yaḥ viśvasya pratimānam babhūva yaḥ acyuta cyut sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt naḥ ṛte vijayante janāsaḥ yam yudhyamānāḥ avase havante   yaḥ viśvasya pratimānam babhūva yaḥ acyuta cyut sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Who hath become the measure of all things, who is the shaker of the unshaken, he is Indra among men.🔽He who punishes those who commit great sin, who slays the wrathful who are not repentant,

original: yaḥ śasvataḥ mahi enaḥ dadhānān a manyamānām śarvā jaghāna / yaḥ śardhate na anudadāti śṛdhyām yaḥ dasyoḥ hantā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śasvataḥ mahi enaḥ dadhānān a manyamānām śarvā jaghāna   yaḥ śardhate na anudadāti śṛdhyām yaḥ dasyoḥ hantā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Who does not give way to the wrathful in their wrath, who is the slayer of the Dasyus, he is Indra among men.🔽He who found Sambara lying on the mountains, in the fortieth autumn,

original: yaḥ śambharam parvateṣu kṣiyantam catvāriṃśyām śaradi anvavindat / ojāyamānam yaḥ ahim jaghāna dānum śayānam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śambharam parvateṣu kṣiyantam catvāriṃśyām śaradi anvavindat    ojāyamānam yaḥ ahim jaghāna dānum śayānam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Who slew the swelling serpent, who slew the Dānu lying down, he is Indra among men.🔽He who surrounded Sambara with ditches, who drank the unpressed juice of the Soma,

original: yaḥ śambharam paryatarat kasībhiḥ yaḥ acāru kāsnā apibat sutasya / antar girau yajamānam bahum janam yasmin āmūrchat sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śambharam paryatarat kasībhiḥ yaḥ acāru kāsnā apibat sutasya
translated: Who caused the sacrificer to reel within the mountain, who caused the many people to reel, he is Indra among men.🔽He who with seven rays, a bull of great strength, let loose the seven rivers to flow,

original: yaḥ sapta raśmiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn / yaḥ rauhiṇam asphurat vajra bāhuḥ dyām ārohantam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sapta raśmiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn   yaḥ rauhiṇam asphurat vajra bāhuḥ dyām ārohantam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Who burst open the Rauhiṇa, the wielder of the thunderbolt, who caused him to ascend to heaven, he is Indra among men.

original: dyāvā cit asmai pṛthivī mamete śuṣmāt cit asya parvatāḥ bhayante / yaḥ soma pāḥ nicitaḥ vajra bāhuḥ yaḥ vajra hastaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: dyāvā cit asmai pṛthivī mamete śuṣmāt cit asya parvatāḥ bhayante   yaḥ soma pāḥ nicitaḥ vajra bāhuḥ yaḥ vajra hastaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Even Heaven and Earth are subject to his will, and at his very breath the mountains tremble. He who is Soma's Prince, whose arm bears arrows, whose hand wields thunder, He is Indra, O ye men.

original: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantam yaḥ śaṃsantam yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī / yasya brahma vardhanam yasya somaḥ yasya idam rādhaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantam yaḥ śaṃsantam yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī    yasya brahma vardhanam yasya somaḥ yasya idam rādhaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: He who protects the man who sheds the Soma, who brews the drink, who sings the hymn, who worships, Whose power is prayer, whose is the Soma, whose this gift, He is Indra, O ye men.

original: jātaḥ vi akhyat pitroḥ upasthe bhuvaḥ na veda janituḥ parasya / staviṣyamāṇaḥ naḥ yaḥ asmat vratā devānām sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: jātaḥ vi akhyat pitroḥ upasthe bhuvaḥ na veda janituḥ parasya    staviṣyamāṇaḥ naḥ yaḥ asmat vratā devānām sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: Born in the lap of his two Parents, he hath spread out like earth, and knows not his high Father. He who, to be extolled by us, is Guardian of the Gods' eternal laws, He is Indra, O ye men.

original: yaḥ soma kāmaḥ haryaśvaḥ sūriḥ yasmāt rejante bhuvanāni viśvā / yaḥ jaghāna śambaram yaḥ ca śuṣṇam yaḥ eka vīraḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ soma kāmaḥ haryaśvaḥ sūriḥ yasmāt rejante bhuvanāni viśvā   yaḥ jaghāna śambaram yaḥ ca śuṣṇam yaḥ eka vīraḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ  /
translated: He who, the Prince with Bay Steeds, longs for Soma, from whom all living creatures tremble, Who slew Sambara and Ṣushṇa, who conquered with a single hero, He is Indra, O ye men.

original: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhre ā cit vājam dardarṣi sa kila asi satyaḥ / vayam te indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema /
analyzed: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhre ā cit vājam dardarṣi sa kila asi satyaḥ    vayam te indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema  /
translated: He who, even to the poor man who sheds the Soma, who brews the drink, who worships, grants strength, He verily is true. We, O Indra, all of us, thy friends, with noble sons, would speak in the assembly.

original: asmai id u pra tavase turāya prayaḥ na harmi stomam māhināya / ṛcīṣamāya adhrigave oham indrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā /
analyzed: asmai id u pra tavase turāya prayaḥ na harmi stomam māhināya   ṛcīṣamāya adhrigave oham indrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā  /
translated: To him, the mighty, swift, I offer this my hymn, as 'twere a gift, to him the Lord of power. To him who loves the song, who finds the booty, to Indra, most to be adored, my prayers.

original: asmai id u prayaḥ iva pra yaṃsi bharāmi āngūṣam bādhe suvṛkti / indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyaḥ marjayanta //
analyzed: asmai id u prayaḥ iva pra yaṃsi bharāmi āngūṣam bādhe suvṛkti     indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyaḥ marjayanta  /
translated: To him, as 'twere a gift, I offer this my hymn, I utter forth my song of praise to him. To Indra with my heart and mind I offer my thought, to him the Ancient Lord, the Sages deck their hymns.

original: asmai id u tyam upamam svarṣām bharāmi āṅgūṣam āsyena / maṃhiṣṭham achoktibhiḥ matīnām suvṛktibhiḥ sūrim vāvṛdhadhyai //🔽asmai id u stomam sam hinomi ratham na taṣṭā iva tatsināya / giraḥ ca gir vāhase suvṛkti indrāya viśvaminvam medhirāya /
analyzed: asmai id u tyam upamam svarṣām bharāmi āṅgūṣam āsyena   maṃhiṣṭham achoktibhiḥ matīnām suvṛktibhiḥ sūrim vāvṛdhadhyai  / asmai id u stomam sam hinomi ratham na taṣṭā iva tatsināya    giraḥ ca gir vāhase suvṛkti indrāya viśvaminvam medhirāya  /
translated: To him, the self-dependent One, the Self-Existent One, I offer this my hymn with reverence and my lips. To him the most munificent, with words of praise, with hymns of praise, I magnify the Lord, to make him grow.🔽To him I fit this hymn together, as a wright fits the wheel, to make it roll. To Indra, who accepts the song, to him who bears the song, to him the wise, with hymns and songs I fit the hymn together.

original: asmai id u saptim iva śravasya indrāya arkam juhvā sam añje / vīram dānaukasam vandadhyai purām gūrta śravasam darmāṇam /
analyzed: asmai id u saptim iva śravasya indrāya arkam juhvā sam añje    vīram dānaukasam vandadhyai purām gūrta śravasam darmāṇam  /
translated: To him, as 'twere a courser, fain for glory, I deck with ladle this my hymn for Indra, To him the Hero, dwelling in men's houses, to him the Ancient, to him of wondrous glory.

original: asmai id u tvaṣṭā takṣat vajram su apastamam svaryam raṇāya / vṛtrasya cit vidat yena marma tujan īśānaḥ tujatā kiyedhāḥ /
analyzed: asmai id u tvaṣṭā takṣat vajram su apastamam svaryam raṇāya    vṛtrasya cit vidat yena marma tujan īśānaḥ tujatā kiyedhāḥ  /
translated: For him Tvastr forged the most excellent thunderbolt, fit to be grasped, for the fight, wherewith he found the very vitals of Vr̥itra, and, irresistible, with his irresistible bolt,

original: asya id u mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyas mahaḥ pitum papivām cāru annā / muṣāyat viṣṇuḥ pacatam sahīyān vidhyat varāham tiras adrim astā /
analyzed: asya id u mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyas mahaḥ pitum papivām cāru annā   muṣāyat viṣṇuḥ pacatam sahīyān vidhyat varāham tiras adrim astā  /
translated: Even in the Soma-pressings of his Mother, he, the mighty, drank at once the pleasant draught of his Father. Vishnu, the stronger, stole away the cooking (pot), and pierced the boar through, and laid the mountain low.

original: asmai id u gnāḥ cit deva patnīḥ indrāya arkam ahi hatye ūvuḥ / pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhre urvī na asya te mahimānam pari staḥ /
analyzed: asmai id u gnāḥ cit deva patnīḥ indrāya arkam ahi hatye ūvuḥ   pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhre urvī na asya te mahimānam pari staḥ  /
translated: Even the Dames, the wives of the Gods, for Indra, at the slaying of the Dragon, sang this hymn of praise. He hath encompassed heaven and earth, the spacious pair: his greatness hath not been surpassed.

original: asya id eva pra ririce mahitvam divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt / svarāt indraḥ damaḥ ā viśva gūrtaḥ svariḥ amatraḥ vavakṣe raṇāya /
analyzed: asya id eva pra ririce mahitvam divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt    svarāt indraḥ damaḥ ā viśva gūrtaḥ svariḥ amatraḥ vavakṣe raṇāya  /
translated: Even his greatness hath spread out beyond the heaven, beyond the earth, beyond the wide air's compass. Indra, the universal theme of song, is Lord of light, of heaven, and hath waxed strong for fight.

original: asya id eva śavasā śuśantam vi vṛścat vajreṇa vṛtram indraḥ / gāḥ na vrāṇāḥ avanīḥ amuñcat abhi śravaḥ dāvane sacetāḥ /
analyzed: asya id eva śavasā śuśantam vi vṛścat vajreṇa vṛtram indraḥ   gāḥ na vrāṇāḥ avanīḥ amuñcat abhi śravaḥ dāvane sacetāḥ  /
translated: Even with his own strength Indra with his bolt rent Vr̥itra limb from limb, who was so proud and haughty. He set the kine at liberty, the captive cows, and, thoughtful, gained renown to give to him who gave.

original: asya id u tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yat vajreṇa sīm ayacchat / īśāna kṛt dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye gādham turvaṇiḥ kaḥ /
analyzed: asya id u tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yat vajreṇa sīm ayacchat    īśāna kṛt dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye gādham turvaṇiḥ kaḥ  /
translated: The rivers, O thou Wonderful One, rejoice in his impetuous might, When he with his thunderbolt hath measured out their boundaries. The bountiful One, the Lord of gifts, hath granted room for Turvîta to move.

original: asmai id u pra bhara tūtujānaḥ vṛtrāya vajram īśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ / goḥ na parva vi radā tiraśceṣyan arṇāṃsi apām caradhyai /🔽asya id u pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navyaḥ ukthaiḥ / yudhe yat iṣṇānaḥ āyudhāni ṛghāyamāṇaḥ niriṇāti śatrūn /
analyzed: asmai id u pra bhara tūtujānaḥ vṛtrāya vajram īśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ   goḥ na parva vi radā tiraśceṣyan arṇāṃsi apām caradhyai  / asya id u pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navyaḥ ukthaiḥ   yudhe yat iṣṇānaḥ āyudhāni ṛghāyamāṇaḥ niriṇāti śatrūn  /
translated: Even to him, to Vritra, the Lord of the people, the impetuous one, hurl the bolt, O thou who hast the power to do it, As one who would cleave the joints of a cow, that the waters may flow for the thirsty.🔽Even of him, of the Ancient One, proclaim the deeds of old with new hymns, When, sharpening his weapons in fight, he pierces through the foes with his impetuous might.

original: asya id u bhiyā girayaḥ ca dṛlhāḥ dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣaḥ tujete / upa u venasya joguvānaḥ oṇim sadyas bhuvat vīryāya nodhāḥ //
analyzed: asya id u bhiyā girayaḥ ca dṛlhāḥ dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣaḥ tujete     upa u venasya joguvānaḥ oṇim sadyas bhuvat vīryāya nodhāḥ  /
translated: Even through the fear of him the firm-set mountains, and the heavens and the earth, at his birth, were shaken. The swift one, urged on by the desire of the willing one, was immediately, for our strength, the supporter.

original: asmai id u tyad anu dāyi eṣām ekaḥ yat vavne bhūreḥ īśānaḥ / pra etaśam sūrye paspṛdhānam sauvaśvye suṣvim āvat indraḥ /
analyzed: asmai id u tyad anu dāyi eṣām ekaḥ yat vavne bhūreḥ īśānaḥ    pra etaśam sūrye paspṛdhānam sauvaśvye suṣvim āvat indraḥ  /
translated: Even to him was given of old this lordship over these, that he, the One, hath chosen, the Lord of wealth. Indra hath helped the swift one who striveth with the sun, the swift one, at Sauvashva's sacrifice.

original: eva te hāriyojanā suvṛktī indra brahmāṇi gotamāsaḥ akran / ā eṣu viśva peśasam dhiyam dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt /
analyzed: eva te hāriyojanā suvṛktī indra brahmāṇi gotamāsaḥ akran   ā eṣu viśva peśasam dhiyam dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt  /
translated: So, Indra, the sons of Gotama have sung their fair hymns to thee, O thou whose steeds are tawny. To these bestow the thought that hath all knowledge: may he who hath good thoughts come soon and early.

original: yaḥ ekaḥ id dhavyaḥ carṣaṇīnām indram tam gīrbhiḥ abhi arcaḥ ābhiḥ / yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān / yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān / yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān / yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān / yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satv🔽tam u naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ navagvāḥ sapta viprāsaḥ abhi vājayantaḥ / nakṣat dābham taturim parvateṣṭhām adrogha vācam matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham //
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id dhavyaḥ carṣaṇīnām indram tam gīrbhiḥ abhi arcaḥ ābhiḥ  / yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān   yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān    yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān    yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān    yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā🔽tam u naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ navagvāḥ sapta viprāsaḥ abhi vājayantaḥ   nakṣat dābham taturim parvateṣṭhām adrogha vācam matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham  /

original: tam īmahe indram asya rāyaḥ puru vīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ / yaḥ aṣkṛdhoyuḥ ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivas mādayadhyai //
analyzed: tam īmahe indram asya rāyaḥ puru vīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ   yaḥ aṣkṛdhoyuḥ ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivas mādayadhyai  /
translated: We pray to Indra for this wealth of his, the wealth of many heroes, of the mighty Lord. Who is ever ready to bestow his gifts, the Ancient One who dwells in light. O Lord of Bay Steeds, bring him to us to make him glad.

original: tat naḥ vi vocaḥ yadi te purā cit jaritāraḥ ānaśuḥ sumnam indra / kaḥ te bhāgaḥ kim vayaḥ dudhra khiduḥ puruhūta purūvaso asura ghnaḥ /
analyzed: tat naḥ vi vocaḥ yadi te purā cit jaritāraḥ ānaśuḥ sumnam indra   kaḥ te bhāgaḥ kim vayaḥ dudhra khiduḥ puruhūta purūvaso asura ghnaḥ  /
translated: Tell us this, if at any time in the past our singers have brought thee joy, O Indra. What is thy share, what is thy food, O Strong One, O thou who art much invoked, O thou who hast much wealth, O thou who slayest the Asuras?

original: tam pṛchantī vajra hastam ratheṣṭhām indram vepī vakvarī yasya nu gīḥ / tuvi grābham tuvi kūrmim rabhodām gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram acha /
analyzed: tam pṛcchantī vajra hastam ratheṣṭhām indram vepī vakvarī yasya nu gīḥ    tuvi grābham tuvi kūrmim rabhodām gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram acha  /
translated: We ask for him, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the charioteer, for Indra, the singer who is eager to win his favour. We seek the strong one, the bountiful, the mighty, the swift one, to go to the food.

original: ayā ha tyam māyayā vāvṛdhānam manaḥ juvā svatavaḥ parvatena / acyutā cit vīlitā su ojaḥ rujaḥ vi dṛlhā dhṛṣatā virapśin //
analyzed: ayā ha tyam māyayā vāvṛdhānam manaḥ juvā svatavaḥ parvatena   acyutā cit vīlitā su ojaḥ rujaḥ vi dṛlhā dhṛṣatā virapśin  /
translated: This one, grown great by his own power, by his thought, by the Parvata, by his magic power, the strong one, the bold one, the swift one, hath rent asunder, with his own might, the firm, the unshaken, the well-guarded (strongholds).

original: tam vaḥ dhiyā navyasya śaviṣṭham pratnam pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai / sa naḥ vakṣat animānaḥ suvahnā indraḥ viśvāni ati durgahāṇi //
analyzed: tam vaḥ dhiyā navyasya śaviṣṭham pratnam pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai    sa naḥ vakṣat animānaḥ suvahnā indraḥ viśvāni ati durgahāṇi  /
translated: We will yoke to the new hymn, to the ancient one, to the most powerful one, him who is ever new. May Indra carry us, unwearied, with his good carriers, over all difficulties.

original: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayaḥ antarikṣā / tapa vṛṣan viśvatas śociṣā tān brahma dviṣe śocaya kṣām apaḥ ca /
analyzed: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayaḥ antarikṣā    tapa vṛṣan viśvatas śociṣā tān brahma dviṣe śocaya kṣām apaḥ ca  /
translated: Thou hast illumined the earthly regions for the man who hates the people, And the heavenly regions and the airs' mid-regions. Burn them, O Steer, on every side with thy flame. Burn the earth and the waters for the Brahman-hater.

original: bhuvaḥ janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagataḥ tveṣa saṃdṛś / dhiṣva vajram dakṣiṇe indra haste viśvāḥ ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ /
analyzed: bhuvaḥ janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagataḥ tveṣa saṃdṛś    dhiṣva vajram dakṣiṇe indra haste viśvāḥ ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ  /
translated: King of the heavenly people, of the moving world of earth, thou whose look is terrible. Lay thou the bolt in thy right hand, O Indra. Thou crushest all the wiles of him who is not immortal.

original: ā saṃyatam indra naḥ svastim śatru tūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām / yayā dāsāni āryāṇi vṛtrā karaḥ vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi //
analyzed: ā saṃyatam indra naḥ svastim śatru tūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām    yayā dāsāni āryāṇi vṛtrā karaḥ vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi  /
translated: Grant us, O Indra, prosperity, O Lord of Bay Steeds, that shall be irresistible, That shall overcome the foe, wherewith thou hast gained the Aryan and the Dâsa battles, O Thunderer, the battles of the sons of Nahusha.

original: sa naḥ niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedhaḥ viśva vārābhiḥ ā gahi prayajyo / na yāḥ adevaḥ varate na devaḥ ābhiḥ yāhi tūyam ā madrī adrik /
analyzed: sa naḥ niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedhaḥ viśva vārābhiḥ ā gahi prayajyo   na yāḥ adevaḥ varate na devaḥ ābhiḥ yāhi tūyam ā madrī adrik  /
translated: Come thou to us, O thou who art much invoked, O thou who leadest the way, with those aids Of thine, O thou who hast all boons to give, wherewith the godless and the god may be subdued. Come thou to us with those most quickly.

original: yaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ cyavayati pra viśvāḥ / yaḥ śaśvataḥ adāśuṣaḥ gayasya prayantāsi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ cyavayati pra viśvāḥ   yaḥ śaśvataḥ adāśuṣaḥ gayasya prayantāsi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ  /
translated: He who is terrible as a bull with sharp horns, who alone moveth all the people, He who is the protector of the pious man, of the worshipper who offereth not, of the niggard.

original: tvam ha tyad indra kutsam āvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tanvā samarye / dāsam yat śuṣṇam kuyavam ni asmai arandhayaḥ ārjuneyāya śikṣan //
analyzed: tvam ha tyad indra kutsam āvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tanvā samarye   dāsam yat śuṣṇam kuyavam ni asmai arandhayaḥ ārjuneyāya śikṣan  /
translated: Thou, Indra, helpest Kutsa, listening to him, with all thy help, O thou of manly spirit, When thou, O thou who teachest Arjuneya, gavest the Dâsa, the wicked-hearted, to him.

original: tvam dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyam pra āvaḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ sudāsam / pra paurukutsim trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtra hatyeṣu pūrum /
analyzed: tvam dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyam pra āvaḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ sudāsam    pra paurukutsim trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtra hatyeṣu pūrum  /
translated: Thou, O bold Indra, with thy boldness helpest Vîtahavya, Sudâs, with all thy succours, And helpest Trasadasyu, son of Purukutsa, and Pûru in the battles for the land.

original: tvam nṛbhiḥ nṛmaṇaḥ deva vītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi / tvam ni dasyum cumurim dhunim cāsvāpayaḥ dabhītaye su hantu /
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ nṛmaṇaḥ deva vītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi   tvam ni dasyum cumurim dhunim cāsvāpayaḥ dabhītaye su hantu  /
translated: Thou, God, with men, O thou who markest men, slayest many Vr̥itras, O thou with Bay Steeds, in the feast of the Gods. Thou sendest to sleep the Dasyu, the Chumu, the Dhuṇi, for Dabhîti's slaughter.

original: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puras navatim ca sadyas / niveśane śatatamā aviveṣīḥ aham ca vṛtram namucim uta ahan //
analyzed: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puras navatim ca sadyas    niveśane śatatamā aviveṣīḥ aham ca vṛtram namucim uta ahan  /
translated: These are thy powers, O thou whose hand wields the bolt, when thou at once, with nine-and-ninety, and a hundred, didst smite the forts, and slewest Namuchi and Vritra.

original: sanā tā te indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse / vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puru śāka vājam /
analyzed: sanā tā te indra bhojanāni rāta havyāya dāśuṣe sudāse    vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puru śāka vājam  /
translated: These are thy bounties, O thou Indra, for the worshipper who brings thee gifts, for Sudâs, O mighty One. I yoke thy two strong Bay Steeds. Let the prayers go forth, and let them win abundant spoil.

original: mā te asyām sahasāvan pariṣṭau aghāya bhūma harivas parādau / trāyasva naḥ avṛkebhiḥ varūthaiḥ tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma /
analyzed: mā te asyām sahasāvan pariṣṭau aghāya bhūma harivas parādau    trāyasva naḥ avṛkebhiḥ varūthaiḥ tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma  /
translated: In this assembly, O Victorious One, let not the wicked find thee, O Lord of Bay Steeds, in the beginning. Protect us with thy safe protections: may we be dear to thee among the princes.

original: priyāsaḥ id te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ / ni turvaśam ni yādvam śiśīhi atithigvāya śaṃsyam kariṣyan //
analyzed: priyāsaḥ id te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ   ni turvaśam ni yādvam śiśīhi atithigvāya śaṃsyam kariṣyan  /
translated: We, O Maghavan, will be dear to thee in the battle: may we, thy friends, O Hero, rejoice in thy protection. Crush Turvaga and Yadva, O Indra, for the sake of Atithigva, who will perform the praise.

original: sadyas cit nu te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsanti uktha śāsaḥ ukthā / ye te havebhiḥ vi paṇīn adāśan asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai /🔽ete stomāḥ narām nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañcaḥ dadataḥ maghāni / teṣām indra vṛtra hatye śivaḥ bhūḥ sakhā ca śūraḥ avitā ca nṛṇām /
analyzed: sadyas cit nu te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsanti uktha śāsaḥ ukthā   ye te havebhiḥ vi paṇīn adāśan asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai  / ete stomāḥ narām nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañcaḥ dadataḥ maghāni    teṣām indra vṛtra hatye śivaḥ bhūḥ sakhā ca śūraḥ avitā ca nṛṇām  /
translated: Even now, O Maghavan, in the battle, men who direct the lauds praise thee with hymns. Those who by their invocations have surpassed their rivals, choose thou them for the yoke, for that purpose.🔽These praises, O most manly of men, are for thee: they, who are friendly to us, bestow boons. Among them, O Indra, be propitious in the slaying of Vrtra: be a hero friend and protector of men.

original: nu indra śūra stavamānaḥ ūtī brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhasva / upa naḥ vājān mimīhi upa stīn yuyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ /
analyzed: nu indra śūra stavamānaḥ ūtī brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhasva    upa naḥ vājān mimīhi upa stīn yuyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  /
translated: O Indra, the hero, when praised, with help, urged on by prayer, increase thy body. Measure out for us strength and food: ye, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam / ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama /
analyzed: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam   ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama  /
translated: Come hither, O thou that art very strong, O Indra, drink this Soma. Sit on this my sacred grass.

original: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā / upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu //
analyzed: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā    upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu  /
translated: Let thy two Bay Steeds yoked by prayer bring thee hither, O Indra, Lord! And listen to our invocations.

original: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ / sutāvantaḥ havāmahe //🔽indram id gāthinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ / indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata /
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ    sutāvantaḥ havāmahe  / indram id gāthinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ   indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata  /
translated: We Brahmans, O Indra, who have pressed the Soma, we who have offered, call thee, O Soma-drinker, to the feast, with prayer.🔽The singers with their lauds have magnified thee, Indra, the chanters with their hymns, the singers with their songs.

original: indraḥ id dharyoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā / indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā   indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ  /
translated: Indra is closely joined to the two Bay Steeds, is yoked with speech to those who offer prayers. Indra is armed with thunder, golden-handed.

original: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi / vi gobhiḥ adrim airayat /
analyzed: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi   vi gobhiḥ adrim airayat  /
translated: Indra hath raised the Sun to heaven, to light the regions far away, and with the floods hath loosed the rain.

original: indram vaḥ viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ / asmākam astu kevalaḥ //
analyzed: indram vaḥ viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ asmākam astu kevalaḥ
translated: We call on you to Indra from all sides, from all the people: may he be ours alone.

original: vi antarikṣam atirat made somasya rocanā / indraḥ yat abhinat valam //
analyzed: vi antarikṣam atirat made somasya rocanā   indraḥ yat abhinat valam  /
translated: In the wild joy of Soma he hath spread out the firmament, the light, when Indra cleft the cloud.

original: ud gāḥ ājat aṅgirobhyaḥ āvis kṛṇvan guhā satīḥ / arvāñcam nunude valam /
analyzed: ud gāḥ ājat aṅgirobhyaḥ āvis kṛṇvan guhā satīḥ   arvāñcam nunude valam  /
translated: The Cow hath lowed to the Angirases: she hath revealed the treasures that were hid. He hath sent downward the cloud.

original: indreṇa rocanā divaḥ dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca / sthirāṇi na parāṇude /
analyzed: indreṇa rocanā divaḥ dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca   / sthirāṇi na parāṇude  /
translated: The luminous realms of heaven, and all the firm and closely-set foundations, Indra hath made his own, and none may move them.

original: apām ūrmiḥ madan iva stomaḥ indra ajirāyate / vi te madāḥ arājiṣuḥ /
analyzed: apām ūrmiḥ madan iva stomaḥ indra ajirāyate    vi te madāḥ arājiṣuḥ  /
translated: Like a wave of the sea, O Indra, my laud hath flowed forth to thee, the swift, and thy wild joys have moved thee.

original: indreṇa sam hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmānaḥ abibhyuṣā / mandū samāna varcasā /
analyzed: indreṇa sam hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmānaḥ abibhyuṣā   mandū samāna varcasā  /
translated: Thou meetest Indra face to face, fearless, with him who comes to thee, With him whose glory is the same.

original: anavadyaiḥ abhidyubhiḥ makhaḥ sahasvat arcati / gaṇaiḥ indrasya kāmyaiḥ /
analyzed: anavadyaiḥ abhidyubhiḥ makhaḥ sahasvat arcati   gaṇaiḥ indrasya kāmyaiḥ
translated: The sacrifice extols with might the blameless, the radiant ones, The bands that are most dear to Indra.

original: āt aha svadhām anu punar garbha tvam erire / dadhānāḥ nāma yajñiyam /
analyzed: āt aha svadhām anu punar garbha tvam erire    dadhānāḥ nāma yajñiyam  /
translated: They have again assumed the state of babes, in accordance with their nature, Assuming the sacrificial name.

original: indraḥ dadhīcaḥ asthabhiḥ vṛtrāṇi apratiṣkutaḥ / jaghāna navatīḥ nava /
analyzed: indraḥ dadhīcaḥ asthabhiḥ vṛtrāṇi apratiṣkutaḥ   jaghāna navatīḥ nava  /
translated: Indra with Dadhyach's bones, unconquerable, slew the nine-and-ninety Vritras.

original: ichan aśvasya yat śiraḥ parvateṣu apaśritam / tat vidat śaryaṇāvati //
analyzed: ichan aśvasya yat śiraḥ parvateṣu apaśritam   tat vidat śaryaṇāvati  /
translated: Seeking the head of the horse which was concealed away in the mountains, He found it in the land of the Saryanis.

original: atra āha goḥ amanvata nāma tvaṣṭuḥ apīcyam / itthā candramasaḥ gṛhe /
analyzed: atra āha goḥ amanvata nāma tvaṣṭuḥ apīcyam    itthā candramasaḥ gṛhe  /
translated: Here they have found the cow's most wondrous name, Tvashtar's, in the house of the moon.

original: vācam aṣṭāpadīm aham nava sraktim ṛta spṛśam / indrāt pari tanvam mame /🔽anu tvā rodasī ubhe krakṣamāṇam akṛpetām / indra yat dasyu hā abhavaḥ //
analyzed: vācam aṣṭāpadīm aham nava sraktim ṛta spṛśam   indrāt pari tanvam mame  / anu tvā rodasī ubhe krakṣamāṇam akṛpetām   indra yat dasyu hā abhavaḥ
translated: I from Indra have received the hymn, eight-footed, nine-jointed, true to Law, The hymn that hath a thousand powers.🔽Both worlds, O Indra, looked on thee as thou wast waxing great, When thou hadst slain the Dasyus.

original: uttiṣṭhan ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ / somam indra camū sutam /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhan ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ   somam indra camū sutam  /
translated: Rising with might, thou, O thou of the ruddy steeds, hast shaken in thy joy, O Indra, the Soma pressed in the wooden chalice.

original: bhindhi viśvāḥ apa dviṣaḥ bādhaḥ jahī mṛdhaḥ / vasu spārham tat ā bhara //
analyzed: bhindhi viśvāḥ apa dviṣaḥ bādhaḥ jahī mṛdhaḥ   vasu spārham tat ā bhara  /
translated: Rend thou in pieces all our foes, drive off and slay our enemies. Bring thou the treasure which we long for.

original: yat vīlau indra yat sthire yat parśāne parābhṛtam / vasu spārham tat ā bhara //
analyzed: yat vīlau indra yat sthire yat parśāne parābhṛtam   vasu spārham tat ā bhara
translated: Whether it be in the village, O Indra, or in the wood, or in the house, bring thou the treasure which we long for.

original: yasya te viśva mānuṣaḥ bhūreḥ dattasya vedati / vasu spārham tat ā bhara //
analyzed: yasya te viśva mānuṣaḥ bhūreḥ dattasya vedati    vasu spārham tat ā bhara  /
translated: Whose, O Indra, of all men, knoweth the gift of thy great wealth? Bring thou the treasure which we long for.

original: pra samrājam carṣaṇīnām indram stotā navyam gīrbhiḥ / naram nṛṣāham maṃhiṣṭham //
analyzed: pra samrājam carṣaṇīnām indram stotā navyam gīrbhiḥ   naram nṛṣāham maṃhiṣṭham  /
translated: Praise thou the universal king of men, Indra, with new songs, The hero most bountiful in fight.

original: yasmin ukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasya / apām avaḥ na samudre /
analyzed: yasmin ukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasya   apām avaḥ na samudre
translated: In whom are all the hymns of praise, and all the glories of the sea, In him the treasures of the floods.

original: tam suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭha rājam bhare kṛtnum / mahaḥ vājinam sanibhyaḥ /
analyzed: tam suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭha rājam bhare kṛtnum    mahaḥ vājinam sanibhyaḥ
translated: I will delight him with fair praise, the King most high, the mighty One, The Lord of treasures, with my song.

original: ayam u te sam atasi kapotaḥ iva garbhadhim / vacaḥ tat cit naḥ ohase //
analyzed: ayam u te sam atasi kapotaḥ iva garbhadhim vacaḥ tat cit naḥ ohase
translated: This one hath settled in thy heart, as a dove in her nest, O thou who hearest prayer.

original: stotram rādhānām pate girvāhaḥ vīra yasya te / vibhūtiḥ astu sūnṛtā /
analyzed: stotram rādhānām pate girvāhaḥ vīra yasya te   / vibhūtiḥ astu sūnṛtā  /
translated: The praise of him who giveth gifts, the bearer of the song, O Lord of bounty, let thy favour be extended.

original: ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭha naḥ ūtaye asmin vāje śatakrato / sam anyeṣu bravāvahai /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭha naḥ ūtaye asmin vāje śatakrato    sam anyeṣu bravāvahai  /
translated: Stand up erect for our protection, O thou of a hundred powers, in this our battle. Let us call upon thee with others.

original: praṇetāram vasyaḥ achā kartāram jyotiḥ samatsu / sāsahvāṃsam yudhāmitrān /
analyzed: praṇetāram vasyaḥ achā kartāram jyotiḥ samatsu    sāsahvāṃsam yudhāmitrān  /
translated: Who leadeth to prosperity, who giveth light in battles, Who conquereth in the strife with foes.

original: sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ / indraḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ   indraḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: He, much-invoked, shall carry us over to safety, to the further shore, Indra, over all our enemies.

original: sa tvam naḥ indra vājobhiḥ daśasyā ca gātuyā ca / achā ca naḥ sumnam neṣi //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra vājobhiḥ daśasyā ca gātuyā ca    achā ca naḥ sumnam neṣi  /
translated: So, Indra, with thy strengthening aids, with thy protection and thy help, Lead thou us also to felicity.

original: tam indram vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave / sa vṛṣā vṛṣabhaḥ bhuvat /
analyzed: tam indram vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave   sa vṛṣā vṛṣabhaḥ bhuvat  /
translated: We quicken Indra for the great encounter with Vritra: he, The Bull, hath been the Bull's supporter.

original: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛtaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ / dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛtaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ   dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ  /
translated: Indra is made for service: in the rapture he is stablished as the strongest. He is glorious, strong, and meet for Soma.

original: girā vajraḥ na saṃbhṛtaḥ sabalaḥ anapacyutaḥ / vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ astṛtaḥ /🔽indram id gāthinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ / indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata /
analyzed: girā vajraḥ na saṃbhṛtaḥ sabalaḥ anapacyutaḥ   vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ astṛtaḥ  indram id gāthinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ   indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata  /
translated: The bolt, like a strong bow, is drawn by the hymn, irresistible, Lofty, and never failing in its strength.🔽The singers with their lauds exalt him, the chanters with their hymns, Indra, the singers with their songs.

original: indraḥ id dharyoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā / indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā   indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ  /
translated: Indra is closely joined to the two Bay Steeds, is yoked with speech to be entreated. Indra is armed with the gold-begotten bolt.

original: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi / vi gobhiḥ adrim airayat /
analyzed: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi   vi gobhiḥ adrim airayat  /
translated: Indra hath raised the Sun to heaven, that he may look on far away. He with the floods hath rent the mountain.

original: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam / ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama /
analyzed: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam   ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama  /
translated: Come hither, for thy bay steeds are ready: drink, Indra, this Soma juice. Sit on this sacred grass of mine.

original: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā / upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu //
analyzed: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā    upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu  /
translated: Let thy two bay steeds yoked by prayer bring thee hither, O Indra, thou whose locks are decked with diadems. Listen to our adorations.

original: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ / sutāvantaḥ havāmahe //🔽yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ / rocante rocanā divi //
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ    sutāvantaḥ havāmahe  / yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ   rocante rocanā divi  /
translated: We Brahmans, O Indra, who have pressed the juice, who have prepared the Soma, call thee, thee who drinkest Soma, to the banquet.🔽They yoke the ruddy steed, the moving, the far-extending one: the luminous lights shine in the sky.

original: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe / śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā /🔽ketum kṛṇvan aketave peśaḥ maryāḥ apeśase / sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ /🔽ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ / dṛśe viśvāya sūryam //
analyzed: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe   śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā  / ketum kṛṇvan aketave peśaḥ maryāḥ apeśase   sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ  ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ    dṛśe viśvāya sūryam  /
translated: They yoke his two dear bay steeds, the strong, the active, on the car, the red, the bold, that carry men.🔽Making a light where no light was, thou spreadest out the robe for Maruts: thou wast born with the Dawns.🔽His banners bear on high that God, the all-observing Jâtavedas, Sûrya, that all may see.

original: apa tye tāyavaḥ yathā nakṣatrāḥ yanti aktubhiḥ / sūrāya viśva cakṣase /
analyzed: apa tye tāyavaḥ yathā nakṣatrāḥ yanti aktubhiḥ   sūrāya viśva cakṣase  /
translated: Those rays of thine, O Sûrya, like birds on their paths through the sky, move onward to the universal view.

original: adṛśran asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janām anu / bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā /
analyzed: adṛśran asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janām anu bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā
translated: His are the lights that all may see, his are the rays that follow men, shining like flames of burning fire.

original: taraṇiḥ viśva darśataḥ jyotiṣkṛt asi sūrya / viśvam ā bhāsi rocana /
analyzed: taraṇiḥ viśva darśataḥ jyotiṣkṛt asi sūrya   viśvam ā bhāsi rocana
translated: Thou, Sûrya, art the swift, the all-beholding, the light-creating God: thou shinest out on all that live.

original: pratyaṅ devānām viśaḥ pratyaṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ / pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe /
analyzed: pratyaṅ devānām viśaḥ pratyaṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ   pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe  /
translated: Thou goest to the Gods' own folk, and to the folk of human kind, To look on all the world of light.

original: yena pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantam janām anu / tvam varuṇa paśyasi //
analyzed: yena pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantam janām anu   tvam varuṇa paśyasi  /
translated: With what bright eye thou lookest forth on men who move in restless round, O Varuṇa, thou lookest forth.

original: vi dyām eṣi rajaḥ pṛthu ahar mimānaḥ aktubhiḥ / paśyam janmāni sūrya //🔽sapta tvā haritaḥ rathe vahanti deva sūrya / śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇam /
analyzed: vi dyām eṣi rajaḥ pṛthu ahar mimānaḥ aktubhiḥ   paśyam janmāni sūrya  sapta tvā haritaḥ rathe vahanti deva sūrya    śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇam  /
translated: Thou goest through the spacious realm of heaven, measuring days with beams, And lookest on the race of men.🔽Seven tawny coursers on thy car, O God Sûrya, draw thee on, Thee, O thou Very Wise, whose hair is flame.

original: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūraḥ rathasya naptyaḥ / tābhiḥ yāti sva yuktibhiḥ //🔽abhi tvā varcasā giraḥ siñcanti ā caraṇyuvaḥ / abhi vatsam na dhenavaḥ /🔽tāḥ arṣanti śubhriyaḥ pṛñcatīḥ varcasā payaḥ / jātam janiḥ yathā hṛdā /
analyzed: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūraḥ rathasya naptyaḥ   tābhiḥ yāti sva yuktibhiḥ  abhi tvā varcasā giraḥ siñcanti ā caraṇyuvaḥ    abhi vatsam na dhenavaḥ  tāḥ arṣanti śubhriyaḥ pṛñcatīḥ varcasā payaḥ   jātam janiḥ yathā hṛdā
translated: The seven bright mares have yoked themselves, the daughters of the Sun, his car. With these he travels, well-yoked steeds.🔽The songs, most active, pour on thee their juice, their splendour, and their might, As milch-kine low to meet their calves.🔽They flow, the bright, besprinkling with their stream of milk the thing that is, As the born babe is cherished in the heart.

original: vajra apavasādhyaḥ kīrtiḥ mriyamāṇam āvahan / mahyam āyuḥ ghṛtam payaḥ /
analyzed: vajra apavasādhyaḥ kīrtiḥ mriyamāṇam āvahan   mahyam āyuḥ ghṛtam payaḥ
translated: The glory which the bolt hath won, which Vâjas and Aṣvamedha won, and which the Maruts won of old.

original: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras / pitaram ca prayan svar /
analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras    pitaram ca prayan svar  /
translated: This dappled Cow hath come and sat before her Mother and her Sire, and gone to heaven, her wonted place.

original: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānataḥ / vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ svar /
analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānataḥ   vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ svar  /
translated: He moves within the light of this, from his out-breathing and his in-breathing. The mighty one hath looked upon the heaven.

original: triṃśat dhāmā vi rājati vāc pataṅgaḥ aśiśriyat / prati vastoḥ ahar dyubhiḥ //
analyzed: triṃśat dhāmā vi rājati vāc pataṅgaḥ aśiśriyat   prati vastoḥ ahar dyubhiḥ
translated: The thirty-fold abode shines forth. The bird hath settled in the voice. The Gods have gladdened them- selves with day, with light, at eve.

original: yat śakrāḥ vācam āruhan antarikṣam siṣāsathaḥ / sam devāḥ amadan vṛṣā /
analyzed: yat śakrāḥ vācam āruhan antarikṣam siṣāsathaḥ   sam devāḥ amadan vṛṣā  /
translated: When, O ye Shakra-like, ye mounted the voice, and thirsted for the atmosphere, the mighty Gods have been delighted.

original: śakraḥ vācam a dhṛṣṭa āyoḥ uvācaḥ a dhṛṣṇuhi / maṃhiṣṭhaḥ ā madardivi //
analyzed: śakraḥ vācam a dhṛṣṭa āyoḥ uvācaḥ a dhṛṣṇuhi    maṃhiṣṭhaḥ ā madardivi  /
translated: O Shakra, thou hast seized the voice. Seize thou the voice of him who hates us. Most bountiful, rejoice thee in the sky.

original: śakraḥ vācam a dhṛṣṇuhi dhāma dharman vi rājati / vimadan barhiḥ āsaran /
analyzed: śakraḥ vācam a dhṛṣṇuhi dhāma dharman vi rājati    vimadan barhiḥ āsaran  /
translated: O Shakra, seize thou the voice. The Law shines forth in thirty abodes. The Gods have been delighted, and have sat them down upon the sacred grass.

original: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ / abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ    abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe  /
translated: We laud with songs that wondrous Indra, who, like a cow in stalls, is dear to you, who joys in the juice, who conquers foes, whom the songs make glad, as cows a milch-cow, in the folds.

original: dyukṣam sudānum taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam girim na puru bhojasam / kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe /
analyzed: dyukṣam sudānum taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam girim na puru bhojasam    kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe  /
translated: The bounteous, glorious, mighty One, encompassed round with powers, like a hill, who gives abundant food, the strong, the vigorous, the hundredfold, the thousandfold, him, him we seek who gives a herd of kine.

original: tat tvā yāmi su vīryam tat brahma pūrvacittaye / yena yatibhyaḥ bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha //
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi su vīryam tat brahma pūrvacittaye   yena yatibhyaḥ bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha  /
translated: To that heroic power of thine, that holy power, we come for aid, wherewith thou holpest Bhrigu and the Yatis in the strife for wealth, and Prāskandha.

original: yena samudram asṛjaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ tat indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ / sadyas saḥ asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yam kṣoṇīḥ anucakrade /
analyzed: yena samudram asṛjaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ tat indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ    sadyas saḥ asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yam kṣoṇīḥ anucakrade  /
translated: By which thou madest the great waters, the ocean, that is thy manly power, O Indra. Never may that greatness of thine fail, for which the worlds have followed thee.

original: kat navyaḥ atasīnām turaḥ gṛṇīta martyaḥ / nahi nu asya mahimānam indriyam svar gṛṇantaḥ ānaśuḥ /
analyzed: kat navyaḥ atasīnām turaḥ gṛṇīta martyaḥ   nahi nu asya mahimānam indriyam svar gṛṇantaḥ ānaśuḥ  /
translated: What mortal shall extol the newest of the strong ones of the fleece? For we have not attained to the greatness, to the godhead of Indra, the singer.

original: kad u stuvantaḥ ṛtayanta devataḥ ṛṣiḥ kaḥ vipraḥ ohate / kadā havam maghavan indra sunvataḥ kad u stuvataḥ ā gamaḥ /
analyzed: kad u stuvantaḥ ṛtayanta devataḥ ṛṣiḥ kaḥ vipraḥ ohate    kadā havam maghavan indra sunvataḥ kad u stuvataḥ ā gamaḥ  /
translated: What time, O God, do they who sing forth praise, the R̥ishis, the priests, adore? When, O Maghavan, wilt thou come to the worshipper's invocation, when to the singer's?

original: abhi pra vaḥ su rādhasam indram arca yathā vide / yaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇa iva śikṣati //🔽śata anīkā iva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe / gireḥ iva pra rasāḥ asya pinvire datrāṇi puru bhojasaḥ /
analyzed: abhi pra vaḥ su rādhasam indram arca yathā vide   yaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇa iva śikṣati  / śata anīkā iva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe    gireḥ iva pra rasāḥ asya pinvire datrāṇi puru bhojasaḥ  /
translated: I SING to him, your bounteous Lord, to Indra, as he is to be known, Who, liberal to the singers, as with thousands, gives to the worshippers what they desire.🔽He goes forth in his might with hundred hosts, and slays the Vr̥itras for the worshipper. As from a mountain flow his bounties, his gifts, the Lord of ample wealth.

original: pra su śrutam su rādhasam arcā śakram abhiṣṭaye / yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyam vasu sahasreṇa iva maṃhate //
analyzed: pra su śrutam su rādhasam arcā śakram abhiṣṭaye   yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyam vasu sahasreṇa iva maṃhate  /
translated: I SING to him, the famous, bounteous, to be praised, to Indra for protection, Who, as with thousands, gives to him who sheds the juice, to him who sings his praise, desirable wealth.

original: śata anīkāḥ hetayaḥ asya duṣṭarāḥ indrasya samiṣaḥ mahīḥ / giriḥ na bhujmā maghatsu pinvate yat īm sutāḥ amandiṣuḥ /
analyzed: śata anīkāḥ hetayaḥ asya duṣṭarāḥ indrasya samiṣaḥ mahīḥ   giriḥ na bhujmā maghatsu pinvate yat īm sutāḥ amandiṣuḥ  /
translated: His weapons, irresistible, are hundredfold, and mighty are the viands of this Indra. He swells like a high hill in the liberal giver's gifts when the pressed juices have delighted him.

original: vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ / pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate /
analyzed: vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ   pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate  /
translated: We, with our pressed-out Soma, like the waters on the strewn grass, O Vr̥itra-slayer, sit around thee at the running streams of the pure juice, to sing thy praise.

original: svaranti tvā sute naraḥ vaso nireke ukthinaḥ / kadā sutam tṛṣāṇaḥ oke ā gamaḥ indra svabdī iva vaṃsagaḥ /
analyzed: svaranti tvā sute naraḥ vaso nireke ukthinaḥ   kadā sutam tṛṣāṇaḥ oke ā gamaḥ indra svabdī iva vaṃsagaḥ  /
translated: The men who press the juice sing forth to thee, O Vasu, in the house, the singers of the hymn. When wilt thou come, as one who thirsts, to the juice, to the banquet, O Indra, as to thy home?

original: kaṇvebhiḥ dhṛṣṇo ā dhṛsat vājam darṣi sahasriṇam / piśaṅga rūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe /
analyzed: kaṇvebhiḥ dhṛṣṇo ā dhṛsat vājam darṣi sahasriṇam   piśaṅga rūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe  /
translated: O bold one, with the Kaṇvas win thou strength in hundreds and in thousands. O Maghavan, most active, we implore thee, for the ruddy-hued, the very rich in kine.

original: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam kad vayaḥ dadhe / ayam yaḥ puras vibhinatti ojasā mandānaḥ śiprī andhasaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam kad vayaḥ dadhe    ayam yaḥ puras vibhinatti ojasā mandānaḥ śiprī andhasaḥ  /
translated: Who knows when he is quaffing the juice together with the pressed-out (Soma), what age he takes to himself? This one who with his might breaks down the castles, the lovely one, rejoicing in the juice.

original: dānā mṛgaḥ na vāraṇaḥ purutrā caratham dadhe / nakir tvā ni yamat ā sute gamaḥ mahāḥ carasi ojasā /
analyzed: dānā mṛgaḥ na vāraṇaḥ purutrā caratham dadhe   nakir tvā ni yamat ā sute gamaḥ mahāḥ carasi ojasā  /
translated: Like a wild elephant, he, the bountiful, hath set his dwelling in many a place. None may restrain thee when thou goest to the juice. Thou movest mightily with might.

original: yaḥ ugraḥ san a niṣṭṛta sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ / yadi stotuḥ maghavā śṛṇavat dhavam na indraḥ yoṣatī ā gamat /
analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ san a niṣṭṛta sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ   yadi stotuḥ maghavā śṛṇavat dhavam na indraḥ yoṣatī ā gamat  /
translated: He who, being fierce, is unresisted, firm, made ready for the fight, If Maghavan, the bounteous, hears the singer's call, Indra will come to us.

original: viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhibhūtaram naram sajūs tatakṣuḥ indram jajanuḥ ca rājase / kratvā variṣṭham vare āmurim uta ugram ojiṣṭham tavasam tarasvinam /
analyzed: viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhibhūtaram naram sajūs tatakṣuḥ indram jajanuḥ ca rājase    kratvā variṣṭham vare āmurim uta ugram ojiṣṭham tavasam tarasvinam  /
translated: All people have fashioned Indra, the overlord of all the hosts, to be their King for glory. Him, the most wise, the most heroic, the most powerful, the most mighty, the most impetuous, have they formed.

original: sam īm rebhāsaḥ asvaran indram somasya pītaye / svar patim yat īm vṛdhe dhṛta vrataḥ hi ojasā sam ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: sam īm rebhāsaḥ asvaran indram somasya pītaye   svar patim yat īm vṛdhe dhṛta vrataḥ hi ojasā sam ūtibhiḥ  /
translated: The singers have all lifted up their voices to Indra to drink the Soma. Him, the Lord of the light, whom they have made firm for increase by his power and his help.

original: nemim namanti cakṣasā meṣam viprāḥ abhisvarā / su dītayaḥ vaḥ adruhaḥ api karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ /
analyzed: nemim namanti cakṣasā meṣam viprāḥ abhisvarā    su dītayaḥ vaḥ adruhaḥ api karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ  /
translated: The sages with their eye have looked on him, the ram, with their songs of praise. Your well-aimed missiles, ye guileless Gods, are swift to hear with the Rkv-s.

original: tam indram johavīmi maghavānam ugram satrā dadhānam a pratiṣkutam śavāṃsi / maṃhiṣṭhaḥ gīrbhiḥ ā ca yajñiyaḥ vavartat rāye naḥ viśvā su pathā kṛṇotu vajrī /
analyzed: tam indram johavīmi maghavānam ugram satrā dadhānam a pratiṣkutam śavāṃsi   maṃhiṣṭhaḥ gīrbhiḥ ā ca yajñiyaḥ vavartat rāye naḥ viśvā su pathā kṛṇotu vajrī  /
translated: I call on that Indra, the bountiful, the mighty, who ever holds his powers unresisted. Best to be praised with songs, he who is meet for sacrifice, may he turn unto us. May the wielder of the bolt make all our paths easy for us to travel.

original: yāḥ indra bhujaḥ ābharaḥ svarvān asurebhyaḥ / stotāram id maghavan asya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛkta barhiṣaḥ //
analyzed: yāḥ indra bhujaḥ ābharaḥ svarvān asurebhyaḥ   stotāram id maghavan asya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛkta barhiṣaḥ  /
translated: Those powers, O Indra, which thou gavest to the worshipper of heaven, to the Asuras, O Maghavan, increase the man who lauds thee, and those who spread the sacred grass for thee.

original: yam indra dadhiṣe tvam aśvam gām bhāgam avyayam / yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin tam dhehi mā paṇau /
analyzed: yam indra dadhiṣe tvam aśvam gām bhāgam avyayam   yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin tam dhehi mā paṇau  /
translated: The horse, the cow, the ample share which thou hast stored, O Indra, for the worshipper who sheds the juice and gives the guerdon, place in the man who does this, not in the niggard.
