original: indraḥ madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ / tam id mahatsu ājiṣūta īm arbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra naḥ aviṣat /
analyzed: indraḥ madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ   tam id mahatsu ājiṣu uta īm arbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra naḥ aviṣat  /
translated: For rapture and for strength hath Indra grown great, the Vr̥itra-slayer with the men. Him will we call in mighty battles and in small. In our contests may he be victorious.

original: asi hi vīra senyaḥ asi bhūri parādadiḥ / asi dabhrasya cit vṛdhaḥ yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu //
analyzed: asi hi vīra senyaḥ asi bhūri parādadiḥ   asi dabhrasya cit vṛdhaḥ yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu  /
translated: For thou art he who sends the hero forth to war, thou art the giver of abundant spoil. Thou art the strengthener even of him who is weak. Thou teachest the sacrificer. To the worshipper thou givest ample wealth.🔽When the victorious one advances, and wealth is laid up for the daring man,

original: yat udīrate ājayaḥ dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā / yukṣvā mada cyutā harī kam hanaḥ kam vasau dadhaḥ asmān indra vasau dadhaḥ /
analyzed: yat udīrate ājayaḥ dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā    yukṣvā mada cyutā harī kam hanaḥ kam vasau dadhaḥ asmān indra vasau dadhaḥ  /
translated: Yoke thy two Bay Steeds that drop the gladdening juice. Whom wilt thou slay? Whom settest thou in happy case? O Indra, set us in happy case.🔽In every fight for spoil, O thou of righteous mind, give us a share of herds of cattle.

original: mademade hi naḥ dadiḥ yūthā gavām ṛjukratuḥ / sam gṛbhāya puru śata ubhayā hastyā vasu śiśīhi rāyaḥ ā bhara //
analyzed: mademade hi naḥ dadiḥ yūthā gavām ṛjukratuḥ   sam gṛbhāya puru śata ubhayā hastyā vasu śiśīhi rāyaḥ ā bhara  /
translated: Gather together for us hundreds of thousands from both sides. Sharpen thy weapons, and bring riches hitherward.

original: mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase / vidma hi tvā purūvasum upa kāmān sasṛjmahe athā naḥ avitā bhava //
analyzed: mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase    vidma hi tvā purūvasum upa kāmān sasṛjmahe athā naḥ avitā bhava  /
translated: Delight thee with the juice, O thou of manly strength, for bounty and for power. For we have known thee as the Lord of ample wealth: we have sent up our prayers to thee. Be thou our guardian now.

original: ete te indra jantavaḥ viśvam puṣyanti vāryam / antar hi khyaḥ janānām aryaḥ vedaḥ a dāśuṣām teṣām naḥ vedaḥ ā bhara //
analyzed: ete te indra jantavaḥ viśvam puṣyanti vāryam   antar hi khyaḥ janānām aryaḥ vedaḥ a dāśuṣām teṣām naḥ vedaḥ ā bhara  /
translated: These men, O Indra, all promote the choicest treasure that thou hast. For thou art known as Lord of men who bring no gifts: bring thou to us that treasure.

original: surūpa kṛtnum ūtaye su dughām iva go duhe / juhūmasi dyavidyavi //
analyzed: surūpa kṛtnum ūtaye su dughām iva go duhe    juhūmasi dyavidyavi
translated: We call on thee, O thou of fair forms, to aid us, as on a milch-cow good to milk, O thou of ample wealth.

original: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya soma pāḥ piba / go dāḥ id revataḥ madaḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya soma pāḥ piba   go dāḥ id revataḥ madaḥ  /
translated: Come to our solemn rites, O thou who art to be adored by all: drink Soma, O thou Soma-drinker. The gift of kine is a delightful joy.

original: atha te antamānām vidyāma sumatīnām / mā naḥ ati khye ā gahi //
analyzed: atha te antamānām vidyāma sumatīnām   mā naḥ ati khye ā gahi  /
translated: So may we know the best of all thy gracious favours, and come not in thy sight to suffer harm.

original: śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim / indra somam śatakrato /
analyzed: śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim   indra somam śatakrato  /
translated: Best giver of delight, protect for our protection the watchful, glorious one. O Indra, drink the Soma, O thou who hast a hundred powers.

original: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu / indra tāni te ā vṛṇe /
analyzed: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu   indra tāni te ā vṛṇe  /
translated: The powers which thou hast in the five peoples, O Indra, O thou of a hundred powers, those powers of thine I choose.

original: agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram / ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi //
analyzed: agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram    ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi  /
translated: O Indra, thou hast gained great glory: win for thyself imperishable fame. We lift thee up to higher strength.

original: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atha u śakra parāvataḥ / u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi //
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atha u śakra parāvataḥ   u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi  /
translated: Come thou to us from yonder side, O Śakra, and from this side, From whatever region thou art wont to come, O Indra, come from thence.

original: indraḥ aṅga mahat bhayam abhi sat apa cucyavat / sa hi sthiraḥ vicarṣaniḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ aṅga mahat bhayam abhi sat apa cucyavat    sa hi sthiraḥ vicarṣaniḥ  /
translated: Indra, indeed, hath overcome a great and terrible affliction. For he is firm and very active.

original: indraḥ ca mṛlayāti naḥ na naḥ paścāt agham naśat / bhadram bhavāti naḥ puras /
analyzed: indraḥ ca mṛlayāti naḥ na naḥ paścāt agham naśat   bhadram bhavāti naḥ puras
translated: Indra will show us mercy, and will not inflict evil on us from behind. He will be gracious to us in front.

original: indraḥ āśābhyaḥ pari sarvābhyaḥ abhayam karat / jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ āśābhyaḥ pari sarvābhyaḥ abhayam karat jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Indra will give security from all the regions around. The very active one will conquer the foes.

original: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam kad vayaḥ dadhe / ayam yaḥ puras vibhinatti ojasā mandānaḥ śiprī andhasaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam kad vayaḥ dadhe    ayam yaḥ puras vibhinatti ojasā mandānaḥ śiprī andhasaḥ  /
translated: Who knows him when he drinks the juice, who has provided him with food? He who here in the front breaks open the firm place, rejoicing, the beautiful one, in the juice.

original: dānā mṛgaḥ na vāraṇaḥ purutrā caratham dadhe / nakir tvā ni yamat ā sute gamaḥ mahān carasi ojasā /
analyzed: dānā mṛgaḥ na vāraṇaḥ purutrā caratham dadhe   nakir tvā ni yamat ā sute gamaḥ mahān carasi ojasā  /
translated: Like a wild elephant, he has set his will on the path in many a place. None may restrain him when he comes to the juice. Thou goest great in might.

original: yaḥ ugraḥ san a niṣṭṛta sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ / yadi stotuḥ maghavā śṛṇavat dhavam na indraḥ yoṣatī ā gamat /
analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ san a niṣṭṛta sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ   yadi stotuḥ maghavā śṛṇavat dhavam na indraḥ yoṣatī ā gamat  /
translated: He who, being fierce, is not to be resisted, is firm, is made ready for the fight, if the bountiful one hears the call of the praiser, Indra will not come as a woman.

original: vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ / pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate /
analyzed: vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ   pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate  /
translated: Men with the juice effused sing forth to thee, O Vasu, in the house of prayer.

original: svaranti tvā sute naraḥ vaso nireke ukthinaḥ / kadā sutam tṛṣāṇaḥ oke ā gamaḥ indra svabdī iva vaṃsagaḥ /
analyzed: svaranti tvā sute naraḥ vaso nireke ukthinaḥ   kadā sutam tṛṣāṇaḥ oke ā gamaḥ indra svabdī iva vaṃsagaḥ  /
translated: When, thirsting for the juice, wilt thou come to the draught, O Indra, as to a trough, for thou art swift?

original: kaṇvebhiḥ dhṛṣṇo ā dhṛṣat vājam darṣi sahasriṇam / piśaṅga rūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe /
analyzed: kaṇvebhiḥ dhṛṣṇo ā dhṛṣat vājam darṣi sahasriṇam   piśaṅga rūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe  /
translated: O bold one, with the Kaṇvas win thou strength in hundreds and in thousands.

original: śrāyante iva sūryam viśvā id indrasya bhakṣata / vasūni jāte janamāne ojasā prati bhāgam na dīdhima /
analyzed: śrāyante iva sūryam viśvā id indrasya bhakṣata   vasūni jāte janamāne ojasā prati bhāgam na dīdhima  /
translated: All men rejoice in Indra's gifts, as in the Sun, O thou of wondrous deeds.🔽Praise thou the bounteous one, the giver of good things: Indra's gifts are most excellent.

original: anarśarātim vasudām upa stuhi bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ / saḥ asya kāmam vidhataḥ na roṣati manaḥ dānāya codayan //
analyzed: anarśarātim vasudām upa stuhi bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ    saḥ asya kāmam vidhataḥ na roṣati manaḥ dānāya codayan  /
translated: He, when the wish is formed, is not wroth with the man who forms it, but impels his thought to give.

original: baṭ mahām asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahām asi / mahaḥ te sataḥ mahimā panasyate addhā deva mahām asi /
analyzed: baṭ mahām asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahām asi    mahaḥ te sataḥ mahimā panasyate addhā deva mahām asi  /
translated: O Sûrya, thou art great, O Âditya, thou art great. Great is thy greatness, O God, as one who hastest to the place of prayer.

original: baṭ sūrya śravasā mahām asi satrā deva mahāṃ asi / mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohitaḥ vibhu jyotiḥ adābhyam //
analyzed: baṭ sūrya śravasā mahām asi satrā deva mahāṃ asi    mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohitaḥ vibhu jyotiḥ adābhyam  /
translated: O Sûrya, verily thou art great in glory: ever, O God, thou art great. By greatness thou art Priest of the Gods, the Asura's Priest, whose light is all-pervading and secure.

original: ud u tye madhu mattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate / satrājitaḥ dhanasāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva /
analyzed: ud u tye madhu mattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate    satrājitaḥ dhanasāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva  /
translated: These songs of praise, most rich in sweets, these hymns of praise are lifted up, Ever-conquering, winning riches, with unfailing succours, like to chariots urged to speed.

original: kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūrye iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ / indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūrye iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ   indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran  /
translated: As Kaṇvas and as Bhṛigus, as Sûryas, they have gained all that is good in song. The living men, exalting Indra with their lauds, have sung to him who loves the hymn.

original: ud id nu asya ricyate aṃśaḥ dhanam na jigyusaḥ / yaḥ indraḥ harivān na dabhanti tam ripaḥ dakṣam dadhāti somini //
analyzed: ud id nu asya ricyate aṃśaḥ dhanam na jigyusaḥ   yaḥ indraḥ harivān na dabhanti tam ripaḥ dakṣam dadhāti somini  /
translated: The share of him who wins the spoil is ever increased, like wealth, Whom, borne on tawny steeds, the foes do not deceive: he gives the worshipper ability and power.

original: mantram akharvam sudhitam supeśasam dadhāta yajñiyeṣu ā / pūrvīḥ cana prasitayaḥ taranti tam ye indre karmaṇā bhuvat //🔽eva hi asi vīrayuḥ eva śūraḥ uta sthiraḥ / eva te rādhyam manaḥ /
analyzed: mantram akharvam sudhitam supeśasam dadhāta yajñiyeṣu ā   pūrvīḥ cana prasitayaḥ taranti tam ye indre karmaṇā bhuvat  eva hi asi vīrayuḥ eva śūraḥ uta sthiraḥ    eva te rādhyam manaḥ  /
translated: Place thou in us the never-failing, well-ordered, fair-formed hymn, in those who serve at sacrifice. Many a snare do they escape who have been with Indra in the work.🔽For thou art he who loves the hero, thou, O Indra, art the hero, and art firm. So may thy spirit be propitious to us.

original: eva rātiḥ tuvīmagha viśvebhiḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ / aghā cit indra me sacā /
analyzed: eva rātiḥ tuvīmagha viśvebhiḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ   aghā cit indra me sacā  /
translated: So may thy bounty, O Most Wealthy One, be stablished with all thy supporters. Even the wicked, Indra, are thy friends in fight.

original: mā u su brahmā iva tandrayuḥ bhuvaḥ vājānām pate / matsva sutasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: mā u su brahmā iva tandrayuḥ bhuvaḥ vājānām pate   matsva sutasya gomataḥ  /
translated: Be not as one who fain would sing, but is too slow, O Lord of strength. Rejoice thee in the juice of him who hath the kine.

original: eva hi asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī / pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe /
analyzed: eva hi asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī    pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe  /
translated: For this his bounty, this his wondrous stream of milk, this ample wealth, Is ripe as fruit for him who offers gifts.

original: eva hi te vibhūtayaḥ ūtayaḥ indra māvate / sadyas cit santi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: eva hi te vibhūtayaḥ ūtayaḥ indra māvate    sadyas cit santi dāśuṣe  /
translated: For these thy powers, these aids are thine, O Indra, for the worshipper, Even now are they for him who brings his gifts.

original: eva hi asya kāmyā stomaḥ uktham ca śaṃsyā / indrāya soma pītaye /🔽tam te madam gṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇam pṛtsu sāsahim / u loka kṛtnum adrivas hari śriyam /
analyzed: eva hi asya kāmyā stomaḥ uktham ca śaṃsyā   indrāya soma pītaye  tam te madam gṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇam pṛtsu sāsahim   u loka kṛtnum adrivas hari śriyam  /
translated: For this his praise is meet to be sung, this hymn to be extolled, To Indra when the Soma is pressed out.🔽This gladdening draught of thine we sing, the mighty, conquering in the wars, The golden-visored, Lord of light, who gives us room.

original: yena jyotīmṣi āyave manave ca viveditha / mandānaḥ asya barhiṣaḥ vi rājasi //
analyzed: yena jyotīmṣi āyave manave ca viveditha    mandānaḥ asya barhiṣaḥ vi rājasi  /
translated: Wherewith thou foundest for the Sun and Manu light, rejoicing in this grass thou shinest forth.

original: tat adya cit te ukthinaḥ anu stuvanti pūrvathā / vṛṣa patnīḥ apaḥ jaya divedive /
analyzed: tat adya cit te ukthinaḥ anu stuvanti pūrvathā   vṛṣa patnīḥ apaḥ jaya divedive  /
translated: Even now the singers of thy praise extol thee as of old, O thou who winnest light for Dyaus each day.

original: tam u abhi pra gāyata puruhūtam puruṣṭutam / indram gīrbhiḥ taviṣam ā vivāsata /
analyzed: tam u abhi pra gāyata puruhūtam puruṣṭutam    indram gīrbhiḥ taviṣam ā vivāsata  /
translated: Sing ye aloud to him, the much-invoked, the much-praised one, To Indra, to the Strong, with songs invite him.

original: yasya dvibarhasaḥ bṛhat sahaḥ dādhāra rodasī / girīn ajrān apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā /
analyzed: yasya dvibarhasaḥ bṛhat sahaḥ dādhāra rodasī    girīn ajrān apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā  /
translated: Whose is the mighty power, whose is the lofty strength, which upholds the two world-halves, The mountains, the floods, the light, by virtue of his manhood.

original: sa rājasi puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase / indra jaitrā śravasya ca yantave /🔽vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kad cit bharantaḥ avasyavaḥ / vāje citram havāmahe / vāje citram havāmahe /
analyzed: sa rājasi puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase   indra jaitrā śravasya ca yantave  / vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kad cit bharantaḥ avasyavaḥ   vāje citram havāmahe    vāje citram havāmahe
translated: You, O King, alone, much lauded, destroy the Vr̥itras, O Indra, for the sake of victory and fame.🔽We, O thou of wondrous deeds, ever seeking help, bearing thee, O thou who art not to be borne, as one very mighty, call thee to the wondrous prize. We call thee to the wondrous prize.

original: upa tvā karman ūtaye sa naḥ yuvā ugraḥ cakrāma yaḥ dhṛṣat / tvām id hi avitāram vavṛmahe sakhāyaḥ indra sānasim /
analyzed: upa tvā karman ūtaye sa naḥ yuvā ugraḥ cakrāma yaḥ dhṛṣat    tvām id hi avitāram vavṛmahe sakhāyaḥ indra sānasim  /
translated: To thee, O thou who art to be invoked in sacrifice, to thee, O thou who art young and strong, who goest boldly to the fight, have we come for help. We have chosen thee, O Indra, as our protector, O thou who givest good gifts, O friend.

original: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe / sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe    sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye  /
translated: Him who hath brought us this and this of old, this boon, him will I praise for you. O friends, Indra, for help.

original: haryaśvam sat patim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata / ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam /🔽indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat / dharma kṛte vipaścite panasyave /
analyzed: haryaśvam sat patim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata   ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam  / indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat    dharma kṛte vipaścite panasyave  /
translated: Him who is Lord of the brave, whose bay steeds are swift, who is mighty over men, who hath rejoiced in this our sacrifice, him, O friends, let us invoke, him who is rich in kine and horses, to bestow a hundred gifts on the praisers.🔽Sing ye a Sâman to Indra, to the mighty, to the holy one, To him who maketh the law, the wise, the bounteous.

original: tvam indra abhibhūḥ asi tvam sūryam arocayaḥ / viśvakarmā viśvadevaḥ mahān asi /
analyzed: tvam indra abhibhūḥ asi tvam sūryam arocayaḥ   / viśvakarmā viśvadevaḥ mahān asi  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the overlord: thou hast caused Sûrya to shine. Thou art the all-creating, all-god, the great.

original: vibhrājam jyotiṣā svar agacchaḥ rocanam divaḥ / devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire /
analyzed: vibhrājam jyotiṣā svar agacchaḥ rocanam divaḥ   devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire  /
translated: With light thou hast attained the heaven, the luminous realm of the sky. The Gods, O Indra, have submitted to thee for friendship.

original: tam u abhi pra gāyata puruhūtam puruṣṭutam / indram gīrbhiḥ taviṣam ā vivāsata /
analyzed: tam u abhi pra gāyata puruhūtam puruṣṭutam    indram gīrbhiḥ taviṣam ā vivāsata  /
translated: Him, much-invoked, much-praised, do ye exalt with songs, Indra, the mighty, with your hymns.

original: yasya dvibarhasaḥ bṛhat sahaḥ dādhāra rodasī / girīn ajrān apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā /
analyzed: yasya dvibarhasaḥ bṛhat sahaḥ dādhāra rodasī    girīn ajrān apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā  /
translated: Whose is the lofty power that hath increased, who upholdeth heaven and earth, the mountains, the floods, the light, as a strong one.

original: sa rājasi puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase / indra jaitra śravasya ca yantave /
analyzed: sa rājasi puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase   indra jaitra śravasya ca yantave  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the King, to be extolled by many, thou alone slayest the Vr̥itras. O Victor, for fame to be gained.

original: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ / yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti //
analyzed: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ   yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti  /
translated: May we be the possessors of these existing worlds, Indra and all the Gods. May Indra, with the Âdityas, ordain for us sacrifice, body, and progeny.

original: ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmākam bhūtu avitā tanūnām / hatvāya devāḥ asurān yat āyan devāḥ deva tvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmākam bhūtu avitā tanūnām   hatvāya devāḥ asurān yat āyan devāḥ deva tvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ  /
translated: With the Âdityas, with the Marut host, may Indra be our guardian for our bodies. As the Gods went to slay the Asuras, the Gods, preserving their own Godhead.

original: pratyañcam arkam anayam śacībhiḥ āt id svadhām iṣirām pari apaśyan / ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ /
analyzed: pratyañcam arkam anayam śacībhiḥ āt id svadhām iṣirām pari apaśyan    ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ  /
translated: With his great powers he brought the Sun to us, and looked around on his own nature, on his own strength. May we win, through thee, O God, the booty gained by heroes. May we rejoice through a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: yaḥ ekaḥ id vidayate vasu martāya dāśuṣe / īśānaḥ apratiṣkutaḥ indraḥ aṅga /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id vidayate vasu martāya dāśuṣe    īśānaḥ apratiṣkutaḥ indraḥ aṅga  /
translated: Indra is the Lord, the irresistible one.

original: kadā martam arādhasam padā kṣumpam iva sphurat / kadā naḥ śuśravat giraḥ indraḥ aṅga /
analyzed: kadā martam arādhasam padā kṣumpam iva sphurat   kadā naḥ śuśravat giraḥ indraḥ aṅga  /
translated: When will he crush the wicked man with his foot, as one would a water-bubble? When will he listen to our songs? Indra is the Lord.🔽He who, though thou hast been pressed by many, thou who hast been pressed by many,

original: yaḥ cit hi tvā bahubhyaḥ ā sutāvān āvivāsati / ugram tat patyate śavaḥ indraḥ aṅga /
analyzed: yaḥ cit hi tvā bahubhyaḥ ā sutāvān āvivāsati    ugram tat patyate śavaḥ indraḥ aṅga  /
translated: The fierce power of that (Indra) is praised. Indra is the Lord.

original: yaḥ indra soma pātamaḥ madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati / yena haṃsi ni attriṇam tam īmahe /
analyzed: yaḥ indra soma pātamaḥ madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati   yena haṃsi ni attriṇam tam īmahe  /
translated: O Indra, that most gladdening draught of Soma, O thou Most Strong, which thou thinkest upon,🔽Wherewith thou slayest the Niatrtri, that we seek.🔽Wherewith thou didst shake Adhrigu of the Dasagvas, the gold-decked (steed),

original: yena daśagvam adhrigum vepayantam svarṇaram / yena samudram āvitha tam īmahe //
analyzed: yena daśagvam adhrigum vepayantam svarṇaram   yena samudram āvitha tam īmahe  /
translated: Wherewith thou didst win the ocean, that we seek.🔽Wherewith thou sendest forth the mighty waters, the rivers, as it were, cars,

original: yena sindhum mahīḥ apaḥ rathān iva pracodayaḥ / panthām ṛtasya yātave tam īmahe /
analyzed: yena sindhum mahīḥ apaḥ rathān iva pracodayaḥ   panthām ṛtasya yātave tam īmahe  /
translated: The path of holy order to travel, that we seek.🔽O Indra, come to us as a dear guest, unconquerable, unassailable,

original: ā indra naḥ gadhi priyaḥ satrājit agohyaḥ / giriḥ na viśvatas pṛthuḥ patiḥ divaḥ /
analyzed: ā indra naḥ gadhi priyaḥ satrājit agohyaḥ   giriḥ na viśvatas pṛthuḥ patiḥ divaḥ  /
translated: Like a mountain on every side, vast, the lord of heaven.🔽For thou, O Indra, the true, hast become the supporter of both worlds.

original: abhi hi satya soma pāḥ ubhe babhūtha rodasī / indra asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ /
analyzed: abhi hi satya soma pāḥ ubhe babhūtha rodasī   indra asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ  /
translated: Thou art the increaser of the Soma-presser, O Indra, the lord of heaven.

original: tvam hi śaśvatīnām indra dartā purām asi / hantā dasyoḥ manoḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ /🔽eva id u madhvaḥ madintaram siñca vai adhvaryo andhasaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ / eva hi
analyzed: tvam hi śaśvatīnām indra dartā purām asi    hantā dasyoḥ manoḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ  / eva id u madhvaḥ madintaram siñca vai adhvaryo andhasaḥ    eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ    eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ    eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ     eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ      eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ
translated: Slayer of Dasyus, increaser of the singer, Lord of the sky.🔽Pour out, O Adhvaryu, of the sweet juice that which is most delightful to thee,🔽For the hero praises thee, O thou who givest good gifts.

original: indra sthātar harīṇām nakir te pūrvya stutim / ud ānaṃśa śavasā na bhandanā /
analyzed: indra sthātar harīṇām nakir te pūrvya stutim    ud ānaṃśa śavasā na bhandanā  /
translated: O Indra, Lord of Bay Steeds, none hath attained to thy ancient praise,🔽Nor shall any one attain to it by his strength or his exultation.🔽We have invoked him, O ye wealthy ones, him who is Lord of strength,

original: tam vaḥ vājānām patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ / aprāyubhiḥ yajñebhiḥ vāvṛdhenyam //
analyzed: tam vaḥ vājānām patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ   aprāyubhiḥ yajñebhiḥ vāvṛdhenyam  /
translated: Him who is to be magnified by those who have not practised deceit, by sacrifices.🔽O Indra, Lord of Bay Steeds, none hath attained to thy ancient praise,

original: etaḥ nu indram stavāma sakhāyaḥ stomyam naram / kuṣṭīḥ yaḥ viśvāḥ abhi asti ekaḥ id /
analyzed: etaḥ nu indram stavāma sakhāyaḥ stomyam naram   kuṣṭīḥ yaḥ viśvāḥ abhi asti ekaḥ id  /
translated: Who alone surpasses all the Kuṣṭas.🔽To the one who is not to be turned back, to the one who seeks the cow, to the one who dwells in the sky, speak the wondrous word,

original: agorudhāya gaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyam vacaḥ / ghṛtāt svādīyaḥ madhunaḥ ca vocata /
analyzed: agorudhāya gaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyam vacaḥ   ghṛtāt svādīyaḥ madhunaḥ ca vocata  /
translated: Sweeter than ghee and honey.🔽To the one whose boundless powers cannot be measured, whose bounty cannot be encompassed,

original: yasya amitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave / jyotiḥ na viśvam abhi asti dakṣiṇā /
analyzed: yasya amitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave   jyotiḥ na viśvam abhi asti dakṣiṇā  /
translated: Whose light surpasses all, whose gift is in the south.🔽Praise Indra as one with good horses, the unswerving, the powerful, the controller,

original: stuhi indram vyaśvavat anūrmim vājinam yamam / aryaḥ gayam maṃhamānam vi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: stuhi indram vyaśvavat anūrmim vājinam yamam    aryaḥ gayam maṃhamānam vi dāśuṣe  /
translated: The noble lord who bestows on the worshipper.🔽Praise him now, O son of Vyaśva, the tenth, the new,

original: eva nūnam upa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamam navam / suvidvāṃsam carkṛtyam caraṇīnām /
analyzed: eva nūnam upa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamam navam    suvidvāṃsam carkṛtyam caraṇīnām  /
translated: The well-knowing one, the one to be praised by the charioteers.🔽For you know the way to escape the snares of misfortune, O Indra, with your thunderbolt in hand,

original: vettha hi nirṛtīnām vajrahasta parivṛjam / aharahar śundhyuḥ paripadām iva /
analyzed: vettha hi nirṛtīnām vajrahasta parivṛjam   aharahar śundhyuḥ paripadām iva
translated: Like the tracks of a bird day after day.🔽The one who presses (Soma) overcomes the abode of misfortune, the one who presses (Soma) truly worships, the one who presses (Soma) conquers the enemies of the gods.

original: vanoti hi sunvan kṣayam parīṇasaḥ sunvānaḥ hi sma yajati ava dviṣaḥ devānām ava dviṣaḥ / sunvānaḥ id siṣāsati sahasrā vājī avṛtaḥ / sunvānāya indraḥ dadāti ābhuvam rayim dadāti ābhuvam /
analyzed: vanoti hi sunvan kṣayam parīṇasaḥ sunvānaḥ hi sma yajati ava dviṣaḥ devānām ava dviṣaḥ    sunvānaḥ id siṣāsati sahasrā vājī avṛtaḥ   sunvānāya indraḥ dadāti ābhuvam rayim dadāti ābhuvam  /
translated: The one who presses (Soma) desires to win thousands, the one who presses (Soma) is unhindered, the powerful one. Indra gives wealth to the one who presses (Soma), he gives wealth that endures.

original: mā u su vaḥ asmat abhi tāni pauṃsyā sanā bhūvan dyumnāni mā uta jāriṣuḥ asmat purā uta jāriṣuḥ / yat vaḥ citram yugeyuge navyam ghoṣāt amartyam / asmāsu tat marutaḥ yat ca duṣṭaram didhṛtāḥ yat ca duṣṭaram /
analyzed: mā u su vaḥ asmat abhi tāni pauṃsyā sanā bhūvan dyumnāni mā uta jāriṣuḥ asmat purā uta jāriṣuḥ    yat vaḥ citram yugeyuge navyam ghoṣāt amartyam    asmāsu tat marutaḥ yat ca duṣṭaram didhṛtāḥ yat ca duṣṭaram  /
translated: Whatever wonderful, immortal thing ye have, O Maruts, in every age, that which is most hard to win, and that which is most hard to win, bestow on us.🔽I think on Agni as the Priest, the liberal, good, son of strength, the all-knower, the sage, the all-knower,

original: agnim hotāram manye dāsvantam vasum sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam vipram na jātavedasam / yaḥ ūrdhvayā su adhvaraḥ devaḥ devācyā kṛpā / ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣā ājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ /
analyzed: agnim hotāram manye dāsvantam vasum sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam vipram na jātavedasam    yaḥ ūrdhvayā su adhvaraḥ devaḥ devācyā kṛpā    ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣā ājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ  /
translated: Who, with uplifted flame, the God, with face to the Gods, looks down upon the spreading of the ghee, upon the flame of the invited ghee.🔽United with the sacrifices, with the spotted spears, the bright ones, dear in the rays,

original: yajñaiḥ saṃmiślāḥ pṛṣatībhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ yāmam chubhrāsaḥ añjiṣu priyāḥ uta / āsadyāḥ barhiḥ bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrāt ā somam pibata divaḥ naraḥ /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ saṃmiślāḥ pṛṣatībhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ yāmam chubhrāsaḥ añjiṣu priyāḥ uta    āsadyāḥ barhiḥ bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrāt ā somam pibata divaḥ naraḥ  /
translated: The sons of Bharata, to be seated on the sacred grass, drink the Soma from the cup, O ye men of heaven.

original: ā vakṣi devān iha vipra yakṣi ca uśan hotar ni sadā yoniṣu triṣu / prati vīhi prasthitam somyam madhu piba āgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛsṇuhi //
analyzed: ā vakṣi devān iha vipra yakṣi ca uśan hotar ni sadā yoniṣu triṣu   prati vīhi prasthitam somyam madhu piba āgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛsṇuhi  /
translated: Bring hither the Gods, O thou who art skilled in holy song, and worship them. O Hotar, gladly sit in the three sacred seats. Turn thee to the Soma-mingled mead that is set forth. From the Agnidh's share be thou refreshed.

original: eṣa sya te tanvaḥ nṛmṇa vardhanaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ pradivi bāhvoḥ hitaḥ / tubhyam sutaḥ maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtaḥ tvam asya brāhmaṇāt ā tṛpat piba /
analyzed: eṣa sya te tanvaḥ nṛmṇa vardhanaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ pradivi bāhvoḥ hitaḥ   tubhyam sutaḥ maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtaḥ tvam asya brāhmaṇāt ā tṛpat piba  /
translated: This is thy strength-increasing juice, thy conquering might, thy power, O thou of mighty arms, laid up in heaven. Pressed out for thee, O Maghavan, brought to thee, drink thou thereof to satisfaction, O thou who art the Brahman's own.

original: yam u pūrvam a huve tam idam huve sa id u havyaḥ dadiḥ yaḥ nāma patyate / adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitam somyam madhu potrāt somam draviṇaḥ daḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ //
analyzed: yam u pūrvam a huve tam idam huve sa id u havyaḥ dadiḥ yaḥ nāma patyate   adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitam somyam madhu potrāt somam draviṇaḥ daḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ  /
translated: Him whom I called on first I call on now: he is the giver who deserves the call. Go to the Soma-mingled draught set forth by priests: as such, O thou who givest wealth, drink Soma with the seasons.

original: surūpa kṛtnum ūtaye su dughām iva go duhe / juhūmasi dyavidyavi //
analyzed: surūpa kṛtnum ūtaye su dughām iva go duhe    juhūmasi dyavidyavi
translated: We call on thee, O thou of fair and wondrous deeds, as on a milch-cow good to milk, for help, O thou who art in heaven and on the earth.

original: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya soma pāḥ piba / go dāḥ id revataḥ madaḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya soma pāḥ piba   go dāḥ id revataḥ madaḥ  /
translated: Come to our solemn rites: O thou who art the Soma's drinker, drink. The gift of kine is a delightful joy.

original: atha te antamānām vidyāma sumatīnām / mā naḥ ati khye ā gahi //🔽parehi vigram astṛtam indram pṛchā vipaścitam / yaḥ te sakhibhyaḥ ā varam //
analyzed: atha te antamānām vidyāma sumatīnām   mā naḥ ati khye ā gahi  / parehi vigram astṛtam indram pṛchā vipaścitam   yaḥ te sakhibhyaḥ ā varam  /
translated: So may we know thy most gracious favours, and let not thy most excellent protection pass us by.🔽Go to the unresisted combat: ask thou the sage, Indra, who is better than thy friends.

original: uta bruvantu naḥ nidaḥ niḥ anyatas cit ārata / dadhānāḥ indraḥ id duvaḥ /
analyzed: uta bruvantu naḥ nidaḥ niḥ anyatas cit ārata   dadhānāḥ indraḥ id duvaḥ
translated: And let the curses speak to us from somewhere or other: let them make Indra our protector.

original: uta naḥ subhagām ariḥ voceyuḥ dasma kṛṣṭayaḥ / syāma id indrasya śarmaṇi //🔽ā īm āśum āśave bhara yajña śriyam nṛ mādanam / patayan mandayat sakham //
analyzed: uta naḥ subhagām ariḥ voceyuḥ dasma kṛṣṭayaḥ   syāma id indrasya śarmaṇi  / ā īm āśum āśave bhara yajña śriyam nṛ mādanam   patayan mandayat sakham
translated: And may the people call us blessed, O wondrous God, in our possessions. May we enjoy the shelter of Indra.🔽Bring hither to the swift one, for his speed, the Lord of sacrifice, the gladdener of friends, who brings delight, the gladdener of friends.

original: asya pītvā śatakrato ghanaḥ vṛtrāṇām abhavaḥ / prāvaḥ vājeṣu vājinam /
analyzed: asya pītvā śatakrato ghanaḥ vṛtrāṇām abhavaḥ   prāvaḥ vājeṣu vājinam
translated: After thou hast drunk this, O thou of a hundred powers, thou hast become strong to smite down the Vr̥itras, and hast helped the strong in battles.

original: tam tvā vājeṣu vājinam vājayāmaḥ śatakrato / dhanānām indra sātaye //
analyzed: tam tvā vājeṣu vājinam vājayāmaḥ śatakrato     dhanānām indra sātaye  /
translated: Thee, O thou of a hundred powers, we urge in battles, O Indra, to win us treasures.

original: yaḥ rāyaḥ avaniḥ mahān su pāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā / tasmai indrāya gāyata //
analyzed: yaḥ rāyaḥ avaniḥ mahān su pāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā      /
translated: To him, the great bestower of wealth, the good deliverer, the friend of him who sheds the juice, sing forth, O ye, to Indra.

original: ā tu etā ni sīdata indram abhi pra gāyata / sakhāyaḥ stoma vāhasaḥ /
analyzed: ā tu etā ni sīdata indram abhi pra gāyata sakhāyaḥ stoma vāhasaḥ
translated: Sit down together here, and sing to Indra, O ye friends, who bring the hymn.

original: purūtamam purūṇām īśānam vāryāṇām / indram some sacā sute /
analyzed: purūtamam purūṇām īśānam vāryāṇām   indram some sacā sute  /
translated: Most frequent of the frequent, the Lord of boons, Indra, with Soma shed, is with the juice expressed.

original: sa gha naḥ yoge ā bhuvat sa rāye sa puraṃdhyām / gamat vājebhiḥ ā sa naḥ /
analyzed: sa gha naḥ yoge ā bhuvat sa rāye sa puraṃdhyām   gamat vājebhiḥ ā sa naḥ  /
translated: May he be with us in the fight, in wealth, in the bestowing of heroic strength. May he come to us with his powers.

original: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate harī samatsu śatravaḥ / tasmai indrāya gāyata //
analyzed: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate harī samatsu śatravaḥ    tasmai indrāya gāyata
translated: To him whose bay steeds in the combat are not to be resisted by his foes, sing forth, O ye, to Indra.

original: suta pāvne sutāḥ ime śucayaḥ yanti vītaye / somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ /
analyzed: suta pāvne sutāḥ ime śucayaḥ yanti vītaye   somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: To the cleanser of the cup these pure juices go for his enjoyment, the Somas with their curd-like froth.

original: tvam sutasya pītaye sadyas vṛddhaḥ ajāyathāḥ / indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukrato /
analyzed: tvam sutasya pītaye sadyas vṛddhaḥ ajāyathāḥ   indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukrato
translated: Thou, for the drinking of the juice, art born at once grown mighty, O Indra, for preeminence, O very wise.

original: ā tvā viśantu āśavaḥ somāsaḥ indra girvaṇaḥ / śam te santu pracetase //
analyzed: ā tvā viśantu āśavaḥ somāsaḥ indra girvaṇaḥ   śam te santu pracetase  /
translated: Let the swift Soma juices enter thee, O Indra, Lover of the song. Be they for furthering thy thought.

original: tvām stomāḥ avīvṛdhan tvām ukthā śatakrato / tvām vardhantu naḥ giraḥ /
analyzed: tvām stomāḥ avīvṛdhan tvām ukthā śatakrato    tvām vardhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: The hymns have strengthened thee, O thou of hundred powers, and lauds have strengthened thee. So let our songs make thee to grow.

original: akṣita ūtiḥ sanet imam vājam indraḥ sahasriṇam / yasmin viśvāni pauṃsyā /
analyzed: akṣita ūtiḥ sanet imam vājam indraḥ sahasriṇam   yasmin viśvāni pauṃsyā  /
translated: Indra, whose succour never fails, accept this food a thousandfold, Wherein are all heroic powers.

original: mā naḥ martāḥ abhi druhan tanūnām indra girvaṇaḥ / īśānaḥ yavaya vadham //🔽yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ / rocante rocanā divi //
analyzed: mā naḥ martāḥ abhi druhan tanūnām indra girvaṇaḥ   īśānaḥ yavaya vadham  / yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ   rocante rocanā divi  /
translated: Let not the mortal foe, O Indra, Lover of the song, oppress our bodies. Drive thou away the shaft.🔽They yoke the ruddy one, the moving one, the Maruts who stand round about. The luminous lights shine in the sky.

original: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe / śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā /🔽ketum kṛṇvan aketave peśaḥ maryāḥ apeśase / sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ /
analyzed: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe   śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā  / ketum kṛṇvan aketave peśaḥ maryāḥ apeśase   sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: They yoke his two beloved Bays, the strong, to the car with yoking-poles, the red, the bold, that carry men.🔽Making a signal where no signal was, thou showest forth thy manly might. With the Dawns hast thou been made alive.

original: āt aha svadhām anu punar garbha tvam erire / dadhānāḥ nāma yajñiyam /
analyzed: āt aha svadhām anu punar garbha tvam erire    dadhānāḥ nāma yajñiyam  /
translated: They have again become an embryo, following their own inherent nature, bearing their holy name in sacrifice.

original: vīlu cit ārujatnubhiḥ guhā cit indra vahnibhiḥ / avindaḥ usriyāḥ anu /
analyzed: vīlu cit ārujatnubhiḥ guhā cit indra vahnibhiḥ    avindaḥ usriyāḥ anu
translated: With those who rend the very rock, with those who rend the cave itself, O Indra, thou hast found the kine.

original: devayantaḥ yathā matim achā vidat vasum giraḥ / mahām anūṣata śrutam /
analyzed: devayantaḥ yathā matim achā vidat vasum giraḥ   mahām anūṣata śrutam  /
translated: The pious have attained the treasure, the songs have reached the famous God, according to their wish.

original: indreṇa sam hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmānaḥ abibhyuṣā / mandū samāna varcasā /
analyzed: indreṇa sam hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmānaḥ abibhyuṣā   mandū samāna varcasā  /
translated: With Indra, fearless, hast thou met, O gladdener, with him of equal might.

original: anavadyaiḥ abhidyubhiḥ makhaḥ sahasvat arcati / gaṇaiḥ indrasya kāmyaiḥ /
analyzed: anavadyaiḥ abhidyubhiḥ makhaḥ sahasvat arcati   gaṇaiḥ indrasya kāmyaiḥ
translated: The sacrifice extols thee with the blameless, with the radiant ones, with Indra's bands who bring delight.

original: atas parijman ā gahi divaḥ vā rocanāt adhi / sam asmin ṛñjate giraḥ /
analyzed: atas parijman ā gahi divaḥ vā rocanāt adhi   sam asmin ṛñjate giraḥ
translated: Come hither from that place, O thou who wanderest, from heaven or from the realm of light: To him the songs are wont to come.

original: itas vā sātim īmahe divaḥ vā pārthivāt adhi / indram mahaḥ vā rajasaḥ /🔽indram id gathinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ / indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata /
analyzed: itas vā sātim īmahe divaḥ vā pārthivāt adhi   / indram mahaḥ vā rajasaḥ  indram id gathinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ   indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata  /
translated: Or from this place we seek the aid, from heaven or from the region of the earth, Or from the mighty realm of light.🔽The singers have extolled with lofty praise, the praisers with their lauds, Indra have songs of praise delighted.

original: indraḥ id dharyoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā / indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā   indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ  /
translated: Indra is closely joined to both his Bays, is yoked with speech to be invoked: Indra is golden-handed, wields the bolt.

original: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi / vi gobhiḥ indram airayat /
analyzed: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi   vi gobhiḥ indram airayat
translated: Indra hath raised the Sun on high in heaven, that he may look afar: With milk they have delighted Indra.

original: indra vājeṣu naḥ ava sahasra pradhaneṣu ca / ugraḥ ugrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: indra vājeṣu naḥ ava sahasra pradhaneṣu ca    ugraḥ ugrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: In battles, Indra, in the wars of thousands, be thou a mighty helper with thy mighty aids.

original: indram vayam mahādhane indram arbhe havāmahe / yujam vṛtreṣu vajriṇam /
analyzed: indram vayam mahādhane indram arbhe havāmahe   yujam vṛtreṣu vajriṇam  /
translated: We call on Indra in the great encounter, we call on Indra in the lesser conflict, on him the banded, him the wielder of the bolt.

original: sa naḥ vṛṣan amum carum satrā adāvan apa vṛdhi / asmabhyam a pratiṣkutaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣan amum carum satrā adāvan apa vṛdhi    asmabhyam a pratiṣkutaḥ  /
translated: O Bull, this our oblation, O thou ever-waxing One, vouchsafe, and grant us increase, thou who ne'er art vanquished.

original: tuñjetuñje ye uttare stomāḥ indrasya vajriṇaḥ / na vindhe asya suṣṭutim /
analyzed: tuñjetuñje ye uttare stomāḥ indrasya vajriṇaḥ    na vindhe asya suṣṭutim
translated: On every side, on every side, the praises of the mighty Indra, Lord of thunder, rise to heaven: I find not his most lofty praise.

original: vṛṣā yūthā iva vaṃsagaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ iyarti ojasā / īśānaḥ a pratiṣkutaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā yūthā iva vaṃsagaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ iyarti ojasā   īśānaḥ a pratiṣkutaḥ
translated: Like a strong bull who leads the herd, he moves the people with his might, the irresistible, the Lord.

original: yaḥ ekaḥ carṣaṇīnām vasūnām irajyati / indraḥ pañca kṣitīnām /🔽indram vaḥ viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ / asmākam astu kevalaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ carṣaṇīnām vasūnām irajyati   / indraḥ pañca kṣitīnām  indram vaḥ viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ asmākam astu kevalaḥ
translated: He who alone hath sway o'er the goods of men, and o'er the fivefold race of men, is Indra.🔽We call on Indra from all sides, from all the people, for our weal: may he be ours alone to aid.

original: ā indra sānasim rayim sa jitvānam sadāsaham / varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara //
analyzed: ā indra sānasim rayim sa jitvānam sadāsaham    varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara  /
translated: O Indra, bring us opulence which none may take away, which none may overcome, most excellent, to succour us.

original: ni yena muṣṭi hatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai / tvotāsaḥ ni arvatā /
analyzed: ni yena muṣṭi hatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai   tvotāsaḥ ni arvatā
translated: With him who slays in close embrace, with him who quells the Vritras, may we, aided by thee, prevail in fight, with him who conquers with the car.

original: indra tvotāsaḥ ā vayam vajram ghanā dadīmahi / jayema sam yudhi spṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: indra tvotāsaḥ ā vayam vajram ghanā dadīmahi    jayema sam yudhi spṛdhaḥ  /
translated: We who are aided by Indra will hurl the bolt of thunder down, we who are aided by Indra. May we in fight subdue our foes.

original: vayam śūrebhiḥ astṛbhiḥ indra tvayā yujā vayam / sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ /
analyzed: vayam śūrebhiḥ astṛbhiḥ indra tvayā yujā vayam     sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ
translated: With thee, O Indra, for our sure ally, with thee the Hero, armed with weapons,🔽May we subdue our enemies.🔽Great is Indra, and his greatness is beyond compare: vast is the God's supremacy.

original: mahān indraḥ paras ca nu mahitvam astu vajriṇe / dyauḥ na prathinā śavaḥ /
analyzed: mahān indraḥ paras ca nu mahi tvam astu vajriṇe    dyauḥ na prathinā śavaḥ  /
translated: As the two heaven and earth are the greatest of all things that be.🔽The men who come to us for aid in the fight for sons and progeny,

original: samohe vā ye āśata naraḥ tokasya sanitau / viprāsaḥ vā dhiyāyavaḥ /
analyzed: samohe vā ye āśata naraḥ tokasya sanitau    viprāsaḥ vā dhiyāyavaḥ
translated: Or the sages who are fain for holy thought.🔽The belly that drinketh most of Soma, like the sea, is filled with food,

original: yaḥ kukṣiḥ soma pātamaḥ samudre iva pinvate / urvīḥ āpaḥ na kākudaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kukṣiḥ soma pātamaḥ samudre iva pinvate   / urvīḥ āpaḥ na kākudaḥ  /
translated: Like the broad waters in the rainy season.🔽So is his bounty, so his grace, so his great gift of kine to him

original: eva hi asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī / pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe /
analyzed: eva hi asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī    pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe  /
translated: Who brings the offering, like a well-grown branch.🔽So are thy glories, so thy succours, O Indra, to the worshipper:

original: eva hi te vibhūtayaḥ ūtayaḥ indra māvate / sadyas cit santi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: eva hi te vibhūtayaḥ ūtayaḥ indra māvate    sadyas cit santi dāśuṣe  /
translated: So are they even now to him who brings the gift.🔽So is his praise, so is his laud to be desired, to be extolled,

original: eva hi asya kāmyā stomaḥ uktham ca śaṃsyā / indrāya soma pītaye /
analyzed: eva hi asya kāmyā stomaḥ uktham ca śaṃsyā   indrāya soma pītaye
translated: To Indra when the Soma is pressed out.🔽O Indra, drink the juice with all the feast-days of the Soma juice:

original: indra ihi matsi andhasaḥ viśvebhiḥ soma parvabhiḥ / mahān abhiṣṭiḥ ojasā /
analyzed: indra ihi matsi andhasaḥ viśvebhiḥ soma parvabhiḥ   mahān abhiṣṭiḥ ojasā  /
translated: Thou art the mighty guardian with thy might.🔽Send him forth, send the gladdening juice to gladden Indra, send the draught

original: ā īm enam sṛjata sute mandim indrāya mandine / cakrim viśvāni cakraye /
analyzed: ā īm enam sṛjata sute mandim indrāya mandine   cakrim viśvāni cakraye  /
translated: To him who makes all things that move not and all things that move.🔽Rejoice thee, O thou of the fair forehead, with the gladdening songs, O thou whom all must win,

original: matsva su śipra mandibhiḥ stomebhiḥ viśvacarṣaṇe / sacā eṣu savaneṣu ā /
analyzed: matsva su śipra mandibhiḥ stomebhiḥ viśvacarṣaṇe    sacā eṣu savaneṣu ā
translated: In these libations of the juice.

original: asṛgram indra te giraḥ prati tvām ud ahāsata / ajoṣāḥ vṛṣabham patim /
analyzed: asṛgram indra te giraḥ prati tvām ud ahāsata   ajoṣāḥ vṛṣabham patim
translated: The songs have flowed to thee, O Indra: to thee have they been raised,🔽The vigorous ones, to thee the Lord.🔽Stir up for us, O Indra, stir up the wondrous gift of wealth, most excellent.

original: sam codaya citram arvāk rādhaḥ indra vareṇyam / asat id te vibhu prabhu //
analyzed: sam codaya citram arvāk rādhaḥ indra vareṇyam   asat id te vibhu prabhu  /
translated: Thou art the Lord of ample wealth.

original: asmān su tatra codaya indra rāye rabhasvataḥ / tuvi dyumna yaśasvataḥ //
analyzed: asmān su tatra codaya indra rāye rabhasvataḥ    tuvi dyumna yaśasvataḥ  /
translated: There, O Indra, urge us on to wealth that gives a thousand bounties,🔽To wealth that is most liberal.

original: sam gomat indra vājavat asme pṛthu śravaḥ bṛhat / viśvāyuḥ dhehi akṣitam /🔽asme dhehi śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam sahasra sātamam / indra tāḥ rathinīḥ iṣaḥ /
analyzed: sam gomat indra vājavat asme pṛthu śravaḥ bṛhat viśvāyuḥ dhehi akṣitam  / asme dhehi śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam sahasra sātamam   indra tāḥ rathinīḥ iṣaḥ  /
translated: Bestow on us, O Indra, with the kine, with strength, with ample fame,🔽With life for all.🔽Bestow on us high glory, glory that shall win a thousand gifts.🔽O Indra, give us those thy bounties.🔽With songs we glorify Indra, the Lord of treasure, meet for praise,

original: vasoḥ indram vasu patim gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ ṛgmiyam / homa gantāram ūtaye //
analyzed: vasoḥ indram vasu patim gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ ṛgmiyam    homa gantāram ūtaye  /
translated: The messenger who comes to help.🔽To him, the lofty, to the great, at every invocation, the foe,

original: sutesute nyokase bṛhat bṛhataḥ ā id ariḥ / indrāya śūṣam arcati //
analyzed: sutesute nyokase bṛhat bṛhataḥ ā id ariḥ   / indrāya śūṣam arcati  /
translated: The singer lifts his voice to Indra.

original: viśveṣu hi tvā savaneṣu tuñjate samānam ekam vṛṣamaṇyavaḥ pṛthak svar saniṣyavaḥ pṛthak / tam tvā nāvam na parṣaṇim śūṣasya dhuri dhīmahi / indram na yajñaiḥ catayantaḥ āyavaḥ stomebhiḥ indram āyavaḥ //
analyzed: viśveṣu hi tvā savaneṣu tuñjate samānam ekam vṛṣamaṇyavaḥ pṛthak svar saniṣyavaḥ pṛthak   tam tvā nāvam na parṣaṇim śūṣasya dhuri dhīmahi    indram na yajñaiḥ catayantaḥ āyavaḥ stomebhiḥ indram āyavaḥ  /
translated: For in all libations they urge thee, the one mighty, the many, each according to his wish, each according to his wish, desiring the light. We will set thee on the pole of the strong one, thee who art able to carry like a boat, Indra, whom the living men delight with sacrifices, whom the living men delight with praises.

original: vi tvā tatasre mithunāḥ avasyavaḥ vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣantaḥ indra niḥsṛjaḥ / yat gavyantā dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi / āvis karikrat vṛṣaṇam sacābhuvam vajram indra sacābhuvam /
analyzed: vi tvā tatasre mithunāḥ avasyavaḥ vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣantaḥ indra niḥsṛjaḥ    yat gavyantā dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi    āvis karikrat vṛṣaṇam sacābhuvam vajram indra sacābhuvam  /
translated: The pairs have sent thee forth, the helpers, for the gain of the prize of the herd of cattle, the gain of the prize, O Indra, when thou gatherest together the two peoples who are contending for the cattle, who are contending for the light. Thou, O thou who art to be praised, with the strong one who is of the same abode, with the thunderbolt, O Indra, who is of the same abode.

original: uta u naḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ juṣeta hi arkasya bodhi haviṣaḥ havīmabhiḥ svarṣātā havīmabhiḥ / yat indra hantave mṛghaḥ vṛṣā vajrim ciketasi / ā me asya vedhasaḥ navīyasaḥ manma śrudhi navīyasaḥ /
analyzed: uta u naḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ juṣeta hi arkasya bodhi haviṣaḥ havīmabhiḥ svarṣātā havīmabhiḥ    yat indra hantave mṛghaḥ vṛṣā vajrim ciketasi    ā me asya vedhasaḥ navīyasaḥ manma śrudhi navīyasaḥ  /
translated: And may he favour us of this dawn, may he be aware of the oblations of the hymn, of the oblations, self-luminous, when, O Indra, thou thinkest of the strong one, O thou who hast a new ally, for the slaying of the foe, listen to this hymn of mine, O thou who hast a new ally.

original: tubhya id imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyam brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi / tvam nṛbhiḥ havyaḥ viśvadhā asi /
analyzed: tubhya id imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyam brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi   tvam nṛbhiḥ havyaḥ viśvadhā asi  /
translated: To thee, O hero, all these libations, to thee all prayers I make for prosperity. In every way thou art to be invoked by men.

original: nu cit nu te manyamānasya dasmaḥ ud aśnuvanti mahimānam ugra / na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ //
analyzed: nu cit nu te manyamānasya dasmaḥ ud aśnuvanti mahimānam ugra   na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ  /
translated: Even now, O wondrous God, the thoughts of thee, O mighty One, reach forth to thy greatness, O Indra, to thy manly power and bounty.

original: pra vaḥ mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatim kṛṇudhvam / viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇiprāḥ /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatim kṛṇudhvam   viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇiprāḥ  /
translated: Bring to the great one who increaseth the great, bring to the wise one your devotion. Lead forth the many tribes, O thou who leadest men.

original: yadā vajram hiraṇyam id athā ratham harī yamasya vahataḥ vi sūribhiḥ / ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sanaśrutaḥ indraḥ vājasya dīrghaśravasaḥ patiḥ /
analyzed: yadā vajram hiraṇyam id athā ratham harī yamasya vahataḥ vi sūribhiḥ   ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sanaśrutaḥ indraḥ vājasya dīrghaśravasaḥ patiḥ  /
translated: When he hath taken his gold-begotten thunderbolt, and his two bay steeds who draw his car, with the charioteers, then Maghavan, the far-famed Indra, standeth up, the Lord of strength whose fame is wide.

original: so cit nu vṛṣṭiḥ yūthyā svā sacām indraḥ śmaśrūṇi haritā abhi pruṣṇute / ava veti su kṣayam sute madhu ud id dhūṇoti vātaḥ yathā vanam /
analyzed: sā u cit nu vṛṣṭiḥ yūthyā svā sacām indraḥ śmaśrūṇi haritā abhi pruṣṇute   ava veti su kṣayam sute madhu ud id dhūṇoti vātaḥ yathā vanam  /
translated: He, verily, is the rain-cloud, in the company of his own friends; Indra bedews his tawny beard. He cometh down to the fair dwelling, to the shed where the juice is shed. The wind bloweth on the wood.

original: yaḥ vācā vivācaḥ mṛdhra vācaḥ purū sahasra aśivā jaghāna / tat tat id asya pauṃsyam gṛṇīmasi pitā iva yaḥ taviṣīm vāvṛdhe śavaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vācā vivācaḥ mṛdhra vācaḥ purū sahasra aśivā jaghāna   tat tat id asya pauṃsyam gṛṇīmasi pitā iva yaḥ taviṣīm vāvṛdhe śavaḥ  /
translated: He who with his voice hath slain the many thousands of the evil-voiced, the spiteful, him we extol for this manly deed, even as a father exalteth his own strength.

original: yat cit hi satya soma pāḥ anāśastāḥ iva smasi / ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha /
analyzed: yat cit hi satya soma pāḥ anāśastāḥ iva smasi   ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha  /
translated: Then, O Indra, think upon us in the matter of our fair horses and our cows, in thousands, O most wealthy One.🔽O thou with the fair brow, Lord of strength, whose deeds of wonder are most mighty,

original: śiprin vājānām pate śacīvas tava daṃsanā / ā tu naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha /
analyzed: śiprin vājānām pate śacīvas tava daṃsanā    ā tu naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha  /
translated: Then, O Indra, think upon us in the matter of our fair horses and our cows, in thousands, O most wealthy One.🔽Lull thou to sleep the pair who look askance, and let the other wake.

original: ni svāpayā mithūdṛśā sastām a budhyamāne / ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha /
analyzed: ni svāpayā mithūdṛśā sastām a budhyamāne      ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha  /
translated: Then, O Indra, think upon us in the matter of our fair horses and our cows, in thousands, O most wealthy One.🔽Let all these evil spirits be destroyed, and let the bounteous blessings wake.🔽Then, O Indra, think upon us in the matter of our fair horses and our cows, in thousands, O most wealthy One.🔽Crush thou the ass, O Indra, who neighs as he is urged to greater speed.

original: sasantu tyāḥ arātayaḥ bodhantu śūra rātayaḥ / ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha //
analyzed: sasantu tyāḥ arātayaḥ bodhantu śūra rātayaḥ   ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha  /
translated: Then, O Indra, think upon us in the matter of our fair horses and our cows, in thousands, O most wealthy One.🔽The wind hath flown afar from the wood, the wind hath flown away.

original: sam indra gardabham mṛṇa nuvantam papaya amuyā / ā tu naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha /🔽patāti kuṇḍṛṇācyā dūram vātaḥ vanāt adhi / ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha /
analyzed: sam indra gardabham mṛṇa nuvantam papaya amuyā    ā tu naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha  /🔽patāti kuṇḍṛṇācyā dūram vātaḥ vanāt adhi   ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha  /
translated: Then, O Indra, think upon us in the matter of our fair horses and our cows, in thousands, O most wealthy One.

original: sarvam parikrośam jahi jambhayā kṛkadāśvam / ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha /
analyzed: sarvam parikrośam jahi jambhayā kṛkadāśvam    ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha  /
translated: Destroy the whole of the howling (demon), crush the Kṛkadans and the Aśvas. Bring us, O Indra, to the thought of the fair cows and horses, and of thousands, O thou of great wealth.

original: vi tvā tatasre mithunāḥ avasyavaḥ vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣantaḥ indra niḥsṛjaḥ / yat gavyanta dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi / āvis karikrat vṛṣaṇam sacābhuvam vajram indra sacābhuvam /
analyzed: vi tvā tatasre mithunāḥ avasyavaḥ vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣantaḥ indra niḥsṛjaḥ    yat gavyanta dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi    āvis karikrat vṛṣaṇam sacābhuvam vajram indra sacābhuvam  /
translated: The pairs of suppliants have spread thee out, the people of the troop of cattle, the people who have come to the distribution, O Indra, the people who have come to the distribution. When thou, O thou who seekest the light, gatherest together the two peoples who long for cattle, thou makest the strong (god) who acts in unison with thee, the thunderbolt, O Indra, who acts in unison with thee.

original: viduḥ te asya vīryasya pūravaḥ puraḥ yat indra śāradīḥ avātiraḥ sāsahānaḥ avātiraḥ / śāsaḥ tam indra martyam ayajum śavasaḥ pate / mahīm amuṣṇāḥ pṛthivīm imāḥ apaḥ mandasānaḥ imāḥ apaḥ /
analyzed: viduḥ te asya vīryasya pūravaḥ puraḥ yat indra śāradīḥ avātiraḥ sāsahānaḥ avātiraḥ    śāsaḥ tam indra martyam ayajum śavasaḥ pate   mahīm amuṣṇāḥ pṛthivīm imāḥ apaḥ mandasānaḥ imāḥ apaḥ  /
translated: The Pūrus know this thy manly power, O Indra, that thou hast overthrown the forts of the autumn (months), having overcome them, having overcome them. Thou, O Indra, hast punished the sacrificerless mortal, O lord of power. Thou hast enjoyed the great earth, these waters, O thou who rejoicest in these waters.

original: āt id te asya vīryasya carkiran madeṣu vṛṣan uśijaḥ yat āvitha sakhīyataḥ yat āvitha / cakartha kāram ebhyaḥ pṛtanāsu pravantave / te anyām anyām nadyam saniṣṇata śravasyantaḥ saniṣṇata /
analyzed: āt id te asya vīryasya carkiran madeṣu vṛṣan uśijaḥ yat āvitha sakhīyataḥ yat āvitha     cakartha kāram ebhyaḥ pṛtanāsu pravantave   te anyām anyām nadyam saniṣṇata śravasyantaḥ saniṣṇata  /
translated: The pious have extolled this manly power of thine, O strong one, in the (sacrificial) feasts, when thou hast helped the pious who desire help, when thou hast helped them. Thou hast done this deed for them, that they may be victorious in the battles. They have gained one river after another, longing for glory, they have gained it.

original: vane na vā yaḥ ni adhāyi cākram chuciḥ vām stomaḥ bhuraṇau ajīgaḥ / yasya id indraḥ puru dineṣu hotā nṛṇām narvaḥ nṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān //
analyzed: vane na vā yaḥ ni adhāyi cākram chuciḥ vām stomaḥ bhuraṇau ajīgaḥ    yasya id indraḥ puru dineṣu hotā nṛṇām narvaḥ nṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān  /
translated: He who hath set his wheel in motion in the wood, or in the desert, hath obtained your favour, O ye swift Ones, with his pure hymn of praise, Whose Priest, O ye Nṛs, is Indra, the Hero, the best of men, the guardian of the people, in the days of old.

original: pra te asyāḥ uṣasaḥ pra aparasyāḥ nṛtau syāma nṛtam asya nṛṇām / anu triśokaḥ śatam āvahat nṝn kutsena rathaḥ yaḥ asat sasavān //
analyzed: pra te asyāḥ uṣasaḥ pra aparasyāḥ nṛtau syāma nṛtam asya nṛṇām    anu triśokaḥ śatam āvahat nṝn kutsena rathaḥ yaḥ asat sasavān  /
translated: At this your rising, O ye Heroes, and at the other, may we be in the assembly of the men, in the assembly of this Hero. Triśoka hath brought a hundred men, with Kutsa, the chariot which shall be laden with food.

original: kaḥ te madaḥ indra rantyaḥ bhūt duraḥ giraḥ abhi ugraḥ vi dhāva / kad vāho arvāk upa mā manīṣāḥ ā tvā śakyām upamam rādhaḥ annaiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ te madaḥ indra rantyaḥ bhūt duraḥ giraḥ abhi ugraḥ vi dhāva   kad vāho arvāk upa mā manīṣāḥ ā tvā śakyām upamam rādhaḥ annaiḥ  /
translated: What gladdening drink, O Indra, shall be thine? O mighty One, run hither to the doors and songs. What car, what prayer shall bring thee nigh to us? I may approach thee with gifts of food.

original: kad u dyumnam indra tvāvataḥ nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kad naḥ āgan / mitraḥ na satyaḥ urugāya bhṛtyāḥ anne samasya yat asat manīṣāḥ /
analyzed: kad u dyumnam indra tvāvataḥ nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kad naḥ āgan   mitraḥ na satyaḥ urugāya bhṛtyāḥ anne samasya yat asat manīṣāḥ  /
translated: What glory, O Indra, of the men who serve thee? With what thought wilt thou favour us? How comest thou? As a true friend, O thou of ample sway, to the food where our thoughts are, in the food.

original: preraya sūraḥ artham na pāram ye asya kāmam janidhāḥ iva gman / giraḥ ca ye te tuvi jāta pūrvīḥ naraḥ indra pratiśikṣanti annaiḥ /
analyzed: preraya sūraḥ artham na pāram ye asya kāmam janidhāḥ iva gman    giraḥ ca ye te tuvi jāta pūrvīḥ naraḥ indra pratiśikṣanti annaiḥ  /
translated: Send forth the singer to the goal, to the farther shore, who hath attained his wish, as if he were born. And those who with their food, O Indra, O thou of mighty birth, will follow thy many songs of praise.

original: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrvī dyauḥ majmanā pṛthivī kāvyena / varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādnan bhavantu pītaye madhūni //
analyzed: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrvī dyauḥ majmanā pṛthivī kāvyena   varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādnan bhavantu pītaye madhūni  /
translated: To thee, O Indra, are the two great worlds, heaven and earth, in magnitude and wisdom. For thee the juices, rich in ghee, are pressed: let the sweet drops be pleasant for thy drinking.

original: ā madhvaḥ asmai asican amatram indrāya pūrṇam sa hi satya rādhāḥ / sa vāvṛdhe variman ā pṛthivyāḥ abhi kratvā naryaḥ pauṃsyaiḥ ca /
analyzed: ā madhvaḥ asmai asican amatram indrāya pūrṇam sa hi satya rādhāḥ    sa vāvṛdhe variman ā pṛthivyāḥ abhi kratvā naryaḥ pauṃsyaiḥ ca  /
translated: They have poured out for him the meath-containing bowl, full for Indra, for he is the true bestower. He hath grown great in wealth beyond the spacious earth, the man who worships with his thoughts and manly deeds.

original: vi ānaḷ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojāḥ ā asmai yatante sakhyāya pūrvīḥ / ā smā ratham na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yam bhadrayā sumatyā codayāse /🔽ā satyaḥ yātu maghavā ṛjīṣī dravantu asya harayaḥ upa naḥ / tasmai id andhaḥ suṣuma su dakṣam iha abhipitvam karate gṛṇānaḥ /
analyzed: vi ānaḷ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojāḥ ā asmai yatante sakhyāya pūrvīḥ   ā smā ratham na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yam bhadrayā sumatyā codayāse  / ā satyaḥ yātu maghavā ṛjīṣī dravantu asya harayaḥ upa naḥ    tasmai id andhaḥ suṣuma su dakṣam iha abhipitvam karate gṛṇānaḥ  /
translated: Indra hath scattered the unfriendly hosts: many are striving to win his friendship. Mount thou, as on a car, in battles, him whom thou excitest with thy gracious favour.🔽Let the true, the strong Maghavan come hither: let his Bay Steeds speed forward to our banquet. To him, the very wise, the very skilful, let us, singing, bring our prayer that he may listen.

original: ava sya śūra adhvanaḥ na ante asmin naḥ adya savane mandadhyai / śaṃsāti uktham uśanā iva vedhāḥ cikituṣe asuryāya manma /
analyzed: ava sya śūra adhvanaḥ na ante asmin naḥ adya savane mandadhyai    śaṃsāti uktham uśanā iva vedhāḥ cikituṣe asuryāya manma  /
translated: At the end of his way, O Hero, sit thou down: be joyful at this our libation, this day. He, the Disposer, like Uśanâ, shall utter the hymn, the thought, to the all-observing Asura.

original: kaviḥ na niṇyam vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekam vipipānaḥ arcāt / divaḥ itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cit cakruḥ vayunā gṛṇantaḥ /
analyzed: kaviḥ na niṇyam vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekam vipipānaḥ arcāt    divaḥ itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cit cakruḥ vayunā gṛṇantaḥ  /
translated: Hath here from heaven engendered the seven R̥ibhus. Even in a day they made the worlds, the singers.🔽When the fair altar hath been made resplendent with lights, when the great light hath shone forth from the east,

original: svar yat vedi su dṛśīkam arkaiḥ mahi jyotīḥ rurucuḥ yat ha vastoḥ / andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaḥ cakāra nṛtamaḥ abhiṣṭau /
analyzed: svar yat vedi su dṛśīkam arkaiḥ mahi jyotīḥ rurucuḥ yat ha vastoḥ   andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaḥ cakāra nṛtamaḥ abhiṣṭau  /
translated: The Lord of men hath dispelled the blinded darkness, and hath revealed the people to the people.🔽Indra hath waxed exceeding great in his own might: he hath filled full the two world-halves with his greatness.

original: vavakṣe indraḥ amitam ṛjiṣi ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā / atas cit asya mahimā vi reci abhi yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā babhūva /
analyzed: vavakṣe indraḥ amitam ṛjiṣi ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā   atas cit asya mahimā vi reci abhi yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā babhūva  /
translated: Even from him hath his greatness spread abroad, who hath become superior to all things existing.🔽Sakra, who knoweth all the deeds of heroes, hath with his dear friends rolled away the waters.

original: viśvāni śakraḥ naryāṇi vidvān apaḥ rireca sakhibhiḥ nikāmaiḥ / aśmānam cit ye bibhiduḥ vacobhiḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ //
analyzed: viśvāni śakraḥ naryāṇi vidvān apaḥ rireca sakhibhiḥ nikāmaiḥ   aśmānam cit ye bibhiduḥ vacobhiḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ  /
translated: Even the stone have they cleft with their voices: the eager ones have opened the stall of cattle.🔽He hath smitten down the Vr̥itra-like cloud with his bolt: the earth with all her heart hath helped thy thunder.

original: apaḥ vṛtram vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ / pra arṇāṃsi samudriyāṇi ainoḥ patiḥ bhavam śavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo /
analyzed: apaḥ vṛtram vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ   pra arṇāṃsi samudriyāṇi ainoḥ patiḥ bhavam śavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo  /
translated: He hath let loose the waters of the ocean: thou, Hero, bold by strength, hast become their Lord.

original: apaḥ yat adrim puruhūta dardar āvis bhuvat saramā pūrvyam te / sa naḥ netā vājam ā darṣi bhūrim gotrā rujan aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ /
analyzed: apaḥ yat adrim puruhūta dardar āvis bhuvat saramā pūrvyam te     sa naḥ netā vājam ā darṣi bhūrim gotrā rujan aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ  /
translated: When, invoked of many, thou didst rend the rock and the waters, and Saramā discovered thy most ancient form, then, as our leader, thou hast shown us abundant booty, rending the stalls, O Angiras, when thou wast praised.

original: tat vaḥ gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane / śam yat gave na śākine /🔽na ghā vasuḥ ni yamate dānam vājasya gomataḥ / yat sīm upa śravat giraḥ /
analyzed: tat vaḥ gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane    śam yat gave na śākine  / na ghā vasuḥ ni yamate dānam vājasya gomataḥ   yat sīm upa śravat giraḥ  /
translated: Sing this to him, O son of him who pours the juice, to him invoked of many, to the Strong One, as a boon to the Steer,🔽For never doth the bounteous God withhold his gift of wealth in cattle, when he listens to our songs.

original: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajam gomantam dasyu hā gamat / śacībhiḥ apa naḥ varat //
analyzed: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajam gomantam dasyu hā gamat śacībhiḥ apa naḥ varat
translated: He, verily, will go to the cow-stall, the Dasyu-slayer, to the stall, with his powers. May he favour us with choice boons.

original: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā / śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi //
analyzed: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā   / śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi  /
translated: O Indra, bring us power as a father to his sons. Instruct us, O thou much-invoked, in this our work, that we may live and win the light.

original: mā naḥ ajñātāḥ vṛjanāḥ durādhyaḥ mā aśivāsaḥ ava kramuḥ / tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīḥ apaḥ ati śūra tarāmasi //
analyzed: mā naḥ ajñātāḥ vṛjanāḥ durādhyaḥ mā aśivāsaḥ ava kramuḥ   tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīḥ apaḥ ati śūra tarāmasi  /
translated: Let not unknown, ill-omened bands, nor those who bring no offering come nigh us. With thee, O Hero, may we pass beyond all the far-spreading floods.

original: indra jyeṣṭham naḥ ā bharam ojiṣṭham papuri śravaḥ / yena ime citra vajrahasta rodasī ā ubhe su śipra prāḥ /
analyzed: indra jyeṣṭham naḥ ā bharam ojiṣṭham papuri śravaḥ    yena ime citra vajrahasta rodasī ā ubhe su śipra prāḥ  /
translated: O Indra, bring us the most manly power, the most heroic fame, wherewith, O thou of wondrous deeds, O thou of fair cheeks, thou hast filled full these two worlds, O thou of the strong arm.

original: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇīsaham rājan deveṣu hūmahe / viśvā su naḥ vithurā pibdanā vaso amitrān suṣahān kṛdhi //
analyzed: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇīsaham rājan deveṣu hūmahe    viśvā su naḥ vithurā pibdanā vaso amitrān suṣahān kṛdhi  /
translated: We call thee, O King, to aid, thee, O terrible one, who conquerest men, to aid, thee, O God, to aid. Rend thou all our frailties, O good one, and make our enemies easy to be conquered.

original: yat dyāvaḥ indra te śatam śatam bhūmiḥ uta syuḥ / na tvā vajrin sahasram sūryāḥ anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī /
analyzed: yat dyāvaḥ indra te śatam śatam bhūmiḥ uta syuḥ    na tvā vajrin sahasram sūryāḥ anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī  /
translated: If, O Indra, the heavens were thine, and the earth were thine a hundred times a hundred, O Thunderer, a thousand suns would not suffice to celebrate thy birth, O thou who art born of old.

original: ā paprātha mahinā kṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā / asmān ava maghavan gomati vraje vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: ā paprātha mahinā kṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā   asmān ava maghavan gomati vraje vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ  /
translated: Thou, O Bull, hast spread thyself with might over all with thy blackness, O thou most mighty one, with might. Favour us, O bountiful one, in the rich pasture, O thou who hast the thunder, with wondrous aids.

original: yat indra yāvataḥ tvam etāvat aham īśīya / stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpa tvāya rāsīya /
analyzed: yat indra yāvataḥ tvam etāvat aham īśīya   stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpa tvāya rāsīya  /
translated: If, O Indra, I were to possess as much as thou, I would be willing to be thy praiser, O thou who givest good gifts. I would not be thy rival, O bountiful one.

original: śikṣeyam id mahayate divedive rāyaḥ ā kuhacid vide / nahi tvat anyat maghavan naḥ āpyam vasyaḥ asti pitā cana /
analyzed: śikṣeyam id mahayate divedive rāyaḥ ā kuhacid vide   nahi tvat anyat maghavan naḥ āpyam vasyaḥ asti pitā cana  /
translated: I would learn to magnify thee day by day, and to find wealth somewhere or other. For, O Maghavan, there is no better hope for us than thou, not even a father.

original: indra tri dhātu śaraṇam tri varūtham svastimat / chardiḥ yaccha maghavadbhyaḥ ca mahyam ca yāvaya didyum ebhyaḥ /
analyzed: indra tri dhātu śaraṇam tri varūtham svastimat    chardiḥ yaccha maghavadbhyaḥ ca mahyam ca yāvaya didyum ebhyaḥ  /
translated: O Indra, grant to the wealthy ones and to me a threefold refuge, a threefold protection, and a happy resting-place. Turn away the dart from these.

original: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhuḥ abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā / agha smā naḥ maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ tanū pāḥ antamaḥ bhava /
analyzed: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhuḥ abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā    agha smā naḥ maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ tanū pāḥ antamaḥ bhava  /
translated: Be thou, O Maghavan, O Indra, lover of the song, our nearest guardian of our bodies.

original: indra ā yāhi citra bhāno sutāḥ ime tvāyavaḥ / aṇvībhiḥ tanā pūtāsaḥ /🔽indra ā yāhi dhiyā iṣitaḥ vipra jutaḥ sutāvataḥ / upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ /
analyzed: indra ā yāhi citra bhāno sutāḥ ime tvāyavaḥ   aṇvībhiḥ tanā pūtāsaḥ  / indra ā yāhi dhiyā iṣitaḥ vipra jutaḥ sutāvataḥ      / upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ  /
translated: O Indra, come to us, O thou of wondrous bounty! These juices are ready pressed for thee,🔽O Indra, come, invited by our holy thoughts, by the presser who hath pressed the juice.

original: indra ā yāhi tūtujānaḥ upa brahmāṇi harivas / sute dadhiṣva naḥ canaḥ /
analyzed: indra ā yāhi tūtujānaḥ upa brahmāṇi harivas    sute dadhiṣva naḥ canaḥ  /
translated: Come, O thou of Bay steeds, to our holy prayers, O Indra, urged by the sacrificer. In the pressed (juice) rejoice in our laudation.

original: mā cit anyat vi śaṃsata sakhāyaḥ mā riṣaṇyata / indram id stotā vṛṣaṇam sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata /
analyzed: mā cit anyat vi śaṃsata sakhāyaḥ mā riṣaṇyata    indram id stotā vṛṣaṇam sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata  /
translated: O friends, think not of any other (god), be not discontented. The singer must ever praise the mighty Indra, when the juice is pressed, and repeat his praises.

original: avakrakṣiṇam vṛṣabham yathā ajuram gām na carṣaṇīsaham / vidveṣaṇam saṃvanana ubhayaṃkaram maṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam /
analyzed: avakrakṣiṇam vṛṣabham yathā ajuram gām na carṣaṇīsaham    vidveṣaṇam saṃvanana ubhayaṃkaram maṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam  /
translated: The irresistible, the strong, like a bull, like a cow who conquers the people, the hateful, the conciliatory, the doer of both, the most bountiful, the all-conquering.

original: yat cit hi tvā janāḥ ime nānā havante ūtaye / asmākam brahmā idam indra bhūtu te ahā viśvā ca vardhanam /
analyzed: yat cit hi tvā janāḥ ime nānā havante ūtaye    asmākam brahmā idam indra bhūtu te ahā viśvā ca vardhanam  /
translated: Since these various people call on thee for help, to us, O Indra, let this prayer of ours come, and all increase.

original: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścitaḥ aryaḥ vipaḥ janānām / upa kramasva puru rūpam ā bhara vājam nediṣṭham ūtaye /
analyzed: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścitaḥ aryaḥ vipaḥ janānām     upa kramasva puru rūpam ā bhara vājam nediṣṭham ūtaye  /
translated: The sages, O bounteous one, are singing forth their songs, the holy bards of men. Come hitherward, bring hitherward the wealth of many a form to aid.

original: brahmaṇā te brahma yujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamādaḥ āśū / sthiram ratham sukham indra adhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvāṃ upa yāhi somam /🔽adhvaryavaḥ aruṇam dugdham aṃśum juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām / gaurāt vedīyām avapānam indraḥ viśvāhā id yāti suta somam ichan /
analyzed: brahmaṇā te brahma yujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamādaḥ āśū    sthiram ratham sukham indra adhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvāṃ upa yāhi somam  / adhvaryavaḥ aruṇam dugdham aṃśum juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām    gaurāt vedīyām avapānam indraḥ viśvāhā id yāti suta somam ichan  /
translated: With prayer I yoke thy two bay steeds, thy friends, thy swift companions in the feast. O Indra, seated in thy firm and easy car, come, knowing, wise, to the Soma.🔽O Adhvaryus, offer ye the ruddy milk of the Amsu to the Bull of the people. Indra, the guest of the white cow, ever seeks the Soma, seeking the drink from the filter.

original: yat dadhiṣe pradivi cāru annam divedive pītim id asya vakṣi / uta hṛdā uta manasā juṣāṇaḥ uśan indra prasthitān pāhi somān /
analyzed: yat dadhiṣe pradivi cāru annam divedive pītim id asya vakṣi    uta hṛdā uta manasā juṣāṇaḥ uśan indra prasthitān pāhi somān  /
translated: The dainty food which thou hast laid in the region, tell us thereof, and give us daily drink thereof. Accepting it with heart and mind, O Indra, delighted, drink the offered Somas.

original: jajñānaḥ somam sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca / ā indra paprātha uru antarikṣam yudhā devebhyaḥ varivaḥ cakartha /
analyzed: jajñānaḥ somam sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca    ā indra paprātha uru antarikṣam yudhā devebhyaḥ varivaḥ cakartha  /
translated: Thou, even as soon as born, hast drunk the Soma for strength. Thy mother hath declared thy greatness. Thou, O Indra, hast filled the wide air with thy might, and hast made room for the Gods to fight.

original: yat yodhaya mahataḥ manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān / yat vā nṛbhiḥ vṛtaḥ indra abhiyudhyāḥ tam tvayā ājim sauśravasam jayema /
analyzed: yat yodhaya mahataḥ manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān    yat vā nṛbhiḥ vṛtaḥ indra abhiyudhyāḥ tam tvayā ājim sauśravasam jayema  /
translated: When thou hast fought with mighty men who scorned thee, thou hast with might subdued the haughty. Or when, O Indra, thou hast been surrounded by men who fight against us, through thee may we win that battle and win glory.

original: pra indrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra / yadā id adevīḥ asahiṣṭa māyāḥ atha abhavat kevalaḥ somaḥ asya /
analyzed: pra indrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra   yadā id adevīḥ asahiṣṭa māyāḥ atha abhavat kevalaḥ somaḥ asya  /
translated: I will proclaim the earliest deeds of Indra, and the new exploits which the bounteous one hath done. When the godless wiles of Diti were vanquished, then Soma became his only property.

original: tava idam viśvam abhitas paśavyam yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya / gavām asi gopatiḥ ekaḥ indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ /
analyzed: tava idam viśvam abhitas paśavyam yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya    gavām asi gopatiḥ ekaḥ indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ  /
translated: This all around thee, Indra, is the cattle which thou seest with the eye of Sûrya. Thou art the sole lord of the kine, O Indra: may we enjoy the treasure which thou givest.

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya / dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya    dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  /
translated: Ye two, O Br̥ihaspati, ye two, O Indra, are Lords of all the wealth that is in heaven and on the earth. Grant riches even to the poor who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

original: yaḥ tastambha sahasā vi jmaḥ antān bṛhaspatiḥ triṣadhasthaḥ raveṇa / tam pratnāsaḥ ṛṣayaḥ dīdhyānāḥ puras viprāḥ dadhire mandra jihvam /
analyzed: yaḥ tastambha sahasā vi jmaḥ antān bṛhaspatiḥ triṣadhasthaḥ raveṇa    tam pratnāsaḥ ṛṣayaḥ dīdhyānāḥ puras viprāḥ dadhire mandra jihvam  /
translated: He who with might hath propped the earth's two limits, Br̥ihaspati, the Lord of Three, with thunder,– Him, the most sweet, the ancient sages, looking, have stablished in their mouth as singers.

original: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madantaḥ bṛhaspate abhi ye naḥ tatasre / pṛṣantam sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatāt asya yonim /
analyzed: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madantaḥ bṛhaspate abhi ye naḥ tatasre    pṛṣantam sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatāt asya yonim  /
translated: Let the swift-moving ones, rejoicing in their splendour, O Brihaspati, keep off those who threaten us. Protect the spotted, the many-hued, the unfailing womb, O Brihaspati, protect his birthplace.

original: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvat atas ā te ṛta spṛśaḥ ni seduḥ / tubhyam khātāḥ avatāḥ adri dugdhāḥ madhvaḥ ścotanti abhitas virapśam /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvat atas ā te ṛta spṛśaḥ ni seduḥ   tubhyam khātāḥ avatāḥ adri dugdhāḥ madhvaḥ ścotanti abhitas virapśam  /
translated: O Brihaspati, those who have touched the highest, the most distant, have sat down near thee, O thou who art true to thy word. For thee the dug-out pits, dug out by the stone, flow with honey all around, with fat.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ mahaḥ jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman / sapta āsyaḥ tuvi jātaḥ raveṇa vi sapta raśmiḥ adhamat tamāṃsi /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ mahaḥ jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman    sapta āsyaḥ tuvi jātaḥ raveṇa vi sapta raśmiḥ adhamat tamāṃsi  /
translated: Brihaspati, being first born, in the highest heaven, from the great light, with seven mouths, with mighty birth, with his radiance, hath dispelled the sevenfold darkness with his seven rays.

original: sa suṣṭubhā saḥ ṛkvatā gaṇena valam ruroja phaligam ravena / bṛhaspatiḥ usriyā havya sūdaḥ kanikradat vāvaśatīḥ ud ājat /
analyzed: sa suṣṭubhā saḥ ṛkvatā gaṇena valam ruroja phaligam ravena    bṛhaspatiḥ usriyā havya sūdaḥ kanikradat vāvaśatīḥ ud ājat  /
translated: He, with the well-praised, with the Rik-chanting band, hath with his radiance crushed Vala and Fligili. Brihaspati, the invoker of the gods, hath come forth with the lowing, the calling cows.

original: eva pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñaiḥ vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ / bṛhaspate su prajāḥ vīravantaḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām /
analyzed: eva pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñaiḥ vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ   bṛhaspate su prajāḥ vīravantaḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām  /
translated: Thus let us serve with sacrifice, with homage, with oblations, the father, the all-god, the mighty one. O Brihaspati, may we be prosperous, having good offspring, lords of riches.

original: astā iva su prataram lāyam asyan bhūṣan iva pra bhara stomam asmai / vācā viprāḥ tarata vācam aryaḥ ni rāmaya jaritaḥ somaḥ indram /
analyzed: astā iva su prataram lāyam asyan bhūṣan iva pra bhara stomam asmai    vācā viprāḥ tarata vācam aryaḥ ni rāmaya jaritar somaḥ indram  /
translated: As one who sets a swift-running steed at a good ford, so bring thou to him the laud as one who decks him. With speech, O sages, cross the speech of him who hates us. O singer, make Indra glad with Soma.

original: dohena gām upa śikṣa sakhāyam pra bodhaya jaritar jāram indram / kośam na pūrṇam vasunā nyṛṣṭam ā cyāvaya magha deyāya śūram /
analyzed: dohena gām upa śikṣa sakhāyam pra bodhaya jaritar jāram indram   kośam na pūrṇam vasunā nyṛṣṭam ā cyāvaya magha deyāya śūram  /
