translated: They yoke the two Bay Steeds with the hymn of him the Strong, on the broad car, on the broad yoke, O Indra, yoked by prayer.

original: agnim dūtam vṛṇīmahe hotāram viśva vedasam / asya yajñasya sukratum / asya yajñasya sukratum /
analyzed: agnim dūtam vṛṇīmahe hotāram viśva vedasam    asya yajñasya sukratum    asya yajñasya sukratum
translated: We choose Agni as messenger, the priest, the all-knower, of this sacrifice, the wise one of this sacrifice.

original: agnim agnim havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim / havyavāham puru priyam /
analyzed: agnim agnim havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim     havyavāham puru priyam  /
translated: With invocations they ever invoke Agni, the lord of the house, the bearer of oblations, dear to many.

original: agne devān iha ā vaha jajñānaḥ vṛkta barhiṣe / asi hotā naḥ īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: agne devān iha ā vaha jajñānaḥ vṛkta barhiṣe   asi hotā naḥ īḍyaḥ  /
translated: O Agni, bring the Gods hither to him who strews the grass for you, for you are our adorable Priest.

original: īlenyaḥ namasyaḥ tiras tamāṃsi darśataḥ / sam agniḥ idhyate vṛṣā /
analyzed: īlenyaḥ namasyaḥ tiras tamāṃsi darśataḥ   sam agniḥ idhyate vṛṣā  /
translated: To be implored, to be revered, shining through the gloom, Agni is kindled, the strong one.

original: vṛṣaḥ agniḥ sam idhyate aśvaḥ na deva vāhanaḥ / tam haviṣmantaḥ īlate /
analyzed: vṛṣaḥ agniḥ sam idhyate aśvaḥ na deva vāhanaḥ   tam haviṣmantaḥ īlate  /
translated: The strong Agni is kindled, the horse who bears the Gods, him the oblation-bringers serve.

original: vṛṣaṇam tvā vayam vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi / agne dīdyatam bṛhat /
analyzed: vṛṣaṇam tvā vayam vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi   agne dīdyatam bṛhat
translated: We, the strong ones, O strong one, kindle thee, the strong one, O Agni, shine forth in thy greatness.

original: agnim īliṣva avase gāthābhiḥ śīra śociṣam / agnim rāye purumīlha śrutam naraḥ agnim su dītaye chardiḥ /
analyzed: agnim īliṣva avase gāthābhiḥ śīra śociṣam   agnim rāye purumīlha śrutam naraḥ agnim su dītaye chardiḥ  /
translated: Praise Agni for his help with songs, O thou of fair hair; praise Agni for wealth, O thou who findest plenteous wealth; praise Agni for good offspring, O thou who art to be implored.

original: agne ā yāhi agnibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe / ā tvām anaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭham barhiḥ āsade /
analyzed: agne ā yāhi agnibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe   ā tvām anaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭham barhiḥ āsade  /
translated: O Agni, come with the fires: we choose thee as Hotar. Let the well-ordered one, rich in oblations, anoint thee, best to sacrifice, to sit on the sacred grass.

original: acha hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaḥ caranti adhvare / ūrjaḥ napātam ghṛta keśam īmahe agnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam //
analyzed: acha hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaḥ caranti adhvare    ūrjaḥ napātam ghṛta keśam īmahe agnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam  /
translated: For, O Son of Strength, O Angiras, the ladles move at the sacrifice to thee. We implore the son of strength, whose hair is oil, Agni, the first at sacrifices.

original: imāḥ u tvā purūvaso giraḥ vardhantu yāḥ mama / pāvaka varṇāḥ śucayaḥ vipaścitaḥ abhi stomaiḥ anūṣata /
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā purūvaso giraḥ vardhantu yāḥ mama   pāvaka varṇāḥ śucayaḥ vipaścitaḥ abhi stomaiḥ anūṣata  /
translated: May these my songs, O thou of plenteous wealth, exalt thee, O thou of pure radiance, the pure, the wise, who have been sung with praises.

original: ayam sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudraḥ iva paprathe / satyaḥ saḥ asya mahimā gṛne śavaḥ yajñeṣu vipra rājye /
analyzed: ayam sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudraḥ iva paprathe    satyaḥ saḥ asya mahimā gṛne śavaḥ yajñeṣu vipra rājye  /
translated: This (Agni) hath been created by the Rishis with a thousand (helps). He hath spread himself like the sea. His greatness, his power, which is true, is to be sung in sacrifices, in the kingdom of the holy.

original: ā naḥ viśvāsu havyaḥ indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu / upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtra hā parama jyāḥ ṛcīṣamaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ viśvāsu havyaḥ indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu   / upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtra hā parama jyāḥ ṛcīṣamaḥ  /
translated: Let Indra, to be invoked in all our battles, be glorified among us. The Vr̥itra-slayer, most exalted, most liberal of gifts, hath sat by the prayers and libations.

original: tvam dātā prathamaḥ rāghasām asi asi satyaḥ īśāna kṛt / tuvi dyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavasaḥ mahaḥ /
analyzed: tvam dātā prathamaḥ rāghasām asi asi satyaḥ īśāna kṛt   tuvi dyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavasaḥ mahaḥ  /
translated: Thou art the first giver of treasures: thou art the true, the all-controlling Lord. We choose the yoke-fellow of the mighty one, the son of strength, the great.

original: tvam indra pratūrtiṣu abhi viśvāḥ asi spṛdhaḥ / aśasti hā janitā viśvatūr asi tvam tūrya taruṣyataḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra pratūrtiṣu abhi viśvāḥ asi spṛdhaḥ   aśasti hā janitā viśvatūr asi tvam tūrya taruṣyataḥ  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, in the battles, art over all the bands of foes. Thou art the slayer of the curse, the victor on every side: thou art the conqueror of the conqueror.

original: anu te śuṣmam turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśum na mātarā / viśvāḥ te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtram yat indra tūrvasi //
analyzed: anu te śuṣmam turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśum na mātarā   viśvāḥ te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtram yat indra tūrvasi  /
translated: Let the two worlds follow thy strength as it speeds on, as the two mothers follow their child. All the bands of foes are broken by thy wrath, when thou, O Indra, speedest to slay Vritra.🔽From this side come to you the undecaying one, the leader, the unled,

original: itas ūtī vaḥ ajaram prahetāram aprahitam / āśum jetāram hetāram rathītamam atūrtam tugryāvṛdham /
analyzed: itas ūtī vaḥ ajaram prahetāram aprahitam    āśum jetāram hetāram rathītamam atūrtam tugryāvṛdham  /
translated: The swift one, the winner, the leader, the best charioteer, the unvanquished, the strengthener of Tugrya.🔽He who is king of men, who moves on his cars, the irresistible,

original: yaḥ rājā carṣaṇīnām yātā rathebhiḥ adhriguḥ / viśvāsām tarutā pṛtanānām jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe /
analyzed: yaḥ rājā carṣaṇīnām yātā rathebhiḥ adhriguḥ    viśvāsām tarutā pṛtanānām jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe  /
translated: The best of all who conquer in battle, the Vr̥itra-slayer whom I praise.🔽That Indra, O ye men, the mighty, the slayer of many, I exalt for aid, whose two arms, O ye who order all,

original: indram tam śumbha puru hanman avase yasya dvitā vidhartari / hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśataḥ mahaḥ dive na sūryaḥ /
analyzed: indram tam śumbha puru hanman avase yasya dvitā vidhartari    hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśataḥ mahaḥ dive na sūryaḥ  /
translated: Are ever ready to the hand, the wondrous, as the great heaven to the sun.🔽That mighty power of thine, O Indra, that strength, and that high wisdom,

original: tava tyad indriyam bṛhat tava śuṣmam uta kratum / vajram śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam /
analyzed: tava tyad indriyam bṛhat tava śuṣmam uta kratum   vajram śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam
translated: The thunderbolt, the excellent, the thought sharpeneth.

original: tava dyauḥ indra pauṃsyam pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ / tvām āpaḥ parvatāsaḥ ca hinvire /
analyzed: tava dyauḥ indra pauṃsyam pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ   tvām āpaḥ parvatāsaḥ ca hinvire  /
translated: The heaven, O Indra, and the earth increase thy manly might and fame. The waters and the mountains urge thee on.

original: tvām viṣṇuḥ bṛhan kṣayaḥ mitraḥ gṛṇāti varuṇaḥ / tvām śardhaḥ madati anu mārutam /
analyzed: tvām viṣṇuḥ bṛhan kṣayaḥ mitraḥ gṛṇāti varuṇaḥ   tvām śardhaḥ madati anu mārutam  /
translated: The mighty Vishnu, Mitra, Varuna sing thy praise. The Marut host rejoices in thee.

original: sam asya manyave viśaḥ viśvā namanta kuṣṭayaḥ / samudrāya iva sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: sam asya manyave viśaḥ viśvā namanta kuṣṭayaḥ    samudrāya iva sindhavaḥ
translated: All people and all tribes bow down before his wrath, as rivers to the sea.

original: ojaḥ tat asya titviṣaḥ ubhe yat samavartayat / indraḥ carmā iva rodasī /
analyzed: ojaḥ tat asya titviṣaḥ ubhe yat samavartayat   indraḥ carmā iva rodasī  /
translated: That is his power and majesty, that he hath brought the two worlds near, as Indra hath the heaven and earth.

original: vi cit vṛtrasya dodhataḥ vajreṇa śata parvaṇā / śiraḥ bibhet vṛṣṇinā /
analyzed: vi cit vṛtrasya dodhataḥ vajreṇa śata parvaṇā   śiraḥ bibhet vṛṣṇinā
translated: He with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt hath cleft the head of Vr̥itra as he rushed to battle.

original: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas jajñe ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ / sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yat enam madanti viśve ūmāḥ /
analyzed: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas jajñe ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ   sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yat enam madanti viśve ūmāḥ  /
translated: This is the highest in the worlds of being, whence sprang the mighty one, the terrible, the bold. As soon as born he slays the foemen, when all the bright ones rejoice in him.

original: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ śatruḥ dāsāya bhiyasam dadhāti / avyanat ca vyanat ca sasni sam te navanta prabhṛtāḥ madeṣu /
analyzed: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ śatruḥ dāsāya bhiyasam dadhāti   avyanat ca vyanat ca sasni sam te navanta prabhṛtāḥ madeṣu  /
translated: Waxen in strength, of plenteous vigour, he strikes the Dâsa with terror as an foe. He hath unclosed and closed the doors of heaven. They who have brought him gifts sing forth their songs of joy.

original: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvis yat ete tris bhavanti ūmāḥ / svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛja sam adaḥ su madhu madhunā abhi yodhīḥ /
analyzed: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvis yat ete tris bhavanti ūmāḥ   svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛja sam adaḥ su madhu madhunā abhi yodhīḥ  /
translated: They honour thee, O Indra, with their hymns, when twice or thrice these many come to thee. O thou most sweet of all that is most sweet, with sweetness make sweet food for us, and win us food with sweetness.🔽If the victorious riches gladden thee in every fight, O thou who art to be invoked by the priests,

original: yadi cit nu tvā dhanā jayantam raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ / ojīyaḥ śuṣmin sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ /
analyzed: yadi cit nu tvā dhanā jayantam raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ    ojīyaḥ śuṣmin sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ  /
translated: Be thou more strong, O thou who art strong, and make thy body firm. Let not the evil-living, the cheerless, overcome thee.🔽Through thee, O Indra, we will be victorious in battles, beholding the many treasures of the warrior.

original: tvayā vayam śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyantaḥ yudhenyāni bhūri / codayāmi te āyudhā vacobhiḥ sam te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi /
analyzed: tvayā vayam śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyantaḥ yudhenyāni bhūri   codayāmi te āyudhā vacobhiḥ sam te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi  /
translated: I urge thy weapons with my words; I sharpen thy limbs with prayer.🔽Thou hast established that in the lower and the higher abode, in which thou hast helped with aid.

original: ni tat dadhiṣe avare pare ca yasmin āvitha avasā duroṇe / ā sthāpayata mātaram jigatnum atas invata karvarāṇi bhūri //
analyzed: ni tat dadhiṣe avare pare ca yasmin āvitha avasā duroṇe   ā sthāpayata mātaram jigatnum atas invata karvarāṇi bhūri  /
translated: Establish the mother who moves not, and from this place send forth the many treasures.🔽Praise him, O thou of great dominion, the most impetuous, the most victorious, the most powerful of the powerful.

original: stuṣva varṣman puru vartmānam sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām / ā darśati śavasā bhūri ojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: stuṣva varṣman puru vartmānam sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām   ā darśati śavasā bhūri ojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ  /
translated: He shows himself with mighty strength, he is able to measure the earth.

original: imā brahma bṛhaddivaḥ kṛṇavat indrāya śūṣam agniyaḥ svarṣāḥ / mahaḥ gotrasya kṣayati svarājā turaḥ cit viśvam arṇavat tapasvān /
analyzed: imā brahma bṛhaddivaḥ kṛṇavat indrāya śūṣam agniyaḥ svarṣāḥ   mahaḥ gotrasya kṣayati svarājā turaḥ cit viśvam arṇavat tapasvān  /
translated: May he, the Brahman, the great-souled one, make strength for Indra, self-luminous, born of Agni, in the great abode of the cow, the self-ruling one, the swift one, who overcomes all with his heat.

original: eva mahān bṛhaddivaḥ atharvā avocat svām tanvam indram eva / svasārau mātaribhvarī aripre hinvanti ca ene śavasā vardhayanti ca /
analyzed: eva mahān bṛhaddivaḥ atharvā avocat svām tanvam indram eva   svasārau mātaribhvarī aripre hinvanti ca ene śavasā vardhayanti ca  /
translated: Thus the great one, the great-souled Atharvan, spoke to Indra himself, to his own body. The two sisters, the powerful ones, the destroyers of enemies, impel them and strengthen them with vigor.

original: citram devānām ketuḥ anīkam jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūryaḥ udyan / divākaraḥ ati dyumnaiḥ tamāṃsi viśvātārīt duritāni śukraḥ /
analyzed: citram devānām ketuḥ anīkam jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūryaḥ udyan    divākaraḥ ati dyumnaiḥ tamāṃsi viśvātārīt duritāni śukraḥ  /
translated: The wonderful banner and host of the gods, the radiant sun rising in the directions, the maker of the day, with his glories, has dispelled the darkness and all evils, the bright one.

original: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ / āprāt dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca /
analyzed: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ    āprāt dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca  /
translated: The wonderful host of the gods has risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni. The sun has reached the heaven, the earth, and the atmosphere. The sun is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.

original: sūryaḥ devīm uṣasam rocamānām maryaḥ na yoṣām abhī eti paścāt / yatra naraḥ devayantaḥ yugāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram /
analyzed: sūryaḥ devīm uṣasam rocamānām maryaḥ na yoṣām abhī eti paścāt    yatra naraḥ devayantaḥ yugāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram  /
translated: The sun approaches the shining goddess Ushas from the west, like a youth to a maiden, where men who delight in the gods spread out the eras, each for the good, for the good.

original: tvam naḥ indra ā bharam ojaḥ nṛmṇam śatakrato vicarṣaṇe / ā vīram pṛtanāṣaham /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra ā bharam ojaḥ nṛmṇam śatakrato vicarṣaṇe    ā vīram pṛtanāṣaham  /
translated: Bring us a hero who shall conquer in the war.

original: tvam hi naḥ pitā vaso tvam mātā śatakrato babhūvitha / adhā te sumnam īmahe /
analyzed: tvam hi naḥ pitā vaso tvam mātā śatakrato babhūvitha    adhā te sumnam īmahe  /
translated: For thou, O Vasu, art our father, thou, O Indra, art our mother. So hast thou been. So we implore thy grace.

original: tvām śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantam upa bruve śatakrato / sa naḥ rāsva su vīryam /🔽svādoḥ itthā viṣuvataḥ madhvaḥ pibanti gauryaḥ / yāḥ indreṇa sa yāvarīḥ vṛṣṇā madanti śobhase vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam /
analyzed: tvām śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantam upa bruve śatakrato    sa naḥ rāsva su vīryam  / svādoḥ itthā viṣuvataḥ madhvaḥ pibanti gauryaḥ   yāḥ indreṇa sa yāvarīḥ vṛṣṇā madanti śobhase vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam  /
translated: Thee, O thou Strong One, much-invoked, who sendest strength, O thou of hundred powers, I address. So grant thou us heroic strength.🔽The tawny ones, the sisters, drink of this sweet juice, of this most excellent mead, who with the strong Indra rejoice in splendour, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.

original: tāḥ asya pṛśanāyuvaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / priyāḥ indrasya dhenavaḥ vajram hinvanti sāyakam vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam //
analyzed: tāḥ asya pṛśanāyuvaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ   priyāḥ indrasya dhenavaḥ vajram hinvanti sāyakam vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam  /
translated: The dappled ones, the mates of him who hath the tawny steeds, mix the Soma for him, the dear milch-kine of Indra. They urge the bolt, the arrow, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.

original: tāḥ asya namasā sahaḥ saparyanti pracetasaḥ / vratāni asya saścire purūṇi pūrvacittaye vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam //
analyzed: tāḥ asya namasā sahaḥ saparyanti pracetasaḥ   vratāni asya saścire purūṇi pūrvacittaye vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam  /
translated: The wise ones serve his might with reverence, they observe his many ordinances, for the sake of the ancient thought, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.

original: indrāya madūne sutam pari stobhantu naḥ giraḥ / arkam arcantu kāravaḥ /
analyzed: indrāya madūne sutam pari stobhantu naḥ giraḥ   arkam arcantu kāravaḥ
translated: Let our songs of praise exalt for Indra, the gladdener, the juice that is pressed. Let the bards sing their songs of praise to him.

original: yasmin viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ / indram sute havāmahe //
analyzed: yasmin viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ   indram sute havāmahe  /
translated: In whom all glories are, and seven assemblies resound. We call on Indra when the juice is shed.

original: trikadrukeṣu cetanam devāsaḥ yajñam atnata / tam id vardhantu naḥ giraḥ /
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu cetanam devāsaḥ yajñam atnata   tam id vardhantu naḥ giraḥ  /
translated: The Gods have set the sacrifice, the watchful One, on Trikadruka. May our songs make him wax strong.

original: yat somam indra viṣṇavi yat vā gha trita āptye / yat vā marutsu mandase sam indubhiḥ /
analyzed: yat somam indra viṣṇavi yat vā gha trita āptye   yat vā marutsu mandase sam indubhiḥ
translated: When, Indra, with Vishṇu, or with Trita, or with Āptya, or when thou rejoicest thee with the Maruts, with the drops of Soma.

original: yat vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase / asmākam id sute raṇā sam indubhiḥ /
analyzed: yat vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase    asmākam id sute raṇa sam indubhiḥ
translated: Or when, O Śakra, thou rejoicest thee beyond the sea, beyond the ocean, rejoice thee in our juice, with the drops of Soma.

original: yat vā asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ yajamānasya satpate / ukthe vā yasya raṇyasi sam indubhiḥ /
analyzed: yat vā asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ yajamānasya satpate    ukthe vā yasya raṇyasi sam indubhiḥ  /
translated: Or when thou art the helper of the worshipper who sheds the juice, or when thou art delighted with the lauds of him who offers, with the drops of Soma.

original: yat adya kac ca vṛtrahan udagāḥ abhi sūrya / sarvam tat indra te vaśe //
analyzed: yat adya kad ca vṛtrahan udagāḥ abhi sūrya      sarvam tat indra te vaśe
translated: Whatever thou hast done today, O Vritra-slayer, in rising up to the light, O Sūrya, all that is in thy power, O Indra.

original: yat vā pravṛddha satpate na marāḥ iti manyase / uta u tat satyam id tava /
analyzed: yat vā pravṛddha satpate na marāḥ iti manyase   uta u tat satyam id tava  /
translated: Or when, O thou who art grown strong, O Lord of the brave, thou thinkest, 'I shall not die,' that also is true of thee.

original: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire / sarvān tām indra gacchasi //
analyzed: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire    sarvān tām indra gacchasi  /
translated: The Soma-pressings which they have performed in the distance, and those which they have performed near at hand, all these thou visitest, O Indra.

original: ubhayam śṛṇavat ca naḥ indraḥ arvāk idam vacaḥ / satrācyā maghavā soma pītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭhaḥ ā gamat /
analyzed: ubhayam śṛṇavat ca naḥ indraḥ arvāk idam vacaḥ   satrācyā maghavā soma pītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭhaḥ ā gamat  /
translated: May Indra hear both this our speech and that which we shall speak to him. May Maghavan, the most mighty, come to the Soma draught, as is his wont.

original: tam hi sva rājam vṛṣabham tam ojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ / uta upamānām prathamaḥ ni sīdasi soma kāmam hi te manaḥ /
analyzed: tam hi sva rājam vṛṣabham tam ojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ    uta upamānām prathamaḥ ni sīdasi soma kāmam hi te manaḥ  /
translated: For him, the self-dependent Bull, for his great strength the two-fold heaven hath fashioned him. And first of all thou sittest in the place of trial, for thy mind is set on Soma.

original: abhrātṛvyaḥ aanā tvam anāpiḥ indra januṣā sanāt asi / yudhā id āpi tvam ichase /
analyzed: abhrātṛvyaḥ aanā tvam anāpiḥ indra januṣā sanāt asi    yudhā id āpi tvam ichase  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, art from birth without a rival, without an enemy, without a kinsman. Thou seekest to win by fight even him who is thy kinsman.

original: nakī revantam sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ / yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanum sam ūhasi āt id pitā iva hūyase /
analyzed: nakir revantam sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ   yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanum sam ūhasi āt id pitā iva hūyase  /
translated: Thou never findest a friend who is worthy of thee. They drink the Soma who are better than thou. When thou makest the river swell, and drivest on the floods, then, as a father, thou art invoked.

original: aham id hi pituḥ pari medhām ṛtasya jagrabha / aham sūryaḥ iva ajani //
analyzed: aham id hi pituḥ pari medhām ṛtasya jagrabha   aham sūryaḥ iva ajani  /
translated: I have received from my father the wisdom of holy order. I have been born like the sun.

original: aham pratnena manmanā giraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇva vat / yena indraḥ śuṣmam id dadhe //
analyzed: aham pratnena manmanā giraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇva vat  yena indraḥ śuṣmam id dadhe
translated: With the ancient hymn I adorn the songs, as Kanva did, wherewith Indra hath gained strength.

original: ye tvām indra na tuṣṭuvuḥ ṛṣayaḥ ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ / mama id vardhasva suṣṭutaḥ /
analyzed: ye tvām indra na tuṣṭuvuḥ ṛṣayaḥ ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ   mama id vardhasva suṣṭutaḥ  /
translated: O Indra, those Rishis who have not praised thee, and those who have, may I be glorified by thee, well praised.

original: mā bhūma niṣṭyāḥ iva indra tvat araṇāḥ iva / vanāni ni prajahitāni adrivas duroṣāsaḥ amanmahi //
analyzed: mā bhūma niṣṭyāḥ iva indra tvat araṇāḥ iva   vanāni ni prajahitāni adrivas duroṣāsaḥ amanmahi  /
translated: Let not the people be to thee as nothing, O Indra, as desert places are. Drive off the inaccessible, O Thunderer, the hard to conquer, which we have thought upon.

original: amanmahi id anāśavaḥ anugrāsaḥ ca vṛtrahan / su kṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasā anu stomam mudīmahi //
analyzed: amanmahi id anāśavaḥ anugrāsaḥ ca vṛtrahan    su kṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasā anu stomam mudīmahi  /
translated: We have thought upon them, O thou who art swift to hear, and who art bountiful, O Vr̥itra-slayer. We will rejoice in thy great bounty, O hero, and in the hymn of praise.

original: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yam te suṣāva haryaśva adriḥ / sotuḥ bāhubhyām su yataḥ na arvā /
analyzed: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yam te suṣāva haryaśva adriḥ    sotuḥ bāhubhyām su yataḥ na arvā  /
translated: Drink Soma, Indra, let it cheer thee, which the stone hath pressed for thee, O thou of Bay steeds, which the presser hath pressed with his arms, which is ready to thy lips.

original: yaḥ te madaḥ yujaḥ cāruḥ asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi / sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu //
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ yujaḥ cāruḥ asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi    sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu  /
translated: That gladdening juice of thine which is delightful to the friend, wherewith, O thou of Bay steeds, thou slayest the Vr̥itras, let that, O Indra, make thee glad, O Lord of ample wealth.

original: bodha su me maghavan vācam ā imām yām te vasiṣṭhaḥ arcati praśastim / imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva /
analyzed: bodha su me maghavan vācam ā imām yām te vasiṣṭhaḥ arcati praśastim   imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva  /
translated: Mark thou this speech of mine, O bountiful Lord, this eulogy which Vasishtli recites to thee. Accept this prayer of mine in the assembly of the good.

original: śagdhi u su śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ / bhagam na hi tvā yaśasam vasu vidam anu śūra carāmasi //
analyzed: śagdhi u su śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ   bhagam na hi tvā yaśasam vasu vidam anu śūra carāmasi  /
translated: Be pleased, O thou who hast great power, O Indra, with all thy succours. We follow thee, O Hero, as one who brings good luck and glory and abundant wealth.

original: pauraḥ aśvasya puru kṛt gavām asi utsaḥ deva hiraṇyayaḥ / nakir hi dānam parimardhiṣat tve yat yat yāmi tat ā bhara //
analyzed: pauraḥ aśvasya puru kṛt gavām asi utsaḥ deva hiraṇyayaḥ   nakir hi dānam parimardhiṣat tve yat yat yāmi tat ā bhara  /
translated: Thou art the lord of horses, thou the lord of kine, thou art the lord of gold, O God. No one shall hinder the gift which thou bestowest, whatever boon I ask.🔽To Indra for the worship of the Gods, to Indra at the rite's beginning,

original: indram id devatātaye indram prayati adhvare / indram samīke vaninaḥ havāmahe indram dhanasya sātaye /
analyzed: indram id devatātaye indram prayati adhvare    indram samīke vaninaḥ havāmahe indram dhanasya sātaye  /
translated: To Indra in the battle we invoke the Vanins, to Indra for the winning of the spoil.🔽Indra hath spread out heaven and earth with might, Indra hath made the Sun to shine.

original: indraḥ mahnā rodasī paprathat śavaḥ indraḥ sūryam arocayat / indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemire indre suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ mahnā rodasī paprathat śavaḥ indraḥ sūryam arocayat   indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemire indre suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ  /
translated: In Indra all existing things have found a resting-place, in Indra have the Soma juices been effused.

original: astāvi manma pūrvyam brahma indrāya vocata / pūrvīḥ ṛtasya bṛhatīḥ anūṣata stotuḥ meghāḥ asṛkṣata /
analyzed: astāvi manma pūrvyam brahma indrāya vocata   pūrvīḥ ṛtasya bṛhatīḥ anūṣata stotuḥ meghāḥ asṛkṣata  /
translated: Sing forth the ancient hymn of praise, and tell the Brahman forth to Indra.🔽The clouds of the lauding priest have flowed to the great and many ordinances of eternal truth.

original: turaṇyavaḥ madhumantam ghṛtaścutam viprāsaḥ arkam ānṛcuḥ / asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ asme suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ /
analyzed: turaṇyavaḥ madhumantam ghṛtaścutam viprāsaḥ arkam ānṛcuḥ   asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ asme suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ  /
translated: The sages have sung forth the hymn that drops with meath and pours down oil.

original: yat indra prāk apāk udak nyak vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ / simā purū nṛṣūtaḥ asi ānave asi praśardha turvaśe /
analyzed: yat indra prāk apāk udak nyak vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ   simā purū nṛṣūtaḥ asi ānave asi praśardha turvaśe  /
translated: When, Indra, thou art called by men to the east, to the west, to the north, or to the south,🔽Thou art the boundary of many men, thou art the guardian of the race of man, thou art the champion of the Turvaga.

original: yat vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpe indra mādayase sacā / kaṇvāsaḥ tvā brahmabhiḥ stoma vāhasaḥ indra ā yacchanti ā gahi //
analyzed: yat vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpe indra mādayase sacā   kaṇvāsaḥ tvā brahmabhiḥ stoma vāhasaḥ indra ā yacchanti ā gahi  /
translated: The Kaṇvas with their holy prayers, with lauds that bring thee hither, Indra, wait on thee.🔽We utter praises to thee, O Hero, as if we were milch-kine unmilked.

original: abhi tvā śūra nonumaḥ a dugdhāḥ iva dhenavaḥ / īśānam asya jagataḥ svar dṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā śūra nonumaḥ a dugdhāḥ iva dhenavaḥ   īśānam asya jagataḥ svar dṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ  /
translated: Thou art the Lord of this world's light, O Indra, the Lord of what is firm.🔽No other God, no man is born or will be born like thee.

original: na tvāvām anyaḥ divyaḥ na pārthivaḥ na jātaḥ na janiṣyate / aśvāyantaḥ maghavan indra vājinaḥ gavyantaḥ tvā havāmahe /
analyzed: na tvāvām anyaḥ divyaḥ na pārthivaḥ na jātaḥ na janiṣyate    aśvāyantaḥ maghavan indra vājinaḥ gavyantaḥ tvā havāmahe  /
translated: O Maghavan, O Indra, we invoke thee, longing for horses, longing for the spoil.🔽May the rich gatherings in the house of Indra be ours, with mighty strength,

original: revatīḥ naḥ sadhamāde indre santu tuvi vājāḥ / kṣumantaḥ yābhiḥ madema /🔽ā gha tvāvān tmanā āpta stotṛbhyaḥ dhṛṣṇo iyānaḥ / ṛṇoḥ akṣam na cakrayoḥ /🔽ā yat duvaḥ śatakrato ā kāmam jaritṝṇām / ṛṇoḥ akṣam na śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: revatīḥ naḥ sadhamāde indre santu tuvi vājāḥ   kṣumantaḥ yābhiḥ madema  / ā gha tvāvān tmanā āpta stotṛbhyaḥ dhṛṣṇo iyānaḥ    ṛṇoḥ akṣam na cakrayoḥ  / ā yat duvaḥ śatakrato ā kāmam jaritṝṇām   ṛṇoḥ akṣam na śacībhiḥ
translated: With which we may rejoice.🔽Even as the axle of a car is fixed in the two wheels, so art thou fixed in thy two arms, O thou who givest ample room.🔽When thou, O Ṣatakratu, comest to the prayer of those who sing, to the desire of those who praise,

original: tat sūryasya deva tvam tat mahitvam madhyā kartoḥ vitatam sam jabhāra / yadā id ayukta haritaḥ sadhasthāt āt rātrī vāsaḥ tanute simasmai /
analyzed: tat sūryasya deva tvam tat mahitvam madhyā kartoḥ vitatam sam jabhāra   yadā id ayukta haritaḥ sadhasthāt āt rātrī vāsaḥ tanute simasmai  /
translated: The greatness of Sûrya, the God, the greatness that is spread out in the midst of the vault, he hath gathered together. When he hath yoked his two bay steeds, then Night for him weaves a robe to wear.

original: tat mitrasya varuṇasya abhicakṣe sūryaḥ rūpam kṛṇute dyoḥ upasthe / anantam anyat ruśat asya prājaḥ kṛṣṇam anyat haritaḥ sam bharanti //
analyzed: tat mitrasya varuṇasya abhicakṣe sūryaḥ rūpam kṛṇute dyoḥ upasthe    anantam anyat ruśat asya prājaḥ kṛṣṇam anyat haritaḥ sam bharanti  /
translated: I look upon the form of Sûrya, which Mitra and Varuṇa make in the lap of the sky. One of his rays is infinite, and red; the other, black, the tawny ones encompass.

original: kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā / kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā /
analyzed: kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā   kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā  /
translated: With what aid will the wondrous, ever-waxing Friend come to us? With what most mighty help?

original: kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām maṃhiṣṭhaḥ matsat andhasaḥ / dṛlhā cit āruje vasu //
analyzed: kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām maṃhiṣṭhaḥ matsat andhasaḥ   dṛlhā cit āruje vasu  /
translated: What truth-speaking gladdener of all libations, most bountiful, shall delight thee? Even the firm-set treasure thou shalt burst open.

original: abhi su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām / śatam bhavāsi ūtibhiḥ /🔽imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ / yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti //
analyzed: abhi su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām   śatam bhavāsi ūtibhiḥ  imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ   yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti  /
translated: Be thou the guardian of our friends and singers: a hundred times through succours shalt thou live.🔽With the Âdityas, with the All-Gods, may Indra further us in these our dwellings. With the Âdityas may Indra further our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspring.

original: ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmākam bhūtu avitā tanūnām / hatvāya devāḥ asurān yat āyan devāḥ deva tvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmākam bhūtu avitā tanūnām   hatvāya devāḥ asurān yat āyan devāḥ deva tvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ  /
translated: With the Âdityas, with the Marut host, may Indra be the guardian of our bodies. As the Gods went to slay the Asuras, the Gods, preserving their own God-head,

original: pratyañcam arkam anayam śacībhiḥ āt id svadhām iṣirām pari apaśyan / ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ /
analyzed: pratyañcam arkam anayam śacībhiḥ āt id svadhām iṣirām pari apaśyan    ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ  /
translated: With might he hath brought hitherward the Sun: they have beheld his own most active power. So may we, through his grace, O God, obtain strength, and, with brave sons, rejoice through a hundred winters.

original: apa indra prācaḥ maghavan amitrān apa apācaḥ abhibhūte nudasva / apa udīcaḥ apa śūra adharācaḥ urau yathā tava śarman madema /
analyzed: apa indra prācaḥ maghavan amitrān apa apācaḥ abhibhūte nudasva    apa udīcaḥ apa śūra adharācaḥ urau yathā tava śarman madema  /
translated: Drive off, O Indra, Maghavan, the foemen, drive off the westerners, O thou who vanquishest. Drive off the northern, drive off the southern, that we may dwell in thine embrace, O Hero.

original: kuvid aṅga yavamantaḥ yavam cit yathā dānti anupūrvam viyūya / iha iha eṣām kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣaḥ namaḥ vṛktim na jagmuḥ /
analyzed: kuvid aṅga yavamantaḥ yavam cit yathā dānti anupūrvam viyūya   iha iha eṣām kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣaḥ namaḥ vṛktim na jagmuḥ  /
translated: What! even the barley-bearing, as it were, the barley, they reap in order, one by one. Here make thou food for those who have not come to the oblation and the prayer of the sacred grass.

original: nahi sthūrī ṛtuthā yātam asti na uta śravaḥ vivide saṃgameṣu / gavyantaḥ indram sakhyāya viprāḥ aśvāyantaḥ vṛṣaṇam vājayantaḥ /
analyzed: nahi sthūrī ṛtuthā yātam asti na uta śravaḥ vivide saṃgameṣu    gavyantaḥ indram sakhyāya viprāḥ aśvāyantaḥ vṛṣaṇam vājayantaḥ  /
translated: For the plougher hath no place in due season, nor hath the ploughman found renown in battles. The sages, longing for the kine, have sought Indra, the mighty, longing for the steed and strength.

original: yuvam surāmam aśvinā namucau āsure sacā / vipipānā śubhaḥ patī indram karmasu āvatam /
analyzed: yuvam surāmam aśvinā namucau āsure sacā    vipipānā śubhaḥ patī indram karmasu āvatam  /
translated: Ye Aṣvins, with Namuci the Asura, have drunk the sweet juice together. Ye, Lords of splendour, have helped Indra in his deeds.

original: putram iva pitarau aśvinā ubhā indra āvathuḥ kāvyaiḥ daṃsanābhiḥ / yat surāmam vi apibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavan abhiṣṇak /🔽indraḥ sutrāmā svavām avobhiḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ / bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma /
analyzed: putram iva pitarau aśvinā ubhā indra āvathuḥ kāvyaiḥ daṃsanābhiḥ   yat surāmam vi apibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavan abhiṣṇak  / indraḥ sutrāmā svavām avobhiḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ   bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma  /
translated: As parents aid their son, so have the two Âditya-Asvins helped Indra with their wisdom and their wondrous power, When with thy might thou drankest the sweet juice of the Soma, Sarasvatî, O Maghavan, hath been thy refreshment.🔽May Indra, the good protector, the mighty, be gracious unto us with his kind favours: may he drive our enemies away and give us peace: may we be lords of goodly hero strength.

original: sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asmat ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu / tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma /
analyzed: sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asmat ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu    tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma  /
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the mighty, keep far away from us even the near foe: may we enjoy the favour of that holy God: may we enjoy his gracious love and loving-kindness.

original: vi hi sotoḥ asṛkṣata na indram devam amaṃsata / yatra amadat vṛṣākapiḥ aryaḥ puṣṭeṣu mad sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: vi hi sotoḥ asṛkṣata na indram devam amaṃsata    yatra amadat vṛṣākapiḥ aryaḥ puṣṭeṣu mad sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: The streams have flowed apart: they have not thought upon Indra the God, Where Vr̥ishâkapi hath been made glad, a friend among the pious folk. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: parā hi indra dhāvasi vṛṣākapeḥ ati vyathiḥ / naḥ aha pra vindasi anyatra soma pītaye viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: parā hi indra dhāvasi vṛṣākapeḥ ati vyathiḥ   naḥ aha pra vindasi anyatra soma pītaye viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: Far from the woe of Vr̥ishâkapi, O Indra, thou hast run away: Thou findest not the draught of Soma elsewhere than with us. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: kim ayam tvām vṛṣākapiḥ cakāra haritaḥ mṛgaḥ / yasmai irasyasi id u nu aryaḥ vā puṣṭimat vasu viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /🔽yam imam tvam vṛṣākapim priyam indra abhirakṣasi / śvā nu asya jambhiṣat api karṇe varāhayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: kim ayam tvām vṛṣākapiḥ cakāra haritaḥ mṛgaḥ   yasmai irasyasi id u nu aryaḥ vā puṣṭimat vasu viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  / yam imam tvam vṛṣākapim priyam indra abhirakṣasi   śvā nu asya jambhiṣat api karṇe varāhayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: What hath this tawny beast, this wild beast, Vrishâkapi, done to thee, For whom thou art enraged? Thou art a noble lord of wealth in precious things. Supreme is Indra over all.🔽This Vrishâkapi whom thou guardest well, O Indra, as a friend, Let the dog seize him by the ear, and tear him with his tusks. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: priyā taṣṭāni me kapiḥ vyaktā vi adūduṣat / śiraḥ nu asya rāviṣam na sugam duṣkṛte bhuvam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: priyā taṣṭāni me kapiḥ vyaktā vi adūduṣat    śiraḥ nu asya rāviṣam na sugam duṣkṛte bhuvam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: My dear, my tawny-coloured beast hath broken through the fences well-made. I will tear out his very jaws: for him who does amiss 'tis hard to fare well. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat / na mat praticyavīyasī na sakthi udyamīyasī viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat   na mat praticyavīyasī na sakthi udyamīyasī viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: No woman is more fair of face, none swifter in her ways than I. None is more active in her limbs, none more alert in bearing me. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: uve amba sulābhike yathā iva aṅgam bhaviṣyati / bhasat me amba sakthi me śiraḥ me vi iva hṛṣyati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: uve amba sulābhike yathā iva aṅgam bhaviṣyati   bhasad me amba sakthi me śiraḥ me vi iva hṛṣyati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: O mother, easy to be found, as it were, is my body now. My loins, my thighs, my head, O mother, seem to reel and whirl. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: kim su bāho su aṅgure pṛthuṣṭo pṛthu jāghane / kim śūra patni naḥ tvam abhi amīṣi vṛṣākapim viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: kim su bāho su aṅgure pṛthuṣṭo pṛthu jāghane   kim śūra patni naḥ tvam abhi amīṣi vṛṣākapim viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: Why, O thou wife of a hero, dost thou hate Vrishâkapi? In all things is Indra supreme.🔽This Shâraṇu despises me as if I were a woman without a son.

original: a vīrām iva mām ayam śarāruḥ abhi manyate / uta aham asmi vīriṇī indra patnī marut sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: a vīrām iva mām ayam śarāruḥ abhi manyate    uta aham asmi vīriṇī indra patnī marut sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: But I am a hero's wife, O Indra, a friend of the Maruts. In all things is Indra supreme.🔽Formerly a woman went to the Saman and the Samîdh,

original: saṃhotram sma purā nārī samanam vāva gacchati / vedhāḥ ṛtasya vīriṇī indra patnī mahīyate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: saṃhotram sma purā nārī samanam vāva gacchati   vedhāḥ ṛtasya vīriṇī indra patnī mahīyate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: The wife of the hero, the wise one, the mighty one, is exalted. In all things is Indra supreme.🔽I have heard that among all women Indra's wife is most fortunate,

original: indrāṇīm āsu nāriṣu subhagām aham aśravam / nahi asyāḥ aparam cana jarasā marate patiḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: indrāṇīm āsu nāriṣu subhagām aham aśravam    nahi asyāḥ aparam cana jarasā marate patiḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: For her husband never dies before her, not even through old age. In all things is Indra supreme.🔽O Indra's wife, I am not satisfied without my friend Vrishâkapi,

original: na aham indrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyuḥ vṛṣākapeḥ ṛte / yasya idam apyam haviḥ priyam deveṣu gacchati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: na aham indrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyuḥ vṛṣākapeḥ ṛte   yasya idam apyam haviḥ priyam deveṣu gacchati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: Whose dear oblation goes to the gods. In all things is Indra supreme.🔽O Revati, Vrishâkapi's wife, whose sons and daughters-in-law are good,

original: vṛsākapāyi revati su putraḥ āt u su snuṣe / ghasat te indraḥ ukṣaṇaḥ priyam kācid karam haviḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: vṛsākapāyi revati su putraḥ āt u su snuṣe   ghasat te indraḥ ukṣaṇaḥ priyam kācid karam haviḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: May Indra eat thy bull, thy dear oblation. In all things is Indra supreme.

original: ukṣṇaḥ hi me pañcadaśa sākam pacanti viṃsatim / uta aham admi pīvaḥ id ubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: ukṣṇaḥ hi me pañcadaśa sākam pacanti viṃsatim     uta aham admi pīvaḥ id ubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: For fifteen oxen, and twenty more, they cook together for me. And I eat plenteously: both my sides are filled. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: vṛṣabhaḥ na tigma śṛṅgaḥ antar yūtheṣu roruvat / manthaḥ te indra śam hṛde yam te sunoti bhāvayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /🔽na sa īśe yasya rambate antarā sakthyā kapṛt / sedi īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ na tigma śṛṅgaḥ antar yūtheṣu roruvat  / manthaḥ te indra śam hṛde yam te sunoti bhāvayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  / na sa īśe yasya rambate antarā sakthyā kapṛt   sedi īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: Like a bull with sharp horns roaring among the herds within, The churning-stick is for thy heart, O Indra, which the worshipper presses for thee. Supreme is Indra over all.🔽He is not master whose knee-cap, O thou of the beard, is shaken within his thigh. He is master whose beard, when he sits down, is stretched out. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: na sa īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate / sedi īśe yasya rambate antarā sakthyā kapṛth viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: na sa īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate   sedi īśe yasya rambate antarā sakthyā kapṛth viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: He is not master whose beard, when he sits down, is stretched out. He is master whose knee-cap, O thou of the beard, is shaken within his thigh. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: ayam indra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantam hatam vidat / asim sūnām navam carum āt edhasyānaḥ ācitam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: ayam indra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantam hatam vidat    asim sūnām navam carum āt edhasyānaḥ ācitam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: This Vr̥ishâkapi, O Indra, hath discovered the slain Parushânta, The new-made knife, the new-made pan, the cart of Atsedha laden with straw. Supreme is Indra over all.

original: ayam emi vicākaśat vicinvan dāsam āryam / pibāmi pāka sutvanaḥ abhi dhīram acākaśam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: ayam emi vicākaśat vicinvan dāsam āryam   pibāmi pāka sutvanaḥ abhi dhīram acākaśam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: I come hither, I have looked about, seeking the noble, seeking the slave. I drink the well-offered oblation. I have looked upon the wise. Indra is highest over all.

original: dhanva ca yat kṛntatram ca kati svid tā vi yojanā / nedīyasaḥ vṛṣākape astam ehi gṛhān upa viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: dhanva ca yat kṛntatram ca kati svid tā vi yojanā    nedīyasaḥ vṛṣākape astam ehi gṛhān upa viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: How many are the threads of the bow and the net? How many are the threads of the bow and the net? O Vṛṣākapi, come hither to your home, which is nearer. Indra is highest over all.

original: punar ehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai / yaḥ eṣa svapna naṃśanaḥ astam eṣi pathā punar viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: punar ehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai    yaḥ eṣa svapna naṃśanaḥ astam eṣi pathā punar viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: Come back again, O Vṛṣākapi; let us arrange our welfare. You who go back by the path, destroying sleep, Indra is highest over all.

original: yat udañcaḥ vṛṣākape gṛham indra ajagantana / kva sya pulvaghaḥ mṛgaḥ kam agam jana yopanaḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: yat udañcaḥ vṛṣākape gṛham indra ajagantana    kva sya pulvaghaḥ mṛgaḥ kam agam jana yopanaḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: When, O Vṛṣākapi, you went to Indra's house, O Vṛṣākapi, to the north, where is that treacherous beast, who has gone to the people's harm? Indra is highest over all.

original: parśuḥ ha nāma mānavī sākam sasūva viṃśatim / bhadram bhala tyasyāḥ abhūt yasyāḥ udaram āmayat viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ /
analyzed: parśuḥ ha nāma mānavī sākam sasūva viṃśatim   bhadram bhala tyasyāḥ abhūt yasyāḥ udaram āmayat viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  /
translated: The woman named Paśu gave birth to twenty at once. Blessed was the birth of her whose womb was afflicted. Indra is highest over all.

original: idam janāḥ upa śruta narāśaṃsaḥ staviṣyate / ṣaṣṭim sahasrā navatim ca kauramaḥ ā ruśameṣu dadmahe /
analyzed: idam janāḥ upa śruta narāśaṃsaḥ staviṣyate   ṣaṣṭim sahasrā navatim ca kauramaḥ ā ruśameṣu dadmahe  /
translated: Listen to this, O people; Narāśaṁsa will be praised. We give to the R̥ishis in the land of the Rusamas sixty thousand and ninety.

original: uṣṭrāḥ yasya pravāhaṇaḥ vadhūmantaḥ dvis daśa / varṣmā rathasya ni jihīḍate divaḥ īṣamāṇāḥ upaspṛśaḥ /🔽eṣaḥ iṣāya māmahe śatam niṣkān daśa srajaḥ / trīṇi śatāni arvatām sahasrā daśa gonām /
analyzed: uṣṭrāḥ yasya pravāhaṇaḥ vadhūmantaḥ dvis daśa    varṣmā rathasya ni jihīḍate divaḥ īṣamāṇāḥ upaspṛśaḥ  / eṣaḥ iṣāya māmahe śatam niṣkān daśa srajaḥ   trīṇi śatāni arvatām sahasrā daśa gonām  /
translated: The car's broad back is stretched out like the heaven's, as they, eager to draw, touch the yoke.🔽He is to be praised, O Rebha, to be praised, like a bird in a tree when ripe,

original: vacyasva rebha vacyasva vṛkṣe na pakve śakunaḥ / naṣṭe jihvā carcarī iti kṣuraḥ na bhurijoḥ iva /
analyzed: vacyasva rebha vacyasva vṛkṣe na pakve śakunaḥ   naṣṭe jihvā carcarī iti kṣuraḥ na bhurijoḥ iva  /
translated: Like a tongue that is cut off, like a razor on the two thighs.🔽The Rebhâs' thoughts, like bulls, are set in motion. Their sons are not clothed in garments,

original: pra rebhāsaḥ manīṣāḥ vṛṣā gāvaḥ iva īrate / amota putrakāḥ eṣām amota gāḥ iva āsate /
analyzed: pra rebhāsaḥ manīṣāḥ vṛṣā gāvaḥ iva īrate   amota putrakāḥ eṣām amota gāḥ iva āsate  /
translated: They sit as if they had no clothes, as if they had no cows.🔽O Rebha, bring forth the thought that finds the kine and finds the wealth.

original: pra rebha dhīm bharasva go vidam vasu vidam / devatrā imām vācam srīṇīhi iṣuḥ na avīra stāram //
analyzed: pra rebha dhīm bharasva go vidam vasu vidam
translated: To the gods send this speech of thine, as an archer sends his arrow to the foe.🔽Of the King who is the people's friend, the God who is above mankind,

original: rājñaḥ viśvajanīnasya yaḥ devaḥ martyām ati / vaiśvānarasya suṣṭutim ā sunota parikṣitaḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ viśvajanīnasya yaḥ devaḥ martyām ati    vaiśvānarasya suṣṭutim ā sunota parikṣitaḥ  /
translated: Of Vaiṣvânara, of Parikshit, pour ye forth the eulogy.🔽He, the all-surrounding, hath made the darkness light, hath made the seat of rest.

original: parichinnaḥ kṣemam akarot tamaḥ āsanam ācaran / kulāyan kṛṇvan kauravyaḥ patiḥ vadati jāyayā /
analyzed: parichinnaḥ kṣemam akarot tamaḥ āsanam ācaran   kulāyan kṛṇvan kauravyaḥ patiḥ vadati jāyayā  /
translated: The Kaurava, making his nest, the lord, speaks to his wife.

original: katarat te ā harāṇi dadhi manthām pari śrutam / jāyāḥ patim vi pṛchati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ /
analyzed: katarat te ā harāṇi dadhi manthām pari śrutam    jāyāḥ patim vi pṛcchati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ  /
translated: What is it that makes thee bring the curds and milk? The wife of the king of the people, Parikshit, asks her husband.

original: abhīvasvaḥ pra jihīte yavaḥ pakvaḥ pathaḥ bilam / janaḥ sa bhadram edhati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ /
analyzed: abhīvasvaḥ pra jihīte yavaḥ pakvaḥ pathaḥ bilam   janaḥ sa bhadram edhati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ  /
translated: The barley ripens, the path is open, the water is near. The people prosper in the kingdom of the king Parikshit.

original: indraḥ kārum abūbudhat uttiṣṭha vi cara janam / mama id ugrasya carkṛdhi sarvaḥ id te pṛṇāt ariḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ kārum abūbudhat uttiṣṭha vi cara janam    mama id ugrasya carkṛdhi sarvaḥ id te pṛṇāt ariḥ  /
translated: Indra has called to Karu: 'Rise up and wander among the people. Do thou make me known as a mighty one. Let every man give to thee, let no foe be left alive.'

original: iha gāvaḥ pra jāyadhvam iha aśvāḥ iha pūruṣāḥ / iha u sahasra dakṣiṇaḥ pi pūṣā ni sīdati //🔽na imāḥ indra gāvaḥ riṣan mā u āsām gopa rīriṣat / mā āsām amitra yuḥ janaḥ indra mā stenaḥ īśata /
analyzed: iha gāvaḥ pra jāyadhvam iha aśvāḥ iha pūruṣāḥ   iha u sahasra dakṣiṇaḥ pi pūṣā ni sīdati  / na imāḥ indra gāvaḥ riṣan mā u āsām gopa rīriṣat    mā āsām amitra yuḥ janaḥ indra mā stenaḥ īśata  /
translated: Here, O cows, be ye propagated; here, O horses; here, O men. Here, O Pūṣan, with a thousand gifts, sit thou down.🔽Let not these cows, O Indra, be injured; let not the keeper of them be injured. Let not the people who are hostile to us, O Indra, let not the thief rule over them.

original: upa naḥ na ramasi sūktena vacasā vayam bhadreṇa vacasā vayam / vanāt adhidhvanaḥ giraḥ na riṣyema kadā cana /
analyzed: upa naḥ na ramasi sūktena vacasā vayam bhadreṇa vacasā vayam    vanāt adhidhvanaḥ giraḥ na riṣyema kadā cana  /
translated: We will delight thee with a hymn, with a good hymn, O Indra. Let us not at any time perish, O Indra, from the sound of the wood, from the songs.

original: yaḥ sabheyaḥ vidathyaḥ sutvā yajvā atha pūruṣaḥ / sūryam ca amuḥ riśādasaḥ tat devāḥ prāk akalpayan //
analyzed: yaḥ sabheyaḥ vidathyaḥ sutvā yajvā atha pūruṣaḥ    sūryam ca amuḥ riśādasaḥ tat devāḥ prāk akalpayan  /
translated: He who is a member of the assembly, who is skilled in sacrifices, who has offered sacrifices, who is a man, who has overcome the Rishis, the sun, and the foe, that the gods have appointed from of old.

original: yaḥ jāmyāḥ aprathayaḥ tat yat sakhāyam dudhūrṣati / jyeṣṭhaḥ yat apracetāḥ tat āhuḥ adharāk iti /
analyzed: yaḥ jāmyāḥ aprathayaḥ tat yat sakhāyam dudhūrṣati   jyeṣṭhaḥ yat apracetāḥ tat āhuḥ adharāk iti  /
translated: When the eldest brother is not wise, then they call him the younger.🔽When a son is born to a good man, who is bold and daring,

original: yat bhadrasya puruṣasya putraḥ bhavati dādhṛṣiḥ / tat vipraḥ abravīt u tat gandharvaḥ kāmyam vacaḥ /
analyzed: yat bhadrasya puruṣasya putraḥ bhavati dādhṛṣiḥ   tat vipraḥ abravīt u tat gandharvaḥ kāmyam vacaḥ  /
translated: Then the sage hath uttered this, and the Gandharva this charming speech.🔽He who is a rich man, most liberal, and he who is most bountiful to the Gods,

original: yaḥ ca paṇi raghujiṣṭhyaḥ yaḥ ca devām adāśuriḥ / dhīrāṇām śaśvatām aham tat apāk iti śuśruma /
analyzed: yaḥ ca paṇi raghujiṣṭhyaḥ yaḥ ca devām adāśuriḥ   / dhīrāṇām śaśvatām aham tat apāk iti śuśruma  /
translated: Of the wise who are ever present, we have heard that he is the best.🔽Those who have worshipped the Gods, and those who have given to them,

original: ye ca devāḥ ayajanta atho ye ca parādadiḥ / sūryaḥ divam iva gatvāya maghavā naḥ vi rapśate /
analyzed: ye ca devāḥ ayajanta atho ye ca parādadiḥ    sūryaḥ divam iva gatvāya maghavā naḥ vi rapśate  /
translated: Maghavan, having gone to heaven as the sun goes to the sky, will give us room.🔽He who hath eyes unanointed, unadorned, who hath no gem, no gold,

original: yaḥ an ākta akṣaḥ an abhyaktaḥ a maṇivaḥ a hiraṇyavaḥ / a brahmā brahmaṇaḥ putra stotā kalpeṣu saṃmitā /
analyzed: yaḥ an ākta akṣaḥ an abhyaktaḥ a maṇivaḥ a hiraṇyavaḥ   a brahmā brahmaṇaḥ putra stotā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  /
translated: Who is no Brahman, though the son of Brahman, a singer, is reckoned among the Kalpas.🔽He who hath eyes anointed, well adorned, who hath a gem, and gold,

original: yaḥ ākta akṣaḥ subhyaktaḥ su maṇiḥ su hiraṇyavaḥ / subrahmā brahmaṇaḥ putra stotā kalpeṣu saṃmitā /
analyzed: yaḥ ākta akṣaḥ subhyaktaḥ su maṇiḥ su hiraṇyavaḥ    subrahmā brahmaṇaḥ putra stotā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  /
translated: Who is a good Brahman, though the son of Brahman, a singer, is reckoned among the Kalpas.🔽He who hath no well to drink from, no house, no river to direct him,

original: aprapāṇā ca veśantā revām apratidiśyayaḥ / ayabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā /
analyzed: aprapāṇā ca veśantā revām apratidiśyayaḥ    ayabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  /
translated: No maiden, no good wife, is reckoned among the Kalpas.

original: suprapāṇā ca veśantā revān supratidiśyayaḥ / suyabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā /🔽parivṛktā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhim gamaḥ / anāśuraḥ ca āyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā /
analyzed: suprapāṇā ca veśantā revān supratidiśyayaḥ     suyabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  / parivṛktā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhim gamaḥ    anāśuraḥ ca āyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  /
translated: The well-yoked, the auspicious maiden, are measured in the Kalpas.🔽The surrounded, the great, the prosperous, and the victorious in battle,🔽The non-exhausted, and the measured in the Kalpas.🔽The windy, the great, the prosperous, and the victorious in battle,

original: vāvātā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhim gamaḥ / śvāśuraḥ ca āyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā /
analyzed: vāvātā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhim gamaḥ    śvāśuraḥ ca āyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  /
translated: The father-in-law, and the measured in the Kalpas.🔽When, O Indra, thou didst plunge into the human world for the king Dasra,

original: yat indra ādaḥ dāśa rājñe mānuṣam vi gāhathāḥ / virūpaḥ sarvasmai āsīt saha yakṣāya kalpate /
analyzed: yat indra ādaḥ dāśa rājñe mānuṣam vi gāhathāḥ   virūpaḥ sarvasmai āsīt saha yakṣāya kalpate  /
translated: He became deformed for all, and was fit only for a Yaksha.

original: tvam vṛṣā akṣum maghavan amram maryākaraḥ raviḥ / tvam rauhiṇam vyāsyaḥ vi vṛtrasya abhinat śiraḥ /
analyzed: tvam vṛṣā akṣum maghavan amram maryākaraḥ raviḥ   tvam rauhiṇam vyāsyaḥ vi vṛtrasya abhinat śiraḥ  /
translated: Thou, O mighty one, didst make the unripe Amra ripe, O Maghavan, O shining one. Thou didst burst open the Rauhina, and didst split asunder Vritra's head.🔽He who hath set the mountains apart, who hath plunged into the waters,

original: yaḥ parvatān vyadadhāt yaḥ apaḥ vyagāhathāḥ / indraḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā anmaham tasmāt indra namaḥ astu te /
analyzed: yaḥ parvatān vyadadhāt yaḥ apaḥ vyagāhathāḥ   indraḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā anmaham tasmāt indra namaḥ astu te  /
translated: Indra, the great Vritra-slayer, to him, O Indra, be homage paid.🔽To Ucchaihshravas, the swift-running horse of the two bay steeds, they said:

original: pṛṣṭham dhāvantam haryoḥ auccais śravasam abruvan / svastyaśva jaitrāya indram ā vaha susrajam /
analyzed: pṛṣṭham dhāvantam haryoḥ auccais śravasam abruvan   svastyaśva jaitrāya indram ā vaha susrajam  /
translated: O horse, bring Indra, the victorious, the well-garlanded one, for victory!

original: ye tvā śvetāḥ ajaiśravasaḥ hāryaḥ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam / pūrvā namasya devānām bibhrat indra mahīyate /
analyzed: ye tvā śvetāḥ ajaiśravasaḥ hāryaḥ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam   pūrvā namasya devānām bibhrat indra mahīyate  /
translated: Bearing the earliest worship of the Gods, O Indra, is exalted.

original: etāḥ aśvāḥ ā plavante //
analyzed: etāḥ aśvāḥ ā plavante
translated: These horses are swimming.

original: pratīpam prāti sutvanam //
analyzed: pratīpam prāti sutvanam
translated: Against the current, against the swift current.

original: tāsām ekā hariknikā //
analyzed: tāsām ekā hariknikā
translated: Of them one is a yellow-spotted (mare).

original: hariknike kim icchāsi //
analyzed: hariknike kim icchāsi
translated: O yellow-spotted one, what do you desire?

original: sādhum putram hiraṇyayam //
analyzed: sādhum putram hiraṇyayam
translated: A good son, made of gold.

original: kva āhatam parāsyaḥ //
analyzed: kva āhatam parāsyaḥ
translated: Where is he struck down, the wicked?

original: yatra amūḥ tisraḥ śiṃśapāḥ //
analyzed: yatra amūḥ tisraḥ śiṃśapāḥ
translated: Where those three sisu trees are.

original: pari trayaḥ //
analyzed: pari trayaḥ
translated: Three times round.

original: pṛdākavaḥ //
analyzed: pṛdākavaḥ
translated: The speckled ones.

original: śṛṅgam dhamantaḥ āsate //
analyzed: śṛṅgam dhamantaḥ āsate
translated: Blowing their horns, they lie down.

original: ayat mahā te arvāhaḥ //🔽saḥ ichakam sa ghāghate //
analyzed: ayat mahā te arvāhaḥ  saḥ ichakam sa ghāghate
translated: Great is thy descent, O mighty one.🔽He seeks the willing one, he finds him.

original: sa ghāghate gomīdyāḥ go gatīḥ iti //🔽pumām kuste nimicchasi //🔽palpa baddha vayaḥ iti //
analyzed: sa ghāghate gomīdyāḥ go gatīḥ iti  pumām kuḥ te nim icchasi  palpa baddha vayaḥ iti
translated: He finds him, the possessor of kine, the goer to the cows.🔽O man, what do you desire?🔽The young one bound by the foot.

original: baddha vaḥ aghā iti //🔽ajāgāra kevikā //🔽aśvasya vāraḥ gośapadyake //
analyzed: baddha vaḥ aghā iti  ajāgāra kevikā  aśvasya vāraḥ gośapadyake
translated: Bound by the foot, O wicked one.🔽The goat-house, the Kevika.🔽The horse's enclosure, in the cow-pen.

original: śyenīpatī sā //
analyzed: śyenīpatī sā
translated: The lord of the hawk, that one.

original: anāmayā upajihvikā //
analyzed: anāmayā upajihvikā
translated: The tongue-less one, the dumb one.

original: kaḥ arya bahulimā iṣūni //🔽kaḥ asidyāḥ payaḥ //
analyzed: kaḥ arya bahulimā iṣūni  kaḥ asidyāḥ payaḥ
translated: Who is the rich man's arrow?🔽Who is the arrow of the poor man?

original: kaḥ arjunyāḥ payaḥ //
analyzed: kaḥ arjunyāḥ payaḥ
translated: Who is the arrow of the rich man?

original: kaḥ kārṣṇyāḥ payaḥ //
analyzed: kaḥ kārṣṇyāḥ payaḥ
translated: Who is the arrow of the black man?

original: etam pṛcha kuham pṛcha //
analyzed: etam pṛccha kuham pṛccha
translated: Ask him, ask Kuha.

original: kuhākam pakvakam pṛcha //🔽yavānaḥ yatiṣvabhiḥ kubhiḥ //🔽akupyantaḥ kupāyakuḥ //
analyzed: kuhākam pakvakam pṛccha  yavānaḥ yatiṣvabhiḥ kubhiḥ  a kupyantaḥ kupāyakuḥ
translated: Ask Pakvakam Kuhākam.🔽The barley grains with the bad grains.🔽The angry ones, the angry ones to be angry.

original: āmaṇakaḥ maṇatsakaḥ //
analyzed: āmaṇakaḥ maṇatsakaḥ
translated: The raw one, the one with the gem.

original: deva tva pratisūrya //🔽enaścipaṅktikā haviḥ //
analyzed: deva tva pratisūrya  enaḥ cipaṅktikā haviḥ
translated: O god, the counter-sun.🔽And the row of chips, the oblation.

original: pradudrudaḥ maghā prati //
analyzed: pradudrudaḥ maghā prati
translated: The Magha counter, they ran away.

original: śṛṅga utpanna //
analyzed: śṛṅgaḥ utpanna
translated: The horn, arisen.

original: mā tvā abhi sakhā naḥ vidan //
analyzed: mā tvā abhi sakhā naḥ vidan
translated: May your friend not know you.

original: vaśāyāḥ putram ā yanti //
analyzed: vaśāyāḥ putram ā yanti
translated: They come to the son of the barren cow.

original: irāvaḥ idum ayam data //🔽atha u iyan iyan iti //
analyzed: irāvas idum ayam data  atha u iyan iyan iti
translated: The food-giver, he gives this.🔽And this much, and this much.

original: atha u iyan iti //
analyzed: atha u iyan iti
translated: And this much.

original: atha u śvā asthiraḥ bhavan //
analyzed: atha u śvā asthiraḥ bhavan
translated: And then, becoming a dog with broken bones.

original: uyam yaka aṃśa lokakā //
analyzed: uyam yaka aṃśa lokakā
translated: This one, the one with the shoulder, the world-goer.

original: āminon iti bhadyate //
analyzed: āminot iti bhadyate
translated: It is said to be brought.

original: tasya anu nibhañjanam //
analyzed: tasya anu nibhañjanam
translated: After that, the black one.

original: varuṇaḥ yāti vasvabhiḥ //
analyzed: varuṇaḥ yāti vasvabhiḥ
translated: Varuṇa goes with the riches.

original: śatam vā bhāratī śavaḥ //
analyzed: śatam vā bhāratī śavaḥ
translated: Or a hundred, the power of Bharata.

original: śatam āśvāḥ hiraṇyayāḥ / śatam rathyāḥ hiraṇyayāḥ / śatam kuthāḥ hiraṇyayāḥ / ahula kuśa vartaka /
analyzed: śatam āśvāḥ hiraṇyayāḥ   śatam rathyāḥ hiraṇyayāḥ   śatam kuthāḥ hiraṇyayāḥ   ahula kuśa vartaka  /
translated: A hundred golden horses, a hundred golden chariots, a hundred golden blankets, a golden pillow.

original: śaphena iva ohate //🔽āya vanenatī janī //
analyzed: śaphena iva ohate  āya vanenatī janī
translated: As if carried by a hoof.🔽The people come with the forest.

original: vaniṣṭhāḥ na ava gṛhyanti //
analyzed: vaniṣṭhāḥ na ava gṛhyanti
translated: The best are not seized.

original: idam mahyam madūḥ iti //
analyzed: idam mahyam madūḥ iti
translated: This is for me, the fool.

original: te vṛkṣāḥ saha tiṣṭhati //🔽pāka baliḥ //
analyzed: te vṛkṣāḥ saha tiṣṭhati  pāka baliḥ
translated: Those trees stand together.🔽The cooked offering.

original: śaka baliḥ //
analyzed: śaka baliḥ
translated: The raw offering.

original: aśvattha khadiraḥ dhavaḥ //
analyzed: aśvattha khadiraḥ dhavaḥ
translated: The Aśvattha, Khadira, and Dhava trees.

original: arat uparama //
analyzed: arat uparama
translated: The Arat and Uparat.

original: śayaḥ hataḥ iva //
analyzed: śayaḥ hataḥ iva
translated: The Shaya, as if slain.

original: vyāpa pūruṣaḥ //
analyzed: vyāpa pūruṣaḥ
translated: The Vyāpa and Puruṣa.

original: adūham ityām pūṣakam //
analyzed: adūham ityām pūṣakam
translated: The Aduha and Ām Pūṣaka.

original: atyardharca parasvataḥ //
analyzed: atyardharca parasvataḥ
translated: The Atyarcha and Parasvata.

original: dauva hastinaḥ dṛtī //
analyzed: dauva hastinaḥ dṛtī
translated: The Dauva, Hasti, and Dṛtī.

original: ādalābukam ekakam //
analyzed: ā t alābukam ekakam
translated: The Ādalābuka and Ekaka.

original: alābukam nikhātakam //
analyzed: alābukam nikhātakam
translated: The Ālābuka and Nikhātka.

original: karkarikaḥ nikhātakaḥ //
analyzed: karkarikaḥ nikhātakaḥ
translated: The Karkarik and Nikhātka.

original: tat vātaḥ unmathāyati //
analyzed: tat vātaḥ unmathāyati
translated: That is what the wind scatters.

original: kulāyam kṛṇavāt iti //🔽ugram vaniṣad ātatam //
analyzed: kulāyam kṛṇavāt iti  ugram vaniṣad ātatam
translated: It says, Let it make a nest.🔽The fierce one who has spread out.

original: na vaniṣad an ātatam //🔽kaḥ eṣām karkarī likhat //
analyzed: na vaniṣat an ātatam  kaḥ eṣām karkarī likhat
translated: Not the one who has not spread out.🔽Who among them scratches with a shell?

original: kaḥ eṣām dundubhim hanat //
analyzed: kaḥ eṣām dundubhim hanat
translated: Who among them beats the drum?

original: yadi iyam hanat katham hanat //
analyzed: yadi iyam hanat katham hanat
translated: If this one beats, how does it beat?

original: devī hanat kuhanat //
analyzed: devī hanat kuhanat
translated: The goddess beats, she scratches.

original: paryāgāram punar punar //
analyzed: paryāgāram punar punar
translated: Again and again, around and around.

original: trīṇi uṣṭrasya nāmāni //
analyzed: trīṇi uṣṭrasya nāmāni
translated: The camel has three names.

original: hiraṇyaḥ iti eke abravīt //
analyzed: hiraṇyaḥ iti eke abravīt
translated: Some call it Hiraṇya.

original: dvau vā ye śiśavaḥ //
analyzed: dvau vā ye śiśavaḥ
translated: Or the two young ones.

original: nīla śikhaṇḍa vāhanaḥ //
analyzed: nīla śikhaṇḍa vāhanaḥ
translated: Whose vehicle is the peacock with blue crest feathers.

original: vitatau kiraṇau dvau tāvā pinaṣṭi pūruṣaḥ / na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase /
analyzed: vitatau kiraṇau dvau tau ā pinaṣṭi pūruṣaḥ   na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase  /
translated: The two outstretched rays, the man breaks them. O young girl, it is not so as you think, O young girl.

original: mātuṣṭe kiraṇau dvau nivṛttaḥ puruṣa anṛte / na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase /
analyzed: mātuḥ te kiraṇau dvau nivṛttaḥ puruṣa anṛte   na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase  /
translated: Two rays of the mother, two of the father, the man is turned away from untruth. Not so, O maiden, is it as thou thinkest, O maiden.

original: nigṛhya karṇakau dvau nirāyacchasi madhyame / na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase /🔽uttānāyai śayānāyai tiṣṭhantī vāva gūhasi / na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase /
analyzed: nigṛhya karṇakau dvau nirāyacchasi madhyame   na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase  / uttānāyai śayānāyai tiṣṭhantī vāva gūhasi    na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase  /
translated: Thou holdest fast the two ears, thou drawest them together in the middle. Not so, O maiden, is it as thou thinkest, O maiden.🔽To her who lies with outstretched limbs, to her who stands, thou dost cling. Not so, O maiden, is it as thou thinkest, O maiden.

original: ślakṣṇāyām ślakṣṇikāyām ślakṣṇam eva ava gūhasi / na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase /
analyzed: ślakṣṇāyām ślakṣṇikāyām ślakṣṇam eva ava gūhasi   na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase  /
translated: On the smooth, on the smooth-covered, thou dost cling smoothly. Not so, O maiden, is it as thou thinkest, O maiden.

original: avaślakṣṇam iva bhraṃśat antar lomam ati hrade / na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase /
analyzed: avaślakṣṇam iva bhraṃśat antar lomam ati hrade   na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase  /
translated: As if slipping down from the smooth, within the hair, over the pool. Not so, O maiden, is it as thou thinkest, O maiden.

original: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk arālāk udabhartsatha //
analyzed: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk arālāk udabhartsatha
translated: Here thus, east, west, north, south, crooked, and threatening.

original: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk vatsāḥ puruṣantaḥ āsate //🔽iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk sthālīpākaḥ vi līyate //
analyzed: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk vatsāḥ puruṣantaḥ āsate  iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk sthālīpākaḥ vi līyate
translated: Here thus, east, west, north, south, the calves, entering the men, are seated.🔽Here thus, east, west, north, south, the mess of cooked food is dissolved.

original: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk sa vai pṛthu līyate //
analyzed: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk sa vai pṛthu līyate
translated: Here thus, east, west, north, south, he, indeed, the wide one, is dissolved.

original: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk āste lāhaṇi līśāthī //
analyzed: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk āste lāhaṇi līśāthī
translated: Here it is thus, east, west, north, south, it lies, in the little, in the great.

original: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk akṣlilī puchilīyate //
analyzed: iha ittha prāk apāk udak adharāk akṣlilī puchilīyate
translated: Here it is thus, east, west, north, south, it is shaken, in the axle, in the tail.

original: bhuj iti abhigataḥ śaliti apakrāntaḥ phaliti abhiṣṭhitaḥ / dundubhim āhananābhyām jaritarothāmaḥ daiva //
analyzed: bhuj iti abhigataḥ śaliti apakrāntaḥ phaliti abhiṣṭhitaḥ   dundubhim āhananābhyām jaritarothāmaḥ daiva
translated: Bhuj means come hither, shali means depart, phali means mount. With the two sounds of the beaten drum, O singer, may we attain strength, O god.

original: kośa bile rajani grantheḥ dhānam upānahi pādam / uttamām janimām janya anuttamām janīn vartmanyāt /
analyzed: kośa bile rajani grantheḥ dhānam upānahi pādam   uttamām janimām janya anuttamām janīn vartmanyāt  /
translated: In the hole of the sheath, in the knot of the night, place your foot. May the highest birth be born, may the lowest be born on the path.

original: alābūni pṛṣātakāni aśvattha palāśam / pipīlikā avataśvasaḥ vidyutsvāparṇaśaphaḥ gośaphaḥ jaritarotha amaḥ daiva /
analyzed: alābūni pṛṣātakāni aśvattha palāśam pipīlikā avataśvasaḥ vidyutsvāparṇaśaphaḥ gośaphaḥ jaritarotha amaḥ daiva
translated: The gourds, the Prishatakas, the Asvattha and Palasa trees, the ants, the wind, the lightning, the skin of the leaf, the cow's hoof, O singer, may we attain strength, O god.

original: vi ime devāḥ akraṃsata adhvaryo kṣipram pracara / su satyam id gavām asyasi prakhudasi //
analyzed: vi ime devāḥ akraṃsata adhvaryo kṣipram pracara   su satyam id gavām asyasi prakhudasi  /
translated: These gods have been anointed. O Adhvaryu, quickly proceed. You are indeed very true in this matter of cows. You are very eager.

original: patnī yadṛśyate patnī yakṣyamāṇā jaritar othāmaḥ daiva / hotā viṣṭīmena jaritar othāmaḥ daiva /
analyzed: patnī yadṛśyate patnī yakṣyamāṇā jaritar othāmaḥ daiva   hotā viṣṭīmena jaritar othāmaḥ daiva
translated: When the wife is seen, O singer, when the wife is about to sacrifice, may we attain strength, O god. When the Hotri has performed the Viṣṭi, O singer, may we attain strength, O god.

original: ādityāḥ ha jaritar aṅgirobhyaḥ dakṣiṇām anayan / tām ha jaritar pratyāyan tām u ha jaritar pratyāyan //
analyzed: ādityāḥ ha jaritar aṅgirobhyaḥ dakṣiṇām anayan   tām ha jaritar pratyāyan tām u ha jaritar pratyāyan  /
translated: The Âdityas, O singer, brought a guerdon to the Angirasas. They brought it, O singer, and they brought it back again.

original: tām ha jaritar naḥ pratyagṛbhṇan tām u ha jaritar naḥ pratyagṛbhṇaḥ / ahānaḥ itarasam na vi cetanāni yajñān etarasam na purogavāmaḥ //
analyzed: tām ha jaritar naḥ pratyagṛbhṇan tām u ha jaritar naḥ pratyagṛbhṇaḥ   ahānaḥ itarasam na vi cetanāni yajñān etarasam na purogavāmaḥ  /
translated: They brought it back to us, O singer, and they brought it back to us. The days are not divided, nor are the sacrifices divided, nor the leaders of the herds.

original: uta śvetaḥ āśu patvāḥ uta u padyābhiḥ yaviṣṭhaḥ / uta īm āśu mānam piparti //
analyzed: uta śvetaḥ āśu patvāḥ uta u padyābhiḥ yaviṣṭhaḥ    uta īm āśu mānam piparti  /
translated: And he is white, and swift to travel, and with the fleetest steeds, O youngest God. And he fills full the measure of his speed.

original: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ tvenu te idam rādhaḥ prati gṛbhṇīhi aṅgiraḥ / idam rādhaḥ vibhu prabhu idam rādhaḥ bṛhat pṛthu /
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ tvenu te idam rādhaḥ prati gṛbhṇīhi aṅgiraḥ   idam rādhaḥ vibhu prabhu idam rādhaḥ bṛhat pṛthu  /
translated: The Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, O Angiras, accept this gift of thine. This gift is mighty, this is powerful, this gift is vast and wide.

original: devāḥ dadatu āsuram tat vaḥ astu su cetanam / yuṣmān astu divedive prati eva gṛbhāyat //🔽tvam indra śarmariṇā havyam pārāvatebhyaḥ / viprāya stuvate vasuvanim duraśravase vaha //
analyzed: devāḥ dadatu āsuram tat vaḥ astu su cetanam   yuṣmān astu divedive prati eva gṛbhāyat  / tvam indra śarmariṇā havyam pārāvatebhyaḥ   viprāya stuvate vasu vanim duraśravase vaha  /
translated: May the Gods give you the Asura gift. May that be well accepted by you. May it be yours day after day. Accept it for yourselves.🔽Thou, O Indra, to the singer, to the Brāhman, to the worshipper, bring the oblation which thou hast for the Parāvata birds, the treasure-winning, hard to win.

original: tvam indra kapotāya chinnapakṣāya vañcate / śyāmākam pakvam pīlu ca vārasmai akṛṇoḥ bahuḥ //
analyzed: tvam indra kapotāya chinnapakṣāya vañcate    śyāmākam pakvam pīlu ca vārasmai akṛṇoḥ bahuḥ  /
translated: Thou, O Indra, to the dove, to the bird whose wings were clipped, to the bird that sought to fly, gavest much food, much barley, and ripe rice, and the Pīlu tree.

original: araṃgaraḥ vāvadīti tredhā baddhaḥ varatrayā / irāmaha praśaṃsati anirām apa sedhati //
analyzed: araṃgaraḥ vāvadīti tredhā baddhaḥ varatrayā   irāmaha praśaṃsati anirām apa sedhati  /
translated: The threshing-sledge resounds, bound fast in three places with the rope. The husband praises her who brings him food, and drives away the barren cow.🔽The thick and solid flesh which she must often rend,

original: yat asyāḥ aṃhu bhedyāḥ kṛdhu sthūlam upātasat / muṣkāvidasyāḥ ejataḥ go śaphe śakulau iva /
analyzed: yat asyāḥ aṃhu bhedyāḥ kṛdhu sthūlam upātasat    muṣkāvidasyāḥ ejataḥ go śaphe śakulau iva  /
translated: her two breasts move as two young snakes in a goatskin move.🔽When she with her thick flesh has cut off her breasts,

original: yadā sthūlena pasasāṇau muṣkāḥ upāvadhīt / viṣvañcā vasyā vardhataḥ sikatāsu eva gardabhau /
analyzed: yadā sthūlena pasasāṇau muṣkāḥ upāvadhīt   viṣvañcā vasyā vardhataḥ sikatāsu eva gardabhau  /
translated: the two young ones turn back and grow in the sand like two asses.🔽When the little one, very little, is swollen like a bladder,

original: yat alpikā su alpikā karkadhūkā iva ṣadyate / vāsantikam iva tejanam yanti a vātāya vitpati //
analyzed: yat alpikā su alpikā karkadhūkā iva ṣadyate    vāsantikam iva tejanam yanti a vātāya vitpati  /
translated: she goes forth like a spring of water, like a spring of water that is not to be crossed.🔽When the gods have put into her the restless, the restless one,

original: yat devāsaḥ lalāmagum praviṣṭīminam āviṣuḥ / sakulā dediśyate nārī satyasya akṣi bhuvaḥ yathā /
analyzed: yat devāsaḥ lalāmagum praviṣṭīminam āviṣuḥ   sakulā dediśyate nārī satyasya akṣi bhuvaḥ yathā  /
translated: the woman is called a hag, as the eye of truth is called a hag.

original: mahān agni atṛpnat vi mokradat asthāna asaran / śakti kānanā svacam aśakam saktu padyama //
analyzed: mahān agni atṛpnat vi mokradat asthāna asaran   / śakti kānanā svacam aśakam saktu padyama  /
translated: The great fire was not satisfied, it roared, it moved not from its place. The pestle, the wood, the mortar, the flour, the meal, the cake.🔽The great fire, as it was passing by the mortar, said,

original: mahānagni ulūkhalam atikrāmantī abravīt / yathā tava vanaspate niraghnanti tathā eva iti //
analyzed: mahānagni ulūkhalam atikrāmantī abravīt   yathā tava vanaspate niraghnanti tathā eva iti
translated: 'As they beat thee, O tree, so will they do to me.'

original: mahān agni upa brūte bhraṣṭā utha api abhūbhuvaḥ / yathā eva te vanaspate pippati tathā eva iti /
analyzed: mahān agni upa brūte bhraṣṭā utha api abhūbhuvaḥ   yathā eva te vanaspate pippati tathā eva iti  /
translated: The Great Agni speaks: The fallen one has become a snake. Just as your tree, O tree, is withered, so is he.

original: mahān agni upa brūte bhraṣṭā utha api abhūbhuvaḥ / yathā vayaḥ vidāhya svarge nam avadahyate /
analyzed: mahān agni upa brūte bhraṣṭā utha api abhūbhuvaḥ   yathā vayaḥ vidāhya svarge nam avadahyate  /
translated: The Great Agni speaks: The fallen one has become a snake. Just as a bird is not burned when it flies through the sky,

original: mahān agni upa brūte svasā āveśitam pasaḥ / ittham phalasya vṛkṣasya śūrpe śūrpam bhajemahi //
analyzed: mahān agni upa brūte svasā āveśitam pasaḥ   ittham phalasya vṛkṣasya śūrpe śūrpam bhajemahi  /
translated: The Great Agni speaks: The Great Agni has placed his own fat. Thus we shall share the chaff of the fruit tree with the winnowing basket.

original: mahān agnī kṛkavākam śamyayā pari dhāvati / ayam na vidma yaḥ mṛgaḥ śīrṣṇā harati dhāṇikām /
analyzed: mahān agnī kṛkavākam śamyayā pari dhāvati   ayam na vidma yaḥ mṛgaḥ śīrṣṇā harati dhāṇikām  /
translated: The Great Agni runs around the partridge with the sacrificial ladle. We do not know this animal that carries the grain with its head.

original: mahānagnī mahānagnam dhāvantam anu dhāvati / imāḥ tat asya gāḥ rakṣa yabha mām addhyā odanam /
analyzed: mahānagnī mahānagnam dhāvantam anu dhāvati    imāḥ tat asya gāḥ rakṣa yabha mām addhyā odanam  /
translated: The Great Agni runs after the running Great Agni. Protect his cows from this. Do not eat my half-cooked rice.

original: sudevaḥ tvā mahān agnīḥ babādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam / kusam pīvaraḥ navat /
analyzed: sudevaḥ tvā mahān agnīḥ babādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam   kusam pīvaraḥ navat  /
translated: The well-devoted Great Agni torments you. The cooking of the Great One is good. The fat one is nine times as strong.

original: vaśā dagdhām imā aṅgurim prasṛjata ugratam pare / mahān vai bhadraḥ yabha mām addhyā odanam /
analyzed: vaśā dagdhām imā aṅgurim prasṛjata ugratam pare   mahān vai bhadraḥ yabha mām addhyā odanam  /
translated: The barren cow has burned this tender shoot. Let it grow more fierce. The Great One is indeed auspicious. Do not eat my half-cooked rice.

original: videvaḥ tvā mahān agnīḥ vibādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam / kumārikā piṅgalikā kārda bhasmā ku dhāvati //🔽mahān vai bhadraḥ bilvaḥ mahān bhadraḥ udumbaraḥ / mahām abhikta bādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam /🔽yaḥ kumārī piṅgalikā vasantam pīvarī labhet / taila kuṇḍam ima aṅguṣṭham rodantam śudam uddharet /
analyzed: videvaḥ tvā mahān agnīḥ vibādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam   kumārikā piṅgalikā kārda bhasmā ku dhāvati  / mahān vai bhadraḥ bilvaḥ mahān bhadraḥ udumbaraḥ   mahām abhikta bādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam  / yaḥ kumārī piṅgalikā vasantam pīvarī labhet   taila kuṇḍam ima aṅguṣṭham rodantam śudam uddharet  /
translated: The great god Agni drives thee forth: good is the digging of the great. The little tawny maid runs forth, the maid of Karabha, the maid of ashes.
