original: sutāsaḥ madhumattamāḥ somāḥ indrāya mandinaḥ / pavitravantaḥ akṣaran devān gacchantu vaḥ madāḥ /
analyzed: sutāsaḥ madhumattamāḥ somāḥ indrāya mandinaḥ   pavitravantaḥ akṣaran devān gacchantu vaḥ madāḥ  /
translated: have flowed through the filter. Let your gladdening draughts go to the Gods.

original: induḥ indrāya pavate iti devāsaḥ abruvan / vācaḥ patiḥ makhasyate viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā /
analyzed: induḥ indrāya pavate iti devāsaḥ abruvan   vācaḥ patiḥ makhasyate viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā  /
translated: The Gods have said, 'Let Indu flow for Indra.' The Lord of Speech is glorified, the Sovran Lord of all with might.

original: sahasra dhāraḥ pavate samudraḥ vācamīṅkhayaḥ / somaḥ patiḥ rayīṇām sakhā indrasya divedive /
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pavate samudraḥ vācamīṅkhayaḥ   somaḥ patiḥ rayīṇām sakhā indrasya divedive  /
translated: The thousand-channeled ocean flows, the gladdener of speech, Soma, the Lord of wealth, the friend of Indra day by day.

original: ava drapsaḥ aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhat iyānaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ / āvat tam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snehitīḥ nṛmaṇāḥ adhatta /
analyzed: ava drapsaḥ aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhat iyānaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ   āvat tam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snehitīḥ nṛmaṇāḥ adhatta  /
translated: The drop hath settled in the plant, the dark-hued one, advancing with ten thousand. Indra with Sachi hath encompassed him, and given him to the men as oil for their delight.

original: drapsam apaśyam viṣuṇe carantam upahvare nadyaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ / nabhaḥ na kṛṣṇam avatasthivāṃsam iṣyāmi vaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yudhyata ājau //
analyzed: drapsam apaśyam viṣuṇe carantam upahvare nadyaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ   nabhaḥ na kṛṣṇam avatasthivāṃsam iṣyāmi vaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yudhyata ājau  /
translated: I saw the drop upon the ridge of the mountain, moving in the region of the Anṣus. I saw the dark one standing in the sky. I will tell you, O ye heroes, fight in the battle.

original: adha drapsaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ upasthe adhārayat tanvam titviṣāṇaḥ / viśaḥ adevīḥ abhi ācarantīḥ bṛhaspatinā yujā indraḥ sasāhe /
analyzed: adha drapsaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ upasthe adhārayat tanvam titviṣāṇaḥ   viśaḥ adevīḥ abhi ācarantīḥ bṛhaspatinā yujā indraḥ sasāhe  /
translated: The drop hath settled in the lap of the plant, and hath assumed a body, shining brightly. Indra with Brihaspati for his ally hath conquered the godless tribes of men who came against him.

original: tvam ha tyad saptabhyaḥ jāyamānaḥ a śatrubhyaḥ abhavaḥ śatruḥ indra / gūlhe dyāvāpṛthivī anu avindaḥ vibhumadbhyaḥ bhuvanebhyaḥ raṇam dhāḥ /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad saptabhyaḥ jāyamānaḥ a śatrubhyaḥ abhavaḥ śatruḥ indra   gūlhe dyāvāpṛthivī anu avindaḥ vibhumadbhyaḥ bhuvanebhyaḥ raṇam dhāḥ  /
translated: Thou, when born, wast the foe of those seven who were not foes, O Indra. Thou foundest the hidden heaven and earth. Grant room to the wide-spreading worlds.

original: tvam ha tyad apratimānam ojaḥ vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣitaḥ jaghantha / tvam śuṣṇasya avātiraḥ vadhatraiḥ tvam gāḥ indra śacyā id avindaḥ /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad apratimānam ojaḥ vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣitaḥ jaghantha   tvam śuṣṇasya avātiraḥ vadhatraiḥ tvam gāḥ indra śacyā id avindaḥ  /
translated: Thou, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with thy matchless might, didst boldly smite with thy thunderbolt. Thou didst crush the wicked with thy weapons. Thou didst find the kine, O Indra, through thy power.

original: tam indram vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave / sa vṛṣā vṛṣabhaḥ bhuvat /
analyzed: tam indram vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave   sa vṛṣā vṛṣabhaḥ bhuvat  /
translated: We urge that Indra on to the great deed, to smite down Vr̥itra. He is the Bull, the mighty Lord.

original: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛtaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ / dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛtaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ   dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ  /
translated: Indra is made for service: he is strongest when the juice is shed. He is the glorious, the adorned, the lover of the Soma draught.

original: girā vajraḥ na saṃbhṛtaḥ sabalaḥ anapacyutaḥ / vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ astṛtaḥ /
analyzed: girā vajraḥ na saṃbhṛtaḥ sabalaḥ anapacyutaḥ   vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ astṛtaḥ
translated: The bolt, like a strong-backed steed, is gathered by the song, irresistible. It waxes great, lofty, and sure.

original: mahān indraḥ yaḥ ojasā parjanyaḥ vṛṣṭimān iva / stomaiḥ vatsasya vāvṛdhe /
analyzed: mahān indraḥ yaḥ ojasā parjanyaḥ vṛṣṭimān iva    stomaiḥ vatsasya vāvṛdhe  /
translated: Great is Indra, who by his might is like Parjanya with the rain. He hath grown great with Vatsa's lauds.

original: prajām ṛtasya piprataḥ pra yat bharanta vahnayaḥ / viprāḥ ṛtasya vāhasā /
analyzed: prajām ṛtasya piprataḥ pra yat bharanta vahnayaḥ   viprāḥ ṛtasya vāhasā  /
translated: The priests who spread the progeny of holy Law, the sages with the chariot of eternal truth,

original: kaṇvāḥ indram yat akrata stomaiḥ yajñasya sādhanam / jāmi bruvate āyudham /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ indram yat akrata stomaiḥ yajñasya sādhanam   jāmi bruvate āyudham  /
translated: When the Kaṇvas, O Indra, have with lauds made ready the sacrifice, They call upon the kinsman for the weapon.

original: ā nūnam aśvinā yuvam vatsasya gantam avase / pra asmai yacchatam avṛkam pṛthu chardiḥ yuyutam yāḥ arātayaḥ /
analyzed: ā nūnam aśvinā yuvam vatsasya gantam avase    pra asmai yacchatam avṛkam pṛthu chardiḥ yuyutam yāḥ arātayaḥ  /
translated: Now, O ye Aṣvins, come to Vatsa for his help: bestow ye on him a wide shelter free from fear. Drive ye away all evil influences.

original: yat antarikṣe yat divi yat pañca mānuṣām anu / nṛmnam tat dhattam aśvinā /
analyzed: yat antarikṣe yat divi yat pañca mānuṣām anu   nṛmnam tat dhattam aśvinā
translated: What ye have in the firmament, what ye have in the sky, what ye have among the five races of men, O ye Aṣvins, bestow ye on this man.

original: ye vām daṃsāṃsi aśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ / eva id kāṇvasya bodhatam /
analyzed: ye vām daṃsāṃsi aśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ   eva id kāṇvasya bodhatam  /
translated: The sages, O ye Aṣvins, who have tested your wondrous deeds, have thus awakened you, O Kaṇva's sons.

original: ayam vām gharmaḥ aśvinā stomena pari sicyate / ayam somaḥ madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtram ciketathaḥ /
analyzed: ayam vām gharmaḥ aśvinā stomena pari sicyate    ayam somaḥ madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtram ciketathaḥ  /
translated: This your libation, O ye Aṣvins, is poured forth with the hymn: this Soma is rich in sweets, O ye who are rich in treasure, whereby ye have marked out Vr̥itra.

original: yat apsu yat vanaspatau yat oṣadhīṣu purudaṃsasā kṛtam / tena mā āviṣṭam aśvinā /
analyzed: yat apsu yat vanaspatau yat oṣadhīṣu purudaṃsasā kṛtam   tena mā āviṣṭam aśvinā
translated: What ye have wrought, O ye of many forms, in the waters, in the forest tree, in the plants, O Aṣvins, come ye hither with that power of yours.

original: yat nāsatyā bhuraṇyathaḥ yat vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ / ayam vām vatsaḥ matibhiḥ na vindhate haviṣmantam hi gacchathaḥ /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā bhuraṇyathaḥ yat vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ    ayam vām vatsaḥ matibhiḥ na vindhate haviṣmantam hi gacchathaḥ  /
translated: When, Nâsatyas, ye are busy, or when, O ye Gods, ye heal, this Vatsa with his thoughts never fails to win you, for ye go to him who brings oblations.

original: ā nūnam aśvinoḥ ṛṣiḥ stomam ciketa vāmayā / ā somam madhumattamam gharmam siñcāt atharvaṇi //
analyzed: ā nūnam aśvinoḥ ṛṣiḥ stomam ciketa vāmayā   ā somam madhumattamam gharmam siñcāt atharvaṇi  /
translated: Now let the sage, with sacrifice, think on the Asvins' laud, And let him pour the Soma, most rich in sweets, into the caldron.

original: ā nūnam raghuvartanim ratham tiṣṭhāthaḥ aśvinā / ā vām stomāḥ ime mama nabhaḥ na cucyavīrata /🔽yat adya vām nāsatya ukthaiḥ ācucyuvīmahi / yat vā vāṇībhiḥ aśvinā iva id kaṇvasya bodhatam /
analyzed: ā nūnam raghuvartanim ratham tiṣṭhāthaḥ aśvinā   ā vām stomāḥ ime mama nabhaḥ na cucyavīrata  / yat adya vām nāsatya ukthaiḥ ācucyuvīmahi   yat vā vāṇībhiḥ aśvinā iva id kaṇvasya bodhatam  /
translated: Now mount your car, O Asvins, whose way is swift, And let not these my praises fail to reach the vault of heaven, as they have done.🔽If, O Nâsatyas, we have failed to-day to gladden you with lauds, Or with our songs, O ye Âsyins, be ye as Kanyâ's friends.

original: yat vām kakṣīvān uta yat vyaśvaḥ ṛṣiḥ yat vām dīrghatamāḥ juhāva / pṛthī yat vām vainyaḥ sādaneṣu eva id atas aśvinā cetayethām /
analyzed: yat vām kakṣīvān uta yat vyaśvaḥ ṛṣiḥ yat vām dīrghatamāḥ juhāva   pṛthī yat vām vainyaḥ sādaneṣu eva id atas aśvinā cetayethām  /
translated: If Kakshîvân, if Vyashva, if the Rishi Dirghatamas hath called you, If Vainya hath invoked you in your dwelling-places, O ye Mighty, even from thence, O Asvins, be ye mindful of us.

original: yātam chardiṣpāḥ uta paraspāḥ bhūtam jagat pāḥ uta naḥ tanū pā / vartiḥ tokāya tanayāya yātam /
analyzed: yātam chardiṣpāḥ uta paraspāḥ bhūtam jagat pāḥ uta naḥ tanū pā   vartiḥ tokāya tanayāya yātam  /
translated: Be ye the guardians of our house and of our home, the guardians of our wealth and of our bodies. Come to the dwelling of our sons and offspring.

original: yat indreṇa sa ratham yāthaḥ aśvinā yat vā vāyunā bhavathaḥ samokasā / yat ādityebhiḥ ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yat vā viṣṇoḥ vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ / yat ādityebhiḥ ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yat vā viṣṇoḥ vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ /
analyzed: yat indreṇa sa ratham yāthaḥ aśvinā yat vā vāyunā bhavathaḥ samokasā    yat ādityebhiḥ ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yat vā viṣṇoḥ vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ    yat ādityebhiḥ ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yat vā viṣṇoḥ vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ  /
translated: When ye are of one mind with Âdityas and with R̥ibhus, or when ye stand in Vishnu's steps,🔽If I this day invoke you, O ye Aṣvins, to win the spoil,

original: yat adya aśvinau aham huveya vājasātaye / yat pṛtsu turvaṇe sanaḥ tat śreṣṭham aśvinoḥ avaḥ /
analyzed: yat adya aśvinau aham huveya vājasātaye   yat pṛtsu turvaṇe sanaḥ tat śreṣṭham aśvinoḥ avaḥ  /
translated: If in the battles of Turvaṣa and Yuva, that is the Aṣvins' best protection.🔽Now come ye hither, O ye Aṣvins: these oblations are prepared for you.

original: ā nūnam yātam aśvinā imā havyāni vām hitā / ime somāsaḥ adhi turvaśe yadau ime kaṇveṣu vām atha /
analyzed: ā nūnam yātam aśvinā imā havyāni vām hitā   ime somāsaḥ adhi turvaśe yadau ime kaṇveṣu vām atha  /
translated: These Soma juices are for Turvaga and Yuva, these for you among the Kaṇvas.🔽Whatever medicine, Nâsatyas, ye possess, far away or near at hand,

original: yat nāsatyā parāke arvāke asti bheṣajam / tena nūnam vimadāya pracetasā chardiḥ vatsāya yacchatam /🔽abhutsi u pra devyā sākam vācā aham aśvinoḥ / vi āvar devī ā matim vi rātim martyebhyaḥ /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā parāke arvāke asti bheṣajam   tena nūnam vimadāya pracetasā chardiḥ vatsāya yacchatam  / abhutsi u pra devyā sākam vācā aham aśvinoḥ   vi āvaḥ devī ā matim vi rātim martyebhyaḥ  /
translated: Therewith, O ye far-sighted Twain, grant to the son of Chardîs freedom from disease.🔽I have awakened with the Goddess, with the Aṣvins' voice.🔽I have awakened the Goddess, the great hymn, the gift to mortal men.🔽Awake, O ye Âṣvins, O ye Dawn, O ye great Goddess, O ye Truth.

original: pra bodhayoṣaḥ aśvinā pra devi sūnṛte mahi / pra yajña hotar ānuṣak pra madāya śravaḥ bṛhat //
analyzed: pra bodhaya uṣaḥ aśvinā pra devi sūnṛte mahi   pra yajña hotar ānuṣak pra madāya śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: Awake, O Hotar, in due time, to the great glory of the feast.

original: yat uṣaḥ yāsi bhānunā sam sūryeṇa rocase / ā ha ayam aśvinaḥ rathaḥ vartiḥ yāti nṛpāyyam //
analyzed: yat uṣaḥ yāsi bhānunā sam sūryeṇa rocase    ā ha ayam aśvinaḥ rathaḥ vartiḥ yāti nṛpāyyam  /
translated: When, O Dawn, thou goest forth with light, and shinest with the Sun, Then this car of the Asvins comes to the place where men are to be ruled.

original: yat āpītāsaḥ aṃśavaḥ gāvaḥ na duhre ūdhabhiḥ / yat vā vāṇīḥ anuṣata pra devayantaḥ aśvinā /
analyzed: yat āpītāsaḥ aṃśavaḥ gāvaḥ na duhre ūdhabhiḥ   yat vā vāṇīḥ anuṣata pra devayantaḥ aśvinā  /
translated: When the red rays have been milked like cows from the udders, and the songs have been sung, and the pious have been delighted, O Asvins,

original: pra dyumnāya pra śavase pra nṛṣāhyāya śarmaṇe / pra dakṣāya pracetasā /
analyzed: pra dyumnāya pra śavase pra nṛṣāhyāya śarmaṇe    pra dakṣāya pracetasā
translated: For glory, for strength, for the protection of men, for skill, for wisdom,

original: yat nūnam dhībhiḥ aśvinā pituḥ yonā niṣīdathaḥ / yat vā sumnebhiḥ ukthyā /🔽tam vām ratham vayam adya ā huvema pṛthu jrayam aśvinā saṃgatim goḥ / yaḥ sūryām vahati vandhura āyuḥ gir vāhasam purutamam vasūyum //
analyzed: yat nūnam dhībhiḥ aśvinā pituḥ yonā niṣīdathaḥ   yat vā sumnebhiḥ ukthyā  / tam vām ratham vayam adya ā huvema pṛthu jrayam aśvinā saṃgatim goḥ    yaḥ sūryām vahati vandhura āyuḥ gir vāhasam purutamam vasūyum  /
translated: When, O ye Asvins, ye sit in the birthplace of the father with your thoughts, or with your favours, O ye worthy of lauds,🔽We will call that car of yours hither to-day, O ye Asvins, the car that goes far, the car that meets the cow, the car that bears Surya, the car that brings life, the car that brings the most songs, the car that brings wealth.

original: yuvam śriyam aśvinā devatā tām divaḥ napāta vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ / yuvoḥ vapuḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāsaḥ rathe vām /
analyzed: yuvam śriyam aśvinā devatā tām divaḥ napāta vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ   yuvoḥ vapuḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāsaḥ rathe vām  /
translated: That glory, O ye Asvins, ye bestowers of glory, ye sons of Dyaus, with your powers, that glory which is your own, which is the glory of the gods. Your form, O ye Asvins, the blessings follow, which they bear on your car, which is yoked with the two ruddy horses.

original: kaḥ vām adyā karate rāta havyaḥ ūtaye vā suta peyāya vā arkaiḥ / ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namaḥ yemānaḥ aśvinā vavartat //
analyzed: kaḥ vām adyā karate rāta havyaḥ ūtaye vā suta peyāya vā arkaiḥ   ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namaḥ yemānaḥ aśvinā vavartat  /
translated: Who now, with offerings and with hymns, will serve you, to gain your aid, or to enjoy the juice? Or who, to win the ancient truth of you, Aṣvins, will turn him to you with reverence?

original: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathena imam yajñam nāsatyā upa yātam / pibāthaḥ id madhunaḥ somyasya dadhathaḥ ratnam vidhate janāya /
analyzed: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathena imam yajñam nāsatyā upa yātam   pibāthaḥ id madhunaḥ somyasya dadhathaḥ ratnam vidhate janāya  /
translated: Come to this sacrifice of ours, O ye who find the many, with your golden chariot. Drink ye the savoury juice of Soma. Give treasure to the man who offereth you gifts.

original: ā naḥ yātam divaḥ acha pṛthivyāḥ hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena / mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ sam yat dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām /
analyzed: ā naḥ yātam divaḥ acha pṛthivyāḥ hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena    mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ sam yat dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām  /
translated: Come hither unto us from earth and heaven, on your car covered with gold. Let not others, who adore the Gods, hinder you, since your ancient navel is united with ours.

original: nu naḥ rayim puru vīram bṛhantam dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣu asme / naraḥ yat vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīlhāsaḥ agman /
analyzed: nu naḥ rayim puru vīram bṛhantam dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣu asme   naraḥ yat vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīlhāsaḥ agman  /
translated: Make ye for us, O Wonder-Workers, wealth in full abundance, with its many heroes, among us. When, O ye Aṣvins, men have brought you praise, and come to the assembly, to the general feast.

original: iha iha yat vām samanā papṛkṣe sā iyam asme sumatiḥ vāja ratnā / uruṣyatam jaritāram yuvam ha śritaḥ kāmaḥ nāsatyā yuvadrik /
analyzed: iha iha yat vām samanā papṛkṣe sā iyam asme sumatiḥ vāja ratnā    uruṣyatam jaritāram yuvam ha śritaḥ kāmaḥ nāsatyā yuvadrik  /
translated: Here, here I long to grasp your hands together. This favour, O ye rich in treasure, is to us. Preserve ye both the man who lauds you. The wish that rests on you, O Nâsatyas, is my own.

original: madhumatīḥ oṣadhīḥ dyāvaḥ āpaḥ madhumat naḥ bhavatu antarikṣam / kṣetrasya patiḥ madhumān naḥ astu a riṣyantaḥ anu enam carema /
analyzed: madhumatīḥ oṣadhīḥ dyāvaḥ āpaḥ madhumat naḥ bhavatu antarikṣam   kṣetrasya patiḥ madhumān naḥ astu a riṣyantaḥ anu enam carema  /
translated: Sweet be the heavens and waters, sweet the firmament. Sweet to us be the Lord of the field. Unharmed may we go after him.

original: panāyyam tat aśvinā kṛtam vām vṛṣabhaḥ divaḥ rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ / sahasram śaṃsāḥ uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvān id tām upa yāta pibadhyai //
analyzed: panāyyam tat aśvinā kṛtam vām vṛṣabhaḥ divaḥ rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ    sahasram śaṃsāḥ uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvān id tām upa yāta pibadhyai  /
translated: That which is yours to drink, O ye Aṣvins, is prepared, the bull of the region of the sky and of the earth. Come to all those thousand praises and to those of the contest for the cow, to drink them all.
